Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Nic74NWOhio
Reviews.Content: This was our 1st visit to Las Vegas. We picked Excalibur for the cost and the location (from what we could tell on-line). The location is good, within walking distance to a lot of things and has a monorail to 2 other properties. The breakfast buffet for $14.99 / person was ok but not great. We ate breakfast at Margaritaville down the strip for comparable prices and much better food. The casino was fine but I'm not much of a gambler. It's definitely not the glitz & glam hotel that others are but we didn't want to pay glitz & glam prices. Also, got a mani/pedi in the Spa (using a coupon from the coupon book we got when we checked in) while here and Holly did a very nice job. And for some yummy food for dinner, check out the Lynard Skynard BBQ restaurant....it was soooo good. It serves a little differently than most restaurants but the food was great! We stayed in Tower II and our room was nice, big bathroom but our bed was a bit on the extra firm side. If we came to Las Vegas again, we would stay at Excalibur again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: BuckeyeNewMexico
Reviews.Content: For the price the Excalibur is good value. The check in and check out procedure was good and the room was comfortable and quiet, but not much else, not even coffee/tea making facilities. The buffet was very acceptable. They offer a deal of $32.00 a day for as many visits as you want, (even if you are not staying in the hotel), which we found OK for one day. Be aware that the hotel charges a resort fee of $15.00 a day that includes local calls, wifi, pool etc. If you are not going to use those options then it is basically a no value add on to your bill that you have to pay. Generally the hotel is well maintained but they dropped the ball on the elevators. They consistently contained litter. If you haven't been to Las Vegas for a while and if you don't enjoy going up and down steps multiple times, be aware that getting from A to B at street level is more difficult because you cannot cross the intersections as was possible a few years ago. We found we could walk most of the way from Excalibur to Bellagio one floor above the strip, walking through New York New York, and the Cosmopoliton Hotel in the new City Center.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than led to believe”
Reviews.Author: videopokerqueen1000
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd trip to Las Vegas in 10 years. We came for the March NASCAR races. We had a widescreen king room on the 18th floor in Tower II. It was excellent. Decent water pressure; comfortable bed,clean and quiet. I am surprised at the number of negative reviews for this casino/hotel. Get yourself a casino host and they will waive the resort fee. We got an Mlife card and lots of comps, surprising for how little we gambled. Will definitely return. Only negative about the room would be that it lacks coffee makers.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and cheap”
Reviews.Author: Andrew N
Reviews.Content: Good hotel for the price! We stayed a Monday - Friday and enjoyed everything. First the positives rooms were clean and nice, has a lot of restaurants to choose from. Always something to do its Vegas! Location right on the strip!!! The negative the check in lines were very very long and slow! The lines to check in just you baggage takes 20 minutes. Drink prices are very high unless your gambling. But even if your gambling it takes a long time to get a drink ( bout 20 minutes) overall it's a cheaply priced hotel with nice rooms and a great location

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel in Las vegas”
Reviews.Author: xronis
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not bad . Its on the strip , it has casinos on the main floor and its on the standard of all the hotels on the strip. We booked this hotel as it was at a very good price and we were not disappointed. On the other hand we were not amazed. A typical Hotel and its worth the money and nothing wrong to report.

Reviews.Title: “"So you want a great view at a great price?"”
Reviews.Author: dukesjc
Reviews.Content: The room view in Las Vegas is the most important thing to me. This is the only place in town where you can control that affordably. The "strip view room" can be had for around $30 sometimes when they're not too busy. There is an additional approximate $15 resort fee so get over it don't forget your free USA TODAY at the gift shops with your room key. My room was on the 22nd floor and had an unobstructed view of the strip and the airplanes landing and taking off. Eventually these rooms will be updated and become pricey but for now it's just fine if you can put up with dated furniture and hallway carpeting. The carpet in the room was new and the room was certainly clean (probably 350 sq. ft.). There is another updated room classification which offers "view of strip or surrounding mountains" but I could not find the ability to request non-smoking via the internet. The location is right across the street from New York and MGM so it's less congested than center strip.

Reviews.Title: “The good, The Bad, and The Smokey”
Reviews.Author: WinnipegBrett
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a four night stay at the Excalibur. I am quite sure I inhaled enough second hand smoke to last me 10 life times. WOW!!! It was really bad. Yes, I am a non-smoker but My whole family get crazy headaches the first night. You have to walk through the heavy smoke to get to pretty mush anywhere in the hotel. THIS IS NOT A HOTEL FOR FAMILIES!!! We did go on spring break but I would strongmen suggest that if you have a family to spend a little more and go to the Mirage as the pool there is fantastic. Don't get me wrong... If you are young and want a cheap place to stay and you want to party all night.. then this is the place for you. It is totally our fault bringing our daughter here. It was our first time and we thought it was family friendly there. That being said.. the staff are all very nice and hard working. Our room was in tower 1 and it was nice and very clean. The elevators were a different story. They were always dirty and often had vomit in them. The staff tried their best but like I said it was spring break. we found the buffet at the Luxor to be a bit better than the one at the Excalibur but they were pretty similar. There are so many hotels there and it IS AN ADULT PLAYGROUND!!!! So If we ever bring our daughter back we will try a different hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: brandi_rocks
Reviews.Content: I stayed here years ago, and it was just average. I read some of the other reviews, and decided it would give it a try again. We stayed in tower 2 (the remodeled tower). The furnishings were nice, it looked alot better than it did 11 years ago. My husband thought that the bed were a little too firm, but I thought it was fine. It's a good place to stay, if you want somewhere clean, has a pool, and fitness center. For the price, this place is pretty good. Don't expect the Bellagio, or Venetian, or Wynn. Location is perfect. The walkway between the other casinos is very convenient to other casinos and the bus stop for the deuce. My only gripe I will say though, I was a little disappointed that for this place being a lower priced hotel, I was surprised not to find a $5 blackjack or craps table. Even during a weekday, couldn't find one there. ***tip*** Take the deuce: It's $7 for a 24 hour hop on hop off trip.

Reviews.Title: “Dated but clean”
Reviews.Author: Sue H
Reviews.Content: The cost of the room was cheap, but you do get what you pay for. The room was clean, sheets were crisp and the bed comfortable. The furniture is worn. I had a room with two queen beds. There was no fridge in the room and no bathrobe in the room. I wish I had brought a bathrobe. You have to walk thru a smokey casino to check in and get to your room. I took the shuttle from the airport. I did get a bunch of coupons when I checked in for $5 off shows. There is no wireless in the room. You have to jack in a provided ethernet cable to get on the net.. They did provide an iron which was nice. I would bring some extra hangers if you have to hang stuff up in the closet. They provided you 6. My room was by the elevator. I wouldn't recommend this because you get extra noise. The bathroom fan is also noisy but there is a rocker switch on the fan to turn it off if you don't want to listen to it when you have the light on.

Reviews.Title: “Tower 1”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteG86
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in March 2012 and had a lovely stay. We were in Tower 1 which seems to have had a lot of bad reviews however we found nothing wrong with it. Our room was large and had two double beds, it had a nice clean bathroom and was good value for money. We really enjoyed our stay here and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: tonyankent
Reviews.Content: Reading some of the other reviews, you would think these people paid for a 5 star hotel and received less. The truth is that this is a perfect stay in Vegas. If you are in Vegas to TRULY enjoy what vegas has to offer...this hotel is PERFECT! Especially for the price! Clean hotel, wonderful and courteous service, great views of the strips, etc. The rooms are just as big as any other hotel. Tower2 has been remodeled and I loved the over-sized showers! The breakfast buffet in this hotel is not very good but other than that everything was VERY conveniently located. The casino gives a good vibe of people just wanting to have fun. The smell of cigarette smoke bothered me a little in the casino but overall LOVED IT! The pool was recently remodeled and I loved relaxing during the day there. NUMBER ONE place go to for food and entertainment later at night is Lynard Skynard's BBQ at the Excalibur. They have PERFECT comfort food...and after eating crappy food from every other expensive place we went..Lynard Skynard's BBQ was heaven! They have Karaoke at night and we couldn't have had any more fun anywhere else...and we don't even sing. They have free-shot times too. Make sure to pick up a few free drink tickets from the guys that stands outside in the casino. There is time-share people at the hotel and several others you walk in and out of. It gets old telling them no...but nothing that was unbearable. We also loved the Circle Bar in New York New York and the Cirque's "Zumanity" Show. If you are going as a couple....make sure to pick up a few tix to Zumanity. You will thank me later!! ;) Don't even hesitate about this hotel....unless you require the 5 starred ones....

Reviews.Title: “First time in Vegas at Excalibur hotel”
Reviews.Author: Claire E
Reviews.Content: When I looked up review of this on hotel in line I was concerned, however after staying a week in the hotel I was more than pleased with our choice of accomodation. The hotel is one of the older ones and perhaps because it is themed gives a slightly out of date image. However our room was just perfect, spacious, clean and everything worked, from iron to hair dryer, bathroom looked brand new and again very clean. Hotel pool was also a pleasure to spend the day at, and the hotel has a range of different restaurants/shops to choose from. Excalibur is at the end/start of the strip and I perfect walking distance for everything. I would stay at this hotel again and certainly recommend, however friends of ours did have a penthouse suit in. The MGM signature hotel which wasn't much far more than what we paid for a week at the Excalibur, pays to shop around

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as some other options available but value truly”
Reviews.Author: psychodoc
Reviews.Content: Well, slightly jaded and small rooms, very average service , decent casino, pretty good location, average buffet ... All said a good budget option .... Or maybe I feel like that as I also stayed at the aria hotel too during the same vacation and it was brilliantly luxurious ... I'll still say its a good budget option !

Reviews.Title: “Great first time to Vegas!!”
Reviews.Author: hot&sweet
Reviews.Content: The room was nice and the bed comfortable and everything was clean. Staff were friendly and helpful. There were lots of stores in the hotel and fast food outlets that were open late which was a great bonus. The only thing I didn't like too much was the smoke or the smell of it and because the ceiling was low it seemed to keep the smoke pushed down. The pool was nice, there were four but only one opened at the time (not warm enough to open all of them?). Loved the gym as well - equipment was in great shape and was clean with wipes available to wipe down equipment before and after your workout. Having 2 water coolers in the room helped keep all hydrated. Overall it was a good experience and I would go back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: flyJ90
Reviews.Content: *** This review is long and covers the hotel and brief summary on some things to do in Las Vegas *** This is my 2nd time staying in the Excalibur, my 1st visit was in Sep 2007 and my stay this time was just as good as the my previous stay... There was a group of 4 people in 2 rooms and we all stayed in Tower 1 on the 4th floor for 10 nights. This was all booked through my local Thomson travel agent. We arrived at the hotel at around 4:30pm and went straight through to check in, no queue at all even though the hotel was busy however the lady who checked us in was not the friendly of people... A lot of reviews on the site say that the Excalibur is 'one of the most smokiest hotels on the strip'... Personally, I smoke and did not find it any better or any worse than any other hotel on the strip. The other 3 people in our party agreed and they are non smokers. The only hotels you do not tend to notice any smell of smoke is Bellagio, Venetian and Palazzo. The hotel itself is dated but asw are many others, having stayed here before I knew what to expect and this was a factor in booking here as although the rooms are basic, they are large, clean and cheap. And besides... Who comes to Las Vegas to stay in their hotel room? When we arrived the 4 of us were also expecting to pay the $15 a day resort fee. When we enquired to reception about this we were told it had all been pre-paid in the cost (so a little tip to UK residents... Maybe speak with your local travel agent when booking and see if they also include the resort fee) As it was all pre-paid we got everything that guests who pay on arrival get apart from 2 free drinks per person per day... Nothing to really worry about. There was no evidence of bed bugs in the hotel room and the room itself was always kept spotless. The beds themselves were very comfortable and the room also featured a decent sized plasma/LCD television. The buffet on offer in the food court is of very good value. All you can eat for a day in either Excalibur or Luxor was offered for $32. As we did not spend much time in the hotel we only had the breakfast buffet 2 mornings for $15 and oon day of leaving we went to the lunch buffet for $16. All 3 times we only went to the Excalibur buffet. The food was very tasty and with all drinks included it works out as a very good saving. There was plenty of choice and food was replenished regularly... If you struggled to find something then you must be to fussy for a buffet. One problem we did have with the hotel was that on the night of the 17th/morning on 18th of March we had the fire alarm set off at 4:30am by some drunken 'idiots' to put it nicely. The same thing happened aat 11:30pm on the night of the 18th March. I reckon the reason for this was due to it being St. Patrick's Day Weekend as we saw many, MANY people who had overindulged on alcohol - but it is Vegas! so why not! The alarms were checked by security promptly and they were swiftly checking all corridors and came back to answer any questions that the guests had. So really this was through no fault of the hotel. All in All I would definately return to the Excalbiur for the price paid and what you get is more than adequate. I would say that yes this hotel is cheap, dated and not as dazzling as some hotels on the Strip but you can not expect a 5* hotel for cheap prices. The timeshare people can get annoying asking you everytime you pass wether you want discount/free tickets or wether you are returning next year and they can get you free rooms/discounts etc etc... If you go along with these I have no sympathy if you spend your day with a timeshare... We just kept on walking, said no thank you if they approached us and asked or just avoided eye contact. If they annoy you too then do the same! *** Now About Vegas*** During our time in Las Vegas I overheard many parents commplaining about Las Vegas not being very Child focused... Las Vegas is not designed for kids. Most people must surely realise that?!? Just my own thought... The bus services are well worth doing to get around Vegas. its $7 for 24 hours and can be brought on the Deuce bus... Only if you have the correct change in $Bills. However at all stops there are either credit card machines or machines that take card, cash and coins. Be warned though... They do tend to be very busy but the deuce ones run 24 hours every 10-20minutes. The Premium outlet mall: We went to both the North and the South Premium outlet malls by taking the Strip & Downtown Express (SDX) bus. The north outlet mall is much better than the south - more shops, more choice and is an outdoor one whereas the south one is roofed. Penn & Teller: We saw their show at the Rio hotel - Would totally recommend this show. We paid extra to get 'VIP' tickets. This resulted in 2nd row seats and a free souvenier brochuere. It was a great show and there is an oppertunity for all guests to meet them both outside the thearte after the show (You may have a wait though). Mirage Secret Garden: 2 of us from our group done the 'Trainer for a Day' Programme that is on offer at the secret garden exhibit at the Mirage Hotel. It is pricey at $550 per person but this includes breakfast, lunch and a day interacting and swimming with the dolphins. Aswell as as souvenier photos. Helicopter Strip Tour: We booked our trip through 'HeliUSA'. It lasted around 15mins onboard the helicopter but the view of the strip/fremont street was amazing! Fremont Street & Stratosphere: We done both in one afternoon/evening. First we went up to the top of the Stratosphere which offers great views from all around then went via the bus to Fremont Street. Well worth a visit!.

Reviews.Title: “Only because of the price”
Reviews.Author: Ariel N
Reviews.Content: Nice location , good price . Lacks the "las vegas" experience in my opinion. Nothing too special. It's not special like the Venetian/MGM/etc... But the price was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - tired property”
Reviews.Author: Rosebud
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days for a mini vacation. The property is well located for access to all South strip attractions. A walkway connects it to Tropicana, New York New York and MGM and there is a tram to Luxor and Mandalay Bay. Check in was smooth and the clek was very friendly and accommodating. The resort fee had just been raised to $15 but includes two drink tickets er night which is fine if you like beer, house wine and well drinks. My friend ordered a shot of gin with a couple of olives. That worked. The bartenders were inconsistent when dealing with the tickets some were friendly knowing that would get them a tip. Others not so much. It helped if you put a dollar with the ticket. Our deal through delta included two buffets per room and we used it for breakfast. It was fine but I'm not sure I would have paid for it. Better options for breakfast were the pyramid grill at Luxor and the beach cafe at tropicana. A little morer expensive but worth it. The pool area was nice but stark with little shade I might stay at excalibur again but will likely try another property.

Reviews.Title: “Good price but too much smoke”
Reviews.Author: buckmountain
Reviews.Content: We booked the Excalibur via an Alaskan Air promo. (The alternative for about the same price was the Stratospere which is much older and at the raggedy north end of the strip.) By going during the week (Check in Monday, Check out Friday) we got rock bottom prices of 29 per night (tho be aware of the additional 15 per day "resort fee.") Still less than a Motel 6. We took a shuttle from the airport for 7 one way. (You can save 2 on a round trip but we had an early flight back and needed to take a taxi on the way home. Cab supposedly was 18-20) The shuttle sat around for a while until it was full then visited several hotels on the east side of the strip before finally getting to our hotel. (There are several different shuttles so look for one that is almost full so you won't have to wait very long.) They let you off in the back of the hotel and you have to walk through the whole very-smoky casino to get to the registration desk. The desk is not isolated from the casino so you have to breathe second hand smoke the whole time you wait in line. Luckily the line was short and moved fairly quickly. (You will be met by an official looking person who wants to give you a welcome gift. This is a time share salesman so blow them off and get in line before the other people on the shuttle get there. If you are really up to sitting through a long high pressure sales talk you can go talk to them later.) We asked for and were given a renovated non-smoking room without an extra charge. We were in 4222 but the card they gave us said Tower II, Floor 4, Room 22 with left us a little confused especially since the first time we tried 4222 the key didn't work. (Maybe we were a bit faster than the computer?). The way to Tower II leads through another long smoky area. We found later we can avoid most of the smoke by walking around the building to the left via the Valet/Taxi area. Much better for the lungs. (When you come down from the tower, go out the door and walk around to the right. Coming back in you come up the moving sidewalk and turn 180 degrees to the right and go back out the door then turn left.) The room was a pleasant surprise. Very clean. No smoke smell. Very comfortable beds. Nice TV. Free wired Internet. (The sign said the cable was behind the TV. It wasn't. Turned out it was behind the dresser under the TV.) Cable could have been longer. It was barely long enough to use while lying in bed. Bathroom was clean and looked new (though the shower head had a couple of calcium blocked outlets). Towels were nice and thick. On the negative side, the bedside lamp was so dim it was impossible to read the fine print on the telephone. The toilet was one of those like you find in a handicapped room. Not my favorite. The soap seemed rather harsh but it may have been the water or the dry air. The shampoo was the type with conditioner and didn't seem to work well. No coffee in the room but we knew that so brought an immersion heater, a filter holder, ceramic cups and coffee and made our own. (Room only has thin plastic disposable cups.) There was coffee available at the base of the tower - Mornings we often saw several people staggering into the elevator on their trek for coffee. Not sure if there was a charge for it or not. Reading the fine print of the check-in paperwork I found we were supposed to get a free newspaper. Turns out you have to pick it up at the little store at the base of the tower. Just show your room key and pick up a USA Today. Would have been nice if they had told us that. We also got two tickets to the buffet as part of the package. They said Breakfast, Lunch or Dinner on them but when we called to see when dinner started, we were told we had to get them signed by a manager or they wouldn't be valid for dinner. This seemed to be news to the manager but she did sign them for us. The buffet is reached from an escalator in the middle of the casino floor so you have to hold your breath and rush to the escalator. Taxi to the airport was only 12.75 plus tip so not a bad deal. Typically taxis that pick up at the airport have to pay a bit fee to the airport for the privilege which explains the 18-20 we were quoted at the airport. Would we stay there again? Now that we know how to avoid most of the smoke it's not a bad hotel so yes.

Reviews.Title: “Two words”
Reviews.Author: Danielle N
Reviews.Content: Bed Bugs........ As a single mom, I finally had the opportunity to take my children on a cheap family vacation. I choose this hotel for two reasons: It looked like a castle and it was cheap. Our first night was fine, but at 2 am on the second night, my mom discovered there were bed bugs! She called to notify the front desk and they sent a security guard to our room to inspect it. He took a statement from my mom and took the bug that she trapped in a tissue to show them. When we voiced our concerns about our personal belongings, he suggested that we place them in trash bags. I told him, that we refuse to carry these pests with us home and from what I have heard, bed bugs are extremely hard to get rid of. We asked him if we could get a copy of the report that my mom had to sign and he refused to give us a copy. Finally, after speaking with his co worker, he gave us a copy. The manager on duty asked us if we wanted to change rooms, initially we told her no (because if one room is infested, then I am sure the others are too.) After telling us that they needed the room for Ecolab, we told them that we were ok with being switched. We informed the manager that we were supposed to check out by 6 a.m. and we reminded her of this again when we decided to change rooms. They left us in that bug infested room for 3 hours until finally giving us a new room. It was 5 a.m. before we received the keys to a new room. There were bugs everywhere too! In our suitcases and in some of our clothes. We had to leave EVERYTHING behind, including my son's stroller. The hotel said they are waiting for some type of test results to come back, but it's obvious that there are bed bugs in that room and probably throughout the hotel. I want a reimbursement for the room and me and my children's clothing. \

Reviews.Title: “Better than Before, Comfy Stay in a Lovely Room.”
Reviews.Author: dpcarlow
Reviews.Content: First time back in 2 years and Excalibur has defiantly improved. We had a standard room with one double bed and the room was perfectly fine. The $32 all day buffet for Excalibur and Luxor is great value considering it lets you come and go from 7am to 10pm and includes unlimited sodas and desserts too. Our room also came with free local and national calls which was handy for booking dinners and shows. There is free internet but it is wired so if you need wifi you will have to go to the 24hr Krispy Kreme upstairs near the buffet for free usage. If, like us you need a little break from the vegas craziness then there is a cinema just across the road where you can catch all the latest movies to chill out for a while. Beware that a taxi ride from the airport to excalibur should be no more than $13, if you get charged any more for no reason than demand to speak to the taxi drivers manager.. Vegas is full of rip off cabbies..

Reviews.Title: “A castle in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: cantoosing
Reviews.Content: If you're traveling to Vegas for some fun & relaxation, the Excalibur Hotel is a nice place to stay. I wouldn't say it is one of the top of the line hotels but, it is rather well maintained, easy on the pocketbook and offers a great deal more ambiance on the casino floor than the other hotels. The hotel consists of two towers, with Tower 2 being the more upgraded remodeled rooms. Either tower is fine with us but, we really prefer Tower 1 for the views of the city. The food court on the 2nd level has a fairly decent buffet. If you purchase the "all day pass" during the breakfast buffet, then you can eat all you want for the rest of the day (up until 10pm). There is also a moving walkway on the 2nd floor which leads you to the Luxor & Mandalay Bay hotels. This is a very convenient and air-conditioned walkway. Something you might want to consider when it's 100 degrees outside. In the other direction, you have the over street walkways leading to New York, New York and the MGM hotels. The Excalibur is a spa & resort hotel. Though the room rates are very inexpensive, be advised that there is a $14 a night resort fee added to your room fees. Don't let this deter you too much however. The pool & spa area to the Excalibur is really nice and since you are paying for it, take advantage of it! Overall; I recommend this hotel over the others nearby. The casino floor is what influences my stay here and the Excaliburs casino floor is always lively.

Reviews.Title: “Go here for location, price, but not service...”
Reviews.Author: Disconation
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my girlfriend and her family they were from Mexico and non English speakers so we were pretty much the interpreters front desk staff had short patience as well as bartenders but it was clean and location was great... Buffet is horrible... You get what you pay for in Vegas but for an inexpensive strip hotel over all value did the job but I won't stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “More than expected”
Reviews.Author: Vannyd
Reviews.Content: I have been to Las Vegas 5 times. I have stayed at MGM, MGM Signature, Bellagio, Luxor. This time I stayed at the Excalibur because it was a last minute arranged trip and the price was very cheap. The hotel was more than I expected. We waited in line for about 20 minutes; however, take into consideration that we arrived early and it was Spring vacation weekend. So 20 minutes was actually nothing. We upgraded to one of their new rooms. It was very nice; spacious and clean. Not to mention that the bed and pillows were very comfy. We also enjoyed The Lounge band called The Klique. Love the music and imitations. Absolutely a extremely entertaining band. Kudos to them. We also try the new Italian restaurant: Buca di Beppo. Wow the portions were huge and tasty (I will do a separate review about this). In general we had a great time. I will be traveling to Vegas again in July but will be staying a MGM. However, I might definitely be back to stay at the Excalibur if the occasion arises. It is very good value for your $.

Reviews.Title: “Very boring place considering location.”
Reviews.Author: Lasershow
Reviews.Content: Nothing really exciting, but then again you do not have to pay the high prices they have at some of the other strip locations. We did not stay here but spent a majority of our trip here as we had many friends stay here during this trip. Lots of gambling and drinking. Even during slower times we had very few waitresses coming by while playing slots. It is a decent place if you decide to lower you budget.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Emmerson1982
Reviews.Content: It took us 2 hours to get checked in!!! We booked 2 rooms online through Expedia and had our printed itinerary with us with the correct dates but when we went to check in, we were told that 1 of our rooms was booked for the next month and the other was correct. She told us that the problem was not theirs and we would have to call Expedia to fix it (which was not cheap on our cell phone, they wouldn't let us use their phone) only to be told that the dates were all correct on their end. We were finally transferred to another clerk in another room and she was able to correct it. The rooms were very basic, no coffee maker, no bath, no fridge. The hotel was very dusty and smoky smelling and you are constantly hounded by staff trying to sell tickets and time shares. They did have some great restaurants. I recommend the italian one.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur Was rockin”
Reviews.Author: Josh-Sage A
Reviews.Content: Ok so my husband and I stayed at the castle for 4 days 3 nights and it was a great time. We stayed in the Wide screen king room which was so clean, neat, comfy, and lots of room for us. We loved the feel of the castle and its old school feel. the tournament of kings is a must see show if you are staying there or just if your in Vegas period! it was awesome. We liked the fact that Excalibur was partners with so many other hotels so we weren’t contained inside our own hotel. Excalibur has many things the offer and they are at a great price. Lets face it, you are maybe in your room for 10 hours the whole time you are there..will we did at least and we had a ton fun because our hotel didn’t cost a ton. Dicks is also in the castle and boy ooh boy that place is fun! This was my first time in Vegas and it was a great time and no bad experiences to report!

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur was a great cheap stay. Would stay again for sure!”
Reviews.Author: Shane A
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights, rooms were clean even had a couch. Bathroom was clean and quite nice. All staff I encountered were great but the older man at check in should probably not push his political views on people based on their home state. I agreed but some may be offended. We would stay again. Very inexpensive and has all that you need.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Peter2159
Reviews.Content: A good choice for a strip hotel, loads of food choice and friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Decent for the Price”
Reviews.Author: D85
Reviews.Content: The Excalibur was decent for the price. The room was a decent size, linens were clean, and food court/mall area was good. Decor and lighting was kind of dark however, and hallways smelled of smoke. Rooms somewhat worn, though we were not in a newly refurbished room so I kind of expected this.

Reviews.Title: “Fun filled week in Las Vegas at the Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: Julie C
Reviews.Content: We have been to Vegas probably 7-8 times. This time we thought we would try the Excalibur. I really love this hotel. We really enjoyed the house band on Friday and Saturday night called The Klique. Great music and current song selections. A great evening both nights. Love the selection of restaurants. Our favourite was Baja Fresh. A terrific Mexican restaurant. The hotel is attached to the Luxor which is attached to Mandalay Bay, so you don't even have to go outside to get to both locations. There is also a tram that travels between the three hotels. We usually stayed in the Miracle Mile area of Las Vegas Blvd, but I like this end just as well. With the air bridges, we never had to cross the busy streets. Our rooms were very clean and spacious. We will definitely be back to stay at the Excalibur. It is very good value for your $.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Theme in a Modern World destination”
Reviews.Author: JoelSallee
Reviews.Content: I booked this resort because it was the cheapest on the weekend I was traveling. I got all that I expected from this location and very little more. I stayed in one of their updated standard room. It had a large flat screen television, new carpet in the room and new tile and shower in the bathroom. Everything was clean. I could see that when they updated the rooms they took down pictures and fixtures and matched the wall paper to fill the holes, unfortunately it made the walls look like their were missing something. Had they taken the time to repaper the walls it would have been better. The beds were soft and comfortable. I think it is standard mattress with a soft pad but I am usually a bed snob and the beds were very nice and each bed had different pillows with varied firmness which is also very nice in my opinion. The table games had low minimum bets which is what I'd expect for the price. The dealers were nice enough but many have accents which makes it hard when they try to explain a new game. Overall, I was very happy for what I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed..”
Reviews.Author: Rhonda B
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews before i arrived,i did not know what to expect.Check in was long when we arrived to a line with about 100 people in it,only one cashier at the time.Finally after being in line forever we were checked in,we upgraded to a view room on the 14th floor.Expecting a bad room we got a nice room.Very impressed with it.Beds are comfortable,the staff on the floors were always pleasant and friendly.We ate at the buffet several times,food was very good.We walked to several different casino,and i do believe this one has the best and most games.To many children on the floors,saw a mom put her kid against wall and she went and played a slot.I was scared for the kid ,i kept my eyes on him so nothing happened to him.All in all my vacation to Vegas was an awesome,relaxing visit.Don't let all the bad reviews shy you away from coming here,it is a very nice,clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Westsussexgirl1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in June 2011 It is a good hotel, slightly dated in the main areas but we stayed in one the widescreen rooms which was newly re-furbished and right by the pool, the room was massive and overlooked the swimming pool area although we were too high up to hear any noise from it and I was really impressed with the room The pool are was nice and we never had a problem getting sunbeds, we generally went out and about in the mornings headed to the pool for the afternoon for some R & R before heading out in the evenings We had dinner at Dick's last resort, great laugh and I recommend to anyone who stays in the hotel, just becareful with some of the waiter if there are large groups of girls/women they pay more attention to them than anyone else having said that we had a good time and a great laugh The location on the hotel is great right next door to new york new york and MGM bit of a walk down to the other end of the strip but we didn't mind that too much. I can't comment on the food as we hardly ate in the hotel at all just on our first night at dick's last resort and the Mcdonalds for breakfast. We only really gambled on the roulette table on the last night, the only thing I found was it is quite smokey and people don't care if you don't smoke and they sit smoking right next to you...frustrating but one of those things you expect it really Overall Good hotel and I would recommend it and would go back to stay there if I return to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Ga2r111
Reviews.Content: The Excalibur was satisfactory. Checkin was fast with friendly staff. The rooms are outdated and you could tell that maintenance that was done was not of high quality and just pieced together.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap..but still”
Reviews.Author: tash710
Reviews.Content: Excalibur is amazing from the outside, but is very dated on the inside. rooms smell of smoke from years of smoking in the rooms. its a bit of an average hotel. it is cheap, but its at the bottom of the strip so it might cost a bit in cabs to get to the good parts instead of walking. you also get people in the lobby trying to get you to buy condos every time you walk in.

Reviews.Title: “Party in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: girlsweekout4
Reviews.Content: This hotel the Excalibur is reasonable and has a great location on the strip. The rooms are average but clean. The casino floor is big but not overwhelming. My husband and I could find each other easily. The buffet is average, and they have enough bars. If on a budget this is the place to stay. We only spent our sleeping hours in the room the rest of the time we enjoyed doing shows and visiting other high lights.

Reviews.Title: “Better then expected”
Reviews.Author: rmb0707
Reviews.Content: I haven't stayed at Excalibur in many years, mainly because I did not like their casino. I was pleasantly surprized of how much I enjoyed the resort on this trip. The rooms are ok. They have wide screen TVs with plenty of channels to choice from. They are a low end resort so they don't charge a lot for the rooms. Maybe I like their casino now because I got a royal flush on this trip but I do not like their payout schedule. I could find only 6/5 jacks or better on the 25 cent machines . That is horrible. The cocktail waitresses don't come around enough and the bartenders are rude. Their beer selection is horrible; the casino weeped of smoke, I love their food court and they have a Baja Fresh at casino level. Dick's Last Resort has great food. Their chicken is the best I have ever had. The location is great . Next door to new York, new York and very close to Mandalay Bay

Reviews.Title: “The castle”
Reviews.Author: Erica W
Reviews.Content: The only castle themed hotel in Vegas, with great eye candy as u walk in the doors, the rooms were good size, they had secrety at the door to the hotel so strangers could not get in, there was four pools to enjoy, was located at the top of the strip, staff were friendly and helpful, no free wifi, but could find some up at the McDonald's which wasn't to far walk, the only thing I could falt is the smell of smoke inside the casino.

Reviews.Title: “Way better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: iAshley A
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the bad reviews I was a little worried about my trip. A lot of people made this hotel sound horrible and gross! I expected to walk into a hotel similar to a Dollar Inn. It was nothing like that. We arrived early, before it was time for early check-in. Once we were able to check in everything went well. It was fast. They did not have the room I had requested,but we were checking in early so that was expected. I am happy they didn't have that room, because the one we ended up in was nice. Nothing fancy but it was clean and comfortable. I wanted to take the bed home! We were in tower 1 10th floor, it had a flat screen t.v and a view of Luxor and Mandalay Bay.The employees at check-in were nice! I didn't see trash in the hallways or the elevators like some claimed. We had the privacy sign on the door, so housekeeping did not come in to clean, but a message was left on the in room phone to give housekeeping a call when we were ready for the room to be cleaned. They had a Mcdonalds with a dollar menu in the hotel, which was great! The one thing I would reccomend not doing, is eating at the buffet. We had a free voucher and decided to go for lunch. It was pretty gross, I wished I had passed on it. They were handing out lots of coupons for buy 1 drink get 1 free. The casino was smokey but so were all the others. I am from Indiana and the Indiana Live Casino is way worse. Check out was fast and friendly. I knew there would be a resort fee at check out because when I booked the room it said there would be. I would deff. stay here again!! I think a lot of these negative reviews were expecting too much. You see the price when you book, so you shouldn't expect anything fancy, but it is worth the money to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, maybe 3 1/2 rating!”
Reviews.Author: imawandrer
Reviews.Content: We bought a package, with friends, for 5 nights, including air. Good value! Not my favorite place to stay in Vegas, but clean and a great location. Lots of slot machines, many newer, decent casino. But, better for families, too many kids. Wi-fi is almost never free in a casino hotel. They want you down gambling!

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Baby!!!!!! The Wolfpack”
Reviews.Author: brian t
Reviews.Content: Great price for a good room. Its Vegas, who cares about staying in your room. Go out and experience the strip!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay on the strip for reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: AAlva1
Reviews.Content: Excalibur is affordable and offers many great things. It has a great location with plenty of dining, entertainment and nightlife options. I have stayed in several other locations and found Excalibur is the best bang for my buck!

Reviews.Title: “Just average, nothing more...”
Reviews.Author: Charile P
Reviews.Content: Ok I stayed at the Excalibur and it was ok as far as the price is concerned. I think it is truly for the visitor on a budget. Other than that I cannot think of a good reason to stay here again. It is was extremely roudy, but I am also in Vegas but it seemed more than usual. The quality of the hotel is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Fancy , but Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: NORTHERNRUBICON
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Excalibur for a recent holiday in Vegas.We are retired and travel on a budget, we look for a good , clean place to stay at a reasonable price and we were not disapointed. Their buffet resurant was one of the best we tried. the Excalibur is very well located on the strip. The only faults we had was it took a couple days before they got our web service working in our room . they sent a service person right away but it was a complicated problem to locate. Also we would have liked a coffee pot in the room, but on the other hand one cup less in the morning was good for me anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: ronzinho
Reviews.Content: The hotel was OK, but I don't think we would stay there again. Yes, it is well situated on The Strip. Yes, the price is reasonable (at least by Las Vegas standards). Watch out for the resort fee - although most of the Las Vegas charge this, it is a total ripoff. Just an extra charge for stuff I neither want nor need. There was a lot of noise from other guests coming and going (and screaming) at all hours. Is this the hotels fault? I'm not sure but it is a fact. Probably a hotel without a casino (if there is one) would be quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur - Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: PLan977
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur for two nights 2/22 and 2/23. I reserved an upgraded room with a view. After a speedy check in we were assigned room 16207. The room was very clean and had a nice view of the New York hotel and the roller coaster. We were right upstairs from the pool area and an exit of the hotel. There is a security guard stationed by the elevators so that only guests can access the towers. The casino definitely smelled of smoke but all casinos allow smoking and so you can't really avoid the smell. The pool area was great and the hot tubs were the right temperatures. There are multiple dining options such as McDonalds, Baja Fresh and Dicks Last Resort. We only ate at the buffet which was just o.k. but I'm not a buffet lover. The hotel is a long walk from the center of the strip but for the cost, the value is excellent. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: vivalasvegas_13
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Excalibur twice, during which both have been enjoyable and great value for money. I found the staff friendly and helpful and the rooms were always up to my expectations. I have heard alot of negative feedback about this hotel and people complaining about the resort fees recently. But I have always found that even with the cost of the resort fee added onto the room cost it is still excellent value for money. I will definately consider staying here again for my wedding next June.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: adison0723
Reviews.Content: I was doubtful before I booked in here but we watched a Jabbawockeez show and this is the nearest decent and cheap place to stay. Honestly, the place is not bad at all. The staff are courteous. We were placed in the left wing (below the coffee shop) and the room is even larger than i thought. It doesn't smell, the bathroom is decent and amenities are complete. We didn't go here to play in the casino though but we did get breakfast in Starbucks inside the hotel. I'd say this is the cheapest hotel you can get in the strip that is a good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Ron_Sweeney
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful at Excalibur. The room was very clean. The service was outstanding, and you can not beat the price. My favorite hotel in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out !”
Reviews.Author: cscsflorida
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok, it could use some upgrading. The only thing that upset me was when we checked out ,there was a $14.00 a day "resort fee" we had to pay.This, we were told, was for the use of the facilities, ie; the pool (60 degrees out) ,spa & some other stuff that we were never told about. Be careful of low rates, they seem to have hidden fees.

Reviews.Title: “Resort Fee Scam”
Reviews.Author: taber
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 days at the Excalibur and chose this hotel because we met other family there. Fantastic room rate but then they add an extra $15/night on for resort fee charge. (use of pool, internet, fax etc). To use the internet, you have to have a laptop & who is sending faxes when they are in Las Vegas. 1st day at the pool - 3 of the 4 pools were closed and the hot tub at the open pool was broken. So much for this fancy resort. The next day we went to the pool, larger pool was open and it's hot tub did work. Crazy way of doing things, but, that is Las Vegas. The room we had was large and fairly clean. Only problem and a big problem was the door didn't always lock & with just a little push it would open. The location is great & handy to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal if all you're going to do is sleep here”
Reviews.Author: aschrader78
Reviews.Content: We just stayed 5 nights at the Excalibur, 3/2 - 3/7. When we booked through priceline, we were offered a free buffet with our stay. They re-negged this offer at check-in, and when I argued they upgraded us to a "widescreen room" in Tower 2. The room was nice, with a large bathroom, pillowtop beds and a nice view of the strip. The room itself was very clean and did not smell of smoke. The pillows were very nice and the sheets were white and clean. My only complaint is that the bedding was thin so I had to call down for more blankets. AND... the resort fees. Supposedly this fee covers the internet, but what you get is a 3-foot long dinosaur-age internet cable. And it's SLOW. The casino area is dark and smoky. We did not spend much time here because while the rooms were fairly modern, the rest of the hotel is in serious need of an upgrade and feels dirty. And I agree with the other poster who mentioned the drunk people. We actually saw a glass of pee sitting next to the elevator one night, and shared a ride down on our way out one evening with someone so stoned they couldn't stand upright. And we got really sick of being stalked by people selling timeshares downstairs.They are EVERYWHERE! Eventually we just got to where we ignored them completely.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all!”
Reviews.Author: tdarrock
Reviews.Content: I was expecting this place to be a lot worse than how it really was. We had a wide-screen room that, although wasn't great, was clean and comfortable with a great view. We paid very little to stay here, and for a city that you are not going to be in your room all that much, it was perfect. I will say, Vegas runs on tips, and if you take care of people who work there, they will take care of you! Also, the pool was quite nice..nothing spectacular but was great for a few hours!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: mrmikekellyesq
Reviews.Content: While there are many more upscale properties in Las Vegas, Excalibur (which started as a Circus Circus property) has always been family and value-oriented. It's close to the airport and adjacent to a freeway entrance. Those things are important as the strip is often gridlocked with traffic. Often the fastest way from one end of the strip to the other is by back streets. The rooms are nice. They are what you would expect. Basic and clean. Its the location and proximity to other attractions that makes this hotel stand out. (It's now an MGM property, and is across the street from their main hotel.) Great pool area and a good show for the family.

Reviews.Title: “Exciting looking place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn J
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a couple in September 2010. Wehad a room in Towwer 1 which was a decent sized but not up to a very good standard compare to what we ahd already stayed in in America. We took our things back down to reception and told the staff how we felt. We upgraded to a room inTower 2 for $60 for a 4 night stay. This room was fantastic it had a huge bed, small dinning area, dressing table and a nice bathroom which was fine for what we needed. We thought it was great value for money as the hotel is in a good location and is great to look at. We had a great stay at this mega casino and would stay there again (in Tower 2) if we were lucky enough to visit Las Vegas again.

Reviews.Title: “Low end of the strip”
Reviews.Author: orangecat1
Reviews.Content: I just stayed here 5 nights on business since i was at a convention. On the positive the rooms (even the upgraded ones) are cheap! For starters casino is consumed with smoke (you will smell bad) and be prepared for a huge amount of drunk people stumbling in and out of the elevators AND all through the hallways at all hours (like 4 and 5am). Why? they give you 10 free drink tickets when you arrive - and my guess is that people use them all! In the room the showers suck -- low pressure and the room has a loud a/c / heating unit. The buffet is so bad i'm not even sure you can all it food - complete crap (walk to MGM). Went to the spa today - again low standard poor service. Overall the place is fine is you are on a budget - do your best never to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “50th birthday”
Reviews.Author: KAVGlendaleAz
Reviews.Content: This is our hotel of choice on the strip. Others are fancier, others are more expensive but the care that you receive from the employees of the Excalibur are something special. No matter who i spoke with, they had manners, responded kindly and were very helpful. Loved my maid teresa on the 12th floor.

Reviews.Title: “low price for a reason”
Reviews.Author: bigCS
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Excalibur this time because it was one of the cheapest on the strip. Check in was a little longer than it should have been, about 25 minutes. The room on the 13th floor had a wonderful view (not) of the roof vents. The room was your standard Red Roof Inn quality but had comfortable beds and a flat screen TV. Walk in shower with very little water pressure. It looked dated. The heater/AC was mounted below the window. Temperture control was off or freezing. The unit was very dirty. The casino was fairly nice with the usual table and slots. Drinks were very watered down and and service at the bar while playing video poker was not necessarily comped (no premium bar service). The buffet was not good and certainly not worth any amount of money. I stayed at Luxor with my wife in a tower room in November and would go there before ever going back to Excalibur. What bothered me about the casino was that they had little kids (6-12 Yrs old) walking through the casino while there were people gambling and drinking and while girls were stripping on stage in the middle of the casino. People need to stay off the strip if they are coming for a cheerleading competition

Reviews.Title: “RATES DECEPTIVE - BUFFET ORDINARY”
Reviews.Author: whopper65
Reviews.Content: The Excalibur, unfortunately, does not advertise that their low rates are subject to a "resort tax" that adds quite a bit to the total. And this applies to each night. For this supposed use of resort facilities, you end up paying more than if you went to a nicer hotel complex that does not charge the resort tax. The buffet was a disappointment, just ordinary buffet food with nothing special. The desserts looked like they had been out a while, and some of the food slots were empty. Their are better deals in Vegas at better hotels. Drop the "resort tax", Excalibur, and you can raise your nightly rates half of that tax, and you might attract more visitors without the rancor and disappointment when they read the fine print after they've already booked and arrived at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Ventilation! Heavy SMOKE SMELL”
Reviews.Author: caprililac
Reviews.Content: I really was not happy with this hotel. My biggest complaint is about the ventilation. It is really bad! So much smoke smell and so little fresh air throughout the whole place. I think this place is ready for a major makeover. It is not worth the few extra bucks you are saving to stay here. I suggest pay the extra 30 bucks and stay at a much nicer place on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: SGP_2012
Reviews.Content: The Casino was very smoky and out dated. Once we checked in; they send us up to a room that was already occupied. We walked into a room with an entire family already settled in the room; what an embrassing moment for all their guests. It was a very poor first impression for all. I would definitely not recommend the Excalibur to anyone nor stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money on the strip”
Reviews.Author: ThomasGBG
Reviews.Content: The rooms are large and has free WIFI (not wireless). The hotel has seen it´s best days but is OK. The check in and out procedures are quick. There are free parking within the hotel. Be aware that even if you have prepaid the room, there is an extra resort fee (about 14 $) that you need to pay. I would recommend this hotel if you want to stay on the Strip but yo don´t need the little extras.

Reviews.Title: “worst experience at Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: Jaime B
Reviews.Content: This was my very first trip to Vegas...stayed at Excalibur 4 nights. First off, the bedskirt and pillow case had toothpaste on them. Secondly, the very RUDE and HARASSING people stop you every time you leave/enter the hotel, trying to "give you a free night stay" which is complete BS! They would not leave us alone! We visited about a dozen other hotels and not one other one did that to us! Plus there is no complementary breakfast but we ate at the lovely excalibur buffet, where they load you in like cattle. Needless to say, I ended up getting sick from the food. At check-out, no one asked how our stay was (surprise surprise) and when I stood at the desk, wanting to complain, the lady looked at me, then looked away. Never again!!! Save your money because trust me its not worth it! Next time we will stay at the Super 8!

Reviews.Title: “The worst Vegas hotel experience I have ever had was at the EXCALIBUR”
Reviews.Author: jacey1127
Reviews.Content: Initially my wedding trip to began wonderfully. My fiance and I arrived early on Tuesday morning around 2 am. The staff was friendly and cordial. The next morning I awoke to find that my ATM card was charged additional fees. I was told that I would be charged 15 dollars a day for resort fees and a 30 dollar deposit was needed to book the room which only left my balance for the cost of the room. None of the additional fees were mentioned and I asked how much in total would be charged to my card at check out before I booked the room. I was told that all of my charges including the resort fees and my deposit would be 94 dollars. That was it. After speaking with an extremely rude check-in employee the next morning it was explained to me that the money held wouldn't be back on my card until 4 days after I checked- out but she couldn't explain why my card was charged 3 separate occasions for 3 separate amounts after I paid a deposit and they already took out for the room. Then when we were ready to check out I waited in line for 20 minutes with no one in front of me. No employee even so much as said that they would be right with me or acknowledged me and there were 3 people behind the counter. I finally walked up to the counter and a woman at the computer said rudely "Oh hold on a second." Then the bell hop drops my luggage in the middle of the lobby and my husband had to yell and flag him down to stop him because he kept walking and then set our bags on the curb and waited for a tip! My dress was on the cart and my computer!

Reviews.Title: “Good for price, and for families with kids”
Reviews.Author: ruthy01545
Reviews.Content: This hotel is old(er), but is VERY clean. The room was especially clean, most importantly the bathroom! The rooms could use a face lift, or at least new wall paper. The Buffet was NOT good at all. For the price you can get a better meal in the food court or in one of the restaurants on the first floor. It's nice that they have two Starbuck, 1st and 2nd floors. The pool was very nice and clean as well. Would stay here with kids, but if staying as a couple spend a few more bucks and stay some where nicer. It's also on one end of the strip so you have to walk a bit to get to the center, and action.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and filthy”
Reviews.Author: Petra_DL
Reviews.Content: We´ve stayed in Las Vegas before, but this was our first time in the Excalibur, and also our last. We had to wait half an our before check in, and after that, our room wasn´t even ready even though it was almost 5 pm. The room was spacious, the bed comfortable, but the bathroom was filthy. We found several black hairs on the sink and even on the towels, disgusting. We also found someone else´s toothpaste and bodywash in the shower... and some more garbage elsewhere in the room. Every time we went through the casino and lobby, we were also harrassed by some people for a time share, very annoying. Luckily we only stayed one night. The next day we had to wait another half hour to check out. When we got our invoice, a ´resort fee´ was charged to us; almost 45% of the amount. All in all, it´s a cheap hotel and the location is good, at the beginning of the Strip. Parking is easy. But you get what you pay for, and we will not come back, rather pay some more and have more cleanliness and luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad At All!!”
Reviews.Author: MCZP
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently on a very last-minute trip to Vegas. Since I was booking at the last-minute there were not many reasonably priced packages left, so I reluctantly decided to chance it and go with the Excalibur. The hotel itself is a little bit cheesy, but the casino is decently clean and not as smoky as some of the other older hotels on the strip. The room was AWESOME! I was actually really surprised when I walked in and saw how big and modern it was. The bed was super comfy, nice flat screen tv with lots of channels, a sitting area, huge bathroom, and a great view! There was also free internet (corded) which I didn't notice until the last day. Nice touch, but would have been nice if they had told me upon check-in. This hotel charges a $15/night resort fee, but they give free drink vouchers that can be redeemed at a handful of the lounges in the Excalibur or Luxor. I normally like to stay mid-strip, so the Excalibur wouldn't be my first choice in the future, but it was not bad! I would consider staying here again if the price was substantially better than other hotels offered in a package deal.

Reviews.Title: “Meh............”
Reviews.Author: brybass
Reviews.Content: I get the whole Mid Evil theme which is fine. The outside looks nice, but I just got this old and dusty feeling on the inside and I don't like the way the place is organized. We were given the wrong room the first time and after an attitude from the desk girl, we got another room, the remodeled room we originally upgraded to in the first place. The rooms don't come with a microwave nor coffee pots, so you are basically forced to purchase a lot. The included resort fee is unnecessary and pointless. We didn't use any of the the things included in it. This hotel doesn't even come with WIRELESS INTERNET, just LAN cord! I honestly will not be returning to this hotel. I just get the dirty, cheap feeling from this place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for me”
Reviews.Author: Perm611
Reviews.Content: I go to Vegas every year with a group of friends and we always stay at the Excalibur! It's not upperclass and is priced accordingly, rooms are clean and maintained, Buffet is good and it has the best poker room for socializing! Great location at the top of the strip near some other big hotels like MGM Grand, New York New York and hooters is minutes walk away for a bit of must see taccyness! Never any complaints from us!

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: UMeAndDupree
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel for the price and location. Perfect for families as they have a game room right in the resort. Tram connects you to the Mandalay bay and the Luxor. Rooms are average. Decent but nothing extravagant. Has a Pizza Hut, Quiznos and McDonald's so not all meals have to cost a fortune. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money, if you know how. Best booked on the Net.”
Reviews.Author: Bushankd
Reviews.Content: Hidden costs all around. But that is Las Vegas. You get charged $14 plus taxes per room per day as Resort charges. Unless you tip, you wont get a good room or even the time of the day. Best bet is book over the net. On the strip, Excalibur is to my mind most reasonably priced. Pizza Hut on the first floor is a good bet. The buffet is the same every day for 365 days. I know since I have been twice a year over the last couple of years.The Mexican food in Baaja is value for money. Anywhere else, it will cost you an arm & a leg. but, the Excalibur is reasonably priced compared to other MGM properties. A MLife member card adroitly used will help. Rooms are good & house keeping is good as well.

Reviews.Title: “Gross AND depressing.”
Reviews.Author: Gerber77
Reviews.Content: Maybe it was nice when it first opened, but it's pretty depressing now -- dirty, cheap and ugly. The time for this type of resort has passed for Las Vegas, it's not a place for family vacations (and it probably shouldn't have been). Remember the good old days when you got comped for everything if you gambled? No anymore. Instead they offer cheap rooms and then add "resort fees" to make up for the money their losing. What's a resort fee for? The food is terrible and overpriced, the hotels are in need of upgrades and the tourists are tacky. Excalibur needs to get demolished and rebuild as something else.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely filthy room”
Reviews.Author: Victori R
Reviews.Content: I was appalled by the condition of the bathroom when I entered and later, by the condition of the entire room. I immediately needed to use the restroom upon entry (to urinate - it is important to mention), and realized AFTER I stood up that my butt was wet - yuck - what could that possibly be??! Then turning to flush, saw that there was stool in the toilet (the small amount that sometimes gets stuck to the inside of the bowl, but is EASILY removed by a scrub brush...). Obviously, the toilet had NOT been cleaned. There was also a LARGE clump of long, black hair on the wall of the shower (discovered later) and a smear of something on the bedside table that came off with a damp cloth. You may be wondering why I stayed in the room??? I asked the cleaning crew, who were on the floor working when I checked in, to clean my toilet, so that issue seemed to resolve things. It wasn't until later than I saw the hair and the gop on the table to further my impression that the room was simply and shockingly not cleaned. I have now reported the lack of cleanliness to the management of the hotel, who "compensated" me for my inconvenience. However, there is no excuse for the filth that was present in this room, and I wanted to broadcast this information a bit further to inform future guests. I was in Tower I, and understand that Tower II has had some renovations (my furniture looked like it came from a dumpster), but also heard from a guest in Tower II that it was quite disappointing as well. I would NEVER recommend this hotel and will NEVER stay there again, just to make myself patently clear.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Tracy R
Reviews.Content: IJust got back on Feb 24th with my girls(16&18) this was my 3rd time staying at this hotel and loved it. They were very courtious and gave us a free room upgrade, and the room was clean, but the housekeeping staff we very loud in the hallways in the morning. We slept in the first day so they never did come back to clean our room. The hotel is older but is at the south end of the strip so it makes it easy to decide which way to go to walk the strip. They were very kind to the kids and we had a great time. Down side is there was no wifi in the rooms only high speed internet, however if you go to the second floor they have a doughnut shop with free wifi. Will definatly return.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Get-Away”
Reviews.Author: LindaG42036
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently visited Las Vegas to take in the attractions. I booked at Excalibur mainly due to the low rates I got. Upon arrival I was pleasantly surprised. The rooms were great - nice views and very clean. They didn't have coffee in the room but you could get it in the lobby. The best thing about our stay was it was so convenient to shows and displays. It is connected to the Luxor so visiting the aquarium, Titanic display and Chris Angel show was a breeze. The other reason I would return was the fact they had fast food restaurants available on one level - making cheaper meals available when desired. They also provided specials for the buffets between the two facilities. (Excalibur and Luxor) They get my vote for a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but needs refurbishing”
Reviews.Author: Traveler-O-World
Reviews.Content: Had a comfortable 2-nights stay at this centrally located hotel. There was no facility of Tea/Cofee in the room - the Excalibur Management may please take Note and provide this "basic" facility in the rooms. Further, the room & facilities seem to be in need of refurbishing.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur needs renovation...”
Reviews.Author: boobot
Reviews.Content: It has been several years since I stayed at Excalibur when visiting Vegas... I don't remember the rooms being so worn. They need to renovate the entire hotel portion. I arrived on a Thursday afternoon for a quick, one-day visit. The place was extremely busy for a weekday in February. I read the reviews before I placed my booking. Many visitors to Excalibur mentioned that Tower II had been renovated so I asked for a 'widescreen' room with a view on a upper floor of Tower II. I don't know about the rest of Tower II but floor 26 has NOT been renovated. Our room was worn, dingy and greatly in need of repair. Also, one of the reasons I stayed there was they sent me an offer for $25 for the night. It turned out that my request of a view room raised the price to $60+ and also had an additional room tax and a $15 resort fee added on. I should have stayed at the Venetian as I have been doing, it wouldn't have been much more expensive. I rating I gave Excalibur is because I do like to play there and the other MGM properties nearby. I just wish they would truly remodel the whole place.

Reviews.Title: “Old standby”
Reviews.Author: ihatecats
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Vegas , didnt do so good. 4th time at hotel in 18 years. We had a comp for 3 day so only paid for 1 ($180) . It is located center strip , but when you have 1 thing in mind it doesn't matter. The casino rates like most in the area, but you should travel to the old strip for better payouts. It is a great place to be located in Vegas , but look around if you are the serious gambler .

Reviews.Title: “Refurbished, Fun, no wifi”
Reviews.Author: highdesertwanderer
Reviews.Content: The Excalibur is a nice hotel. It is large, has plenty of restaurants and can be a lot of fun. If you are there for fun, and didn’t bring a device relying upon wifi, it is a great place to stay. The rooms have been updated and IF the housekeeping staff didn’t let the property down, it could be an even better place to stay. You may ask why I single out the housekeeping staff, well here is why. Housekeeping is a thankless job where most only notice a job not done and rarely if ever acknowledge a job well done. In this room, the Ethernet cable was damaged so it would not stay connected to your computer. If you are addicted to your tablet, don’t bring it unless it has a connection other than wifi. Since you are tethered to the table by the Ethernet cable it would be nice if there was an electrical outlet close by. The room had recently been updated and the ice bucket was brand new. The reason I know it is brand new is that the plastic used to protect the handle from scratches was still in place where it was taped to the handle. When we first arrived, the bathroom lights did not work. We called the front desk to inquire and they said, oh, the GFI in the bathroom must be tripped. So, can anybody explain how the housekeeper did not know this or fix it. The GFI does not trip without a cause and it should not have been an issue. We were there for 5 nights and the plastic was never removed from the ice bucket eventhough it was moved to its proper location EVERY DAY by the house keeper. So, would I stay there again? Maybe. But, if you are there and don’t have any plans to do any work while there, absolutely consider it. I work nonstop so I am a bit more focused on issues which affect my ability to get work done. The room was clean, it was a very good value and barring the shortcomings of the housekeeper, it was a good stay. If you have any questions, please feel free to message me directly. If you found this to be helpful, please hook me up with a helpful vote! Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Fair Value-If you're brave”
Reviews.Author: djhershey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Excalibur 2/9-2/13/12. We figured we'd try a more budget conscious hotel for this trip as it was part business. While we succeeded in keeping within our budget, we found was both a downside and an upside. Right off the bat when we checked in, it seemed they didn't care that there were empty beer bottles on their counter. When opening our room door, the wall on the doorknob/lock side "moved" as if it wasn't exaclty secure. The dresser was on it's last legs, with drawers that barely slid in/out and handles missing. It was apparent that the room was given a 5 minute "once over" cleaning, not a real cleaning. There was a man's coat stuffed in the in-room safe. There was a candy wrapper on the floor peeking out from the bedskirt. There was mold in the corners of the bathroom. There was garbage and dishes along the hallway that would be there 2+ days. There was garbage in the elevators that would be there 2+ days, and they appeared that they had never been wiped down during our stay. There are a lot of shady characters heading through the room elevators and security never checked anyone's room key. For the upside, we received a room with a partial view of the strip which was nice as we didn't upgrade or ask. There was an adequate convenience store and food court, including a McDonalds which had the $1 menu. We found this great for breakfast. Taxi service was fast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - great hotel”
Reviews.Author: LouLou09000
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights - was perfect. Stayed in a double twin room - beds and room where huge with plenty of space. Huge tele with plenty of chanels. Bathroom also had great space. Rooms where clean with Great cleaning service. Buffet breakfast on the 2nd floor $16 all you can eat - you can get anything you can think and has much of it as you ant for breakfast. Casino isn't the nicest out of the strip but plenty of nice ones around, just walking distance. Overall a good and pleasent stay. Value for money

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but in need of updates”
Reviews.Author: Livetotravel
Reviews.Content: I travel to Vegas a couple of times a year, and this past year booked a room at the Excaliber because most everything else was booked. I was disappointed in the quality of the hotel, as everything was in need of updates, and most everywhere there was a noticeable smell of smoke. Compared to other hotels in the same price range, this would not be my first choice. The location is good, as it's close to New York-New York, MGM, and Monte Carlo, so that's a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Find Someplace Else To Stay!”
Reviews.Author: glass_man111
Reviews.Content: We come to Vegas each year for convention. Normally, we stay at the MGM Grand but several years ago started stayping at different hotels just because there is so much in Vegas. This was our first stay here and everything was a disaster. Started with checking into a room that had not been cleaned, walking into unmade bed with a bathroom that literally someone had gotten sick in (booty duty all over the place). Hotel personel could care less and just said, "Well get you another room" with no concern at all. The next room was at least clean but none of the electrical items worked including the wireless control for the heat/air conditioner. Finally, the third room was okay! We were staying for the week. On the third day, my wife had some sorta pain attack that doubled her over when we started to walk outside late one night to see the lights. Her pain was so bad that we ended up taking her to the hospital where she had emergency surgery for a double strangulated hernia in her stomach. When it started, the hotel personel treated it as "so what, no big deal". Nobody at this place cares about anything except getting your money. We expected at least some sort of followup from the management since she could have died on their front doorstep. But no! We finally got back to the motel Thursday where we stayed until our flight out Friday night. The people at US Airways were one hundred times more accomidating and helpful than anybody at Excalibur. So like I have said... find someplace else to stay. This place is a disgrace to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: NickelCa
Reviews.Content: Cheap yes, but hotel is dirty, unhelpful, and out dated. We only stayed here due to the fact that we were not going to spend a lot of time here anyway but after seeing this place I would spend more to make sure my belongings were ok. The counter wouldn't allow us to keep our cake in the fridge for an hour (unlike the Hilton) and a Bel hop who had brought over a cart for us to pur our things on had the nerve so say he worked separately from the bel hops inside and was implying I needed to tip him now. I was like um ok and continued to walk away as he had done nothing to deserved one nor was he escorting our things to the room. Room very outdated and musty...won't stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good service, nice rooms - great value on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: Allamys
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Excalibur from Sat, 2/18 thru Tues, 2/21. We booked this hotel through a package with Southwest Vacations. We found the hotel to be clean, the staff to be friendly and helpful. Our room was nice, clean, roomy. The bed was comfortable (had a king). The bathroom was nice, clean. It had only a shower ( a large one). We were later told that this hotel has no rooms with bath tubs. The gambling was good and the casino staff(dealers, etc) were friendly and helpful. This casino/hotel is connected to the Luxor which is then connected to Mandalay Bay thru internal walkways. New York-New York is connected via an external bridge. There are many shops and restaurants in this hotel which gives you lots of choices to eat. We ate at the Buca Di Beppo Italian place upstairs and the buffet. They were good. There is a food court with your normal "mall" type food shops as well. I would recommend this hotel/casino and would probably stay here again.
