A few cons but they are only a few.... gambling tables were kind of worn and a little dirty. Elevators were dirty... they need swept several times a day in my opinion. We really enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Yet another satisfied visit to the Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: Flyguy05
Reviews.Content: Visited Excalibur for presidents day weekend, rooms expensive all over the strip, but I somehow got lucky to get the room for a weekday price (don't know if it was a system error with their Mlife website, or it was a semi "comp") either way it was good. Asked for a room not facing a wall, but got one that was facing tower II, didn't bother me much, because I pretty much it wasn't a wall lol. Reception for those who need to use their phone on the internet is not so great when you aren't facing the Luxor, Las Vegas Blvd, Tropicana Blvd or the mountains. Casino this time was good, it was really busy and tables were pretty high. Cocktail waitress was amazing, she remembered me by name and kept on coming to see if I needed any drinks. The dealers at the Craps tables are always great (especially when I hit a number and got them so much money). Vegas itself is not really meant for kids, but the excalibur did a good job in having a "Fun Dungeon" as they call it for the kids to have fun while the adults are having their good time. So this is a good place for families. Will definately be returning again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for families”
Reviews.Author: skaym89
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here on our vacation on the strip. We had a great time! The hotel was in a good location for us as we very much enjoyed the shows at MGM. It's not luxury but it's a great value for the price. The pool area if I remember correctly had a really neat waterfall that my little cousin was amazed with. Overall, the trip was great. No complaints about cleanliness, price, or noise. For Vegas, it's a great family hotel choice.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Upgrading”
Reviews.Author: hillcolorado
Reviews.Content: This hotel, though reasonable was outdated. We were in Tower I. Wallpaper was peeling off the walls, furniture in the room was VERY worn, and the bathroom needed an uplift. We probably would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Updated but still needs Work”
Reviews.Author: AJK789
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Excalibur at the end of January for 3 nights. This was our first time staying at this hotel even though I personally had been to Las Vegas many times. Overall, our stay was only average. Check-in was less than enthusiastic. I had booked a renovated deluxe room. However, upon arrival the clerk gave us only 2 choices - 7th floor Tower II or 3rd floor Tower I. In an effort to perhaps encourage some other choices for us, I mentioned that it was our anniversary and was greeted with a congratulations and what room would you like reply. Nothing resulted from this and so we took the 7th floor room which was actually a good choice. Very quiet floor and location. The room faced west and we had a view of the swimming pool, mountains and the parking lot. The room was clean in all manner. However, even though it was considered renovated, it still looked old and tired. The desk chair had old golden colored courdory material. The lighting was also dark even with 3 lights on. That could have been caused by the color scheme of the walls and carpet - dark browns and tans. The grating/cover over the AC/heating unit was already broken at one corner. The bathroom was a high point. It only had a shower but it was very clean. Housekeeping did a very good job - no complaints on this service. The overall appearance of the hotel gave it a tired expression. The casino smelled of smoke but this smell did not reach up to our room on the 7th floor. Trying to get to our elevator was always a challenge because we had to walk past the employees trying to get you to take a tour of the time-share property advocated by the hotel. Just a nuisance. Of note, the elevators appeared to never have been cleaned while we were there. They were always dirty. As mentioned, our stay was only average. We chose this hotel due it's location and the cost. The money saved was put to good use - 3 shows at other hotels which really made this a wonderful trip. This was a one time experience for us at the Excalibur and it only confirmed the saying: you get what you pay for. We'll stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: cmurraymint
Reviews.Content: Huge rooms at good prices. Not the most glitzy but you get what you pay for. Room was clean and comfortable. Shops and food in the resort. The Casino a bit dingy but basically the same as every other one. Once you have been in one casino you have been in them all. Staff friendly. In a good location on the strip and easy walking distance to the other resort hotels. A bit confusing finding reception at first and getting a sense of direction from there.If you are after a basic room in a good location then the Excalibur is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Spent a long Presidents Weekend Here”
Reviews.Author: kh57ca
Reviews.Content: Just completed a 3 night stay at the Excalibur, as part of a visit tied to a Junior Volleyball tournament. Booked the stay via their website. The pricing seemed competitive compared to other options. The team was staying at this hotel...so we didn't look at other options in the area. Had been a few years since I had spent any time in Vegas. I have now had enough for quite a few years. But was fun to visit for a few days. Positives - Decent self-parking... a bit of a walk, but worked out just fine for the rental car. - Room was clean, and bedding quality was nice. - Room had hard wired internet which worked great and was speedy. - Location is pretty good...easy in and out by car...if your traveling around town for various activities. Also decent location for walking to other locations on the strip, although you are toward the N.End of the strip. - Nice food court.....with decent prices and a nice variety of options. Negatives - Room was very very basic. No desk to work from, and a real lack of 120V outlets. - Bathroom sink had a faucet that leaked precipitously in many direction when using water. - Hotel is a bit worn.... - I realize this is Vegas....but the odor of cigarette smoke is everywhere. - Like most casinos'...you have to walk thru the Casino to get anywhere....but on Saturday night they have live dancers on platforms...like a strip club right in the middle of the casino. How do you walk thru here with your kids with this going on....crazy. - Our room had one window...which looked out to a block wall that was about 10 feed away, and towered above...so no direct view or light. Could see a small sliver of sky. Why bother having a window. yes, i would stay here again if it was price competitive and other reasons. But this hotel isn't anything close to the new facilities and their look. But I don't know differences in price points.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you are on a budget”
Reviews.Author: EalingBlue
Reviews.Content: The Excalibur clearly has a bit of an identity crisis going on. Originally a themed Arthurian fantasy, MGM are slowly getting rid of the more kitsch elements and replacing with more up to date versions - eg, the Sherwood cafe is now the Lynyrd Skynyrd BBQ and Beer. Ironic really, as the hotel has developed a kind of musty, dated feel which is more authentically mediaeval than when it was first built! Returning here in the evening, after visiting any of the other local hotels, is somewhat depressing. No doubt, when the long term renovation project is completed, this will improve - and the prices will go up accordingly. For now, it is one of the cheaper Strip hotels, so you pay your money, you take your choice. The clientele kind of match the surroundings, so don't expect any high rollers here! Staff were mainly indifferent and not over friendly, apart from the lovely lady on the check out desk. On the plus side, I had no problems with the room itself. Spacious, clean, towels changed daily, good shower, and nice comfy beds. The location is OK, if you don't mind a fair bit of legwork to get around. Would I stay here again? Probably not, just my opinion but I would prefer to stay further up the Strip, and pay a bit extra for a more modern hotel. But for the price, it does the job.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Update and staff training”
Reviews.Author: DWG10
Reviews.Content: Out of all of the MGM resorts I didn't have a horrible stay but also not a great stay. The ventilation was horrible so the smell of smoke was constant. Also the room we stayed in (basically tower 1) needs updating badly. Other than one desk person at registration being rude and seeming to have no time or desire to help anyone, and a few others that seemed to dislike their jobs...there was some great folks in the m club check in area that were always pleased to help as well as a manager named Marco. We likely won't come back but rather head to another MGM resort in the area

Reviews.Title: “Changes at the castle, not nessarily all good”
Reviews.Author: catlovers123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Excalibur Hotel in Las Vegas. This was my 9th or 10th time staying there although I hadn't stayed there since 2007. My overall experience was a good one. The rooms have been redecorated and a few new restaurants have been added. My complaint is the Hotel needs more ambiance. They have taken the fun at staying at "A castle" and made it like just another casino. That was one of the reason we liked it there. Now I'm not sure if they still have musicians playing throughout the castle on the week-ends or any type of vanity fare, so to speak, but that was the fun of going there in the first place. The price of the rooms are reasonable, Staff is friendly, they need a 24 hour restaurant like they used to have though. They have replaced the 24 hour restaurant with the Lynyrd Skynyrd restaurant. Now the food at the LS was good, but nothing beats a good meal or breakfast at 2am! My over all opinion is still favorable though and I would recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Another stay at the Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: bled1
Reviews.Content: Second time we've stayed during the Superbowl weekend. Nice room, friendly staff, great location. What else needs to be said?

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: trvlgrl922
Reviews.Content: Ya know, its not the fanciest place on the strip, but it has clean, large rooms, helpful staff and the price is right. Food: We tried Lynards Skynards BBQ and it was awesome, we also had Dacquiri's at Dick's Last Resort. For breakfast there was McDonalds and Krispy Kreme. They also have a buffet, but we didnt try it. Location: The location is also nice, you can take a free tram to the Luxor or Mandalay Bay and its across from MGM where they have the monorail ($5.00 per ride). We didnt rent a car, we just walked or used the transportation mentioned above. Gambling: We only played slot machines - didnt win, but they had plenty of penny slots, some of the other hotels had way fewer penny machines. We would def stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: billonbribie
Reviews.Content: We found the parking to be to far to transport your bags but for price and location to everything it was fantastic rooms were ok clean and comfy

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: mommyofcam
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our stay Wed-Sun, Feb 15-19. We were in room 25175 which is in Tower 1, 25th floor. We had a King Spa Suite with a Widescreen TV. The location of the tower is ideal. We walked right off the elevator and our the door onto the strip (just a 3 min walk to the bus stop)... or through the casino out the other door onto the strip towards NY NY. The elevators were fast, no waiting. The check in was easy, no crowd (although we saw crowds as the weekend got closer)... typical Vegas. The room was dated, kind of remodeled, but very clean. It has a dark brown carpet that looked in good shape, dark furnishings which looked a bit wore. There was new tile in the bathroom and apparently they must have removed the tub and just put in a large shower base. The counter in the bathroom was old, with a crack and older faucet. Again, everything was very clean though! The bed mattress was a pillowtop and new, very comfortable, with comfy pillows! This was the main reason we chose this place.... we kept hearing the beds were soft. I checked over the mattress when we got there. Very clean! The room was exceptionally quiet, we never heard people around us. The hot tub in the room actually sits off to the side of the small table. There was a widescreen tv in the room. We got a great rate on this room, otherwise I might have been more inclined to stay mid strip or downtown. However, I've always wanted to try them out. I like new places. We've done it, but will chose another place next time. If you get a great rate or special pricing, take chance if you don't need upscale! Just don't expect new in Tower 1. I have heard Tower 2 is renovated more than the area we were in.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, value for money.”
Reviews.Author: 79sheps
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, massive room and very clean. Excellent value for money. The staff were very friendly. Stayed for 5 nights and really enjoyed ourselves. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “For the price why not!!!”
Reviews.Author: keljam731
Reviews.Content: first time in vegas and didnt know what to expect for my money and was very very suprised, rooms huge and couldnt fault anything about it!

Reviews.Title: “August”
Reviews.Author: mmendoza688
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here in August and the stay was not bad. The rooms were clean and the bathroom looked recently remodeled, it was huge! There were only two things that bugged me. To get free wireless without a password or sign up you need to go to the food court. The other wasn't so bad but if you're picky you might think twice. You could still smell the musty tobacco smell in the casino area. It wasn't too bad to get my allergies going but still not that great. I think though that most of the casinos are that way unless the completely renovated their casino area recently. Overall a great place to stay. A little far from the more popular casinos but my family and I didn't mind walking to it was good for us. Be sure to take advantage of the trams if you're not used to the heat and walking!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms.”
Reviews.Author: IMJetlagged
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was supposed to be better quality at a moderate price; had free parking and internet(!?) After our previous night in at the Stratasphere we were relieved to find a much better quality room and service. Beds were comfortable, shower was good (no bath tub) and bathroom spacious. I liken the room quality in decor and amenities to the standard newer Sheraton rooms. Regretfully we were only on the 4th floor and looking at a brick wall but since we were there for business and on a last moment booking we tolerated it. All of these older hotels seem to have window air conditioning units in the room, this one was tastefully disguised beneath a granite counter top. They buffet dinner was compulsorily included (meaning you paid extra for it in the room booking anyway) but it was actually pretty darn good! We also ate at "Dick's" in the casino and thought that would be a great place to return with a group that just wanted to kick it up a notch - good fun - food was basic, mostly fried but tasty. Either they accidentally gave us the pot smoking floor or they spray a pot scented air freshner in the hallways, greatfully the room smelt fine and not smokey or even funky. We could hear the people in the neighboring room and hallway, it was not overly loud but I guess it's hard to escape this in Vegas. Oh the free internet ... it's ethernet/cable and it's slower than treacle, you are supposed to get a newspaper and free local & 1800 calls. We didn't pick up the phone and we never saw a newspaper - they charge a compulsory $17 for this. Check in was slow, check out was slower ... like an hour standing in line. This was low season, there were only 3 or 4 people working the front desk with 200 people in line. Bring a book/kindle/chair on rollers, take turns with other members in your party at standing in line then play a few slots while waiting. Hotels should really do something about this unnecessary standing in line nonsense. Staff were professionally attired, we were greatful not to be exposed to too much cleavage on the vulgar side, muffin tops or unsightly thighs of women who really shouldn't be sharing. FYI - you WILL be harassed by time share sellers at the Tower II entrance every time you walk by. As far as casinos and pokies go ... this isn't too bad, not seedy like some others can be. Location is pretty good, in between New York, New York and Luxor with pedestrian overpasses for easy access. For a moderately priced stay, in a decent Strip location this is a good choice!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pinkneko
Reviews.Content: The Excalibur was a good stay for us, easy and fast check in and checkout. The rooms were clean and tidy everyday and I found the beds to be pretty comfy. It was our first visit to Vegas so I thought the hotel location was also fantastic, right by the strip and other hotels with a handy transportation system to further hotels. The pool was also pretty good. The only thing I didn't like was I noticed it was smokier in the casino than in other hotels, coming from a place where no smoking is aloud inside ever it was a shock, but other than that it was a great stay with a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place to stay if you want the strip.”
Reviews.Author: Cloakofstars
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel due to the price and since I had been to Vegas before I didn't need anything fancy. It was a decent room for the money. The room was clean and the maid service was helpful. I wasn't too impressed with the food court, though. Not a lot of choices. We actually went next door to the Luxor for food. We had a free breakfast buffet with the room and it was just ok. It was free, so no big deal. It would be nice if the monorail was closer, though. It took us 30 minutes to walk to it (at the MGM). The only truly annoying this was the sales people stalking the hallway outside the room elevators in the casino. They hounded us everytime we walked buy to try and sell us packages. I understand the economy isn't great and they were just doing their job but it was really annoying. Overall, it did the job of being a decent place to sleep after being out all day. If you need a cheap place to stay, I would reccommend it.

Reviews.Title: “not great but not terrible”
Reviews.Author: kevin r
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because we were travelling with kids and grand kids. The room was dated but ok. The staff was again, ok, but they certainly didn't go out of their way to help with any issues. We did have the odd issue, they were not major, but I guess the fact that they didn't really seem to care that they were an issue was the thing that got you..Lets start with the fact that when we booked, we booked 4 rooms for 4 nights. We asked that they be as close together as possible. When we arrived. 2 rooms on the 21st floor, 2 on the 23 rd. Not really together, but it was all they could do to get us on the same floors 2 at a time. It took extra time at check in to get what we got so we didn't push it. Next the resort fees. 12.50 a day plus 1.50 tax I'll bet the Gov never sees...... for internet that rarely works and a paper we never got. Informed at check out we were supposd to get them from the stands at the base of the elevators. And we would know this how? any hotel i've ever stayed at drops them at your door...... next, the whole place decided that after super bowl, they may as well shut down or reno as much as they could as the people there that week were not that important. Lounge closed for reno, no entertainment.Tournament of kings, closed. Pool bar and resteraunt, open sunday, closed the rest of the week. Dicks has entertainment sunday, none the rest of the week. Supposed to open for breakfast, barely open by 10:30. supposed to be open till late at night, done by 10 pm. One other item while talking pools, do you really need to close at 5 and even then, could you not just leave the hot tubs open for the adults to use in the evening? The next thing is the time share salespeople are getting to be too much. We were asked at least 10 times a day if we were staying at the resort or wanted to see a free show, usually by the same 2 people. I guess the bright side is that the hotel knows they were doing their job. Lastly, the hotel needs a good update but especially a cleaning. The kids ran around a bit on the pool deck in bare feet and it was a full time job for our daughter to try to get them clean again......... Filthy. We are return customers to this hotel, at least 3 different times, but this was probably it. There are too many other places in Vegas that are close in price and are nicer, especially when you factor in the resort fee. If the kids need to play the games, we can visit, but stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice”
Reviews.Author: tayshan1
Reviews.Content: My mom and I flew into Vegas for the Magic clothing and jewelry show and were suppose to stay at the Golden Nugget. We were at the Golden Nugget from 1pm-4:30pm but were unable to get into a room because their computers were down. I had to go online with my phone to find us another hotel and Excalibur had the best last last minute prices. The room we stayed in was an upgraded room and was very nice. The workout room was very big and had lots of equippment. The food court had great prices. I would recommend this hotel!!! But they need to get rid of the timeshare reps that bug you the whole time you're there.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: MUZIKM
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on Feb 12 for Three nights.It was just Okay but nothing special.The price was right but you get what you pay for.This Hotel needs an upgrade.The room I stayed in over 20 years ago hasn't really changed much except for the flat screen tv.And when I was here exactly a year ago the people mover to the Luxor wasn't working and STILL ISN'T.Casino did a good job of taking my and many others money.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: PinkSally
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel as part of a cheap and cheerful last minute package deal. The checkin was smooth, quick and stress free. The rooms were of a reasonable size and the decor was pleasant. The hotel staff were friendly and offered help whenever we needed to check anything. Overall the stay was good for a few days enjoying what Las Vegas has to offer. The truth is that there are more luxurious hotels with upgraded facilities and services but we needed a good base to enjoy our time in Vegas and the Excalibur definitely did not disappoint. Afterall, we had come to enjoy Las Vegas not sit in the hotel room. Would recommend for a cheap, reliably decent hotel to use as a base to enjoy Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine for a few day stay”
Reviews.Author: ozziep9
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Excalibur because of Priceline (named my own price). I wasn't thrilled but was just hoping that the rooms would be clean. Although the place is cheesy, the rooms were clean and housekeeping effective, which was all I was looking for. The food court was convenient and had a decent selction. The staff wasn't incredibly friendly but they got the job done. If you're looking for a clean room for an affordable price, I think the Excalibur is adequate. If you're looking for something fancy, I would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you expect!”
Reviews.Author: Sionel
Reviews.Content: At the end of a business trip, with a couple of days to spend in Vegas, I wanted a cheaper option that allowed me to simply explore the place and provide somewhere to sleep. Excalibur provides all of that and you get precisely what you'd expect from the place if you've done any research at all. It's built like some sort of Disney nightmare, but in a good way, and it makes a Brit chuckle to think that this is how Americans might actually view medieval castles and pageantry. It's a casino front and centre with the hotel part of the resort being tucked away into two wings ("Towers") to the rear. Given what I paid the quality of rooms were better than expected and the service I received when I actually needed it was good. Its location at one end of the strip means you can walk a fair way if exploring Vegas is your thing (I clocked about 30 miles over two days), but nothing here should be any sort of a surprise at all. I didn't make much use of the facilities or the restaurants so I can't comment directly on those, but as a hotel/casino the Excalibur does all that you'd need for the price it offers. No complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Never staying here again”
Reviews.Author: kmead0ws
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last weekend for our wedding. We picked this hotel because it was cheap, but didn't expect it to be as awful as it was. We had 22 people with us so we booked 12 rooms - which you would think they would be happy to have us all there, not the case. I paid $20 to upgrade our room and we ended up having the same room as 4 other people we were with, who paid less than we did. I asked the person at the front desk about it and they couldn't have cared less and said that I could talk to the supervisor about it but that they probably wouldn't change our room or take away the fee. I walked away. A week before we were flying to Vegas, I called the hotel and told them that we had 24 people coming (including us) and asked if there was any sort of transportation or anything that they had to get us all from the airport to the hotel. I told them that I would be happy to pay for it. They told me no, their limos are reserved for the high rollers. Ok, I can handle that. I asked if we could have a limo to transport everyone to my wedding that was Saturday, again, no, you're not a high roller. So, I said ok, thanks and hung up. The beds are hard, the rooms smell funny and don't appear to be incredibly clean. There were no blankets on the beds, just double sheets. We asked for a King bed, and was told that they don't have King beds available. Really? I don't need 2 beds. I had to steal the double sheets off of the other queen sized bed in our room so i didn't freeze to death because the heater was less than adequate. The people at the front desk are rude and they don't seem happy to have a job, or your business. I told them we were getting married and I got a oh, that's nice. No congrats or anything. The casino is really smoky, not like the other casinos. There is an overwhelming smell of fake rose perfume that's in the entry way that made me want to gag everytime I came in the door. The nicest part of my trip was taking my bags to the holding area next to checkout. The men there were very nice and helpful. They put our bags on a cart and when we were ready to leave they brought our bags to the curb and hailed a taxi for us and loaded them. Checkout was a different story. The line is REALLY long and the people at the desk are still VERY rude. I will never stay at this hotel again. We spent most of our time in the other hotels on the strip and enjoyed every one of them. DON'T STAY HERE. IT IS AWFUL.

Reviews.Title: “What a difference”
Reviews.Author: Kerik7700
Reviews.Content: I came along to the Excalibur to make sure my parents had no issuues checking in. ( I stayed at another hotel) Wow!! the Excalibur treated them like royality, Gift Basket & all. Super friendly & fast check in! p.s. My room down the strip at another hotel was very dissappointing... D Kerik

Reviews.Title: “anniversary”
Reviews.Author: yyoyolala
Reviews.Content: the hotel was clean but the pool was extremely dirty i know it was off season but to look out of the window into a dirty pool omg the excalbur was at the very end of the strip so you had to walk a bit to get to everything. i was promised a free buffet but the girl at the buffet counter tried to charge my room, the hotel did not offer a shuttle to the airport. the room was clean,.

Reviews.Title: “I'm glad we stayed somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: MArrington
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with another couple, went to Vegas to celebrate the birthday of one of our friends. Fortunately, my husband and I stayed at a different hotel (thank God). My friends, unfortunately, stayed at Excalibur. I was with my friends when they checked in and was ecstatic that we didn't stay there! The staff were very unpleasant, unfriendly and seemed to forget that they were supposed provide good service to their customers. That spoke volumes to me and made me appreciate my hotel even more. Quite honestly, I was terrified when I got on the elevator. It was filthy, rickety and moved at a snail's pace. That seemed to be the longest elevator ride! We finally got to the 26th floor, and the hallway was just plain ugly. The rooms were very dark, smokey, dated, and worn. The dresser in one of my friends' rooms was scratched and nicked. The bathrooms did not have a bathtub, but only a shower. Although they were on higher floors, their views were horrible. None of my friends were very happy with their rooms, but they figured they wouldn't be in there much, so they could live with it for a few days. However, they did say they are going to stay at the hotel where we stayed for the next trip. I'm just glad my husband and I didn't book a room there!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, cheap but smokey”
Reviews.Author: inigo1954
Reviews.Content: Great value, very comfortable rooms/beds but having to walk through the casino with children everytime you went out even to the pool, was horrible especially as smoking is permitted there. Also disappointed the pool did not open until 10am - no good in blazing summer weather when its too hot to be outdoors by 11am. But kids loved the pool slide. Went to the 'Tournament' show - enjoyable but very pricey and very ordinary food.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Tracy081
Reviews.Content: We like to stay at Excalibur because it has a great atmosphere not found at other resorts. It has a great pool area where everyone feels welcome, It is also located on a corner with other casinos making it other properties on the strip fairly accessible without having to take a cab or bus everywhere. It also has a decent buffet for breakfast and the Tournament of Kings or Thunder Down Under for entertainment options.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay - as always.”
Reviews.Author: MNtraveler004
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here several times, and we had a good time. Our theory about hotels in Vegas is as we are rarely in the room, so as long as the rooms are clean, the bed is comfortable, and service is good, we are fine. We stayed in tower 1. It was a bit chilly in the room the first night, so we asked for an extra blanket. It was brought up promptly. It would be nice if the rooms had coffee pots, but no hotel we've ever stayed in on the strip has - not sure why. We had a great rate for the room, as we have the M-Card. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised....”
Reviews.Author: Gysel
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Vegas, during the superbowl weekend (Sat.-Wed.). My husband and I have different point of view about this hotel. It was a great price and we were pleased with the wide screen room. We asked for an upgrade (as suggested, on the reviews) and we got it at no extra cost. We were definitely pleased all around given the poor ratings from the other critics. My husband gives it a 3.5 stars I give it a 4. Likes: One thing we do agree upon, this hotel (side vendors) are cheaper than the south side of the strip hotels (TI, Bellagio, Ceasar Palace, Mirage...etc.), such as, cigarettes, water, liquor bottles... etc. There were tram rails and over pass connecting to other hotels... so you didn't have to battle with other people on the strip and it was INCREDIBLY convenient. We stayed on the 3rd floor and the music and smoke didn't bother us any. The bed was comfortable and to our knowledge their were no signs of bed bugs :). Big hotel... lots of room to gamble, easy to get lost. The hotel workers were nice. Dislikes: We do agree that the buffet was not worth visiting. If you desire to eat at a buffet that is less expensive try the Luxor was very good for breakfast and dinner. The payout on our gambling was poor at Excalibur. We left tips for house keeping and they were nice and good; however, in the hallway we saw dishes that accumulated from when we checked in and by the item we checked out. The elevators' carpet was dirty all the time. Keep in mind... that if you want house keeping to change your bed linen every day you must place a house keeping card on your bed every day to indicate you want it changed. We gambled a lot of money and did not get many free drinks on the gambling floor. The worst part of Excalibur and Luxor is the pestering "time share" people (GrandView Hotel). I guess, they are able to be inside Excalibur and Luxor verses compared the other hotels. Just ignore them when you see them, don't get bothered when you are on vacation! Over all... we would return for the price... but we like to explore new places.. so we would defiantly try another hotel. Excalibur is not a Ceasar's Palace or a Treasure Island but it's better than what we thought.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SHELLYJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 7 nights over Christmas, mainly because it was so cheap and we didn't intend spending much time in our room! I wasn't expecting it to be amazing after reading some of the reviews on here, especially when I found we were in a standard room in Tower 1, but the room was great and very clean - not huge, but the bed was comfortable and we had a big flat screen TV and a decent view of the airport! Yes, the casino was a little smokey at times, but no more so than every other casino we went in. As we had just spent 1 night in a lake view room at Bellagio, it was a little come down from that, but then we paid almost as much for that one night that we did for 7 nights in Excalibur! All in all, it was a nice room and we had no problems or issues with Excalibur during our stay. I would stay here again, no hesitation, if I was looking for an economical, value for money, hotel in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Tired Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nannychiicken
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Vegas, Booked online, thought the location would be good as it was on the strip, this proved to be the case, not too far from the airport. The hotel rooms were clean, two king sized bed flat screen tv, very large bath room, but this hotel is very tired, needs modernisation. the only other complaint really is the "resort fees" $14 per night which we weren't aware of, it looks cheap when you book on line but you do need to take these fees into consideration. It seems these fees are charged by all the MGM group hotels. The buffet breasfast ok, but we found that for an extra $2 dollars you could get a superb breakfast at the Aria down the road so if your not too hungry when you get up shop around the better quality hotels. Really did miss having tea and coffee facilities in the room, every morning you needed to go down to the main part of the hotel to get coffee, bit of a pain if you weren't ready to get dressed!! Check in was a pain didn't seem to have enough staff for and they seemed a bit miserable, travelling for nearly 24hours I was quite disappointed by the reception the staff gave, no offer of help with the cases this in a country where I thought service came first.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for your money”
Reviews.Author: SMBSLT
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice. It isn't the poshest of hotels available in Vegas however it is clean, lots to do. Loads of great in house entertainment (Dicks Last Resort is hilarious but not for the easily offended), Thunder From Down Under is usually on and great for the ladies and it connects to the Luxor without having to go out in the sweltering weather if you don't want to. They also now do a joint wrist band that means for less than $40 you can eat as much as you like in the unlimited visits to the all you can eat buffets both at Excalibur and Luxor hotel. I love it and would stay here every time (although hubby would like to try one of the OTT posh hotels but this one is not too expensive nor cheap and a great place to stay in Vegas). It is also bang on the strip so you are walking distance to the shops and other hotels MGM and New York New York.

Reviews.Title: “Go if you are on a tight budget”
Reviews.Author: Roadies_11
Reviews.Content: The entire hotel had a staunch smoke smell. Although it was clean and on the strip, it did not have any restaurants. If you can spare some $$, definitely upgrade to Luxor nearby.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump”
Reviews.Author: dwwalg25
Reviews.Content: I'm here in the hotel now. this place is a joke upgraded to widescreen room looking at a brick wall nice view. Not. People are rood. The buffet sucks is rather eat out of a trash can gambled 700.00 dealers are absolutly ignorant from that 700 I got 4 dollars in comps stay away from all mgm casinos there a joke here at excalibur there are homeless people sleeping in the hall . And every where u turn they are trying to give free rooms there a joke you can not have a good time .... Fremont street was great will stay at binions next time

Reviews.Title: “1st time in las vegas with husband 2012”
Reviews.Author: cawa76025
Reviews.Content: It was our 1st time in las vegas. we did read that the excalibur had alot of bad reviews but we decided to give it a chance. The bed was comfortable. th room was clean. the bathrom had a rug on floor that looked dirty and was so thin it looked like it belon in the trash can. we paid extra to have a view guess what the view was???? the las vegas airport. we could hear the airplanes it didnt bother me but my husband is a light sleeper he couldnt sleep. It takes only 1 thing to ruin your vcation and for you to be dissapointed. That 1 thing could make the guest not want to come back to the hotel. At check in thee was a long line only 3 front desk agent. they didnt have a smile they didnt seem to want to be there. The agent that checked me in never used my name didn't verify my information was correct. Neither did the Mlife club used my name or explain it to me at all. I asked the person i booked with if i can get a complimentary refrigerator because my husband is diabetic and needs to keep his medince in a cool place. She said to check in at the front desk and ask them. I asked the front desk they said no! I was like really you dont care its medical issue? I ended up just using the cooler i bought. i was dissapointed they said no. They didnt go the extra step to make you feel welcome. My husband and I decided to just waste our money at other casinos and hotels and stores we only paid the excalibur for the room. they could of made more money on us if they would of just done that one thing we wanted but since they said no we spended our money else where at check out we left early we just didnt want to be there anymore. next time i will just stay at starwood hotel, marriott which are the ones i usually stay at or just pick another hotel on the strip. the valet was great. the buffet was great except for the emxican food it didn't taste good at all also the suchi seemed old the advocado on them was black and old. ewwww. We are going to plan our next trip to go to Las Vegas between April - June. we will have to check where we will stay where they will actually make us feel welcome. i would only return here if i was guranteed i was going to be treated fair and that they will go the extra step.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the Price!”
Reviews.Author: Rachel V
Reviews.Content: It is nothing fancy at the Excalibur but it is worth the money. I suggest upgrading room from just the basic - like a Widescreen Room. There are plenty of places to eat and the gambling area is good sized. They have a pretty nice Sports Book area - not as large as others but still plenty of seating. Spongebob 4D ride for kids downstairs. If you aren't wanting to spend much - this is a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “so - so for first timers”
Reviews.Author: pee k
Reviews.Content: I read various review on this hotel before booking and thought it would be alright. It was okay and that's about it. Upon checking in the clerk was less than impressive. We were put in Tower 1 facing the inside of the castle, in a room that was obviously original to the building. The beds were hard and uncomfortable and the 'sheet' that was supposed to be a 'comforter' was anything but. Wallpaper was peeling from the walls, the lampshade had markings of water (or something) on it and I don't even want to think about what the splatter spots on the ceiling may have been. The bathroom was big, no tub, stand up shower only and it was decent, but again...dingy. Some of the towel were not clean with staining on them. The only thing this side of 1990 in the room was the tv. We appreciated the in-room safe. The casino was SMOKIER than any we went in (and as smokers that's saying alot that it bothered us), staff was almost non-existent. The people hawking time-shares are everywhere and extremely annoying! EXTREMELY ANNOYING. You can't take 10 steps in the hotel without be accosted by someone asking if you're 'there tomorrow night'...stay far far away from these people. If hotels feel the need to subsidize these antics with free meal vouchers and show vouchers, perhaps limiting the numbers of people bombarding their paying guests would be better. Bottom line for us is that the room was clean, but we won't stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Price!”
Reviews.Author: nickyjl99
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located at one end of teh Strip - we stayed here as past of our Road Trip on the West Coast in July 2011. Its ideal for the price although a little far from the centre of the strip We stayed in the refurbished Widescreen rooms in Tower 2 - bathroom was a decent size and so were the beds. Pool area was great and we hired a Cabana for $100 which was great value for money. Buffet at hotel was fine.

Reviews.Title: “spend the extra”
Reviews.Author: kevin j
Reviews.Content: I took the wife on a mini weekend vacation it was a first for both of us, We understood the consierge was there for the guest but it was time share, the minute we walked in we got rooked in to the time share trip for the free tickets to a show. it was a total of 4.5 hrs from the time we left to the time we got back. so next time we go i will pay for my own dam tickets. we will not ever stay at any hotel owned by that company again they have those people at every door hassleing the guests. At one point the same lady asked us 4 times in 20 minutes. Next time we go i will pay the extra to stay at one of the other ones that do not have those people its really not worth it. If you are wondering about the time share deal the want you to drop about 17,000 to 44,000 dollars in the 3 hrs you spend with them (one time offer for the incentives) and then they are insulted when you say no you would like to look into it. Seriously what nerve.

Reviews.Title: “First Time in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Ed D
Reviews.Content: This hotel was located near the beginning of "the strip" at the corner of Tropicana Ave. and Las Vegas Boulevard. It had a Medieval flavor and the rooms were in Tower One or Tower Two. The room was relatively cheap, around thirty-dollars plus a $14.00 dollar fee paid at checkout. Check in and checkout took less than 10 minutes. The room had no tub just a large shower. We could not find the remote for the TV so my wife opened the doors to the hutch under the TV to look for the remote and found a woman's lower undergarment. The light fixture's socket w/bulb was hanging out by the wires so I pushed it back into the socket. They did drop off a remote outside our room but would do nothing about the women's underwear so we left it where we found it! The room itself was clean and the King bed was comfortable. It had a hair dryer, a safe, the usual ammenities but no tub as I stated. The dinner buffet was around twenty dollars . It was warm, not hot, and not what I expected. I expected a much larger selection of food. The dining area looked dim and outdated! I refused to eat breakfast there and found a nice clean IHOP about three miles up the road. As for the casino, we were constantly hounded by people asking us questions about our stay like how long we were staying, are you coming back, would we be interested in a deal for a free night next year etc. etc. That, with the fact that the casino was smoke filled and being an ex-smokers for twenty years we could not stand the smell we did not venture back to the casino. As noted it was our first time there in Las Vegas, maybe all the casinos are smoke filled? The hotel was average, the food could have been much better, the housekeeping could use some improvement, and the casino could have better ventilation or a smoke free section. The reviews made made this place sound better than it is.

Reviews.Title: “Too Much Smoke and Time Share Hawks”
Reviews.Author: Soundtech36277
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Excalibur for 4 nights 02/02 - 02/05. Widescreen Tower room in tower 2 was good. Could have used a little more interior lighting and a decent size mirror somewhere other than the bathroom. Bathroom was decent size with a big walk in shower. The room was clean and we head no problems with it. The casino is by far the smokiest area I've ever been in in Vegas, and we've been to a lot over numerous stays. Check in / out was quick and easy. Elevators were pretty nasty, but hallways were fine. My number one cpmplaint was all the time share sales people EVERYWHERE. They got on my last nerve and I'm not normally this way, but toward the end of our stay I got down right rude with them. Decent place for the money, but you can do much better with just a little more cash.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money-- go for the upgrade room”
Reviews.Author: superuke
Reviews.Content: My wife took me there for my birthday last year-- everything was good. We decided to upgrade room for only a few $ more a night and had a view of part of the strip-- but we were high up. Being in Vegas I do not see the need for spending $$$ on room that you might only be in for a few hours. The foor was above average but not over the top. Everyone was friendly, check in and out was a breeze. The only thing to watch out for here (and every other hotel) is the time share guys who promise free tickets to show, etc. My wife wanted to go-- and we were told 2 hrs-- well 6 hrs later and alot of pressure sales we left without buying and had a nice dinner on them. Best is stay away for the time-share guys. When staying in Vegas-- buy the daily or multiple day bus pass--- best and easiest way to go up and down the strip.

Reviews.Title: “average at best. ok if you are on a budget.”
Reviews.Author: melisa b
Reviews.Content: out dated rooms and decor. not tubs in standard rooms. if you want something better go to mandalay bay just a little more $ but much cleaner. buffet below average but not as bad as Luxor (terrible) if you are using your free buffet coupons walk to the mirage or aria or even the mgm grand soooo much better food. check in and out was ok always a line.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Decent Price!”
Reviews.Author: BudgetTraveler81
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the last weekend in Jan 2012. Celebrated a friends birthday. We had 2 rooms. 1 Tower Room (Located in Tower I: The room could use an upgrade and still has the same decor from when the hotel was built. Has the musty smell, outdated furnishings but they did upgrade the tv.) We had the Deluxe room (Located in Tower II: Updated from floor to ceiling. All new beds, furnishings, bathrooms, carpet, etc.) If you can, upgrade to a Deluxe room. Both rooms, however, were clean, and no problems with noise or any of that sort. Check in was very easy. We were able to check in early and check out late. Plenty of parking and it is free. Located in the middle of all the action with the NY NY, MGM and Tropicana across the street. Luxor and Mandalay Bay are located next door. You can walk using the hotel walkways (indoors) or using the Tram (free and can take you to Luxor, Excalibur or Mandalay Bay). This hotel does have plenty of options of for dining, from the buffet, McDonald's, Pizza Hut. Even has a Starbucks and Krispy Kreme Donuts located in side the hotel. This hotel will serve your needs if you plan to just use the room for the bed and shower. Nothing too fancy or extravagant. I would stay here again and recommend it for the traveler on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Smells Freakin Awful!”
Reviews.Author: duckfisney
Reviews.Content: I attempted to stay in this hotel (at the request of a client). I was barely able to walk through the putrid smoke laden casino to the registration desk I was coughing so much! I tried to wait in line for check in to tell them to cancel my room. I figured If the casino smelled this gawd awful the rooms wouldn't be far behind, and as I was still recovering from a mild case of bronchitis I wasn't going to chance it. I couldn't wait in the line, I had to get to some fresh air. When I finally got to a nice clean Marriott I had to wash my clothes, and I was only in the place about 10 minutes tops. I stayed there once about 10 years ago, and it was horrible then too, I will never set foot on the premises again. Took a solid day for the coughing to subside...

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Families with Young Children”
Reviews.Author: Traveller13
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel could do with an upgrade, I would recommend it for travellers with children. My whole family stated there (13 of us, one disabled and 1 a baby) I found the price was very reasonable for 13 of us and there were some wide-eyed children who couldn't stay away from the activities. All in all, as the beds were clean and comfortable and the atmosphere exciting for first-timers, we enjoyed the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Greesy nasty winodws every were i look. i wonder how dirty other things are”
Reviews.Author: Mike M
Reviews.Content: The hotel was decent if you stayed in tower 2. i was about to stay in tower 1 and saw the room and those look like they came with the original hotel! The entire hotel has filthy windows and only once did i see a window washer in the hallways going door to door washing windows.Greesy Smudges on all glass through out the entire property. Yuck!! got sick of seeing greese on every piece of glass i saw every were i looked. HIRE WINDOW WASHERS! atleast pretend that you care about your property and presenting it to your guests excalibur! If the windows were this grose i dont even want to kno how dirty the beds are that i slept on!

Reviews.Title: “Good for a bed, but not alot else.”
Reviews.Author: EJRTRAVELS
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in September 2011, we only wanted a bed really, didnt pick the hotel to spend alot of time in the room, so the hotel was fine for that. The decor throughout was quite dated though, and did seem a little 'dim' could be improved and lightened abit. However our room was clean and bathroom was clean and kept clean throughout our stay. We upgraded our room, just one up from the normal rooms, it didnt feel very, ugraded. But the bed was huge and super comfy!!! Most of the staff were really nice, the receptionists were a bit off but the rest were fab. The pool area was nice and waitresses always around, we also got a pass for the buffet, this could be used in 3 dfferent hotels, the food was good, nice and plenty choice. plenty space and well organised. The only down side was that someone in the UK rang the hotel to get champagne put in our room and after 30 mins on the phone were told they couldnt do it, thought that would be pretty straight forward. Ideal location for the strip, and Las Vegas sign, not the best food areas, drinking places and shops in hotel but its connected by mono rail so can easily get around. I proberbly would stay there again as theres not many others that cheap right on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money- Read the small print. Good fitness center”
Reviews.Author: Markmontana
Reviews.Content: For less than $24 (plus resort fee of $12.50) we had a good experience at the Excalibur. We just needed a bed for the evening before the SCI convention. The rooms have been remodeled since our last stay (over 20 years ago!). No problems at all, and for less than the cost of staying at a motel six. WiFi was included. We typically book rooms at more up-scale hotels now, and probably won't stay at Excalibur again in the near future, but we had zero problems with our stay and the 'all important' bedding and bed cover were clean and nice. Carpet was good too. We didn't have time to use the fitness center, but it was included in our room, and we checked it out. Very good equipment and clean. Our room was on the 4th floor and our view was a brick wall. But A-ok for this quick stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, comfortable rooms, good rates!”
Reviews.Author: Gazpacho16
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel and casino I stayed in on my numerous visits to Vegas. I had a very good impression from the start. The rooms were spacious and comfortable and the staff was professional and friendly. They had a fire-alarm go off during my stay and at no point in time there seemed to be panic. An evacuation was ordered and the procedures were followed flawlessly. All staff members seemed to be well-trained in dealing with such a situation and I will never forget how well everything was dealt with! The entire situation was dealt with in a timely manner and management managed to locate the source of the alarm very quickly. The all clear was given and we were all allowed to go back-in and carry-on with our day. Talk about feeling safe! They really delivered that feeling here! Compared to the Bellagio and other hotels in town I can´t really give it a 5, but the Excalibur is really ranked high on my list.

Reviews.Title: “Good buy for the money.”
Reviews.Author: camarymc
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay in a standard room, which we were told were refurbished 8 months ago, on the 21st Floor of Tower 1. The room was very basic, clean, and had a flat screen TV (no coffee maker). The furniture was nothing special. We booked directly through the hotel. The price was 1/2 of what we were quoted for several other hotels in that area. A resort fee is tacked on to the price of the room, but this appears to be common practice at major hotels and should not be a surprise to travelers. While it is located at the south end of the strip, the location is good and public transportation is easily accessible. I have stayed here many times and will return.

Reviews.Title: “A week in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: wbelgum
Reviews.Content: Excalibur is showing signs of age , especially in the maintenance department. However, the room we had on the 3rd floor of the second tower were large, clean and the staff were brilliant. It is a nice looking hotel, especially at night with all the towers lit up. A nice location at the southern end of the strip. Ideal to visit MGM, New York New York, Luxor and Mandalay. Also with the bus stop almost directly outside, it makes a great jumping off point. Would and have recommended the Excalibur to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “good location but kinda cheesy”
Reviews.Author: Cedric J
Reviews.Content: Okay. This place is getting a little long in the tooth, there is no amount of cleaning they can do to it that will make it feel clean enough to compete with the newer hotels. The buffet is really bad for the strip, and not even very cheap any more. You can go next door to Luxor if you want a decent buffet for about 2 dollars more. HOWEVER.... the combination of location and price STILL makes this a great place to stay. You are right on Tropicana&Las Vegas Boulevard, does it get any better than that? Right next to, or walking distance from all the best hotels in Vegas. Plus although Excalibur has become a bit seedy, it still has a quirky charm about it. I mean seriously, dragons, knights, wizards, they do what they do well. It's a good place to go solo or with buddies, if you're going to be out and about partying, this place is good for location alone. And the rates are VERY good! Almost as cheap as downtown, but you're on the best part of the strip! Easy to get from the freeway, or the airport, easy access to main roads to get you to other parts of town. It's a great place if you're driving to Vegas because you take the freeway to Tropicana and BAM! You are practically there with hardly any navigating of the dreaded Las Vegas Boulevard. If you're bringing somebody you really want to impress, try the nearby Monte Carlo or something better like Venetian, Bellagio, or Paris but be ready to pay out your nose for those better places.

Reviews.Title: “Will not be coming back”
Reviews.Author: Benzie
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival to the hotel we had to wait in line for check in or an extended period of time. For a Saturday afternoon, not very many front desk agents were available. The front desk agent that checked us in scribbled on a piece of paper asking for our telephone number and email. She then proceeded to ask us for our phone number 3 more times during check in. It took at least 30 minutes to check in (we alreadry had a reservation, weren't walking in off the Strip). The resort fee that is charged by the property covers many amenities that should be included in the rate. I find it unacceptable that you should have to go get your own paper when it is included in this rate. Two pools were closed and the remaining two left available were incredibly dirty (layer of brown at the bottom of the pool). Excalibur does not have wireless internet, yet wired internet is included in the resort fee. This does no good to people with cell phones and tablets. We were told the entire hotel would have to be re-wired in order to provide wireless....the whole point is WIRELESS. When we arrived to our room, we found the front panel on the air conditioner was missing and exposing wood framing, the toilet paper holder was hanging to the wall by one loose screw (you couldn't hang a roll on it), the dresser that the TV sits on was extensively chipped and the TV kept blowing a fuse. The ice machine was broken on our floor and when we called down to ask for ice to be brought up we were told "No, you need to go one floor up or one floor down and use those ice machines". Our room safe needed to be reset and we were told we had to stay in the room and it would take 40 minutes to have someone up to do this. Unacceptable! It should not take that long to have a call resolved at any property. Management should be aware that this is time we could be using to spend money in their casino. We were told at check in that this was an upgraded room. Upon visiting the front desk and informing the front desk of the issues with our current accommodation we were "upgraded" to a higher floor. Many of the issues with the first room were not present in this second room, but the bathroom still had chipped floor tiles and shoddy patch work on the grout in the shower. We also did not appreciate being hounded by the "Guest Services" employees everytime we walked through the lobby/casino trying to sell services and shows. My parents had stayed here a few years ago and raved about the rooms and service. I was left utterly disappointed by the whole experience. We will not be returning to this property for our planned trip in the fall.

Reviews.Title: “Good, cheap place if you are taking kids!”
Reviews.Author: joecaraboys
Reviews.Content: We thought the Excalibur was great with the kids. If it were just my husband & I, we'd probably stay somewhere else. My only real complaint is gagging on the smoke smell walking through the lobby & casino area, but it's Vegas, right? The only thing is that this was not the case at many of the other hotels... ventilation in an older hotel maybe???? Just mentioning it because it could be an allergy/asthma issue for some. No free shows at this hotel. We were told the slay-the-dragon show (whatever it's called) hasn't been there for a decade, but the staff still get people who ask about it. Our room was basic, but clean and a nice view of the mountains. We did get the slightly upgraded room with the flatscreen TV, so I'm not sure what the other rooms looked like. Ours was fine, nothing fancy, but fine. The pools were great, although due to the time of year, we didn't get to swim but one day. We would have loved to spend more time at the pools if weather permitted. Be sure to take a tour of Hoover Dam (very cool - kids loved it too) an d go to the Grand Canyon. We went to the West rim due to time (only about a 2 hr 15 min drive). Just expect a hefty price to see the canyon... it's on private Indian property... but so worth it if you've never been before. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay & would stay here again with kiddos (BTW, ours were 9 & 6). Be sure to check out Old Vegas too!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Splintaay
Reviews.Content: This place rocks! I've never stayed in a casino before and this was brilliant! It is located at the end of the strip opposite MGM grande, The Tropicana and New York New York. The resident bar is called Dicks and they are a seriously crazy lot! Great fun. The location is brilliant as everything is within walking distance. The only think I didn't like about this was that not all rooms had a safe in it but for a small charge you can upgrade to one that has. It was a clean place and the rooms were seen to every day. It was a long walk to our room from the main lobby but isn't this the case in casinos this big? I would stay here again tomorrow and would recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more”
Reviews.Author: EastCoaster02809
Reviews.Content: Hallway & casino carpets were ragged & torn; nice bathroom; poor service at registration--always a line; resort fees (in most Las Vegas hotels, not just this one) are ridiculous, a rip-off since most travelers don't use them. One of the "amenities" covered by the fee is a daily newspaper--but you have to go to the registration area & seek it out, it's not delivered.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: Rhian_25
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at the Excalibur hotel in November 2011. I found the hotel room to be spacious, very clean with no complaints!. For the price, the room was fab and surprisingly quiet for Vegas. So much to do within the hotel with everything you may need entertainment / food related however, as it was our first time in Vegas we didn't spend much time in the room and only used it for sleeping and changing. Medival feast is something you must do if you are staying at this hotel, just remember to bring your inner child!. Views from the room were fantastic as we were at the back facing the New York hotel and the strip. All in all, a fab hotel however, i would sugest requesting a room high up as we were only on the 3rd floor and did hear the bin men around 6am every morning.

Reviews.Title: “So-So Experience”
Reviews.Author: Angelica S
Reviews.Content: First of all, the parking area for the hotel is terrible! All of the hotels have an elevator going from the parking garage to the hotel. This one, unfortunately, doesn't. My family and I ended up personally dragging our luggage to the casino entrance. From there, I didn't see any ramps for handicapped people or for those who have luggage, again making it hard for us to travel through the hotel. When reservations were made, I thought we were getting a view of the Strip. However, upon arrival, such plans weren't made and we had to spend $10 extra to see a glimpse of the Strip. Most of the time we were there, hardly any security to the towers were there (only once were they actually there doing their job). We had flyers slipped under our door and an upset man knocking at our door at 4 in the morning. The rooms were mediocre (others compared it to Super 8 motels, and I agree). Two of my pillows had stains and tire marks on them. Also, the room looked a bit dull with only one painting (in the bathroom of all places). Most of the hotel's restaurants are a bit expensive so eat elsewhere. On the upside, the theme of the hotel is nice; I just wish the hotel would live up to its name in overall quality.

Reviews.Title: “If looks could kill....”
Reviews.Author: MissyCee
Reviews.Content: I thought with the new renovations, or updates to some of the rooms ( called the widescreen room) would be worth paying a little extra. Rooms that are out dated and unclean is not my cup of tea. Check in was decent, fast. Staff was polite. Our room was in Tower 2 with the pool. When we got to the elevators the tile and nice walls really got excited as to how the updated room would look. We were on the 27th floor rm 27237. Keys to room worked the first time, that was a plus. But when we opened the door it was a HUGE let down. First the overall size. Soo small. It was supposed to hold a king size bed and we wondered how, this brings me to my second upset. It was supposed to be a widescreen room with a KING bed. What we had was a QUEEN! Thirdly the picture clearly shows us a modern up-to-date room. The sheets (there was no cover over top) had tears, holes, and they were not changed the entire time we were there. The dresser was chipped and the carpet was dirty. The blue pillow looked like it was on it's last legs with stains and dirt. That should not be on a bed!! Now the widescreen tv was a plus however, when you have a tv that is supposed to have hd channels on regular cable it looks pixelated at best. The least they should have done is calibrated the tv so it would not look so fuzzy. As to a lot of people having the problem of stealing in the hotel, I had none, I did take extra precautions with my luggage. Using locks on the bags and anything that I knew would be a huge loss to me if taken was in a carry-on that I took with me.  Now for some positives. The view of the strip from our room was spectacular! You could see the whole strip from our room! Pool was nice, heated and open to use. I love to walk so being a little far from everything was not a problem, even if a person was tired there was always taking the trams. We had asked for a late checkout which did cost money however if we didnt have to get ousted by 11 it was great. Late checkout is at 3pm. Now for the buffets/ food. The food buffets at Excalibur and Luxor were so HORRIBLE I would never serve that  to my dog!! It tasted horrible! it definitely looked as though it had been left out for 3hrs or more. As for food elsewhere on the strip, Denny's was tried, but they brought a glass of grapefruit juice and web I got halfway down I noticed the glass was completely stained aka DIRTY. Margaritaville was a nice venue except for service. 20mins sitting at a table waiting for our server to come to the table. She came 3 times. Once to take our drink order and by that time we had already figured out what we wanted and ordered food as well. Second was when we were just about finished to ask how the food was. And to take the bill away as we left.  As a sidenote: make sure when you take a taxi you know where you need to go and what route to take as if you don't they will take you for a ride.  Other than noted I had a great trip, but due to the price and out dated rooms available, I will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good time at Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: sushifarmer
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights from Jan. 13th-15th. We had a great room on the 24th floor looking over New York New York. We had a big, comfortable king bed. Our room was a non-smoking room with a great view. Excalibur also had free wired internet, which was great with out small laptop. We enjoyed walking to Tropicana, New York, New York and the Luxor and taking the Deuce & Express Bus anywhere we wanted up and down the strip for $7 per person for 24 hrs, including downtown Fremont experience for one day. We ate at the Steak House at Excalibur our last evening there and it was great. We enjoyed the live music at the lounge. We definitely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday and Graduation Celebration”
Reviews.Author: BEH54
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1/23 - 1/27/2012, in Tower 1 on the 24th floor, in a room with a great view. It was your basic "standard" room without any coffee maker or refrigerator, but then we weren't in the room except to sleep. The room was clean, and neat, and had everything we needed. The employees were very helpful and friendly. The buffet was really good, with a wide variety of foods to choose from (go at 10:30am when they are in the middle of changing breakfast to lunch for a wide variety). Catching the bus was great with the 24 hr pass for $7 that enabled us to hop on and off at different locations along the strip. The show's are great, but the casino is a little smokey. Extra hotel charges at check out are the only thing I didn't like. We had a great time though!!!

Reviews.Title: “If you can't afford anything else..”
Reviews.Author: the_beach_911
Reviews.Content: The Excalibur isn't the worst hotel on the strip, but it's definitely not great. The hotel itself is very dated, and not just because the theme is medieval. It feels very run down. The rooms that aren't renovated are very old, carpet worn, old beds, old furniture, old tube TV's, but those still seem to be rampant in Las Vegas. The property itself is very crowded with kids and families. Be weary of the rates, they do have a resort fee- and I'm still not clear on what I "received" from paying it. Even with the fee, they still have very low rates- so if you can't afford anything else..

Reviews.Title: “las vegas trip”
Reviews.Author: travel_bug01002
Reviews.Content: we spent 5 days in las vegas at the excalibur on the strip , the view from the window was of the garbage and beer kegs each time they took the garbage out or changed a beer keg out it sounded like they where in your room , they add resort fees even when the pool was down for the winter , $12.50 that was $14.00 per Day with tax the room was not that great for the price I would not stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Girls' Weekend”
Reviews.Author: jenluvstravelin
Reviews.Content: I planned a trip for 6 girls to stay in Vegas for the weekend and picked Excalibur for the price, the service and how close it was to the monorail. Our trip started out with check in that was a breeze. I had emailed them and asked for adjoining rooms and initially did not get it but it was soon rectified. We had awesome views of the mountains which is what the girls wanted and the rooms were huge! We had three girls to a room and everyone was very comfortable and had more than enough room to put their stuff. The staff was amazing, they were very helpful and our room was always clean. This was my 4th time in Vegas and I will definitely stay here again, our only problem with the hotel was leaving it!

Reviews.Title: “Good room, some concerns.”
Reviews.Author: It_must_be_clean
Reviews.Content: Booked a Winter Promo which allowed us ti get 2 free tickets to Viva Elvis by Cirque. 3 months before the trip we found out that we could no longer get those tickets as the show was closed. We were not offered anything comparable (In my opinion their Medival Feast is NOT comparable to a Cirque!). Managed to negotiate a small amount off the room, again not comparable to what we had booked. (Would have cancelled altogether but our daughter really wanted to stay at the castle). When we got there, guess which show was not closed!!! My heart felt like we had been duped. After discussing with the manager, we received tickets to the Medival Feast (again not comparable). I commend the working staff on trying to make it right but the managerment and promotions staff need to be held accountable. This promotion was sly and slimey and I feel there was never any real intention of giving customers free Cirque tickets. The room/hotel was great! The view of New York New York was awesome! We watched the roller coaster and the wonderful bright lights of the strip. The room was clean and comfortable, and aside from the booking concerns, we enjoyed our stay. However the booking concerns would prevent me from staying there in the future. Something was fishy about the entire promotion.

Reviews.Title: “vegas”
Reviews.Author: wg1Birmingham
Reviews.Content: las vegas is a must for anyone who enjoys nightlife an site seeing combined. the hotel and casino excalibur is one of the best on the strip with four excellent pools and one of the busier casino's with well mannerd staff an a high level of cleanlyness. we also did a trip to the grand canyon and hoover dam which are fantastic sites our tour guide cowboy dave was very well educated about thewhole tour and very entertaining he made the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay at Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: Altimatic
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Excalibur (Jan 2012). I had booked a trip from Thursday evening to Tuesday evening. The primary hotel I was planning to stay at was ridiculously priced for that Thursday evening. Knowing that I was not landing in Vegas until 10:30pm and having to check out by 11am, it didn't make sense to pay over $149 for that evening. Instead, I decided to book the first night's stay at Excalibur. I had booked a Widescreen room. It was nothing fancy. A comfortable bed, decent bathroom, and a flat screen TV. For those that have never stayed at the Excalibur previously, the widescreen room are the newer/renovated rooms. I wouldn't recommend staying at the older rooms. For $55 a night, there's nothing really much to complain about. If you're looking for fancy, this is not the room or hotel for you. If you want a decent place to crash while you're checking out the Vegas strip, then this is a great rate and decent stay. The staff is very nice and friendly. You barely had to wait in line before you're attended to. If you have an MGM player's card, you can use it while gambling at the Excalibur (as it's an MGM property). The casino is not as smokey as some of the others at night. There's lots of slots and table games for the people looking to gamble. I believe the daily poker tournament buy in is only $30 or $35. If you want to grab a drink, Dick's Last Resort within the hotel is a fun place to grab some food and/or drink. The hotel has a walkway to the Luxor hotel so you don't have to go outside. There is an overpass to go to the New York New York hotel. From New York New York, there is also an overpass to go to MGM Grand. The vending machines in the hotel typically charge a ridiculous $3 for a bottle of water or pop. What I typically do is walk to the Walgreens (on the strip) just past the MGM Grand and get my drink/snacks for the room. Much much cheaper if you're staying a few days. For those who want to explore the strip without cabbing everywhere, there is a Monorail within the MGM Grand. You can typically purchase single ride or all day passes. The hotel is very close to McCarran airport. So, you don't have to leave too early to head to the airport. You can typically get there within 10 minutes by cab. Overall, I have no problem recommending this hotel to someone just looking for decent to cheaply priced stay on the strip. I would sooner recommend this hotel before the Luxor (as its rooms have been aging). The Excalibur renovated rooms (Widescreen room) are more than decent for the less picky. If you're looking for a luxurious/fancy hotel/hotel room experience, then you need to look at other options towards the middle of the strip. It really comes down to expectations when staying on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “DISNEYLAND FOR ADULTS AND THE FAMILY TOO!”
Reviews.Author: earivas2005
Reviews.Content: I have been to the Excalibur more than 8 times through the years. It never ceases to amaze me. The facade of a Castle, even without Merlin and the Dragon working is enough to realize you`re in a Disneyland for adults and the rest of the family. You see kids with young parents, old people with their grandchildren. Young women a!s brides and newly married. Older women enjoying shows like Menopause the Musical!! If you want to stay real cheap, go from Monday to Friday. Leave your bags in the hotel and enjoy the Friday for free. Want to see the desert? Ask for a room 18th floor or higher and there will always be a sight for your eyes! You can see the whole Strip! Or you can see the desert and the airport! Want to see what the Luxor is all about? Take the tram from the Excalibur! Take photos of all the Egyptian stuff and come and stay at the Excalibur! You have kids Easy to walk to the STRIP, where you find M&M, mountain climbing, Coca Cola or stay in the Excalibur and enjoy the kids show with Medieval fightings. The kids love McDonalds? There is one in the hotel! The hotel gives you good service. The bathroom is clogged? Immediate service! Need a shower mat? Call room service! Need extra blankets? They are brought immediately! Want to call friends in all USA? Pick the phone and speak for free! Speak for all the time you want, not three minutes! Want to use your laptop? Free wired internet! Good speed. Want to use your wireless? Get to McDonalds and Krispy Kremes and use it for free! You leave valuables on view. Personnel is honest to the fault!!! Need to protect valuables! There is a free safety box! Need the news? There is free newspapers even on Saturday and Sundays! You get US1A Today Monday to Friday and the Local newspaper Saturday and Sundays with all the supplements included, not a smaller version! Want to get to shows with good prices? Get them at the lobby! Want your Facebook friends that you are having a good time in Las Vegas? Take photos in a photo booth near registration at the lobby for free! You can send them with your e mail also. And also free! Want to exercise walking in the mornings? Take a walk in the Strip! It takes about an hour to walk from the Excalibur to Circus Circus! In front of the Circus Circus there is a Ross, so you can do some shopping! Want to do shopping and walk less? go across the Excalibur to the Ross nearby and shop till you drop! Want to do shopping in the shopping center? Take the Express bus that you can get on to in front of the Luxor to avoid the people in the Strip. Forgot your medicines? There is a Walgreen`s across the street! Want to go back to the Airport? Get a cheap shuttle for 6 or 7 dollars without problems! Want to take buses to do some shopping? Ask for the bus stops nearby! Want to take a small souvenir back home? Look for the booklet you`re given at registration and go and play for a small toy. You will always win! Want to take a drink for free? Look at your booklet of the Excalibur Hotel! Want to go home with money in your pockets? When you check out you see how little you paid! Want to spend little for a vacation you`ll always remember? Compare prices with other hotels and even with motels! And stay at the Excalibur!
