Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Tammy L
Reviews.Content: I read reviews that were mainly negative and I was very nervous. The reviews were way off! The hotel was wonderful!! We stayed 1/21- 1/26/12 and it was WONDERFUL! All of the staff were incredibly nice and helpful. We did upgrade to a room in Tower II (widescreen room), which I think made all the difference. The casino is great and the restaurants, including the room service, the buffet, Dick's Last Resort, and Camelot Steakhouse, were each wonderful, with their own quirks. There was housekeeping service everyday and the staff was incredibly cheerful. The bartenders were personable and knew how to make drinks. We loved this hotel. After staying for four nights and barely even leaving the hotel (but it is so conveniently located that it was very easy to visit other resorts), I would definitely stay there again. I think the negative reviews are people who are expecting too much for their money. This is a middle of the range hotel, there are much worse and there are nicer hotels, but for a comfortable, relaxed, while having everything you need (including a 24/7 store) for a decent price, this is the place to be. The only complaint I have is there condo promoters are super annoying. I was probably asked 50 times if I wanted a free show. I know that is an incredibly difficult job, but it was annoying for a guest to constantly be asked the same question. Other than that, the hotel and amenities were wonderful. I do not have children, and I do not think children should be brought to Las Vegas (have you heard of Disneyworld??) so I cannot speak to the family friendly pitch the hotel attempts. I think it is largely unsuccessful (again - do not bring your children to Vegas). For adults, who want a place to relax, unwind, gamble, party, shop, dine, or just plain go crazy at a decent price, this is the place to be!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean Basic & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Angelooney37
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur from 13th - 23rd January 2012. It was great nice and clean and very comfortable. Staff were very helpful and I would definitely stay there again. It is at the south end of the strip and is very close to the Deuce & SDX bus stops so getting around Vegas and the Strip is a breeze. $7 for a 24 hour all access bus pass is great too. There is free WiFi at Krispy Kreme / McDonald's in the food court so don't pay for their wired internet in the room, in fact all over Las Vegas there is free WiFi. Having said that the buffet is terrible we did dinner and it was a poor selection.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: Mels49
Reviews.Content: I read the most recent reviews and I was nervous. I had no need to worry. A group of 3 ladies were there and we had no problem! Room was big...got a free upgrade, people were pleasant and room was clean. It is not fancy..it does not present itself as fancy. It is a reasonably affordable hotel with casual gambling, cheap food and terrific location. If you want class and elegance..you need to pay for it!

Reviews.Title: “Good family hotel but beware of timeshare selling”
Reviews.Author: Littondoddy
Reviews.Content: Beware of multiple staff purporting to offer you a concierge service to arrange discounted show tickets. They are trying to refer you into a timeshare selling process. We were hit-up about 6 different times. We were offered $380 worth of show tickets for $50, on condition that we joined a 2-3 hr bus trip and tour to Grandview and attend a presentation. We had to pay $50 up-front. This seemed like a good deal, as we wanted the tickets on offer and figured that we could resist the timeshare selling, albeit that we were annoyed at the initial misrepresentation and failure to declare interest up-front. However, after paying the non-refundable deposit, we researched the process and read about high pressure sales tactics, dishonoring of time commitments (ie an all-day process), being locked up as a captive audience, and sometimes problems with the promised tickets. Stuff that! Life (and vacations) are too short for that kind of entrapment. If you are on your guard and can dodge the undeclared selling, then the hotel was otherwise good value for a family group.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible reservations!!!”
Reviews.Author: Shannon B
Reviews.Content: My new sister in law and brother went to Las Vegas to get married. They booked a room with a view and then upgraded it. Upon arrival to the hotel they were told there were no upgrades left and there room was of the intersection not the strip. Front desk would not refund the money for an upgrade and would not provide them with any room of the view of the strip as indicated on making the reservations. I commented on facebook about this and was told to contact guest relations to inform them of more to the story. I did so and emailed back and forth about the situation at hand. Trust me when people get married and make the reservations they made it isn't something they want to have to deal with upon arrival. This is a special day and the reservations have been made with the understanding they are getting what is paid for. Guest relations claimed they refunded money for buffets for the troubles, however, you can't refund something that comes free with the room anyways. This fixed nothing and I along with the rest of my family, friends and co workers would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “average hotel, nothing special, buffet average”
Reviews.Author: NativeCalif
Reviews.Content: in this town, why not stay someplace you really enjoy? Of the group of hotels that the Excalibur belongs to, this is the bottom of the pick. Once we'd stayed there and tried the buffet, we quickly learned that there are much better places to say.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the Vegas strip”
Reviews.Author: grampa_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights during the 2012 Las Vegas Shot Show. Our daughter arranged for three rooms. Pricing is very reasonable for a strip hotel. If you join the M-Life players club you will be on a mailing list for special offers. The rooms are somewhat plain, but clean and well-maintained. Bathrooms are also very clean and spacious. Our rooms had flat-screen TV's and internet connections. Beds are comfortable, not luxurious. Hotel amenities and entertainment are plentiful and varied. The property has an acceptable food court with a Macdonalds, Cold Stone ice cream, Quizno's, Pizza Hut, Dairy Queen, and of course, Krispy Kreams eateries. For the budget minded folks who want a good value in a busy part of the Strip, this would be a good place to stay, as we have on many occasions.

Reviews.Title: “watch out for the hidden fees”
Reviews.Author: Kent E
Reviews.Content: When you check in your welcomed with open arms, but when you leave you get hit with hidden fees and not even a thank you. I checked the web site and sure enough they state a $14.00 fee would be charged, they stated it was Taxes, but when you actually check out, you already paid Taxes, and the $14.00 fee was outlined as a newspaper you never got, internet you never used, phone not used and exercise rome which we did not use, then $1.50 Tax on that Balance. It appears even Excalibur does not know what the fee was for. When I complained about the reasoning of the fee, all I got was all the Hotels do it. The wife and I will be glade to spend our dallors in a differant tourist location next time.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price”
Reviews.Author: hayesl1125
Reviews.Content: We had a good time here. It is a great location on the strip.. The rooms were clean. Beds were comfy, The funiture needs a little updating still but over all it was a decent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the Resort Fees!”
Reviews.Author: NobleTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Excalibur for one night to get a few hours sleep before an early morning flight home. Considering the limited amount of time I would be there, I used priceline.com to book a cheap room. Excalibur was nearby and affordable so I went with it. At check-in I learned that in addition to what I pre-paid to priceline, the hotel charges a resort fee of $15.00 per day. I asked what this fee covered and was told about amenities like free in-room internet and the pool. I explained that I wouldn't be using these features, but was informed that the fee is mandatory regardless. The nice man at the front desk gave me a free upgrade, but the resort fee was unsavory. I would have been especially upset if I was staying for multiple nights. The common areas of the hotel (lobby, casino, halls, elevators) seem pretty dated. The room was large and fairly well appointed. The place doesn't have the wow-factor you find at many Vegas resorts, but it also doesn't come with a hefty price tag.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive and Impressive”
Reviews.Author: Canshy
Reviews.Content: Note: We usually stay at the MGM Signature which is significantly more costly than Excalibur although the hotels are kiddy corner to one another. This trip we were roadtripping it so we were unsure what day or time we would arrive but we wanted to ensure we had a place to stay when we did get there. For this reason, we booked the first three days of our trip at Excalibur and the second three days at the signature. We arrived at Excalibur late on day one of our three day stay. Check in took about fifteen minutes or so, there were a surprisingly large number of people in the area, not just at the check in but around the casino area and such. The staff member who checked us in was efficient and friendly. She offered us a free upgrade as it was our honeymoon and we were put in a King room. They had our bags delivered to our room and we settled in right away. We were pleased to find the room to be large and spacious with a nice sized bathroom. We also had a view of the New York New York roller coaster and part of the strip. It was an excellent view. The bed was very comfortable, the room was clean, there was a safe there for us to use which was nice. The room was quiet, we had no complaints about anything while staying here. While there we visited the pool. There was a water slide attached to the pool but it was not working while we were there. There were a lot of lounge chairs spread throughout so we were able to suntan. We booked this hotel by phone and were told they had a promotion going on that allowed us two tickets to a show for an extra $70. We were allowed to choose from a variety of shows but we decided to go with the Tournament Of Kings dinner show at Excalibur. This show was excellent-- very good food, entertainment, atmosphere etc. I will write a separate review for that! Overall I would recommend Excalibur to anyone looking for an inexpensive, clean hotel!

Reviews.Title: “TOTAL Dissapointment”
Reviews.Author: Greg R
Reviews.Content: We were in Vegas the first week of Nov. 2011 for a Trade Show, and stayed at the Excalibur for 4 days. During that time, it was impossible to enter or leave (via ANY door) without being pounced upon by the vultures trying to sell time shares. It was VERY annoying, VERY invasive and got old VERY quickly. Additionally, we were there on business - and it was necessary to conduct business via the Internet (with customers/potential customers) from our room. But that was nearly impossible given the fact that we had NO Internet service for most of the time we were there. Engineering visited our room several times, got the connection to work for a short period of time, and then it would crash again. Excalibur is a beautiful property to visit while you're in Vegas, with some of the best restaurants in the city. But it's NOT a user friendly place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: maria14Essex
Reviews.Content: In fairness the hotel itself is OK. Our room did leave a little to be desired. the room was very dated and dingy. We did consider asking for another room but we decided that we were only sleeping in it (and it was christmas, so very busy) and we paid next to nothing for it (about $15 a night) so we put up and shut up. Didn't find all the staff very helpful...but then you always get the odd few don't you ???

Reviews.Title: “I would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: MadDogBiker
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur (in spite of several less than favorable reviews) for 6 nights and were quite satisfied. Let's face it, you're not going to get a room like at the Bellagio for the prices at Excalibur. Our room was clean. The decor was a bit dated but in line with the Excalibur theme. We had a non-smoking room that had a couple of cigarette burns in the carpet but overall, the room was fine. While not the greatest view, we looked out to Sunset Blvd. and the airport so we were able to watch the planes coming in at night. We didn't spend much time in the room anyway. The lines to the buffet were long, so we ate elsewhere. What we didn't like were all the people approaching us to see their timeshare location under the guise of a "Welcome Gift", seeing a free show, etc. We decided to go anyway since it was billed as taking 2-3 hours. Wrong. It took a full 4 hours and completely killed an afternoon. When we came to the closing part of the presentation and decided it wasn't for us, we then had to meet the manager who then dropped the price. We said no again, so he mentioned there could be some foreclosures available for even less. No, dammit, no. The actual "tour" took about 10 minutes. The free food was free but pretty limited when we expected something on the order of a buffet. Yes, we did get $25 in dining credit (choices are limited) and $25 in free play in the casino, plus discount tickets to a show (that we never saw) but it's not worth the time unless you're really interested in a timeshare. The sales people in the hotel are relentless, so just tell them you went yesterday and keep on walking.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur, the new Circus Circus”
Reviews.Author: eltotaupin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Excalibur about 9 years ago on a solo trip so i wasnt really needing anything too lavish and was satisfied, this time i only had that memory to go by when booking our trip to Vegas, BIG mistake. Our room was on the second floor. the coouch had cigarette burns in it. the window was blocked by a cement wall. lights in room worked sometimes and sometimes not. depended on how the light felt i guess. It was quiet so sleep was good. EVERY day when going into hallway the smell of pot was overwhelming. I mean OVERWHELMING!!!!! Just seemed divey and worn. remodel all the rooms and perhaps i'd come back

Reviews.Title: “not the best”
Reviews.Author: hwhiteley
Reviews.Content: poor hotel looked very dull and dingy compared to the rest, location is ok so if you not bothard about the look then the price is great. I would pay that bit extra and stay at the luxor next time although will not visit vegas again its abit been there now nothing to see after you been there a couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing price but average hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmjs4016
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for two nights for a last minute trip. At $24 a night, it was by far the best deal available.Like most Las Vegas hotels, Excalibur charges a $14 resort fee per night, but that is pretty much to be expected, especially at an MGM brand resort. This hotel is located on the strip, but pretty far on the south side, right between the Luxor and New York New York. It was quite a walk to get to the middle of the strip, but we found plenty to do at our end. The room itself was surprisingly nice. The medieval decor was subtle, but still present in the rooms, which i really liked as I love when hotels have themes. The view from our room was horrible, it looked out to basically just a roof with a tiny view of the freeway in the background, but we didn't spend much time in the room anyways. The casino and restaurants were just average. Many of the tables had low minimums, which is nice if you dont have too much cash to lose but it wasn't huge, and everything seemed a little worn. We had lunch one day at the Lynyrd Skynyrd restaurant, which had good barbecue served cafeteria style. Overall, it was a good stay and for the price that we paid, it was a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Your Money”
Reviews.Author: nehasaxena
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good value for your money. Rooms were clean and hotel was well kept. I wasn't expecting a hotel at a convenient location on strip and at this price. It is connected via Tram to Luxor and Mandalay Bay. Had lot to do in itself that you could have spent your week staying in there.They do charge you Resort Fee when you check in which is some 12-13 bucks per night, so add that to your budget while planning your trip. I would not mind staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Strip hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: was_bh
Reviews.Content: Excalibur is an old hotel located in the Strip (Vegas main and glamurous street). It worth the money since it's not too expensive. We got a Twin room for 5 nigths. It was a business trip. >>> ROOM Room is avarage, good size, nothing special. Flat Screen TV, good cooling/heating system, nice window view. The bath lacks a better shower. Free *cable* internet in the room (average speed and pretty reliable). We didin't use room service. There is no refrigerator in the room. >>> FOOD There is a good buffet option in the casino (USD 20,00 lunch and dinner, USD 16,00 breakfeast or USD 30,00 all-day pass). Not a wonderful food, but worth the money. There are 2 starbucks inside the hotel as well as many other options (pizza, snacks, bars, etc). >> PARKING Valet USD 7,00 per day. But you can always use self-parking. Parking lot is behind the hotel but there is a very close entrance. >>> OTHER THOUGHTS There is a tram connecting Excalibur to Luxor and other 2 hotels. Elevators are pretty large (American way) and very fast

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and staff”
Reviews.Author: Yolanda M
Reviews.Content: The Excalibur extended the olive branch with their excellent customer service and staff. They made sure I was comfortable and had all the amenities I needed. I would highly recommend this hotel to all of my family and business partners.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you paid for........”
Reviews.Author: St-Patrick89
Reviews.Content: I had booked for 5 days at the Excalibur and found it to be adequate, but just barely. I had book for a room with a single king size bed only to be told at check in they didn't have any available. So being the nice guy that I am, and being very tired from my flight, I took the room they gave me. It had 2 queen sized beds, no problem there. But the bath room was handicapped accessible, that was a problem. Again being a nice guy, and very tired I thought it would be fine. It was not. I should have gone back to the front desk right then and asked for another room, but I didn't. Other problems with this room were, 1) the shade for the window didn't block out light very well, even at night light from across the highway came in around the edge og the shade. 2) The room was on the back side of the hotel overlooking the highway and there was the constant sound of traffic. 3) The bathroom sink had no counter space do to the fact it was a handicapped accessible. These were the major issues I had with the room. There were some other minor issues which didn't bother me as much but if I were to do this trip over I would have booked at another hotel, or at least gone to the front desk and asked for another room. The casino, as with most casinos in Vegas, was smokey and loud. I found the payouts on their video poker to be very poor. The staff at the hotel were very freindly and helpful but that is not enough for me to stay at this hotel again. If you're on a buget this is a cheap hotel on the strip, but just make sure you get the room you booked. If you don't then go the the front desk and tell them you want another room.

Reviews.Title: “ugghhh!”
Reviews.Author: SenoritaBeverly
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel with a friend. After a 6 hour flight I wanted to be wow'd by the grandeur of the hotel but I was thoroughly disappointed! From the outside it's beautiful but once inside what a disappointment. The check-in area was not inviting. Everything in the lobby area looked so outdated! The rooms definitely need a makeover; completely outdated. None of the furniture matched in the room, I mean NONE! There was no coffee maker, no microwave ; it was the pits. The halls did not look vacummed, the elevator doors were dirty; I would NOT stay there again! Oh, and the people in the lobby chasing you down to book a time share; what a freakin' annoyance! Had a decent view and had a good time with my friend but all in all I did not like the hotel. Do not stay at the Excalibur unless you want to stay in a 1 star hotel! ~Disappointed New Yorker

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Mrs Bradley
Reviews.Content: Fortunately I form my own opionion despite the reviews! I visited Vegas 1/6 thru 1/8/2012. I booked a room at the Excalibur and was very impressed. This hotel is right in the heart of all you would want to see or do. The hotel is very attractive and the room was very clean. I would recommend this hotel for all, especially families.

Reviews.Title: “Free buffet is only free if you remind them at checkout.”
Reviews.Author: Bruce2468
Reviews.Content: Hotel was decent, room was clean, sleep was quiet. It was easy to google a coupon code for a free buffet that you mention the code when you check in. It does require you to register your credit card, charge the buffet to your room, and then they say that $40.00 for two of us will be taken off the $50.00 price. Sounds pretty simple, but just as I expected, when checking out your are presented with the hotel stay bill and expected to simply sign it and go away.... no surprise the buffet cost has not been deducted, no apologies, just a simple case of reprinting your bill and it is now reduced. Seems pretty sleazy to me, yet obvious, that hotels have this type of policy.... (lets see if they don't notice the lack of crediting the bill.) Also don't forget the no choice "resort fee" (rip off fee) that gets tagged on to your room fee...... come on guys why is that not just shown as the room fee if we have to pay it? Vegas, or this hotel now comes complete with dancing girls next to some of the blackjack tables. At times there were dancing girls on the bars as well. I don't gamble much, but it was fun to see the sights..... I would say leave the kids at home, vegas is not a place for kids to have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a Strip hotel”
Reviews.Author: hughjorg
Reviews.Content: This was the third time that I have stayed at The Excalibur. The price has always been a good value and the property is well kept and clean. It is centrally located on the end of the strip, with access to many other casinos near by. During my most recent visit, the water presure in the shower was a trickle - at best. NOT GOOD!!!! I voiced my displeasure to the staff and they didn't charge me for the "Resort Fee" - a savings of $30.00. This was an ok resolution to the problem, but not the one I was looking for. I will return to the Excalibur.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: backsthepack
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the resort. We enjoyed this visit as much as the first one. When we arrived we had to wait awhile for valet this time, kind of surprising because it wasn't that busy on a Monday morning, but the wait wasn't too long. We arrived way too early for check in, so we opted to use the baggage storage. Worked out great. Left our luggage for a few hours and had some fun. Once we were able to get to check in the process was a little slow. But the clerk was very helpful. I had booked view rooms, but the people that went with us wanted smoking rooms so we had to change our rooms. The clerk handled that with us without a problem. We had a Tower II room again, this time on the first floor. It was clean, roomy and nice. Our family had a room on the other side of the tower, floor one as well. The only issue was that their hallway smelled as though a skunk had sprayed inside of it. Otherwise, no issues with their room either. Check out on Wednesday was a tad slow as well, but again, no issues.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is Better than its Guests”
Reviews.Author: N0ahsdad
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two mid-week nights in January. Arrived without reservation but was able to secure a room without any difficulty. Desk person; Vicky, was very professional and courteous. Placed us in room 21173 with a great view for $54.32 a night all taxes and fees included. My wife and I cannot believe how far room rates in Vegas have plunged since 2008. The room was very clean. Large flat screen TV. Shower but no tub which we didn't care about. Hard wired internet access. No wireless. Hard wire is 10 feet long so you can sit and work at the table provided in the room. View of MGM Grand, New York, New York and airport. Use of exercise facility included in price. Use of sauna and showers $10 extra. Medium end buffet available in hotel. $16 for lunch, $20 for dinner. Crowd is about 50% foreigners (mostly Asian) and 50% American. Surprisingly few children though the last time we were here 5 years ago there were kids galore. This is definitely a dress down town. Some of the visitors look as if they just got off of work at a construction site and came to Vegas to emulate the characters in the movie 'Hangover'. This is true of every hotel we've seen in Vegas and we have seen every one on the south end of the strip. Small groups of very young and very inebriated young men and women given to spasms of profanity. Casino was sparsely populated. Slots near registration desk are, amazingly; penny slots. All players are offered watered down cocktails. Real drinks are $5. Things have gotten so bad that there are even penny slots at the Bellagio and yet there are few people there and those that are are viewing the fountain show out front. Hotel employees are actively pushing time share presentations for which you will receive things like free buffets or show tickets. If you are looking for a very good quality hotel with a great location for less than $60/ nite Excalibur fits the bill. Lots of free parking and the monorail stops right out front.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump.”
Reviews.Author: Escena
Reviews.Content: Filthy. Do they even own a vacuum cleaner? How about scrubby sponges for the bathroom? The walls of my room were bashed in by the clunky furniture and the carpet was ripped. The casino was decidedly low end decor and it looks like the management of the place just doesn't care. Give it a few more years and they'll implode it to make way for a decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: Lisabug1021
Reviews.Content: It was large and loud but definitely nothing special. Also, the reservations lead you to believe if you pay up 10.00 you will get a room with a view, they just don't tell you it is of the parking lot. The pool area is nice, however. No, coffee in the rooms. An expensive coffee shop down in the lobby. We won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur - Tower 2”
Reviews.Author: nealf
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Tower 2, 25th floor. Absolutely perfect, no complaints whatsoever. My last stay was at the MGM Suites and apart from the kitchen facilites I missed nothing. The Excalibur was a perfect resort and I enjoyed my stay. I am not sure what the rooms are like in Tower 1, but I have posted 3 pics of my room in Tower 2 and it was large, clean and well-appointed. There was no smell of smoke on our floor, the casino floor is very smoky but that is normal for all the casinos we visited in Vegas. I would have to say that Excalibur had one of the best Casinos, packed with people and lots of fun. There is a resort fee of $12 per day but that includes wired internet access in your room so I didn't mind it too much. Note: Most of the negative reviews seem to be people staying in Tower 1, as you can see from the pics of my room it was modern and tastefully furnished. Tips: There is no kettle, coffee maker or any bar fridge in the rooms. Therefore its not possible to make a cuppa tea or store perishable snacks. You can buy water in the Excalibur for $5 per litre, or just walk up the strip a block to either the CVS or Walgreens where you buy a gallon for $2. Its cheaper to buy the 2 day all you can eat buffet pass than trying to pay for individual meals, in truth you end up paying more if you don't eat at the buffets. The best buffet we had was the MGM, thumbs down on both the Excalibur, Luxor and Mandalay. There is a small food court in the M&M plaza which is a 5 minute walk from the Excalibur where you can get reasonably cheap meals (e.g. $7 per person at the Panda Express). Don't waste your time at the Premium Outlet Mall (South), the prices are basically 20% off retail and they only have last seasons merchandise. A total waste of a trip. The strip bus is supposed to be every 10-15 mins but its more like every half-hour, so don't rely on it. You will be walking in Vegas ALOT! Ladies what is it with the 9 inch stilleto heels?!?! I saw lots of women limping around and in pain ... take your walking shoes.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Melle70
Reviews.Content: I have a bad experience with the wire internet service at the room. It took me three phone calls and over one hour on the phone for them to realize that was something wrong with the modem.

Reviews.Title: “Once is enough!”
Reviews.Author: Centralnewyorkers
Reviews.Content: Place smelled/dirty, very unfriendly and there were holes in the sheets in all three of our rooms! It was also very annoying to have people stationed throughout chasing you down to give you a "deal". The ladies running the kids games in the Fun Dungeon were the best part of Excalibur! We knew the first day we wouldn't be back. We would call it the Wal-Mart of casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Older but still good”
Reviews.Author: petrcze
Reviews.Content: Try to find the special deals on Expedia, we booked this hotel for about 38 USD/night. Good central Strip position, spacious rooms, clean, nice bathrooms, no complains. Perhaps one thing was worse: the view from the window into the backyard that looked like an old abandoned factory...but no problem it was probably cheapest rate room.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel on the strip, you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: mgrp
Reviews.Content: Excaliber would definitely be considered a budget hotel as I paid an average of 70/night on a weekend. We stayed in the upgraded tower rooms, the rooms were clean and comfortable, nothing to wow the guest. The only complaint I would have is the property is a little older and the smell of cigarettes is sometimes present on the casino floor (not in the rooms or hallways however), I have rarely noticed this issue in other casinos on the strip. The hotel was worth the money paid as I was looking for an inexpensive weekend away and wanted to save my money for the SHOPPING! If you spend little time in the room I would recommend Excaliber, also the pools looked nice however I didn't go in them. If you plan to spend all your time in Vegas in your room and the same casino, I would recommend spending more on your room at a different casino, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck, this can't be Vegas...”
Reviews.Author: Ian D
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my 4 day stay at Excalibur and it was by far my worst experience in Las Vegas. I usually travel to Vegas 2-3 times per year and decided to try Excalibur as an inexpensive alternative during a very busy convention week (CES). From my initial walk into the room (Air not working, cover removed, used deordant stick on the floor) to the terrible noise every morning from 2-4 am, to hotel security arguing, then fighting with, then tazing a guest in my hallway, it was absolutely the worst stay I've had in Vegas. Take out the outside circumstances of people with little respect of others, and the room itself was dirty and not well maintained. So much for upgrading to the widescreen room... The front desk "manager" was no help, stating that "It's Las Vegas, it happens". Shame on you MGM Resorts for letting a property slip this far. Maybe it's time to switch my alliegance to another brand other than MGM when I travel to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: hellofish
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Vegas when there were quite a few specials on at the time. We paid about $40 a night for this place, which was pretty cheap. However, the room was dated (furnishings looked like they were from the 70s and 80s) and the air conditioner was very noisy and was falling off the wall. The room had free wired (not wireless) internet - a cable modem. This was perfectly acceptable but still a bit outdated. The TV reception was also very fuzzy. We paid extra for a view, which was pretty good. The hotel itself (lobby, casino etc) felt dated but was acceptable - Circus Circus, for example, felt a lot seedier. The food was pretty bad, and my advice is to eat elsewhere - the food in their restaurants was very mediocre. Service was generally complacent and bordered on rude at times, from the receptionists, to the waitresses. It seems that as they have such a high turnover rate and few repeat customers, they don't seem to care. Also, as the hotel is so huge and has so many rooms, the lines to check in are proportional - though this is probably common in Vegas. The location is at the bottom end of the strip, but is close enough to everything. The Vegas Monorail is a rip-off and doesn't go anywhere useful - get the tourist bus, or taxis. For the price I paid I really can't complain - just do not expect luxury!

Reviews.Title: “Quick, easy, and inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: J_cali86
Reviews.Content: Ok, so we wanted a quick inexpensive trip to Vegas since we just had spent a week at the Mgm. The excalibur was great. Stayed in tower 2 and we had a great pool view. Check in line was a bit long but went by quickly. Room was nice and clean and had a nice big flat screen. So I've stayed in plenty of Vegas hotels and I hate how long it takes from the rooms to the strip, but the excalibur was actually not bad at all. It was about a 5 min walk to the strip or the food court. The bus stops right in front which is great, u can't beat $7 bucks for 24 hrs and it takes u to fremont st. Had a great weekend trip, I will be staying at the excalibur again!

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Northern_AB_Girl
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to vegas we were going for a weekend away to celebrate my ahem older birthday and our 15 year anniversary. I booked the Excalibur hotel for the great price I thought I was gettting!.. this is yet another hotel that is charging resort fees. which inludes free wired internet--seriously with all the iphones and ipads out there why wouldn't you have wireless internet access. but anyway I didn't mind the resort fees because I thought I was reserving a room with a king size bed that was on the strip. I even didn't mind the fact that I had to pay a portion of the bill as a deposit up front. I recieved my confirmation email and this is where they get you...at the bottom of your confirmation email there is a line that states "We will do our best to ensure that you receive the room type that you have selected during your stay at Excalibur. However, room type selections cannot be guaranteed." and yes I just copied this word for word from my confirmation email. It has been my experience that when you reserve a room online and you select the room type this is what you get! not that they can't guarantee the type of room that you think you have just booked and paid a portion of. I think what made us the most angry was that at the front desk the clerk was quite snotty in saying well thats just a request!! we were told to call a number from our room with our concerrns and so we did just that and were basically told so what..try and find another room on the strip tonight. so I have to ask the question what good is it to book a specific room type if it can't be guarnteed. Now the room itself was a standard two bed queen room, only showers, and no tub, which is ok but after several hours of touring it would have been nice to come back to the room and soak my tired feet. The maids kept the room fairly clean during our stay but I did notice black mold on the walls in the bathroom..so that part wasn't so good. so overal I wouldn't reccommend this hotel to anyone between the hidden fees and inablilty to reserve a specific room type.

Reviews.Title: “Not a mistake!”
Reviews.Author: h2o_mermaid
Reviews.Content: I loved the Excalibur! I went there with my dad and one of my friends, and didn't have a single complaint. The pool was warm, and relaxing. Staff were very friendly, and cared about what you had to say compared to some hotels I have stayed at. I would definitely recommend it, and go there again! We went to a dinner theatre there, and the show was pretty good. The food was...okay. I do have one thing to say if you go to their dinner show. Expect to say "HORRAH!" alot. Not a bad thing. The actors were very energetic as well.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate But Depressing”
Reviews.Author: richard_traveler
Reviews.Content: I was there during the Consumer Electronics Show when hotel rooms are in high demand. I think I got value for my money, paying about $140/night. But this place is creepy unless you like cartoonish castles (Snow White plus Dwarves had to be nearby), the spires of which were staring at me through my window whenever I dared look out. Ground floor filled with slots and smoke, not my thing. Some websites said the Excalibur was one of four favorite hotels for hookers but I didn't see many at all (although I was always in bed by midnight so maybe they show up earlier). There's a fun Lynard Skynard bar with bar-b-que that was just great. Location was good, as it was a 10 minute walk to the monorail (at MGM), with about half the walking inside. Overall the place felt dingy and in dire need of renovation. Front desk staff were fine, and everyone friendly, can't fault them on that. And I must say my room was quite large.

Reviews.Title: “clean and cheap”
Reviews.Author: eldeesilver
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Excalibur during the Consumer Electronics Show because of the price. The hotel was the first stop on the shuttle bus route, and the check in/out was efficient. My room was a "wide screen room" which, I assume, is an upgrade over their standard rooms with old tube TVs. Although large, the room was very plain; nothing fancy....shower instead of a tub, had an in room safe and iron/ironing board. The room was very clean, had good pillows and the bed was comfortable. When I think about it... what more do you want in this town? Excalibur is at the end of the strip which can be inconvienient. However, there is a tram stop behind the MGM that can get you up and down cheaply. $12 gets you a 24 hr ticket.

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel with hidden fees”
Reviews.Author: kalamajkab
Reviews.Content: Just the hotel: rooms and halls feel tired and in desperate need of updating. But they were clean and the beds were comfortable enough - nothing special but not bad. The common areas (not casino) are where you see lots of issues with cleanliness, and I didn't see that at other resorts. Broken bottles laying around for hours, homeless sleeping in benches outside. What really ticked me off was the addition of $16/night "resort fee". We booked through online site (Hotels or Expedia - and will take it up with them) and paid the price listed, but at check-in they added the fee and couldn't adequately explain what the fee covered. IMHO, it is absolutely unconscionable to up charge guest for facility amenities. Either a) include the price in the room rate and raise the room rates or b) use a "pay to play" model and charge for using Internet, pool or gym. Sneak attacking your guest with charges at check-in (when they're already here and can't go anywhere else), puts you in the leagues with the airlines and politicians. Only thing worse would have been to charge it at check-out Definitely not putting an "hospitality" in the industry.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Towny72
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Excalibur in Tower 2. We had a widescreen room on the 23rd Floor overlooking the MGM Grand and New York-New York. The rooms are very comfortable and are cleaned daily. Loads of choices of places to eat in the hotel along with the links to Luxor and Mandalay Bay. We stayed during CES week and the food venues were pretty busy in the morning. Would definately stay there again if the price is right due to the location. The only annoying part was having to say no every 5 minutes to people offering you 'Free Show Tickets'.

Reviews.Title: “Very Economical”
Reviews.Author: Pat075
Reviews.Content: For the past 3 years my family have stayed at the Excalibur the week before Christmas (not so crowded at that time of the year). We have paid $21. a nite (with a loyalty card) and $32. for an all day buffet (either of 2 casinos). The rooms are in Tower 1 and do not have a view - but who cares for this price. The rooms are clean and I would call it medium quality. My daughter had a plumbing problem and they were there to fix it immediately. It is handy to the other hotels and the slots seem to be better than some of the other hotels. We will continue to go back every year. They do have a resort fee but then everyone does.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended - Service is below standard”
Reviews.Author: lisajf28
Reviews.Content: The rooms are okay, nothing special. The price on the website and the price that you pay at check-out is not the same. I even called to confirm the price I received on the website was the final price with no hidden costs and they confirmed that was the price. When I went to check-out the price was $85.00 higher. After feeling nickel-and-dime at every turn in Las Vegas, I felt it was very unfair. The service was well below standard, especially at check-out; I spoke to two supervisors and the last was so rude and condescending that I would never EVER recommend this hotel to anyone. i would rather pay extra than be treated the way I was treated. Be warned that after you check-in, there are Excalibur employees to direct you to your room, with the statement of "Did you receive your free gift at registration?" There is no free gift only a very aggressive salesperson attempting to sell you various shows owned by the MGM conglomerate. Do not be fooled. In addition, I was emailed a survey on my experience with the request of follow-up only to never receive anything. Another reason not to stay at the Excalibur Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for the CES convention”
Reviews.Author: WSS64
Reviews.Content: A bit old but clean. A bit dark looking but good enough for a few nights during the CES convention. Friendly and helpful staff, clean rooms. I don't care to gamble so not much to write about that. Not too many restaurants to write about either. In the end, the Excalibur is just a decent place to stay for a convention with still fairly reasonable prices and easy access to convention center with shuttle bus. Oh, the gym has nice opening hours, not too big and decent machines & weights. Too bad 4 out of the 10 cardio machines were out of service. Oh, also the water volume in the showers were a bit lame but I guess since we are in a desert.....

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: ThunderBayHiker
Reviews.Content: I didn't expect much but the rooms were very tired looking and in need of repairs. Our Tower 2 room for $86 had torn off wallpaper and the nightstand light bulb was torn out of its socket. Our Tower 2 room also had torn wallpaper and the shower stall doors were damaged. In the hotel and casino common areas the cigarette smoke was thick. If you are looking for cheap ($56 to $86) and don't mind the conditions then this hotel is acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasently surprised”
Reviews.Author: AZEGHTESADI
Reviews.Content: Was concerned after seeing the reviews involving theft, but I never once felt unsafe. We stayed in the updated Tower 2 and loved the room. The timeshare pitch people can get a bit annoying but other than that had a great trip

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for...Nice enough.”
Reviews.Author: samb971
Reviews.Content: I'll keep it short and sweet. We paid £200 for 8 nights over Christmas and New Year. The room was clean, Large TV, Great View. Yes the bathroom could prob do with a re-furb, but it was clean. We arnt ones to sit in our rooms whilst in Vegas and i have paid top dollar and stayed in some of the better hotels. But to be fair couldnt fault it for what we wanted....oh and as we booked with hotels4u.com...no resort fee!

Reviews.Title: “It was good.”
Reviews.Author: leatherharry
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur from Jan 5-8 and I would stay there again. I thought the rooms were ok, nothing fancy. The shower had good water pressure and the beds were comfortable. I liked that the hotel was affordable. The dinner buffet was $20 and breakfast buffet was $15. There was a group of 12 of us and we never had a problem getting a table all together. The food was very good but I am not a picky person. I did think the coffee was terribly bitter and I always had to add a bit of french vanilla latte to it just to drink it. That would be my one complaint. They have a lot of affordable restaraunts like McDonalds, Quiznos, Pizza Hut, Crispy Creme and others. There is a walkway to the Luxor which is next door and then on to Mandalay Bay. My 7 year old niece was with us and this was a very kid friendly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Bristolforever
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Excalibur in November. Needed somewhere fairly cheap and this fitted the bill. Very close to all the action at the "right" end of The Strip compared to other reasonably priced hotels nearer to the Downtown end which are a getting somewhat isolated these days. Excalibur is bit run-down and dated but lots going on and people seemed to be checking in all times of the day and night so it's definitely popular. Room was just ok; bed was not the most comfortable but I slept all right. Bathroom was clean and housekeeping was done each day. Went to the Tournament of Kings show in the hotel; I enjoyed it though my pal didn't so much. Food at the show was pretty basic. I guess that it would be better if we'd had a few more drinks before going as it helps with the audience participation (of which there is quite a bit..)! Their breakfast buffet was very good and we used it every day we were there. Message to fellow Brits. Do please tip the staff that clear the dining tables a couple of bucks, they rely on the cash a lot. I "bussed" tables in Vegas as a student and many fellow countrymen were notorious for not leaving anything. And you need to book a table for dinner at most places (use the hotel phone, free local calls or included in resort tax if you're paying that) if you don't want to end up queing for ages especially at week-ends. The restaurant at Paris that is set on the pavement and overlooks the Bellagio fountains is good and suprisingly reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY IN EXCALIBUR”
Reviews.Author: Ravi K
Reviews.Content: I booked my trip through Expedia on Excalibur. Of course they immediately charged me for the two night reservation. I called to cancel and expedia system goofedup and they said there is no reservation to cancel. I saw the charges on my credit card bill so i called expedia they said they will call Excalibur, this was 70 hrs prior to my 2 night visit. Excalibur charged me for 2 night stay stating credit card has been charged. I did nto even stay one night which hotel charges 2 nights when guest doe snto show one night???????????? Excalibut i DO NOT TRUST AND WOULD AVOID......& AVOID. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: cmo_matsuk
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is pretty good and we got a nice room with view. My only concern was about safety - nobody was checking the keys, even at night, to verify if people that were going upstairs were guests. But next time I'd try to get a hotel that offers at least free wi-fi, since you are paying the resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there....awful.awful.awful...beyond awful”
Reviews.Author: Emma573
Reviews.Content: I seriously would consider rebooking elsewhere if you are unlucky enough to have booked a stay here. We stayed over the new year period and whilst we were told by hotel staff that the hotel was over crowded at this time of year, the 'things' we experienced could happen to anyone. Myself and my husband were both ill throughout our stay here...i had upset stomach, nose bleeds and my husband had 'flu' but was coughing up blood and generally bed ridden...we believe due to cleanliness of rooms, atmosphere in casino itself and general standards. We are currently talking to lawyers about our stay here and i therefore won't say too much other than...if you can book elsewhere...please do so...it is well worth avoiding this place.

Reviews.Title: “New Year in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Harold60750
Reviews.Content: It has been probably 5-6 years since my last stay in this hotel (also for New Year)...it was bad than and hasn't improved since. The only good thing was convenience and access to the Strip. Other than that, avoid the place. We paid almost $300.00 per night, plus the "Resort Fee". For extra $13.00 per night you get newspapers, which you can claim at the shop on the ground floor and access to internet (cable)... no wireless stuff here. This is usually a $40 per night room. One soap for two of us for three nights...luckily my wife speaks spanish so we got some extra soap from the cleaning ladies. This wouldn't bother me so much for $40 per night, but when I spend $300... No coffe-maker, no fridge, no anything. $300? I know, I know,...the demand...the glory of a New Year...etc., etc.

Reviews.Title: “Food voucher scam also too much smoke”
Reviews.Author: Karen S
Reviews.Content: Always wanted to go to Las Vegas booked trip via a agency rooms were okay the resort was acceptable I figured I would read the paper as I enjoyed my coffee in morning couldn't located where to pick-up paper I thought they would be in lobby wrong during my stay. Needs a walk way that is not smoke infested also got a breakfast/lunch voucher that I thought was for both people in room but at check out I found additional charges stating it was for only one I felt riped off has anyone else encountered mangers did not want to assist with error they also indicated their was no corporate number or office to complain to overall not the worse place to stay but I will not go back

Reviews.Title: “Old, tired, & smoky...but cheap!”
Reviews.Author: husker7028
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Excalibur for national meetings each of the past 4 years. Though they claim to be updating the hotel, it seems that each year it gets a bit more tired and dated. This may be due to the spectacular updates at many of the other Vegas Strip hotels but it is what it is. It also seems to be one of the few big Strip hotels that hasn't figured out a way to get a handle on the lingering smoke in the casino area. Unfortunately, you have to walk through this area to get to any of the rooms. While the price is hard to beat (we've stayed for as little as $33/night), I don't think I will be staying here anymore. For a few dollars more you can be next door at Luxor or for maybe $20-$30/night more you can stay at NYNY or MGM. Both of which are considerably better properties in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Great for New Year's Eve”
Reviews.Author: NicoleHT
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights (dec 30-Jan1). We attended the UFC fight at MGM on the 30th and watched fireworks from our room on the 31st. The location of this hotel is GREAT. You have easy access to the strip and can take a tram to Mandalay bay for free! We walked to the Coca Cola store, the ABC store, MGM, etc. and it was a nice, easy walk. The only issue we had was the construction at NYNY. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable and the bathroom was nice and large. The view from our room (27223) was AMAZING. On New years eve we saw TWO fireworks shows from our room. We saw the fireworks from MGM and the Aria. The windows open a few inches and we could hear people on the strip and hear the fireworks. The whole experience was great. My husband played poker downstairs and had a great time, very professional dealers. I would absolutely recommend staying here, especially if you are on a budget. No, it's not as nice as the Wynn or Bellagio, but its half the price and has a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good value....”
Reviews.Author: luvsthesun_45
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in November, i have stayed in Vegas before at Planet Hollywood x 2, at first i did think "oh dear what have i done" but after a few days it grew on me. The rooms are a nice size and cleaned everyday. Lovely pools although too cold to go into at that time of year, the staff were very friendly and helpful. Loved Dirty Dicks restaurant and bar. Theres a nice array of restaurants and snack bars on the 1st floor, reccomend the ice cream, the buffet is very nice too. I would recommend staying here if you dont mind the walk to rest of the strip, but i think that's the same all over Vegas really. Wherever you stay you will want to go and visit other hotels. Had a great time as always and would go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice palace, good memories”
Reviews.Author: LucySonyan
Reviews.Content: This was a nice place to stay on pre- new year stay for couple of nights. The cleanliness of the rooms could be better, the curtains were dirty, but the towels and beds were clear and fresh. I think this was just worth the money we paid for it :)

Reviews.Title: “It's an "OK" place”
Reviews.Author: Photo_traveller_AZ
Reviews.Content: The major reason for me staying there was affordability - $25 (plus $14 of Vegas charge). The price and non-smoking room with clean everything, and nice view to the towers was the major plus. Parking is free but it is a long walk from parking to your room - not that hotel management has anything they can do about it. Location is good but the walk to monorail is not clearly marked. Management could be friendlier - but well, it's like a big factory satisfying people's crave for gambling. I did not detect any Wi-Fi, but 3G reception was really good. Getting breakfast is not easy - unless you want to pay premium for the room service.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur not the best for families”
Reviews.Author: Sugismama
Reviews.Content: I booked the Excalibur because of our two kids, ages 9 and 12. But there really is no kid theme here, the lobby is of course slots and cig smoke plus all the awful Vegas ads and plenty of drunken creeps. There's not much for kids to do other than the pool (nice), although they do teach kids how to gamble in the Fun Dungeon - gotta love the wine bottle ring toss for kids! The room is basic, picture a La Quinta or Days Inn, minus the nice amenities like fridge, microwave, coffee maker, breakfast - the Excalibur provides none of these because they want you to buy all your food at the overpriced restaurants. We tried the breakfast buffet; you get plenty of choices but all are bland and dull, classic American diner stuff without much flavor. Room was clean and quiet, but everything was run down, a plugged up sink, non-functional safe, stained bedding, hole in the bathroom ceiling. No bugs though. The worst part of our stay IMO was the absolute lack of information. There was no guest info in the room, other than a few ads, but nothing about transportation, restaurants outside MGM, and no friendly faces to ask for tips. A smaller more friendly hotel would probably help by providing suggestions from people who actually live in Vegas and aren't trying to sell you something. For a quick overnight, the Excalibur will do, but for more than one night, stay somewhere else, especially if you've got kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the the money.. enjoyed it.”
Reviews.Author: misterburns
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay here, first time. Got bumped up to a better room by the really nice desk guy. Huge shower, bathroom, great beds. Easy to make your way around the hotel. The "resort fee" is crap, but still cheap overall. Great location. Not very smoky. Would def stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: Malialyssa
Reviews.Content: We came here after New's Years and it was the perfect time: no crowds and nice weather. Checking into the hotel was quick and thru Expedia's winter special, we even got a voucher for free breakfast/lunch buffet to use there or at any of the other "sister" hotels...totally worth it if you are travelling with kids (which we had two: ages 6 & 3). We were given a room in Tower 1. When we arrived, we found that it was the old furniture and not a rennovated room like in Tower 2 or 3. I recommend that you request these rooms instead of Tower 1. First of all, there was ONE trash can to be found. There were no other trash cans in the bathroom. Also, everytime you sit on the toilet, the seat moves off to the side and the seat cover bangs down on your back...flimsy to say the least! Another annoying thing about our experience at this hotel was how slow the housekeeping took to clean our room. We had to call for service, left our room to eat lunch, and it was still not done! Highly inconvenient when you have little one's who want to take a nap. Our housekeeper finally did come late afternoon. Lastly, one of the reasons we decided to return here besides the location, was that it was kid-friendly and that there were carnival games. When we took the kids there Wednesday night, we noticed that they raised the prices of the games. Also, there were not enough attendants for the games so even if you wanted to play, you couldn't. Maybe because the holiday rush was done? We ended up going back to circus circus for some affordable fun. Overall, I'm not sure if we would stay again...perhaps if we requested to stay at Tower 1 or 2. If you want to stay at a cheap location with the kids that's on the strip, then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Old but still nice”
Reviews.Author: europeantravler_2011
Reviews.Content: stayed here for new years weekend...the staff was extremely helpful and the rooms were decent for the price...one of the cheapest hotels on the strip and the hotel is starting to age but they have recently updated rooms with a few new details like bigger bathrooms and plasma tv...one downside is the main floor casino is very smoky from all the years of smoke...but perfect place for a budget and when ur not spending a lot of time in the room

Reviews.Title: “Do an upgrade if you stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Megga-Traveler
Reviews.Content: I reserved a standard room at the Excalibur but when I arrived they were out so they upgraded me to a much better room, Tower II. I also reserved a room for my mother-in-law and she got upgraded also. The only complaint (and my mother-in law) have is they allow people to bring in ice chests. Kinda lowers the want to stay here again. I am by no means wealthy but felt very uncomfortable. I realize that you get a great rate but then that's the kind of people you attract also. I would only stay here again if I was in a pinch but will probably stay elsewhere, pay the money to feel comfortable in my surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Economical choice on strip - excellent value for price”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaKuku
Reviews.Content: Booked the tower room online through the Excalibur website - room was better appointed than the pictures on their website which was a pleasant surprise. Rooms are clean. Shower only which is hard with little kids. Shower fixture and doors need to be replaced as they are quite old.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Sabyby
Reviews.Content: This hotel had good value for the money. I paid $58 per night in March of 2011 for a renovated room. Be sure to pay for a renovated room since the other ones seems really outdated. The cleanliness was ok, could have been better. but I'm a fussy person and I wouldn't hesitate to return to this hotel. On the down side, the staff is not friendly at all and there are people trying to give you free show tickets if you go and visit other hotels, they are constantly harassing you. As for the location, it is a bit a the end of the strip, but definitely better than staying at stratosphere tower. We visited all the major hotels by walking.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for folks”
Reviews.Author: CincyTravelBuff
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Excalibur BECAUSE of the low price--we could get 2 rooms for 5 instead of cramming everyone into 1 room. Pros--1) Price. The price is one of the lowest on the strip. 2) Location. Good location with easy access to NY,NY, Luxor, Mandalay Bay and MGM. A walk to get to mid strip--but doable.. 3) Cheap Food. Low priced and fast food options. 4)Kids. if you have kids/teens, the Fun Dungeon and DQ are a hit. Be aware that this is Vegas. Your kids are going to see things that you may not want them to see, either at your hotel or on the strip. 5) Staff. The staff was extremely responsive and friendly when we had a plumbing emergency. 6) Music at the Lynyrd Skynyrd. Check out the house band--they rock. Also, they have the cheapest drink options on the strip with no cover and NO smoke. Cons-- 1) Rooms. Once one of the largest hotels on the strip, the Ex is falling behind in rennovations. Stay in Tower II to get the upgraded rooms. 2) Check-in. We checked in immediately. However, we did see very long lines the next day for check-in. Depends on when you arrive. Things that are the same in hotels of this price in LV-- 1) Timeshare. You are going to be be approached in just about every moderately priced hotel in any resort in America by timeshare agents. There is no law that says you have to talk to them. Just walk by. 2) Smoke Cigarette smoking it is more noticable in a smaller casino like EX. If you don't want to be bothered by smoke, take the tram to Mandalay Bay--the casisno is so big you won't notice the smoke. 3) Long walks. If you stay at either end of the strip, it is a long walk to the middle (Casers, Bellagio). You can either walk and cut through the other casinos--which is the point--or take the very cheap bus $7 for 24 hours. Just make sure you exit the bus at the end of the strip or you will have a long wait to get back--the buses don't loop around. Remember--you get what you pay for. Don't expect a $35 night hotel to be anything more than is it and you will be fine!

Reviews.Title: “Unethical and poor management”
Reviews.Author: ThanhVu
Reviews.Content: Got confirmation even though hotel has no room left. So Unethical! They sent us over across street for MGM which I did not even like in the first place (overrated hotel for the look but no quality of service). Our original reservation was for 3 nights and Excalibur's manager promised to take care of it at MGM, but only to find out we got kicked out after second night (again unethical). I'd made it very clear that I do not want to move back and forth with luggage and check-in/out hassle. I called up Excalibur and being transfer from place to places, put on hold for a long time. Management were so rude, at one point a manager intentionally put me on hold and hung up (ways unethical). We come here every New Year and major holidays for past 20 yrs and things'd gotten worse every year.

Reviews.Title: “too long in a casino”
Reviews.Author: orangetabby58
Reviews.Content: The casino was very reasonably priced and everybody was very friendly. It took a long time to get hot water for the shower in the morning, but the room was clean and the beds were comfortable. Being non smokers it was hard walking through the casino. Because we were visiting family and friends this was the most affordable way to go and it is very kid friendly.There was a nice fitness center that was open early and not too busy. We stayed in tower 1 but if we go back would change to tower 2 as it is much closer to the pools and fitness area. Free parking with easy access to the surrounding freeways was an added bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Among the Lowest grade hotels on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: xs2xa
Reviews.Content: The hotel used to be better, but on my last trip, I had a really bad experience. First, the lack of parking - we managed to find a spot almost a mile away, and had to drag all our bags across the parking lot, as they were not allowing us to drop our bags off at the main gate (they had some equipment blocking the entry). Then the really long lines at check-in; this was at 11 am. The checkout lines were long, and there were only 3 counters open off the 14 in total. Due to this, guests wishing to checkout had caused a huge line. So they told everyone that there will be a separate line for checkin, and it will start at 11.30am. So all the guests started to form another line at the registration lobby, and this caused even more confusion. The checkin counters opened finally at 12.15pm (we had waited for an hour already) and finally our turn came at 12.45pm However, here we got an even bigger surprise - they had our reservation, and all details were correct. They even had our room - all good - but even after that, the staff member helping us was so slow that it took her 45 mins to check us into 2 rooms. She was not trying to be friendly or helpful or courteous by giving us more time - she was just slow. She had to ask for my details 6 times, and everytime there was some issue. By the end of it, i was frustrated, and I can only imagine the condition of the people waiting in line for checkin. Next, the room we got was ok - far from the elevator but that's fine by me. However, the towels & sheets were stained and the bathroom floors were dirty. We called and asked them to be replaced, and they said that the staff is preoccupied with the rush of guests and will replace it by the next round of house cleaning (and that never happened, as we were there only for a night). Finally, we went to the casino, it was normal - nothing great. We couldn't find a good low-minimum table and so we decided to hit the slots. The only good thing was a blackjack slot table that seemed to be paying out a bit, and i made my profit and stopped in time :) Overall, I would not go back to this hotel. I guess its time to checkout some other newer hotels that have come up in Vegas now

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Rooms, Robbed by hotel housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: Rob B
Reviews.Content: We checked in on time and we were directed to our room. It was smaller than a room at motel 6. After making a trip to the front desk and letting them know that if thats all they could offer me, I would move to another hotel and they could refund the remaining 4 days. Some how they found a larger room. The whole 5 days we were there the room was never vaccumed or wiped down. They only changed out the towels and made the beds. On our 3rd day we left in the morning to sightsee. We returned to find my wifes purse had been gone through and 40 dollars was missing. She only had 80 dollars when we left. We callled the Hotel security and they filed a report. No forcible entyry! The only people with access is hotel staff. If you cant trust them, who can you trust ! I will never stay at this hotel again and I reccomend to you not to stay here! Look elsewhere!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable bed, long walk to Parking lot”
Reviews.Author: Isabelle B
Reviews.Content: The sitting chairs and table in our room were really aged had a loose armraiil. We got a room on the 27th floor overlooking the strip across from Tropicana and upgraded to a room with a spa tub. Got a great price thru SW for a roundtrip and room. Room had cobwebs hanging from lamp. This was in Tower 1, asked for Tower 11, but was told that there were no rooms available there. We had to walk across the casino each time to get to our car in the parking lot. Parking is tough after 4:00 p.m.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money but thats it”
Reviews.Author: Crusaders
Reviews.Content: Everything was fine compared to the price I paid. Room was clean & tidy so no complaints. Have paid more for worse around the world. Las Vegas does need to ban smoking in the public area's I will not return to Las Vegas until they join the 21st century.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best but great for middle of the road!!”
Reviews.Author: deb8364
Reviews.Content: This is not the best hotel on the strip but as far as being comfortable is it pretty close. And as far as waking you have to walk almost anywhere you go in Vegas so that doesn't count. Generally located to everything but again a little walking never hurt anyone. I would return to this hotel. I have been to Vegas four times now and always stayed at this hotel so that should say something. Upgrade your room if you have a chance the beds were very comfortable and a nice view of the strip. Stayed on the 27th floor which was very cool. The only thing is the elevators need redone looks kind of gross as soon as the doors open up.

Reviews.Title: “The only good thing about this hotel is the location.”
Reviews.Author: atlncegy
Reviews.Content: Great location. I booked the room via SWAirlines. I was supposed to get two buffet meals included. The fine small print that the buffet was not included if my stay touched one if the dates of my stay. The TV didn't work upon check in. After calling in a repair five hours later (again) a repairman finally came. The room. Food still on the floor in plain sight from the previous guests. The bathroom towels are below that of the localotel 6. Yes, it's all about location. But this hotel (standard rooms) are on pare with the local motel 6 with working TVs. This is my first day of three.

Reviews.Title: “Dont everWon't ever!”
Reviews.Author: Sexyteddy007
Reviews.Content: People don't ever stay at this hotel,even if they offer u a free stay.i ordered a coffee it took 1 hr to reach room

Reviews.Title: “Crappy rooms, low price.”
Reviews.Author: 2FarAwayLands0
Reviews.Content: The room felt dirty when we walked in, after a little looking around we found out it was. It wasn't vacuumed well, there was crumbs around all the furniture and the bathroom was the same. The location was good but not super close to what i consider the main part of the strip (Ceasars palace) but walkable. When I stayed the room was on sale for $26 a night, not worth any more than that.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated, Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: kredenza
Reviews.Content: Nothing was horrible about the Excalibur, but nothing was great either. Pros: fairly good location- able to easily get to attractions on the south side of the strip, decent food court, clean room. Cons: too many fees, even though we got a fairly good deal on room price- it's still not worth the money, you have to walk forever through the casino to get anywhere, too many people everywhere, and it's just so smoky and loud.

Reviews.Title: “YUCK, SEEDY, GROSS, RUN!!!!”
Reviews.Author: khardst
Reviews.Content: ONLY stayed at this hotel because another family member booked our rooms. The exterior is very deceiving. This hotel is old, seedy and disgusting. The rooms are ancient and the casino is too. This is the only casino ever where I have waited 2 hours on a cocktail at 2am!! Believe me, it is a reason their rooms are so cheap. Once you check in, you'll be breaking your neck to check out.

Reviews.Title: “Another BURGLARY VICTIM!”
Reviews.Author: il0venatur3
Reviews.Content: The room is clean in tower 2 but we never thought that we'll have a bad christmas experience here. I should have read the review on burglary before booking this hotel. We lost 3 thousand worth of electronics in a matter of 6 hours from checking in. We booked at around 7pm, left our items in the room, then headed to a show. When we came back at 1am, we noticed the door was open and also the light in the bathroom. When we checked our belongings, we discovered that all our electronics are gone. I will NEVER come back to this hotel again. The security said that they will investigate the issue, but until now, we did not get any call yet from their security department on the status of the investigation. We're planning to call them again and see what will happen next. For you who want to have a peace of mind while having your vacation, look for a better place to stay. DON'T stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay but...”
Reviews.Author: TruBluTravel
Reviews.Content: I took a group to the Excalibur. Rooms were great, Price was great but group department needs a litte work. Our group was coming in at 1:30 and I called at 12:30 to make sure the rooms and keys were ready and they told me everything was great. My group went ahead and pulled in on time and the rooms were not ready. The group desk was not told that we were coming early. My customers stood and waited while they (one by one) got us in clean rooms! The group desk also put everyone in rooms with 2 beds even though I requested most our group in to be in King rooms! Once in our room everything went great and the rooms were comfortable and clean!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Christmas at Excalibur!!”
Reviews.Author: Susan P
Reviews.Content: We just spent 2 horrible days after choosing to spend "Christmas at Excalibur". I had read bad reviews but still opted for a spa room over a regular room at Paris or the Venetian thinking "how bad can it be?" HUGE MISTAKE!!! First of all they went ahead and charged the wrong credit card, and that has yet to be cleared up. Next the spa in the room worked perfectly and long as no one sat in it, the minute you did it stopped working! (and there wasn't even a microwave in the room...weird and cheap...). Tho toilet also was running and not working properly, nothing like being your own plumber on vacation. Next, was the lousy service. We played slots for 3 hours in the casino and never found a waitress to order a drink. I asked a bartender to send one over he said "she was just covering a break" and he never sent the next one. The casino was just dim, old, smokey and gross. The $38/2 special Christmas buffet was a huge disappointment!!! The food was lousy, and that's generous, and we're not that fussy. Judy, our waitress, who was outstanding and cute as a bug, and one of the managers there were the only bright spots of our stay. Honestly, they couldn't pay me to give them another chance. I would stay clear of Excalibur.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Vegas experience, by far”
Reviews.Author: Steve H
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Vegas for the Las Vegas Maaco Bowl and selected the Excalibur. Our room was comfortable and clean, but that was the extent of the positive aspects. The negative began as soon as we arrived. The first person we met upon arriving at the Excalibur, was a pushy timeshare sales person. After that, everywhere we turned, we encountered another one. For anyone who has experienced the airport in Puerta Vallarta, Mexico, you will know what it was like. I'm not sure when Las Vegas hotels turned into timeshare central, but it definitely detracted from the overall experience. To top it off, the restaurants inside the Excalibur were sub-par. We ate at the burger restaurant (ABX, I think it's called?) for breakfast and were underwhelmed. The breakfast sandwich I ordered was encased in two inches of tasteless, biscuit-like bread. But even that was good when compared to the buffet. The Excalibur buffet was the worst casino buffet we have ever experienced -- and we've eaten in a lot of them from Vegas, to Reno to Jackpot. The food was tasteless, of low quality, and did not appear fresh. I have stayed at half a dozen hotels in Las Vegas on various trips, and this experience with the Excalibur was the worst, by far.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas trip to Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: carol1989
Reviews.Content: we got a good deal on the Excalibur Hotel, It was clean and the breakfast buffet was excellent. However, we could have paid the same price at the Luxor which is a little more upscale and the casino was not smokey like the Excalibur was. All and all we had a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but a little dated.”
Reviews.Author: M C
Reviews.Content: The Excalibur is a great hotel if you're looking for a basic room for Vegas. The room had the basics, and the beds were very comfortable. The mattresses tended to roll you to one side but they were very comfortable. Our room had no view-our windows looked out to a bed of rocks in a courtyard. The towels need to be updated. They were clean but weren't really white anymore. It's on the southern end of the strip-but still pretty convenient. The buffet is good. They have lessons for many of the casino table games. The employees were really friendly. There is some good entertainment in the hotel. The spa services were lacking though. Overall, a good hotel for a cheaper Vegas vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Can you spare a cup?”
Reviews.Author: CableJoe
Reviews.Content: Clean and affordably priced ... but ... the rooms do not have a coffee maker! I know they want to make a buck ($3 actually) selling there own coffee, but c'mon! Even Motel 6 has a coffee maker in the rooms. We did enjoy our stay. The location between NY NY, MGM, and the Luxor is great and the local bus up & down the strip, the Deuce, stops right out front. Tip: If you want to get to the north end of the strip or to Fremont Street take the express.

Reviews.Title: “Delighted ???”
Reviews.Author: stevekippax
Reviews.Content: Location is very good for the airport and the strip.Rooms are basic with NO tea or coffee facilities in the room.And had to go down to the lift entreances to purchase an expensive hot tea or coffee,The room we stayed in was smelly and cleaners did try to clear the smell down the drains but with no luck so for our second week we asked to change rooms which they did with out any problems.watch out for the taxi drivers,we got charged $28 when it should have been around $12 if they drive straight there and remember to get the taxi drivers to use the back road behind the MGM which is clear when going up to the top of the strip.They avoid this road so they can get more dollars of you in taxi fares.The buffet was not very good for the money they charge except for deserts,we eat there once for diner but never again.go to hotters over the road behind the tropicana it is 100% better.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price”
Reviews.Author: roxy1913
Reviews.Content: Although we were in tower 1 which is the non renovated tower, it was really clean and nice. You could tell the fixtures were older in the bathroom. But my son and i got great service and it was always clean. We were lucky to have quiet neighbors as well. We paid $117.00 per person for each person INCLUDING round trip airfare from LAX. We just had to pay the resort fee which was $42.00 dollars for the 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “3rd Visit, still a great place”
Reviews.Author: k9david
Reviews.Content: The Excalibur probably gets more varied reviews than any other Hotel.
