I am biased as this is my 3rd visit to Vegas and my 3rd time at the Excalibur and i think it offers great value for money, great rooms and a nearly perfect location. Of course the casino is smoky but this is Vegas, it is no worse or better than anywhere else on the Strip, blame the Nevada laws. It is noisy in the Casino, but of course it is. In the car Park it is sometimes difficult to find a space but as with all Vegas hotels they are free and open to everyone, All of the hotels suffer the same problem. The tower 2 widescreen rooms are large and in my experience adequately maintained and clean and relatively quiet, but remember this is a town where partying is the norm, there will be noise from the corridor but it is not intrusive. Overall i would not stay anywhere else in Vegas, it offers excellent value for money, good facilities and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Ben P
Reviews.Content: Really out dated, musty smelling room, poorly cleaned Bathroom, Really uncomfortable bed, and the fact that the piercing, annoying fire alarm went off for almost 1/2 hr at 3 am. Oh, and almost forgot about the $16 buffet for Lunch at the Round Table, were the only thing edible (at best) were the Taco's and desserts.

Reviews.Title: “dirty, dirty, dirty ( and not at all in the naughty way!! )”
Reviews.Author: missvcat
Reviews.Content: Its simple really, if you don't mind blood on your towels, dirty marks on your bed sheets, bugs in your room and general disgust...book here!! If you don't....see my other vegas hotel review. We booked through expedia and to their credit, upon my return and complaint to expedia, they refunded me £30 shy of the full amount I had paid. This really helped as we booked another hotel while we were in vegas. I would like to say the hotel redeemed itself a tiny bit...but they didn't! To this very date they are yet to reply to my email complaint...must be too busy cleaning their hotel...not!!

Reviews.Title: “Another nice experience!”
Reviews.Author: BonJoviGirls
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I stayed at Excalibur this year and it did not disappoint! The location is great. Once again, I asked for any available free room upgrades and was pleased to receive not only a room upgrade from the standard room to a widescreen TV/updated room in Tower II (Room 20227), but a nice view room of the strip as well on the 20th floor. I will say that having a view room gets you more noise as well. One click of the ON switch to the fan mostly covers the noise at night.

Reviews.Title: “More that enough for a single grandmother coming to visit her grandchildren”
Reviews.Author: bachelorbroad
Reviews.Content: I loved the room and appointments, and found the hotel set up nicely. But cannot stand the smoking which was everywhere in the casino and common areas. And the limited pool opening, with no access to a place to change, or warm up nearby,which was unpleasant, as it was bitterly cold and windy,( believe it or not.) We chose this hotel because it was listed as child friendly, and it is not ideal for younger children, but nothing in Vegas is...The Excalibur is in an amazing part of the strip, and the price was excellent, since I was leaving on a " red eye", and was able to get a late check out and rest in my room on my final day ...nice since I don't gamble, and the rest of my family left on an earlier flight. The buffet as excellent, and I wished we had tried the all day buffet option, because eating in restaurants was pretty pricey for three adults and two children, and children eat free at the buffets.

Reviews.Title: “Nice outside terrible inside”
Reviews.Author: hurstdj
Reviews.Content: Looks can be deceiving. On our yearly trip to Las Vegas I booked the Excalibur. At night with the lights on, beautiful. Inside another story. Of course you get what you pay for. Better furniture could be bought at a yard sale. Hallways to the rooms are dim lit to simulate a castle, I think it was to hide the dirt. House keeping should be repromanded for this place. Inside a wall light, a piece of glass was missing, inside was a beer cap and 1/4" of dust. I am not making this up, Check outside room 16119 and see. In the lobby you can't walk for being harassed by timeshare sales people. From my obsevations it appears the place is being used by prostitutes. If you don't mind any of this and looking for a cheap place to stay in a good location, this place is for you. If you have higher morals and a family pay a litle more and get a decent place to stay. One more item. during our stay a helicopter was hovering outside our room, filming I think, didn't mind until this continuted unitl 1-2 am, and again the next night.

Reviews.Title: “Rude”
Reviews.Author: Von J
Reviews.Content: They was rude at the check out desk and they said it was free wireless internet and it was not I will never go back there again......

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: sagregson
Reviews.Content: Myself and a freind booked this through Virgin holidays as a package so the cost of the hotel was low and our expectations were not high due to the cost. Location wise, Excalibur is excellent. It is at the lower end of the strip which is close to New York New York, MGM etc and therefore if you don't like the facilities in Ecalibur there are plenty of walkable places nearby. Rooms are basic, with 2 double beds, a good size tv with plenty of basic channels.There is plenty of clothes storage with a unit of draws under the TV and a rail for hanging clothes with an iron and board in the room. There is also a table in the room to sit at. The bathroom was again basic but was of a good size with a shower which had excellent pressure, toilet and sink built in a unit and full wall mirror. Again more than enough for 2 people with toiletries included. The room was clean and tidy and the maids did a good job of keeping the room tidy although a note to make was there were used glasses left outside rooms and this were not removed by the maids for the full week we were there so I can only assume they were either instructed not to remove them as they were not part of the room or just left them which I can not understand as the overall cleaning standard was excellent. The hotel had good overall facilities that most of the Vegas hotels include, sports book, poker room, casino, food court, bar and specific shows/attractions. A note that improved the hotel for us in particular was on check in the resort fee was already inlcuded in the package and we received 7 buffet vouchers to the value of $20 per meal for any MGM resort (exc Bellagio and MGM apartments) which was a nice suprise but probably only included as this was booked as a package holiday. Overall a good alround hotel to the budget traveller as it is in a good location and has all the necessary facilities and being connected with the walk way to New York New York and Luxor, anything it doesn't offer can be easily walked to.

Reviews.Title: “Find it to be hit or miss”
Reviews.Author: Blueshirt35
Reviews.Content: This was the third time I've stayed here. Given what we paid for the room (on a weekend, no less), I feel like we shouldn't complain. I'm not a Four Seasons type and have never been able to justify paying a lot of money for a room I'm only going to sleep and shower in. With that being said, all I ask for is a clean room. I don't feel like we got this. Upon arrival, there was a long black hair on the bathroom floor. Additionally, the furniture showed glass marks from drinks that were previously there. Though these weren't things that didn't ruined the trip, it made me question how clean the rest of the room was. We were in a widescreen tower room on the 23rd floor. At check in, we were asked if we needed a room near the elevator which was helpful as my mom has mobility issues. Even though the line was long, it did move quickly. Our room wasn't serviced until late in the day on Saturday but not a big deal. However, I will point out that this person did wipe away the drink marks. Overall, the room served it's purpose. Though I would consider staying here again, I would probably stay elsewhere if the room rates were somewhat comparable. I also found the casino area to be very smokey.

Reviews.Title: “Got what we paid for.”
Reviews.Author: MustangGirlAB
Reviews.Content: Excalibur - we got a reasonable place to stay at a reasonable rate. Beefs - resort fees, will definitely be researching that in the future. Smoke - other than O'Sheas, by far the smokiest casino we were in. Bouquets - rooms were decent. Show some wear and age. Beds were ok. I would recommend you buy some shampoo of your own as the hotel stuff is not good. Fun dungeon, we were traveling with kids, so the arcade was a huge hit. Tournament of Kings was good, food was ok, though some condiments would have helped tremendously. Thought the experience was a bit overpriced, but we found everything that way this trip. Some notes - the shuttle to the airport cost $7 per person. Another thing we should have researched as our cab from the airport was $14.10 for 5 of us. Cheaper to cab if there are more than two.

Reviews.Title: “jimbo”
Reviews.Author: james o
Reviews.Content: I stayed in tower 2 for a week recently while competing in the marathon and found the hotel very comfortable and friendly.It was convenient for the start and finish and handy access for luxor and new york new york.Casino was bit dated but the only downside was the timeshare sales.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Vegas hotel”
Reviews.Author: djdelboy
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay @ the Excalibur, first being 2003, after seeing some of`the nagitive reviews on here I did wonder if we had made a mistake in booking here again! However I'm pleased to report that the hotel is as good if not better then our last visit, we up graded to one of their new rooms with the big TV also asked for a strip view, and I can say both were well worth it, did pay $33 day more but they did not charge us the resort fee which is something like $12 a day! Had no problem with the room what so ever although a fridge & kettle would been nice touch esp as we Brits like our cup of rosy lee, good job we had our own travel kettle. Staff in the casino were all very nice and helpful and yes it can be a bit smoky at times but no more then any of the other casinos we went in, the food was great to, went in the buffet a few times. Getting around is not problem ether now they have a good bus service on the DUECE up and down the strip ($7 for a 24hr pass) did go to one show in the Excalibur, Tournamount of kings, yanks seem to enjoy it, but we found it very cheesey! The pool area has been up graded since our last stay with more pools (even though only was open this time of year) and some whirlpools which we liked, they also have a new Spa which we used once, it's $10 mine was really good but my partner got kicked out of the lady section after about 5mins as they had work man coming out, but she did get her money back. To sum up we had another great 7 nights at the Excalibur and would be more happy next time we hit Vegas to book again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay, good price.”
Reviews.Author: WillTravel2TryFood
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Excalibur while in Vegas which we picked from our Southwest Vacation Package. Overall, it was descent. We stayed in Tower 1 which has not been updated yet. Bed was compfy but decor was outdated. I was not happy about the $42 resort fee when all we did was sleep there! I was happy about the location, the in-house dining and shopping options. I was not happy about all of the sales pitches that I was getting at every entrance...leave me alone already!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sumit1411
Reviews.Content: We stayed at NY NY hotel, Excalibur and Monte Carlo. I found rooms of Excalibur big, neat and clean as compared to other 2 hotels. Also we got the Excalibur at much lower price than other 2.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Price”
Reviews.Author: ChitownTif
Reviews.Content: My family stayed last year December 22-26 the rates were great but the hotel was smokey our room was not an upgraded one but that was ok, we also were reluctant about the time share but for 50 dollars and one hour of our time we recieved 6 vouchers for meals for the both of us at the Mandalay Bay free Shark Reef tickets and free Titanic Exhibit at the Luxor. I enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the $$”
Reviews.Author: cando1
Reviews.Content: Hotel is average. Rooms are very plain, but clean. Get a room with a view if possible, my room had a great view of a brick wall on the back of the hotel. Had an issue with interent connection that took a day and a few people to fix. Casino was the best part - nice people

Reviews.Title: “Don't Expect Much”
Reviews.Author: syBoston
Reviews.Content: Like many others I was here for Rock and Roll Half Marathon Checked in late and they did not have adjoining rooms, no surprise Got "free" upgrade to big TV room, probably because thats all they had left. Room was not clean and smoke detector was going off when we walked in! Overall lack of cleanliness of Hotel is shameful for MGM ownership. Lack of maintenance is obvious from elevator to old shabby carpets Staff all seemed friendly from check in to cleaning lady and Casino staff Only chose this hotel because it was near start finish of R&R run Would NEVER chose it again

Reviews.Title: “Big let down”
Reviews.Author: d m
Reviews.Content: Came to Vegas and the Excalibur for the Rock and Roll Marathon because it was close. First impression on the hotel was old and run down, not to mention very smokey. Had an outside room that had a great view of the strip area. Little bit noisey, but the view was great. On the last night the hotel started piping pretty loud music that even on the 17th floor was a bit loud. Had to catch an early flight and mentioned to the front desk and basically was told--your problem not mine! Next time to Vegas if it happens, would spring for nicer hotels like Mandalay Bay or Luxor. I bet you could spend another 20 bucks and stay at a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good price but very smokey”
Reviews.Author: 4Ninjas
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights and decided not to return to this hotel at the end of our trip. Smoke odor in all rooms and hallways. The cheap vanilla scent could not mask it. Even though we never unpacked our clothes, they still smelled of smoke when we unpacked at the next stop of our tour. Would not return. Price is right for young travelers, if you can tolerate the smoke.

Reviews.Title: “If Smoke is what you want then this is the place”
Reviews.Author: Seacruise
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 10 days because of the price. I have stayed here before and found it acceptable for the price. The Casino this time was filled with smoke almost all the time, there just didn't appear to be any air circulation. I feel like I was smoking at times and I don't smoke. Clothes smelled badly of smoke. The good news was the Tower I rooms are undergoing a refurbishment and my room on the 6th floor had the new Flat Screen TV and a couch. The beds also have the round roll on the bed, not sure why this is there but it is. I am not sure if they replaced the beds in Tower 1 but I like them much better than Tower II. There really isn't the need to spend for the upgrade now when Tower I is being upgraded. The bathroom hasn't been touched. Arriving in the room brought it's own challenges. The Safe was locked, the the plug in the bathroom sink didn't work, the TV didn't work, There was gum on the painting in the room. The toilet would start to run in the middle of the night. I look at this way the maid should have picked up on many of these things when she turned the room over. I managed to get all but the sink sorted out the first day. The day I left they were to open two new restaurants which replaced the Sherwood Forest cafe. They look interesting. There was other reno work starting at the bar next to the lobby as well. They also replaced many slot machines while I was there with newer different ones. I would say they are trying on the upkeep but it is slow. If you are looking for price then this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: thimdat
Reviews.Content: I checked in on Saturday around noon, they were very accommodating to let me check-in before 3pm while they were very busy doing check-outs. Emily at the front desk was very friendly. When I got to the room, the room was still dirty (there were empty bottles, cans, bags of chips, etc), I know mistakes happen especially on a busy day, so I used the phone in the room to call guest service to ask for a key to new room. The guest service agent on the phone, Wayne, did not show any interest in the situation and just told me to go down to the front desk. No apology for the situation. When I asked if somebody might be able to bring me a key so that I don't have to go down with all my luggage, he said it'll take 40minutes. It was not the fact that I had to go down or the fact that it takes 40 minutes for a new key, it was lack of sympathy or apology that made me feel not cared. so I went down to the front desk, and asked for a manager. The person who helped me was very understanding and apologized for the inconvenience, and offered me an upgrade. When I spoke to a manager, Denise (I believe that's her name was), I felt disappointed again. Instead of listening to my complaint that the guest service agent lack the customer service or listening skill, she told me that he is a very nice person but has a cancer and that is the reason why he sounded like that over the phone to me. I am very sorry for his situation,,.,he has a cancer, and maybe I talked to him on his worst day or the day he had his treatment, and yet, i just did not feel that she cared about customer service, rather, she was trying to justify the situation. All I wanted was a room that I can check-in that is clean, and I am very thankful that they accommodate me for an early check-in at noon, but I still wish that they had somebody who can listen rather than talk over me to justify their actions. other than that, my stay was great, the bed was comfortable, everything was clean, they have a food court that is very convenient to grab a quick bite. all other staff was very friendly, even the housekeepers on the floors were very friendly and welcoming. I am not big fan of their casino, as it is quite smokey and smells funny. The casino itself is nice and has bars and place to eat and place for kids to play, so for people who is ok with smoke/smell, this is a great option as it is a cheap accommodation compared to some hotels on the strip =)

Reviews.Title: “Right on the strip! Cheap as chips!”
Reviews.Author: Jenski-Bob
Reviews.Content: You cant fault the location of this hotel. At the end of the strip and it has a walk through to the Luxor hotel! The room yet basic, has everything you need! Plus for how long you are actually in the room as long as its clean who cares? I used the fitness room which was great but no aircon? Wow it got hot! Got a free breakfast buffet that normally costs $15 but we only paid£20 each night for the room! Bargain! Would definitly stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Smoky and unpleasant”
Reviews.Author: S K
Reviews.Content: The general environment was poor, despite an upgrade to the apparently nicer rooms in Tower II. Parking situation was horrendous. The common areas were smoky and smelly due to possible poor air circulation, and there was frequent bothersome pitches by sales people. The tagged on resort fee ($14 per room per day - yet no in room wifi) was a surprise - not mentioned when we booked the hotel. The only plus was the location.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad...but not very good either.”
Reviews.Author: Shane D
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Excalibur in March of 2011 primarily because it was cheaper than most hotels on the Strip. While there is no overwhelming reason why I don't recommend staying here, there is also no overwhelming reason why I would ever suggest that one check this place out, let alone stay in it. Although it is technically on the Strip, it is about as far south as it can get, with the exception of the Luxor and Mandalay Bay properties. If you only plan on hanging around the south end of the Strip, than this place might be for you, otherwise I would suggest that you pack a comfortable pair of walking shoes. One of the few positives about this hotel is the exterior design of the hotel. I have always found the Excalibur to be one of the coolest looking hotels on the Strip, but that is just my opinion, and others may not feel the same. The rooms themselves were not bad, but nothing special either. They come with standard amenities: 2 Queen or 1 King bed, flat-screen TV, small table with chairs, and a decent bathroom. The casino floor looks like any other run-of-the-mill casino, and has no features that really separate it from any others. It has a average selection of table games, and most of them run at $10+ limits throughout the day. They do have a pretty good selection of fast-dining options compared to others, however they are spread out through the hotel as opposed to being in a centralized food court. This can cause a minor inconvenience if one is not familiar with the hotel layout. The Excalibur also contains what I can confidently say is the WORST BUFFET in Las Vegas. Making the decision to dine at the Round Table Buffet was the only regret I had during my trip. The food quality and selection is comparable to food you can find in a high-school cafeteria. In fact, I actually would have preferred my high-school cafeteria food to the crap they served here, but I suppose I should save that for another review. In closing, if you are looking for a cheap place to stay for a few days, the Excalibur isn't the worst you can do. However, it is far from the best. For about the same price, I would suggest staying at somewhere like the Imperial Palace or Bally's due to a significantly better location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: mrsfreeze80
Reviews.Content: We had a widescreen room on Tower 2. Nice and clean. Our beds were made up every day and we even had fresh towels daily. In my previous stays at other places..Excalibur topped them all. Loved the tropical/ coconut smell they had to help cover the smoke in the casino. Most of the hotels we walked through had the smoke smell and tried to cover it up in some way or another. I will stay at the Excalibur again. :)

Reviews.Title: “Resort fee does not include $5.95 extra for boarding pass printing”
Reviews.Author: RyNess
Reviews.Content: Far treck to 28202 but nice widescreen room clean updated bathroom. Good housekeeping. Put off by extra fees for boarding pass printing,no in room wifi, was snapped at by checkout clerk after politely asking for clarification of room charges. Overall good location easy access to Luxor Mandalay Bay, strip.

Reviews.Title: “VICTIM OF BURGLARY AT THIS HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: BellaChacha
Reviews.Content: please beware! this is not a safe, secure hotel. A robber walked in on us while we were sleeping and stole all our valuables! Hotel management has no sense of customer service. They could care less. STAY AWAY PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE.

Reviews.Title: “BG”
Reviews.Author: Lbair10
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Excalibur in October in Tower II. If it is considered better than Tower I, then I am glad they didn't put me in Tower I because I would have opted out and stayed else where. The room was average at best, it was very dated. The cleaning staff never appeared, not even to make the beds or bring clean towels. We resorted to raiding the cleaning carts whenever we saw one in the hallway for clean towels. I noticed the sales people, but for some reason they never approached us with their sales pitches, must have been the don't come near me stare I gave them everytime I walked by. I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent rooms- annoying timeshare sales pitch”
Reviews.Author: cgrollins60
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Deluxe Room (has sitting area and king bed). That's well worth the few dollars more on room rate. Room was decent, but everywhere you walk in the hotel/casino someone is trying to get you to go listen to a pitch for a timeshare in exchange for "FREE" show tickets. --Don't do it!!-- Outdoor hot tub is nice and fitness center is nice. Also in Vegas, if you can stay at a hotel that is one of the station locations for the monorail, that is worth doing. The Excalibur is about a 20-minute walk from the station in the MGM Grand.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Economical”
Reviews.Author: SMM55122
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Excalibur. Most of our trip top Vegas found us way down the strip so this hotel was a treat. The casino was fun and lively and very comfortable. We liked the inexpensive food options on the upper level. It is super convenient to many different hotels and casinos which makes it a treat. We found our room to be clean and easy to find. The price was also what drew us to the hotel. Planning a return visit in March 2012 and can't wait.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place if you have kids...but sales pitch was annoying”
Reviews.Author: WNY_Voyager
Reviews.Content: Room was large, pool was nice, buffet was good but this place is more centered on families with kids. My biggest problem with the Excalibur was that near each room tower were salesmen trying to push timeshares or something. They bother you going to your room and coming out all day long. There is also a few other stationed near check-in and on the bridge going between the casinos. The real reason to stay here is to save money, cost less than most places but be careful the resort fee is almost as much as the room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Watch your purse!!! Dont expect "Security" in this Casino.”
Reviews.Author: Kathy L
Reviews.Content: My purse was stolen while I was sitting at a slot machine in the casino at Excalibur. Let me share my experience - upon realizing my purse was gone I raced to the "Security" Desk saying repetively that my purse had been stolen - the man on the security desk paid me no particular attention, passed me a form to fill out describing the incident (which I completed with large bold letters "PURSE STOLEN") - handed it back to him, asked if there was anything else he could suggest and was ignored. The contents of my purse included cash, all my Identification, credit cards, all the normal stuff. Fast Forward to a couple of days later when I went to file a police report - I went back to Excalibur to get a copy of the report so I could take it with me - no one could find it - after 2 hours it was determined that the incident had been mishandled from the outset - there was no record of my purse being stolen - it was labelled as lost - no investigation had been started/no one was the wiser that there may be a situation where criminals are targetting the casino/ no one had reviewed the security tapes - basically I was completely ignored when I reported my purse stolen. I actually saw the original form I filled out - it had a large X across the whole form - I then completed the correct form and was interviewed by someone else in security and was directed to call "Risk Management" after a few days (from home) -I did - they apologized very nicely - advised regretfully there was nothing they could do and furthermore there were NO CAMERA'S where the incident took place - so "sorry". Oh - they did offer me a "free" buffet - I dont really think that is a reasonable offer in light of the serious problems that they obviously have in their security / risk managment area - maybe its a throw away mentality - throw me some food that would likely get thrown away like they threw away my report? - Thanks but dont think I will ever step into the Excalibur hotel again - and if anything seriously happens - dont even think that "Security" means anything - Security at this Casino is nothing more than "LOST & FOUND" -

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: DimitarStefanov
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, on the strip, the rooms are comfortable with king or queen beds. A very huge casino and cheap prices for all-inclusive (didn't try it). Basically: good hotel for good money. A lot better location than the others in that price range - Circus Circus or The Stratosphere. I can certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay”
Reviews.Author: Karen5056
Reviews.Content: The Excalibur is just fine. Rooms clean (we upgraded to Tower II- don't know if it was necessary). Big bathroom. Why can't these places have a fridge?!!

Reviews.Title: “Reviewed before and meant to give a four but clicked two. So this time I give it four because it is now a two.”
Reviews.Author: Antony T
Reviews.Content: Poor standard of rooms, even with two upgrades, pretty rubbish. Bed comfy though and nice big tv but cleanliness is iffy. First room we had certain white stains on furniture and rubbish all over floor and holes in furniture. Remember this was an upgrade. Pool area is ok and at least open in november. Not as nice as say tropicana but it is open this time of year. Nice big casino with good service and a good food court upstairs. Easy access to many other hotels and close parking, especially if you park by tower 2. This is the supposed nicer tower. But was disappointed by room and front desk. It was almost as if I was being seen as whiny for complaining about stains. Sorry I expect better. Have no real idea what the resort fee covers. You get a discount on health spa and free calls but just include it in the price. No free drinks or priority parking or free newspapers. Lose the resort fees MGM group. Likely won't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel overall... =)”
Reviews.Author: bdavil0228
Reviews.Content: I love excalibur, I've stayed there for about 4 diff times. The rates are great for the location, & the rooms are clean & very nice. Always stay in tower II, I think it's the most updated. For the rates your paying don't have high expectations its just a room. I've read horrible reviews about it but it's excalibur not Bellagio, u knw?lol Anywyas, I strongly recomend it bc its a great value overall. I just dnt recommend their buffet but I'm being biased bc I hate buffets...lol

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, okay rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mustafa81
Reviews.Content: Been to Vegas the week before Thanksgiving to avoid the rush. Stayed at Excalibur for 2 nights. Located on S Las Vegas Boulevard minutes from the strip biggies- NYNY, Paris, Venetian, MGM Grand, Bellagio, Caesar's Palace and Mirage. Affordable rates and above average room. But who cares as long as we are able to have a good day's rest and toilet and bath are clean. And you get all these and more. Theres a Starbucks and 24 hour Mc D for caffeine shots.

Reviews.Title: “A bit tired & dated, not offensive though”
Reviews.Author: Christofofofof
Reviews.Content: Our tour operator moved us to the Excalibur about 2 weeks before our trip. Had never heard of the place before but had been assured it was an upgrade. The hotel is a bog standard 3 star in my eyes. Rooms were big but dated (Tower I, think Tower II has had an uplift). Internet was wired only, not an issue for us but can see that would be for many with mobiles, tablets etc. Shower was nice & warm & house keeping did the minimum - made beds, new towels. I'd agree with previous reviews, it was hard to walk through the casino without being approached by at least one member of staff trying to sell shows or a stay next time around. Check in took about 15 mins, check out about 5 so can't fault that, free parking was also good. Overall there is nothing wrong with the hotel, it's just acting it's age now (lift lobby was chaotic / crowded), rooms a bit sad, no real feel of Vegas wow factor.

Reviews.Title: “Good value location for exploring the strip”
Reviews.Author: gafferroche
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised that I enjoyed my recent stay at Excalibur as much as I did, given that it is one of the older casinos the strip. I stayed in a deluxe room on the sixth floor, which to be honest was basic comared to rooms at Aria or The Cosmopolitan, but my room was large, clean, quiet, had a comfortable king bed, and a nice view of the pool area. Excalibur has a food court with Starbucks, McDonalds, Krispy Kreme etc, and the usual buffet, steakhouse, lounge and some other dining options. The buiffet is great value and you can even buy a combined 24 hour buffet pass for both Excalibur & Luxor for about $32. The table limits were $5 all day for roulette, craps, blackjack, poker (3 card, crazy 4, let it ride) on a number of tables and i found the slots a lot looser than many of the other newer mid strip casinos. Excalibur has a good location at a great value price for exploring all the strip has to offer, and I would recommend it for a family/couples/solo vacation based on my recent stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: colleenleopard
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the Excalibur the weekend of 11/11/11. It was very busy & we arrived early in the morning & was able to check-in right away which was a good thing. The desk clerk gave us a room with a view of the strip (Tower I) which was nice & view was even nicer at night when all the lights from the different hotels were lit up. Also, the buffet had excellent food & a variety of choices to choose from. The shopping stores within the hotel was nice & reasonable & you could even walk to the Luxor from within the Excalibur which was another good amenity.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur - ok to stay when you get a good deal”
Reviews.Author: dRobke
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed 2 nights in the excalibur resort. I was looking for a good deal, and found one here, but I've stayed in other vegas hotel and found them to be in better shape. We book a deal to include complimentary buffet, and stayed at teh basic room The check in process took a while and we needed to ask ourselves to an offer we received during booking. In the end the compliemntary buffet worked out well, but we had to ask several times how it would work, and had to ask in teh end to remove it from the bill, which they did promptly The room was old, but it was clearly described when booking to have the older room types, so no worries there. Upon inspection of the beds we found an empty candy box between the bed and wall, not a very good start. Bathroom was clean The casino charges a resort fee (14$ per person) for which you get free cable internet (but no wifi!), a free newspaper (that you have to collect yourself) and access to the pools. I found this to be a bit of an extra cost, as none of teh extra services feel payworthy. The casino area itself is much like the others on the strip, no remarks there Overall, I was happy to find a cheap place to stay, but I would look to other hotels to get a better vegas experience

Reviews.Title: “fun fun fun”
Reviews.Author: noodles09
Reviews.Content: my family visited in 2008 ,great position in vegas ,fabulous rooms we were happy and will return

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, good service”
Reviews.Author: traveler_pr_usa
Reviews.Content: Check in - We arrived very early in the morning and baggages were kept at the baggage rooms. We came back just two hours later at 11:00 am and they had a room already at that time (That was good). We order an extra bed and they took it to the room very fast. Same thing when we asked for them to pick it up. Good service. Rooms are kept clean and everything was in order. What I did not like is that there is not wifi in rooms, just the lan cable. Very nice location between NY, NY and Luxor. I liked it a lot for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Extras”
Reviews.Author: Jiankos
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, centrally located but was disappointed with the hidden charges. We were made to pay an additional $98 in check in but all the staff would say was that it was a hotel charge. These charges were not evident at the time of booking and OPODO has refused to accept any responsibility. I would seriously advise anyone to consider booking elsewhere after my experience with OPODO. I have even had to raise the matter with ATOL.

Reviews.Title: “Not for us.”
Reviews.Author: tes0520
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for just a cheap room to sleep in while in Vegas than this is the hotel for you. My husband and I have decided that this is our first and last stay at the Excalibur. We checked into our hotel. We were upgraded because they had no king/non smoking rooms left We ended up with a flat screen room. Our room over looked the roof of the castle...we could only laugh. The upgrade, I was very thankful for because I would have hated to see the other room! The room was a Motel 6 at best. The heat and air did not work in our room when we got there. We had to call the service desk 3 times. The 3rd time asking if we could change rooms because we were just sitting and waiting for the repair man to show up. It was midnight, we had not eaten because our flight was delayed and we wanted to explore the hotel. My other big complaint is the resort fees. I don't mind paying resort fees where credit is due except I didn't receive any of the services such as a newspaper, internet ect. (FYI- you will need to go fetch your own newspaper) We have stayed at other hotels on the strip with resort fees but received excellent service so did not mind paying the extra. Salesman will harass you. They will try to sell you shows on your current and future stays at every entrance of the casino. So if you are coming in off the strip headed to your room you will be asked no less 2 times to buy a show. If you dare leave your room again....they will still be there waiting for you! We purchased our shows from the box office but were still harassed multiple times per day. We were polite the first 2 days because they are just doing their job but on the third day I was really tired of the harassment. If you are looking for a hotel with a touch of class....this hotel is not for you! Keep looking! You will be happy you did.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the Bad Reports!”
Reviews.Author: Patrik K
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a week in the Excalibur. I must admit after reading some reports on this site I was a little unsure of what to expect, but I have to say there was nothing to worry about. We arrived, and straight away got a free room upgrade, room was clean, 42" plasma tv, cleaners were in every day. I've read reports the casino was smokey? Well isnt this obvious considering smoking is allowed in the casino, but the casino is well aired so no problem. The casino itself is very good, with betting limits for all types of people who want to bet low to high. Food court is very convenient, 24hr mcdonalds. Only had breakfast in the buffet, but it was good value for money ($18) and a good selection. Also great links to Luxor, Mandalay Bay, New York New York. Seriously for what you pay, you cant go worng in this hotel, and i will certaintly be going back here. By the way, other reports talk about time-share people around, i seen 2 in 5 days and wasnt approached once. No big deal. Great base, good fun, good beer and great casino.

Reviews.Title: “Very smoky in the casino!”
Reviews.Author: letmecount123
Reviews.Content: A group of 9 of us stayed here in 4 rooms for four nights in November. We were there to celebrate a bachelorette but we had parents with us as well. Our rooms were on the 14th floor Of tower 2, and thankfully far from the elevators as they could be very noisy. The smoke smell wasn't as bad on the 14th floor but there were definitely some rooms smoking marijuana which stunk up the halls most days. The housekeeping was fairly basic. They made the beds and replaced towels when we needed them, but the ice bucket was always left full of water wherever it had been left the night before. Overall the rooms were comfortable, however the fan was difficult to control and you could never get a consistent temperature. Water pressure in the shower was also horrible. Annoying to only have wired internet as wi-fi would have been more convenient for those with iPods, etc. We didn't spend a lot of time in the casino, but it looked like most of the other casinos we went through. The whole place smelled like years of second hand smoke which we had been expecting anyway, but still gross. Tried the all you can eat buffet supper on our last night... Salads were good and plentiful. Everything was pretty classic buffet. Only really gross thing was the super dried out chicken that may as well have been jerky. Probably okay for $20 but we didn't try any other buffets either. Not exactly sure what the value was for our stay here as it was part if a westjet vacations package, so can't comment on whether it was worth it or not. Would not likely stay again mostly due to the smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfortable rooms.”
Reviews.Author: ljhughes8
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean rooms and comfortable beds. My only complaints were that it had a noisey bathroom door.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Rude, and Reservations mean nothing”
Reviews.Author: Mandy V
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Excalibur from Nov 12- 18 and were very disappointed. The hotel was dirty, smokey and the staff were rude to say the least. After standing in line for 20 minutes to check in We were notified that they did not have our reserved room available - we were told our reservation was merely a request and did not guarentee us a room. The rooms are outdated and rough looking, we were given a room that was dirty and the blinds were broken, also housekeeping rarely emptied the trash. The constant harrasment by the "concierge" people only added to my distaste for the hotel. The bartenders were rude and cocktail waitresses rarely came around, the added hidden fees were another unpleaseant surprise. The only positive about this hotel is the location. I understand this is not a high end hotel but no one should ever be treated this poorly when traveling - save yourself the headache and stay @ another hotel. We wish we had.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpenside, convenient and well located”
Reviews.Author: CBassG
Reviews.Content: I'm not in love with las vegas, so this hotel worked well for me. It was resonably well located. The on site attractions didn't ticle my fancy, but you are in the southest bottom of the strip, and distances are not that bad (at least for me who likes to walk). The room was big, clean, and comfortable.and although it wasn't reserved with a view, it had a partial view of the strip. We were lucky to get early in the week (in which Las Vegas look evicted), so we could get a top floor room. There is no wi fi access, but the cable high speed internet worked as a charm.

Reviews.Title: “Good value!”
Reviews.Author: DMIH
Reviews.Content: Clean & friendly! Did find the casinos smokey, and some guests even smoked on the elevator. This hotel did not have the amenities of others, but the location was good to access other hotels. Overall, for the inexpensive price, and this place is good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Stay #5”
Reviews.Author: Utica_NY
Reviews.Content: I recently completed my fifth stay at the Excalibur while on business in Vegas and again found it to be a very good value. From front desk service to room cleanliness, all the way to prompt check-out, I was happy with my stay. When I rec'd my satisfaction survey upon returning home, I did note two things for their management to consider: a. On all previous visits, there was live entertainment in the lounge each night (even during the week) - this time there wasn't. b. The gym has always been very well maintained - on this visit, three pieces of equipment were not working. If these things matter to you, just ask during the time you're making the reservation. Otherwise, I'm very likely to stay at the Excalibur again on my next visit in early 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Ticogringo34
Reviews.Content: What you pay in one hotel per night you will probably be able to pay 3 nights here. Location is good right on the strip, get the Tower 2 renovated rooms they are decent and remember the $12 a day resort fee. If you are on a budget and will not spend to much time in your room this hotel is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur in two words: What happened?”
Reviews.Author: DrNik
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Excalibur 8 years ago, and my trip there in October 2011 made me wonder what happened to this place! I expected the tacky castle theme, but I was so disappointed to see the wizard in the tower replaced by a hideous banner for Dick's Last Resort. The moat around the castle was nasty; fountain sprays non-functional. If they aren't going to keep up the castle decor, then I suggest it is time to change. The elevators to the tower rooms were supposed to be guarded by security and they were there half the time, although the guards only checked keys about 10% of the time. The room had a great view once the stained curtains and blinds were moved out of sight - how did stains get there??? I didn't want to know. Tears in the bedding looked from years of wear. The bathroom vent leaked water from the room above, but the maintenance people fixed that. Room service ended in the middle of the afternoon. I was so hopeful after my last stay, but extremely disappointed with this visit. The room was cheap, and I got what I paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and location.”
Reviews.Author: bullseye60
Reviews.Content: Our second time to stay here in last five years. Still got a good deal £150 for 5 nights. Rooms are very spacious with two queen size beds and plenty of room to walk about. We were on 11th floor so had a great view of the Strip especially at night when pretty lights came on. Casino was awesome too. Endless fruit machines and roulette tables etc. Plus some nice bars too. We saw the pool but didn't use it even though it was quite hot when we were there.Location was good too Excalibur is near the top of the strip so all other Hotels including MGM, Luxor and New York New York are very close. The buffetts here in Vegas are awesome just endless rows of food for a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “well worth the money”
Reviews.Author: geordieboy292622
Reviews.Content: First the negatives.Wife was hoping for a bath,but the shower we had was great.Only stayed 4 nights and decided to use the dinner buffet on the last night.Was not that impressed.Food was ok but $43 for me and the missus?We ate cheaper else where with better food.Good points.Great location,bus stop right outside hotel.Room was large and clean with a great view of the mountains(tower 2)Check in and out quick and easy.Fare by taxi from airport $16.Air conditioning was very good

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive, average, good value”
Reviews.Author: KandRYukon
Reviews.Content: The standard room we booked was very inexpensive, around $200 for the week. We received an upgrade to a larger room with a "widescreen tv" and a not-bad view for free. We slept well and heard very little from others around us. Long walk to get down the strip. Good access to The Luxor, New York New York, Mandalay Bay etc. The casino is dated and really smoky, had a tough time getting a drink without going up to the bars. Downstairs there is a "Fun Dungeon" for kids with games... but if you think taking your kids to Vegas is a good idea...think again. I wouldn't take my son there, at least not until he's 21.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PerfectGin
Reviews.Content: This is our fourth trip to Vegas, and the third time we stay at the Excalibur. It is centrally located, parking is ample, the casino is easy to maneuver around, food court is small but excellent. Rooms are not brand spanking new but are clean and have all the amenities you need. Flat screen tv, free internet, and phone. Bathroom was clean and spacious, always had lots of hot water, and soaps towels and shampoo/conditioner/lotion were plentiful and replenished daily. Maid service was considerate of do not disturb signs. Walking to other casinos and theatres was a breeze due to the location of this hotel on the strip. Best of all, the price was right!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: FineToonin
Reviews.Content: Excalibur Hotel was a good deal. Everything was pretty average from the room to the casino. Its on the newer end of the strip. Very close to NY NY, Luxor, Mandalay Bay and MGM. All of which we frequented. We stayed in Tower One but the pool and gym were in Tower Two which was awkward crossing the casino while still wet. Very accessible to buses and trams. There afre so many places to stay in Vegas, I don't see a reason to repeat.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay won't say here again there are better options”
Reviews.Author: nirt
Reviews.Content: Stayed Nov 5-12, 2011. There are no good restaurants here except fast food - McDonald's, Quizno's, Starbucks, Dairy Queen/Orange Julius smaller menu closed by 8:30 when we went there one night, Baja Fresh (don't let the name fool you), although we didn't try the Steakhouse. We ate at the buffet twice - once for lunch and once for supper - hard to make any healthy choices as everything is sauced or fried or creamed (unless you ate lettuce). Apparently two new restaurants are supposed to be opening soon (even though we thought they were open already before we went from the website) - a Burger place and a BBQ place. Even a small bottle of water ended up costing close to $4 (can you say gouge?). On Freemont Street we were buying water for $1 a bottle for the same size. Our room was okay - the safe was locked and we called to get it opened as it was not useable - they said they would show up to fix it in 1/2 hour and we waited over an hour then gave up and left - of course we missed them but we didn't bother to call again. The dresser door was broken. The hairdryer was broken in the bathroom. There is no room in the shower to put your soap and shampoo bottles except a tiny shelf where nothing will fit. There was so much yelling and screaming in our hallway at night we were constantly woken up all week long. There were cigarette butts all over the hallway outside our door when we got up one day and we are in a non-smoking floor. OH YA our view was looking at another brick wall - apparently all the even numbered rooms in Tower 2 where we were, all look at this view so maybe try to get an odd numbered room if you are located in this Tower. Not sure about the other tower views and room numbers. The lady at the counter where you sign up for the "points" card was rude and couldn't have cared less. However on our last day we had an Asian guy with a different name (dang wish I could remember his name) and he was awesome! I'd love to write a note to the hotel management and let them know that this guy is a keeper for sure! And something we just found out on this trip too was if you call the hotel directly to book your rooms etc. it all counts as money spend on your "points" card and you qualify for a better rate - so if you want to earn a few comps you might want to check this option out. And check back often with the "comps" desk as you might get a free buffet or $20 starbucks credit to use (although even that was a hassle as the girl at the Starbucks didn't know how to process it and we held up the whole line up and people were getting a bit upset behind us even though it wasn't our issue that was causing the hold up). We were two gals in our early 40s, no kids with us, but I was surprised at the number of kids in this hotel with all the "over 18" things going on. (Although the hotel does promote itself as the family friendly place!?) The male dancers were trying to take pics with any gals walking by for $25 a picture and trying to lure you in with cheap plastic mardi gras beads, and this was right close to the "dirty" dancing stipper pole girls which were both located close to the escalator to go down to the "fun" dungeon where all the kids are supposed to go and play games and have fun - really? With the big Sponge Bob statue looking on? and the Bar/Restaurant called Dicks - use your imagination . . . might be a fun place if thats what you are there for (hey I agree its fun sometimes) but all mixed in with the "family friendly" image? and all located right close together? Is that so dad can stare at boobies and mommy can take a picture getting her butt slapped by a greased up stripper while the kids get their picture taken with sponge bob? It just seemed like there is a lot of confusion over what image the Excalibur is trying to be and it didn't fit together very well. Plus add on the "resort" fees of approx. $12-$15 per night for things I don't use on holidays why should I have to pay that? Put your total price online without adding the fine print and really tell people what you are charging instead of trying to make the price look good and not being upfront about it. I don't need wi-fi or a partial fitness pass (you'll pay even more if you want to use the good stuff). And if I do want it then make it an option to pay the extra resort fee. The only good thing about the resort fee was you could make free domestic calls (which included calling to Canada) but I don't phone home every day when I'm on a holiday so . . . with cell phones and plans I didn't really need to pay $15 a day x 7 days = $105 extra to make one phone call home. This was my 5th year in a row visiting Las Vegas and my first time trying the Excalibur, but it will definitely be my last time at this hotel. I've tried 3 times on the strip, and twice off the strip, and you get better value staying off the strip or downtown for sure. The only thing we really did like was the location was good - and easy to get around and use the transit system and only a short cab ride to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the Price”
Reviews.Author: MalekV
Reviews.Content: We picked a random weekend to visit Vegas in November not realizing there was fight that weekend and hotel rooms had skyrocketed. Excalibur wasn't one of our first 5 choices but they offered us a deal we couldn't refuse. M-Life membership has its priviledges apparently. Since our deal was so good, we opted for the renovated Tower II and it's pillow-top mattresses and flat screen tv. That's what we got - pilow-top mattresses and a flat screen tv. The floors were still old, the walls were still banged up and the shower still had a 15 year old shower head. Not really worth the extra $25/night. Customer service was good. The long lines at check-in moved quickly enough and the counter person was very personable. Our upgraded tv wasn't working when we checked in but a call to the front desk had someone there to fix it within 20 minutes. Extremely acceptable considering it was check-in time. Housekeeping left us alone for the most part but missed making up one bed on one day. It was a bit odd to come back to the room and see one bed made up and the other not. The Casino is typical of middle range hotels on the strip (although the craps tables seemed overly springy compared to others on the strip). Finding waitresses on the floor was a bit of a challenge but not impossible. None of the dealers were rude to us so that's a plus too. I was a bit disappointed that the "Draft and a Dog" price had gone up to six dollars and the quality seemed to go down at the same time. My main complaint is location. Excalibur is on the south end of the strip and to get to most of our starndard haunts took a bit of walking. The Tram from Mandalay Bay to Excalibur is nice but it should continue on to at least the Bellagio. The walk from Excalibur to Harrah's was annoying to say the least. I would recommend for the price for a "standard" hotel room, but beware the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great base to explore Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Alkaz
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a few nights in May 2010. Stayed in tower 2, room very clean and quite modern with 50" plasma television. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for Price”
Reviews.Author: Necole
Reviews.Content: My friend and I usually stay at another hotel at the other end of the strip but decided we wanted to be a little closer to the action without paying a whole lot more. We parked for free in the parking garage and entered through the back of the casino/hotel. Once inside the main casino the signs for the registration desk seemed to disappear. After asking someone we made our way through the entire casino to the other side and finally made it to registration. Once there we were informed of the joke of a $14 per day resort fee. The fee covers internet in the room (which we could never get a signal to make a connection to) and to the pool which although heated closed at 5pm. Fitness room and jacuzzi were additional charges. The front desk advised us we were in Tower One and gave us vague directions on how to get there. We went off in the direction she pointed and looked for signs. Our room was a little dated but clean. The beds were very comfortable. We never heard any noise from other guests either in their rooms or the hallway. The brochure in the room listed that they had a "Sherwood Cafe" which we were going to go to for breakfast but once downstairs found it no longer existed so we ended up eatting somewhere else on the strip. It was very nice to walk out of the hotel, cross over the bridge into New York, New York then walk to the rest of the strip. We missed some of the amenties of our usual hotel (shops, restuarants, Fat Tuesdays) but we found new spots by being closer to the action of the strip. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur - Don't do it”
Reviews.Author: Joseph N
Reviews.Content: If you see high reviews for the Excalibur then you know its a sham. This Hotel is nasty compare to their sister hotels. This is a very dirty Hotel. I arrived at 12:30 am and was given a room that had not been made up. There were no bed sheets in two if the rooms they sent me to and the third one had vomit on the floor, the forth one was a down graded room but that smelt like smoke but had to suffice as I was so tired. I was comp a 40 dollar breakfast but when I went to use it I was denied the comp and had to pay cash. The buffet was 15 dollars and tasted awful. They must use the most generic products. A hint never eat at a casinos because you will get low quality food for a high price. For Dinner they offer crab and prime rib but they don't tell you that the crab is cold and the prime rib slices fit in the palm if your hand. While in line at the buffet I met a lady that had an intrusion in her room during the middle of the night. The hotel gave some one else a key to their room and said she needed to leave as was in the wrong room. At least she manage to get comp a 100 bucks for her inconvenience. I found four other people that day with similar stories. It made me so up set how they did not seem to care that I demanded a refund. I had a better say with NewYork-NewYork even though they are own by the same property it was a better stay. Although its just my opinion when it comes to Excalibur "Do Not Go There" !!! You been warned and you have no one to blame but your self.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: lucyloo811
Reviews.Content: After staying the 5* Planet Hollywood hotel the year before and after reading reviews on this site in the 11 months I had to wait to go myself, I was not looking forward to my stay. But after staying there myself I can’t see why people have a bad world to say about this hotel. We got to the hotel about 4pm on a Thursday and there was no queue to check in, I was shocked as it was Halloween and there was a Huge UFC fight in town, I had 2 rooms booked for 7 nights I has standard rooms booked and I asked for a free upgrade and I got BOTH rooms upgraded to king-size widescreen rooms, we were in tower 2 on the 11th floor and we has a pool view room, the room was large and clean! Very modern, the bed was huge couldn’t fault the room at all, our safe was faulty so I called down to the front desk and they sent someone to fix it, they were very quick and it was all sorted in 5 seconds. The free in room internet is also a great bonus to. I happed to be having parcel’s delivered to the hotel and they were very helpful to find them for me. The casino was great, all modern slot machines and the staff were very friendly. The hotel location is great, connected to New York New York, the Luxor, and Mandalay bay, there is a free tram between the Luxor, and Mandalay bay and there is a bus stop right over the road from the hotel which will take you to down the strip both ways and to the shopping outlets. The Hotel’s buffet is great and cheap, the shops are also cool. My must see things to do while in Vegas • Lions at the MGM Grand • Have dinner in Hooters • Pinks hotdogs • The earl of sandwich in the PH shops • Max Brenner in the Forum Shops at Caesars - Max Brenner, Chocolate by the Bald Man, the first restaurant entirely devoted to chocolate, provides a “chocolate mood:” a person being surrounded by huge bricks, candles, pralines, colorful toy tins and crates filled with cocoa beans. Each person’s chocolate experience is exclusive to the individual as it brings out different emotions in each and every person. http://www.maxbrenner.com/menus.html • Shopping outlets • Steel panther - http://www.houseofblues.com/tickets/eventdetail.php?eventid=69433 To sum up my stay in this hotel I would give it 10/10 the casino has been totally modernized, and considering people can smoke indoors it’s not really that Smokey. I would defiantly stay again and I would recommend others saying at this hotel is great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Super deal; super value. Book it!”
Reviews.Author: SydneyMermaid
Reviews.Content: We got a FANTASTIC deal on the day we arrived. We searched www.hrs.de (a german website for last minute deals) and Excalibur came up at USD$180 for 5 nights. Clean fresh smelling rooms, no fridge or coffeemaker but location was perfect and having access to the pool in 37 degree weather was perfect (although the pool side music was very loud & jarring). I'd stay there again definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Good price for what I got”
Reviews.Author: bkirbyson
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal on a room in this hotel through an Internet booking site, and for what we paid, we really can't complain. I went down with a buddy and we met up with 2 friends who were staying at another hotel. The room was clean, but fairly small. Unfortunately it has neither a fridge nor a coffeemaker - both of which would have come in very handy during our stay. The Excalibur is a typical Las Vegas strip hotel; really a destination in itself with restaurants, bars, shopping, and of course all the gambling you could ever want. There are several other hotels and some souvenir shops very close by. The Excalibur is located at the south end of the strip, and it's a fairly long & inconvenient walk back up the strip to the hotels where the best shows and buffets. I know it doesn't look very far on a map, but you have to take overpasses over most of the streets, and then walk through the hotels along the way. It takes longer than you think to get around. I recommend you get a 24 hour bus pass ($7). It's good for the Deuce bus that goes up and down the strip (very slowly) and also the express bus. You can also use your bus pass to take the WAX bus to the airport, saving you a bit of money. Taxis are expensive ($10 to get anywhere), and the monorail is also expensive ($5 per ride) and the stations are not convenient to most hotels. I was a little miffed about the $12.50/night "resort fee" the hotel charges on top of all the regular taxes and fees, but it sounds like all the strip hotels charge it now. With your resort fee, you get free internet, a free newspaper, and something else...I can't remember.

Reviews.Title: “Not so "families with toddlers" friendly”
Reviews.Author: YayLinda
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Excalibur hotel for an 11-11-11 wedding. We decided that the Excalibur would be a good fit for us because of the price & it seemed family friendly. We stayed in tower 2 on the 15th floor in a Widescreen room with a view of the strip. The room was fine, had a big flat screen on the wall, 2 queen beds, a nice view, it was clean & the bathroom was big. The walls are thin & you can hear anyone walking & talking passed your room. Check in & Check out was easy. The main problem I had was the smoke smell as soon as you walk in the hotel....all the way to the hallway of the room. The room itself was a no-smoking room but the smell in the casino & halls was horrible. We've stayed at other hotels on the strip & it was never that bad. I would not bring my kids back to the Excalibur for that reason. Another reason, there was always a Go-Go dancer at a bar by the lobby. It was an open concept bar...so anyone walking by the lobby & or by the slot machines, or even trying to get to your room....you can clearly see the Go-Go dancer dancing on the bar. It wouldmt have bothered me at all if we had gone without the kids....but her butt cheeks were out for the world to see. The only thing covered up were her boobs & crotch....it was a little weird seeing that out in the open in a "family" hotel. There was a huge plastic Sponge Bob you could take pictures with....& 50 feet away there was a half nekid Dancer on top of the bar. Just weird! Especially if you have older kids. Like I said....its Vegas, you expect nekid chicks, but at the Excalibur....feet away from Sponge Bob? So WRONG! Anyhow....Would I stay here again? No, the smoke smell was bad, & especially not with kids. Its an ok place If they have a good deal for the rooms & if you dont mind the smoke smell & aren't bringing kids, Go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice castle hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scorpioyves
Reviews.Content: One of the hotel situated nearby the Strip, walking distance to other famous hotels in Las Vegas. Probably not the best of Las Vegas but considering the prices paid, was not a bad one.Rooms were OK, the view was not extraordinary but we did not expect to have a nice view, here also the room price will probably also play a role.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed,nothing changed in 10 yrs.run down.”
Reviews.Author: claire p
Reviews.Content: Been coming to Vegas at least 2 times a yr. for 40 yrs. from Mass.by plane or R.V. Put on "13th" flr..Unlucky from start.Asked for fridge for medicine,told fee was $ 25.00 a day,no wave for Medicine,only Hotel in group not to wave fee,1st time in Vegas not having a fridge,had to buy insulated bag for ice to use as fridge,refilling everyday.Told we were near ice machine.Said fine. when i got there,it was not working right,made slush.Up the elevator,get ice,back down.Everyday same routine,never fixed. Safe was locked,called security,A/C unit old & noisey,walls showed where pictures hung & removed.Holes in heavy drapes,toilet slow,shower floor slippery,no grab bar or anti slip items on floor.Queen size bedding on king size.$14.00 Resort fee

Reviews.Title: “Well, it was bad... Really bad.”
Reviews.Author: TNboi
Reviews.Content: Ok. I understand that when most people go to Vegas, an extravagant hotel room is not a must. However, I don't expect to pay good money for a room and immediately have to ask for housekeeping to come and clean the room. Upon entering the room, I could tell by the interior corridors that the place could use a good cleaning and remodeling. Yet, I stay optimistic. When we entered the room, it was obviously just a room that was extremely outdated and a little "rough" looking. The furniture was scratched up and extremely dusty. The AC unit had not been cleaned out in years. The carpet was dingy and extremely dusty in the edges all around the room. The first thing I do when I get in a hotel room, regardless of the condition of the room, is take off the bed comforter. I then check for bugs. It's a habit that I formed when I got into the hotel industry, which I have been for the past 13 years. I inspect the sheets on the bed to find large stains. It was terrible. I then go to the bathroom and inspect. The towels and washcloths were old, housekeeping had left a shampoo bottle and conditioner bottle on top of the shower, which is probably still there because I didn't touch it. I call the front desk and ask to speak with a manager. She then transferred me to one and I told her what I had found when I inspected the room. She then sent me to housekeeping where they were coming to clean room and change sheets. Its Vegas, we were in a hurry to get down the strip where the action happens. I would have asked to change rooms, etc. But, we were okay with them cleaning the room just so we wouldn't have to go through the extra procedures of changing rooms and etc. We came back to the room hours later and indeed the housekeeping cleaned the room, obviously in a hurry. Anyway, my point is that I would NOT ever in a million years stay back at Excalibur. To me, this hotel needs to remodel and change housekeeping procedures or hire housekeeping staff who care about the property, before it would be up to anyones standards. Shame on you Excalibur for the nasty hotel room! A letter has been sent to the President of Operations of this establishment. Waiting on response!

Reviews.Title: “Good value if you just want to use hotel to sleep.”
Reviews.Author: harsha3852
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Vegas and stayed at Excalibur. it is an ok hotel. nothing excited. if you stay at this hotel, stay at tower II and upgrade your room. we had a strip view and it was beautiful to look at MGM and Newyork Newyork. nice and clean room and comfortable bed and pillow. only thing was about checking, it took us long time for us to check in our room. don't know if it was due to hotels.com or the hotel computer.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Andreassn
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed 4 nights at the Excalibur. I am very pleased. Nice casino, great breakfast buffet. Convenient location on the strip, walkway inside to Luxor and Mandalay Bay. Had a Widescreen room, free upgrade from the hotel. The room was large, nice bathroom with a big walk-in shower. Very friendly staff, especially Kathy at the front desk and Sherry at the buffet restaurant. The only minus I found at this hotel is that the internet provided in the room is wired, I live in 2011 but not the Excalibur's IT department. Luckily free wifi is available in the food court.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Price and Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: DMBabe43
Reviews.Content: We go to Vegas twice a year for business and usually stay at Mandalay Bay, Wynn or Excalibur. I know 1 of these things is not like the others, right? But, Excalibur is always a great value. And usually has availability if we make a last minute decision to go. Nice rooms, clean, comfortable beds (in the Widescreen rooms). My only complaint would be the obnoxious sales people that are like vultures near the Tower 2 ramp as well as near the check-in desk and on the bridge going to NY-NY. Overall, a great place to lay your head for a reasonable price. I love that you can take the free tram to Mandalay Bay or walk just down Tropicana Blvd. to the MGM Monorail station to get to destinations North on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Leave your worries behind and enjoy”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie M
Reviews.Content: Excalibur is a buget friendly hotel. You get great value for the money. The rooms are nice and clean and the staff was friendly and nice. The hotel offers great slots, shops and places to eat. So pack your bags and escape to Excalibur and have fun. The location is Great too right on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “SERIOUSLY, PEOPLE- WHY ALL THE BAD REVIEWS?????????”
Reviews.Author: Kathron
Reviews.Content: First off, my sincerest apologies to those of you who DID have an awful experience. I'm sure a lot of you were in Tower 1 so I can't comment on that as we were in Tower 2. My husband and I were there 3 weeks ago and absolutely loved it!! The only negative we had was on the night we arrived. My husband put an $80 voucher into the machine I was playing as I only had a buck left and we wanted to cash out & combine the 2 into 1. The voucher got jammed in the machine and after 15 minutes of my husband looking around the whole casino for floor help (also had the machine light on), found no one. Then I tried for 15 minutes including standing in the one cashier's line with 15 people ahead of me to no avail. Finally rectified after one hour at 1:30 a.m. We also stayed here for 5 days and was only bothered once or twice a day by time-share people. Just smile, say no thank you, and they will leave you alone. They will not harass you as others have said. PROS: If certain things are important to you in a room, ASK FOR THEM when you book. A high floor, quiet room, and non-smoking room was important to us and that's exactly what we got. The receptionist said she'd given us an upgraded room, without us even asking. (Staff in the whole place was always friendly) The room was large, new, spotless and the bathroom had a nice,large countertop for lots of room for your toiletries.. The bed was super comfy and the room had a good plasma TV and quiet air-conditioning, and also a safe. We also only ever saw 1 room service tray left in the hallway, and when we came back a few hours later it was gone. (Definitely none of these trays being left for days in the hallways as some have said) And, no evidence at all of lots of garbage in the slow (HUH???) elevators. As well,, hallways are not narrow and dark. The casino is very nice and it was NOT AT ALL smoky. The buffets at Excalibur and also the Luxor are both quite good; one has some things better, and the other has some things better. You're certainly not going to get crab legs here, but delicious beef and a wide variety of food items. The Tournament of Kings show is highly recommended. Each person gets soup, a whole small chicken with potato & broccoli & bun for dinner and apple struedel for dessert, as well as choice of water or soft drink. Can also buy alcohol. As you sit and eat, the knights and their horses put on quite a show in front of you. They get the crowd involved and it's really good fun. If you want to eat inexpensive at the Excalibur, there is a food court (with a McDonald's as well) on the upper floor. Also must comment on the handiness of having the moving walkway going to the Luxor and Mandalay Bay; was wonderful. Didn't have to go outside if you didn't want to. KID'S ISSUE: There wasn't one at all. Not that we don't like kids, but were afraid we'd be bombarded with them, especially in the casino, as a lot of people have said. I think we saw maybe 6 kids in total the whole 5 days we were there, but of course realize July & August & school holidays would be much different. CONS: Besides what I said abou the casino in my opening, was the lack of security by the security guard that is sitting before you get to the elevator to go to your room. Of the 5 days we were there, he didn't check our hotel room key once, as he's supposed to, so why is he there? For the price we paid, we found the Excalibur to be a fantastic place and would have no hesitation in staying there again. To all the people who hate it there, I'm sorry you must have had bad days and situations. In our opinion, just make sure you ask for what you want in a room and make sure you get Tower 2 and then please don't be frightened off by the bad reviews and people saying it's a dump and dirty, etc. For the price you pay, no it's not the Bellagio OR their prices either. but you will get a nice,modern ,clean room in Tower 2 and find it's an overall wonderful place at a great bargain. ENJOY!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: airwin55
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at the end of october. The excalibur is a good hotel with reasonable comfort at reasonable prices. Good location on the strip, with a lot to see nearby. Good buffet.

Reviews.Title: “leave it all at home”
Reviews.Author: Diane V
Reviews.Content: We love everything about this hotel. It's size- you don't have to walk around forever to be where you want to be(tables, slots, food and room). The staff have been so helpful from check-in, housecleaning, people on the casino floor, the girls who bring you drinks, even checking out was a bonus, had somethings comped I didn't even know about. Oh the tournaments. My husband loves them. He's happy i'm happy. lol Location-every day we walk the strip. We like to walk. We stay 6 nights (my husband was horrified when I booked our first trip here, wanted to know what we were going to do for all those days days) we have been coming here for 4 years now, He doesn't say a word. You have the Luxur next door, you don't even have to go outside if you don't want to. The only time we are in the room is to go to bed. No tv or computers. We see some shows and go out to dinner. When people ask us were we stay and then ask why, we just tell them what I said in this review . Why would we go anywhere else when we have it all right here. We even come home with money. lol.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: Melissa B
Reviews.Content: This is the third time I have stayed at Excalibur while being in Vegas and I love it. I don't know why there are such bad reviews? It's a GREAT hotel especially for the price! This last time I stayed, I was upgraded to a widescreen room for free. There's not much difference between that and a standard room but we had a great view! Hotel is on the main strip and connected to the Luxor so it's very easy access to other hotels and shops.

Reviews.Title: “About what I expected”
Reviews.Author: EdFiero
Reviews.Content: Room rate at the Excalibur is pretty good compared to Luxor or others near by, so don't expect anything special. Room was functional, no major complaints. Though room did not have a refrigerator. Hotel Casino area stinks like smoke. Buffet was over priced. Go to Old Country Buffet. Similar quality for less $$. Also, WIDESCREEN rooms are a joke. Yes, there is a wide screen TV in the room but the signal fed to the TV is not digital, so you are seeing a fuzzy and/or staticy picture.

Reviews.Title: “Not very Impressive”
Reviews.Author: Bigger32
Reviews.Content: Nothing good to say about this place, except I guess it was acceptably clean. A/c sounded like a jet plane taking off, wall paper peeling from walls, cheap plastic shower insert (like something you would find in a mobile home...I don't really know, but, I've heard!!!). Ordered a pizza which had so much cheese on it, we could not eat it; and it cost $50 from room service.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all.....”
Reviews.Author: luvbnarn
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews here, decided to upgrade to a Flat Screen Room. Glad we did, it was much nicer than the standard rooms. Had a great time, visited over Halloween, crazy times!! Visited many casino floors on this trip and the Excalibur by far was the most generous with their free cocktails...don't forget to tip your waitress! A VERY DECENT stay for the money, it's not the Wynn but a great place if you don't have deep pockets!!

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel, but a terrific sportsbook”
Reviews.Author: Teach2travel07
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is older, it still fits the bill for a weekend stay. It's right on the strip & has easy access to three surrounding hotels.
