There are two Starbucks, fast food, & a few restaurants. Ate at Dick's Last Resort which was overpriced, but what isn't in Vegas? Enjoyed football at the sportsbook that had comfy chairs & a terrific bar. Overall, decent value for a short weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Ouch!”
Reviews.Author: MarkSSeattle
Reviews.Content: Just got back from four nights and five days at the Excalibur. It bordered on painful. Two buddies and I were there mainly for the Breeder's Cup horse races. Because of a big auto parts convention room rates in Vegas were sky high, hence our choice of the Excalibur. It was still unusually expensive, but beat other choices. Check in was very slow, and the "Resort Fee" is now $14 a day. They don't tell you what you get for it, but it includes wired internet access in the rooms, ethernet cable provided. Funny marketing message on-screen when you first hook up - "Enjoy this complementary internet access as part of your resort fee." This place is old-school strip, meaning dark, confusing casino. The smoke from the first cigarette ever lit still lingers in the air. I can usually ignore second-hand smoke, but this was truly unbearable. My lungs still ache. Most properties in Vegas (even the older ones downtown) have done a good job improving ventilation and filtration in their casinos. Not so at the Excalibur. Our room was in Tower 1, the less desirable of the two based on other reviews. It lived up to its generally low ratings. While the mattresses on the beds were OK, the roll-away they provided was from times long past. It was painful. Everything about the room other than the flatscreen was very dated. Water pressure was awful. The shower flowed at about a pint a minute and the toilet took several minutes to refill. The sink faucet trickled. The door to the bathroom was missing some of its laminate from years of whatever. Heating/cooling was via an aged through-the-wall unit that rattled and roared with each cycling. No one slept well. Hall decor was a mix of heavily-patterned ancient carpet and wallpaper that didn't match. Who cares, right? But it was so funny looking I had to take a couple of pictures. Like most strip properties, it's a long way out and to anywhere else, and you have to get there through the casino. No, that's not a forest fire you're trying to get through, it's the cigarette smoke. Stay near the floor and cover your mouth with a wet rag and you may make it out alive (OK, that's an exaggeration). We gambled there a lot, mainly because compared to other strip properties they have reasonable limits and decent odds. Cocktail service was a plus. It's a low-roller joint, so $1 tip gets attention. What else is good about it? The connection to Luxor and Mandalay Bay, the budget food court, and possibly the $32 all-day buffet deal. The restaurants are expensive, but you have a wide choice of fast-food places in the second-floor food court, and their prices aren't inflated. The all-day buffet price is a bargain compared to the restaurants. We never tried it, so I can't comment on quality. You can take a free tram or indoor walk to the Luxor and Mandalay Bay. Luxor has redone their casino. It's modern with much better air quality, as is Mandalay Bay. I read all the time that Excalibur is a great place for families. I guess so if you want to introduce the kids to smoking at a young age. Yes, all casinos permit it, but I've stayed in at least 15 different Las Vegas hotel casinos on the strip and downtown, and this one rules when it comes to poor ventilation and a dark, dungeon atmosphere. Rates can be cheap at times, but, at least in Tower 1, it's no bargain. It was the worst room I've ever had in Las Vegas (and I've been 20 to 25 times). I won't stay here again, regardless of the rates. Why two stars? Things could always be worse.

Reviews.Title: “Castle - not! Well, maybe...”
Reviews.Author: Car G
Reviews.Content: This place wasn't my first choice but the only one available for this particular trip. I figured it was part of the Mlife brand, so it should be OK. I booked on Hotels.com and was promptly treated like a second class citizen. My room backed up to the elevator shaft so all night long I got the woosh and rattle sounds of the 7 elevators running up and down the shafts. The solution - ask for a new room - sorry, you are prepaid. Turn on the air conditioner to low to drown out the sound - well, castles are drafty, but low was like being in a wind tunnel. Needless to say I didn't sleep at all while there. The food service was typical vegas, crappy and overpriced and the only Starbucks had a line a mile long - shouldn't that be a hint to the hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: travelseeker67
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in Oct. We were nervous about staying at the Excalibur after reading the reviews about bed bugs but our stay was very nice. We meticulously inspected both our rooms in tower 1 and found no bed bugs. Both rooms were very clean and the beds were comfortable. Buffets are plentiful if you like that style of eating. Watch out for expired coupons books. Convenient location on the strip. Staff was accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Scam”
Reviews.Author: Bev C
Reviews.Content: I booked a hotel reservation for 5 nights at the Excalibur. I cancelled this reservation later on, which was confirmed cancelled at the time. When I returned home from my vacation I found the hotel had charged my credit card for the full 5 days I had originally booked for. When I questioned this they claimed that we stayed there the whole time.When asked for a copy of the check in form so we can prove we didn't sign in, I was ignored. What sort of Hotel does this sort of thing. They are dodgey.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Over the top”
Reviews.Author: gcaver
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a fun Vegas trip, the Excaliber is the place to stay. Everything about The Excalibur says fun in a big way. The castle motif is over the top. The rooms are huge, clean, and comfortable. The staff is pleasant and helpful. The entertainment is all larger than life. The buffet , like everything else is larger than life. The check in desk is, larger than life that made the process a breeze. The location right on the strip made it easy to get anywhere in town.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, at the heart of everything, great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: GlenBlackpool
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 11 nights in Oct.... Loved every minute and would deff stay there again. Great area with loads going on, hotel was very good with plenty to do and food court excellent with all sorts catered for. Pool area was clean and well kept with sun all day long... Great time can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Smokers beware”
Reviews.Author: rk2011_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur for 5 nights in April for our honeymoon. When we arrived we were given a room on the first floor and when we opened the window their was a main sidewalk 5 feet outside it with hundreds of people walking by looking into our room and kids were running on the "fake" grass right up to our window. We went back to the front desk to ask for another room and we were now put on the second floor and were told "ALL SMOKING ROOMS ARE ON THE FIRST AND SECOND FLOORS ONLY". The room on the second floor now looks at a brick wall right outside the window and this is a deluxe room how????. The first night the toilet kept running all night tried to call maintenece the next morning no one would answer the phone so we went to front desk and the girl told us it would be fixed. The third day came and not fixed went back to front desk and got told "If we didn't complain about the first room and make them move us we wouldn't have this problem". Beware you get what u pay for in this hotel which isn't much and for the rate we paid we could have stayed at a number of other propertys on the strip for equal or less money which have much better reviews. Wish I would have known about trip advisor before this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Ajljhall
Reviews.Content: Took our family for our son's 21st birthday, needed 3 rooms. Therefore didn't want to spend a lot of money. Excalibur was perfect. Rooms were nice (wife and I had upgraded room). Pool was not over the top but fun. We had a fun dinner at Dicks, Taco was hilarious and gave our son a lap dance (Taco is a guy). We have stayed in Vegas many times and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “FUN FOR ALL”
Reviews.Author: prindipops
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Excalibur on numerous occasions since 1990. We have always found the hotel and it's staff to be excellent. Love the location too.

Reviews.Title: “We were pleased”
Reviews.Author: Bonana
Reviews.Content: We stay in Vegas several times a year while passing through usually and we stayed at Excalibur mainly because of the price and I always remember it being clean. The kids like Excalibur and actually chose it this time. The rooms were clean, bed was comfortable. The buffet was great as usual. The one thing I always remember with Vegas is swimming since it was so hot and that's what the kids like to do. I was told they close the pool around 5:00 p.m. and open at 9:00. This was disappointing for the kids. I remember swimming in the evening before bed and it was great with the kids. Now, this is the third hotel we've been in where the kids could not go swimming since we came later and left in the morning. So, if you come with kids be mindful of that. All and all though a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for-great value”
Reviews.Author: JillyLou123
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Halloween. The hotel isn't fancy but it was clean and our room (tower 2) was great. Good size, recently renovated and much better than the Luxor, which we stayed in in April. We also had a great view of the mountains. For what we paid, I'd definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bdeditch
Reviews.Content: My first time staying at the Excalibur and I loved every minute of it. Last time in Vegas I stayed at Circus Circus, which is on the other end on the strip. I pulled up to the front after not being able to find a close enough parking spot. I was greeted by Angel, who works the front entrance, and told I just wanted to drop my bags off and find a place to park. Being from California, Valet parking costs a lot. Angel informed me that it was free there, he then went to get a cart to load my bags onto. He then gave me my tag and told me to call in about 15 minutes to have them deliver all my bags to the room. That helped in a big way! I went and checked in, once again a very nice experience, and went off to my room. I called for my bags, and about 5 minutes later they were delivered by "Ish". All the staff there were very nice to deal with. The hotel is located in a very great location, right across from the MGM and New York New York, and right next door to the Luxor. The walkways take you to any of these hotels with out having to cross the street, The Tram Station is also on the walkway on the way to the MGM. The tram costs $5.00 to ride one way, but found a better way to travel the strip and all the way to Fremoint Street. There are 2 different Buses that travel up and down the strip, one is the RTC and the other one, and my favorite is the Deuce.The Deuce is a double decker bus. I took this the first night to Fremont to meet friends there. You purchase your tickets near some of the bus stops. I purchased a 24 hour one for $7.00. You just get on the bus and swipe the card. I think they also take exact cash for trips as well, not sure how much. The bus stops along the way and you acn get off to go to other hotels and then get back on to continue.if anyone has seen Pawn stars, the bus come within 1/2 a block of the store, but not down the street. thehotel ahs a lot of great places to eat at as well. On the second level is a huge food court and a 24 hour store. Near the Excalibur and many great spots to check out. The Hard rock, Coca Cola World, Harley Davidson Cafe, are with walking distance. Walgreen's has a store near by as well, and CVS is down the street a bit and on the other side. Even Ross has a clothing store near by in case you need to get a fancy outfit and a great price. Once again thanks to all of the staff at the Hotel, you were all great and enjoyed my visit there thank to all of you.

Reviews.Title: “Ditto - you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Golfnut00
Reviews.Content: Great location but reminded me of a days inn at homecoming. Lots of 21 year olds playing grown up. No ammenities, no real restaurants - food court, subpar buffet, or Dicks Last Resort (yuk). You have to leave the property if you want something better. Lots of smoke, poor ventilation and constant bothering by salespeople. Wont stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!! would go back!”
Reviews.Author: nickig_4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Excalibur for 3nights during July long. Check in was very quick. We payed for the room upgrade with a view, SOOO WORTH IT! we were facing New you, New York and MGM. Sooo cool!!!! i think they even put us on the top floor! Rooms were very clean and BIG! Elevators are quick. There are time share people standing and waiting to approach you as you enter the casino part of the hotel. We just kept telling them we werent 25 and they leaft us alone!!! We would defineatly go back. :)

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: Chris H
Reviews.Content: When booking though the airline we got a room with 2 double beds...Not so romantic for 11 yr anniversary. When I walked backed to the desk they moved us to a king room with a great view of a BRICK wall... It was no more then 3 feet away from the window. So was not really happy about that...The rooms are in real need of an update however it was very clean. When booking through the hotel last time we stayed they upgraded us for free and without asking this time complete 180. The front desk staff was really not all that friendly and the first lady I called from the original room basically told me tough that's your room that's why I went to the desk. The buffet is not very good here, however for $16 you get what you pay for... Planet Hollywood's is double the price but 10 times better. The casino was fun and the dealers and casino staff were nice.

Reviews.Title: “Only the location is good the rest is bad.”
Reviews.Author: JohnC610
Reviews.Content: Whenever I go to Las Vegas, I always stay at Excalibur Hotel and was happy with the service and rate. However, last weekend, upon check-in, I already felt that something going to happen really bad. 1) I made the reservation on July 2011 for my stay on oct 2011 to get a good rate. I reserved 4 rooms. Weeks before my trip, I modified the reservation to put my friend's name and their credit card for the deposit so i get the refund, but the reservations department told me that i will get the refund upon the check in of my friend because they are using a different credit card. I checked out my room and verified the other rooms that was used by my friend, i did not get the refund until i has to ask for them to reverse the charges. So if i hadn't checked the bill of the other rooms, I will have to collect money from my friends. 2) Upon check in, I informed the Front Desk Agent that we will be paying cash and use the credit card for incidental charges, the Agent told us just pay upon check-out. Even if my friend paid in cash, my credit card was charged the whole stay. and have to collect the whole amount from my friend with which we don't have to do when she already took the hotel room payment. 3) Don't accept room upgrade since the upgrade's difference is just a sofa or a small work table. We were still housed in Tower 1, i thought we were supposed to be upgraded to Tower 2 as per internet invite.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to rest your head”
Reviews.Author: arrowrootcookie
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Saturday afternoon by taxi from the airport and were immediately whisked over to a desk to be "comped", however, being under 25, we did not qualify for the comps. OK, whatever. We proceeded to check in, which went smoothly. Went up to the room (Tower 1, 25th floor) and the first thing we did was check for signs of critters (aka bed bugs). I am super paranoid and that is always the first thing I do. Everything came up clean, but the bedspread had some stains and tears, but appeared clean. The whole room looks a bit dated. The bathroom only has a shower, no tub, but there is a hairdryer and an iron. After the first night's sleep, we were not too impressed with the bed. The mattress is so soft, it is like sleeping on a marshmallow. We had some trouble with the wired imternet connection, so we called the desk and they sent the engineer up right away. He was pleasant, told us the whole hotel was haivng a problem and that the service provider was sending someone to repair the issue. He checked our box and the cord and decided to replace the cord because it had a small nick in it. The next day, my aunt and her family joined us down the hall. They were trying to "comp" us again for a family pack, but we decided not to go to the presentation they wanted us to. My young cousins enjoyed the pool, but said it was cold. As someone from and area with smoking bans everywhere, my biggest peeve was smelling like cigarettes all the time because of the heavy smoking going on on the casino floor. We tried the buffet deal for a day, but breakfast was not that great (slimy eggs and breakfast meats and stale pastries), lunch wasn`t much better. The bracelet allows you to eat at the Luxor too, so we went there for dinner. It was MUCH better. Not sure if it was just the time of day, though. We also had breakfast at Dick`s Last Resort (theme restaurant where everyone is rude to you, located in the casino at Excalibur). Breakfast was huge, but very greasy. Tip: don`t buy generic Vegas souvenirs at the hotel- Grand Canyon Experience just down the Strip has most of the same stuff for WAY less money. Overall, a great place to rest your head in a great lacation on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas for work ..”
Reviews.Author: RiodeJaneiroCris
Reviews.Content: Stay only because it is $59 a night. The room is outdated and did note thinks is was very well cleaned ... The beds are NOT comfortable, no blankets. I was there for work, so I needed internet, but only cable available.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, You Get What You Pay For!”
Reviews.Author: Steven D
Reviews.Content: This hotel, you can tell has been around for a while and is not the poshest or classiest hotel on the strip, but we had a great time for the money we paid. The atmosphere is great, not stuck up or too posh as in some hotels. The casino is lively and the breakfast buffet is great. The room was big and spacious, there were two giant beds and it was clean and cool. The sheets were changed every day. It's a great location, the staff were great and I would definitely stay there again!! If you're rich, you probably wouldn't, but we're not so we did!!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for?”
Reviews.Author: malaka1076
Reviews.Content: Even at $59 a night, I wont say there again. The room is at least a little updated, not a complete dump, but close to it. I actually left a list of things in my room that I didnt like. The beds were NOT comfortable, also there are no blankets, its like layers of sheets. I was there for work, so I needed to log in my computer. They do not have wireless, instead you have to plug in an akward cord. The "clean" towel had hair all over it and another "clean" towel had a blood booger on it. The curtain had some sort of schmeg on it...what it was? I have no clue, I wouldnt go near it. I got off my plane early afternoon and wanted to eat when I checked in. They stop food service at 2pm. 2pm??? YOUR IN VEGAS!!! I heard someone complain of no soap in their room, I did, but it was nasty soap. The shower only had one little shelf to hold soap in...no others or racks or anything for my washcloth, shampoo, etc. The top drawer of the bureau wouldnt close all the way. The safe box was still locked from someone else. And I called down for extra hangers, they sent up nasty old wired ones. If you think this is all acceptable, I hope you enjoy your stay. If you arent sure, I hope you will stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Yes there's resort fees! Get over it!”
Reviews.Author: Montreal_native
Reviews.Content: I hate people who write reviews lowering a hotel status when it is not even the hotels fault but the person who didn't read what they were booking. The Excalibur is a great and cheap Vegas option. Yes there is a resort fee but nearly all the Vegas hotels charge it and it is CLEARLY marked on their website. Tower 2 has recently been renovated and I would highly recommend you pay a little bit extra for the newer rooms. The room was clean, spacious, and well appointed. We got a 25th floor room facing the Luxor which all though it wasn't strip view was still quite nice. Some people don't like the theme because they feel its too cheesy but I for one really enjoy the themed hotels. I feel its more Vegas then all the new modern hotels you can find anywhere else in the world. We ate one breakfast at the hotel which was quite good. There's so many options in Vegas for food so you definitely can't go hungry. On our last day we bought a buffet resort pass which includes both the Excalibur and Luxor hotels for the day. Great value for money as long as you can handle eating 3 buffet meals in the same day. This was the first time trying this and I don't think I would do it again. By the time it was dinner we simply weren't hungry enough to eat at a buffet again, but both the dinner buffets for the Excalibur and Luxor were good. Overall I would definitely stay there again since it is great value for money and the hotel is really well located. It is a very short walk to the CityCentre monorail by the Monte-Carlo hotel which takes you directly to the Bellagio so if your a bit tired its quite nice. So booked or ask for one of the newer rooms and you'll definitely enjoy your stay at the Excalibur.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room”
Reviews.Author: pooh2010
Reviews.Content: The location is great. Rooms are clean. The down side is it only have shower, don't have bathtub. The sloting machines are fun and lot of penny sloting machine.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Isabela55
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here before and was keen to come back. We stayed in widescreen rooms both times and they are worth it. Cost wise, it is wonderful value for money. Location on the strip is good and it has good restaurants and easy access to the Luxor and Mandalay bay.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as I expected..”
Reviews.Author: bgib21
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at TI, Caesars and the Jockey Club. So reading some reviews on the Excalibur, I expected it to be a lot like the Jockey club, only bigger. And in a way, it was. The grounds are okay, and the Casino is decent too. It feels little more congested than TI or Caesars, and it had a different aroma which might not be the hotels fault, if you know what I mean. They had good, fast and easy restaurants on the upper level, and they had easy access to the Luxor and ManBay on the train. The pleasant surprise was the room. It was very clean and updated, and the beds were pretty comfortable. I would say the biggest con to this hotel would be location, which it can't help. Everybody knows, the middle of the strip is where you want to be, so for this hotel to be on the south side, it hurts it's reputation. But, if you are on a budget, this is a good hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Travelbugg311
Reviews.Content: While I knew the Ecalibur was at the end of the strip, I was surprised at how nice it was. Our room was OK, it was in the older of the towers, and it could definately do with a remodel. I was more impressed by the staff, as they were all so friendly and helpful. I will for sure stay here again for that reason alone.

Reviews.Title: “Second trip to the Excaliber and worth it”
Reviews.Author: Peyton18
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 4-night stay at the Excaliber in Las Vegas. It was even better than the first trip. We stayed in Tower 2, the "newer" or renovated tower. The room was fine; clean, great view from the 26th floor, comfortable beds. We did not eat there the whole trip this time, just because we wanted to try new places. The casino was great. There are some older dealers, so be careful and watch your hands. There were a couple of times when they didn't notice a winning hand. Other than that, the dealers were great, and a couple were very friendly. The pool area was nice and the water still warm.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Brittany M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here the week were in Vegas to get married. We were in Tower 2 on Floor 18. Our room was pretty nice, very clean and the bed (king size) was comfy. My mother-in-law got a great deal on this room so we stayed 5 out of the 7 nights we were there. The bathroom looked to be recently updated with a nice shower. The view from our room wasn't the greatest but overall the room was nice. The tv wasn't working when we first got there but we figured out that it was unplugged. Although we didn't get in the pool we walked out to look at them and they were both nice and clean. The food court upstairs didn't have many choices but at least there was eating right there in the hotel, and they have a 24/7 store also which was nice if you needed anything in the middle of the night. When we go back to Vegas I plan to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and good restaurant”
Reviews.Author: GK000
Reviews.Content: The service was ok and also cleans rooms and very comfortable beds. It´s a good option if you want to eat something different to the normal fast food because they have the all you can eat buffet. It´s at the end of the strip so sometimes you feel that you are far from the rest of the attractions but there is no big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Extra fees and disappointing service”
Reviews.Author: leilaj80
Reviews.Content: There were some nice things about the hotel: Tower II rooms are decent (though no fridge or coffee maker.) Also, the pool area is very nice--large with a kiddie slide in the family pool. The hotel/casino/restaurants are pretty tacky though. But what I really didn't like is that they have hidden fees and poor service. Though the price they quote for a room seems very good, they impose a resort fee and they also charge an extra $20 for another person (beyond two in the room), so if you are traveling with a child, they will expect you to pay extra. I at least expect them to give us an extra towel, toiletries but they didn't and I had to call housekeeping each day for these. At the end of the stay, I requested that they print out a bill for me without that extra person fee called out, but they would not. I've recently stayed in some other hotels where they try hard to make their customers happy....but this hotel isn't one of those. Customer service is really important to me and I have to give this hotel low marks because of that.

Reviews.Title: “just ok”
Reviews.Author: khbmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed in tower 1, the older of the towers. THe rooms were clean but old with multiple war wounds. like most resorts it is huge-expect to walk through the casino to get to the pool, the restaurants etc. It was convenient to have a MacDonald's in hotel, also Quizno and Starbucks. We went with kids so those fed us with our budget in mind. The boys (age 5&14) went to the Medieval show and enjoyed it. The casino is definitely for the budget minded -older and definitely not as snazzy as the middle of the strip. It 's a long walk to the heart of the strip but if you are doing things at the south end then it is great. It was quiet. the free shuttle to the Luxor and Mandalay Bay is nice. two adults tried the buffet at the hotel and said it was barely ok. The kids carnival area is great-all the kids ages 5-16 had a great time, even we adults got into it.

Reviews.Title: “not good hotel to stay with family and kids”
Reviews.Author: icsh
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in good location. Perfect location to stay without a car. Not much good to say about hotel or service. My husband and I spent 1 night there. We were Tower 1, floor 10. Room was not very clean or furniture was very old. Hairdryer was not working, neither was the toilet. I have called front desk and told them about it. I did not ask to change our room, just to see, if they could do something about it. I was told that someone would be send to our room to take a look at problems. However, ofter more then 1.5 hour nobody have shown up. We did not come to Las Vegas to stay and wait at the hotel room. We have had a dinner reservation. So, we left. When we came back to change for the show, we realized that nothing has been fixed. Once again, we have come to Las Vegas just for one day, and did not want to argue with hotel about service. Moreover, this time we have traveled with our child. Just to imagine, how much discomfort that would coast us. When I checked out the next morning, I remind them that in our room hairdryer and the toilet was not fixed. Woman at the friend desk did not react on our word and seems did not care about it either. I was very disappointed about hotel, even though over all our trip was great.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: CheapoTravellor
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Tower 1, King sized bed on the 18th floor. The room was spacious and clean, bed comfortable and we had a flat screen TV. We booked well in advance and paid $38/night less AMA discount at checkin, plus $12.50 resort fee. We requested late checkout to 2:00 p.m. and paid an extra $25. Well worth it as otherwise we would have spent the entire time in the checkout and baggage check line. The internet connection did not work but after one call to the support line and one visit to the front desk, it was replaced. The internet was included in the resort fee. The staff were very pleasant and accomodating. Only bad thing about the hotel as well as others in Vegas is the cigarette smoke. You have to go through the casinos to get to anything and they allow smoking. You can even smell it on the non smoking floors. They need to get with the rest of the world and review their laws as only a minority was smoking. We paid for the buffet 1 day $32, but in retrospect, would have only eaten the evening meal there. Breakfast and lunch were okay, but in the evening they had fabulous prime rib, sword fish, mussels, large peel & eat shrimp all for $20. Desserts were awesome throughout the day. We bought half price tickets to The Auto Collection at Imperial Palace and the Titanic exhibit at Tix4Tonight, but they had Cirque, Phantom, Lion King and others available. I found out later the Auto Collection has free passes on their website. We had purchased Phantom tickets in advance and arrived early and were the first to be seated in the cheap seats. They upgraded us to 4th row centre!! We phoned Ambassador shuttle to request pickup but after waiting for 20 minutes past our time and seeing none of their shuttles, we hopped on board an executive shuttle. Executive, Showtime and Grays had several shuttles stopping at the hotel. Our driver said "Friends don't let Friends ride with Grays". Not sure why? We had a fabulous time, but there is a dark side to Vegas and should not be a family destination. Leave your kids at home and take them to Disneyland another time.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur 7 night stay with friends”
Reviews.Author: BIGAL6666666
Reviews.Content: My brother and 4 others stayed here from early October 2011 for a week and we were genuinely surprised at the value for money.The rooms in the Tower were clean and the bed very comfortable.The bathroom shower was very good and the widescreen tv a worthwhile extra. We had good weather all week-and spent most mornings by a deserted pool with lots of free deckchairs.The pools are very big and there are lifeguards from about 11.0 am and if you want a quiet spot of sunbathing this is ideal.Waitresses are on hand for food/drinks orders or you can fetch them yourself from the bar-and i thought very fairly priced for Vegas. We ate at the hotel only twice-once in the morning for the breakfast buffet which was just ordinary -nothing wrong with it but no wow factor -(we tried Bellagio`s later in the week,which was simply outstanding) and the steak bar which was very very good and worth a visit.The service was good and the food well prepared and tasty. For me the only reason for not coming back would be its location.If like me you are going to gamble a lot in Bellagio or caesers Palace then getting cabs constantly can be a bit expensive and boring after a while especially if you after a cab at checkout times as the wait can be 20 mins or more.

Reviews.Title: “Perefectly fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nigelh
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights from 13th September 2011. I was a lone traveller stoping off in vegas to have a look around before continuing onto Montana for my main stay to meet up with a group of Travel agents and tour operators. You may want to know that i work in the travel industry, so i feel i can give an unbiased review. Just a tip to start, i had decided that i was going to get a shuttle bus, which was fine, however in hindsight i should have got a taxi because the Exc is so close to the airport for an extra dollar or 2 it would have been worth it, especially if there is 2 of you staying. So my first tip is get a cab if your staying at this hotel. Well first off when i went to check in, there was a small queue of about 15 people, but this wasnt a problem, as there was plenty of staff working, and i waited about 10mins, which was fine. However there was a problem with my booking, 'apparently' my booking had been cancelled by the 'customer' (which was me)! Now bear in mind i am a travel agent and booked this direct with our USA supplier through my account manager, this was quite a surprise to me!! This obviously was quite anoying, but was handled ok by the check in person, who asked for a swipe of my credit card so they could get me into a room, and we would then sort it out in the morning, for my inconvenience i got upgraded to a widescreen room. Well to cut a long story short the next morning i went down at 7.45am and got this sorted after about 40minutes of phone calls to the company who i booked it through. But here is the thing, when this problem occured the duty manager told me that this was cancelled by the company i booked through. Well after i got back to the uk i checked this claim out with my account manager, and it turned out it was 100% the hotel error and i got a written appology from the hotel. So unfortunately i was lied too by the check in person and the duty manager, which is really disapointing. However after this intial annoyance, everything else was fine. Location The hotel in my opinion is in a good location, at the south end of the strip, but on the srtip, so you have great access to the busses and other hotels. You are next door to luxor, New York New York, and MGM. Some may want to be in a more central locationm, however i liked the fact that everything was bascially north and up the strip from where i was staying, which made finding and visiting things easy. I walked up to the fashion mall which to me was bascially the end of the strip you would want to visit, this took about and hour I also took the busses up to freemont st, which took from 25-50 minutes depending on the time of day. Rooms The room was perfectely fine for me, it was clean, a good size, and had a nice tv. The pillows and bed was very comfy, which incidentally was the case in all the 7 hotels i staying in during this trip! There were toiletries in the bathroom, but no tea and coffee making facilities, which would have been nice. No complaints at all with the room Hotel / casino I didnt really use any of the hotel facilities, such as the pool, but as i could see it from my room, it looked fine and was well frequented. The casino, i didnt use, but had a couple of drinks and a hot dog in seemed fine, not as shiny, new or as many bells and whistles as other strip hotels, but when your paying £35 a night, you cant really complain. It wasnt smokey as others have reported. Wifi tip There wasnt wifi in the rooms, which is where vegas seems to be behind to the rest of the world. However if you went into the food outlet part of the hotel you could pick up the free wifi offered by Krispy Kreme donuts! Food on the Strip IMO you can spend hundreds of dollar or just a few dollars. Can you do vegas on a budget? absolutely! This was the start of my 12 day trip of the states, so i couldnt go mad with may cash, so was carefull what i spent it on. I ate at the Planet Hollywood buffet, and used a voucher i got from the internet, it was clean and tasty, but i wasnt overly impressed. I think i paid something like $20. Anyway the best bit was the $11 drink as much as you can add on you can buy, So for $30ish i got all the food and drink i could eat. I also ate for lunch at the main st station near freemont st, which i felt was much better, and better value for money at about $7.99 which is fantastic value for money, and the dining room is beautifull. I would choose the main st station of PH everytime if i went back, the only down side is its at freemont st. Vegas on a budget There are loads of casinos that offer happy hour discounts or permenant discounts for drinks. THE BESt value i found was at Casino Royal where they were offering Bottles of Michelo for $1 and forzen margaritas. The bar tender was also very freindly and i got talking to some customers who were also freindly. Also went to happy hour at the bar just inside the entrance to PH, sorry i cant remember the name, but it was buy on get one free. Look for vouchers, i got a $10 voucher from the internet for the Planet holywood buffet. Hooters were doing a discount on bud i think for $1.50 per bottle. Take a walk up the strip and look for adverts in the bar and casino windows for happy hours etc, so you can get an idea of where you want to go perhaps in the eve.

Reviews.Title: “Good Enough”
Reviews.Author: formertravelagent
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal and I would stay here again if the price were right. We did upgrade to a Widescreen Room and I am glad we did as I am hesitant to think what the regular rooms might be like. The room had potential but just looked run down and in need of some TLC. We called housekeeping to clean our bathroom floors at check in as there was hair all over them (a little gross!) but other than that they were at least acceptable. Dick's Bar in the lobby area was handy for getting delicious drinks and refills each day and the pool was clean, large and a nice atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: joshwtuttle
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Tower 1, 19th Floor, middle of September 2011. Just me and a buddy, guys trip. I expected it to be run down, out of date and just overall kind of crappy; especially for $39 a night. But almost everything exceeded my expectations. Casino was nice, ended up being one of my favorite ones. Loved that it was attached to Luxor, you could get there in just a few minutes. Food court & buffet were both good. Room had a plasma TV, bed was VERY comfortable and I never heard a noise from outside our room. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the money”
Reviews.Author: ChrisB010
Reviews.Content: Found Excaliber to be pretty tired overall, nothing special - but was OK for the price and to still be on the main strip. We were charged an additional $5 a day 'resort fees' for things I can't even remember now (newspapers, internet and something else) so be aware there may be additional costs. Good size room, with two queen beds, flat screen TV, Internet (hard wired not wifi) & good shower. Aircon was old but worked well. Was on the second floor of the smoking rooms. Ate at the breakfast buffet ($15 each) lots of choice but pretty standard on taste. If your expectations are not too high this is an ok place to stay, but you may be able to get better if you shop around and negotiate

Reviews.Title: “Outdated”
Reviews.Author: nlkowal
Reviews.Content: The one good thing about this hotel is its location. The price was decent, but the rooms and casino need major renovations. There are not many after hours entertainment options either. There are no major restaurants; only a food court which provided slow service in the hours it was actually open. I stayed here since I was in town to see a concert at the MGM and the proximity was great. I would not stay here again, even if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: Drakarula
Reviews.Content: I was there for 5 days. The place smells like an old ash tray. The rooms are way over due for upgrades. It was clean and the mattress was comfortable. It was adequate to sleep but the food at the buffet was terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: airnole
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when visiting Las Vegas for my daughter's wedding. It is true that we weren't in the room very much, so that helped. The price paid for the stay was reasonable and that was why I chose the hotel so that was good. The location was very close to the hotel that my daughter had her wedding parties at, so that was another reason I chose it. In fact the location on the strip was very good indeed and that was a real plus. You wouldn't need a car if you were just planning to be on the strip. Those are the good things about the hotel. As for the hotel itself, it felt like I was in the 1970's and not in a funky,hip retro way - it was like the place hadn't been freshened up since that time period! It was clean enough in the public areas and the room but there was just something unappealing about it that made our stay in Las Vegas not quite as nice as it could have been. I am a thrifty person but I sort of wished I had spent a bit more and gotten a nicer room at a more modern hotel. That said, though, it was a very good price and if you are hardly planning to be in the room at all and don't care about it being appealing, then I would say to stay here for the value factor. If the aesthetic portion of the stay matters to you, then go somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: alaskacat_10
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the excalibur many times before. I usually get emails from them with some really good deals. Well this time my son and I went down there for his 18th birthday, yes he wanted to go. Anyways got in kinda late around 11:30 pm. Went to our room and the heat was on and could not turn it off, called down to the front desk asked if someone could please come take care of it, they said no problem would send someone up. Waited for about an hour no one called back down there and asked if we could just get moved to another room we just wanted to go to bed. Someone bought our kids up to us, we moved to a different room. Oh man it was bad someone must of gotten sick because it stunk so bad. We thought ok one night we can do this. Called the next night which was a friday and said they could or would not move us. They said they would take care of the smell. Well left for the day at went and saw vegas came back was a little better not much though. Thought ok lets just move hotels, found out if we did that it would cost way to much money since it was the weekend. So waited until Sunday and moved over to the Monte Carlo. Much better hotel. Will never stay at the excalibur again.

Reviews.Title: “Budget on the strip”
Reviews.Author: spanky132
Reviews.Content: This place is all about location. It's in a great spot on the strip, at affordable rates. The buffet contunues to underwhelm year after year and should be avoided. The rooms have been modernized, but they are nothing special. The pool area has also been upgraded and is one of the nicer features of this property. This property continues to draw families.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you paid for”
Reviews.Author: skamikirn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with the family since it was a more kid-friendly hotel, so to speak. It's got the Fun Dungeon (arcade & carnival games) downstairs, 3 pools (18 and over pool, pool with 2 water slides, reg pool) and a couple of jacuzzi's. When you first enter the hotel, you are stopped by a personnel who is trying to get you to see shows within the next year. And every time you pass by them, they try to stop you again which can get really annoying. Also, they've got these scantily-dressed girls dancing in the casino as people are walking by. It wasn't even 7pm and they were already out. The rooms were ok. Book the rooms that say 'widescreen'. Those are the rooms in Tower 2 which are the remodeled rooms. It has the widescreen tv, remodeled bathrooms (sink was kinda high). Would have been nice if they had a refrigerator in there. We weren't in the rooms much so the price was decent for what we got. $14 mandatory resort fee. Not quite sure why they call it 'resort' since we didn't get free-internet. They need to update the hotel directory since it did not mention where the tram is. The free tram stops at Luxor and Mandalay Bay. Ok to stay here as a family. For a couple, go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good times for all here folks...”
Reviews.Author: s500driver
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and well managed, our only gripe was no coffee makers in the rooms, even the two room suite didn't have one! Do yourself a favour and pack a disposable coffee maker and the makins for your favorite hot morning beverage and life at the Excalibur is complete! The smoke smell wasn't that bad, we had a friend smoke in our room and we couldn't smell it afterwards, they must change the air very often, the casino was the same, very fresh despite the odd smoker here and there - Thanks to all for our good times - Steve & Pauline PS You might want to pack ear plugs if you're in Tower 1 facing the Hwy & airport, the emergency sirens are regular throughout the night if you're a light sleeper, they seem to last for minutes as the land is so flat the sound carries for miles...you can't hear the air traffic though ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Was a little skeptical but overall A-OK”
Reviews.Author: imageworks
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights there and wasn't my first choice but the prices were so good and since you actually spend so little time in your room I figured, "what the heck" ! Pleasantly surprised .... arrived about 10:30 in the morning and was greeted by very friendly staff and checked right in. Stayed in Tower 1, 5th floor ..... room was clean, huge, bed was very comfortable. Had sofa, coffee table and work table. A/C was a little noisy but nothing major. NO Wi-Fi and NO coffee maker or Mini-fridge ... MAJOR FAIL for a hotel in Las Vegas where so much convention travel and business travel is conducted. Didn't eat at any of the restaurants although we tried at Dick's Last Resort but wait was LONG so we opted to walk next door to New York New York and dine at one of the MANY choices there. Would stay again without hesitation .... close to MGM, NY NY, Mandalay Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location for price!”
Reviews.Author: imaworldtraveller
Reviews.Content: Hotel room, facilities and location were great! Couldn't fault it at all! If you don't want to pay silly money for a hotel with a great location with convenience to the strip then id recommend the excalibar. Had a free upgrade to large suite couldnt complain, friendly staff! Defainately recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Get a Widescreen Room - great value”
Reviews.Author: amelia80
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel, our first being two years ago. Although the hotel is dated in places, very smoky and at the south end of the strip, we found it to be great value and the newer widescreen rooms are a great option. They are clean, large and modern. The casino is always busy night and day, the staff are very friendly and the atmosphere is fun. If you don't mind a bit of a walk up the strip I would highly recommend this hotel if you are on a tighter budget.

Reviews.Title: “Frist time at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: DapperDon51
Reviews.Content: It was clean and comfortable. The only thing missing was an in-room coffee pot which would have been nice. I think that when going to a place like Vegas, it doesn't pay you to stay in one of the more expensive hotels since you spend so little time in your room anyway, so this was a great deal for us. The only thing I wish all the hotels there would do, is get rid of all those time share people who lurk in the lobby. I am on vacation...I do not want to spend an entire day wasting my time looking at some resort. I was approached every day, sometimes multiple times by these people.

Reviews.Title: “Over rated and Priced”
Reviews.Author: Kurt s
Reviews.Content: Stay anywhere else! Expedia FAILED, we checked in went up to our room to get ready for the day and walked in on the cleaning lady vacuuming up throw up from the following night. WOW the staff said it's NORMAL to give keys out when rooms are not yet cleaned WTF. 30 minutes after waiting in line again to get a different room which was on a completely different floor from our friends we were able to get our room !

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Josie504
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 8:30 PM on Oct. 17/11.Check in was smooth, people at the registration desk were helpful.Our room on the 7th floor tower 2 was very clean.The cleaning girl Marcela made sure we have clean towels everyday & our beds well done daily. The bathroom was also very clean. We purchased the 32.00 buffet pass for 2 days.Love the fried bananas for breakfast.Lunch & dinner were pretty good.By the way you may use your buffet pass for snacks & you may use it also at the nearby Luxor. The resort was open so we made use of it for 2 days. We had fun exploring the strip by foot.We made it up to Wynn hotel & back walking. We made some money at the casino.So we had a great stay.Excalibur is okay in our book & we will stay there again. Josie C. of Mississauga,ON. Canada

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Coleraine3
Reviews.Content: We stayed a couple of nights and had a widesreen room in tower 2 overlooking the pools. The room was large, clean and comfortable. Check in was fairly quick, no problems. We like the casino although it's hard to get used to the smoke so didn't spend too long inside! We tried the all day buffet the food was good enough and plentiful. We have no real complaints about the Excalibur the prices are reasonable, better then alot of the other hotels and we prefer to stay on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Stop your moaning!”
Reviews.Author: Boutiquefoodie76
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 5 nights at the Excaliber! I am so disappointed at all the negative comments snout this wonderful hotel! You get what you pay for and for a budget hotel on the strip it is PERFECT! Great rooms (tower 2) very attentive staff, excellent buffet (I am a head chef from England) and great atmosphere! Your gonna need to learn how to walk unless you wanna pay ridiculous taxi fees to get to the other end of the strip but I found it a great way to see everything! All in all a fantastic resort! You lot nerd to stop your moaning or go stay at the Wynn or aria! Will defo go back to the Excaliber no question!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Trip, Fantastic Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: LeanneRoss
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Excalibur in October 2011, check in was very smooth and quick, rooms were very clean and good, had a good view staying in tower 1 of the strip. Used the dinner time buffet a couple of times, same food on both occasions but was ok, maybe a little overpriced though. Definitely worth a visit and i would certainly use this hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for cheap on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: daisyforyou
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 9:30 am, was able to check in and go to our room by 11:30am. We were in a King Widescreen with a View room. The room was a good size. The bed was really comfortable but the sheets never stayed on the bed. If you aren't looking for bells and whistles, this is a great place to stay. Everyone we spoke with was friendly. I recommend getting a players club card online and trying to get a deal through it. They are offering great deals right now! The downfalls, the room service only runs 6am - 2pm. Really sucks when you want a midnight snack and don't want to leave your room. There is no fridge or coffee pot in the room. Also, skip the buffet. It isn't that good. It is pretty far down on the strip. Walking down the strip kind of sucks. You can get a shuttle from MGM to take you to Harrahs or Ballys which isn't so bad. Overall, we'd stay again if the prices were as cheap as they were.

Reviews.Title: “Super visit”
Reviews.Author: Encinoman333
Reviews.Content: We cant say enough great things about or visit!the room was great, the staff was great even the timeshare staff was great, we would even do it again for more carrot top tickets, boom! Great location cause we like to walk to other casinos, dont be lazy folks it vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Good for families”
Reviews.Author: sfs1966
Reviews.Content: As a big fan of Vegas, Excalibur is not my first choice for a grown-ups trip, but for a family vacation, it was surprisingly kid-friendly. Yes, the whole thing revolves around the casino, but there's an arcade, fun pools, and child-approved food available. It wasn't particularly luxurious, but it was clean and the price was right so I thought it was a good value. I'd bring my kids back.

Reviews.Title: “great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: brianlisa2
Reviews.Content: i stayed in the Excalibur Hotel from the 7th to the 15th of October 2011. i traveled to vegas from Cork, Ireland with my wife and three kids. on arrival at the hotel at about 9:30p.m. local, we were checked in very quickly. The staff there were very friendly and even upgraded our two rooms as there was five of us staying at the hotel.i must admit i was a bit apprehensive because of some of the reviews that i had read about the hotel prior to arriving at the hotel but i found the rooms to be in excellent condition and very clean. we stayed in Tower two. The view from the room was not great but so what we had gotten an upgrade for free. there are four pools at the hotel but the main pool was closed for the season so we had a choice of three other pools which is not to bad. the sun loungers at the pool are free and even the towels that they give you for the loungers are also free (just produce your room key). there was three to four life guards at each pool all day which was great if you are going with kiddies. in the food court in the hotel you have a choice of Mc Diddies, Star Bucks, Krispie Kreme, Pizza Hut etc. We had a ball staying at this hotel and i would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Las Vegas either with kids or without. i would definitely stay here again on a return visit to Las Vegas. This Hotel is not the Ritz but for the money you pay its clean and well situated on the top of the strip next to the Luxor and across from the New York New York Hotel. This Hotel is well worth a return visit. :)

Reviews.Title: “Very Good For Price Paid!”
Reviews.Author: fiohn
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews i was a bit hesitant about this hotel. Let me tell you it is not as bad as some say. Yes the hotel is a bit dated, but it appears to be clean and although it can be smoky so are a lot of properties on the strip. We had a room in tower 2 on the 3rd floor. View was not terrific. We were rarely in our room so did not actually matter. The bed was comfortable and clean (no bedbugs). We had a deluxe room with 2 queens and a little sitting area and the furniture appeared newer. The previous guest had left the in-room safe locked. Unfortunately it took them 2 hours to get up to the room to unlock and because we had to be in the room for them to do, it was a bit of a hassle. The bathroom was large, however for those people who enjoy a bath they may be disappointed as there is only a shower. The pool area was good. There were plenty of loungers available around the four pool areas, the only complaint is that the loungers were not very comfortable. The pool area had sun for most of the day which was thoroughly enjoyed. The food court was very convenient and really an added bonus. It was not too far away from the rooms and some of the restaurants were open for late night snacking or early morning coffees. A Starbucks at 7am is a must for me:). If you are looking for glamour and glitz, this is not the hotel for you. They have some great deals on room rates so if you need somewhere merely to rest your head after a long day/night on the Vegas strip, this hotel can do that.

Reviews.Title: “Needs upgrading”
Reviews.Author: don12345
Reviews.Content: We stayed in tower 1. Sink didn't drain. Air conditioner was so noisy you could run it while you were in the room. View of a brick wall. Hair dryer work intermittently. Not clean and I am sure I smelled smoke in a non smoking room. The buffet wasn’t up to much. It was a Westjet package so I don’t know the cost but the resort fee of $96.00 at the end was a slap. Won’t stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Gave our room away......”
Reviews.Author: carol s
Reviews.Content: My husband made reservations to stay at the Excalibur Hotel & Casino for our 35th Wedding Anniversary...8 weeks in advance to be sure we would get Tower Two, as we had heard that Tower One was not renovated, but Tower two was. Everything was settled, and we booked for 10 days there. We got at the Reservation desk at exactly 8:08p.m., and were bluntly told by 2 managers (that we ask for) that our room was not available until tomorrow night, BUT, they would give us a smaller room for two beds. I was in disbelief since I told them who we made the reservations with (her name), and that all was fine, and it has been 8wks. ago. They argued & argued with us that "It's just NOT here....we can"t make one for you". I wanted to know how that could happen since it's been 8 weeks ago that we made these accommodations? They just shook there heads "No".....and I walked off to sit down & let my husband handle it because I could feel my temper getting crazy. My husband stood there & discussed this nicely with them to no avail. He came to where I was sitting & said we HAD to take the room. I got incensed. I walked up to the counter & there was a man there. I ask if he was in management for the Hotel. He said yes. I had been in Management myself, and PR, and NEVER would I do this to anyone. After ripping him a new one for about 45 minutes, he finally said this....."Those rooms are saved for High Rollers". I was calmly furious & let him know we had thousands in our bank accounts, and I have a generous inheritance left by my late parents....so how would he KNOW WE weren't "HIGH ROLLERS"?????? This he had no answer for, but I told him with pleasure, that not a PENNY of it would be spent here now. I began to leave, and he told me to have a seat & he MAY have a room soon. ha ha ha! It was now 12:10a.m. I didn't care. You just don't DO THAT to people.....period. Fifteen minutes later we had our room in Tower Two, but I have to say this.....it was a crummy OLD joint, and if this is what they save for their HIGH ROLLERS....I pity them...what a JOKE!!!!! No one there was friendly & it's the VERY LAST place you should stay. This is not a made up story. Pay a teeny bit more & go elsewhere...ANYWHERE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Average Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SpeedwayCJ
Reviews.Content: Used to stay here regularly with my family when the hotel was newer. About 2 or 3 years ago, swore I'd never stay here again, after the place had begun to become dirty, dingy and noisy. Previously tried one of the newly remodeled rooms and found it to be an utter disappointment. But, late booking and reasonable rates dictated that my father and I stay here for one night at the end of a trip to Las Vegas for a vintage racing event. The room was reasonably clean, but very sparsely decorated. Beds were large and reasonably comfortable. Flat screen TV was nice. View room, looked out over the airport and a bit of the Strip. Not a bad place, but very basic. Vents and air conditioner really need to be cleaned, as massive dust is visible inside of venting, as it has been for years. The rooms at this hotel desperately need a make-over better than the ones they've tried so far. The place is just getting old and needs to freshen up. Not bad for a one night stay, but it's still not going to be on my list of hotel/casinos to stay at normally.

Reviews.Title: “Good, not perfect”
Reviews.Author: Trip A
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Excalibur 5 or 6 times and have generally been satisfied with each stay. It is moderately priced and very convenient at the south end of The Strip, across the street from the MGM Grand and from New York New York but only about half the price of those two hotels. The rooms are large, if plain, and generally very clean. I find three things to be aware of (or beware of): 1. Prices vary wildly from day to day, depending upon what conventions are in town. This is definitely a case of "charge whatever the market will bear." If your plans are flexible, check the hotel's web site closely for prices. A weekend room might be $120 while the same room a day or two later might be $39.95 (plus taxes plus the mysterious "resort fee"). 2. Avoid the Excalibur buffet. Las Vegas has many excellent buffets but this isn't one of them. 3. There is no wi-fi but each room has WIRED Internet connections in each room. On my last visit, the Internet connection in my room didn't work more than 50% of the time. Looking at the modem in the room, the ONLINE light didn't come on at all when it was malfunctioning. Repeated calls to maintenance didn't seem to make any difference. Apparently, the in-house folks had no idea how to fix it. Luckily, I also had my 4G Sprint wireless card with me and it worked perfectly during my entire 5-night stay on an upper floor. I suspect Sprint's signal was strong that high up. Overall, I will stay here again because prices can be cheap but I will always check the web site for prices before making a reservation.

Reviews.Title: “VULTURES”
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent 3 nights at the Excalibur and had mixed emotions about our stay. When we first arrived at the hotel, we were stopped by an employee of the hotel asking if we were just getting to the hotel and needed to register. After telling her that we DID need to register she walked us over to a small counter, introduced us to another woman and said that SHE would take care of us. I was very shocked to find out that we could NOT register at this desk, but was blindsided with a sales person trying to sell us a TIMESHARE with offers of reduced prices for any show we wanted to see, and also $150.00 in free comps. The only thing we would have to do is go to a free breakfast, and go to a "2 hr seminar". As my wife was telling this sales VULTURE that we had to think about it, and that she really had to use the restroom, the VULTURE walked around the dest to show us where the nearest facility was, she literally walked toward the enterance with us and I swear she would have gone into the restroom with my wife to continue her sales pitch. Talk about being pissed off as soon as you walk in the door. We finally got away from her,and finally got registered, we started enjoying our stay at the Excalibur. The rest of the staff were very helpfull. The room was very clean, but the chairs at the table were uncomfortable. We were in a great location: first floor in tower 1. Another problem that we had with staff was: every time we either walked out of the casino or came back into the casino, more vultures would keep asking if we wanted to see a cheap vegas show. They were relentless and would not give up. Even after we checked out, and were walking to the door to get in a taxi for the airport, they were on us like vultures. As far as the casino, we had absolutly NO problems. We didn't like the fact that there are so many penny slots and the min. bet at the tables were as much as they are. I would definatly recomend signing up for the M life players club, We were able to get tickets for Chris Angle's Believe, third row stage left, for a very reasonable price. I would stay at this hotel again, if it weren't for the VULTURES.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't plan on being in the room much, and can get it cheap, it's a good choice.”
Reviews.Author: Baseball4evr10
Reviews.Content: If you don't plan on spending a ton of time in the hotel and can get this place for a good price, then it will work. Rooms are clean, haven't been updated in quite a while. It's near the end of the Strip but still close enough to walk to most locations. Nothing special but it does the job.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back tomorrow!!!”
Reviews.Author: Wendz_88
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 10 night stay in the Excalibur Hotel and we loved it. I travelled with my boyfirend. This was our 1st time in Vegas and choose this hotel for location and price. Room was clean and a good size, maid service everyday and fresh towels everyday! We stayed in a widescreen roon on Tower II. Location was good at the South end of the strip across from NYNY and within walking distance to MGM and a few other hotels. Buffet was nice you will find something you like as there is a large choice. As for the time share people if you just ignore them and keep walking they don't bother you. I would reccomend this hotel to anybody who is looking somewhere at a good price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: Keentravelle
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights and the other reviews cover it quite nicely... I must say the biggest issue is definitely the smoke! Coming from a country that has a strong antismoking campaign it was abit hard to take! Rooms clean and cleaning service good. I found the whole Vegas hospitality generally quite disappointing! It's actually an effort for anyone to go out of there way to help... And the Excalibur was the same! Again, I must agree the half naked dancers (at 4pm!) really cheapens the look of the casino. Seriously, kids don't need to see that in the lobby! It looks nice at night but Id stay somewhere more upmarket nxt time. If u like cheap tho then this is your place!

Reviews.Title: “Excaliber stay”
Reviews.Author: Kathy6554
Reviews.Content: Just returned from four-night stay here. We were concerned about mixed reviews, but we arrived before 11, and were told they would check us in at 11. Stayed in Tower II - room was clean. We have always stayed at the Flamingo in the past -- but this year they did not have rooms at rates they sent me promo on so I decided to go elsewhere! Excaliber was much nicer room. PS Why is it people bring kids to Vegas and then complain about attire of cocktail waitresses?

Reviews.Title: “don't pay attention to the negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: Faction6
Reviews.Content: My wife and I checked into the Excalibur Oct. 9. We were getting married the very next day, and stayed the rest of the week for our honeymoon. We were a little uncertain what to expect thanks to all the negative reviews on tripadvisor. I must say they were wrong! I think the people that did not like the hotel must have been snobby, "nose in the air" type of people. We totally LOVED this hotel. When we checked in, we were upgraded to one of the newly remodeled widescreen rooms in tower 2, with a 42" plasma screen tv, new furnishings, and a beautiful view of the mountains. The hotel, of course, is medieval themed, and stays true throughout the whole resort. We stayed on the 17th floor, and it was always quiet, never had a problem going to sleep. I've seen alot of complaints on here about the timeshare people, well, they are everywhere in Vegas. Just ignore them and go on about your way. Our only complaints were that the Roundtable Buffet was not very tasty, and the resort fees that you have to pay when you check out. We had already known in advance abut the resort fee, so it was no big deal. Try out dinner and a cocktail at Dick's Last Resort, you will have a blast in that place. If you want a fairly priced hotel, in a great location, definately to try out the Excalibur, you will not be disappointed. Thank you Excalibur for a wonderful honeymoon from my wife and I

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: gaz40
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Vegas for a return trip after 5 years with a couple of mates for a boys week away (wifes left at home) In our mid 40s we were not looking for a wild time or a dear time, so hopefully this will help those in the same situation. We flew direct with Virgin from Manchester. When we landed we headed out to the taxi rank and grabbed a cab straight away, but forgot the first thing i had read prior to the visit, DONT let the cab go by the tunnel route, he needs to go left not right! The difference was $23 to Excalibur and $11 on way back not going via tunnel ! This time we stayed at the Excalibur at the South end of the Strip, previously at the Sahara at the North end which is now closed.This location was a lot better as there is nothing between circus circus and the stratosphere at the north end, and it's a bit shady down there! The Excalibur is joined with internal walkways or monorails with the Luxor and Mandalay Bay and just across the road via walkways to the New York, MGM, Tropicana. Check in was speedy and receptionist pleasant, although we didn't get the adjoining rooms we requested, this was rectified when we noticed neighbors leaving and asked if we could swap rooms, which was sorted no problem. We did notice that there was a large que at check in at various times,especially the weekend when it did get busy! We tried our luck for a Free upgrade,without success. Our room was on the 19th floor in tower 1. Tower 2 is nearer the pool and spa. The rooms were very large with 2 queen beds, flat screen tv, writing table and chairs, the bathroom was large and had walk in shower. There was a safe in the room, iron,hairdryer and free toiletries.The maid service was spot on, and although I hung the towels up for re-use they still got changed everyday ( maybe because I left tip from day 1). Although the decor is a bit tired and could do with an upgrade the rooms are large and ideal for a Vegas trip!! e.g your not there to sleep!!! Oh yeh the beds are comfy. Air con works, although mine smelt of pea so I didn't use it. The bad point of these rooms were they faced the airport and road, so there was a bit of noise, the other side of the corridor had no view. Gambling- if you want to gamble on the cheap and want your money to last a bit, do it during the day and during the week. The roulette min. was $5 then it went up to $10 at night or at the weekends! We went down to Bills gambling hall further down the strip for cheaper gambling,$3 min during the day. Freemont street is not as cheap as we thought $5-10 min although well worth a visit. Eating- we tried the buffet twice and was not impressed, not much choice and it looked like it had been there a while. Better taking walk to the Luxor or splashing out for the MGM dinner buffet, salmon,oysters,steak etc for $30 all you can eat The steakhouse Rib Eye was great!!! Drinking- we thought the drink prices dear ( but we're from a small town) $6 for a draught beer in Dicks last stand, a noisy in yer face bar/eating place, if like wearing paper hats with slogans/ jokes on while you eat, this is for you! This is where we met the bar man with attitude, and apart from 2 dealers were the only staff with negative attitude,he refused to serve us without ID,even though we had been there for 2 hrs and was there for another 2 when served by another. The octane bar is ok but quiet $7 a bottle of bud. Nine Irish man bar in New York is good crack, but again dear. We got a taxi $10 up to Mac Mullens Irish bar on East Tropicana street, this was a great authentic Irish bar with great food, cheaper drink and live intertainment. Transport- the best way to get up and down the strip is the downtown express bus,( the smaller long bus) it doesn't stop at all the stops and you have to buy a ticket at the machine at the stops, you are better carrying a credit card as most of the time they wouldn't take cash $7 for 24 hr unlimited. They have spot checks for tickets, although we only seen this once in a week and that was from Fremont street later on at night, you either wouldnt get on or put of at next stop if you were unlucky, certainly didn't seem the locals bought tickets. This is the bus to get on for the premium shopping malls at either end. The deuce bus you can pay as get on, and stops at he stops and therefore is usually busy.There is a stop outside the hotel for South bound and one across road at Tropicana for North, although you have to go down to MGM for the express! Shopping- oh boy, there's shops every where, a premium outlet at either end, with good discounts the North is slightly better though the bus goes through some rough areas and you get some dodgy bus mates!!! Planet Hollywood mile shopping arcade, caesars, fashion mall all on the strip. Town square shopping mall between Mandalay Bay and Premium outlet south, get on the downtown express outside Excalibur, this has Apple,Holister,AF etc in a lovely layout, Millers Ale house is across road, good food $7 pitchers of beer and lots of sports screens. Pool- the pool area is huge, with lots of beds and free towels. We didn't try the spa or gym!!! Surprise surprise! General- although this hotel is billed as child friendly hotel (although who in their right mind would take a child to Vegas) we didn't see many! The smoking in the casinos and bars take a bit of getting used to again! The constant clicking of the mexicans with call girl cards and the black fellas trying to give you music cd grates on you while walking the strip! We didn't go to any shows, so I cannt comment, we did however do all 3 of the stratosphere rides on top of the tower....awesome! And the Fremont street light show is great. In summary this hotel is great, you get what you pay for! If you want fancy pay more and stay elsewhere! I would return if given the chance, the location is spot on!

Reviews.Title: “A Bit old”
Reviews.Author: mashpotato22
Reviews.Content: Excalibur is getting a bit long in the tooth. The decor is old. Not good for kids, we arrived at 1am only to have scantly clad ladies dance on the bar. The people who work there give you all different information. They have a meal deal which is good but the food is a bit bland, not much variety.

Reviews.Title: “This place not much on customer service”
Reviews.Author: EMP1958
Reviews.Content: There were six of us in our party and we traveled around from one casino to another. We had been in the Excalibur casino for well over 45 minutes and not one cocktail waitress had been by. I went up to the bartender and explained the situation and he said he would call the waitress. After another 15 or 20 minutes, a waitress said to calm down and she would get us a drink. After awhile the "beverage manager" came by and instead of apologizing or trying to acomodate us, she was rude and arrogant. It was obvious that no one really cared, so we left. Customer service doesn't seem to be a real concern to them.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience”
Reviews.Author: sconsi87
Reviews.Content: The room was great; we got upgraded for free to a widescreen room. It would have been nicer to have the one king bed, but oh well--the bed was still comfortable and the second queen allowed the girlfriend to spread out everything that she packed. The view of The Strip from our window was amazing. I somehow woke up our first morning at the exact time the sun was rising, and I'm glad that I did because the sight was awesome. The rooms were also very quiet, which I was worried about being on the strip. TV was large, could have had a channel guide though. The hotel leaves some information on things to do in the city and provides coupons which is nice. The bathroom was large, but the shower doesn't get the best water pressure. Also, the floor gets very slippery when wet, even in oil-resistant shoes. Here's the bad part. When we got in I went to plug in my phone behind the nightstand. Apparently the last cleaning person slammed the nightstand into the wall breaking the outlet cover, which meant that the outlet was moving around in the wall. When I unplugged the clockradio to plug in my phone I was shocked. When I tried to plug in my phone, I was shocked again for a few seconds, despite not touching the outlet at all. I was fine, but my hand went numb for a few minutes. I called down to the front desk, they said that they would send someone up from security to fill out a report, but a repair guy showed up. The repair guy then had to call in security because the desk attendant apparently failed. Both the repair guy and the security officer were awesome, funny guys and they got everything taken care of, the hotel staff though didn't seem to care that one of it's guests was electrocuted in one of their rooms. Won't be staying here again simply for the neglegence of the hospitality staff.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: PeterW1967
Reviews.Content: check-in and check-out took awhile but staff was friendly I had a renovated widescreen room which was clean. It's more a hotel for family with lil kids The best buffet I ate at But good hotel for the price I paid sept 2009

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: bluevegas981
Reviews.Content: great hotel =great location-staff were great = tip,sign up for comps card lots of freebies==great hotel for kids

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for price”
Reviews.Author: MGoose1215
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed one night at Excalibur. The check in line was super long (which we expected as the hotel offers the lowest priced rooms on the strip), but moved at a good pace. We probably only waited in line for 15 - 20 minutes. Our room was not one of the newly renovated rooms, so it was dated, and the carpet had some stains, but it was very clean and the beds were very comfortable. Dicks is a lot of fun, and the hotel/casino is very easy to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur Hotel, Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: dancinglawyer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 28/09/11 - 06/10/11. We booked a standard room but got upgraded to a widescreen room in Tower 2. We also received some free passes to the Round Table Buffet. The staff were helpful, and friendly. The room was kept spic and span. Very good view from our room of NY NY, MGM etc. We were on the 18th floor and heard no noise from adjacent rooms or the casino/strip. Room was comfortable - 2 large beds, a huge shower, wide screen tv, a table and two chairs, pictures on the walls, lots of storage space and lighting. Beds were very comfortable. Only complaint would be the air conditioning unit got quite noisy and there is no full length mirror.
