It's a great location on the strip with easy access to neighboring hotels and a free tram to Luxor/Mandalay Bay. There are also Deuce stops right outside. The hotel itslef is quite striking and stands out from a lot of the others! The Round Table Buffet was fab value. Breakfast was a great meal to have at this hotel. Casino is large and vibrant. Dick's Last Resort is definitely worth a visit, even if you aren't staying at the hotel. There is a Food Court with Krispy Kreme, McDonalds, Starbucks etc. You can get free wifi up there. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip To Vegas”
Reviews.Author: kitstar
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, little old and dated compared to some of the more modern ones but very affordable for its location. We had booked a standard room with a view and did the $20 sandwich and managed to get upgraded to a Widescreen Room with a View in Tower II which was great. We had friends in the other Tower in the standard rooms and the difference was very noticeable. The casino was friendly and there was a good variety of shops although if you didn't want the buffet breakfast your choice was limited to sticky donuts and pretzels etc so every morning we walked to the Luxor and went to MacDonalds there. Although if you go onto the strip breakfast is much cheaper, it depends how much time you have. No Wifi, which was disappointing unless you went to the Krispy Kreme shop where there was a hot spot. If you gamble at the tables the hostesses will bring you drink and you just need to tip them maybe a dollar each time and then you don't pay for the drink which is great if you are on the table a while. Roulette is what we played most of the time. The pools are nice there are 4 only 3 were open when we were there. One of the pools has a slide which is great fun especially if you have kids with you. We had a car and parking was free and easy to find there is also a free Valet Service there. There is a daily resort fee plus tax but I expected that. It is worth joining their mailing group before booking as well as I got an extra 20% off when I initially booked. I would definitely recommend staying here as a cheap way to stay on the strip

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: fishingEastBAy
Reviews.Content: My child and I stayed here for two nights, the bedroom was very comfortable and quiet. We will return again. On negative point was the check in and check out line at the front desk was extremely slow. During last check out on August 2011 , it took me more than 15 minutes standing in line.

Reviews.Title: “Bring good walking shoes!”
Reviews.Author: TorontoRobDT
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during the first week of October and found it to be a lovely hotel. As with any Strip hotel the lobby and the elevator bank to the room is always a hike through the casino and then there it is. Here, it was a long walk and then when I got to my floor, my long walk continued way down a long hallway, LOL! Not bad for me, but if you are using a walker or other mobility device, ask to be put close to the elevator. The room was very clean and the cleaning staff did a good job of attending the room daily. My friend was on another floor and found though that even with the "Privacy" sign hanging on the door, the cleaning staff still entered. On that note as well, the only concern was that there was not dead bolt or secondary lock on the door. My room was large, big king bed, table and I faced West with no view of the strip. There was wired high speed internet and what I loved was that calls to anywhere in the US or Canada were free! That was a plus. In the mornings to get to the food court meant a long walk again through the casino, up an escalator and then to the food court. Though very minor, it would have been nice to have some more food choice options a bit closer to the elevator bank in Tower 2. There was a small coffee kiosk there but that only offered muffins, no bagel or other breakfast items. Being a non-smoker, I found that even though I was on a non-smoking floor, smoke still managed to seep into my room. The windows opened a little so that solved this problem. Note, Vegas has no non-smoking laws so keep this in mind if you plan to travel to any Strip hotel. All the casinos are filled with second-hand smoke---no getting around it. As I mentioned, asking for a non-smoking floor and opening the window should help with this. Front desk staff were nice on check-in, on check-out I found the person a little distant but at 5am, she was probably just tired. Would I stay here again-- most definitely. It was at the South end of the Strip and with some good running shoes, I was able to walk everywhere I wanted to go. Plus, the taxi to the airport from there was very cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience for the money”
Reviews.Author: Mira G
Reviews.Content: Stayed twice this summer. It was awesome accomodation for the price 25$/night. The best about this hotel is the great pool area and perfect location right on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: sharon p
Reviews.Content: hotel was good, room was good huge bed cleaned everyday. large flat screen tv. theres a food court with a donut place and pizza hut and all the usual food stuff.Hotel quite central on the strip next to the better hotels.

Reviews.Title: “my sister and i recently stayed at the excalibur,lovely room,good atmosphere, not too big,good entertainmentwe arrived ,”
Reviews.Author: patricia m
Reviews.Content: also good choice of shops, and near new york,new york,and m.g.m grand. only negative is the resort fee.totally not worth it.for us anyway.we arrived at 10pm.shattered from travelling from scotland,had a nap.woke up at 3am. went out and there was still a buzz.went to denny,s to eat,lovely service and food yummy.great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: joliver1000
Reviews.Content: Overall, it was a good experience at this property. Bring your own 4-cup coffeemaker from home if you are a coffee drinker. There are coffee shops on the ground floor of each tower of rooms, and a center Starbucks operation. However, the lines are very long in the morning, and you have to leave your room and walk so far just for a $3 - $6 cup of morning Java; it can literally be an hour-long ordeal. There is a Baja Fresh in the hotel, so you can get a quick light meal and don't need to deal with overindulgent buffets or the crowds. Check-in and out went smoothly and quickly. Room was exceptionally clean, and when we needed extra items, housekeeping responded quickly. The beds are heavenly!

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Stuart S
Reviews.Content: We stayed a couple of nights with kids and overall was a very good place to stay in a town not set up for kids. We were given a room in tower II as it was near pool which the kids loved. It has 4 pool areas including a water slide. There is also a kids arcade which kept them entertained. We ate at the buffets on most occasions as this was the easiest option for the kids. We were able to use our daily buffet pass at either Excalibur or Luxor. Excalibur is close to the main area of the strip and connects to other hotels locations by walkways etc. We found the staff were friendly and helpful and had no problems at all.

Reviews.Title: “the best”
Reviews.Author: elva l
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas never ceases to amaze me. We go gambling there twice a year. By far the Excalibur is the best place to stay, and to gamble. Wouldn't think of staying anywhere is. Go Castle.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: MANDY082
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights here - great rooms, hotel, buffett and great access to luxor/mandalay/mgm/new york new york on travelator/walkways in hotel and great location lovely large pools also!

Reviews.Title: “On the south end of The Strip”
Reviews.Author: TomLynnMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Booked one night online more that a month out. Quoted $35.84, paid by credit card. On check-in found that there was a room tax of 12%, a resort fee of $12.50, and Resort fee tax of 12% All up total of $50 Had a room on the 27th floor which was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Resort fees should not be a surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Michael E
Reviews.Content: Get a clue, folks! Resort fees are here to stay - and the Excalibur isn't the only casino that charges them. In fact, the $ 12.50/day (plus taxes) that the Excalibur charges is one of the LOWEST rates on the Strip! Most casinos charge upwards of 20 bucks a day. It is the newest trend that Vegas hotels/casinos can grab some extra money from you. Sure other casinos may give you a little more in amenities for the extra fee, but just about all hotels/casinos are charging them. So don't include this complaint in your posts when reviewing your experience here. If you have complaints about dirty rooms, poor service, or some other problem it's fair game. But don't base your grade based on resort fees that any knowledgable Vegas tripper should already know about!!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Gummycandy
Reviews.Content: Overall, the rooms are not as bad as I expected, they appear to have been updated in the last few years. However, this hotel is a smoker's dream. Even non-smoking rooms reek. If you are expecting a warm welcome and to be treated super-special, this ain't the place. It's a bargain spot with few amenities. If you are willing to skip some plushness, the midweek rates are a deal. Otherwise, spend a few more bucks and get something nicer at MGM or Mandalay.

Reviews.Title: “Second time staying. Won't do it again.”
Reviews.Author: CConn
Reviews.Content: If one is required to pay a resort fee, they could at least give you an idea of what it includes. Rooms good size, and I had a nice view. The pillows were nice and abundant, but that is the only good about it. Beds hard, no blankets or comforter, just two sheets that were worn and torn. No coffee maker. Toilet paper and face tissue was rough and soooo thin. Room temp controls are either hot or cold. Don't even attempt to eat buffet food. Sad when kids won't even eat dessert. Just gets worse as years go by.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and nice”
Reviews.Author: nikoned b
Reviews.Content: it's on the south side of the strip but not far from all the attractions the room is basic, neat, comfortable, big. we has a view to the New-York Roller coasterת MGM and strip on the registration I got an upgrade to a room on higher level with a view even though I paid for something more simple

Reviews.Title: “FREE UPGRADE”
Reviews.Author: daytripper041152
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week from 22 sept. got a free upgrade to tower 2, and a reduction on the resort fee from $14.50 per day to $5.00 per day we didn`t ask for these , thank you brenda on check in. Room clean ,no view other than a roof. No coffee making facilities in the room.Pity Plenty of free drinks as long as you are feeding the machines. Bar prices are a joke. Get the deuce (express) bus to fremont st. Check out BIG ELVIS at Bills casino & bar a great afternoons entertainment, avoid COOK E JARRE at the same venue,crap..... Try the buffet at Paris fantastic includes free drinks. Gladys knight was superb, get your tickets from ticks 4 tonight on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Very impersonal”
Reviews.Author: kajj21
Reviews.Content: On a recent bus trip, we were to stay at Bally's or similar. The GetAmerica Tours booked the Excalibur and we were very disappointed when we got there. Firstly, the tour check in was closed and we had to walk through the smokey casino with our luggage to the general registration desk. The clerks wanted us to sign a paper and give ID but the tour guide was trying to explain that the rooms were already pre-booked and paid for. He had to talk to the manager to straighten it out. When we did get to our room, the carpet was wet with towels on the floor and keys were still on the table in the room. We weren't sure if the people had actually checked out yet. When we called down to the desk, eventually they said to leave the keys on the table and a bellhop would bring up new keys for the new room. We expect that a previous guest had left for another room and left their keys in the room. Wouldn't you omit that room from being booked that night??? The other disappointment was the line for the buffet - the clerk was very impersonal and just wanted our money. Can't complain about the food but we never did see our waiter so couldn't order a drink if we wanted one. Vegas was wonderful -- enjoyed Bally's on the last day of the tour which we booked ourselves - good location and view!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best weekend in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Leonard J
Reviews.Content: It been two years since I last stay at the excalibur. We went back for three days this past weekend and had the best time every in vegas.We have plan to go to 3 different casinos ,but was having so much fun at excalibur ,we didn't go anywhere else.The entertainment , shopping , and dinning was off the chart. I had a few issues and the staff at excalibur took care of me right away . NO HASSLE . Excalibur ,you and your staff was great and I will be coming back again. Thank you for a great time.

Reviews.Title: “What do you expect!?”
Reviews.Author: Andy B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is comfortable and basic. For the money you pay to stay here you cannot complain. My room did not have a view but I'm not in Vegas to look out of windows! If you want a view go up the top of Paris or any walkover bridge! Next door to New York New York, and opposite MGM Grand, 2 great hotels. This is my first review of a hotel as I was fed up of reading bad reviews...what did they expect for the money!! It's not the Wynn! To sum it up, good price, good location and comfortable room.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur is the place to stay in vegas!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: janette c
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay while visiting in las vegas.The atmosphere is great the eating places in the casino are great people are just wonderful. This is our number one hotel we stay at everytime we visit las vegas. The casino is great pay back on the slots are good.

Reviews.Title: “Good For The Price”
Reviews.Author: artiepea
Reviews.Content: First of all the price of this hotel was outstanding. The room was clean and the bed was somewhat comfortable. We upgraded to the widescreen view room. It was worth the few extra dollars. The service was great, the staff was very friendly. The location was just ok. Even though it was on the strip I found myself going on a journey to find good food and entertainment. All in all I would say it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: mosleyshl
Reviews.Content: Checked in on a Monday about 6;45 pm not to long of a lines.Received free upgrade to Tower Two,very nice room,although housekeeping was lacking,never vacuumed or swept bathroom floor, not once during our 5 day stay.We were on the 5th floor very quiet,no view,but that was ok. Negative too far to carry bags and have to go thru the casino to get to registration desk,not fun.Did have to pay a resort fee.Tribute to the Bee Gees concert was excellent!!! Heard people say buffet not very good,we did not eat there.Not sure if we would stay there again due to location.Dicks last Resort a lot of fun,must have a sense of humor,nice band.

Reviews.Title: “After the fees,you could stay at a nicer place”
Reviews.Author: meanestmom
Reviews.Content: Just got home today and its not a bad hotel but I probably would not stay here if I had to stay in a standard room. We asked for a upgraded room in tower 2 and was charged $60.00 for 3 nights and then charged $14.00 a night for their resort fees.We didnt use the gym,and the big pool was closed and I feel the resort fees are a total rip-off. For the $, We could have stayed at a way nicer place in a better location...If this hotel was my only choice,I would stay again but next time I will research the price of all the fees and stay at a nicer place..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Casino”
Reviews.Author: wolfetone
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Vegas and stayed in the wonderful Excalibur. I can't understand all the negative reviews that are posted for the Excalibur. This hotel is great value for money. Hotel: Check in took 10 minutes ( saturday evening) and I was upgraded ,for free, to Tower 2. Room was spotless and bed was so comfortable. Maid service was excellent. No view of strip (2nd floor) but who cares, didn't spend much time in the room. Plenty of places to eat and even at 4.00am, was able to get a Hotdog and a beer for €5. Cocktail waitresses are brilliant, just tip a dollar for every drink and they will remember you and keep comin' back to you. Security was great. Didn't see any trouble for the five days that I was there, even at all hours of the morning. Lovely party atmosphere, great live music in various bars. Mixed crowd of all ages. Great location, it takes about 15 mins to walk to central strip. Casino: I did gamble alot in the Excalibur and other Casinos. Didn't win anything but plenty of low limit tables (€5) available in the Excalibur at any time of the day. Out of all the casinos that I played in, which was a lot, the Excalibur was the best, especially the Blackjack tables and video poker. Slots weren't great. All the staff in the casino were so friendly and helpful. Overall I would recommend the Excalibur to anyone. This was my first time in VEGAS and I would definitely go back to the Excalibur. By the way, it was not crawling with kids. I don't understand why anyone would bring kids to Vegas, but if you have to, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed from last time here!!!”
Reviews.Author: kok0222
Reviews.Content: First, McDonalds is closed for remodeling from September 12-October 2 the closest McDonalds is over at the Luxor or north of MGM on the strip. Second, The two Starbucks could not use my giftcards dueto technical difficulties with the network involving the giftcards. Third, if you have to cash in a ticket at the cashier cage by the Tower II and you see the cashier by the name of Jenny ask for or go to a different cashier or go to the cash kiosk because she is one RUDE cashier or LAZY person!!!!!! I was disappointed because I brought gift cards with me for McDonalds and had to "hike" to the nearest McDonalds to use them and Starbucks I wasn't even able to use the giftcard because of whatever was going on with "technical difficulties".

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Money”
Reviews.Author: july71RoyseCity
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights at the Excalibur and cannot have one complaint. The inside of the hotel is a little dready however, my room was great. Updated, modern, stayed at tower 2. The maid service was wonderful. Good location, fast, early check in. Must say no more, I loved it and won't think about it twice to stay in this hotel. Especially for the price in Vegas, you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Erin C
Reviews.Content: This is a cheap and average located hotel - only good for being close to the airport. If you are looking for a cheaper hotel you are better off staying in the Imperial Palace, which is located opposite Caesars Palace in the middle of the strip and has the monorail at the back for access to other locations. It also offers Wifi!!! This hotel charges you a small print $12 a day charge for internet, newspaper which we never saw and TV. The flaw in this plan is that (1) you may not want any of this, (2) its not wifi so can only be used with a laptop (most people these days have smart phones and iPads etc), and (3) everywhere else gives you free tv access and cheaper wifi internet access. The rooms do come with air conditioning but this is the noisiest thing we had ever heard and makes the room like a wind tunnel. In Vegas shop around there are other cheaper hotels offering very good rates and you can even get good rates at places like the Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Listen to Bad Reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Amanda B
Reviews.Content: Before my week long stay at Excalibur, I was a little worried after reading some of the bad reviews on here....utter rubbish! People are so ungrateful for the amount of effort such a large hotel puts into making it a personal experience for their customers! When we arrived, there was three or so members of staff in the foyer ready to help and asking us where we from and if we had a nice journey etc. We then got a free room upgrade with a beautiful view! I have been to Vegas before and stayed in much more expensive hotels and this was by far the best. Brilliant atmosphere and all the staff were very welcoming and friendly! Also there WAS internet access, it's just wired not wifi but i'm sure in time they will switch. Rooms were very clean and maintained daily! Excellent location as well for the strip and the airport. Great stay and a great holiday, I miss it already! Excellent hotel and you honestly could not get any better for such a cheap price...BARGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “Just returned from Excalibur 9/26-9/29”
Reviews.Author: sydmoal
Reviews.Content: Upgraded room #12-2-17; overall room had a great view of New York-New York; bed comfortable, requested extra pillows; room smelled a little musty/moldy and smokey, even though the room was to be non-smoking; bathroom tile floor was over caulked and it showed, initially I thought the floor was dirty but it was poor workmanship; the bathroom mirror and drip lighting was contemporary; shower was outdated with frosted glass and metal plated door handles; bathroom counter top was granite, not sure why they stopped at the countertop? flat screen 40" TV mounted to the wall, poor quality picture, not sure if it needed to be hooked up to a HDMI cable? multiple channels to choose from; I too was concerned about the $14 per day resort fee, not quite sure what it was for?? the internet never worked. We did not eat at the Hotel, we ventured out of the hotel; lastly the smoke is a killer at the hotel in the casino, casino's definitely cater to the smokers so get prepared for your clothes, hair, etc to be doosed in smoke. Overall good time, would return as it was a great value.

Reviews.Title: “resort fee but no internet”
Reviews.Author: Charlene H
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was nice, older but not too bad. The beds and pillows where awesome. The problem I see is that you pay 12.00 per day for a resort fee that is supposed to include internet in the room. This was stated on the westjet vacations and the Excalibur website but when I tried to log into the internet I had to pay a daily fee. When I asked what the resort fee was for, the desk said it is for cable tv. YOU'RE KIDDING RIGHT? Nope, dead serious. I have checked the two sites again and both state internet in the room. I've email Excalibur regarding this but have yet to hear from them. The buffet is well worth the $34 a day ....morning lunch and dinner included and a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel on the strip - thoroughly recommended”
Reviews.Author: jander11
Reviews.Content: Having heard mixed reviews about Excalibur I wasn't sure what to expect - but was very happy with our 5 night stay here!!! On the strip itself (next door to New York New York and opposite MGM Grand) this hotel is great value for money - we had the basic Tower Room (no breakfast, but not a big deal as plenty of food outlets in the hotel and nearby on the strip). Large clean bedrooms, decent pool (to be fair if you're in Vegas during the week, the pool at Caesars is free and we went there most days but did enjoy an afternoon at the Excalibur pool), fun casino (not too big and definitely not claustrophobic or antiquated like some of the hotels), excellent 24hr starbucks near Tower 1. Quiet hotel - I was never woken up due to noise and I'm a fussy and light sleeper! I would not hesitate to stay here again - great value for money in the main area of the strip - great stay - thank you Excalibur :)

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Thestens
Reviews.Content: After reading about this hotel I wasn;t expecting a lot, but it was cheap for a one night stop off in Vegas on the way to LA. Check in was about 10 mins and the clerk was really nice,giving us a room with a Jacuzzi and table and armchairs for no extra cost! The room was big with a view and the jacuzzi. The bed was very comfortable. Everything was very clean. There were lots of towels and toiletries. I am not an expert on luxury hotels and I suppose some people might consider it a bit old fashioned? However, it more than hit the spot for us. The resort charge is annoying, though. Why do they do that??? I have never heard of it in UK.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for this hotel”
Reviews.Author: BCNina
Reviews.Content: The Excalibur is located at the south end of the strip across from the Tropicana and New York New York hotel. The hotel is not luxurious but well worth it. I found the hotel room clean and comfortable. I opted for the $5 a day internet e-uprade which gave us a bigger room and queen beds. The only complaints I have was that the restaurants in the casino is being upgraded thus they were closed. We also took in the Tournament of Kings dinner show which we also enjoyed very much. Since the hotel is on the strip, it is near the RTC and Deuce bus system. You can go up the strip with them for just $2 or a day pass for $5. Very convenient. The Hotel is very bustling on the weekends and a bit more quieter on weekdays. If you expect fancy, this is not the hotel for you. But it is comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “I was surprised, in a good way.”
Reviews.Author: Joe215ca
Reviews.Content: I came here for a wedding, and I never had a good perception of Excalibur from the outside. I have been to Planet Hollywood and Treasure Island twice before this trip. Excalibur was a great price, it was very clean, the rooms were modern, and the hotel was very quiet. What more could you want? The pool area had some great drinks and it wasn't crowded. One silly thing is the pool chairs have metal frames. Sure, it looks nicer, however they get so hot you burn yourself on them. The wedding chapel was also really nice, and the service was very well said.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, Good position”
Reviews.Author: AKsadvice
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Excalibur for a week when visiting from England, we come to Vegas often and Excalibur is a good place to stay as it is in a good position and value for money. The remodeld rooms are Ok but the blinds dont meet in the middle so the light comes in and wakes you up. They only have showers so no nice soak in the bath, weekends are full of young people getting drunk but the whole area is the same. On the plus side the hotel is linked to about 6 other properties within the chain so you can eat anywhere and book it to your room. The rooms are clean and food is cheap, you are at the top end of the strip and hotels around this one can be expensive, you can stay cheap and live the high life in the more expensive ones if you want to.

Reviews.Title: “Best location for the money”
Reviews.Author: StanimirB
Reviews.Content: It was 4 of us and we stayed at Excalibur for 3 nights. Amazing 3 nights in Las Vegas. The hotel is nothing special inside. The casino is a bit dark and dirty, the staff could be more pleasant and polite, the security could be more strict, the food could be better. The good part of this hotel is its location - at the beginning of the strip, and its price. I wasn't ablt to find cheaper decent hotel on the strip. Don't expect luxury, this place is for people who don't plan to stay in their hotel, but to explore Las Vages during the day and the night. Before agreeing on going on Time Share presentation, make sure you have enough time to loose with that. Coz, even though they say it takes 2h, it actually takes 4+. Well, you loose your time, but you get your discounted tickets for an MGM show :).

Reviews.Title: “Poor Experience”
Reviews.Author: TopSecretTourist
Reviews.Content: We booked at Excalibur as part of an "inexpensive" deal through Expedia. What a mistake. Our first experience was a massive line to check in. That followed with a room with a view of a brick wall and broken air conditioning. Thankfully, we were able to get another room (Tower 1). They do have remodeled rooms available - for an upcharge. My guess is Tower 2 may be the newer rooms. I couldn't believe the smell of the place. A combination of cigarette smoke, a basement and some terrible "hide over" fragrance. Internet access is $15 a day as well. If you know what staying at a run down Motel is like, that is how Excalibur is.

Reviews.Title: “Great value on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: sjs9807
Reviews.Content: Excalibur Hotel and Casino is a great place to stay on the strip if you don't want to spend a lot of money. If you're in Vegas you really don't spend that much time in your room, so fancy ammenities aren't necessary. It's in a great location, connected to NYNY and MGM via an above the street walkway, making it super easy to move from casino to casino. I'd recommend booking a wide screen room, those rooms are the newest ones they have and they've done a good job with them. They position security guards in the elevator lobbies to the rooms making sure you show your room key before heading up, a great, secure feeling. The casino is inviting and fun, and if you want a quick and easy breakfast before heading out, make sure to go upstairs and hit Krispy Kreme Donuts. Yumm!!!

Reviews.Title: “check your beds”
Reviews.Author: allsunnydaze
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our three sons stayed at the Excalibur Sept 19 to the 22nd. We were there for my eldest son's 27th birthday and my youngest son's 21st birthday. My husband and I stayed in one room, the boys in another. We were surprised that our rooms were quite nice - better than our last stay at NY NY. Every surface was dirty, walls, doors, windows, and especially the carpets - the worst in the hallways and elevators. They had a nice selection of slot machines. The buffet is a 3 on a scale of 1-10. We were fairly happy with our visit until the last day. The day before one of my son's had found a couple of sores that we thought were mosquito bites. When he woke up on the 22nd, he had at least 6 bites on his face, under his chin, and on his neck, more on his back, and a few on his arms and legs. They are big, red, itchy, swollen bumps. I went to talk to management and they shuffled me away from other customers, took a report, took pictures, and said someone from risk management would get in touch with me next week. That's it. They did give us a list of clinics we could take him to, but we did not rent a car this trip, they were far away, and we had to be at the airport in 2 hours. From what I understand, it's likely I won't hear back from them, or if I do, they will say they checked out the room and there's nothing wrong. From other review sites (that I wished I had read BEFORE booking the rooms), Excalibur has a bed bug problem. Also, as soon as we got home I called the risk management department to let them know the boys also had a roll-away bed in their room and should be checked and not given to another customer. I was told the person handling our case would be gone until Monday - three days later - and there was nothing they could do.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Tmopks
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a week-long professional course, and chose to stay at the Excalibur due to its low mid-week rates ($25-$35 Sun -Thurs) and its location on the Strip. This was actually the 5th or 6th time I've stayed here over the course of 15 years, and every stay has been a good experience. The rooms are clean and updated, the service is efficient, and the hotel offers a good mix of dining and shopping. As a business traveler, the hotel's close proximity to the airport, I-15 and the strip is very convenient. Excalibur does charge a $14 per night resort fee that adds a hefty charge to the final bill, but considering that this fee includes parking, in-room internet access and free local and long-distance calls, it is probably only slightly exorbitant. (But in a town where almost everything seems overpriced, what can you expect?) For a traveler wanting a safe, clean, convenient and fun place to stay in Vegas at a minimal price, I really don't think Excalibur can be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur Hotel was disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: TexieKilleen-TX
Reviews.Content: The employees we encountered were very rude and not helpful. The room was an "upgrade" however, I don't know what it could have possible been upgraded from. No coffee maker, No refrig, and no microwave. Will never stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “The Excalibur - great value but looks a bit cheap.”
Reviews.Author: kvg3879
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Excalibur at the end of our holiday touring around. We hadn't planned to go back to Vegas but did and wanted somewhere cheap to stay and this was the place. We had previously mocked the outside as looking rather cheap. It has obviously been designed to attract families who take their children with them to Vegas. The bars and food outlets were akin to what you would expect in an 18 - 30's resort. That said the pools (4 of them I think) were really nice and there was one area where children were not allowed. In addition our room was great but what I genuinely think made us take a somewhat negative view was that at the start of the trip we had stayed at the MGM. All in we would stay there again but if we did it would be based on price and not necessarily choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise!”
Reviews.Author: spankygem
Reviews.Content: We checked in and got upgraded to a widescreen room for free which was great. We asked for a view of the strip and were lucky enough to get one. The lady at the checkin desk was very helpful. Bit of a queue but we werent waiting more then 15 minutes. The room was fine, clean and big. The cleaning everyday wasn't great, all they really did was make the bed, they didnt take away dirty glasses etc but the cleaning staff were very helpful and if you wanted a lie in in the mornings they would clean your room later in the day when you had gone out. The AC was pretty noisey but you get used to it as its a continuous hum. The casino was just like any other! The pool was nice, although the biggest one was closed on the day we went down, maybe because it was midweek? The buffet wasn't great but didn't make me sick like I have read on some other reviews. The one compliant i have is the smell, everyone on here says it's smoke but it's not! It's like a fake orangey smell they pump in to cover the smell of smoke I guess? Much better then actually smelling smoke granted but it could get pretty overpowering! Overall I would recommend this hotel, it did the trick. We were really nervous after reading bad reviews but don't let them put you off! If you can get it it's a good price to stay at the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur Hotel was our first choice - Not Next Time - Be careful of what you are charged”
Reviews.Author: Chr1st1nec
Reviews.Content: On checking out of the hotel today I was asked to pay for our stay minus the deposit we had paid on booking. I explained to the check out assistant I had paid the $40.00 room upgrade in cash to (Alexandria) the check in assistant - who I thought was very helpful - this was clearly marked on the paper I had to initial twice and sign. I asked the check out assistant to check the paper but she refused stating if I do not have a receipt then I could not have paid this. -- PLease be careful.

Reviews.Title: “Older Property. Good Rates. Overall Decent Experience.”
Reviews.Author: Aaron R
Reviews.Content: Good location on the Strip. The "Resort Fee" will kill you, however. The food was decent. The rooms were good. Overall, it is just a middle-of-the-road hotel by Vegas standards, but it is in a safe area, and the prices are right. So all in all, I would stay there again. Plus, it attaches to the Luxor, so you can get around quite easily.

Reviews.Title: “excalibur hotel”
Reviews.Author: badger04_11
Reviews.Content: Room was clean, 2 huge comfy beds, large bathroom but only had a large shower, no bath. Views over Luxor hotel and Mandalay bay hotel-on 20th floor. Lift was large, fast and quiet. Staff very friendly and hotel ideally situated with a free tram running to Luxor and Mandalay bay.Close proximity to MGM Grand, New York New York, Tropicana and Monte Carlo. Breakfast buffet not the best, try Mandalay Bay instead or the Mirage- much classier with a better choice of food. Shame room didn't have tea/ coffee making facilities, maybe if we had asked for an upgrade we would have got them

Reviews.Title: “Good Value..”
Reviews.Author: annhMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur for 4 nights and were happy enough with the room and the facilities provided by the hotel. The location was OK - there was lots to see and do in and around the hotel , but it's at the south end of a very long strip - so be prepared to do a lot of walking ... The room we had was on floor 27 . It was clean and comfortable , and our view was interesting as we got to see the many many planes take off and land at the airport! The hotel has an excellent pool ( which we didn't get the chance to use - but were charged a facility fee ) . The buffet was extensive and catered for everyone. The casino was - a casino!. I felt there appeared to be a smell of stale smoke in the air throughout this hotel , but my husband didn't agree .. All in all we enjoyed our stay at the Excalibur , but if we returned to Vegas , I would spend a few more dollars and go further up the Strip. That in no way is a critcism of the hotel - just the location .

Reviews.Title: “Unclean and outdated. Not what I expected in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Ems_S28
Reviews.Content: Very unimpressed with this hotel. Rooms were grotty and shabby with broken lamp shades and marked walls. Beds were grubby and the towels were disgusting. Each day new towels were left in our room but each had the same horrible smell that the previous ones had! I understand that this is a cheaper hotel than some in Vegas but I still expect a certain standard of cleanliness. Afterall, this is still one of the rather large hotels based on the main strip.

Reviews.Title: “Not Good!”
Reviews.Author: SusanOshawa
Reviews.Content: Just came back after spending a week at this place. My husband and I are seniors and the price sounded right for us, we were upgraded to a wide screen room without asking which I thought was just great, however the room was not good, the carpets were filthy the furniture old and worn, the bedcover was all stained with what I do not care to think!, dirty water kept coming up in the shower, and the toilet would not fill properly. None of these thingswere fixed for us and I could not wait to leave. Please think very carefully before you book at this place, I would not recommend it to anyone, You are also constantly pestered by people trying to sell you show tickets, they will not leave you alone and pop out from eveywhere, all-in-all a very bad experience. We would NEVER RETURN!!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price.”
Reviews.Author: cndguy25
Reviews.Content: I just came back yesterday from the Excalibur after a three night stay, and I must say this hotel was above satisfactory. It has a large arcade which is great for kids, great pool with different section's so there is something for everybody whether you like fun times, or relaxing time's. Good location, however it is near the south end of the strip, if you pay a little more for somewhere like the Flamingo you will be much more central, but still plenty to do and see around the excalibur area. The only thing i didn't like is they ding you with a mandatory $42 facility fee to use the pool, gym, phone, internet. But overall I would say this place is a good bang for your buck and I would consider staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Kenneth D
Reviews.Content: This resort is situated quite far up in the strip. This was my first time in Vegas so I don't have much to compare against (compared to all my previous hotel visits around the world, this is by far the best). Fantastic room, boring view (the back side of the castle). The casino looked like every other casino on the strip (except less dancers). The pool area was great, but the food was really boring if you order it by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: LuLuEdinburgh_10
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Excaliber for 10 nights in September 2011.This hotel was the only one on the strip in our price range and we were a bit worried after reading some of the reviews. We only waited 5 mins to check in we were upgraded for the 10 nights to a tower 2 room for free and also given half price resort fees from a lovley receptionist.We were on the 25th floor our room and bathroom was spotless the corriders were hoovered everyday and we were provided with loads of clean towels for 3 women every day.This hotel is in a great location and not overcrowded outside . Thankyou Excaliber we had a great holiday we also did not have to check out we were told everything was fine and just leave the key cards in the room, if ever in Vegas again we will return to stay with you.

Reviews.Title: “My daughters were Princesses”
Reviews.Author: Momof2gurls
Reviews.Content: We stayed here and my daughters got to feel like princesses. They had so much fun. We went to the Tournament of Kings and all four of my kids got into the show. It was fun to watch. Similiar to Medieval Times, but still different. Our Knight won which made my daughters happy. The hotel was clean and fun and in close proximaty with other hotels and great activities. I definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: Helenfs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur hotel for our honeymoon in June this year. We arrived to reception after a very long flight and the check in assistant was so very friendly and helpful! We got upgraded to a widescreen room on the 27th floor free of charge. The room was huge in comparison to what we get in Northern Ireland with the biggest bed I've ever slept in! It was so comfy and had all what you needed. I found it hard to use the tv as it was a bit tempermental! There was an iron, ironing board, ipod dock, air con! What else could you ask for?? The bathroom was also huge! The maid service was excellent, towels changed every day and bed made up. Fresh towels provided when using the pool and lots of sunbeds available! The all you can eat buffet is well worth the money with plenty of choice. We loved the McDonalds, Pizza Hut and Krispy Kreme!! I would receommend staying at the Excalibur to anyone! Great location also! The only thing I would say is we found alcoholic drinks in and out of the hotel to be rather expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur- You get what youve paid for.”
Reviews.Author: Gregyb
Reviews.Content: I chose the Excalibur to stay for 7 nights in Las vegas in September 11, reason i chose it was because of the great location and unbeatable price. I read tripadvisor reports on all hotels i visit and i take all reviews i read with a pinch of salt, the reviews i read before i arrived at the Excalibur werent great but i was more then happy with the Hotel during and after my stay. The facilities are decent , plenty of food options and its very close to some of the other big casino Hotels. I find ( working in a Hotel myself) that people will complain about anything and tend to exagerrate there complaints alot but again everyone is entitled to there own opinion. All in all if you are looking for a decent strip hotel with decent facilities for an excellent price, then i would reccommened the Excalibur.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: rabcaz007
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Excalibur at the start of September for 10 nights. This is the second time we have stayed and had no hesitation in going back.The Hotel is in a superb location at the bottom of the Strip and is close to the MGM Grand, New York New York, The Luxor and Mandalay Bay. All the hotels are part of the same group and you can access them without any problems. The Excalibur has got one of the cheesier themes of the Strip hotels and it certainly lacks some of the quality of the others but you get what you pay for and it represents great value for money. The room we had was large with two queen sized beds and a large bathroom/shower room. The decor is a bit on the tired side but it is clean with the towels and bed linen changed daily if you request it. There is a large pool area with plenty of loungers. Even during the Labour day holiday weekend when the hotel was very busy, there was no problems in getting a good place at the pool. There is a spa/gym which we didnt use, but it offers all the usual facilities and treatments. We were in Tower 1 which has a bit of trek to the pool so if possible try and get a room in Tower 2. One annoying aspect of the hotel is the number of times you get stopped by staff looking to sell you show tickets or meals. This is common to all hotel in Las Vegas, not just the Excalibur but it gets to be a real nuisance. A good tip is to split up when walking through the Casino as they tend to only target couples. There's a variety of bars and eating places in the hotel which again represent decent value for money in Las Vegas. The pound doesn't go as far as it used to in the US at the moment and any time you can get good value you should go for it. All in all we had a good experience at the Excalibur and whilst we might try one of the other hotels in the furture, I wouldn't have any issue with recommending this for a no frills location

Reviews.Title: “DONT STAY THERE---RESORT FEES”
Reviews.Author: Brian H
Reviews.Content: check in was fast, however the clerk didnt tell us about the resort fees, neither did our travel agent, but thats another matter. We found out when checking out, that $98 was added to our expenses for "resort fees", this was for the free daily newspaper, which you can buy for $1, it also includes local and national calls, well local calls are free anyway, it dont even include the fitness spa, thats another $10 just to use the gym. The check out girl was the most rudest [--] i ever met Resort fees are $14 a day. For Las Vegas hotels that dont charge this fee, then google 'Las Vegas resort fees' and lets all boycott these rip off hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: tttoojftrndmd
Reviews.Content: This is are third time staying here , as we travel to Vegas often and have stated at alot of different hotels, this would not be are first choice but we we with are kids 14 and10 and they love the Theme of the hotel,upon check in I hid a 20 dollar bill between my I'd and asked the girl for a pool side view with a view room worked like a charm and saved myself 150 dollars in upgrade ,this is the only hotel that I have found that allows you to bring outside drinks in the pool area as long as you use cups so you save a bundle there ,location is great across from MGM plus you can cathch the tram next door at Monte Carlo all the way to bellagio ,dicks restaurant was fun for the family ,in all this is the best value for money hotel on the strip and I have done my homework ...have fun

Reviews.Title: “Outdated, inconvenient and uninformed”
Reviews.Author: William1600
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Excalibur because I needed to be near Mandalay Bay for a convention. It was my last choice. It is outdated, dark and reeks of stale cigarette smoke. The check-in took about twenty to thirty minutes. I asked for an upgrade and was placed on the 26 floor of Tower I. The upgrade was the view.......of the airport! The furnishings were dated and looked like they had seen better days. The sheer fact they had wired internet should embarrass them. The concierge had an attitude when I asked about printing my boarding pass. I refused to pay five dollars for 30 seconds worth of computer time. It was nice they supply a daily newspaper. However, you have to trek down to the gift shop to pick it up yourself. The staff didn't even know the McDonald's in the food court was closed for renovation. The lack of decent food options was disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Diane79764
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out our Vegas trip was amazing! Debbie at registration was great and offered us an upgrade for our 9th anniversary. We were in tower 2 and on the 27th floor with an amazing view of the luxor. We were able to get pretty much all our show and actiivity tickets at the box office in one stop. Tournament of the Kings was a fun time and food was pretty good. We never had a problem navigating our way around the hotel, and every person we came in contact with was very pleasant and very helpful. We were a little sceptical after reading review after review of negatives. The location is awesome and the only complaint is the timeshare people. We stayed for a week and the same people every 100 ft would try to stop you. I know they have a job to do but that has got to be the worst job ever. But it is not just at the Excalibur its every hotel and on every corner. All in all this was a fabulous vacation. I do like to stay at a different hotel each time we go to Vegas but i would definitely stay here again and reccomend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Unitedflyier
Reviews.Content: I only stayed for one night. Couldn't bare anymore. Tower 1 has the original decor and looks like a 1970s cheap rental apartment. This should have been modernized 20 years ago. It looked like the bead spread and blanket were original too. Thin dirty brown and worn out. The carpet was old worn out dark brown and faded in spots. The bathroom was old tired and dirty. The only new things were the flat screen TV with very few channels and the mattress. The whole hotel was tired and absolutely stank of cigarette smoke. The old popcorn ceiling were stained form nicotine. I only walked through the reception to register and go to my room, and then to checkout. The air quality was so bad I lost my voice and started to cough. I am still wheezing 3 days later. I checked out very early the next day and my newly washed hair stank of smoke from the casino. If you don't like smoke don't even go through the front doors.

Reviews.Title: “There are far better places in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Dawndavid
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in need of a makeover . Room was literally falling apart. Security made us feel like criminals everytime we needed to use the elevators to go to our room. Toilet didn't work properly. The buffet was decent Checking in and out took way too long

Reviews.Title: “good value for the family. Buffet breakfast has something for everyone.”
Reviews.Author: Ozzieoioioi
Reviews.Content: rooms are clean and well-serviced. Pool is great for all especially kids. lifesaving staff all around the pool and no bad behavior tolerated. Roaming Pool bar staff not helpful though. Get your own drinks at the bar instead.in casino area annoying people try to sell you deals to shows etc. Ignore them. They have nothing to offer.

Reviews.Title: “1st & last stay-Less than expected...”
Reviews.Author: Trvlblast
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Excalibur in September 2011. The first thing i noticed upon arrival was that this hotel has a weird smell. It smelled like dirt and a little musty as well. When we checked in we were put on the 2nd floor (out or like 29 floors lol) and so needles to say our view sucked. Overall it was dated and dingy. The theme is cheesy and old. When we actually got into our room it wasn't even clean. There were glasses outside the room and trash in the room! I never even got to see the pool because it was only open from 9am-6pm! The restaraunts closed at like 10pm....come on people! It's Vegas, people eat later then 10pm. It was farely cheap to stay but i wish i would have just paid a little more to stay next door at the Luxor. It's much, much nicer. The only good thing i can say about this place is that the beds were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: tiger_smiles4u
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great. Enjoyed many shows. There is a tunnel that you can walk through to get to the Luxor(pyramid hotel). That is a very nice hotel as well. Excalibur also had morning classes for Black Jack and Roulette. They were very helpful since we are from Texas and are novice to gambling.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a group”
Reviews.Author: WorkinGirl19
Reviews.Content: We had a group of around 35 people and this hotel worked out perfectly for our needs. Some stayed in the newer renovated tower and others in the older section. Trust me, it's worth the little extra to stay in a new room, but who spends that much time in their room anyway? The pool was huge and my niece loved the water slide. It's not a high-end hotel, and it's not trying to be, but overall a really good value. We had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Exellent”
Reviews.Author: redditchblondebint
Reviews.Content: we have just come back from the excalibur Sep 2011 staying there 10 days and we had the best holiday ever. Victor at Sherwoods bar was so friendly and nice. We got married while we was out there and every bit of service we was given was exellent. As for wi-fi in the room yes there is so don't know what there on about. The room was cleaned every day. we have no conplaints what so ever and will be returning as soon as we can LOVED IT.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Olivier_41
Reviews.Content: Definitely one of the filthiest places we've ever stayed in. The half eaten crisps and candy of the previous occupants were still in the room when we got in and so was their hair in the shower. The carpet was worn off, the rooms smelly. Just a big sleeping factory. Nothing charming, nothing friendly, nothing attractive. Try to call them. You only get a speaking computer. Definitely a place where we will never stay again, no matter how low the price.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, poor customer service.”
Reviews.Author: eamonnevangelists
Reviews.Content: It's 99% Casino, 1% hotel. Unnecessary resort charges and the employees are unhelpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful casino and service”
Reviews.Author: Kookaburra361
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay. Enjoyed every minute of it. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Very clean and tidy

Reviews.Title: “no real ammenities”
Reviews.Author: AtlGa2U
Reviews.Content: Check in took forever - almost an hour wait - lots of stations that were not staffed --check out took even longer -- if you want a receipt you have to stand in an hour plus line -- most hotels put your bill under your door the morning you are checking out - not this one - there is NO convenience for the customer ----- No Wi-Fi available in rooms - have to go to food court and rely on Krispy Creme or McDonalds for that service----- if you want to print boarding passes it cost -almost $6 for a few minutes of internet access and then 50cents per page to print. Room was clean - but obviously this hotel does not really care about the customer -only about their profit - what is now basic amenities are sorely neglected. Pool also closed at 6pm -- in the desert in the summer-- made no sense.

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is... location is good considering the rates”
Reviews.Author: dalcy3
Reviews.Content: Definitely 2 star - but the rates are really low and the convenience of the location could be worth the 2 star rating. They don't have wifi in the room - they have hard wired internet, but in my room all of the cables were missing - and based on what I heard going on at the front desk, that is the case in most rooms. It's dark and the rooms are ok - no coffee maker in the room. but for $60 a night it's to be expected

Reviews.Title: “Great value on the strip”
Reviews.Author: LoveTravelandPoker
Reviews.Content: Dates of stay: September 8th to September 12th, 2011 Room number: 18269 (floor 18, tower 2) Comped a regular room, asked for an upgrade at arrival...and received Wide Screen room at no cost. Great room for a lower end strip property. Fantastic bed, huge flat screen TV, very large bathroom. Our room was clean upon arrival...and it was kept clean by a very good housekeeping service. We were on the 18th floor in tower 2. Everything about the room and housekeeping met our expectations. Nice view of the pool from our room. Only things to complain about: Resort fee ($12.50/day). No wireless internet...only wired. Water pressure in shower was a little weak. Casino is ok...not great. We played a little craps there and played some late night poker in the poker room. Otherwise, we played elsewhere. We did not eat in any of their restaurants this trip. Overall, I like the Excalibur for what it is...a low priced property on the strip. Its location is not the best...but with the bridges and trams surrounding it, we find it very convenient to get from the Excalibur to wherever we want to go. We would stay again and recommend to anyone on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Dishonest!!!”
Reviews.Author: kori p
Reviews.Content: i had a ring stole right out of my room. the ONLY people that had been in the room from the time we left to the time we got back was housekeeping and now i'm being told the hotel isn't liable...ARE YOU KIDDING ME?!?!?! you're running the risk of losing THOUSANDS of customers because you want to believe your housekeeping and not pay a $30 claim...spread the word. Excalibur doesn't care about their guests and has dishonest housekeeping. i'll NEVER stay there again and i hope you don't either!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay you will get robbed literally by the staff”
Reviews.Author: jpr2005
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on our way through. Good value for the money the room was your typical chain room...when we were sleeping some one entered our room with a key card and stole all of our cash about $900 mind you there are no chains or dead bolts on the door and door was checked by the 2 of us before bed to be shut and locked and when we woke up it was opened ...best part when we were finally able to get security to come it was 1.5 hrs after we called them...after we wrote statements the security guard surched our room and tried to say we had missed placed it and it was our fault. And after calling risk management who does the investigations we were told they have 30 days to do the investigation..my biggest complaint beciieds getting robbed is that no one seemed to take us seriously. Seven forbid it was worse like we were hurt, killed, or raped

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: Mark W
Reviews.Content: This hotel was good for the price we paid. Staff was very helpful at check in. they made a mistake in our reservation and promptly corrected the mistake and upgraded our rooms to meet our request. Casino area was fun. Nice location by MGM, NY NY, Luxor, Mandalay Bay. Would stay here again. Better durung the week than the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur once again!”
Reviews.Author: TexasLady40
Reviews.Content: We spent two days at The Castle and had a great time. We arrived at 10am and our room was ready, and they accommodated our request for a room near the elevator with no issues. The casino was jumpin' with people and the slots were loose and fun. The dealers were nice and the cocktail ladies were friendly and quick with the drink orders. All in all a great stay. This is our third visit to Excalibur and have never been disappointed with anything. Last but not least, Housekeeping was also terrific!

Reviews.Title: “Not real fancy, but a good value!”
Reviews.Author: Texan82
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Vegas & I was suspicious of staying here originally when I read some of the reviews. But the price was unbeatable and it seemed like a great location, plus I didn't spend on staying long in my room. But overall I enjoyed my stay. I was in the older tower and the room does seem outdated. The carpet looked old and there was an area of the wall where the paint was chipping off. Like I said in the title, its not a fancy place maybe like a Super 8 or something. But the bathroom was nice and it did have a large flat screen TV & fast wired internet. The casino floor is large enough but looks older then most others. You can get to Luxor & Mandalay Bay by an indoor overstreet walk or by a free tram very quickly and both of those are very nice, I gambled mostly there. The foodcourt has some good options like Dairy Queen, McDonalds, Quiznos, Krispy Creame ect.. but like everything in Vegas expect to pay more then usual. The pool is really pretty nice with waterfalls & just a cool place to hang out. The worse part about my trip is the cleaning crew stole my flip flops. I couldn't believe it at first but I was not drinking on this trip & spent half and hour tearing the room apart looking for them. But I reported this & the hotel made up for it somewhat. I would not pay alot to stay here and would not be happy if I had. But for the price I am 100% satisfied and would do so again. Stay here, save money, and walk down the strip & use it to gamble.

Reviews.Title: “Always consistently great place”
Reviews.Author: grinandbearit
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a few places in Vegas but always seem to end up back at the Excalibur. The pro's of this hotel is that the rooms are clean and modern. Good views overlooking the mountains or the strip. I found the beds comfortable. The hotel is typical of the hotels on the strip.There is smoking in most common areas, lots of restaurants. This one has A Baja express, McDonalds, pizza hut, Starbucks, Quiznos subs and many other fast food chains. They also have other restaurants. An all you can eat, all day buffet. when we were there I think the all day buffet pass was 32 dollars, this allowed you to eat Breakfast, lunch and dinner at the buffet for a total of 32 bucks a person. Pretty reasonable price. We ate there for breakfast and it was well stocked and a pretty tasty start to the day. They also have a Dicks restaurant. Seems to attract a regular flow of patrons. I have never eaten there but looks interesting to say the least. I saw a sign that a Lynyrd Skynyrd bar grill will be opening in October. Just up the street off the strip is a In Out Burger, awesome burgers and great prices. It is walking distance but a good walk. The nice thing about the Excalibur is there is tons of self parking so if you are driving there is easy in and out for parking. The pool area is nice. They have 4 pools, one adult, one slide pool and two regular pools. I think three of the 4 pools are open all year but not totally sure. They have bar service at the pool.The pools are nice as you can get shade if you choose and also full sun. Not all pools in Vegas are like that. A negative for me is those people always stopping you and asking"How long are you here for?" They seem to be at so many hotels in vegas its annoying. I try not to be rude as i know they are only doing their job but at the same time my hotel should be a safe zone from salespeople and its my vacation. I stopped once and it was your typical sale. Not sure if they are all the same but once bitten, twice shy. So now i just say "nope leaving tonight" The hotel is pretty south on the strip if you compare it to the Mirage but i still find it a good spot. It is next door to the NY NY and across the street from the MGM Grand. I think this hotel has everything you need for a good Vegas vacation. There is a kids arcade area downstairs in the casino, I have never been but I am sure it is a great stop for the kids. Being next door to the nyny you can also take the kids on the roller coaster there. The MGM has the Lion feedings at their hotel and they also have a rainforest Cafe for the kids. This is an Excalibur review and not a vegas review so I will stop there. Feel free to message me if you have any questions on the hotel or vegas in general. I will do my best to help you have a great trip. This hotel in my opinion is a fantastic value. One last note. Hotels in Vegas charge a daily resort fee. At the excalibur I paid 13 bucks per day. This covers the wireless internet, pools and parking. Considering the rooms can be as low as 47 bucks a night it's still a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value For The $$”
Reviews.Author: ToddRA
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay at Excalibur over Labor Day weekend for 6 days/5 nights. I chose this location when I found an online deal at their website for a discounted stay. My flight arrived earlier than expected on Thursday, and the front desk check-in staff was more than cordial in letting me check in earlier than 3 PM. My room was one of the upgraded rooms with a king bed and 42" TV. My room view faced the Luxor, Mandalay Bay, and the airport, along with the mountains. The room was clean and everything was in order when I went in. There was absolutely no smoke smell, so I am not sure what previous reviewers were talking about, unless they stayed on a smoking floor for some reason. Inside the room, there was a network cable available to connect your laptop to for internet access. My only complaint with that was that it was a little slow on internet speed. But, who goes to Vegas to hang out online? :) What was nice too was that there was free phone service in the room, allowing you to call anywhere in the US. Not a bad deal if your cellphone minutes were limited for any reason. As for the resort as a whole, it was really more than I expected. The casino was nice and didn't smell of smoke, thanks to an excellent air circulation system. I even won a few times on their slot machines while I was there! I did dine at the Camelot Steakhouse one night and truly enjoyed my experience. The food was phenomenal and service was top-notch. The Buffet at Excalibur was average at best. The food was cold, tasteless and really wasn't worth the $15-20 pricetag, depending on which meal you were there for. I tried both their breakfast and lunch buffet on two separate occasions. I would recommend eating someplace else. I also did the "Tournament of Kings" dinner/show in the basement of Excalibur. The show was great and food was exceptional. This is much like the Medieval Times dinner/show that is around the country. It was very enjoyable and definitely family oriented. The outside pools of Excalibur were well-maintained and the chairs were plentiful. The only complaint I had was the innattentiveness of their waitresses. I wanted to make a drink purchase, but no one ever stopped by to check on me. That's something that pool/bar management needs to address. When it's 107 degrees outside, people do get thirsty. Ask for the order. It's as simple as that. As for the location of Excalibur, it is not in the heart of the strip, but you are close enough to walk it or cab it if necessary. Plus, Excalibur is connected to the Luxor and Mandalay Bay either via walkways or through a tram. All-in-all, I really enjoyed my stay at Excalibur and I would recommend it for anyone looking for a nice place to stay that won't break the bank.

Reviews.Title: “its ok”
Reviews.Author: ThePolisher
Reviews.Content: The only thing i didn't like was there's no where to eat after 9 pm , except Mc donalds . and they forgot to book my wife's spa day. If she ain't happy , i ain't happy........

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and ok, but too much smoke!”
Reviews.Author: CarmenH2
Reviews.Content: I liked the Excalibur as far as value for money, but the beds were like a board and the cigarette smoke is definitely bothersome if you aren't a smoker. Everything in our suitcases smelled like smoke when we got home and we were in a non-smoking room and most of it didn't even leave the suitcase the whole trip! We "upgraded" to the newly renovated "widescreen deluxe room" but it didn't seem like it was very special. We also requested a king room and were given one with two queens, which wasn't a huge deal but worth mentioning. I would probably only stay there again if there is a room with a more comfortable bed. Other than the smoke and the bed, it's a fun hotel and has cheap table games and slots. We visited the hotel for the games on our next trip, but we stayed at the Aria the second time.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay!”
Reviews.Author: 1PickyMom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Excalibur Hotel Sept 2-6/11. When we first walked in the check-in line looked very long and thought we would be there all night. Fortunately they have alot of people working and get you through so quickly. Our room was very clean and modern (we paid for the upgrade Widescreen room though). The hotel room was very quiet but we did have a crappy view of a rooftop. My one big complaint was that the pool closes at 7:00 and when it is 104 it's nice to come back after being out all day and sit around the pool before going back and showering before going out for the evening. Also all you smokers out there that leave your cigarette butts all around the pool, shame on you. It's really sad when you sit along the pool and you butt out wherever leaving a big stinky mess. Loved Dick's Last Resort in the hotel, we had a blast there and then listened to the awesome band they had. I feel we had really good service at the Excalibur considering it was so busy that weekend and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Family Wedding in desert”
Reviews.Author: flyboy1320
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas more than six times previously. This place was way too crowded with groups of people wandering aimlessly throughout casino on the weekends. They did not appear to be gambling much. Business is bad in Vegas and they are giving shows away at very low prices etc. I stayed Fri through Tues and since our wedding was off site we needed info on the exits and pick up points, for chartered bus, limo etc. Very confusing and staff was not helpful. With elderly parents we ended up walking to all 4 exits once each and a few twice...to get to right place fortunately bus late. The exits are Front, Rotunda, tower 1 and tower 2 all vehicles can not get to all exits. I was told the only wifi was by the tasty creme donut shop....turns out each room has a cable on side of dresser! The high end steak house was normal price but excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Another fabulous stay at the Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: KazzieDy
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here three times now and while it isn't quite as upmarket as some of the more expensive hotels, the rooms are clean, the staff pleasant and helpful and the buffet, in our opinion, is one of the best. It's also very handy for trip pick up, especially if it's early in the morning and a little quieter being almost at the end of the strip. The connection to the Luxor is really handy as there are some nice restaurants (more expensive though) in the next door hotel. The gift shops are also quite nice in both hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back”
Reviews.Author: mpls72
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur Labor Day weekend, it was overall a good experience. I went to Vegas with 7 other friends, 2 in each room. Check in was a breeze, the line was long but it didn't really bother us. We ordered a drink and drank that while we waited to check in. I had a king room in Tower I. The room wasn't anything special but for the money it worked. The sheets were stained but the bed was comfortable. You didn't really spend that much time in the room. The casino downstairs was fun. If you go to Dick's try to get TJ to be your server he is awesome!! The pool was a great way to spend the afternoon. Check-out was also easy. We had a couple hours before heading to the airport so we left our bags at the bag check.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Blast!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lizbeas
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd time stating at the Excalibur. The room was nice, no outside noises. Love the Casino location. The only downside not many good resturaunts. But New York New YOrk and MGM are right there.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice and Clean!”
Reviews.Author: flyersrok
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here the last week in August 2011. We checked in (although the line was long, it moved fast) and made our way to the room. The room was fairly big and clean. We also had a great view of the strip! It was beautiful at nighttime. We found that the employees are friendly, but the timeshare people were a little persistant and became annoying after the second day. The food court was also nice. We had a few choices including McDonalds, Crispy Creme, Starbucks among others for breakfast. Although a little more expensive than normal. I also thought the the location was convenient. It is located at the end of the strip so its easy to get to if you take the monorail at MGM Grand. There is also a tram that connects the Excalibur, Luxor and Mandalay Bay, and its free. It is easy to walk to New York, New York and MGM Grand. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and Excalibur will be our first choice the next time we are in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty...Pretty...Pretty...Pretty Good.”
Reviews.Author: CarmineNJ
Reviews.Content: The Excalibur is one of several properties owned by MGM on the Strip. It is a Medieval Castle themed property that It is nestled in Between the Luxor and New York - New York on the Southern part of Las Vegas Blvd. We stayed in a standard room with a King Size bed and the room was nicely appointed and very clean. The hotel offers internet via a LAN cable that you can plug into a laptop as opposed to WiFi. It is worth mentioning for smartphone or tablet users that might need WiFi since these type of devices usually don't have a LAN port. The hotel has a pretty nice size casino. If you intend to casino bounce, get a players card as soon as you check in ( known as the ' mLife card ') as it can be used to earn comps not only at Excalibur, but all of the MGM properties in Vegas ( NYNY, Luxor, Monte Carlo, Mandalay Bay, MGM Grand, etc...). They have 3 pools on the property which were a pleasure to use on the 100 degree days that we encountered. There is cabana service available, in addition to a poolside bar/cafe which had great frozen cocktails. Buffet court is pretty good with decent selections and offers an all day dining option for around $32 for 24 hour access. We only dined there for breakfast and my only complaint was that the coffee was a bit week. There is a Starbucks and a Camelot Coffee for those needing a strong cup in the morning. The Steakhouse at Camelot located near the buffet court was top notch both for service, decor, and food. Other food establishment you can find at Excalibur are Baja Fresh, McDonalds, and Dick's Last Resort. There is an RTC transit bus stop right in front of the property if you intend to use the 'Deuce Bus' to shuttle up and down the strip (It was $7 for a 24 hour pass and has bus stops near every casino on the Strip - highly recommended if you don't have a car). Overall, the Excalibur is a good deal for a vacation in Vegas. I would consider going there again if I come across a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay good price”
Reviews.Author: TruBluTravel
Reviews.Content: We booked the Excalibur because it was cheap and then we found out it exceeded our expectations! The rooms have been remodeled since last time I stayed and we loved the decor. The only warning is... if you have children, there are strippers in G-strings and you walk right by them when you come in the front door and are on your way to the towers on the right (NY NY side of the building)! If this bothers you, I would ask for a room on the other side (Luxor side) of the building so you dont have to walk through that part of the casino. All in all, I recommend this hotel if you need a great room at a good deal!

Reviews.Title: “It's a craps shoot”
Reviews.Author: Jacks017
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at Excalibur for nearly 20 years; and for the first time today, I don't know that I will ever be back. I'm trying to balance out the good service I've had over the years (in fact, some of it at the beginning of this week) with the terrible experience I just had. I'm a business man, and I get the multiple pricing model(s) that hotels use. But it's my opinion that if a customer comes to you with the lowest price in hand (on a smart phone) you should honor that at the desk. Leaving that argument behind, I was forced to go online to get the best rate (after spending nearly a grand on hotel rooms), so I did. I then got to the desk before check out, to roll over my reservations. And when I expressed my frustration with the resort policy, I was talked to down to by both the desk attendant and her supervisor. I made it clear I was frustrated the resort and not them personally, but they continued to be rude. They could care less who I was, what I've spent, what I know, or how long I've been coming their (this was the 4th time this year). Which is strange considering that I have never been comped or pampered in anyway. Looking at the money I've spent and my years of loyalty to this property, I can't help but feel as though I may have been wasting my time. In fairness, maybe I just got unlucky enough to find to the two worst humans employed by this property, and they wanted to take a shot at me. I know several others who work there that are great. But like the title says, it's a crap shoot. If you're looking for great service without question, I have to recommend that you look elsewhere on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel ever.”
Reviews.Author: nirav p
Reviews.Content: i was so unhappy with this place, it was my first time in Vegas and this place made me really unhappy. When I checked in, there was a huge line u have to wait in, I didn't see a line like this at any other of the big names on that strip, and the guest service clerk was so rude, it made me feel like I was at a DMV, where the DMV clerk is rude, but they don't need to provide us with good guest service, these people do. I stayed a week, not once did I put the do not disturb sign up, I probably got room service two times. The room I got was remodeled and looked better then my friends room, who had a room on the other side of Excalibur. One night, I had lost my room key and I was in my buddys room, and I didn't bother to bring my wallet, because I was only going to hang out, when I got to my room, i noticed that I didn't have my key on me. I went down stairs, they refused to give me a new key because I didn't have my ID on me. I understand that but they could of asked me few questions like have did I book the reservation, what payment mothod i used, etc. Finaly that had a officer escort me to the room and he opened it and I got the wallet out of the safe and showed him my ID, it was so embarrasing being escorted by a cop, they could of had the bell boy or a front desk clerk come up with me. I will never stay here again..

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: ayoungpretender
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a weekend to visit my brother who was working nearby at the time. The prices were very reasonable, so I wasn't expecting much. The room was much cleaner and well-kept than I anticipated. It is in a pretty good location, but you don't have to go far to have a lot of fun. It's very convenient to be able to get to Luxor and Mandalay Bay without going outside.

Reviews.Title: “Not fancy, but clean.”
