Reviews.Author: Margie123789
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed at the Excalibur several times over the past 20 years and have never been disappointed because we know what to expect. The intention of this hotel is not to compete with the Cosmopolitans or Ceasars or Bellagios of Las Vegas. Their goal is to provide you with a clean hotel at a reasonable price. You are not in Vegas to spend a long time in your hotel room. Your hotel is meant to be a base for you enjoy all the fun and interesting sights in Vegas. We spend very little time in the hotel room, so we booked the lowest end (not updated) room in the hotel. It was very big, with two queen sized beds, and clean. And that was most important. Do not expect anything fancy. The rest of the hotel was clean as well. No less clean than the other fancier hotels on the strip that we visited. The amenities are good as well. Nice casino, variety of restaurants from fast food (Mcdonalds, Pizza Hut) to their buffet, adequate gift shops, fun arcade on the bottom floor (good for kids) and themed shows. The location isn't bad and the Excalibur always looks neat when lit up at night. This hotel is a good choice if you are looking for a simple place to stay at the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at the Excalibur!”
Reviews.Author: natlocke
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur for 3 nights and we had no complaints! Our room was renovated with very comfortable beds, the pool was awesome and the price was very affordable. I highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Family Vacation - would return again”
Reviews.Author: cohollywood
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant about booking here from reading the reviews, but overall, am glad we did. Traveling were 2 adults (25,26) and 1 child (4). We stayed for 2 nights in late August (Sun, Mon) and paid $30/night + $14/night resort fee (which is ridiculous, but I did know about it prior to going, so I was expecting it). Check in was quick and easy - there was a big line, but, plenty of people working and it moved fast. We were an hour early for check in, but it didn't seem to be a problem. We got 2 complimentary buffet passes per day as a special when we booked to almost any MGM property, and those were given to us at check in without any problems. The time share sales people in the lobby that everyone complains about...they said hello to us, and would start saying something else, but we just kept walking and said "no thank you". It was annoying, but, never really a big deal. They were always friendly. Our room was a standard room in Tower 1 - I was concerned about that, but since we were only in the room to sleep, I didn't care much. The room though, was clean, cool and comfortable. It had the upgraded plasma, which was nice. We were on floor 11, with a view of the roof, but, again, I only booked the cheapest rooms, so I didn't expect much. The elevators were dirty - that is probably my biggest complaint. We described the decor inside as "midevil meets Dennys". They could have done a much better job with it, but then, I'm sure I wouldn't have paid $30/night. We ate at the Excalibur buffet (for free) Monday morning. No complaints. It was nothing special, but, there was a decent variety, and we all filled up- everything we tried tasted like Dennys. No Lucky Charms - that was my 4 year olds biggest complaint, although I'd prefer for him to try something new. :) We ate at the Monte Carlo buffet (for free) for lunch Monday afternoon. Decor was nicer, but food again was nothing special. Plenty of variety though and we were happy. We loved the 4D rides at the Excalibur - we did them all using a coupon in the book they give you at check in. If you have young kids, those are a must! We tinkered around in the game room for awhile and won a couple of cheapie stuffed animals, but, those make a 4 year old happy, and when he's happy, Mom and Dad are happy! It was nice having the food court upstairs - we ate breakfast at Starbucks Tues morning, McDonalds Mon evening for dinner. Also loved the walk ways through to Luxor and Mandalay Bay. It was really hot when we were there, so that was a nice indoor option to kill some time. The tram was great also. We hung out at the pool for a bit on Tuesday morning. We were there early, so lots of seating, pool wasn't too crowded. My child had a blast since there were plenty of areas where he could touch the bottom - which made it easier for Mom and Dad to relax a bit. Kiddo had a blast on the slide - another complaint would be the life guard at the top of the slide. She was the most disinterested person person I have ever seen. She wasn't really watching anything that was going on. It's a pretty tame slide though, into shallow water, so I guess there's not a lot of watch. Overall - we had fun. If we come back, I'd probably stay at another hotel, just to experience somewhere else, but if I was on a big budget, I'd have no problem going back to Excalibur if we were traveling as a family again - and even staying in the "cheapo" rooms again. Hope this helps someone! :)

Reviews.Title: “eehhh... ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: Summer O
Reviews.Content: We were located in the tower 2 (which there is no self parking near that side), in a view room and the view was pretty nice. The room was okay, the bathroom seemed a little dirty/run down and same with the blankets (smelled weird). the pool is only the complete other side of the casino (near tower 1). the casino is nicely located near the strip (MGM, NY NY, Hooters, etc). overall the price was good for the location, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for kids!”
Reviews.Author: kozmokr
Reviews.Content: We've stayed there about 2 nights during our family vacation. We moved from another great hotel in Vegas, since it was cheaper and more sutied for kids. The hotel is very nice, lots of activities for the young ones, and more than fine for the adults as well. Great locaion, very nice castle-like theme throughout the hotel. I wouldn't choose any other hotel in vegas for families.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic time, all around!”
Reviews.Author: r0semarie81
Reviews.Content: Great value! Hardly had to leave the resort...we did the Night School 4 Girls class, saw Thunder From Down Under, and rented a poolside cabana there. It was a blast, and all very affordable. Dick's Last Resort bar/restaurant was a lot of fun too. Will be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Sponge bob”
Reviews.Author: genobear
Reviews.Content: Comped rooms so i can't complain much very much geared towards kids kid theme i would not pay to stay but honestly not bad so enjoy your time

Reviews.Title: “Like Being The Fat Man In Africa”
Reviews.Author: EnglishAdam
Reviews.Content: I was by far the richest person that has ever stayed at excalibur the high roller area had one dollar machines in seriously wtf. The time share people are like a plague and should find the nearest sewer and die. But I loved it, casino was good and didnt really smell of fags, waitress service was ok although far to hot to get smashed on cheap watered down beer. Room 23215 was great fantastic view over strip high floor big bedroom. Didnt have to pay resort fee as I book in advanced with virgin holiday, got my buffets comped which was good as I would not have liked to have paid for them. Monorails down strip are cool so I can go fit in with more my sort of people at Mandalay bay. Please not Americans some of this is sarcasim

Reviews.Title: “Great fun to be had in the castle”
Reviews.Author: Ilisapeci
Reviews.Content: The Excalibur is the perfect low budget hotel for the saving savy traveller. Its close to the action with overhead walk ways to the Tropicanna, New York New York and MgM. The duce bus is perfect for getting around Las Vegas and the bus stop is right out the front of the property. The fare at the buffet is the usual Las Vegas standard, but the casino makes up for any short commings the buffet may have. There is also a Macdonalds, Quizznos, Starbucks and Cold Rock on the property. I found the staff to be helpful and kind.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay @ Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: ebanda2188
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I stayed at the Excalibur from Aug 26-29 2011 for a getaway wkend. This hotel was fun and it is located at the end of the strip. We arrived at the hotel at approximately 11:15pm and we waited in line about 30 minutes to register (WHICH IS OK BECAUSE IT WAS THE WEEKEND -so its expected ). The front desk help was friendly despite all the people they had to check in. The only thing I did not like it that I got charged a RESORT FEE, but I booked thru ALLEGIANT which I did not argee with but the lady upgraded our room at no cost. ( or maybe that was the fee) BUT it didnt matter b/c the upgrade room was really nice.---NO MUSTY SMELL, CLEAN SHEETS, COMFY BED & PILLOWS--bathroom was super clean--no dust--no hair- we had a standing shower stall but the water pressure was great and no clogs) The hotel has a variety of resturants to choose from(fast food or casual dinning --Dick's) BOTTOM LINE : LOVED IT ...CLEAN ROOMS, FRIENDLY STAFF, ** OVERALL GREAT **

Reviews.Title: “Unhappy”
Reviews.Author: Unha
Reviews.Content: I will never recommend this hotel to any one. The buffet is lousy, terrible shower, room did not impress me for a supposedly upgraded room

Reviews.Title: “Not the best, but its o.k.”
Reviews.Author: mike l
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the excalibur as a friend had booked a similar trip. He enjoys this hotel and since i have never stayed anywhere but flamingo or harrahs i decided to tag along. The accommodations are nice, its just a room, and hotel was clean. Prices are comparative to the rest of the strip. As one who prefers the middle of the strip i was not happy with its location. I did not enjoy the atmosphere either. One never expects to win money in vegas but the dealers could have at least indulged in some fun conversation. You could barely get their name out them before they would clam up and keep on dealing. Much more fun at o'sheas.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: northie
Reviews.Content: good size room for a double, close to pool, clean. got lost a few times as both towers look similar. Staff helpful in finding way!!! variety of family eateries in hotel area, close to other features of Las vegas . hate the way you have to walk through gambling areas to get to the hotel .

Reviews.Title: “second time staying here”
Reviews.Author: momtotwoteens
Reviews.Content: we have stayed here twice now, and both times have felt it has been a great value considering the location and size of the room. We have stayed in the widescreen rooms, the first as a couple with a king size bed, and this trip as a family with two queen beds. Big bathrooms, big widscreen t.v.'s. air worked great thank goodness.Hotel has some cheaper? eating options upstairs (mcdonalds, quiznos, pizza hut, starbucks, etc.) very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Nice to try”
Reviews.Author: Grace A
Reviews.Content: It's a nice hotel, especially by appearance on the outside. the inside is pretty, too. But this hotel isn't as fancy as the others. The buffet was cheap quality, (probably aimed more for kids, with make your own tacos, pizza, macaroni and cheese). There were lots of kid stores inside; there aren't even many to begin with. There is a toy store with flying toys on the ceiling, which i remember very clearly, but also vegas merchandise stores. The stores aren't fancy like Caesar's. There's a food court, with fast food places... Mcdonalds, burger king, even pizza hut. It's a nice hotel, but not as fancy.

Reviews.Title: “Massive Hotel/Building, Average”
Reviews.Author: princessvania
Reviews.Content: - Stayed for 3 nights - There was quite of a line up when we got to the reception. The receptionist was not one of the nicest persons: no smile and kind of moody. - Our room was located in the Tower 2 - (had to walk across all of the slot machines ... which I'm sure was totally done on purpose). The room did not meet my expectations: ugly carpet (which actually started as soon as you enter Excalibur), a view of the roof, outdated bathroom. Beds were decent - sheet covers seemed to be daily changed. - Restaurants: Never had the patience to try and wait at the long line up of the Excalibur Buffet. The other restaurants seemed to be very "fast food"-ish...so did not try any of them. If you are looking for decent breakfast/lunch/dinner, walk on the Strip which is located 5min walk from the hotel. - The pool: it was ridiculously small and did not have the entertainment we were looking for. Drinks were offered at the bar, music was on but there was no fun going on. At that time, the pool was made of drunk men hitting on whatever they saw and family. Overall: for the price, we actually did not expect too much coming from the Excalibur. We have to say that it has a great location and all of the rooms should be updated/renovated (they were not the worst we've seen). Recommendation: for a 2-3day stay (weekday), you could get a room for at most $60. Basically, it is an average hotel for short stay and first time travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Gross sticky stains on both bed's- bad smell in room”
Reviews.Author: Annet M
Reviews.Content: Took the deluxe tower suite- room had bad order- a strong chemical smell, that did not leave even after we left window open for 4 hours- switched room and next room smelled fine - BUT: . There was a large sticky blood stain on one bed and a white sticky stain several inches big (I can only imagine what that was!) on the other- obviously they don't wash their comforters. Called to have them replaced, housekeeping guy came but said he usually does not make the bed's and had us change the gross bedding- only to discover that the new ones had several cigarette burns all over both (we had a non smoking room!!) - we canceled the next night and checked into a pyramid suite at the LUXOR- everything was perfect and very clean there. For 14 bucks more it was a world of difference- I would NEVER stay at Excalibur again- cheap and dirty. Horrible services

Reviews.Title: “Good option if you are on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Freelunch42
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend for 5 nights 19-24 Aug in one of the recently refurbished Widescreeen rooms. The room was clean, spacious and offered a nice view over the pool area and on to the surrounding mountains. The only let down was the incredibly noisy A/C which kicked in when ever the temperature fell/rose over the one which I had set. This disturbed my sleep quite a bit. The Casino/hotel itself provided a good base, and its location at the crossroads with New York, New York / MGM Grand & Tropicana is very handy. The monorail (to Luxor, Mandalay Bay) and the elevated walkways over the boulevard make it easy to walk around the vicinity. The niggle I had with the casino floor (compared to others) was the smell, as there was an everpresent aroma of Coconut & cigarettes - not pleasant. Other casinos smell much better! One of the main reasons that we selected Excalibur was for the friendly, relatively low stakes poker room where less confident players do not feel intimidated. We were not disappointed, and I would definitely recommend a 'refresher' poker lesson from one of the many experienced dealers who will explain the nuances of 2-6 limit that they play here. The pool area is large and you can always find a sun lounger even over a busy weekend period. If you stay in Tower 2 then access to the pool is very convenient as its very close to the bottom of the lift lobby. All round I would recommend this as a great 'budget' option if you want a good, 'on strip' location.

Reviews.Title: “Good family stay, old but good location/service”
Reviews.Author: Nellsh75
Reviews.Content: Excalibur is a bit schizophrenic, trying to appeal both to families with kids and adults out to prove "What happens in Vegas. . ." but we had a good stay with a 6-year-old and found the room/service to be quality. Midway/arcade games not as good as Circus Circus, of course, but it's a nicer property than Circus, and is tied in with the Luxor next door (all MGM-owned) with many shared activities. Our son loved the arcade and carnival games. Our room was huge, and old but clean. It can be a noisy place, as it's a favorite for bachelor/bachelorette parties. Rates are cheap for such a good strip location, but it's not a luxury property--rooms are simple/no frills, but comfortable. Buffet is ok--nothing special but not bad and pretty cheap. Downsides: time-share stringers are all over and really annoying. I wish the hotel would boot them or at least limit their activities. Also, the mandatory MGM "resort fee" is irritating--it's basically a way to boost revenue while keeping posted rates lower, by charging an additional fee that's in addition to the advertised rate. It's a shady practice and I hope others complain about it. Highly recommended: Tournament of Kings show. Our kid loved it, and we enjoyed it, too.

Reviews.Title: “A tired old gem...”
Reviews.Author: cuttershelper
Reviews.Content: Ahhhhh the Excalibur, I remember coming to it when I was a teenager, what a grand hotel it was....was. The old girl has become a little rundown and well used, but still a reasonable place to stay. My complaints, beside the un-vaccumed hallway and the hair in the shower, are the prices you pay for "upgrades". I don't think it is right to have to pay for a decent view other than the maintenance guy working on the roof. I also don't think it is right to have to pay for a modern television. These are my opinions and I know Vegas is not going to change because of them, that still does not make it right. On the other hand, after paying $40 more for a modern TV and a view, I must say it was the best view I have had at my dozen stays at Excalibur. I like the location, I like the short walk to other world class hotels and casinos and I like the pool area, well, my kid likes the pool. She would swim in a puddle if that was all that was available. The rooms are nice, big bathrooms(with additional hair in the shower at no extra cost), a safe for your belongings (a plus) and a nice flat screen TV. We had a fabulous strip view that was what memories are all about, sorry roof maintenance guy, I watched you enough. Why wireless is not available is beyond me and why in the heck do the pools all close at 7 o'clock? Makes no sense, in 100 degree heat at midnight, an evening swim would be great. We will always come back though and enjoy our time at the Excalibur hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our wedding trip, it served it's purpose”
Reviews.Author: TheConroys
Reviews.Content: The general cleanliness of the room was good. However, there were stains (or maybe not stained just dirty) on the bedspread of one of the double beds right under the pillow, and burn marks on the chairs. The bathroom was clean and we got fresh towels daily. Most of the staff was friendly, however the staff that checked us in was hurried and somewhat rude. We were given a non smoking room when we specified smoking.

Reviews.Title: “Met all our needs!”
Reviews.Author: Nonnyamy
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with a woman that was both developementally and physically disabled. Our parking pass was stolen at the airport, but security went out of their way to accomodate our parking needs. The front desk, housekeeping, etc. were all very helpful in situations that came up! It wasn't the Bellagio, but then that is not what we paid for. It was clean, beds very comfortable, and staff was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Great pool area for a family trip”
Reviews.Author: Molly730
Reviews.Content: For our first trip to Las Vegas with the kids we chose the Excalibur, primarily for the pool, price, and location on the strip. The pool was huge, with two separate sides and a slide. The kids had a blast. On our particular day (Monday/Tuesday) at the pool there were only two groups of people who appeared to really be "partying", everyone else there were primarily other families which was great for us. Rooms were a little outdated, had a very loud and humid air conditioner, although clean and worked just great for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Times”
Reviews.Author: Charles B
Reviews.Content: The service was good everyone seem to be in a good mood. Room was ready when we arrived, and my family have found this not always the case at other places we have stayed. The location was great on the strip & the pool was awesome for my kids as well as game room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for a good price and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: cath353
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend of mine as it was cheap and in a great location its right next to luxor, tropicana and mandalay bay. Our other friends stayed in mgm and it was only a short walk from our hotel to them. Excalibur is family orientated as in it has alot of things for kids - 3d rides etc and a nice food court as well as toy shops and other unusual stores. I really enjoyed picking up things here for my 2 young nieces at home who love castles and dressing up. The rooms are pretty standard but clean. If you are on a budget and do not mind kids this is a nice hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: JetGibson
Reviews.Content: The service of the front desk people were not overly friendly and I felt a little upset after checking in. Everyone else who i talked to that worked there was wonderful and very helpful! The room it self was sufficiant, There was no view but everything was clean and served it's purpose. The location was good as we were not only walking the strip but also driving out of town so the loaction worked out perfectly. Well staying at the Excalibur we went to the Tournament of Kings, which was AWESOME, I would stay at Excalibur again just to get the discount for the Tournament of Kings. A must see if you are in vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Don't know what everyone is whining about”
Reviews.Author: feffer536
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a "Widescreen Room" for four nights and everything was fine. Room was clean, casino was outdated but not gross, and the pool was really nice. It was within walking distance to a lot of other casinos and looked cool on the outside. The only issue I had was with the Camelot Steakhouse. Overpriced, mediocre food with TERRIBLE service. Otherwise, I would go back because of the reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “OK if you have to be in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Susie T
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was a good value choice for the kids, and there was a pool area with a slide that they enjoyed, however the resort was huge and security guards would not let the children (10 & 12) move about without an adult. We chose to take the buffet deal to eat all 3 meals in the restaurant. Whilst it was not expensive, the food was mediocre at best. We lunched in the Luxor (next door) and the food was awful. I wouldn't return unless I had to.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it !”
Reviews.Author: Michel G
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with the family for 1 night. The first room we were proposed was absolutely not acceptable - just in front the tram, with a constant mechanical rumble... 2nd one was smaller, but on the 27th floor and facing the airport... 1 rumble for another... The place is old, no accoustic insulation - Far too noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Needed a place to crash, ants all over the room, will not return”
Reviews.Author: Quanita42
Reviews.Content: I booked Excalibur because of the good rate online ($50 plus tax). Not worth it, wish I stayed somewhere else. Dingy and gross, there were ants crawling all over the bathroom and bed stand, had to change rooms. Wish I stayed somewhere else. Fitness center was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality for the price.”
Reviews.Author: DodgrFan
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice visit. View of New York, New York roller coaster, Tower 2-right next to the pool. Reasonable prices for food, kids stuff, drinks, etc., convenient parking, friendly staff. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “OK but nothing more”
Reviews.Author: JDGRT
Reviews.Content: I guess you could say that it wasn't too bad. We fled the circus circus property to stay here. All in all you get your moneys worth and the staff is very helpful. That is something i always have respect for when traveling to the States. I come from Holland and always treated nicely while on holiday leave in the USA. The rooms are a bit dated so i got an upgrade and did't have to shell out alot more for it. The Location is perfect so you can't go wrong there. Take note of the fact at the pool opens late and closes early (7:00) why Excalibur? For the price you pay you can have a pretty good stay although i would go for the deluxe room which we got.

Reviews.Title: “rooms are large and spacious”
Reviews.Author: jklqp
Reviews.Content: Rooms: Got the most basic room for 4nights. There were 2 queen sized beds inside - very huge and spacious. Despite the heat in Vegas, the room can get pretty chilly so we slept without the a/c on all nights. No wifi and only one lan cable in the room. Hence, only one person can go online at a time. Location: At the beginning of the Strip therefore it's pretty convenient to walk along the Strip and back.

Reviews.Title: “Tricked by our own Concierge”
Reviews.Author: renkol
Reviews.Content: While the hotel itself was ok (pretty clean), I was plenty ticked off that I was tricked by our own Concierge. I expected to be bothered by salespeople for the timeshares and other stuff... but I certainly didn't expect to be tricked by the concierge of the hotel where I was a paying customer. He set us all up for discounted show tickets, claiming they do that for their married couples. Only to find out (thankfully before we went!) that it was a timeshare presentation, something our concierge failed to mention. I expected it from others.. not from the hotel I'm paying hundreds of dollars to. P.S. - the hotel buffet has HORRIBLE FOOD.. the worst I had in Vegas (including McDonalds!)

Reviews.Title: “What a dump”
Reviews.Author: brian12345
Reviews.Content: I was forced to stay here a night when I got bumped from the Palms Place. The only words to describe this place is a total dump. I have stayed a lot of places in Vegas and this takes the prize as the worst. The crowd was total trash, the casino was sad and the restaurants and bars were a joke. The room was dated and hadn't been updated in ages. The only positive is that its cheap and on the Strip. So I guess if you want a Vegas trip on the Strip and are short on money this is your place. Otherwise, stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Family vacation”
Reviews.Author: porkchp
Reviews.Content: The Excaliber was ok. It is the cheapest of the Mega hotels on the strip. I think maybe the locals stay here because its cheap. Overall it had a dirty feel to it and kinda felt like living at a carnival. Stay in tower 2 or you will have to walk through the entire casino to go to the pool area. Buffet resembled the one on Vegas Vacation.....some of the food was unidentifiable. Rooms were clean in the newer remodeled tower 2. The location is good because we were right near MGM,New York and Luxor and it was easy to walk to a lot things to see. We would stay there again because some of the other big hotels are way overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “special holiday”
Reviews.Author: roadrunner56
Reviews.Content: stayed at the excalibur hotel 28th may to 9th june this year and had a fantastic time. this hotel is only a 3 star but it has loads of character and we felt at home and well looked after. the casino takes up the whole of the ground floor and an esculator takes you to the 2nd floor where all the eating areas are including a buffet rest. macdonalds and a steak house and numerus other areas.From here you can take an esculator which will bring you into the next hotel the luxor which also belongs to the same hotel group. the hotel is on the south of the strip on a cross roads with flamingo .new york , MGM Grand and excalibur. A good position on the strip for everything.

Reviews.Title: “they dont care”
Reviews.Author: Cris S
Reviews.Content: 2:30am... people fighting in room next door... security comes... I cut my leg open on a broken table in the room getting out of bed... 6am security comes again for more noisy neighbors... asking for a change of rooms we are told they are not yet clean... they wont block a room for us even though we got no sleep... management here cares not one little bit about satisfying their clients... DO NOT STAY HERE...

Reviews.Title: “Is what it is - cheap room, good location, great pool”
Reviews.Author: galici
Reviews.Content: What more is there to say... the room was cheap, it's near the airport and on the strip, and the pool scene was pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel/casino on the south end of the strip”
Reviews.Author: Flyguy05
Reviews.Content: Excalibur has been my favorite place to go even since I returned to Vegas (of legal gambling age). Back in 2009 the hotel hadn't started to remodel their tower rooms, so the rooms were standard... Returning in June we got bumped up to a widescreen room, the room was amazing, it was neat and clean, Plasma tv for my little brother with good channels for him to watch... The casino is great, I like it a lot, lots of machines to pick from, and the craps tables are some at $5 and they are always crowded because who wants to pay $10? I don't! LOL It's a fun casino... Excalibur has an area for kids at the lower level of casino entrance... I took my little brother there and he had fun. So this is a great place for families. I highly recommend anyone to go here. I'm returning back again in September for some more "de-stressing" well okay gambling lol... and again for my cousins bday in Oct... =-)

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again”
Reviews.Author: babyoh3
Reviews.Content: We had a great room after an upgrade. Stayed in Tower 2 21st floor. Good view of mountains and pools below. Only paid a alittle over 100.00 for 4 nights. Only a couple complaints there are kids running around but they are suppose to stay on a certain area of the carpeting and do get told that if they go off. No maid service on our 3rd day so no fresh towels or our beds made.

Reviews.Title: “The excalibur is a great hotel for the price, allows everyone a chance at Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ashleebaby0789
Reviews.Content: Good hotel at an affordable price. On the strip so that's always a plus. Love the all day buffet

Reviews.Title: “amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: redBerry30
Reviews.Content: Everything nice a hotel can have - helpful and courteous people at check in, OK room with a view of the strip (tower room), flat TV, nice cleaning crew who takes care to leave towel bunnies and chocolates. The casino in the hotel has some good rewarding slot machines, spl. the gold fish. Did not try the buffet in our hotel- so will not comment on that. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the splendid Excalibur.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: Newmami
Reviews.Content: Hubby & I went to las Vegas to celebrate our 20th anniversary. We were a bit worried, since we read the reviews, but decided to choose this hotel. Great choice! Registration line was long, but fast. The clerk was cold & not informative. I had to ask lots of questions about amenities. We told her we were celebrating our 20th anniversary & was indifferent until I told her it was our 1st time in 20 years traveling by ourselves. She smiled & she said she knew how it felt. From then on, she gave us a free update to the 2nd tower (close to pool, gym, spa & food court!). Got to our room on 13th floor & was very happy. Room was very clean, lots of towels & big plasma tv. Our cleaning lady (Emma) was very friendly. Kept our room clean & every morning she will greet us with a smile & a good morning! For breakfast we went to the food court. We had mc donald's big breakfast with hot cakes (cheap, healthy & fresh). We spent around $5 & change including the drink. It's open 24 hours ;) drinks & food are very expensive in las Vegas, therefore, we visited pizza hut, quiznos & mc donalds for food. We also did the buffet for an entire day. It was delicious & inexpensive compare to other buffets. Loved the dessert variety! Felt in heaven. Tip: to save on water or soda, there's a souvenir shop on your way to the m&m store that sells liter bottle water (2x$2)...Very close place and you can find little gifts for less. We recommend the water fountain show at the bellagio (it's free, romantic & it gave me chills-specially when they played the titanic song). La salsa cantina was an excellent Mexican restaurant. We had great savory food (lots of it) for less than 30 bucks for two including drinks. Service was fast & our waiter was very nice. We told her we were very hungry & she made great suggestions! Rain forest cafe wasn't that good. Service was extremely slow (not that many people), spent over 50+ not including drinks & tips & we were still hungry. Had to visit mc donalds afterwards. Most restaurants close at 11pm & prices are too high. Tip: while you gamble, u get Complimentary drinks (we gave tips). We highly recommend the piña coladas! Better than paying big bucks on the strip for watery ones ;) ok, enough with the food. Excalibur is connected by a "bridge" to new York hotel. To get to luxor or Mandalay bay, you need to take the Monorail which is free. Tropicana is very close too. The pool is very big. There are 4 pools, really good modern music playing & a big sports bar. The gym is small but have many treadmills, a water cooler, lockers & clean towels. Was never crowded. Clerks at the spa were very informative & gave us great suggestions on what to do or where to eat. We had a great time & will go back again since we didn't have enough time to finish visiting the entire strip. The casino at this hotel was always crowded & alive!! Lots of music, dancing, people having a good time & when it was time to sleep, we did peacefully. Loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: jadeegreen
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed for 10 days - absolutely no complaints!! We didn't book to stay in the hotel, the pool was fantastic you could see the new York new York hotel and the Luxor! Beautiful! I really enjoyed!! Great value for money! I was slightly worried at all the bad reviews and even packed extra towels and bedsheets! But there was no problem! We hired a car from this hotel as well - smooth transaction! Great location to get off the bus aswell!! 2nd stay in Vegas and 1st time stayed at a hotel which the bus stop wasn't outside - it was here which made it great!! You walk so much in Vegas it's lovely to stop just outside the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Matt G
Reviews.Content: This was my third trip to vegas and went on honeymoon! We stayed for 2 weeks We chose the Excalibur due to the fantastic price of the holiday as we wanted to do alot whilst in Vegas The hotel is grand to look at, having read some reviews we did have slight reservations however these disappeared upon arrival! the hotel is based on being medieval so dont expect the glamour in some of the hotels, its what you would expect for medieval theme. There were alot of reports saying the casino smelt of smoke, not once did we feel it smelt of stale smoke! The pool area is fantastic, DJ at the weekends, the only problem we found was there is little shade and being very fair skinned really needed some, the only way for gaurenteed shade would to be to hire a cabana or pool side bed but at $40 alone was over the top. I feel there really should be parasols for people as i would just fry, however this is the same in all hotels in vegas. we were llucky there was an area if you could get it was slighty shaded! The bedrooms were large and spacious! very average and probably a little tired looking but nothing to complain about considering how long we were actually in them! The buffet is fantastic price especially if you purchase the all day buffet, which we did if we were staying at the pool or hotel most the day! defo a must! other then that do as much as you can while you are in vegas, we saw 5 cirque shows, 2 magic shows went on a champagne tour, helicopter ride, went up the eiffle tower the list goes on ... it was fantastic! TIP!! collect up all the brouchers that are lying around and collect the coupons, we had lots of 2 for 1, free dinner and upgrades by using these saving us loads of money!! also the broucher change week to week and the offers in them change slighty too so remember to pick up the new ones!!

Reviews.Title: “Not as fresh and glitzy as the new hotels, but overall a nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: ZenFinder
Reviews.Content: The Excalibur is located at the end of the strip near a lot of other major hotels and attractions. The room was nice and spacious and the staff was really friendly too. After all the Vegas style action we had that week, it didn't come to a surprise to me when I realized after coming home that I had left a few things in my room. The hotel already was aware of my items and shipped them to me, which I thought was really commendable. The buffet (forgot which one we went to), was sub-par. More like hometown buffet than one you would expect to find in Vegas. Overall not a bad hotel. We really weren't interested in the luxury you'd expect from something like the Wynn, so the Excalibur was a great option for a group interested in going out and experiencing Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: HA20
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur for two nights. The first thing you notice is the whole of the ground floor is covered with slot machines, throngs of people and the smell of smoke. I'm going to try and be objective. This is not my thing at all and we wish we'd spent more and stayed elsewhere. However, I do get it that some people would love this and is exactly why they go to Vegas. I think perhaps it's a bit like Marmite! The room was fine and clean, but the cleaners decided that they would natter outside out bedroom both mornings VERY LOUDLY and VERY EARLY. Not what you want. To be fair to the hotel I would have mentioned it to them at check out, but we were strongly encouraged to do the express check out as the queue was so long and so I didn't get my chance. I would just suggest that if it happens on your first night it will happen again and so do mention it to the reception staff to sort out. Although the hotel wasn't our thing we did walk through to the Luxor and went to a really good restaurant which I think was called 'Rice'. Good Japanese food, good service and great value. We also went to the Grand Canyon and the Ranch there for a day. A really brilliant option if Vegas gets a bit much for you - you get some peace and quiet! If you're going to Vegas in a big group and want the whole mad thing then this hotel will be fine for you. For us, as a couple, it wasn't the right place.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THE STAY”
Reviews.Author: EMiller1956
Reviews.Content: I took my 2nd vacation of the year to Vegas stayed 3 days and 2 nights. Everything was great. Checked in quickly. This was a comp stay for the room. I had the all day buffet. It was fantastic. The room was great and I had a great view of the south strip and airport. It was a quite room when I did sleep. The staff was great from check in to the players club to the floor personnel. sWill be back in Feb 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Really great option for families”
Reviews.Author: CriCriFischer
Reviews.Content: We are proof that you can stay a few days in Las Vegas with the kids and avoid the seedy side of the whole gambling scene. We stayed at the Excalibur from August 3 to August 6. We were at the tail-end of our vacation in California and it was much cheaper to catch a flight from Vegas. We paid $95 a night Wednesday and Thursday. Friday night we paid about $20 more. For that price we got the room with the flatscreen tv in Tower II. If you have young kids, this is the perfect place to spend time at the pool. There are 3 pools for kids, one pool just for the adults and 2 jacuzzis. One of the pool includes a slide. The basement is where the arcade room is for the kids. We went in there with a pre-established budget and the kids had fun earning those little tickets or trying to win a stuffed animal. The basement would benefit from a thorough cleaning because it really smells. My son and I watched the 3D shows. It's expensive for what amounts for 30 minutes of fun, but we had alot of laughs. We were careful not to go out on the strip too much in the evening, because there are alot of shady characters giving out shady coupons on the street. It's really not a place for kids. There is a movie theatre nearby, though, which is convenient. During the day, when it was too hot to be outside (110 F), we were happy to take long air-conditioned walks inside each hotel and window shop. The Excalibur is well situated on the strip for that. Each complex has a great toy store, so we made sure to manage expectations on that one otherwise we would be broke in a day! Our room was simple but very comfortable. We never heard any noise. Note that the drapes don't completely cover the windows, so kids are up fairly early, no matter what time they go to bed. The bathroom was very nice, but not much water pressure. We were disappointed to learn that the rooms did not carry wifi. The buffet upstairs is fairly pricey, however, the food is good , and was our only option if we wanted to get away from the dreaded fast food fare, without dining at expensive restaurants. All in all, we were happy to have chosen the Excalibur for our family.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service - felt pampered and appreciated”
Reviews.Author: noodlebop
Reviews.Content: I was reluctant to stay at the Excalibur due to a few bad reviews but I am so happy that we did. The front desk was always very helpful and the MLife membership meant that we were able to get a free show and a free dinner. We ate at The Steakhouse at Camelot and were treated to wonderful service and delicious food. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. We also enjoyed being able to go to the other resorts and accumulate points with the MLife card. Donna, the hotel hostess, was friendly and helpful and made our stay so enjoyable by informing us of the MLife benefits. I have already booked our next stay at the Excalibur for October.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: janetday13
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for 11 nights in July and I could sum everything up by saying it was wonderful in every aspect. We checked in about 4 pm 4th July and had around a 15 minute wait in line but this was moving all the time. The lady at check in asked if we would like a room up high or low down, I asked for one up as high as she had available. we arrived at our room, a standard one on the 16th floor in tower 1 and this was lovely: it was large, two queen beds and beautifully clean, with a large TV. We even had a nice view of the pyramid at the Luxor. The room was cleaned to a very high standard throughout our stay. The hotel has many different restaurants, catering to all budgets, with an assortment of different shops also. Not that I'm a gambler but the casino was huge and seemed to be buzzing with excitement each time we walked through - infact that's how I would describe the hotel; " Exciting " My daughter - who's in her early 20 s loved the pools, there were four of them. The pool area was very attractive, with enough sun beds to cater for everyone. All the latest music was played making for a " Hip " environment. The public areas were beautifully maintained and the staff I spoke to around the hotel were friendly and helpful. It was an absolute delight to return to The Excalibur each evening and return is something I'm planning to do on my next visit to Vegas. This is a wonderful hotel for everyone: families with children, singles and older people. What more can I say, it was just a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Well worth it!"”
Reviews.Author: hi-itsmebarb
Reviews.Content: When we were looking into hotels in Las Vegas we were disappointed to find all the pools close between 6 and 7 PM. This was the last stop in a month long adventure along the west coast states and we were looking to just relax. (Gambling and drinking are not on our priority list.) We were trying to decide if we should splurge for Mandalay Bay or stay at Excalibur. When we discovered that we couldn't get to the pool at Mandalay Bay after check out - they scan their room cards- (we only stayed 1 night), we decided on Excalibur. Check lines went fast. We did have some issues with the room (phone didn't work, beds hadn't been sufficiently cleaned/changed. But, the polite staff recitfied all this quickly. Had to give the room cleanliness a 2 doe to this. But the hotel was nice. The pools were beautiful. The day of check out we were able to go to the pool and hang there most of the day. Pool tip. *** On the day of check out for $10 anyone over 18 can upgrade their experience and get the spa package. This allows you (even on the day of check out at 11am) use the spa facilities until 8pm. You get a locker acess to a whirlpool, sauna and (I think there was a steam room - not sure) as well as shower. All amenities for personal care (deoderant, blow dryer, qtips, ect. are provided.) Since our flight didn't leave until much later, on this 114 degree day, it allowed as a family to stay cool during the day and shower before going home. (Kids changed in the bathroom stalls, at 9, 11 and 13, they were happy not to take another shower. We ate at the Buffet a value at $12 per child and $16 per adult (that is there lunch price). We ate our dinner just before 4. Plenty of options, am sure you can pay more and get better quality, but it was fine for us, we were hungry and it was easy.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, but excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: padraig74
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur for about eight nights. Overall the experience was enjoyable- especially considering the price was well below most other hotels on the Strip. Let's start with my Likes first: Likes--- Price. I don't know how you could beat the price. The first thing most people would be concerned about is whether the price is due to poorer service or quality. I never felt that, to be honest. The buffet wasn't as good as MGM or Aria but a) you can use your buffet tickets at other hotels (like MGM, Aria, or Luxor) and b) it wasn't bad at all. It had a lot of fresh choices. Staff. The staff were amazing. You could have transplanted them into any other hotel on the Strip and they wouldn't have been out of place. My father had to use a scooter during our stay due to a recent stroke and the staff was very accommodating. In fact, we had to change out scooters several times (a few times due to our mistakes) and they never asked questions and were extremely kind about every ordeal. Their patience was limitless at the Bell Desk. The gentleman that helped us to our room was not only kind, but he gave me some great advice on where to go during an outing thatI had planned to the Valley of Fire. Great advice. The Dungeon. It was the children's area in the lower level, which my niece liked. But honestly, we all had a pretty good time down there. It wasn't overpriced and the games were enjoyable. I wish the attendants were more readily availabe, but that's just a minor criticism. Tournament of Kings. I have another review of this event, but let me say that we enjoyed it. This is a definitely "like." And now my dislikes... Dislikes--- The smell. Before that sounds too critical, let me be fair to say that the smell that I disliked was the deoderizor they used to rid the casino of the smoke smell. To me, it was overpowering. This may not be fair because my family didn't complain. However, I visited several different casinos and never felt that they were overpowering. Being pestered. As soon as you walk into the hotel with bags, you will get pestered by the staff about shows, etc. It's pretty easy to shake them off, but a bit annoying. After they get used to you, you won't get it much, but every once in a while we were bugged after coming back into the hotel after a long day/night on the Strip. This could/should probably be toned down a bit. Overall, I would recommend the Excalibur. The casino is nicely laid out. The buffet is good and the food court has a good selection. Kids have the pool area or the Dungeon where they can go to kill time while the parents either play along or gamble- or rest. And finally, the price is probably impossible to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Horriible experience!"”
Reviews.Author: Mike C
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for! Hotel was dirty, smokey, and the maid theived from our room. Hotel did nothing about it. Very unprofessional! We moved to Planet Hollywood for remainder of trip and it was awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a family to stay on the strip.”
Reviews.Author: The8racer
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed at Excalibur for 2 nights. Reviews are sometimes misleading and we were unsure what to expect. Self parking and registration were a breeze with many signs to help first timers like us. We stayed in a widescreen room and asked for a strip view at check-in. When we arrived at our room we found it to be very clean and spacious. Our view was excellent, 20 floors up overlooking NY NY and other strip sights to the North. The kids loved the Fun Dungeon and the walk way to Luxor was very convenient. We are all sensitive to smoke but were pleasantly surprised that it was a non issue. The room smelled fresh and the casino had very little smoke. The pools are also extremely nice and a good place for families. Overall very pleased with our stay and happy that we didn't change our plans based on some negative reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Palace”
Reviews.Author: pmdawn4
Reviews.Content: We have been taking our whole family to Excalibur for 8 years! We love it there. Something for everyone. Great pools, friendly staff, Camelot restraunt is fantastic, nice rooms, always clean. Great place to stay and have fun. Location couldn't be better.

Reviews.Title: “stayed here once, wont be back”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyMyhers
Reviews.Content: Where to begin? Front desk employees were rude, especially when charging me $12.50 a day for resort fees i was unaware of. It dosnt matter to me that many other places also charge this, if i wouldve known ahead of time it would be a different story. She acted like i was an idiot because i had to pay EXTRA. the only benefit was 'complimentary' internet. First off how is it complimentary if i am paying for it. And, i can stay in a comfort inn/suites or holiday inn and get internet for free, i would expect more from a hotel like this. Ants in my bathroom, dirty sheets on one of the beds when i checked in. There are enough places to chose instead of this, my next time back i will not stay here. ever. i will not advise anyone else to do the same, and yes even on the strip you can stay somewhere nice like Ballys and have no insulting resort fees. they dont even have a bathtub in the room? wtf

Reviews.Title: “I am very upset..The hotel is very dirty..out dated the elevators are aweful”
Reviews.Author: cher4pt
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from August 4th till the 10th..and I am very upset about the hidden cost..when my room was paid in full on line..upon check in time i am told i owe $85.00??? seriously? Then get to the room it is so outdated..grey dindgy look curtains are out dated and all stained up? No tub to relax in..The elevators were constantley dirty..no matter what time of the day and night it was..The staff are very rude..especially the clerks..almost every food court was closed as of 2;00 am..no complimentary breakfast? no complimentary coffee?the beds are hard and uncomfortable.. this place is a rip off..I will never ever recommend this hotel to anyone i know..I am very very unhappy..they should be ashamed of themselves

Reviews.Title: “LOOOOOOVED it!! will DEF go back!”
Reviews.Author: Louise T
Reviews.Content: I read a couple of bad reviews and was a bit worried but I enjoyed every moment of my trip. I stayed in the new tower (tower 2) where the rooms are renvoated, the upgrade is usually $20/ night but the lady at the desk gave it to me at $10/night; i stayed a total of 4 nights. the hotel is on the strip and easily accessible to transportation, ie the deuce bus, there's even a tram that goes to the mandalay bay & luxor! NYNY hotel was easy to get to as well with an air walk. the pools were great, I mainly stayed at the adults only pool, and the service is great. I acutally felt kind of sick due to the heat & the staff was very good with helping me feel better & not leaving me alone until I felt better. I can not wait to go back & will DEF stay here again with my fiance.

Reviews.Title: “What would happen if I forgot something at the hotel? They found it!!!”
Reviews.Author: janetvb01
Reviews.Content: We recently returned home from a five- day stay at Excalibur and faced every travelers’ nightmare. What would happen if I forgot something at the hotel? We called “Lost and Found” and was told nothing had been turned in. We pretty much kissed off our stuff. It was our own fault --failing not to double- check all the drawers before we left! Guess what-- two hours later we got a call back from Excalibur and they had retrieved our items!!! The Excalibur staff will be Fed Ex-ing them back to us!!! Not everyone would be this fortunate but they really tried and got out stuff back! We really appreciated their help! What a great relief to know you at least have a chance of getting your stuff back if you forget it! Things to know before you book……. Use the Excalibur web site to book your room because they offer promotional deals like 2 free breakfast/lunch buffets per day! There is a resort fee per day—it gives you free internet service and free US long distance and local calls (do not call information it costs extra!) It saved on my cell phone usage. Most hotels in Vegas have this fee too. Check the price before you book then add it into your cost! If there is a long line at Registration you can check your bags at Storage they will later bring your bags up to your room for you. It beats standing in line with four bags. It only took about 30 minutes with a real long line. Avoid the timeshare people like the plague. They have navy blue jackets on and lurk in the entrances of the resort. Your time is limited and you may not even get the “free show tickets”. It takes up about four hours of your life -- not much fun on vacation! We had a great time here. It is very affordable. The room was clean, nice big bathroom and the bed was very comfortable. It was 106 degrees and the air conditioner kept up with the heat all week. We usually do not spend much time in the room so the fact that this hotel is an older one really does not matter. Location wise it is right on the strip between Luxor and Mandalay Bay and there is a Tram to take you back and forth. The fact that they are an honest hotel will be my primary reason for my recommendation to stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: neelleyfam
Reviews.Content: I travelled to this hotel for a one night stay with my three kids ages 14, 11 and 7. They wanted to stay here so I caved in. Never again! First the lines upon check in were ridiculous. Took forever. The room I got was the "upgraded deluxe" room which I paid extra for. Well if this is their re-modeled room I would hate to see the normal room at this hotel. The room was dirty and smelled. The bathroom was old and did not even have a tub. They do not put comforters on the beds. It is a plain white sheet, blanket, plain white sheet. They even left the blanket off one of our beds so we were cold all night. Not classy at all! The only positive thing I can say about the room was that we had a great view of the strip. The pool was very crowded and there was no shade anywhere. They were all out of pool towels and we had to wait over an hour to get clean ones while my kids stood around and shivered! The kids enjoyed the kids fairway with the games and prizes. I stood in yet another huge line to try to buy tickets to the Tournament of Kings for dinner and it was sold out for our night. They should have signs up posting it is sold out so clients do not have to waste their time in these long lines for nothing. I cannot say anything very positive about this place. Its dirty, crowded and not worth it. You can stay elsewhere on the strip and get a much better value for your money! Beware!

Reviews.Title: “We love the Excalibur.”
Reviews.Author: CalvinandKathy
Reviews.Content: We always stay at the Excalibur as they are the cheapest place to stay on the strip. Not the fanciest hotel, but certainly adequate for our needs. Since we use their player's card when we play the slots, they send us amazing deals on our room. They are situated in a great location. They have four pools to choose from with plenty of seating. We always sit at the adult pool, but also enjoy the other pools.

Reviews.Title: “Do not Expect much”
Reviews.Author: venkatjs
Reviews.Content: The huge looking Hotel tempted me to expect too much from it, though it did not promise much of it. The check in at the afternoon was fast for a hotel of this size. It was pleasant walk through in the Casino to reach our room in the tower 1. The lifts were plenty and fast. There was some strange oily smell all through the passage and we could not discover much about this though stayed here for two days. The rooms are disappointingly small. The AC is noisy, if you need the room to be too cool, much required in this hot place. The television has no good free channels. The bath room is a basic facility with no bath tub except for a small shower. No toiletries are provided. The message was clear and loud from the hotel- that you are here not to sleep and spend much of your time inside the room, but you are here to spend them with your money every where else!!! My nephew with me, who had stayed earlier in the tower 2, felt it was a better choice than this. The hotel needs to refurbish the tower 1 immediately. Till then it is better to look for a place in the tower 2 if you plan to stay here. The only pleasant thing is the check out facility through the television, in tune with Las Vegas. Many Casinos are at a walking distance and the nice mono rail starting from The Excalibur takes you to the other major Casinos for free.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of The GrandView Timeshare employees!! Say NO!”
Reviews.Author: Cathy R
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back from a trip to Vegas and stayed 3 nights at the Excalibur. This was our first stay here and had heard decent reviews from friends. I knew it would be very kid friendly and more laid back. What no one told us was the Grandview employees who stalk you as you literally check into the hotel. They promise you a show tix, dining and gaming vouchers for a hour long presentation. Seems easy and we already have a timeshare so we thought it wouldn't hurt to get a good free show to KA and dining vouchers. We went early morning and they took us to the Grandview Hotel about 15 min off the strip. It was very pretty and secluded. They set you up with a sales rep and they do their "pitch" and show you the rooms. Easy and simple at this point. We are all friendly and start saying looks nice but not the right time for us...no need for two timeshares. The sales rep does the numbers....gets a manager who does his sales pitch but is more aggressive and throwing in insults to our desicion making. We finally get them to let us go after being very nice but firm in saying No we have one already. But you get sent to another sales rep who tries to scam you into a even cheaper deal of a lifetime excuse before they let you out of the room. But theres more.,.....you get to sit in another room and wait for your name to be called so you can get your vouchers and show tix. We get called into a cubicle and guess what?? No show tix for us because its SOLD OUT for that night! WOW....you can say I was pissed and annoyed that they can't even hold their end of the bargain. We lose 4 hours of our vacation so they can say "Sorry its Sold Out". Real piece of work these people are and its a lesson learned on our parts. Free is not worth it!! Just buy the show tckets and avoid the rude scammers...The GrandView employees at Excalbur and Luxor!!! Say No! This trip would have been over the top if we had never met these people and wasted our time and lost out on a good show. Being harrassed on the strip is better than the harrassment you will get in the Excalibur. At least on the strip they get the words.............No thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Kimbosold1
Reviews.Content: We chose the Excalibur because of the location and price. I was a little worried about too many kids, but that was not a problem. We were in Vegas to get married and everything went great! Very nice room with a fabulous view of the strip! The staff went out of there way to help. Dick's Last Resort was too much fun!! I don't know if I would stay there again (all of my kids are grown) unless I take the grand kids out to visit. But if you have kids and your going to Vegas, I think this is the best choice! Clean and a great value!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: Olivia E
Reviews.Content: Excalibur is great for many reasons. Their remodeled rooms are great, their pool section is great, there are 3 or 4 different pools, one has a slide for the kids, it has a tram to Mandalay Bay, and the casino doesn't look too outdated and of course their rates are great. if you are planning a trip with kids, this is a good hotel for that. they have a sponge Bob square pants attraction, and a virtual video game, and other things for kids. The things I didn't like about this hotel, is of course, it not super nice, it just average, as far as ambiance, aura, and appearance. Their layout is also pretty confusing and inconvenient and it is at the beginning of the strip so it is too far to walk to all the best places. Take a cab if you want to get to the Bellagio, Center City, Mirage, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: CCAA12
Reviews.Content: Checked in line was very long but got to room fairly quickly. Front desk staff was nice .Rooms very outdated.Room not as clean as it should have been broken outlet covers furniture old and uncomfortable chairs and sofa not in the best shape. The time share staff was so unprofessional and rude completely wasted my time and was not even accommodating after my whole day had been ruined due to their mistake

Reviews.Title: “Three Star Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SteveUpstateNY
Reviews.Content: We arrived early on a Saturday morning and as some others have commented, the check-in lines were long. The Hotel handled the situation as best as possible, having at least 20 people working to move the line along at a reasonable pace. We passed by the reservation's counter a number of times over the weekend and always saw long lines of people waiting. However, this was not the case during the weekday. We were upgraded to a widescreen room at no charge, which was nice since we didn't request it. The room was more than adequate and had a fairly large bathroom. We didn't have any problem with hot water, as others have mentioned but the water pressure was on the weaker side. One other thing to mention was the noise from the air conditioner, which was quite loud in our room. We were a little disappointed with the house keeping service, as one of the trash cans was still half full when we checked in and although we checked in early, it was on someone's omission, as the room had already been cleaned. Also, we were there three nights and only had the correct number of towels the day of arrival. We were on the 15th floor in Tower 1. If you like to use the pool a lot or the fitness center, ask to be in Tower 2, so you don't have to walk from one end of the resort and through the casino, every time you want to go there. The only thing that we wish the Hotel would curb, is the time share property sale representatives that hunt you down every time you walk past, which is at check-in and at very exit on the property. They act as if they're there to offer assistance and then hook you into the sales pitch, which gets quite aggravating when you've passed them ten times a day. All in all the Hotel was a bargain for the rate we paid and we would stay there again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room for the price”
Reviews.Author: bandmom14
Reviews.Content: Our rooms was very clean, and we had a nice view of the city. Checking in was very confusing as we could not find where to park or which entrance to use, once we finally did the staff was helpful and upgraded our room at no charge. After we had oriented ourselves, it was no problem to find parking. We stayed in the South tower and had an outside room with a nice view. We did not use the casino at all. We mainly used Vegas as our home base and took day trips to surrounding areas. The price of the hotel was very good for what we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: DebRFranksville_WI
Reviews.Content: While this was definitely not the best Vegas strip hotel I've ever stayed at, it was certainly adequate for the price. Room was nice, but no real extras. Had a safe in the room, but no refrigerator and no nice little extras you get from some of the nicer hotels. Pool was nice, a bit of a younger crowd and the DJ played music for the younger patrons, but we enjoyed it anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disapointing”
Reviews.Author: pokeroom2
Reviews.Content: First off I will tell you i am not new to this hotel,I have stayed here several times since its opening in 1990 and have always enjoyed it very much, as it WAS a great place to stay for the money. The last time I stayed here was before the 2005 ownership transfer from circus circus enterprises to MGM,aparentally MGM let this place go to hell.AS soon as i walked into the casino/hotel lobby there was a heavy musty smell,the carpets were torn and worn,the overall apearence was dirty. The room itself was ok but the hotel halls again smelled musty,and carpets torn etc. Back in the day this once beautifull hotel had express check in.These days you can expect to stand in a long cattle line and if your lucky enough you can get to the front of the line within the hour. I was so disapointed in this hotel that i cut short by intended 4 night stay here to 2 nights and moved to another hotel on the strip. On the only positive note,the pool area has been completaly referbished,it is one of the larger pools on the strip but far from the best. The once best value on the strip has turned into dump. Get your act together MGM,shame on you.

Reviews.Title: “Old Hotel with outdated room”
Reviews.Author: Maui721
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old and outdated, the aircond is very noisy, cant even have a good sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what expected”
Reviews.Author: Jackie155042
Reviews.Content: Just spent four fabulous nights here this July. Travelled with my sixteen year old daughter, my fourteen year old son and my mother. Booked this hotel for the following reasons.... close to airport close to outlet mall AWESOME food court and shops for kids arcade and 4d rides(which I thought my kids would be too old for....NOT!!! Loved all 10 hours we spent down there!) Tournament of Kings(Just as cheesy as I expected but surprisingly better than expected. Unless you like hospital food, don't get the dinner. It has no flavor!) Across the street from David Copperfield at the MGM(Kids enjoyed. I have seen him twice now, the same show. Not worth the ticket price...except my daughter got asked on stage this time. See Steve Wyrick instead for illusons and Lance Burton for the traditional magic. Both are worth it.) Moving walkway to Mandalay Bay where we seen The Lion King...FABULOUS!!!!!(Son wasn't eager to see it but really enjoyed and Daughter loved it. It is Cirque, so has life sized puppets instead of people in costumes. A little artsy but still good. Get seats up close . Worth the extra money. For small kids, they probably won't be able to read the story line and will just annoy people wanting to listen by asking what is going on. It is 2 and a half hours long.)

Reviews.Title: “Surprising”
Reviews.Author: jgpingpong
Reviews.Content: Stayed her for 2 nights with the girlfriend on a last second getaway. Got a good deal with the promotion for free buffets. Check in line was long, but got through it quickly. There was a little mix up with the promotion, but the manager straightened everything out without a fuss which was really nice. We stayed in room 22207 which was an upgraded Widescreen room with a view of the strip at no extra charge. The room was nice, the decor and furnishings were modern, and the room was clean. We disliked the small window, the falling ac covering, the faulty shower door, and weak shower head. The bed was extra comfortable, one of the better ones we experienced, maybe except for the beds at the Wynn. We didn't experience too much unwanted noise, and housekeeping was prompt when we requested extra shampoo and conditioner. The hotel itself has seen better days, but it was very amusing. We had a good time playing in the casino, but we ventured to Luxor, Mandalay Bay, NYNY, and MGM mostly. The layout is simple and easy to navigate, but it gets crowded, especially on the second floor, in the evenings. We disliked the parking because the covered garage was far from the entrance, so we parked outside in the heat, and crossing the little street was sometimes a little dangerous. We didn't sample any of the food besides Krispy Kreme for breakfast. The pool was exceptionally nice, though 2 of them were closed, we stayed in the adults pool and found it relaxing. Overall, we were surprised by the level of service we experienced for the price. We were more than satisfied with the room for the price we payed, especially for its location which is ideal for exploring the south end of the strip. It isn't hip, modern, new, or fancy; its 90s Vegas at its best, just make sure you don't get caught in the older rooms (Tower 1). Recommended if you are on a budget looking for a good place to stay at a central location to explore other resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Sim120
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the perfect location off the strip better than expected no complaints; and they had a pretty decent pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for a hotel thats starting to look run down”
Reviews.Author: blue500sp
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the price of this place but we found the hotel to be run down and showing it's age. The kids don't really notice this so for them it's a win. The location is at the southern part of the strip so walking can be a bit much unless you take a cab. I would opt for a hotel near the center of the strip next time and I would pay a bit more for a more upscale stay.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms where lovely other things can be improved”
Reviews.Author: Lollypopsicals
Reviews.Content: First trip to Vegas. My friend picked the hotel as I made her fly on her 21st. Check in que was long but was upgraded to a new room. Lovely view. Comfy beds. Very modern! We never gambled in our own casino except for the last day as we had to check out at 11 and our flight was not till 20:45! But on that last day was when I noticed the smoke alot more. My advice go to the Luxor! Alot nicer place to gamble and they are quicker with drinks! Aswell as ceasers palace! Had one buffet in the hotel and ate nothing. Ate in the Mexican and that was ok. Breakfast tip: Luxor buffet or the rainforest Cafe in the MGM grand. I think the one thing I was most shocked about was at 5pm they had dancers in small underwear doing there shows. The hotel caters for families yet they have this on!! The spa is amazing well worth a trip!! Staff where friendly and lovely! Please be aware a do not buy any club tickets from the people selling them on the street. They are a big con! You can get them for free in the particular hotels! Overall the staff where lovely and the rooms where good! If your there to see things other than a fruit machine it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed before, and will stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Chad I
Reviews.Content: Not a fancy hotel, but location and price is a big plus. Thought kids would be infested, but they had their activities down stairs. Easy to get around in. Staff was good and rooms were clean. Sister property at the Luxor - DON"T waist your time with Chris Angel. Waist of time and money, and NOTHING "Cirque" about it. This was my second time staying, two different decades, and I'll surely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “**INFESTED WITH BED BUGS!!!! Disgusting, dirty, and horrible service!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ang986
Reviews.Content: This was the WORST place we have ever stayed. There was six of us and all of us had to be moved to different rooms because we were covered with bug bites and after reporting to security the test results came back positive for BED BUG ACTIVITY! One of the couples went to crawl in bed after a long night and their bed was filled with ants!!!! They had to be moved immediately. The Excalibur did NOTHING to compensate us and our trip was ruined because we had to keep reporting to security and try to fight for some type of compensation. We were extremely itchy the entire trip and had to have everything dry cleaned and sanitized before we could bring our belongings back into our homes! We barely received an apology... I suggest not staying at any of the MGM Resorts unless you want to have a miserable vacation- they are all filthy and the staff is uncaring and rude. They tried to justify that bed bugs were in every hotel- I've stayed all over the country and never had bed bug problems and it didn't just happen to us it happened to everyone we traveled with!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: StevenRDew21
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my 21st Birthday and just WOW! Had a very nice welcome to the hotel, we Had a Family Plan room and it was Huge. The Beds were very comfortable slept. The Bathroom was huge aswel and so clean and tidy. The whole room altogether was Very Clean and was cleaned every day i was there, bed sheets were changed daily bathroom was cleaned daily. the Swimming Pools are beautiful and you have 4 to choose from all big sizes. They even have Jacuzzis :D. I will be staying at this hotel again when i next go to vegas. Had an amazing time in Vegas itself and had a wonderfully stay at Excalibur. Thank you for having me.

Reviews.Title: “Best Holiday Ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: Zeva90
Reviews.Content: Travelled to the Excalibur for my wedding with a group of 7 of us can honestly say this was the best holiday I have ever had. Upon arriving at the hotel we told check in that we were staying for a wedding party and they gave us a free upgrade to the newer suites. These rooms were brilliant flat screen tv, great bathroom and wonderful view of the castle turrets. They were also joined which was extremely helpful when preparing for a wedding. The casino itself was smoky but not overly noisy so no complaints. The excalibur itself is in a perfect location for seeing all the sights of the strip, i definatly would not recommend staying at the Stratosphere end of the strip where things start to get a bit too scary with homeless people wandering the street begging and such. Whilst we were in Las Vegas we also had the opportunity to stay at the Monte Carlo hotel which although more costly than the Excalibur lacked a lot of the heart of the hotel and the quirkyness of staying in Vegas. It was also not helped by there being a Playboy party on whilst we were staying there :S Overall I would definately recommend the Excalibur to anyone I know and if you happen to be here for a celebration definately order the room service celebration cake it was amazing!!! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: babyhardee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 days 4 nights at Excalibur and we loved it. We were treated very nice by the front desk staff Brenda and she also upgraded our room to a view room. We had a lovely view of Vegas. Our room was clean and smelled great (as did the casino). This hotel is awesome. Just alot of kids hanging around.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job”
Reviews.Author: scholiday
Reviews.Content: We were looking for some basic, cheap accomodation for our one night in Vegas, and Excalibur didn't let us down. Our room (with two queen beds) was really spacious and clean. The bathroom was equally clean, but there weren't enough towels for the four of us to use. We received friendly and helpful service whilst checking in and out. If you are looking for simple, no-frills accomodation, I would recommend staying here. The cheaper price gives you some more $$ to spend in the (very smoky) casino!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD AND BAD”
Reviews.Author: jdsrf900
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights here and over all it was a little better than I thought. There was a line at check in but it didn't take to long. However, the lady at the counter was not very helpful and really did not up-grade us even when I was willing to pay. Since our flight was late we just let it go, as there were 3 of us staying here all in a different room. The Lady at the check out at the end of our stay was super, wish I had her name. The place is older than many of the other places we went while on our trip....I really didn't notice any more smoke here than the other places. Place was a little dark and it could use some updates to the casino over all. The staff at the sports book were great and helpful, and you were always able to get a diet coke or what ever you wanted at the sports book and on the slots, poker room etc...The doormen are nice and always ready to help you get a cab etc...Really only the check in lady was negative on the staff end of things. When I got to the room, found a old empty glass on the floor, and the bathroom counter needed wiped down, but everything else was ok. The flat screen tv's were nice, and the beds were fine also....The a/c was god and really was not very loud in my room. My friends had better views from their room's but that was just the luck of things I guess, as we were all in Tower one. The rooms could use an upgrade, but the safe in the room did work and there were clean towels everyday and the bed was made and clean. Only ate breakfast in their buffett as it was part of our deal staying there, it was ok. The food court is about average but many of places close early. Of course the store is open but $3.50 for a diet pepsi is a little much I think... I guess the biggest draw back to the place is the resort fee they charge which comes to $14 a day. We got there about 9 p.m on Sunday night and were charged the fee for that day, and we left first thing Thursday 9 a.m and were charged again. I started to ask about it, but we had a few things we wanted to do before we left for the airport so I let it go. For the 14 bucks a day, I never got a newspaper, never saw the pool, spa or anything else. This reason alone will probably have me staying at another place when we go back. Over all of my 4 trips to Vegas as far as Hotels go, I would rank this one 3rd.
