Reviews.Title: “Would never stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Charline46
Reviews.Content: I went with a group of friends and stayed at this hotel. We reserved in the new tower which not cheap. Upon entering our room there was a real strong smell of vinegar. Our bathroom floor was sticky and the toilet was not clean. It was disgusting. I called housekeeping and the supervisor came in with a cleaning lady and she was surprised on the smell and the dirty bathroom with crapon the rim of the toilet. Just thinking about it makes me want to get sick. I complained to the manager and she credit about $70.00 Even with the credit still having to pay almost $100.00 was not worth the stay. Stay away!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fine if you are on a budget.”
Reviews.Author: Emmat93
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and just got back from staying in the Excalibur Hotel for three nights. We upgraded to a Widescreen room for an extra $20 a night, however it was nothing special! There was a large King bed and a widescreen TV but the room was a bit rough round the edges with scuffs on the wall and the shower was really weak. However, the view was good - we had an excellent view of the pool area and other parts of Vegas. Although the hotel is at the upper end of the strip - we quite liked its location and were happy that we weren't at the other end of the strip. There is a free tram between the Mandalay Bay and Luxor hotels which have nice places to eat. It is also easy to walk to New York, New York and the MGM - however the escalators and moving walkways were always broken! The casino itself is fine but as someone mentioned before feels very smoky - more so than other casinos. There are also McDonalds, Krispy Kreme and other fast food outlets in the complex. The real negative for us was that there is no WiFi which is pretty standard in other hotels but this seems to be the case in many of the Vegas hotels. Overall, this hotel is fine if you are on a budget but if you have the money I would stay in one of the hotels further down the strip.

Reviews.Title: “No Frills but Good Bang for the Buck”
Reviews.Author: Aubrav
Reviews.Content: As usual we booked a widescreen room because I prefer it to a standard room. The room was great, very clean, warm tones, everything as expected. The beds were also very comfortable but there are only two pillows on each bed. The view was awful, straight into a service entrance and a wall again, but we did not pay for a view so it was expected. The hotel staff is not super friendly or helpful, but they are adequate as long as you don't expect special treatment. Basically, for the low rates they offer, you are getting a great value, but don't expect a luxury resort feel at that price. The pool was great as always, with all 4 pools and the water slide being open even in the morning. I like that they added the Dairy Queen in the Midway but I miss Sherwood Forest Cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Good Family Vacation Location”
Reviews.Author: zgirl12
Reviews.Content: When we got there we had to wait for a while at the check in line, but it moved pretty fast. They didn't book us the right room, but fixed the issue right away. that was the only 2 issues we had the entire stay. They have an arcade area for kids & adults, they have 4D rides that are cheep and fun also for kids & adults, they have package deals for shows at the Excalibur and other Hotels/Casino's, that are reasonably priced. We saw the Tournament of Kings show, it was alot of fun for couples, families, or anyone who loves to eat and watch a good show and participate with the actors of the show. We also saw the Chris Angel Believe show, which was good for the whole family, but I would warn some about the loud music they play during the show, it may be too loud for little ones, and also they have some creepy looking props that might scare little ones a bit. The Excalibur has decent rooms, we had the King bedroom, smoking, and the celing was a little dirty, but the rest of the room was clean and the bed was soft. I wouldnt recomend this room to honeymooners or anyone who will be in the room more than in the Casino, I would advise to upgrade or get the spa room. The Excalibur has some of the best rates for rooms if on a budget and it connects to the Luxor, and New York and ,mandalay bay Hotels via walk ways and has a tram to get to the Aria and Monte Carlo. you have to walk from the Monte Carlo via sidewalk to get to the Bellagio. Then walk on to Ceasers from there. Also dont forget to check the dresser for a booklet full of coupons, curtesy of the hotel, we saved alot of money using there coupons for shows and other stuff. They have burger king and krispy cream and all kinds of places to eat cheep, If you are looking for a more expensive dinner, then eat at there steak house.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: angelaernie
Reviews.Content: We were a bit worried about this hotel but everything turned out very well. We arrived early ans asked if we could check in. The lady at the desk was very friendly and told us we could for an extra 20.00. We took her up on the offer. We booked the upgraded room and my mom booked the regular room. She upgraded my mom to be in our tower and gave us a top floor with a strip view. She also gave us buffet passes. She was extremely nice. While we were checking in there was a line forming behind us and another lady at the desk was very rude to them, screaming, "check in isn't until 3!!!!" So we felt very fortunate to get the happy clerk! Room was great. Housekeeping was great. Kids liked the games in dungeon. Ate at buffet it was good. Our daughter has a nut allergy and the staff and head chef were great at helping us select items. (compared to the Paris buffet where they basically told us they couldn't help us and we should eat somewhere else) The only negative about our room was that we could hear the screaming from the NY NY rollercoaster. We used the pools. Theyw ere great too. If you are staying with kids in an updated widescreen room you have nothing to worry about.

Reviews.Title: “!! NO HOW NO WAY !!”
Reviews.Author: shellstravel66
Reviews.Content: This is one spot you don't want to spend any time in the rooms. Go elsewhere!!! Rooms are run down and very out of date. I am not that hard to please but when you are in bed and maintenance shows up at your door at 1AM not happy, not happy at all!! Also eat at Luxor or Mandalay Bay food is good.. On a better note the casino is fun and gamble friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to visit.”
Reviews.Author: mdmacke
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Excalibur casino in Las Vegas for three nights. It was pleasant, very quiet in the rooms yet full of activity everywhere else. The outdoor swimming pools were nice and the buffett food was actually very good. I would reccomend this location, for its price, over any other casino.

Reviews.Title: “Suprisingly Quiet, and an upgrade!”
Reviews.Author: Route66Convert
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a flat screen TV room, which was a nice surprise. It was very nice, clean and comfortable with comfortable beds. The rooms were extremely quiet. We never heard any hall noise or noises from other rooms. While the room was clean, some of the common areas could stand a walk-through more often. There was trash in one of the elevators for 24 hours. In the casino, there one very lousy waitress, interestingly enough near the payout windows. It was so bad that twice... we left the area and played in another area long enough to be served, then came back to drink them. I'd say we waited an hour without seeing a single waitress. We were very happy with its location on the strip. We were able to walk to all the other main hotels with ease. The only thing I need to mention to anyone planning a trip to Vegas (and this wasn't this hotel's fault so I'm not reflecting it in the rating) -- there are NO GROCERY STORES on or near the strip! We were planning on saving some money by buying some bread and basics to have in the room, but they make it nearly impossible to do that. You have to pay a bus or cab, which pretty much negates the money you would save.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Go Wrong Staying Here”
Reviews.Author: Likes2Review
Reviews.Content: When I arrived to check in the line was extremely loooooooooooong (it took me 32 minutes in line before I was able to check in). I do have to give the staff credit, it was exactly 3pm (check in time) and the line moved fairly well. So I won't say that this was a negative. Room is fairly large, has a nice soft bed and clean. Carpet is a bit dated but other than this the room was great. I honestly feel that check out (with a very small line) took extremely long!!! This was my only complaint. You can not go wrong by staying at Excalibur. Oh and check out Dick's Last Resort Restaurant...you will have a blast (waiters will be rude to you in the most fun way possible...so many laughs!!!! Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Last Vegas !!!”
Reviews.Author: breeqieen
Reviews.Content: The Excalibur is a great place to stay, while in Vegas. I loved the castle, its location, the service and friendly staff. Hope to stay again soon

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for a decent price !!!”
Reviews.Author: Aja D
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with friends for Halloween and I must say that it was very nice. Hotel deals are very affordable, and we got great room for cheap price. Hotel is located near everything, its 5 minute walk to the center of the strip. We had a room on 19th floor,and the view was amazing. Interior was really nothing special, but it was clean. Hotel bar is also nice, but there is no food for purchase after certain time (not sure what time) which was kind of a hassle. I would definitively come back here.

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong with the castle. Best place if you're on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: MLoGilbert
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Excalibur July 7-11 of this year. Excalibur is the only hotel I stay at when I venture to vegas (which is 3 times a year). They have such great prices, and the location is great. The excalibur is connected to the Luxor, Mandalay Bay, and MGM Grand by walkways. So when you stay at one, you basically stay at them all! My friend and I especially enjoy hanging out at Jesters, the video poker bar right next to the check in desk. We have made friends with all of the bartenders. Theyre so nice and helpful, and will answer all of your questions. My tip for anyone who is staying here is this: Tower 1 has way more comfortable beds. However its older and a bit dingy. Tower 2 has a lot of upgraded rooms with flatscreen TV's and better decor. However, the beds are not nearly as comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Great value on the strip”
Reviews.Author: PokerkingDublin
Reviews.Content: One of the best cheap hotels on the strip, we paid 28$/night midweek, location is right in the strip but at the end, plenty of walking involved but the ace/deuce bus stops right outside and there is a monorail to mandalay bay. Be ware of the resort fee checking out and tower 2(refurbished) is much nicer than tower 1. the http://www.thetwentydollartrick.com/ got me upgrade from tower 1 to tower 2. Plenty of cheapish eating options and the pool and pool bar was quite nice. Would return if on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Not a chance we will back!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rullafive
Reviews.Content: We had to wait to check in for 40 mintues..not a good start considering we were lugging around 2 suitcases and 2 duffle bags. Then we were offered to "upgrade" for $40 to an easy pool access room. We happily accepted, as we were looking forward to pool time. Wait until you see the pictures from our "upgraded" room. A room is a room in Vegas. So our mind of thinking was that we would not be in the room much other than to rest our heads for a bit. AUGGHHH!! A place can be older and still be clean...this place was not clean at all! I should've complained right away but I didn't. While walking around, the only people that were decent were the ones trying to sell you something. If you asked a bartender or someone behind a counter a question, they would mumble to us. WE ARE NOT FANS OF THE EXCALIBUR!!!! Our goal is to try a new place each time we go. I have to say, though, I would hate to put another penny into the Excaliburs slots, except for the fact that a bunch of these casinos are linked and we have no choice!!!! Over-all....Vegas can be a wonderful trip...just don't spend a lot of time here!!!

Reviews.Title: “If you like the smell of smoke, loud aircon and rude staff...”
Reviews.Author: Mellow93
Reviews.Content: ...then this is the hotel for you, not sure what was worse the smoke or the air freshener liberally used everywhere to mask the smell, even on the non smoking floor. The amount of money this hotel makes surely they could invest in a modern efficient aircon unit for the bedrooms, it was a choice of either sleep and die of heat exhaustion or stay cool but awake... Large pool but get this...no changing rooms we were told to use the toilets, what sort of halfwit planned this. Check in was interesting, The staff member actually told us something and then changed his mind, when we queried it with his manager and the correct price was arrived at, after the manager had left the staff member argued with us telling us that we had made him look a fool. What a joke. I would say... stay at any other hotel. Give this a wide berth.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: rckbtm9999
Reviews.Content: This was the third time that I've stayed at the Excalibur. I'm rating it Very Good as it's a Great Value. We went for a wedding. Our friends stayed at the Mandalay Bay. Their rooms were 3x as much. We stayed in the remodeled section of the Excalibur. The rooms were very nice. We had a great view of the NYNY hotel. We like the Excalibur b/c it's a great location, the casino is guest friendly, and their are economical restaurants (McD's, PIzza Hut, Quizno's etc...) for cheap breakfast and lunches. The fitness center and pool were very nice for the price you pay to stay there. Would recommend to anyone looking to get the most for their money.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: ANTfromJerz
Reviews.Content: booked room as part of a flight/hotel package deal. The rooms were basic. 2 beds, shower w/o a tub, no safe. Carpets and linens were clean but old. Everything in the hotel just looked old and worn. The limits in the casino were low ($5 to $10). Cheap Dining options were plentiful from mcdonalds to baja fresh to krispy kreme. Also, the gym/spa/pool area was nice and relaxing...but there is a 12 dollar per day resort fee. Overall, it was a decent stay and would stay again. P.S. Don't bother paying for the room upgrade. You can get a room at a better hotel for a similar price. .

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur is awesome”
Reviews.Author: binkee_10
Reviews.Content: The atmosphere is great. The pool area is awesome with good music playing. The buffet has lots of choices and reasonably priced. The rooms are clean and relatively quiet. The spa is really relaxing with lots of choices for pampering oneself. Great location on Strip and can walk to lots of other hotels/casinos. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Tried to up the rates when we arrived, but overall a decent trip.”
Reviews.Author: MystyWolf
Reviews.Content: When looking for hotels in Las Vegas (without the cash to stay at a place like Caesars Palace or the Venetian) my husband and I stumbled upon Excalibur's website. If you joined their mailing list, they had deals for rooms as low as 27 dollars or so per night advertised online. We were going to stay there for 4 nights, and we upgraded to a better room in tower 2 for a bit more money. I suggest if you stay at Excalibur, you stay in tower 2, considering it is more recently renovated. Watch when you book online because they only charge you for the first night rather than the duration of your stay, so be prepared to pay for the hotel even if you think you have gotten that covered! They charge you a "resort fee" now as well, and what should've been a much cheaper trip grew into one much more expensive. I think this fee is a joke, considering the amenities at this hotel do not "wow" me. The hotel also smells of strong solvent, probably put into the rugs and upholstery to stop it from smelling like smoke near the casino. When we checked in at the front desk, they attempted to charge us a higher price for our rooms than the rate we got online. They fixed it when we refuted the charge. The room was clean and comfortable, though nothing at all special. We had a nice view out of our window. If you are on a budget, I would say go for it, but watch for hidden fees and make sure you pay attention to what they are charging you.

Reviews.Title: “Great time and free upgrade!”
Reviews.Author: Beachgirl1234
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay here. Although it was only one night. This is definitely a place to bring the kids so if you don't like kids, don't go here! The casino is decent. Pool very nice with music playing and even an adult only pool for over 21. Towels provided pool side as well as many poolside bars. Offers decent night life, food options and has a covered walk over to the Luxor which is an added bonus. On a busy holiday weekend we were offered a free upgrade to a room with a view of the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Way too crowded .. Terrible Buffet”
Reviews.Author: Leesa777
Reviews.Content: I guess a lot of people stay at Excalibur because they have some of the best room rates on the strip. Next time, I'm going to spend more money and stay at a nicer, less crowded casino. We stayed at the "newly renovated" rooms, but even those seemed old and not too clean. And the buffet .. I paid $16 for a banana!!! I honestly could not get myself to eat anything else. Even the macaroni and cheese was bad!!!! How can you get that wrong?!! What a waste of money.

Reviews.Title: “Old and musty”
Reviews.Author: Themenace4
Reviews.Content: The hotel felt old and smelled old. The hallways are dimly lit and the ceilings are low. In addition they charged a $12.50 resort fee. The pool is not accessible from tower one without going through the casino. We would never staty here again.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place for a great price.”
Reviews.Author: Scrapfool
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur for 6 nights. Our room was clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful. Trying to avoid the timeshare sales people was a pain! Overall we enjoyed our stay and felt it was worth the money we spent. Monorail to Madalay Bay and Luxor was easily accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Disabled Travellers!!”
Reviews.Author: travel_buff2009
Reviews.Content: Reading some reviews I was a bit worried about staying here. Checking in and dragging my suitcases to the room didn't help. However, it got much much better from here. The room was huge and had two big comfy double beds, a modern plasma screen tv and a great ac unit. Iwas travelling with my sister who is in a wheelchair and we received an ADA room with a bathroom big enough to party in. The casino floor itself is very dark, not the cleanest but totally fit for purpose. The pool area is fantastic and the staff are extremely friendly and can't do enough to help. They have a pool hoist for disabled travellers which can be used at the adults pool at the back of the pool area. This was fantastic and really helped my sister have a trouble free holiday. We really did have a great time and he hotel was very inexpensive, great location, great rooms, and I would recommend it highly. We are going back in Sept 2012 and will n ot be looking for anywhere else to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Really good fun!!”
Reviews.Author: FelixNottinghamUK
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in November 2007 and then again in October last year-I have noticed it has received some very negative reviews but I really enjoyed it and so did my boyfriend and my friend who came with me in 2007 ,I also have other friends who enjoyed it and returned after the first visit.For the price you can't beat it. The location of hotel is very handy for the airport and the strip.Last year we were given a free upgrade as the room we booked was not available-the room we were given had a wide screen television and plusher furniture ! The rooms are spacious and on both visits I had no problems with the cleanliness.The pool area has been renovated and is very nice .The only gripe I had last year is that the drinks at the bars had become very expensive ,however at the weekend the beers were two for the price of one so this made up for it somewhat! We were offered loads of free drinks even though we were only playing the 5 cent slots -we tipped the waitresses 1 dollar each time-they were really friendly and helpful. The hotel is quite rowdy with a party vibe and lot of young people especially at the weekend, but personally I prefer that kind of scene! -the more luxurious hotels are lovely to walk around but I am more comfortable in a more down to earth unpretentious atmosphere.Other reviewers have complained about the smoke ,i know this is not politcally correct but as a smoker i love being somewhere where you can still smoke!!.(strike me down!) however i didn't notice lots of other people smoking. Maybe they should have smoking and non smoking casinos then everyone would be catered for. I enjoyed the buffet which was great value at 19.99 during the week and 24.99 at the weekend for breakfast lunch and dinner-the food was good with lots of choice. I would definately consider staying here a third time!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Quality Buffet”
Reviews.Author: NancyFFF
Reviews.Content: Did not stay at hotel so I can't comment on the rooms. However, the we did go to dinner at the buffet and the serving area was very dirty. Food was awful. Would not recommend eating at the buffet to anyone. Actually told some people who were going in to buffet as we were coming out to pass this one up. Health Department obviously is not checking out this hotel. The ice cream machines were so dirty I could not even stand the thought of getting a dish. Left still hungry because the food and dining areas were so "GROSS."

Reviews.Title: “Good Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: 2ularbell
Reviews.Content: I was very worried after we booked this hotel as I booked on the spur of the moment without actually looking at the reviews, after checking the reviews I was disheartened to say the least, We arrived and immediately upgraded as I was so paranoid but the charge was not that much. Our room overlooked the pool and the mountains, we found it to be pleasant, clean and the beds were very very comfortable. The housekeeping service we could not fault they were friendly and we had clean towels every day. Pool area was lovey however there were charges for some of the beds - all in all good value for money as I find that Vegas is becoming very expensive!!

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: eme1970
Reviews.Content: Ok so every Thanksgiving my family goes to Vegas this particular trip was sort of last minute and we asked our boys where they would like stay...now I will say we normally frequent the Venetian so our standards are pretty high. However, this place was a nightmare...parking was just awful even if you did valet (the wait was just not acceptable). First off, they checked us into a room that was in the middle of a re-model. When I called down to front desk to explain the clerk was rude and could not comprehend what I was telling her...she didn't believe me?!? HELLO? why would I lie about something such as this? After finally getting the situation resolved we were moved. Apparently, security is not tight here...the whole trip teenagers were running the halls at all hours, walls are very thin. Every time we were in the halls it reeked of pot...not that cared just the fact that it did...the elevator waits were insane...because kids were constantly playing in them...I could go on and on, but I won't basically I would never recommend this place unless you are a young couple out to party and don't care about service and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and hope to be back”
Reviews.Author: willkirk85
Reviews.Content: I have never been to Las Vegas before and was totally taken back by the experience I had. Originally, I had a regular room at Excalibur, but considering I had no idea about the resort fees that most of the casinos had, the receptionist was very nice and upgraded my room for only a few extra bucks! I'm sure the regular room would have been fine, but the deluxe room was wonderful! The beds were very comfortable and the view was excellent. Overall, my stay was a blast! I hope to come back and relive that great experience!

Reviews.Title: “The best nights sleep ever, great hotel, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: beachjunkie1980
Reviews.Content: We originally planned to stay for 2 days and ended up staying 4. This hotel has soo many things to do and see. We saw the dinner show, it wasn't all that great! "Tournament of kings" we first noticed a foul odor of manure, then we were served our Cornish hens, baby red potatoes, with a stock of broccoli. It was good, i Could have of eaten more if i was comfortable eating without silverware, a baby chicken is made to cut not tear with ur fingers. definately not worth the $60. Per person we paid. The fun dungeon was the highlight of the hotel, i also enjoyed the many gift shops. This hotel has 4 large pools and many other amenities, too many to see in 1 trip. We will return soon. GREAT SPECIALS ONLINE!

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: gramc16
Reviews.Content: My daughter, son, and I stayed at the Excalibur Hotel and Casino. We found the price was surprisingly affordable for our accommodations. It was quiet and peaceful for sleeping. I will stay there any time I ever return to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Weekend at Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: jagreenlaw
Reviews.Content: My family went to Excalibur this last weekend, July 22, we arrived 1:00pm Friday and the hotel clerk got us right in too an upgrade room for an extra $9.00 and she was extremely friendly. Our room was perfect and clean. The pool was fun, buffet was okay, but we paid for the all day pass, so got our money worth. The casino was a little crazy, because Dick Last Resort bar and restaurant is loud and crazy and the people that were coming out of there were loud and feeling no pain. The elevators and the carpets in tower II are little outdated; however if you want the glamour of a casino, they you need to pay the extra price and stay at one the upscale casinos.

Reviews.Title: “far better than expected”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler246810
Reviews.Content: Our recent trip to Vegas was made special by the great room we had at the Excaliber! We arrived and were upgraded right away to a better room in tower 2 with a great view of the pool and the mountains in the distance. An unexpected bonus! The room was clean, the king size bed was very comfortable, everything worked well and the maid service friendly and fast. All in all we couldn't have asked for a better experience and at a great price! The best Vegas stay and overall deal we've had in years.

Reviews.Title: “Busy and served our get-a-way, lacking security”
Reviews.Author: lizzyrazzi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two years ago. Not pleased with the lack of security to check for room keys. Very different than two years ago. Even when guards were there they did not ask. Buffet was nothing speical. Enjoyed eating at other buffets, and resturants. Our bed was good, and maid was great and did a great job with the room. I left a tip on the sink and she did not take it. So then left it either with the towels or on the bed. The check-in line was long but went fast and check-out was good. No problems with our bill. To hot to check out the pool this visit. It is a pain to have people ask you all the time if you are checking in and they can comp you a show. Would like to do it to them on their vacation . Parking is easy but long walk if you are in tower 1. No coffee pot and happy I brought our own! CVS is short walk away so you can get some supplies there.

Reviews.Title: “$$$ FEES...FEES $$$$”
Reviews.Author: atxinthehouse
Reviews.Content: Resort fees....fridge fee....early check-in fee. Fees everywhere.We were invited to vegas by some friends to enjoy the 4th. they decided on the Excalibur due to the low price. We arrived early. We were informed check-in was after 4:00PM, but we could check in now for 10.00 more dollars or come back after 4:00pm.My wife has meds that need to stay cool,so we needed a fridge, 25.00 fee. A 12.50 per day resort fee is accessed upon check-in for certain uses of the facilities.Since we were traveling together we needed to stay close or at least on the same floor. We were unable to be on the same floor, however for a 10.00 fee they could upgrade us so we could be close together. my wife expressed her disappointment was this fee,at the end the fee was waived,and we were able stay next door to each other.The rooms had a safe in them,which there was no mention of them on the website,very pleased with that.Next time I think we will ask about all fees up front....or stay else where.

Reviews.Title: “3rd time this year and wont be going back”
Reviews.Author: RosieMarie95
Reviews.Content: this was the 3rd time this year we have stayed in the Excalibur, and I am still disapointed with what we encountered. We had 2 rooms in tower 2 which are the "updated" rooms. Both rooms were filthy!!! and i don't say that lightly. There was at least half an inch of dust on all furniture in the rooms, there were stains on the duvets and the bathroom floors were dirty. Our air con wasn't working on arrival but the maintenance staff were quick to fix this. I can't say the same attention was given when we went to check out, the lady on the checkout desk did not make eye contact with us, and made no attempt to apologise for the room being dirty. unfortunatly this was not the 1st dirty room we encountered here, when we stayed in March we had booked a room in tower 1.... big mistake!!!! The room was covered in bodily stains and dust, at that time we were given a different room and we just attributed the condition of the room to the fact it was just after spring break.. we were wrong. It appears now the cleanliness of the rooms is not a priority for the staff here and we will not be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Best family vacation yet!”
Reviews.Author: Mommy2BabyG
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay at the Excalibur. We weren't really sure what to expect since the reviews here were either really good or really bad. We had been to Las Vegas before, however this was our first time to stay at Excalibur and the first time for us to bring our 8 year old daughter. Our vow renewal for our 10th wedding anniversary was the purpose of our trip and we wanted to include our daughter in that. (To those of you that frown on kids coming to Vegas, shame on you! There were more than enough attractions for her to see and we knew what was what when we were there and sheltered her from what she needed to be sheltered from. It was an amazing trip!). When we checked in we were corraled by the Timeshare folks, but because they had a great offer, we signed up for the 2 hour timeshare tour. We got 4 tickets to the Shark Reef Aquarium and $200 in gaming and dining vouchers. After a short sign up there we were able to check in at 11 a.m., no extra charge. Not only that, but we explained why we were in Vegas and got a complimentary upgrade! We were still in Tower 1 (which is nowhere NEAR as bad as people make it out to be on this site), 25th floor with a Strip view, which filled our window at night! The room was themed with the whole knights-of-the-roundtable theme, which I thought was great! We had 2 queen beds and I will tell you, I'm picky when it comes to a mattress. It wasn't as comfy as ours as home, but it was the most comfortable mattress I've ever slept on in a hotel. The room was more than accomadating for the 3 of us. It was very clean, and it was a non-smoking room and there wasn't even a hint of cigarette smell. We were given a room with a widescreen TV which we used only at bedtime. The internet IS wired, however the cordis long enough to stretch all over the room, and it's pretty fast as well. The room was clean and comfortable, which are the main things I look for in a hotel. We never had to wait more than a minute for the elevator. They were fast getting us from the lobby to the 25th floor and back down. The staff was extremely friendly, from the registration desk, all the way to housekeeping. Even the Timeshare people were ok. Just tell them, "No thank you" and they'll leave you alone. As far as kids in the casino: as long as you are just passing through you're ok. If you stop and are too close to machines or tables, someone will very politely just explain that your child is too close and will direct you where to go. The casino does smell of cigarettes, but we also went into MGM, Tropicana, Hooters and New York New York and they all smelled the same way. There is a food court upstairs and I'm pretty sure we got a little bit from everywhere; again, great staff! We had the buffet twice for breakfast and once for dinner and it was wonderful. Just when I thought I couldn't eat anymore, I would find something else!! There are also little souvenir shops upstairs. Helpful hint: all the same stuff is downtown for WAY less! There is an arcade downstairs for the kids and we spent HOURS down there playing the games with our daughter and spent no more than $20. She LOVED it! Check your coupon book; 2 free midway games! The pool is another great spot. 3 different pools, 2 for families and 1 that was adults only. Helpful hint: get there early! There are a few places that you can more your chair and get some shade. Otherwise you have to rent a cabana or an umbrella chair, or bake in the sun. One of the pools has a small water slide that my daughter (and husband) couldn't get enough of. Be sure you have your room key with you when you head out there. You won't be allowed access if you don't have one. The casino after dark, as well as anywhere else on the Strip, is no place for kids. There are half nude knights and "wenches" dragging you over to take a picture and there are girls dancing on the bars. We knew this going in and made sure that we were back in our room, or avoiding these areas, after dark. Speaking of the casinos--- tightest slots I have ever seen, but my husband won big on one of the 3 card poker tables! All in all, this was an amazing trip. We chose the Excalibur because it seemed to be kid friendly and it was extremely affordable. In fact, we got our room 40% off, $203 for 4 nights, that is including tax and the resort fee(If you stay here, you have to pay it whether you use the ammenities or not, which really is the only bad thing I have to say about the Excalibur), and the complimentary upgrade. We were in our room long enough to shower and sleep so it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Third time and still happy”
Reviews.Author: Sheannb
Reviews.Content: Room was very, very clean. Buffet deal was a great one and food was very good. No complaints at all about Excalibur!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean, good value and on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: altwishes
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 12 nights and although the rooms are in need of updating it was very clean. The air con however was so noisy we had to change rooms but the staff were very helpful and nothing was too much trouble. Hairdryer, Iron and ironing board and clean towels were provided. A safe for your valuables. No tea or coffee facilities in the room so would advise you take a kettle and tea and coffee if you like a morning cuppa. Breakfast buffet for 14 dollars we found good value and set us up for the day! I would definitely stay there again. Not luxury but very good value!

Reviews.Title: “Will not return...poor service”
Reviews.Author: Tam0922
Reviews.Content: Pros; the updated rooms were very nice, comfy bed, large rooms, great view of the strip, great location, food was okay. We loved the $29 daily buffets. Breakfast was the best. Great service at the restaurants . Cons: Very dated hotel. stained carpets, spills, etc. rude staff at check in/and check out. The M life membership is like a players card. The whole sign up process for the M Life membership was stressful and a waste of time. Long process to check in (despite my special offer included priority/speedy check in). After check in(9pm), I was sent to the M Life desk and waited in their line for 30 or more minutes. Was told the special offer included 75 to use toward food and/or resort fee. Upon check out 5am( a disaster ) my credit card was charged resort fee and food totaling an average of $100. Took more than an hour and half to get my bill corrected. Was sent back to the M Life desk, waited in line 30 or more minutes, missed airport transfer. Waited 2 hours for another one. Manager was very rude and cold. No eye contact, no empathy, nasty tone. Was sent back and forth to and from the M Life desk to get the charges corrected. Not once did anyone apologize. I emailed management to express my frustrations/concerns. I also provided the names. Still no response or apology from management. The service was very poor. I will not return to this hotel. I traveled with a group of girls in a wedding party. The standard rooms were nasty, smelly, and dated . If you want a clean room, you pay extra. Others complained of very poor service from the staff at front desk. Due to poor service (especially from management) , I will not return. Too many other options in Vegas..

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunately We Will Not Come Back to Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: rubmax
Reviews.Content: My friend and I have been staying at the Excalibur for over 6 years. We always enjoyed out visits but this time upon checking in (we arrived on 7/14 and left 7/19) it was very disappointing to see how the place changed in just one year. First off we had to pay $70 to cover out use of the spa, the pool and internet. We explained to the lady checking us in that we never used any of these things, and that we never had to pay for it. But we were told we had to do it. Secondly the food served in the buffet was almost always cold. But more than anything we realize that the Excalibur like other hotels is trying to reach out for family bookings. I think that you should look into how you can eliminate these children from being on the casino floos where they are running, screaming and not being supervised by their parents. More than that was the fact that you have all of these college kids running all over the place and unfortunately (I really can't blame you guys for all of this) but they never without drinks in their hands, loud and wild.. I was really disturbed by the fact when coming out of the elevator 4 young ladies were laying on the floor drunk and their friends were trying to get them up to go to their rooms. I was also very surprised tosee dogs in the hotel. It was not very comforting when you are trying to sleep and one of the guests dog barked half the night. It might be a good idea for the planning staff or whomsoever is in charge of the management should try to work out something whereby they children are not running all over the place (with a chance of injury) and the drinking of the college kids leads me to think about other places where college kids go to have fun and a girl ends up stating that she was raped or that she winds up dead. I hope that these things will be something that your hotel can work on to try to enhance the Excalibur and not bring it down. I would appreciate receiving a response to this review and once again, I am really unhappy with this visit to the Excalibur after so many years of patronage.

Reviews.Title: “/Fabulous trip, just too short!”
Reviews.Author: Jay580419
Reviews.Content: Excalibur Hotel great venue, surprised to see so many children there as hotel is also casino, but lots for children to do as well. All day buffet meal ticket good value for money for all ages and groups, excellent food. Hotel staff very pleasant and helpful. Went for a long weekend for friend's birthday, not enough time, but fabulous destination. Can also recommend Cirque du Soleil 'Ka' at the MGM Grand, stunning show from start to finish. Fantastic night out.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Dunebuggy12345
Reviews.Content: Great rooms if you're on a budget. Clean and affordable on the strip. Some of the most comfortable beds I've slept on. Beats Wynn's $4000 beds!

Reviews.Title: “Treated like royalty”
Reviews.Author: sober2626
Reviews.Content: We had just walked in after over 600 miles of riding a Harley-Davidson motorcycle across some of the driest ares we had been through in a while. Tired ,dirty and exhausted we really didn't know if we would get a room because it was the 4th of July weekend. The lady that we talked to did everything possible to accomadate us and went much furhter than we expected and we were very grateful to her for making our stay at the Excaliber start so well. We tried to find her later to thank her personally but she wasn't at the desk anymore. We don't even have her name yet. I will include the reference number on our invoice and maybe that will tell you who she was? Reference [--]. We stayed in room 18172 from June 29 thru July 1. Thank you again for the great service. We had a wonderful time in Vegas and at your hotel! Ron and Kathy Martzahl

Reviews.Title: “Good stay but not classy”
Reviews.Author: LizNGF06
Reviews.Content: It has been updated some since I stayed there as a kid about 10 years ago maybe. Newer tvs, bathroom updates, etc. We were in the room very little except to sleep so if that sounds like your trip then it's the place for you. The room was very clean. There is unfortunately a wait usually for the elevators to get to the towers almost all of the time. Not high end but nice enough and no major or really minor problems during our stay just waiting for the elevator bit. I would stay there again :)

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and i am coming back in September”
Reviews.Author: patty33023
Reviews.Content: My husband and i came in June 20th 2011 stayed here for 3 nites.it was my birthday and this was the first time for me and my husband to come to Las vegas i was so impressed with my room. I love the way this hotel Exccalibur look it was very nice and i loved the stores and resaurants and the casinos the staff was very nice to us. we r coming back in sept 9th 2011 and i already booked 3 rooms because my son is getting married on the 10 of sept.2011. I have already recommened others people about this hotel they are also staying here family and friends. thanky u soo much i was pleased.

Reviews.Title: “In desperate need of updating”
Reviews.Author: My3sonsof5
Reviews.Content: The front desk service was good. Our rooms were "upgraded" as we had booked 2 rooms & only one was listed - after some time the other room was "found". So, in order for the 2 rooms to be clos,e they "upgraded" them. The only upgrade we think was the strip view. We stayed in Tower 1. The furniture in the rooms was in BAD shape. They did have a new TV, but all the furniture was damaged and faded. The maids did a good job of keeping them clean everyday, but I was not comfortable walking on the carpet in bare feet or lying on the comforter. The "Fun Dungeon" is great for kids. The Tournament of Kings was a very good dinner & show for the money. I was expecting a $12.50 resort fee, but was charged $14. Glad we booked through Orbitz & got a package deal, but was still disappointed in the condition of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “" Slot, Machine Heaven on a Carnival Ride "”
Reviews.Author: chief396
Reviews.Content: It was the first time for myself and my family of five. We enjoyed the Las Vegas, atmosphere, different sites that we toured and the culture of people. We enjoyed playing the newer more eccentric slot machines then the ones we're used to back home. You have to appreciate the pillow top mattress in the rooms especilly after site walking for miles and miles. I especilly liked the shuttle bus that Excalibur has to offer which i had booked with the vacation package. It allowed us to visually take on the sites while enroute to the hotel. This actually allowed us to look at the different thinks Las Vegas has to offer instead of being stuck in a limo. My wife and kids went camera crazy. I actually didn't care for the shows they were promoting. Like i told one of the show attendants " I'm here to play the slots machines, and hopefully take some monies back home". We stayed at the Excalibur for three days and two nights. During that time, being a retired police chief, I applied my profiling skills and analized that Tthe Excalibur Hotel and Casino has every bit of good intentions, never slacking, of making your visit a memorable and wonderful experience. Can'nt wait to return! E-mail dmartinez5fpd@yahoo.com Ph # --. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Family hotel and good for low budget trips.”
Reviews.Author: alextucker100
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Excalibur hotel and casino located on the strip of Las Vegas in July 2011. We had been on a round the world year trip and decided as we were passing we would spend some time in Vegas. We didn’t have too much money to spend which is a nightmare in Vegas as there is so much to do. The hotel was clean and tidy although a little dated and in need of some work. The pool and other hotel facilities are good and there is a massive option of food and attractions including shows and casino games. This hotel is more of a family option and is good if you are on a lower budget compared to other hotels down the strip. We paid around $60 per night in the week and $150 on the weekend. The service was not as good as general American customer service but for the price you pay it’s not a major issue. Although next time in Vegas I will stay somewhere else I would highly recommend the Excalibur.

Reviews.Title: “Bad customer service and long lines”
Reviews.Author: meg1991
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to this trip because it was for our 20th anniversary. We were very disappointing in the customer service and long lines at the hotel. We were with another couple and the day they checked it they were in line for over 45minutes. Waiting again in the show tickets line for over 30 minutes. The hotel seemed very short staffed. Room was not real clean. There was makeup on the walls in the bathroom that can right off when I wiped a towel over it. We were in the updated rooms in tower two and thank goodness because I would hate to see what the old rooms look like.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed this place immensley”
Reviews.Author: lazee0799
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here from Memorial Weekend for about 4 days. Even arriving late Sunday night we were treated with BIG smiles which makes you feel pretty good about being at this hotel. I have always wondered what folks need in hotel stay that would be so different from their home life. For us the Excalibur provided all of our needs in comfort, price, location, and many other things too numerous to list here. For the price they are very competive. For quality, they rank up there and offer great deals for food, gaming, and just a fun experience. I have no hesitation to recommend this hotel and lok forward to returning again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel to stay in.”
Reviews.Author: Sammyoboyle
Reviews.Content: Love love love this hotel, hotel room was beauitful, locotion was fabulous and staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great summer getaway!”
Reviews.Author: dapr0d1gy
Reviews.Content: Amazing service by Roberto at front desk and even more amazing service by Celia at the pool or Drenched! Enjoyed my vacation from start to finish, will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “CAN'T WAIT TO GO BACK!!”
Reviews.Author: MzFiesty
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the stay, rooms where clean, food was good, a lot of walking, lots to do. would like to see more tour packages, and not be bombared with the time sharing evertime we walked through the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: PWJHam
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at Excalibur and enjoyed it so much will be back in November again. I stayed here about 12 years ago and it does seem a little tired in areas and could do with a spruce up. We stayed in a widescreen room and it was very comfortable and spacious. We were happy with the big shower but be warned - if you like to soak in the bath there is only a shower. Facilities in the hotel are quite good although we were dissapointed that the 24 hour cafe was closed at 11pm so had to make do with McDonalds as we arrived late in the evening. Its worth signing up for the players card as we did get some discount on our room when we were leaving. i would recommend this hotel to groups of guys or girls but if it is a romantic couples retreat you want try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good fun for just this one.”
Reviews.Author: racinkyle78
Reviews.Content: I went by myself to vegas just to go. The pool was cold during the hot june days, the gambling was hot, and the party was always hopping. The staff was great, and I had no complaints. It is by far one of the coolest places to play when you hit the strip, and the kids would love the entertainment. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Rude workers and dirty rooms”
Reviews.Author: miki8188
Reviews.Content: So I was told when I made room reservations resort fee was $12.5 per night. When we cheked in not only did we have Rude service but the resort fee was then $14 per night, mind you your paying for something that 90% of people dont use ie phone (we all have cell phones) internet (most travel with their own internet on phones on wifi for laptops) Gym (most dont work out when on vacation) but we still have to pay for this (just a way to get more money out of you) We get to the room and its a non smoking room but it stinks like old smoke carpet looks like it had not been cleaned in years. Old razor in the shower pretty gross. Ate in the buffet and lets just say after someone who worked there reached acrossed my plate as I was taking a bite to get used plates with out saying excuse me or anything we then ate in the next door casino the rest of the trip. I will never stay here again When I pay good money for rooms in Vegas I expect im paying for CLEAN rooms and at least half way good service.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a perfect stay, good atmosphere, pleasant staff and outstanding value, we will return.”
Reviews.Author: TheRealCallyDay
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, outstanding staff, variety of entertainment and the suite was clean and comfortable, we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice play to stay-Great room rates"”
Reviews.Author: MissDori
Reviews.Content: I went with family. The newly remodeled rooms are very nice. The service was great!! The excalibur has the best specials. I plan to go back to Vegas in October for my anniversary and I hope to stay at the Excalibur!!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place to stay and play!!”
Reviews.Author: steelersgirl86
Reviews.Content: You will not be dissapointed if you stay here. It has a lot to offer for all ages. I've stayed at plenty of places, yet this is my favorite. I rarely even leave it while I'm in town.

Reviews.Title: “I would definately stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Qestral
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly suprised by the hotel. The rooms were nice for a very decent price. The staff was friendly. I checked in at about 9:30 p.m. And the only fault I found was a long wait for check-in, there were only 3 desk clerks and the line was very long. That's the only negative point I have. Very nice hotel for the price. I did have the buffet, and it had been under the heaters a little too long and was very tough. The dessert selection was delightful though.

Reviews.Title: “Great price”
Reviews.Author: vanessaf11
Reviews.Content: Great hotel.. Great prices.. Convienent location.. I stay at this hotel every year!

Reviews.Title: “Average but good value”
Reviews.Author: Nator86
Reviews.Content: If your short on cash and still want to be in Vegas, then this hotel is good value. However, I found the hotel to be very smokey, even in the hallways of the non-smoking room. The smell of smoke sticks on to you unlike any other resorts in Vegas. We got upgraded to the widescreen room for free and was provided a breakfast/lunch vouchers which was good. The internet is free, however it is a wired connection and there is no WIFI, which meant my Ipad was pretty useless at the hotel. Overall good value, but would probably select something nicer next time in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be Back...”
Reviews.Author: armylad1573
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from Vegas where we stayed at the Excalibur and for a 3* hotel and casino it is very good. we arrived in the morning busy check in but was not a problem waited about 10 mins to check in. The staff were very helpfull especially Kyle Haines the Casino Host who could not do enough for us a great ambassador for the Excalibur hotel. For the price we paid for the week the basic Tower 1 room was more than adequate, Massive bed, Big TV, Big Shower, room service air con was abit loud. For the amount of time you spend in the room you wont need much else. The Casino was always busy, Clean and great waitress service never had a empty glass. We dined at the Steakhouse great food at a reasonable price never tried the buffet but there was always big cues, there is lots of fast food to choose from all stay open quite late for a midnight snack. The pool area is adequate, good to have a adult section though it is small, the pool side restaurant had very nice food great fresh fruit and salad selection. Will definitely be staying there again next year.....

Reviews.Title: “great location on strip”
Reviews.Author: vegaspokerplayer
Reviews.Content: Great room and location for a great price. I go to Vegas a lot and I have never been unhappy with Excalibur. I love the location and and the vaule for my dollar. I want to spend my money playing poker and having adult beverages not on a room that I spenmt maybe 4 hours a day in . I love the locatyion and the fact I can basically go from casino to casnio without having to be outsde in the hot summer Veegas heat for more than a couple of minutes. Luxor and Mandalay are connected inside and its a short to New York and over to MGM where yoiu can use the monorail to access most of the other Strip properties. The front desk staff is always friendly and the casinoi staff is friendly and knowledgable about the games. The resturant selction leaves a but to be desired but you can walk over to Luxor and Mandalay and find lots of places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: krndeville
Reviews.Content: Our room was lovely and very comfortable and a great bargain. The TV reception was not very good but that wasnt a problem since we were out and about most of the time. The internet worked great. Would have been nice to have a coffee pot in the room

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: crackers1
Reviews.Content: We live in Phoenix so Vegas is a quick trip for us. I have visited Excalibur on a walking the strip trip and I always viewed it as a kiddie haven. I was very surprised - it has turned into a very classy hotel. The room was clean, comfortable and tastefully decorated. The casino always has action (and we went mid-week) Kid action was confined to mid-way. I would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from buffet!!!”
Reviews.Author: kknmesa
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice and clean but 3 family members got sick from the buffet, Food was terrible very blaa, We lost a day of our trip due to food poisoning from the buffet. We sent feedback to the hotel and they did not even reply

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for price, no frills”
Reviews.Author: RowlTD24
Reviews.Content: Got the cheapest room they had to offer, 2 qn. Room was clean and neat. A/C cold. Just what you want in LV if you are there for the shows and gambling. Check in not bad. Only complaint is that at time of reservation, I called and checked on adjoining rooms as we were traveling with our kids. Agent said no problem, but would have to call the day before to set it up. Called the day before and was told that they had very few adjoining rooms and they could not promise that until check in. and as luck would have it, none available at check in - just next to each other. Overall, average at best for Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great stay”
Reviews.Author: ploeggie
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 days in a luxury grand suite, which was very spacious. Some furniture a bit old/demaged and why still no flat screen tvs ????? Pool is good, days for room service too high. Location is too far from the main attractions at the strip, allways took our car to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Good for children and families”
Reviews.Author: BeachBabe2377
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last week for 3 nights. Great for children as medieval themed. Has childrens arcade downstairs. Good location situated between MGM and Luxor hotel. Rooms a bit dark. We paid for a strip view upgrade which we were pleased with. Hotel had a waterslide pool for the children and a larger pool too which were very busy at the time we visited. All you can eat buffets really good value and worth the money with lots of choice. Would def visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Real review by real people.”
Reviews.Author: Fliptop2
Reviews.Content: I was worried at first about this hotel after reading all the bad reviews ,but after spending five days here I can say this hotel is worth every penny.We booked a widescreen room witch was a small cost upgrade and the room was great clean big bed cant grumble at all.We visited all the main resort hotel casinos and I can't see how the expensive hotels could be that much better for the money there is in my opinion no better hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Would pay more and stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: AustinRugg
Reviews.Content: Booked a room on expedia for one night. Check in was a nightmare. Problems with printer cause line to be extremely long. 45 minutes wasted waiting in line. Also, could not figure out from outside where to go to check in. Went in one door and had to walk extremely far with luggage through casino to registration desk. At check in was told we were upgraded to a deluxe room, which after checking in found out it wasn't so deluxe. No refrigerator and when opening blind had complete view of a cement wall. On plus side, there is a nice food court. Location is kind of far when walking strip to newer casinos. Parking is also a distance from hotel. But, was very cheap when booked.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and Great Rates!”
Reviews.Author: krstn425
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few nights with friends and it was so reasonable! We has a great time. It is further down on the strip so its not walking distance to everything. But still a great value and a fun theme! Beautiful pool area!

Reviews.Title: “Waste of Money”
Reviews.Author: Day_tripper1234
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in july and thought the outside of the hotel looked cool but we were disappointed by our room. Upon arrival we waited 10 mins to check in but we werent bothered by that. The front desk clerk was very friendly and super helpful which was great. Upon arrival in our room it really smelled, the only way i could describe it was it smelled like "pickled onions" which was disgusting but the staff didnt seem to care. The bed was stained with coffee down the side and the lamps were covered with mould and dust. The AC unit was so loud we couldnt use it and everytime we put it on it smelled of must! The tv is good with plenty of channels and a flatscreen tv. the pools are great and spacouis there are 4 in total i think. Inside the hotel the casino is ok but i think its aimed more towards families with kids with the arcade and varouis kids activities which is good. During our stay we didnt get any service from the maids they didnt even enter our room at any point i ended up having to go and ask for clean towels and toilet paper and we didnt even get ours beds changed. If your going to stay here i wouldnt!

Reviews.Title: “Looks nice on the outside but not so on the inside.”
Reviews.Author: johnandkara
Reviews.Content: We purchased 2 rooms for the week of July 4th to the 9th 2011. We checked in just fine and the Bell man kept our luggage for us until our room's were ready. Up to this point thing's were awesome. We get to the rooms, get settled in start using things and that's when the hotel started showing its age. The first room the bathroom faucet leaked out the top of the handle and soaked the counter top every time you used it. The light on the wall next to the TV and mirror would twist in your hand when you tried to turn it on. The second room was just as bad. When you would go to pull up on the knob to wash your hands the back side of the sink would lift up out of the counter top. The beds were old and broke down. The side slooped towards the floor. My wife and I each slept in a bed so we didn't have to sleep on a hill side. What a pain. Las Vegas is suppose to be romantic lol how romantic is sleeping in seperate beds??!! Will avoid this hotel in the future and reccomend that if you are considering staying here, look else where first. If you have any questions just send them on over to johnandkara@ymail.com

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BlythLambo
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week and I thought the Excalibur was excellent. I got a discount code from the internet (stick it in google, there are loads) and the got a 33% discount on what was already a cheap rate! We also successfully employed the '$20 Trick' (again use google) so ended up with a fantastic deal. The hotel is enormous and despite being at the budget end of the Vegas has all of the bits and pieces that you would want in a hotel - it is also next door to some of the cooler hotels and you can just use the facilities in there! The rooms were clean and were pretty big (ours had two 'queen sized beds' which is pretty much two double beds) and had all things that you would need - Vegas is about being out and about though, not sat in your room! I would have no hesitation in returning and have recomended the hotel to loads of people who are heading to Sin City and no-one has had a bad word to say about the place.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best, but cheap”
Reviews.Author: SKNR
Reviews.Content: Hotel needs updating, we stayed in a renovated room but still looked dated. Smoke smell permeates the whole place so that even being on a non smoking floor it is very noticeable. Thought this would be good for kids and the arcade was good and the hotel was very cheap, but needs those little things like fridges in rooms and free WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “Just want your money”
Reviews.Author: Smithl1991
Reviews.Content: Check in was long. No Internet in room. TV quit working. Pool was closed. Still charged the resort fee. I'll admit that I didn't call to get these things fixed but these room issues were discovered in the early morning when the family was either sleeping, showering or getting dressed. Desk manager wouldn't credit me the resort fee despite the problems.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok, I would rather try some other hotels than come back here.”
Reviews.Author: pmpoore
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and really enjoyed Vegas. Excalibur was just a place to sleep. We stayed in the nicer rooms, they were ok. The bed wasn't very comfy, the linens were cheap and the blankets thin. If we didn't pay next to nothing for our room I would have minded more. The casino was nice, however, very creepy how many kids are walking around. The buffet was decent. The location was good, next time i'd like to stay in the middle of the strip. It was a little too cold for me to try out the pool, but it looked nice and they played good music.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed many times.. this was the worst”
Reviews.Author: mndavet
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Excalibur MANY times. I love the location and the staff is generally really pleasant. I received comped rooms for this trip and stayed over the 4th of July weekend. Check in was easy and the gal was very pleasant. I was given a room in Tower 1.. Room 11111. As I got off the elevator, the smell from the floor was HORRIBLE (and this was a non smoking floor). As I walked down the hallway, the carpet was disgusting VERY dirty, paper all over, glasses all over, gum inbedded in the carpet, half of the hall lights were out. I thought I was in a bad dream. When I put my key in I entered into an old room that had yet to be refurbished. The room smelled STALE.. Stained.. dirty, dim. Gross! The only thing that was new was there was a widescreen TV in room. The bathroom was fine but that was about all. Oh, well. I don't plan on staying in my room too much. The AC was very loud, but was needed as it was 100 degrees out. When I went down to the Casino... I was disgusted.. it was FILTHY!! Machines were gross, gum everywhere, empty beer bottles, glasses, etc. and kids EVERYWHERE! Even sitting with their moms and dads as they were playing the slot machines. I never once saw security do a thing about it. Everywhere you looked was kids. strollers everywhere.... UGH I know that families go to Las Vegas (not sure why, but they do) but there needs to be some type of control of what can and should be allowed. The resort fee is RIDICULOUS! $14 for a lot of nothing! Nice resorts have a fee that is the same. Excalibur shouldn't be more than about $5!!!!! I go to Las Vegas often, and even though I received this room for free, I would have to say I'm not planning on returning to the Excalibur.

Reviews.Title: “House cleaning staff needs to check behind the curtains!”
Reviews.Author: Crosscollector
Reviews.Content: I found a pair of fake eyelashes behind my curtains. I went to open up the windows, and there they were! They were not mine, either!

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Nacho67
Reviews.Content: My friend and I arrived at the hotel about 1am on a Tuesday. We had flown cross country and had to pick up a rental car. We were exhausted. The guy at the front desk gave us our room never mentioning it was a handicapped room (more on that later). We asked him where we could get something to eat. No room service was available, only the McDonald's in the food court. Later, we found out from someone else that we could have gotten food delivered to the hotel 24/7. We haul our stuff up to the room. No bathtub, only a shower. No bottom lip on the shower and the curtain didn't reach all the way to floor. When you used the shower, water went all over the bathroom floor. The room itself was dismal. The carpeting in the room was damp by the door (maybe from the shower?) The decor looked like it was from the 60's (not the cool part of the 60's, either). We were so exhausted and we were supposed to get going in the early morning. Neither one of us wanted to go through the hassle of changing rooms that night. A week later we stayed there again for one night (we were prepaid and just coming back from a road trip). We told the desk clerk what had happened previously. They gave us a room upgrade for $10 more. That room was fine, no complaints. During the day, the pool area was pretty full. There was hip hop/techno music playing loudly all through the pool area. There was no way I could relax and catch some sleep. I went back up to my room on the 23rd floor and I could still hear the music playing down below.

Reviews.Title: “excalibur is clean, quiet, and a great view of the awesome building”
Reviews.Author: americantravelers_7
Reviews.Content: The only real problem I saw around me at this hotel was the check-in, baggage storage, and check out lines. They were all long all the time, so be aware. We got in at 1:00 in the afternoon and did not have to wait at all to check in, but at 3 it was at least 30 people long. When we saw those long lines we took our bags down early in the morning the day we were leaving and we were the only people there, then we went back to our room. We also checked out by the television, and they have kiosks in the lobby that you can check out at. The last day the lines were closer to 75 to check in for the week-end, but it was the rave week-end. Try to get there early and your room will be ready if you e-mail them what time you are landing. That line would be a deterrent to anyone, and that's a shame because this hotel is so quiet and large and clean. We asked to be on a high floor for the quiet and we got the top floor at the end of the hall. It was a heavenly place to come back to. Room 12172 is great. (12th floor tower1 room 72) Also heard it's coming down in a year or so. book it now.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: junivores
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an inexpensive stay in Vegas, Excalibur is definitely worth a look.

Reviews.Title: “3rd time at Excalibur but never again!! has really gone downhill”
Reviews.Author: vegasloverUk
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay here. It has been a few years since the last stay. The pool is excellent. That is the only good thing about the hotel. we were in a standard room. This was aweful. Nothing like their web site pictures. The safe did not work. I complained about safe and web was deceiving.Got upgraded to a refurb room. This was not very good either. The first one the toilet seat was not fixed. The bathroom handbasin plug did not work and was full of water you could not get rid of. The safe was locked. After waiting over 1.5 hours for someone to open the safe, and during this time reported the handbasin, i was accused of LYING by their staff that i had only placed the call 27 minutes earlier and 26 minutes for the handbasin as that is what the computer said!! moved to another room. This was ok but bedding had holes in it and was cheap!! I will never stay here again. The staff are rude especially at check in and guest services. The only friendly helpful staff are the concierge. It may be cheap but it is dreadful.

Reviews.Title: “OK IF YOU WANT SOMEWHERE CHEAP BUT WOULD NOT RETURN”
Reviews.Author: ChezDevonEngland
Reviews.Content: Arrived very late at night due to delay on plane. There was quite a few receptionists on duty and the one we had was far than helpful and even charged us the resort tax although we were on a multi centre trip with all taxes included!!! We did point this out but she wasn't having any of it - SO BEWARE. Room okish. It had a flat screen TV and decor was fairly recent but the upholstery in the room had stains all over it, the curtains were hanging loose off their rail and the bathroom was very dirty/dated. The shower cubicle door did not close so a pool of water on the floor after each shower! The iron was also dangerous the bottom of it was hanging off with the wire exposed! I will say we did have a good view of the pools which our room overlooked but we didn't use them. Everytime we got in the lift there would be dirt and food waste all over the floor. We were on a non-smoking floor but continued to find trails of cigarette butts everywhere. We also noticed that somebody had spat on the mirror and it was still there for 2 days before it was cleaned up! We didn't use the casino but it was very very smokey which I can't stand. We didn't eat in any of the food places within the hotel but did use Starbucks for coffee in the mornings. (They have two Starbucks one upstairs in the foodhall and one near the rotunda entrance). We have stayed at various hotels in Vegas over the last 5 years (Mirage, Caesars and Stratosphere) and unfortunately this was the worst one. The location is not a problem because you can use the Deuce and Strip Express for $7 for 24hrs. This is a cheap hotel with no standards but if you want more then go elsewhere - WE WOULD NOT STAY HERE AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: djruthie
Reviews.Content: The hotel appears quite dingy once you walk in (its dark carpets and wallpaper) There was a big queue for check in but once we got there, we were able to check in early and check out at midday. The hotel rooms reminded me of something from the 1990's. However the rooms were cleaned daily with fresh towels everyday. If you ever had a query, guest services and concierge were more than helpful. Great location, the hotel is right at the start of the trip. Cost $12in a taxi to get to the airport and is right beside the bus that goes to the north and south shopping outlets. Also right on the strip and a 8-10 minute walk to Planet Hollywood Hotel / Bellagio. Cheap and cheerful and would stay her again, if it was still the cheapest place on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodation and great swimming pool”
Reviews.Author: CS-Linlithgow
Reviews.Content: We got an upgrade into the widescreen rooms in tower 2, with a view onto the strip looking towards NY NY and MGM Grand. Our Room was large, comfortable and modern and what a view! We stayed for 7 days and had previously stayed elsewhere. Although less expensive than some others it was more comfortable and relaxed, and the swimming pools are great in a large clean area that gets the sun pretty much all day long. They have an adults only pool if you want to avoid children which is shallow enough that they allow you to sit in the pool with your drinks which arent badly priced. The only downside to this hotel is that there isnt really anywhere for a quality meal. However, other hotels are very close by that gives you plenty of choices. All in all, I'd highly recommend this hotel. My wife and I will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 3 star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: csmorgan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at one end of the "strip". This area is cleaner than the other end. The Bellagio, Ceasars, Mirage and Venetian are about 1 - 1 1/2 miles away. There is a city bus (Deuce) that goes up and down the strip. A 24hr ticket is $7. The arquitecture of the Excalibur hotel is nice. It doesn't have a "lobby" per say. You walk straight into the casino. Within the hotel there is a food court. There is a gameroom for the children. There is a monorail that conect the Excalibur, Luxor and Mandalay. I chose a room with the "flat screen TV". The room is fairly large. The bathroom is large as well. It doesn't look "rundown". The beds are comfortable and the room was quiet and clean. There is no mini fridge or coffee maker. Blowdrier and iron are available. Some rates include free breakfast or lunch at different restaurants. This is the way to go, if available. There is also a "deal" at the Excalibur and Luxor for meals. This is not as appealing unless you plan on being around these hotels during your stay. Tower II has the option of pool view or roof top view. Odd number room have the roof top view. The hotel has 3 pools. One is a kids pool with a small slide that kids upto about 7 years will enjoy. The other are mostly adult. All of the 3 pools are "play pools". There are plenty of lifesavers. This hotel has a 12.50/day resort fee. It includes internet access. Overall, there is nothing special about this hotel. It is just a good value hotel!

Reviews.Title: “I won't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Holland020
Reviews.Content: We had to change our room three times. First 2 times the room was dirty and there was hair on the bathroom floor. We finally were upgraded to a better and clean room. However, when we came back from being out all day wanted to shower and change before going to a show that evening, our room was not cleaned and there were no clean towels. I called but they did not bring us towels in time, so had to shower using dirty towels. I will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, had everything you would need.”
Reviews.Author: Kakie84
Reviews.Content: Exalibur is great, widescreen rooms are clean and comfortable and the hotel had everything we needed, nice casino and great places to eat at baja fresh and dicks last resort. The free monorail to the luxor and mandalay bay is really handy too. This was ourd first trip to vegas and were happy with our choice. The only downsides is that the rooms do not have a frig, micro or coffeemaker. They also do not have wireless internet, which was annoying. The daily resort fee is too much given that they don't have internet. Also, beware the staff that tries to give you free tickets to shows, they only want you to spend a whole day viewing their timeshares. This is very annoying as they stop you everytime you walk to the elevators.other than that it was a nice adorable place and we will probably go back.

Reviews.Title: “ok close to strip”
Reviews.Author: shiral2011
Reviews.Content: Very outdated decor in the hotel, the hotel carpets smell looks like its not been updated since the 90s, rooms do smell stale. Beds are comfy and clean and the room was generally clean, downstairs the casino and bars are great even a McDonald's inside the hotel. You will get hassled walking in out of the casino by staff who try to sell you shows and other forms of entertainment tickets. Elevators are very slow and if your staying high up like we did it takes a while. We did have some door lock problem but was sorted and were upgraded to deluxe suite Great value for money though if you need cheap place to stay next to the las vegas strip.

Reviews.Title: “Earned its reputation as the best place for families on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Kramerdog
Reviews.Content: If you're traveling to Las Vegas with couples, this is not the place for you. If you're traveling with kids, it's near-perfect. Big pools, fun games for the young ones, comfortable rooms, affordable eating options on-site, and when else will the kids get to say they slept in a castle? We spent two nights in a high-floor Tower II widescreen room with a view of the strip (a nice upgrade). Got a great price on the rooms, and lots of great discount offers upon check-in. You have to walk through the casino to get anywhere, but that seems to be Vegas standard. They have a whole kids area (the Fun Dungeon!) where you can let them play games while you go play blackjack and slots. The casino was clean and well-maintained, with friendly dealers, and the knights and castles theme is fun. This is clearly not the glamour address on the Strip, but if you want Vegas fun for families and don't want to spend a ton, this is the place to go. The hotel and casino are connected by both walkway and tram to Luxor and Mandalay Bay, so there are many more dining, entertainment and gaming options nearby. The only beef was the early closing time for the pools (7p) but I suppose they want you in the casino once the sun goes down. And from the south end of the Strip, it's an easy walk to places like Caesar's and Bellagio, and only about a 15-minute drive to Fremont Street.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Ashby de la Zouch, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Marraman
Reviews.Content: Seeing as the Hotel is coming up to being 20 years old this year (2011) the rooms are clean and comfy.
