We stayed in a room on the second floor with a bathroom big enough for a small party and more than enough room in the shower cubicle and this was a standard room! The room was cleaned everyday day with fresh sheets and linen. The location of the Excalibur is superb, you have access to the Luxor and Mandalay Bay via Interlinking walkways or if you're feeling lazy you can take the tram which is free of charge. Across the street is the MGM Grand with it's Monorail station which makes getting up and down the Las Vegas Strip very very easy. A single ride ticket will cost $5 or a 24 hour ticket will cost you $12 (I think). Be advised that the Monorail runs 20 hours a day weekdays or 22 hours a day weekends. If you want a cheap hotel in a great location on the strip with comfy and clean rooms then the Excalibur is Perfect. The one issue I have is the fact I had to pay $14 per night Resort Fee, even if you don't use anything that the Resort Fee covers, such as access to the Spa or Internet access but to be fair, near enough every Hotel/Casino in Vegas charges a Resort Fee and I booked the hotel through Expedia and they did make this clear in their, "Know before you go" section. I would happily stay at the Excalibur on a return trip to Vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: CaziMontreal
Reviews.Content: hotel smelling cigaretts, room was clean, pool was nice, located on the strip walking distance from the others hotels such MGM, MonteCarlo, New York, etc. - ok for the price

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel we've experienced for years”
Reviews.Author: 9453PE
Reviews.Content: After standing in a long line for registration, we transported our luggage through the clouds of cigarette smoke in the casino and took the elevator to our 22nd floor room. The room was very basic, and did not even include a tea / coffee making facility, which must surely be standard issue these days. The room also had no bath tub. The room had complimentary cable internet, but there was no adjacent electrical socket for the laptop. The speed of the cable connection was appallingly slow. WIFI was not available in the room, nor in the lobby, and the receptionist suggested I loiter around the Krispy Kreme concession! The outside pool area looked nice, but with searing sunshine and 110 degree temperatures we found it completely unusable as there was no shade available anywhere. Sunloungers and parasols were scarce and fully occupied, and the few premium cabanas on offer were a complete rip-off. The main eatery within the hotel is a buffet with a reasonably wide range of food. Most of the dishes we sampled were bland. There is also a steakhouse next door to the buffet where the food and ambience is far better, with prices to match. The only impressive thing about the Excelsior is the sight of the floodlit towers from a distance. And that's the best distance to stay from it! We stayed in the Excelsior at the start of a tour of the spectacular natural parlks of Arizona and Utah, and can honestly say that it was the worst hotel of the entire trip. In fact it was the only hotel on our tour that we would definitely NOT book a repeat visit. The Excelsior is definitely the worst hotel we have experienced anywhere for years. But we should realise it is not meant to be a hotel. It is a casino with crashing-out facilities masquerading as hotel rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but room was dated”
Reviews.Author: fannybaws
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, right on the strip and $15 taxi to the airport. Room was very dated decoration wise but had a decent bed and tv, but you dont go to vegas to sit in a hotel room. Hotel had massive selection and variety of bars, eating places and a great swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “do NOT stay there”
Reviews.Author: zawtica
Reviews.Content: We reviewed Tripadvisor and it said this is a children-friendly place so we booked for a deluxe room at 69 a night. The moment we checked in, it was not a pleasant experience, parking is difficult to get to, reception desk is not friendly. everywhere in hotel smells including the non smoking rooms. ROOM: I wonder if it can be called hotel; no refrigerator, no coffee, no newspaper service, the in-room clock is broken. WiFi is super slow and most of the time it does not work, and engineering could not figure out why. Despite the peak travele season, hotel CLOSED off the big pool. the small pool got sand in the bottom. DO not stay there. Pay a few more $ and stay in Aria for 79 a night or Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad & The Ugly”
Reviews.Author: Dodgerfan2011
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Excalibur from a extended family vacation. The main reason we went to Vegas was my son competed in a Karate Tournament. When speaking to a reservation agent over the phone the customer service was very good. Seemed like they cared about you. When we checked into the hotel it was a different story though. The Front Desk agent was very rude and instead of welcoming me to the Excalibur she just asked for my name and credit card. Never thanked me or made me feel welcome. When we were done with check in we were told to go to tower 2 which was on the other side of the front desk and required us to through the casino. My 8 year old son got an eye full to say the least with dancers dancing on stage. Looked like we were downtown near an airport strip club. Walking around at night as well near the hotel was another story. Had to remind our son on numerous occasions that what happens in Vegas stays in Vegas. (Now that we got through the bad and the ugly, lets talk about the good) The best part of our stay was the pool staff and water slide pool. We got a cabana near the kids pool and came with a lot of amenities. It had a couch with a table, 2 chairs with another table, I think it was a 48" TV and 4 lounging chairs. It had a refrigerator, and a cabinet to keep our personal things as well. If you go when it's hot I would highly recommend this. Tracy our server was extremely nice as well to start and then went to another server who was OK but wish Tracy would have been there all day. Anyways we stayed all day at the water slides. The only bad thing was they closed the kids pools at 5 PM which I thought was early as it was still hot outside. If we do go back to the Excalibur it may be for 2 days and it will be only for the pool, but all in all was a good trip. P.S. We did not play in the casino that much as all there was is $10 tables. I mean that is only 10 hands if you like playing blackjack as I do. I mean $5 would have been OK and probably would have been a little more crowded at the tables, as they were not many people playing...........

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel- great price”
Reviews.Author: BBDoll619
Reviews.Content: There were a total of 4 families that stayed here. We chose this hotel because it appeared to be the most kid friendly. The exterior is cool, pools are a little above average, the buffet was surprisingly good and a great deal (pay $30 to eat the entire day!) and the room was just average. It served it's purpose and we were able to spend money on other things. They have an arcade on the bottom level which is smaller than Circus Circus, but sufficient. One complaint I do have is that although I've been to Vegas numerous times, I've never seen a "performer" dance in the middle of the casino. The dancer was just out in the open for everyone, including kids, to see. I thought that was odd especially since I thought the Excalibur was more kid friendly. But we only paid about $30-$35 per night, so we would return and just walk a different route from that stage:o)

Reviews.Title: “Great Place Great Price”
Reviews.Author: jasonvegas1981
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed here for 7 nights for her 30th birthday... Was a bit concerned because of varied reviews. However after staying I couldn't understand the negative comments. the casino itself was actually one of the better ones. all machines and tables were nicely spaced out and easy to navigate yourself from one bar to the next. all staff were friendly and it didnt smell of smoke like others suggested. In fact we found Caesars Palace to be more smoke filled. I am a smoker anyway so we probably didn't notice this as much. We stayed in Tower 1 and on the 27th floor, room was huge, clean with a 42" Wide Screen TV. Bed was clean and very comfortable. In fact so comfortable that we managed 14 hours sleep in one night. The bathroom was big and clean. We have no complaints about this hotel whatsoever. we spent most of our casino time here as well because we found the machines to be better and a wider selection. The location on the strip was perfect right where you need to be and the price was fantastic for this. we also did the breakfast buffet one morning.......well what can I say!!!! what they had set out for breakfast was truly unbelieveable.... the selection was so extensive it was incredible..... My girlfiend loaded her plate with 5 sausages, 4 bacon, 3 or 4 types of egg, breakfast burritos and more!! needless to say we didnt eat again that day until about 9pm. we are planning to go again and will stay at Excalibur again. It was a great holiday. In fact the best I have had.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Hotel--good location--watch out for extra charges”
Reviews.Author: jdieringer
Reviews.Content: The location, at the south end of the strip is a great location. The hotel has two towers. Our driving trip had us start and end in Las Vegas so we stayed here twice. The first time we were in Tower I and the second trip Tower II. They try to up-sell the different room types and there was a notable difference in room quality. NOTE: there is no wireless internet in the rooms. They have an Ethernet connection by the TV which is very inconvenient--this is a very poor substitute for wireless. Watch out for a $14/night resort fee. This was not expected and they don't budge. They have this to cover a nice pool complex and spa/work out area (frankly, any three-star hotel has this). It is at the base of tower II--get there if you can. Customer service is just OK and the desk agents were inconsistent--different agents gave different information. One was great on our second stay--the others were pretty rigid and not very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: BJ2011AL
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights, there was a mix up at check in and it took a while with attitude at the front desk like she didnt really care. Room was refurbished and nice with a good view of he strip. Casino i thought was not the best by far. Looked not so clean and was really smokey compared to the rest, didnt really urge me to stay in there so went to nearby better ones. dirty pots from someone room service left in corridors all day.

Reviews.Title: “Hated it, won't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: MGFANS
Reviews.Content: 1-Hotel website clearly stated that they would match a better rate off of any published rate and take 10% off. We followed the directions and faxed the info to the given number. We called a couple of days before arrival, left cell number-call was never returned. Several attempts were made to talk to people at the front desk and they were less than helpful. We never did get the lesser rate we found elsewhere. The one piece of information that we did manage to get out of one of the front desk people was that the rate would not be honored because the hotel had sold that room to that particular website. There were no disclaimers to that effect for the special rate. 2-The room we had was very old and dated. The wallpaper was stained in spots and coming off the wall. The carpet looked old and the drapes and bedspread looked worn and/or cheap. Feet were on the dirty side after walking around barefoot. Apparently rooms that have been renovated are available at a mark up. We have stayed in some pretty nice resorts while they were in the process of renovation and we have never had to pay more for an updated room. 3-No safe in the room. No guest services book in the room. No coffee maker in the room. No tub only a shower stall with no place to put toiletries. . Shower stall looked old. 4-when we asked about a minifridge we were told it would be $25/night. Considering we had just stayed at the El Dorado in Reno, a nuch nicer hotel I might add, and they only charged us $10 for the whole stay of 4 days we thought the rate at this hotel was a bit outrageous. 5-The bell people were a little surly. The gentleman who delivered our bags was unhelpful in answering questions and at the time of check out we were told it would be 20 minutes for someone to come get the bags. When I called again I said it had been about 30 minutes I was informed that it had actually only been 26 minutes and they would get there when someone was available as they were waiting for a bellhop to become available. 6-The internet was "free" if you consider paying a resort fee with internet included to be free. We do not.

Reviews.Title: “bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: LyndaB0403
Reviews.Content: When we booked this trip for 2 rooms, thru a travel agency, we were not informed that there is an additional fee at check in of $12.50 per day per room for: a daily newspaper, interenet access and a phone, which we used none of these items. I spoke with the manager at the front desk and informed her that we were not aware of this additional charge. I had paid for everything at the time I booked the trip and I was on a limited budget. All she did was give me a phone number to call the travel agency that booked my trip. She did not try to work with me on these fees. She could have offered to only charge for one room or help me out in some way but she did not. It's either pay or don't stay. I will say that the room was very comfortable and clean and I liked the pools however, they do not open until 9am and the bigger one opens at 12 noon and they close at 7pm. I prefer to go earlier and relax and Las Vegas is supposed to be "the city that doesn't sleep" I think 7pm is early to shut down the pool when the sun doesn't start going down before 8:30. Our rooms were on the 5th floor and we had a brick wall to look at out our window. (I wonder if this was because of my disagreement at the front desk when I complained about the fee.) I would suggest you ask for a room above the 8th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Expect to get ripped off”
Reviews.Author: mark_bates09
Reviews.Content: Booked into the hotel with no issues, only had to wait for less than 10 minutes. Like all Vegas hotels the places are huge so good luck with trying to find anywhere, the exits are hard to find and other areas are very poorly signed (it took us several days to relise where the car hire desk was which is no where need the check in desks! We were in tower 2 in and odd number room which must have had the best view of all the towers as it overlooked the strip and had a good view of the airport. However on check on we where then top of a 'resort' fee of over $10 a day, what a rip off and were never told about it either at the time of booking or checking in. The rooms themselves are reasonable quality with a huge bed, A/C, TV with quite a few channels and a good bathroom with shower.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!! Please read this!”
Reviews.Author: marccee
Reviews.Content: Right Im in excalibur right now 14 nights me and my girlfriend are here for! we payed under 900 pounds 2 weeks each in vegas! its in the south side of the strip direct to mgm and new york new york. ill start with the rooms. im in tower 2 im in a basic room it has a 42 inch TV with 30 channels? A decent shower what produces good hot water . Big mirrors for women to do make up. A good toilet for the guys lol.The beds are massive and really comfy!! best of all the room is cleaned every day and you get clean towels everyday!! So room is perfect. on a plus side we got a view of new yor new york. for 35$ a nite its class! furniture you have a wardobe with sliding doors and a chest of drawers maybe a few marks on them big teal but i aint looking to take pictures of them and you have lamps and work like which are lamps lol. outside landing very quiet at night!! ps girls dont bring a hairdrier as the one in the rooms are good enough and save 2kg in your suitcase my girlfriend says! The pool! they provide beach towels for sunbeds! plenty of sunbeds for everyone staying. The weather gets really hot so make sure you hydrate yourself saw alot of people faint including my girlfirnd and she hadnt even had a alcoholic drink yet. Cabannas at pool cost $100 worth trying one you get a TV etc shade and fridge full of soft drinks and water. pool expensive for alcohol $7 a beer etc you can get drink from shop sneak it in. 4 pools adult pool no children very chilled children pool with 2 slides well i went down a few times good> and two mixed pools. at weekends pools get rowdy as locals from LA come here friday sat but sundays are dead!!! casino i read reviews you smell of smoke when you walk through her!! no you dont. people are so picky!! this is one of the smoke free casinos and ive win alot of cash in here i bet $" win 300 and then bet $10 150 so happy days!! getting free drinks just play anything and i mean anything 1 cent machines and you will get free drinks tip the girl $1 per drink 60p.we had friends on the luxor who came here to get casino drinks because it was so easy luxor they came round every so often here i i wasnt even finished my beer and they were like next drink!!! Check in was good do not ask for an upgrade as the women will turn round and laugh or just tell u its $15 plus tax a night extra alot of people have been trying the vegas sandwich slip a 20$ bill it doesnt work!!! resorts fees i do not know about yet as they take them at the end but ppl have payed at the start so hopefully i dont get charged 15 Per night per room. entertainment and restraunts plenty of cheap fast food and italian and chinese and restraunt has a sense of humor and has is very busy but worth a laugh!!! bands play most nights!! the shows austrilain beegees and tournament of kings double pack 75$ pp includes a full chicke for dinner etc worth it and also saw lion king and tomrrow britney spears and nikki minage!!! The strip!!! bars everywhere inside hotels tooo many to goo through just hit cosmopolitan and planet hollywood. Bar prices are like $12-$15 a drink anywhere clubs are like ibiza $25 a drink $50 entry!!1 try marque in cosmopolitan. we wlked the full strip to see all the free shows like belligio ceasers palace etc on a quiet night up and down was an hour and half strolll wear good shoes or blisters:)) and the internet in room is ethernet and if your skyping home there is a slight delay but browsing net facebook etc is fine!! also the only ppl we have tipped in vegas is $1 a day everyday is maid shes so nice got us nail clippers and left me a couple of ice cold buds and cocktail waitress $1 a drink. if you get coins in change use vending machine to use them up!!! im 23 nd gf 22 and if ive missed anything please email anytime ill get back to you am here till thursday!! so ignore all the rubbish reviews if your laid back like me and go basic holidays on a budget this is the place!!!

Reviews.Title: “service with attitude”
Reviews.Author: triskit1
Reviews.Content: my eleven year old daughter and I have stayed at the excalibur a few times because of how inexpensive it is. In the past we had good experiences but this last trip was not so good. We had two comped nights at another hotel but got a deal on the excalibur that offered me $75 in resort credits and $50 in free slot play so because of that I decided to get to vegas a day early to take advantage of the resort credits so we could use them for food or show tickets . Well, maybe i should have read some fine print somewhere but because i do not have a credit card i could not get the resort credits. I found this funny since i stay at treasure island all the time and they allow me to make a cash deposit to get the resort credits . I explained to the women checking me in that i booked this room because of those credits and it was our only food money ( kind of a fib). She was extremely rude and i was told to go to the rewards counter to ask them. I knew right off the bat this was just an attempt to shove me off on someone else and sure enough the guy at the rewards counters words were " I have no control over resort credits here you have to talk to the front desk about that ". I just finally gave up. It would have been nice for them to make some kind of compromise and give me some kind of free food coupon free upgraded room or something but i was not offerred a thing. Now to get to the room. In the past i had always upgraded to a wide screen tower room . this time I didnt. Honestly, the room was about the same quality as the widescreen tower room. The furniture is a little older but it still had a flat screen t.v that was the same size as the widescreen room. The beds were actually pretty comfortable and everything seemed to be clean. We had a non smoking floor but was hit in the face with the smell of marijuana the second we stepped off the elevator which i cant blame on the hotel for that. I guess if you are only paying for $21 a night you have to expect to be around $21 a night kind of people. We enjoy the food court there . There is a little bit of everything , pizza hut express , mcdonolds, quizno's , crispy cream, starbucks. Basically a lot of cheap food which you cant really find in some of the more expensive hotels. I have mixed feelings on the pool there. There are three pools , one which is an adult pool but of course ive never been able to go in since i have my daughter. There are two water slides in one of the pools but one of them is always out of commision. TOO MANY LITTLE KIDS IN THE HOT TUB!!!! I dont like the idea of being in a hot tub with diapers. There are a lot of chairs but if you dont get down there by 11 am you will not be able to find a seat. I like the location of the excalibur and how it is connected to the luxor and mandalay bay by an indoor walkway and just a bridge away from new york new york and mgm grand. If it was not for the rude service i had and the broken promise of resort credits i would probably give this hotel a little bit of a higher rating. Another thing I want to add about the room and the option to upgrade to the widescreen tower room. All the widescreen tower rooms are in tower two which is were the pool is and for some reason it seems to be a little less crouded. In tower one you can expect to wait for an elevator for 15 minutes ( not exagerating it actually happenned to us) .

Reviews.Title: “Very good value and great location”
Reviews.Author: traveltherockies
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very good value FOR WHAT YOU PAY. They offer some nice benefits and facilities for an economy on the strip hotel. With that said i hate the people who want to pay an excalibur price and get the bellagio. It isnt a 5 star hotel nor does it claim to be. It is an economy hotel located on the strip. This property is a solid three star hotel and looks alot better than it did a few years ago. It has a great pool (newly redone) and offers some newly refurbished rooms for a little more. It is a MGM property so you get the benefit of getting one rewards card and you can gamble or use comps earned at all the MGM brand casinos. I would stay here again without hesitation. Good value

Reviews.Title: “Just fine for a place to stay at a great price.”
Reviews.Author: DairyQueenWisconsin
Reviews.Content: We picked the Excalibur because we got a great deal on a room, and it was about what we expected - not one of the jewels of the strip to be sure, but a perfectly adequate room at a reasonable price. The hotel is in a relatively good spot - close to several other hotels, a bit of a walk to the mid-strip hotels, but a real hike if you want to end up near the Mirage or north of that. At times, the distance to another hotel was a definite factor in deciding where to go. We always needed to make sure we budgeted enough energy to come home because the hotel is so far south! The rooms were adequate, the bathroom floor and shower floor could have used a re-do, but it wasn't disgusting. We found the beds uncomfortable and didn't sleep well at all during our 4 night stay, but that may have been a personal preference issue. We enjoyed the pool area, the DJ and the drinks gave it a fun party feeling. The hotel has 4 pool areas, which meant they could handle a lot of people without feeling overwhelming. However, we did not spend a lot of time at the hotel, so I can't speak to the restaurants or other-onsite activities. We did find the concierge to be very helpful when we were looking for a place for dinner, and he recommended several reasonably priced yet very good restaurants that we wouldn't have looked at (bonus points for him not recommending a restaurant in the hotel). Beware what we termed the "fake" concierges - they try to intercept you as you walk through the hotel and offer you discounted tickets to shows if you would go look at the new resort half an hour out of town.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: DKFAN
Reviews.Content: TIPS = If the Excalibur sends you an email offering you upgrades after you have booked a room, do it. It was so worth it for us. I've been going to Vegas all my life and this is the first time I have ever stayed here. My husband and I had a great time! We drove all night and arrived about 6:15 AM. I didn't know if we could check in or not. Valet Parking guy got a bell hop (Marlon) to help us with the luggage and he took us straight to the registration desk. Gentleman at check in was going to put us in a regular room in Tower 1, but Marlon cajoled the man into putting us in a Widescreen Room Deluxe in Tower 2. We were offered this upgrade in our email and since it was available, we took it! Glad we did. Room was on the 4th floor facing East Tropicana Avenue and New York New York, VERY quiet and spacious room. The bathroom was huge! Flatscreen TV, table and chairs, sitting chair with ottoman, huge chest of drawers, safe, and yes, a noisy air conditioner, but it was like white noise for us, so it didn't bother us at all. Beds were okay. Clean and comfortable. Room came with a blow dryer, iron and ironing board. There is no coffee maker or mini fridge, which didn't bother me none. We brought an ice chest anyway and that worked out perfectly. As for coffee, yes, the hotel wants you to buy yours, there was a convenient coffee shop as you exited Tower 2, also there is a Starbucks upstairs in the casino. I don't understand those who say the hotel casino is hard to navigate, follow the signs, walk along the carpet path and voila! It's not that big of a casino floor. It's like the MGM Grand, follow the signs. We got around with no problem whatsoever. Loved the pool area! A pool for everyone to enjoy. I also enjoyed the Dungeon, the game room area. Big kid in me still loves a challenge to win a toy. These are some areas I wish were addressed - Resort Fee - Really? Why? Never used anything to be charge $14.00 a day for. Bathroom - Nice and big...BUT...the granite counter top is too high. I'm short and this was a bit of an annoyance. Also, who thought of putting the toilet paper roll holder behind and to the left of the toilet? Peephole in door - Up way too high to be of any use for me. I couldn't see out of it. Security wise, that's an issue. Casino/Hotel - I wish there were more restaurants to choose from. The ones available were not impressive. I enjoyed the Food Court food more. EXCEPTION - Baja Fresh, they were on the ball and had great quality food for a reasonable price. Buffet was okay, but nothing great to charge $19.99 for dinner for. Also, can the drinks at the bars be any more expensive? $8.00 for a shot of Smirnoff and cranberry juice? Beer was $6.00. TIP - Bring your own booze OR, buy the drinks in the gift shops, a couple of bucks cheaper. Add on those annoying people who try to get you to a free show at the cost of sacrificing 90 minutes of your life at a timeshare or resort buy in, seminar. Just walk past them, after a while they will leave you alone. My husband and I rode the monorail up and down the strip one day. Even though you have the very upscale hotels of the Venetian, Caesar's Palace, The Palazzo, The Mirage, TI and etc....I wouldn't stay in that area of the strip for nothing! Way TOO many people and too crowded. Not enjoyable at all. I'll stay at the South end of the Las Vegas strip, thank you. As for the smoke issues - EVERY major hotel on the strip allows smoking, so what are you going to do? If you don't want that, stay off strip at Trumps, or any of the Marriott's properties. They have no casinos, therefore, no smoke. Overall, we had a great time and vacation. I would gladly stay at the Excalibur again.

Reviews.Title: “First visit to vegas.. Group of 8! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: dhughes87
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Las Vegas on 21st April for 7 nights, we picked the excalibur for its location as we had our 18month old son travelling with us! Our room was in tower 1 on the 27th floor and was excellent, two large very comfortable beds, flat screen tv, internet big shower and great views of new york new york and mgm grand! I have seen peoples reviews regarding smelling of stale smoke and can honestly say this isnt the case! The rooms were cleaned everyday to a great standard, with fresh bedding and towels everyday! Aircon worked fine and wasnt noisy! Yes the hotel is a bit dated looking in comparision to the newer hotels but that is the style of it! It is meant to look medivial. The casino was big enough, the pools were wonderful! My son loved the pool all cleaned everyday, bar staff were great, it was spotless! It was very easy to find your way round the casino to the food areas or rooms! I would definately stay in this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “First time to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: regeyer
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 night stay at the Excalibur. We stayed Thursday – Sunday in a widescreen view room on the 13th floor of tower 2. The room was decent, good view, comfortable bed, clean. However, there was no coffee pot or mini fridge which was a huge issue because we had to purchase coffee ever morning, and we are big coffee drinkers. The maid came by every day, sometimes twice. The hotel is nothing special, the casino area isn’t very big compared to other hotels. The first night we arrived at midnight and to our surprise there wasn’t anywhere still open that we could grab food at, we even asked the front desk and they said the only places that were open were McDonalds or Krispy Cream. This was a huge shock for me since it was my first time to Vegas and I thought things would be open 24/7 or at least til 2AM! We just walked next door to New York!New York! which had multiple places open. The hotel is a good location, there is a tram stop right out front and you can get to Mandalay Bay and the Luxor without going outside. The stay was worth what we paid for, but I wouldn’t stay here again. Too many kids, small pool, not much to do (in fact, I don’t think we spent any time here except for one morning at the pool and to sleep)… I don’t regret staying here but next time I’ll try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Old and Tired”
Reviews.Author: Safirehov
Reviews.Content: I was in a "refurbished room" with a tap in the bathroom I had to tighten. Switch on the floor lamp did not work. The chest of drawers was chipped and gouged, air conditioner to noisy to allow sleep. No wireless internet in room. Did have a flatscreen tv; left a larger tip one day for the maid in coins which was refused, more than I usually left in bills which were always taken. Refurbished room was suppose to have a view of the strip or pool, great view of the casino roof! Property needs updating including the refurbished rooms.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: valuetraveler2011
Reviews.Content: Rooms were shoddy need an update. Hotel location a distance from strip center. If you are looking to keep expenses down this hotel is ok but if you want an uplifting vacation go for the extra bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: hannahon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur June 6-10 through a Southwest deal. We were a bit nervous based on conflicting reviews of this property, but were pleasantly surprised!!! We were in Tower 2 which maybe made the difference. The rooms were nothing fancy, but they were very clean and spacious and the bathroom was very roomy. The only restaurant we ate at was Drench's by the pool and we were quite surprised at the quality of the food and the portion sizes. Speaking of the pool area, it was AWESOME!!! Having 4 different pools to choose from was really nice and the adult only pool was a nice break for us since we didn't have our kids with us. We were worried about the cigarrete smell that everyone seems to complain about, and honestly unless you happened to walk by someone that was smoking, I didn't notice a smoke smell. We will definitly return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur is good if your concentrating on partying!”
Reviews.Author: brentsf
Reviews.Content: Excalibur is a decent hotel in a nice area of the strip. The rooms are nothing fancy, but it's a great place to stay due to the location and you can usually get rooms for under $50! There is nothing that special about the hotel, but it does have a decent pool and decent food! I usually stay if I want to save $ overall on lodging! They have a Dick's last resort bar! If u have never been there, it is a good time and they have a great band that plays on thursday - saturday!

Reviews.Title: “Not even a great place to crash for the night.”
Reviews.Author: CinemaChick
Reviews.Content: I should have known better than to stay at Excalibur, but since it was only a place to sleep for the night, I didn't think it would be an issue. I was so wrong! Let me say that if you don't mind being in an extremely old casino hotel that reeks of smoke and is confusing to navigate, than Excalibur might be the hotel for you. However, I have stayed in Vegas many, many times and know that it isn't much more to stay at a place nearby that is way better in quality. I drove in, and although I was pleased that there was ample free parking, it was very difficult to find the reservation desk after we got in. I actually needed a fellow guest to put me in the right direction, and they mentioned it had been hard for them at first, too. It is equally as difficult to find your parking lot on the way out. If the repugnant odor of cigarette smell permeating every area of the hotel bothers you, forget about staying here! I had requested a non-smoking room, but that was a joke. I am very sensitive to smoke and that room smelled like it hadn't been cleaned since the '80s. It also seemed like the room that housekeeping & time forgot. The lighting was fairly inadequate and the bed was uncomfortable to boot. Even if the bed had been comfortable, I still was unable to sleep due to the room smelling so heavily of smoke (and yes, my room was considered to be a "non-smoking" room). The only redeeming factors here are the tram that takes you out of this medieval nightmare and that check out is fairly painless. I will NEVER stay here again. The saying is true - you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “I love the castle!”
Reviews.Author: LisaOxford_England
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Excalibur from 12 – 22 April this year and LOVED it! I got upgraded at check in to a widescreen room, which was really well decorated with comfy beds and huge flatscreen tv! I cannot fault my stay, staff were excellent and the only annoyance was the knights from the round table trying to get you to have a photo with them! I went to most of the bars here, and they were all great, Dicks especially – I’ll never watch Grease in the same way again! The refillable cocktails were also great. I honestly cant see why anyone would want to pay more in Vegas, it was brilliant! Cant wait to go back to my castle!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: Mike S
Reviews.Content: Decent place - stayed here because of its proximity to a venue where I was attending a concert. I usually stay off the strip since it is quieter but I wanted to be within walking distance for the concert. Pretty clean and straightforward - I used it mostly as a place to sleep as we spent the rest of the time on the Strip doing various things. The bed was comfortable and the room spartan but that is OK. I'd go back again if the price were right. Good service from the front desk staff. Liked best: location. Liked least: Property is showing its age and it is a bit busy and noisy at times.

Reviews.Title: “its a ok hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: kingpin2920
Reviews.Content: I stayed here June 9 and 10th. The carpet was a little dated but clean rooms clean. The check in check out was great although I did see long lines at times. They do have check out machines located by the elevators use these only if you would like to keep the charges on the same card. The pools were great clean and a fun time. The buffet was a good deal $24.99 all day but only the dinner was worthy of any applause. The location for the strip can not be beat close to quite a few big hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and budget friendly”
Reviews.Author: irl29
Reviews.Content: Customer service was prompt and courteous. Arrived at 8am and was able to check-in early for a $20 fee. The room was basic but clean. Hotel is down at the south end of the strip so we had to walk a little way to get to the heart of the strip. It does need to be renovated in order to keep up with some of the newer casino hotels that have been built in the last few years. If you are just looking for a place to sleep then this definitely fits the bill. Beds were very comfortable. Had a great sleep each night.

Reviews.Title: “Third Visit to Excalibur..and a little upset!”
Reviews.Author: Ocnluv616
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit in a years time. We have always had a blast for the price , no fancy gift baskets or anything but always friendly staff willing to help and nice clean rooms ( Even in Tower 1 ). this Trip however staff seemed a bit abrupt and rude when I needed help. We were on the 25th floor of tower 1 and someone was having a little TOO much fun smoking things other then cigarettes in their room. The air was so thick of the smell each night of our stay and throughout the day it made us ill. Several attempts to get the problem fixed were all ignored. I'm hoping this was an isolated event and wont run into it again.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: IrvineTraveler1
Reviews.Content: We were initially placed in a 3rd floor room where the window looked out onto a brick wall about 10 feet away. It was like a dungeon! The window mechanism was broken, and in trying to close the window my finger was smashed in the window frame. It took security about 30 minutes to arrive, and in the meantime it was bleeding, BUT they have NO MEDICAL ASSISTANCE OF ANY KIND at the hotel! They could call the EMT's but for a split open finger, I didn't think it was necessary. The security guy gave me some bandaids (even one of his own), and he helped us get a better room, but the rest of teh 'customer service' was extremely lacking. With the number of hotels and rooms from which to choose in Vegas, I will definitely not stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, no frills!”
Reviews.Author: jvduren
Reviews.Content: Located on "The Strip" close to the shops/airport and other casino's. Large (bath)room decor is a bit plain. Confinient located Starbucks in the casino and a small foodcourt. Large poolside with lifeguards. No free wifi only free internet cable hookup. We didn't had the best experience with the dinning facilities, we got food poisoning at the onsite MacD.

Reviews.Title: “Another great week spent at Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: amyluvshockey
Reviews.Content: This is our 4th year in a row staying at Excalibur for a week (May 29th to June 4). We've always stayed in one of the new towers (Tower II) and booked via smartervegas.com using the promo code for a Deluxe Widescreen Room. Nice, large room at a great price (usually 30% less). Sure the casino has a stronger smell of smoke compared to some others but it also has 4 large pools and lots of pool chairs to choose from. I come to Vegas to relax/sun tan and don't want to sit by a pool that is mostly in the shade (Monte Carlo) or has a line up to get in (Mirage) or you have to walk all the way through the casino just to get to the pool (MGM). Also, I'm not a 20 something model so am not looking to go topless at Bare!!

Reviews.Title: “Needs a thorough work out”
Reviews.Author: interintra
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with the family. The rooms are clean but are definitely in a need of new colors, paint, wall paper, furniture etc. Good service but mainly oriented to lower middle class gambling clientele.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: traveltotry
Reviews.Content: This place needs an update real bad. Great place if you don't mind old looking rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fun!”
Reviews.Author: amy3608
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Me and my husband had a BLAST! It's kind of a walk to the other end of the strip but doable! It's directly connected to the Luxor, which is super convenient. The staff was nice, but we got a little tired of the sales people at every entrance of the hotel, they're unavoidable! But I get it they are trying to make money, it was just annoying! The stay was great, and you have to go see the tournament of kings while you're there!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Pompeyman
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights, having had to move from the hotel we had originally booked. The room was very reasonably priced, especially during the week, but quite adequate, with 2 comfortable king size beds (for a family of 3), nice bathroom and clean. The casino was noisy 24/7, like all Vegas casinos, but the room was always very quiet, so no problem sleeping. The buffet was very good value and we especially liked breakfast. One of our party is unable to use the elevator, but the Excalibur allowed us easy access to the stairs with no problem. We liked the fact that high speed cable internet was available in the room, included in the price.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: alishahamptone
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at 8 different hotel properties and 2 time share properties in Las Vegas and Excalibur is the best value. The service/staff are wonderful, the casino dealers are my favorite in Vegas. The casino floor, lobby and common areas are somewhat dated but the rooms in the newly renovated tower are nice. The pool is one of the better ones we have have experienced. Four large pools, plenty of space, the cabanas rental price is very reasonable, the bar/food service great. Located at the 'bottom' of the strip is good - still easy to get around. The restauants we ate in were McDonalds (at 2 am you just need a burger), Baja Fresh while at the pool and Starbucks for morning coffee - so really can't attest to the 'feature' type places - not sure if they would be our idea of great dining for dinner. But Excalibur is just up from Mandalay Bay which has some of the best eating in Vegas - within walking distance. The only down side to this resort is the amount of children - they are bloody everywhere! It is a family friendly place, not our idea of an adult get away. Over all we enjoyed our stay ...... and saved a lot of $$$.

Reviews.Title: “Whoa needs updating!”
Reviews.Author: CanadianJane
Reviews.Content: Alert to Exaclibur: it's not 1987 anymore! We stayed one night here and found the decor to be really out of date: rust-coloured shag carpet, brutal olive-green curtains, old bathroom fixtures... They could really play up the castle aspect in this hotel, but they don't. We had a problem with 5 big-bodied moths flying around in our room. I've heard of hotels having issues with bed bugs, but moths!? Pretty gross. My husband ran around stomping them and whacking at them before we went to bed. I don't even know how this could happen in a hotel where the hotel windows can't be opened. Anyhow, the buffet is noisy due to food carts rumbling right by you. Needs updating, food=mediocre.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: StevoCanmore
Reviews.Content: Not one thing about this property makes me wish to return except for the service at the bars. Unfriendly security, concierge, front desk and management. The housekeepers I found to be friendly however I do not believe it is checked thoroughly at least in the public areas. The Tuesday evening I stayed I walked down the corridor where my room is located to see a soggy and dripping ice cream wrapper on the floor. Not really a big deal. I returned 6 hours later to find that it was still there. I woke in the morning to go get breakfast, the wrapper was still there. I returned from breakfast, there were 2 housekeeping carts in the corridor with two very kind ladies working on cleaning guest rooms, the wrapper was still there. UNBELIEVABLE!! Now for the good points. My bed was very, very, very confortable. The iron I needed to use to prepare for a friend's wedding was in excellent working condition. The buffet offered by the property is very good and the price can't be beat. The bartenders manning the bars on site were indeed very kind and friendly. The location is a little far from Old Vegas but for the majority of the strip it's well placed. I do not recommend. There are plenty of better properties to stay at in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: gARY04050
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas to celebfrate our 35th anniversary. We had booked this hotel for 5 nights. When we checked in and got to our room the AC was not working, there were no light is the bathroom, and the room was dirty. We spent 1 night there then went to The Hotel at Mandaly Bay which was GREAT !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Rates”
Reviews.Author: Bobsibaok
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay. Would come back in a heartbeat. Excellent Strip location. Surprisingly quiet for a "family" hotel. Good food. Good booze. Friendly staff. All-around great experience. No kidding!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review”
Reviews.Author: DennisRK
Reviews.Content: For the price, the room was a great value. However, having stayed at this location, several times, over the past years, the selection and quality of the food available at the Roundtable Buffet has decreased. Also, disappointed with the hours and the customer service of the Sherwood Forest Cafe. If not for the price of the room, I would not recommend staying at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not great”
Reviews.Author: weary_traveller25
Reviews.Content: During a recent business trip to Las Vegas, I stayed at the Excalibur Hotel & Casino. It was conveniently located on the Las Vegas strip near the Luxor, New York New York, and the Tropicana. When you arrive, you can choose between valet parking and self parking. I chose self parking and had quite a bit of a walk to get to the registration desk. When I arrived at the desk, the check-in process was rather quick. Unfortunately, my room was in Tower 2 which was on the opposite side of the hotel from the registration desk. The hotel had standard Las Vegas amenities: slots, table games, shops, restaurants, pool, etc. They were roughly the same as most hotel and casinos on the strip. The medievel theme of the hotel was noticeable, but not overdone. When you go to the elevators to your tower, there is a station for a security guard to check patrons to make sure they are guests of the hotel. Best I could tell, the guards were only present fifty percent of the times I went past that station and they never once checked to see if I was a hotel guest. Why bother having them at all? The room was mediocre at best. If you're going to stay on the strip, you should at least get a better room for the few hours that you will be in it. It was not much better than a motel room you'd find off the highway. As money as the hotel rakes in on gambling, they should spend something to upgrade the rooms. With so many choices of places to stay in Las Vegas, the only thing that I can say which would make me recommend this one is the price. It's less expensive than several other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Annoying timeshare offers”
Reviews.Author: BagmanNZ
Reviews.Content: This was an ok hotel. There are a couple of major issues for us. First, security. They sat in chairs at the bottom of each tower to make sure the right people got in to the hotel rooms. They were there about half the time we got in. Of that they asked us three times for our key to make sure we were staying there. Why bother. Don't have them at all and charge me less for the room. Second, timeshare sellers. They're everywhere in this hotel. Every time we moved, they swooped. They were like vultures. If security were this good my first problem wouldn't have been a problem. Other than that this hotels is ok. Nothing fancy, but you get a hotel in an pretty good location.

Reviews.Title: “Offer huge variety of entertainment”
Reviews.Author: asamodia
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our business stay in Las vegas mainly based on its #1 rating on internet site. And it is a unique little gem, really. We have stayed at many hotels over the years, often luxury ones with impeccable details and fantastic designs. Price-wise is on par with these better-class hotels. But the comparison fails: Excalibur is a luxury place dream world

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: sprklngsaphire
Reviews.Content: This was my very first time in vegas and honestly I had no real expectations. I came on here a few times to read reviews but really didn't know what to expect and kept an open mind and was generally looking forward to the trip over all to excalibur. And like everything there were good and bad to staying here. I will start with the good. 1. The price was great. We booked direct with the hotel/casino online and at the time it was one of the better deals on the strip. 2. The hotel did Not reek of cigarette smoke like some of the other reviews have said. ( but it does smell! not quite sure how to describe it, but if it's an airfreshener, it needs to be changed out and has to go! 3. Our hotel room was spacious and clean. No bed bugs, and yes I checked. 4. We valet parked and the attendants were Great! very helpful and prompt. 5. The bellhops were prompt and delivered our bags within 10 minutes upon calling from our room. and now The BAD.. 1. I am telling you, when you read about those pesky Time shares people hounding you to death every single time you walk by BELIEVE it!! you could not get by those people without them bugging you. and it does NOT matter how many times in a single day you walk by the same exact person, they will try and corner you wanting you to do their "tour". It doesn't matter if you say "no" or " already signed up" they will still ask the next time you walk by! my hubby and I were trying to dodge them, trying not to make eye contact, if we saw them on the left, we would veer right, and they still got us. it was ridiculous how relentless they were! and this is a big reason I may not stay here again. it was just above and beyond annoying. 2. we could not get a drink at all while on the casino floor! out of 3 days and perhaps over 12 hours gambling at just Excalibur alone, we only saw a cocktail waitress twice!! but she was walking by so fast, and she never once asked us if we wanted anything!!when we went over to NYNY within the first 10 minutes we were offered something to drink. 3. the slot machines are getting old and it shows! one machine in particular got stuck the moment my hubby put his $20 in it, and it took over an hour to get a slot attendant to come over and fix it, and that was with me leaving and treking across the casino floor in search of an attendant , finally found one, and she came over to fix the machine. ( now mind you, before this, we had all the service lights going in hopes someone would come over but after waitting for twenty minutes, i began to hunt down an attendant. 4. The staff in general are not very welcoming and you can tell they hate their jobs.( other than the bellhops and valet guys, they were great.) 5. The casino/hotel just seems old and dated. almost like a nursing home for casinos. and not very excitting. we really did prefer NYNY much better than the excalibur . and next time that is where we will stay. All in all, not bad for the money, BUT if you are looking for a nice fun place to stay as well as gamble with slots or table games, I would stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing :(”
Reviews.Author: jsmcolegio
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs updated carpet ASAP. Rooms are dated, no mini-bar, Formica on bathroom's counter tops and Good LORD, how about some soap and shampoo (that's like Hotels 101). Pay $13 for a frozen drink at the pool that tastes terrible. Waitresses are nice but almost senior citizens for Las Vegas Standards. I guess if you are a college student just looking to get drunk and don’t care much about accommodations then this hotel is OK. The players’ club sucks (might as well not give any points at all). The outside looks good but the busy inside is just dirty and dingy looking.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel on the strip”
Reviews.Author: joholidayManchester
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Excalibur hotel twice once in November/December and then few years later in the September. Weather was nice in the November/December and I even had an afternoon sunbathing by the pool. The weather was boiling in the September.Rooms are nice a size and beds are comfortable. I think the hotel is good value for money you are across from the MGM and New York New York. There are restaraunts and shops within the hotel, used the MacDs a few times and went to the steak house once (this was lovely) The hotel is connected to the Luxor by a moving walkway that is undercover. No matter what time you went down into the casino there was always plenty of people knocking about.

Reviews.Title: “This Castle is positively medieval.”
Reviews.Author: zippy100
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to Excalibur I stayed in an upgraded room in 2004 and gave quite a favourable review. As we got a very good rate of $200 for four nights we thought we'd stay again. This time went for a standard room since didn't plan on spending much time in the room. Check in was ok, although the woman on the desk wasn't what I would call welcoming.. Very disappointed with the room, I thought it would be on a par of the last room we had but smaller and no strip view. This room had tatty bedding, stains on the carpet, and old furniture. However it was a large room, with a LCD TV, and a good view of Luxor and the airport so couldn't really complain with the price we paid. The bed I found out later was very soft, the springs had gone and it had a dip in the middle. I woke with a bad back but strangley slept ok. I was disappointed how downhill this hotel had become. The casino had the worst smell of smoke than any other hotel on the strip. I am sure replacing the tatty carpets would rectifiy this. The pool area although has been renovated since my last visit, was probably the worst experience of the whole stay. I didn't book an 18-30s holiday but this is what I felt I was on. Although I don't mind loud music in the right place, I think it inappropriate to have it blaring out all day from every conseavable part that you just can't avoid it and relax and read. Gone are the families, replaced by teenages drinking in the pool. The loungers were the most uncomfortable I have ever experienced with a large gap where you loose parts of your body and towels. I thought these were faulty but in fact they were made like this, though I think they were meant for cushions. Incidently, you can have for a price. I hated everything about the way this hotel tries to extract every dollar from you from any means possible. Like no coolers or cans by the pool? Now I understand no glass but coolers? Yes because they can charge large amounts for their drinks. No fridge in the room, this is a first for me in the US. Again so you buy their drinks. Not me, I filled the bin with ice. Very disappointed with this hotel and wont be staying here again. Most American's were speechless when I mentioned where I was saying, says it all really. The only good thing about this hotel is it's location, but I will pay more and stay at New York New York next time. Top tip for other travellers, get the 201 bus outside NY for the Albertsons supermarket, prices a fraction of the price than on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Phanto
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sahara last year, but it closed down this year, had to look for alternative cheap accomodation, found Excalibur to be excellent location, great shops in their mall, great eating facilities. Overall really good. the down side was noisey rooms for sleeping, couldn't run A/C unit when sleeping to noisey and they didn't clean room or change linen regularly, they just missed days. The scammers didn't bother us at all.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good nights sleep!”
Reviews.Author: luvwater
Reviews.Content: Reserved & paid for 3 night stay in Deluxe Widescreen room with 3 adults because wanted a larger room with extra seating in newer remodeled room. Upon check-in - TOLD by clerk that we were getting a FREE upgrade to room with a view. It was on 24th floor overlooking NYNY & MGM - yes good view. However, friends staying on same side lower level visited our room after 2nd night and noted how much smaller ours was compared to theirs. After talking to manager, turns out it was not an upgrade, just a switch from large room on lower level to small room with view - same price! I asked for some concession for not putting us in room which we expressly reserved for size NOT view but she only offered to move - which we didn't want to do. Finally asked for later check out and did get that. Back to the smaller Widescreen room - bed was close to wall so not much room to get out on my side. NO BLACK OUT CURTAINS! Just a roman shade that leaks tons of light out of sides and bottom of window. Beds were hard and only supplied with 2 sheets and 1 blanket - not even a comforter! We are used to "sleep systems" and this was not! Plus, because we were so close to the helicopter airport - there was continuous noise from them from 6AM - 7:30AM - for trips to Grand Canyon and then all evening long for the 15 min. sightseeing. There was a large walk in shower instead of tub, but it only had one small grooved tray for soap - so you had to put everything else on the floor and watch it float around while showering! $24.99/$29.99 all day buffet was fine if you don't plan to leave the hotel otherwise Dick's Last Resort had good very food - just strange/purposefully rude attmosphere. 4 big pools and several outside hot tubs which anyone off the street it seemed could use as entrance was at a side entrance of casino and no one on duty to check room keys - ever!

Reviews.Title: “Get what you have paid for”
Reviews.Author: rortoni
Reviews.Content: I´ve mixed opinions about Excalibur. I´ve stayed there about 5 times, and had good and bad experiences. Well, is has a good price, nice location and a very cheap buffet. One night the fire alarm went off at 3AM... ok, it´s VEGAS, but it scared the hell of out me! In our last stay, we were given a room at 4th floor, with the window facing a wall. We barely could see the sky! The hotel had half of the elevators working, so had to wait a LOT for it. Staff at the casino is really annoying offering show tickets every time we went thru the casino entrances. Not sure if we are staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't use the phone if you're calling Europe!”
Reviews.Author: rattenpakker
Reviews.Content: Good value and place to get to know Vegas. Don't expect any extra's: you're a number coming in and a number going out. Call to Europe costs 9$ per minute! That's how they keep the rates that low... Buffet is OK for the price ( no beer! ), steakhouse is overrated and overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “The Funk, the Whole Funk, Nothing but the Funk”
Reviews.Author: Ellenwood
Reviews.Content: The Widescreen room looked as advertised but the funk or smell encountered when entering the room was unbearable. The room had a strong, distinct, musty odor. The odor seemed to be strongest near the bathroom but maybe because I opened the window on the other end of the room. One of their own workers attributed the smell to the carpet that needed cleaning. The smell was so bad I worried about it stinking up my clean clothes. Although they charge you a daily resort fee that includes internet, forget about connecting wireless devices - internet is wired only. The bed was also hard. I woke up with a backache. No parking deck, so long wals are in store from the large parking lot. I should have known something would be wrong when I landed a strip-view $100 per night weekend rate when most hotels were charging three times as much (some music awards show as in town). I could only stand the smell for one night and checked out the next day when i found a room at another hotel. On the positive side, there were numerous reasonably priced eating establishments. Vegas is a place where you can easily spend $30 for breakfast. The room was look as advertised and I won over $700 in the casino (the reason I did not rate it lower). I guess it is the old saying that 'you get what you pay for'. Spend the money to clean the freaking carpet and get rid of the smell! You will get higher rates and more guests.

Reviews.Title: “Good Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MusicAsh
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for families. It may not be the nicest hotel, but it is a great hotel for the price you get. There is a nice arcade for kids and teens and slots for adults. The buffet is nothing special-I would recommend going to MGM or Luxor for a buffet, but they have a good food court. The hotels are clean, the service is fast, and the workers are very friendly and helpful. The pool was recently redone and is very nice- it isn't the nicest pool in Vegas, but it does the job on a hot Vegas day and it looks nice. I have stayed at the Tropicana and Circus Circus before, but Excalibur has been my favorite and I have stayed there for a week for the past 4 or 5 years. It is nice because you can walk through this hotel with kids and teens without scaring them for life or covering their eyes, unlike many hotels on the strip. It is also towards the end of the strip-we do Mandalay Bay,Luxor, and MGM in one night and then the rest of the strip in one or two days-it's easy to work your way down the strip because of the great location-it also makes it quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely NO PROBLEMS HERE!”
Reviews.Author: helpingothers
Reviews.Content: Easy check in. Plenty of parking in back. Quiet, large, clean room. For $40.00 dollars (it was a Thursday) I got a great deal. I asked for a 6 a m wake up call. I thought when the phone rang, it was an automated call. I hung up the phone and it rang again when I was in the bathroom. The next thing I know someone is pounding at my door. He yelled, "security". I asked if I could help him and he said he wanted to make sure I was awake. Now that is going the extra mile with a wakeup call. When I checked out I asked the person at the front desk about the security guy coming to my door. She said the Excalibur wants to make sure you get up in case you need to catch a flight. All I had to do was drive to Death Valley and Utah. The pools in back looked nice too! Only good things to say about my stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the LV strip.”
Reviews.Author: LizMacOttawa
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights in May 2011 with 2 children (10 & 7). The hotel was fun for them since it looks like a castle. Lots of things for them to do in the Dungeon (basement level) including games, 3D rides and fun food (Dairy Queen). The rooms are large and comfortable. We faced the strip so it was a bit noisy and bright but that's Vegas! The pools were great - there were 4. It was a really good deal compared to the other higher end hotels on the strip and since you don't spend that much time in your room, who cares. Internet was not free but parking was. Location was great as it is right near New York New York, MGM and Mandalay.

Reviews.Title: “Can't really fault this hotel, enjoyed my time here”
Reviews.Author: WannabeBallerina
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 days in August '10. The great thing about this hotel is that it is actually on the strip (the other budget options we looked at were a distance away) and is very affordable, particularly if you stay during the week. Sure, it looks a little funny on the outside (like a children's castle) but it really is quite nice on the inside. It's family-friendly and well laid-out for such a massive hotel. Staff are always on hand to assist if you get lost (believe me, I managed to get lost in the lobby). The rooms are nice and spacious and the free internet is a nice touch. This is available through a cable on a table so you can't move around but the signal is consistently strong. The room and bathroom were clean and the shower facilities were nice. The casino downstairs is on the small side but it has the advantage of being non-intimidating to a novice like myself. The selection of restaurants and shops is good, they really have something to cater for everyone. The all-day buffet is reasonable priced and there's a great selection of food. I would definitely stay here again as it was an ideal base for the rest of the strip and they actually paid attention to security (checking for keycards, etc) which was a welcome change from some of the other hotels I've stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: jayonce81
Reviews.Content: The location was great easy access to luxor and mandalay bay bridge access to MGM and NYNY and Tropicana casino staff was great thanks Nila for a great Three Card Poker Hand :-) and teachi me pai gow poker .....Highly Recomend The Widescreen View Room join Excalibur FB page and get great rates as we did Overall 4 out of 5 the food at buffet and overall selection avlb and high resort fee 14.00 was the only downside

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: SBH_11
Reviews.Content: While we had heard that perhaps some of the casinos were aging, the Excalibur was a fantastic destination for us. We didn't take in the dinner theater show but I was amazed that it was in the "dungeon" or basement of the casino! We stayed in Tower 1, which was opposite the casino to the pool, meaning we had to traipse through the casino in our swimsuits, but we fit right in with the style! The room was very clean, the view was fantastic, the bed was very comfortable, and the wake-up call system worked every time. We really liked the location - Deuce (bus) stops just across the street and while we were in the midst of everything, it didn't feel too crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location and overall fab hotel for las vegas stay”
Reviews.Author: agapantha33
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas for a weekend and found an awesome deal at Excalibur. Ratings in travel books said 3 star but, in my opinion, it is a low 4 star (and i've travelled a lot). The hotel isn't fancy as Venetian or Bellagio, etc. But for the price, it felt like we were getting a steal. the service was excellent, the rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. We upgraded to the room with a view of the strip right at the front desk which was cheaper than booking an upgraded room ahead online. Some people may not like its location on the strip but we actually preferred that it was near the end of the strip rather than in the middle. That is because it was less crowded in the casino with visitors from other hotels/casinos. Being less of an attraction hotel (such as conmpared to MGM) also meant that we had fewer crowds to contend with in the hotel. it is definately more family friendly and we saw quite a few children in the hotel (we didn't bring kids ourselves). Service was great with lots of genuninely perky and happy staff (except the concierge guy--he was a bit miserable). it wasn't as flashy as other hotels but i would definitely stay there again without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Comfy”
Reviews.Author: 13whiterabbit
Reviews.Content: Excalibur was a pretty good find, we stayed in the widescreen tower, non-smoking king room. If you sign up for their newsletter you get a decent percentage off the hotel price, keep in mind though that there's the resort fees and taxes. The hotel is clean, but like any casino/hotel - it often smells of smoke. The room was unexpectedly large - and the bed was very comfortable. The location is pretty decent as well, being opposite the MGM. We got a view of the back of the castle/tower. There is no mini-bar/fridge in the room - only a room service option.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are dated, but cheap and clean - $15 resort fee”
Reviews.Author: annabanannaMelbourne
Reviews.Content: For $25 USD per night, we can't really complain! Booked the room through the Excalibue website using a discount code (XNEWS) from their emails, which got us 20% off. Check retailmenot etc. for discount codes when you book. Had to wait in a queue for about 10 mins at check-in. Service was fine, $15 resort fee charged. This gives you free in-room wired internet access, and use of the gym. We stayed in Tower A, which has the older rooms. The room was large, and very clean. Very dated though. Wired internet was very fast. The bed was quite soft, but comfortable. Quiet at night. Large flatscreen TV. Hairdryer and safe. Ample free parking available. Overall, great for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families & spending money on Vegas”
Reviews.Author: bh1986
Reviews.Content: Excalibur is in a great location on the Strip and is close to the Monorail station (across the street at MGM Grand). It's excellent for families with children - they have a midway with all kinds of stuff for kids. However, there's plenty of fun for adults, too. (Try Dick's Last Resort & Thunder from Down Under). There are so many great restaurant choices in the hotel (McDonald's, Pizza Hut, Quizno's, Krispy Kreme, etc). The pools are AMAZING! They're sparkling clean & huge. Couldn't have asked for better amenities. The hotel itself is clean and in good repair, and the rooms are fairly large. The rooms are plain in decor and nothing fancy. The beds were somewhat uncomfortable and the mattresses are lumpy. The bathroom is huge and has a great shower. The in-room safe is a nice feature. However, do NOT pay extra for a room with a view of the Strip because the "view" is nothing. You can't see down the Strip because of the angle the hotel sits to Las Vegas Blvd. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for people who want a clean, no-frills place to stay in Vegas. The rates are reasonable and it's a great place to crash after you've had all the gambling you can stand.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Naomi099
Reviews.Content: I read a few negative reviews about this hotel, but I didn't find anything negative about it! For everyone that is complaing about this hotel - its not a 5 star hotel, you pay for what you get, if you want 5 star treatment then stay at Bellagio. Don't complain about stupid things the hotel doesn't do. I got a standard room in Tower 1, thought it would be bad, but it was better than expected, a big room and big bathroom. Stayed on the 11th floor, non smoking. Very quiet floor and had a great view of the Luxor. Didn't think the casino was smokey at all, it was very easy to get around. The food court was nice and was easy to run up there for food and drinks. Sherwood Cafe was good for breakfast, and the Baja Fresh Mexian was good as well. Timeshare people were annoying but all we said was "We're not 25" and they left you alone. Even if you are older than that just dont answer or say "Already have it" or just say your not 25 anyway, who cares? If you can't handle a few timeshare people then you can't handle Vegas walking down the street getting handed naked girl pictures. Overrall had a great stay, check in was easy as well as the self checkout. Only thing is that on Friday elevators were very crowded had to wait about 10 min to get downstairs, so if you have the energy and are not on a floor too high up then take the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Reisblij
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in Luxe room. Perfect. Nice and quiet. In casino very busy A pity the Italian restaurant is closed up. Swimming pool very nice. Don't like for the DJ noise at the pool.

Reviews.Title: “When you want to spend less on hotels and more on Vegas”
Reviews.Author: lvoregon
Reviews.Content: Pros: For two retail workers it made this trip possible because it was within our budget. Great location on the strip, but still took public transport to get down further or to Fremont St. It was fairly quiet even though there where a lot of people. Rooms where cleaned everyday, and although not pretty to look at, felt clean. Customer service was good, easy check in and out, and renting a car was a breeze Cons: No WiFi, but on last day found out if we had Ethernet cord we could get service. Our view out the window was a white brick wall. As with most Vegas hotels, there is a lot of walking involved. We where in Tower 1 and pool was in Tower 2. Than meant walking through the smelly casino to get almost anywhere. Also with most hotels, smoking in tolerated, so if we even reached our foot into the casino our clothes would smell for the whole trip. There is a $14 dollar a night "resort" fee which meant we had to pay $75 extra a person.

Reviews.Title: “Ehhh...so,so”
Reviews.Author: Ka_hawaii83
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Tower 1 and the rooms were seriously outdated. I should have expected that because we paid the online special price. The online price said $38 for the first nite, but on our bill, it said $45. I don't think it was the resort fee because that was added on as a separate charge. Like other reviews, the shower water pressure is not so great. The shower has a sliding door and the water seemed to seep out of the bottom part. I have kids that came along with us on this trip and it was a pain dragging them through the casino area. I stopped just for a split moment so my 10 year old could catch up with me, and a floor security told me to keep it moving. I thought that was uncalled for because it wasn't like I was staying for a long period of time. I really didn't like the promotional people who hound you while you pass by their desks. The same people who I told that I wasn't interested kept asking every single time we passed them throughout our stay. Overall I think I got what I paid for! If you are on a budget then it's a good place to stay, but if you can afford a few more dollars then find somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: Vegasman16
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay at Excalibur in Las Vegas. I have stayed here many times and after this stay I am still convinced its the best value on the strip. Upon check-in I was informed the room I requested was not available. Without asking I was given a complimentary upgrade to one of the new flat screen view rooms, which was very clean and comfortable. While there we ate at Sherwood forest cafe and spent one day at the pool. The casino is large and has a wide variety of slots. We enjoyed listening to the band in the lounge in the evenings. As always we had a very good stay and we will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad, Ejoyed my stay.”
Reviews.Author: harris52307
Reviews.Content: I thought the hotel in general was good. It is alittle outdated but for what i paid I thought was worth it. The hotel does have alot of kids. I thought the staff was great. I ejoyed my time in vegas so much already looking forward to my next trip. And i seem to win alot at the Excalibur.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful to read between the lines”
Reviews.Author: John_Michael925
Reviews.Content: The resort charges resort fees regardless of what other websites say about there being none. Also, the widescreen rooms that have an upgrade fee of $10.00 and are said to have a view... do not unless you upgrade another $10.00. The management's answer to this was "it didn't say what the wiew was of...." The hotel and casino were nice but basically bland. There are far nicer choices on the strip for comparable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Dated, but clean and inexpensive.”
Reviews.Author: jkmccue
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas was a last-minute add-on to a business trip, and I therefore had to be a bit budget-friendly in my hotel choice. I selected the Excalibur because of its location, price, and it had the best reviews at that price point on Trip Advisor. The room was dated, but clean and did the trick. Let's be honest - I wasn't in my room for more than 30 minutes, other than sleeping (which also wasn't for much longer than 30 minutes :)) I had a bit of a wait checking in, but not too bad. The staff were nice.

Reviews.Title: “Gross”
Reviews.Author: nurse0729
Reviews.Content: The pool is nice and the Tournment of kings is good other then the food is less then par. The rooms are simple for what you pay for. The problem is the second day into our trip we noticed there was dry puke or poo stays from a toilet back up running down the sides of our toilet. We have now complained 4x and still have not had the situation taken care of. Each time house keeping has came back and made our beds and changed our towels, but we come back to our room and the nasty marks are still there. The fourth time we called downstairs and the attendent was very rude on the phone. I would never stay at this hotel again or recommend it to anyone. Doesn't take much to clean properly hving worked in house keeping before.

Reviews.Title: “The 2nd hand smoke in casino was the worst of all casinos we visited, update ventilation”
Reviews.Author: luuluu50
Reviews.Content: Desk clerks friendly and efficient, check in and check out was fast. We stayed in Tower 2, the updated rooms, clean and spacious. We loved the pools and pool staff, but didn't understand why they closed for a few raindrops. Our no. 1 complaint was the smoking on casino floor, just walking thru casino our hair and clothing where covered in smokers stench. We suffered from burning eyes and sore throats.

Reviews.Title: “resort fees, what a ripoff”
Reviews.Author: damguy3
Reviews.Content: We made reservations for May 3 and May 10 & 11. We paid 2 nights in advance as required (paid in july 2010). When we checked in we were told that it would be an additional $14.00 per night for RESORT FEES. The taxes were not included in the Prepaid rooms either. We assumed that the $51.00 per night room rate paid in advance was payment in full. By the time were finished, our rate was $75.00 per night. What a ripoff. Everything at the hotel was extra: internet, pool, health club. The room wasn't even that nice. The leaky faucet and the clogged shower were disgusting.
