We stayed at 6 different hotels during out vacation and the Excalibur was awful by comparison. We expected a lot more from one of the biggest hotels on the strip. It seems that the hotel cares more about making money than customer care. As a result, we took our business and dollars elsewhere to more accommodating establishments. We will be sure to tell our friends and family about our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great value on the strip”
Reviews.Author: MF2011_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. The room was big with 2 king sized beds, although we had requested one as we are on honeymoon. At check in the woman at the desk was stone cold and very unfriendly, and we were offered tickets to a 'free show' which turned out to be conditional on attending a timeshare scam which we weren't all that impressed with (we were told it was to provide feedback on their new casino, but when we arrived we recieved an aggresive sales pitch!). The room was dated, but big and clean and fine for us as we were hardly there. It was excellent value for money. Overall the Excalibur experience was pretty good and If I come back to vegas I would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously this hotel stinks DO NOT STAY HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: iluvholidays2011
Reviews.Content: I am not a fussy person at all,usually I always stay in cheaper hotels, Ramda's, Premier Inn's etc, all I ask for is the hotel to be clean but this one is certainly not.. I'll never forget the smell as I walked in it was a really cheap airfreshner that was obviously tryin to cover up a worst smell!! We had to upgrade because our room in tower 1 smelled so bad I wanted to be sick.. The room we had in tower 2 wasn't as bad but we had to move after one nyt after finding 5 huge moths, we did not have the window open so we believe there was a nest of them in our room.. The dust in both rooms was about an inch thick and I had to clean the bathroom floor myself, it had oblviously not be cleaned in a very long time..The smell of the towels an bed linen was gross, like they had been re used without being washed.. Also 1 nyt we were woken up by our phone ringing, it was guests from another room askin were we sellin weed cause they could smell it outside our room, we rang the front desk to report this incident and the girl we were talkin to asked' What do you want me to do about it???'' I know she couldn't of found out who was calling but she could of least sent security up to our floor to have a walk up an down.. Obviously u can do wat u like in this hotel include smoke weed.. Then to top it all off the nyt before we went home we found 2 other bugs in our room.. Seriously do not stay here pay the extra an stay in New York New York..

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the renovated rooms in Tower Two”
Reviews.Author: travel4me_9296
Reviews.Content: Stayed here three nights last week and enjoyed the stay. We were in Tower Two which had been renovated. The room was comfortable and sufficient for what we needed. There isn't a refrigerator, but we just used our cooler. I don't think may of the Vegas hotels have refrigerators. The air conditioning unit was very loud, but that helped drown out any noise from next door or from the pool (even though we were on the 24th floor). This place is a good value. I got a 2 for 1 show and lower rates by using my mlife card. We liked staying at the Excalibur because of the location. We were seeing "KA" at MGM Grand and we like to play switch blackjack at Excalibur and Luxor. We also liked parking at the small parking lot at the side near the Tower Two entrance. That was very convenient and closer than the parking garage. I would stay here again because the rates are good.

Reviews.Title: “Always stay at Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: shajak61
Reviews.Content: We love the Excalibur. Have been staying there for years. They always treat us right and give great deals.

Reviews.Title: “Fine just for somewhere to stay on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Double0D
Reviews.Content: This place is alright really if you're just using it as somewhere to sleep. It is cheap, and therefore you can't expect too much. The rooms were reasonably clean. Corridors did have a bad smell sometimes. And as someone else commented, cleaners don't take glasses from the hallway. We actully put some glasses on a cleaners trolley (they weren't ours, and had been sat there since we arrived), but later seen they'd just been put back in the corridor! The pool is quite nice, and clearly benefited from the recent work. For casino's, I'd advise taking a walk or taxi elsewhere on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur has become our HOME Hotel and Casino, the BEST in Vegas!!”
Reviews.Author: NormaJean81258
Reviews.Content: We always stay at Excalibur because the staff is welcoming, friendly and always go the extra mile to make guests happy! Our slot host Chona, is fabulous. It's obvious she loves what she does, Mike Jackson, our Bellman, is exceptional. If you are unhappy with anything, even the smallest thiing, they will fix it. When you play at Excalibur and it's sister properties, you can not beat the Comps. And with the Player's Club card, now called the MLife card, the benefits carry from each hotel/Casino in the MGM/Mirage group. We always have a great time, and don't want to leave! It's wonderful to feel so at home when your among the thousands of people also staying there. If you'dlike to have a great stay at a great place in Vegas, Excalibur is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Great value!!”
Reviews.Author: Shisnit
Reviews.Content: Any hotel is vegas would give good value regardless. But This hotel was at the south end of the strip around 15 mins from the airport. The hotel was busy which was a good sign, however the wait time was minimal. Service was great, the food was cheap. We ate the all you can eat spaghetti... make sure you are hungry. The room was very big (they upgraded us for free).

Reviews.Title: “THIEVES IN THE HOTEL!!!SECURITY AINT HELPING.WOW”
Reviews.Author: GODDESS3759
Reviews.Content: we stayed there for 2 nights check out sunday morning about 11:40 am. we realize we forgotten our cell phone (droid x) came back to get it less than 30 mins from checking out. it was gone. ask the maids? they denied of seeing it. report it to the security all they did is file report and look at you like they dont care. i used my wife droid x gps to locate and to make the phone scream didnt work, cuz the person who stole the phone turn the cell phone off. couples of hours later that night we had had located the cell phone by GPS. we went back to excalibur security offices gave them information about the thieves address ( excalibur employee). the security didnt even want to do something about it. the security told us is out of their concern. we got metro (vegas police) to help us out. The officer was really helpful and help us get our cell phone back. The officer knock on the thieves door and surprisingly it was the cleanning guy who lives in the house once again employee from excalibur. we did our own investigation and it was successfull. thank you for the officer who help us. excalibur security are helpless.they didnt even search their own employee before leaving to go home. after the fact customer had complaint of things are being stolen.

Reviews.Title: “Can I come back..soon?!?!”
Reviews.Author: Alikazally
Reviews.Content: So great. Close to everything. Wishing we could make it back sooner than later! Stayed for 3 days and each day was fantastic! Love the hotel, loved the staff, loved our room! Oh! Plus the all you can eat buffet and the tournament of the kings (is that what its called?) was awesome! Staying at the Castle again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Best time ever”
Reviews.Author: Alexanderh08
Reviews.Content: First time staying at the castle, and it was a great experience, great entertainment all around, rooms are very clean, will definitely be staying their again

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous castle for a great trip”
Reviews.Author: Steph_Craig40
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur for 2 weeks (30th March- 13th April), we arrived in Vegas from the UK after over 24 hours of travel for us, the check in was quick and efficient, we were asked if we wanted a smoking room (as my boyfriend smokes we said yes), they then told us that would mean we would be on the first 2 floors as wew weren't bothered we said it was fine. We paid the room rate (which worked out at £66 each) and they handed us the keys. The room was lovely, much bigger than we had anticipated, we had a kingsize bed, a huge TV, a sofa, a desk with chair, and a more than resonable sized bathroom (shower only), and we had a hairdryer which is a plus for me and the furniture was well spaced so plenty of room and we had air conditioning and we had an electronic safe with no extra cost. We could see the pool from our window but when the window was shut you could hardly hear the music, which ended at half 5 everyday and began at 10 and never woke us up. Room service was excellent, it was cleaned every day and clean towels were given if we left the ones on the floor we wanted replacing. All the staff in the casino and hotel were friendly, and we even ate at the camelot steak house which was delicious and great service, and we went to the tournament of kings dinner and show which was amazingly good fun with an fantastic atmosphere The hotel has great shops and a 24 hour shop so you never have to go without those essentials, the location isn't the best if you want to be central but there is loads going on the end of the strip too and the walkways between the Excalibur- Luxor and Mandalay Bay means that if you don't feel like going into the outside you can get between three hotels. \we loved every second and were sad to leave (check out was just as efficient as checking in) we hope to return and wouldn't rule out staying at the Excalibur, this was our 3rd time in Vegas but 1st at th Excalibur

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: llucio35
Reviews.Content: We had a great time hotel was clean, pool was awsome , casino was great lounge was nice we are even coming back this june 2011 !!!!! We love the excalibur..

Reviews.Title: “Many thanks!!”
Reviews.Author: rsalas2
Reviews.Content: I love Excalibur, my kids always have a blast. This time I paid for my mom and sister's room visiting us during Christmas and thank you so much for treating them like queens. We are going to stay during summer because my kids like it so much, specially the pool and arcade. We have seen your Tournament of Kings show and we loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor management, dated property”
Reviews.Author: chilopoda2
Reviews.Content: The Excalibur is very reasonably priced and the location is great, but the hotel itself is kind of gritty. The room was basic and smelled from cigarette smoke, the casino is dated, and the worst part of the experience was dealing with the long queues at the front-desk. I waited over 40 minutes in a chaotic line (very disorganized) just to get my receipt and check-out (on a Monday). I have never experienced such an inefficient system in all of my travels! I wasted a lot of my vacation time standing around in the lobby when I could have been outside on the strip having fun. On the bright side, the resort is very exciting on the weekend and the gym was quite nice (good views of the Luxor pyramid).

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur is my Vegas Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: VegasLove2011
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic! Great place, awesome food both fast food(mcdys, pizza hut and krispy kreme) and sit down resturants as well. Everyone must go to Dicks last resort! Very fun place, and the waitstaff are hilarious!!! :) great location, close to bus routes and shopping too! You dont want to miss out on such a great hotel...book now!! And remember what happens in Vegas.... Stays on TripAdvisor :)

Reviews.Title: “Mom got married we had a big group!”
Reviews.Author: tinkerbella0630
Reviews.Content: Everything was well the only complaint was the people that sold the tickets for the shows had a issue with them but overall a great hotel and would come back and send friends and family here too! Ps the shows are awesome there and so is DICKS!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay!!”
Reviews.Author: CindyandTim
Reviews.Content: We got upgraded to Widescreen and the room was nice- check in was friendly and quick. Ate at the Camelot steakhouse and the food and service awesome. The buffet was good too. Pool was nice only complaint was not all the pools were open. Casino was fun and drink girls were fast and friendly. Only complaint not with the hotel but Grandview people trying to give you a free gift or stay if you go on the tour/presentation. We did it but there are so many they keep asking you over and over.....

Reviews.Title: “Loved the castle.....”
Reviews.Author: Matt_SanJose
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Excalibur and plan to go back again this October. The service was great, the room was clean and the price was quite reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, NIce Rooms”
Reviews.Author: gkeim
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here as part of a family trip to the US. We really enjoyed this hotel. The kids loved the fact that it was a 'castle'. We had a widescreen view room. The view was certainly fantastic and the room was a good size and quite new and modern. We were in a great location, just a short walk across the bridge to New York New York or MGM Grand and a monorail ride to Luxor. Only a short walk to the strip. The kids loved the pool area and I couldn't get them off the waterslide however it would have been better if it had stayed open a bit later as by the time we got back to the hotel from a day of sightseeing it was almost time to close and the kids were disappointed. A fridge would have been nice but we were content to go to the food hall for breakfast. Check-in/out was fast and efficient. The only thing I didn't like was that we had to take the kids through an extremely smoke filled area every time we went up to our room but we are used to more strict smoking laws in Australia. Otherwise I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: oldtoughnut
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights at the excalibur while attending a sign show. The room was very clean, no bedbugs as some reviewers have said. I do not mind having only a shower, but really missed having coffee available in the room. The food court was a great place to grab a quick meal. The resturant had great breakfasts at a reasonable price. (closed in the evening) The Luxsor had a good resturant for the evening time. I booked through Expedia so it was VERY reasonably priced. i plan on staying at the REcalibur next time I go to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Value for the relative cost, no more, no less”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Weston
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a night flight at 11 p.m. and had booked the Excalibur because it was approximately $200 less for the night than the Palazo, where we were staying the next three nights. Since we were only there to sleep the first night, we did not want to spend the extra $200 on a room at the Palazo. Check in at 11 pm was extremely quick. The attendant was friendly and, without our asking, gave us a 6th floor room with one of the best views we have ever had in Vegas. When we arrived on the 6th floor, we noticed that the smell of air freshener was as strong as it was downstairs. Unfortunately, it did not follow us into the room: the room had a decidedly unpleasant odour which both of us noticed. However, we were exhausted and did not want to change rooms, so we decided that we could tolerate the smell for one night. The room was large and clean. The furniture and furnishings were utilitarian and unbeautiful (not a real word, I know, but it gets its meaning across). We paid extra for a wide screen television. The bed was neither especially comfortable or uncomfortable (actually comparable to that at the Palazo). We found no bedbugs (we check everywhere: we bring a flashlight with us). The bathroom had a shower only. Note: we got taken by the taxi driver. He took us from the airport through the tunnel, onto the highway, and around the back of the Excalibur: the fare was $25, $10 more than we paid from the Palazo back to the airport, which is considerably farther away. Tell the driver you do not want the tunnel (this is not in any way the fault of the hotel, of course, but it's the best tip I can give). Other than the unpleasant odour in the room, the Excalibur offered relatively good value for the money: the room was by no means luxurious, but neither was it $270 a night.

Reviews.Title: “run away from here... nasty place”
Reviews.Author: piximuse
Reviews.Content: How bad can we say? Let me count the ways…. Over priced… upgraded rooms in tower II? Where ? I paid for and I so did not get… I dare not ask what the standard room is.. The furniture was old scratched and dated… moths flying about the room… on casino level that overlooked the sidewalk so people could look in. Nasty crusty sink faucet…. The food was terrible. Buffet changed prices on Sat morning and was worse than it was on Friday. Top that with wait staff that wiped down tables with a nasty rag with no disinfectant then set the table by grabbing silverware by the tines of forks and such… Listed as kid friendly properties,,, how? The music fights between bars and the sleaze shaking their crap on the bars as you pass thru the casino (since you can’t go anywhere without passing thru there) and the trolls jumping you every 5 paces to sell their shows and crap come on I used to come here when Vegas was fun… Now it’s nothing but crap in that hotel. Take your money and go somewhere else…. With some class… And NO ROOM SERVICE… ok lets be fair you can order room service from 6 am to 2 pm…. But when it really counts and you want food forget it …. Then we have the security that is suppose to halt issues in the room wings…. Last I saw that was a man on a bike in the hotel at the desk yucking it up with other guards and ppl kicking on doors all night…. And of course the 2 am kicks to the door next to ours for over an hour… I opened our door and saw a group of men kicking the door next to us… Needless to say I packed and got the hell out and you should do the same…. I was there last weekend for a wedding and stayed where they put others…. Agreed to stay here huge mistake. Now I drink and I like to have fun but… if you recall the movie with chevy chase vegas vacation. Well let me tell you… the Griswalds must have stayed here as there were people walking around with the bubba kegs of booze. Or walk around coolers. Come on… if your 21 -25 and like stupidity this is your place…. If you have some iota of class in you take your money and don’t stay here go to mgm or Tropicana or anywhere but this place. Luxor was so not better… same property owners and just as much trash… With this said bring your mini black light bed check thingy and see what is where you will sleep … trust me if you stay at excel you will puke if you see that luminess .. Get out of this hotel. They don’t train their staff and you are harassed constantly RUNNNNNNNNNNNN

Reviews.Title: “Good Cheaper Option, Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_Travel_Writer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur in March 2011 having booked our room online a few weeks before. We used the airport shuttle to get to our hotel and it dropped us off at the very rear of the hotel, leaving us without a clue where to go. There were no bell desk at this entrance and no signage on how to get to reception - also no lugguage trolleys! We had to struggle our way through the endless rows of gambling machines and various twists and turns with all our lugguage before we finally found the reception desk. Not much fun after 26 hours in transit! Just as we were making the final few steps to the reception desk, we were intercepted by a lady in a black suit, asking us if we were checking in. She then guided us to another desk a few hundred meters away, with us behind her, carrying all our lugguage. This was NOT the reception staff, but promotional staff who tries to sell you all kinds of stuff such as shows etc. Look, I understand you have a job to do, but hey, let us check in first or at least, get a trolley for our lugguage. Needless to say, as soon as I realised what she was doing, I cut her short and made my way to the "real" reception desk, where we had to queue up to book in. Still, no one offered us a lugguage trolley, so hubby decided to leave me standing with the lugguage while he hunts one down for us - in the process, he finally discovered the bell desk and our lugguage was taken care of. I must say, the bell staff is very friendly! From here on, our stay was smooth and pleasant. The room had a view over the side street next to NYNY and a glimpse of the strip, which was nice. The room was spacious and clean, but have not been dusted in a while - maybe it has not been used for some time. The bathroom had granite tops and a huge shower with plenty, huge, fluffy towels. The decor in the hotel is very authentic and even the outside looks like a real medieval castle! It is well located on the strip with easy transport options to the rest of the strip. We had the buffet on the day of our arrival and it was not much to get excited about. Everything was various colours of orange and yellow with loads of cheese and very fatty - not many options for fresh stuff such as veggies, salads or fruit. We booked tickets to the Tournament of the Kings. Although this was somewhat entertaining, it is not a "must see" in my opinion. They fit a few hundred people into rows around the arena and everyone is served the exact same very basic meal. We ordered drinks as we sat down (once we managed to get a waiter's attention) - the drinks never came the entire evening, even after we asked the waiter who brought our food, to please check on our drinks. Thank goodness for the glass of coke everyone got with their food! The free internet is not wifi, but dial up through a cable in your room which you have to connect to a laptop. Not much use for an iPhone... Seeing as we could not use the internet, we basically paid the $13 per day resort fee for nothing, as none of the other free stuff is something you would want (such as a free newspaper...). I feel they should scrap the resort fee and just charge for the rooms, like some other hotels on the strip have started to do. All in all, I would stay at this hotel again, but would prefer the NYNY, where we stayed two nights on our return from a road trip through Arizona. This is a very good cheaper option and excellent value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Had a GREAT time, you will too!!!”
Reviews.Author: ajmtx2000
Reviews.Content: I know that there is a plethera of bad reviews about the Excalibur hotel, but you need to take them all with a grain of salt! First of all there is NO better deal for a hotel on the strip than the Excalibur Hotel! You will NOT find any other property ON the strip for less!! I was visiting my second time in Vegas and yes, second time staying at the Exxcalibur for my Birthday! A couple of things to mention.....Yes, check in isn't until 3pm BUT do you know you can start inquiring about an available room as early as 2pm?!! Yes, this is true!! I was in line by 12pm and was given a room key no problem!! I STONGLY recommend that you don't wait until 3pm to get in line to check in, the lines are AWFUL! Also, BE NICE!!! When you check in ask for a room with a strip view or a plain old upgrade if it is available!! I will tell you the first time I came to stay here I got an upgrade to a room on the strip at the end of the hall with a Jacuzzi in it!!! And I paid for only a standard $40 dollars a night room!! This last time I went the lady that checked me in showed me a list of "upgrades" available to me at an EXTRA charge, and I told her I really wanted a room on an upper floor with a view. Guess what she gave it to me with NO CHARGE! I was just nice to her and I got the free upgrade! We stayed for 4 nights so we were very happy about this. The staff at the M Life desk was very helpful and nice you get $10 dollar in free play if you sign up so do it!! By the day we left we got free meals and money off our room bill and we are NOT highrollers! The buffet at the Excalibur is awesome, much better than the Luxor we went there for dinner one night it was awful! And the buffet is a great deal too! Back to the rooms, they are clean but nothing fancy, which is fine because who goes to Vegas to sit in thier room??! We had fresh towels, sheet and soaps every day!!! Our cleaning lady was very nice and she always greeted us every morning in the hallway. The casino is a bit smokey, but you will find that this is the case for most of the properties. One last nugget, the time share people that stalk you are VERY annoying, I will give you that, BUT they will recognize you after you already tell them no. We noticed that they would look at us recognize us and not bother us any more. All in all, don't cancel your reservation, go and have a great time!! Remember that a little kindness goes a long way!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to stay without any frills”
Reviews.Author: hr1313
Reviews.Content: Couldn't beat the price on the strip-- the rooms were basically clean, but spit and polish type of clean. Dust and garbage behind furniture. Sound was ok with others in hall and overall activity. Pool area was nice for adults and kids. Staff just ok, conceirge could seem to care less to help and the staff in the arcade (Fun Dunegeon) was less than helpful and usually hard to find. Bartender at the Last Dick's was cool and funny. Appropriate as well with teenager in tow to watch a sports event. Buffet is betty basic buffet again without a lot of staff attention. Food Court is great for a snack or quick bite. Forgot how far Excalibur is from center strip---walking was ok, but 30 minutes to get to Caesear's area. Taking a taxi was challenging from here- because the taxi had to go down to go up strip adding some cost to the ride. Bus access across street at Tropicana and station a MGM was convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but no extras!”
Reviews.Author: FolsomBill
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 04/24/11 to 04/27/11 on a promo package deal. Package price was great thru SouthWest Airlines but the room was just average. Bathroom with a hair dryer and that was it. Beds were comfortable and the room did have a nice new wide screen tv. The Tournament of Kings show at the hotel was alot of fun but you have to be willing to eat your meal with no utensils. ****DO NOT GIVE THEM YOUR EMAIL ADDRESS AT CHECKIN OR MEMBER SERVICES!!**** I have had the same email address for 20 years and never had a spaming problem. 24 hrs. after I gave them my email address it was being used to spam everyone on my contact list. When I confronted the hotel they stated they did not give out customers email addresses. Kinda of funny that when I had them remove my email address from their files the spamming stopped. Hummmm!!!

Reviews.Title: “Spend the extra and go next door”
Reviews.Author: beckyboo123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Lux last year and was impressed with the hotel, knowing this is owned by same people and thinking it was a bit cheaper we would try it. The rooms at this hotel are the only thing good about it. they were big, and spacious and the bed was very comfy. How ever the maid did not know how to clean. Our first night we laid in bed and ondered why the light shade was glowing. Being too tired we waited till morning where we found a glow stick left by the preivious occupants. The pool is smaller than lux and no where near as nice and teh casino its self is second rate. The resurant is cheaper than 'more buffet' by $5 so yes you expect the setting to be a little less grand and to get your own drinks. But the quality and quantity of the food is appaling. We ate pizza and that was it. In all just pay the extra and stay in the Lux

Reviews.Title: “Great, cheap, right on the strip”
Reviews.Author: jmasc1
Reviews.Content: My dad & I were in California/Arizona visiting family/sight-seeing and we had a few extra days at the end of a 2 week trip. Decided to make the four hr drive to Las Vegas & booked this room over the phone via Priceline (super cheap) on the way there. I'm grown, but I was as giddy as the next girl about staying in a castle. (I couldn't help it; I just thought it looked really fun on the outside.) Comfortable beds, huge bathroom. The downstairs is dated, as the others have said, but we don't gamble anyway. We were right on the strip and that was cool for the 2 days we stayed in NV. We spent our time walking around, exploring the casinos, shopping, taking in shows, and went to the Hoover Dam. For us, it was perfect. (I believe this was the one with an arcade downstairs for the kids.)

Reviews.Title: “Great room, hotel is dated, smoke-filled casino”
Reviews.Author: majjones74
Reviews.Content: Upgraded to a better room without asking for the upgrade (Tower II without the strip view). Room was recently renovated -- flat screen TV, new furniture, carpet and tile. Room was comfortable and roomy for two adults. Hotel is at one end of the Vegas strip. Very close to the airport but no airport noise. Expect to walk but during April the weather was very pleasant -- mid 70's. The only negative is the smoky casino area. It reminded me of another era when smoking was more prevalent.

Reviews.Title: “super cheap and it shows”
Reviews.Author: kpbs68
Reviews.Content: I have two nice things to say about this hotel, the beds are super comfy and the desk staff try to be helpful. Now on to what sucks about the place: 1) the cleaning staff either aren't trained well or there are not enough of them to keep up,2) the cocktail waitress's are almost non-exsistant,3) don't use the internet kiosks they freeze up and there goes your money and you can't get done what you need to, 4) the steakhouse serves cold food at very high prices and they don't care if you don't like it, 5) 90% of the machines are either breaking down or in the process of repair, and they won't take 5 dollar bill's at all. and 6)the ice machines don't work properly in tower 1. If all you intend to do is sleep in the room the bed is very comfy, but don't bet on any thing else being that way. I must say the machines in the casino pay rather nicely when you do hit on them. We won't stay with this hotel again unless we get some kind of screaming deal from them to come back. Like a free room and meals for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Our 40th Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Alanhmccoysr
Reviews.Content: Stayed from 04/04-04/08/2011, had a great time everyone was helpful at hotel, room service was great, room was very clean, resturants were very good and the price was very good did not break the bank. We did come back with money and brought back some gifts for the grand children. Will be returning, booking through SouthWest.

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay there again”
Reviews.Author: kkkkb
Reviews.Content: I booked the Excalibur for the fact that it is advertised as a family friendly hotel. First off I wasn't very happy with how far away the parking, once you enter the hotel you have to walk from one end of the hotel to the other to check in.Then much further to the elevators to get to your room. Oh and only half of the elevators work so there were long waits and crowding. When we got to our room we went ot get ice and found the ice bucket had black sludge in the bottom, so decided to use one of our own bags only to find the ice machine made lots of noise but no ice (had to find one on anothe floor). The next day my 10 yr old daughter was asking why someone had left Tylenol on the floor next to the bed and when we looked it was a box and empty packages of condoms, Yuck! We took them to the front desk and the manager at the time apologized and said she would remove a few days of resort fees. The next day after I showered I was drying myself and there was a nasty smell, I looked at the towel and it had horrible brown streaks on it and smelt like hell.Yuck again! When we checked out a few days later The resort fees were not removed so I spoke to a different manager and told her the story and she said they would never remove resort fees and how were they to know if we had not done any of the stuff ourselves. After discussion she removed the fees but we were not happy and I would not recommend staying at this hotel. I have never come across such nastiness anywhere that I have stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: deightons
Reviews.Content: The rooms were good and always clean. All the staff we met we very helpful. Only down side were the people trying to sell you timeshare they would try and get you every time you walked into the casino. The Tournament of Kings was an unbelievable experience very good entertainment a must see

Reviews.Title: “Don't Believe the Hype!!!”
Reviews.Author: razzmatazz71
Reviews.Content: So I came all the way from Washington State for my 40th birthday. I dealt with a buffet that had increased by $10 and was nothing to rave about. I also dealt with the fact that the Elevators were not working properly (ran down the stairs from the 13th floor with a nice English family running down from the 17th floor. No Joke), and the halls were not kept clean. It was not the hotel I stayed in three years ago, and I do not look forward to coming back. Did I forget to mention that the air conditioner sounded like a jackhammer all night, and my BFF just HAD to sleep with it on. It was the lousiest sleep I ever had, and the worst hotel. I think that the first time, I was just to focused on Las Vegas itself to worry about it. Next time, I think I wlll get a separate room. This would be at the Tropicana or the Gold Nugget; both of which took steps to use the exorbanent amounts of profit to finally make their hotels comfortable for their custormers. With the Excalibur having money coming out the ears, I frankly was appauled at the condition of the hotel and the condition of the rooms. Oh, and one more thing....the electrical outlets were scary and some outlet covers were cracked or broken. How much does it cost to fix those, $5??? Welll, I am sorry to have to break it to you but I am not recommending the Excalibur to ANYONE. Respectfully yours, T

Reviews.Title: “Amazing would definatley go back”
Reviews.Author: cindyhasan
Reviews.Content: Excalibur hotel was perfect for our holiday. Bedrooms very clean. Location perfect. Staff very nice and polite. Food hall offers great choice. Buffet well worth a visit. Casino brilliant. Shops in hotel have lots of choice and affordable. All in all a great place to stay whether a couple or a family or with friends. Pool are clean and lots of room with free towels.

Reviews.Title: “There's everythibg you need in the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: steph_young
Reviews.Content: I loved myt stay at the Excalibur. I didn't have to leave the hotel for a thing. There was many different restaurants inside as well as many different places to shop from convienent stores to nice clothing stores and jewlery stores. It had it all. The pool area was vey nice with different bars, restruants, and souviner stands right at the pool the casino is one of the best casinos inside a hotel in vegas and their is also a great arcade room for children to teens. It also has a nice spa. The hotel along with the rooms are very nice and clean, and the service was grear. The only things I didn't like in the hotel was there is no shows you can see on sight. You have to go to a different hotel to see any shows and there are bars in the hotel but their is no nightclub. And also the rooms arw very nice' clean' and spacious but there are no kitchens in any of the rooms, not even a mini fridge. That is the only thing I did not like about the rooms. Which of course in vegas you don't spend much time in your room but you still do not want to have to travel out to get a cold drink so atleast a mini fridge would jave been nice. But overall I had a great stay at the excalibur and the rooms had a great rate. I would definetly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice big room for the money!”
Reviews.Author: Jayinpdx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Excalibur for 3 nights for $30 a night and it was one of the best rooms for that price I have ever stayed in! The bed was comfy with soft sheets, the room had a flat screen tv, a couch and a table and chairs to eat at. No coffee maker in the room, but you won't get one anywhere in Vegas for this cheap! I thought this hotel might be pretty crappy - but it was just fine! The timeshare people get really annoying (we walked past them on the way to the elevators) but we'd just say "already did it" and keep walking. Would I stay here again - yes, if I needed a room to crash on the strip. Would I take my girlfriend here on a romantic getaway - no. But it's a good room for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Second Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Mytwingirls
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a good place to stay but when we go back to Vegas we will stay near the middle of the Strip. We either had to walk or take a cab everywhere. The price of the hotel was ok and the place was clean and staff was friendly. Wish there was a bathtub in the bathroom but we could live without that. Only thing i didn't like was all the soliciting at the entrances trying to get you to try the time shares. We walked by the same person 4 times in an hour and told them "NO" everytime...Not sure I would stay at this hotel again but only because of its location.

Reviews.Title: “Fun family vacation”
Reviews.Author: Susiemac66
Reviews.Content: Our family was pleasantly surprised. After reading all the awful reviews we expected the worst but, since staying with our kids for first time I. Vegas they said this was the hotel to be it and they were only right about that. 1. Hotel smoke smell was not bad. it's Vegas people do smoke here but, it wasn't unbearably or thick. They do a pretty good job of airing it out and keeping the smells down. 2. Kids arcade was one of the cleanest we saw and very well ventilated unlike disgusting circus circus that we visited on our trip. 3. Rooms were fine and clean. We stayed in a flat screen room and it wasn't luxiourious but for the price you can't complain. 4. Pool area was fun the kids plentynof spots to sit. Food and drinks were good. 5. All employees were very courteous and helpful. 6. Check in desk was close didn't have to walk far. It was the easiest casino to get around in. We had a pleasant experience and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok”
Reviews.Author: pagiepage
Reviews.Content: So my sister and I stayed at the excalibur from april 7 to 11th. This was both of our first time to vegas and we had many things we wanted to see and do so we picked this hotel for the price.Check in was fast and same for check out. I didnt find the room or the casino overly smoky but the casino decor and service is not very good. It took forever to get a drink when we were playing roulette. The drink usually came back wrong as well. We definetly rather gambling at other hotels. mandalay bay was great and really close. The room was clean and believe me I checked everything after reading some of the reviews on here. The beds were very comfortable as well. We had a terrible view of a concrete wall but we didnt really care. If you want a veiw of the strip get in tower two. The buffet is bad bad bad. Plenty of other options in other hotels. We did have a bad experience with a bartender there, an older gentelman who clearly hated his job and was very rude to us. Other than that it was fine for what we wanted to do in vegas which was explore everything.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but scams galore”
Reviews.Author: happyface369
Reviews.Content: Went to Excalibur April 12 to the 19th. Was charged a "Daily Resort Fee" not mentioned in our package. Cost on Excaliber's site is $11.95 per day and in real life was $14.00 and change. This fee covers a newspaper that you have to chase. No..it's not delivered to your room. It also includes telephone use (the snooty operators have to dial the numbers AFTER you hear an abnormally loud advertisement) and incoming faxes (when was the last time you recieved faxes on your vacation?) Also it covers the exercise room that you'll never use because there is so much walking involved on this trip. Besides that scam, you get attacked by people in the lobby that want you to tour a property and then if you dont want to buy it, they don't want to bring you back and they continually delay. They catch you every time you leave your room. Also, had to beg for a room with a safe. Not all of them have it. Was given a room as far away from the elevator as you could get, that will teach me to ask for extras. On a good note....the room was clean. It had several bulbs burnt out but the maid fixed them right away. The first night there the sheets smelled like B.O. but the maid changed them on request. No separate shampoo and conditioner samples...they give you the mixed ones. No bed bugs found. Carpet overall was clean. Room nicely decorated but in dark dingy colors (browns, grays, etc.). Had nice view of the Luxor side of the strip. One of the 5 pools out of commission. All the pools are only 3-1/2 feet deep. Pools were much smaller than expected. Waterfall on big pool not running and only 1 of 2 waterslides working. Life gaurd was sleeping when I asked her a question. Business center expensive...$5 for 10 minutes to print your boarding passes. Then airport printed them for you anyways. $1.00 to print a page.

Reviews.Title: “THE EXCALIBUR IS PHENOMENAL!!!”
Reviews.Author: georgie_1988
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week at the start of November and could not fault the hotel at all!! The rooms were spacious and clean with an awesome view of the MGM at night!!! The casino is probably one of the best we visited while there and the food court has soooo much on offer!! The location is terrific as it is just a short walk to the centre of the strip plus you can just walk straight through to the Luxor which has brilliant shows (go see Criss Angel!!) and to New York New York. The spa was unbelieveable value for money and I spent many a night getting pampered in there before hitting the town while my boyfriend played poker. Overall, the Excalibur is just out of this world, Vegas is out of this world!! I will most definately be going back and when I do there is no doubt I will be staying back at the Excalibur!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay and play!”
Reviews.Author: mk08dalejr
Reviews.Content: I just got back from another great stay at Excalibur! We stayed five nights in a widescreen room with a view of the pool in tower 2. Our room was clean top to bottom and was kept up by great housekeepers all 5days! The check-in, check-out and Mlife staff all treated us like valued guests! The casino was not as smokey as others have said. Yes, did get kind of bad Friday and Saturday night but it was no where as bad as I have seen at other casinos. We enjoyed several meals in the food court, including the $25 dollar buffett all day on Monday. Great, fresh food with a wide variety of choices! Very nice! Also had the pleasure of eating at Dick's one night and we had such a blast!!! Overall, you can't go wrong by staying at Excalibur! Can't wait to the next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms for the money.”
Reviews.Author: mamajocham
Reviews.Content: My husband and I found our stay at Excalibur very nice while visiting in March of 2011. We did not do any room upgrades and found that our standard had wonderful beds to lay our tired bodies down on. We were both extremely pleased. We had wonderful service throughout our stay and we were very happy with the service at the MLife rewards area. The food at the buffet was not something we cared for at all, but we found some of the other restaurants to be satisfactory. We had stayed at the Excalibur many years ago and found it nicer than before.

Reviews.Title: “The Excalibur hotel/casino is the BEST place in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: lisakabela
Reviews.Content: my husband and i go to las vegas at least once a year. of course we've seen all the hotels/casinos in the area (strip & downtown). we stay at the Excalibur every time we go. we absolutely LOVE this place. it is extremely clean, good food, not to crowded, very safe. we only play slots, and have an excellent time playing. we usually break even! we would recommend the Excalibur to anyone, and have also shared our wonderful experience with our friends. i look forward to our trip every time, and can't wait to go back. i call it "my home away from home!" our last stay was in january 2010. our first time ever to las vegas, was for our honeymoom--which is in january, so we go there for sure every year for our anniversary, and any other time we get a chance.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: craigct1977
Reviews.Content: The price is great for a per night stay. We stayed during the week and the rooms were only $35 a night. You do pay an additional resort fee upon check in but with it you get free internet, free long distance, morning paper. I have stayed here before and have tried other resorts on the strip but Excalibur is the best for the money and location. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - Basic room fine but no frills, Widescreen rooms are worth the upgrade”
Reviews.Author: LisaM81
Reviews.Content: Went to Vegas March 16-21, 2011 and traveled with a friend. We were also meeting two other groups of my friends out there. We settled on Excalibur because another of my friends had a comped room there and was able to get us a discounted deal, which was nice since room prices skyrocket around this time due to spring break and March Madness. Excalibur was also conveniently located since we would be attending a wedding at the Luxor and going to the Bon Jovi concert at MGM Grand. Check in was busy but the line moved quickly and the check in process went smoothly. If you don't already know, be forewarned that there is a $14 per night resort fee tacked on to the quoted room rate. The resort fee gives you fitness center acess and internet usage. I was aware of the resort fee, so it didn't bother me but I have heard complaints from others. We were in a Tower I room and had requested a safe in the room. Apparently they have safes in the rooms only below the 16th floor in Tower I, so we ended up on the 7th floor with a view of a brick wall. Not a big deal since the safe was more important to us than the view. The room itself was clean and comfortable, but was showing signs of wear and tear - dents and dings in the walls, the shower probably needed to be regrouted, etc. The tv was a flat screen, which was nice, and the bathroom and room were both spacious which was also nice. My friends with the comped room ended up staying in Tower II and I visited their room, which was very nice - everything new, very clean looking, and in good condition. The tv was a large flatscreen, the furniture was dark wood and the bedding was crisp and light colored. The bathroom had granite countertops and they also had a safe in their room. If I were to do it again, I would probably pay the extra $20 per night to stay in the widescreen room as it seemed to be a fairly significant upgrade for only $20 more. Unfortunately it was too cold to use the pools while we were there, but the pool area did look nice. The internet is through a cable rather than being wireless, but it worked perfectly fine - I plugged it into my netbook and used it to order some show tickets. We ate at Sherwood Forest Cafe and Dick's Last Resort - the food was fine but not spectacular at both places. The 24/7 shop on the 2nd floor was great for getting snacks and drinks when necessary. Pros: location - at the south end of the strip near Tropicana, Mandalay Bay, the Luxor, MGM Grand, and NYNY since we were attending a wedding at Luxor and a concert at MGM Grand, it was the perfect location. It's also close to the airport, so getting to and from was very easy. cab line - always short and quick moving compared with the cab lines at many of the other large casinos value - consistently one of the least expensive hotels on the strip and if you upgrade to the widescreen room, you get a nice, renovated room without breaking the bank Cons: the timeshare sales people - they are annoying, but just ignore them and keep walking.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: monette04032009
Reviews.Content: On I got married on NYE and took the whole family to Las Vegas and we had a fabulous time. Our rooms were nice and clean, the room service was fabulous. The workers were friendly and professional. This hotel is even prettier in person. The atmosphere in the Excalibur, smokey yes...but it's a great place to just let loose. On the weekends, I would recommend kids in the lobby due to the PIT, but I will definetly stay there again. Tower 2 though! The chapel is the best in Vegas and I was glad I made the decision to stay there! The Excalibur holds special place in my heart now!

Reviews.Title: “I love the experience of being myself!”
Reviews.Author: SamLam3485
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at Excalibur Hotel & Casino. I love this Hotel for the reason that it is a very friendly, laided back enviroment and it gives you the experience of being back in the midevil times. This is also a kid friendly hotel. I personally do not have children, but even with it being kid friendly, you don't find them running around the casino, which is very nice. They have their own arcade downstairs apart from the casino. They have a good selection of resturants in the hotel, sit down and quick and grab. Visit Dick's! It's SO MUCH FUN! The pools are amazing, They have 4 pools, and one is 18 yr old + which is so nice and relaxing! I really do not have anything negative to say about my stay at this hotel. I have enjoy both times I have stayed there, and plan to stay there the next time I go to Vegas which will be within the year.

Reviews.Title: “Pay attention to room descriptions!”
Reviews.Author: jean_likes_maine
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur twice in one week. The first time we had an excellent room on the 17th floor with a great view of the mountains and the roller coaster at NY NY. The room was clean and comfortable. That was a 'widescreen view room'. The second stay we got a 'widescreen tower room' and had an excellent view of a concrete wall. The renovated rooms were clean and smoke-free which was good for us.

Reviews.Title: “It was good for the price.”
Reviews.Author: kizzum
Reviews.Content: I just want to say the Excalibur hotel was very nice to my sister and I...we stayed April 5th to the 10th 2011...the hotel is very live and exciting...when we got our room in tower 1...it was ok...we wanted non-smoking but the room smelled like smoke...you can't blame the hotel people are just pigs...I must say the room was regular and there was a flat screened t.v....the only thing was the blankets were dirty...I'm not sure who to blame for that...well after returning from an all day super grand canyon tour our bathroom sink was was clogged with this black smelly stuff..I was kind of skeptical to call the front desk because I read some bad reviews about that...but I tell you none of that happened to me they were very nice and courteous and very accommodating...They made our stay very nice and I would definitely return to this hotel if in Vegas...just in tower2...oh that's where they transferred us to...good job Excalibur!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: JennyH_42
Reviews.Content: I was really worried about staying here after reading some of the reviews but having spent a week here in April with 3 friends we had a brilliant time. The hotel is in a great location, right by New York, New York and MGM, Luxor and Mandalay Bay. It's on the strip and easily linked to the other hotels. We upgraded on arrival for $10 per person per night to a Tower 2 room, which was large, comfy queen beds and a smart bathroom. The room was cleaned daily. There are lots of facilities in the hotel and although it is a bit dated compared to some of the others we had a brilliant time. There are 4 pool areas and plenty of sun loungers. All in all, this was brilliant value, great location and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “The Excalibur was a great base for LV.”
Reviews.Author: BCH_10
Reviews.Content: Not long back from a week in Las Vegas and I thought The Excalibur was excellent. We were checked in really quickly and the lady that helped us was very friendly and made us most welcome. We had a refubished room in Tower 2. The lifts were easily found at the back of the casino on the way to the pool. Our room had a great view toward the mountains and looked over the pool. The room was modern with two big double beds, 42 inch flatscreen tv, 2 plush chairs and some nice lamps etc. The bathroom was black marble and really big, couldn't fault it at all. In terms of the service we recieved all the staff were really good and very friendly. We ate only at the snack places there, including twice at the Mexican place Baja Fresh. The portions were massive and really tasty. Cheap too. There's easy access via travelator to The Luxor and outisde and across the sky bridge to NY/NY, MGM and Tropicana (loved the Tropicana, definitely worth a visit). Good tip is to use the Deuce, the 24 hour bus that goes up and down the strip $7 for 24 hours is good value and we never waited more than 5 minutes for one, usually there would be one along straight away. It beats walking in the baking heat especially if you have somewhere to go and have walked the strip before. In terms of gambling, the casinos are all pretty much the same although they have a different ambience and clientele. A fun new addition for me this time was the organic roulette which is a real wheel but you lay your bets on a computer screen. Also the similar set up but with a person spinning the wheel. Almost all of the casinos are really laid back, with no dress code and patient staff if you're not too sure what to do. We visited the Mob Experience at The Tropicana which is really good fun. I wont say too much as don't want to spoil it for anyone, but there's lots of real characters to meet and jobs to be done! Worth a visit. Something else worth making the effort for is Hash House A Go Go at Imperial Palace. It's a special hash brown reastuarant but serves a lot more. Food is delivered in comedy proportions, served in a ginat frying pan. Buffets to try: The Bellagio (out of this world), Spice Market (Planet Hollywood), Cravings (Mirage), Treasure Island, More (The Luxor).

Reviews.Title: “Had a blast”
Reviews.Author: AndreaMcRae
Reviews.Content: We stayd at Excalibur for 4 nights and 5 days. The hotel is in a great location on the strip, with lots of extra fun nearby. Ate twice at Baja fresh, awesome prices and great food, loved it. Loved having a dj at the pool and they played awesome music. I just wish that the pools/hot tubs were open later. All the staff were friendly and helpful. Best sleep ever in the super comfortable beds, room was super clean and smelled great.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, Bad, and Ugly”
Reviews.Author: Jonezy5555
Reviews.Content: Front Desk: Very friendly personnel. They were very efficient and got us our rooms quickly. Rooms: Very inexpensive. The rooms are great. They are just as good as the fancy hotels. Very modern. 42 inch TVs. Nice modern bathrooms as well. Safe for keeping valubles. Thermostat worked well, so we could keep comfortable. Casino: Very lively. One area with rock music and go-go dancers. Great lounge for watching the Final Four games. One giant projection screen and a few large plasmas. Food: We went to the evening buffet for $19.99. Everything was terrible. I was particularly disappointed that they had the crappy peel and eat shrimp. The coffee shop was bad as well. Terrible service along with mediocre food. Baja Fresh food was really good. We were going to eat at Dick's Last Resort, but then we took a look at the menu. $14.75 for a chicken tender dinner. Yikes! Better off hitting the McDonald's there for some chicken nuggets. Liked the little coffee vendor near Tower 2. The little shop near tower 2 came in handy for drinks and other goodies. Nightclub: None. They really should convert the "Fun Dungeon" which has carnival games, into a nightclub. I am sure they could keep a lot of people in the place at night, if they had a club.

Reviews.Title: “Seems like such a "magical" place, but it's a nightmare.”
Reviews.Author: MexguyUSA26
Reviews.Content: I had always wanted to stay at the Excalibur, ever since I was a little kid, because it seemed like a magical and cool place; the honest truth is, this place sucks. It isn't even that old (built in the late 1980s, I think), but the place is so run down that once you enter the premises, you feel like you're going back in time to a casino in the 1960s or 1970s. I guess they are trying so hard to give you that "medieval", "old" look that they have totally given up on maintaining the place decently looking. The rooms are a joke, the decorations are stupid and, in my case, did not get a "welcoming" vibe at all and didn't feel comfortable in my own room. I know it's a cheap hotel and I get what I pay for and but the people should at least try a little bit harder to make you feel welcomed. Yes, the majority of guests here are young, broke college students and most employees may be sick of them and don't try as hard to be pleasant but we're not all rowdy, dumb kids. The only thing worth a good review is the casino; it's spacious, has all the cool medieval theme going on and if you feel like having a good time, you will actually have it here.

Reviews.Title: “We now call it the "Low-Calibur" (stay somewhere else !)”
Reviews.Author: LeeMike
Reviews.Content: This hotel is geared towards the party crowd. It is smoky (moreso than any other casino we walked through), loud, crowded and tacky. Our room was clean, but in need of re-decorating. Everything seemed to be extra - late checkouts, e-checking in and printing boarding passes, etc. - things that other hotels were offering at no charge. We found the restaurants lacked quality food and were overpriced. There is a food court on the second floor which offers less expensive options, but not much in the way of healthy food. Definitely stay away from Dick''s Last Resort. In addition to the abuse from the staff (which is part of the "character" of the restaurant), it took us forever to get mediocre food. They do, however, get your drinks to the table in a hurry if you are ordering alcohol. There are lots of options in a similar price range to this hotel. Check out the newly renovated Tropicana across the street - it is very classy.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap. On the strip. Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: run2j
Reviews.Content: I booked this room for the price. Wanted to take the kids to Vegas for spring break. Rooms are dirty, shower sucks, parking is ridiculous and pool is crazy loud. We stayed one night in an off the strip hotel and had a relaxing time wish we would have stayed longer at the other hotel. The only good thing I have to say about this hotel is the McDonald's in the hotel is great and the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine!”
Reviews.Author: Floridian004
Reviews.Content: After reviewing all of the negative comments, I almost cancelled my reservations. Once we arrived I looked for all the negative things that were said and found NONE!!!!!!!!! We stayed for 7 day and enjoyed every minute of it, customer service was also wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “It could be worse...but it could be a lot better...”
Reviews.Author: cabojoe16
Reviews.Content: Some of this stuff is nit-picky, but here it goes...Check in was quick, rooms in the tower with the bigger tvs were ok. I was looking forward to taking a nice relaxing bath, but only shower stalls (with no where to put your shampoo, razor etc except the floor). The kids had fun in the pool with the slide. One of the pools was closed on Friday. The beers at the pool were expensive ($7/beer or $25 for a bucket of 5). Bathrooms by the pool were messy. Sent the kids to get a bucket of ice down the hall from our room and they came back saying there was "poop" by the ice machine. Sure enough, someone felt the urge to crap right there. Mind you, it was during spring break and there were some young revelers, but whatever, it was gross. The kids were looking forward to the arcade which was marginal. They did enjoy the Sponge Bob 4-D experience. When we went over to see New York New York and went through their arcade, we realized how cheesy the arcade at the Excalibur is. The buffet is HORRIBLE!! Do not pay $20/person. Hometown Buffet is WAAAAAYYY better (and that aint saying much). The check-out line was very long, but only took about 5 mins. The valet was speedy. The baggage check people will tell you that there are "extremely busy" (seems like they use this phrase a lot), however we didn't have to wait more than 15 mins to get our bags and about the same for them to come and get them. All in all, the kids had a good time, the price was reasonable and the rooms were pretty clean (no bed-bugs in our room, believe me, I checked), but we will not be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't spend much time in the room and are looking to save money - this is for you!”
Reviews.Author: MeganHobbs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 11 days in Vegas for our honeymoon. I, never having been to Vegas, saw a great price for Excalibur and jumped at it. I wish I had done a bit more research - this is an older casino and therefore doesn't have the greatest ventilation system. If you are sensitive to smoke, steer clear. My husband and I got a terrible headache if we spent more than an hour in the casino portion of the hotel. The room initially was not that great - the toilet hadn't been cleaned well and three of the lights in the room were out. I called down to the desk and requested they be fixed the next day if at all possible and was very polite about it. (To our amusement, the toilet was cleaned but none of the lights were replaced - by the end of our stay, only one light worked!) Moral of the story - if you aren't planning on staying in the rooms much, and if you want to keep cost down, then this is a good place to stay. The casino is super smoky, so be careful there. And don't worry too much about the small stuff - you're in Vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL CLEAN EXCITING ACCOMMODATION”
Reviews.Author: faye000
Reviews.Content: After looking at some of the reviews on this site recently concerning the cleanliness etc of the Excalibur, I was very concerned about our booking which had been organised by a travel agent as a package deal. When we walked into our room, it was beautiful and clean and very spacious. I loved it!! We were in Tower 1 which overlooked the strip so had a prime view especially at night of all the neons!!!!! Some of the reception staff had a bit of an attitude but on the whole, we found it to be a wonderful hotel. The best place for breakfast in right in the hotel itself in SHERWOOD FOREST. What a great meal and very good price. Don't let anyone put you off this hotel. I would go back in a heartbeat!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: woodman38
Reviews.Content: I would never stay here again. The simple fact, really loud music at 9:00am. We were woke up every morning to blarring music from the pool area. After a late night and some drinking that was the last thing we wanted to wake up to. The resturant "Sherwood Forest", had terrible wait times, and they were completely understaffed. I felt sorry for the people who worked there.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Daisybsktlvr
Reviews.Content: I booked eight coworkers in four rooms at the Excalibur in Las Vegas for ConExpo in March thru Expedia. Two men per room, each listed on the reservation. Upon check-in one of the gentlemen did not make the trip. Since he was the first name on the reservation, the second gentlemen could not check in. I received a phone call from him in Las Vegas to see if I could correct it. I called the Excalibur and they told me I had to call Expedia and I explained that there should be two names shown, but the girl at the front desk didn't want to hear it, gave me the phone number to Expedia (since it was after hours at my work) and she HUNG UP ON ME! I called Expedia, explained the situation and they said they would call the Excalibur to remedy the situation. Five hours later I receive another phone call at home and he is still unable to check into the room. I then spent another 65 minutes on the phone with Expedia who finally after transferring me five times, remedied the situation at the Excalibur. It is astounding to me that in this day and age, and with people not traveling as they did in the past, that anyone would do something like that to someone. Give me a job there and I can promise you that I would go out of my way to assist a guest and make sure their stay was good from check-in to check-out.

Reviews.Title: “Would NOT stay there again...”
Reviews.Author: amt415
Reviews.Content: I went against my better judgement and stayed at this hotel because my boss recommended it. The price was very good - $38/night (although there's a $12 resort fee I didn't know about until I got there). However, the room was dated and not very clean. I found other people's trash around the night tables. The lamps were unplugged. I even found a pair of men's shoes behind the chair. The bed was ok - I had no trouble sleeping. But the room was just unpleasant. The bathroom was clean, but cheap and missing a bathmat. The halls were dirty. Just standing and waiting for the elevator, I noticed food and stains all over the wall. The casino is old and smells bad. It's not a place I'd hang out. And none of the restaurants appealed to me. The reasons I stayed here were price and proximity to the hotel my conference was ACTUALLY at. Next time, I'll pay the difference in price and stay somewhere better.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine for what it is”
Reviews.Author: Impapa
Reviews.Content: Got a Tower I room with no view on the 13th floor (figures), but the bed slept like a cloud. Never was checked by security for my room key. The room was perfectly adequate for the limited time I spent in it. No timeshare hassle the entire time I was there; this part of Excal TA reviews is so overblown it's not even funny. Casino paid off nicely, mostly Wheel of Fortune slots. Easy access to Tropicana, where I watched NCAA hoops in the Trop lounge. Drinks flowed freely at VP spots at the Excal bars. Would highly recommend it for anyone on a budget. Taxi cab to downtown was $15 w/ tip; Taxi cab to/from airport was $15 w/ tip. The bad reviews of Excal on TA are an anomaly, as far as I can tell.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price but might want to upgrade”
Reviews.Author: toughbutfair99
Reviews.Content: Our stay was over Mar 16 - 20 (March Madness weekend AND spring break), so hard to say what the place is like on a normal weekend. Room in TOWER II was fine - updated and clean with nice view of the strip. Make sure to at least upgrade to this level. Apparently half the hotel has been remodeled (Tower II) and half hasn't (Tower I) which may account for some of the bad room reviews. Ask for 'wide screen delux & strip view'. Found front desk staff very friendly and helpful. Elevator security was a joke. One night hallway at 3AM sounded like keg party, other nights marginally OK. Lobby and Casino area not our style. Like Ft Lauderdale on free beer night. Excalibur is part of the MGM Group, with Luxor next door and Mandalay Bay next to that - all connected. TIP - great late night snack place is the Backstage Grill (near the Sports Book) at the Luxor. On MGM scale of 1 to 10 (with Bellagio being 10 and Circus Circus being 1) would put this property at a 4. Location is far South end of strip - a little away from the fun walking around areas. We booked in Sept so our room rates were really low ($59 - $89). Hung out mostly at Luxor and trekked over to Madalay Bay for 'upscale'. Easy walk to MGM, Aria, & Bellagio - SO, maybe TAKE the room and walk to better places. All in all, OK for the price we paid (would not even consider paying retail) but would try something different next time.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: mgilbert417
Reviews.Content: We took our honeymoon trip to Vegas because it was semi close to drive since we're from Colorado & neither one of us had ever been. As a wedding gift we were given 5 night stay at the Excaliber. Its probably the coolest looking hotel from the outside in my opinion, but the inside is in serious need of updating. Its very smokey and pretty crowded most of the time. We had a decent room in the second tower on the 22nd floor with a great view of NYNY and the MGM. The room had a king size bed that was decent but no real blankets just sheets and those crappy hotel blankets. I'm always cold so I didn't like that, but our heater & AC worked great so I used those a lot during our stay. Upon first entering our room I noticed a serious smell. Its hard to describe but I'm pretty sure its either the smell of smoke or the dingy smell of the hotel. Its was seriously noticeable but we didn't want to mess with trying to get another room. Our room was non smoking but there really isn't much to stop someone from smoking in any of the rooms though. Housekeeping did a great job everyday too. The pool was okay and one half was closed off which was disappointing but it looked like it needed a major cleaning so that could be why. We had a flat screen tv in our room, but no frig which I hated because I have dietary restrictions and could have really used one. Most hotels that cost this much have those but in vegas you have to rent them for $15 a day and we just decided to get a disposable cooler instead which worked fine and we used ice from our floor to keep everything cold. Saved a ton of money that way. I'm not a big gambler but the tables were okay, the slots seemed rigged but that's probably everywhere. We had one issue with our internet not working and we contacted the front desk who said they would send someone up to check it out in 20-40 mins. Five hours later no one showed and we had to go down there about it again the next day. They had a lock on our internet from the pervious guest and hadn't taken it off. Once they removed it our internet still didn't work. They sent someone up again and it took probably a good 40mins to an hour for him to arrive. Once he was here it was a pretty fast fix and our internet was good to go. I was pretty disappointed in how long it took to solve that problem and we paid for it for 5 days only used 4. With a $15 "resort fee" that adds up. The food court has ok options like McDonalds, Quiznos and a chinese food place. Do not eat at Dicks Last Resort!!! Its a fun place but insanely over priced. Not worth it in my opinion. We paid $60 for two drinks some fried shrimp and a cheese burger - not worth the money and not that great. Eatting off the strip saves everyone money or I would suggest the all day buffett pass for $25 with unlimited trips. We didn't use this but again I have dietary restrictions and a buffett would just go to waste on me. All in all our stay was okay and the Excaliber was just ok. We checked out a lot of other hotels during our stay that seemed nicer and they probably are. But for the price I guess its a decent deal and a decent stay. Nothing to get excited about but ok for those looking to save money.

Reviews.Title: “Only thing going for it is that it is on the strip”
Reviews.Author: SBTraveler38
Reviews.Content: Compared to the other hotels that we visited during our stay in Las Vegas, this hotel was the lowest common denominator in terms of attractiveness, food options, and attractions. Stay here only if you want to spend all your time, except sleeping, either by the pool or somewhere else. Would never stay here again

Reviews.Title: “First time stay at Excalibur - Very Positive”
Reviews.Author: margorick
Reviews.Content: Wow - I've been to LV many times but it was my first stay at the Excalibur. I had concerns having read previous reviews ... but I was very happy with my stay there. Staff very friendly and helpful. Had a great room. Really enjoyed the variety of slot machine games. Won some $$. Nice variety of restaurants to choose from, to fit any budget. Saw the Tournament of Kings and it was quite a production. I would definitely stay at the Excalibur again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: john_ecko
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with work and we had one of the new rooms which were fine, two of the girls we were travelling with were moved to a tower view room with a hot tub because they found bed bugs in their bed on the first night. our room was fine, if your going to vegas and want a cheap hotel this is good but it takes ages to walk to the Bellagio or PH.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: IACouple311
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Excalibur for three nights. I just got to say how disappointed in the lack of customer service and the cleanliness of the hotel. I understand you get what you pay for - but for $500 for 3 nights you would like to see a little effort. The hotel and casino area was disgusting - the room was not set up bad but again not very clean. We were on the fourth floor and there was a terrible odor all weekend - when it was mentioned to the front desk person, Angie - she literally did not acknowledge that there was a problem and walked away from me. I asked to speak to a manager - simply because her lack of service was very annoying - the manager pretty much did the same thing..tried to give me a free coupon I think. There was a piece of toast that remained in our hallway on the floor for the entire trip. To be honest, I was not even looking for something - just trying to give a heads up. There were a couple bartenders that tried to make the experience fun - but otherwise it seemed like we were just another couple visiting Las Vegas. I will definitely pony up a little more money next time and stay at another hotel - Excalibur was a complete disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel but in need of renovations”
Reviews.Author: jrp0629
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here and it was ok for the money, but needs a major overhaul. We switched rooms three times due to no water pressure in the shower. If I were you and you have a few extra dollars, stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great times at Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: sairuh119
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed here for our vacation. I will say the smell right when you walk in is a horrible incense, but other than that it was great. Our room was clean and recently renovated I would say. Nice 50inch flat screen and we had a great view. The pool was open when we were there was was very nice. Great music and wait staff. The location is great we were able to walk to lots of different hotels. Tender at the Luxor was delicious and we walked to Hooters 1 night for $1.50 Bud lights at the bar. We ate dinner at Dicks Last Resort also...food was good. They had a really great band and 2 for 1 drink coupons too. Overall I would stay here again..it is great for the value and the location was great!

Reviews.Title: “A nice experience”
Reviews.Author: BonJoviGirls
Reviews.Content: After reading many negative reviews on this hotel (including bed bugs, room quality, and timeshare salespeople), I was a little concerned about staying here. However, we were pleasantly surprised. I booked a standard non-smoking room online, but when we checked in at registration, I asked if there was any way to request Tower II and if there were any free upgrades available (both of these were included in past reviews that I had read). She said she would check and the next thing we knew, she said yes to both and we were off to our room (#18272). She was extremely pleasant about everything. The room was nice. We immediately turned out the lights, put our luggage in the bathroom, got out the flashlight and checked for bed bugs. None were found and I must say that even the mattress and pad were very clean. Our entire floor was fairly quiet, except for housekeeping. The lighting was good, the air was good (no smoky smell). The bathroom was clean, but you could tell there had been some repairs made to the walls, etc. Checkout was very accommodating as well as my friend and I needed to split the bill and they were very willing and very nice about that. All in all, this was a nice place to stay for a lot less than we would have paid elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break, so what to expect.”
Reviews.Author: ExploreNationalParks
Reviews.Content: Was staying here with family for the March Madness Tip: book early and it is a lot cheaper, I just stayed one night and it was $200. The bathroom was bare bones by any large hotel standards. The room was stuffy all night long but I think that goes with the Las Vegas Casinos Hotels. There are many food options but I would not say any are good for you. Lots of fast food on the second floor.

Reviews.Title: “A good time for sure, skip the Tournament of kings!”
Reviews.Author: BeachBumTN77
Reviews.Content: We were out there from March 15-18 for a wedding. We had three rooms on the 10th floor tower 1 in Excalibur. Some others were staying in other hotels. We managed to get halfway good prices, even with the daily rate hike games that everybody likes to play in vegas. The rooms were certainly basic. They were clean, but when is the last time that you had a hotel room without a tub, only a shower? We have a 3 year old who was not with us on the trip, but I'm wondering how kids take baths there. Just a shower stall. Same with the other rooms also. The people trying to sell you stuff in the lobby were much more than in other hotels. It was pretty much nonstop trying to sell you show tickets and all other types of crap. That was the case in the lobbies and also in the exaclibur walkways outside the casino. The little gift shops in the hotel are nothing great either, as far as knowing they have you where they want you for prices. $18 for suntan lotion? Really? Thanks guys. But since we weren't there much except to sleep, it was okay. But on our last night there (St. Patty's day), we decided to do the tournament of kings thing for dinner, figuring that we could just have dinner and beers there and continue the night. Well, they came around exactly ONE TIME to take drink orders from the bar. ONE TIME in 2 hours! On St. Patrick's day. And then it took about 20 minutes to come back. The food was incredibly plain. I understand it's supposed to be like medieval times or whatever, but they had cornish hen (read unflavored DRY whole chicken), two potatos, one huge branch of broccoli and a biscuit from KFC I think. And a McDonald's apple pie for desert. But it came on a plate at least. That was for the bargain price of $59 each. The show was okay, but for it taking two hours and no beer for the whole time, you were certainly ready for it to be over. AVOID THAT SHOW! That pretty much ruined the night for our group. Ages 26-36.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel so much.”
Reviews.Author: irishsymphony
