Reviews.Content: I'd stayed in Excalibur last October, and knew it was a hotel I wanted to return to - and again, had a great experience there. We'd requested to stay in tower II, knowing it was closest to the pool, and they'd made a note of this - then gave us an option of a higher or lower floor, rather than just assigning us our room. Staff there are always very friendly and helpful in our experiences. The casino is quite diverse, although we never played the tables so I can't comment. Naturally, during March with Spring Break, it was very busy most days, and Dicks Last Resort was incredibly noisy whenever we passed - but that's known for its rowdy business, and it's why people go there, expecting it! Food court is great upstairs, though we didn't try the buffet. Although it's at the end of the strip, it has a short quick walkway to NYNY, and somehow, doesn't feel like it takes ages to get to. Have only good things to say about this hotel - and would definitely recommend people try to get Tower II, as Tower I is quite a trek from the pool area. It's not at the same standard as other hotels on the strip, but considering its rating is 3.5, it more than lives up to taht for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: hrae_7
Reviews.Content: Recently my mom and I along with my aunt and uncle, travelled to Las Vegas. It was my second trip and couldn't be happier with where we stayed! The rooms were clean and well kept, and although we chose not to upgrade, my auntie and uncle did. I must say, what a difference! Both were great, but the upgraded room was much more modern. I was very happy with my stay from beginning to end, and would definitely stay again! Can't wait for the next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: karen_dodds
Reviews.Content: Was a little annoyed when I arrived as the hotel had incorrectly amended our booking and tried to blame us...dispite us having print outs of all the emails sent to the hotel prior to our arrival. After some discussion they finally fixed this in our favour. The rooms were clean and tidy enough although the bathroom seemed to be a little tired and in need of an update. The pool area was very good, very clean and spacious and had an adults only area where we managed to bag a poolside cabana for only £50. Overall there was nothing wrong with the hotel and it was a good stay. However, once I started to explore Vegas and what the other hotels have to offer I probably wouldn't stay here again. A lot of the other hotels have better attractions, facilities and restaurants. In my opinion there's nothing wrong with the Excalibur and, for the price, its in a pretty good location. We originally had been looking at Circus Circus and we were so grateful that we chose Excalibur once we realised how far away Circus Circus really is from all the hot spots. If you want a little bit more 'Vegas Wow-factor' to your trip then I'd go somewhere else. If you're on a budget and out to explore all that Vegas has to offer then I don't think there's any harm in staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_FamilyNowra
Reviews.Content: On arrival, dropped of at door, no staff to assist, no signage to direct you where to go, head inside into smoke filled noisy casino, have to walk the entire lenght of casino to get to reception, booked in, staff were adequate with no personality. I had requested two interconnection rooms when I booked, this was not available, offered free upgrade with two rooms side by side, I thought ok good deal, first night discovered our rooms are directly over loading dock, truck after truck after truck, no sleep. One of my kids had medical issue and I needed to take her to hospital for treatment, went to guest services for information, informed that they only give information on casino issues and that i need to find security officer for help, what a joke guest services are. Lay out of hotel is a disaster, elevators are at opposite ends of casino floor, to access food you have no option but to walk the entire length of the noisy, smoky casino floor to get from your room elevator to the food court elevator. I thought we currently lived in a society which realise the dangers of passive smoking, not at the Excalibur, our room was non smoking yet stank of stale smoke. Rooms are tired and run down even the new widescreen deluxe rooms, hallways were nosiy with drunks stumbling back to their rooms knocking on doors for admission, not always the right door I might add. The casino and hotel here seems to cater for a sleazy clientel, if you want this then this is your location, when I made my booking it was cheap, now I know why, do yourself a favour, pay a couple of extra bucks and stay at a classier establishment. My family and I regret our choice to stay at this hotel and will not make the same mistake again.

Reviews.Title: “MAGNIFICENT”
Reviews.Author: gerardmccartan
Reviews.Content: First time in Las Vegas and stayed in Excalibur i travelled all the way from Ireland and didnt know what to expect from hotel.But as soon as i arrived i knew i had picked a great hotel staff pleasent as soon as i went in and rooms lovely and clean.If your ever in vegas check in at the excalibur..Also buffet was first class and only $25..

Reviews.Title: “Pay an extra $100 and stay an another hotel!”
Reviews.Author: carlalb75
Reviews.Content: My husband and I last visited Las Vegas several years ago. We decided to stay at the Excalibur because our multiple previous experiences were wonderful. The first day we arrived everything was great. The second day coming back from breakfast my heel got caught on the motorized walkway and after 5 hours in the ER,..result, broken ankle! There were no barricades, cones or yellow tape warnings stating that the ridges in a motorized walkway, when not operating, is dangerous. As security has on file, the ridges on the walk caught my heel and caused me to fall approximately 10 feet from the end of tha walk as we were getting ready to step off the motorized walk metal ridges. We get back to the hotel and my husband could not get a courtesy wheelchair from the hotel knowing what had just happened. It was not until he explained the whole story 5 times to 8 different people...sigh... what a nightmare. Thank god for pain medication! We checked out on Sunday no calls from anyone at the hotel to check to see how I was doing. So after $670 later and ongoing doctor visits, this will be our last stay at the Excalibur Hotel and we will not recommend a stay at Excalibur to any of our family and friends. I am finally capable of expressing my thoughts since I've been in excrutiating pain even with prescribed medication. The customer service was not up to par. Excalibur will need to meet or exceed their customer relations with us as well as the others in our party which were also guests. No effort to go out of their way to accomodate me properly when I was injured, never showed concerned for my well being while I was a guest there and most of all....Excaliburs customer relations manager dismissed their role to provide service to us and threw it right back at the Security department. Who does that, really? I was a guest at Excalibur not at the security department.

Reviews.Title: “Spend the money....GO ELSEWHERE”
Reviews.Author: k75b75
Reviews.Content: Wow, we got what we paid for ! Not much ! 2 adults 2 kids, so we got 2 rooms with adjoining door. Bathrooms were disgusting with broken parts. One smelled so bad we all used only 1 of the bathrooms and constantly had to keep the stinky bathroom's door closed. Housekeeping was unable to help. We were CONSTANTLY HARASSED by touts in the lobby trying to sell crappy tours EVERY time we walked through. NOT a good place for children....more for sleazy, cheap gamblers. Had room service once, which was ok. Noisy aircon, bright carpark lights outside at night. Depressing rooms....I'm sure the Griswalds stayed here in 1973, but it was built in 1990 ! Spend an extra $20-30 a night and GO ELSEWHERE !

Reviews.Title: “malodourless is first impression”
Reviews.Author: nudlim
Reviews.Content: immediately on entering there is a stench of nicotine and something else which along with the noise is offputting. however room was nice and food okay

Reviews.Title: “DISCRIMATION AND DISTORTION”
Reviews.Author: Karen562
Reviews.Content: I rented a room at the excalibur with my friends for the weekend. At the time we decided to rent some scooters at the hotel to make it fun and less of a hassle to walk the strip. The hotel security kept complaining about being inside the hotel with the scooters when they obviously rent it to everyone to use without an specific contract of rules. Long story short they came to our room around 5am knocking (waking us up) asking for te scooters keys. I was like excuse me first of all im in the middle of my sleep and this is not the time to be knocking our room trying to come and collect scooters keys when we rent them for a lap of 24 hours and the time was not up. I refused to give them the keys and they immediately had security kick me out of the hotel with my luggage and demanded the key or they were sending me to jail. I had them call the cops cause i wanted a report of such discrimination and they obviously switched the story and told the cops they wanted me out of their premises and that i was not cooperating so they had the cops hand cuff me over some dumb key. I have never in my life been handcuffed nor less been thrown out of a hotel that I paid for and didnt get a refund. This hotel is horrible, bad service, and I will never in my life stay there again. My entire weekend was ruined by this horrible embarrasing moment.

Reviews.Title: “Had the best time ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: sha_austin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Excalibur about 10 years ago, and wanted to stay there again. This would be my husband & 8 year old daughter's first trip to Vegas. After booking the hotel, I saw the reviews and was kind of apprehensive about staying, but it was the complete opposite of what I was expecting. Our plane arrived at 9:00 am, they let us check in then even though check in isn't until 3:00. The room was nice & clean, and we had a great view of the strip!! Everyone was so friendly, from the buffet cooks/waitresses to the casino floor cocktail servers. I highly recommend the Excalibur to anyone. I am already counting down to next year so I can go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “it was okay, nothing fancy”
Reviews.Author: ching_wa
Reviews.Content: Pros convenient location right on the strip affordable price clean room with basic house keeping done everyday Cons Limited parking space non smocking rooms smelled like smoke really loud water pipes (hard to sleep at night) no fridge in the rooms, that would of been nice stay here if you are looking for a basic room to sleep in!

Reviews.Title: “so much fun for the kids”
Reviews.Author: mlperkins
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for three nights whilst travelling across USA travelling myself and 11 and 3 year old. Valet parking upon arrival after a bit of a queue. Very easy and bellboys to help with bags immediately. As expected great Vegas hospitality from the start!!!! We used the car twice during our stay and whilst we waited for the car it was very convenienet and FREE Hotel check in was quick. Had to pay Vegas resort tax on arrival. Room only literally means room only....the pool is free though!! We had a tower room which had a view right up the strip which was cool. The room was big but a little dated and in need of some TLC The kids of course dont notice anthing like this and really enjoyed the theming of the whole place Bathroom was a bit dirty with hair on the walls. the first day we had no toiletries but second day there were some. plenty of tv channels!! We used the pool on several occasions as it was soooooo hot (august!!). Huge pool area with three pools plus an adult only pool. Cabanas avaiable to hire otherwise plenty of sunbeds as along as you get there early, Take own towels. Pool side air conditioned bar. Toilets grubby Being a vegas hotel of course they have 24 hour gaming, shops and restaurants. We enjoyed the 12 hour all you can eat which inlcuded drinks and ice creams and once youve bought the pass you go straight to the front of the queue. Good value and a great rage of food and drinks. Clean and reasonable service For the money i would prefer to spend a little more and enjoy the MGM for quality. However the kids loved the excalibur and its easy to get aorund town using their monorail station nearby

Reviews.Title: “Great service, dissapointed with room”
Reviews.Author: Mrymerry
Reviews.Content: Paid for a widescreen room with a lovely view of....walls & a roof. If you want a strip view, pay the extra $20 per night. Since the Excalibur has been redecorated, we just a expected a bit more. Truthfully, we like the widescreen equivilant rooms at Circus CIrcus better, but that is just us. The service here has been outstanding. We requested connecting rooms for our friends from California, even though we arrived before them. The request was granted. Our safe was not working when we tried to use it. We called the front desk & within an hour, the safe was fixed. Housekeeping was speedy as well. When we requested extra towels, pillows & blankets...we had them in less than an hour. If you want good buffet food, don't expect it here. The food isn't terrible, it's just standard buffet food. Go to the RIO if you want good food & an awesome selection. My folks had to rent a wheel chair for this hotel....$17 for 24 hours. I'm not complaining about that, just posting it so others would know. I was not aware wheelchairs could be rented because i've never needed one.

Reviews.Title: “Basic & Clean”
Reviews.Author: akaent
Reviews.Content: We reserved a standard non-smoking room in Tower I with a king bed and that is exactly what we got. The room was basic and clean. The bathroom was large with a huge shower but no tub. We had the breakfast buffet and there was a good selection of food. We went to the Steakhouse but found the prices to be a bit high ($6.00 for a baked potato) and $28.95 for just the steak with nothing else. We were not happy when the entrees that we ordered came at the same time as our salads and when we complained we were comped drinks (well one mini drink each). The food was okay but I wouldn't go back again. The check in and check out was fast and we left our bags at the bell desk until evening with no problems. All in all I would stay there again but probable choose Tower II with a widescreen room.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: vivron
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed in this hotel from the very beginning. We came here for my son's wedding in their chapel. We reserved a King room in the upgraded tower. When we arrived they did not have a King available and let us know in no uncertain terms ( interpret: rudely) that they do not guarantee any kind of reservations. My husband is very tall and cannot sleep in a queen size bed. I asked to speak to a manager who came over and was also rude and said they could not do anyting for us. They said we could move into a King room the next day but they could not guarantee that either. FInally, after talking to the second manager a room with a King bed appeared in the "old" tower. It was ugly but relatively clean. Housekeeping never came unless we called at 5Pm and asked them to clean our room, please. The room service breakfast was the worst coffee we've ever had and a store bought mini rubber bagel. The room service plate stayed outside our door for the entire four days we were there. The staff was not pleasant nor were they helpful. Everywhere you walk in the hotel someone accosts you for a timeshare presentation. I would never stay there again. Especially since for maybe $20.00 more you can stay at very nice places.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly Casino”
Reviews.Author: ritz0529
Reviews.Content: The minute you step into the lobby/casino you can instantly smell the awful odor! The odor is so strong that you don't want to spend another minute in the casino area. I did not have a good impression of this hotel so i was surprised when i saw the hotel room. It was recently renovated so everything was new and decorated contemporary. Both the room and bathroom were spacious but basing it on the overall experience i would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service is NO priority here.”
Reviews.Author: Brettsreality
Reviews.Content: The plus, the hotel is inexpensive, the bathrooms are large & clean. The downside, red roof inn is nicer with better customer service. The upgraded room I was given actually was significantly smaller than the one paid for. Lights were burned out. Iron was leaking ruined a shirt. Alarm clock was broken. Message light on phone continuously light. Colleagues TV was broken. I assumed I was in an older room but was informed when I called the front desk that it is a new room. Room designed w/ small table in a corner but w/ a large chair that can never face the table. Next to it is a large floor lamp blocking the mirror. No wireless internet, but there is DSL. The only cable is next to the TV across the room from any place you may be able to sit down. The only way to get a receipt is to truck across the casino to the registration desk. No receipt under the door or by email. Avoid the buffet like the plague. Food was terrible and expensive. MGM's is great for about the same price. Smoke.... smoking is allowed in Las Vegas casino's but most apparently have a much better ventilation system. Just walking from the entrance to your room will leave you stinking. I don't even want to take my clothes home. Most hotels will make an effort to make things better. Excaliburs response was "sorry to hear that". Spend the extra money and stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was in a good location on the strip.”
Reviews.Author: knepc
Reviews.Content: Excalibur was in a good location on the strip,was within walking distance to most things. I read alot of bad reviews,but we had no problems.Our room was upgraded to the widescreen room at no extra charge,and it was in tower two.We were close to the pools,which were nice. They have four pools,and three hot tubs. We thought the drinks were alittle high priced though. Dicks bar&grill was fun and the band was awesome. Would not waste money on the buffet,not much to choose from.Also remember you have to pay resort fees when you check out. We stayed five nights and it came to $70.

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING 8 black hairs were in our shower and throughout our stay - NEVER CLEANED!”
Reviews.Author: JenandScott123
Reviews.Content: We booked a Widescreen View Room. We arrived on a Sunday and immediately noticed red stains on the carpet and the round, blue decorative pillow on the bed. (Photos attached.) There was a sizeable rip on the bed cover. We decided not to let these minor issues bother us and did not report them. We went down to the pool area to find that 3 of the 4 pools were roped off and inaccessible.... Nothing like booking a hotel with 4 pools and a water slide and then only getting to use 1 of them - the smallest one and, of course, no water slide. The AC unit was very loud and came on periodically throughout the night to maintain temperature. It woke my girlfriend up each time and because of this she complained that she didn't sleep well during our stay. On Monday afternoon the TV would not turn on. I called the front desk. We had to wait for maintenance to come up and "reset" it. Apparently this is an ongoing problem with their TVs. Monday evening we were getting ready to go out to dinner and when my girlfriend got in the shower she found EIGHT long black hairs on the shower walls. (Photos attached) She called the front desk immediately and instead of apologizing they asked her, "Why didn’t you report it when you checked in?" (GREATservice, by the way.) She explained that we hadn’t used the shower until just then so we didn’t know there was a problem until that time. She was told that they would deduct 50% off of that night’s room rate and send someone up to clean the shower immediately. She told them that we were in the process of getting ready to go out and asked if they could come clean the shower after 8:30pm instead. We returned to the room around 1am. The bed had been made. There were fresh toiletries and towels in the bathroom. My girlfriend opened the shower door and pointed out that she had spilled some shampoo on the shower floor earlier and it had been cleaned up but the hairs were still on the shower walls! How can a housekeeper “clean” a shower without touching the walls? Especially when we had called specifically to complain about hair on the walls! We will stay elsewhere moving forward because of issue we had with the cleanliness of our shower. We let the minor issues slide but our basic needs in a hotel room are that the room is CLEAN and in working order. With stains throughout the room it really creeped us out laying in bed wondering if the sheets were actually clean. If I could give any advise it would be to thoroughly inspect your room immediately at check in. Hopefully you will avoid the same issue we had and you will not have to endue the non-stop whining and complaining that my girlfriend gave me for "forcing" her to stay in "such a dirty place." Never again, Excalibur. I've stayed with you many times because of your location and price but I will happily pay more to stay elsewhere moving forward.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not luxurious”
Reviews.Author: mxchick03
Reviews.Content: I traveled for a conference that was at Mandalay Bay. There was convenient shuttle buses but sometimes they took forever to arrive cutting it close for time. The food seemed very expensive and not a lot of options in the hotel. There were much more options across the road at NYNY The hotel lobby staff was great. Very friendly and very helpfull The room was clean. I stayed in Tower I which was not recently renovated so it was a little out dated but the view was good. Had a jacuzzi in the room but didn't use it. Bathroom was ok but nothing amazing. Always had good water pressure and hot water. Bed was comfy. It just seemed like a long walk to do anything (shows, nightclubs, dining) If your interested in the nightlife maybe check out NY NY or the luxor. Coyote Ugly and ROK was in NY NY and cat house and LAX was in Luxor LAX was not as good as I expected VIP sections were ok but dance floor was way too crowded and pushy people. Crowd was not as friendly or the were tooooo friendly. If you like hiking check out the charleston mountains about a 1/2 hour drive. Over all the hotel was ok but I would book at a different one next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Good for Families. No Frills Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: R-J-W07
Reviews.Content: My first impression of the hotel was that it smelt of smoke! However, after a short wait at reception, we were given our keys and we made our way to our Wide Screen Family Room. (We weren't asked if we wanted help with our luggage, but we were happy to carry it ourselves.) The room was newish and overlooked the strip but it was not cleaned to my standards. There were are few hairs in the bathroom and one of the beds had a hole in the sheets. There was no smoky smell in the room. The beds were comfy and the room itself was a decent size for a family of four who did a lot of shopping! Watch out for the people in the foyer selling time shares... we just said "no thanks" and kept on walking. This hotel is at one end of the strip so take your walking shoes. We also got a bus up and down the strip which was cheap (I think about US$7 for 24 hrs) and you can get on an off as often as you like. Try and get a seat up top of the bus and get to the front... it's the best view of the strip! It's also a great way to check out the amazing Casinos. Don't forget to check out M&M World, Denny's was yum for dinner, book your Grand Canyon tour at one of the shops on the strip and the Las Vegas Outlet Centre was great for bargains. We were there for four days in December and the weather was fine but a bit chilly... we needed our hoodies! Vegas really is the adults playground, but my kids (11&13) loved it also.

Reviews.Title: “Past it's prime. If you're looking for cheese-factor, this is the place.”
Reviews.Author: TravelsWithKids2011
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel over February break for a quick weekend in Las Vegas. Since we were traveling with a 14 and 10 year-old, we spent a lot of time researching hotels that were more kid-friendly (it *is* Las Vegas after all). While the hotel looked fun on the outside, that feeling quickly dissipated when we got inside. The casino floor area looked completely worn out, dark, dingy, and, well, gross. The restaurants were mostly fast-food chains and the few that weren't, didn't look appealing at all. We ended up eating elsewhere for all of our meals. The room, despite being on a non-smoking floor, smelled. The bathroom was seriously dated. The shower was a throwback to the 1970's. It seems like they've been trying to keep up with the times on the soft furnishings, but overall, it fell short. On the plus-side, the linens were clean and the staff was friendly. It was also surprisingly quiet. We had a great view and found the hotel to be easily accessible to The Strip. There is a tram that runs from this hotel over to the Luxor and Mandalay Bay ones. We spent more of our time over there and walking around. We walked all over Vegas and took in the sites and spectacle of the place and decided that if we ever went back, we'd stay at the Mandalay Bay Hotel instead.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!!!”
Reviews.Author: Travel1040
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Excalibur and was very disappointed with the facility. The rooms need a major makeover since they appeared very dated. The casino could also use a makeover as well. They do not provide much in customer service. One day we returned to our room to find that we had been missed by the maid. When I contacted housekeeping they said that they would send someone up. We left the room and returned over an hour later and no one had been there. I contacted hosekeeping again and its as though my first request was forgotten. This time I asked to speak to a manager. Someone who said that they were a housekkeping manger called to say that someone was on their way . Our room was finally cleaned at 6pm but the hotel never did anything to make it up to us. They only gave excuses. When we went down to find out about printing our boarding passes we found out that they charge $5 whether a person does it or you use the self service kiosks. Also, they have self service kiosks for self checkout but none of them was working so we had to stand in line to checkout. The hotel has a great location and they seem to cater more to families but in the future I would stay be willing to pay a little more and recive service.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price but the smell of cigarette smoke was too much.”
Reviews.Author: rmg15
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok. The main problem as mentioned by previous reviewers is that my non-smoking room reeked of smoke. For that matter, the whole casino and hotel did. On the positive side, the staff was very friendly and helpful, free wired internet connection and comfortable bed. I don't think I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What I get for being cheap”
Reviews.Author: MamaLuu
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a few times before along with other hotels in Vegas. I like the location and the walkways to the other hotels. Never had a problem and was aware this was not one of the fancier or newer hotels. Was having a special weekend for my husband 's 50th birthday. Wanted to spend our money on fun and not on a hotel room we would be in for only a short time so when I checked the prices on-line I choose Excalibur based on price being slightly lower than Luxor. Big mistake, Luxur would have been a much better choice. Here are the good items, price was great, location as I mentioned, valet parking quick and friendly and check in was a breeze. We even had 4 other rooms reserved and they made sure we were all in the same Tower and close to each other. Unfortunately there ends the good. We headed off to our Tower to find our room.. Surprised there was such a crowd to get on the elevator but not a big issue. Once on the 10 floor noticed the decor was a bit worn, The table near the elevator chipped, there was a bit of a smell and just didn't seem very clean. We went to our room and there was definitly a musty, moldy smell. The paper on the table had a childs doodle and the bedding just looked really old. Again didn't mind too much so dropped off our stuff and headed off to have some fun. But then just had issue after issue; - TV in one room did not work, never fixed all weekend. -A/C did not work in another room in our group. -Smashed glass in Hallway in front of one of our rooms. -Security guards (not just once) who were supposed to check who was coming in to floors who did not even look up or were chatting with friends. -CONSTANT assault from time share people EVERYwhere. and finally figuring out musty smell in our room was leaking toilet that was flooding bathroom and was not noticed by housekeeping. They did come and fix leak and gave me 50% of one night for the inconvenience. Now when you plan a weekend for a group and the hotel just seems this shabby and for $20.00 more we could have stayed next door you start to feel crabby. Of course we still had a great weekend but really wish we would have paid the extra $20.00. I think that's it for me and Excalibur.

Reviews.Title: “Good value & location; wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: Andre009
Reviews.Content: The price was great, the location was very good for our purposes in Vegas, the room seemed clean, but I wouldn't stay here again. The smell of the place bothered me... whatever deodorizer they use to cover up the smoke just didn't sit right with me. My daughter didn't seem to mind and Ive talked to others that didn't mind, but it wasn't for me. I was very annoyed by the hotel staff that try to stop you to sell you show tickets. It's bad enough on the streets of Vegas, but at my hotel I'd rather not be pestered by people trying to offer me stuff I don't want. When checking out only one of the 3 self checkout terminals was working at Tower 1, so we had to wait a long time to check out. The buffet wasn't anything special.

Reviews.Title: “Good position but smoky and run down”
Reviews.Author: shirleyjoy
Reviews.Content: This was the cheapest accommodation we had in our 4 week stay in USA. No fridge/microwave which we needed the fridge for inuslin an extra $20 a day. The promo had included fridge. we were also jumped on by time share sellers at the front reception (they are at all the entrances in this hotel BEWARE) they pretend to be welcoming you and give you a free gift. If you want to give up 4 to 5 hours of one of your days for a free show, dont get if from this hotel, bargain with ones down the street and you will get a lot more. The sheets were not changed for 3 days,. one was soiled and I noticed a small note in bathroom with spanish side up saying put this on pillow if you want sheets changed. I cant believe the cleaner made a bed with dirty sheets. Also the bed side table had a hole in it and a ticket dropped by the side of the bed stayed there for the whole duration of our stay. The bed was the most comfortable bed I have slept in at a hotel. This hotel is very smoky and the smoke seems to follow you throughout the hotel. We ate and played the slots at other venues. Good car paking and valet service. For the price you cant complain especially if you are a smoker. I probably would stay there again if I could not get a smiliar price on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: xanthe0160
Reviews.Content: Just got back yesterday from a 4 night stay at the Excalibur hotel it was a heck or a long way to travel for this length of time but worth it. The hotel itself perhaps not a glitsy as some of the others maybe because its camelot medieval castle theme. However the hotel was huge the room basic but clean and I think newly decorated but still to look old castle style. Nothing like tea or coffee in the room but I believe thats typical of American hotels and they want you in the casino not your room. I read a couple of poor reports about the buffet at the hotel before I left so avoided it at first had the buffet at the Luxor which was fine instead. However on the last day for convenience we had the all day option and it was extremely good value. Plenty of choice well laid out and nothing left stale and poked around. The location at the end of the strip was a bonus very close to the airport could see it from the room. It allowed you to walk down the strip and know that you hadn't missed much the other way.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families, great location and good value.”
Reviews.Author: trell0v04
Reviews.Content: Had booked 2 rooms for our family and grandma. Didn't realise they had connecting rooms, so didn't ask. Once we got to our rooms, realised that they did have connecting rooms but we hadn't been given them. Went back to reception - very long trip and had our rooms changed quickly and easily. However new rooms supposedly non-smoking but very much smelt of smoke, weren't going to change again however. Stayed in Tower 2. Rooms very cute. Great beds, large TV, however no coffee machine or free wifi. Didn't even have a free computer service to check-in for our next flight, had to pay for internet. Rooms very spacious and quiet, large bathrooms. Great food court - had Mcdonalds for the kids. Staff very friendly and helpful with tours. No offers to help carry bags however. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “hugh hotel”
Reviews.Author: wildthang619
Reviews.Content: The rooms in tower two were nice and new...so make sure you stay in tower two. The hotel actually surpised me...it was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur Hotel: One Night of Hell!”
Reviews.Author: malltura
Reviews.Content: Subject: Excalibur Survey Reply With Specific Event Circumstances Which Occured During the Stay of James Malloch Excalibur Hotel February 6 to 11, 2011 Date: Feb 20, 2011 4:30 PM Attachments: Letter to General Manager Excalibur March 2010 February 20, 2011 Dear Ms.or Mr. Munoz-Mejorado Magaly: Guest Relations Representative Excalibur and Luxor Hotel Las Vegas Nevada I am James Malloch and I am responding to your recent E-mail below. I stay at Excalibur often, at least 4 times a year for 5 days each visit (for location purposes). Occasionally I stay at Aria or MGM as well. I am retired 3 times, financially secure, and able to travel anywhere at anytime. I was a guest of your hotel (Excalibur) for 5 nights arriving on Super Bowl Sunday February 6th, 2011 at about 4 PM at the hotel from Myrtle Beach flying Delta. I was using an Expedia booking package for the flight and hotel as they gave me a $100 discount on the trip for a total of $305. I normally book the hotel through the Excalibur E-mails and website E-mail specials. I checked out on Friday morning 2/11/2011 at 4 AM to catch a 6 AM flight to the East Coast and my home of Myrtle Beach, SC. On arriving at Expedia on 2/6, I checked in, asked for a comp to the Tower 2 flat screen room from Tower 1, was denied, and was given the option to upgrade for 5 nights for $50 to Tower 2 as is the usual if not comped so I agreed to the upgrade. The receptionist was pleasant and I had no problems with the check in process then. I am 69 years old and have a lower spine stenosis problem so my mobility then was very limited as I was to have a spine operation on February 14th, 2011. I stay at the Excalibur primarily because of location as I am limited in how far I can walk due to my back condition. Excalibur is the best location for me through past experiences. I am also a service connected 70 percent disabled Vietnam Veteran with many service related injuries and disabilities for your information. I also am neither a drinker, gambler, or smoker. I was assigned to room 12-2-62 for my stay which had an overstuffed chair and footstool which was nice for my back and of course a view of the air conditioning roof as usual. All went well until about 2:00 AM on February 8th Tuesday. I had gone to bed at 10:30 PM. At about 2 AM I was awakened by a loud disturbance in the hall outside my door, I assumed it was drunken guests returning to their rooms. A few minutes later there was a fire alarm and the PA system went on stating they were investigating an incident and to remain calm and wait for information. These alarms and PA announcements went on for 15 minutes, then an announcement was made that it was a false alarm and to continue normal activities or words to that effect? So I went back to sleep at about 2:45. Shortly thereafter there was a knock on the door. It was security and the fire department I believe (about 6 men)? They told me I had to pack up everything and evacuate my room and go to the check in desk for reassignment to another room and floor? I asked why, they said rudely, don't you see all this dry powder on the floor and walls? I said yes, but it is only PKP or fire extinguisher dry powder and it is not toxic, so just get your maintenance crew up here now and clean it up without relocating anyone at 3 AM in the morning as obviously there was no fire and some idiot had discharged a dry powder extinguisher making a mess and causing the alarm condition. They again told me to pack my things and vacate the room! I previously was a Navy Captain with Command at sea and ashore and knew much about firefighting and I knew personally the correct way to clean up a dry powder spill. One uses a mask not to ingest the powder, gloves, and a vacuum and a broom to clean up the residue as it is not toxic, then water and vinegar to clean the remaining residue. I asked them again to just clean it up now as I was fine as as my AC was drawing from the outside! They said no, we are evacuating this floor wing, and to get out now! At about 3:30 AM or so now, I had packed everything in my room into 3 suitcases hurriedly from a deep sleep. I could barely walk due my back condition which needed 10 hours sleep a night to recover, I had only had 3 hours at that point and I was in a lot of pain. When I went in the hall it was empty, I saw no other rooms being evacuated, and the dry powder was still on the floor and walls. I proceeded to the Check In desk as directed with all my belongings and spoke to a woman named Cari or something like that behind the desk. It was about 3:45 now. I told her what had happened and what occurred and why I was directed by Security to report there. She seemed uninterested in my plight and circumstances and perhaps thought that I was lying to her and just walked in off the street. She asked to see my ID card, I showed it to her. She then said nothing? No regrets or compassion for the circumstances I was in due to no fault of my own. She should be fired for her poor attitude and poor customer service!! Finally, she issued me another room on the 16th floor, it was now 4 AM. I asked her for the same type room as I had with a similar chair due to my bad back, she said the room was the exact same room. I left towing all my bags back up to the Tower 2 16th floor still in very much pain. No offer of a bellman to help me was given or suggested by the lady at any time! I got to the room I was reassigned on floor 16 and upon inspection there was no chair as I had requested at the desk and I was told it would be the same room. I called Cari? at the Check In Desk, I told her it was not a room with a chair, she told me that at time it was the best she could do! I told her that due to no fault of my own I had been up all night and I was going to hold out for a room with a chair as I had requested in a courteous manner previously under stressful conditions. She sent a bellman to the room with another Key to a room on floor 16. I asked the bellman to assist me and he said he just brought the key! I went to the next room assigned on floor 16 and it also was the same devoid of any chair, the bellman had departed. I called the Front Desk again and identified myself and told Cari? that the second room was also without a chair and was unsuitable again. It was now 4:45 AM. She said she found a room on Tower 2 Floor 3 Room 1 that had a chair, again the bellman brought up another key and left, not offering to help with the luggage. I went down the elevator to floor 3, found the room, it had a couch, so that was good enough for me at 5:00 AM. However it was 60 degrees due to being on full AC blast, on the ground floor and on the end of Tower 2. I turned the heat on full blast and crawled into bed, tired, angry, in pain, and disgusted with the Excalibur Hotel and its staff that included, security, Check in (Cari?), and the Bellmen. On Friday morning, February 11th at 3:35 AM I left my room, I went down the fire escape exit stairs next to my room to the ground and pulled my bags to the taxi stand nearby and departed for the airport to catch my flight, wondering if I would ever stay at the Excalibur Hotel again! In Summation: I am almost 70 and I look somewhat old , but I have 22 years of formal education and 25 years of technical education, very computer literate, and knowledgeable in many areas and very sharp mentally. I travel often. In my history of travel, I have never been treated the way I was treated on February 8th/9th by the staff of Excalibur Hotel. I felt I was disrespected, mistreated, and rudely accommodated by your staff due to circumstances I did not create! I found your staff ignorant, uncaring, rude, and unaccommodating. You should have a simple procedure in place for the immediate cleanup of a dry powder fire extinguisher discharged by idiotic guests, rather than evacuating and moving the whole wing of guests. I guarantee you it will happen again and again due to alcohol and stupidity combined! Where was your security and the cameras? Were the perpetrators apprehended? Why should I be severely inconvenienced by your lack of professionalism and poorly trained staff? I would like some answers to my questions concerning this matter. If I receive none from you, I will go to your General Manager for resolution and ask for your termination as the Guest Relations Representative. I have written to him previously with similar complaints and will attach that letter to this E-mail reply as an attachment. I look forward to your reply soon! In closing, I was very disappointed during my stay in February at the Excalibur Hotel due to the above circumstances! Sincerely, James E. Malloch

Reviews.Title: “Raze the Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: excalibrated
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the Excalibur is leaving, Room 4246 has view of a wall. One drawer on the bureau doesn't stay closed. Luckily, the previous occupants left the rolled-up cardboard they used to jam the drawer shut. The bureau had a safe but it couldn't be used because one of the bureau doors wouldn't open. The bedcover had multiple stains. There was a whole pretzel on the closet floor when we arrived, Supposedly, it's a non-smoking room but the casino must exhaust directly below because every time the fan is used, there's the smell of smoke. They must be aiming for the dundgeon feel in Tower Two because the feel is dingy. The best thing would be if someone bought the Excalibur and tore it down p.s. You're charged $14/day for internet, fax and fitness center even if you will not use them.

Reviews.Title: “Way better than we thought, loved it here.”
Reviews.Author: breekick
Reviews.Content: After reading previous reviews for Excalibur we didn't have high hopes. We thought we'd just get a good deal, well we got way more. We booked over the phone because we are Mlife members (Excalibur is an MGM resort) and the phone reservation operator Yuki was great. Once we got there we checked in in the VIP area (highly recommended, become a member online) and I just asked if the happened to have an upgrade from the basic room. Well they gave us a deluxe room for the same price and were so nice about it. The room was so much better than expected I wish I would have taken a pic. King bed was so comfy and with a flat screen too. After seeing Linkin Park live at MGM arena we were so tired and it was so nice to come back to such a soft and specious bed. Oh and the sales people in the lobby are not as bed as other reviewers said, they are there still but not as bad as other resorts we have stayed in like Bally's. We didn't get much gambling in but what we did was good.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: RoadtripperColl
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a weekend in Las Vegas and a stay at the Excalibur. This would not have been my first choice of hotels in Las Vegas but we got a great package deal from USAir vacations and figured for the price it would be fine. We were given an upgraded room with the deal which was nicely furnished with a flat screen TV and a updated bathroom with granite counter tops. The room was clean and the service at the hotel was great! An added bonus was the pool was open, where many hotels have their pools closed in February. We were pleased with the speed and efficiency of the check in and check out process and all the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. The housekeepers especially! Location was at the end of the strip but we didn't mind the walk. Overall we had a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur is consistently the best value on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Tmopks
Reviews.Content: At twenty years old, Excalibur might be considered old by Vegas standards, but it looks as good as ever and offers more bang for the buck than any other hotel on the Strip. From the excellent customer service at check-in, to the updated rooms and the clean and always-evolving casino, Excalibur offers everything I would want from a value-priced hotel located off the Strip, but which happens to be located at the most vibrant corner in Las Vegas right on the Strip. My mid-week, off-season rates were $30/night. For that price I got a recently-updated room plus all the amenities of a resort casino. What really sets Excalibur apart, however, is the ease of getting out to explore the other casinos on the Strip. You can visit Luxor and Mandalay Bay without even going outside, or easily walk to New York New York or MGM Grand in minutes. You can set out on foot to explore the Strip, or board the monorail at MGM to go downtown or stop at attractions along the way. Though still a fun medieval-style ambiance, I was a little disapointed that the roaming entertainers, like the jugglers and puppeters, have been replaced by hucksters selling vacation packages and show tickets. Like everywhere on the Strip, you have to learn to walk straight ahead and not make eye contact, or you will constantly be harrassed by people wanting to sell you something. Nevertheless, when compared to any other hotel experience, Excalibur offers a value unparalled anywhere else, and remains my favorite place to stay in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here and save your pennies for the casinos”
Reviews.Author: Buffers
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its location and price. It next door to Luxor and New York New York (and MGM and Tropicana) We've stayed at Luxor before, which was wonderful, but wanted to try somewhere different. The Excalibur is a fun cheap hotel. The gambling tables are cheap and the staff are nice if you get to know them, poker tournaments are cheap all day. The hotel could be described as medieval and/or tired! after all you're supposed to be staying in a medieval hotel, so what do you expect? The rooms were spacious and clean, no problems with anything. The couple we went with stayed at MGM for 5 days and Bellagio for 2 days, and they still walked down to the Excalibur for the gambling. It cost us about £250 for a weeks stay, so go on, why stay in a more expensive hotel? Get on the deuce bus and go to the Las Vegas outlet centre for some bargains, or if you're looking for designer then go to Mile?? centre (opposite Bellagio)

Reviews.Title: “Just the Basics”
Reviews.Author: sdudley24
Reviews.Content: OK...so the room we stayed in was very plain...seemed a bit dated...but it's not like we were in the room very long, so it was no big deal. The beds were comfy and there was plenty of room for our luggage. Our only complaints were the mandatory service fees when you book the room AND the adult pool was a bit filthy. Overall this is one of the best deals in Vegas to get you on the strip, and I think you'll be fine staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price!”
Reviews.Author: SophieT1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Excalibur with my 2 sons (12 & 7) in Sept for 5 nights. We had a great time and found the hotel excellent value for the price. The pool area was great with plenty of sun chairs. The boys loved the waterslide and spent hours on it! Those that complain about the rooms, food, smoke etc seem to forget they are not in a 5 star hotel. What do they expect for the price they pay (for the record our room was clean, quiet and the smoke didnt bother us, it was no worse than other casinos we visited) It is located on the strip, close to all the action and for the price cant be beat!!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for CES 2011, it was OK but nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: izardak
Reviews.Content: I had to stay somewhere to get to CES 2011, so I've chosen this hotel because it was not expensive and there was a good transportation. The hotel's infrastructure looked a bit aging, but it was ok and clean. I liked swimming in the pool. There were even 2 guards on duty though I was the only one swimming, perhaps because it was about +10C in the air. On the first day of staying there I've tried breakfast in the hotel's restaurants and the food was tasteless. So on the following days I went to Starbucks near one of the exits, it was much better there. I can't write anything about gambling because I am not interested, but the casino area was very busy at any time I've passed through. It was also very easy and fast to get to the Strip to see other hotels and attractions, so hotel's location is quite good.

Reviews.Title: “DOWNRIGHT TERRIBLE, SMOKEFILLED GARABAGE CAN”
Reviews.Author: lcgbar
Reviews.Content: The sink would not drain. The housekeeping would wipe out with a towel. The toilet tank cover would not fit properly. The shower would hold water so you were standing in the backed up mess. The smoke came tn the room from the airconditioner-heater. The casino and card tables were so smoke-filled you had trouble breathing. I am so glad I never spent any time playing. Too bad I have to write this review. Never again to stay in the EXCALIBUR... @11114 room # Lawrence

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Krzysztofgolec
Reviews.Content: Great location, restaurants and shows. Very clean, friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous time, great service and fantastic room and a super value!”
Reviews.Author: EricaIsWickless
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas for my best friends wedding at the Excaliber chapel. We arrived on a Wednesday afternoon around noon and we were able to check in very quickly with the help of the very friendly clerk. When we went up to our room we were SUPER impressed by the room, totally remodled with a FABULOUS view of the strip! It was large and very nice and we couldn't have been happier for the price we paid which was less for 3 nights than we would have paid for one night at most other casinos on the strip! The room was very clean and the bed was comfy. They cleaned and brought fresh towels every day. One afternoon I asked for an extra blanket and in less than 5 minutes they had one up to me! The bar tender at the bar in the casino was super awesome and friendly. Dicks in the casino is super fun, good food and a total blast! The buffet wasn't worth what they charge but wasn't bad. Lots of other food choices at the food court or go right next door to New York New York and lots of food options there too. Overall great stay, wish it was closer to the center of the strip but not bad and a fun walk. Would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “More Bang For Your Buck!!!”
Reviews.Author: Shika1974
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Excalibur for 2 nights at a going rate of 38 bucks per nights.Nice &clean rooms.We stayed in a newly upgraded rooms, no complaints on my end.I will stay again at Excalibur.

Reviews.Title: “Room showing its age”
Reviews.Author: RelaxedYo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were excited that we were able to stay at the Excalibur for a decent price. Well I think that we were both disappointed that the room had no mid-evil theme or character at all, I would compare this room to a low end motel 6 room. The walls in this hotel were so thin I could hear conversations in the hall like I was in the middle of them. I came home with a rash from something on the linens. The more expensive rooms may be nice in this hotel, but the low end rooms aren't worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Tellingitlikeiseeit
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in a tower room for about $50 per night. The room was about the same standard as an average to low quality motel. It was clean and comfortable and unremarkable. Staff service was pleasant except that the garbage bins in my room were full on arrival and it took 3 telephone calls to housekeeping before someone came to take out the trash. The location was decent, near the bottom of the strip near to some of the major casinos such as MGM and NY NY. But if you want to go further north to see the outdoor shows of the Bellagio, Treasure island and Mirage then plan to take a cab, monorail or bus as the walk is about 45-60 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and even better location!”
Reviews.Author: ColombiaJuanSe
Reviews.Content: I travelled witha couple of friends and booked two rooms at the Excalibur. Our main objective was to gamble and do a lot of hotel hopping in the Strip, reason why we chose this place. We always rent a car, since the distances between hotels are too long and walking is dreadful. The hotel offered us a two queen bedroom suite and another one with a King size bed, I took for myself. The rooms were spacious, had a great view and the staff kept our rooms clean and tidy. At the Excalibur, there´s also a convenient food court, which allowed us to just stay there and not go out to find our food, plus we realized they also offered and all day 24 hour All You Can eat buffet, for just $24,99 which we decided not to take, because we were always out. For people deciding to stay at the hotel most of the times, I guess that it would be an excellent option. The free internet in the rooms and parking, are also a good added value, though most hotels also offer those two essentials. I would go back, though in Vegas the great thing is to change hotels and get to experience different options every time we go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: CoBa80
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I honestly was positively surprised about the hotel, prices and the rooms. Ask for a room at Tower II as they are renovated. Had a great view (floor 26), two large comfy beds and the location on the strip cannot be better ! The crowd is more younger, not so high class. If you look for something more fancy, try another one.

Reviews.Title: “When in vegas Baby ...”
Reviews.Author: Elton_B
Reviews.Content: I spend a night in Vegas and given the nature of my stay doing all things Vegas in a short space of time I decided on Excalibur. It was perfect place to get some shut eye at a very reasonalble rate. Being upgraded to a delux suite also endeared me even more to the hotel. I think it ideally located on the strip for it was one walk in one direction taking in some of the more swankier Hotels like the Bellagio and Ceaser Palace. Lotsa of places to eat from and lotsa slot machines. Very busy on the game floor, conveniance and a play area for children all in good value for money if that is what you looking for. Service wasn't bad either given the amount of people the hotel services

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay As Always!!!”
Reviews.Author: H82w0rk
Reviews.Content: We always stay at Excalibur and have always had a great room and service. Every time we stay here the staff is excellent, rooms are great and clean, and the restaurants always have good food. Can't wait for our next stay in Vegas!!!

Reviews.Title: “I wont come back”
Reviews.Author: dscharf
Reviews.Content: I always stay at nicer hotels but decided to go cheap for my one night stay. The room was what I expected for the price. Casino is old. Checking in was quick but the front desk agent was not friendly at all. The day of checkout at 7:45 they start doing construction beneath our room. Drilling and banging. I called to complain. Waited on hold for 15 min and all the woman offered was a room change or late checkout. What's the point of staying later if I have to listen to that and why would I get up and move all of my stuff to checkout in a few hours? I asked to speak to another manager. I was told pam byery or pryery would call me but she never did. Extremely ride of them to start that type of work at such an early hour. They could have told me when I checked in that construction was going on. Ill never come back and discourage anyone I know from staying there.

Reviews.Title: “It's only somewhere to lay your head”
Reviews.Author: Superwing27
Reviews.Content: Never having been to Las Vegas before we were a little apprehensive about the Excalibur given the reviews however we needn't have worried. $20 from McCarran to the lobby, that's how close you are. Reception, or registration as it's called, sorted in a flash and Tower 1 24th floor it was. Never had a problem getting an elevator at any time. We had a standard room and it was huge by UK standards as was the en-suite (no bath just a massive shower). Two UK king size beds, flat screen tv, table and chairs, enough room for two couples to stay. Decor is a bit dated but as the title suggests we were only there to sleep. Worst part for us was the Las Vegas attitude to smoking. Every casino floor allowed it however the Excalibur turned a blind eye to it happening everywhere. Access and egress is largely through the casino so be prepared to smell like an ash tray every day. Despite other reviews I would recommend eating at the Roundtable. $25 each for all three meals, all you can eat buffet. Food was perfectly acceptable on every occasion we were there and plenty of it, choice and portion. If you want oppulance and staff falling at your feet then the Bellagio is up the strip but have your Platinum card ready. Worst part after the smoking is the continual harrasment every hundred yards or so of the free show offers. Nothing comes for free, it's a time share pitch with the promise of free shows and clubs. Even the free tickets we did get had a drinks minimum. Excalibur was an excellent base, New York New York over the way next to MGM, Luxor and Mandalay Bay next door via a free mono rail, over head walkways keep you away from the traffic too. No frills is not the worst choice in the world, believe me.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: 21Roberto
Reviews.Content: We took a trip to Las Vegas for Super Bowl weekend at the Excalibur. After reading other reviews I was a bit worried when it came time to arrive and check in. After my stay, I can't wait to go back! Check in was a breeze. Friendly people to deal with. We had a Widescreen room which was very nice. We didn't have a view, we were over looking the back side of the castle. It was ok since we didn't plan on being in the room much anyway. Hotel room was spacious for 2 people. Bathroom was nice, beds were comfy. Casino floor was easy to navigate. Food court upstairs and other restaurants on main level. Sports book staff was great on Super Sunday. We had a blast! And the Packers won!!! The pool was nice, a bit chilly to swim but we did sit outside and enjoy the sun for a bit. If there was any complaint it would be the walk to the room. We had to walk the whole distance of the casino to Tower 2 with our luggage. Not bad for us but for an older couple may be an issue. There are alot of the time share people greeting you at the entrances and also trying to sell you show tickets. We just shook our head and kept walking. There is a charge for each day of $12.50 but it is like that at most hotels. For that you do receive wired internet service, use of the robes and fitness center. Not a bad deal. Will definately look at staying again when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “my terrible holiday”
Reviews.Author: doggyandnelly
Reviews.Content: the service was terrible when we first came in the room there was blood on the beds and pillow cases and cigarette burns and holes in the carpet and we rang for someone to change the bedding and a man came up then he dragged both of the bedding off the beds left the in the corner and said move them and here is your other bedding screwed up in a ball which was really not nice. the room smelled and behind the head board there was live wires if i lent over in my sleep i think i would of been dead if i had of touched it because the wires was showing and the shower did hardly work it was just trickling and the sink taps was the same . the location from the hotel to the other hotels was 100 % great i like the most about excalibur the sherwood cafe they do good food and drinks. i lked the hilton hotel because it was filled full of elvis presley stuff. i did not like the excalibur hotel hotel rooms and staff when we went out to the pool one day we was only out an hour and when we got back our safe was open and money stolen the amount was £ 230 english money and $ 207 dollars and $ 200 dollars out of another purse only certain staff with a card can get in our rooms what already been cleaned we noticed a cleaner when we was going out once doing rooms lay on the bed watching tv with a cigarette i really do not recommend the excalibur hotel to any one and out of the money what was stolen we only got £ 75 back .

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: Ligeia_ppgl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located, but somehow dark and old. It was ok for the price, but I think the difference with the MGM makes that one a better option. Carpets were definitely dirty, and the halls were dark, making things appear to be even dirtier. It was connected to New York New York, and from that one you can easily to go MGM. The last one has the better casino. I must add that I did my reservations through expedia wrong. They did not change them, but I could get in for the right time. Expedia was great and canceled the wrong reservation I had made.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Voyageur1964
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at Excalibur Hotel last week of september 2010. Reservation by internet is very good. You cannot get better hotel for their price. (Excellent value). Very good caring staff. The room was very basic but clean and very quiet. The hotel buffet is basic and is the same everyday and doesn't worth the cost of it ! Go eat somewhere else ! Casino is as good as the other on the strip, Ambiance and decor are very good. Overall, I would go back to this hotel and I would recommend it to my friend and family

Reviews.Title: “Didn't even make it there and hate the service already. Fees for everything.”
Reviews.Author: laughlic
Reviews.Content: Can't cancel my reservations online or by phone. Horrible service. When I cancel online I get an error message. When I cancel via phone I get a busy signal. Awful! Avoid the headache. Fees for everything. Tried calling and speaking to a person only to be transferred to the reservation line which was not working.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Hotel in Las Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: LMargaret W
Reviews.Content: This is, obviously, now one of the older hotel on the Las Vegas strip. Ok decor, but nothing special. Check in/out service was ok. Other staff within the hotel were hit and miss, when it came to friendly service. On our first night we tried the buffet restaurant, but it felt like we were back in the dining hall, at school, so we didn't eat there again. Next morning we decided to try the seated waitress service restaurant (sorry the name escapes me), which was much better, for food, but a bit slow on service. Though it was more friendly that the buffet restaurant. The one big negative i have about the Hotel is the bar named "DICKS". There were alot of children walking around the hotel (I think people see this as a family themed hotel, due to the hotels facade). One evening we came back a walked past "DICKS" to find a woman (who appeared to work for the hotel) on a table doing a sort of lap/pole dance. I'm no prude, but think this not what children should be seeing. I been to Vegas a couple of times, staying at various hotel and I have to say this on was the worst so far.

Reviews.Title: “A Smoke Chimney”
Reviews.Author: martymania85
Reviews.Content: For the price it is a good value hotel...but man I have never seen so many smokers. It is like walking into a cigarette factory. This hotel seems to cater to the older crowd. You will see a lot of scooters and oxygen masks, I think some of the people literally are glued to the machine and will have skin rip off if they leave. If you want to save a few bucks and don't mind the smoke not a bad deal, but for ~10 dollars more you can stay @ MGM or Luxor and it's less smokey.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: fitz11
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5. We booked 2 widescreen rooms and were very happy with the rooms. Great front desk service, we had our rooms adjoining. Beds were comfortable, safe in room as well as internet. Lifts fast and efficient. Fast food places everywhere McDonald s etc. Best value is all you can eat buffet $25- for all day meals. Lots of fresh fruit and variety of hot and cold food for breakfast, lunch, dinner. We did this 4 days in a row. Works out $8- a meal including hot or cold drinks, dessert etc unlimited. Not in the central part of the strip but their is a monorail directly across from the Excalibur at the MGM. We walked it not a problem. Rooms a little dark with lighting but otherwise a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “An insult to other 3-star hotels”
Reviews.Author: jeannette777
Reviews.Content: I can't believe this is called a 3-star hotel. It is the worst hotel I have stayed at since I accidentally booked a 1-star in 2004. If I were one of the many comfortable, pretty, polite 3-star hotels I have previously stayed in, I would be very insulted that Excalibur was put in my class. The best thing about the place is leaving it. Things right with Excalibur: 1) A pool is actually open through the winter 2) Cheap rates 3) They recycle Things wrong with Excalibur: 1) Dated, dingy, very low quality room furnishings - and this is in "upgraded" rooms. Bed sheets and towels were great quality, but everything else from mattress to wallpaper is cheap cheap cheap and uncomfortable. 1A) The mattress especially sucked. 2) Non-smoking rooms that are clearly not non-smoking. 3) A staff that refuses to move you to a truly non-smoking room - and lies about the hotel being fully booked - until you call Travelocity to have them intervene. 4) Terrible proprietary dining establishments. 5) No room service in the evenings. 6) No mini-fridge in-room. 7) The total absence of any of the nice little touches that make it pleasant to stay in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Should have paid a little extra”
Reviews.Author: Dodger482
Reviews.Content: Arrived on a late flight from Toronto (mdnight PST)...got to the hotel and was told the place fully booked...i had made a reservation on line and pre paid the hotel.....it took over 30 minutes to find me a room (not fun).....the room was absolutely gross, things were broken, water running in the bathroom, no safe (when i called down to ask about the safe the girl said there should be one there maybe it got stolen...WOW)...its just not a very nice place to stay, very run down and the service is very slow

Reviews.Title: “The classic 90's room.”
Reviews.Author: Freelancenw
Reviews.Content: This hotel is straight out of the 90's. It could really use a remodel to the rooms. No the less, it has maintained very well and is a great location on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “It was fine for the price of the stay”
Reviews.Author: mountaingirl73
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went with 3 other couples and we picked this place because we had visited the hotel on our previous trip. At Check In the lady was fairly rude and when I asked about upgrading to Tower 2 (because that's what I have been reading and a couple of friends told us to do as well) she didn't even look me in the eye and said it's $20.00 a night to upgrade to Tower 2. I opted against it because the $12.95 fee per night for whatever they need it for, seemed enough. So meeting up with the other couples that we came with, one of them was offered an upgrade to Tower 2 for $10.00 a night so I went and stood in line again to see what the deal was.The guy behind the desk was pleasant and said that sometimes different managers give different discounts at different times?? Whatever, I just wanted the upgrade so I decided to pay the $10.00. We had stayed at NYNY the last time we were in Vegas, and we both thought the room at Excalibur was better than NYNY. Waited forever on more than one occasion to get a drink and ended up paying for them up at the bar. I agree with the person that said in their review that it's pretty sad that we you get treated better at other hotels that you visit than the one that you stay at. All in all, for the price, it was a good place to get a few hours of sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Over Pirced @ $39.00!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: skidoo44
Reviews.Content: I have stayed there twice now, once 18 years ago and in Jan 2011. What needs to happen is HollyWood needs to make a movie and destroy another hotel...and use this one!! The only bright part was when I left for my meeting the casino was empty and I did have to walk throught a smokey and MUSKY casino that was empty. The Ramkota in Bismarck has better rooms !!!! Tear It Down!!!! Take a look at the Picture can you say REDRUM!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Vegas perfect hotel for Vegas fun!”
Reviews.Author: gavandstace
Reviews.Content: Check in: We tried the 20 dollar trick and got an upgraded room with amazing views of New York New York and MGM Grand. Checked in quickly and was very efficient. Room: The room was much bigger than expected- it was very comfy and had everything we needed for an enjoyable stay. Service: The maids cleaned our room every day- no problems. Apart from our last day where the key no longer worked think we had been 'wiped out' too early which was frustrating. Pool: Fair do's the pool was good it was the main reason we booked this hotel as a lot of the other pools seem to be small/ in the shade. We were down the pool early and it was quiet during this time it got very busy later on in the day though. Restaurants: We had breakfast one day and tried a few of the places in the food court and they were all good- not gourmet by any means but this is not supposed to be a five star hotel. Bars: We didn't really drink in any of the bars- Dicks Last Resort seemed too loud and in your face for us- we mainly drunk whilst gambling anyway. Casino: The casino is very loud and is huge! We gambled a bit here but did most of the gambling at other casinos. We played a lot of slots here and had fun whilst doing so. The drinks service was pretty bad compared to the other hotels we went to- very slow. The casino was also a lot smokier than the others we enjoyed more Location: Not the best location on the strip but we loved all of the adjoining hotels and spent a lot of time at mandalay bay and Luxor which is all joined up by a long corridor. Next tim e we go we would probably stay at paris or Bally's which is more centrally located on the strip. Overall: We weren't going to stay here originally but due to the ash cloud our holiday was cancelled and we had to pay so much more to fly out a few weeks later. we are glad we chose this hotel it exceedeed our expectations and we were out most of the days anyway exploring.

Reviews.Title: “good location nice pool”
Reviews.Author: chrisc1502
Reviews.Content: upon arrival i asked at reception if there were any free upgrades available as did the guy nxt to me, he got told no i got a free upgrade....no idea why but i was glad.room was spacious with good sunrise view. on 2nd night the room nxt door was partying all night so the nxt day i requested to be moved and as an apology they gave us a free upgrade to a king suit, very big massive tv and very quiet. the pool was nice, hot tub amazing. good locaiton about $15 in a taxi from the airport and on way back to airport a guy asked if we wanted to hare a cab to the airport so it only cost $7 on the return as we shared cost.we did the all day buffet one day to try it for $25 each, we found it ok but a bit annoying that to eat u have to get back the hotel as u feel if u eat out ur wasting ur money so if ur gona stay local for the day deffiatly do it. overall good hotel, a bit smelly in the reception/casino but which hotel in vegas isnt?

Reviews.Title: “Overcharged for services!”
Reviews.Author: Rebelli0n
Reviews.Content: This is an ok Hotel to stay in. Nothing more, but I have to give the Hotel an overall rating of 1 because: 1) They charge you daily for using the internet 2) The internet is not wireless 3) At checkin I asked to use the internet for no more than 3 days and asked if I had to pay for all 5 days (and they said I only had to pay when the internet was used) 4) Day 1 internet does not work and I go to Tropicana to use the internet there (front desk says Oh no you dont have to pay for today) Anyhow long story short on checkout day I have to pay 60$ for using the internet! The manager simply said I had been misinformed and that it was nothing she could do! Thats just silly nonsense. All in all i recommend staying across the street at Tropicana! I will not stay at Excaligash again.

Reviews.Title: “A stop on a tour of hell, well maybe not so bad..”
Reviews.Author: pookiegalore
Reviews.Content: I will never stay at this hotel again! Full of smoke, screaming people and horrible service. its bad when you get better service from hotels you aren't staying at!

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for your buck in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Faith5782
Reviews.Content: First time to Vegas so I wasn't sure where to stay. This place is excellent for the price. The room had a wonderful view and it was clean and quiet. The casino kept the drinks flowing and the mall attached was great for that morning coffee or late night snack.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price, but a little out-dated and dark”
Reviews.Author: jason_rocks
Reviews.Content: The price is great for this hotel, but the standard room is out-dated. If you are looking for luxury, you might want to spend a little more money for another hotel. There are many options out there. Food is alright, but location is great. It is also dark in there and is not too perfect for gaming.

Reviews.Title: “Stay @ Excaibur”
Reviews.Author: skyfox69
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the stay. Clean room, excellent maid service, comfortable. Good service in restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for what's considered a moderate resort in WDW Resort”
Reviews.Author: swk728
Reviews.Content: Typically we stay @ the deluxe resorts in Walt Disney World (Animal Kingdom Lodge, Wilderness Lodge) but this time we decided to try one of the moderates. Our trip was 10 days with the Disney dining plan and 10 day park hoppers. I have to say that the Coronado Springs Resort is a very good value and a very good moderate resort and we would stay there again in the future. The layout of this resort is in stark contrast to the layouts of the Deluxe resorts in the way that it is all separate buildings not connected with a bit of walking involved. As anyone who has stayed in the deluxe resorts knows everything is connected under one roof (concierge, dining, photo-pass, gift shops, most amenities, etc). The Pepper Market @ C.S. is an awesome place to grab a bite to eat with loads of choices and delicious foods (loved and would recommend the goat cheese pizza). Coronado Springs also has a great gift shop. The pool areas are nice, they have several what they call "quiet pools" in each separate section of the resort and one large themed pool area with an arcade, bar, hot tub and all types of other activities. I only visited the large pool twice because it was a 10 min walk from my end of the resort so I didn't get to spend much time there. Our family ended up buying into the Disney Vacation Club so my next review will be Bay Lake Tower when we stay there this upcoming Nov 2011

Reviews.Title: “Good times”
Reviews.Author: pixiedreamer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Excalibur in Vegas over the weekend (1/21-22/11). I had never stayed at this hotel before but have gone through the casino area plenty of times in previous years. The casino/ shops are OK and thought the rooms would be the same. The room was really nice with a view of the Luxor. Really good price on the room as well. The only problem was that I had placed my bag on the floor of the "closet" area and when I had left the next day, it was all wet. The whole floor was wet, I can only guess that the shower leaked... may be a problem for the hotel. Other then that, great service, quiet, and nice room.

Reviews.Title: “First visit with wife and it was great!”
Reviews.Author: Encinoman333
Reviews.Content: Room was great with super view of strip. Great location to most anywhere you want to go.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: luis084
Reviews.Content: On a recent vacation to Las Vegas, myself and two friends booked a week at the Excalibur. After two days, one of my room mates began to develop a severe rash on his hands and arms. On the third day, the rash extended to his leg, neck and forehead. Early on the evening of the third day, we received a message from the front desk informing us that they needed to change our room due to an infestation. We were not told what the cause of the infestation was. Finally, my roommates arm swelled to the point that he had to be rushed to the emergency room. He was informed by the doctors that he had been bitten by bedbugs.

Reviews.Title: “Dark, dirty and lacking the essentials.”
Reviews.Author: wadoe80
Reviews.Content: As we sit at the airport reflecting on our stay it is almost comical. Our room was mediocre putting it nicely lacking bare essentials, lightbulbs and working lights, I know its supposed to have that "midevil darkness," but this was downright depressing! Our first morning we even thought the room was lacking hot water but upon further investigation we discovered the sink was hooked up backwards. Our room was on the 7th floor tower 1 and the window was so dirty one could only see the light come through, however, our view was a cinderblock wall so it didn't matter much. Halls dirty with toilet paper, paper and beer bottles thrown about. The casino itself is the same dirty mess with trash everywhere except the can!
