And those annoying, harrassing timeshare people..... seriouly? Why did I encounter them only at the Excaliber? Not to drag this on any further but sitting at a bar hearing him complain to another employee about poor management and his hours being reduced is not something I want to hear on your vacation. Spend a little more and stay elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Accommodations and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: harly91
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 5 night stay in LV at the Excalibur and this facility can't be beat for the money. I was a little hesitant about booking at the Excalibur after reading some of the negative reviews on this site, but I can tell you that this hotel casino was excellent. The location is great and is a 2 minute walk to the Tropicana, Luxor, MGM and New York New York. The hotel staff was nice and courteous, the facility was clean, the room was fine, and the hotel offered all the amenities that I needed. One of the most complained about items is the $12.50 resort fee but even with that added in to the cost, the nightly fee totaled only $50. For all you whiners and complainers that rated this hotel poorly, break out your wallet next time and pay the $300/night if you want something better. I can say without hesitation that this hotel is the best value on the strip. I don't normally write reviews, but I felt compelled to on this one because this hotel really deserves an A+. I'd stay there again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place To Stay In Vegas”
Reviews.Author: picky_travler_11
Reviews.Content: I was there for New Years 2010/2011 and had a ball, the hotel location is great, just down the elevator and a short 2min walk and your on the famous strip. I was on the 13th floor in tower 1. The beds are good (soft) but there's no fridge, kettle or toaster in the room, the garbo's can get noisy at times sorting out the rubbish, For the girls there's plenty of shoping in all the hotels. Most of the hotel car parking is a fair way away, nearly a 10min walk but I was lucky and was able to park in a section about a 1min walk from the hotel. I'll come back to this hotel again next time I'm in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: kosmo1968
Reviews.Content: Last time I visited LV I stayed at IP, so I did want a bit of an upgrade. Gets top marks for being right on the strip, and a short and cheap $2 bus trip from the airport. Did look at the reviews and each to his own opinion, but I had no problem with the "standard room". For me its not necessary to upgrade to the "widescreen" room. Maybe I just lucked out, but the room was big eough and clean enough. Was on a non smoking floor, but I guess years ago all floors were non smoking so took a night to adjust to it. I also agree the "resort" fee is a scam, but all hotels charge varying amounts, plus tax! The casino section of the Hotel as well as the outside of it does need a fresh coat of paint, not a major overhaul, just a touch up. Hotel and casino were generally clean, but maybe reduced staff lead to many unclean elevators. No big deal, but to see the same bits of paper and such throughout the day, meant to me its not cleaned regularly. Would recommend as a budget hotel especially this close on the "strip".

Reviews.Title: “Got more than what I expected”
Reviews.Author: ALLIGATOR9
Reviews.Content: New Year's eve in Las Vegas! Last minute planning got me a room at Excalibur at a decent rate compared to other hotels. I wasnt expecting much and as it is had decided to spend time at other casinos on the strip. But surprisingly Excalibur was buzzing with people & I spent my entire 2 days in Excalibur. Though the room was dingy with a dark carpet & someone had a dog barking in one of the rooms. Anyways hardly a place to spend time in the room. Ofcourse the mid-night celebrations of NYE on the strip was an exception but it was good fun to be in Excalibur. 2010 ended on a decent note.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargin”
Reviews.Author: landsbieber
Reviews.Content: Great location on strip, Great price. Great comps. Buffet all day pass good. Mc Donalds in hotel. Room Clean and good size . Wired internet. ( inclued in resort fee)

Reviews.Title: “Average room with AWESOME jacuzzi. Nice staff. $14 fee unfavorable.”
Reviews.Author: tntgirll
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for an affordable place to stay for one night due to difficulty finding reservations. We checked in late (shortly after midnight) and called to let them know - the staff was very polite and accommodating. When we got there, they gave us a free upgrade to a jacuzzi room, which I had low expectations for, but it was actually AMAZING and was a full sized huge jacuzzi in the room, which you fill with hot water and just ENJOY all the space! The few things we did not like: The hotel is still using old beadspreads and pillow shams which had yellow stains and looked REALLY used. We folded it all up and stuck it in the closet. The sheets were otherwise very clean, bathroom was nice. There was a loud music thumping from somewhere nearby at 8 AM which was also annoying. The other thing is that there is a $14 fee which pays for internet, gym, newspaper- stuff we did not use anyway and I would prefer not to pay this fee! But overall, we would still consider staying there again if not for the jacuzzi alone.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to start.”
Reviews.Author: TheButcherBunch
Reviews.Content: Room was good fairly clean although bed spreads had many stains on them. Window curtain didn't meet in the middle so you had this bright light streaming in quite early. Elevators were busy and often had to wait for some time. Our room had towels for 3 people so we rang for more no one came we went out and came back and had to ring and ask again. Safe in the room was convenient. Fun dungeon needs a little TLC games not working which is a shame as it was great place for kids. Position was good being on the end of the strip as you could escape the crowds. Inside walk thru to the Luxor was good. Outside bridge walk to New York was quick and easy. We enjoyed the castle features. No laundry, you could send your clothes out to be laundered but seemed very expensive as they charge per article - cheaper to buy new clothes out on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Added daily Fees”
Reviews.Author: Metcalfe01
Reviews.Content: Watch out for the extra $12.50 daily charge they hit you with when you check in. When asked why it wasn't Included in the original price. They explained it's for the use of their fitness center whether you use it or not. Typical missleading advertising.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but a strange noise..”
Reviews.Author: MrEcosse
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Excalibur during the CES show early January. Over time they have removed more and more of the 'Castle Decorations' from the property. In time no doubt it will have the same cookie cutter look as many of the other hotels on the strip - personally I think this is a shame. We were allocated one of the freshened wide-screen rooms. Room was good size for the price, clean and everything worked. Odd arrangement with the blinds which might make it difficult to sleep during the day. Only complaint was droning noise coming from somewhere but not in the room itself. Might be pipes somewhere but given it was January the air con wasn't running. Being at the end of the strip is not as convenient as say the IP mid-strip but this is a much better hotel and not much more money.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel can't be beat for the money!”
Reviews.Author: Joyce1208
Reviews.Content: The Excalibur is a wonderful hotel. It is very clean. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The beds were very comfortable and the room was very quiet.. The maid service was excellent. The location is also excellent. This was a great stay for a bargain price!

Reviews.Title: “Convienent location.”
Reviews.Author: jmlr
Reviews.Content: The resort is in a convenient place on the strip and easy to access from the highway. The staff is most helpful. The food court on the upper level features a variety of choices. The price can't be beat and there is plenty of entertainment within the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: EMoney99
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Vegas alone in December for a 4 day get away and stayed at Excalibur for a really great price. The goal of my trip was to relax and just let anything happen, and Excalibur allowed me to do so. I had a fantastic room, which was probably only fantastic to me because it had a terrible view, but since I was there to get away from it all, I didn't mind one bit that I couldn't see the outside world. Its in a very convenient location to practically everything I wanted to see and do. Room service and housekeeping were quick and efficient. Everything I needed I was able to get and the casino and hotel staff was very friendly. I will definitely be staying at Excalibur again and highly recommend a visit!

Reviews.Title: “vegas baby”
Reviews.Author: jaman_spake
Reviews.Content: We went to vegas on a budget. Loved our place, the pools , the casino, and the near by shows. I will try to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Better hotel than Circus Circus”
Reviews.Author: kok0222
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at Circus Circus but since staying during holidays I thought Circus Circus would be to crowded with children. I thought Excalibur would be better choice and it was. Check in was very quick, short, and staff was knowledgable. Room was on the side of New York New York and enjoyed the view each evening. Yes, I would stay here again!!!! I very muchly enjoyed my stay! I might not the next time but I did this time.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated hotel with a bad smell”
Reviews.Author: Leather_Egg
Reviews.Content: The hotel is outdated. We stayed there just because of the price. The room is clean. We booked two rooms and one of the room kind of smell. When you visited other hotel and come back at night you will really notice the bad smell in the hotel lobby as well. Inside the room, one light has a broken switch, the other has a broken bulb. Internet is provide with the cable, but no wi-fi. The shower hardly have much water pressure which is very disappointing when you come back from a tired day and want to refresh. The location is so so, right on the south side of the strip. The front desk service is only so so. They asked us for the credit to charge some fees and didn't tell us what it was or how much it is until we asked. I probably rather pay more money and stay at a better hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “nothing is free”
Reviews.Author: danno2011
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were first met by someone that was going to show us about "free" tickets to shows, etc. In actuality he was a pitchman for some new property and wanted to sell us time shares. The incredible part at the very beginning he said we didn't have to buy anything to get tickets. THEN came the check-in. Since reservation was made on line everything was set, right? Wrong! There was a little thing called a resort fee ($11.95) which is hidden at very bottom of hotel desription on website that had to be tacked on to each nights stay. I explained I did not care about what that fee got me, I did not want to pay this mandatory fee. After going round and round with desk clerk we summoned the manager that was on duty. That was futile too. In so many words he said we were stupid because "as consumers we are supposed to read everything, on every page of website so we would be informed", plus he didn't even have the guts to tell us his last name which meant to us they got a lot of complaints. We figured if we went somewhere else we would still be paying for this reservation so at least it was a place to lay our head and clean up. Following morning wife saw cockroach crawling down wall in bathroom. For a supposed top of the line hotel/casino this first time visitor found out otherwise. Excalibur did not get one more penny from us. All gambling, food, etc. was done elsewhere along "strip" Did like the location though, and made use of FREE tram that ran to several other casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special - Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Venkat418
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights @ excalibur and 1 night @ Stratosphere (just for the deck view). I would recommend stratosphere over excalibur. Excalibur has the worst people at the front desk. They treat you as if you are staying for free. The discounted shows aren't worth mentioning but the location is really good. Tip/suggestion for budget travelers: find a good hotel for a deal even if it is slightly away from the strip (it would be mostly stratosphere). Drive your car, park it in Excalibur or MGM or any casino that you want to enter, enjoy the night and go back to the hotel. You get the best deal.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but could be better.”
Reviews.Author: Magicalkat
Reviews.Content: Overall this was a decent place to stay considering the price. The room rate was pretty good though taxes and fees quickly make it a bit more expensive (this is universal in Vegas so nothing against Excalibur). It's an old casino/hotel but the upgraded rooms are nice. We got a free upgrade from the standard room to a wide screen deluxe room without even asking. I saw a standard room one of my friends was in and there was truly very little difference... just a little more space between the window and far bed allowing for a bit more furniture. The great thing about this place is probably how family friendly it seemed. I didn't have my kids with me but if I were to bring them to Vegas, this would probably be a good choice. They had kid activities and the pools looked great (too cold for me in December). The food court was okay. McDonald's seemed comparably priced to free standing McD's so I ate breakfast there pretty cheap a couple of times. The buffet was nothing to write home about and I was disappointed when I paid for the all day buffet and lunch and dinner were the exact same. The casino itself had a smell to it but I hate cigarette smoke so was probably just picking up on that and the age of the hotel. Favorite place by far in this casino was Dick's Last Resort. NOT for kids but a lot of fun for us girls there for a bachelorette party. Thunder from Down Under was pretty good as was the Tournament of Kings.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bud Haven”
Reviews.Author: Sightsee2008
Reviews.Content: Not a lot to do inside hotel if you don't want to gamble and/or don't have children. Two of us stayed in an "updated" room (flat panel TV provided . . . Wow). I broke out with a rash and bug bites starting from my left-side neck and hand/wrist then spreading to shoulder and chest. (Apparently only one of the queen-size beds had an investation.) Security personnel wrote a report and took pix; paramedics looked at the outbreak; and we were moved to another room - same type; definitely not better - but at least the bed didn't have bugs. Hotel did not offer any compensation - nothing! What I liked best: Location. What I liked least: Cleanliness of the room and hallway (23rd floor); a bath rug (holds more germs) was provided instead of a bath mat made from cotton/towel material.

Reviews.Title: “Great Upgraded Rooms, but the Steakhouse Sucks”
Reviews.Author: thebear56
Reviews.Content: The experience at the hotel was great, The Upgraded Flat Scrren Rooms were great, the Staff was great, the Casino Staff was great, The Sportbook Staff was awesome, and the Dinning Options are the downfall. If you care about great Restraunts with awesome food, then this is not the Hotel Casion for you. The Steakhouse was a disaster, service, the food and the overall attitude in that restraunt was not good, and for the prices Not a pick. The Krispy Creme Donut Shop was the best Dinning experience for sure, Baja Fresh was second, but what I usually get at Baja Fresh for $12 cost me $24 at the hotel. Great Stay :) Look forward to going back, but will be Eating at other venue's. By the Way this hotel has the Best Spa Value of any hotel in Las Vegas The Bear

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for food allergies!”
Reviews.Author: debdeg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the request of our daughter who was turning 21. She has dairy allergies, so my husband called to speak to a chef about how they could be accommodated. Chef Jeffery M was wonderful! We called him at check in and he met us to talk about what she wanted to eat and where in the hotel and the Lux we were planning to eat. It was wonderful not to worry about her having a reaction and the food was great!! The hotel was dated but well kept. The staff was friendly and responsive making it a fun stay. We went to the Tournament of Kings and everyone enjoyed both the food and the show. It is at the end of the strip, but with plenty to do around it. It was also close to the discount ticket booths, definitely a plus! We would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur Again”
Reviews.Author: Loftypines
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nites at the Excalibur, my 5 visit (I think) always get a room in Tower 2, 17th floor this time but 2nd from the end of hall. Try get one closer to the elevator. The bonus is it's quiet down there. Casino was busy, slots a little friendlier this time. Poker room does not spread 2-4 all the time but will if a bunch sign up for it. Like I've said before rooms are clean and comfy, obviously a little dated casino but lots of fun. Great budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Facade for young children”
Reviews.Author: haycoop
Reviews.Content: this was our secodn trip to Vegas, and the Excalibur hotel was far superior to other 3 star hotels we have stayed in. Fantastic location, we were able to walk to everything that we wanted to see. Buffet is great value. The Sponge Bob ride was a great hit with my 5 year old. rooms were clean and tidy and did not smell of smoke at all (we were in non smoking rooms, but other members of our party had smoking rooms and even these didn't have strong smoke smell) the beds and pilows were comfy. Only issue I had was that every day House Keeping would take away 4 towels and only leave us with 2 towels, so i had to call every day to get extra towels. (there were 4 of us staying in the room) would be good if the rooms had tea and coffee making facilities. swimming pools were also good, they have a shallower section in the big pool for younger children.

Reviews.Title: “Would like to come back”
Reviews.Author: comnen
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas proved to be the cheapest place in the US unless you are gambler. Excalibur was not the exception. Everything in this hotel was nice. Room on the 21th floor, all-you-can-eat menu, show (knights and Thunder from down under). We chose this hotel because of its proximity to the airport, and because of medieval show. Two negative impressions were: the security man, who once asked our hotel cards. and that my credit card was charged twice. but it was over-done very quickly. The staff was great!

Reviews.Title: “Resort fees disgraceful, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: UkMacyslover
Reviews.Content: We had already been in Vegas for 4 days and stayed downtown in the Fitz and had a great time, we had booked to stay in the excalibur for the last 3 days of our holiday so we where on the strip. We had read other reviews about the rooms and the resort fees so we new what to expect but it would have been nice for the hotel to tell us we could use the phone in the room for all calls including international as my husband took ill and i needed to phone home i went out and bought a phone card for $10 and used that and when we checked out they said we should have used the room phone for free. Anyway the room itself was large, it had comfy beds and was clean the bathroom was very nice and we had lots of chanels on the TV. I would recomend this hotel but i think the resort fees are a rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: HereComesTheSol
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visit Vegas once a year, this was our first time staying at the Excalibur. We were pleasantly surprised to say the least, self- parking was a breeze, we parked on the first level of the parking lot which was a 2 minute walk to our room. Check-in took about 10 minutes, we stayed at "Tower 1" which was very easy to find and close to the exits. As far as the rooms go they were dated and the sheets were worn, but since we have a habit of taking our own sheets, it wasn't so bad. And we only stayed in the rooms to sleep so the "dated" look did not bother us in the least. It was very nice to have a true "non-smoking" room; it did NOT have any strong cigarrete scent (other times we have stayed in other hotels' non-smoking rooms but you can still smell the smoke). It was however a bit noisy (the noise coming from the street outside), but we were able to have the heater/fan on and were able to sleep well. The staff was friendly and housekeeping was done timely on all five days of our stay. We did visit their buffet which was OK. We also took in the "Tournament of Kings" dinner show which was actually pretty good. Check-out was very easy, it took about 5 minutes. We would definitely stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Sometimes just the essentials are good enough!”
Reviews.Author: hkplayer
Reviews.Content: We went to vegas to run the marathon and half-marathon on December 5th and opted to stay at the Excalibur due to what we felt were pretty good price points. Having been to vegas twice before over the last 2 years and having stayed at the Mirage and then the Encore, I was somewhat hesitant on taking the plunge in staying at the Excalibur. Though, I knew (at least perceptually) that it is one of the older hotels and that it had it's prime days some years before. Nonetheless, given the price points for our Fri-Mon stay, and the availability of renovated widescreen tv rooms, we went for it and booked a 2-bed room. Once checked in we went to our room on floor 27. Indeed we got our renovated widescreen tv 2-bed room and was relieved (you never know nowadays what you end up getting at hotels - 5 star or 1 star). The room was clean, bathroom was clean and still in pretty good shape post-renovation. Room is very basic with a 40+ flat screen on the wall (nice touch), somewhat small closet, and a good bathroom with a high granite counter, but just a shower (no bathtub). We paid the following for our stay there (excl resort fee of 9.95 per night): Friday: $76 Saturday: $76 Monday $41 Total was $249.59 for all 3 nights, incl taxes and resort fee. Surprisingly, we ended treating this trip as a "budget" trip to vegas, actually. I flew in via airmiles and therefore booked the hotel on its own (rather than via package, which is what we usually do). Here are some of the other things we thought were budget focused: - we bought a 3-day pass for the deuce (double decker bus) and took that all the time. it is slow (as most would say) but due to our race event, we wanted to conserve energy and the deuce really helped us with that. I almost always take the deuce while in vegas at least by the end of the trip since by then you've walked the heck out of your feet/legs anyway. - we noticed the "gold line" bus which is a double-extended bus that is express. it routes on the strip but stops at, say, every 2nd or 3rd hotel unlike the deuce that stops at nearly every hotel. this gold line actually takes you all the way to the premium outlets! having had to take the taxi before to those outlets, it was neat to find out that the gold line can now take you there at a fraction of the cost. that is, if you have the time. plus, the pass for the deuce works on the gold line. kudos to vegas on this one i must say. - we went to tix4tonight on 2 occasions. 1 for carnival world buffet at the rio (to carb up prior to the race), and they offered half off the normal price (instead of 30, $15). we figured that since the rio is off strip, that is why they had to lure ppl with a lower price point to go there. while at tix4tonight and buying these buffet tickets, we asked if taking the cab would be the usual way to get to the rio - the rep said, no, just take the shuttle at paris that goes to rio. we thought that was great. again, this just added to our budget style vegas trip. ironically, though, due to packing in too many things to do that day. there are also 2 other hotels that shuttle to the rio but i forgot which ones (ph could have been one of them). - so the rio's buffet in my opinion is the best one in vegas. i have been to the wynn buffet all 3 visits to vegas, and to the bellagio buffet once. bang for buck, even i had to pay full price at the rio buffet, it would still win. there were 6 or so regions of the world represented at the rio buffet and each region/buffet area had a good selection of food. service was good as well. - the second time we used tix4tonight was for a cirque show and we watched mystere at TI for $72 each, which i believe was $40 off regular price each. all cirque shows are fantastic, regardless of ticket price. I think that's about all I can mention for the time being. Hopefully the above info will help in some of your planning for vegas.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to be”
Reviews.Author: ckwiltbank
Reviews.Content: I travel to Vegas every year and stay at different hotels each time. Everything at Excalibur was easy from check-in to check-out and the staff was exceptional. They were friendly and very attentive. I felt right at home. I was pleased with my room and the price was great. I will go back again for a second stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Hesitate to Stay at the Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: Utica_NY
Reviews.Content: I've flown to Vegas from central NY state and have stayed at the Excalibur on two separate occasions this past year (January & November) for a week each while attending trade shows. I've had excellent experiences on both stays. The Tower rooms that I stayed in were nice and simple; more importantly they were very clean, well-kept and comfortable. I've never had a problem with noise or unruly guests on any of my stays, including my last trip when I arrived on Halloween evening. The front desk service is excellent, and on both occasions, they graciously provided me with additional dinner & drink coupons without my asking for them. (FYI...I'm not a gambler at all, so there was no prior "comp" motive for them to do so.) Lastly, don't worry at all about the relatively short distance from the usual trade show venues, as between the show shuttles, public transportation, or even for those who enjoy a good walk - even after visiting their very nice fitness center - it's really not an issue at all. Bottom line; for tight-budgeted, small-business travelers in this economy these days, the excellent, excellent value you get for staying at the Excalibur is refreshing. You can do a lot of business at the shows, enjoy your stay, and not have an expense record that you'll be reluctant to turn in to your boss. I'll be back in January 2011, and I'll stay there again without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Value and comfort”
Reviews.Author: hasamadsnarl
Reviews.Content: Why spend big dollars to sleep? Excalibur, offers clean rooms, wide screen TV's (not that you watch them). The rooms are clean and the staff are always nice to talk to. I choose to spend my money on shows and gaming, which Excalibur offers as do the 5 hotels that are joined to Excalibur by a pedway.

Reviews.Title: “Fine and clean - just be ready for lots of walking!”
Reviews.Author: Lestreet
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Excalibur for 3 days in a widescreen room with a view of the strip. The room was large and clean although very basic. A fridge would have been useful in the room but we were aware that we had certainly paid less than other hotels to stay on the strip so it was still value for money. The room had Internet access but we needed wireless so paid travelers wireless separately. I has been painfully slow and definitely not recommend. We needed it because we didn't have a phone but it often took 5 mins to open a page. It would have been faster to walk to star bucks for free wireless. The gym was large, clean and well equipped and all the staff were friendly. I think we would pay more to be more central on the strip but only for the location. Definitely recommended, just be prepared to walk or catch taxis to see everything.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Trip”
Reviews.Author: lindausda
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nearly at the south end of the strip and a lot of attractions were more than a walk away. But the Defending the Caveman Show was really funny and the hotel is associated with the Luxor and the Mandalay, so tickets for Carrot Top the comedian were available also. Carrot Top is hilarious at the Luxor. The Shark Reef at the Mandalay was interesting also. A tram runs between the hotels, but it's nearly as easy to walk in the covered/over the street access connections. Resort fees of $11/night are mandatory and need to be remembered to be paid at checkout. Our room with taxes and resort fees averaged only $47/night. It's not the fanciest hotel or newest, but very good for the price. We rented a car for $240 for the week which we thought was a good price but upon returning it, we were surprised by $90 something in taxes, assessments, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Not special...”
Reviews.Author: Unusualname
Reviews.Content: Excalibur was OK for a reasonable value stay for a couple of nights. Location's OK and it's cheap!! The staff were fine, but the rooms are in need of a refresh. Everyhting feels a bit well worn. I wouldn't recommend it for a couple or family...

Reviews.Title: “Mix of The Brady Bunch meets Medieval Times”
Reviews.Author: Powwow5
Reviews.Content: The appearance outside if like Disney World-- inside it's a lot of brown and older furnishings... I would think the tower 2 with their new renovations is probably better than the Tower 1 I stayed in.. Rooms were ok, they served it's purpose, it was somewhere to sleep and wasn't spotless but decently cleaned. There were NO bed bugs so that's always a plus, right? This hotel is very kid friendly-- and for the price, it makes it very affordable to take the kids there, if you wanted to! Overall-- I'd stay here again... Simply because it's on the strip, it's very affordable, and it's not a bad location. Not to mention the Sherwood Cafe is really good and very nice prices!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT USE SPA!!!”
Reviews.Author: rxme
Reviews.Content: Hotel was ok. Nothing special, but clean enough. The casino had a good, fun crowd. The Spa sucked. I paid $70 for a pedicure which was supposed to last 60minutes. It lasted 25 minutes. They were supposed to massage my feet, did not rub my feet AT ALL. She put sea salt on 1 heal, did not even rub it in. Also, they charge you 20% tip up front and only give 18% of it to the server. I tried to get compensated, but still have not gotten anything from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Appalled and horribly disappointed in our room cleanliness and condition”
Reviews.Author: jushorsinaround2
Reviews.Content: We have happily stayed at the Excalibur Hotel & Casino generally more than once annually for the 20 years it has been in existence. Because of the fair room prices and its location, Excalibur became our traditional place to stay during the National Finals Rodeo until the Southpoint was built. We opted for the Southpoint for 2008-2009, but returned to Excalibur this year to be closer to the strip and away from the NFR buckle ceremony crowds. At Excalibur, two of the four towers are supposedly "remodeled" with the remaining two towers still containing older furnishings and decorating style. When making a reservation, the room description specifically delineates the difference between old and new decorated rooms, with the rooms priced accordingly. Wanting to ensure a clean room with the newest accoutrements (furnishings, decor, etc.) we opted for the highest priced room called the "Wide Screen Deluxe Room". Upon entering the room, I was appalled. A thick layer of white dust covered the dresser, desk and end tables, the supposedly remodeled furnishings literally looked like someone took a chain to the furniture they were so banged up and scratched. Even so, finger prints and smudges were evident under the dust. To our horror, the king size bedspread had a large stain on it with white crust around the edges of the stain. God only knows what that stain consisted of...I have a pretty good idea and it is sickening. The safe for valuables located inside the dresser was rickety at best. The roman shade and surrounding curtains were loose and did not block out all the light. The bathroom was extremely dusty, I could have written my name in the dust on the ice bucket and tissue holder. Hair resided under the sink cabinet and around the floorboards along with an evident black line of dirt. A phone call to housekeeping yielded prompt response and resulted in a room with no stain on the bedspread but no further cleanliness in my book. The shower? While an “engineer” was sent to repair the water flow, there was no change…the water pressure was non-existent. It was so bad, I could not even wash my long hair as I would have never gotten the shampoo out. And to top it all off, the flat screen TV only sporadically worked. WE WERE JUST SO SEVERELY DISAPPOINTED. What was once our favorite hotel has gone to the dogs or should I say the pigs? What's next, bed bugs? One thing is certain, when it comes to Excalibur we will never find out because this was a deal breaker. We will spend our hard earned dollars at a hotel where the management provides a CLEAN room to its clientele. Beware is all I can say. If you don’t mind a dirty room, then by all means stay at the “Castle”. We are done and WILL NEVER STAY AT EXCALIBUR AGAIN. They have lost our business.

Reviews.Title: “Strip location a plus...hotel lacks "Vegas" bells and whistles”
Reviews.Author: lhaganmich
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel since I was running the rock and roll marathon at mandalay bay. This hotel was much cheaper and within walking distance. It is apparent that this hotel has seen better days. Room was spartanly furnished...Stained medieval tapastry hanging from the wall; dorm room style wooden furniture. Telephone worked half the time. The room didn't have a coffee maker or fridge. In terms of products, the basics were offered: one ply toilet paper and tissue, conditioner shampoo, lotion and soap. Room carpet was was old. On bedspreads and walls, we spotted random stains. This is not a hotel you want to sleep on the floor on. No flat screen tv. Basic basic cable. And high speed internet (included in resort fee) yet it was not wireless. Bed was comfortable (although sheets and blanket looked worn) Although I had expressly reserved king sized bed, I received two queen beds. No bath tub, basic glass shower (hot water always worked which was a plus). Elevators at this hotel were slow. Casino was bit smokier than some of the newer casinos. Parking free (although space was hard to find late saturday night). I would not stay here again unless I had to. I knew booking this hotel it was not a 4 star property, however, I think unless the strip location REALLY REALLY matters, you'd be better off at one of the marriott/hilton/holiday inn type properties across the highway. (plus you'd get free breakfast and wireless internet). Can't complain about price of this hotel- saturday was the most expensive, but other two nights were under $40. Pool was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was good but casino terrible”
Reviews.Author: pbh68
Reviews.Content: We checked in at 1:00 AM on a Saturday night. It was slow season so everything about the hotel was good: check-in, check-out and other assistance. A maintenance call was quickly resolved. Even though the room size was their smallest it was adequate and clean. It was very quiet the entire 5 nights we stayed there, again, probably due to the slow season. Our major complaint was with the casino which constantly reeked of smoke from current and past gamblers. It was so bad that we only gambled there once and went to other hotel casinos but we had to walk through it from our hotel room so we were constantly bombarded with it. The Players Club is a good program but can be confusing. We had several questions about it and ended up standing in the Club line, a couple of times we waited a long time. Tip: What we found out is that many Players Club employees don't know the rules and processes of the Players Club. When we got an answer we knew to be wrong or didn't like we would go back another time and often get the answer we wanted. Bottom line: our stay at the hotel was good and we recommend it due to the value price for rooms but we recommend you go close by to the MGM Grand or the NY NY or a ways out to the Ballagio or Mirage for a much better gamling experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: pusmes
Reviews.Content: I've been stayed here for a couple of times. Vegas is usually my destination for business travels and trade shows so mostly it happens during the weekdays. This hotel is a steal during weekdays with unbelievably low prices, provided you book it little in advance. Its right at the start of the strip so a wonderful location! great views of the adjacent Pyramid and barren airport if you stay on southern tower rooms. Monorail station is just across the street at MGM so cheap and easy travel to Convention Center for me. Overall, it has always been a great experience staying at this hotel especially when you save some bucks :) but I never had any luck at the casino downstairs. May be that's their way to steal money out of the guests, so be careful ;)

Reviews.Title: “Decent place with a fun atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Becky21159
Reviews.Content: We stayed here this past October. It was our first trip to Vegas, and we loved it. It was a little far down the strip, but it's convenient that the Deuce stops right across the street to get down to the busy area. The check in staff was really nice, there was even a nice older guy who reminded me of my dad lol the room was clean, kind of dated but who cares. The shower was really big, but not much place to put your shampoos etc, other than the floor. The black out shades were really nice. We were in Tower 1 - the older renovated rooms, and had no problem with them. Just one piece of advice, I think the maids are used to guests leaving out gaming slips from vlt's as their tips, so I had left some out for just pennies to keep in the scrap book, but she took them. Not mad or anything, just didn't expect that. If you do spend time in the resort, watch the channel with the 702 scene stuff, it's really informative. We ate at the Sherwood Forest Cafe and absolutely loved it. I had the best French Onion soup ever at this place, and our waiter Stewart, was really great. He wasn't around constantly, and was really courteous whenever he was. When you're in there, you totally miss the hussle and bussle going on outside. We did also try the Last Resort Restaurant (since I can't put the full name on here), and it was totally different. Probably won't go back, but I knew what I was getting in to. When it came down to it, you were given what you wanted/needed, just not the normal kind of service. I never smelled cigarette smoke in the casino. All the casino's put this stuff in the air conditioning so it's got kind of a sweet smell. I don't think anyone can smell it unless you're super sensitive. Overall, we had a great time at Excalibur. Comfortable bed, clean room, nice staff and good options to eat. Great for a first timer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Goscha
Reviews.Content: We arrived late evening and found only two varients to get to this hotel: taxi (15-20 dollars) and shuttle bus (6,5 dollars), but if you want to save money and arrive to Las Vegas during the day, you can go on foot to the hotel, because it's not far from airoport, only 15-20 min. It's even not hotel, it's a big city. You can spend several days here without leaving the hotel. Everyone finds here, what to do. Even if you don't like casino. One evening we visited men strip show, and muscle naked guys drove many ladies so crazy. They cried for pleasure. We bought all day buffet for 25 dollars per person, and food was good and various. Our room on 20th floor was cool: large and comfortable with reasonable price. If you want to have good holiday, I'd recommend to spend several days here, not just 2 nights as we did.

Reviews.Title: “No Frills”
Reviews.Author: grevo77
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a perfect location. It is across the New York New York casino, it is very close to the airport and very easily accessible from the I-15. I stayed at the basic room (the cheapest option). The room was on the 4th floor and I paid $70 (with tax and resort fee) for a Saturday night. The room was big and clean, however it was outdated, and felt cheap (for instance no flat screen TV, no bathtub, and no wireless internet). Most importantly, the whole day and night there was a constant noise. I am not sure from where it was coming from but I suspect it was from the heater motors from the surrounding rooms. This was very annoying. In conclusion, this hotel was built on 1990 and seems that its all appearance (at least the interior) stayed there. Now, given its location and attractive price its a not a bad choice. However, I would suggest to you to explore more options around the neighborhood before deciding.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jojojo101
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Vegas, we stayed for 2 weeks in the Excalibur, I was very surprised by our room in Tower 1 floor 22 great views, clean large room. Very soft comfortable beds, good maid service every day. We took our 4 yr old she had a blast, loads to do and see, although the casino was smocky compared to the other casinos.Tried the buffet, it was good, the food court has plenty of variety, timeshares a bit of a pain but just walk past them, no real problem. We would return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “still a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: piggies06
Reviews.Content: This was our third time of staying here, we stayed in tower 2 with a pool view, room had been upgraded couldnt find fault it in.As you first walk in there is a smell of smoke from the casino, it is a bit dull compared to some of the others but the hotel is 20 years. If you want somewhere cheap to stay then you should know what to expect. The buffet wasnt as good as before we only had breakfast there. There are plenty of other places in and out of the hotel so we ate in them. Also everytime you walk through the casino you get pounced on by staff trying to offer you free things which did become a bit annoying but just smile and say no they soon leave you alone. The other staff were always friendly and helpful. The other thing is you get charged a resort fee which is a bit of a con if you dont use the facilities (free paper and internet and other bits We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare with housekeeping maids.”
Reviews.Author: angelonvacation
Reviews.Content: On Tues. 11/23 - Weds. 11/24 on two separate occasions while staying here at Excalibur Hotel two different maids entered our room only knocking and rushing in the room without even saying " housekeeping" and did not even apologize. Called and spoke to housekeeping manager Sharlin and was very unprofessional didn't have any concern about our complaint. Than called and spoke to assistant manager Lory she took care of our concern and apologized. Would not want another guest to go through this inconvenience. Someone took the sign " DO NOT Disturb" from the door two days straight. Would not recommend this hotel to friends or family!!! Thank goodness we were fully clothed.

Reviews.Title: “Economical family hotel - and it's a castle to boot!”
Reviews.Author: happytravel14
Reviews.Content: The hotel is one of the more inexpensive on the strip. My seven-year old could go anywhere in the two large family pools as the water at it's deepest went to his neck and there were no blind spots - speaking as a wary parent. We paid for a $10 upgrade so we could have a view of the strip and it was worth it. The boys loved watching the roller coaster at the New York-New York zip around all day and all night. The gym was small but functional with new looking equipment. Negatives - no refrigerator or microwave in the room and the parking structure seemed really far away. The bed was a little too firm for my taste.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: csquier
Reviews.Content: Was a good location with great value on rates! Our room had a view of the strip and was very comfortable. Also had good shows and a fun pool atmosphere. Would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it”
Reviews.Author: GlobetrotterBella
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at this hotel. I was pleased with the commodities. The room was ample enough for four women. The bed was great. I slept very well. It is located at the beginning of the strip which can be a hassle due to the walking, but you can buy a bus day pass for $7 and hop on and off at your convenience. Pros: affordable, clean, good slots, good food court Cons: a hidden resort fee if 11.99 per night, location

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: trixie96
Reviews.Content: We upgraded our room to one of the "newly renovated" rooms for an additional fee because we felt we would get a newer room/furnishings. WRONG. The minute you walked into the room the smell of mildew overwhelmed you. They may have upgraded the carpet, headboard, and some pieces of the furniture; but they certainly did not update the mattresses or bedding. I felt like I was sleeping on a wooden board that was covered with a 2" piece of foam. The bedding was clean; but stained, dingy and OLD. Okay so if that does not turn you away... I will mention that there we safety issues as well. A family member requested a handicap accessible room. The shower was easy enough to get into, however the vinyl shower stall had no slip proofing on the floor. When we mentioned this upon check out, they were more concerned with a law suit than fixing the problem. AND FYI, they will tell you there is no construction going on.... However, even if you see with your own eyes that the whole floor filled with workers and construction being done at 7 am, they tell you that you are wrong and there is currently no construction going on. Go figure.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, clean room.”
Reviews.Author: Maizie3213
Reviews.Content: For the price we paid, we really can't complain. We were able to check in early and our rooms were clean. A little on the small side, but we only needed hot showers, a safe place to lay our heads, and clean sheets. This hotel had all of that plus really nice pools and hot tubs. The food court was nice for our large group because we were all able to find something we liked.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay (once again)”
Reviews.Author: Ron063
Reviews.Content: This was our 10th Stay at Excalibur we have been coming twice a year for the past 5 years. The service we get is second to none everyone is so helpful and pleasant. When i read some of the really negative comments I am amazed ok its not four star but you are not paying 4 star prices. We have stayed at several other hotels on the strip over our 10years coming to vegas. Ceasars, MGM, LUXOR and this year because we were meeting family for the first two nights we stayed in the Encore which was amazing but at considering the price we paid you would expect that. It may have been more luxurious but we were hardly in the room. I think some people expect five star luxury for three star prices and all that should be taken into consideration. If you want to go to Vegas and sit in your room all day by all means stay somewhere more luxurious and pay the price seem a waste to me. As far as the restaurants are concerned the buffet, sherwoods etc all ok to me perhaps we are not as fussy as others. If your looking for posh nosh you wont get it but plain simple food is great. Their players card benefits are fantastic, we've had free room, food and shows. We've been totally blown away with the hospitality we've been given. I'm sure some of you reading this may think we're exagerating but honestly no I cannot praise the excalibur and staff enough (totally from our own experience).

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great location”
Reviews.Author: sisterkls
Reviews.Content: For a place to sleep and play, this hotel will meet your needs. It has to be the best rate in town, even though they tack on another $9.95 for a resort fee plus taxes each night. We truly enjoyed our stay, so much that we added another night.

Reviews.Title: “Very unimpressed.”
Reviews.Author: rivtrail
Reviews.Content: Checked in around noon. Was turned away due to lack of ready rooms. Basically, a ryal screw you attitude plus added a substantial undisclosed resort fee...for very little in return. Room was sketchy...kinda cheap all around.

Reviews.Title: “AHHHHHMMMMAAAAAZZZZIIIIINNNGGG!!”
Reviews.Author: JodieDeaves
Reviews.Content: This hotel was FANTASTIC! Kevin and i stayed here for 2 weeks. The pool was gorgeous (except one of the pools was closed :() But they had another 3 pools to use! We were happy enough to be upgraded to the new Tower 2 where we had a lovely view of the front of the castle which looked beautiful at sunrise. The McDonalds was great because it was cheap and was open most of the time! The all you can eat buffet was brilliant and we enjoyed some huge meals then chilling by the pool. Tournament of the Kings was brilliant and the food was again lovely! We had a lot of free goodies (tickets for Ka and Elvis viva las vegas for cirque du soleil) Because we gambled quite a lot :D It added to our points. The room only cost us about $950 for the 2 weeks!! Due to online promotions and booking in advance! This was the best and most memorable holiday. I am sure the next time we go back-Might be our wedding ;) P.S HAVE THE STEAK HERE TOO!! It was the best steak i have ever had! (Even better than the Outback) Its pricey-But completely worth it!

Reviews.Title: “It's definitely a great location and the rates are great!”
Reviews.Author: sarah1370
Reviews.Content: I've read such bad reviews about this place but I had to wanted to prove them wrong. When I checked in, the room was clean, I had a nice view of the strip and the price and location was great! I didn't feel the need to get an upgrade. I was perfectly happy with the room I was in. I would definitely book there again. I love the Excalibur!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel if on a budget and want to be central!!”
Reviews.Author: DunnerScotland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our Honeymoon & was upgraded to a Widescreen room at no extra charge which we were delighted with. Room was clean, large with a huge tv, bed was huge!!, bathroom huge and good view. Room quiet & bed really comfy. Air con/heating excellent & easy to use & it stayed on even if you were out the room so nice to come back to a cool room when hot outside. Hotel was central, staff okay but didn't really need them for anything. Restaurants not so great & disappointed at a few meals I had here but we just ventured somewhere different ever night. Would have stayed at another nicer hotel but we stayed here at a cheaper price so we could afford a few extra nights in Vegas & as I always say you don't go on holiday to spend it in a room!! We used this hotel to sleep, shower & dump shopping. Only down side was that hotel was more suited to younger crowds, ideal for groups of friends or hen/stag do's as entertainment & bars quite loud & rowdy but looked fun for the younger age group. Shower pessure was good but water came out as a blast of fine spray which took ages for me to rinse my thick longer hair & there was no bath but shower could have fitted 4 people in it! Would stay again just because of cheaper price, location and free upgrades if lucky enough!!

Reviews.Title: “second chance no better”
Reviews.Author: moffee
Reviews.Content: purse was stolen last time in the shuttle waiting area. beware still no warning signs about cons in this area. staff was not very nice, seem to not know about customer in the phrase customer service. not looking for anything free,but just a more positive experience. watch out for bugs in your room. i hope they will see these concerns and take them very seriously,and im sure they can have a positive experience for their guests. remember, customers are why you exist at all, and should be your first concern.

Reviews.Title: “Looked for a value hotel and found it.”
Reviews.Author: jethro1211
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Las Vegas for 5 days and wanted to stay at cheap hotel but wanted to be on the strip. When we got there the registration was super quick and the rooms are okay with old carpet. The best thing was is the walls are awesome we did not here ant noise in our room at all. The beds are great, but the heater worked everyonce in a while in the room. Over all if looking for a cheap stay it would be great.

Reviews.Title: “Fun!”
Reviews.Author: donnieg101
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very fun atmosphere! Will for sure be an option when we return to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful way to spend a vacation.”
Reviews.Author: ShirleyOkeene
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Excalibur Hotel for many years. It is my favorite hotel in Las Vegas, it is always clean, comfortable and Jan Perez, our casino host makes our stay very pleasant. She takes care of every detail so all I need to do is let her know when I will arrive and my length of stay. She does the rest!! I always visit there twice each year, October and April. It is a wonderful vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Krzysztofgolec
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, great slot machines, restaurants, easy check in and out,

Reviews.Title: “The best overall experiance Las Vegas has to offer”
Reviews.Author: kaedansmommom
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for the perfect vacation spot in Las Vegas,you need to stay at the Excalibur Hotel and Casino. The rooms are fresh and modern, the choice of places to eat are huge. From simple meals in the Sherwood Forest to a fantastic Italian meal in Regalis.The Staff are the most accomadating in all of Las Vegas. You will feel like family. The layout of the Casino in easy to navigate and "people traffic" flows very smoothly through the casino.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bang For The Buck”
Reviews.Author: Goodwrench2000
Reviews.Content: We had two Excalibur rooms on our recent trip to Las Vegas, for less than the price of the last strip hotel we stayed at. I was wary of the place because of some negative reviews that I had read on various travel sites. I was nearly 100% satisfied with the place. My only real complaint was being approached upon every re-entry to the casino by the time share people. They were not at all intrusive, but it did still hurt my impression. The casino was well ventilated and not smoky like some. The room was clean and the bed very comfortable and supportive. We ate at the Sherwood Cafe and the food was good, if a little ordinary. The price for meals was reasonable. We seldom do buffets, so I can't rate theirs. There are lots of other food places on the second floor near the buffet. Most are not fancy, but that's not what we were looking for. The steak house looked impressive, but again it's not our style. Near "Dick's Last Resort" the casino is sort of noisy and crowded, but we just avoided that area. If you are a party person, Dicks seemed like the place to hang out. Overall, it was a great stay and we definitely would return.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for !”
Reviews.Author: Eduardo F
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a budget hotel on the Strip, this is the one. The rooms are horrible. You can hear the noise from the strip, the curtains do not block the lights from the outside and their staff is very rude. Not to mention that they have timeshare scammers all around the hotel stopping people to force into buying their "great products". The round table buffet is horrible and I only recommend if you are in a very tight budget and want to get as much food as possible. The food is horrible, no taste, and the lines are usually long.

Reviews.Title: “Returning back to the Excalibur is like "Coming Home!"”
Reviews.Author: tenaflyrose
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many different hotels in Las Vegas thru the years for both business and pleasure. While some are much larger and "glitzier" ONLY the Excalibur makes me feel like I am returning home for a visit. They have an amazing staff.....from the dealers, waiters and my hostess who treat me like a "family" member of the Excalibur!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: tonyandsue2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights great hotel only problem is the timeshare people grab you before you even check in they are the only down side to this hotel we had a really spacious room on the 28th floor with a bit of a view,coffee maker & 2 double beds which were comfy. location is really great within walking distance to mgm grand,luxor,new york new york were just across a walkway we would definately stay at this hotel again only for longer than 3 nights as we felt rushed trying to fit as much as we can into such a short time.

Reviews.Title: “My host (Donna Johnson) truly put the perfect final touch to my stay!”
Reviews.Author: pirate014
Reviews.Content: My experience was excellent and I will continue to book all stays to Vegas, with Excalibur Hotel & Casino!

Reviews.Title: “This is a great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JimandCarolJ
Reviews.Content: Last time we went to Vegas, we stayed at the Flamingo, which was also nice, but we found that in the casino, the roof was very low, and the not very well ventilated, so the casino part was always blue with cigarette smoke. At the Excalibur, the ceilings are high, and the ventilation is incredible. You cannot smell the smoke at all (unless you are right beside someone that is smoking). The lobby and casino have a very nice smell. The room we had was spacious and comfortable, and the only thing we found that was a disappointment was there was no fridge in the room to keep drinks cold, but there was a small store right by the elevator to our floor, so we just bought cold drinks there.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly bad”
Reviews.Author: ChrisK14
Reviews.Content: No longer family-friendly: has been overrun by drunken fratboys. There were dirty dishes stacked in the hall outside our room when we first arrived. The hallway smelled of urine. The carpet in the room was soaking wet (hopefully from recent shampooing). We couldn't put anything on the floor or take off our shoes. This facility is showing its age. The two L-shaped room towers make a box, and fully half their rooms (those facing in) have a view of nothing but the roof of the casino. Further, south-facing rooms on the outer side of the box have a view of a concrete wall of a parking garage. Very bad design. Self-parking is not conveniently close, which is probably why valet parking is free. Down Side: the wait for valet parking is a little bit long.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: brownbearLeeds
Reviews.Content: This was our first port of call as part of a Virgin Holidays fly-drive and we stayed here for 3 nights. The location of the hotel is towards the end of the strip with just Luxor and Mandalary Bay below it, however it was really easy to access from the airport (we had a car). The rest of the strip was easily accessibly by walking although this may not appeal to everyone. It does burn off the heavy US food thought!!! We used the valet initially however you soon get used to Vegas and the fact that you have a fair walk everywhere you go, so used the car park out the back which was fine. We managed to park on the lower lot which provided shade during the day. Check in was fine, although we did get hassled by some sales people en route to the desk. People like this are everywhere in Vegas however a firm 'no' usually does the trick as does carrying on walking!!! We got upgraded for free to a widescreen room in tower 2. The room was clean and comfortable. The odd cigarette burn on the cushions, however we really didn't go for the soft furnishings!! The bed was comfortable and our towels were changed daily. We ate at the Round Table Buffett once which was OK for the price, however not the best buffett in the world (try Caesers - excellent quality and value). There's other stuff like McD's, Pizza Hut and Krispy Kreme available too if you want. An excellent place for a fun night out is Dicks Last Resort which is located just off the casino floor. Don't go if you're easily offended as it's pretty rowdy!!!! The food there is great and always good chat with the bar staff. All round, Excalibur is OK. Clean and comfy, nothing too flash. Yeah, the view out of the room was poor, however we went here to sleep and nothing more. Vegas is all about getting out there and seeing things, so if you just want a place to crash, then this place is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but wouldnt stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Wantstotravelmore22
Reviews.Content: My friends and I went to Vegas in February 2010. There were about 14 of us and we were traveling to vegas for a rugby tournament and needed to be within walking distance to Hooters to catch the bus from there to the tournament. I enjoyed the location, but we were at one end of the strip, with only Luxor and Mandalay Bay to our right. Everything else was to the left. When we arrived, the check it was quick and easy. The casino smelled like a mixture of old must and cigarettes. Our room smelled the same. The theme of our vacation was, "Vegas, whats that smell?" We had a view of the other rooms at the hotel and the sheets fell off the bed every night. Two of my friends did win $260 and $160 on quarter slots in the hotel though. Since we were such a large group, it was easy to grab a quick McDonalds breakfast before heading out for the day. The day we arrived to the hotel we asked the front desk how to get to In-N-Out Burger (being from Baltimore, we have never had it!) They told us we were going to be able to walk there. We walked for about 30-40 minutes and couldn't find out how to walk across the major highway. Major disappointment. Were going back to vegas in Feb again and staying at NYNY this time. Still within our budget but seems a step up from this.

Reviews.Title: “great deal, decent rooms but no amenities”
Reviews.Author: Sherry_J
Reviews.Content: We went on a spur of the moment trip and got a good deal to stay at the excalibur. We upgraded to the widescreen room and it was a nice room with a nice view. The pool area is quite nice but half closed although it was 20 degrees and we were sharing it with the Luxor clients. None of us are gamblers but enjoy small time blackjack. Not alot of cheap tables here. We went for the shows and clubs and shopping and some nice meals. None of this here. Had to go to other hotels for every meal, show and club. All the restaurants, including the buffet were not good and always had huge lines with only half the tables full. If you want a good deal and will just play machines, the Excalibur would be fine. We spent alot of time at New York, New York for bars and shows, Planet Hollywood for meals and shopping and The Luxor for shows and casino:)

Reviews.Title: “inexpensive and family friendly”
Reviews.Author: imissnewyork77
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Excaliber before but never with children. My husband and I took our 4 year old and my 65 year old mother on this trip. We picked the Excaliber because of price bottom line. I was pleasantly suprised to see the rooms had been given a much needed remodel from the last trip we took. The rooms are quiet...no noise coming through walls (and I worried about that given the place is inexpensive), the rooms were a good size and the staff was fantastic. I will say that the casino part still has a musty, smokey smell; unlike say the Mandalay Bay that smells of coconut oil throughout. Being a non-smoker I noticed the smell, it might not bother some people but I couldn't gamble there for the simple fact that it stinks (IMO). Though, once on the elevator to the rooms the smell is gone. Overall, I would stay there again ...it is a great value for the $$$, and is family friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time in Excalibur Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowAngie
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay at the Excalibur Hotel, could not fault the hotel at all. Great location of the strip just follow the monorail and you are in New York - New York Hotel. Our room was a great size and we had a great time in the casino, we were also pleased that the hotel which had a few swimming pools & jacuzzi's, plenty of sunloungers which we used every day and also the supply of fresh towels at the pool were great. Would recommend this hotel to anyone and also just going to Las Vegas doing the Grand Canyon is brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - clean and safe accommodations for the price”
Reviews.Author: Perfectly-Suited
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on recommendation from our AAA advisor.....she said it was family friendly. For just slightly more $$ we booked 2 rooms versus cram into 1 room with 2 extra occupants. Definitely worth the extra money to have additional space and avoid bathroom /schedule conflicts. We brought along 2 young adult children. I thought housekeeping did a nice job keeping the room clean. We had a side view of the Luxor (looking south). We were able to get inexpensive breakfasts at the food court on the top floor............kids could go off and pick their own establishments. Had dinner a couple of times in the hotel restaurant and thought the prices and food quality were pretty good. Sometimes a nighmare waiting on an elevator but this problem was solved once we found the stairs and could bypass the lines. Kids thought the pool closed too early for their liking but this is apparently the norm for LV hotels. Gambling was pretty good............found low cost slot machines and the waitresses came by fairly frequently with free drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome vacation - awesome price!!”
Reviews.Author: suz82398
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5, with children aged; 3,7, and 10. Obviously with times the way they are we needed to find a cheap vacation - that would be kid appropriate. We stayed at the Excalibur in a deluxe room Tuesday through Friday. We paid $45 per night!!!! The hotel was clean, staff was friendly, and did I mention it was cheap? The only downfall to the hotel that we found was the smoking in the casino, all casinos have smoke and we knew that when we booked the trip. The smoke exposure was limited to when we left and returned to the hotel because you must walk through the casino to get to your rooms. The location was great because there are free shuttles all over the place, and free things/shows for the kids to watch. The entire week including: lodging, food, and entertainment was $537 - and we did a TON of things with the kids. I highly recommend this hotel though, because the others have a lot of hidden fees that you don't realize until you actually check out of the hotel. We booked online directly from their site - the additional taxes and fees added $12 per night - some of the other hotels add up to $37 per night. Some hotels even charge you $25 per child you have between the ages of 3-17 - so be careful!

Reviews.Title: “They don't care about you”
Reviews.Author: jayson3706
Reviews.Content: Horrible service. We booked a room online and they gave us a different room when we got there. We got married there and did not get the discounts we were suppose to. Complained about several issues in the old rickidy room the first night and did not see anyone try until after our fourth night. 3 hours before we were going home someone showed up. Fire alarms go off in the middle of the night randomly because they are so out-dated. I have sent 2 emails since I came out last week and nobody has responded. There are a lot of nice places cheap in vegas but excalibur is not one of them. They say $32 night but add fees to be closer to $55 a night in the slow season.

Reviews.Title: “Never Going Back to this Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: desirhea
Reviews.Content: The great price lures you in for $50 a night with a standard room, which a 20 year old room with a bubble back TV, a dresser as old as me and with NO VIEW!!! So we upgraded to a deluxe for additional $30. The room was better but the shower door didn't have a bottom tracks. This Hotel had the worst eatery places and overpriced. There is nothing exciting about this Hotel. The Fantasy Fair sucked!@! We ended up checking out and moved to South Point. What a difference....

Reviews.Title: “would stay again”
Reviews.Author: pairofbigmonsters
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through our travel agent for 4 nights before then flying to San Francisco. Check in was speedy with more than helpful staff. Our double room was situated in tower 2, which was clean and the air- con much appreciated. Maid service was daily with fresh towels given as well as a general tidy. The casino was much the same as the others on the strip, however no noise could be heard in our room. Security was positioned on the entry to the accommodation, however they seemed a bit uninterested. Beware of the sales reps in the lobby who persistently hassled everyone who happened past. Overall, not the most pretty casino or accommodation in Vegas, but good value.

Reviews.Title: “Not good for family and the rooms sucks”
Reviews.Author: ggoogle
Reviews.Content: Had booked Standard 2queen bed. At check-in the people are monotomous, just gave a room and 2 keys...that's all no offer to upgrade the room or even smile. The room is very outdated and dirt all over. Though the room is non-smoking...could very well smell the odor. The faucets needs to be opened with a pull and while doing so the whole wash basin lift.. The TV channels are very basic. While check-out, no courtesy to ask how was the room ...etc. I would have given feedback it was asked.

Reviews.Title: “My wife didn't like it, but I thought it was fine.”
Reviews.Author: jreuscher
Reviews.Content: We booked this online directly through the Excalibur website. We arrived in Vegas by car about 9 o'clock at night, after a couple of days in the Grand Canyon. Needless to say, Vegas is a bit jarring after the peace and tranquility of a National Park. We entered the hotel through the casino (we later learned you can't get anywhere in a Vegas hotel without going through the casino first) and were bombarded by loud music, ringing and dinging slot machines, a strange air freshener smell and chaos at the front desk -- oh, and the ubiquitousTime Share booking agents. The check-in process was fairly smooth and speedy. We were told we were lucky to have received a free upgrade to a room with a widescreen TV and some worthless coupons. .Nice gesture, but no big deal since we weren't planning on watching TV. There are two towers at Excalibur -- tower I and tower II. The front desk accidentally wrote the wrong room number on our check-in form and sent us to tower I. The hallways and decor was really tired and outdated. Our room key also didn't work until we discovered on our own that we were sent to the wrong tower. Tower II was a lot newer and fresher. Still kind of drab, but nicer than tower I. Our room was burning hot -- no AC. We called down to the front desk and opted for a new room (rather than wait for the repair guy.) Minutes later, bell services came up with our keys to the new room a few doors down. Nearly, simultaneously, the AC guy arrived to fix the thermostat (needed a new battery). The new room was fine, especially when you consider the price. My wife thought it was dirty (throw pillows and bathroom mirror), but it wasn't something that I noticed or cared about. Would I go back? Sure, as long as I wasn't pahying Bilagio prices. It was really convenient to get to NY NY, MGM Grand and the Luxor / Mandaly Bay. If you like to walk around a lot during the day, I think mid strip near Treasure Island would have been better.

Reviews.Title: “They Have Improved”
Reviews.Author: ScrewedinNO
Reviews.Content: Over the past twenty years, I've stayed at Excalibur a number of times, primarily because of its proximity to Mandalay Bay Convention Center (still a heck of a hike) and its rates. I never cared for it but since someone else was footing the bill, I accepted it without complaining. This past week, I paid my own way and was impressed by how much their quality has gone up. Rooms were clean, elevators were fast, and gaming pay-outs were generous, at least for the first couple of days. The Sherwood Forest Cafe has good food and ran an excellent 6am to 8am special while I was there. Since I was on East Coast time, 6am was not a problem. Otherwise, expect $10 to $15 for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Dissappointed”
Reviews.Author: Hawaii721
Reviews.Content: Rates are great in the month of November all throuhout Vegas. Booked a Deluxe View Room with a Wide screen TV at Excalibur. Knowing that it's not one of the classiest hotels on the strip I thought the Deluxe room would be better than it was. It was your average hotel room showing signs of ware! Paid over 400.00 for three nights midweek. Should of choose a regular room for half the price. Sherwood Cafe was very sloooooow! Waited in line to be seated about 15-20 minutes for breakfast, food was average. Heading to our room throughout the day was acosted by the Time Share group- very annoying. Next time so many other choices on the strip!

Reviews.Title: “8 Days in Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: Whiggi
Reviews.Content: This is my first time reviewing a Hotel so please keep that in mind if I dont seem to present my review as well as others have. Straight away after booking Excalibur for 8 nights I then decided it would be wise to see what other people had said (i know, i did it backwards... my bad). What I found was a lot of negative reviews. The rooms smelt, far too many kids, its old and outdated, etc etc. So even before I arrived I was starting to feel like this would be a bad place to stay. All I can say is you really cant trust everything you hear. The room was exactly what it was meant to be, a bed, TV, awesome view of the luxor (20 something floor in tower 1), and a very decent bathroom. Although after a previous 2 weeks of staying at other places, Excalibur had the worst shower out of all of them, and being there for 8 nights this was a big disapointment. Did I get a terrible room as far as the shower went? Or is this the american standard for showers, and the Days inn I stayed at a few days before hand just manage to have an awesome shower? I dunno. All I know is when I got home I jumped straight into the shower :D. Since I was there the entire week I saw the families come and go. And yes Excalibur is known as very kid friendly, but it was really only on friday/saturdays that you really noticed swarms of kids running around... What I mean by swarms is only a handful. No big deal. Though I am not use to seeing them walking past gaming tables, big shock to me :) My biggest problem with Excalibur was its location. I felt more often then not I either had to fork out 10-15 for a taxi, or go and wait for the Duece, which most of the time was too packed to pick up, or late. So my piece of advice here is if you plan on travelling to vegas and seeing a bunch of shows like I did. Pick a hotel closer to those shows. The Gym was quite a nice edition. Certainly not going to get you into Mr Olympia, but a great way to get a bit of a pump up or undo a small amount of damage done the previous night ;) The Pool was closes both times that I used the gym so I didnt really get to see it in action. It was only closed because it was raining both those days (same reason why I was at the gym instead of cruising around the strip getting my burn on). Ok, last thing for my review is the staff service. Being someone who likes my sleep in's and privacy I left the do not disturb sign up then entire 8 days :D The staff took note of this and whenever they saw me offered fresh towels and anything else which was needed. Very polite. As goes for the bar, casino and valet. The only one I didnt find that pleasant was the bell desk. Would I stay here again? Doubtful. But not because of what Excalibur has to offer, it is a great casino/hotel. The problem is more that it feels more out of the way. Possibly just my way of thinking but I would much prefer be a bit more north of planet holiday. If walking is your thing and you dont mind walking places, or paying 10-15 per taxi ride then Excalibur might be for you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for the price $$”
Reviews.Author: LTtracy
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the hotel for the bit of time I stayed there. The only thing I have bad to say is the shower did not drain very well. It was great for the price!

Reviews.Title: “I pod and Jacket stolen from Room”
Reviews.Author: VodkaMike
Reviews.Content: I had back-to-back reservations and housekeeping stole my IPOD and jacket. I was able to get my jacket back, but some maid is currently rocking out on my IPOD.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the price”
Reviews.Author: gmataffy
Reviews.Content: We got in about 12:30am our flight had been delayed check in was fast, they upgraded us to a jacuzzi room. the room was clean and needed to be updated. Bed was comfortable we fell right to sleep. Lack of hot water in the morning. I have no ideal what kind of view we had we were just there for the 1 nite and didn't look out the window. The hotel was a good price clean with a comfortable bed located on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Value”
Reviews.Author: pvdesign
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel considering the location, the best in LV in my opinion, and the price - I was told this would have the best rate in Vegas. I actually think it had. It's nothing spetacular, just come to the room to sleep and you'll be fine. I got a Standard Queen room, that was faced to Luxor. The beds were clean, my only complaints are the air conditioner, that was real dusty, and the faucet in the bathroom - the knob was really nasty - lots of dust below the plastic cover. Also, there's almost no water in the shower, so if you usually take 10 minutes under the shower, consider taking 30. Hotels are only for sleeping to me, so I admit I ignored these faults most of the time - I wouldn't let these things spoil my leisure. Also, there's no free internet. They charge $13.95/day for a wired connection. Too lame. Most of the staff were really friendly, but a woman in the Information booth, that was really rude.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: nirvanaqween
Reviews.Content: The exterior of the hotel lights up the strip! It's a huge castle and in a great location on the strip, and plenty of parking. We got a tower room so we used a close lot and were lucky to find a spot. The general parking garage is SUPER far away, too far to walk with your luggage so have someone drop you off and wait for the other to make the 10 minute trek back up. The room was very clean, large, and comfortable. Everything was working as far as the TV, alarm clock, lamps, etc. The shower was a nice size and the shampoo wasn't as cheap as other hotels in the area. Checking in & out was very easy.
