We also signed up for the card which is silver and actually has your name printed on it. Its a free cheap souvenir to take back home, unfortunately I lost mine. There are plenty of things to do here, as with most Vegas hotels so spend some time walking around checking everything out.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur is friendly and is great value for the money!”
Reviews.Author: Aubrav
Reviews.Content: Forget all of the bad reviews you hear about Excalibur. I just returned from my 5th trip staying at that hotel and still have absolutely nothing to complain about. We upgraded to the widescreen room for the 3rd time and it was just as beautiful, clean and comfortable as always. The decor is very warm and modern, the tv is a 42" flat screen, the shower is large enough for 2 and the beds are super comfortable. The hotel itself is great. It's very laid back and has the "come as you are" atmosphere instead of the posh "rich" atmosphere. It really makes you feel like you belong. And since in Vegas you spend very little time in your room, why pay the high prices that the other resorts charge? The location isn't any better. I would rather say that I paid $24/night to stay at Excalibur than say that I paid $300/night to stay at the top resorts. The only thing you are limited to in Vegas is your hotel pool. Other than that you can access all of the attractions, restaurants, shows and casinos of any other hotel in the city. And Excalibur's pool isn't bad either. They have 4 pools and multiple hot tubs, a bar, a restaurant, cabanas, a water slide, an adult pool and cocktail servers just like every other hotel (with the exception of the few that have wave pools/lazy rivers). Give it a chance and you will enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “will not be back”
Reviews.Author: heathers44
Reviews.Content: poor reception, very brisk unwelcoming booking ordeal at which they over charged us. Room basic and frankly the shower was horrible, I had to clean it before I could use it, desperately needs a make over. not happy to find out Tower 2 had been made over but we were in Tower 1 which was very run down. Quite a walk to the centre of the strip Hotel advertises it self as a boys getaway, stag nights etc, of which I was unaware when I booked.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value...if a little smokey!”
Reviews.Author: andydev17
Reviews.Content: Satyed here for 7 nights in October 2010. Got the room for free but even if we would have paid the going rate it would only have approx £300 ($450). For that price it can't be faulted. We stayed in Tower 1 , though we did get a strip view which was nice. After reading reviews of Tower one I have to say I was more than a little weary but I needn't of worried, yes the furniture has seen better days but the room was spotlessly clean and the bed was one of the most comfortable I've ever slept in. Room was cleaned every day and we always had plenty of towels and the air con worked a treat. The only negatives are the time share people (but you can simply ignore them), the distance to the centre of the strip (monrail and busses are easy to access however) and the smokey casino which has you stinking after walking through. But these are minor gripes, buffet was ok and the food court is fine if you like junk food and doughnuts. Food wasn't great but I'd recommend Dick's last resort if you're looking for a laugh (and if you're not easily offended!), though give Sherwood cafe a miss, long lines and below average food. On the whole if you get a really good deal I'd stay here and spend the rest of the cash on enjoying yourself elsewhere on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “icky-will never ever stay again.”
Reviews.Author: rachaelmarie044
Reviews.Content: Cons 1. a resort fee of about $10 a day that we were not told about up front-didn't receive newspaper and had to route all long distance calls through front desk even those these are covered in resort fee we were stuck with 2. safe didn't work-we were told could be up to 2 hours to fix and that someone had to be in the room when the maintenance employee came. Only took them 20 minutes to get there so that wasn't so bad-still didn't appreciate being told would have to stay in room an extra two hours at the beginning of my Vegas vacation 3. We had a first floor room. When we first entered the room both of the windows were open *******NOT SAFE** 4. Room was not clean. Beds were made and there were fresh linens, but there were cigarette butts in the ice bucket, still trash in trashcan in main room, and it was just very dusty and musty. Pros 1. On the Las Vegas strip 2. Cheap 3. My wallet fell out of my purse and security was very friendly and helpful, and I did get it back. I really appreciated this.

Reviews.Title: “Paid for upgrade, my god what did the older room look like!”
Reviews.Author: lakenit
Reviews.Content: My friend and I decided to econ it, and since we were only staying 3 days and were not going to spend much time in the room, why not try it........Oh my GAAAAAWWWWDDDD. What a dump! If you have heard of motel 6..well this is motel 3. Paid for the upgrade cause I had read about bed bugs in older rooms, couldn't deal with that, so surely the new renovated rooms would be nice. WRONG! Opened the door and I could not believe they were trying to pass these rooms off as renovated. A/C did not work but half the time, place was dirty, smelled....on and on. Even though we spent most of the time gambling we still had to come back to sleep. NEVER AGAIN!!! RUN FROM THIS PLACE!

Reviews.Title: “Would not spend another night here for free”
Reviews.Author: lec1727
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel on a Wednesday about 6:00 and immediately upon entering were grabbed by an employee in order to get our free "gift". We were told that we could get free show tickets if we put a $40 deposit down & then when we picked them up the next day, the money would be returned. The girl wouldn't directly answer some of our questions because we knew there was a catch somewhere so we declined and went to check-in. Check-in took about 10 minutes and we were given a widescreen room on a smoke-free floor which is what we had requested at booking (Tower 2 on the 24th floor). After checking in someone else tried to get us to come get our "free" gift (if you've been to Mexico & dealt with the timeshare people, this was very similar). We got to our room & it didn’t smell like smoke, but smelled like very strong air freshener; I thought it would fade, but it never did during the 3 nights we were there. There was no comforter or blanket on the bed, just sheets which had multiple small holes in them. There were four pillows, three of which had stains on the pillowcases. One of the pillowcases had what looked like a large blood stain. I called housekeeping & requested some that weren’t stained & those were brought up quickly. The bathroom had a large counter with one sink and a good-sized shower with hardly any water pressure. The shower head was caked with what looked to be lime/calcium deposits. I called and spoke with the manager the next day about that & the showerhead was replaced which helped some, but the water pressure still wasn’t what I expect from a hotel. The room was also very dusty & the TV made a weird buzzing noise while on. While speaking with the manager I questioned him about the room because the widescreen rooms on the hotel’s website are advertised as newly renovated & I couldn’t see how this room was renovated. He basically argued with me that it was renovated; I would be terrified to see what the non-renovated rooms are like. My mom had a widescreen room on the 14th floor of Tower 2 & she had the same problems with the water pressure & stained linens. The bed was comfortable, but that is the only positive that I can come up with. Our room overlooked the pools & freeway & had very thin windows. Even though we were so high, there was still a lot of traffic noise from the freeway. I was woken up multiple times each night and would not stay here again if they offered me a free week stay. We booked here because it was cheap, but next time I’ll pay the extra money & stay somewhere better. I don't think that I've ever stayed somewhere that I've been this disappointed in.

Reviews.Title: “The room was disgusting.”
Reviews.Author: 73biz
Reviews.Content: When we first check into our room there was used condoms in the garbage and then toliet had not been cleaned. We called housekeeping and they sent someone to clean up the room. He explained this happens all of the time. On morning of the second day the shower would not drain. Again, phoned housekeeping and they sent a maintenance person the clean the drain, however, the black disgusting sluge was left in our shower. We called housekeeping numerous times and it was over an hour and half before we tracked down someone in the hallway. When talking directly to guest services they suggested to explain everything to a superviser when checking out so they could compensate us. When checking out they said we could have had a room change and would not compensate us. We had no time during our numerous call to guest services or housekeeping we offered a new room. Very disappointed in the excalibur. Never would recommend to anyone to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected”
Reviews.Author: SReed12
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights, Wed-Sun. We stayed in an upgraded widescreen room in Tower 2, which did not disappoint! Friends of ours stayed in Tower 1 (old rooms), and weren't impressed though. Front desk staff was extremely nice, and the housekeeping staff responded very promptly. We found it was best to give them a call letting them know when you’ll be heading out for a few hours so they have time to get in and out of your room. The casino was MUCH smokier/less ventilated than many other casinos we visited up and down the strip. Drink service was sparse. The timeshare people were quite pushy, though we learned to just pretend we didn't see them, or when they ask "will you be around this weekend/tonite/etc?" just say "nope, today's our last day here" or something of that nature. Our favorite part of the hotel was definitely the pool and poolside bar/restaurant Drenched. Very reasonably priced food we thought....drinks not so much, but we expected that. You can however fix your own drinks up in your room (stop at a grocery/liquor store prior to checking into the hotel) and bring them down to the pool as long as they are in plastic containers. Food at Drenched was amazing-chicken tenders, waffles fries, etc made the perfect hangover-curing foods, and the drinks were very strong. The adults only pool was quiet and the waitress service was fine. Although it’s located at the south end of the strip, the tram to Luxor/Mandalay was a nice touch and the easy access to the Deuce bus system (stops in front of pretty much every hotel) made traveling northbound on the strip bearable. Overall, we were quite impressed, especially given the $40/nite price!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL IN GOOD LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: LOIRE1282
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Excalibur Las Vegas for 10nights, this is our second year here, it is a great hotel with great rooms, the buffet is excellent, the location is excellent, large swimming pools and free parking, dont know why some reviews are negative! Would recommend and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for your money!”
Reviews.Author: swiffy_new
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a few days at the Excalibur in Las Vegas. Just like every hotel on the strip, it is loud and overcrowded and the constant ding-ding-ding from the slot machines can get to you, but... We encountered great service, personnel who went out of their way, an excellent room which was upgraded just cause, slept incredibly good, and very much enjoyed our stay. If you go, take advantage of the all day buffet for a special price - it is most certainly a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “This was a better stay than I expected.”
Reviews.Author: Peyton18
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of reading on the hotels on the strip before I booked our stay. My wife and I picked Excalibur, even though there were some negative reviews, but we were optimistic. We were thrilled with our choice. 1) The hotel and casino were very clean. We stayed on a non-smoking floor, but there wasn't a smokey smell anywhere. I'm not sure if they have a new air system or what, but it was very pleasant. The room was plenty big enough as well. Typical size, bigger bathroom than I would have expected. 2) The food was very good, also. The buffet was a great deal ($30 to eat all day) We got our money's worth. We had a huge breakfast, lunch was several different entrees, Chinese, lots of fresh food, dinner was a huge selection, including sushi. During the day, if we wanted to take a break, we could simply walk in and grab something to drink and snack on and rest a few. We did not have a pricey meal in this hotel, but we ate food from the court at different times, and it was always fresh. 3) The casino was just right for us. The table games started at 5 dollar minimums during the day, and sometimes rose to 10 at night. Other hotels offer the same games with higher minimums. We walked to the Luxor, NYNY and MGM; the Excalibur always appeared to be busier, maybe for that very reason. With more people, the place was a lot more fun. Some of the dealers were personable, some not. The waitresses were all nice, and the comp drinks were very good. I'll list the negatives here, not just for Excalibur, but overall. My main complaint is the staff of the company pushing resort packages. They are set up at each entrance and approach you every single time you enter the casino. The first time you meet them, you think they work for the hotel, and of course, they don't bother to tell you different. They walk up, ask you if you are checking in and for how long, and usher you to a desk. Then you find out who they are. By the last day, I just held up a flat hand as I passed them. It felt rude, but you had to do it. They were a huge pain in. I did not run into any of them in the other hotels. It wasn't that they were pushy, they just approached you every time you passed them. Just hold up a hand or ignore them, just like you would the guys pushing the flyers on the street. 2) The tram to Luxor and Mandalay Bay wasn't working all the time, not sure why. It rained one day while we were there, and that was the day it was shut down, so it may have had to do with the weather, but I'm not sure. When we did ride it, it was great. However, there is a moving walkway connecting Excalibur and Luxor, and it was very convienient and was running the whole trip. As far as negatives go...THAT WAS IT! My tips for a Vegas trip to Excalibur: Buy a daily bus pass. There were kiosks all over the place (we used the ones in front of MGM and Excalibur) and there were security guards there to help you figure out what you needed to buy. By the way, those security guys were extremely polite and very helpful. It costs $7 for a day, and there are two line it will work for: the Duece and the Gold Line. The Duece makes a lot more stops, so it can be very convienient, but will take longer if you plan on going farther. If you want to do some inexpensive shopping, take the Goldline South to the Outlet Center. Again, the buffet was a good deal. Try it for one day, and I think you'll agree. If you are looking for generic Vegas souvenirs (sp), walk around shop. The same ones can be found in Walgreens right down from MGM and for a fraction of the price. I hope this helps, and have fun on your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - More than I ever Expected!”
Reviews.Author: blairs1
Reviews.Content: Went to Vegas with Friends in late 2009 - and had booked a Vacation package through Delta Vacations. Had no issues with storing my bags for a few hours while I waited for friends to fly in and for me to walk down the strip to get some paperwork that I needed to pick up from another hotel. I came back around noon and was granted an early check in. There was an issue with my booking (well, Excalibur couldn't find it - can't fault them, Delta couldn't find my flight reservation either). Delta had just went through their merger and apparently some packages were mixed up (double booked in the airline system but no tickets actually generated) - so I assumed this was just a case of calling Delta. I didn't even need to do that. Handed my paperwork over to the Check In Rep (not sure of his name) - and he took care of everything. He upgraded me from the normal Standard Room to a Widescreen (maybe a Widescreen Deluxe) room. I was pleasantly shocked at the size of the room, and how great it was. The bed was comfy, the TV was the perfect size and the bathroom was nice. Nice little meeting space off to the corner of the room, almost seperated. I had received a few drink coupons, and had no issues with those either. Plenty of options for either having a sit-down dinner or just grabbing a quick coffee or bite to eat. There were tons of shops as well. Almost like you didn't need to leave the Hotel for anything! Overall - I had a pleasesnt and comfortable stay. Staff were more than friendly. Room was more than comfortable, and it was a fun trip! Now if only my luck were as great as the whole experience that Excalibur offered.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely no problem”
Reviews.Author: Paul H
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Excalibur or the second time and found that it is still a perfectly acceptable strip hotel. Las Vegas is quite unique in that apart from the private rooms, most facilities are open to all. The rooms are large and comfortable, would have benefitted by access to a fridge but the safe was free and easy to use. The all day buffet at a single price of $27.50 was excellent, we had breakfast lunch and supper there and it was to a high standard. What more can I say. There are four swimming pools, one with slides and private booths to rent. .... As for the US, a few comments would be relevant here, it is about time that the US fell into line with most of the civilised world and banned smoking in public buildings. When in the casinos it was necessary to remove a stinking overflowing ashtray from the machines and tables. I had forgotten what it was like to have stinking clothes at the end of the day and having to sit beside ignorant smokers oblivious to those around them who are sickened by the stink. ... Children - Don't take them to Las Vegas (It's great) under 21 years of age they cannot drink or enter the gaming areas of the casinos. ... Think twice about stag and hen nights as the drink is exhorbitant, Nine fine Irishmen at New York New York a tiny tin of apple juice around $5 and a pint of Guinness for over $7. Drink prices, apart from the floor of the casino are mad. ... Transport - despite having been there 8 times we still got ripped off by the taxi from the airport when the clock said $18+ and he tried to charge $27, I begrudgingly gave $25. On the way back to the airport, the driver was a lovely chap from Sri Lanka and the clock said just $12+ so use that as your aim when getting taxis. The Deuce which I recommended in the last review will have to be amended. They now have a bendy bus that supposedly complements the Deuce and does not stop as often. The two times that we used the Deuce it was like a sardine can, absolutely jammed tight with new passengers having to push those already there into a tight claustrophobic jam. Watching it pass it was obvious that this was a regular occurence.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: CateTay
Reviews.Content: You really are treated like royalty when you make your stay at the Excalibur! I have made 4 trips to Las Vegas (Dec 2008, Feb 2009, Dec 2009 & Feb 2010) and have already booked my stay for Dec 2010! You start your stay by meeting friendly checkin staff who really do work with you to make sure everything is as you want it. Really love the fact that I can have my luggage looked after as I fly into Las Vegas in the morning before the normal check in time. The rooms are nice and clean and well looked after. I've stayed in both Towers and while I agree that the newer side have beautiful rooms, I had no complaints about the other rooms at all! The cleaning staff are quick and efficient, and on the odd time that I came in while they were still there, were super friendly! One of my favorite places is the Octane on the 2nd level! It is a hidden gem for the Excalibur with super bar staff and great live music (and a friendly and fun DJ on the nights they don't have live music). A definate item to include in your stay is the Tournament of Kings! It was fun to cheer along for your country and the food was fantastic! Just a really fun night's adventure! We even got to take our picture with a few of the performers afterwards! I have recommended this hotel to friend's since my first stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel to stay & play and centralized in an area where you can get to other casinos easily- a definate plus!”
Reviews.Author: NewSel1
Reviews.Content: I will stay at the Castle for all my future visits to Sin City. It has a wonderful location. I love the in-house restaurants. The casino is great and so are all the shows. Also a great place if your looking for fun with the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, affordable, true Vegas experience”
Reviews.Author: DoubleAOZ
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a conference and was after a hotel that was close enough to the strip but still gave great value. I booked the widescreen room and it was all I needed. Only issue was that the poker 'room' took 2 hours to get a table for me to play on.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round”
Reviews.Author: lesleym_1967
Reviews.Content: My partner and i stayed at the Excalibur for 7 nights, We had a room in tower 2 , which was clean, spacious and had everything we needed, It was the best holiday i have ever had and we are in the process of booking again for August 2011. The location of the hotel was fantastic, had plenty of places to eat and drink and lots to do apart from playing in the casino. To finish our holiday nicely, I had a jackpot win on the slots the day before we flew home to the u.k, I came home with more money than i had taken, what a RESULT!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: cashbox1124
Reviews.Content: We visited Las Vegas for New Years Eve 2009-2010. We’ve been to Las Vegas many times and have always stayed at a different hotel. We’re not picky and when in Vegas are really only in the room to sleep and get ready for the day. We chose the Excaliber for the reasonable prices leading up to NYE (although, be sure to take the $10/night fee into account when comparing prices) – the price for our room the night of NYE was comparable to other hotels. We stayed in the new towers (thankfully) and traveled with another couple. There were quite a few issues we encountered. Oddly enough, the TV kept cutting out and shutting off while we were watching it. I know you don’t go to Vegas for TV watching, but it’s nice to at least catch the weather or the headline news. That’s hard to do when your TV periodically shuts off. I made sure to call down to the front desk because I didn’t want to be blamed at checkout for a TV that didn’t work. I was told that the TVs weren’t working because too many people were watching TV. Seriously?! Yeah, that’s what I was told. The other couple we traveled with were on a different floor and didn’t have the same problem as us. I guess no one was watching TV on their floor? Having a non-functioning TV in your Vegas hotel room is one thing that we could have dealt with (even though we booked the “widescreen room”), but I really didn’t appreciate the way we were spoken to and treated. If you have a room that’s advertised by the TV, at least make sure the TV works! I understand there probably was nothing they could have done for us, but at least apologizing and telling me that although it sucks, they can’t move us to another room and there’s no one available to fix it (acknowledging the issue) would have been better than the curt response I got! Housekeeping: Food was left in the hallways for days (that must be where the cause of all the bugs I read about). We called down and asked for a comforter (although it was December, our bed did not have a comforter on the bed when we first arrived to the room), but were told we couldn't have one since we were on the 20th floor and comforters are only given to certain floors and below. Maybe they were trying to save money and under the assumption that since heat rises, it would be hotter on the upper floors and those guests wouldn’t use the comforters, but if we called and asked for one, surely they had an extra we could use… Nope, we never got one; they definitely held their ground and my husband and I slept in sweatshirts under a sheet! We called 3 times during our first night to ask for a do not disturb sign. Each time they said they would send someone up. Not only was it was never delivered (not even when they cleaned the room periodically during our 5 day stay), but we were woken up by the housekeeper numerous times a morning (even after we told her we didn’t need our room madeup). Also, when housekeeping was on our floor, I asked one of the women for an extra towel (we were only provided 2 and I wanted one for my hair) and she told me that she couldn't give me any since she only had 1 towel per room to give out and that we shouldn’t use all the towels we were given during our stay. 5 days and you want 2 people to share 1 towel? I found this unsatisfactory, although, when I called to ask for the manager, I was treated as if I was asking for something very outlandish. Bell Desk: We had a late flight and left our luggage with the bell after checkout. When it was time to collect our luggage, we waited for 40 minutes and almost missed our flight. We stood in 2 lines (that didn’t have more than 6 people in them) while we could see our luggage in the room. They switched staff a few times and took a long time asking for tips after retrieving luggage for guests. I asked if I could get it myself, but was told that for security purposes, I needed to stand in each line once. The manager could have cared less when we approached him with the problem! The staff really needs to act like they care about those who are staying at their hotel! There is absolutely no hospitality at this hotel! And, to top matters off, our friends that traveled with us received a flyer under their door everyday about the hotel happenings, we never did. They also received a packet of information regarding the hotel procedures for New Years Eve, we did not receive this. When I went to the front desk to ask for this information, they told me that the information didn’t exist and that my friends must have made it up! PROS: The room and bathroom were large and very clean (initially) and the elevators were quick (they have express elevators taking you to the higher floors without stopping at the lower floors on the way). We had a nice big window that overlooked the NY skyline, which was very nice. The only time we could hear noise from the strip in our room was during the day on NYE and that’s completely understandable (and who stays in their room in Vegas on NYE anyways?!). There were no bugs in our room. The food court is very convenient and there’s interior moving walkways to both Luxor and Mandalay Bay. All in all, if you stay at the Excalibur, you’re staying at a budget friendly hotel. These days, with the economy the way it is, you can find just as great deals somewhere else with a lot better customer service and nicer amenities!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay - Wide Screen room with a view”
Reviews.Author: kms61
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur Hotel for 2 nights in Sep this year with two boys 11 & 8. We had booked a widescreen room and asked for an upgrade to a Widescreen Room with a view. The upgrade cost us $10 per night, which we were very pleased with, Our room was in Tower 2 which was a short walk from reception thru the Casino. Our room was fantastic. Very roomy with two queen beds and a great view of New York New York and the strip. The room was very clean and beds extremely comfortable. We ate at the all you can eat Buffet (we only had Breakfast & Dinner, not the lunch) for $24.95 adults & $18.95 children. There was plenty of food and also a large variety to choose from. Our kids loved being able to go up and help themselves over and over again. The hotel smells a little smokey around the gaming area, but all the hotels we went into were similar. We used two of the 3 pools at the hotel and one had a waterslide which kept the kids amused. We read some great review and also some terrible reviews for this hotel, but I would definately stay there again if we returned, Staff were very helpful and restaurants at the hotel were fine. I took money out of a ATM Cash machine which apparently was empty, and it took the money out of my account but I didn't get the cash. The Hotel was very helpful and after looking into it, they sort it out very quickly and gave me the cash from the Cashier in the Casino. I particularly loved the "Pearl Factory" shop upstairs near the Buffet where tou pay $14.95 for an Oyster and get to keep the pearl inside. I was lucky enough to get 2 Blue Pearls, also 2 white & 1 pink pearl which we got set into Jewellery. Its a bit of fun, but could get expensive if you get addicted to it, like I did. Overall it is a great hotel to stay at and right near New York New York Hotel and MGM Grand. You can walk across the road and pay $7 per person and get a 24hr bus ticket to ride the bus up and down the strip.

Reviews.Title: “The Disney Castle”
Reviews.Author: SamB77
Reviews.Content: The hotel actually looks less tacky in real life than it does in the brochure! The stay was fine, the casinos are all HUGE and you can easily get lost, so make sure you pack your sense of direction. The rooms were a good size and clean but no drinks facilities in the rooms. When we arrived there was a problem with a broken bedside lamp, but the maintenance man was in our room within about 5 minutes of calling to report the problem. The only downside was that there are Grandview timeshare people crawling all over the hotel. They constantly badger you, but once you learn to recognise them you can brush them off easily. We got nabbed before we even got to the registration desk and didn't realise it was a timeshare thing. After over 14 hours of travelling it was the last thing we needed and we signed up for the visit (2 hours, 2 and a half hours and then told at the end it wouldn't be more than 3 and a half hours) and handed over 40 dollars on the promise of getting it back, getting tickets for Lion King and 50 dollars for gambling in the hotel. Well, we met a couple who had been on the talk and they said they kept them for 5 and a half hours!! So we managed to get a refund by saying one of us was unwell and we just paid for show tickets and spent the day exploring the strip. They also said they never got their gambling money and had been promised something else we didn't and they didn't get that either. We ate at the all-you-can-eat buffet and this seemed to be quite good value for money, lots of choice of food. Get there early for breakfast though, they're serving lunch by 11am. All in all, the excalibur seemed quite a good budget choice.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal on a budget”
Reviews.Author: fatnchoi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur from the 9th October until the 14th October 2010 having previously stayed at the MGM Grand. Prior to our arrival we had used Tripadvisor and as such had booked Widescreen Rooms and again prior to arrival had requested a Strip View. This is all in addition to the basic room cost and you also have to add on a Resort Fee of approx $10 per day and the only useful part of the resort fee was that you got use of wired internet access in your room. Check in was a painless process and we then made our way through the Casino to our room. Our room was on the 25th floor and we had a good view of New York New York and the MGM. The room had a king size bed and a flat screen tv (we turned it on once for about 5 minutes during our stay) The bathroom had a large walk in shower but no bath, but then again I dont know many people who would have a bath on holiday! The room also has an iron, ironing board and an electronic safe. There are 3 lifts for floors up to the 17th floor and another 3 lifts for floors 18 upwards so generally you didnt have to wait long for an elevator. The rooms were cleaned to an acceptable standard and noise from the strip was audible but then again what would you expect in Vegas! The Casino is smokey at times but as we didnt really gamble that much I couldnt comment on the gaming. We ate in the food court and in the Sherwood Cafe and the food was good on all occassions. The hotel is connected to the Luxor and Mandalay Bay by walkways and by the monorail and it is a short walk to NYNY or the MGM where you can get the monorail up the strip. As has previously been mentioned the Timeshare folk can be very tiresome with the same person asking me on no less than 4 occassions in one day if I wanted to see a "free" show. Might be worthwhile wearing a Tshirt with "I'm not wanting a free show thanks" printed on it as they are at every entrance in the place!!! We also asked about booking a trip to the Grand Canyon with the Concierge in the hotel but they were about $70 per person more expensive than the stall at the Fashion Show Mall. All in all though I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wishes to see Vegas on a budget and is prepared to walk or take transport to the other sights on the Strip. I would also recommend booking a Strip View room as the sight in the morning of the sunrising behind the Casinos is fantastic. As an aside the taxi from the airport cost $25 and the taxi to the airport cost $13 (both including a tip) and the other taxis we took during our stay also had quite a variation in price between the outward and inward journeys!

Reviews.Title: “ok for the price...”
Reviews.Author: Iluvhyd
Reviews.Content: ok for the price... I was here for 2 days and shower tub clogged on both the days. maintenance wasn't good either.

Reviews.Title: “avoid the buffet”
Reviews.Author: brit-xpat
Reviews.Content: even though the all day buffet is a good price, 29.99$, this casino is at the top end of the strip so if you plan to go anywhere it means you have to keep travelling back which takes up a conciderable amount of time out of your day. The cheap buffet does mean the choices are less than other buffets although the range is enough on a budget. Also beware if you enter the buffet after 9.30pm you will not have a lot of time to choose and eat at a resonable pace, they close at 10pm. This caught us out big time. If you go to the buffet at Harrah's, Rio, Paris, palms, sahara, and two others, it costs 39.99$ and you can enter into any of that group any time of day so just go to the nearest when hungary In our opinion the hotel is a budget casino, needs a good spruce up, a little costly compared to others as you get no extra benefits like a club card for discounts like you do if you book else where. also the sherwood cafe charge $9 for a very weak vodka & coke, if you sit at a slot you can get the same for the dollar tip. The poker room chips are very dated and dirty. This casino had no buzz. Would not book again would go to centre of the strip probably in one of the buffet group as they give you bonuses.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price.”
Reviews.Author: fashionistalibrarian
Reviews.Content: Good price. Convenient in terms of the strip & the parking lot. The food is awful, but the drinks are fine. It's so extra-okay, I've stayed there twice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for the Value”
Reviews.Author: ChessieChick86
Reviews.Content: First off, getting to the hotel from the airport was a breeze. Very convenient location! Check-in took a while but only because it was very busy!! (all the 10-10-10 weddings) Getting through the room was ok, just walking through the smokey casino was a bit of a con. We chose a "non-smoking" room. When reserving the room they said we might not get one, but when we checked in it was "non-smoking" ! The room was clean, beds were a little hard but sleep able. The tv only got about 5 channels, but we didn't spend much time in the room to worry. Also a microwave or fridge would have been nice, since i had so many leftovers from my meals. I enjoyed the gym and the pool area was very relaxing. Also the pool food was great, because you got a lot for a very small price (compared to other places along the strip) A plus to the hotel was that food was available when I was hungry. The all-day buffet was a great deal!! And having a connection to the Luxor and Mandalay Bay was very convenient. I would definitely return to this hotel, because of the location, price and I was able to relax.

Reviews.Title: “NOT WORTH THE PRICE”
Reviews.Author: cmason54
Reviews.Content: I even had free rooms! Still not worth the price. They were advertised as " rooms that were redecorated with flats screens". The only thing new in the room was the TV and who watches TV in Vegas!?!? We did turn it on once and discovered it only received 4 channels anyway. We checked into the hotel in the VIP check in area. Wonderful people who told us that we should charge everything we do to our rooms and it would be compted to us when we checked out. Not only was nothing compted, people were rude when we checked out. We were told we were not compted because we had free rooms. I thought we had free rooms from previous visits. Very disappointing service and rooms. Won't stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur Hotel - Good value for money mid week”
Reviews.Author: cgburmie
Reviews.Content: Stayed a Thursday and Friday night. Good casino area and cheap tables. Friday night prices tripled so not really worth it but oh well its Vegas and still one of cheapest in the middle of the strip. Great value if you only go for the mid-week deals.

Reviews.Title: “Visiting our son who is stationed at Nellis AFB.”
Reviews.Author: djm65
Reviews.Content: I've been to Vegas 5 other times with girlfriends and this was the first time staying at the Excalibur. It was a great hotel since we had our younger daughters with us and there was a lot to do for kids, it wasn't the greatest hotel we've ever stayed at. You can definitely tell it's very old and hasn't been updated in a long time. Rooms were older, a few things broken in our room, never enough towels. But I will say that whenever we called the front desk, we were helped immediately. One problem we encountered was the maid service knocking my daughters Ipod onto the floor with her $40 ear phones and going over them with the vacuum breaking the ear phones. They reimbursed her though.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck”
Reviews.Author: EaLaSpada
Reviews.Content: Let me first preface this by saying that for the amount I paid for the room, perhaps I shouldn't be complaining at all, but for the sake of others who are considering a stay, I'll continue. Here's what you can expect for a standard room: dated and dilapidated furniture (i.e., veneer missing, wobbly tables, etc), and less than clean elements (the room had a great deal of other people's hair left around: on the bed spread, on the floor of the bathroom, etc.). My shower drain was also so clogged up with what must have been *more* hair that it would quickly fill up with nasty, sudsy water (even before my soap got in there) up to the top of my feet. It is a large room (even with a love seat), and does include some amenities, such as a iron and board, but that's about it. Prepare to pay premium for any mediocre food you want to order within the establishment. I paid $21 for a very Denny's-like Eggs Benedict and a cup of the worst coffee I've ever had at their cafe (but there's Vegas for you). Finally, no matter how you paid for your room (I paid through Priceline), be prepared to pay a resort fee on top of that. Altogether, not the greatest. However, no roaches or bed bugs, so I suppose that's something!

Reviews.Title: “Do they know the meaning of PRIVACY?”
Reviews.Author: orangetree_82
Reviews.Content: I just went for a vacation to Las Vegas with my family just recently. In total I booked 2 rooms. The hotel was located near other hotels like New York New York and MGM among others. The reason why I rated the hotel as bad is because..First of all one of the rooms is dirty, the carpet at one corner was sticky, I kid you not. The knob for the side table drawer was missing. The air condition kept on going back to its original temperature. Though i took 2 smoking rooms, but the stench was too much even for my husband who is a smoker himself. On the second day, I was greeted by 2 security officers in the afternoon after I returned from sight seeing.. They said that I used an electrical appliances which can be danger to the hotel. True enough I brought a small elctric cooker to the hotel but that is only to be used for boiling water for my baby as well as for cleaning up my baby's bottle.. I admit that I maybe wrong for using the electric cooker but the main reason as to why i am very UPSET is, the housekeeping staff actually entered my room without me knowing it although I place a PRIVACY TAG on the door. They have already intruded my privacy and to top that they also entered the other room too. DON'T they know the meaning of Do Not Disturb.. since both rooms has electric cooker we were told to bring it down to the reception counter for them to keep it till at night where they insist that we go down back to the reception to collect the appliances. The fact that they entered our rooms without permission makes me wonder how many other rooms with the privacy tag they could have entered without the customers knowledge.. Not only that you entered the room without permission, and you didnt even bother clearing the bin which was filled with trash.. To be honest I do not feel SAFE at all leaving my stuff lying around our rooms after that incident... I hope with this review whoever you are who is thinking of staying in this hotel.. I hope you will at least read through my review and make your best decision. What a bad experience for my first trip to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “The Steakhouse at Camelot”
Reviews.Author: usck77
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to eat at the Excalibur hotel restaurant The Steakhouse at Camelot. We were sat right away and someone dropped of bread. The waiter came over and took our order , it took 20 plus minutes for us to get our salad. I over heard the expo talking to our waiter asking if he had brought out our salads and he was like "oh no ... i forgot" at that point i was mad because he hadn't even come over to apologize. Someone else ending up bring our salads out and that's when i called the manager over and just let him know that i was upset that we were forgotten about only because the table across from us got sat after us and had already gotten their steaks while we were still waiting for our salads. I had asked the manager if our food was dying in the window gettting dry and he was like " no we don't start making the food until you have your salad. lol great now we are 20 minutes behind. Our waiter didn't even bring out our food... it was ok ..not worth the money at all. The manager apologized and said he would bring over a drink to make up for it. It was an espresso but in a cold version with alcohol. The reason I am writing this review is because I think we were poisoned by the manager because my boyfriend and i both had the poo's no more than 20 minutes afterward. We thought about it for awhile and think that he either did something to our food because i said something before it came out ..or he did something to the complimentary drink he gave us. If I were you... I would never eat there.. the service was horrible and the management is questionable.

Reviews.Title: “The rooms are big and the hotel is right...”
Reviews.Author: popkid
Reviews.Content: The rooms are big and the hotel is right on the strip, within walking distance of most of the hotels....that's about as far as the good points go. This hotel is very out of date, needs a complete refurb! The room we had wasn't clean, there were pubic hairs all over the side around the sink area in the bathroom, also the shower was awful, it was like someone dribbling on me. The hotel is very cheap and you do get what you pay for....personally I would pay a bit extra next time and stay at Ceasers Palace. If you're looking for a few cheap nights and somewhere to crash on a drunken weekend it's perfect but if you want a bit more i'd pay the extra and go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “They charge a resort fee”
Reviews.Author: World-Explorer81
Reviews.Content: On my last trip to Las Vegas I decided to spend the nights at the Excalibur. The two main reasons were its location on the strip as well as the price. But be aware that the hotel charges a resort fee of 10 USD per night, which they do not tell you beforehand. This is actually inacceptable. Some of the rooms have been upgraded lately but the one we stayed had not been. It was quite old as you can tell by looking at the picture. The TV set also did not function upon arrival so that we had to get it replaced by the hotel staff. Other than that the hotel has a lot to offer. Besides the casino at the bottom floor the hotel also features a large pool area, a large number of restaurants and free parking. The internet was also free but the hotel did not offer wireless. So using my mobile to access the internet was not possible.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: Sashalina1
Reviews.Content: My niece and I enjoyed a 6-day stay at Excalibur from October 3 through October 8. We had a very comfortable room. The mattresses are so comfortable one sleeps like a baby. The maids were prompt in making up our room when we left in the morning. The food was very good in the Sherwood Forest Cafe, and there where several chains in the hotel that made our stay pleasant and convenient: Starbuck's, McDonald's, Quiznos, etc. There are great shops and services available at the hotel. My niece bought an wonderful massage for me for taking her to Las Vegas, and the spa was incredible! There were 4 showers in the spa, and each one had a scent associated with it that had body wash, shampoo, and conditioner in the same scent: Green Tea, Lavender, Citrus, and Mango. The spa provides robes, slippers, and anything else one could possibly use. Q-tips, hair gel, dryers, combs, deodorant. My niece had back problems, so she spent hours in the whirlpool and steam room doing stretches and exercises. The pool was spotless and the deck chairs were widely available and very comfortable. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Does A Job For a Price”
Reviews.Author: MANorthShields
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in 2004 and found it a good value, if a little basic strip hotel back then and having now revisited in 2010, it seems pretty much the same for the main part. I don't think it has deteriorated substantially. The obvious advantage is the price and the location. We got a really good deal and found ourselves in a good location, near to New York, New York and MGM. If you are complaining about the amenities here then think about what you paid - the hotel offers good value for the money they charge, although the resort tax does stick in the craw if you ask me. I suppose we are not typical Vegas visitors - we come here to see friends and family rather than to gamble and party, but this hotel did what we wanted it to do. We came with a 10 month old baby and she had a great time actually and in spite of what people claim, there is plenty to keep a young child happy and busy here. What I didn't like was the constant attempts to sell stuff at us within the hotel. I don't mind a little of this, but here it was pretty much non-stop. Walking from the elevators to the parking lot, we would usually be accosted about 3 or 4 times and it's hard to stay polite with these people I can tell you. I also thought the Sherwood Forest Cafe (don't worry, it's a short walk to Denny's) was terrible! Overpriced (to be expected) but long lines and poor service with very average food makes this a place to miss. Fear not though, there is a Baja Fresh here (give it a try if you're British and not used to Mexican food). One thing that surprised me was the amount of Brits here (too many for my liking as I am British and I come abroad to escape it!) - always easily identified of course by the bottles of beer in their hands at 7.30am. The pool was okay and we tried to get our daughter some pool time without much success, but that was mostly down to the time of day I guess. As usual in America, most people were very friendly and polite and service outside the hotel was mostly exceptional. I would recommend this to a friend if they wanted good, basic value, but if you are looking for a more upmarket experience then head to one of the pricier hotels on the strip it isn't rocket science - you get what you pay for. At the budget end of things, this is better then Circus Circus and the Sahara and maybe a little behind the Flamingo, but as long as you know what to expect it is a good bet.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: LALA_TLV
Reviews.Content: great value for hotel-on the strip,average and not expensive all day buffet,big rooms. yes ,it is not on the level of Paris/venetian hotels-the price is relative... we took the chepest room and spent the money on shops and attraction. small problems-no refrigirator on the room,no knights parades as on the past.

Reviews.Title: “It is cheap for a reason”
Reviews.Author: faruz
Reviews.Content: We booked the Excalibur in our hope that this cheap hotel will still host 5$ BlackJack tables. We were wrong. Only 5$ BJ in the area is located in Tropicana or Hooters, but with bad rules. The hotel is cheap for a reason. It looks like its best days are already behind him. We loved the ability to travel fast to Luxor (LAX) and Mandalay Bay, but were a bit far from the center (Bellaggio area). When you order - make sure to ask for Tower II which is in much better condition than Tower I. (We had rooms in both towers).

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: berryberkeley
Reviews.Content: We went there for xmas, and it's definitely a very happy memory! We stayed for 5 nights and the price was very pleasant. The hotel room is clean and bright. The room view was spectacular and my kids absolutely loved it! The roundtable buffet downstairs is not as good as we expected though, but it's okay for its price. The castle design is very good for family with kids. The staff were very kind and friendly too. Generally, I would recommend it for its good value!

Reviews.Title: “Great Vaule”
Reviews.Author: uresev
Reviews.Content: We stated in a newer room, very clean. Would recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Good times”
Reviews.Author: pokieokienolikesmoki
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur for the first time this past weekend. We didn't know what exactly to expect since the hotel was so cheap and reasonable to stay at. Upon arrival we asked if we would be able to get a room in tower 2 even though we has just booked a standard room in tower 1. The front desk clerk said she would see what she could do. Within a minute she had upgraded us to a very nice room. completly redone and for no additional charge. It was awesome! The hotel had everything we needed. You didn't have to go far to eat or anything. There was lots of things for everyone to do. My only complaints are that the pool is only open till 6 which kind of sucks since we were on a holiday and the fact that there is time share people all over the place. You just have to be aware of them I guess. All in all we had a wonderful time and it was so nice to stay at a hotel that had such great amentities. The rooms were well cleaned, staff was pleasent and location was great. Ohhh and I must not forget...the room itself was far enough away from the strip that it was so nice and quiet at night! :)

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with good service.”
Reviews.Author: vrdumbos
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel and the service was good. The casino is slightly boring when you compare to the new ones on the strip. When we checked in they offered some free coupons for Luxor.

Reviews.Title: “A cheap choice with a good location”
Reviews.Author: My_Manao_Wale_No
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Excalibur. We stayed October 4-7. I found this hotel to be very convenient- it's south strip, and New York New York, Mandalay Bay, and Luxor were easily accessible. It's a short walk to Showcase Mall where the M&M's and Coca-Cola store are. There's a kind of cheesy magic to staying in a hotel that looks like a castle! The staff-Housekeeping, concierge, and valets were extremely friendly and helpful. I read some bad reviews on the cleanliness of the hotel, but I had no problems- it was made up daily and I always got a card with the name and phone number of our hotel maid. We stayed in Tower 1 which is way quieter than Tower 2 with a great view of the Luxor. This hotel was pretty family-friendly with a cool arcade level on the bottom, and shows and shops, and attractions that catered to families. Probably too much kids for visitors who are trying to have an adults' weekend out. We didn't mind. We had the breakfast buffet one day and it was just okay. I don't regret staying here. I loved the location and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “perfectly adequate”
Reviews.Author: whitepele
Reviews.Content: Hotl check in was quick, rooms were tidy for the price concious this hotel is perfectlly adequate for a short stay. lets face it if you are spending more than 5 hours in your room in any 24 hour period maybe you shouldnt be vacationing in Las Vegas

Reviews.Title: “AVOID AT ALL COSTS. PAY MORE FOR YOUR SANITY SOMEWHERE ELSE”
Reviews.Author: daisymay2
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel/flight with Alligiant from Bellingham 2 months before arriving. I called the day before arrival to ensure connecting rooms, as we were travelling with our daughter, son in law and 8 month old baby. 2 kings non smoking. Also wanted to set up a refrigerator to store the babies food. Extra cost was $20 a night. The person I spoke with directly at the hotel said everything was confirmed and I could pay for the fridge on arrival. Upon arrival , there was no connecting room. They don't gaurantee a reservation unless you call the day of. I said no one told me that and I just called the day before we left to ensure everything was taken care of. Big arguement about it at the check in. Finally she called a manager and together they went to the computer system to check. No adjoining. Can give you two queens in each room side by side but there will be no water on Tuesday for repairs. ARE YOU KIDDING? Back to the computer. The original desk clerk came back and said we have adjoining, 2 queens non smoking we moved someone else. Fine. Great. Get to our rooms. Yup we are adjoining, but NOT to each other. We join to someone else. LIvid. The furnishings are outdated old, worn, and sheets are stained, towels are fraying. The bathrooms are clean, but worn. Mirrors worn, old tiles, Sink doesn't drain, Blower dryer has been dropped a few times and missing parts. Table tops are stained . Taps in our daughters room were actually missing the chrome on both sides and they filled it with silicone. Hallways are dark and old looking. Food trays and items in the hall are left for days. I went to the desk and told them about the sink not draining. Also the shower was leaking at the tap. I said the shower worked fine for me, but for you the hotel to know you need to tighten the set screw for your own maintenance, not a big deal. Went out for the day. When we came back at 8 30 pm, my hubby went for a shower.. No handle, just a big hole in the wall now. Called down but the phone line was beeping the lite for a message. You have to move across the hall. Engineering issue in your room. We call down and say, what they hell? It only needed a set screw tightened. Not a new handle. They said you have to move. We said we don't want to move. You have to move. We will let you have a late check out at 3 pm for the inconvenience. Big whoop! So we start moving across the hall. 5 minutes later security comes up. (I guess they have cameras in the ceiling in the hall). What's going on here? You told us we had to move so were moving. He gets on his walkie talkie walking away from us and says, apparently we told them they have to move. No one assisted us. Someone had came up and dropped off a new room card that was it. The room was identical and still worn. Now though we were over the strip. NON stop traffic noise all night, sirens, aircraft noise and some band plays till 3 am in the morning and not even the a/c drowns it out. So I never slept until 3 -330 am when it got quieter, even though we were usually in by 1 am at the latest. Also the telephone message light was beeping in our new room. We pick it up. You have to move from your old room to this room. We will assist you with your move. Please call. Okay... We have already moved. Duh! We usually took our money with us where ever we went. However, one afternoon after the room was made up, we left my pack under the pillow and spent a couple of hours lying by the pool reading. I had counted the money the night before and that day we had only had breakfast. We were missing $400. I never said anything to the hotel as I can't prove it, but we did not leave any money there again. Food at the buffet was okay. The redemption machine at the casino never wanted to pay us , and we always got a ticket redirecting us to the cashier on the other side of the casino. The last day, I found out my daughter and hubby were not given the same 3 pm check out we were for the inconvenience of the shower, even though we were all travelling together. They had to pack all their stuff , including the baby items we rented and leave it all in our room. The hotel would not let them check out late when I called down. They went to check out. Came back with their bill, which was charged to my credit card even though I wasn't there and wasn't planning on paying all of that, but it wasn't okay to give them a late check out? Hmmm. We went to the Paris Cafe for lunch. It has reasonably priced good food. My daughter's family were going to shop , and we decided to go back to Excalibur and go to the pool for the last 1.5 hours before the check out. We gave my daughter one of the room keys when we left the Paris's restuarant. We stopped at some slots for 15 minutes on the way back. Went to our room and the key/card didn't work. We were on the 28th floor. Down the elevators. The security desk is right there. I asked if there was someway of contacting the front desk. He said yes the phone right here on the wall. I picked it up and took about 8 minutes to get someone. Meanwhile another couple talks to the security gaurd and they have the same problem. I am still on hold. I tell the gaurd I have the same problem that is why I am on the phone. The lady comes on the phone. I tell her the problem. You have to come to the desk front she says. As I watch the security guy pick up his phone and deal direct for the other couple whose card doesn't work either. I tell this to the lady on the phone. She says no you must come to the front. I hang up on her and go to the gaurd. He takes our room number and tells all 4 of us somewill will be up to our rooms momentarily. We got back up to our floor, 10 minutes later. No one. We are pissed. There goes pool time. I walk towards the elevators and see shadows and jingling around the corner. I ask the guy if he has keys for the room or if he is the guy we are waiting for. No he says. I can get you in. We tell him our problems, none too politely, but tell him we realize its not his problem. Now we can't leave the room as we have no way of getting back in. We call to the front desk, angry. Get transferred to Mary the manager. She says you have to have your card re keyed as they die at 12 oclock check out time. We told her 2 days ago you gave us late check out. You should know that. No you have to have them rekeyed. We said we have spoken to the front desk several times and no one told us that. I said the right hand doesn't know what the left hand is doing in this hotel. I said NO WAY am I paying a resort fee. She said its mandatory. I said I am not paying. All of the employees working here I said are brain dead. You just don't get it and I am not wasting my time speaking with you and hung up. Now we just waited until the kids showed back up from their shopping. Wasting our time and fuming. We went down to check out. No one at the counters for that. CLOSED. Only self check out. I went up to the counter and a guy and said I wanted to speak with a manger. I am he he says. I ranted about all the problems and I WAS NOT PAYING THERE RESORT fee as that would imply there was a resort of some kind. ITs manadatory he says pointing at the sign. We argue and I get frustrated. My thyroid problem has been bothering me since day one with all the problems here, (there are many more). He says I will take off 2 days fees. I said NO I AM NOT PAYING. Get your supervisor. Manager comes , same rig a ma roll. Finally after 10 minutes, he says . Okay I won't charge you the resort fees. I am like are you kidding me? That is what I asked you right off the bat and even you said it was mandatory. I said I AM Never coming back here or recommending it. ITS ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE AND 4 days of STRESS. Now I need a vacation :(

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeL3
Reviews.Content: Cannot fault this hotel , food was excellent., rooms were clean. , pool was good. well located along the strip

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Essexoldgirl
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews i did wonder what to expect, i dont know what people expect from a very inexpensive hotel, we stayed for one night before a road trip in tower 1 overlooking the airport, very quiet nice big room very clean and comfortable beds only thing no safe in room. We arrived back to vegas a day earlier than we had booked, and booked a upgraded room in tower 2 because we wanted to relax by the swimming pool and these rooms were really close to it, the staff were really helpfull and upgraded our other 3 nights for nothing. Again nice big room overlooking the swimming pool, very clean with comfortable beds slightly better decoration and a room safe, can't comment on the smoky casino as we are two of the smokers so did not notice, mind you i dont think it was any worse than any other casino, and we went in a lot of them. We ate breakfast at the Sherwood and it was ok, we had to queue most mornings for a little while but not too long. The swimming pool area was really wonderfull, 4 pools only 3 were open but none of them were packed and even though i am an 58 year old i enjoyed the slide!!!. All in all we had a wonderfull time at the Excalibur and would definately book to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: jrman66
Reviews.Content: All I can say is this - - Decent Hotel Room (do yourself a favor and pay for the upgraded room) - Nice pool complex (especially for kids) - Amazing Location - Nice bars; especially Dicks Last Resort So this hotel is not a luxury spot. But for real cheap, it's not so bad either. If not for the smoke in the Casino, I would have no complaints. However, sometimes I wanted a little more class. When I did, I went to another hotel and hung out. I could tell the kids just loved this hotel, espcially the pool with the hotel slide. If you want luxury, go someplace else. For business it also works well beacuse of its proximity to the Luxur and Mandalay Bay (with a tram in between hotels). PLUS IT'S CHEAP! Just make sure you stay in abn upgraded room and you will not be unhappy.

Reviews.Title: “Good value from a Canadian visitor”
Reviews.Author: wewanttoctheworld
Reviews.Content: Excellent value. Avoiding weekends when the prices for rooms in Vegas skyrocket will save you a bundle. We stayed 8 nights and our bill was under $650 even with the upgraded to the Widescreen Deluxe. Lovely clean, quiet room in Tower 2, over looking the pool. Beds were very comfortable. Casino is a little smokier than others in Vegas but it did not travel up to our room. Staff was very helpful and we really appreciated security at the tower entrance to our room. Food court is handy and reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “nice big room with great location”
Reviews.Author: billytourer
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 5 nights, the room is clean and large as is the pool area. The hotel is in a great location on the strip, with a walkway to the New York, New York hotel. The food is averge, I would recommend the buffet restaurant at the Paris hotel for both brakfast and lunch, it is amazing value. Overall the hotel offers great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, a little jaded, but adequate”
Reviews.Author: paspa2
Reviews.Content: We booked standard rooms with request for strip view. On arrival we were upgraded to widescreen rooms. This sounded great, but when we saw them we were very disappointed. They were at the back of the tower block on floor 3 and faced the brick wall of the casino! so, no view at all and because of the gigantic wall just a few feet away they were very dark. Didn't complain at that time as we were drained after 24 hours of flight and layover time getting there. Next day, and we were reassigned widescreen rooms on the 15th floor without any problem. (The staff on reception and concierge are extremely helpful and friendly. We used the concierge services a lot for trip advice, booking golf and confirming trips and return flights,) These rooms had fantastic views of the strip, but even on 15th floor traffic noise is continuous. However, that wasn't so bad as we had the views and room was clean an tidy. Location was very good. Handy for the monorail and trams, and taxis are very good value if you are in a group (taxis only carry five max though). Easy to get anywhere from here. Amenities at the hotel were good. You can eat and drink at various places within the Excalibur from a coffee and cake to go, macdonalds and pizza, cafes and restuarants. Not the best cafes and restuarants but we also went for breakfasts at NYNY and Luxor which were better standards for same price (both within 10 minutes walk). Pool area was brilliant, with good amenities (bar and food) and super pools and jaccuzzis. We liked the least.....timeshare sales people on Excalibur casino floor hassle you lots (with lure of cheap show tickets). We liked most the shows (tournament of kings and thunder down under). Also good food court and shops

Reviews.Title: “value”
Reviews.Author: venus173
Reviews.Content: Not the first time we have stayed here. OK it ain't the Ritz but room was clean (hi Rosa best maid ever) and staff are friendly. Pool area OK but they could provide a bit more shade without having to pay through nose. Buffet and Sherwood Cafe good value. (What has Sherwood Forest got to do with Excalibur?) We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “fine for the price”
Reviews.Author: muzz29
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel,after reading some of the reviews on here we wasnt expecting to much,but we found it to fine for the money we paid,staff friendly,bar staff ok,a couple of the staff on casino floor was abit misarable,but after finding our way round we had a brill time here,would go back,we got an upgrade without asking,and didnt have to pay resort fee which was a nice surprise,overall a good time had by all 4 of us

Reviews.Title: “We stayed for 5 days. Were pleased that...”
Reviews.Author: 19mandy84
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days. Were pleased that there have been upgrades to the hotel since the last time we stayed. We got a free upgraded room but the big screen tv had poor cable tv. Most channels were fuzzy or poor quality. The shower was dirty but since we didn't shower the first night, the maids were sure to have it cleaned up by the following day. The pools were awesome. The staff were friendly and very helpful. Dick's last resort was so much fun! The buffet was good. Would most definitely stay there again! Great value in $38 dollars a night. I found the resort fee a rip off though, at $10 a day per person. I would recommend this place to others.

Reviews.Title: “good value and good location”
Reviews.Author: josi50
Reviews.Content: good location on the strip. the room was big, clean and quite but the decor was oldish. we had a very good time also in the pool.the bufet is of good value and with an allday ticket no big wait.

Reviews.Title: “be aware the standard rooms are really 1980's dated”
Reviews.Author: trevor-wa
Reviews.Content: they have upgrade rooms for extra $'s we didn't see, but the "standard" rooms haven't been touched since 1984 and have views of walls

Reviews.Title: “brilliant hotel, friendly, fantastic place!!”
Reviews.Author: travelnics
Reviews.Content: we visited vegas whilst traveling across america, me and my boyfriend had stayed in the luxor for a few night and thought we would try out the excalibur!! we thought it was a brilliant hotel, the staff were so much friendly here they couldnt do enough to help you!! the rooms were brilliantly clean! the housekeepers did a brilliant job too.. the pool area was so clean, v wel maintained and there were 4 pools so it wasnt over croweded!! there were great places to eat there, a place called dicks was a good experience!!!! the buffet that is available on a daily basis was super food!! i would deff go back to this hotel as we had such a lovely experience!

Reviews.Title: “Fun for Vegas”
Reviews.Author: opera_classical
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights while staying in Las Vegas. I had a non-smoking room that smelled of smoke. Guess not much you can do in a Casino. All in all, it was a fun place to stay> I was expecting the room to be a tad nicer for what I paid, but heck.. it is just a place to lie your head after a long, fun night.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean, great value”
Reviews.Author: melbfamily10
Reviews.Content: We had booked two rooms - 1 king and 1 twin. On arrival at the hotel, we asked to upgrade to a one bedroom suite with an interconnecting twin room. The hotel upgraded us for $50/night - what a bargain (total average per night was $125). The rooms were HUGE and, although not the upgraded to the widescreen rooms, very clean and perfect for our stay. There is a $10/day charge for WIFI, but the landline internet connection was free (and fast enough to watch the AFL final on the ESPN feed). The buffet is pretty ordinary and the wait staff a bit jaded. Check in and out was quick and very friendly. Easy access to the Strip and monorail.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for a Decent Las Vegas Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kaiser51
Reviews.Content: The Excalibur is a decent hotel with a great value. It's not a luxury hotel by any means, and certainly not an option for those looking for a more hip, trendy, or glamorous Vegas stay. However, this is a great option if you're looking for a place to stay on the Strip and save money.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected”
Reviews.Author: suz406
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at Excalibur for the first time. Usually stay elsewhere. It was better than expected. From the reviews I was a bit worried but we got upgraded to a Wide Screen room which was nice and clean. Very roomy and big bathrooms. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The casino was easy to get around and not to big where you are walking forever to find something or get somewhere. Everyone in our party liked it. The only downfall was we always ate at the Sherwood Cafe which was great food and you do get big size portions. But the staff must not like there jobs at this restaurant. Not many smiles and slow at getting seated. It wasn't fille with kids like some reviews say. I guess if you travel during school break there are kids everywhere. Otherwise it was great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff,spotless room,good location,nice atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Beth502
Reviews.Content: After reading some recent reviews I began to really worry that we'd made the wrong choice with this hotel. We'd stayed here about 7 years ago and thought it was fine so booked on this basis but then began to panic when we read up on TA. However our worries were totally unfounded. The staff at check in were really friendly and helpful (we had a problem caused by our UK agent) but the Excalibur staff were great. We had booked a widescreen room which was modern, spotlessly clean and had an iron,ironing board, hairdryer,kingsize bed and decent sized wardrobe.It was also really quite. Room service was also available.The bathroom had granite surfaces and a big double shower. It was also spotless. If you get lucky you may even get a room with a view of the strip. The casino was fine. The cocktail waitresses came round frequently. People were friendly with a good atmosphere on the tables etc. There were plenty of food options incl pizza hut, mcdonalds, krispe kreme and quiznos for a quick meal/snack and there’s also a buffet and seated steak restaurant if you want something a bit more substantial to eat. We tried Dicks last resort for a drink and its not a place I would have picked but we had great fun and its worth at least one drink there (although prepare to be insulted- I know it sounds awful but its hilarious). There were a few bars (one with live music) and a couple of shows going on . There are 4 pools (although none appeared to be over about 3ft deep) and we rented a cabana for $50 which inc widescreen tv, towels, free soft drinks and crisps and a host and cocktail waitress service (although alcohol was extra - between $25-$30 for bucket of buds/budlights (5 bottles) depending on whether happy hour or not) and I would definitely recommend hiring the use of one. The music round the pool was good and not too loud and we chose our cabana in the adults area (although the pools that allowed kids were relatively child free and seemed pretty quiet.). There was also a spa that did special offers quite regularly. There were people of all ages staying here and I'd say it would be comfortable for any age group. The location is good- you can walk to MGM, NYNY, Luxor, Mandalay bay and a cab to the mid strip area (Bellagio etc) was around $10 inc tip -although you could walk this in about 20-25 mins if its not too hot. We hired a car (as we also wanted to travel further afield) and the hotel (as did all the others we visited) had free parking If you’re considering this hotel Id pay the $20 upgrade for a widescreen room and you'll have nothing to worry about. I cant comment on the standard rooms but if you book this room type I cant see you’d have reason to complain. Ok its not the Bellagio but as one reviewer has previously said- If you want 5 star you need to pay 5 star prices.In the Uk we wouldn’t even get a travelodge/premier inn room for the price we paid to stay here (For any US readers these are just a basic hotel -on a par with Motel 6 but without the pool!) So, if you’ve already booked to stay here and have booked a widescreen room- dont worry. If you’re considering staying here and you’re after a modern clean room with good hotel amenities but would rather be spending most of your money on gambling/eating and drinking and being entertained then a w/s room at the Excalibur is a good choice. Id definitely go back. Have a great trip

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: zottDallas
Reviews.Content: I'll just list my pros and cons.. Pros: good price, updated widescreen rooms were fine. Restaurant was fine, good food. Casino was fun and I didn't lose too much money! Smaller resort, walkway to Luxor and Mandalay. Rooms actually allow you to open the window a few inches. Location wasn't bad, as you can take the monorail at MGM or the free monorail at Monte Carlo to get mid strip. MGM comps were outstanding.. comped 2 of our meals as well as our spa fee just from playing slots. You have to ask at the player's booth.. Cons: no deadlock on the door, no do not disturb sign. Beds a little hard, cheap linens. Internet is wire, not wireless. One of the pools was closed when we were there and they closed a second pool after someone got injured. Overall an OK stay. Rooms were clean and the staff was GREAT.

Reviews.Title: “Good room for the price”
Reviews.Author: 76Haywood
Reviews.Content: Good for the price. When you walk in to the casino, is smells musty and smokey. It's just an older casino that has seen it's better days. The pool is nothing special. However, for the value, it wasn't bad. The room was clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. Because the rooms are inexpensive, there are lots of families and college kids. If that's what you want and expect, it's not bad at all.

Reviews.Title: “great for the price”
Reviews.Author: snikers
Reviews.Content: me an my three teenage daughter stayed at the hotel it was great the rooms were clean.the staff was great we eat at the buffet it was very good.great location would stay there again.great hotel for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad - value for money....”
Reviews.Author: ChilliLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on 12th Sept for 3 nights. What can I say, you kind of get what you pay for, it was really reasonably priced, but the rooms, are brown, dated and shabby looking really. I mean the beds are fine, so is the bathroom, everything works and it's okay. You have to weigh up how much time you will actually be in the room. The location is great, centre of the strip, so it worked for us. The pools were really quite nice too, one was closed when we were there, but there were sunbeds to go around. It was fine and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated, but you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Stangerang
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms were extremely outdated. The beds were hard and the sheets and comforters were also old and thin. The room was tidy, but not clean. Stains on the carpet, and the room legitimately did smell. The casino was typical, but old as well… The people harass you at all entrances about show tickets and try to get you to sign up for things, but this is at most hotels. Downstairs they have an arcade and games for children, also pretty outdated – was empty when we went, no one was there. The only good part out this hotel was Dicks Last Resort – absolutely fantastic if you have a good sense of humour and you don’t mind crude fun while you eat good American pub food. Overall, you get what you pay for and most of the time this is one of the cheapest hotels on the strip ranging from $33-60/night on most sites.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky hotel - Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Pezzapug
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in the Excalibur hotel for a week and thought it was lovely. It was her 21st birthday and we decided to spend more money on doing things whilst in Vegas rather than a posh hotel. This place was perfect for us! It was relatively cheap and the rooms were very nice and clean. Its not the most spectacular hotel on the strip but its still pretty amazing to someone who had never been to Vegas before.
