The casino floor is great and all the staff are really friendly. The buffet was brilliant! I have never eaten so much food in my life but I couldn't stop myself returning for another plateful or two every day. We did eat at other places but for the money you pay its great. It is down the end of the strip and so prepare yourself for a lot of walking if you venture out. Overall I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a good holiday in Vegas. If you want good value and a nice place to stay then this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Needs to be upgraded but ok if your not staying in your room a lot.”
Reviews.Author: mikity31
Reviews.Content: For the price, you can't really expect too much. The rooms are dated and need to be cleaned a bit more throughly. The bed comfort is average to a little below as they are a bit hard. This was a last minute trip for me so Excalibur it was! The casino is very large and the restaurants in the hotel offer good values on food. If your looking upgrades and higher end, this isn't the place for you but it will do as long as your not spending much time in the room. I would pay the extra amount for Luxor which is right next door. I'd give the shopping within the hotel a 1. (Luxors shopping selection would get a 2, 2 1/2. Head to Crystals for REAL shopping). Go elsewhere for clubbing too. Can't say I'd reccommend Excalibur. The fitness center has been upgraded and is nice tho.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for a realatively "old" hotel”
Reviews.Author: grazinggoat66
Reviews.Content: Well "old" by Vegas standards. We stayed at the Excalibur for 2 nights at the end of 6 weeks in the US in Sept 2010. A room rate of $28 a night was enough to attract us, and a complimentary upgrade to their Widescreen TV rooms was appreciated. The rooms are spacious and have been refurbished in the last couple of years. Perfectly adequate! The hotel itself is a bit dated, but it really does pack a lot into the premises. A plethora of food choices including fast food (Quiznos, Maccas etc etc etc) , an adequate buffet (no more no less...but at $24.95 a day for all you can eat it is great value), a couple of upper end restaurants, bars, sports lounges, good pool area (even for kids), and a top location on the corner of Tropicana and the Strip and the Excalibur exceeded expectations. Wouldn't hesitate to stay here again, especially if you can get a ripping price.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure what everyone is complaining about????”
Reviews.Author: GregR30
Reviews.Content: I thought this was a great bang for your buck. it's a little dated but clean. The rooms were good and the staff was friendly... If you want a Seven star hotel then go pay seven star prices.

Reviews.Title: “COCKROACHES - STAY ANYWHERE ELSE!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: skparkerward
Reviews.Content: My husband & I came here from NY on our honeymoon, anticipating a fun, adventurous trip. However, upon our arrival back to our hotel room at around 1am on the first night of our stay, we were greeted by an abundance of cockroaches scurrying throughout the bathroom when we turned the light on. Although we aren't faint of heart (we've been fortunate enough to travel to third world countries), we felt it best to request a room change. What a disaster!!!! Over an hour later, and after multiple trips to the front desk, we were finally given a new room with nothing more than a $10 comp. The front desk manager was unbelievably rude, actually rolling her eyes when we came down the second time, explaining that our original room keys had been cancelled, locking all of our belongings in our original room! (Quote of the night: "Cockroaches? On the 12th floor? They usually only make it to the first." WHAT??!!!) Long story short: there is an abundance of competition on the Vegas strip, and accordingly, you can get better rooms with friendlier service for the same price elsewhere. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Good bargain, but there are better choices on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Schlauefrau
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Excalibur for a short 2-night visit last October. Pros - Very low price (I believe the rate was under $40/night plus the resort fees.) Large room - we were upgraded at no charge to the flat-screen TV room and happened to be at the end of the hall so we had a larger sitting/table area. The room was decent, but not remarkable - furnishings were a little worn. Cons- You have to walk a LONG way through the casino to get to the guest rooms and to the Strip. The hotel is near the end of the Strip, and it is quite a hike to see some of the more popular attractions such as the Bellagio fountains. This is an older hotel and it feels more run-down/dated. (Although the guest rooms seemed to have been updated somewhat.) Unless you just want over-priced fast food, the dining choices seemed pretty limited. We ended up eating at other hotels. All in all, we didn't have any real problems with our stay, but having stayed in some of the other hotels in Vegas, there are much nicer establishments that don't cost that much more and are more centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur - smelly noisy, dated”
Reviews.Author: gillyflower1
Reviews.Content: Of all the hotels on he Strip, think the Excalibur is the poor relation. While it supposed to represent a medieval castle, the decor is dated and grubby. All thepublic areas stink of cigarettes and the general atmosphere is cheap and tacky. I haveo idea of how much we paid per night because it was all included in a LV, LA + cruise package, but the sign on our bedroom wall says 850 USD per night - I find that hard to believe. I have no doubt tha if you are in your teens or early 20's looking for a few heavy nights and lots of booze (not cheap), cigarettes and noise you wil love it. If you are a little more refined don't bother - choose the Four Seasons or Bellagio instead!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Bother”
Reviews.Author: dsmascritic
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in bad need of some refurbishing. Worn, not particularly clean, holes in chair upholstery, and poor cleaning. I was also not happy with staff attitude and helpfullness. Also noisy at night.

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded rooms are amazing”
Reviews.Author: lovesmexicoalot
Reviews.Content: Just took my 2 children for a weekend to do their school clothes shopping, initially I booked in the original rooms but when they told me we were furthest from the pool area, I requested to change rooms, we upgraded to the Flat Screen TV rooms which are amazing, clean and very modern, my only problem was that I could never get the internet to work, and son complained that there were only showers and no bath tubs - oh well neither were things we worth getting upset about . One thing I have to say is that I felt pretty safe at this hotel, there was a security guard that checked your room card to ensure you were a guest when coming in and out, as well as at the pool. The pools were nice but they never opened one of them so there was too many people in the kids pool section where the water slides were, but either way it was nice, though the pool was a little cool to get into at first but nice and refreshing from the heat. The bar is a little expensive, I had one pina colada for $10, but that all I needed, they use 100 proof rum so one was enough. It was nice that they had a food court in the building which we partaked in the yummy Krispy Kreme donuts, pizza hut and McDonalds. We also ate the Buffet, I dont know why there were so many complaints about eatting there, we did the all day buffet one day and my kids who are fussy eatter loved it, they had so many choices, they had italian, chinese, american, my daughter loved the dessert section and for the price it was pretty good, I would eat there again, but if you do want to go to a excellent buffet - go to Planet Hollywood!! We did go on the Sponge Bob 4 D ride which was fun and played games in the midway which the kids seemed to enjoy. Shopping was amazing, anyone interested in some great deals, go to the Ross that just opened up this summer on the strip right next to M&M world. It was insane in there but the prices were crazy cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Defending the Caveman”
Reviews.Author: handtoGod
Reviews.Content: I wanted to write a review of the comedy show "Defending the Caveman" but TripAdvisor didn't recognize it so since it's showing at the Excalibur I thought I'd get to it via this route. Three words--GO SEE IT-this is a funny show, my son who is 24 absolutely loved it. We saw the matinee and bought discounted tickets so it was a very good deal and a great break between gambling and sightseeing. We didn't stay at the Excalibur but I have to say it was one of the best casinos when it came to offering drinks while playing the machines. We stayed at the Golden Nugget and not once was I offered a drink while gambling there. Since we didn't stay at the hotel I gave it 5 stars for everything, so keep that in mind when reading this review.

Reviews.Title: “A fine place to stay....”
Reviews.Author: MrT10001
Reviews.Content: After 13hrs of flying, finally arrived at the hotel. The drop off and pick-up point for coaches and tours was really easy to find and get too, so from there checked in. The desk staff were a bit curt, but no more than I am used to in other hotels I have stayed at. They upgraded us on request at no extra cost, but hit us with the usual resort fees (which I expected anyway from past experience). We were put in tower 2 which was reasonably easy to find and made our way over. The security guard asked for our room keys which pleased me as they don't always. The lifts were clean and quick and we soon found our rooms (as a family with 3 teenagers it was easy)... Our rooms were pretty good. There were two queen sized in both rooms, which were clean and pretty solid. The furniture had a fair amount of wear and the safe worked. The blinds didn't block out all the light and the air conditioning unit was old and a bit, well really noisy, but still worked. All lights worked, but the alarm clock didn't and we were promised an ipod dock in each room which wasn't there... The Bathroom was clean, but had a lot of wear as can be expected. The towels were clean and the usual amount of toiletries were left. Everything was cleaned daily in the room. I always got a good nights sleep with no noise from other guests. The casino was as expected, but a bit quiter than usual. Loads of places to eat and easy to find. we used the place for breakfast everyday costing for us all about $65, but being a buffet, we all filled up. We did the Tournament of kings which was great fun and really good value for money. One odd thing, we didn't get pestered by the ticket mobs or timeshare which pleased me no end (I am on holiday, I don;t wish or need to be rude)... It is really well located with walking distance easily to NYNY or MGM grand and from ther the monorail is available or the bus service to downtown (the 'Deuce'). Overall a good hotel, but a bit dated, close to everything really. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Its like the song Hotel california- you can check out any time you like but you can never leave”
Reviews.Author: Tleesn
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel on the strip!!!! I can't believe that it has a better rating on tripadvisor than the Luxor!!! As we walked into the excalibur the smoke was so overpowering immediately my allergies kicked in and i could hardly breathe. At reception we asked for a non smoking room which was definately not non-smoking even the bedding had cigarette burns in it. When i phoned and asked for another room i was told to come back a bit later as check outs were at 11. We went to the front desk at about 1pm and was given the run around again saying i should check back later, never once did they ask me for a contact number, i had to run around and keep coming back like i have nothing better to do in Vegas!!!. Needless to say we checked out the next day (2 days early and into the MGM absolutely wonderful!!!! what a difference) We weren't even asked why we were leaving the excalibur or checking out early and no comment was made by the staff checking us out on the fact that complaints had been raised and nothing was sorted out!!!! IT IS DEFINATELY NOT WORTH THE MONEY, I WOULD RATHER HAVE CHECKED INTO HOOTERS!!!! One more thing watch out for the timeshare people they are sharks after reading reviews they always go down to $5000 after you ahve said NO 6 million times, however the show tickets are nice.

Reviews.Title: “NFR”
Reviews.Author: Jaclin13
Reviews.Content: Great hotel to stay in for the NFR; cheap yet close to rodeo with free shuttles. Nice end of strip, too.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK but not again”
Reviews.Author: ppowers619
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur a few years ago and enjoyed it. The rooms were nice, the beds comfortable and the pool excellent. This time however the rooms were showing their age. Lots of patches, the sheets too. Chair had a piece broken out. Hard to get a drink in the casino while gambling. We ate at Dick's Last Resort. It was fun and exactly what I expected. The location and service were good but the room was at best old and the mattresses were too soft. Also had no working remote, so had to call for new batteries. Overall an OK experience but nothing to write home about.

Reviews.Title: “OMG! NEVER AGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: Christie S
Reviews.Content: My now husband and I travel to Vegas at least twice a year for the past several. We have stayed at many hotels on the strip and go between MGM and Harrah's properties. Well, we decided to get married in August 2010 and decided to stay at the Excalibur for four nights since they comp'd 3 of them. So the last night was $50 plus the $40 in the so called resort fees. They put us on the 13th floor. Ok, not a problem. We went to bed a little early like midnight since we traveled all day. At around 3:15am, I awoke to yelling and pounding on the wall! These guys in the next room were in a fist fight and using all kinds of words I'm sure would not make their momma's proud. And it just got worse so I called the front desk and told them. I dont think they came up since they just kept it up. So the next night which was the night before my wedding, at midnight, the same rats next door decided to throw a drug party! The smell was in our room and the hall. I had enough and went down to the registration and told them what was going on and told them I wanted a new room or them kicked out. Well, the manager ignored me and looked at me like I was a complete idiot and I was bothering her. They moved us to the 2nd floor and told us we had 30 min to move rooms. Mind you, I had my dress, makeup, everything ready for the next morning set out. So we went all the way through the casino back to our 13th floor and low and behold, our key was shut off! So now we are pretty mad and went back down, through the whole damn casino and they were like, opps, sorry. A security guard will meet you at your room. So back up we went and there was a older man in a security outfit. I let him have it about the drug party and screaming going on and he said oh yeah, I hear that. I told him "can't you smell the drugs" and he said he could and is suprised they were not kicked out last night. So I asked what he was going to do? He just looked at me with a duhhhh look and did NOTHING! So we packed up all our stuff, or I should say threw it in bags and down to the 2nd floor all the way to the end and around the hall. They never did anything to the drug infested room next to us even though other guests were complaining. The halls were filthy. There were used q-tips and travel size shampoos on the floor. The customer service sucked. Since it was my wedding I kept my mouth shut for the most part. They did nothing to accomidate us but get us a new room. By the time we got in and settled, it was 2am. The casino on the other hand is fun to gamble at. Just for the love of God, DONT STAY AT THE HOTEl.

Reviews.Title: “Average Affordable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mitcheky
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms are very bare bones, simple yet clean and spacious. We stayed at Tower 1 and was pleasantly surprised on how comfortable and clean everything was despite some of the negative comments on here. The water pressure in the toilet was not the greatest; be prepared to hold on to the handle until it flushes completely. It is simply average, no frills, so if you are looking for luxury, stay elsewhere. My main complaints were security issues. They only offer safes from floor 1-12 in Tower 1 and in all of Tower 2. We stayed in floor 22 in Tower 1 so that was an issue. We simply locked our valuables in our luggage using our luggage lock. The other security issue is the fact that security does not ask guests to show their room keys; they have a stand setup for them to do so but they do not ask. Which is why advertisers can get in and slip restaurant ads under your door. Not sure if this happens in all hotels since this is my first time here. I did address this with hotel management, but it continued so that went to deaf ears obviously. As far as other complaints I read on here about the smoke smells, this a casino and people are allowed to smoke in them as well as all other hotels we walked through. Some had hardly any smells and some even smelled wonderful, however, you also pay a lot more to stay at these places. The buffet wasn't bad at all. It's like a Ryan's or Golden Corral--average food for an average place. The resort fee was presented to me upfront when I made the reservation online so not sure why it caught some people off guard. The staff was quite friendly. I was annoyed by the people coming up to us trying to get us to buy tickets to other shows, I simply ignored them as I walked by them or shook my head, they're not pushy but can be persuasive when approached. I probably won't stay here again simply because I would like stay at nicer place; we mainly stayed here because my retired parents were on a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “I think one would be better off elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: tdsuperstar
Reviews.Content: I got to stay at Excalibur on a sell-off from an online website. The location of the hotel is nice because you are essentially in the middle of the Vegas strip. You can wonder off to other much nicer hotels and casinos quite easily. The casino is dingy and unsatisfying. The restuarant that we ate at was pretty disappointing. The hotel, though apparently in midst of upgrades, is seemingly outdated with cheesy carpeting and decor. The fact that I was apprached by a pimp, and repeatadly asked for business, while I was with a casino attendent does not make me think that Excalibur attempts to keep this type of clientale away from the Casino floor. (I was also asked on another occasion by a prostitute for patronage). This makes me worry about all the positive comments I see for "family-friendly" place to stay. I also stayed at Stratosphere, for longer, and I never had a problem. The price I paid to stay here was the only positive and that I stayed with a buddy, not my wife. The staff lacked humor and people offering timeshares were borderline harrassing people. If you plan not to stay within the confines of the hotel with a buddy and get a deal, then maybe you could stay here, otherwise I think one would be better off elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel on The Strip when travelling to Vegas with kids”
Reviews.Author: TheMackem105
Reviews.Content: After a long drive from LA we arrived to be greeted by friendly valet parkers who heloed with the luggage. Check In was a breeze and we received a free uprade to a Deluxe room because we were staying for 4 nights. We had a great view of The Strip from the 15th floor, lovely large clean and airy room, with a spotless huge bathroom. Only draw back with the rooms was the fact that there were no tea/coffee making facilites but that is obviuosly to get you to spend in the onsite Starbucks and hotel coffee bars. Pool areas were great, one pool is over 18s only,one has a slide for the kids, 1 has a hot tub and the other is 'just' a pool. For kids the basement is a "Childrens Casino" and 3 4D rides including Spongebob.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been Better....”
Reviews.Author: sf004
Reviews.Content: Excalibur ticked a lot of our boxes - cheap, on the Strip, inter-connecting rooms. However, the hotel lobby smelt of smoke, drink or food. The rooms felt tired and old. No fridge or coffee making facilities. There were stains in the bathrooms broken tiles and dirt under the sink. The corridors were worn and generally had an unclean feel to them. This hotel is right at the very end of the Strip so to walk to the more interesting hotel takes a very long time! Breakfast here was over our budget, so we found a Denny's just up from MGM near M and M World and the huge Coke Bottle! We booked this hotel just to recover from our jet lag before heading to the Grand Canyon so it did the job. Next time I would pay more and either stay up towards the other end or stay off the Strip and use the shuttle buses.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for price but better options are in neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: UpperCapeResident
Reviews.Content: Bellow average beds, dated decor and bathroom, cleaning was good, $10 resort fee per night but wifi was free

Reviews.Title: “King/Queen for a few days!”
Reviews.Author: AffairsinMiami
Reviews.Content: Excalibur I stayed at the Excalibur in June 2006. We went with a group of friends (they stay at another hotel). Our room was newly renovated and so nice and comfortable. Our view was toward the strip and the lights looked so beautiful from our window. The casino had the usual cigarette smell to it but not as overwhelming. The hotel was undergoing renovations at the time so some of the hallways (like going towards the spa) were paneled up with cardboard, but nothing that would impair you from scoping the place out! Unfortunately I was totally turned off by the timeshare employees harassing you every time you walk by any of the entrances. We passed the same employee several times and each time they would try to stop us. The buffet here was not so great but pleasant. It probably had to do with the fact that we got there almost at closing time and their foods were not as fresh looking as they should have been!

Reviews.Title: “dirty hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: pecosdriver
Reviews.Content: This hotel/casino was part of a Southwest Airline vacation package to Las Vegas. The airline portion was GREAT. the Hotel sucked!! While it is right on the "strip" and in the middle of the action I have never stayed in a dirtier hotel. Everything from dirty glass at the entry doors to hair in the shower. And, the dirt stayed there all 3 days that I did. The hotel also charges a hidden $9.95 "resort fee" for nothing!!! Add to the above a staff that is arrogant and rude and it all made for an unpleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Exalibur”
Reviews.Author: MikeKSanAntonio
Reviews.Content: We moved from MGM hotel in Vegas to save some money but we should have stayed at MGM. We stayed in Tower 1 on the 5th floor. Everything in our room including the carpet, bedspreads, curtains, walls, and furniture was old, stained, and dated. There was hair on the bathroom floor. Eventhough the sheets and pillow cases appeared clean the mattress and pillows smelt of body odor. The other couple traveling with us in the next room had the same problem. The icemaker on our floor was broken, carpet in hallways stained and dirty, and light fixtures on the walls near the elevator missing. We went to a bar that advertised $4.00 beer and hot dog but the bun was hard and the hot dog looked old.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but not nice”
Reviews.Author: Crossbill
Reviews.Content: At $75 per night this looked like a great deal for a family of 5 and it was. But the room was nothing to write home about - worn carpets and clunky air conditioning. The catering in the hotel was surprisingly good and not too expensive. But I regret not paying more to stay in one of the grander hotels so we could sample the true Vegas experience. I would recommend anyone visiting from abroad to use Priceline.com to see what you could get elsewhere for a bit more money.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy rooms, perfect for how little time we spent in our own hotel!”
Reviews.Author: eek-i-saw-a-mouse
Reviews.Content: Let's face it, when you go to Vegas you spend your time visiting all the other hotels , watching their shows , shopping etc. excalibur had very little to interest us - other than an amazing price and very comfy beds! so we stayed here and then visited all the others! and - I felt in Vegas we should do the most tacky and plasticky we could find, and Excalibur is certainly quite plastic!! We had two adjoining rooms in Tower 1, they were large, very clean and we could have been in any 4 or 5 star hotel anywhere in the world really. We overlooked the airport and the strip, the view wasn't great but to be honest we weren't in the room much. The bed was huge and very comfy. I couldn't fault the standard of cleanliness or fixtures and fittings at all. We didn't find the staff overly friendly, more brusque than chatty but ok. It is right at one end of the strip - but in some ways we found that easier than being in the middle as we knew which way we were heading. We did chose to walk everywhere instead of using the bus, which in hindsight, in August wasn't such a great idea as it was just so hot, but on the second evening we drove to the Venetian to see Phantom of the Opera and then we drove downtown to Fremont Street to see the light and sound show which I would thoroughly recommend. I was not looking forward to Vegas, it was just a stop off on a 3 week tour of National parks, but, it was so full on, naff and tacky that we all loved it! The Bellagio fountains were fascinating and we watched them at least 4 times! My son also managed to buy up most of Abercrombie so was quite happy! A lot of people we met were quite snobby about Excalibur telling us it was "really tacky" but to be honest having visited all of the hotels I would still have stayed here !

Reviews.Title: “Great for kids”
Reviews.Author: tompaNorthJersey
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, superb pool area, ok fast food restaurants. Location is ok but would have preferred more central location on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: mmme
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 4 nights at Excalibur with a room rate of $24/night. Yes $24! The room was in Tower 1 (never had a problem with the elevators). The room was big and very clean. Housekeeping did a great job. We ate at the buffet for dinner and kids ate free - $42 for a family of four, can't beat that. Food was excellent in quality and selection. Even included dessert and drinks for that price. There is also a food court that we ate at for breakfast (Mcdonalds and Krispy Kreme). The hotel has 4 pools, 2 large, 2 small (one is adult only). One of the large pools has a waterslide that keeps the kids occupied for hours. We saw Tournament of Knights in the hotel and really liked it. We visited the huge arcade downstairs too. And upon check in we were given coupons for 2 free bar drinks (anything you wanted), 2 free games in arcade and some other spa and show coupons. We used the valet parking several times and never waited long. Yes the casino smells like smoke but smoking is permitted in Vegas so it's going to smell like smoke. And there are timeshare/show sales people but we just kept walking when approached and they never were pushy. Yes there are more glamorous hotels in Vegas - but do what we did - go visit them, shop in their shops, eat in their restaurants and then go back to Excalibur and laugh about all the money you are saving but staying there!

Reviews.Title: “a really good stay and perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: Michelle444
Reviews.Content: The excalibur was amazing, especially for the price. The rooms were beautiful and clean and the beds were comfortable. There was a nice big pool and the casino was great fun. It was also quite central on the strip and we could walk around to all the other casinos and explore. I have nothing bad to say about the excalibur and would definitely reccommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms...No Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: ourdairy
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice, large, clean, and quiet. The staff, however, leave a lot to be desired. You are harassed every time you leave your room by "sales people", stop at the concierge desk for help and you are told to go to another desk. We did have good service and good food at the Sherwood Forest Cafe. We enjoyed the penny slots. Also, be ware that the pool closes at 7 p.m. I would recommend this hotel but don't expect any customer service or help. We traveled with our 18 and 20 year old children, there was basically nothing for them to be able to do at this hotel. I do not recommend taking anyone under 21 to Vegas, period.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel ......”
Reviews.Author: DiscountTrendsetter
Reviews.Content: Last week I visited Los Vegas for the very first time. I was looking forward to my 2 days and 3 nights vacation. Upon arriving at the Excalibur Hotel, I was immediately disappointed. I found the customer service reps to be rude. My room was dirty. There was hair on the floor and in the shower. The casino was so smoky, I got a headache every time I walked through the hotel. Last but not least, I picked up my ticket for The Lion King show at the hotel's ticket desk. I was charged extra money and the ticket rep could not explain why. If you are going to have people working for your company, the staff should at least know what certain fees are. I will NEVER stay at this hotel again nor would I EVER recommend it. I suggest adding more money to your budget to stay at a better hotel or simply go to a Motel 6. At least you will get your money wroth. .

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff !!”
Reviews.Author: Tink89
Reviews.Content: We checked into this hotel it was a comp for two nights. We requested a king size non smoking and after checking in realized we had recieved a two double bed non smoking we called down to get it switched and although we waitied a half hour for someone to bring us keys the gentlemen who did was the front desk manager and quickly apologized and didnt charge us for the upgrade wide screen room. The bathroom is a great size and has a stand up shower and the bed was huge very comfortable. The hotel is located in a great place its just a quick walk around town it was nice. The casino was great we did good there at times. It was pretty lively and although loud you never heard a noise from downstairs. it was nice also to see security guards asking for keys so people couldnt go to the floors without a room key. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. The restaurant Dicks was a huge hit there. All the bartenders were very nice and professional. Cannot wait to return to this place!

Reviews.Title: “Another Beautiful Stay at Excalibur....”
Reviews.Author: beangurl
Reviews.Content: For the second part of our yearly trip to Vegas we stayed at the Excalibur Hotel. We arrived at 3:30pm on Monday, July 12th. The check in line was long, but they put extra reps. on so the line moved fast. We booked a remodeled widescreen spa king room. We have stayed several times at the Excalibur since 1995 and the remodeled rooms are fantastic. The remodeled rooms are in Tower II. With the new bathrooms, bedding and color scheme. There is nothing like ending a long day with relaxing in the huge jacuzzi tub with your spouse and a glass of wine. Housekeeping was always done in a timely manner. Although the rooms do not have refridgerators, we simply picked up styrofoam color at the market to store or soda, wine and Jack Daniels. For the value, service and location, we recommend the Excalibur, especially if you stay in the remodeled rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Rude, poor communication, problems with internet service”
Reviews.Author: Rez2
Reviews.Content: Rude, poor communication, problems with internet service The Excalibur charges a daily resort fee of $9.95 ($11.14 with tax) for amenities including internet service (wired, not wireless). However, I found that the internet service in my room didn't work. I proceeded to call the hotline number and was instructed to dismantle the Cat5 cable spool and then plug the Cat5 cable into my laptop directly. This didn't work. I was then instructed to reset the cable modem. I still didn't have internet service. I noted that the Cat5 cable didn't "light up" when I plugged it into my laptop and also that it appeared to be crimped. I was told that a technician would be sent. I waited a little more than half an hour and then asked for an ETA. The customer support representative was unable to provide an ETA, so I requested that the technician be sent the next day sometime after 9 AM, since I needed to go to sleep. Later, I decided to cancel the tech visit since I would be checking out before 11 AM. The next day, the tech came around 9:30 AM despite the fact that I had called to cancel the visit. If I ever stay at the Excalibur again, I'll bring my own Cat5 cable in case the cable in the room is crimped, though I most likely will not be staying at the Excalibur again. Also, I found the cashier at the Tower II gift shop ("Elements") to be rude. I had a coupon that said I could get a complimentary newspaper, so I grabbed a Las Vegas Review Journal. The copy on top was in disarray, so I grabbed the one on the bottom. The cashier angrily told me that I could only get a copy of USA Today with my coupon (though the coupon says "newspaper" rather than "USA Today"), that I must take the copy on top, and that I must show my room key card. If I wanted the Las Vegas Review Journal, I would need to pay a dollar. I told her that I had already turned in my room key card, but she let it go. I proceeded to take the USA Today on top and tried to hand her the coupon. "I don't need that!" she half-shouted with the same scolding tone she used to tell me that I couldn't take a Las Vegas Review Journal. My recommendations to Excalibur management: 1) tighten up communication between the hotline and the technicians, 2) if the complimentary newspaper is the USA Today, write that on the coupon, 3) if customers can only take the newspaper on top, put up a sign to say that, 4) find someone with a more pleasant personality for the Tower II gift shop.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced but poor sleep quality”
Reviews.Author: paki29
Reviews.Content: I just got back from celebrating my 29th birthday in Vegas and we spent a night at the Excalibur which was booked online to later be slapped with the resort fee at check out. Which is something you can't do anything about when staying on any of those hotels on the strip. Anyhow, for $30 on a sunday night (before fees/taxes) its pretty reasonable and I like the fact that there is a tram that takes you to the Mandalay Bay and the Luxor so if you want to give your feet a rest there are the trams available at your convenience. It's too bad that they stop running at a certain hour throughout the night. So if you're left to stumble from the Mandalay Bay back to the Excalibur at 3am thats just a risk you're going to have to take. Now as far as the room goes, I thought the room we had was clean and cozy, but the bed was too soft and seemed to sink in the middle. The curtains are so short and they are not the lights out type of curtains so the early morning sun will leak right through and will awaken you. Those were my only complaints other than that I would come back and put up with all of this, I'll just have to bring a blindfold next time and another can of febreze because it can get kind of musty in there sometimes.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs Infested”
Reviews.Author: Ksiddik
Reviews.Content: We had a horrible experience staying in this hotel. Our room in the second tower, 17th Floor was infested with bed bugs. My daughter woke up crying from the bites. My wife checked the billows and we found bugs running allover the place. When I called the front desk informing them about the bugs, the lady on the phone sounded like she knew about this problem. Her answer was: "We can send someone to spry the room but we don't know when he will come!" The other option she offered, which was not an option for us, was to move us into a smoking room. When I said we will leave, she said she would still charge us! (We took enough photos and videos of the bugs but this is an advance warning to other travelers.)

Reviews.Title: “One of the very best hotel in Las Vegas - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: JFKtravel
Reviews.Content: This is one of the very best hotel I have stayed in. great location, great for family and honeymoon couples. highly recommended - you'll not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, GoodService”
Reviews.Author: RN_from_WA
Reviews.Content: We upgraded our rooms to the new widescreen rooms with a view and were not disappointed. The room is very modern and clean with a new view of the strip. We thought we got a steal for the price we paid. Yes there are a lot of families with kids, but it was summer vacation and I'm sure many families are taking advantage of the low rates. The staff met or exceeded our expecations. The hotel is located at the south end of the strip and walking the strip in mid July was quite warm, but nothing we couldn't handle with proper hydration. Bottom line: We will be going back to the Excalibur again, with these low rates it can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Not good”
Reviews.Author: kkamalx
Reviews.Content: This is a cheap place, so expect what you can expect at a cheap casino. My advice pay a little more and stay at Monte Carlo, the rooms are smelly, the restroom is smelly and bad like motel 6.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't expect too much, but was pleasantly surprised.”
Reviews.Author: kevin443
Reviews.Content: I booked a package deal through hotwire.com for both flight and hotel stay at The Excalibur. Upon arrival I received a complimentary upgrade to tower 2 which has been remodeled (it was a weekday and not very busy.) The room was very clean, flat screen TV, bathroom had granite countertop, updated furniture, and a safe. The AC unit worked well and actually maintained the temp that you programmed. For $31/ night I was very pleased. You should note that a $10/day resort fee is also charged upon check-in. Since I was expecting this it didn't upset me, but I could see how it might if was a surprise. Several hotels on the Strip tack on this fee. I have stayed at several Strip hotels in the past and my Excalibur room was comparable to a basic room at MGM or New York New York. It was certainly nicer than a basic pyramid room at the Luxor. I was pleasantly surprised. Service at the Excalibur during my stay was fine. Check-in/Out was very fast and the desk personel were pleasant. My gambling consisted of playing Poker at the MGM, so I can't comment on the casino staff at Excalibur. On past trips they have not been that great though. Because it wasn't very busy, the smoke levels in the casino weren't that bad. During busy times however, I'm sure it could get pretty cloudy. The casino itself is a little outdated and does not have very good ventilation. The pool area has been improved fairly recently and suited my needs just fine. The adult only pool was very relaxing with lots of space and uncrowded. There is a hot tub right next to the pool which made for a nice transition from hot to cold. There is also shallow area to the adult pool that allows you to sun bathe like a beached whale if you like. Not the fanciest of towels are distributed as you enter the pool area and I thought the poolside chairs are a little old and worn out. The pools and pool decks looked new and clean and well maintained. There are nice view of the Luxor, Excalibur, and Mandalay Bay from the pool. As far as restaurants go, there is a food court which is fine for a simple meal. There is also a Baja Fresh right at the bottom of the elevators to Tower 2. For a nicer meal I would go elsewhere. In summary, for the $31 price it was a fantasic hotel, at least when it is not crowded. I suspect that the staff may get overrun when it is busy and service suffers. Midweek during the Summer everything was very pleasant however. Remember, tower 2 is the only remodeled tower.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected; great value”
Reviews.Author: FriscoDad
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a great trip to Las Vegas. Excalibur is located at the south end of the strip across the street from NY NY and diagonally across from MGM Grand. For the price, I doubt you'll find a better location. Based on some of the scary reviews, we paid the extra $22 to upgrade to Tower 2, and it was really worth it. Large rooms, recently renovated, granite counters, very comfortable beds. They tack on a silly $10/night "resort fee" that adds no value, but even with that at $50/night, it's a great bargain.We had 2 connecting rooms for 7 people and we never felt cramped. Tower 2 is also conveniently located next to the pool area which was very large; the pool drinks were very reasonable compared to all other Vegas hotels we've stayed at. We ate at the foodcourt McDonald's to save money on Breakfast and lunch to splurge a little on dinner. Our maids were friendly and effective. Conciege were knowledgeable and helpful. I would definitely stay again, but next time we'll try to get a little closer to the central strip (ie. Bellagio, Caesar's, Venetian). This was my 7th Vegas trip but the first time bringing the kids so I was very glad that everyone had a great time (ages 9, 15, 15, 24, and 24).

Reviews.Title: “lively atmosphere, good fun”
Reviews.Author: holibobin
Reviews.Content: My family stayed in the Excalibur in July 2010, myself my husband and our 16 year old daughter. We found it to be great, if a little noisy walking through the casino at night, but we expected that so it was fine. On arrival we were offered an upgrade to tower 2, we took it and thank goodness, tower two elevators are about 10 feet from the pool entrance, if we had been in tower 1 we would have had an enormous walk through the casino to get to the pool. The pools , 4 of them were fantastic, busy but great, there was an adults only pool also. The rooms were comfortable and we had a great view of the pools from ours from the 16 floor. The hotel itself had so many places to eat and shop inside it, Mcdonalds, starbucks, pizza hut, krispy creme, sub sandwiches, it was great and cheap too. There is a walkway that connects the hotel to others on the strip so it is great to get around. Next time I think we would stay a little further down the strip as it was a bit of a walk to get to the Bellagio/central area of the strip but fine for the price we paid. All in all a good hotel, although maybe not for an older family as it did get very busy with stag/hen parties at the weekends and you have to fight your way through the crowds to get back off the casino floor to get to your room.

Reviews.Title: “OK Stay”
Reviews.Author: Stringbean57
Reviews.Content: If you want to be on the Strip for cheap, this is the place. If you want peace and quiet and a good night sleep, go to Henderson or someplace off the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Okay For The Price”
Reviews.Author: akillingham
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Excalibur while in Vegas for a wedding at the Excalibur. The cost of the room was very inexpensive. Walking into the hotel, I was hit with an odor of stale cigarette smoke and something else I couldn't detect. The bathroom had at least 3 different types of hair on the counter and floor. The toilet had something brown on it that I wiped off! The bed was really very comfortable. The room was spacious but the decor and TV were dated. I was in tower I and nothing happened. However, I wondered if something did happen, how long would it take for security to respond. Some security guards checked key cards and others did not. There are quite a few restaurants to choose from within the hotel. The rooms in tower II were nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur is a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Mack78
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Excalibur in July with friends - what a disappointment! The place was over-crowded with children (they must have been running some kind of family special) making it impossible to enjoy the place. We had to wait long periods for the elevator, the buffet, etc. But the worst was the pool. They have speakers attached to the trees all around the pool with the volume turned up so high the sound is almost deafening - there's no way to escape it. And they only play harsh, ugly rap music all day long, making the pool almost unbearable. We spent most of our time next door at the Luxor - will probably stay there next year.

Reviews.Title: “night mare/”
Reviews.Author: kenforcement1
Reviews.Content: stink fill with smoke. and foul oder.dusts. rooms dirty . management /customer service below standard. stayed one night august 7,2010. made reservation for a non smoking room. on arrival all non smoking had been filled. ended up in a smoking room ., smell of foul order. and dust. would never recommend it to any oe..

Reviews.Title: “Poor service and maintenance”
Reviews.Author: SoonerlawyerTulsa
Reviews.Content: I chose Excalibur because my kids and I were coming back from Zion to fly out of Vegas the next morning. I thought to the extent any hotel on the strip would be kid friendly this would be it, plus frankly it was cheap. Now i know why Initially, we couln't get in our room we were assigned due to the key card not working. A maid told us she called the front desk and someone was coming to let us in our room. 30 minutes later after no one arriving I went back to the check in and explained the problem. The manager switched me to a different room and did not even say so much as i am sorry we kept you sitting in the hall way for 30 inutes or sorry our hotel maintenance was poor. An upgrade would have been nice but even a mere apology would have been nice. In any event, several elevators were broken and were not repaired during our stay. this led to huge lines and waiting inordinate amounts of time to get to or from your room. the hotel room was pedestrian quality and needed an update but relatively clean. The hall ways were not clean and had the smell of mildew. I could go on about the numerous deficiencies but suffice to say the hotel is a lower tier in quality and has service to match it. The entire property is in sore need of a massive remodel but it is cheap .If i were coming to Vegas with my wife this would be the last place I would stay. . In summary you get what you pay for and with Excalibur it isn't much.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Great location with a clean room!”
Reviews.Author: Wigglit
Reviews.Content: My family booked a vacation thru Expedia for 5 nights in Vegas at the Excalibur. We loved it. We got one of the widescreen rooms in Tower II. Make sure you book in Tower II since they are the ones that are upgraded and recently remodeled. We had a 9th floor room that overlooked the impressive pool area. They have four large pools (one adult only), hot tub, two water slides and several waterfalls. There is also a poolside shop that is reasonably priced and a nice poolside bar and restaurant. There is security everywhere, at the pool and at the entrance to the elevators to get to the rooms. If you don’t have a card, you don’t get in. The other great thing was the Midway that is located below the main casino floor. My kids ages 11 and 14 loved it. We did the Knights dinner show and it was pretty cool. The location of this hotel is great and the gambling was pretty good too. One great tip…..If you want to get something to eat and don’t plan on going for a nice sit-down meal…Hit the McDonalds in the 2nd level area of the casino. The have a value menu, yes you read right, a value menu in a casino on the strip. Their large fountain drinks are only a dollar as well as their double burgers and fries, ice-cream and pies, chicken sandwiches…etc. For a family of four we ate lunch there almost every day for a little over 12 bucks. We are not cheap…but dang a regular bottle of soda/water in the shop was 3 bucks. Over all we had a really good time and we all want to go back again. There were a lot of families there and there is a lot to do in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip!”
Reviews.Author: KNCDancer
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at Excalibur because it was one of the cheapest hotels on the strip. I was a little bit scared but convinced myself we would only be sleeping and showeing there, how bad could it be!? Boy was I pleasantly surprised when we checked in. Our hotel room was huge! Also I was afraid it would smell of smoke but it did not at all! Our room was very spacious and clean! The only prolem we had was that one of our room keys ended up not working and we went down to the front desk and they sent someone up to fix it right away! They were very prompt and accomidating! I would defintely stay here again and would recommend it to my family and friends!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel did not keep our reservations and did not offer alternate accomodations”
Reviews.Author: ceeg123
Reviews.Content: We were traveling to Las Vegas for a hockey tournament. The team was given a code for a block of rooms so all rooms were close to one another. Even though we indicated a late arrival, all rooms were given away, and the team was spread all over the hotel, some in different towers. This was upsetting to a lot of the children including my son, the children on the team some from different states and countries could not easily be together. When we addressed this with the check in staff they said they could not hold the reservations and did not try to offer alternate accomodations to a least have the team some what closer together. The hotel itself was clean and lots to do with in a close proximaty, located at one end of the strip. This was a holiday for most families attending and thought that the hotel should not offer team/group bookings, without being able to hold rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Choice for First Time to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Midster
Reviews.Content: I tried to enter my room several times at two different times and the door wouldn't open with my key card. I had to go all the way back downstairs the 2nd time to get the door opened. When I first walked into the hotel, I got hit in the nostrils by OLD cigarette smell. No, I don't smoke BUT the ventilation system should be able to rid the air of smoke. I visited the Luxor and Bellagio and the smell was not in the common areas and was barely noticeable in the casinos. I stayed in Tower One and on my floor (27th), someone was removing the privacy signs from all the doors for two days. I ended up hanging my sign on the doorknob with it partially stuck inside the door. Next time, I think I'll probably stay at Bellagio or Mandalay Bay. Every single activity was done outside of Excalibur. If I had stayed longer than a weekend, I would've checked into another hotel. By the way, other than enjoying myself at all the other hotels, we really enjoyed the Liberace museum. Really!! There was a free shuttle so we checked it out.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: SACMO
Reviews.Content: If you choose the Excalibur, most likely it's because of the low rates. With that in mind, remember that you get what you pay for. If you want a higher-end hotel, you have to be willing to pay for it. We were staying just one night in Las Vegas and didn't feel compelled to invest much money in that. We spent most of our time at the Excalibur with our tongues planted firmly in our cheeks. It is a hilarious place to stay if you keep your expectations in line with its low rates. First, the rooms are so outdated you have to laugh. I haven't seen furniture or wallpaper like that since 1975. The place was built in 1990, so you have to wonder where they found it in the first place. The wall sconces were gilded torches with hands gripping them. Even the TV stand had a neo-Gothic design. Sort of. Second, any medieval themes that remain in the place are only to be found in the rooms. We didn't observe much decor around the common areas of the hotel that appeared medieval in nature. It mostly seems to revolve around Dick's Last Resort, which has a restaurant on site, and "Thunder from Down Under," which is an Australian "adult" show. When I hear the phrase "thunder from down under," I don't think of strippers first, but evidently the Excalibur does. I should mention that the comedian Carrot Top was also on site while we were there. I can't remember the last time I saw his name anywhere. Third, I've stayed in good hotels, and I've stayed in cheap hotels. But this is the first time I've stayed someplace that only provided one bar of soap in the bathroom. Fourth, if men in dark blue blazers approach you, just say "no" and walk away quickly. They will leave you alone. Woe to the person who says "yes" and has to stand there for the sales pitch. On the more serious side, the room was clean enough, but you could tell the bedspreads and carpet had been there for a LONG time. Some reviewers have mentioned the clientele being mostly young adults. We found it to be mixed -- some couples, some families, some young adults. The registration process went quite well despite the long line. The elevators were efficient. Food was about as expensive as you'd expect. If you're staying longer, it might be worthwhile to buy the all-day buffet pass. The pool area was better than expected. The common areas of the hotel were not as clean as you might expect. We walked past one pool of vomit in the casino area. You may see bleached patches of carpet in the hallways. It's pretty obvious what probably happened there, but the bleach stains are unfortunate. There was trash left on a table in front of the elevators. The hotel maids had been walking through that area, so it's unclear why the trash remained on that table from the afternoon we arrived until the morning we departed. If you don't like cigarette smoke, walking through the casino will bother you. If you take your kids to the arcade, be aware that about one-third of the arcade games were either nonfunctioning or not functioning as they should have. Normally, you might expect a hotel this size to be of higher quality. But just remember that you get what you pay for. If you're paying a lower-end rate, you're probably going to get a lower-end hotel. That was not a surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Filthiest hotel weve ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: ChrisBirkett
Reviews.Content: Filthiest Hotel We Have EVER STAYED AT !!! To Much to tell you. It would make you not stay at this Hotel Ever so I will Try to keep it as short as possible and the last part you have to read ,It was very Gross! First - The hotel reeked of horrible stale smoke even our non smoking room smelled like this too. Next - The hotel glass on all the doors had so many fingerprints on them and they were never cleaned our whole stay. Then - Our towels and bath mat looked like someone had used and stepped on them for about a week.Stains ,Footprints and all. Also - Hairs on the Sink ,floor, bed and shower(some black mold). Finally - The kicker ,Our sheets had Dried MANELY GOO Like substance on them .So we talked to the Head lady at the check out desk and she said (Oh sir did we go up to your room and use a(I cant say what she exactly said to me because this review thing wont let your use bad language) Dried manley like substance Detector and they determined that is what it was)at this point I was shocked then she continued to say how do you know it was not just lotion or something else)now I could not believe that she had the gall to say that to me so I responded with there should be nothing on my bed that I did not put there myself.Those sheets should be washed and clean when I arrive for the first day of my stay. I can not believe THEY RUN A HOTEL LIKE THIS.GROSS!!! Shame on EXcalibur. All the other hotels did not smell and looked very clean in the Neighboring area.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Eleni1911
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a package deal....know the hotel is older, rooms are not the best. Air conditioner was very loud and had to be turned off so we could sleep. This use to be a family-based hotel, but it has changed with all of Vegas. Lots of young adults (20s) and not the best environment for children. Take the young ones to another hotel. If your a college student or 20 something...this is good for you ...inexpensive and major party place.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect but cheap!”
Reviews.Author: unknownis
Reviews.Content: Good things- location, cheap, quiet rooms Bad things- pool closes at 7, no wifi which is stupid as most motels in the world provides wifi, resort fee $10 a night you get nothing for it, staff aren't there to help you only to take your money, hotel needs a lick of paint, oh the sheets were dirty! But overall i would probably spend a bit more to get a modern hotel

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected...”
Reviews.Author: mcstix
Reviews.Content: First off, people must realized that this is a BIG hotel (lots of rooms) and so take the complaints from some of these reviewers with a grain of salt. Just because one patron says they were bothered by kids running in the halls all night doesn't mean everyone will have that experience. The walls were not too thin in my opinion, but were rather sturdy feeling actually. I was on the eighth floor of Tower II. I did have a little "trepidation" about staying here due to some of the bad reviews I must admit, but I guess I was lucky or something because I had a great seven-night stay! Check In: Check in lines were long, but seemed to be moving "fairly" quickly. I however checked in at the VIP desk, which anyone can do if they are an "invited" casino guest, such as one who has received coupons for discounted rooms in the mail as I did. Took me about five minutes to be waited on, and the comp room I got (for three nights) was on the eighth floor of Tower II, and had a decent, though not spectacular view of the Strip. Room: My Tower II room on the eighth floor was indeed an updated "Widescreen" room, and though the furniture was showing some wear (nicks, scrapes, etc.) everything, including the comfy chair, seemed very clean. The Internet worked as expected and is included in the mandatory "resort fee." AC worked just GREAT. I could cool the room down to 67 degrees if I wanted to, and it was over 100 degrees outside each day I was there. I wasn't thrilled that it blew towards the BED though, but that was fixed by moving a chair in front of the vent to deflect the air. The bathroom has PLENTY of counter space, and a magnified make up mirror with a light right above if for the ladies. The one sink is of the very "deep" variety, which I thought was great. Heck, you could do laundry in that sink if you wanted to. Nice and deep. Shower, as others have said, had only adequate water pressure, but it was plenty to get clean. If you want real water pressure, try the Mirage Hotel further down the strip. Great showers there! The bed was definitely on the firm side, but frankly I liked it and slept just fine. I had NO problems with noisy neighbors, kids, maids, etc. during my week long stay..which included the weekend. Maid service was excellent in my view. I did not tip them during my stay, but left her $25 on check out day. Even without a daily tip (which I rarely do) they kept the room clean the entire week. I asked the maid not to replace the bedspread every time she made the bed, and she didn't. That way I didn't have to remove it every night. Gym: I went in to check out the gym. It's actually pretty nice for a hotel gym. There are adequate free weights (on barbells) and also a good selection of dumbbells. A "bench press machine" is also included, though it is not your standard bench press bench. There is also adequate cardio equipment, most have T.V.'s on them as well. The view out the window is of the pool area, which is nice. I did not check out the spa, but the gym itself (workout room) is included in the mandatory resort fee of $9.95 per day. Casino: I like this casino, or at least most of it. It's just got a good "atmosphere" in the slots area, which I liked immensely. A little "happier" than some other casinos I've been to. The one thing I really don't like is the "party pit" on the weekends. I'm a craps player for the most part, and one of the craps tables borders the party pit, and on the weekends it gets VERY noisy what with the loud dance music and the band in Dick's Last Resort (which is right past the party pit.) Even if I were 21 I"m not sure I would enjoy playing blackjack or craps or anything else in or near this party pit. Frankly, the dancers were only "so-so" anyway. They have better dancers at the Golden Gate downtown in my opinion, or even at the MGM. Maybe I was just not there on "Babe Night" I don't know, but I wasn't that impressed. On the weeknights the party pit is closed, so noise is no problem, but on the weekends they actually raise the table minimums to $10 on the front craps tables in an effort to herd people to the back of the casino where they have an additional three tables in a much quieter atmosphere. They do this because it's even hard for the craps dealers to work in this environment. I could always find a $5 game of craps in this casino, and the Tropicana across the street as well. Even on the weekend. I also found $5 craps at NY NY most of the week, including some on the weekend if it wasn't crowded. I did not look that much for blackjack table minimums but assume they were $5 as well, at least at the Excalibur. They have some interesting new slots in the Excalibur as well, and I found most of the slots I played to be somewhat "loose" though if they stopped paying off, or didn't pay off after ten or so pulls I would switch machines. I probably put about $1200 through their slot machines while I was there and so gave them a good test run. I won $400 on a dollar machine after just a few pulls, then another $300 on the same machine. I had similar experiences on some of the other machines, but didn't always win of course. I also found the machine at the Tropicana across the street to be loose as well, even the Wheel of Fortune machines, which are usually NOT very loose. If I were just playing slots, I'd head over to the Trop instead of Excalibur, but both were pretty good in my opinion. Poker Room: The poker room is towards the back of the casino, and is "open" to the casino, with only a short "wall" separating it from the casino. Not a bad place for beginners to learn to play in my opinion. Most of the players are friendly, and they have poker lessons every day at 11:00 am. I partook of the lessons, and then got taken at an actual game later ha ha! They have $3-$6 limit games most of the time, and also $2-$4 occasionally. There are also "no limit" games. Drink service in the poker room was adequate, but not spectacular. Dealers are friendly for the most part. Poker room is located near the sports book. Food: I ate mostly at the fast food joints in Excalibur, but did try the buffet a couple of times as well. I found the buffet to be about average, not horrible like some folks have been saying. I also went BETWEEN "rush hours" and so rarely had to wait in line at all. If you time it right, you will not have to stand in line very long. I also ate at Pizza Hut and McDonald's. I think McDonald's is the only thing open after midnight, other than the 24-hour room service (which I did not try.) For a "good" restaurant I hoofed it across the street to NY NY or MGM. They both have some nice restaurants. Staff: I found most of the staff to be excellent, including the craps dealers, front desk, pit bosses etc. There was a rather glaring exception however at the bar next to the sports book. I had been drinking heavily (ha ha!) for the past two days, and had ALWAYS been able to get my preferred mixed drink in one of those "bucket" or "rocks" glasses, but one night when I went there the bartender was very adamant, to the point of being rude, that his bar had no such glasses. He refused to even go look in the back for one, even though the matches they had in a glass on the bar had been placed in such a glass. This was a white guy, and not the excellent Mexican bartenders who had been working there the previous two nights. If I could remember his name I would post it here, but alas, I can't...lucky him. I proceeded to leave the bar without my drink that night. I actually headed over to the Trop across the street and played THERE all night, and drank, and actually won a few hundred bucks. I made a point of telling the bartender at the Excalibur that the next time I saw him. He was unimpressed of course ha ha, because he just doesn't care about anything apparently, including customer service. Time Share People: Yes, they are there, and yes, they bug people. However they NEVER once bugged me. Why? Because I was there by myself! Tip: They will only usually approach COUPLES, not singles or groups of people. If you can separate from your wife or hubby for just a few seconds while you walk by their desk, you will not be hassled. Their desk is strategically located as you exit the casino going towards the elevators to your rooms. The casino narrows at this point so there isn't much room to run ha ha! Overall: I would stay at the Excalibur again. I liked the room, the casino atmosphere was great (minus the party pit,) and MOST of the people that worked there were great too. The place was NOT overrun with kids, though there were certainly plenty present. The maid told me that the week before I arrived the place HAD been overrun with a bunch of kids there for a basketball tourney or something. She said she'd had to tell them numerous times to not bounce their basketballs up and down the hallways at night and early in the morning. Had I been there THAT week, I think I would have had some complaints about the noise for sure, but again; lucky me I guess.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but there are two qualities or the rooms”
Reviews.Author: hrefa
Reviews.Content: Good value for the money. Big parking. The same problems as in the other hotels in Las Vegas: AC works too much, resort fee charged (equal to 2 bottle of water and some type of phone calls). Wireless internet works. At the first day we were in the Tower 2, they upgraded us free of charge for a wide screen room. This was a modern room with flat TV on the 14th floor, with good view. After the first day we decided to stay for an additional day. They moved us to the Tower 1, for the 2nd floor. Our room there was very large but with old furniture, and everything was too old there. So try to stay on the Tower 2 if you want better room! There is not too much possibility to eat, McDonalds, some chinese, one expensive restaurant, etc. We found donuts 7/24, it's good and we were there to eat in the night. We will try the next time another hotel but this is good, too (only the Tower2!!!)

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected but hate the resort fee”
Reviews.Author: pellicaninvegas
Reviews.Content: Nice updated room in Tower ll. Clean, and a great view of the strip. We did not use any of the amenities offered in the resort fee, so they may as well just add the ten dollars to the room price and stop with the phony room price. I booked through Vegas.com where the resort fee also included 2 bottles of water daily and a reception area for guest in the casino - the check-in clerk said there were never any offers like that. Only complaint was the mattress was hard.

Reviews.Title: “JULY STAY-HOT DAYS IN VEGAS”
Reviews.Author: Loftypines
Reviews.Content: stayed for 4 nites in a Tower 2 room, clean no frills room. Tower 2 has been reno'd with what seemed like a new bed, carpet, bathroom, nice TV. Avoid buffet. Friendly staff throughout the Hotel. If you are not hung up on high end spots to sleep the EX is alright! If trying off strip restaurants look up the Ghandi Restaurant on Flamingo by Terribles casino. Lunch buffet is $11 and yummy!

Reviews.Title: “room was impeccable, but facilities a bit dated”
Reviews.Author: bigpaulo
Reviews.Content: Shared a room with my sister, mini-family reunion. Enormous bathroom. Counters non-standard height (too high), niggling complaint. No tub, but shower was enormous! Beds were very good, housekeeping was great... bathroom and bedrooms were spotless. Elevators a bit slow, esp. when busy. Pools are a mob scene, and you can't do lap swimming (I was hoping to get some serious swimming done). Casino is smoky-smelling and old-looking, but I only walked through it. Our room was on a non-smoking floor, and room smelled smoke-free, thankfully. Sit down breakfast and buffet are both mediocre/expensive. Parking lot is a long walk away, especially when it's above 110 deg F.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: RChappo
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in Vegas. We stayed 2 nights. My wife made the reservation (she had stayed here 16 years ago) and I was a little bit worried about what kind of room we would get for $36 a night. I was pleasantly surprised when we got there and our room was clean and spacious. OK the hotel's castle concept is a bit dated and cheesy, but it's Vegas, it's all cheesy! For that money you can't go wrong. Our room was on the 26th floor of Tower 1 and it was more than adequate for our needs. The bed was comfy and the bathroom was clean and fuctional. The only minor quibbles I have were that there was no coffee maker in the room (not a big deal) and the elevators in Tower 1 were pretty slow and infrequent. But overall I've no complaints...especially considering the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “it was terrible”
Reviews.Author: michaela0144
Reviews.Content: so the first thing when we arrived in the hotel we got room keys they were not working. than one of the rooms was really really smelly. you couldn't stay there for an hour, i still don't know how we maneged to sleep there. in the bathrooms were ants crawling around (on the towls and in the shower and lately also in the whole room). it was disgusting. we told the roomservice about it- they don't unstood a word and after waiting for hours the sprayed something but it didn't work. ther was a picture missing in one of the rooms. and the whole hotel wasn't clean. dishes and food were in the hallways. It was the worst hotel i have ever seen. And we had to pay more for the rooms than they tell you on their webside.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price, Average Rooms”
Reviews.Author: LaurenA12
Reviews.Content: Not a bad experience, just nothing special. If you are looking for a cheap room in a great location this is your best bet. But if you are looking for flashy Las Vegas, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't impressed”
Reviews.Author: Nathan_Pisani
Reviews.Content: This hotel is getting very old and the theme is starting to be cheesy compared to the other hotels on the strip. We went here because it was cheaper than the other places, but I regret this now that I have stayed at the Bellagio for a really good deal and flight sale (not much more that what I paid for the Excalabur). The rooms weren't that great and overall I didn't enjoy this hotel. It is a place just to sleep and at least it's on the strip (even if it's a bit far from where all the better hotels are).

Reviews.Title: “First time ever in Vegas--Excalibur ok”
Reviews.Author: awdang_99
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Vegas with family for basketball tournament. Stayed in Excalibur. Got a pretty good rate--could have paid $50 less had I confirmed reservations a day before which would have helped pay for the resort fees. Anyway, we stayed in Tower II which hasn't been renovated in a while. The room was fairly large. The bathroom had no bathtub, which makes bathing a chore if you have children under 5. I wasn't here to gamble. This casino resort and all the ones I walked through via the connecting bridges forced you through there casino floors. SMOKE EVERYWHERE! Scantily-clad women everywhere--not the greatest scents and sights for young boys. Food I was expecting food to be cheaper here, but their prices were almost worse than prices where I live. re except the casino. In subsequent visits I have stayed elsewhere. There were a lot of fast food options in this casino resort, but not a lot of healthy options w/out paying a mint. Swimming The pool was excellent. Four different pools. It is ridiculous that the pool closes at 7pm at this family friendly resort. Temps were well into the 100's. One pool (which was completely shaded until about 12 noon, doesn't open until 11am. Most of the kids were at the pool will the two nice slides. Kid favorite pool. I would stay here again if I had too, but plan to stay away from the casino resorts (if possible) if I ever visit Las Vegas again. FYI... --Checkout the lion exhibit at MGM --Watch out for all of the adult pamphlets and cards being passed out on every corner on the strip (material even passed out to teenage boys)

Reviews.Title: “Good time”
Reviews.Author: thegoodguyz
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Excalibur after 3 days of driving, and we couldn't wait to just get in our room. The check-in was fine, and we were pleasantly suprised with our room - awesome view of the Strip from the 21st floor of Tower 2. Our room was clean, with a flat-screen TV and wireless internet. Now, on to some positives and negatives.... Use the valet parking. It's free, but we always tipped a couple bucks. Well worth it. The casino is very smoky. We casino-hopped a lot and Excalibur was the smokiest casino (with Stratosphere being a close second). The time-share people are a major nuisance. We stayed at Excalibur for 6 days, and the same people would harrass you even after you had told them "not interested" each day. We would leave a note for housekeeping every day, asking for 2 extra towels (for our boys) with a $ tip beside the note. They always took the tip, but they never left the extra towels. All in all, we enjoyed our stay at Excalibur. It's not the best place in Vegas, but I think it's a really good value. We paid less than $40 per night - pretty sweet for a place with a good location on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “"You Get What You Pay For"”
Reviews.Author: Drizzt_Calgary
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Excalibur for a single night on our way to San Diego. I had originally stayed there 15 years ago and found the service to be terrible. I felt that they were understaffed everywhere except the casino. In subsequent visits I have stayed elsewhere. This time however I was travelling with a 4 and 6 year old. We needed to stay at a family friendly hotel that was reasonably priced. The Excalibur fits this need perfectly. I did however tell my better half not to expect much, that the hotel was a “dump” and that we’d get poor service. My negative expectations were not born out by reality. There was a long line at check in but they had a lot of front desk people on and it went very quickly. We paid $86 for a room and were very happy. It had been upgraded and contained a flat screen t.v., marble countertops and a large tiled shower. We also found the service elsewhere to be friendly and efficient. This hotel also has a lot of attached franchises such as McDonalds and ice cream stores that were perfect for our needs. My kids loved the pools and the Kings Tournament night show. On the way back from San Diego we also stopped in Vegas. We had heard great things about the swimming areas at Mandalay Bay and the MGM but we were unsure about how kid friendly they would be. We decided to stay at the Excalibur again and upgraded our room for an extra $16. I assumed the really low priced rooms would be the old un renovated ones. This time however our room was an exercise in contrast. It also had a flat screen, marble countertops etc but was filled with worn and tired looking furniture. The dresser looked like it had been picked up in a garage sale after being used in a kids room for 15 years and the bed spread was torn and repaired in multiple places. Why renovate a room, charge extra for it and then fill it with furniture and bedding that are many years old? It just leaves a poor impression. Despite this however I’m giving the Excalibur a good rating. I find so often on Trip Advisor people review a hotel as if it is always a 5 star. This is not the Wynn. The room was not $500/night it was only $90 and the Excalibur is a 3 STAR HOTEL. On so so many reviews people pay much less and then complain about a 3 star being a 3 star. The Excalibur is one of the cheapest large hotels on the Las Vegas Strip, our kids had fun staying in “a castle” and so did we. P.S. The pool does close ridiculously early and I too am very very tired of having extra charges such as the “resort fee” added to the price of the room by hotels. We also had to pay a $20 service fee for buying four tickets to their OWN Kings Tournament night show.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel, Basic but Good”
Reviews.Author: reviewit24u
Reviews.Content: It was ok. No tub in the basic/standard room, shower only, which was a disappointment. Check-in is 3pm, but I had them hold my bag starting at 7am and they allowed people to check in at about 1pm. I stayed in Tower I, which I think was the quieter tower; Tower II is nearer to the pool and fitness center, so you have more people-traffic in that area of the casino/hotel. You get a free paper daily (you have to go downstairs to get it though) and some discounts for shows, but they have discontinued the free water in the rooms. Also a drawback was the elevator system; 4 elevator banks, but only 1 or 2 ever seemed to work (for each side), and they are not air-conditioned, so it was hot in the elevators and pretty packed at times. The room was ok - large king bed, large workstation/desk, and some cable channels. No wireless internet, so leave your ipad/itouch at home - the free internet is via ethernet connection only. Free small lotion, conditioner, soap and shampoo in the room and some plastic cups, nothing more. I didn't spend much time in the room, but I would stay there again - the location is good, and close to a lot of the discount souvenir shops you won't find father down the strip.The fitness center was ok; I worked out a few times, and they have ample amount of treadmills for everyone, but only a 2 bikes, and no ellipticals, mainly weights.

Reviews.Title: “Kids had fun but the experience was forgettable”
Reviews.Author: astromberg
Reviews.Content: We arrived with excitement to dig into our vacation but were disappointed to have so many problems with our room. The pull out mirror was broken and out of fear one of the kids would shatter it, we spent the first 45 minutes waiting for maintenance show up to fix it. Fortunately when it was finished we were able to get the kids some fast food from the hotel food court (it has a McDonald's, Pizza Hut, Subway and Cold Stone right there!) The pool was fun, especially the water slide, but by the time we made it there, we had roughly 45 minutes before we were kicked out. It was like 108 degrees outside and the kids wanted to play at the pool longer. I don't know of many hotels that close the pool off at 5:30 or 6 pm. It was stupid.
