But on the bright side, because there were hundreds of screaming kids everywhere and it wasn't even remotely relaxing -- I was secretly glad to leave. Then we paid to see the Excalibur medieval dinner show (nearly $70 per ticket!) and it was fun but felt like cattle being herded in. Literally. Our waiter was taking away our plates before we able to finish the meal! Start to finish we were there for like an hour. The sound from the microphones was so distorted you could barely hear what the actors were saying. If possible, wait for the second showing if you must see this, perhaps you will get to stay and enjoy your food longer. (Which was really just okay anyway) The real bummer was the next day when the cable went out for the entire hotel and we couldn't watch the World Cup from our Widescreen Room. The entire day!!! Honestly, that was the straw that broke the camel's back. Pay a little extra and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: rteixeira
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd time in Vegas. The Excalibur is a nice hotel, very well located in the strip. The hotel/casino is big a lot of amusemend and things to do. Pools are large enough to everyone, restaurants and round table buffet is also good a not too expensive. Rooms are large and have everything you need, coul have a fancier newer decoration but they are allright. The only bad thing was the fact that we were constantly requested to go seeing time-share properties when we wanted just to relax and have fun. Nice place to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: blu3dud3
Reviews.Content: Our Stay was great at the Excalibur. We visited many of the other hotel / casino's and the Excalibur was one of the best places that had a great mixture of games/ food / attractions. Only issues we had was kids doing sprints above our ( Ground Level ) Hotel room at 7 am in the morning. This is a Great hotel as its at the beginning of the strip and you can walk the strip and enjoy the surrounding views of the casino's.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place. Stay here.”
Reviews.Author: progirl016
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Las Vegas. I didn't plan on staying at a place on the strip however I found the Excalibur's rates to be very affordable. It was as nice as I thought it would be. I was traveling with my mom who had won tickets to go see a taping of Wheel of Fortune that was in town. We were given a room on the 14th floor in tower 2 had a nice view of tower 1. The room was big and the beds were very comfortable. The bathroom was big and had lots of counter space with a deep sink and nice walkin shower. There were only 3 things that we found to be a bit odd. 1) The floor lamp didn't have a lightbulb in it but there were several other lamps in the room that worked perfectly fine. 2) The bathroom fan didn't seem to be working but we really didn't need it. 3) There didn't appear to be a deadbolt lock on the room door but we were looking at it at 2am after a few hours on the strip so perhaps we just didn't see it. The Sherwood Forest Cafe was very nice. The hostess Ruby and our waitress Phyllis were very nice and helpful. The food was very good and so was the service. The check-in and check-out process was swift and speedy. The front desk clerk Lola was very helpful. We didn't see any other shows at the hotel or use the pool since it was just an overnight stay and the show prices were not in our budget. I would enjoying staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: TicketToRide68
Reviews.Content: We upgraded to a wide screen room and got the greatest view - floor 24, room 15, tower 2. The beds were very firm which was unexpected - usually they're too soft. The bathroom and room were both really clean. I'd read some bad reviews and was expecting the worst but was pleasantly surprised. The front desk staff was extremely helpful. Yes, there were people trying to "give" you show tickets, etc but we "no, thank-you" and kept walking. No one got in our face or followed up. The casino was smoke filled but it is a casino after all. Didn't eat at the Excalibur but did however at the Luxor and it was great. I would definitely stay at the Excalibur again if I ever got back to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Mandatory Resort Fee is Total Hidden Fee”
Reviews.Author: bremertonmjs56
Reviews.Content: Don’t stay here! I bought my room via Priceline and was not told about any extra fees. When I arrived at this hotel, they told me that there is a MANDATORY $9.95 plus tax ($11.14) Resort Fee. This was clearly a hidden fee that was NOT disclosed when I made the reservation. I have the copy of the email reservation, which I showed to the Desk Supervisor, and he agreed that there was no mention of any Mandatory Fee on this confirmation, but still the desk manager refused to concede the charge. I called Priceline and they also refused to reimburse me for this charge. I am writing all the respective managements as well as the attorney generals of Nevada and my home state, as well as CNN, Fox News, the Chamber of Commerce, The Better Business Bureau and every travel advisory site I can find. When the hotel would not take away the charge, they offered to upgrade my room. Some upgrade! When I got into the room, a) the electrical outlets at the base of both the internet connection did not work so I had no where to charge my cell phone except in the bathroom; b) the Ethernet cable was about 18 inches long and attached on top of the dresser, which was across the room from the one small table and chair in the room. No way to sit and work on my laptop even if I COULD get a connection working; c) The internet connections did not work; I work in the industry, I know all the tricks for getting it to work, it did not work in this room. d) The phone was across the room, and cord was too short to reach across the room to call the Internet service provider while also looking at my laptop, and e) there was no soap so I could not wash my hands after going the bathroom. I called and asked for another room. They moved me back to a standard room on another floor where at least the Ethernet worked and it had a bar of soap. So I went to go take a swim and cool off, went down to the pool and discovered that THE POOL CLOSES AT 7 PM. When I asked a bellman why the pool closes at 7 PM he said that they ask the management team that same question EVERY year and the management team ignores the question and just says, “because it does.” When I asked the Desk Supervisor why the pool closes at 7 PM he said “because it gets dark before 7 PM.” Like no one wants to swim after dark? Like no one in Las Vegas doesn’t have a PLETHORA of lights lighting up the entire desert 24 hours a day?! Not to mention that as I looked out the window at 8:15 PM as I spoke with Mr. Desai, it was still light out. (FYI, sunset in Las Vegas on July 14, 2010 was at 7:58 PM.) I should also mention that the rugs are dirty and the elevators are especially dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Keep Looking! the pool is a trap!”
Reviews.Author: royaljelly
Reviews.Content: Dear Folks: I recently stayed at the Excalibur on the tail end of a Grand Canyon , Bryce, Zion trip. Let's start by stating I'm not a Vegas lover but while we were so close I figured I'd fly out of Vegas and spend a couple of days. My main beef with the Excalibur is the Pool hours. They obviously want people in the casinos so the pool hours are radically truncated. We got out to the pool early one day to find the main pool closed. It was 98 degrees and this pool was in the shade of the hotel, perfect right? Wrong. They don't open the pool until the sun hits it...what!!? The main pool won't open until 11am? Everyone is crowded into the Kids pool with the slide as it is "in the sun". One employee tells us the pool won't open until 1pm as there was a "contamination yesterday so we treat for 24 hours". That's a load of crap as when there is a contamination at Disney they treat and everyone back in the pool in 45min. They also try to spin the "no lifeguards on duty" speech, crap again - in a town where you let people walk around EVERYWHERE with alcohol 24/7 you're trying to play the safety card? Do I have "stupid" written on my forehead? To top it all off the pool closes at 7pm....7PM!! Are you kidding? it's 100 degrees here at 9pm. I'm told other resorts in Vegas have pool hours til 10pm, I know all non-Vegas resorts do, some like Disney have 24hr pools - FIND OUT BEFORE YOU BOOK! On a positive, the room was clean we booked adjoining rooms King/2 queens with widescreen TV and a view of the strip for two nights less than $200. Room turned out very nice and the location was fine. The "Tournament of Kings" was great and a convenient thing to do in the Hotel on Check in day. If you're with kids and they're pool junkies as mine are, look for a better option as there really is not much for kids to do in Vegas other than get an education on vice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Kids!!”
Reviews.Author: worldtosee83
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel and my kids had a great time. Only sad thing is the buffet is not the best. But I would go back with my kids, great location and plenty of places to eat elsewhere. The rooms are fine, comfortable beds, spacious washroom and clean. The maids/housekeeper are very nice and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all Costs”
Reviews.Author: mstimc
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying I'm not one to expect more than I pay for. If I pay for a two-star motel, I don't expect four star amenities. But no matter what, I think customers have a few basic rights 1) decent service, 2) a reasonably clean room 3) things in the room should work. Excalibur struck out on all three. First, we made reservations for three rooms through Vegas.com, under my name, and that of my mother in law and my wife's aunt. The hotel managed to screw up the reservation and reserve two of the rooms under my mother in law's name; fortunately I had the paperwork from Vegas.com to prove I had the reservation under the right name, but it took a manager to over-ride the erroneous entry. When we got to our room, the electronic keys didn't work, so we had to trudge back downstairs to have them reprogrammed. They worked, but it was hit and miss for the rest of the stay. Second, the rooms themselves were small, drab, and dirty, furnished with what looked like Motel 6 cast-offs. The room had two beds but one small nightstand between them with a puny under-powered lamp. There was a mysterious sticky spot on the rug. The bathroom appeared clean, but I noticed a small vent fan on the wall, with a pull-out filter, which read, "Must be Changed Every 6 Months". Just for the heck of it I pulled out the filter and yikes! It was full of lint, dust and who knows what else. The fan itself was so overloaded with crud I didn't turn it on for fear of starting a fire. Third, the room safe didn't work. Fourth, there was a security guard station in the first floor elevator lobby with a sign that read "Your security is important to us. Please present your room key." The station was un-staffed most of the time, even late at night. Finally, the whole place looked and smelled very worn out and run down. Obviously, management is deferring simple maintenance due to the economy, but for a hotel that tries to draw families, I'd expect some basic attention to maintenance and safety. The whole place needs renovation and a new management philosophy.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not for Me [I dont own a leisure suit}”
Reviews.Author: drhawk100
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Excalibur for 2 nites in July 2010, just to catch our breathe before heading out to the Canyons of Arizona and Utah. Let get this straight I am not a fan of Las Vegas and this was purely a stop-over. We originally visited Las Vegas back in the early 80’s and was totally underwhelmed back then.,anyway the hotel is very close to the main airport and $10 should get you there by taxi, The check-in was quiet and we quickly negotiated our way to our room in tower 2. The room was very large, clean and well equipped, not bad for £27 a nite. There was a nice coffee shop called the Sherwood café and we had good breakfast here for about $8 each. But apart from that the place is full of leisure suited families lollygagging about the place leaving strollers and tired children all over the place. A cocktail cost about $10 each. the place is busy and not relaxing one bit, but hey I will not be staying long. There is nothing natural about Las Vegas and after walking to all the nearby hotels not a lot to choose between them, If you must go to Vegas I suggest the Excalibur is OK but nothing more, But I think you would be very sad to stay longer than 2 days

Reviews.Title: “Not for families! Stay somewhere else....”
Reviews.Author: YukonCornelius98
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at other hotels on the strip and this was the worst on so many levels. Most disturbing was the lack of care for families being exposed to lewd behavior. Just 35 steps from the Sponge Bob statue in the main atrium is the "Party Pit" where a what looks like a strip show is VERY visible. It is totaly inappropriate & in my opinion, unacceptable for that area of the hotel. Another 10 steps away at the main entrance is a trellis where photos can be taken. We observered a classless female bent over with a man stradling behind simulating an act again totally inappropriate for a public entry. Final straw was the the TV in their highly marketed 'widescreen room' automatically turns on at room entry. It runs advertising, including porn ads showing women in underwear in sexual poses. The TV remote was missing and the channel controls were disabled so we couldn't even watch "family friendly" TV, but rather had to power it off altogether. Other problems were that the room window was open slightly when we arrived only to learn it would not shut completely or engage the lock. Being on the 24th floor, this was less than pleasing and had to be a code violation. Finally, the hallway noise kept us up most of the night. Every time the nearby door would shut or guests would walk down the hall, we could hear it as if right in our room. Was really unpleasant to hear the drunken guests full of profanity all night. We stayed here 1 night after a family vacation to the Grand Canyon and picked this hotel thinking it would be kid friendly since it didn't advertise adult only environment/pool area. While we were able to find an area of the pool where children could play without seeing the beer pong stuper AND the Tournament of Kings was family friendly, it wasn't worth the other distasteful surprises. Being an older hotel, it also requires passing directly through the casino to get to the tower room entrances. Unfortunately, smoking is allowed in the casino making it impossible to get in/out without traversing a cloud of smoke. Pay the extra $$ and stay at Mandalay Bay where they at least pump in coconut air freshener to cover undesirable smells.

Reviews.Title: “STAY HERE!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hovdog
Reviews.Content: BEST hotel ever great for kids and adults arcade and casinos you guys should stay here it is the best!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great-if you are looking for cheap, loud, dirty, rude, etc.”
Reviews.Author: The-Flying-Circus
Reviews.Content: We are not Puritan's by any means, but what a mistake it was for me to book this hotel for our 20th Anniversary. We had never been to Vegas, so I booked on Vegas.com and chose Excalibur for its claim to be pushing for a more adult crowd. They advertised an adult only, relaxation pool. What a joke! The DJ was pumping out the tunes so loud, that you could not even think. 4 pools, and they were all basically crawling with under 18 and 18-20 that were there to drink and party. Cans and plastic cups thrown to the ground when finished, and don't even get me started on the smoking both in the casino and at the pool, and everywhere else. My wife and I were bothered at the number of families at this casino who brought there children to the casino with them. I know that it is a casino, but not the place to bring your family. Vegas.com bookings apparently don't get the best rooms...no kidding. Our first room just had a bad vibe to it; check-in claims they "upgraded" us even though I had booked a widescreen tower room through the website. View was of the back of the castle spirals, and an alcove where some workers set up chairs to take a break. If this was one of the new upgraded rooms, Excalibur has failed miserably. I have stayed at older Holiday Inns that had better decor. We upgraded on Sunday night for $10 and got a much better view with basically the same decor. However, we just could'nt get passed the noise, smoke, and lower class guests at this place. The hallways were littered with debris and room service carts. Believe the reviews that say the carts stay in the hallway for up to three days. We saw them. If you ask housekeeping for extra towels, they tell you they only have sheets, you need to call for towels ??????? Obviously someone else is responsible for cleaning up room service carts, room cleaners only touched the rooms. We ended up lasting about three nights and then I chose to book at Luxor for remaining duration of our vacation. The only bright spot in our stay at the Exalibur was the Camelot Steakhouse. Great service, great meal. One example of rude service I witnessed was a Japanese man trying to get the $4 beer and hot dog deal from a casino bar, only to be harshly told he had to get his wife and child in stroller out of the gaming area. We we about 50 feet from the nearest gaming table that was operating, and his wife and child were another 10 feet away from that. And this while we personally had seen families gathered around one person playing a slot machine on several occasions that weekend. Maybe the bartender was just racist because the man did not speak English very well. Luxor was better updated, friendlier service, less smoke (better filtration) and less noise. There were still families with young children here, but about 1/10th compared to Excalibur. Overall it was a much better set up. We finally got to enjoy ourselves more at Luxor. Pool area was fine until Friday 1 PM when DJ showed up to blast tunes. We got up and left area, knowing what was probably coming. I realize Vegas is all about excess and partying, but don't advertise relaxation. I should have bit the bullet and booked at a more upscale hotel such as Bellagio or Ceasar's. BTW we are only in our mid-40's and like to have fun, but this was not our cup of tea.

Reviews.Title: “Find another hotel”
Reviews.Author: BTB01
Reviews.Content: Our party of 5 including 2 teens & 5 year old survived the long check-in lines to be given rooms that did not interconnect (as requested) & that were FILTHY - hair in the bathroom, no towels, toe nail cuttings on the carpet - in the pay extra wide screen rooms. Rooms were changed after complaining but public room carpets and lifts all looked like they hadn't been cleaned in years, queues for everything (30 mins for coffee at the Castle Coffee kiosk as only ever one lady working) & you need to walk through the casino to get anywhere. Seeing as children aren't allowed in the smoke filled casino this was a challenge as if you stopped for a minute (to allow the 5 year old to catch up) you were rudely told to move on. Children's area also disastrous with more than 75% of the games out of order - friendly staff here though. Tournament of Kings show was good but book once you're there - if you can stand the queues - as they have good specials. Food not great and slow - tomato soup, whole chicken and jam tart - all eaten with your hands to add to the atmosphere! Free, and plentiful, cool drink at the shows. Find another hotel - one that is truly child friendly - the Excalibur is NOT CHILD FRIENDLY - even though it says it is.

Reviews.Title: “Miserable”
Reviews.Author: GABoy63
Reviews.Content: I did not enjoy my stay here what so ever. The great rate I got was not worth the dread. The thing that upset me me the most was the parking situation. Unless you use valet, which I choose not to do, prepare to walk to get to and from your vehicle. The closest lot to the my tower, one, was always full because it has about fifty spaces. The only other option is the garage and it is located a block distance behind the resort. Combined with the 100 degree weather, getting to my car was exhausting. The place was just plan crowded also. I could not walk around inside it without bumping into people. Our room, which was in tower 1, was a mess. The rooms in tower 2 were considered an upgrade because they had recently been upgraded. My back hurt every morning after getting up because of the hard bed. The house keepers were stingy with towels and hand rags and they were always asking to clean the room even after it had been cleaned. Everything there is expensive, including the slots. We never ate one meal there because of the prices. The only thing that I enjoyed, although very slightly, was the pool. It is one of the largest I've seen in Vegas and had lots of space and enjoyment. Also, wireless internet is paid for with your resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “Pick another hotel skip this one”
Reviews.Author: my123abc
Reviews.Content: Planning a trip to Las Vegas? With so many options on the strip the Excalibur is one to skip. Accomodations were minimal at best. When we arrived the lines for check in were extremely long and slow...observed that guests in wheelchairs were not treated with respect nor consideration. When we arrived in our room to rest after a long day of travel... the smoke detector was beeping every five minutes or so... we called the front desk. We received a very rude response from the person on the other end of the line. They said they would send someone right up...waited for a half hour ...no one showed and the beeping continued. Don't bother paying extra for the rooms with the widescreen television, there are only six tv channels and two are looped Vegas reels. Casino is so smoke packed it is sure to send you outside for fresh air! They say you get two bottles of water each day...they should call it two sips of water in tiny bottles each day! No service, bare minimum....never to return here!

Reviews.Title: “Return Trip....Another Great Stay for the Money”
Reviews.Author: 3spunkytravelers
Reviews.Content: This was our second time at the Excalibur. When deciding to return to Las Vegas for a second time we thought we'd like to try a different hotel given all of the options available, but when I landed a $61/nt rate for a strip-view room on an upper floor with two beds and a wide-screen TV we decided to return to the Excalibur. It was the right choice. While not the most glamorous hotel on the strip, from what we saw while exploring it has one of the best pool areas and is the most (at least in Las Vegas terms) "family accomodating" hotels for those traveling with kids. Since all of the interesting areas of the other hotels are accessible to those not staying there, why pay more?? Overall, another good time at the Excalibur.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at the Excalibur!”
Reviews.Author: wendy96734
Reviews.Content: I know that I just came from Hawaii where service is everything, but the service at the Excalibur is the poor to say the least. We paid for an upgraded room and it was so dirty. I would not let my son walk around the room without shoes. The linen and blankets had cotton balls with dark brown velvet headboards. They had long round light blue velvet pillows on the bed that were dingy with white stains, that look very disgusting. Service in general has been very bad, it feels as if most of the staff don't like their jobs. I also scheduled to have a deep tissue massage in the spa, upon checking in after disclosing that I took medication for high blood pressure they said that I could not have my deep tissue massage. They should have said this when I scheduled the appointment. I have been getting deep tissues massage for years and this is the first time that I was told that I could not have one. They also told me I could get a swedish massage or nothing but would still need to pay for the service regardless. In the kids game room last night all the change machines were down and half the games did not work. The one good thing that I can say about the hotel is the food buffet is an excellent value and the pool was great for my son and husband. (the service at the buffet was an exception it was very good). I would not recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “We stayed here twice, once for 2 nights...”
Reviews.Author: AbbsG
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice, once for 2 nights, then came back a little over a week later for another 3 nights. The price for a standard room was the major drawer card for us, around $45 per night all inclusive. In case you don't know, there is a $9.95 service charge per room per night, and I think tax is added to this. The rooms we stated in were both a good size, as were the bathrooms. Facitities were all suitable. I wouldn't call it a 5 star room, but for the price I certainly wouldn't complain! The pools (4 I think) were great, the gym one of the best I have come across, so big ticks there. Food and drinks can get a little expensive, we did the $30 buffet one day which was very cost effective, but we ate too much! Other food options were quite expensive, even the take away options. Drinks are really expensive! That is unless you are a fullon gambler which I am not. I did playback game of Texas holdum (didn't win) and got complimentary drinks throughout the game. Apart from that beers were from 6 to 7 dollars per drink. Drinks at Dicks (nightspot) were also expensive. Location was great, very accessible to the rest of the strip. I should also add that we weren't there on the weekend either time, rooms cost s lot more on weekends! So, overall I do recommend staying here - and even though drinks are a little expensive, if you want to have a good night with a few drinks, Dicks is good (but not clean) fun!

Reviews.Title: “Very poor, stay away!!!”
Reviews.Author: Source
Reviews.Content: No A/C, called front desk and was transferred to housekeeping, waited more than 2 hrs, the maintenance guy finally showed up. No soap/shampoo, called front desk and was transferred to housekeeping again with the same lady- VERY RUDE lady!!! Front desk staff was not pleasant at all. I would not recommend this hotel STAY AWAY.

Reviews.Title: “terrible hotel and experience. staff were...”
Reviews.Author: Dazpants
Reviews.Content: terrible hotel and experience. staff were miserable and unhelpful. family member got purse robbed and they failed to do anything. apparently thieving is rife throughout Vegas but more so in this hotel and other of similar value. definitely don't stay here regardless of how cheap it may be as you get what you pay for and we got one of the worst hotels on the strip. only saving grace was the 3 pools on offer but 1 didn't open until after 12pm and all were closed around 7ish. food was vile so and not much of a choice. Vegas is a place to go many times but definitely don't stay in this downtrodden hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: sped01
Reviews.Content: I stayed here when I was very young when it first opened and loved it. I stayed here last september on a comp for one night in the Wide screen room. It was a good room. The tables have lower limits. The only complaint is slow drink service which is not ok with me.

Reviews.Title: “Good Trip”
Reviews.Author: nrain02
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival to the Excalibur the parking was not to be desired, there was limited covered parking and a long walk from the parking lot to hotel entrance with no shuttle or cart srevice, this made it difficult with kids and luggage. Check in was quick and friendly, we had stayed in the Widescreen Room. The room was nice with big flat screen tv, just as pictured on the hotel website and the bathroom was decent size with shower only, no tub. With Vegas being the town that never sleeps, we actually did get sleep and didn't hear much noise from hallway or surrounding rooms. We had stayed at the Excalibur strictly for it's kid friendliness and that it was. I did not have to worry about walking through the casino floor and having my son look at half dressed women or anything inappropriate, so that was nice. During our stay here we saw the Tournament of the Kings, very good show for 4-12 year olds, the food is not that good and my 7 year old did eat any of it. The show itself was entertaining and the knights and horses stayed around afterwards for pictures and meet and greets. The Roundtable buffet, not worth it, my son liked it because it had a lot of kid dishes, but not worth the money we paid. The Excalibur pool was beautiful, there is a waterslide and an whole entire pool that is only 3 feet deep, perfect for kids. They also had 3 other pools with nice cabanas, the pool restaurant "Drenched" had really good food and fun atmosphere. There was an entire floor full of arcade games and carnival like games, this would have been fun but about half the games were out of order and could not be played. For he cost of hotel and kid friendliness, I would definately stay here again, it was nice to get to be on the newer end of the strip for the 3 star price.

Reviews.Title: “Trust me plenty of other places just as reasonable to stay”
Reviews.Author: vshizzle
Reviews.Content: First time in Vegas with no option as to where to stay as it was a company Christmas party. Probably a step up from Circus Circus but right around what I would expect to find there. Bathrooms were great and rooms were pretty clean. However, my friends watch ended up missing off of our bedstand and the maid was of no help. We had the ultimate pleasure of seeing a show, of course they picked Tournament of Kings even after the suggestion of Beatles Love. If you are over the age of 7 I do not recommend it, especially for the ticket price. However if you like crappy food and eating with your hands...by all means...go for it. I drank my soup out of a straw as I did not want to put my lips on the bowl. Some poor kid peed his pants at the end of show after the ear deafening faux grenade went off and pretty sure a guy in our group tinkled a little too. I was too busy worrying what conditions the horses lived in, as they kicked dirt in my splendid meal. The Casino and hallways were soooooo smokey, which I can tolerate but would wake up when someone in the hallway was smoking and it filtered in our room. With about a 5 million dollar update and the ridance of Tournament of Kings it could be a decent Casino.

Reviews.Title: “Only stay here if you get a REALLY good deal”
Reviews.Author: Allively
Reviews.Content: don't let the fact that is lists itself as a 3 star hotel, that it looks fancy on the outside, or that it is located on the stip confuse you. it really isn't all that nice of a hotel. its grungy and attracts a certain class of persons that can be quite unappealing. we went to vegas through a US Airways deal which included airfare and this hotel for a really good price (round trip airfare plus 4 night stay for under 350 a person). we got what we paid for and it was certainly adequate for what we paid. if you are looking for a nice or even typical experience of las vegas, i would avoid this hotel. other things to note: -the maid service decided not to show up one day -they charge you 11 dollars a day for internet, gym access and 2 tiny water bottels -their pool is disgusting -hotel has a very 70's looking style inside. its almost as if they tried to live up to their theme, but got lazy after hanging up a medieval inspired light in each room. - oh and there resutrant staff is MISERABLE.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value...Good Service!!”
Reviews.Author: sumerx
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Excalibur..and my Husbands first...it was actually his first ever trip to Vegas...We booked our trip through Southwest Vacations because we were going to my 15 year high school reunion. We left St. Louis in pouring rain and headed to Denver. When we landed in Denver it was snowing and our plane fishtailed upon landing. We changed planes and headed to Vegas, only to have another passenger suffer a seizure. So when we got to Vegas we were not allowed to unboard for a half an hour. It was a real experience for my husband who had never flown before. We got our luggage and caught a shuttle to our hotel. This was another harrowing ride as we flew down streets and over speed bumps...LOL!!! Needless to say we were very happy to arrive at our hotel. Check in was fast as it was late in the evening when we arrived. The front desk was very helpful and directed us to our room. I knew what to expect from our room since I had stayed before. We selected the widescreen room since these were remodeled rooms. I would recommend that if you book here, that you do the same. My first visit had a much better view than this one. My first visit I had a view of the NYNY hotel next door. This time I had a view of a lower level roof. That aside our room was very nice and very clean. Plenty of room and space for our clothes. Once thing that was missing was the Do Not Disturb sign, but we were usually up & out before housekeeping made their rounds. After our check in we went back downstairs since we were starving. We ate at a fast food mexican joint and it was suprisingly affordable. We ordered two plates of food and two drinks and it was $23. Our servings were huge and we couldn't finish. The beds were comfortable but I did hear a lot door slamming because our room was located at the end of a hall that entered into a stairwell. The hotel was fun, although we are not big gamblers so I have no idea about the casinos. We did however sit at the casino bar to wait for friends and the bartendar informed us that if we put $20 on the bar game we could get free bottled beer and rail drinks...so we played a little...drank 3 drinks a piece..and cashed out with $14..we onlu lost six and had six drinks...not bad for a buck a drink :) We did tip our bartendar very well though. We were due to check out on Sunday at 11, however after being out til 3 am for my reunion I was very tired. I called the front desk and asked if they offered a late check out and they said yes for an additional $20 we could stay until 3pm...SOLD!!!! LOL...we checked out which was fast since we did the late check out. We checked our bags with the conceirge since our flight wasn't leaving until 7pm and we went and got a bite to eat. We retrieved our bags and went to the front enterance and asked where we could catch a shuttle and the doorman said it would be just as affordable to grab a cab and have them take a certain route to the airport so that it wouldn't cost a lot. He was right..our cab total was $11 and we tipped him $5...still less than the $24 for a shuttle. I was very satisfied with the Excalibur and would recommend it to my friends. We are going back to Vegas in October of this year, but we will be staying at TI because of its location. I will write that review when I return :)

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Tower 1”
Reviews.Author: KavehK
Reviews.Content: First got a room in Tower 1 (standard room) but the room was horrific. It was dirty, the toilet didn't work well and the rug was disgusting. After a couple of hours in that we room we went to the desk and upgraded to a Widescreen Room in Tower 2. That room was atleast clean and modern. The only two things that irritated us in that room was that the AC was so loud that you could barely sleep. Also the bathroom wasn't in the best shape. The casino and restaurants were alright even though the choices were few and the breakfast options even fewer. But you're only a three minute walk away from New York New York where the dining options are superior. But the worst thing with the hotel were the timeshare idiots whom tried to lure people to buy timeshare condos everytime you passed by. During our three day visit we probably got disturbed every single time we got out of our rooms. And these salesmen claim they work for the hotel and just want to give you free tickets to shows but then you end up getting harrassed for 30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money, very comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: nanniejax
Reviews.Content: we found the staff helpful and friendly. The rooms were clean and the beds were very comfy. we stayed in Tower 1. I feel the rooms could do with re decorating though. The location was ideal. Would go there again

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: JohnandBarb020
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay here and the rooms are big and comfortable. This room hadn't been renovated yet and although clean, it was looking tired compared to our last visit 4 years ago. For a massive Vegas hotel, service was good and friendly and we were never disturbed by noise in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Went Down Hill”
Reviews.Author: mmowry
Reviews.Content: Wow I was really disappointed. My family and I stayed for 4 days and 3 nights in Tower 2 and that doesn't mean anything. I was expecting at least nice but got horrible. Everything is beat up carpet dirty and the first room we had there was stuff on the bed. We called to give them a chance to come change the bedding. We left and returned 2 hours later to it still dirty. I called down and they said they only got the order 20 minutes ago. I said no. I asked to switch rooms so I didn't have to wait they agreed. You could take a shower in the sink better than you can in the actual shower. Didn't like the fact there was no tub I wasn't expecting that and it made it a little difficult with a small child. Lights were out in the bathroom. They didn't even come to change the trash or bedding. I thought they would ask at check out how our stay was but I guess they don't care because they didn't even ask. I will never stay here again. This hotel has just went down hill in the years and they don't care to keep up with it. We even got yelled at when we stopped for a minute to figure out a plan and we had our 2 year old in a stroller. We weren't even by a machine. It was okay though for children around 7 and 8 to be by the actual gambling tables and the adults had to tell them to move not one worker said anything.

Reviews.Title: “WORST BUFFET FOOD EVER!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: roro1922
Reviews.Content: I did not stay in the hotel...however OMG! The buffet was horrible. I am personally offended at the low grade quality of the food. I mean I understand buffets are not usually high on the gourmet scale, but come on! The food tasted frost bitten, there was a 2 inch layer of grease on every sauce and gravy. It literally tasted like everything was masses microwaved and put out on the buffet table. The drinks were even bad. I would definitely NOT recommend this hotel's buffet....BEWARE, unless less you are a fan of inedible food

Reviews.Title: “don't do it”
Reviews.Author: Clyde414
Reviews.Content: We got a room with a triple upgrade. We got it free and still feel like we made a bad choice. The room smelled awful, mildew on shower curtain ,the shades in the bedroom were broken and couldn't be closed. the food was even worse, the beard of health should close down the buffett. The only positive comment I have is that the table minimums in the casino were very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Stay and overall experience was good except that the Health Spa customer handling was pathetic !”
Reviews.Author: NAVRin
Reviews.Content: My brother in law booked us for this hotel in Las Vegas.And it was a good stay . I wouldnt say that there were all facilities in the room .but given the rate at which it was booked at a fairly discounted rate despite the peak season the room facilities offer @9.98 USD addnl services The rooms are spacious they offereed us a free upgrade to King Size Twin sharing due to non availability of Queen size .which is a good factor . Being Indians,the eating options in the lobby and first floor are good.we had a good variety of Pizza Hut , Baja Fresh (mexican) which reminds us of our typical rajma rice , good taste , Sandwiches at a Sub kind a joint.Starbucks for hot coffee and tea , So food wasnt a problem for us @Excalibur.The hotel room rate included only stay and no coffee vending machine or microwave which was a bit disappointing . In and around the hotel there are very plush casino's like Luxor, MGM Grand , New York New York making the Strip accessible too ...they are all walkable distances from Excalibur. 1 mile away and we can reach Hard Rock cafe which also offers good food and beverages, Now coming to the hard part of it -We signed up for Spa service treatment at this hotel for the 2 of us.unfortunately due to some unforseen appointment we had to move our appointment to 4.30 from 3,30 ,some gentlemen at the Spa mentioned that its moved to 4.30 and we needed to check in however at 4pm .However we got a bit delayed and reached the SPA at 4.32 pm and also apologised. to our dismay the staff had already charged me a no show cancellation fee of 50 USD ! and that too my slot was originally at 4pm ...now this was something we hadnt called for.Inspite of several requests to take a late treatment at the same rate -the mgmt was bit rude and they werent even apologitic until we made them realise it.and they charged both of us eventually a no show cancellation fee of 50 USD.and they also mentioned that whatever time was left cannot be availed due to the staff having to leave at sharp 5.Now this is what is cust dissatisfaction.We were quite upset and tried to escalate to their mgmt but no use.we were told that we could provide feedback on their website post our stay. Thanks to Trip Advisor before we receive their online survey , thought of sharing our thoughts publicly !!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandBookgirl
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were given a free upgrade to Tower 2 which was great, right next to the pool area. The room was clean and air conditioned and also had a safe. There are four pools, one of which is for adults only which is great if you want to relax, have a drink or just read a book(beware the heat loosened the pages of someone's book). We hired a Cabana for a day which was great when the sun got too much but they can be expensive unless there is a group of you to chip in. We went to The Tournament of Kings which we thouroughly enjoyed and would recommend to anyone. We also went to the Criss Angel show but found it disappointing. We enjoyed walking down the strip but if it gets too hot you can take the Ace or Deuce buses which arrive every 15 mins or so and travel the whole length of the strip. Fremont Street is worth a look even if its just to see the Light Show. There are walkways connecting the Excalibur to the Luxor and Mandalay hotels which are worth a look. If your looking to go to some shows check out the half - price ticket booths on the strip as you can get a bargain. For a good meal we recommend the Outback, the steaks are delicious. All in all a great holiday and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “NASTY NASTY NASTY”
Reviews.Author: MargeandSam
Reviews.Content: got the room for 4 nights thu vegas.com when we purchased the room there were no mention of a resort tax of approx. $12 per night extra or we wouldn't have stayed here. but being as it was, the room looked okay carpet was dirty needed a good cleaning, fouled your socks or bare feet, bathroom was terrible with long black hair all over everything sink commode shower and floor, it's like the person who cleaned it used the same instrument to clean everything with, very un-sanitary. we cleaned the bathroom up got rid of all the hair, and put do not distrub sign on door for a couple of days. on the third day we diceided to let the maid into clean, then there it was all back again hair everywhere. very un-sanitary, so we looked behing the bathroom door, it had not been cleaned for a very long time, hair and dirt. I think maybe the hotel might want to investigate what is going on here before someone gets really sick there. never again.

Reviews.Title: “Annoying spammers in hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Blackbrd
Reviews.Content: Good value, rooms were dated but what do you expect for $70 night in Vegas. This is a family hotel, great for kids...but smoke is pretty heavy smelling in the lobby/casino. Major complaint on the nagging time share people! After a few times of being asked did we want to see the free shows it was about all I could do to not be rude. They actually stand in your pathway while you're trying to make your way through the hotel. Very annoying and I noticed none of the other hotels had this problem! Also noticed the casino was a little too warm in June. The other hotels were cool inside the casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Les Vegas - Crazy place! Excalibur - Lively hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RoxMoz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to LV in May 2010 to celebrate my 30th birthday. This was our second attempt at our holiday following the volcano disruption. Although I'd read travel guides I didn't really know what to expect. I guess the best way to describe LV is a 24-hour party place! Great holiday. We stayed for 7 nights and could have stayed longer if money wasn't an issue - lots to do in LV itself - each casino is a holiday on it's own. Plus lots of excursions you can book on. (May weather ideal!) Hotel: The Excalibur is in an ideal location on the Strip, in-between the Luxor and NY. Originally we were supposed to stay at Circus Circus but the Excalibur was definitely a better location. The hotel itself, like all the others, is massive. Several bars and fast food restaurants. There was lots of choice on the buffet but very similar to an all-inclusive holiday - you wouldn't want to eat in there everyday. The Italian restaurant advertised in the brochures was closed all week - one of the staff told us it was because no one ever booked in there. The staff in the hotel were all very helpful I must say. Nice pool area - very clean and although it was busy we didn't struggle to get sun loungers. I would say the casino in this hotel was the busiest casino in Vegas. Can get smoky but they all do. The room was clean and comfortable and we had great views (floor 23). Make sure you try and see as many as the hotels as you can. I can’t describe how big they are – some with malls inside. 2 tips I wish we knew about before we went: When we got to the hotel with our cases, we were greeted by what we thought was a member of check-in staff. He took us over to a counter next to reception and asked us if we wanted to see a free show. Luckily my husband was on the ball because these folk try to sell timeshares - you'll get a discounted show if you sit thought a 2-hour sales pitch. Don't be fooled! And it turns out these 'time share people' are everywhere in Vegas, especially in the hotels. Handy tip, if you don't wanted to be pestered walk past them on your own - they only seemed to bother us when we walked past as a couple. Other tip - drinks can work out expensive compared to UK when you buy at the bar. Put a $1 note in a machine - play 1 cent at a time very slowly and a cocktail waitress will ask if you want a drink. Wait until she comes back with your drinks, tip her a dollar and there you go - cheap round of drinks! And you might even win on the machine haha. Same in all the hotels. The machines pay out in ‘vouchers’ now so if you have any money left and don’t want to carry on playing, print the ‘cash out’ voucher and cash it in or save it for another machine. In terms of trips, we did a trip to the Canyon - a definite must see. We booked through hotel concierge. The company who did our tour was Adventure Photo Tours. They were great I must say. I only wish we had enough money to book on the Hollywood tour too - but there was too much to do in Vegas anyway. Also, get on a bus and go to downtown Vegas. You can buy cheap all day tickets and it is definitely worth seeing. Bit shady to walk there though. Views from the Stratosphere are worth a look too. Have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Jantunez
Reviews.Content: First time to Las Vegas! We stayed in TOWER 2 (upgraded) and loved it!!! The pool is so awesome! The Tournament of kings dinner show is off the hook! I took a 12, 10 and 5 year old with us and we all loved it. The pool was fun! I really liked the Food court! So convenient! We also did the Dinner Buffet that was good to for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, rooms were a good size and fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: fleurbaby
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 5 nights and had not problem our room over looked the strip our kids were 8 and 12 years and they loved it too. Room was clean and was a good size too. Cheap hotel and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Not terrible but not impressed either”
Reviews.Author: TXHoneymooners
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Vegas. Traveled with husband, in-laws, and a few others. (Ages 19-50). We chose this hotel for the price/under 21 friendly. In General: Not impressed with much except for the fact that it was a castle! lol Lots of cool things to look at/do for kids but don't go for a romantic get away. High Points: 1. Comfortable bed and clean room/bathroom (took a humidifier b/c I read reviews about smoky rooms but ours was fine - Tower I 8th floor) 2. Our 1st night the house keeper did a SUPER job and organized all our things. 3. Sherwood Cafe was excellent. We all tried different things and everything was good. 4. Arcade/Tournament of Kings Show (don't recommend for children under 12) Low Points: 1. Out-dated furniture in rooms 2. Slow/crowded elevators 3. Not enough bathrooms for the size of the resort. 4. Poor service at casino & unfriendly dealers/staff 5. Very, VERY smoky casino area 6. Have to walk all the way through casino to get to and from pool.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot find a better deal !!!”
Reviews.Author: chowdahead76
Reviews.Content: We just spent two nights at the Excalibur . Got a rate of $29.00 per night ( so basically I expected the worst rooms available ) . To our absolute shocking surprise our room was IMMACULATE !! and I mean IMMACULATE !! Not only was EVERYTHING remodeled and new , but we had a 42 inch Plasma tv in there . A good sized bathroom with tiled showers that could fit both my wife and I in there ( ummm hmmmm ) . I mean this is the third time we have stayed at this hotel ( a hotel that usually gets criticized ) . And I have to say I dont get the bad critics . If you are rich then stay at the Bellagio . But if you would rather put your extra money into gambling , drinking , souvenirs , entertainment etc.... then stay here . You cannot beat the price , and you cannot beat the rooms . For the price we payed for the room you CANNOT find a better deal .

Reviews.Title: “I must be really picky”
Reviews.Author: jvilla2027
Reviews.Content: I've read a few of the other reviews and they seemed to like this place. I stayed here about 10 yrs ago and from what I saw, they haven't changed much. I really don't like the place. For starters, every night of our stay some companies were shoving restaurant menus under our door. When I call to ask about it, I was basically told they couldn't do anything about it. "The people must rent a room so they have access to all the floors". Also the water in the room tasted horrible. They do give you 2 complimentary 6 oz bottles per day, When I called to ask for more I was told "You got your 2 bottles, go buy more at the gift shop." Great customer service. When I stayed the last time I tried to call room service and was on the phone 20 min before they got to me. Things haven't changed much. I'm really sorry to say I didn't enjoy either stay and won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Basic Hotel with No Frills”
Reviews.Author: kezfiesta
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights in June 2010. This was booked as a bit of a last minute thing as a trip to LA didnt happen. I have stayed here before and found that nothing had really changed. This time hubby and I decided to stay in the 'older' rooms. Early check in was not a problem at 10am and we were given our room key straight away. I can honestly say that therooms are basic but very very good for the price paid. I paid £170 for 5 nights!. The room appeared to have had new carpet and the bathroom had been retiled. The rest of the room had basic fittings but all were clean and perfectly functional. The maid came in every day and cleaned the room to a high standard. My only grumbles are with the casino. It is home to a LOT of hookers and hubby was approached a lot. The drinks service is very very poor. I can honestly say i was not offered a drink the entire time i stayed here and I gambled quite a lot in the casino. I did find the casino to be smokey. The machines are also tight but that could just be me not being lucky! Basically if you just want somewhere to wash and sleep go for it. It truly is not as bad as some reviewers would have you believe and it is not full of kids either.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: hurricanedougie
Reviews.Content: I honestly cannot think of anything bad to say about the Excalibur. I was immensely surprised at the quality. The service both checking in and checking out was superb. Friendly, professional, and prompt. The room was immaculate, and about twice the size of a normal hotel room. It was just a standard room booked through Expedia, but much larger than a normal hotel room. The bed was, without question, the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. I cannot begin to describe how much I enjoyed the bed. The bathroom was at least twice the size of a normal hotel bathroom, with a huge walk in shower that astounded me with it's roominess. This hotel far surpassed my every expectation by far. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “If you're on a budget this hotel is not bad”
Reviews.Author: douglas12345
Reviews.Content: A-OKAY. I stayed at the Excalibur for 3 nights in June. I had been to Las Vegas a few times before for work and had stayed at the palms; this time I was traveling with family and wanted to stay on the strip. We were on a budget so decided to book the Excalibur, I checked the reviews from many sights and almost canceled my reservation and made one somewhere else because the reviews were Terrible for Excalibur. I decided to just try it and the hotel was not bad at all to my delight. I don't understand why there where all the bad reviews. We got a free upgrade to the renovated rooms in Tower two without even asking, the staff was very friendly, floors were quiet at night, and our rooms were very clean. Cleanliness is key! The hallways and elevator in the hotel were not always pristine but I guess that is what happens at a family hotel where there are a lot of little children. The pool had a nice atmosphere - it was clean, music was lively, staff was nice, there were enough chairs! Overall my family and I really enjoyed the stay. People complained on this site about being hassled by time share people in the lobby at Excalibur!? Well I didn't see them there at all, in fact I was hassled by time share people in the forum shops at caesars palace and walking into the venetian. I do think Excalibur could offer a nicer lounge/club venue and maybe something other than dick's last resort. The food at dicks was great but I didn't find the atmosphere appealing especially for families. I understand they are supposed to be rude, but I didn't find it funny. Again I can't complain about my stay! If you are on a budget and want to stay on the strip this hotel will do!

Reviews.Title: “Great option for those who like Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Balu07071972
Reviews.Content: As we have never been before to Las Vegas we wanted to use this trip to the US to discover it in combination with an overnight stay. We drove the "strip" up and down and finally opted for the Excalibur as they offered a quite competitve rate. To say it in a nutshell: The hotel and it's service are very good. What was unknown to us are the immense distances in the hotel (might be the same with other big competitors). You can walk for 10 minutes until you reach your car on the parking place, as well as for those with suitcase rollers - the carpets in the hotel are not 100% ideal - however I managed to bring two big ones trough the hotel without getting exhausted:). Rooms are very big, clean, fully equipped, simply good. I would recommend to buy beverages outside of the room as minibar prices are relatively high. Otherwise a really good experience with nothing to moan. Recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, only demand to be in the remodeled rooms”
Reviews.Author: Worldtime
Reviews.Content: If you don´t mind the "Disney Castle " styling on the outside the hotel has nice pools, an acceptable casino - I don´t bet so I can´t tell you more about the casino-. It is a nice option for families. Only problem is rooms in Tower I is that their styling dates back to a combination of the 70´s and Cinderella. It seems that for a little more money you in Tower II you get a newly remodeled room and you are closer to the pool. Room service is pricey but the other restaurants seem -didn´t go because I was working- very acceptable. "Business center" if you can call it like that is next to the casino -noisy- and they charge you by the minute...

Reviews.Title: “Cool Place”
Reviews.Author: Amers1983
Reviews.Content: stayed at the excalibur from may 31-june 5.....it was a cool place very central to everything... the rooms were clean with free internet hookup. there are 4 pools at the hotel which were very clean...staff was friendly...no complaints, very happy with the accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location, and nice decor. Hidden prices...”
Reviews.Author: Trip2Nevada
Reviews.Content: Everything was good except the hidden fees. We booked it for a certain price, yet they had extra charges for a greeter, small bottles of water, newspaper, and coupon booklets. This information should be disclosed on-line as well.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! That was a surprise”
Reviews.Author: MapleLeafsfanforever
Reviews.Content: Just spent a few nights in Excalibur. At first I am not too sure about this hotel. It seems old but I got a pretty good deal on the web, so I took a chance. I am so glad I did. I am pretty sure this hotel is not the best in the strip but it does the job for us. The room is quiet and clean. It has a flag screen TV and the bathroom are big. Compare to Circus Circus, which we stayed also in this trip, Excalibur is much much more better. If we go to Vegas again, we will still stay in Excalibur.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, good location, good value”
Reviews.Author: alli123
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i have just returned from a 12 day stay in the States which finished with a 3 night stay in Vegas. We booked through a travel agent so im not sure of the exact rate we payed but when we checked in (which there is usually a que for so be prepared) we decided to upgrade to a Superior Widescreen room for $30 a day. Thank god we did this as our room was only a standard size so goodness knows what a standard room would have been like. We paid for a 'widescreen' room. We're still not sure what this meant as the window was a regular size and gave an ok sidewards view of New York New York. We ate in the breakfast buffet one morning, $15.99 for all you can eat...of cold not very exciting food, we didnt go there again. The pool was ok, there are 3 in total but there is NO shade unless you pay for it so becareful as it gets VERY hot!! We did the typical thing of spending very little time in our own hotel we ate at MGM, Ceasers Palace and The Bellagio all very nice. The Excalibur is brash, even for Vegas standards. However the room was clean and very quiet and made up everyday and the towels were changed which was nice. However all that said, we would probably stay there again as the room was of an acceptable standard as we spent very little time in the casino/hotel anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday, average hotel which unfortunately seemed to attract some idiots”
Reviews.Author: Clarebella
Reviews.Content: Check-in On arrival at the hotel you check in basically in the casino which was quite cool! Every hotel entrance is virtually into a casino - but hey this is vegas after all. We were annoyed to find out that we were required to pay a resort fee on check in that we knew nothing about and were not informed by lastminute.com who we booked our stay through, a bit of a shock having to pay something like an extra £50 for the two of us on top of the holiday price which we had already paid, but apparently this is the norm for most las vegas hotels. Room The room was nice, spacious and in the refurbished part of the hotel, 2 double beds which were comfortable and nice big bathroom, unfortunately as this hotel is one of the cheaper hotels it seemed to attract a lot of rif raf, it was very noisy in the corridoor outside our room for 2 nights in a row at 4am, people running up and down, screaming drunk, security were even called one night, also people arguing in the room above us, sounding like they were coming through the ceiling!! Food Quite cool having a 24hour food court with macdonalds, pizza hut, krispy kreme etc, good breakfast in sherwood forest cafe, didn't really like the italian restaurant, poor quality for the price, preferred to eat out in the evening because lot more choice available out and about on the strip. Spa Well worth a visit, lovely massage, separate male/female relaxation areas with jacuzzi, sauna etc, very quiet and peaceful when I went in. On the whole this hotel is not too bad used as a base to explore las vegas, rooms were comfortable, but if you can afford I would choose one of the other more upmarket hotels

Reviews.Title: “Not the best...not the worst.”
Reviews.Author: romacaldwell9
Reviews.Content: We arrived after travelling approx 22 hours from Scotland and were confronted with staff trying to sell timeshare..We were allocated a room in Tower 11 which was nice enough but looked onto the back of the hotel. The standard was clean and fresh towels were provided every day.The bathroom was also topped up daily with toiletries so no complaints there. We didn,t like the bar called "Dicks" as it was rowdy and they had live rock bands there most nights which resulted in the noise level reaching a deafening crescendo and not for us. We did enjoy the buffet though and it was great value for all day dining for 30$ each per day. We dined most mornings in the Sherwood Cafe which we loved and the staff very nice. We arrived in a heatwave and one morning we ventured down to the pool. It was fine until 12.00 noon when the sun came over and we thought about getting under a sunshade but the only ones available could be hired for 45$ per day!. On a final note we will certainly search and spend a bit more on a better Hotel if we ever come back to Las Vegas. Not in June though!!!

Reviews.Title: “"Fun, Not Fancy"”
Reviews.Author: gcullrich
Reviews.Content: One great thing about this hotel is it's location. It's right near one of those bridges that cross over the strip. It's also in a location of the strip where other fairly cool hotels are that you can walk into and check out. The food is not so good. Theres only a couple restaurants, none of which are nice. Sherwood cafe was actually pretty gross when I was there, and it seemed like all other sources of food were closed all the time. The pool was not open and the TV in our room did not work. I didn't expect much cause we didn't pay much, and we got a discount on that. The rooms were clean and the staff was friendly. I don't know if I'd ever want to stay here again, but I'd recommend it for young adults or people on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: HauteTraveler
Reviews.Content: We picked Excalibur because it had the best weekend rate of all the "majors" on the strip and because of the great location. We got the great location but the rooms are run down and dirty. We stayed in Tower I and our room had stains on the carpet, a ripped couch and bathroom that was in need of a serious renovation. The registration desk is very close to the casino floor and my kids all commented on the cigarette smoke while waiting to check in. We've stayed at New York New York, Monte Carlo and the Flamingo and this hotel was not even close. We will definitely spend a little more on our next trip and choose one of Excalibur's neighbors.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, nothing fancy”
Reviews.Author: TIMB0
Reviews.Content: This was the second time staying at the Excalibur. Both times we had no problems to mention, but nothing great to report either. This is an inexpensive 'get what you pay for' type of hotel near the southern end of the strip. Access off the freeway was easy and the parking was equally easy. Check-in was quick and painless. Standard room was nothing fancy, very simple, but not gross. We stayed for Halloween night, so there were plenty of crazies, but the hotel did a good job of keeping things under control. For the people that aren't interested in spending much time in the room, this is a perfect hotel. Around the same price as the Luxor and Circus-Circus, we prefer the Excalibur.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a good price”
Reviews.Author: K_519
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Excalibur for one night before switching to another hotel along the Strip. Overall, Excalibur is a fine choice - low price, good location. At check-in, they give you the option to upgrade to a Strip view or other room types. We chose the basic room which is in Tower I. Note that if you self-park, it's a long walk to registration (on par with walks at the MGM-Grand). Tower I is the furthest from the Strip, so you need to walk through the entire length of the casino to get out to NYNY or Luxor or anywhere. There is a mandatory ~$11 charge for wired internet, bottled water (two 8oz bottles), and a newspaper each night. This is less than the charge at hotels like MGM-Grand ($15+tax), but Excalibur's is mandatory while other hotels give you the option.

Reviews.Title: “fascinating”
Reviews.Author: bntlav25
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fantastic, my nieces fell in love with excalibur and want to go back again. They described it as "fairytale". we are food people and the food was definitely superb. location was optimal, very close to McCarran Airport. The price is the best part, what you save for the overnight charge you can add to your games... you can never go wrong. the hotel is worth recommending. i would go back anytime with my nieces.

Reviews.Title: “It was ALRIGHT. but we're not going back. ever.”
Reviews.Author: christinie_weenie
Reviews.Content: We had a wedding to go to, held at the MGM which is located across the street & over. That, coupled with the cheap price, was the main two reasons why we chose to stay there. check in took forever because my fiance left his wallet in the car (our mistake, not hotel's >_<) ; once we got in the room, it was roomy & comfortable for the two of us. the furniture however, was hideous. If you dont mind the thrift store (i say THRIFT, not vintage, please take note of the difference) mismatchy furniture/wall pieces, you're ok. i think though, it is to the excalibur's advantage the theme is medieval, because they can get away with the "rustic" look i suppose. the bathroom was roomy as well too. what i did not like was the cleaniness. we were located at the end of the hall, & the very last room was next to ours. placed outside this door was their old food on a room svc tray from who knows when. this was there when we checked in--on a thur. i cant honestly remember if the tray had been removed sat or sun--but it was there for most of our stay. on the first night the room had been cleaned, yet our bed was left unmade. on sat, i called asking for the room to be cleaned while we were out that evening & was treating very rudely by staff. she told me to "call back" & hung up. unbelievable. my friend stayed across the street at the tropiciana, which was cheaper. Her room was much larger, though older, had a balcony & she had free 2 drink passes every night she stayed there. next time, we'll be staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but dont expect anything too flashy, and watch out for timeshare stockers!!!”
Reviews.Author: stimpyyeah13
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a weekend at Excalibur with my wife, and overall it was a nice trip. One of the main things I have to complain about was the people who guard all 5 enterances to the casino trying to get people to view time shares. We were bombared each and everytime we walked thru, once by the same person twice!! All you need to say is no thank you, but i still found it annyoing. We had a room on the 13th floor in tower 1, which i think was the older tower. I the room was a bit outdated, but clean non the less. I asked if there was any chance of upgrading my room to the newer tower, but they were sold out this weekend. Pool was really nice, and staff was very helpful and friendly. Casino was typical of any on the strip, nice selection of slots and table games, but noticed the tables increase their minium bets after 6 pm. Overall, nice place, but if your looking for a more modern, flashy hotel, seek elsewhere but for the price, its a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised; very nice room”
Reviews.Author: mejdankid
Reviews.Content: 1st off, there are way too many idiots and people who should not have access to the internet. 2nd I'd seriously ban you for writing such pathetic and retarded comments/reviews about this hotel. 3rd, just because you had a bad experience, most likely because you've caused it yourself for being drunk, stupid, etc, doesn't mean you get to write bad review for the hotel (or maybe you work for the competitor, so in that case nice job idiot!) I just came back from a 2 night/3 day trip and i stayed at the hotel. I was upgraded to a suite overlooking the pool and west LV (tower 2, fl 28). It was excellent! Staff was friendly, it was busy as heck but i still had great time. Everything was a 5, other than the heat :) lol So honestly, it was worth it. And i would stay @ the hotel again because i do not regret it, and had i listed to some of the reviews on here, i would have missed on a great hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Widescreen Room”
Reviews.Author: 16gauge
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our honeymoon in Lake Tahoe with overnight stopovers on both ends of the trip in Las Vegas. On our return stopover, we stayed at the Excalibur for two nights. We had one of the newly remodeled stripview widescreen rooms on an upper floor. The room was quite nice as was the view. It was a far better experience than we had on our outbound stopover night at the Luxor a few days earlier. I am writing this review two years after our stay at the Excalibur. If I would have written it two years ago, I would have given it 4 stars instead of 3. We have been back to Las Vegas twice since this stay. We have now had the opportunity to stay at other places and compare the experience, price, and value. Our experience at the Excalibur was a very good one - no complaints. However, we have gotten good rooms for 1/4 the price we paid at the Excalibur so I feel like we did not get good value for what we paid. Looking at tripadvisor and other sites, it looks like the Excalibur has lowered their prices since we have stayed. If you can get a room for <$50/night, than I would highly recommend this place as a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Run Down and Dirty but Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Rors21
Reviews.Content: You’ll be satisfied with the Excalibur if you’re only interested in a roof over your head during your stay in Vegas. The rooms are totally average – neither good nor bad – and during my visit the rate was extremely low. However, if you want more of a hotel “experience” (nice décor, top service, great amenities) run for the hills. Outside of the room the hotel is dirty and second-rate. I believe this was one of the more shabby places I visited while in town. Net: great for bargain hunters, bad for folks looking for luxury or anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Love Vegas, but won't do it again with kids!”
Reviews.Author: ebk1174
Reviews.Content: We were on a road trip out to CA and stopped over in Vegas. We were going to do 2 nights, but after my son not feeling too well, we left a day early. I have been to Vegas over 10 times and have stayed in the Excalibur one other time about 10 yrs ago. We chose this hotel b/c we were going to have our 2 children with us. When we got there, we were happy to see lots of other families, but you forget how smoky the hotels are, especially with concern to having our kids with us. The check-in and check-out gals were both very nice. I booked a standard room, but we ended up getting one of the upgraded rooms. They were nice, but not expensively upgraded, basic upgrades and a flat screen TV. The beds were not very comfortable, but they were fine for the night. The hotel elevators were very fast which was nice since we were on the 23th floor and we never had to wait more than 1 minute for an elevator even on Memorial Day weekend. We had fun in the basement arcade with the kids playing all the carnival games. A nice change of pace after walking down the strip in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: AnnetteHolden
Reviews.Content: This hotel has great staff, great restaurants. The bigger hotels do the posh restaurants but this does great, all you can eat, little diners and Pizza Hut/Krispy Kreme. Air conditioning can be on the cool side but thats nothing to worry about when its so hot outside. Great little casino, bars, shops.....we loved this place and would definately stay again. Better booking directly on their website and calling a week before to confirm than going through travel shop, its simple to use.

Reviews.Title: “Ok when we sorted our room out.”
Reviews.Author: H_and_AWarrington
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our second part of our honeymoon, we decided to stay here as we have stayed here before. As it was our honeymoon we wanted a nice room and where willing to pay for an up grade but the lady that checked us in could only find a spa room in tower 1 and we wanted tower 2 she also said ahe had no strip view rooms either so we left it at that and went off to our room to drop the bags off. We where not impressed when we opened the door to find two queen beds in there after all it was out honeymoon. My husband was straight on the phone to the check in desk asking to change it. After being told there was nothing else he asked to speak to a manager and when he did this all of a sudden a room king room became available. We got to our new room to be surprised by a strip view which kind of annoyed us as we where told at check in there was no strip view room left. After this terrible start we had a great time, we had a meal in the camalot restaurant the service was great and the steak we had was amazing. The hotel is ok as in vegas all you use is the bed and shower which was comfy and clean so it didn't really matter. Next time we visit vegas we will probably stay somewhere different not because of a bad experience but more for a change as we have stayed here twice now. I would recommend this hotel if your on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “The "Motel 6" of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: BostonTravelPro
Reviews.Content: Don't expect much. HOTEL - great location. Large casino. Lot's of dining options. ROOM - large, but that is the only good thing I can say about it. It was old and worn. The carpet was so worn it looked stained. The bathroom was large and had plenty of space, but no tub. Not very practical for a "family friendly" hotel. A two year old doesn't like showers. Only two drawers for clothing. The headboard was screwed to the wall. The room had a dirty feeling to it. The furniture was old. The bedding felt like it came from a donation box. Time for a renovation! POOL - large and spacious. Clean. BUSINESS CENTER - Only a few computers with large screens out in the open area by the coffee shop (not good for privacy). STAFF - not very friendly. I asked for a room in Tower 2 (to be closer to the pool) and the check-in agent told me none were available. She didn't even attempt to look. I dropped mail off at the front desk to be mailed (postage included) and it has been 12 days and it still hasn't arrived at its destination. I visit Las Vegas at least twice a year. I stayed here 12 years ago and decided to give it a try again. I wish I hadn't. I wouldn't go back and wouldn't recommend this to family/friends. There is so much better in Las Vegas with a good location and similar rates.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Suprised”
Reviews.Author: tracerx1969
Reviews.Content: After reading a few bad reveiws I was leary of staying here, but the check in/out on down to the coffee shop staff were all very friendly and helpful. We checked in very late (1:30 am) and all that was left was a handicap room. I didn't feel right about that so they gave us a new room the next morning, no questions asked. We didn't even have to wait until "check in time" Our room/bathroom were very clean and the furnishings were nice. Bed was comfortable. If I had to "complain" about anything it would be one of the elevators was out during our visit. But I didn't mind waiting a few minutes. A very very nice hotel for a very very reasonable price, with a nice location on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: C-RFerguson
Reviews.Content: We went to las vegas to get married and figured it didnt matter where we stayed since hey its vegas and we wouldnt be in our room very much. I was wrong, it was very outdated (we stayed in tower 1), there was only a shower in our bathroom and I love a good bath tub so I was dissapointed in that. The carpet and bedding all looked quite old. I wouldnt stay here again no matter how good of a deal we got. The only good thing I can say is that the staff made sure to help us out, I had to get my wedding dress pressed and we had already missed the deadline but they took it anyway and guaranteed it would be ready in time and it was so i was very grateful for that. And I must say the spa was AMAZING! Very friendly staff and the treatments were so nice and relaxing. And the ladies in the salon did a great job with my hair for my wedding, upon first walking in i was a little scared that it would be a wreck, the place is a bit outdated, but I ended up extremely happy with it!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and roomy but don't expect any staff to help”
Reviews.Author: auskez
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights with my two sisters and have to say the rooms were clean and plenty of room. The house keeping staff were friendly and helpful but as for the rest of the staff forget it. We arrived exhausted after a long flight and lots of baggage when I checked in I had to ask for help to get our bags to the room as we had been dropped off at other end of hotel after waiting for 15 minutes I asked if help was coming and was told she could not find anyone to help. Later we asked if we could post some letters and it was like we were asking for gold so much trouble for a couple of stamps.
