But forgetting the fact that the staff did not seem to want any guests the hotel was good. The all you can eat buffet was very good value for all day dining and their staff were very friendly. So as long as you don't need too much service an OK place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BelfastTravellover
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to let people kno not to panic about staying here like I did after reading some reviews! just home after 4 nyts at the hotel and I thought the hotel was in a brilliant location, room cleaned everyday. ok room was a bit outdated but it is a medieval themed hotel. We booked a standard room and got a free upgrade to a bigger room, just ask! The pool area is brilliant, and it is not too rowdy at all for kids! So if you have booked to stay here, dont panic. Cheap and cheerful!

Reviews.Title: “Good for what it is”
Reviews.Author: Briebonanza
Reviews.Content: For the price you're paying, the Excalibur is a fine hotel. It certainly isn't the best hotel on the strip, but it's a far cry from the worst. The hotel itself looks pretty awful, but the room we had (a widescreen room) was pretty great. And the location is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “HONEST REVIEW OF EXCALIBUR”
Reviews.Author: sc0tschick
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and myself are just back after a week at the Excalibur and it was absolutly amazing!! The rooms were really big and so was the bathroom, we were in tower 2 on the third floor. The room was very modern and clean. When we were reading the reviews of the hotel it was quite off putting, but honestly the hotel, location everything was fab. We never once got stopped of timeshare people, this was what i was worrying a bit about cos i dont really like to be bothered by people selling stuff. There is a lot of people trying to give you 'Free' nightclub passes (cost us $20 and u got in free anyway) so dont entertain these people. The pool was brill, 4 pools and lots of sun loungers. You must go to the Grand Canyon, we went via bus then got the helicopter down to the canyon floor then took a lovely boat ride down the colorado river, it was one of the best things i have ever done, you must see it!! We went to see 2 shows, Human Nature was a motown show, oh it was great, what amazing singers, i would highly recommend and Zumanity, which was also good. If you are going to the Excalibur, dont worry about some peoples reviews, its an awesome hotel, enjoy

Reviews.Title: “IT IS OK, NOT THAT BAD.....”
Reviews.Author: Sharon_513
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, I was upset about the reviews, but I saw it was better than the things I read. Our room was very clean, also the carpet, it had king bed, flat tv, (No cofee maker or small refrigerator) What I didn't like was the smell of smoke all over the place. It is true the hotel looks awesome outside but the inside is not the same, it is an outdated, average hotel just to say to sleep, but it is not that bad......I liked the location, it is in front of the NY, Luxor, MGM, near Mandalay, etc. and we can walk easily til the middle of The Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, a lively (if small gaming...”
Reviews.Author: evenheskeyscored
Reviews.Content: Great value, a lively (if small gaming floor), and a superb location combined to make this a steal. While everything is far from perfect (elevator issues and an older look to the rooms) thbgaming floor had low limits and fun youn people all night. Our room was larger and with a nicer tv than that of our friends staying at the MGM. Definetly worthvthe value.

Reviews.Title: “Stolen Property, No Compensation.”
Reviews.Author: sla_10
Reviews.Content: Last week we stayed at Excalibur, and quite frankly, it was the WORST experience EVER at a hotel. My boyfriend and I did not have any issues, but my friends had a VERY COSTLY trip due to this crappy hotel. The first two nights were fine.. On Saturday we ALL went out for dinner, and came back to find that almost $1000 CASH (two different wallets) and a $360 camera was stole out of their room. Mind you, one of the wallets was IN the closet, IN a suitcase.. and the other was in a purse (they didnt take the purse that cost 700$.. obviously someone trying to be discreet). It obviously had to be someone who had access to the room because the four people staying in the room were at dinner TOGETHER. You would imagine that the moment a hotel heard something like this they would do anything in their power to show that their customers matter to them but NO.. Hotel manager was a rude, and did not care. They did not comp the room. THEY didn't even call to say that they finished investigating.. My friend had to keep calling. They also say they dont have surveillance cameras in the hallways.. so if you care about your safety or your possessions.. DO YOURSELF A FAVOR AND DO NOT STAY HERE. EVER. Unless you want to get robbed.. Way to ruin a trip.

Reviews.Title: “OK for budget priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jamsey
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 4 or 5 times over the years and it's a well located hotel on The Strip. Rooms are good sized, clean and comfortable. There is a fun thing downstairs where you can keep the kids amused also a "Knight show" with a King Arthur theme which didn't tickle me but everyone else thought it was great !!! I'm sorry now that I didn't stay for the whole show! The swimming pool area is OK too. As usual, with Vegas unfortunately , there is the usual mob of timeshare touts on the loose. So be wary when someone offers you a "free show" or something similar as it's a cert that it involves a time share outing first. BE WARNED!!! The buffet is excellent value for money and now you can book all day meals for $39 (that was the last price I saw) I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right...”
Reviews.Author: Kerry019
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. I had low expections becasue of all the bad reviews. We checked in no problem, we stayed in tower II, 12th floor, the room was nice, a king size bed, big TV, nice bathroom, quiet and clean. Friends of ours stayed at the Mandalay Bay which is very expensive, sure its nicer. To be honest most of us who go to vegas just need a clean room to sleep in as there is so much to do in Vegas. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: mainegirl_luv2travel
Reviews.Content: Not impressed. I would never stay at the Excalibur Hotel again. Out of all of the casino/hotels we went to the Excalibur Hotel Casino smelled the worst as for smoke. Walking to our room we noticed it was REALLY outdated and dirty looking. I guess that's what you get when you're going for that castle look? We arrive to our room and we see two double beds, not the king size bed we specifically asked for. When we called downstairs they said there was nothing they could do because they didn't have any left..BULL. You have XXXXX amount of room and it's Wednesday! The bathroom was not cleaned fully either. We were on a "non-smoking" floor but had to keep the AC on 24/7 to keep out the smoke smell. It had 3 really nice pools and NO where to sit because they let everyone off the street visit them. So people who actually paid for the ammenities of the hotel couldn't enjoy it. Next time I visit Las Vegas it will be in a regular hotel that doesn't have a casino under it and you need a room key to gain access to the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Looks impressive from the outside, inside not so great”
Reviews.Author: Mimiwu
Reviews.Content: At the end of the new strip, good if you want to visit the "Welcome to Las Vegas" sign but a LONG walk to the heart of the action (Ceasers, Bellagio & all the shopping etc). Luckily got a free room upgrade to the newly refurished rooms in tower 2, rooms in tower 1 run down and old, the casio is the same but good if you want to play on the lower priced tables. For what I paid I was happy and we wasn't in the hotel much at all, but wouldn't have wanted to pay full price or for the room upgrade. Overall the hotel was ok but would recommend you pay that little bit more for a better location. If your thinking of visting Vegas I would definatelty recommend, it is WICKED!!!!

Reviews.Title: “No Way”
Reviews.Author: maxthelip
Reviews.Content: Been to Vegas over 25 times staying in many different hotels and this was the worst Had upgraded room - walked in and floor lamp was broken in half on the floor. Heat/Air did not work properly. Two out of the four nights had to call to get the room cleaned 42 in TV had poor reception Pool lounge chairs are very uncomfortable Resort fee added to bill but included extras were not available(newspaper and reception) as promised Worst part was the Hotel supervisors did not care. Best part of stay was checking out

Reviews.Title: “Rooms ok,staff not helpful,hotel needs makeover”
Reviews.Author: colinda40
Reviews.Content: I just returned from The Excalibur Hotel this week and I will not be returning,it is severely old fashioned and dated.Where do i start,my friend was having a shower and the plasterboard ceiling collapsed on him,we rang reception and they sent up a young security guard,no sign of a manager.We were moved to the 23rd floor with no apology or acceptance of liability,reception blamed security and vice versa.When we checked out they had the nerve to charge us for our room upgrade and when we refused they said they would just charge it to our credit card,unbelieveable......There is no Customer service,dont stay here,pay extra for Caesars or Ballagio if you can afford it

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice stay, and price for New Years eve.”
Reviews.Author: jmalter7
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for New Years this past year. We had one of the new widescreen rooms. I was pretty surprised when I walked in the room, it was nicely decorated and it was clean. The bathroom was really nice and the beds were pretty comfortable. I did end up choosing this hotel because it was the best price I found for that time of year. I'll admit we didn't spend too much time in the room, but knowing I wasn't going to have to sleep somewhere filthy was a sigh of relief. The elevators were clean as well as the hallways and I didn't smell any lingering cigarette smoke around the room area. The staff was pretty nice, although we didn't have much interaction with them besides check in and check out. Upon arrival we were handed a coupon book with various discounts to shows, clubs and restaurants mainly for Excalibur and the Luxor. We never ate at any of the restaurants this trip, but I have eaten at Dicks previously. I know people give this place bad reviews but it's all in good fun with your friends.... Plus you kind of expect what they dish out to you walking in the place. I would definitely recommend spending the extra money to upgrade to a widescreen room, I haven't personally stayed in the classic rooms but I heard they aren't very pleasant and extremely outdated. Overall we had a pretty good time here.

Reviews.Title: “Overall it was a dissappointing hotel”
Reviews.Author: garret1
Reviews.Content: Facilities--ok Location--v.good Rooms--good Ambience--fair customer service--terrible.

Reviews.Title: “cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: paulreith
Reviews.Content: went to excalibur good friday for 1 week with my wife. as in most vegas hotels, the gaming area is massive (kept getting lost even after a week) the rooms are clean and the staff very friendly. average rate per night was roughly £23.00 per person.went to a show in the hotel called the tournament of kings which is the same as medievel night you would find in some spanish resorts.good show and reasonably priced.hotel has its own mcdonalds,starbucks etc. some of which are open 24 hrs.if you are going to vegas i would recommend spending a bit extra and take the helicopter flight over the grand canyon (stunning). even though we were there for a week we still did not see everything we wanted to, so will try and get back again sometime in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some upgrading”
Reviews.Author: UpperCapeResident
Reviews.Content: It is a hotel at good location with basic features. It is a hugh but typical dated hotel in vegas. Room quality is inferior but offers good value. It needs some refreshment. Mattresses were soft and loose, carpets were worn, bath room fan was not working, Toilet was slow. Room was clean and free of any stains. Shower pressure and temprature of water was good. Amenities were adequate. I like the two water bottles in the room, saved extra trip to the vending area. Internet was free and reasonable. Good for value shoppers on short budget. I stayed there as part of southwest package but next time I may choose something else for little extra money.

Reviews.Title: “went to gamble”
Reviews.Author: RanzT
Reviews.Content: While on our way to mgm from Mandalay bay via the tram I stopped here at the tables for gambling and the Roulette Table was all tacky and torn like it was 20years old. They need to spend money in clean tables im sure the cloth on top doesnt cost much. Overall felt dirty and outdated. Mandalay Bay was cleaner nice fresher glad we stayed there plus they got the beach with wave pool and lazy river

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: TravelTwin777
Reviews.Content: This is my 5th stay at Excalibur and I love it there. I stayed in an upgraded Tower 2 room - hopefully you'll get lucky and get upgraded to one of these rooms. Having stayed in both the old and new rooms, the new ones are worth the extra money! Rooms are huge and nicely decorated. Bed is super comfy. Rooms were quiet. Pool area is very large with plenty of seating though drink service at pool was slow and frozen drink was expensive with little alcohol. (Go to shops in MGM and get a Fat Tuesday instead!) Casino is easy to navigate, and free drinks were aplenty. Sherwood Forest Cafe has a nice menu with the right price. Parking was free, though it's quite a hike into the casino and rooms. Only complaints are that check in was slow, and I did not like the timeshare / free show people hounding us. I recommend the Excalibur if you are staying at the South end of the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: Emma_j2112
Reviews.Content: After visiting Vegas a few times we couldnt wait to go back. We usually stay the other end of the strip so decided it would be an idea to stay somewhere different. After reading very mixed reviews i wasnt sure about staying there, but we had already booked. I had visited the hotel on previous visits and wasnt either way about it. We stayed in tower 2, the new widescreen rooms. They were very clean and housekeeping did a great job every day. The staff around the hotel seemed friendly and willing to help if we ever had a problem. The only thing i can complain about are the people constantly trying to make you buy show tickets, but you can soon avoid them! The pools were lovely, we hired a cabana for one day, and the host was very helpful. The pools were clean and drinks were frequent. It never seemed too busy either as the area was so big. The buffet was pretty good. In the evenings they only had one side open so it soon got busy, but there was a good choice of food and drink there. We also ate at the sherwood cafe, the host there was rather rude, almost seemed a little drunk too! But our waitress made up for that and the food was great. We ate in Dennys a fair bit too, its not far to walk. And as a visitor from England, it was great to go to a typical Usa type place. Would happily stay there again, just wish it was a little more central. Would recommend this hotel if you dont mind kids, although saying that, we didnt come across many! Overall very enjoyable stay :) :) Emma - Cornwall, England

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: youngvactioner
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas once before this trip with a friend, this time I was going with my fiance and wanted to try a different hotel. The Excalibur seemed like a cool hotel and the pictures online looked really good. This was not the case, the rooms are old and in poor condition. This would not be a huge problem considering you only sleep in them, but the rudenness of the staff was enough for me to never want to step foot in there again. We had several issues with the plumbing in the room and instead of help we got nothing but headaches from the staff. And at every corner someone new asked me if I wanted "free" show tickets .. but wait I wasn't 30 so no no we cant help you, but they would ask again and again and again. Definatly not a nice place to say, and I would rather pay the extra for better quality and service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but wouldn't go back...”
Reviews.Author: Jenni0621
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur for two nights, at the beginning of May. The first thing when we walk in, we are welcomed by what seem to be a very friendly woman. Who directs us to a desk for our "free gift". We then proceed to be bullied by the man behind the counter. He was trying to get us to purchase show tickets. We had already bought all of our show tickets for our trip before we got there. We said no to the man about 10 times before he let us go to stand in line to check in. After we checked in, we were on our way to our hotel room and were asked by a woman if we needed any show tickets. We politely said no. We went up to our room to change and get settled and decided to go walk the strip. When we got to the first floor, the same woman asked us if we were interested in buying show tickets! This same woman proceeded to ask us to buy show tickets 5 times in less than 24 hours. EVERYTIME we walked past that counter we were badgered. We walked through a ton of other casinos and the only other one that we saw this at was Luxor. I can't believe that hotel employees are doing this, its almost as bad as the guys who are flipping the nude cards at you when you walk past on the strip. The pool was great! The room was clean. But I would never stay here again purely because of the pushy hotel staff!

Reviews.Title: “A little dated”
Reviews.Author: Kirsty_Glenn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here purely because it was a "castle". Hotel is dated - we stayed in Tower I. Room was large and comfortable - just needed a facelift. Airconditioner was too noisy to sleep at night, but if we opened window monorail and street were also noisy so we didn't get too many good nights sleep - but I guess you dont go to Vegas to sleep... Would pay more and stay somewhere else if we visited Las Vegas again but if all you want is a place to sleep and shower which is quite cheap then this place fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “slightly dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: NessBPortsmouth
Reviews.Content: Went with my Mother who had been 10 yrs previously. Not the smartest hotel on the strip. Had emailed them before our trip in the hope we could get a 'Widescreen room', but we received no communication. The Casino is huge 100,000sq ft. It was pretty grubby and extremely noisy. Smoking is still allowed inside and this has made a real difference. Our room was obviously not one of the refurbished room. It was very dated and grubby. The daily maid service literally pulled the bed clothes over again. Despite all that the bed was comfy just a shame that it all so dated. Be warned that this is a very 'lively' and popular hotel as its one of the cheapest. It was packed to the rafters therefore the buffet restaurant meant very long waits. Sherwood Cafe was a really nice for breakfast and evening meal.

Reviews.Title: “Very Basic Hotel- No Luxury”
Reviews.Author: DebnDen
Reviews.Content: Recent trip for 5 days with my sister and her friends, stayed in tower I which is the tower that hasnt been renovated. Rooms are clean but very old, furniture is very old as well. Sheets and towels were fresh daily so that was a plus, I did notice staff bringing in freshly laundered bedspreads and blankets, something you rarely see or worry if bedspreads are washed. I didnt spend much time in my room or at the hotel so it actually worked out. I wouldnt stay here again, the hotel has lots of families with kids which was a turn off. But if you want a budget hotel this is it. The hotel also charges a resort fee of $11 per day in addtion to the room fee so keep this in mind. I feel if I'm staying at this hotel I shouldnt have to pay extra to use it or the pool. My sister used the exercise room and she said it was very nice an well equipped. Didnt get a chance to use the pool the weather was too cool. Staff was friendly. Except for the goonies at the front entrance trying to get you to sign up for some tv show survey or something, always a gimmick. Elevators took a long time, we waited 20 minutes a couple of times since we were on a top floor.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Vegas Hotel that I would go back to anyday!”
Reviews.Author: EnigmaticBlonde
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to LV with my husband, unfortunately we took the in-laws with us who don't like to spend money, so we opted for this as a more middle range hotel. I went on the reviews from here, which didn't let me down. We were upgraded on arrival, as our rooms weren't ready, and were fortunate enough to get the newly refurbished "wide screen" rooms. Everything was spotless in true Vegas style and the bathroom was lovely and spacious. The hotel itself is simply decorated obviously with a Camelot theme. Its not plush but basic, has many bars and restaurants, all alcohol is massively overpriced, but thats the same with ALL LV hotels. There are plenty of discount stores on the main strip selling cheap beer (with the in laws I needed it!). The restaurants are good and service is overfriendly, but again that's Vegas! Tournament of Kings is worth a punt, it's not Shakespeare, but good chewing gum for the eyes. But buy your tickets from the street booths, they are often heavily discounted and worth the money! The only downside is it's located towards the bottom end of the strip, so involves a lot of walking. We knew we had to walk.....the in-laws didn't! Never take your in-laws!

Reviews.Title: “Like a giant frat party”
Reviews.Author: roughnready68
Reviews.Content: I was "upgraded" to a refurbished room in their renovated tower. The bad part is that the room was on the second floor. This meant getting to listen to kareoke and entertainment from the casino floor all night. The room was nice, though. It had a great tv. The bad part if that the bathroom didn't look to clean. There were a couple of giant hairs in the bathroom on the floor. But honestly, I was just looking for a place to crash for the night, and the Excalibur is right on the Strip, so it's tough to complain. And the casino? There was a dj yelling out "who wants to get drunk?" There were a lot of obnoxious college age kids running around loaded. But I guess this is what the owners have decided to with Excalibur -- make it a bargain choice for young people. If you have a family I suggest going somewhere else. Single and young travelers -- Excalibur is a good bet.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Riedoll
Reviews.Content: I read alot of bad reviews about this hotel, but was pretty happy with my stay. Check in was quick. The timeshare people are around but if you put your hand up or just say no thanks they move on. The room was clean, bed very comfortable and staff very friendly. The ONLY thing I didn't like was the Dick's Last Resort. We decided to go there for dinner one night and instead of waiting for a table sat at the bar which had the past customers plates and leftovers scattered on the bar. When we picked up the menu it was dripping wet. The bartender passed by us blowing a whistle while holding a sign asking for ID, didn't clean off the plates or wipe the bar. Instead he walked right by 2 times not saying a word, then threw a wad of napkins at the 2 couples sitting at the end of the bar. NICE. At that point we left, there is something to be said about appropriate behavior and the guy behind the bar didn't show any. No wonder they call it DICKS. Other then that our stay was great. We went and saw the Lion King and Circus Soleil O, both were amazing shows and well worth the money spent, looking forward to future visits to Las Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and gross”
Reviews.Author: UtahMikester
Reviews.Content: I felt like sleeping in my clothes. The TV I had in my room was one step up from a black and white, room fixtures were from the '80s, and check-in took over half an hour. Will not stay again, even if they give the rooms away (which they basically did).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LCastilloCalifornia
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel to stay at. Very clean. rooms are very roomy and are kept up very well. Staff very friendly. Convienient shopping and dinning areas.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: iwannagotovegas
Reviews.Content: We stayed in tower 2. Room was great. Clean and spacious. Had a funky odor from smoking, but we cracked open the window and it soon dissipated. Casino dealers were friendly and eager to help. The best band we watched was in Dicks Last Resort later in the evening. Classic rock. The pool area was top notch, altho we didnt get to use it. Beds were very comfy. Location is perfect for enjoying that end of the strip. We would def go back. Tip for coffee drinkers....McDonalds is in food court on 2nd floor...get your morning coffee for 1.09 large cup...huge savings on that.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Coseleybabe
Reviews.Content: Stayed 10 days, was very worried after reading reviews but this hotel was great! We were upgraded at no extra cost, clean large rooms, cleaned every day.check in quick & easy. We were stranded for extra 7 days due to volcano, hotel staff very helpful and re booked us another room.Had two children 14 & 9, great hotel for them too.Would stay agin when visiting Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Now the Motel 6 of Vegas, Avoid if you care about your stay.”
Reviews.Author: liesuretraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayted in the refurbished tower at the Excalibur. Windows dirty on inside, mirrors dirty, behind desk fuzzy,dusty,dirty. I needed a bathtub for my back, would cost another $50.00 in an un-refurbished room. Bed like a rock, noved to the Planet Hollywood, MUCH NICER. Excalibur charges a resort fee upon checkout, what kind of resort do you get at Motel 6? Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as family orientated as you'd expect”
Reviews.Author: Delight57
Reviews.Content: Had a widescreen room which was very clean and very spacious with an excellent view of the roller coaster across the road. The pool appeared busy and wasn't open late enough for us. No particular effort seemed to be made to welcome families although you would expect this from a castle themed hotel. The casino areas were unpleasant due to there being no smoking ban on the casino floors. This meant every time we went to eat or walk through the casino our clothes ended up smelling of smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: owenmc
Reviews.Content: I upgraded to a Tower 2 room for $20/night more. I was very pleased with the room except for the reception on the TV which had colored stripes bouncing all over the screen. However the room and bathroom were clean and well maintained. I overheard other guests complaining bitterly about their Tower 1 rooms. I spent a good part of each day by the pool - it's a lovely area, though I noticed the large pool closed for 2 of my 4 days. This didn't bother me as I was sunbathing only and I stayed in the adult only area (great idea!), but I can see why it would upset some folks. For those people complaining about timeshare reps, do what I do: walk by without looking and completely ignore them. It's easy. Casino is smoky but hey, you're not in Canada. Almost impossible to get a waitress in the slots area, but I found they are quite attentive in the sports book/Keno area.

Reviews.Title: “super gross”
Reviews.Author: maylisa0517
Reviews.Content: i stayed in a "non-smoking" room with my seriously allergic friend. it was obvious from the moment we entered that the room had been smoked in - a lot. when i approached the desk about the issue i was told (very threateningly) that "well we can't help it if people happen to smoke in there!" by an older lady with big red hair. the reason i was at the desk in the first place was to report that a PUDDLE of urine had been left on the counter in the bathroom from the previous guests. it was under the soap dish - it was like hskp wiped around the dish but didn't lift to wipe under it. when i lifted the dish to see what the weird shape thing was under there, i knew immediately what it was because i could see the color and i could smell it. i cleaned it up quickly without alerting my roommate. they offered a 10% discount on the FIRST night of my visit - which was going to be like $7. they said that they couldn't do more because i hadn't brought it to their attention earlier. they yelled at me (not kidding) because i didn't call them and let them clean it up and now how do they know i'm not lying about it. i told them that if i had called them at 11pm on our first night, my roommate would have made us leave - not to a different room, but leave the hotel completely. there was no way to go about letting them know without letting her know. all i was looking for really was an apology. some compensation would have been nice too. but $7 is like a slap in the face. they kept going on and on about how they could have moved us to a different room had they known. i told them that i didn't want a different room. i wasn't going to put myself in the position of explaining why we were moving to my roommate - she would have made me book somewhere else - and we simply didn't have time or energy to make that happen. on top of it all, the room was filthy. the edges of the carpet and around the furniture were COVERED in dust and other crap. the awesome room that i had UPGRADED to for ONLY $20 extra per night was at the end of a hall (second to last door) overlooking the parking lot - my bad for not asking to be placed somewhere with a decent view and not in timbuktu. i will never stay here again. and i will tell aaaaalll of my friends what a gross dump this place was. and smokey and bad ventilation comments from below? i'm right there with you. i visited a number of other casinos and the excalibur was BY FAR the most gnarly one. soooo gross. and a complete waste of money. never again you evil people. and $7!!!!!!!!!! are you kidding me?? it was PEE on the counter and they LEFT IT THERE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: pony1219
Reviews.Content: My family travelled to Las Vegas for the weekend. We got an internet special on 2 rooms at the Excalibur. The rooms were not the cleanest . The casino was so smokey I could hardly stand to walk thru. It was VERY noisey. The first morning we waited 25 minutes for a elevator to leave our 11 th floor room- could not get an elevator to come or they were full.We ended walking down 11 flights of stairs. We ordered room service for my mother- in -law who got sick. One hour wait for a bowl of soup--$14. Dirty trays were in the hallways for over 18 hours. Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Not again.”
Reviews.Author: ger1984
Reviews.Content: excalibur is the hotel we have stayded at in the past and enjoyed, not anymore. Hit up by 2 timeshare reps before we even checked in, the second was very rude because we did not tell her we were just hit up. Hit up by several more throughout the stay. The air conditioner didn't work, although they did fix it. The safe didnt work, they would not fix it and would not give us a new room. Never once did a cocktail waitress offer a drink in the casino. The buffet was not good. The shower head did not work and was dirty. Security did not ask for room keys they let everyone pass. The only pool open was the one for kids. There were kids all over in the casino area. The previous guests belongings were in the closet. Bad experience!

Reviews.Title: “better places to stay, hidden charges”
Reviews.Author: DRLARRYP
Reviews.Content: Group of 8 stayed for 3 nights in 4 rooms. All rooms were worn and carpets dirty and we were in upgraded rooms they said. Casino was dark and smokey. Food at buffet was ok only because we had free allday passes which was nice and came with the special room rate of $49. But they added on a resort fee for what I do not know as pool was not usable and spa had extra fees. was not informed of fee at time of booking or in follow up email reservation. With extra fee and taxes rooms ended up well $100 a night. Save your dollars and stay at straightup places like The Orleans, Sams Town or Gold Coast

Reviews.Title: “While in Vegas I would stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: KatyerFin
Reviews.Content: Well for the price this is ok hotel, but I was quite dissapointed with it. First of all we had to park very far from the entrance and had to carry our luggage without any help. We were tired after a long drive from Los Angeles and the people who were around us tried to sell us tickets to shows etc. They didn´t quite get that we were tired and just wanted to check in. Finally when we reached the reception there were not enough information about queuing and people were running to the desks and the staff was very rude. When checking in they didn't tell nothing about the hotel nor about the resort fee and what it did include... Nobody helped us to our hotel room and again we were surrounded by the people who wanted us to buy tickets. I found the whole hotel pretty disgusting and tasteless. During the nights we woke up couple of times because drunken people were being noisy in the corridor and in our next door. Yuck. We changed into the Venetian after 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “fine as expected”
Reviews.Author: pcbunter
Reviews.Content: stayed here for the fourth time and again cant complain...it is by far the cheapest place to stay for the location.stayed in a tower 2 widescreen room which was good and cleaned every day.casino floor is also good and the poker tourneys suit me just fine with 50 dollar buy ins.i wouldnt recommend eating in the restaurants there as not as good as others on strip.all in all for a low cost hotel with a very good pool scene i would recommend excalibur

Reviews.Title: “Good Value when looking for a deal”
Reviews.Author: hisurfernmi
Reviews.Content: When booking this trip I was really looking for the cheapest MGMMirage property for the 4 days we would be there. I had seen the Excalibur from the outside before and thought it looked super cheesy, but had never been inside. Since I was trying to stick to a tight airfare and hotel budget we settled for the Excalibur. I was pleasantly surprised on how nice it was inside. It just didn't seem to fit the gaudy decor on the exterior and I was happy for that. There sports book was probably one of the best we hung out at. It had very comfortable seats and plenty of TVs to watch all the games. Since it is holed off in a corner it unfortunately doesn't have the best ventilation. The gaming tables were okay and I like that they often had $5 craps tables available. Most of the other MGM casinos like to keep it up at $10 most of the time. Our room was in the older tower and was fine except for the water pressure. It would have probably been more of an issue if it wasn't just us guys and we had intentions of hanging out there for more than just sleeping, but we dealt with it. I'd definitely stay here again if I wanted to save on some money. I've been seeing really good deals at many of the hotels, but for some reason during the chosen weekend the rates were up everywhere but Excalibur. I'd only stay somewhere else because I would like to check other places out. The pool looked really nice and I know they just finished a renovation on it. Too bad it was a little too chilly for hanging out at except for the first day which we spent exploring the strip. Fitness center and spa also looked new and well kept. Too bad the only lifting I did was left for food and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “The Upgraded tower is Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Ace78
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been staying at the Excalibur since it opened and we were really surprised by all of the bad reviews lately. We have not been to Vegas for two years and we were holding our breath when we arrived not sure what to expect. We stayed in the upgraded flat screen room overloking the pool and could not have been happier. The room was new and perfect and the pool area must be the best in all of vegas. We did not see the older tower so my advice is to stay in the new rooms and your stay will be fine. We had lunch at Dicks and were very happy with the service and food. (We had to cover the eyes of our 5 year old as we left the rest. back into the Casino as there was a naked dancer on a Bar; but this is Vegas nevermind the kids.)

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant & uninviting”
Reviews.Author: ShyliniK
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 days and the cleaning service was lacking. My bathroom was never cleaned in the 3 days I was there. Fresh linen was provided but no cleaning was even attempted. I came away with terrible bites on my legs from insects that resided in the bed linen. They didn't have my room ready until the evening of my arrival & wanted me to pay extra when I requested a late check out. Unfriendly front office staff and long queues for everything. NEVER AGAIN!!!!!! Besides, casinos are not my thing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price but so-so experience...”
Reviews.Author: NovaM
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Excalibur with friends during easter. First time in Las Vegas so of course the gambling frenzie in the hotel initially was too much. However, after getting used to the noice and alcohol level of our fellow hotel guests I was still disappointed about the lack of claening, especially in corridors, elevator, food court etc. It very much resembled "the morning after" on one of those huge party ferries between Sweden and Finland. The room was big and had a pretty nice view, though. Next time I'll spend some more dollars and stay at the Venetian or the Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “dont eat the buffet”
Reviews.Author: plarsflaps
Reviews.Content: the hotel was fine for the money... but if you want buffet............ grab the free tram to mandalay bay. just a buck more but 100 times better. cant comment on the other restaurants at excaliber cause the buffet was our 1st meal there and we all said " we wont eat here" cept for dicks last resort which was a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mellonie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 31 March 2010 for 7 nights and having read some of the negative reviews were a little worried about what to expect. We needn't have worried. This hotel by far exceeded our expectations. The room was extremely clean and comfortable. Yes it could do with being redecorated but the friendly cleaning lady did us proud. Clean sheets and towels every day. The only negative point we would say about the room is the noisy air conditioning unit. The casino was fun too. We ate at the buffet breakfast on our last day and it was okay. However, for the best breakfast on the Strip you can't beat America at New York New York. We had a fantastic stay at the Excalibur and wouldn't hesitate in recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur was great”
Reviews.Author: K_Meister1983
Reviews.Content: We have not long returned from our trip to Las Vegas where we stayed at the Excalibur. The hotel was just what I was expecting really, I have friends who have stayed there before me so I knew that it wouldn't be bad as they wouldn't keep going back to it. Our 1st room (we later upgraded) was clean, neat and tidy with a pleasant view of the Luxor & Mandalay Bay. The only thing with the room was that it was abit dated, but at the end of the day how much time do you spend in a room on a holiday? The main thing was that it was very clean and the maids did a good job everyday on keeping it that way. The only problem we did come across was that, as it was very windy when we visited, that the wind blowing against the window was very noisey at times. Other than that a good stay in that room. 2 nights before the end of our stay we decided to upgrade to a spa room for $75 each night. This room was absolutely fantastic. Again, very clean & well kept. I was in my element with a brilliant view of the strip (New York, New York, MGM Grand...) and the hot tub was just perfect at the end of a days walking & sightseeing. The spa room was in tower 2 (1st room was tower 1) tower 2 is newer and not dated like the first. I would recommend upgrading to anyone who stays at the Excalibur. All in all we had a brilliant stay here. The staff we met were friendly, lots of choices of food, plus shops to look around upstaires. Next time I visit Las Vegas I would like to stay further into the strip as Excalibur is quite near the end. There are buses very regularly into the strip, but it can get abit tiring. Also every time I visit Las Vegas I plan on staying at different hotels to check them all out, this is nothing against Excalibur!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Who stays in Vegas in a hotel room?”
Reviews.Author: CecibelB
Reviews.Content: The hotel has recently renovated some of their rooms and has transformed itself into a hipper place. Not completely, but they are targeting a new waive of people. If you need a place with a clean room to get ready in the strip at a cheap price, then the Excalibur was it. The hote is a little far from the middle of the heart of the strip, but it is a good walk when you have a drink in your hand.

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal on the Strip- We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Vibratone
Reviews.Content: For the price we paid- around $30/night you can't beat this place. Stay in the upgraded rooms (42in flat screen) and you won't be disappointed. The bed was excellent and the room was surprisingly quiet and well located. The hotel itself seems a little outdated and smoky. I didn't like the casino. You have to pay a $11/day fee but it includes internet unlike other hotels- plus you get two free drinks and two games, so its more like about $7/day The best things about this place were that the pool is beautiful -- and unlike any other place I've been they sectioned off one of the pools for adults only. This was great because the place is crawling with kids during spring break. Nice gym! Nice pool area! The location is fantastic- close to all the big hotels like New York, NY and MGM, Luxor when most of the shows are playing. The food at the buffet was decent but not spectacular. There are many great restaurants in Vegas, so you need to decide if you want easy or fantastic food. The $30 all day deal is definitely worth it- you would easily spend that even eating fast food.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty much happy”
Reviews.Author: JeffNV
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a newly renovated widescreen tv room. The decor was nice and clean. I had a view of the pool. Can be great with the sun shining during the day but get's noisy during happy hour at night. The hidden fees I had expected since I read TripAdvisor in advance, but still a little grating. The final room fee you book for should be it with hotels, the add on is weird. Strangely at 3am one night I got a knock on my door from a service man saying he was there to fix the air conditioner. Since I hadn't called and had been sleeping for a couple of hours this was unerving. Otherwise happy with stay.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!!”
Reviews.Author: 1luvmykids
Reviews.Content: My husband and I picked the exculibur because we brought are kids with us. Checking in was not bad. As soon as we went in the room, it wasnt that bad until I noticed brown stain on the pillow, not the case. So I decided to check all te pillows and 4 out of 3 had these big yellow staun. It looked like urine. I mean come on now this is Vegas and of course people tend to ge drunk and tend to cause accidents on bed and even on pillow. I can not believe this hotel we paid for to upgrade would keep trash like that. I would throw it away. I dont care if they use some kind of chemicals to clean it, that is gross! Who would want to slee on a pillow that im sure someone urine on. We now know to not sta in this disgusting hotel. Its not worth an extra 40 dollars! I bet staying in motel 6 is way better then the excalibur!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I'll always go back to the Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: BartleCat
Reviews.Content: Of the seven trips I've taken to Vegas, I've stayed at the Excalibur for six of them. Staff are always friendly and accessible, rooms are always clean, and I never get bored with their casino. Restaurants are pretty good for the price (avoid the buffet though), and the sundry shop has a nice selection of alcohol. If you want an extra-special experience, ask to upgrade to a Parlor Suite. They aren't always available, but the Suites are like the cherry on top of your vacation - especially if you plan to entertain while in town. They come with a separate living room with kitchen and bar, a guest bathroom, and an amazing jacuzzi tub in the bedroom. We left quite a mess after a party in the suite one time, and they never charged us extra for anything. The updated pool is awesome too. The only complain about this place is the time-share vultures near the front door - but you get them everywhere in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur not as bad.”
Reviews.Author: MPLSguy78
Reviews.Content: I've made many trips to Vegas staying in high class and not so high class. We stayed for one night at the excalibur before moving to the NYNY. We got a updated room, which had a very comfortable bed and large bathroom. This room was nicer than the NYNY deluxe room we had at the NYNY. The tables were much more fun than other casinos, people were more outgoing and the dealers were great too. Overall, Excalibur is older but I didn't mind it. It was a fun enviroment to hang out. Note. The mexican resturant in the casino (I think it was called Fresh Baja or something like it) was NOT very good.

Reviews.Title: “Much improved from 10 years ago”
Reviews.Author: mikeinlamesa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Excalibur for two nights in March to see a concert at Mandalay Bay. I chose it based on the price of $36 a night but wasn't expecting much based on previous experience there. I have to admit that they have upgraded the property since the last time I stayed nearly 10 years ago. The room was clean, the bed was comfortable and the shabbiness from my previous visit seems to have been addressed.

Reviews.Title: “COULDNT BE PAID TO GO BACK”
Reviews.Author: jaydensmum
Reviews.Content: we travelled to las vegas this month and stayed at excalibur for 4 nights.we chose this hotel as we travelled with our child age 2. things went wrong right from check in. i had requested a king bed as my son would be sleeping in our bed and a queen was to small as he rolls. when we arrived at our room we had a queen... i called to front desk they said they had nothing till the next day so we had to make due. the next day we got to switch rooms which was a complet hassel. our new room had no internet connection which both my husband and i needed for work. i called agin down to front dest expressed to them that it was needed for work and that was one reason why we booked here for this ammenity.48 hours later just before switching rooms again ech guy shoed up who was very rude. any ways all and all i think the hotel itselfs is ok. some what clean and tidy. staff i found to be very rude. thats the biggest turnoff for a customer. would recommend paying a few more bucks to stay somewhere nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, was as expected”
Reviews.Author: trvlr2009
Reviews.Content: We were looking to keep our hotel costs down but stay in a decent location and we felt that the Excalibur would be our best choice. It was as expected, rooms were clean but nothing extravagant, we did get a good deal for one of the rooms in tower 2, it is quite a hike to the room but it is quite a hike to your room at most hotels in Las Vegas. We didn't utilize the pool or spa but did take a look and it appeared quite nice. The location is good for what you are paying, although you are not center strip you are close enough to numerous hotels and you can take the monorail to Mandalay Bay or Luxor. If you are going to vegas you have to be willing to walk unless you want to ride the bus which can be quite a journey. The restaurants leave a bit to be desired, especially the cafe. We did not have the best experience at the cafe but after we let the manager know of the problem they did a little something to make up for it. As many others have stated, you get what you pay for and if you are looking to conserve the money that you spend on your hotel then the Excalibur is not a bad choice.

Reviews.Title: “As expected”
Reviews.Author: traveller201088
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights in March and was pleased to find that while my room was not new, it had been very well maintained. Service was good, although I was confused by the wake up calls which came about 5 minutes early and the time they quoted was about 10 or 15 minutes later, both came in reliably though which was what mattered to me. Had a slight glitch in not having hot water for a shower one day, but a quick phone call and there was a man at my door less than ten mins later and water was there within about 3 minutes - I was impressed with that service. I was very pleased with my stay overall.

Reviews.Title: “Good, comfortable and clean but smoke filled”
Reviews.Author: dpcarlow
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Excalibur for a week and it was fine, not 5 star but clean and comfortable rooms and would stay there again. its clearly aimed at party people and wouldn't suit people who want top quality service or peace and quite. The location was fine only a $15 taxi from the airport and right on the strip. I can understand some peoples issues with the hotel as the casino stinks of smoke but that didn't bother me as i was rarely there, room service was fine and the pools were nice and clean and all in all this hotel was just fine .

Reviews.Title: “Yuck”
Reviews.Author: Lilbuddha2
Reviews.Content: Checked out after one night. Where do I start - guess this place is good for young partiers who need a cheep place and don't care about the following types of crud - 9" inch hole in the wall, super smoky casino, weird stain on sheet, hole in sheet, weird stain on floor, mold in shower grout? and dingy, cheap furniture. Did not help that I got a room next to the whooshing elevators. I will say the bed was comfy though. Weird, huh? Best was when I checked out early and the manager wanted to know why I didn't call to switch rooms the night before (I was exhausted from the drive in). I asked why they didn't put me in another room. They didn't know about the hole in the wall. Okay, I figured that is what she would say. Then I asked why did they put me in a room next to the loud elevators. She said it was the only room as they were fully booked when I checked in (10pm) Yet she kept asking why I didn't call down to switch rooms that night. I thought you said it was fully booked. "No, we had rooms we could have switched you to". Typical hotel logic. They were full at 10pm so they gave me the crappy room, but magically at 10:20 they had rooms! No matter the smoke and the nonsense was enough reason to move!

Reviews.Title: “Another great trip to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ras59
Reviews.Content: I read reviews about the Excalibur and I laugh because it sounds like people expect Wynn or Palazzo amenities at Excalibur rates. First of all let me start by saying this, the widescreen rooms are the way to go, they are remodeled and are very roomy. We paid $46 a night, $10 more than their standard rooms, but it's money well spent. If you want to complaint try the Sahara and you'll see that the Excalibur IS a great bargain. Service, this is our second stay at Excalibur and both times we never had any issues. We approached everyone with a smile and used a polite tone and they got things done for us in a very timely manner. You people need to realize that these folks do a very thankless job for the most part and they appreciate this. We had NO issues with service here, our toilet got clogged they came and fixed it within 20 minutes. Rooms were cleaned everyday, and as mentioned before, for what we paid per night we got what we expected. People complaint about it not being kid friendly, people, its Vegas not Disney, they will do the best job they can for kids but they are in the Casino business. Be logical. Yes there is smoke, yes it is loud and yes they have a kid’s pool. If you don't want to stay here with your kids may I recommend a spot off the strip, or the new resorts in City Center, Aria, Vdara... etc. The resort fee... well, accept it because every other hotel is charging it. So don't complain about it. I can understand if they were the only ones doing it. If you do your homework and looked on their website you will see that the resort fee does show up, they also explain what it is for on the website. So don't sound shocked when you see it there. All in all, it's a great place to go and sleep, because in Vegas that's all you'll need a hotel room for. My advice, spend the extra on the widescreen rooms, the beds and pillows are comfy, rooms are big enough. Be polite and you will get served. And the best tip for being served better than all the other guests… TIP. It’s up to you who you tip and how much your wallet can afford, but just remember, you don’t have to tip every time and you don’t have to tip a small fortune. But it will help you stand above the other guests, it will get you better advise from the locals which is always great, and it will help you have a better stay.

Reviews.Title: “Spend your money ELSEWHERE”
Reviews.Author: 6Voyagers
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our family's first trip to Las Vegas. If you have children, we would highly recommend going elsewhere. First, upon check-in, we are informed there are 'resort fees'. I'm sorry, it was my understanding that hotels set their rates according to their amenities, conveniences and all that the hotel has to offer...why the need for a "resort fee"? Second, when we got to the first room, it hadn't even been cleaned and it was around 5pm. They were good about finding another room but it wasn't long and we found that the bathroom sink had a slow leak and was plugged. Needless to say, it over-flowed all over the bathroom. It took the maintenance guy over an hour to arrive. When he gets there, he uses a TOILET PLUNGER (what?!?) to "fix" it. He leaves and we have to call to have them send house cleaning as we surely didn't want to brush out teeth in a sink that was just plunged with something used in a nasty plugged up toilet at least a few times. We waited over an hour for them to arrive but the family was so hungry they couldn't hold on any longer so there is no telling what the sink was ever cleaned with, however we know they did show up because they replaced all the used towels we had mopped up the mess with. Dealt with the plugged sink for the remainder of the trip as we were already worn out from dealing with them. THIRD, the hotel / casino area is really dark and smokey. There is a definite nasty smell that seems to be a combination of smoke, lack of air flow, bad food, follwed by bad gas and who knows what else that has taken over this hotel. Fourth, the TOWER II, so called remodelled tower, is not remodeled. Unless you consider remodeling sticking in a few new pieces of furniture and fixtures and repairing cracked grout in the tile with grout that doesn't even match. The room smelled older than Las Vegas itself. The beds were far from comfortable, although we have slept on less comfortable hotel beds. Fifth, the hotel staff made no attempt to be prompt at any request and offered no break on prices. On a positive note, it is close to the stip for those looking for the convenience of that part, but for us, the lack of consideration and uncleanliness outweighed any of those conveniences. As far as being child friendly, NOT AT ALL. (There was a really nice lady who worked at the Pearl Factory on the first floor who was very entertaining and loved talking with our children answering their many questions about how those pearls got in the oysters! Kudos to her) All in all, we will not be returning to this hotel. If I could give it less than a 1 rating I would. The South Point Hotel/Casino at the south end of the strip will be getting our business from here on out. With a very light atmosphere, family friendly staff, bowling alley and many other family oriented offerings...and we weren't even hotel guests and they still treated us with lots of hospitatlity.

Reviews.Title: “the price was right”
Reviews.Author: ord1454
Reviews.Content: the price was right, but the room was a bit musty.. had to stay an extra night because flight was canceled. It was a 5 star compared to the jungle at circus circus. the wedding went very well but the stay at circus circus was nasty. I needed this night to get some much needed rest. the pool was closed at 5pm. +1 for the free internet

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: nessica
Reviews.Content: first ever trip to vegas- this hotel is definately the place to go! we wanted something that was daggy and fun and out there, and the moment you arrive your jaw drops and you cant stop staring at the place. its a wonderland! and we are in our 20s! checked in easily, our "tower" was a bit of a walk from the reception but that was ok. high level room and it was lovely. we had a wide screen room, not that we watched tv. excellant view. it wasnt of the strip, but just of the suburbs stretching out to the desert.. so pretty. sunset was amazing. the casino is amazing! never seen anything like it. bars everywhere and loads of nice friendly staff. upstairs there are shops and restaurants and a walkway to luxor. there is also the most amazing buffet you have ever seen. omg. the food was to die for. $27 all you can eat ALL DAY. ALL DAY!!!! mouth watering. we also went to the tournament of kings show which was fun. eat with your hands, nice meal and a fun show with horses and battles. my boyfriend enjoyed it (boys!) we are at the very end of strip, so its just a matter of walking and turning around when u get tired! its definately a fun hotel. we were looking for that though, if you want class or romance, do not stay here. we went into luxor and ours definatley was more exciting and had more atmosphere. New york new york was on the same kind of level, maybe a bit more sophisticated. i would stay here again becuase i know its great, but i havent compared it to anything else so im not sure! i dont really recall seeing many kids? so dont worry about that being an issue, but im sure they were there. we did spend most of the time on the casino floor though so that could be why. the pool looks fantastic but as it was new years eve we didnt really wanna have a dip! loved it. love vegas. every adult should go.

Reviews.Title: “Gross”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Snob72
Reviews.Content: Probably a really unfair review as I am used to staying at places that are very nice like the Red Rock or The Hotel. But we received an offer from Excalibur which touted there newly remodeled rooms with the 42" tvs and all these great new upgrades, so we thought we would give it a try. The room felt very dirty, the carpet was gross, everything felt dingy, dark and dirty. There were mystery stains all over the curtains and walls. There was hair on the bathroom floor that could never seem to be swept up. Food offerings for the price are mediocre at best. You can go to an off strip property for a far better meal at half the price. The elevators were very, very slow. There was a bottle cap in the elevator the day we arrived, and still present the day we left 2 days later. I will pay the extra to stay at a nicer place and steer clear of this dive.

Reviews.Title: “The girls turned 60”
Reviews.Author: CarolC27
Reviews.Content: As all casinos and hotels in Vegas, they are all too big - was a great room - adjoining for all of us girls.

Reviews.Title: “terrible!”
Reviews.Author: SJZ59
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay in this hotel, because we needed 7 rooms and the price was right. Now I know why, it was dirty, had a very rude person at check in. Changed rooms twice, because the shower was plugged and bubbled up. Floor in bathroon was dirty, this was the first room. Second room just as bad, had dirty dishes outside our room the while weekend, the elevators didn't work half the time ended up taking the stairs, cause they were so slow if they even were working, and never cleaned. I've never stayed in a hotel this bad. Would NEVER recommend this hotel to anyone> Very disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ANGRY10
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 1 week ,floor looked like they were never hovered food trollies left in the hall all day and night, looked like they have a staff shortage, bed and bathroom were clean, i was surprised to see people smoking in a working erea, and in a small bar where there were musicians sing. and then we were charged an extra 10 dollars a day plus tax for resort fees, i feel like i was robbed ,as i did not use any of the facilities in the hotel,

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: dnaylor10
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Excalibur, from the 13-16 of this month. I am 21 and in college, I went to Vegas for spring break with my girlfriend who is also 21. For the price, the Excalibur is a good option to stay, although it does have its ups and downs. The location is decent, very close to the Luxor and Mandalay Bay and only a short walk to reach some of the more expensive hotels. But at the same time, basic rooms are literally that - basic. I wanted the cheapest/most decent (if that's even possible) room, so I am not complaining about what it had/didn't have; the fact is there wasn't even a fridge in the room. The shower was poor and room service is nothing to brag about. They do not clean up anything unless you semi-clean it up first yourself. As for the time share selling people in the lobby...yes, there is about 1-2 of them at any given entrance. But honestly, they are not an issue unless you get annoyed easily. Simply don't even give them the time of day; I was approached once and just ignored his attempt to lure me in and I didn't get asked - but hey, maybe that's because I'm an intimidating college student! All in all, I'd recommend the hotel because the cheap prices you can get for the room. While luxury is preferred, sometimes it just isn't necessary. While I was in Vegas I spent barely any time in the room, and unless your whole family wants to watch TV on vacation, I don't expect many other people to spend a significant amount of time in the room. It's a bang for your buck, save some money for extra shows or gambling, and have a good time. I will probably be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: Radzyn315
Reviews.Content: Overall our stay at the Excalibur was great! Everybody was really helpful and willing to help us out in any way. We arrived at noon (and knowing that check-in isn't until 3pm) we decided that we were going to have the Bell Desk hold our luggage while we went and saw a show down the strip. However, we were greeted by employees at the Concierge Desk who told us that they were already checking people in, so we figured we would give it a try. We were upgraded for free to a Widescreen room, which was really nice. The Widescreen room has an iPod dock/alarm clock instead of the standard radio/alarm clock, a decent size widescreen falt-panel TV, iron, iron-board, hairdryer, the little alcove that hotels have with the shelf & hangers is enclosed with sliding doors (a first that I have seen), and a shower (no tub), and of course the dresser and table/chairs. There isn't a coffee pot in room, so coffee drinkers be forewarned. We didn't have much of a view, but only for staying 1 night (and in a town where you really aren't expected to be in your room anyways, but out on the casino floor) it wasn't that big of a deal. The casino had various games to play. It was not very hard to navigate and was very nice. Most of the restaurants/fast food is located on the second floor of the main building, which is nice that it is off the casino floor. The only thing that I didn't like was the constant barrage of time-share salesman (this is pretty much everywhere on the strip anyways). The Fantasy Faire/Arcade was fairly large and had a variety of games to play. They do have a 4D motion ride with 3 different scenarios: Extreme Log Ride, Dino Island & SpongeBob. It was $12.95 for all 3 for $9.95 for 1. Even if you aren't a fan of SpongeBob (like us), it is still worth getting all 3 to do the other 2 cheaper than buying them individually. The casino is located at the South end of the strip, and does require walking to get to the center. Other ways around are catching The Deuce (a local bus) or the monorail. Both do cost: $7/person for The Deuce (24-hours) & $14/person for the monorail (I think its 24-hours). Next time we go back, when we consider where to stay, we will give the Excalibur a second look.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience at the Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: JBell7
Reviews.Content: I went with a few friends for the opening weekend of March Madness and we found a decent price at the Excalibur. When our room was booked, the description of our room claimed it would have a safe, flat screen TV, 2 double beds and be non-smoking. When we checked in, our room did not have a safe, had an old tube TV and had a musty/smoky smell. We immediately went downstairs, explained our concerns and were moved to a new room. Our new room was exactly the same only it had a safe. Unfortunately, it also had a stained carpet and an air conditioner that was on the fritz (either blew high cold air or you had to turn it off, the low button didn't work). It was great having to wake up every 2 hours to turn the AC on and off because if we kept it running too long it would freeze, and kept it off to long it would be very hot. After explaining all of this we found out that there was another part of the hotel that had been renovated (these are the rooms with the flat screens, etc...). We told them that we were under the impression, because of the description we had read, that we should be in one of those rooms and they gave us a "too bad, but you can pay $20+tax a night to upgrade." They then sent someone up to fix the AC, and when he got up there he said, and I quote, "This is an old unit that can't be fixed. You just have to keep it on high or turn it off". We told the hotel staff, and again were met with, "that's too bad, but it'll cost you $20 a night to upgrade." We were treated with utter disrespect and had to pay extra for a functional, livable room that didnt smell terrible. We ended up paying for the upgrade because our room was that unbearable and we couldnt change hotels/cancel our reservation there. We are planning to go back to Vegas next March and I can promise you, no matter what the price, we will not be staying at the Excalibur nor do we recommend it to anyone! The newer, remodeled rooms are about average, nothing to complain about there, but the customer service and level of disrespect we were treated with is enough to keep me away. If you are going, make sure you are staying in a new room or you will be SEVERELY DISAPPOINTED (but since the price of a remodeled room at the Excal is about equal to the price at other much nicer hotels on the strip, I highly recommend avoiding the Excalibur).

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Birthday Trip”
Reviews.Author: btk333
Reviews.Content: I had just arrived to Vegas for the first time and had booked this hotel a few months prior and was very excited about it. Once I went to the check-in area, I was greeted by a person who could barely speak English and couldn't explain anything about the room or packages she was trying to give us. We went to our room and found it was nothing like what I had booked. I had reserved a king bed/non smoking with view. I had received a two full bed/smoking no view. We had called the front desk explaining of the room difference, which most hotels would do their best to accommodate a guest, even if they had to do an upgrade, but was given a "too bad for you, we will TRY to move you tomorrow" attitude. (This was on a weekday and not very full) We found that the only way to get some response was to be vocal about our disappointment. After arguing with the manager, we were moved to a different room later that night, but still smelled like old smoke, but were told that it was a non-smoking room. (I think they call it that if you're a non smoker and to the smokers, they call it a smoke ok room). We tried to make the best of the situation and later the next night, we came back from a long exhausting day of fun only to find that no maid service was done, not even new towels or the bed made up! We quickly got on the phone and after some time, again expressing our disappointment, a staff member came and gave us fresh towels. We had visited all of the hotels on the strip and when you walk into the others, they smell fresh and taken care of. On occasion we would sit at the slots and found no one wanted to wait on us for drinks, but at other hotels, we had no problems with this. We have stayed at many hotels in our life and found that this was the worst experience and would never recommend this hotel to anyone. I hope they take some time to read these reviews and find a way to improve themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: PhilipL4
Reviews.Content: Nice room and very reasonable cost. Best part of the stay was the service after we left. I lost a library book on the trip home. I was pretty sure it was lost at the airport, but in checking all the possibilities, I called Excalibur. I received not one, but two calls from the staff there after they truly looked for the book. Better than I got from the airport and definitely better than Hertz.

Reviews.Title: “room was AWFUL!!!!”
Reviews.Author: amanda918
Reviews.Content: i took my brother to las vegas for his birthday and stayed at the excalibur. this hotel is listed at a 3 star. i can not figure out why! when we opened our door it smelled like something had died in there. we called the front desk to ask for some spray or something. a staff member came and sprayed our room. after they were done it still smelled like death but now it smells like the industrial spray AND death! we ended up going and buying some insence to try to fix the smell. we were charged extra for a "seating area" in our room which was nothing more than a broken table and 2 chairs. one of the chairs had a big long skinny burn in it. there is no was it was a cigarette burn either. when we checked in we were charged an additional 35 or so dollars for a "resort fee" that our travelocity booking said we already paid but our papers from travelocity said it was 22.50. we asked about this and we were told that it was about 10.00 per day for the "resort fee" and the desk lady had no idea why travelocity papers said what they said. the fees didnt even match. its a good thing you dont go to vegas to hang out in your hotel! the smell of excalibur it toxic!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: BrightStar101
Reviews.Content: Twice now I've stayed at Excalibur. Once for business and once for pleasure. The rooms are clean and big, the bed was excellent. The price can't be beat. I can't find a bad thing to say about this place. Just came back and it was just as good as the last time I went there about 6 years ago. If I go for pleasure, or a conference/meeting that is on that end of the strip that is where I'll stay. I've stayed at some other "value" resorts and they were bad, but not this place.

Reviews.Title: “If you are smart about spending money stay here”
Reviews.Author: cdxjr
Reviews.Content: I have stayed many places in Vegas. Five star to, well I guess this is the cheapest place I have ever stayed. Once I stayed here, I never went anywhere else. Come often and never have deviated. It's just the best place for your money: Room- clean(fantastic upgrade from fantastic staff), Pool- nice adult area and newly remodeled, I paid for the gym anyway so resort fee very reasonable but too many people in gym now, Spa- fabulous(facial and massage great), restaurants not good but have lots of left over money for fancier places. I do consider myself discriminating, but not wasteful. Oh, and yes, the one thing that almost chased my away were the time share salesmen. Kind guests beware, you do have to get ugly. Look strait forward and do not let them see your hotel key. The location is great for that end of the strip. Again, I am not high brow, nor pretentious, I like my coffee for under 20.00 a pot.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best 'cheapest' hotels on the strip”
Reviews.Author: lauralove5uk
Reviews.Content: This is probably one of the cheapest hotels what is on the strip and is great quality for what it is. The decor is typical Vegas style and the people are very helpful and will do anything to make sure your trip is going well. I have stayed there three times now and wouldnt pay any more for other hotels. The casino is great and the bars are fun too. They have a fabulous steakhouse in the hotel called Steakhouse at Camelot. The steaks are amazing! Best i've ever had! There is also a great buffet at the hotel too. You can buy an all day wristband for $30 and children under 5 go free. The hotel is in a great location. Right in between the Luxor and New york New york. If possible I would recommend spending an extra $50 dollars to upgrade your room when you check in. The rooms are in the newest tower, closest to the pool. They also have beige carpets and white bed clothes. Compared to the tacky floral bed clothes in the standard rooms. Only downside was the room service is abit expensive. We ordered a jug of coffee, pot of tea and a bottle of coke when we were hungover and it come to $47 inc tip. Also be prepared to pay the extra room tax when you arrive. You also have to pay for travel cots and there isnt a bath, which isnt great when youve got kids. Have fun! Remember - What happens in Vegas, Stays in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Once again, you get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: Irish_Angel03
Reviews.Content: Your opinion of this hotel depends on what you pay for, what you want, and how picky you are. This was my first trip to Las Vegas so I decided to upgrade to a Widescreen Room with a View once I got there, for an extra $20 per night. I stayed in Tower 2 and I'm fairly certain that these rooms were the most recently updated. I went for a wedding and most of us got rooms in Tower 2, but one set of girls paid the very least that they could and got a room in Tower 1 that... honestly looked like a Motel 6 room... Like many others have said: You get what you pay for. My room ended up being the largest and had the best view of all the people that went for the wedding. Going in all I really wanted was clean bedding, a clean bathroom, no nail clippings on the carpet and a view of the Strip. I got all of that and I was quite comfortable during my stay. I do have a few minor complaints, but nothing that would have made me storm out or demand a refund. When I arrived, there were dirty room service dishes sitting outside my room that were not picked up until the next morning, but they didn't smell or anything and I couldn't see them except for coming back to my room. It was annoying, but I didn't trip over them, so really I wasn't terribly concerned. Also, I did go about 48 hours before housekeeping noticed that one of my lamps was missing a lamp-shade. Again, not a deal breaker, but a little more attention could have been paid. When I arrived there were face and handprints all over my window looking out to my terrific view--but all that took was a call to the housekeeping office the next morning. Truthfully, I was more concerned about looking at my view than the missing lampshade, which I actually could have done without, truth be told... And actually, for what I paid, I would have really liked a mini fridge in my room... Whenever I had a question or concern, I was met with smiles, understanding and friendly service/advice. Now--I would advise you to steer clear of the "Blue Jacket Monsters" as I've seen others call them. In any hotel, do not talk to anyone in a blue jacket with a name tag. Should you make eye contact, make sure you tell them you make less than $50,000 per year and they will want nothing more to do with you--even if you make much more. Unfortunately, all the hotel/casinos allow smoking on the gaming floors. There is no smoking upstairs around the shops and restaurants, however. There was a Baja Fresh just around the corner from the elevator that took me to my room. It was very good, but $17 for a burrito and two small tacos was a little pricey, in my opinion. I tried twice to go to the Sherwood Cafe--once for breakfast and once for lunch, but there was always a ridiculous long line and I have no patience for long lines when it concerns food. Upstairs though, is an Italian restaurant that catered to the wedding and the catered food was phenomenal! There was also a Starbucks, a 24-hour Krispy Kreme, a Pizza Hut Express, a 24-hour McDonald's, and a Quizno's Subs. The location is great! It is next door to The Luxor, which has Mandalay Bay on the other side. There is a free monorail that connects the three, although you can also use the walkways within all the hotels: I walked from Excalibur, through the Luxor and on to Mandalay Bay without once setting foot outside into the rain! The Monte Carlo and New York New York were across the street diagonal from Excalibur, but across from New York New York is MGM Grand. There is a walkway that connects Excalibur, New York New York and MGM. We also discovered that while Excalibur is on the very south side of the strip and the Bellagio is in the very center--it is only about a 15 minute walk from one to the other--but do NOT attempt that walk in heels, ladies! There is also a monorail that will take you from MGM Grand to any other hotel on that side of the strip all the way up to the north-most end. This one is not free, but you can get a 3 or 4 day pass for about $30 I think--or $5 each time you get on. It was nice though, so we walked everywhere. Overall, I loved the Excalibur and I would definitely stay there again! It is one of the cheapest places to stay and even if you do upgrade, it's still cheaper than staying at MGM Grand or Bellagio or somewhere, and there is so much to do all around that area.

Reviews.Title: “Price-wise, it's the best for its location BUT...”
Reviews.Author: FamilyManLACA
Reviews.Content: To whom it may concern: I want to comment on the hotel I recently stayed in. It is called Excalibur located on the Strip of Las Vegas. My entire experience was not a pleasant one. As soon as you walked in the front door or ANY door to Excalibur, there were dozens of salesmen waiting to lure you in a "free offer". First I thought they were the check-in counter greeters, so nice and everything, but I was so wrong. I am one of the stupid people who got “tricked” into this "free-offer".
