First, they asked if you want free tickets to shows, not giving all the details until after you paid $40 cash deposit. They kept telling you paid deposit here and you immediately can get it back at another counter somewhere in hotel. Not after they got your money do they tell you to attend a 3 hour long sales tour before getting the deposit back. And it is not immediate, it is the next day. Also, there were many survey questions they ask, some are very personal I think. I wanted to back out but they already got my money. The worst is yet to come, at the 3 hours (it really did take that long) tour, the salesmen there use many sales tactics to try to get you to buy a time share condo on that day. Who in their right mind would make a big purchase like this in one day? After telling them we are not interested 10 times, they tried and tried, with different salesmen and tactics. Finally, they know they can’t make a sale with us do they let us get our money back, but before that, one more salesman trying his last attempt and plenty of survey questions waiting for you. I know the economy is bad, but the way they lure you into this is not a fair sales practice. They should let you know all the details first. If I knew the tour will take 3 hours of my vacation time and that I don’t get my money right back like they said, I would totally refuse this stupid offer. It seems like Excalibur is the only hotel that have this hard sales at all their entrances. I went to many other hotels on the strip and they don’t do this. Also, the stay at Excalibur is somewhat disappointed since they strip down to very basic “amenities.” All they have is basic toiletries & basic TV channels. There is no coffee maker, no iron board, etc… I felt like I stayed at an overpriced motel. The “customer service” is terrible at this hotel. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Exaclibur”
Reviews.Author: ABFirecracker
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and the employees were all very friendly. Love that they had a military discount!

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: wolverine291
Reviews.Content: Only stayed at the Excalibur because of a good deal i got. I was quite nervous after reading some of the reviews but it was much better than i expected. Sure the rooms were a little out-dated but our room was very clean. The service was very pleasant and I was very happy with the sports book.

Reviews.Title: “Smoke Filled Hotel and Disgusting, Needs a makeover!”
Reviews.Author: Sharttle
Reviews.Content: I must say just walking through any part of this hotel will have you smelling like smoke, all in your hair and clothes. Your children will smell like smoke which is pretty disgusting. Hotel is very old and run down. The rooms arent nice. The whole hotel is in desperate need of a makeover. Very Disappointing!

Reviews.Title: “Skip it”
Reviews.Author: blobee
Reviews.Content: Overpriced rooms, outdated, dingy and dirty furnishings in the room. The desk lost our dinner reservations pre-paid over a month ago and we lost our front row seats to the OVERPRICED Tournament of Kings show. We were offered no amenity for their error. The tournament of kings is a pre-set menu of chicken and soggy veggie, soggy roll, and soup. The only beverage available is coke, unless you buy an alcoholic drink. For a family of four, this equates to well over $260!!!! Skip it!!!! Go to Medieval Times instead. The "midway" for kids in the basement is pretty generic and pricey. Timeshare and show ticket salesmen hound you CONSTANTLY by every door. There are MANY better options in Vegas for kids. The Golden Nugget has a pool with a clear acrylic slide that runs THROUGH the shark tank, and kids can swim up to the shark tank from the pool. Even Circus Circus might be better. I will never stay at the Excalibur again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice value”
Reviews.Author: gmayer
Reviews.Content: We spent four days in Las Vegas last february and we stayed at Excalibur. When my husband told me that we would stay em this hotel, I was a little bit afraid because I know that the hotel isn't brand new (I visited the hotel when I was a child). However, since my arrival the hotel and its staff has surprised me. We stayed in the older rooms, that were nice. My only complaint is that the room smelled cigarrettes. For the price, its a good choice and its is in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: JennLynn1981
Reviews.Content: I did rent a fully upgraded widescreen room, and I was completely satisfied. The cleanliness was top notch, the service was no issue and the rooms were quiet. The price was unbeatable and the location perfect. I would not pay another dollar to stay elsewhere. I definitely got more than I paid for.

Reviews.Title: “A bit worn down, but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: LJinEire
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Excalibur in Sept 08 for 1 week and it was ideal for what we were looking for which was cheap. When we arrived our room was upgraded and was clean and nice. The shower was huge and the room had a huge flat screen TV and two large double beds which were really comfy. We weren't in the hotel all that much as we liked to visit the other casinos and it was there that you could see the huge difference. Excalibur is a little worn down (even the staff look that way) and cheap but still a good place to rest your head. We got room service twice (waaay overpriced) and the food wasn't that good. The buffet was a disappointment and we usually went over to New York New York to eat. The hotel was never really that lively and the shows they had didn't appeal to us all that much. The bars also didn't appeal and again we always went elsewhere. Overall it was fine for a place to sleep but I probably wouldn't go back, I would shell out the few extra quid for the MGM or even New York New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great price and location”
Reviews.Author: Mona-Lisa-lady
Reviews.Content: We didn't know what to expect at this casino and hotel, but we were pleasantly surprised that it turned out to be better than expected. With our two young adult sons, we got a side by side rooms with two queen beds and the large wide screen TV's - without asking for the upgrade! We also got the tower with a view of both New York New York and MGM Grand so the view was spectacular especially at night! Rooms were always cleaned and when we wanted to stay in longer one morning - no problem housekeeping came in later in afternoon. Quiet at night as we had the 13th floor. This casino was affordable for playing and staying and it was so close to New York New York, Luxor and MGM Grand. The all day buffet was affordable and surprisingly good with lots of variety. If your a lady the show Thunder- Down-Under was a hoot! The Tournament of Kings was a great show - but not the food - you eat a small chicken with your hands - not very good. Pool was closed as it was their winter, too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation”
Reviews.Author: queentrish26
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time. Need to rekindle, time away from stress, then Las Vegas is the place to be. It is Adults disney. We love it!

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur = FUN FOR ALL!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tiny_T_13041994
Reviews.Content: I'm from Perth, Western Australia and went to Las Vegas in 2004 and loved every bit of it! Went along with my mum and dad who also had the time of their lives. While we were in the US we went to many different luxury hotels around the country...the Excalibur was 100% the BEST!!! Staff - 9.5/10, Entertainment - 9.5/10, Atmosphere - 10/10, Value - 8/10, Cleanliness - 9/10, Fun factor - 10/10 !!!!!!! It was like a fairy-tale and a dream come true!!! (Highly recommended...) :D

Reviews.Title: “Nothing wrong staying here at all”
Reviews.Author: nworock
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a 5 night trip and because we found Excalibur to be so much cheaper than the others out there, we were a bit worried it might not be that great. But we were proven wrong, it's perfectly fine for a Vegas trip! Value is awesome. We stayed before at the Tropicana and Flamingo, and both cost quite a bit more for the time we were looking. Flamingo might have been slightly nicer, but really, how much time in Vegas do you spend in your hotel room? Not much for us. We would easily take the savings and stay here again. It has a free tram to Luxor and Mandalay Bay which is nice, and is still right on the strip to get to the other hotels. And it's super close to New York New York which we find to be a lot of fun to spend some time in. Excalibur itself was fun too, and the Knights dinner theatre was a blast. Highly recommended to check that out. The room was ok. You can tell it's older, and even though there's room for a bathtub we only had a stand in shower stall, but still, perfectly fine. It's obviously not the most romantic hotel room, but if you're looking for functionality, it's fine. The staff were very good. We tried to get a king sized bed but they were unfortunately out, so they made it up to us with a top floor room with a great view of the strip. It was very nice of them instead of the usual "oh we're out, so take what we got". There are quite a few time share people in the casino (where isn't there though) but we found if you just say you're leaving town that day they don't say another word. There's plenty of stores inside as well, including a 24 hour McDonalds and Starbucks and all that. So yeah, places like the Flamingo might be a bit nicer overall, but if you're looking to stay in Vegas with a budget, there's nothing wrong with the Excalibur at all.

Reviews.Title: “Morale of staff is awful....and made me go elswhere for fun and entertainment”
Reviews.Author: Ritzmank
Reviews.Content: Well the experience at the Excalibur left us knowing we will stay elsewhere in Vegas. From the time we arrived untill we left the staff seemed less than interested in our business. We inquired about the room upgrade for a "view" and took it for an extra $10 per night. Do not waste your money as there was nothing to see from our room but hotel garbage and an empty parking lot from our tower. Stay in the basic room and you will be fine. Be aware of the coupon book you receive at check in, there are bigger savings easily found. We waited to be seated for breakfast at Sherwood Forest Cafe, and ended up leaving after 10 minutes as several staff passed by us on more than one occasion. We ended up with great service over in the American Restaurant at NY NY where we had breakfast for the next 5 days.. Secondly when we had an issue playing slots and tito ticket would not print.....we waited over 15 minutes with service light flashing, then approached a nearby security guard and waited another 10 minutes...this was at 10:00pm the second night. Thursday I played Poker with "Grumpy" as the dealer and finally our table backed me when I spoke up to the pit boss. Thursday afternoon we decided to take in Defending the Caveman to kill an afternoon. When purchasing tickets we were given the impression that there was reserved seating.......which there was not. The VIP ticket is only providing you with a pre-paid t-shirt!! Be prepared for the ulitmate in ridiculous, as we were charged $12.00 for two glasses of cola at the show. The Entertainer was good, but the false pretences provided by the ticket booth and the cost of the drinks left a sour taste in our mouth!! I have been in Vegas on several occasions....and this is definetly a tired property, staff included. The staff needs a good lesson in the old "3ft rule" of acknowledging the patrons, instead of looking down to avoid any possible interaction that may cause them to help with some type of service or request. If you are looking for value with great service.....Riviera want's your business. If you want great dealers and staff that enjoy their job and look after you head down to the Old Casinos on Freemont Street.

Reviews.Title: “poor customer sevice in account dept”
Reviews.Author: purpletravler
Reviews.Content: we never got fully disclosure about the resort fee when we check-in, the account dept Linda G promised will credit us back the amount it never happened it proved such a poor management and unprofessional!

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need”
Reviews.Author: rossgo2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideal for people who are`nt premier leauge footballers and want to stay in a great location on the strip, but dont want to pay through the nose for the privage. It was clean and tidy, the room is a basic but not that much different from any of the other hotels I`v stayed in while in vegas. I have no complaints about the hotel, it does look old but that is down to the theme of the hotel. Rooms were cleaned every day and not a silly times in the morning either. I would recommend this hotel to any one who wants to do Vegas on the cheap side, but wants to stay in the heart of the action. Who wants to spend all there time in the vegas in the hotel room anyway?

Reviews.Title: “Great casino hotel”
Reviews.Author: NatashaJ4
Reviews.Content: Rooms were just right for a Vegas stay. We're never in the rooms much when we go. We prefer other casinos and the waitresses weren't as timely as others...clean rooms, but the Excalibur doesn't seem to do as much for the smoke in the casino as other casinos. Recommend Dick's last resort restaurant...and they have a walk up slush bar (alcoholic slushes ready to go)

Reviews.Title: “sooo cheap ;) and I got an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: GlobalTraveller73
Reviews.Content: best to go to vegas off season . Its cooler and hotels are cheap cheap cheap ! I paid £50 per night . Got upgraded to the brand new rooms . You cant beat location. I'll will be back !!

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Disnydude1
Reviews.Content: We got the Excalibur recommended by a person at my work. Will try another place when we go back. It was OK. Not great!

Reviews.Title: “Won't be returning to this hotel/casino!!!”
Reviews.Author: kaymouse
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights. It has a great location. However, my entire family walked away sick at check out! On our last morning before check out my husband noticed a huge circle of mold on the ceiling!!! We took pictures and alerted the front desk. They called security and we made a report. They didn't offer us a reduced bill upon check out, they haven't called to check up and make sure we are okay, in fact noone has called me at all! They also haven't made any steps to insure our return! Don't get me wrong I don't look for hand outs or cheap everything, but the fact that myself, my husband, and my two year son all walked away with sinus infections and head colds upset me pretty bad!! We even had trouble breathing! It's been almost a week and I"m still trying to get rid of my headache and sinus infection! Wasn't impressed with how it was handled! I definitely will be going somewhere else the next time we go to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: AlexR2
Reviews.Content: Excalibur has great rooms, convenient walking distance to most everything you want to see in Vegas, affordable....very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!!!”
Reviews.Author: rsstoner
Reviews.Content: We live close to Vegas and try a different Hotel/Casino each time we go, after staying at the Excalibur we've all decided a Super 8 in crack-town would be preferable!!! NEVER have we been made to feel as uncomfortable as we were made to feel there, from the moment we walked in the door until we left we were continually harassed bothered by pushy salesmen trying to "giveaway" free stuff if we'd tour their new condo's.... and saying No once was never enough!!! We went there so our kids could have a good time, but I've worked many carnivals and fairs through the years, and the Games at the Midway Faire at Excalibur are rigged worse than ANY I ever saw on any midway I ever worked. Now we all know the odds are against us in the Casino, but is the Excalibur so in need of Money that they have to Rip Off the children too? Definitely a -9 star place in our opinion.

Reviews.Title: “We happen to love this place...”
Reviews.Author: scrappinmad2005
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed in Vegas 4 times now, and two of those 4 times, we stayed at the Excalibur. I have read countless reviews that are unfavorable for the hotel, but I honestly love it! The price is perfect if you're on a budget and want to have more $$ for other things. Plus, it's still ON THE STRIP!! Granted, it's on the South end of the strip, but it's still a great location, being sandwiched between the Luxor and NYNY (connecting walkway to both), and kiddie corner to MGM. Yes, there tends to be more kids that stay there than at some of the other hotels, but... who cares? The kids are down in the arcade or in the pool... Not on the casino floor!! And, both times that we've stayed at the Excalibur, we didn't have any issues with noise. I personally LOVE the midevil theme too. It's carried throughout the whole place including your room. The only issue we've ever had with the place was taken care of promptly. Last time we stayed, we paid extra for an updated room with a pillow top mattress... Only, when we got to the room, the pillow top mattress was extremely hard!!! We tried 3 different rooms!!! all with the same issue. The hotel staff and management did everything they could to try to help us... finally, we decided to just try one of the older rooms (since we didn't have any issues before with the older room when we stayed in it before).... and wouldn't you know it? The bed was WAY softer!! And, as I said... the hotel staff and management were more than gracious about helping us.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: Justinmso
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, prices were very very reasonable, rooms were standard which was to be expected, however in vegas your normally only in your room to sleep and shower. great view stayed in the second tower.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: readheadMonmouth
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Excalibur for four nights and overall thought the hotel was good value for money. The room we had was a very good size, comfortable bed and the room was cleaned to a good standard. The down side was that the room (and the hotel) is looking somewhat tired and good do with a revamp. The carpet and chairs had a few stains on them and the furniture had obviously had some knocks. We did use the all day meal ticket one day and found the food to be well stocked and excellent range of choices. This paricular restaurant is, however, like a large canteen, not parituclarly comfortable or relaxing and you cannot have a drink. Having said that it represents fantastic value for money and we did enjoy what we had to eat there. Food hygiene is well observed (I saw food temperature being checked several times and areas being cleaned on a regular basis). Positioin of the hotel is very good with easy access to other hotels on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Too much fun!!”
Reviews.Author: SeabaSharp
Reviews.Content: The Excalibur was a blast!! The casino was fun and our room was newly redecorated. The beds were extremely comfortable and the shower was huge. I stayed in a handicapped room due to one of my travel mates and it was easily accessible for use of a wheelchair. It wasn't a huge room but we had more than enough space for everything. Loved the flat screen t.v.

Reviews.Title: “Not Comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: KimberleyF
Reviews.Content: The beds were terrible, the rooms smallish, the restaurants were not on a par with other resorts in the area. We won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: SkiTrpn
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel with good restaurants. We stayed there over the Memorial Day Weekend and it was pleasant enough. We ate at Dick's Last Resort in the hotels main level - you have to see Taco's rendition of the Bellagio's water show - HILARIOUS! But I think we'll definately try another hotel the next time we go.

Reviews.Title: “Eh. Don't expect much.”
Reviews.Author: ErinA2
Reviews.Content: Nice pool. Lots of families and kids. Room was forgettable. Decent location at the end of the strip. Easy access to monorail thru MGM.

Reviews.Title: “its okay if you just wanna sleep there”
Reviews.Author: HeatherB6
Reviews.Content: excalibur is a clean place to sleelp but there is very little in entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “what happens in Vegas.....”
Reviews.Author: EvelynN2
Reviews.Content: this hotel was great! It had so much to do inside the hotel and the rooms were very clean and the beds really comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Go Looking for Luxury”
Reviews.Author: iwanatravel
Reviews.Content: Excalibur is a reasonably priced hotel located on the strip. It's in a great location surrounded by Luxor, MGM Grand, and Tropicana, but it is a no-frills hotel. If you want luxury and a bunch of amenities, don't stay there. If you want super-cleanliness, don't stay there. I think this is where a lot of people stay when they just plan on partying all day and night and don't plan on getting much sleep. The rooms are really just good enough for dropping off your luggage but that's it...oh but make sure that you keep your luggage closed or else you may be taking a critter or two back home with you! I went a few years ago, so hopefully since then, they have called Orkin.

Reviews.Title: “I'm not sure what to think, it was good and bad”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravelNewYork
Reviews.Content: Well this was my first trip to las vegas which I enjoyed. I traveled with a group of family of almost every age group for a 75th birthday celebration. We stayed at this hotel because it was known to be family friendly and it was. They had a nice pool area with a seperate pool for 18 and over. So having children jumping in and out did not offend those that wanted peace. However the pool closed at five, which i thought was odd because it was heated and people with children would have went at night. It had a big arcade which was nice for the children. There were so many families there no one felt out of places. We had a wide screen strip view room. the view was nice but the furniture was pretty beat up .I mean it looked like someone took shoots at it with a hammer.Room service never seemed to pick up the trays of food that people ordered from room service all week. It was absolutely disgusting. I tood the cleaning people everytime I saw them in the hall and they said dont worry they will take care of it. That never happened. I told the desk they said they would take care of it, Never happened. That was was there longer than me cause when i checked out it was still there. I know its not an expensive hotel and didnt expect the same services as a four seasons but thats rediculous. The people in the lobby stop you every time you walk past trying to sell you tickets to shows it never ends. Got directions from travel desk to go to grand canyon skywalk. ended up in California. When I read the small print at the bottom of the sheet It said not responsible for wrong directions so directions is a problem for them. I do have to say that all the staff were pleasant and friendly. The Buffet deal seemed great 29.00 All day. However lunch and are the exzact same. And it never veries from day to day.It did have a nice selection though. I dont gamble but i seen alot of people doing so and they appeared to having a nice time.It seemed to be a friendly crowd not a rowdy bunch. I guess because of the families that go. The location was the absolute best. That end of the strip was family friendly. There was no porn pushers like on the other end. The tram to the luxor and mandalay bay were great. All in all I had a nice time in vegas because its a fun place. But the hotel needs to work on these weak points because no one wants to stay in a dirty place no matter how cheep

Reviews.Title: “Tournament of The Kings”
Reviews.Author: obscuria
Reviews.Content: Medieval times meets modern era of gambling, glitters and glamour.

Reviews.Title: “EXCALIBUR”
Reviews.Author: dgh0528
Reviews.Content: One of the nicer visits to Vegas. Very clean and the extras were very evident. I will be sure to stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: JacquelineC4
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine, nothing special and they supposedly gave us an upgrade. No amenities and not that cheap. Old linens, no brochures, not many TV choices. I know it's Vegas and they want you out of the room, but for the price I've had better.

Reviews.Title: “Jeff's 40th Birthday”
Reviews.Author: kellicassi
Reviews.Content: We had a terrific time at Excalibur. Jeff is into Camelot so staying in the "castle" was the utmost. We took in the King Arthur show which was 100% impressive. It was a little spendy but it was well worth the price of the ticket.

Reviews.Title: “4rth Trip to Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: DavidP8
Reviews.Content: When making your reservation at Excalibur be sure to get a View Room, cheaper rooms you can get views of the inside roof or employee break area. Its better to spend $10 more per night for a veiw room than to gamble on what they will give you. Also if you have a laptop computer, do not use Cheetah high speed wireless, weak signal at best and they won't refund your money. Better to pay 13.99 per day for the ethernet connection in your room. Excalibur is nice, but not as luxurious as the other hotels like Belagio, Treasure Island, Mirage and so forth. But is affordable and better than older hotels such as the Sahara and Downtown Freemont st. Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: PinkTrixies
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 days and 2 nights in this place and it was a nightmare. The staff that was all over the casino trying to give you free shows was like walking on a car lot with the sales people attacking you. The staff was very rude, all of them. The rooms were just plain rooms I could have gotten at Best Western! They nickel and dime you for everything. They charged us a $28 "resort fee" but refused to tell us what that covered. She said we would have to find out on our own. The staff at one point tried to sell us 3 days on a future trip for $99 but lied to us just to get us to the counter to tell us about the deal! Now I understand that the point of a casino is to take your money but Excalibur puts a whole new meaning to rip off. We went to dinner at Planet Hollywood, toured Ceasers Palace and vistied the Bellagio and none of their hotel staff bothered us walking around at all. The staff sales people followed us all the way to the elevators we had to take to get to our room!!! The hotel is old and not up to date like the rest of Vegas and their building needs serious repair. Needless to say I will be telling everyone I know NOT to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Grate value for money, a week on February 2010”
Reviews.Author: YROAG
Reviews.Content: We came from Israel for a "second honeymoon" week at valentine day weekend (after 16 years of marriage). We had a deal with a flight so we paid around 65$ a night. We were confused because of all the ambivalent reviews and had a warry from "what would it be". When we came after 18 hours of travel, they didn’t have a room with king size bed. They offered us two queen size beds for one night and change the room in the next day. We refused (I mentioned already the "honeymoon" ...) so they offered an upgrade to a flat screen king size bed room for additional 10$ a day (instead of 20$). We agreed (I knew from trip advisor reviews that these rooms are much better ones) and were very pleased from this decision. The room was huge and fully renovated (the biggest rooms are between the 1-7 floors we were on 5). It had a 2X2 meters king size bed, 43" flat screen TV, big bathroom with a big shower stall (perfect for two or more…) and a view to the swimming pool and the mountains with the snow on the top. We were pleased from the towels, cotton bedclothes and comfortable pillows and mattress. The entire hotel public area is in very good shape and is been cleaned and renovated all the time. But it is after all a bit "old" and not "inviting". We spent most of our off room time in much trendy spots of this city. The hotel has lots of parking area all around it so you always can find a parking spot very near to your hotel entrance (there are 4 entrances one of them close to your room). For summary, this hotel is a very good value for your money, you always can find a better spot on the strip but I don’t think you get better deal for such low cost.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: pwanjari
Reviews.Content: Wasn't spectacular, but was good for the price we got it for. The casinos though are pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “My Vacation”
Reviews.Author: KarenH55
Reviews.Content: I met family members in Phoenix, AZ, we drove in a motor home from Phoenix to Las Angeles, CA.. with stops along the way... Las Vegas was one of the places we visited. Our stay at the Excalibur Hotel & Casino was very nice... i was particularly impressed with the walk-in shower... Nice hotel for budget minded travelers..

Reviews.Title: “Clean and on the strip”
Reviews.Author: wiunicole
Reviews.Content: Didn't stay in the hotel much - too much to see and do. Room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty rooms and poor customer service.”
Reviews.Author: Zac1mac1
Reviews.Content: Checked in on Sunday and went to room. Upon walking down the hall to the room we saw glasses laying on the floor of the hall, dirty room service trays, and old cigarette buts all laying in the hall. Opened the door to the room and were met with a musty smell .. opened the window to air room out and left for several hours. Upon returning to the room the smell remained. Went to close the curtains and found multiple large stains on the curtains, large stain on the bedspread, a very dirty floor, and the TV did not work. Called the desk to change rooms and were told we couldn't until noon the next day. The next day we went to the desk to request the room change. We were given a new room .. we asked if our keys to the old room would still work, because we needed to get our luggage out and we were assured they would. We went back to the old room and of course the keys didn't work. Called and asked for assistance and were told they would send security ... 20 minutes later still no security ... called again and were told they were on their way ... decided to wait in the new room. When we got to the new room we found the carpet littered with glass slivers. Called the front desk and asked for a supervisor ... who moved us to still another room. Finally and hour and a half later we were in the new room. Went to the front desk and spoke with the supervisor who said that they have issues with dirty rooms and halls all the time. We explained our frustration to her and the fact that it took us so long to get things resolved and we were not offered so much as a meal. The trays of food that had been sitting in the hall on Sunday were not removed until Wednesday, and only after we stuck a note to the wall above the tray asking for it to be moved. We have stayed at Excalibur in the past and had satisfactory stays, however, we will never again stay there or recommend it to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “went to get married”
Reviews.Author: KerryM5
Reviews.Content: very good service and clean..i would stay again. The location was convienent. didn't care for the bus service too crowded and took way too long to go about 2.5 miles.

Reviews.Title: “a Night in a Castle”
Reviews.Author: KialaRose
Reviews.Content: this hotel was nothing to write home about. it was cute and the view was gorgeous but thats all it had

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: ianblack4
Reviews.Content: I am not one for gambling but you cannot get away from it in Vegas, Freinds dragged me along and we got in the Excalibur for a weekend. Great Time and the hotel was fine. Nothing special but comfortable enough. Love the Camelot theme but theme is the name of the game in Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: PorterPig
Reviews.Content: The Excalibur looks great in pictures but is a horrilble place to stay. Our room was dirty, the sick kept backing up if someone else in the hotel flushed a toilet, there is nowhere to put anything in the shower and from the time you enter the hotel the staff are trying to sign you up for everything. There was never anyone at the front desk. I will never step foot in that hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: ClydeL
Reviews.Content: Foood was great, service was great, rooms were large clean comfy and cozy. Great value Great place definately will stay their again!

Reviews.Title: “family friendly!!!”
Reviews.Author: yesita
Reviews.Content: I went with my family last year.!Very surprised!!!.This hotel caters from families with young children to adults only.Very accomodating.Will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Old Hotel that needs to be renovated”
Reviews.Author: zoomink
Reviews.Content: The cleaning crew was awful, they left dirty cleaing rags in our room, didn't vaccuum or mop the floor. On the 2nd floor by the restaurants and shops they have a couple of kiosks with guys pushing lotion...I was literally followed and harrassed by these two guys just walking down the hall...sorry for the shops that were down there but I never went back because of these two guys. I'll go to the mall and state fair if I want to be harrassed like that, NOT a hotel. The hotel also allowed people to harrass us to go have a "talk" about condos for free shows, these people stand right by the elevators so you have to pass them several times a day to push them off.

Reviews.Title: “It's not glamorous but it's still great”
Reviews.Author: BOOBOO30
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a couple of years ago during our honeymoon and really enjoyed it so we returned again this year. It's not the flashiest hotel and it is a bit corny but the staff are fantastic, both in the hotel and the casino. We had a room in tower two over looking the strip which had an enormous television and a walk in shower. The room was nice and clean and although nicely furnished was a bit tatty around the edges. The hotel is well located for the monorail, or if you prefer to walk it right at the top of the strip so the stroll down is eye opening. Unlike some of the other casinos the Excalibur is the family friendly side although of course the little ones still can't gamble!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant low budget hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Linz87
Reviews.Content: I thought the Excalibur was a brilliant find and would definately advice friends to stay there! The rooms are fairly spacious and clean and the pool area is nice and relaxing. The food there was always good and I thoroughly enjoyed my stay there. If you're looking to stay on the Strip but you're on a budget the Excalibur is the place for you! It's located opposite New York New York, the MGM Grand and the Luxor so I don't think anyone could possibly complain about the location. Staff were very helpful and I'm happy to say I shall be staying there again this summer! Wonderful find!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: hbsprite
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on Tripadvisor, I expected this place to be a dumb. It was not and I was pleasantly surprised. Pros: 1. Price: I paid $37 per night, which you can't beat for a center strip hotel in Vegas. 2. Room cleanliness: Although the furnishings were dated, the carpet and drapes were brand new and high quality. Everything was in working order. 3. Location Location Location 4. Excalibur is a great hotel for a family with kids to stay at. Lots to do for people of all ages. Cons: 1. Resort Fee: Resort fees are total BS. the $11 per night resort fee is on the high side, but at least it included free internet access. If the Excalibur didn't charge a resort fee I would rate it 4 stars. 2. The furnishings were outdated. 3. AC is the old style, through the wall unit, without a temperature control, just a dial with numbers. 4. No exhaust fan in the bathroom. Conclusion: Definitely not luxury, but clean, comfortable accommodations. We would definitely stay here again if the price were right.

Reviews.Title: “Fun times!”
Reviews.Author: stephers11
Reviews.Content: I went to Vegas from July 1st, 2009 to July 4th, 2009 with a group of 9 girls. We went to go relax and have a good time. When we got into the hotel, we were checked into our rooms. They were ok but nothing nice. We requested to get upgraded to the other wing of the hotel that was newly renovated and got it with no problem with no additional cost. The renovated wing is MUCH nicer!! I would recommend asking for a room change!! The pool was nice and service was good. The casino grounds aren't the nicest and needs updating but you are so close to other hotels that you can walk to play elsewhere (thats the fun in vegas - checking all the hotels out!) I had an awesome time and only thing i recommend is seeing the show O and Ka and if your staying at the excalibur, request a room change if your not in the renovated wing. Besides that, no complaints! :)

Reviews.Title: “Why pay more when location is good & rooms are great”
Reviews.Author: MotherOfSeth
Reviews.Content: Booked via Excalibur's website to stay here in September-October 2009 for our first visit to Vegas. Upon arrival (a Monday evening), the queue at reception was relatively short. The sales people at the entrance try to get you to sign up for trips etc.... don't get sucked in, you will soon get used to saying "no thank you" as you are pestered with this kind of thing everywhere in Vegas. Anyway, so we were upgraded free to a widescreen room without asking, which was nice. The rooms here are great.... decent size, either 1 giant king size bed or 2 decent sized queens, walk in shower, plenty of storage space. Also our room had a table & chairs. The views weren't great, but that wasn't a problem. There is an ice machine & drinks machines on every floor. The lifts give you static shocks when you press he buttons! Ha ha. The pool area is fantastic.... several good sized pools which are always manned by life guards, free towels, pool side bar for drinks & snacks, a small shop for ice cream, sun tan lotion etc. You might not think of Vegas as a place to sunbathe, but the Excalibur certainly offers you somewhere to do that or cool off in the pool. I spent a couple of days out by the pool as I was there for 10 days so had plenty of time to do a bit of everything. Also sat out here for an hour in the morning before breakfast to read & let my hair dry! Shops on the main casino floor inside the hotel offer souvenirs, medication, snacks etc. There is also a restaurant, bar & a cake stall which is tasty. Upstairs you have McDonalds, Krispy Kreme, more souvenirs, toys, clothes, a wedding chapel.... all sorts really. This is where the moving walkway connects you to the Luxor. Downstairs there are fairground type activities & games for children, along with the Tournament Of Kings show (get tickets for this from Tix4Tonight) There is pay as you go internet access on the casino floor. 24 hours internet access in your room is about $17 if I remember correctly. The concierge desk isn't manned 24 hours a day, but the lady on there was very helpful & made phone calls, made suggestions etc for us. There is a taxi rank at the front of the hotel, where cabs are always available. The hotel is very large, so making the same long walk every day is a bit annoying, but that would be the same with any hotel, and the moving walkways make it slightly easier when your legs are tired! All in all the rooms were more than adequate, & given the small amount of time Vegas visitors spend in their room, I don't understand why anyone would spend more money to stay in a more expensive hotel when you can use the majority of the other hotels facilities anyway. It is at the end of the Strip, but still easy access to everything. It is particularly close to New York, Luxor & MGM Grand. However I wouldn't pay less to stay at the Stratosphere end of the trip. Even though the hotel is fine & is inexpensive, the money you save on your hotel you would end up spending on taxis to the main part of the Strip - it is quite a distance to the Strat. end; I walked it once & it nearly killed me! I would definitely stay here again & would recommend the Excalibur to anybody.... unless you're looking for luxury.... you won't find it here, you'll find a good priced, ideally located place to rest your head, and a fine place to stay all day if you want a hotel day.

Reviews.Title: “super bowl trip report”
Reviews.Author: wildcatfanLouisville
Reviews.Content: stayed at excalibur sat thru tue super bowl weekend. this is about my 7th time to vegas and 1st staying at excalibur. also 1st time out here for super bowl. this trip was by far the best trip i have ever had. disregard any neg reviews. asked for upgrade to wide screen room at check in, lady charged me 10 dollars more a night to upgrade. told me at the end of our stay go to vip services and they will check my players card and take the fee off and they did. Wide screen rooms are still nothing but a holiday inn room but with updated looks. Bathroom sink was very nice, about 6 feet wide, lots of room for all my wifes stuff Room had a big stand up shower too, very nice. Casino floor was very lively. Never really gambled in the party pit, this is where the go go dancers are. Party pit area is for the young ones as the girls do dress very very skimpy. Is very much like a strip club atmoshere, but still very fun. Did not eat at any of the restaurants here, but did frequent the food court on the 2nd floor. Perfect for on the go. Watched the super bowl at the sports book here. Had a blast. Not the best sports book, but still very good time. Location okay. dont bother taking the monorail, cost 4 of us 20 dollars one way to get down to harrahs via mgm grand. only 15 to get back by cab. Drinks are very expensive if not gambling. 6 dollars for a bud light bottle Sports book did sell buckets of 5 during the game for 20, not too bad. dealers here were very nice as was the hotel staff. did not get to check out the pool area. Wil most likely stay here again next time we come back.which will be quite awhile, was here in oct and stayed at the mirage. Will say that the reviews about cigarette smoking are spot on, can be over welming at times for us non smokers, although the. air was better here than at the mirage. Got a great deal on hotel/air combo thru southwest airlines. If you come across a great deal and are looking at staying here, dont hesitate, what a deal.

Reviews.Title: “On the strip, good price & slept well”
Reviews.Author: RowenaH
Reviews.Content: Hi, Las Vegas was our first to last destination, so we we're a bit tired already and really looking forward to a nice room and a good night sleep. Excalibur provided exactly that. A nice room, with a nice view, clean, rather spacious and a nice bed. Although it was clean the shower was a little calcified. But it worked so wasn't really bothered by it. The location of the hotel was great. Just at the beginning of the strip. So from there you can just walk all the way down and back again. Good work out too ;-). And when you walk back up to the hotel it looks amazing, especially at night. In general there was nothing really bad about it and also nothing exceptionally good. This is really the type hotel which just gives you good value for your money and a pleasant stay. Hope you enjoy as well. Rowena

Reviews.Title: “Just Fine”
Reviews.Author: rybass03
Reviews.Content: When you go to Vegas it's just like anything else, you get what you pay for and you can pay a lot or a little. I have now stayed at the Excalibur twice in the last few years, and I would stay there again for two reasons. It's cheap and it's in an excellent location. Hotel: If you're going for extravagance or ellegance this is not the place for you. If you're going to have a place to throw your stuff down, have a shower, and a little bit of sleep while partying in Vegas, then this place is for you. The rooms are much like Holiday Inn quality. The hotel itself is always crowded and a bit loud. The only other problem is that at this hotel you will see A LOT of children running around. I understand that not everyone can get a babysitter, but Vegas is not for children and I'll never understand why parents think it's ok to bring them with them to America's Adult Playground. The hotel is in an excellent location right in the middle of everything on the north part of the strip. Drinks: Drinks here are good as long as you're playing. Sometimes takes a while for them to get around but you'll get quite a few playing at a 5 dollar table. The drinks in the Sportsbook are even better, but you have to be betting a lot more for the constant service (100 dollars bet earns one drink coupon). Entertainment: They usually have a band playing at nights with some go-go type dancers dancing on top of tables and slot machines. Nice to look at, but terribly distracting while you're playing some blackjack which is exactly how they like it! Bottom line is this is a fine hotel for the money. Would I rather stay in a nicer room? Sure. Would I rather stay someplace with great service and no children? Absolutely. But if you can save 100 bucks+ per night by staying here and go have some nice dinners and extra gambling money then why not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “viva las vegas”
Reviews.Author: pip8686
Reviews.Content: we satyed at this hotel for 10 nights the first night we stayed in a standed room but asked to upgrade which we could not do as it was laborday thay said we could do it the next day and true to there word we did we got a discount as we were staying for 10 days we upgraded to a jacuzie suite which i would recomend you get o 2 person jacuzie in your room we all so had a veiw of the strip which was nice the pool has been re done this is are second stay at this hotel i woul not recomend the bufet restarant in this hotel but would recomend if you go to vegas to go to the mgm grand buffet it the best i have ever been to

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly satisfied.”
Reviews.Author: milk1shake
Reviews.Content: At the price, I wasn't expecting 5-star. That said, I was very pleased with my entire experience. I was in town for business and stayed 3 nights. I would expect the numerous negative reviews I read about Excalibur prior to traveling were written by people who turn their nose up regardless. At $62 for two nights, and $109 for Friday, it was great. Casino was huge and any game you looked for was available. There was plenty of live music, and it was a very fun environment. The restaurants were very good, and the Camelot Steakhouse was excellent. My contact with hotel staff was a very good experience. No complaints at all. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location bit tired”
Reviews.Author: garden3129
Reviews.Content: Hi , stayed at Excalibur with husband, kid (9 & 4), mother and mother in-law. Had no trouble checking in received connecting rooms as requested through Expedia. The room was large enough and the beds and pillows very comfy. The bed linen and towels were very clean, The bathroom was also clean enough. I did feel as though the surfaces were a little dusty and the walls were quite marked. I think that the rooms get a lot of use. One complaint that I will make regarding cleanliness is that some one had left a childs drink in the in room safe. We removed it but it must have spilled and soaked into the safe lining, as a result our passports stink like off milk.- who does that? The hotel it self is in a good location with a walk way to New York New York . You can walk all the way through Luxor to Mandalay Bay without going outside, which was good for us as it was raining and quite cold. I felt that the hotel/casino was a little tired in comparison to the other casiono/hotels. Although it was fine and the room rate was great I would probably look at staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Go!”
Reviews.Author: Indytamato
Reviews.Content: If I ever plan a trip to Las Vegas again I would rather sleep in the streets than spend a minute in this hotel. Filthy dirty smelly Ghetto Hotel - Horrible service - I was there for 5 days gambling in their casino and was never approached by the wait staff for a beverage. At one point one of the slot machines broke open and slammed down on my legs I was still not offered a drink or even asked if I was OK! Can you imagine? You should see the bruises. Every time you walk through the casino you are approached by some one for a 'free' show ... free my butt - you gotta sit through some time share super sale in order to get the 'free' show. Heck I saw the time share people more than the wait staff! My sister planned her wedding and brought in a party of 18-20 people, around 10 rooms. You'd think they would have upgraded her and her future husband to a suite, no charge . .. nope they didn't. Terrible customer service. And talk about expensive nasty food. I ordered Apple Dippers from McDonalds they come with MOLD for FREE! - the only bargan offered in this hotel. Mold, and lots of it ... in the food, bathroom, stinky moldy carpets around the elevator. The place is gross!

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming, good location, great room and staff; clean acommodations”
Reviews.Author: PJ-Denver
Reviews.Content: Started out booking at Gold Coast and when we got there realized it was a huge mistake, snooty staff, not very accommodating. Called Excalibur and they were wonderful. Got there and didn't have to wait around for anything. Asked if we could check in upon arrival, even though it was not "check in time", and they were great - "Sure, go on up!" They acted like they wanted our business, and so they got it. Room was very nice, clean, plenty of room, great TV selection. Was a little shocked at the room service cost, both other than that, it was perfect in every way. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. Perfectly located at the south end of the Vegas strip, closest to the airport as well, which is a 10 minute ride from Excalibur. Ironically, I stayed at the Glastonbury Abbey Retreat House in June, with the ruins behind us that had THE King Arthur's original gravesite there...and then a month later there we were at the Excalibur.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel & Room Abhorrent, Service Deplorable!”
Reviews.Author: RunningBearTexas
Reviews.Content: The registration desk backs to the smokey, dingy, stinky casino so the half hour that it took to get through the check in process (yes, we did have reservations) we were breathing filthy air. Everything we were carrying now stinks of smoke. The bedspreads in the room were ratty. The bathroom had only a shower, no tub, and there was a prior guest's trash on the top rail of the shower inclosure. The sink was spotted with who-knows-what. And the tiles in the shower were scummy. The wall-unit heater was so old it blew out smoke-stinky air even thought the room was considered non-smoking. The "pop-corn" ceiling, old wall paper and who-knows-how-old carpet still reaked of smoke from the days when the hotel didn't have non-smoking rooms. Because the heater was intollerable we requested extra blankets. Called housekeeping. Waited 40 minutes. Called again... were promised that they'd rush extra blankets to our room... and were still waiting on the blankets when we checked out 11 hours later. We slept in our smoke-smelling coats. Even though we couldn't run our heater, our neighbors did... and the rattling & thumping sounds kept us awake half the night.

Reviews.Title: “Royal treatment spa”
Reviews.Author: swdesertrat
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I go to Vegas every 12-18 months and always go the Excalibur's spa. It's clean and efficient and the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the amount you pay!”
Reviews.Author: cheekee
Reviews.Content: It's an average hotel room. We stayed in Tower 1, on the 27th floor. The view of the strip was incredible!! The rooms were in decent condition. Apparently there were some renovated rooms, and I can't say our room was renovated. There were a few down side to the room, which were: the bathroom doesn't have a fan. There is a weird device with a flick switch behind the door -- but it was placed quite high, so I never got to flick the switch to see what it was. So, because there wasn't a "noticable" fan in the bathroom, the room got steamed up as we came out of the shower! Also, the room condition wasn't that great, but it wasn't enough to bother me too badly. The wallpaper was peeling by the window, and inside the light fixtures was stained. It was kind of gross, but you just don't look there. So, if you're staying for a short trip on a budget -- and don't plan to be in the room too much, it's a great hotel! The sheets and towels were clean, and sometimes, that's all that matters.

Reviews.Title: “What view?”
Reviews.Author: David87
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Las Vegas. Read up lots of reviews about Excalibur. All in all the casino was grubby looking compared to other hotel casinos. We tried to charm the reception into giving us a room with a nice view - well we had a view of the Luxor. Is that it? We thought we;d get rooms with a view of the strip. Location was ok, and rooms were clean. But next time I;d rather stay near the Mirage, where there are more affordable things to do.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: AgentXman
Reviews.Content: Hotel needs to be cleaned. trash was every where and in the elevator I saw the same trash for 12 hours and staff would not pick it up. Saw vomit in the hallway and the guy cleaning it told me that it happens all the time. We stayed in tower 2 and the room was clean and cozy. There is a mix of young 20ish crowd and kids every where. Tournament of kings was a great show and for 50 pp with food not a bad price. Slot machines did not pay out like they should.

Reviews.Title: “basic rooms”
Reviews.Author: auks
Reviews.Content: stayed 4 nights in smoking room whole wing and rooms stunk of a damp smokey smell and thats coming from a smoker.If you stay go non smoking as the non smoking wing is much better maintained,or better still stay else where were smoking areas are maintained, I pride myself on never spending money again on any hotel ,airport ,bar or restuarant that dosen,t attempt to cater to smokers if all smokers follow this policy we will make a financial statement world wide(have no problem with smoke free areas but will not be down trodden as a smoker)Room has no tea and coffee or fridge.Good casino area nice pool and plenty of food courts entertainment and restaurants,easy access to other casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Great view of the freeway”
Reviews.Author: VIVAHUME
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying in a themed Vegas hotel (first time in Vegas period for me) so there´s not too much to compare it too. So in a nutshell, we were there on a timeshare pitch and they were initially going to stick us on the ground floor, we paid the few extra bucks to get moved up and were glad we did. The room appeared to be recently renovated and was nice enough for me. Big screen TV, minibar, nice shower, bathroom - no balcony. We had a room that overlooked the freeway and the pool in the back. We liked the location, even though it is basically and the end of the strip. That being said, they offer a shuttle service to both the Luxor and Mandalay Bay (which are all owned by the same group). You can also cut across to the MGM and jump on the train that runs the length of the strip. Your right across the street from New York, New York, MGM Grand and Tropicana. The food is food and the drinks are drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Bachelorette Party”
Reviews.Author: Duyen
Reviews.Content: Went to Vegas in Jan 2010 for a Bachelorette Party. Stayed at Excalibur w/ the Bachelorette Party package. We got tickets to CatHouse nightclub, drink coupons, casino coupons, and 2 for 1 discounts to Thunder down Under. We were able to have 6 people stay in the room without "additional guest" charges. A very good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Cedarburg_WI
Reviews.Content: After having read some of the not-so-flattering reviews, we were a little leery of staying at the Excalibur again. Have not stayed here since 2001. This time our visit was from 1/24/10 to 1/27/10 and we were pleased to see Excalibur is still a great value and a comfortable, fun place to stay. Our very spacious room was on the 24th floor in tower one and had a beautiful view. The beds and pillows were especially comfortable. The lovely woman at check-in was warm and welcoming and we used the in-room check-out without problem. The time-share people only approached us while we were walking...... NEVER approached us while we were playing a slot. A simple "No thank you" and we were not pursued. The vendors in the walkway between Excalibur and Luxor were a little more persistant. There are plenty of places to eat for all budgets including a $29.00 all-day-buffet. And the location can't be beat if you want variety without having to walk far. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “WideScreen Deluxe View Room”
Reviews.Author: sharper10be4
Reviews.Content: I definitely recommend if you're looking for a place that's affordable, nice-looking, and extremely clean. Its not fancy but you shouldn't expect anything super crazy anyway for the price. The hotel is in a great location on the south end of the strip.The King sized bed was comfy, the room was fresh smelling and a very good size. The room had an AMAZING View, a 42 inch plasma, and nice marble and chrome features in the bathroom. Honestly we barely slept while we were in Vegas, so it was kind of just a place to take showers in and nap for 2-3 hours a night. The restaurants weren't very appealing we didn't eat at any of them. I will stay somewhere different when I go back to Vegas but it's only because I like to try new things. I would recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “i did not like it at all.”
Reviews.Author: sher2010
Reviews.Content: the way they treat guests was awful, the bar tendersand staff were so rude.

Reviews.Title: “Keep in mind it's not a 5 star, and you'll have a great time”
Reviews.Author: alison915
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to last Vegas 1/21-1/24 - before leaving, I was reading ratings of the Excalibur and started to get a bit nervous about what we saw. 1. The hotel casino did not have an overwhelming smell of old cigarettes. This is Las Vegas - expect it to smell like cigarettes. But, the smell in this casino was NO different than ANY other casino we visited. 2. There were no ants in our room and our sheets were clean. (Just wanted to clear things up with anyone else reading these reviews - maybe that will put them at ease) We stayed on the 14th floor and the wait for the elevators was fine, nothing outrageous. 3. Yes, the daily hotel fee was annoying because we didn't use the gym and we didn't use the internet. Initially, I expected us to get 2 free drinks per day. It turns out the fee only includes ONLY 2 free drink tickets (well drinks, beer or a $5 drink coupon). All-in-all we had a great time, the hotel was great - one of the best locations on the strip. If you have high expectations for any hotel you stay in, then this is probably not the hotel for you. But, if you realize that this isn't a 5-star hotel, and you just want to have a great time, Excalibur is definitely a great choice. Plus, how much time do you actually stay in your room? I mean, this is Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “No Thanks”
Reviews.Author: turnonelectric
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked our room through Expedia. When we arrived from the airport we were greeted with a very rude baggage handler that was complaining that no one was tipping him. We were assigned our room and off we went. Our room was on the first floor, first room of the "old" towers. The smell of smoke was so overpowering that it was gagging. Our view was of the parking lot and people walking by waived as I had to have our window open at all times due to the smell. There were crickets in our room that never and I mean ever shut up. The fan in the bathroom was noisy and didn't work well. My husband screamed like a school girl one morning as he swears a cockroach came skittering by his feet. The timeshare personal were so annoying that we didn't want to even go through the lobby until aftet 10pm. At checkout time the lady was a cranky lady who actually held her hand up (oh no you didn't) as if to tell us to stop talking before we ever said a word. We had family staying in the other tower and they had a beautiful, clean room and paid a better rate. What gives? I do compliment the security, they were very friendly and way more helpful than any other staff member.

Reviews.Title: “No No No”
Reviews.Author: b4nafter
Reviews.Content: Went for CHEAP and got cheap, with this place you really get what you pay for. Stuff on wall behind bed??????? Dingy room and bedding, backed up shower drain, low low water pressure. Would rather not go if I had to stay here again. I explained issues to front desk, they were sorry but did nothing about it. I think complaints are common to them.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Place”
Reviews.Author: Mimibest
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my recent stay at Excalibur. The rooms and bathrooms are large and comfortable. I did notice that the dressers were not dusted on the tops or the ledges on the drawers. Otherwise the room seemed clean and the beds were comfortable. I like the walkways to the Luxor and New York New York. The food at the buffet was good and the price for the all day buffet was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you are on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: jenniferlauren284
Reviews.Content: It's a very fair price...I believe we only paid 30 dollars a night and the hotel has a lot of cool shows in it along with a nice food court, few resteraunts, shops, and a nice big casino. The rooms could use an upgrade...for example the water pressure in the shower wasn't too good but there was hot water at least. The walls are paper thin too. The service is great though...When we got there our safe didn't work and we called the front desk and sent someone up immediately to fix it. Our neighbors also forgot to turn off their alarm and we called security and they came up immediately to turn it off. I was very impressed with the sense of urgency. Its a great value however...it is at the end of the strip which makes for a long walk to shows. If it's your first time to vegas I would highly recommend staying in the center of the strip where most stuff happens.

Reviews.Title: “bad start”
Reviews.Author: travelguy71
Reviews.Content: okay - will update after trip - say what you say, will be there for a week end of february til first week of march. Although get a load of this will be will family member and told heart felt story why going and ask for price of 2 bedroom room for privacy and understandable reasons. Recieve lame reply 4 days later and said call us and will give prices. Sorry but the hotel should have prices for upgrades available and should of been more passionate about situation - I know this is vegas and its all about money. sorry excalibur wasen't looking for comp upgrade just some class and diginity - expecting too much I guess. funny thing only people reading this are potentional guest too bad for me - but good you you. Know one thing in the previous 4 visit to vegas - luxor - class all the way even for the normal guest (non high roller that is)- treat you right form the moment you step in to checking out, keep in mind.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, casino and hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lemonaidan
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews on here we were a little nervous about staying at the Excalibur, but we are so glad we did! It's considerably cheaper than all the other hotels on the strip and it's such a great location. Everyone was friendly, the room was clean, and the casino was great. Yes the rooms are decorated a little tacky, but really who cares? We're already planning on staying here when we go back! Who doesn't want to stay in a castle!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location- thats the best thing about it.”
Reviews.Author: PartimeHolidaymaker
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on 10-15/01/2010. Booked it as a slight up-grade from Circus Circus (which I am glad we did!), it lies about a 10- 15 minute taxi ride form the airport. The size of this place is `awesome`- some 4000 rooms. At reception we tried the old $20 `free room upgrade trick`. The staff member was slightly offended by this, refused the cash and gave us a slight upgrade anyway, although I would not like to have seen the un up-graded room! For USA, our room was quite big with a massive king size bed and large shower, 40"-ish flat screen TV free safe etc.- more than adequate for our short stay. The room was quite clean but a bit jaded. Not that we were in the room much anyway. The massive casino area was a cacophony of noise - hundreds of mostly loud Americans shouting and screaming, different live music groups in different eating areas in the casino. And everyone seemed to be trying to outdo each other on the decibel stakes! Don't go expecting to win big style- we didn't see any big wins in our time there. The hotel is an a great location, at the junction of Las Vegas Boulevard (the strip) and Tropicana avenue- the best location in the place, I would say. The best way to get about is the local bus service, the deuce. $7 a day or $3 for a single trip, it covered the whole strip and more. DON`T get a Las Vegas sight seeing bus tour- $35 each fr a 2 day ticket that just covers the main strip area- a waste of money. Best shopping area in Vegas- The Outlet Centre, at the SOUTH end of Las Vegas Boulevard- get to it via the bus. Discount designer shopping in a massive mall. There is also a Premium outlet Centre at the north end of town- harder to get to and I would say 20% dearer fro the same brands. Best trip to do- visit the Grand Canyon/ Hoover dam- they are building a new road that avoids the Hoover dam so go soon or you wont get a chance to see it up close, due to Americas preoccupation about the terrorism threat. We went on a bus trip to see these awesome sights- a long day but well worth it. make sure you are well rested before you set off because you will be wrecked by the time you leave - and that's just from the shopping! NB- one play in the hotel complex to avoid- the `Sham of the Strip` restaurant- some marketing person came up with the clever idea of having a place were the staff verbally abuse you, throw things at you, curse at you etc and think this is good fun. Also they play music at such a high level you have to point at things to make yourself understood. And they think its a cool place. Go and see yourself! Its the pits, man!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not Kid Safe At All”
Reviews.Author: PahrumpMike
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Excalibur the weekend before Christmas with my wife and kids, it was a small staycation since we live 60 miles away. I was shocked at the highly suggestive atmosphere of this formerly kid-friendly hotel-casino. Male strippers were dressed as Santa's helper and set up by the front entrance, with open shirts, offering people the opportunity to have their picture taken with them on Santa's sleigh. Meanwhile a female exotic dancer was dressed in a skimpy Christmas outfit on a table nearby. I am far from a prude. But seriously, this used to be the top place, along with Circus Circus, for families to visit. It still has an elaborae midway and Spongebob ride. But it isn't appropriate at all for kids. Also the place was dusty, I had a little fun writing Clean Me on a table in the hallway that hadn't been dusted in what must have been weeks. I will say that the buffet was better than I remember it as being a long time ago, above average or even better.

Reviews.Title: “motel 6 of vegas”
Reviews.Author: sparkyIndy
Reviews.Content: Staff was rude, no one ever came to unlock the safe in our rooms , even after being asked twice, said it would be 20 minutes , 5 days later NOTHING, showers in some of rooms had low water pressure , some had almost warm water . the front desk lady was even rude about check out !!!!, no, thank you ,didn't ask if everything was ok ? we are planning next years trip already and it will not be even close to the Excalibur NO thanks almost forgot, Internet service is not WiFi it is wired and is $13.99 A DAY

Reviews.Title: “Viva Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: tdotchickie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a 5 day CHEAP getaway with 3 girlfriends last year (all in our mid 20's). Overall for the price we paid, It exceeded our expectations. The rooms were kind of ugly (we were in the older rooms), but we were never in the rooms so we didnt care. There were lots of places to eat in the food court (good if youre on a budget!) The pool area was awesome. There were cocktail servers who come right to your lounge chair so you dont need to get up! Also, all single ladies must see Thunder from Down Under...it won't dissapoint! One downfall is location. It is all the way at the end of the strip so if you dont mind the walk this is the place for you!. (There is also a bus that will take you up and down the strip, we never used it though)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and great Food Court”
Reviews.Author: Alohanuiloa
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in different hotels in Las Vegas. At this one I had a very nice stay. Although it was really full I had no problems whatsoever. Staff was kind and helpful. Room and bathroom very large, clean, comfortable, facing the Luxor Hotel. Its Food court is nice, as it has many choices especially for those with a tight budget : MacDonalds 24/7, Quiznos, Auntie Annie Pretzels, Cold Stone Ice Cream) besides 2 nice restaurants, a nice buffet for breakfast, lunch and dinner and one Baja Fresh. The pool area is immense, with maybe 3 pools and hot tubes and a very nice Spa and Gym. I was there for the New Year and it was a very nice experience. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the deal, but could use some clean-up”
Reviews.Author: cupper3
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Vegas and only went because of my son's wedding. The Excalibur had a great deal on at $28 (plus a ridiculous 9.95 "resort fee" add-on) rate. At the price I paid, I can not complain. The room was clean, had a large flat screen TV, large clean and looked like it may have been updated bathroom. The hallways, elevator and waiting areas were not clean, and when I first went up to my room I raised my eyebrows and wondered if I was going to a Motel 6. All in all, for the price I would go back. I would not pay any sort of premium to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Go Somewhere Else!”
Reviews.Author: Shannonp252
Reviews.Content: Room was dirty, shower was really moldy. Staff were rude and not helpful whats so ever. The casino was even dirty and most of the machines were broken. The only good part of this hotel was the restaurant in the lobby 'Dick's Last Resort' the staff there were fun and the food was good. I wont stay at this hotel again, so run down and you just get that constant icky feeling when you are in it.

Reviews.Title: “2-star hotel...no more”
Reviews.Author: TravelBudMontreal
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a leisure/tradeshow trip and stayed at Bally's and Excalibur. What a difference between the two. I would recommend Bally's if you're looking for a decent 3-star hotel but not the Excalibur. Bally's is also much better situated (center strip). Excalibur is pretty dumpy and the casino is VERY smoky. I have to say, however, that our room was very clean and the bed extremely comfortable. But the rest wass loud and smelly. We stayed here because we had won the trip, but would never stay there again. You're better off booking the Luxor (right next door)...reasonably price, MUCH nicer and a great casino that doesn't stink. Tip: Get 50% OFF show tickets across the street at "Tix 4 Tonight" next to M&M World.

Reviews.Title: “Smokers everywhere”
Reviews.Author: CANadvisor
Reviews.Content: My main complaint is the casino floor was full of smokers. I could not stay and gamble. I found a casino in another hotel with less smoke. The smoke also drifted into the Sherwood forrest restaurant next to the casino.Even in the elevator and some corridors people were smoking even though they were not supposed to be. Room 4119 in Tower 1 had a mechanical noise all night which kept me awake. The best part of this hotel is outside....nice pool and patio areas and a very nice spa facility and gym. $10 for the gym / spa if you are staying in the hotel. I submitted comments in the comment box at reception but over a month has passed and I have never heard from Excalibur.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: PhilaVT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Excalibur for the week of Jan 4-8. We could not have been happier with our choice! We paid for the upgrade to Tower 2, which for an extra $20 per night is definitely worth it. Room was very clean and quiet, and we had a beautiful view of the pool and the mountains which we thought was nicer than the strip view anyway. The tub could have used a little updating, but it was clean and did the job for us. Large granite countertop sink area that was large enough for all our toiletries. We stayed on floor 22 at the far end away from the elevators, which added a little walking but was very quiet due to the fact that we did not have people walking back and forth by our room at all hours of the day. Housekeeping was very efficient. The only compaint we had about the room was that there was no fridge and no coffee maker, but this seems to be standard these days in Vegas. We cannot understand people who complain about the resort fee. For $10 a day, you get internet, access to a beautiful new gym, as well as access to the pool and hot tub, which were clean. This is one of the only pools that was open in Vegas this time of year and for us Easterners 60 degrees in the sun feels pretty nice! Water in the pool was warm, and the hot tub was relaxing...we had bothpretty much to ourselves the whole time due to the facct that there are TWO pools and one of which is only for guests over the age of 18. Pool hours wereshort (10-5) but once it gets dark it would be too cold anyway. The $10 (for two people) we spent for this per day was one of the best values of the trip. Another common complaint on here is about the timeshare people. Yes, they will constantly try to stop you to give you their pitch (and they are EVERYWHERE not just in this hotel but every hotel on the strip!), but I found a very easy way to get them to quit on you immediately. As soon as they approach you tell them that you live in Las Vegas and they will stop in their tracks and leave you alone! This worked us the whole week and it is an easy, polite way to get them to back off. The location is the best on the strip in my opinion...and I have stayed in every part of it. there are moving walkways to get you to Luxor, Mandalay Bay and NY NY. The MGM is right across the street, as well as the Tropicana. Their is a lot of walking involved no matter where you stay if you want to save money on cabs, but we did not find this to be an issue as there is always so much to look at. The new City Center is a must see, and it is about a 10 minute walk from Excalibur. The casino was a little dated, but was fine for us. I won more money on slots than I did at any other hotel, and the table games were cheap ($5 minimums) and easy to get in on. I encounted one rude pit boss, but other than that the people were great and we were never waiting for drinks...in fact, most of the time my drink was only half empty and they were right there asking me if wanted another one! One last tip...if you can, get a late afternoon flight and ask for the late 3PM check out option. This will save you the hassle of a HUGE line to get a taxi in the morning! Also try to check in early as you will be waiting in a long line if you get there at 3 PM like everyone else. I tried the $20 trick here when I checked in to see if I could get an upgrade and it did not work. Overall we were thrilled with the value of this hotel, and although I never stay in the same place when I go to Vegas, I would certainly consider staying here again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Value on the strip”
Reviews.Author: qldr54
Reviews.Content: Family holiday in December we decided to take a cheap option and a $22 a night deal at Excalibur. Could not ask for more, great location, free parking , clean rooms and good daily service. Started with reception giving us vouchers for free drinks and other discounts, did not even use all the free drinks because drinks were brought to us continuously when gambling in the casino. Plenty of food options but some advice would be to get your show tickets at the half price places not through the hotel, saves you plenty. Great value at this end of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: yellow77
Reviews.Content: Got there had upgraded to flat screen room and the tv was broken. Called the front desk and it forever to get the repair guy up there. Then he couldn't fix it right away. Called the desk to get a different room was told none were available. Went down talked to a manager who put us in a much smaller room then the first one and offered no other discount. At least the tv worked. Someone had used the bathroom and not flushed. Was to tired to continue to complain. Overall room was noisy and dirty and bed was hard. Had a nice view. Rooms are not very newly remodeled like they say, but the base rooms are even worse. My family stayed in them and there was really not alot of difference. Wont stay at excallaber again.

Reviews.Title: “Agreat getaway!”
Reviews.Author: oilers8389
Reviews.Content: First things first, if you want a 5 star hotel stay at a 5 star hotel. We got a great deal on the Excalibur and stayed 3 nights. We stayed in a regular room on the 3rd floor, the floor was non smoking and smelled very fresh and clean the entire time. We don't go to Vegas to spend time in the room so we were very happy with the room as we pretty much just slept and showered there. The room was very spacious and perfect for what we needed. Very comfy bed and the room was very fresh smelling as well. Yes this hotel is dated but as I stated if you need fancy then pay the extra and stay somewhere fancy. The front desk staff were friendly, the luggage holding guys were friendly, any staff that we were in contact with were friendly. We checked in on a Saturday at the peek time and waited about 5 minutes in line. A buck or two here and there goes a long ways for the baggage guys and the housekeeping always. We spent an afternoon at the pool, yes the hours are terrible but a lot of the Vegas pools are that way. They want you inside the casino! The pool was great, still swimmable even in Jan....the hot tub was great too. We didn't use the gym but it was one of the nicest fitness centres I've seen at a hotel and that includes 5 star hotels.The timeshare people just crack me up every time we go, but if you are going to Vegas you cannot avoid them. Just say no or ignore them or whatever and they don't really bother you. "You in town tonight" Nope! Then be on your way. Location is great, right next door to New York New York and about 10-15 minutes from the heart of strip.
