FOOD: I do not recommend the Sherwood Cafe, take the 5 minute walk to New York New York and eat at "America" if you are looking for breakfast or lunch type food. Much better food and service, and a bit cheaper even! I've stayed at 4 different hotels in vegas and this was my favorite especially for the location. All in all if you are looking for an inexpensive place to stay and sleep and you aren't expecting to be pampered, this is your place!!

Reviews.Title: “beware!”
Reviews.Author: oc714
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekend, overall the casino/hotel was very average with the room (standard) very below average- we had a broken iron board, the furniture was outdated and appeared very worn. I would strongly encourage to stay away unless you are planning on not staying in a standard room, there are definitely nicer places to stay on the strip which don’t cost a whole lot more. In addition, the hotel had some of the worst customer service I have ever experienced, ironically the nicest person was someone who helped load our luggage in a taxi on our way back to the airport. You could tell the people working there didn't really like their jobs..

Reviews.Title: “Hotel did not live up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: irish5969
Reviews.Content: Just back from vegas after 5 nights staying at the Excalibur. When I booked I had great expectations of this hotel after reading reviews but I have to say that I was very disapointed. We were allocated a standard room which initially was fine, I didnt expect a grand room but I did expect cleanliness! on entering our room there was a musty smell and the decor was very dated, it was like stepping back in time to the 1970's! I then discovered that there was what looked like a blood stain on the main throw over one of the beds, at this point my partner and I were so exhausted that we chose to ignore this and put up with things. Also the last day the toilet didnt flush and when we complained to reception it took over 2 hours to get someone to come and fix it. The last straw was when we checked out and they charged $48-00 for a 5 minute phone call back to the UK, now I was aware that phoning from the room to an international number would most likely be a little bit more expensive but this was ridiculous! when I complained they just didnt want to know and were very rude, I tried to explain that there was no details of phone charges in the room but my plea's fell on deaf ears. My advice to anyone thinking of staying here, go elsewhere! there are much nicer hotels around this price range in vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price!”
Reviews.Author: bunjies
Reviews.Content: We did not expect much considering we got a super cheap plane/hotel deal but we were surprised! Location: It's right on the strip, near by the action, which you can either walk (its alot of walking as each hotel is like a mile long) or we opted for the 2-day (35$) hop-on hop-off bus. You get great views and are able to be in the action Room: When i asked for a room with Double-queen beds they ended giving me a free upgrade to a widescreen room. It was fairly spacious (we would have liked a bit more counter space for our luggage) comfortable beds, granite counters and a nice large bathroom! (No bath though.) The room is pretty quiet, we only heard the hallway ruckus a bit, but we were expecting noise in Vegas. Room Service is $$$$$$$, but it always is. We ordered in Pizza from Dominoes for way cheaper. Service: When we arrived we were a little discouraged at the length of the check-in line but it went by very quickly and the person at the counter was extremely courteous and was pleased to answer our questions and accommodate our needs (He even gave us a free room upgrade! ). One night there was a drunk person (When in Vegas.. ) trying to get in our room (probably thought it was his) and after over 5minutes of him jiggling the handle and body slamming the door i called security; who were amazingly efficient "Were on our way up" and not even a minute later -- Silence. I couldn't see anything that had happened tho as the door's magic eye is placed too high. The internet was pricey, there was 19 TV channels of which 4 are vegas/hotel ads but we spent very little time in the room. We took the 29$ all day buffet thing, its great for the fact that you can just pop in and have a glass of soda.. But we had to stay near the hotel. The food varies from meal to meal (although alot of repeats from supper to lunch) We were SO excited to find out the pool was open in January, it's one of the only hotels in which it is, and for easterners like us pool time in Jan. is golden. The water was nice and warm (82-84°F) and the hot tubs felt divine one a day of walking. Careful tho very restricted hours (10-5) As all hotels, streets and anywhere you go, Yes the little show/prostitute/.. sellers are quite the annoyance. But they're everywhere so don't think you'll avoid them by changing hotels or area. Lastly, Try the Coldstone Creamery in the hotel its a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: MrsSteede
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for its price and location and got just what we wanted. We flew to Vegas to get married but had a few problems getting there our flight was cancelled so we missed the first night of our stay here. When we arrived the next morning tired, stressed and frustrated the staff at reception put us at ease they arranged our room very quickly. When we asked they gave us advice on how best to get to the marriage office and directions including estimated taxi prices. We ate in the hotel a few times and I cant fault the food but it was busy. The location of this hotel is the best thing about it though its right on the strip and although at one end its easy to go anywhere from here. We also saw the tournament of kings show I fully recommend it we had a great night there.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre hotel, very smokey and noisy.”
Reviews.Author: BennyDoran
Reviews.Content: Rooms OK, but constant smell of cigarettes wherever you go in the hotel, and casino was probably the smokiest I had encountered. Free parking and internet a plus. Avoid valet parking at all costs, as a wait of 40 minutes in the moring to get your car is not uncommon. Parking lots are huge, so park your car yourself. Lots of restaurants and bars on-site and no shortage of things to do. I stayed in one of the tower 2 widescreen rooms, that apparently have been renovated recently, and have no real complaints about the rooms, although as seems to be the norm with American hotels these days, the walls offer no resistance to hallway noise, and if a door is closed anywhere on your floor, the noise is very loud indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Great family Hotel--super arcade/carnival games!”
Reviews.Author: SanFernandoCAStacy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my 11 yr. old daughter on a monday night. We had the cheapest deal, it came to $42.00 with the resort fee. We were on the 25th floor, I forget what tower, it overlooked the strip, although the Excalibur is so far south on the strip, there is not much to look at. Good view of the Tropicana and the airport. The resort fee includes internet access, two free drinks an two free arcade games. I took my daughter down to the arcade and she used her coupons to play oneof the carnival games, the one where you throw darts at balloons, she hit the balloons and got a small stuffed animal. I saw a sign there about guanranteed prize for young kids. They have skee ball and video games, but also lots of carnival games like you see at the county fair. They normally cost $1.00 each to play, but I was told that on Tuesdays, these games are 1/2 price, 50 cents to play. The room was nice, big and clean. Two beds. ONe funny thing was, the bathroom was big, I think they must have had to make them wheel chair compliant, anyway, my daughter couldn't reach the toilet paper from the toilet. (It is hanging off the counter) I didn't believe her at first, but then I was laughing because it was so funny. So, heads up, those with small children, put a roll near the toilet. We took the tram over to the Luxor and saw the Titanic Exhibit. We did not go to the Tournament of Kings show at the Excalibur because we have something similar here in Los Angeles, but that is a fun show if you have never done it before. I don't like eating the food with my hands though, I would ask for silverware or bring my own. The Tropicana is just across the street, and we have seen the magic show there before "Xtreme Magic" with Magician Dirk Arthur. He has big Tigers, and they are very up close. It's a good show and you can get it pretty cheap thru Tix4tonight. I would recommend for families with kids to stay at the Excalibur and see the "Tournament of Kings" and "Dirk Arthur-"Extreme Magic".

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: AshleyG2
Reviews.Content: Hotel rocks! Cool wizard/dragon fight out front every hour

Reviews.Title: “Sight seeing in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: MatkaajaSuomi
Reviews.Content: We were travelling in the west with my family and stayed 3 nights in Excalibur. It was a convenient location to see Las Vegas. The hotel was huge and we felt like pieces in a big process. But the room was great and that was the most important factor. And the price! What a deal!

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: glendro
Reviews.Content: While we liked the hotel, The valet service really sucked. Out of all the Hotels. This was the slowest ever. It always seemed we was waiting what felt like forever to either get out of our car or to pickup our car. Ever night it was full. Which i guess means good businness for them. Then our bedspreads smelled really bad, like they needed washed. But we slept really good. We did enjoy the hotel alot. They have affordable dinning. Just remember to ask questions about where your room is located. The hallways are very long once you get off the elevators. The hotel is in a very good spot. ALL & ALL WE REALLY DID HAVE A GREAT TIME AT THE HOTEL AND VEGAS...WILL GO BACK TO THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “5th trip to vegas”
Reviews.Author: Gooood1
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in the best location on the strip,close to everything.the pool is great and clean with an adult only area (fantastic)when you think its party central we had a good nights sleep for my entire stay.will be going back in september this year, never get bored of vegas or this hotel.......

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel, out dated room”
Reviews.Author: Jennadee17
Reviews.Content: A girl friend and I went to Vegas for a 4 day trip. We didn't care too much about what the room looks like - I mean, who goes to Vegas and really cares about the room!? We just needed somewhere to sleep and shower. The room was sufficient for that. We stayed in a tower room. They are very outdated and the decor... Is just plain ugly. Brown everywhere. It goes along wth the 'Camelot' motif but nothing fancy. Also, the walk from the casino of the hotel to your room is a hike, especially if you're wearing heels. Over all, it was sufficient for what we needed and I would stay there again but nothing fancy about this spot. Time for renovations!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: CourtzV
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Great location! Within walking distance to everything Vegas has! AWESOME!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: hrtldy
Reviews.Content: The room was very old not clean not even a luggage rack to put the luggage. There were hairpins on the carpet which were never removed. The carpet was torn away from the wall exposing the glue, as was the tile in the bathroom. The view was over the roof. The casino had awful ventilation, the bartender in the jester lounge was rude, looked very unkept and when I asked for celery for the bloody mary she said we don't got any. The ONLY redeeming area of this hotel was the Regales restaurant, the waitress, Kerri was salient, the food tasty fresh and the best Tiramasu I've ever eaten. The people at woman at the check out desk was the epitome of rudeness. She acted as if doing a favor by even chatting with me, like pay your bill and get out of here. I shared the room was old and tacky she said "oh you are in Tower 1, it's old", thus that is the reason there is no luggage rack? She dismissed me and sums up the rude service that prevailed in this hotel. We were bombarded by hustlers non stop each time we passed through the casino. The spa is wonderful sorry to have discovered it on our last night. Thus with the spa and the restaurant Regales there is no reason to stay in this run down, awful service, room hotel. Regardless of the price, it's not worth it would never return.

Reviews.Title: “Ye Olde Fashioned, But.....”
Reviews.Author: Luckystu
Reviews.Content: If you stay in the right rooms it's good value and a great location. We stayed here over the New Years period from the 29th to the 1st Jan 10, our two rooms (tower 2), both Widescreen View rooms, had brilliant views of the strip, from MGM round to the mountains. Both rooms were spacious and clean with two queen beds, and great value compared to other nearby hotels. We didn't use the casino here or any of the restaurants, choosing to spread our wealth elsewhere, to be honest we didn't find them very appealing, however they were always busy, so plenty others do. Our check in was quick,and the staff friendly even though it was at 4pm, and very busy. One major plus point is the ease of access to and from the hotel to your car, it's possible to park right at the entrance to tower 2, making it easy to drop your bags off, and get parked up nearby. We used the auto checkout (located @ this entrance) and were in our car in 5 mins and on the interstate in another 10, try that from other strip hotels. We didn't have the elevator or time share tout problems that others have suggested, and the proximity to MGM, NYNY and Mandalay Bay make this a good value and practical choice.

Reviews.Title: “You live in royalty - IF you upgrade your room.”
Reviews.Author: cheeseancrakers
Reviews.Content: Upon exiting Tropicana Ave, we see Excalibur. Wow, it's nice outside! Then we go to Valet Park, but it's sadly full - with it's rude employees telling us to get out of here and self park in one of the spaces in their huge parking area which was packed with cars already. We had to park pretty far from one of the entrances and with the amount of luggage we had, and the cold air - this hotel was already getting a thumbs down for me. But you know - I decided to give the hotel a chance. So I'm entering the hotel and the automatic doors are broken. GREAT! Thank goodness some kind lady opened the door for me (not an employee) and I was able to walk to check-in. Check in line wasn't so long, so it look like 10 minutes and I proceeded to my room 5132. Floor 5, Tower One, Room 32. Once I entered, the whole trip was just ruined. UGLY UGLY UGLY standard tower room. This is the worst room I've ever stayed in the Las Vegas. I mean - this could stand back to back with Rivera's cheapest room and Sahara's standard room. But this was even way worse than the standard tower room at Circus Circus (a really great hotel, even if it is crowded with kids and a bit old). Anyways this room was a disaster. Chipped tiles in the bathroom. Mold on the bathtub. Handles of the sink I didn't even touch. Carpet was stained. Furniture was chipped. Chairs were stained. Beds were so old, you could feel the springs! Decor was so old, it was really dated and should be changed soon. THIS ISN'T ROYALTY THIS IS LIKE THE DUNGEON. I went to front desk and asked to change my room, but the staff was arguing that the hotel was fully booked (accidentally actually over-booked) and I was lucky to even get a room and that the people waiting in the lobby were waiting for any room they could get. SO, I went with it and slept on those mattresses and disgusting bed covers. The next morning, I went straight to Front Desk. I decided to take the $20 upgrade per night for the new "Widescreen Rooms". This is it room 24241, this is the last chance I'm giving Excalibur or I'm changing my hotel. I proceeded on to Tower 2, floor 24, room 41 - noticing that the hallways in this tower had new carpeting and more modern accents. I entered the room, and found it to be much much more better. Very modern, and cozy. THE UPGRADE IS WORTH IT! The only thing was the bathroom tiles were the same as the first room - but other than that everything was updated and different. The bed was also a great difference, with nice sheets and comfy mattress. THIS IS ROYALTY. So, everything from then was going fine - until the elevators. Only one damn elevator was working and it was just chaos. The line to get to the elevator was like 20 minutes. Unbelievable! This continued until our last day at the Excalibur. And that's all. It was a rough start, okay middle, and bumpy end - meaning I wouldn't recommend this to anyone. This is certainly, my last stay at the Excalibur - unless they improve.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, gross, no thrills, and just overall bad experience”
Reviews.Author: laceybur
Reviews.Content: We got a deluxe room on the 2nd floor, meaning we had to take the elevator to get to one floor lower. There were many instances where we waited over 15 minutes to get an elevator to get to the casino floor (the exit) because by the time the elevator reached our floor, it was full to the max of people from all the other 20-something floors. Stairs weren't an option since it would sound an alarm. The rooms were gross and filthy and I have seen much better at super 8's and random truck-stop hotels. Our view was of the monorail track and we heard the monorail throughout the night. When arriving, our bathroom toilet seat was wet and stuff splattered on it. The casino was not appealing. However, the check-in and check-out was the easier one on the strip. They had self-check in & self-checfk out which was really useful and slightly helped make up for the long elevator waits. Overall, I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Bad Stay”
Reviews.Author: scorp505
Reviews.Content: You get what you paid for. Cheap rates = Cheap rooms. Staff not very friendly. Their remodeled rooms are not even top notch. I would think so especially where they are located. Their restaurant "Dick's" or whatever is a messy place to eat. Too cold to walk the strip. Their spa is not the same as it use to be(no complimentary drinks, robes,slippers, etc.) Our resort fee was about $30 which is like the going daily room rate. Received vouchers for drinks and fantasy mid fareway(?), didn't have any trouble redeeming those. Tried late night hot dogs and draft beer for $3, which was gross. I don't know how long food was steamer. Buns were brown and hog dog rubbery. The elevators took too long. We use to stay here all the time, but for past 2 yrs we've been staying at Mandalay Bay. I guess we better stay with them. I wouldn't chance this again, especially if I'm vacation and drove 2 states to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Good 'OLD' Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: traceytracey
Reviews.Content: My 16-year old and I spent Christmas weekend (Friday to Monday) in Vegas at the Excalibur. Yes, the hotel's furnishings are OLD but the room was clean upon our arrival and was adequately cleaned upon our daily return. Check-in was fine but you have to walk through the casino to get there. I had no need to call the front desk for anything so I had no interaction with the staff. The bed was super soft and comfortable. There's neither frig nor microwave in the room. The TV only had about 6 channels and I personally didn't care for the fact that it had a shower (only) and not a tub. I also did not at all appreciate paying the resort fee (about $9 per night) upon check-in -- I don't even have a place to keep snacks so what am I paying for? DO NOT USE THE COMPUTERS IN THE BUSINESS CENTER. It charges you a minimum of 5.00 usage plus the cost of printing per page. I spent about $12 for literally 2 minutes of usage to print out 4 pages of boarding passes -- RIP OFF! (What was the resort fee for again?) They had a computer specifically for printing your boarding pass but of course it wasn't working. There's an entrance near the towers but otherwise, you have to walk through the casino to get ANYWHERE. Even though there is a smoke free section, it's not near either tower entrance so you're always walking through smoke just to get to your room unless you're up for always walking around the outside of the building. PARENTAL FYI: There are half-naked women dancing on stage at a club in plain view inside the casino after about 9 pm. I was in parent mode but actually Excalibur is a GREAT LOCATION FOR PARTY PEOPLE! For the price, the location and the comfort, it's very good. The buffet was a little pricey but the food and wait staff were great. We literally ONLY SLEPT in the room because there was so much going on but if you plan on chilling in your room, find somewhere else. Oh, last PARENTAL FYI: VEGAS IS NOT FOR KIDS (unless you hole up at Circus Circus.) There were only THREE live shows that admitted kids under 18 (one was very expensive; one was moderately priced and moderately likeable; the other, cheap, starred house-pet-type animals doing tricks). Also, the street is constantly littered by cards with naked women and pornographic images on them. Like I said, not for kids.

Reviews.Title: “a value hotel in a great place”
Reviews.Author: kalla78
Reviews.Content: for the price, you get more than you asked for. clean rooms, nice bathrooms. casino is crowded. but you get coupons for drinks, games and other stuff. excellent value for money. great buffet. all you can eat for the whole day for $30 !! and really close to all the stuff on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay, very lousy”
Reviews.Author: raisin5101
Reviews.Content: I booked the Excalibur because it seemed to be reasonable and it was for my my wifes birthday for 4 days. We stayed in room 27213, which was to be a non-smoking king, (which was about what you would get at a cheap Motel 6 !) Someone had been smoking in the room, so I requested another room, and was told no but could freshen the room for us. No one ever came to freshen the room while we were there. You get a 42 inch flat screen tv, but you only get 6 local, 3 casino and 1 or 2 advertisement channels. There were cracked and chipped floor tiles in the restroom. No refrigerator or coffe maker. That night we received a phone call informing us of a family emergency and was going to have check out the next day, only staying one night. I spoke to the desk explaining our emergency and request some portion of our money returned, we told that after checking in they keep 100% of the cost.. So the room cost us $362.00 for one night. We enerally in Holiday Inn Express' which are around $90.00, with larger rooms, refrigerator, micro wave in the room, much cleaner and very nice complimentary breakfasts in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Old, unloved and should be retired”
Reviews.Author: plywoodtheunhinged
Reviews.Content: The reception is in the midst of the casino. The rooms are old, tatty and reek of many years of use. Ours was a so called refurbished room; if it had been modernised then it did not show. The bathroom shower only just worked. It was cheap, but not that cheap. The food in the place was abysmal and we were continually annoyed by 'time share' sellers. One plus was that it had a heated pool. It was not dreadful but there are many better ones...we moved to Monte Carlo which was cheaper and better.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible! Outdated! Disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: Dsperin
Reviews.Content: I booked the Excalibur for our first trip to Las Vegas because it was cheap and on the strip. I requested a king smoking room for 4 nights, Tuesday through Friday nights. My first impression of the casino/hotel was of rotting garbage. See, when you drive in and park, the closest entrance is by the service entrance. You have to walk past their delightful dumpsters that have been in the Vegas sun all day. Beautiful. When I arrived at about 8pm Tuesday night, I was told by the less than friendly desk lady that the room I requested was unavailable. When I told her that's what I requested when I made my reservation, she said, "We don't guarantee requests." Great. I inquired about upgrading (at my own expense) to Tower 2, and she still said that there were no rooms available. So what she's telling me is that in a 2,000 room hotel, on a Tuesday night in September, they don't have ONE smoking room? Right. Being that I was exhausted after our flight, I didn't have the strength to argue and so we ended up with two queens, non smoking in Tower 1. She did say, though, that if I called the following day I could get a new room. 18 floors up, down a looooooong hallway to a crappy room that I would expect from Motel 6. Now, I'm not stuck up and I often book Super 8's and Motel 6's when I travel, but in Las Vegas, I expected more. The bed was worn out and instead of a fitted sheet, the bottom sheet was just a top sheet tucked in. When you moved in bed, the sheet followed you. The room was bare bones for decoration and our view was of the interior of the castle. I hated this outdated disgusting room SO MUCH. The following day I paid an additional $20 per day to have the privelage to stay in the upgraded Tower 2. Talk about just masking the problem. The room was exactly the same as the first, except that the tv was a flatscreen, some newer drapes and carpeting had been added, the bed was actually a king and other cosmetic changes. The view was still of the interior of the castle, but this time we had the added benefit of a grease dumpster. In addition, there was a tiny table and two chairs tucked into this weird tiny alcove that's only accessible by squeezing between the wall and chair and ducking the ugly chandelier. What's the point of this table anyway? The t.v. gets 10 stations that aren't advertisements for Las Vegas. The hallways had room service carts outside of rooms for days. We watched the food got more dry and shriveled each time we walked past it. Every entrance to the hotel is overrun with people selling timeshares. My boyfriend figured out the best way to get them to leave us alone was to tell them we either lived in Vegas, or worked at the hotel. They quickly high-tailed it away each time. The whole hotel is outdated and gross. There are a ton of kids depsite the table dancing girls and hoards of drunks. (Why do people bring kids to Vegas???) The bartenders aren't that friendly, even when you tip them $5 on a $7 drink. I never once saw a watiress handing out free drinks. The pool closes at 6pm, and is only 3 1/2 feet deep. You get to feel like an idiot walking through the whole hotel to get the pool, too. I, too, received a questionare from the hotel when I returned home. They never responded. I'm returing to Vegas in Jan '10 and I'm staying at the Venetian.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy and nasty”
Reviews.Author: sallydrew
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because our friends had been married here several years ago. The staff was annoying, hounding us with a sales pitch for shows and time shares. The room was dirty and looked like it had not been clean in some time. The sheets did not fit the bed. The elevators were dirty. In fact everything in the hotel was dirty. I can stay in a very basic room and be happy if it is clean. This was not clean. In fact it was nasty. Do not stay here if you want to enjoy your trip.

Reviews.Title: “a bit Tacky, but if you have a sense of humor, you'll have fun”
Reviews.Author: numanuma99
Reviews.Content: Its a medieval themed hotel right beside the Ny Ny hotel and casino and the MGM grand. If your not super snooty and can handle a very smokey casino and lots of kids running around, then its not that bad of a place. Its older and a bit tacky in the casino area but the room was nice'ish, clean, big and the bed was comfortable. On the midway fun fair level, there are some fun 4-d rides, a bit pricey but worth the experience at least. (fun place for your kids if you have kids) The shopping level is kind of like a bad abandoned mall in the smallest town you've ever been, the hotel website talks a lot about the shopping level - but once you arrive, theres about four stores and there not good ones! The best thing about this hotel is the "Dicks last resort" pub and restaurant, the entertainment put on by the bartenders will make you laugh so hard you'll lose your voice. There rude and thats the point, so if you can handle a dirty sense of humor and a lot of laughing, definitely go there! Just leave your high maintenance friends, girlfriend, or even boyfriend at home, these bartenders aren't around to treat you like royalty, there around to make fun of you, put funny hats with dirty sayings on your head and keep you laughing! The one place I wouldn't recommend is the sherwood cafe in the casino area, unless your going there for breakfast (which is pretty decent) do not eat there happy hour appy's! so gross...although the food at Dicks isn't anything to write home about either, cheese whiz on your nacho's? The nice thing about this hotel is that its so close to the others and its a lot cheaper! the pool and spa area is very nice, I didn't use the pool because it was December, but the spa was very relaxing and not packed full of people. The pool (outdoor) is huge, looks clean and if it was warmer out im sure it would be really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Not the family place it used to be”
Reviews.Author: Batta83
Reviews.Content: When staying in Las Vegas we alsways stayed at the Excalibur which our kids liked since it offers apart from the usual casino environment special attractions for kids such as an extensive kids arcade. We were really disappointed this time, since the orientation to families in the hotel has been somewhat lost. It started in the hotel entry, where management had placed a stage were burlessque dancers performing in full view. In addition the hotel customers have shifted to the typical college student crouwds. About one third of the machines in the kid's arcade were broken, obviously due to bad maintenance. Overall the upkeep of the hotel was bad, our room (supposedly renovated) was aged with a smelly carpet. We payed 100 Dollars per room per night and we certainly will stay at a nicer place next time.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping a real let down !”
Reviews.Author: BajangSingapore
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Excalibur in Dec 2009 for 3 nights. On our last night there, when we returned to our room after a long day out feeling exhausted, we were shocked to see that our room was not tidied at all. The beds still looked the same the morning we left the room ! Went into the toilet and saw that the dirty towels were still lying on the floor, waiting to be changed. Got to call housekeeping to get new towels. When the guy came with the towels, we told him that our room was not tidied and he checked with his colleague from housekeeping dept. To our surprise, he told us that according to their record, our room had been made. We insisted no and wanted him to come in to take a look for himself. Do not understand why he just refused to step into our room. Just told us to call housekeeping dept to complain. We did just that and still we got the same answer that our room was already tidied. I mean, if customer complained about the room not tidied and houskeeping side insisted that they had done their job, it's only right that they sent someone up to take a look and see for themselves rather than to brush us aside with such lame excuse. Mind you, we did not hang the 'do not disturb' tab on our door ! They really need to buck up their service at housekeeping !

Reviews.Title: “Honest to goodness opinion”
Reviews.Author: kalayka
Reviews.Content: Check-in was a breeze at 1:00 p.m. , 2 hours earlier than required. No long lines that I am used to in big hotels in the strip. Agent was friendly especially when he was able to confirm we came from the same birth country. I just do not know if he gave me a special favor but this time I got a room in a higher floor unlike in the past. Since I booked for the lowest price, I did not expect much. The hotel opened June 19, 1990 and everything in the room certainly looked that old. The furniture finish were all messed up, one chair even bore a flat iron burn mark, old tube TV with 18 channels including those that belong to the hotel for promotion purposes, TV stand had dust all over and bread crumbs on the floor near the bed. Toiletry was decent although I noticed the soap did not foam. One thing with big hotels in the strip, if you have a car, be prepared to walk a mile to or from car park unless you opt for valet which means shelling out a few dollars in tip every you need your car. Check-out was also fast using the TV and you then walk straight to your vehicle without dropping by the registration counter.

Reviews.Title: “let me warn you about the spruking”
Reviews.Author: LouRSydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Excalibur in Nov 2009 and were so put off by the constant, unrelenting staff members approaching us at every opportunity to get us to attend a talk about time-share apartments in a new casino in Vegas. Every time we left the room we would be approached and it got so tiresome and annoying. We were in Vegas to have a good time, not spend 3 hours listening to a talk about a new casino, which we would never buy into! Apart from that, the hotel was adequate, good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Pay a little more to stay somewhere else--they don't understand customer service”
Reviews.Author: DesiTravellers
Reviews.Content: I had reserved a 4 night stay with a king bed through a special offer on the website. I was told that a king was not available, and had to stick with 2 doubles. Upon arriving, I checked in, and discovered that my "deluxe" room had hair on the bed. The room was in the older tower, and it was very obvious that it had not been updated in a long time. The carpet was worn and dingy, furniture had all kinds on nicks in it, and generally had the feel of no-name motel from the 80's rather than an MGM property. After complaining about the hair to the front desk, I was given another room by the supervisor... it seems somehow that the king bed room which had been unavailable had suddenly become available. Unfortunately, the 2nd room had the same issue. A second call was made, and I was told to take it up with the housekeeping supervisor. Looking again at the general condition of the room, I requested to move into the renovated tower because of the aforementioned issues. "I'm sorry, were you not aware of the condition of the room when you booked? These are our older rooms, and you were offered to upgrade to the renovated room..." I explained that I expected any room, no matter what the price, to not have hair on the bedding. I went down to the front desk, and swapped out the key for the renovated room. The on duty supervisor had the audacity to make a snide remark, "Now you know what our rooms look like for next time", implying that I was trying to freeload an upgrade. The renovated rooms were a big improvement, though...it wasn't a huge surprise that here, too, the bedding was sub par (torn and stained sheets). By this time, I was sick of the back and forth and decided to just crash for the night. The next morning, I spoke to the supervisor (different one), and he apologized, and offered to make things right. Unfortunately, I was in no mood, and just asked to cancel the reservation. I ended up moving off the strip to the Rio suites, which had a much better room (got a beautiful upgraded suite without asking) , atmosphere, and comparable price. I'd highly recommend avoiding the Excalibur, despite the seemingly low prices being offered...

Reviews.Title: “A Good Place To Stay!”
Reviews.Author: SKDMumbai
Reviews.Content: We got a lovely deal on the hotel, buy 1 get 1 night free. Even though it seems to be at one end of the Las Vegas strip, I would still recommend this hotel if one gets a good deal. There is a bus stop right below (u just have to cross the road) u can get a 1 way ticket for $2, the best is that u can get an all-day pass for $5, & hop on & off the bus any number of times. The hotel is not really that far from the Bellagio/Planet Hollywood, we would often walk to it too. It has a nice food court for some nice Starbucks coffee & freshly made Crispy Cream doughnuts for breakfast...what a lovely way to start a day!

Reviews.Title: “Great all round hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Brookzymatt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur at the start of December for my girlfriends birthday. We managed to get an upgraded room as we asked for a room with a safe and they saw it was her birthday the following day, The room was huge, clean and served us well. The hotel itself had a great atmosphere and all the staff we dealt with were great. Its also in a superb location as its close to the airport so a taxi wasnt too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Blergh”
Reviews.Author: meljup
Reviews.Content: I knew it was cheap, but I wasn't expecting it to be that bad. I almost stopped breathing when I walked into the lobby, the ventilation is appalling and the smoke was so thick it was unbearable. The first room we were given had the most toxic fume type smell in it, that I couldn't bear to be in it for more than 5 mins, so we had to pay extra for a room on the other side. These rooms were spacious and comfortable however. The pool closes at 530, which was annoying, and half the pool was closed. The security guards shadow you with the kids as you walk from your room to the front door, it would be helpful to be able to get out some other way. The toiletries were cheap. I also think it would be better to be down the other end of the strip. It's just a smelly grungy old casino, pick somewhere else, even if you have to pay more. They also charge an additional resort fee, that you may not account for.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible pretty much all around”
Reviews.Author: nursetraveler87
Reviews.Content: Our stay was to say the least, terrible. To check in was at least a 45 minute wait. Finally, we checked into our room. The room didn't have a deadbolt or chain lock on it. So, we left our luggage and went out to explore the strip. When we returned, we found another pair of guests in our room. We came to find out, the hotel had checked them into the room too, gave them keys and everything. We called the front desk, after waiting 30 minutes on the phone to speak with someone, they tried to say they didn't know they had made a mistake. They upgraded our room and compensated us a 100 dollar meal at their resturant. Wouldn't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Expect Anything Fancy-Live and Learn”
Reviews.Author: desvw1029
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Las Vegas was booked on a Southwest Vacation package...the only hotel being available on the dates we needed to book was Excalibur. Price was very fair, but you get what you pay for. Until we walked through other hotel/casinos, we didn't realize how old and out dated Excalibur was. Clean enough, but whew...really old. Had everything you needed as far as Vegas facilities, but I wouldn't stay there again. Rooms also pretty old in Tower 1. The Steakhouse restaurant was AMAZING...two of the best meals I've ever had! Actually all the eateries were very good. If you are on a budget and don't care much about anything fancy, this is an ok place...cheaper than most, and fairly ok. OH don't go the first 2 weeks in December...there's a rodeo in town and all the music was country...all the people were country...it looked like a cowboy hat, Wrangler jeans convention...not my thing.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay for the price and good location”
Reviews.Author: nslesley
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Vegas for Thanksgiving and stayed at the Excalibur. This was our first time to Vegas. The hotel was decent for the money and we got a really good deal, especially for having been right on the strip. The rooms were clean and they cleaned our room and gave us fresh towels everyday. There wasn't anything spectacular or special about the room itself, but it's Vegas, we weren't in the room that much anyway. Our room wasn't on the strip side of the hotel, but that was fine. Take comfortable shoes because there is a lot of walking, which we did a couple of days. If you don't know the area, there are pedestrian bridges to get everywhere as well. You can walk right over to New York, New York and stroll around in there. One day we took the monorail, which is ok if you like walking to the back of the casinos to get to. If your not used to it, then it can be a long way. The nearest monorail station from the Excalibur is in the back of the MGM Grand and if you aren't used to that, it's a long way. The restaurants were nice. We tried the Sherwood Cafe, which wasn't bad, but a bit pricy. If you want a cheaper meal, I recommend going to the Village Court, which is on the second level and has McDonald's and other eateries. I got a breakfast burrito for only a $1. Can't beat that. One night we went to the Tournament of Kings show. It was cute and comes with dinner but because of the theme of the show you won't have untensils, but it was fun. I have heard negative reviews about this show, but it's not aimed towards your comedic shows or celebrity styled shows. I would highly recommend going to the Bellagio and seeing the fountain. It is beautiful and free and you can stay there as long as you like! There were not benches that we saw, so be ready to stand for a bit, but it's very well worth it! If you can make the trip up the eiffel tower which is just across the street that is worth it to see the fountain from there too, though we didn't make it there. Overall, for the value, I would recommend the Excalibur.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymooners”
Reviews.Author: Sophrina
Reviews.Content: Cheap and cheerful, familyish orientated, enjoyed our stay! Buffets were excellent value!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at the Antcaliber”
Reviews.Author: markjuch
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the excalibur for 3 nights and on the 2nd day we found ants all over the bathroom, furniture and even in the bed when we asked to be moved we were treated very poorly and were given the same room number but 5 floors higher when we packed all our bags and checked the room we found the same problem in that room when we asked to be moved from that room the receptionist was not very friendly and told us we can have a room 10 more floors higher than the one we were in as the ants wont be able to climb that high but they did.when we checked out we asked to see the manager but he was not helpful and did not apologise.we contacted the hotel on several occasions but they have not even replied. we will not be going back

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Vrok
Reviews.Content: it was very good we stayed on the 24th floor and you could see evrything. everyone was very helpfull and the room was very clean and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “situated at the best end of the strip”
Reviews.Author: tahitato
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 night at this location as a solo traveler mainly for vacation and to get suit for a wedding. A great hotel, really clean and friendly staff, espically at the karaoke bar, they rocked. smaller than i seems on tv but well placed. i found this hotel to be more kiddyfied with is decor and lighting styles. Easy acess to ny-ny and mgm grand also a tram to mandlay bay and luxor (which was the best casino i went to). Being after thanksgiving i thought it would be packed but it was calm and quiet, even in the room. food was good too upstairs there is a food court and great buffet. tips... go see carrot top it rocked be aware that show can be cancled at last miniute like Louie Anderson was, it left me no time to get another show ticket and get down to it. watch out on the strip for flickers giving out hooker cards, i had a backpack on one day while walking down the strip and came back to find it filled with cards.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, simple/clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: dphillips05
Reviews.Content: I was unsure of what to expect at the Excalibur after reading some of the reviews on TA, but I was pleasantly surprised. My husband and I stayed in a double room in Tower I. The room was very simple and clean which is really all we needed. No frills, but a comfortable place to come back to in the evening. We loved that the Excalibur was within close walking distance of several other casinos, with a free monorail to Luxor and Mandalay Bay (although we didn't use that because there were also indoor walkways to get there). The hotel had a nice casino as well, but we did not try any of the restaurants. I guess my only complaint would be that the elevators were sporadic - out of 4 elevators going to our floors, one was broken the whole time we were there, and at one point 2 others were broken as well. Even when those were running, there were long waits for the elevators. Overall though, a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur Hotel& Casino”
Reviews.Author: jtatsu
Reviews.Content: Nice room, service and stuffs.All the places inside the hotel are nice and well organized.Attractions inside and a good reception service to check in and chek out.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, affordable, and classic”
Reviews.Author: devathabhi
Reviews.Content: Though the casino and the lobby looks a little aged, the rooms are very well maintained and very comfortable. It has a very big pool and the casino is rocking all the time, with shows and other attractions. It looks beautiful from the outside with the looks of a colorful castle. It is located on the strip and right next to the Luxor, MGM, Tropicana, and New York New York Very affordable rates when booked in advance

Reviews.Title: “A nice location and”
Reviews.Author: villahills3
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Excalibur over the Thanksgiving week. Upon entering the hotel we were able to go straight up to check-in, there were plenty of friendly attendents to take care of us. I asked for a view of all things the airport, for a hubby that is more into plane watching than gambling...lol...the request was met easily. We arrived early due to time changes...at about 10am, check in is not til 3pm but we were able to get into our room immediately. The room was one of the older rooms and had not yet been remodeled. It was neat and clean, with the only exception being little finger prints on the window. The beds were comfortable and clean. The casino was bright and active, but the drink service could have been alittle more available. All and all a nice place with a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Mandatory Charges”
Reviews.Author: Odiemae
Reviews.Content: I booked a trip through CheapTickets.com and when I went online to print my confirmation, I found an unwelcome surprise - "Mandatory hotel charges will be collected by the hotel at checkout: Resort fee of $20.00USD or Per Night that is taxable - includes fitness center access, free drinks and more." Had I known about this mandatory charge at the time of booking, I would have been able to compare my options better. As far as I am concerned, this is a dishonest pricing policy - why are they not including this fee as part of their hotel charges? I won't be staying there again and I'll certainly be on the lookout for hotels doing the same in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but full of kids”
Reviews.Author: icf
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel but we found our room on the 23rd floor of tower 2 to be a playground for kids at nighttime as they thought holding up the elevators was funny!! We were hounded upon check in to go and claim a free gift which was only redeemable after giving a $40 deposit and attending a time share meeting at a new resort the next day where we were told to bring our credit card as a form of idendity!! Go figure!!

Reviews.Title: “Our Not So Excellent Excalibur Experience”
Reviews.Author: Kalia07
Reviews.Content: We arrived to a "remodeled widescreen room" only to find a partial remodel. New tv, low-end remodeled bath, and new pillowtop mattresses. Be warned these are thin pillowtops. The sheets were clean, but stained. The blankets were dirty and not double sheeted. However, I requested extra sheets and did it myself. Room furniture appears to be original. On third day, our hall was filled with 8 screaming kids running up and down knocking on doors. Security arrived but we had to contact security manager the 2nd time before things calmed down. Cocktail service in casino is horrible. The pluses we found were excellent maintenance staff; good service in Sherwood Cafe, and the location. Overall, I do not recommend this hotel unless your budget-conscious. It is a step up from Circus Circus, but we will stay elsewhere next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: GordM
Reviews.Content: We had no problems at all with The Excalibur even though some comments made here have been negative. We booked online and got a great deal on price that included admission to "Defending the Caveman". The staff were relaxed and friendly at reception, our room, 25th floor, Tower 2, facing the other tower, was clean and quiet. No issues whatsoever. The one thing that was a bit annoying was the fact that people who look like they work in the hotel approach you and offering free show tickets and then it turns out that they are trying to get you to attend a "time-share meeting". that wasn't the hotel's fault, but it was annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty room and no attempt to address issues after notification.”
Reviews.Author: IDOCIAM
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at Excalibur. Stained sheets and brown 'water' spots on the toilet seat lid. Hair dryer either moldy or layered with dampt grey dust. Dirty carpet. I informed the front desk the following early morning but when I returned late the next night nothing had been changed other than the towels were changed. Two sleepless nights and no compensation from Excalibur... because I booked through Expedia. The lack of response to my complaints at the time and a similar lack of response to my recent emails is quite frustrating!

Reviews.Title: “excalibur hotel lasvegas and its child friendly”
Reviews.Author: Alison-JuneM
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel recently and it was child friendly and there was so much to do and see and its in the perfect place a few stops away from the outlett mall and the fashion malls etc lovly

Reviews.Title: “If your going to Vegas on a budget this is the place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Stud99
Reviews.Content: "You get what you pay for" is a saying that is more true in Vegas than anywhere else in the world. This Hotel is very cheap and very central. If you are going to Vegas on a budget and do not mind a walking then I would recommend this hotel. It is acroos the road from NY NY and the MGM. But if you plan on going to see shows in Mirage like we did everynight, then it can be a bit of a task walking up there. Also if you are a fan of the fast foods, there are many on the 2nd floor. Not everyones pick but again if you are in town on a budget. We got a standard room, cheapest, in tower 1. It was grand. Very clean with all the basics you need. Window was looking into center of hotel so no view, but no noise either. Now the Bad. 1. Time share people, We go a short taxi from the airport. Striaght as we got in the door we were catch by some time share people who were offering us "free ticket" after 22 hours travelling we were fooled into going to a time share presentation which lasted 3 hours and is the biggest scam in the world. We did get half price show tickets though. Not every hotel has time share people, but the cheap ones do. But ignore them the first time and then tell them that you are booked to go when ever they ask. 2. Smokey Bar Casino. As you can still smoke in bars and casinos in Vegas, you may find it hard to take if you are a none smoker and not used to smoke indoors. Excalibur was the most smokeist casino on the strip. Summary, if your going to Vegas on a budget this is the place to stay. Do no stay at Circus Circus, long walk from the main strip and walking with dirt. If I had more cash and wanted a more pleasured stay I would stay at caesars palace.

Reviews.Title: “adequate”
Reviews.Author: MissMaryMac
Reviews.Content: with so many people staying in such a large hotel, i think its easy to become lost as just another guest. Its probably the same in all Hotels in Vegas. You don't feel at all special. The hotel is adequate. The room is nice. The staff are friendly when you do actually encounter them. The restaurants on site were standard.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomodation; Great Location; Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: TheErn
Reviews.Content: The Excalibur Hotel provided great accomodation at a very reasonable price. If you want to stay at a location that is at the heart of the action this is it! You have quick access to Tropicana, Luxor, Mandalay Bay, New York New York and MGM. Want to go further or Downtown? Try the Duece (Double Decker Bus). The Excalibur Staff are very friendly and helpful and they provide lessons for most of the games. I took the Craps lessons and it is now my favourite game; next time I'll try Poker. If you enjoy the gambling, as I do, the table minimums are lower at the Excalibur so you can stretch your dollar. Also, when you need a break but still want to gamble...try the Excalibur Keno Lounge...I think it's the only Hotel at this end of the Strip to still have a Keno Lounge. So in closing, I say, "Unsheath your dollars and come to the Excalibur" If you are lucky You may even become Knight or Damsel of the Realm...Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “LV”
Reviews.Author: JennyD4
Reviews.Content: Rooms and view were beautiful casino area could have been updated, entertainment was class and situated in prime position

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kedskraver
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here when her parents and brother where there and we had a great time. We had a wide screen tv room and it was clean. The television didn't work, but they fixed that. The hotel is connected to the Luxor and Madalay Bay Casinos by a monorail or walking skyways, so you can easily travel to these upscale hotels and their entertainment. The Excalibur buffet was $29 to eat all day and it was good and tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marinermama
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Excalibur was great. We booked online at their website and got the Stay and Play package. The money off food coupons really helped with the food costs. The employees were all friendly and helpful with directions. Our room was clean and comfortable. Our TV remote didn't work so someone brought another one no problem. I went to see Criss Angel in Believe, husband went downstairs and had free cocktails thanks to the Stay and Play coupons. An all-around positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Why stay anywhere else......... !!!”
Reviews.Author: gatesheadgirlie
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we couldn't afford to stay at the Wynn or Bellagio so opted for the next best thing of Excalibur. How long are you actually in your room ?? exactly , 8hrs to sleep and 1 hr to get ready to go our for the day. Excalibur is the ideal location to stay on a budget while enjoying all the luxury the strip has to offer. Excalibur offers Huge immaculately clean rooms with lots of red hot powerful water in the walk in shower. A more than adequate pool area ( very quiet in October) Right next to the bus stop for the outlet shopping mall ( $3 ) Right next to the monorail at MGM Right next to the Outback restaurant near to m & m shop for a meal to die for So close to the new "city centre " complex due to open in December. You know it makes sense. Spend wisely on your accomodation and spend the rest on slots and sightseeing. Why stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “What more do you want.......... !! You know it makes sense.”
Reviews.Author: gatesheadgirlie
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we couldn't afford the total luxury of Wynn and Bellagio so opted for the next best thing Excalibur. How long are you in your own hotel ........... exactly , about 8hrs while you sleep and one hour while you get ready to go out. Money well spent i would say to stay in the Excalibur. Huge ,immaculately clean rooms with powerful hot water in the walk in shower Great pool area ( very quiet in October) Right next to the bus stop to take you to Outlet Shopping Mall ( $3) Great fast food area for when you have the late night munchies after a hard day sightseeing Fab view of New York on leaving the hotel Right next to the Monorail at MGM Right next to the Outback Australian restaurant for when you want a meal to die for. So close to the new "city centre " when it opens in December. Do the right thing , save on your hotel room ,it's only a place to lie your head , spend on the slots and sightseeing. You know it makes sense.

Reviews.Title: “LOW LIMIT GAMBLERS 3 NITE STAY at the EX”
Reviews.Author: Loftypines
Reviews.Content: The Excalibur is a more budget conscious location. I had been to the Excalibur casino many times on previous trips because I really enjoy the poker rooms low limits. A year or so ago the poker room switched to electronic tables so the Ex was not a spot I played on my trips to Vegas but Live poker started again a few months ago so off I went. I checked in just after 1pm with the $20 trick getting me an upgraded room in tower 2 on the 21st floor overlooking NYNY, MGM, and the rest of what u see in the picture. Really clean room with upgraded bathroom, bedding, carpet and flat screen TV (only 12 channels). The hallways were also recently painted with new carpet and no smokey smell. Pool area very nice with 4 pools to choose from and 2 hot-tubs. Used the very nice gym facilities one morning that are included in the resort fee. I would definitely recommend the Excalibur for those who don't need crazy high end amenities.

Reviews.Title: “what a suprise!!”
Reviews.Author: longpod212
Reviews.Content: This was our second vegas trip and we wanted to spend less on hotel and more on avin fun.We booked excalibur cus it was a bargain but after reading reviews got a bit worried that soon changed when we arrived though, check in was excellent no waitin,free room upgrade without askin and really helpful staff.The room was clean,comfortable and quiet big the view wasnt any good but not a problem. Room service was fine seem to take days to remove food trolleys though. The pool area has loads of space and a kid free area aswell. The casino has one of the best atmospheres on the strip especially at the wkend the dealers are really friendly and the slots seem to pay out more than any other casino.

Reviews.Title: “perfect in every way and what we expected!”
Reviews.Author: lovinlife_9
Reviews.Content: we just returned from a 2 night stay in Vegas. Our goal was to see the Criss Angel Believe show (which is incredible if you are a fan!). My 16 year old daughter and I traveled together and I wanted a comfortable, clean, updated room. The Excalibur provided that for us without a doubt. We stayed in a wide screen remodeled room on the 23rd floor. Beds were VERY comfy-and everything worked. Prices are still quite high Th - Sat., but hey it's Vegas and everyone comes here on the weekends. I've heard the deals are all earlier in the week. Even though we paid $146 per night I feel we got exactly what we expected. I have no room to complain about anything because hey! This is Vegas. I think you need to be prepared for the unexpected or don't go! The staff was helpful, very nice. Dick's Resort was loud - but again, you are in VEGAS! We used the connecting bridges to get to Luxor, NYNY and over to MGM with ease.Ate breakfast in the McDonalds on the upper level of the Excal and it was hot and fresh. took a taxi down to the Venetian to soak in the beauty of it & also walked across to Mirage to see the Volcano and browse through the Ceasers Forum Shops. Taxi home to Excalibur where it was more quite to sleep. I felt completely safe with my 16 year old and we had a very nice time.

Reviews.Title: “We don't have kids, so not for us”
Reviews.Author: RobNYC77
Reviews.Content: Of all the big hotels I've stayed at in vegas (around 10), this was the worst. The lobby, amenities and grounds are very well kept. All a very carefully constructed maze to keep you from ever finding your way around though. The room was pretty standard for a big hotel. Views were only ok. The temperature was never right. The room service was just awful. In fact all food in this place seemed to be old, bad, or both. The casino has nothing unique or interesting about it as far as i noticed. They did always have cheap table games open though. The pool was ok as far as setup, but man there's a lot of kids there. Not the trendy scene i'm used to in vegas. The location is not great either, you're really at the far end of the strip with access to only one or two other nearby hotels. I question the intelligence and morality of putting a beer pong room in a hotel with so many tweens. (I know, it's vegas, what's with all this morality stuff... but really?).

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: ShortyEvansvilleIN
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay. We especially enjoyed the swimming pools.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: SteveDebs
Reviews.Content: Luckily for us, we only stayed 3 nights at the Excalibur prior to leaving Vegas to tour some of the wonders that the South West has to offer. The Excalibur occupies a pretty good spot on The Strip, yet offers little or none of what you might expect. Very average. Rooms: We had one of the 'new' Widescreen Rooms....it's basically a room with widescreen TV. The decor was awful, as was the sound proofing. Casino: Dark and dingly, and a horrible musty smell. Dining: Apart from the usual food hall, it pffers very little in terms of fine, or even just plain good, dining. I personally would nevert use this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Wow - very surprised and pleased!!”
Reviews.Author: Sunshinegirl2233
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip with Expedia and got a really good deal for 5 night's staying at the Excalibur. When we arrived we had no problems checking in what so ever, the receptionist was very helpful and friendly. We were in Tower 1 had a Strip View, Room was quite some size, King size bed VERY clean. Bathroom was a good size aswell, huge shower ( No bath ). I couldnt believe how happy i was with the hotel , i was expecting maybe a few problems as the reviews i red wasnt great and the fact we got it so cheap, but wow i cannot explain what a deal your getting. PERFECT location. Nice chinese upstairs i'd recommend. Go in all the hotels, you have to visit them all, so beautiful and so much to see. New York had lovely bars and we ate in there most nights. We didnt eat at the hotel buffet as i didnt see what the point was, your there to experience all sorts of food and restaurants so in my opinion i wouldnt bother. Round the pool was great, loads of sun loungers, weather was lovely, not too hot. Go on the Rollarcoaster at New York New York Very fun!! We visited downtown to see the lightshow, apart from that there isnt much there, but was on the last night and since we were shattered from all the others nights we'd had out. Las Vegas has some fantastic clubs if you like your partying scene, of all ages aswell so dont be afraid, I'd recommend, The bank at the Belliago, PURE at Caesars Palace, LAX at the Luxor. DONT buy any tickets from people on the street, most of the time you can get them free from workers in the hotel. Also go the Paris hotel up the effiel tower, Me and my fiance went, was very romantic and you get a fantastic view of the Strip. We were there for Halloween and we had the BEST time ever! Very sad to be home. I would definitly stay at the excalibur again, why pay all that money for a top notch hotel if your hardly in it? EXCALIBUR ALL THE WAY!!! Oh and bring comfy shoes, there's a lot of walking!!! Have fun x

Reviews.Title: “Agree! This hotel sucked big time!”
Reviews.Author: iTwins
Reviews.Content: This review is 4 years late. My apologies. Only now I find time reading other people's review and wanting to give my two cents. This was a hotel I can remember very vividly. It was Hell on Earth! -- We just got off the plane at 9am from a 14-hour flight from Hong Kong via Tokyo, heavily jet-lagged, tired and yes, they refused to give us a room even though they had one available. "Hotel policies" stated it is 3pm check-in time. Then she walked off as if refusing to discuss with us further -- Furnitures were old - chipped, scratched, written on - the table legs were crooked -- noisy outside of the room. The rooms were not very sound-proof -- noisy INSIDE of the room. The damn, old and cranky air conditioner, which was about to break down refused to shut up. And you really don't want to turn it off with the 44 degrees Celsius blistering Summer heat outside. Either you live with the noisy air-con or you live with the noisy corridors, either way, you are screwed! If it wasn't because of the discounted convention price that the organizers offered, we wouldn't have stayed there. Out of a total of 12 days we spent in Las Vegas, we had to stay for 5 nights in this hell hole. The other 7 night we booked at Luxor. We almost cancelled Luxor as well thinking the quality would be much the same because both Excalibur and Luxor were owned by the MGM group. Overall quality of service of this hotel is appalling, not because I was heavily ticked off of the other finer points but rather comparing with other hotels in other major cities around the world, this hotel is shameful to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay. Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: aggie71Sydney
Reviews.Content: Stayed here by recommendation by friend. Had room with two queen comfortable beds, with husband & 10yo&7yo. Rooms were very clean. Kids loved pool even tho the pool with slide was closed for the 5 days out of 6 we were there - disappointed in that. Las Vegas Casinos/Hotels should really look into "KIDS CLUB"... Kings of Tournament Show at Excalibur was great too.

Reviews.Title: “Decidedly average!”
Reviews.Author: jax1972
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Excalibur for 6 nights. Whilst it was clean and comfy enough, the hotel and casino was very dated in its appearance. The rooms were average - we had no room safe, or refrigerator. Would have been nice to also have a kettle in the room for a morning cuppa. All in all it's pretty basic. I did stay one night in the Hard Rock Hotel and in comparison to the Excalibur, that was very smart. With all the deals around now, I think you can get more for your money elsewhere, but if you are literally just in the room for a few hours sleep and to shower, Excalibur will do the job.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, mean workers”
Reviews.Author: mis13mis
Reviews.Content: My aunt and uncle met my dad and I in Las Vegas NV since it is halfway between us. I am not yet 21 and although we knew I couldn't gamble we booked our stay at the Excalibur, believing I would be able to still walk around with them and everything. I guess its a state law you cant even be stopped near the machines if you are not 21. I understand it is a law, and I was ok with that. But everytime I even walked past the machines I got told off for supposedly "stopping". They were also very rude.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel rcommended fot children”
Reviews.Author: sidned
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews from other people about this hotel, I was a bit worried about taking my children to Las Vegas but I needn't have worried. We didn't get approached by any holiday reps, and check-in was a breeze! We booked a Widescreen View room in Tower 2 which was excellent. We overlooked the New York hotel which was lovely. My 2 children are aged 6 and 10, and they both loved the Spongebob ride as well as all the games available in the Festive Fayre area. The Food Court was excellent and had a Cold Stone Creamery outlet which was lovely! Access to the Luxor was provided by a covered walkway as well as a regular free monorail, and New York and MGM were connected by a bridge. Las Vegas provided loads of entertainment all day and night with the Bellagio fountains, Mirage volcano, Ceasars shops, Venetian, MGM Lion Habitat, Mirage Secret Garden to name but a few. There is even a huge 4 floored M&M shop! Apart from the many "vendors" pedalling "escorts" as we walked down the strip, there was no issue bringing the children. They did not pass any of these cards once they saw the kids,so even this wasn't an issue. Excalibur is a great base if you have kids and I would recommend it to anyone considering bringing their kids to Vegas. The pools are great and kids friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Yep we would stay again”
Reviews.Author: chrissymWhyalla
Reviews.Content: We thought that this hotel wasnt bad at all .The food places were great the service was good ,the room was clean on the downside those people soliciting in every entrance and exit were harrassing and annoying and the Tounament of kings was a BAD waste of money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great rate”
Reviews.Author: Lisa_WLG
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week and really enjoyed it. the room was large with a huge bathroom and very clean. We were in a smoking room and it did not smell at all. The staff were a bit unfriendly but it didn't really matter as overall my expereince was great. Good location on The Strip and good buffet breakfast. Not the fanciest of casinos but overall I got value for my money.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Excalibur!”
Reviews.Author: letsgohere
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend for three nights (Wed, Thurs & Friday) and this was my first trip to Vegas. Once we were in our hotel room, I was very happy with it. We booked one of the newer widescreen rooms and asked for a view of the strip. We were told those rooms required an extra $10 a night, so that's what we did. Our room was on the left side of tower 2, and had an incredible view of NYNY and MGM Grand and some of the mountains. And while the TV is nice, there aren't many channels to watch (but who's going to be watching TV in Vegas, right?). The beds were really comfortable, with plenty of pillows, but we later discovered one drawback to having a strip-view room: the sound of traffic is so loud you feel as if you're sleeping right on the street! We fixed this by turning the A/C's fan on to drown the noise out, but those really sensitive to noise might want to avoid these rooms. The room was cleaned, bed made, bathroom supplies restocked each day and the towels were nice and fluffy. The hallways during our stay were kept clean and food carts & trays removed promptly. Our third day there, we discovered that the folder your room key comes in is also a map of the hotel if you unfold it even further, but we'd already figured out the layout by then. For the resort fee of $5, you get 2 free drink credits, 2 free passes to carnival games in the Fantasy Faire Midway and 2 free passes to the fitness center. We didn't use the fitness center or pool area, so can't comment on them. We were approached by the timeshare people and were at first fooled into thinking they were hotel employees trying to help us. As I'd read previous reviews, I quickly figured it out. If you just keep walking, they leave you alone. They are dressed in navy blue suits and are located right next to the tower entrances and the bell desk. We tried the breakfast buffet and was happy with it, but I'm sure there's better elsewhere on the strip. As for location on the strip, I was somewhat happy with this hotel. It is a bit of a hike to the really impressive mid-strip hotels, but a major part of the fun I had in Vegas was exploring the strip. Also, the Deuce bus makes it easy and cheap to get around. We aren't gamblers at all, so while I'd say the casino was dark and smoky, it didn't seem to be that much more so than any other casino we walked through. All in all, we were both very happy with our stay here and felt (at least with the Widescreen view room) it was probably worth more than what we'd paid for and I definitely recommend staying here if you want somewhere nice while sticking to a budget. I'd probably choose somewhere else to stay if we ever visit Vegas again, but that's only for the sake of variety.

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some bad”
Reviews.Author: CamaroNC94
Reviews.Content: Third trip to Vegas in about a year and a half. Have stayed at Ballys, Harrahs and Imperial Palace(twice). Decided to go with Excalibur because I waited too long to book and they had a better deal than any of the HET properties at the time. This trip I decided that I wanted to stay on a weekend night. Flew in on Sat around 3:30 and stayed two nights at Excalibur before moving to my comped nights at Imperial Palace. First thing my opinion about Vegas on a Sat night...basically the same as a weekday night only more people! Got to hotel around 4:30pm, no line for check-in. Front desk lady tried to make me upgrade to widescreen room for $20 extra each night, no thanks paying enough already. Told her that I would like my standard room on a higher floor. She told me that she couldn't give me one if I still wanted a smoking room. Told me it had to be 1st or 2nd floor only in the standard room but if I paid for upgrade I could have one of those rooms higher up. Hmmmm, No thank you again, told I would take 2nd floor...she said we only have 1st floor left. Great! No map of hotel given. Really wished they would have given a map to know what all was in the hotel. Nothing in the room either. Room was in Tower 1, first floor. Didn't need elevator so can't comment on it. Room was next to last room on hall. Had to go all the way to other side of Tower 1 for ice machine. (had to ask directions from security, no map remember?!) Security was usually sitting there by elevator, sign says you need to present room key but no one ever asked. Sales people are completely outta control, they harrass you as soon as you walk in the door for all angles and are always by the entrance to rooms so they get you coming and going! Don't be fooled at first they will make you think they are hotel staff trying to help you check in!! Okay, now to my lovely standard room on the first floor. At first I was completely upset but as it turned out being on the first floor was great!! No waiting for elevators!! Room was quiet, no outside noise, as the view was of a giant wall. There was some space in between and a maintance guy walked by the window one day and scared the crap out of us. Had two double beds, comfortable but only 2 pillows on each. Thank goodness we only used one bed. Got in bed the first night and pulled the covers up to find holes and brown stains....ughhh! Quickly got out and switched beds, that one was better. Room service was good but they did stop me in the hall one day at 11:30 and ask if we were leaving the room at all. Ummm yeah give me a minute lady, I'm on vacation! lol Room had small table and two chairs. Typical small no channel vegas tv. Bathroom was rather large, no tub just shower. Room size for standard room was pretty good size. Went to the pool for about an hour one day. Not packed since it was Oct but nice set up. Pool is located in Tower 2. Didn't do too much gambling here, usually keep on walking out to other hotels. Liked having a base to return to after exploring south end of strip more thorougly. You can walk into Luxor and then into Mandalay Bay without going outside. They also have a free tram connecting them. Liked walking to NYNY, MGM and Tropicana. Bought a 3 day Deuce pass online a head of time and used that to head to the other end of strip and downtown. This hotel has an excellant food court. Loved being able to walk to second floor for quick food options. Ate at McDonalds and Chinese place but they had lots of other stuff to choose from. Also ate at Southwest grill on first floor near Tower 2. Would come back to Excalibur if a good deal came along!!

Reviews.Title: “Still value for money!!!”
Reviews.Author: Hendry's-on-Holiday
Reviews.Content: Ok, quick bit of background here. We were heading back to Vegas Oct 12-22, myself, wife, 12yr old son and my folks. We had stayed at the Excalibur same time last year, and this was to be our 5th visit to Vegas in the last 7 years. Got a great deal on Smartervegas.com, $647 for widescreen room for 10 nights. After a long day travelling from Scotland, we hit Vegas at about 2130, grabbed our bags and dived into a taxi. $15 and 10 minutes later, we were at the check in desk!! No lines, served straight away. Tried the $20 trick but check in clerk already rushed through our booking before even asking for ID & CC, so he didn't even get the chance to see the sandwich, lol.... Only upgrade available was view room for extra $15 per night, declined his offer as we knew the rooms booked were good enough. We were on 26th floor, with view of Luxor and Mandalay Bay. Ok, to the rooms....Like i said, we had stayed here the previous year, so knew what to expect. My folks however were at the Ex for the first time, having previously stayed at the Hilton and HGV Club. Everyone was impressed with the rooms, large enough, 2 good sized queen beds in each room, with requested adjoining door. The Excalibur, in my opinion is a great hotel if the price is right, and we certainly got a great deal. We didn't use any of the hotel restaurants, as we had other places we wanted to try, although we did hit Krispy Kreme Doughnuts a few times!!! Service at the hotel was very good from all employees, and this was true when my folks shower had backed up and a maintenance man turned up within 5 minutes of reporting to front desk!! Pool area was good as always, and had 3 out of 4 pools open, and cabana hire for $60 was really good. Tables and slots were pretty tight though, but i felt this was the case at all the casinos this year, not just the Excalibur. Overall, had another great stay at good prices and comfortable rooms. Would recommend to anyone who goes with a realistic expectation. Excalibur is not high end Vegas luxury, but neither is the room rate. If you appreciate you will get good solid 3 star accommodation, good amenities and friendly service, you will have a great time here.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for the money”
Reviews.Author: keeptryin
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in a standard room. Arrived around noon and there was a line of about 30 people to check in. The line moved fairly quickly and I got a non-smoking, 2 bed standard room (no widescreen tv) on the 14th floor. I didn't inquire about any upgrade and wasn't offered any. Got up to the room and it was dated, but clean and functional. Didn't spend that much time in the room or casino. Did not try any of the restaurants here either. Tried to check out via tv, but it said it was unavailable. The location is a detractor. I spent most of my time mid-strip so I wouldn't stay here again unless it was a really good deal. Took the deuce bus up and down the strip. Bought the 3-day pass online and used it to get to Orleans, Rio, Palms. There is a shuttle from Paris to Rio, but I had the 3-day pass and was set on using it. Ate at Bellgio and Wynn buffets and they're both still exceptional.
