I also took advantage of some coupons online and had a sandwich and soup at Bella Panini in Venetian food court and used the Haagen Daz coupon for ice cream. The meatball sandwich was very good. No complaints about the bed or facilities at Excalibur. I was a bit nervous from reading some negative reviews, but I found everything satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't go back.”
Reviews.Author: DaveNkate
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted a cheap vacation and with the rates right now in Vegas it was possible. This was my third time to Vegas. I have previously stayed at Ballys and the Stratosphere. The Excalibur was probably my least favorite because it is old, corny, and just not nice. I upgraded to the Widescreen room, which is a must, and I was still upset with the room. The rooms just feel dirty and old, the casino is dark and dingy and the sales guys are obnoxious. The best thing about this hotel is the pool, there are a few pools, they are clean and it is a fun atmosphere. The food court was great too. I would definitely not return, I would pay double the price to stay somewhere else nicer and more central on the strip. I don’t have any horror stories about this hotel/casino, I guess you get what you pay for and this is a very old hotel and that is why it is so cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise of a older hotel”
Reviews.Author: oahu2sf
Reviews.Content: Despite it's dated look, the property and casino is clean and manageable. Location is perfect, walkways to Luxor and the New York New York and the Tropicana is good perfect. Upkeep on cleaning is tough as troughs of people go through this property easily. Overall it's a good bargain and near to everything. Stay here to enjoy a good night's rest before going back on the tables or slots.

Reviews.Title: “Right on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: syson1977
Reviews.Content: Getting a little dated now but still got all the bells and whistles and has the basic format of most strip hotels. Ask for a high floor room as they have best views and are quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Not true advertising on web”
Reviews.Author: taffPerthWA
Reviews.Content: Great with the kids due to the Fantasy Fair. Smoking was a huge issue for us, once out of the lift all you could smell was smoke from the Casino. The kids pool was closed the whole time we were there as it was out of season but this wasn't stated on the web site when booking. Rooms very small, meant to be recently refurbished but the bathroom was already looking very tired. Excellent restaurants and good shops in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay and accomodations”
Reviews.Author: travelalloveragain
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights while on vacation in Vegas. Was on floor 26 which had a nice view and decent elevator access. The rooms haven't changed much since we were here 1 1/2 years ago but the place is fine. Good service and checkin/out was easy. For the money you can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Trip w/ kiddos & friends”
Reviews.Author: HeatherG7
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to stay for lots of fun and great place for kids!

Reviews.Title: “Camelot - Ha!”
Reviews.Author: Barti_Ddu
Reviews.Content: Excalibur Well I'm a proud Welshman and I could go on forever in letting you know how VERY WRONG they got the King Arthur element here!!! But let's stick to the facts. I've stayed in Vegas quiet a few times and this is a family orientated three star hotel. Obviously below the Bellagio, Wynn, Venetian etc or the MGM & Mirage, on a par with Harrahs and Flamingo, slightly better than Circus, Stratosphere, Tropicana! This hotel has a supposed King Arthur Camelot castle theme with knights in shining armour, fair maidens, fire breathing dragons and......Robin Hood???? Having said that I found the check in staff miserable and was pounced on every five minutes by the ticket sellers once i ventured off the casino floor! They seem more evident and annoying here than anywhere else I've stayed on the strip. They are like the roaches that hand out flyers outside Planet Hollywood, just in suits! The casino is typical of any other hotel and not much to write home about. The room, located in one of the lower floors of tower 1 had no view at all but was spacious and adequate with plenty of storage space, table & chairs, shower but a safe that didn't work. This was the first time in three trips here over the past 12 months that I was stung for the $5 a night resort / energy tax! The hotel, clean for the most part but I did notice plates & dishes in our halway which noone collected for over 24 hours! Oh yeah and the moat didn't seem to have water in it for our entire stay....guess the water shortage has finally reached Vegas! There are plenty of food choices from fast food to restaurant but fails to have that exclusive eatery or the big name chef attatched to the 4 or 5 star hotels on the strip. A poor selection of shops here, a couple of souveiner ones and plenty selling kids bits & pieces, nothing suitable for a thirtysomething couple! In my opinion if you want to stay this end of the strip opt for the New York, New York or Luxor or pay that little bit extra for the MGM Grand. This hotel is definately in need of upgrading and a revamp.....Disney if you are reading this, give me the job....I'll do things the right way!

Reviews.Title: “Fine for the price”
Reviews.Author: jackflack3
Reviews.Content: 19 year old hotel was fine with us. Elevator wait was really the only negative as how can you complain when you aren't paying much for a room you are never really in? In good proximity to the shops and restaurants New York, New York, Luxor and Mandalay Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur - first time, not the last”
Reviews.Author: 1979guy
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at Excalibur and I would definitely stay there again. The service was great and the casino personnel was very polite and helpful. My spouse booked a standard room but were upgraded to a Widescreen room, and were very impressed with the room. I don't think our experience would have been the same with the less modern standard room, maybe it was just the feeling of having an expensive room but not paying $$$ a night for it. Originally we were going to stay at the Stratosphere due to it's low cost, but seeing how we wanted to spend most our time on the strip we then chose the Sahara due to it's Monorail connection. After reading all the horror stories we then chose the Travelodge on the strip, but my spouse had never been to Vegas so we chose Excalibur as the least expensive big casino value. I don't care how little time you plan to stay in your hotel, it does make a difference in the overall vacation experience.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected .... Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: BrummieSmithy
Reviews.Content: We stopped at the excalibur from the 24th-29th september and had a great time in vegas as usual. This was our third visit to vegas and we absolutely love the place. We had previously stopped at luxor and mgm and we were slightly concerned with the excalibur from what we had seen on previous visits and reviews etc but it was the complete opposite. On arrival, we asked for an upgrade and got one of the refurbed rooms with the plasma tv and a view of the strip which was brilliant all for nothing (well, a bit of sweet talking and smiles), so that was the best start we could have hoped for !! Room was in tower 2, second floor and was perfect for what you we needed. At the end of the day it is a base and somewhere to sleep and shower. Never see the point of spending a fortune on a luxury room when you wil hardly be in it! So, the view from the room was of the strip, as we looked out the window we faced the side of monte carlo and if we looked slightly right we had the view of the strip, mgm, new york new york etc etc and could see as far down as the venetian. The room had recently been refurbed and looked good and modern, nice plasma, carpets, comfy beds and large bathroom etc. No faults with the room at all. The pool area was nice, no where near the size and quality of mgm's pool area but still nice and always found sunbeds early afternoon. Inside the casiono areas, it does have an old look about the place and probably could do with modernising but the likes of excalibur, new york new york and other older hotels are sometimes what vegas is all about. We walked past the 'party pit' every night back to the room which was a nice view, the casino, slots and tables were always busy, as well as the food areas etc. Overall, we were pleasently surprised by the quality of the hotel, especially the room we had. We love vegas in general and would definately stop at the excalibur again.

Reviews.Title: “not for children, not for adults.... not for anyone!”
Reviews.Author: doctor925
Reviews.Content: we travel to vegas a lot and decided to stay at the excalibur this time since we have had good experiences at other mgm/mirage hotels. I was suprised to see how much upgrading this hotel/casino needed and was shocked that it was an mgm/mirage hotel. It must certainly be the black sheep of the family. reservations and check-in experiences were acceptable. we stayed in tower 2 with the "renovated" rooms (they basically put in a widescreen tv and it is now "renovated.") the room was in need of new "renovating" already and the shower barely worked. we came with kids.... the pool with the slide was only open for one day out of the three that we stayed, but the kids loved the pool for that one day. the arcade/midway downstairs was the worst i've ever seen. broken games, indifferent employess, not enough staff.... looked a lot like what a carinival museum would look like. this is NOT a hotel for kids, trust me on this one. later in the day, adults will not like all the kids running around, and the families with kids will not like the strippers dancing on the tables. Just who the hotel is catering to is a huge mystery. for those who like to gamble, this is NOT the place to play. This is the only mgm/mirage casino where i was treated badly by the VIP host. they certainly need lessons in customer appreciation. Definitely one of those hotels that need to be replaced since the location is failrly good.

Reviews.Title: “Castle on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: TheGreatOne11
Reviews.Content: Service at Excalibur was kind and courteous Hotel room was clean

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: ahershy
Reviews.Content: Went to Vegas w/my hubby, his parents, my parents, and his sister and brother-in-law. We all absolutely loved it. It is on the corner across from New York, New York, MGM Grand, and another one whose name escapes me at the moment. Perfect place to stay on the strip because you are at the end. Not a far walk from the Bellagio, Caesar's, etc. The rooms were immaculate, the casino was nice, as was the pool. Staff was all super friendly, and the rates were AWESOME. The eateries left a little to be desired, but you get what you pay for at buffet time. Can't wait to go back again :)

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel - BUT Dont eat the Buffett!”
Reviews.Author: kjk64
Reviews.Content: We got a good price for the newly remodeled Tower 2 with widescreen tv for $59 a night, plus 2 all day all you can eat buffett passes--- The room was great for the money. Clean, nice tv, cant complain. Know that there is no tub (only walk in shower) and no coffee maker (which is standard in Vegas these days).... But the beds were comfortable and the room large enough for the 4 of us. No complains.... pool was nearly empty and very nice, 4 large pools, 1 adult only, very nice! HOWEVER, we all got very sick on the Buffett and it was so mediorce when eating it too. Not good food and made all for of us sick. Cant recommend the food. Go somewhere else! (METRO PIZZA delivers and was really good)

Reviews.Title: “Kid Friendly for Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Luv2VacationForever
Reviews.Content: We were very careful in selecting a place to stay with our kids in Vegas. We needed a stopover on our way back from San Diego, we had some friends in Vegas, so we decided to stay here. Having children while traveling is always tricky, especially in a place like Vegas. We are lucky because our kids are cute and don't cause trouble. I do have to say that everyone we encountered, both staff and guests, were kind to us. Pros - --Pool - just make sure it is open, and which parts are open. There is a small 18+ pool if you are traveling without kids. My kids enjoyed the waterslide. There are 2, but only 1 was open. --Room - We chose a large deluxe room. It had recently been updated and was very clean considering what we have seen on the strip in Vegas. It was roomy. It had 2 queens and a couch. Shower only, no tub. --Check-in- The line was long, but moved quickly. I was about 10 minutes. The staff members were friendly. --Quiet Cons- --Parking. Use free Valet. Self-park is far away, and worth a couple of bucks in tip. However, having said that, valet is a little bit of a wait. --Location is okay, but remember that you are on the south end of the strip, so getting anywhere takes some time.

Reviews.Title: “don't stay in tower 1”
Reviews.Author: sweettarts
Reviews.Content: i found tower 1 to be very old and still had the motel style AC units. all view are blocked by a wall. it was clean but furnishing need a serious overhaul.

Reviews.Title: “Staying in Excalibur is great.”
Reviews.Author: XxMerlinxX
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Excalibur twice now and it's one of our favorite casinos in relation to price. The casino itself is situated somewhat at the end of the strip, but still easily within walking distance of other major casinos and the monorail. The staff there are normally very friendly and will try to help you with whatever you may need. The atmosphere inside is nice, not overly crowded, high ceilings, and lots of floor space make for a nice non-claustrophobic experience. We've gotten the cheapest rooms both times we stayed and have been perfectly satisfied. One thing that I don't like about the place is the food, their buffet is slightly sub-par when compared to others. The shows that they had going didn't seem to be very entertaining either. And lastly, the time-share hawkers that try and grab you every time you walk in. That is the MOST annoying thing ever.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: 4hunters
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were a bit nervous in reserving a "lower-quality" hotel on the strip. However, we were pleasantly surprised. We had no issues throughout the entire trip (3 nights). Table minimums are among the lowest on the strip and the updated "widescreen" rooms are nicer than we expected. If we had kids with us I would not have appreciated the go-go dancers being placed in the middle of the casino as they are. However, since it was just the wife and I, we had absolutely no problem with the eye candy.

Reviews.Title: “Last of 3 hotels for week absolutely the WORST..never again”
Reviews.Author: mustang88actuator
Reviews.Content: Most bizarre parking situation (should have just done valet) very rude check in employee, there was a extremely long line of people checking in so we decided sure we'll check in also (slightly after 1 :20 pm) Chastized for trying to "check in early" and told that nothing was ready and we would have to come back after 3pm. Told to leave bags with bell service. I decided that I would rather leave than stay where I was going to be given such attitude, what bout all the other peoplee in line the never ending line. So we hiked back to the parking ramp with all our luggage because at this point I would rather have stayed anywhere but here even I had already paid in advance. Left stuff in car and went back in immediately, got back in line, different registration person and no mention of what had just occured and like magic we had a room!!??** Go figure. So not sure what the little witchs problem was, but I am not demanding, a very easy going customer, but certainly to get put off by poor customer service. Room was okay but place is laid out like a rat maze, cocktail service is just about non-existant (and yes I always tip, but can only tip if I receive something) Poor signage to get to NYNY. Tried to sample the flavor of a couple different establishments in one week trip to report to folks back home for future travel plans. Paris - YES , Harrah's - YES, Golden Nugget - YES, Excalibur - NO NO NO & before I forget did the room get vacuumed before we got it, found someone's skanky black socks on floor near edge of bed, weren't ours! Uck!

Reviews.Title: “Best of the cheapest on strip”
Reviews.Author: lplage
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, people were freindly, check out and check in was less than 5 minutes. We did not much in the hotel but those that did found it better than ave. The pool area was clean, large and well organized. Rooms were outdated but clean. Not the Paris or MGM but not near the price either.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the $$$”
Reviews.Author: travelingurl01
Reviews.Content: Good Value for the money for sure! The all day Buffet is good for a change we went next door to the Luxor and ate there for free on our Comps. The casino was always hopping we stayed in the Tower 1 rooms the room was clean only complaint the bed was too soft. The pool area is nice always chaise loungers available and on our last day we got a cabana for $75 which was great. If you have a late flight you can check out spend the day at the pool and pay the $5 guest fee to use the spa to shower and get ready. Over all I would stay at the Excalibur again as we got a great deal couldn’t beat the price. We had some of the best cocktail waitresses on this casino floor. Went mid strip it was like pulling teeth to get a cocktail this might just be why the casino @ the Excalibur is busy!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, excellent service & location”
Reviews.Author: stefgizzi2
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded after asking for an upgrade to king widescreen room and explaining we were celebrating our 5 year anniversary. The pools were nice, there were several margarita machines at the bars, food was good at every resteraunt. I was excited there were 2 starbucks and a krispy kreme at the hotel too. I had good luck with the slot machines too. I would for sure stay here again and I just have to add that I was skeptical on coming here because I typically ONLY stay at 5 star (maybe 4 star depending on where we are going). Oh and be sure to visit Casa Di Amore - an Italian resteraunt off the strip. It was really good and they picked us up in a limo (round-trip) for free - if you book in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Price”
Reviews.Author: Ionb1
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel with a good location right next to New York and the Luxor. Perfect for kids - good size pool (4 pools) and a food court for a quick breakfast or late night snack. Just be mindful of the evening entertainment just like any other Hotel in Vegas. Large portions through room service and up to four of us ate (with leftovers) by ordering just two entrees.

Reviews.Title: “Simply a good place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: snowangel888
Reviews.Content: Excalibur may be down in the far end of the strip but it's still on the strip and for the price you can't really beat it. It's close to the luxor and mandalay bay. We didn't get to see the tournament show and the casino is not that bad either.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Excalibur if at all possible”
Reviews.Author: MichaelAMiller
Reviews.Content: No security – no chain or deadbolt lock on door, no checking for access, Pizza delivery leaves menus nightly under door. Access to floor or room is available to all. Additional resort fee of $ 7.50 per night plus tax accessed. Tower wide screen room is most basic and contains no thrills Bath contains shower with hanging doors, non-adjustable head, no tub. If close to elevator bank – noise is constant. No coffee / tea service / refrigerator / or mini bar. No TV guide / hotel service manual / or listing of amenities. Internet charge is $ 13.99 per day for connection. No desk or other work area. Access to pool in through lobby. Inadequate working areas and no reading lights. Furnishings: rug, chairs, tables, etc. well worn even after refurbishing. I would not recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Value, Value, Value”
Reviews.Author: tennisbob
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean and spacious. This hotel is located near other nice hotels and casinos on the strip and a short distance from the airport. There is a very reasonably priced buffet at the hotel which is probably the best buffet on the strip. The night life is good also since there were various bands and singers at the different bars in the casino. We were able to get a bus trip that picked us up at the hotel to go to the Grand Canyon which was also worth the cost.

Reviews.Title: “hidden charges...”
Reviews.Author: ma1inka
Reviews.Content: They gave us 2 "free" drinks and game coupons, but then they charged us for them 11 dollars, even we didn't use them. Towels are old and not clean, no fridge in a room... hotel is far from parking lot. No free Internet.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, Speedy Check In!”
Reviews.Author: ms_nataku
Reviews.Content: Decent standard rooms. View is decent also. There is a very good thing and that is the speedy check in. From line to counter to check in, it took less than 5 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “a basic room on the strip, but the price is right”
Reviews.Author: courtneyschmortney
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a plain ol' place to sleep it off on the strip, this is it... clean rooms, but very basic. Nice, clean pool area - better than what we saw of the New York, New York pools. Hooray for the $5 craps table!

Reviews.Title: “Try somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: jxb534
Reviews.Content: The reason I say try somewhere else is because with all of the options in Las Vegas there has to be a better hotel for people on a budget. Here is my take on Excalibur to help you with your decison: The room- Sheets and pillowcases had stains on them. Gross. There were used glasses outside our door when we first arrived and for about 24 hours after. Gross. Dust on bedside table. Gross. There is no fridge in the room and it is 20$ a day to rent one. I asked for extra blankets and the person at the front desk said "We'll see what we can do. I'll put it in the computer." Like that was so much to ask! He was VERY rude to me. I have been to many hotels and have traveled to many cities and I've never been spoken to like that by someone at Guest Services. I simply asked for two extra blankets. I asked for these blankets because they are paper thin and there are no comforters on the beds, just very thin blankets. The pillows are VERY soft. There is a plasma tv in the room with about 5 channels, so what's the point? The bathroom looked slightly updated but still in need of repairs. The beds are very firm. I like firm beds so this didn't bother me as much as the soft pillows, the dirty sheets, and the paper thin blankets. Service- Besides the man at the front desk, every one was very nice. The bell man, the waitresses and waiters, bartenders, etc. Location- good. There are many shops near by and places to eat. Excalibur has a nice buffet where you can eat all day for $29. We also really liked the italian restaurant "Regale." There is also a chinese take out place, Coldstone, Starbucks, Auntie Anns, McDonalds and other options. I really liked Excalibur's eating options. Excalibur is about a 10$ cab ride from the airport. It is within walking distance to all the big hotels like Bellagio, Ceasers, Venetian, Mirage, Mandalay Bay, MGM, New York. Mirageand Venetian are about a mile away. There are several pools and they are all nice. You can rent a cabana to get out of the heat for $80. The cabanas have plasma tvs in them as well. The spa- wonderful. So relaxing and clean. There is a steam room, sauna, jacuzzi, showers, etc. I got my first massage and it was perfect. Ask for Tricia, she was awesome! Prices are reasonable. Tip: take the bus for $7 all day and see Old Las Vegas and all the wedding chapels and get on and off as much as you like. Go see Love by Cirque Du Soliel. It was amazing and plays at The Mirage.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur is excellent value and has a great location”
Reviews.Content: Out of the hotels on the strip it's obviously not the most glamorous, but definitely worth the money. Room was very nice and clean, and I loved the poolside area. I have no complaints about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value, Clean Rooms, Great Staff.”
Reviews.Author: vargoge
Reviews.Content: I'm always very hesitant when a great price is offered. We were offered rooms at the Sahara @ $16 per night, but staying at the Excalibur was the best thing we ever did. The room was clean and offered a good view of the southern strip. We stayed on the 11th floor of Tower II. I think the only disappointment was the distance you had to walk to get to the casino from your car. This wasn't my first trip to Vegas, but it was for my two friends and we wanted to take full advantage of the weeks stay. The casino offered free games of chance ($5x2) and two free drinks ($5x2) every day we stayed at the hotel. This was to offset a $5.60 fee we were billed daily in addition to our $38 plus tax nightly room charges. The weeks stay was only $187.38, we received 2 free nights because we stayed the entire week. Considering that many of the other casinos were charging close to or over $100 per night, I think we made a great decision. The casino was packed daily, but got worse on Thursday, Friday and Saturday. There were plenty of comps being thrown around, but not for a group of guys, only for couples. So show/dinner/casino discounts were not offered to us in the casino. The TIX discount show booth is only 1/2 block from the Excalibur, so we didn't miss out getting discounts on shows we wanted to see. There is a 2 for 1 discount for those who stay at the Excalibur to the "Tournament of Kings" dinner show, so don't book this at checking if you are staying a few days. They don't offer the discount until you have stayed a few nights, but go down to the desk everyday! They will offer you comps you didn't receive at check in. The all you can eat "All Day" buffet is a great option for $25, but we didn't take them up on it since we were not willing to come back to the casino for lunch and dinner. They place a daily guide in your room of events that occur in the casino all week, plus there are other specials slipped under the door every morning. I will stay again, especially since we were only in our room to freshen up or sleep. By the end of the week we heard people being offered $189 per night @ the Luxor, but looking at the rooms, we were very happy with our decision to stay at the Excalibur for less than a nights stay at a neighboring casino.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: acepeda
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect for Las Vegas... at a great price!! Would go back at any time!! We were booked for normal rooms, but when we got there, we didn't like the rooms on the first floor looking at the garage, so they upgraded the 6 rooms we had for free!! Amazing service!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: cabbie61
Reviews.Content: This might not be one of the classiest on the strip but we got an excellent rate $47 a night and it was well worth the money. Had one of the refurbished widescreen view rooms too which was adequate, Only downside was the safe was locked and even though we reported it straight away nobody came and unlocked it for us the whole time we were there. We figured they would rather we had all our money on us so it was easier for us to get our hands on it to spend it in the casino! No fridge, or coffee in your room which was a bit annoying but there again they want you to spend the money downstairs. I This hotel has a great location and as we werent spending a whole lot of time in the room and for the price we paid we were more than happy there. Parking was plentiful and free too which was good. The facilities in the hotel and the pool were more than adequate too Beware the time share people though, they bug you and if you dont buy with them watch out!!

Reviews.Title: “Showing signs of wear & tear”
Reviews.Author: quiUK
Reviews.Content: Whilst the Excalibur is obviously a more budget friendly option than other hotels & casinos on the strip, it really does feel it. The decor - in an appallingly cheesy Medieval theme - is beginning to fray around the edges and the staff are a little brusque. Despite being in need or a refurb, our room was clean and spacious though. We didn't eat in the hotel so cannot comment on the restaurants or pool, but it was easy and convenient to walk to other places on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “The Excaliber has Become a Larger Motel 6”
Reviews.Author: stewwwie1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I checked into the Excaliber and the desk person immediately showed us the "upgrade list". Why should you have to upgrade when you already have a reservation? We were given keys to a room on the fifith floor overlooking the pool. A fairly clean room that was well worn and used. Not the cleanest but not the dirtiest! The bedspread was torn, the sheets were threadbare, and they also had a hole in them and the bathroom towels were worn and smelled like they were burnt. The hallways were never cleaned in the three days that we stayed there. People bring drinks up from the casino and them put them in front of their room doors where the same four glasses remained throughout our stay. I called housekeeping and alerted them to no avail. The buffet was running a special $25.00 dollars for food all day that they were open, what a deal. OK food but nothing to rave about, if you are a big eater or traveliong with a family what a bargain, three squares and all of the snacks you could want. Bring baggies like everyone else did, Overall a good place for families on a budget, great location, good shows lots of noise and lots of kids running!

Reviews.Title: “carnival atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: suki5150
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at EXCALIBUR a number of times over the years, but the latest trip may well be the last............................. We arrived on a Sunday night, usually a quiet time to arrive, but the check in queue was rediculous. Some 40 minutes later, we got to the desk and told the room we booked was not ready and to check our bags. An hour later we went to the desk and got our room. We paid a fair price and got the old rooms with the terrible bedding. Dirty towel on the floor, candy wrappers and a total of 18 cents in change. NOT vacuumed then......... The main problem was the kids. It's a casino !!!!!!!!! Smoking, swearing, drinking, dancing girls, etc, NOT an environment for them. They were everywhere !! anytime, anywhere, strollers, screaming, winging, elevators, eating, falling over. C'mon EXCALIBUR, observe the plaques everywhere warning of the "21 ONLY" law and make your casino kid free and bring back the old customers.

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: MexicoMadness
Reviews.Content: We had a fine stay Sept 12-16. Fortunately we were upgraded to the Tower II rooms ( as per comments from friends and other reviwers Tower I rooms are like dungeons)and over-looking the Tropicana Ave side..7th floor with a great view. the room was very nicely appointed ...clean and spacious. And at $ 33.00 per nite ($ 61.00 for Sat) plus resort fee and taxes a truly unbeatable rate for we got and the location. Only complaint perhaps is that walking through from room to entrance is very noisy...---Dick's and the Party Pit.....and the " Hi...Guys" from the timeshare hustlers is bothersome ...particularly being hassled before even checking-in...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Pity about some of the Staff!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gavandkatie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in September, and had a great time. It was my third time in Vegas and in this hotel. My last time in Vegas was 1999 and I couldn't believe how much the city had changed! The hotel is in a perfect location on the strip, and great value for money. Great pool and gym/sauna facilites. Good restaurants, (must try the all day buffet for $25!!) Good food court, and outlets.We stayed in one of there widescreen rooms, which was clean and tidy, with a huge bed and massive over the top sized TV!!! Perfect location on the strip, touching diostance from New York New York and Luxor/Mandalay Bay. Only problem we had with the hotel was been bothered by sales staff trying to sell us timeshare at the new hotel!!! Everytime you walked through the hotel, and before we even checked in, trying to ship us off to a new hotel site for a day, for a discount on show tickets!?!? No Thank you! On a similar note about staff, desk staff/Porters were not the most friendliest or helpful, with our few queries during the week. 3 different staff members telling us something different each time we asked about the shuttle buses!?!? But this is a all round great hotel, for your stay in Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur is FUN! :)”
Reviews.Author: Superjungleboy
Reviews.Content: The Excalibur hotel was a great part of our stay in Vegas! Very worth the money we paid, the pool and gym were beautiful and the Drenched bar staff were all really nice on the 3 40+ days we were in town. The hotel is among the older ones on the strip but they're working to renovate the rooms and keep up to date, a hard task for any 3000 room hotel! We had a very spacious room with newly appointed features, the bathroom was HUGE! The room was very quiet as well didn't hear anything all night (maybe becuase we were in bed at 4am every day) Front desk staff were all really nice, and quick to check us in and explain our stay perks to us. Housekeeping was really nice too, smiling and chatting with us in the halls. Dicks looked like a really fun restaurant but unfortunately we never had the chance to eat there, stuff to do on the next trip! :D

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Excalibur!”
Reviews.Author: nunontherunn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Excalibur for three nights whilst on holiday this September. This was our first time in Vegas and we stayed here and at the Bellagio for the last two nights in Vegas. We really liked both hotels, the Bellagio was obviously much more luxurious but we thought the Excalibur was great for the price and were really pleased we stayed there. We stayed in a widescreen tower view room which was one of the newer rooms in the hotel. Our room was HUGE, really clean, nice bathroom, big plasma TV and great views of new york new york hotel and MGM grand part of the strip. For the price this is a great hotel in terms of quality and location. The casino was also really good and we really liked the Italian restaurant in the hotel. You also get two free drinks vouchers on checking in. Pools were good too although the main one was closed for duration of our stay and none of the staff seemed to know why. A bit annoying when we paid $5 day resort fee! The other two pools were good though. We did a free poker lesson in the casino one moring which was really good and the 1c slots at Excalibur were the best we played on in terms of fun and frequency of wins!! The casino seemed a bit more smokey than other hotels maybe because of the low ceilings - As non smokers this was a bit of a pain. Drink severs came round frequently and were more than happy with a one dollar tip per free drink. Overall I would definatley recommend the Excalibur and would stay there again in future. It seems a lot of the negative reviews on here are from people who stayed in the older rooms so maybe its best to book the newer widescreen tower rooms like ours when staying here if you can. As with most of the hotels you have to put up with the staff trying to get you to go on timeshare tours. We actually went on one of these tours to get free theatre tickets. This might not be for everyone but we were pleased we gave up 3 hours one morning to get 2 full price Cirque du sol theatre tickets for free! Also got breakfast whilst there too! As long as you dont give in to the sales talk and just say no its fine and relativley painless! Great hotel for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur is the definition of "Vegas"”
Reviews.Author: CanadianBonair
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights at the Exalibur, our first time in Vegas. We were NOT disappointed!. This hotel is exactly what we expected! It's not flashy and modern, it's original outlandish Vegas. The room in Tower 2 was nice. We paid $68/night for 4 people! It is right inbetween Luxor and NewYork NewYork,. In reality, you don't spend any time in your hotel room, too much to do!. We found that the food court in The Excalibur suited us the best (Mc' D's, Pizza Hut, Quizno's, Dunkin Doughnuts. etc). It is located in a great spot. MGM is right across the street. We found the dancing girls in the casino to be exactly what was expected for Vegas. Only spent about 30 minutes in the pool, things to do, places to see! Valet and bellmen very helpful. I'd stay there again or might try NY NY next time. No problems with the room, view of the pool, not noisy, nice bathroom. If you want a true Vegas experience, try the Excalibur and save lots of money since you will spend very little time there anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Great Pool!”
Reviews.Author: myoa05
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Excalibur with my mother for 4 nights. The room was ok nothing spectacular...but we dident plan on staying in the room too much. The room was very clean, and we were stocked up daily with fresh towels. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The Pool's were GREAT. We spent a couple hours a day in the pool & hot tub! We would recommend this hotel to others if your looking to get the best value for your money!

Reviews.Title: “good value - happy with our stay”
Reviews.Author: macdan
Reviews.Content: We only had a one night stay at Excalibur but we were very happy with the experience. We were in Vegas for 4 nights and spent the first 3 nights in the MGM which we really enjoyed. We got a fabulous deal at the MGM for Monday to Wednesday but found the price trebled for the Thursday night so we thought we would try the Excalibur which was a fraction of the price. We stayed in a standard room at the Excalibur which was clean, comfortable and spacious although alittle dated. We loved the atmosphere of the hotel and found staff to be very helpful and friendly. Wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good casino, poor room”
Reviews.Author: ShortieMichigan
Reviews.Content: I had fun in casino but my room was another matter. Upon check in, the room w/ king bed that I booked thru Expedia wasn't available. I was given a room w/ two queens. I go to open the door of room and discover that the previous quest were still in room due to late check out. I guess I surprised them! Carried luggage back to reservation desk and received another room. This time I was given a room w/ king bed and a couch. I carried my luggage to new room. Also, during my stay, I found at least three insects of varying types (not anything small like ants, large beetles?) in my room. I will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “+Excalibur not handicapped friendly”
Reviews.Author: Bernadine53
Reviews.Content: Our shuttle bus dropped my handicapped husband, daughter and myself off at the back of the hotel. We had 6 bags of luggage. When we entered the hotel, there was no one to help us with the luggage. We dialed 7241 for help, but no one answered the phone. We were stranded and depressed until my daughter said out loud, isn't there anyone here who can help us?? A security guard heard her and came over to us. We told him that we need a wheelchair for my husband and a cart for all of our luggage. A manager appeared on the scene and he quickly dispatched a wheelchair for my husband and a luggage cart. Security Guard, John "Shrek" came to our rescue and took us to the registration desk where we had an electric scooter waiting for us that we had ordered. He took us to our room and ordered more towels for us and a bath mat for our shower so my husband wouldn't fall getting out. He was really our Guardian Angel and was so personable that we felt so much better with him looking out for our well-being. I want to praise John who is a wonderful asset to Excalibur. They should have more employees like him. He makes the hotel/casino look very good. We bought the "all you can eat" meal ticket, however, we only ate breakfast and dinner there. It was still a good deal. My daughter made arrangements for when we were leaving and everything was done as she requested and also at the time she requested. My suggestion is: Have a security guard near where the people enter the hotel from the shuttle bus. That was completely horrible and so depressing for us not knowing where to turn for help. B. Elick from Pennsylvania

Reviews.Title: “mistake to take kids”
Reviews.Author: aido23Liverpool
Reviews.Content: we read all the reviews about this hotel and where very apprehensive about staying there, however we asked and received a free upgrade with no problem and for the price can not fault the hotel. The 4 pools where great although they do appear to let anybody in as you do not need to show your room key. My kids are 9 and 7 and enjoyed the pool and eating at Denny's and that's all. We have been to Vegas before and felt there where a lot of things for the kids to do but it was to hot outside and to cold inside and they are not interested in looking inside all the Hotels or shopping. Are total spend exc the holiday was approx £1900 for 1 week and we bought very little. Two drinks costing 18 dollers. I would return as I love vegas but I would never take my kids again.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT VALUE”
Reviews.Author: bigmickey69
Reviews.Content: Just returned after annual holiday in the USA, and had my 6th visit to LAS VEGAS, this time we stayed 7 nts in The Excalibur and as Vegas goes found it excellent value. We were in Tower 2 on the 24th floor and the room was very clean with a large bathroom with a big walkin shower, the room also had a large LCD tv on the wall and the daily cleaning service was excellent. The hotels casino is vast and the staff very friendly, check in took all off 3 mins. Bars and music are plentiful and the Buffet was excellent value @ $25 for all day if you wanted, there was also a good food court with Mc Donalds etc if you wanted to go for fast food. (Especially with kids) There was also a few restaurants for the more intimate diners. The hotel also has a nightclub and various shows of which we went to TOURNAMENT OF KINGS, which is a Jousting show where you have a meal and eat with your fingers and was good fun and lively. The hotel has joined access to New York New York and Luxor hotels and therfore you have the best off 3 hotels-4 if you count the MGM across the bridge. The only downside is that the wee shops ( CIGS- SWEETS CRISPS, etc) at the base off the lift entrance are very pricey, so its better to buy room snacks and sweets for kids in some off the shops outside. But all in allthat would be my only complaint

Reviews.Title: “My stay at Excalibur Hotel”
Reviews.Author: justmekaren918
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Excalibur for 6 nights 7 days and it is a decent hotel. No frills and somewhat clean. I ate at the dinner buffett and did not find the food all that good, the prime rib over cooked and dry. I ordered steak and eggs through room service and I ordered around 3am and got a 9:30am slot which was perfect and the food was great. Steak was just the way I wanted it and it was good. I stayed in a widescreen room and it was showing some wear with the table lamp shade had a crack in it and the other shade had some black marks on it and their were other small issues. The one thing I did not like or appreciate was that making the bed correctly is apparently optional. Apparently the maids just pick up whatever is the next set of sheets and if they don't fit they stil make the bed. This happend just about every night I was their. I couldn't be the only person running into this issue. I also had meetings at Mandalay for 3 mornings and the tram was not running in the morning, so I had to hoof it over and almost missed the start of my first meetings for this issue. We surmised that maybe they wanted us to hoof to hopefully spend money or gamble, but what a drag to have to walk then be pretty hot for your first meeting. I certanily could not beat the view of NY NY and MGM for the price. All and all it was liveable for the price. The Excalibur champagne was good not to dry for $9.99 a bottle.

Reviews.Title: “Nice casino, poor rooms”
Reviews.Author: pack8398
Reviews.Content: First off, you get what you pay for and that is definitely the case at Excalibur. We checked in on a Friday and moved in and out of two rooms before finally getting a decent room on the third try. The first room (on the 13th floor of all things) had something that looked like red kool-aid all over the wall, curtains ceiling and floor. The curtains had to be completely removed and the floor shampooed. All of this not to mention that a lamp shade was completely missing from one of the lamps. Not sure how the staff missed all of this when they declared the room ready. Off to room number 2. We were put in a handicap room with a vanity that was approximately 18 inches across. There were other alterations that would be helpful for people that needed it but an inconvenience for someone who didn't. So, off to room number three. That room, thankfully, was clean, mostly. The shade over the window didn't work- we had to tie it up with some string to get a view of the pool. The lamp fixture was broken but otherwise, was okay. One thing about the widescreen rooms-- they are widescreen TV's but there's no HD signal. In fact, there were only about 15 channels on TV to watch. But hey, who goes to Vegas to watch TV? The casino was nice and we liked the food court. It was nice to eat at McDonalds or hit the Starbucks and Krispy Kreme on occasion. I thought the fitness center was clean and outstanding as was the pool. Other than the rooms, the Excalibur is not terrible. The staff was helpful and friendly. However, we will not stay here when we return to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap Clean Fun”
Reviews.Author: CNOVA2208
Reviews.Content: Some Girlfriends and I decided to take our first trip to Vegas and booked the Excalibur through southwestvacations.com after reading I don't know how many different reviews. This hotel ended up being perfect for what we were looking for. When we arrived it was only 12p in the afternoon and check-in wasnt for a few hours...but they allowed to check into our room anyway with no additional charge. We stayed in tower 1 like tower 2 a good distance away from the check-in desk but it really didnt matter to us. When we got up to our room everything was clean including the bathroom. They had a good amount of towels for everyone as well as extra toilet paper. Also what i really liked was since there were 5 of us we were given rooms right next to each other and we could access each others room because there was a door within the room. I am picky when it comes to the beds...but my bed was clean and soft...my only complaint was that the pillows weren't the best. Also just to set the record straight, there are no refridgerators or microwaves....so we ended up buying a styrofoam coolers to keep water, juice, and LIQ cool. Also, there is a tram that will take you from the excalibur into the Luxor and Mandalay bay hotels, which can be accessed within the hotel. If you prefer to walk, just go up to the second floor of the main tower, where the casino is and you can walk right through the hotels. The buffet in excalibur is the greatest, ended up getting the $30 bracelet to eat as many times as we wanted for the day...and they didnt change the lunch..so we ended up eating the same thing for dinner as well. I would recommend the Mandalay buffet which was about the same price, but had a better selection and the food was amazing. If you dont want to buffet there are also restaurants like McDonalds, starbucks, crispy cream, and some others, but for the most part going out to the strip was what we did for the remainder of our trip. Although the strip looks walkable...its not not. Since taxi's weren't the cheapest..we decided to get a 3 day bus pass which was $15(and it was well worth it). The isn't a long wait for buses and it travels right down Las Vegas BLVD, which was perfect, but beware the buses stay at every stop for at least 10 min or more. Even the the buses were cheap....when we went out to the clubs we did end up taking taxi's...and just so everyone knows, there is a line outside every hotel which is extremely only and since we were parties of five we had to wait for the vans.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur - Great Price, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Okanaganamiga
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent five nights and six days (Sept 13-18th/09) at The Excalibur. I had read alot of reviews before arriving, some good, some bad. We had a great stay. Our room was on the 24th floor in tower one. Yes, it is an older hotel, but it was clean, our room attendant was awesome and went out of his way to make our stay comfortable. Being also, that when in Vegas, not much time is spent in the room. It was extremely hot during the week and the air conditioner worked perfectly. Our view was ok enough to get some good pictures from the room. Check in was unbelievably fast, and the line up was loooong! Pleasant staff as well. I have nothing negative to say about the hotel other than the elevators could use a bit of better air flow, but a very quick ride I must say, the elevators are also split into sections of the hotel so ours was from the 18th to (I think it was) 27th floors. The service in the casino was great, have to remember how many people are all thirsty all at the same time, if you are THAT thirsty there are other options for beverages and convenient. We went to Thunder from Down Under, now this girls will be up to you, but I would have preferred to spend my money on something else! The men were handsome yes and can dance, and 99% of the time fully clothed. We were lucky to see some "butt cheek" and there was no frontal nudity. There was alot of talk from the host and alot of advertising. Another thing is that the hostess does not check ticket stubs matched with the seats. We had a lady be quite rude and told us to move not realizing there were numbered seats, only to see that lady get the boot from those seats. The highlight was that my friend got pulled up on stage, never saw her smile that big!!! Jello shots helped ease the feeling of wasting my money. We also went to see The Tournament of kings...totally worth it!!! Great show, well done and beautiful costumes. Check out was a breeze as well. Location is good, connecting to New York New York and The MGM. I could write a review about all of Vegas that we saw but the review is for the hotel (and it would be pages long!!!!), my advise is to take a cab everywhere!!!!! They are cheap and plenty and believe me you will regret taking the bus!!!!! The trams and high speed LRT are also good options. DON"T TAKE THE BUS!!! Even the "Deuce", uh uh! Comfortable shoes are a must and in a pinch you can get some good cheap flip flops at Walgreens....learned that one the hard way! All in all The Excalibur was a great place to stay with good shops and munchie choices. Didn't do the buffet, too much food in a day for me. Was too hot, YES TOO HOT to go to the pool, so no review for that. Easy to fill your days. There were two of us in one room and we only got charged for one person for the $5.00 a day charge. Good times, good times. Fancy no, rasonable yes, and great service. Bed was a little tired but hey, no biggie.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel with lots to do in and around it.”
Reviews.Author: Habby31
Reviews.Content: Nice casino, decent restaurant, some good bars and really excellent caring staff, I was in one of the newly renovated rooms with a 42 inch HDTV. Beds were extremely comfortable. This place is not even close to the nicest hotel nor is it the one with the most amenities...but it's clean, has great service and offers very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel when you don't want to go all-in”
Reviews.Author: chepdk
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel when I went to Vegas for the first time. We were 10 mates for a casual weekend without wanting to go all-in. Both the rooms and casino were good value for the money. Unlike Caesar's Palace where it often costs a minimum of $25 per hand of Black Jack you can find some nice table games here to a fair price when in the mood for a bit of casual gambling.

Reviews.Title: “Make your own mind up - For the location and price it can't be beaten”
Reviews.Author: monstermuppetdog
Reviews.Content: Having read many reviews left by previous guests, I arrived at the Excalibur Hotel for my 13 night stay in August full of dread and fear. I had initially chosen this hotel because of the great location and cost (some of my nightly rates were as low as $22 a night), and had decided that all I needed was a base for my stay, after all I had gone to Vegas to experience the fantastic atmosphere not to take root in a hotel room. Over the past 5 years my husband and I have visited Las Vegas 3 times,staying at the Imperial Palace, Flamingo and Luxor and have found the accomodation to be pleasant and more than adequate for our needs. When we checked in to the Excalibur after 14 hours of travelling, the member of staff was very pleasant, and upgraded with out asking us to a widescreen tower room which had recently been refurbished, and gave us some vouchers for 2 free drinks, 2 free spa passes and 2 free games on the fantasy midway. The room was very clean and tastefully decorated, and was more than adequate for our needs. As we explored the hotel we were very impressed with the cleanliness of the hotel, and the helpfulness of the staff who we encountered. The pool was fantastic, and there was always sunbeds available for guests, even over the labour day weekend which saw a massive increase in the number of guests staying at the hotel. The only drawback was that it was a real suntrap, and the pool had very little shade (unless you hired a cabana for $60 - $100 per day) but the shallow pool and hot tub helped to cool you down. The only negative thing about the hotel was the constant badgering by sales staff to get you to attend a presentation for the new city centre resort - they were placed in all key areas in the hotel, and even though they were not persistant, we found ourselves finding alternative routes through the casino to avoid them. Overall I was really suprised at the quality of the accomodation and would definately stay here again. The rates are cheap, there are plenty of options for food, drink and shopping, and is in a prime location for accessing many of the large hotels. The other advantage of staying at the Excalibur is that it is one of the first stops on the deuce route and so normally has loads of room before hitting the really busy bus stops.

Reviews.Title: “hard hotel to rate”
Reviews.Author: chrissymidnight
Reviews.Content: Everyting in this hotel is either really good or really poor no middle ground Stayed for 2 weeks from 29 aug Check in was a night mare flew with thomas cook (who are a joke very strict on luggage weight charged nearly £100) who get you to your hotel at mid day but you cant check in until 3.00 p.m. . unless you pay for a room upgrade so its a bit of a con because the last thing u want to do is wait in recepion for 3 hrs after a 10 hour flight, youl pay anthing to get a room So we upgraded to tower 2 room was very nice memory foam bed pillows good air con, but no bath? for a view of the strip ask for tower 2 high floor with an odd low numbered room. Casino is ok but like every one says the vultures that try sellin time share are so annoying and in 2 weeks they drive u up the wall. For brits the tipping does get quite annoying as were not used to it ,as u baically have to tip for everything from buying a bottle of water in the shop to restaurants writing on your bill how much you should tip very annoying. we payed 29 dollars for mon - thur so very good value and the resort is generally only about half full. weekend rate was over 100 dollars per night so not worth that and everything was so busy. This hotel also basically loves americans and hates brits. e.g. americans can smoke and drink alcohol in the pool if our a brit for get it no chance you'l be told to get out , they also love closing the pools, in 14 days the pools where closed 6 times, which was radiculous. This prob makes the hotel sound awful but it really wasnt what I would say is if your paying 29 doallrs a night its great but when your paying 100 dollars you will fell short changed, pay the exta and stay some where else would be my recommenadtion

Reviews.Title: “"Excalibur Never Again, Never Again"”
Reviews.Author: motormouth007
Reviews.Content: Never again will I book a room at the Excalibur. Thanks to Excalibur employees; Annie, Jeff and Loretta. I will never again set foot in the Excalibur. I was lied to and scammed out of a free one day buffet coupon and ten bucks. When I checked in, Excalibur employees refused to honor a promotional offer for a free one day all you can eat buffet which was sent to me via email. I brought my concerns to the attention of 2 supervisors. I was lied to and scammed by these supervisors at the front desk. They assured me that they would correct the problem. Wrong. All I got from them was an apologize. The problem was never corrected. I never received my one free all day buffet coupon or did I get a discounted room rate that was promised to me by Loretta (on the front desk). Loretta, Annie and Jeff at the front desk are the reason why I will never again set foot in the Excalibur. I got ripped off at the front desk and not the casino floor. How can that happen? Loretta, Annie and Jeff get your hands out of my pocket. Enter the Excalibur at your own risk. Bigbus6903@verizon.net

Reviews.Title: “good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: swankyart
Reviews.Content: Checked in on 9-9-9, checked out 9-11-9; received room on 13th floor, tower 2, room 13... you'd think it was some sort of omen! Check in was smooth. Upgraded to the widescreen room. Totally worth it. Had a wonderful view of NYNY and MGM, along with the rest of the strip in the distance. Traveled from the airport and back via city bus, using our 24 hour passes we purchased for $7pp knowing we'd be using them alot for the Deuce the next day. It was very very easy! Spent the first night gambling at the Excalibur casino. Cocktail service was once about every 20 minutes.. not bad. Didn't win but was able to gamble on their penny keno machines for about 4 hours on only $20. Woke up the next day ready to hit up their all you can eat buffet for $25. I'll tell you right now.. the reviews are true! It sucks!!! DON'T DO IT!!! Go next door to the Luxor and do their all you can eat buffet for the few extra dollars; or even at the MGM which I believe just started theirs. ANYTHING has got to be better than the Excalibur buffet. I read reviews of it before going and I took it all with a grain of salt, as we wanted to do a cheap Vegas trip and not worry about the cost of spending money on food for one day while there. Yeah.. won't be doing that again. Anyway.. about the room.. no amenities in the room. There was a hair dryer, a magnifying mirror in the bathroom, fabulous towels, COLD a/c, and comfy mattress and bedding. Elevators were quick, even on the day of check out at 1059am (check out is at 11am, by the way). Walking to the neighbor hotels were no problem at all. There's an indoor walkway to the Luxor, which links (indoor!) to Mandalay Bay. Going to NYNY, MGM, and Tropicana you do need to walk outdoors. There is no street crossing to these hotels as they have bridge walkways that take you over the streets. Elevators and escalators (when working) are provided for ease as no one wants to walk outside when it's 100+ degrees outside. It was a great budget trip overall. I will stay there again, but will not eat there. There's too many other food places to try out in Vegas to settle for blah! Oh.. one other note.. there's these people between the entrance and the check-in desk, and again located near the walkway to the hotel rooms that ask you if you want free show tickets. They're trying to get you to pre-book your next Vegas trip. Just an FYI. They got VERY annoying after the 2nd time trying to make a sale to us. They need to G-E-T!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: CHILLAXIN10
Reviews.Content: I was not at all pleased with my room's condition and the lack of customer service the front desk clerk showed me regarding my concerns of the mold growing in the bathroom of my room.She showed no remorse and acted as if I was inconveniencing her ! I asked what can be done to rectify this matter,her response..If they up-graded me, I would be charged extra money ( like this inconvenience was my fault) or be moved to another room just like the one I had. I was not going to come out of my pocket anymore than I already had so I just went along with the lateral move. FIRST IMPRESSIONS ARE LASTING ONES...

Reviews.Title: “If the rate stays low, I will show up....”
Reviews.Author: imani_28
Reviews.Content: Here's a rundown: Pros: - Location! - Price - Sandwiches by pool (at Drenched) were pricey but good - Slide at the pool was a good addition and it wasn't too hard to find chairs - Rooms are pretty spacious - Bathrooms are very large with a lot of counter space Cons: - Windows/Doors in casino area need to be cleaned. - Room not cleaned so well before arrival so we never got service while we were there. - $5.60/day resort fee for things we did not use (i.e. fitness center, local calls, etc.) - The bed did not have a fitted sheet which caused the mattress to become exposed on numerous occasions. - The vultures who kept attacking you to see time shares, or "free shows". EVERY hotel had at least 3 different people bother everyone that passed, particularly couples. It got VERY annoying. - I' m not sure if the people at the register were just the slowest people alive but there was always a line at the buffet. The food there is OK but they could stand to lower the price a bit. I would definitely stay again as long as they don't raise the price.

Reviews.Title: “Remodel was done right.”
Reviews.Author: rockbaby
Reviews.Content: This is my third stay at the Excalibur in recent years. I was invited back after their remodel because of a terrible stay previous (the springs were poking through the beds and the linens were thread bare.) This time, however, the rooms were nice. The beds were new and the linens as well. It had a flat screen T.V. and a decent view as most of the strip does. The casino is quite large and can be a bit confusing. There are kids and I personally go to Vegas in an adult mode. The restaurants are usually crowded and check in always gives a bit of a wait. But it is Vegas and lines are part of the bigger casinos. If you don't mind kids, a bit of an older place and what I consider large casino, this is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Budget friendly, but not "family" oriented”
Reviews.Author: My4sons65
Reviews.Content: Confusing check-in, had to walk to the casino floor to get to the towers where the rooms are located. My sons got an "eyeful"! Glad they are a bit older. The pool area was nice, unfortunately the pool with the slides was closed during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Bang for your Buck”
Reviews.Author: Shand81
Reviews.Content: When I was reading the reviews I was a little taken back from all the bad reviews. Don't believe them, me and my Boyfriend stayed over the Labour Day weekend and had a blast! Yes the rooms are a bit outdated but they're suppose to be, it's a medevil themed hotel. They do have really nice upgraded rooms if you wish but for us we we're only in our room to sleep so it didn't matter much. The maids cleaned everyday and the size of the rooms are quite decent. Everyone at the Hotel is extremly friendly and are willing to answer any questions that you have. Yes the Time share people are quite annoying and are dressed in blue blazers which makes you believe that they're part of the Hotel Staff, but all you have to say is No or just walk right past them. The hotel is in a pretty decent location connected to the Luxor, New york New york and MGM Grand. The pool is really nice but don't be fooled by the water slide advertisment as it's more like a regular kiddy pool slide. As for entertainmant there's always something to do, the Tournament of Kings dinner show was awesome, we had a great time and you can find cheap tickets for this at the same day ticket booth right beside M&M world on the strip. if you like Nightlife then Coyote Uglys and Studio 54 is right beside the hotel in New york, New york. For the Price this Hotel is Fantastic!!!

Reviews.Title: “good value place to stay”
Reviews.Author: catsmiow
Reviews.Content: yes the trolleys do get left in the hall for ages but apart from that it was fine, nice big room, clean and comfy, air con a bit noisy but works. good location deuce bus pass all day pass to go up n down the strip saves long walks. loved it would go back

Reviews.Title: “Fairy Tale Land！！”
Reviews.Author: SamLonghunters
Reviews.Content: Let me just list a couple of things I love here: Outside look--You will really feel like being at a fairy tale land. Bedrooom--big and clean with a comfortable bed. The one we got was a king. TV--huge 42" LCD. (BTW, you can do television check-out. That is fun!) Parking is free but internet access is NOT. $13.99 for one-day internet access, which is not cheap to me. The hotel has small rooms with 26" TV, but the front desk lady was very nice and upgraded us to a better room for free, which would have otherwise cost us $20. The hotel is located right on strip, where you can go anywhere by the monorail ($13 for 24 hours) Anyway, this is a very good hotel and I will fully recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: annabakewell
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Las Vegas to get married and spent a week at the Excalibur. The rooms were spacious and clean with great views of the strip (if you pay extra). We upgraded to a spa room, which was well worth the extra too. We only had 10 coat hangers between us, so asked for more and received them pretty quickly. The Excalibur has a good location although it's at the bottom of the strip, there is a frequent bus service which is cheap and reliable. The staff were very helpful. The only thing that was really bad, was upon arrival at the hotel, we were approached by a member of staff who asked if we were checking in. We said yes, but he took us to a 'promotions' desk for trips and shows. We had been travelling for over 12 hours and had 4 suitcases, this was the last thing we wanted!! We eventually checked in and had a great holiday. TIP - don't but drinks from the bars in the casino, buy them from the mini-market on level 2 and these can be drunk in the casino and on the strip.. P.S the alcoholic slush puppies are fantastic!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay once we got our room changed.”
Reviews.Author: Julie78
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at the Excalibur for 6 nights in April. I got a fantastic package deal on Expedia that included Cirque tickets. When we first arrived we were assigned a handicap accessible room on the 6th floor. When we opened the door to the room it had a foul odor as if someone had just used the bathroom-a turnoff to say the least. The windows opened up to a wall because we didn't have a room with view (fair enough, we weren't paying for a view.) And unless you have a disability and require it, you don't want a room designed to be handicap accessible. There was virtually no counter space in the bathroom. Us ladies like our counter space. By the next morning, when we couldn't turn on the TV I was over it and went down and requested another room. Our second room was on the 27th floor and things were great from that point. It was so high up it had a view anyway. I thought the pool area and workout area were great. I do wish the Excalibur was more centrally located on the strip-makes the transportation quicker if you want to go downtown. The Cirque Show "Ka" at MGM was amazing. I had never seen a Cirque show, and was blown away. Overall a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur ehh”
Reviews.Author: cynthea995
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Excalibur for a weekend in July (24-27) to celebrate my 25th birthday. Tried to upgrade and couldn't. The decor is very dated and lame. TV was missing the power button. We saw 1 too many roaches this was probably due to housekeeping letting trays sit out on the floor in the hallway for HOURS before taking them away!! The hotel was nothing special at all. The pool area was over crowded one day we couldn't find chairs at all. The connecting hotels (luxor and Mandalay bay) are much nicer + they have night clubs and shopping! Make sure you check LAX out (inside Luxor)! Next time I will be staying at luxor or Mandalay!

Reviews.Title: “We love the Excalibur!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kfbear21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur last August and got married in their Gorgeous Chapel. We returned to the Excalibur thisAugust again for our 1st wedding anniversary...We love the location, the slots seem looser then some of the more expensive casinos. It has easy access to many other casinos and you can literally walkout of the casino and start walking the strip with lots to do...Be sure to check your comps as we never paid for any food and we even went to the tournament of kings show at the hotel and it was awesome!Great service and a great hotel...I highly recommend this huge casino!

Reviews.Title: “Great times!”
Reviews.Author: armeegurl
Reviews.Content: We went for UFC, which was being held at Mandalay Bay. Excalibur was quick on check-in, on the four corners with NYNY, MGM and Tropicana, so they are right on the strip and convenient. Dicks Last Resort is a pub style restaurant (a little raunchy) and the staff are SO much fun..we had one guy sing Harry Connick Jr to us because we asked what he had to do for an interview for his job and he sang exactly the same as Jr. The staff are great and the food was what you expect from any pub style restaurant - you can even leave a bra behind and hang it on the bar!! There is a "fair" downstairs for kids with arcades but its a little cheezy, although I dont recommend Circus Circus, they have far better rides etc. There is a food area up the escalator which is really convenient as well as a store to buy booze! Cheap, bring the booze to your room and dont waste your time waiting for waitresses at the slots...although the waitresses at this hotel were really nice and very quick. The pool was nice and they have a no kids zone which was nice and We were there to party and we did. You could hear people in the next room, but we were rarely there. Alot of people seemed to come from Luxor and Mandalay Bay to play at Excalibur and you could play for quite a while. We paid under five hundred for four nights, flight and hotel from Ottawa and it was worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, dirty, crowdy”
Reviews.Author: LePope
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not expensive during summer (except week-ends), but you don’t get much more for your money. Never ending lines at check-in, crowd everywhere, and, most of all, the omni present casino noise. We booked the more expensive "renovated rooms" that did not look renovated at all. Cleanliness is perfectible. If you can spend more, go to the Bellagio!

Reviews.Title: “Try other hotels”
Reviews.Author: RoundDeWorld
Reviews.Content: We were stopped 3 times by the staff on arrival with lies of "welcome pack, meal coupons, discount book" between the entrance to the reception table to the tower lift. They were trying to sell us shows but the lies and hardsell was a complete turn off. We stayed at another hotel along the strip the week before and we were given welcome pack, various freebies, meal coupons at check in impromtu with no gimmick, lies no hardsell. Foyer was a bit funny, you need to go around the casino to get to the reception or to the tower and on more than one occassion we saw dads with their 9-10 yo sons watching exotic dance (the dance was in the foyer, open for everyone to see). We checked in at 10 PM and found the corridor to our room was littered with trays, plates, room service trolleys and plastic wrappers. They were still there the following night. We got a room which has been renovated with huge LCD TV and faced New York New York. Room was clean, spacious, and nicely furnished. Housekeeping was good. We like the room very much. We also liked Tournament of the Kings too but agreed without the 2 for 1 ticket it was not worth the price. We'll try different hotels the next time.

Reviews.Title: “a good start”
Reviews.Author: ZOE044
Reviews.Content: We started our trip here for the first two nights..we flew into vagas and met with friends who were staying at the mandalay bay. This hotel was roomy, comfortable and clean. I find it bizaare that the lobby is nowhere near that car park entrance or the lifts to the rooms. I heard mixed reports about this hotel, but was pleasantly surprised. We had a nice view of the pool too, even though we didn't get a chance to use it.

Reviews.Title: “awesome place:D”
Reviews.Author: NikiLang
Reviews.Content: Not so expensive...on the Strip..close to everyhing..all-you-can-eat service:)..casino..bars

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all...”
Reviews.Author: nikerbokers
Reviews.Content: Just got back today from spending 3 nights at the Excalibur in Las Vegas. Checked in around 3pm on a Saturday. Only spent about 10 minutes in line. Our room was on the 2nd floor of Tower 2. Wished we would have gotten a higher floor or better view but we didn't spend that much time in the room. We booked a widescreen room and it was a decent size. Clean, lights worked, etc. The dresser was a little worn but didn't care... plumbing was okay except the sink took a little long to drain. The casino is a good size and I loved that they had low minimum bet tables. Played roulette and came out even after 3 days which is nice. Dealers were fairly friendly as were the pit bosses. The pool was pretty good, went yesterday morning (Monday) around 11 am and had no problem getting a lounge chair. The music was Top 40 and wasn't too loud. The location is decent- next to NYNY and Luxor- across from MGM Grand. We took the Deuce bus ($7 for 24 hours) after the first night of walking. Didn't sample too much food except the $2.50 hot dog and beer was a steal (for Players Club members only). The only show we saw at Excalibur was the Tournament of Kings, which was entertaining but we wouldn't have paid to see it (not worth the $65ish it costs) if we didn't have a 2 for 1 coupon. We saw Penn & Teller at the Rio which I strong recommend! There were kids around... but I saw them all over Vegas. Still boggles my mind, why would anyone bring a child to Vegas?! But on Sunday afternoon to this morning, only saw a few. Overall, the Excalibur is a good value for the price. I paid an average of $74 a night and I didn't have any major complaints at all. No noise in the room, decent housekeeping, and overall a nice casino. I would go back if I was going on a budget again... but I'd like to keep testing out other hotel/casinos.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for people!”
Reviews.Author: Bessca
Reviews.Content: Seems people complain and compain about this hotel - what do you expect for $30-$50 rooms - royalty? We reserved a widescreen deluxe room and paid $46 for the night. It is not great - but it does the trick, and worth what you pay for it. If you are looking for an amazing hotel - stay somewhere else. But if you are looking for something cheap and clean -try one of the remodeled rooms.

Reviews.Title: “No Frills, but with good location and great value!!!”
Reviews.Author: Griesimatt
Reviews.Content: I was surprised that you can book nights at Excalibur for less than Motel 6 (which is not even on the strip!). Excalibur has the best deals on the strip!!! Sure it is not the classiest hotel, but it beats Circus Circus. I booked a non-smoking room on the 6th floor with a king bed. We had a nice view of a cinder-block wall that was probably 10 stories high. The room was kept clean (turn down service every day) and the housekeeping were nice people. I do not have many complaints about my stay. I only wish that they would have had a DVD player connected to the TV. I would recommend this hotel to anyone trying to stay on the strip cheap!!! I was not planning on staying in my room long (most of my time was spent on the strip) so I did not care if it had a basic setup.

Reviews.Title: “There are plenty of places to stay on the strip. Say NO to the Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: Rocky_Mountain069
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews for the Excalibur, and for the most part it was a mixed bag. I just want you all to know, the Excalibur is not what it's cracked up to be. The room we stayed in was well used - really well used. It was reminiscent of 1977 (a good year - but also 32 years ago). Some of the furniture (plural) were broken. The beds were relics left over from the mid 70's - you could feel the springs in both of the beds. I'm pretty sure there was black mold in the bathroom - which can be a health concern (and is pretty amazing since Vegas is the driest place you can find). The hotel & Casino is a smoking establishment (like all the hotels on the strip), but because of its age, it has a "special funk" about it. The positives were that it was closely located to the MGM, the Luxor, and New York New York. It had a pretty decent arcade for kids. There's a family friendly show with knights, horses, jousting, while eating with your fingers. There's a food fair on the 2nd level that has a McDonald's, Quiznos, and a few other places. There are 3 or 4 pools (some with water slides), and a bunch of deck reclining chairs - perfect to soak up the Vegas sun. Overall, though, I'd say you could do better. We stayed at New York New York, for a couple of nights, before the Excalibur. It was a considerably better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap -- and it shows”
Reviews.Author: wavemom
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for less than 24 hours and that was plenty. There was a food trolley and stray plates with leftover room service food outside our door when we checked in about 5 p.m. It was still there the next day when we checked out at 11. The bedspread on one of the beds was ripped. The elevators were horribly slow. Since we were on the fourth floor, we decided to walk down -- but the entrance to the first floor is emergency exit only, so there is no option besides the slow elevators -- I'm not exaggerating when I say we waited more than five minutes sometimes for them. This place is advertised as one of the more family friendly places on the Strip, but there were exotic dancers on a stage in the lobby -- impossible to get from our room to the outside without passing within a few feet of them. We paid $50 for the four of us, and it was just barely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Decent For A Night's Rest”
Reviews.Author: SiennaVST
