Reviews.Content: Excalibur probably seen better days. Definitely not the most luxurious place to stay on the strip but if your idea of a good time in Vegas consist of hopping to several casinos in the day time and several clubs in the night time without actually spending all that much time in your hotel room, then this would be a good value for you. However it is pretty far from all the happening places. We did just about everything outside of the hotel. For a little extra moola, you can get a decent place right smack in the middle of the strip with much more exciting clubs and restaurants. There wasn't anything outstanding about the place but the staff was friendly and the rooms were clean. That's all we needed. The place was booked by a friend so I probably never would have consider it otherwise. I probably would not go back but I would recommend it as an alternative for budget accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly Hotel - NOT!”
Reviews.Author: seiryu
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Excalibur several years ago and the place has really gone down hill. Some of the problems: - A food cart sat a in the hall a room down from us for our entire 4 day stay, getting more and more ripe as each day progressed. On the last day, someone covered the plates on top with a napkin. I simply shouldn't have to call food service to request their cart be removed from the hall. Housekeeping had to walk past it every day to clean the rooms. Definite "not my job" syndrome here. - For a "family friendly" hotel, the pools all closed at 7pm. Huh?!?!?!?! - Scantily clad and suggestive dancers between registration and the rooms. I know it's vegas, but really, this doesn't belong along the main walk between registration/front door and the rooms in Tower II. - Arcade downstairs feature many broken games, taped over coin slots, working whack-a-mole missing a mole while the broken one next to it had the full set... - If you visit the arcade in the afternoon, don't expect any of the change machines to work. One of the attendants I asked about the machines said the morning crowd empties the machines so that's why they were all empty. And the same person didn't have any change. A nice guest changed one of my $1 bills for 4 quarters. I'm dismayed that they can't schedule a few more refills on the machines. - My wife was nearly knocked down by two bellmen taking luggage to the rooms. Going from the Tower II elevators into the rest of the property, there's an incline ramp. The bellmen take FULL baggage carts down this, barely under control, disregarding guests that are milling around. The 2nd guy was clearly out of control and no sign of apology from him after he side-swiped my wife with the cart. Thankfully no injuries. - Sleeping guards at the elevator rooms. There's a sign as you go into the elevator area that you should show your room key to the guard. Yeah, right. Not sure what purpose these guys served. They definitely were not preventing anyone from going up the elevators. Guess they were just waiting for people to come in and announce that they were up to no good to stop them. And yes, one morning, I'm pretty sure one of the guards was sleeping. - No coffee maker in the rooms. Heard a number of guests complaining about this. - Inconsistent housekeeping - seemed the linens in the bathroom kept decreasing in qty during our stay and they did not do a good job cleaning the room, inconsistently wiping down surfaces. - Reservation system that didn't confirm our online booked reservation. I had to call them after completing the reservation to make sure it really did go through. I received a thank-you for your reservation and up-coming trip AFTER our trip.

Reviews.Title: “If I could do it all again, I wouldnt bother”
Reviews.Author: lifeslilfairy
Reviews.Content: We arived later in the afternoon, and were immediately struck by rows and rows of slot machines. Before we could even find the reservation desk, we were hijacked by timeshare people trying to get us to go to one of their presentations. Once we sucessfully pulled out of that one, we finally saw the reservation desk, and a huge que. My first impressions l eft me wanting to walk out of there. It had the smell of cigarette smoke, dark lighting and looked very dated. The reservation person was just basically processing us and showed no interest in us as humans, other than to let us know that the room we booked was gone so they upgraded us. Our room was clean, but very dated. The air conditioner...while effective, was extremely noisy and would often wake me at night. The hotel staff did come every day and clean the room so that was nice. They offer all you can eat all day for around $25 but the ques are enormous and I can only describe it as a chow hall. If we come back to Vegas, I think we will choose to pay more and get a much better hotel. You get what you pay for I guess

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: Daylove
Reviews.Content: I stay there before at the standard room and it was so-so. This time I upgraded to the widescreen room and it was much better. The room is still small but the decor was more modern with a decent bed and clean room and bath. I recommend to upgrade the room, it is worth the extra $20/night.

Reviews.Title: “Superb budget option”
Reviews.Author: maisie_muck
Reviews.Content: The rooms we booked over the internet were really cheap ($40 USD) so we werent expecting anything great, but it was absolutely fantastic! Check in was pretty quick - they didnt have any rooms left of the type we had booked so they upgraded us to a better room with flat screen tv, 2 giant beds and big bathroom. All the staff were really helpful with any questions we had, pool area was good, room service was quick and we didn't find it noisy at all despite the large amount of drunk people up late. The location was at the end of the strip so to get up and down if you want to have a look at the other casinos further along it takes a while, but it wasnt a problem because there are plenty around that you can walk to. We found getting the deuce bus a nightmare, it was SO slow. Thought it was a great hotel for the rock bottom price, would definitely stay there again if we went back.

Reviews.Title: “Pole dancers in the lobby!”
Reviews.Author: marcus_welby-SC
Reviews.Content: OK, I know this is Las Vegas...but women dancing on tables in little bikinis right by the registration area in a hotel that's supposed to be more family oriented than many on the others???? I thought this hotel was a zoo. The price is certainly right, and I think that's why it tends to be filled. I'd much rather have paid a little more and stayed at a hotel that didn't remind me of a subway station. And what's with the pool closing at 7 or 8 pm in the summer? You got to be kidding!!! If you're just looking for the cheapest room at a resort on the strip than this is your place. But if you want a little more atmosphere than I would suggest looking elswhere.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste $ at Excalibur - if it looks too good to be true, it is!”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravel81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur on 8/13/08 for 2 nights. We booked the hotel because the family special was a good deal and we read that the pool was remodeled. It was true the pool area was remodeled but one of the slides in the kids pool was not working so there was a long line of kids waiting to go down the one slide that was working. The lifeguard said that the second slide has never worked. The arcade games were a mess. At least 1/4 of them did not work. The room was terrible, terrible. We traveled for 2 weeks in Utah, Arizona and California and the room was the worst we had stayed in. We were in Tower 1, floor 9 room 51. There was mold and the grout around the shower was old, cracked. The grout around the sink area was cracking. The air conditioner sounded like a 747. When it came on, the drapes blew so the daylight would come in. This was our wakeup call in the morning. The alternative was to turn the A/C off but the room became too hot/stuffy. The bed was uncomfortable, the sheets old, the ice machinge barely churned out enough ice for a couple of drinks. I wanted to call and complain after the first night but after two weeks of travelling, I was tired and did not want to move rooms. I figured I would write a review and let everyone know that you should stay some place else... any where except here. As we were leaving town, we saw some nice hotels on the outskirts of the strip that we should have stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Not the most luxurious hotel in LV”
Reviews.Author: AnneSo81
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night at the Excalibur. We didn't pay a lot for the room so I guess we couldn't have high expectation. But it is not the cleanest place I stayed during my stay in the US. There were hairs in the shower, some joints were mouldy. The furniture wasn't spotless clean and the linens showed signs of wear. The room overlooked the back of the hotel (concrete roof of the casino and huge AC fans). The hotel is situated at the end of the strip, not far from the airport but we didn't hear any planes. I didn't think it was far away from the centre. It is nice to walk along all the hotels on the strip. I would recommend this hotel for people on a limited budget.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: IsisMontreal
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 2 nights and it was the least expensive hotel that we found (that still looked ok). The room was much better than we expected. It was new, clean and comfortable. It is a little far from biggest hotels so we had to walk a while (in the very hot weather) to go see the outside shows at the Bellagio or the Treasure Island, but it is much less expensive! The parking is free, but keep a little money for the valet (you can also park by yourself at the back of the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel for families and limited budget”
Reviews.Author: justatraveler508
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a four day visit to Las Vegas where we stayed at the Excalibur Hotel. The Excalibur is located at one end of the strip, very close to the airport however we did not notice any noise from the airport. The hotel is not bright and “glitzy” like other hotels in Vegas. In fact it is decorated in darker tones. The staff was friendly and helpful. Upon our arrival I tipped the front desk clerk twenty dollars and received an upgraded room on the twenty fifth floor and a twelve o’clock check out time. Upon going to our room we found that the door would not open. We reported the situation to a security guard who went back to our room with us. After trying the door several times he discovered that the doorset was faulty and that you had to jerk the handle in order to get it to open. We then discovered that the door would not close unless you slammed it several times. He said that we should probably report the problem to someone. The next morning I did report the problem to one of the housekeepers on our floor and she stated that she had noticed it wasn’t working the day before when she cleaned the room. She did call and report the problem. I also went to the front desk and reported the problem. The door was repaired by the time we returned from breakfast. We also received a follow-up call from housekeeping asking if the door had been repaired and if it was working properly. The room was good sized but older and rather tired looking. The wallpaper by the window was peeling back, the curtain was missing some of the rings and hanging down. The furnishings showed signs of wear, one of the bed spreads had a hole in it and one of the chairs had a mark where someone had tried to repair the hole in it with tape, but the tape had peeled off long ago. A shower cap from a previous guest was left hanging on the bathroom door for two days. I told the housekeeper about it while she was cleaning our room and it was gone when we returned to our room. We were awakened at 5:30 in the morning to the sound of the fire alarm (but this could happen in any hotel). It turned out to be false alarm. The elevators were efficient with very little wait time. There were time share salesmen in the common areas (as they were in several other hotels) but they were polite, offered assistance and really didn’t bother anyone. The buffet at the hotel was very reasonable and the selection varied. This is a typical buffet with all the usual selection of foods along with Mexican, Italian, and Chinese food bars and a carving station. The lines can be rather long but they move quickly. Again the staff was friendly and efficient. We also went to the Tournament of Kings dinner show. It was different and fun, but one of those things were going once is enough. You eat everything with your hands as there are no eating utensils. Eating broccoli with your hands is very different. I would think that families with younger children will really enjoy this show. The show itself is not great acting, but fun. You cheer for your King as he competes in a various contests. All in all the Excalibur is an older hotel that would benefit from having there rooms updated. If we had an upgraded room I wonder what the standard rooms are like. This hotel is probably best for families, and those looking for a limited budget experience.

Reviews.Title: “I wasn't surprised at all!”
Reviews.Author: airbrush101
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Excalibur from June 7th thru June 10th, this was actually my 3rd time there in 3-months. My friend that lives in Vegas recommended the hotel as it was cheap and in a great location, so I was very prepared for my stay. After I stayed there the 1st time the hotel sent me room comps for my next trips (make sure you sign up for players cards everywhere you go!!). So, in my opinion, a "free" average room is worth more to me than paying $$$ to stay in a "nicer" room! That allowed me that much more mad-money to have fun with while I was there! As for the hotel, you want to stay in the remodeled tower-II versus tower-I. I had paid for a tower-I room my 1st trip, but was upgraded to the better tower after asking (politely!) the front desk person for a free upgrade. After my 1st stay, all my future comps were for the newer tower. The room was nice, clean, with an ok view. I did all of my eating at other hotels as I knew that they had much better food. The only things I ate/drank at Excalibur were coffee & snacks (plus lots of booze!). The gambling was fine, though a bit smokey when compared to nicer places. Yes, the time-share folks did approach me, but I simply said "no thank-you" and they left me alone. And yes, there are kids running & ripping all over the place, but I just ignored them also! I am amazed at how many people think of Vegas as a good "family" vacation! Basically I just used the hotel as a place to crash, and spent most of my other time at other casino's. But I would stay there again, as long as the room was comped!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION BUT NEEDS AN UPGRADE”
Reviews.Author: Tappy Feet
Reviews.Content: We flew into Vegas and spent our first night in the US at the Excalibur. We had stayed there once before so thought we knew what to expect. But this place is shabby and needs an upgrade. However, the location is excellent. We also stayed for 3 nights before flying home at the end of our stay and really wished we had gone elsewhere. If you are out of the room all day and only want a safe place to sleep, this will fit the bill for you. It's not too bad but really needs an upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “a nice, perfectly located hotel for the family”
Reviews.Author: alicia_darcy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Excalibur Aug 2-7 (sun-Fri), 2009 with three children, girls, ages 7, 9, and 13, and loved it. We booked directly through Excalibur and got an average nightly rate of $40. Upon arriving, we requested adjoining rooms in Tower II and were offered upgrades for $10 more per night, per room. The cost to upgrade was well worth it, mainly for the proximity to the pool, and for the view of the pool and mountains. Actually, the first rooms they put us in on floor 17 overlooked the roof and a/c units. A call to the front desk landed us rooms on the other side of the hall with spectacular views for no additional cost. The rooms were clean and well-appointed. The beds were comfortable, and the a/c worked great for both rooms. There were no problems with construction noise or other guest noise. The employees, for the most part, were great. On the last two days we were there, the winds in Las Vegas were strong and Excalibur closed all three pools!! This was very disappointing and the front desk was lackadaisical about it, saying it was for guest safety and no compensation would be offered. We went over to the Monte Carlo pools and spent the day there. It was windy, but I didn't see that anyone's life was in danger at the Monte Carlo. We had massages at the Excalibur spa and weren't real impressed with the $60 25-minute back massages -- actually, that was the most disappointing thing about the whole trip. The best things about the trip were the great rooms with views and the uncrowded pools. The other resort pools were jampacked. One day we went to check out the Mandalay Bay pools because they are supposed to be the best. At first, the pool guy at the turnstile said "No entry without a hotel key," but when my husband gave him a $20, he unabashedly said we were "abolutely welcome in." It was a nice pool, complete with sand, wave pool, and lazy river, but you have to buy tubes for $23 each!!! Luckily, we met some people who loaned us theirs. The Monte Carlo, whom we didn't have to bribe for entry, charged a reasonable $10 per tube! The Krispy Kreme doughnuts tasted stale, but the McDonalds came in quite handy a time or two. The Regale Italian restaurant is overrated; we paid nearly $100 and the service was horrible. We've had much better meals and service at Olive Garden (a medium price range family eatery in Texas). We ate some at the Excalibur buffet and enjoyed it. For two days, we bought the eat-all-day buffet armband at Luxor. These hotels are connected by moving walkways. The adult price is $29, but the really good deal is for the kids -- just $15 to eat all day (ages 4-11). Check-in and check-out was quick. The arcade was a lot of fun for the kids. Just start out early ignoring the men and women in blue blazers who want to know "where you're from" and "how long you're staying," to avoid getting tied up talking timeshares. The Excalibur was a nice, perfectly located hotel for the family.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, food not so good”
Reviews.Author: nikkibaillie
Reviews.Content: The excalibur looks amazing, could be seen as tacky to some but I was looking for that when visiting Vegas. Its has recently been redecorated and the hotel rooms are roomy, modern and nicely decorated. The beds were extremely large, and were changed daily. The bathroom kept extremely clean and looked wonderful. Hotel obviously had a massive casino, four separate pools which unfortunately were only 3ft deep, so swimming was slightly impossible. There was a spa available which included a gym. On the upper floors there was a variety of food courts, including mcdonalds and pizza hut. There was also a buffet which was open all day, I can't say I found any of the food particularly appealing. There was also a beauty salon which was pricey but they did do a good job, ( I attended a wedding while there and used this facility). All in all I think excalibur was a nice hotel which offered value for money and I would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Really happy with Excalibur!!!”
Reviews.Author: heathliam
Reviews.Content: Before arriving in Vegas and at the Excalibur I was already put off by some of the comments on here made by people who expected 5 star for 35 pound a night. We stayed in tower 1 and although the decor was a bit outdated everything else was great. Great pools, space in room and bathroom, clean and freindly staff. So please don't be put off by the deluded people who speak bad of it, it is great value for money and in a great position on the strip!!!

Reviews.Title: “the cost benefit is excellent”
Reviews.Author: DPAIATO
Reviews.Content: The Excalibur hotel has an excellent location, but could have more choices of restaurants. The rooms are quite spacious and can also improve the cleaning, but the cost benefit is excellent, it is worth. I was in the hotel from 11 to 15 July and returned to the hotel cheaply

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at better places”
Reviews.Author: marymcq
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Excalibur quite a few years ago and just stayed there again last month. I got a good deal on the room for the weekend and the location on the strip is just okay. The whole hotel and rooms are badly in need of updating. You can tell almost all the furnishings in the room are original to the hotel being built and seemingly the mattresses too! It was okay to stay here for one weekend and when we finally figured out how to get out of the parking lot with the car without killing ourselves that was okay. The casino needs updating and I for one didn't appreciate the girls dancing on the bars. I'm sure they are trying to attact a younger crowd but it just seemed sad! I won't stay here again unless the hotel gets a major overhaul (unless it's imploded first to make way for a new hotel!)

Reviews.Title: “Not bad - you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: tink1201
Reviews.Content: Not the best hotel iv stayed in. We arrived from the airport via a shuttle bus at the rear rotunda drop off point at the hotel. There were no signs and we had no idea where to check in. We finally found the front desk after walking through the casino (not good with suitcases really). The memeber of staff who checked me in was very rude and didn't speak to me at all. We were put in tower 1 and were given a non-renovated room which was not great but we didn't pay much for the room so I suppose it is only fair. We had no window view at all - just a wall right in front of our room so had no idea where abouts we were. The room and decor was dated and really does need renovating. The bed was comfortable the bedding was not nice. The bathroom was very spacious and clean with a huge mirror and shower which was good. The room was large with a bed, table and chairs and a sofa so it was spacious. We didn't order room service but the people opposite our room did and there dirty trays and food were left outside their room for 3 days!! Incredibly unhygienic!!! There was also glasses left outside from room service that weren't collected and some were broken by the morning. The hotel itself is in a great location with a connecting walk way to new york new york and luxor. Compared to other hotels on the strip the excalibur is definately not luxorious but for the price and the location i probably would stay there again but i would pay the extra to get one of the updated widescreen rooms. There is no free wireless internet which is quite poor as most american hotels do offer this now. Beware of the time share sellers!! They tried to con us into free show tickets the minute after we had checked in. Free tickets in exchange for a full day at one of their resorts - i would suggest saying no staright away unless you have plenty of time in vegas and don't mind losing a day for free show tickets. Personally, i dont think the hotel should allow time share people to bother their guests. We didn't eat in the hotel but would recommend the outback steak house above the coca cola shop. Overall, a good place to rest on a budget but if you want vegas luxury, don't go here.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for kids”
Reviews.Author: leesvillelake
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from six nights at the Excalibur, and we were extremely satisfied with our experience. If you read my profile and contributions, you will note that I am almost always satisfied with the hotels I choose. That is because I research them thoroughly and select the ones most likely to provide the experience we are looking for. The reviewer who had to move from the Excalibur to Caesar's Palace was obviously in the wrong place the first time! The two hotels are nothing alike, and for my family, that is a good thing. The Excalibur is a great place for kids. The turrets, drawbridge, and moats may be a bit cheesy, but my grandsons loved them. The Tournament of Kings dinner show was a big hit. No, it is not historically accurate, but we weren't there for a history lesson. Our grandsons did learn about jousting and the legend of King Arthur, and the beautiful horses were an attraction themselves. The dinner was good: tomato soup, a small roasted chicken, broccoli, french fries, rolls, apple turnovers, and pitchers of soda. If you book your stay on the hotel's web site, choose the promotion that includes 2 for 1 tickets to the show. Our boys absolutely loved the 4-D rides and the arcade. Look in free tourist magazines for discount coupons. We stayed on a lower floor on the side facing New York New York, and we never once heard the jackhammer or construction noise another reviewer complained about. We did hear screams from the roller coaster at NYNY, but we considered that part of the Vegas atmosphere, as we didn't go there for peace and quiet. Our room was a double queen with the widescreen TV. It was quite large and was serviced regularly while we were out during the day. The sheets were of high quality, and the towels were new. Bathroom amenities were excellent and were replenished each day. I will agree with another reviewer that the sink counter was unusually high and that the toilet paper holder was not within a child's easy reach.. Also, the room did seem a little dark, but after all, you are staying in a castle!. TV channels were limited, but we had almost no time for TV anyhow. The halls, elevators, and public areas were clean enough, maybe not to the standards of Caesar's Palace, but certainly adequate for a place with so many children and so much foot traffic. We appreciated the fact that there was a McDonalds on site, in addition to a Pizza Hut Express, Quiznos, Krispy-Kreme, and Cold Stone Creamery. Our grandsons would have little interest in the food offerings at Caesar's Palace, and I wouldn't like the price. We were tempted to buy the all-you-can-eat -all-day buffet tickets, but we didn't think our young grandsons would eat $25 worth each day, although that might be a bargain for some people. Shopping venues included souvenir shops and Everything's $10 stores. Again, if your taste runs to Armani and Gucci, for heaven's sake, don't book the Excalibur! The location at the south end of the Strip suited us perfectly. We wanted to see Bodies: The Exhibition at the Luxor, in addition to seeing the Luxor itself, which was right next door. We walked the length of the Strip, visiting every hotel along the way, seeing the light show and conservatory at the Bellagio, Cleopatra's barge at Caesar's Palace, and the volcano at the Mirage. Although we bought a monorail ticket for one day, we found it to be not very helpful. Getting to and from the monorail from the Strip was more trouble than just walking along the Strip, and the Strip was much more interesting. We considered the Deuce bus, but every bus we saw was horribly overcrowded. We just walked, which was best for us anyhow. Yes, there were obscene pictures of boobs scattered on the sidewalk and men (and one very pregnant woman) passing out invitations to Dial-a-Girl, but to me, that is no worse than the advertisements for erectile dysfunction prescriptions that now punctuate primetime TV shows.At least you can reject the offers of the touts; the Viagra ads come into your living room when you are only trying to watch the news. Certainly, the mystique of Sin City is disappearing in our more open and permissive society.The Excalibur itself had heavy security at every exterior entrance and at the entrances to the towers where the rooms were located. There was absolutely no semblance of impropriety there, at least not before midnight when we retired. Dick's Last Resort Restaurant wasn't even doing a good job of looking risque. From the outside it just seemed silly and juvenile, not obscene. Along with our stay at the Excalibur, we flew to the Grand Canyon National Park for one day and spent another at Hoover Dam. We did not swim in the pool, which seemed awfully crowded, as did all the pools we saw, especially the one at Mandalay Bay. We had a fantastic trip that our grandsons will never forget, and the Excalibur was part of the fun.

Reviews.Title: “Nice price, terrible beds.”
Reviews.Author: TripTomato
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Excalibur before, so I was pleased when they offered a room with 2 queen beds for $23 plus resort fees & taxes. Sadly, we were put in an old room (Tower 1, 11th floor). Both beds should be moved to the torture dungeons! I woke up every hour with pins & needles in all my limbs. After the first night, I made a bed on the bed out of the extra pillows (and the two teenagers I brought with me just had to suffer). We had hauled up so much luggage, and unpacked everything, and it would have taken up many hours to get a new room and move. Every minute of my vacation time is precious, I can't afford 4 hours wasted. The rooms are a good size, you don't keep bumping into each other on the way to the bath. The staff was responsive, but we really asked VERY little of them. If you don't mind themed-vacation resorts (I know many find them tacky), this can be a fun place to stay. But don't unpack your bags until you have spent a few minutes trying out the mattress.

Reviews.Title: “disapointed”
Reviews.Author: aycarumba
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay here 4 nights and left after 2. We were really looking forward to our stay, but were left extremely disapointed by this hotel and the management. We payed a premium to stay in a strip view delux room and were given a partial view of the strip on the side of the hotel directly opposite New York, New York. Directly below our window there was major constuction work going being done on the road. The noise from this was 24hrs and due to the window having no sound proofing we were kept awake all night by jack hammers and pnuematic drills. After complaining to the concierge he said we could have a new room in the morning and that he would give us a partial refund on our stay, which we thought was a fair deal. We returned to the concierge desk in the morning to get our room switch and all the could give us was a downgraded room with no view and she said she new nothing about the partial refund, as the guy on the night desk had made no note of it. On top of this the public areas of the hotel were very dirty, especially the lifts and corridors. There was quite often trays of uncollected room service stuff left outside rooms for days. The pool area was nice yet the part with the water slide was closed off because there weren't enough life guards. The all day buffet was good value but my wife visited the rest rooms twice and on both occasions there was someone vomiting in there. I know its Vegas but if you've been drinking all night why would you go for a buffet? We checked out of the Excalibur and moved to Ceasars which was excellent in every way, the check in clerk even upgraded us for free when we ntold him about our experience down the street. The Excalibur is in need of a good clean up and could take a few customer relations lessons from its superior neighbours.

Reviews.Title: “This was a great place to stay for our first trip to Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: oleiros
Reviews.Content: If you've seen the movie 'The Hangover', there's a moment of pure excitement when the guys see the view from their hotel... My brother and I had the same reaction when we saw the view of the Strip from our room. We stayed in a newly renovated room with HD tv and we loved it. The view was great and the room was very modern, well decorated and clean. The hotel has great facilities, restaurants and pool. There's lots of things to occupy your time. We originally stayed a night at the Four Queens, but moved to the Excalibur to get the Strip experience and we didn't regret it. We paid under $50/night for our room per night and it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value.”
Reviews.Author: Oldham74
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend & i stayed at Excalibur for 2 nights during our road trip around USA & Canada. We actually just moved across the strip as we had just stayed at the Signature for 3 nights, which was excellent. We did this as we were travelling for 5 months & we were looking to save money were we could. I think it cost us approx $50-$60 per night through expedia. I wasn't really expecting to be too impressed by Excalibur after staying at the Signature so was not dissapointed. When we arrived we noticed there were long queues at the front desk so we went for a drink & a gamble until it got a bit quieter. The casino is ok, not the best but not the worse either (my girlfriend won a few dollars but lost it all again soon afterwards!). We found the service quite good & were refreshed with free drinks regularly enough. Our room was ok, it must have been in Tower II. Reasonably clean with a good view of the strip & the airport. We ate at the buffet which was very good but i thought it could have been cheaper. Check-out was quick & hassle free. Probably wouldn't stay there again but would recommend to travellers on a budget. Go for Tower II unless Tower I has been refurbished since October 2008.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at the Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: LovelyLillly
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at the Excalibur and thouroughly enjoyed this hotel - wish we could've stayed longer! I booked a basic room in advance over the internet and paid a very reasonable price, which is why we were pleasantly surprised by the quality of our room and the facilities. We had a lovely view of the Luxor next door, our bed was comfortable and I thought the 'castle' decor of the room and passage ways lovely. The room wasnt brand new, but it was nice, clean, comfortable, had a very nice bathroom and all the amenities we needed. We loved walking through the casino and past Dicks and loved the refillable slushie cups! We ate in the buffet which was ok, and enjoyed browsing through the souvinier shops. The location was good - we spent our nights walking around the strip just enjoying the atmosphere of Vegas. Check in and out of the hotel was really easy - there were lots of people waiting to check in/out but there were also a lot of operaters. After checking out on our last day, the hotel was happy to look after our bags and for us to spend the day at the pool. The pool facilities are lovely - it was quite busy when we were there but still heaps of deck chairs and pool mats to float on in the water, and lots of different pools. The poolside cafe and bar were nice and they had a live band entertaining us. We were quite happy to spend the whole day there! Overall we loved our stay at the Excalibur. I suppose its not the newest or most luxurious of Vegas hotels, but I thought it was really good value for money and would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Well Worth the value . . .”
Reviews.Author: gizman6024
Reviews.Content: Overall: Stayed at Excalibur at the end of July for 3 nights for a first time trip to Vegas. We were skeptical at first given some of the reviews and the ratings. We have fairly high standards from previous trips to Mexico, Jamacia and Hawaii. We would say that for the value this was a very nice hotel and casino. There were much fancier and glitzier hotel/casinos like Caesars, Planet Hollywood and Bellagio (to name a few) but for the price this was very nice. Rooms: Upon check-in we had originally booked a standard King size room in Tower I. We asked for an upgrade to Tower II in a widescreen room and were given it for free. (Never hurts to ask). The room was very nice on the 25th floor and had a nice view of the pools. The bed was very comfortable and the room was quiet. It was nothing fancy or over the top, but you spend very little time in the room anyways. Casino: The casino was great because even on the weekend and later at night, you could find $5 tables without a problem. Also the dealers were very friendly at the Craps table as they taught me how to play and it paid off. The casino never seemed very busy. The drinks were expensive unless you were gambling, then they were free. We did not have any problems with Timeshare pressure as when we told them no, they left us alone. Food: We did not eat at any restraunts here, but it was nice having a Starbucks for my wife and Monster enery drinks for me. On one side note, we ate at Casa Di Amore and it was fantastic!! We also had the seafood buffet at the Rio and it was great as well. Pools: The pools were somewhat busy, but because there were so many, you could find chairs without a problem. Overall, we would definitely stay here for the money as the location is fantastic and the hotel/casino is of great value! You definitely come to Vegas for the overall experience, not to spend all your time at one hotel! Hope this helps!!

Reviews.Title: “it's crazy”
Reviews.Author: ferdinando_pucci
Reviews.Content: ok, everything is crazy in las vegas. we stayed few days, very clean rooms, reception is always very busy, you feel somewhat lost in such a huge hotel. Nice outdoor swimming pools (some warm water massage pools), with children slide. Great deal the all-day all-you-can-eat buffet for 25$. Centrally placed, on the strip. We got a free beer pass upon registration.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: nieb
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Excalibur from July 17th - 22nd. Checking was no problem, done within 10 minutes. Room was large and clean ( room 4 2 69 ). Got a good deal on the internet and stayed in a newly renovated room in Tower II. Had no problem what so ever with timeshare people. I guess that was because I was a single traveler. Had fun playing on the slotmachines even though I am not a big gambler. But eh, with those penny and nickel machines you don't need to be ! I do think the music and other noise in the casino was a bit ( too ) loud, but that is personal. It sure didn;t stop me from playing. If you don't like noise at all, go to Mandalay Bay for example. Housekeeping was good. No complaints there. Done the buffet once. Ok, if you are looking for a gourmet meal, you do need to go somewhere else. I personally didn't like it very much. Would not eat there a lot if I stay again. Excalibur is a great place to stay, especially for a budget traveller. Would surely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice pool area, good staff, but clearly a budget experience”
Reviews.Author: MichiganFloyd
Reviews.Content: We stayed had two adjoining tower II view rooms for three nights in July. We checked in at 3 pm and found the process to be much quicker and friendlier than at the MGM, Mandalay Bay or Monte Carlo. The rooms were decent size and the view of the NY NY and down the strip was ok. As other have mentioned they have a relatively large pool complex. More importantly, the pools weren't crowded and so you enough room to float around on rafts, play catch, etc. We rented a cabana for one of the days, which was nice albeit a bit expensive at $100. The only problems with the pool area were one of the slides being closed and because many guests leave their towels on the chairs when they leave, it can be hard to find a group of lounge chairs that you know for sure are unoccupied. Pool side drink service was also good. All that said, the place is a budget hotel. The furniture is worn, room service trays would stay in the halls for hours, and nothing in the place could be described as immaculate. On the upside, we never ran into the time share sales people that others have called ubiquitous. Nor did we have any problems with the room, which was quiet and cleaned promptly each day. One note of advice: You can't enter the self park from West bound Tropicana. If you are arriving via Las Vegas Blvd. turn in at any of the roads south of the hotel and work your way to the garage from the back of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Should Have Gotten Married There!”
Reviews.Author: Comfycat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took an early honeymoon.....long story. We got a great deal thru travelzoo for $31 USD/night at this hotel, June 3-10/09. We are getting married in September in costume. He will be a King and I'm going to be an Elizabethan Queen. This would have been a PERFECT place to get married, although it would have been just the two of us. In hindsight, it would have been ok. Instead we are doing the same thing here and we also have Medevil times here in Toronto. The hotel is beautiful, located near the end of the strip across from the MGM Grand and Tropicana and right smack beside New York New York. We rented a car for $155 for the whole week. Parking is free at all the hotels, which is unusual but awesome. That's what happens when a hotel actually wants your business! As far as the hotel itself goes, it's great for kids and adults. They have an arcade downstairs for kids. They have everything upstairs for adults. It's cool. We checked in with "Jeff". He's awesome. We were friendly (at 1:30am their time) and he upgraded our room for free when I told him this was our official honeymoon before the wedding. Real sweetheart. We had a beautiful view of the 4 swimming pools and the beautiful Las Vegas mountain range every morning. I can see the Vegas strip any time. The beds were hard and we were unable to sleep the first night but we called housekeeping and had them put egg crate foam on our mattresses and then it was ok. They were awesome too. The rooms were nice, bathroom had a huge shower, no tub. Who needs a tub anyway. It was great for two to shower, which we did and enjoyed the big space to move around in. Water pressure was great, not like those dribbly showers in most hotels and we were on the 17th floor. We tipped the maid to NOT make our bed cause we don't like to pull the sheets out every night from the foot end. Nice. I'm told if you put clothes on the bed, the maid isn't allowed to make your bed. They can't touch your things. The only complaint I have about the hotel itself is that they seemed to be lacking in the ventilation department. Here in Ontario we aren't used to smoky casinos. It's a no no. They need to update their ventilation system because we found it the smokiest casino of all the hotels we went into. Other than that it was a fully self contained hotel. It even had a Starbucks, MacDonalds and plenty of other neat stores in it to shop around in. You didn't really have to leave the hotel for anything. They have the most AWESOME food deal on the strip. $25 all you can eat all day buffet. IT WAS WORTH EVERY DIME! The food was great. We never went hungry and because we had a car we could come and go as we pleased. I even bought a Lanyard and filled it with ice chips, ice cream and fruit juice. It made an awesome slushy. It was about 85-90 degrees of dry heat every day. If you tip the servers a couple of bucks they will get you extras you don't see on the buffet. My hubby loves lemon meringe pie. He mentioned it and they brought him a piece although we didn't see any out the whole week. We gave them extra tips for that. Most hotels, including this one, have escalators to take you everywhere and moving sidewalks. It's nice after walking for hours. Oh yeah, those creepy people at each entrance and all over the hotel who want to give you free stuff...... unless you have a day to waste, don't take their free stuff. They promise to only take 1-2 hours of your time "depending on your level of interest" and you also get a "free lunch". You get your "free stuff" alright but friends of mine ended up going and the truth was they haul you off on a a buss to a resort far away so you are stranded and dependent on them. The 1-2 hours was more like 4-6 hours. The free lunch were stale sandwiches that they couldn't stomach and the time share...... oh did I forget to mention that? The timeshare was $40 000.00 plus $700 a month maintenance fee! Eeeeek! Of course the prices get cheaper when you argue but the bottom line was still expensive and the amount of time you get to spend every year goes down. Total rip off. Just smile and tell them you're not staying past today. The hotel spa and swimming poos was like none I've ever seen. They have a pool for kids, a pool for everyone, a pool for adults only and a pool for kids and the young at heart with a water fall and waterslide. It was nice. The lounge chairs are fairly new, comfortable and we NEVER had to fight over them because there were so many pools and so many lounges. Awesome! Nobody reserves them at 7 am and when you leave you take your towel and the next person gets the chair. Awesomely simple isn't it? Every night they clean the whole deck with a mini Zambone. The pools are not very deep but refreshing in the desert, just the right temperature. Only problem is the pool closes at 6. I like to go for a midnight dip or at least late night. During the day there are lifeguards everywhere. Oh yeah, please remember you're in the hot dry desert and dont' spend a 1/2 hour in the whirlpools..... duh! Some poor unfortunate soul ended up having a stroke in the hottub and they had to fish him out and take him to the hospital. Overall I would stay here again...... most definitely. We also say Hoover Dam and the Canyon, South Rim. Don't get ripped off at the West Rim , take the 5 1/2 hour drive to the South Rim. It's worth it. I know the new bridge is at the west rim but it'll cost ya an arm and a leg to get in and out and around. They don't allow you to take pictures off that glass bridge either. They'd rather sell you some. Take a bus tour, don't drive yourself either. It's a long and lonely ride through the desert.

Reviews.Title: “pools were fabulous but the room, not so much”
Reviews.Author: BriannasMOm09
Reviews.Content: My 7 year-old daughter and I stayed for 8 days at Excalibur in a widescreen room in Tower 2. The room was OK; A/C worked well and beds were comfortable and had a tall, long, brown suede headboard that extended over both Queen beds. Granite counters in bathroom and top of A/C unit and spacious counters. Shower walls had black & pink mold, I asked for new bedspreads when we got there as ours had little blood and chocolate stains, and there were a couple of stains on the curtains and some stains on the ceiling. I re-cleaned all table, counter and dresser tops on arrival; the windows were dirty, too. They never seemed to clean the bathroom mirror; same water spots remained daily; I had to do that, too. One day they forgot to clean our room, even though I called twice to remind them. Finally, by midnight I put out the trash cans and towels into the hall and called to tell them so; finally someone came up with fresh towels and clean trash bags. Wonderful laundry service; they bring you back your panties in little gift boxes with tissue wrap, like a gift. For the most part, they do accommodate, but it may take a while. 4 pools there; 2 are fabulous with waterfalls and 2 slides. Can rent rafts and float around, water is super warm, 1 pool's capacity is 850 people, another is about 700; they're huge. There are half-naked women dancing on a stage that you have to walk by to get to your Tower 2 room, and time share people everywhere trying to get your attention, and of course it's very smoky, but there are oxygen bars everywhere, which my daughter and I used each night; we really enjoyed that. I liked the location. Connected indoors through walkway to Luxor and Mandalay, and through an outside bridge to New York, then another bridge to MGM. About a 20 - 30 min walk to Ceasers and Bellagio. We saw David Copperfield at MGM, Bodies at Luxor, Tournament of Kings dinner at Excalibur, Lion Exhibit at MGM, Shark Reef at Mandalay Bay; it was all right there; location is good. We were on the 15th floor and had the Luxor light blinding us through our window if the shade was up. This hotel is good for parent traveling with mature child.

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating”
Reviews.Author: Hershey9
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed the last week of July. The rooms are in needs of an update mattress and carpeting. The staff was quite pleasant and helpful. I did not like having to pay for the use of a pack n play $20.00 per day. Children need to be in a crib. It is something that is needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location, Will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: doctor16
Reviews.Content: Timeshare People: Yes they are guarding the entrances, and even though I had read about them no one told me what to look out for or how to bypass them. They are the friendly people in the blue blazers that act like the care about you when you walk in. If someone says the following to you: "Where are you guys from", or "Is this your first time here" when you walk in the door they are most likely timeshare people. Simply look at them and say no thank you. They know the drill and leave you alone; the key is to not stop walking. The check in desk is to the left of the main entrance when you go in the hotel, you can sight see later. Check In: There was a long line to check in, but it moved quickly. We waited maybe 10 minutes, not bad at all. The young lady that checked us in was very nice and the whole process at the desk took about 3 minutes. Room: After reading several reviews I opted for the safer bet in my opinion and booked a wide screen room. These rooms are in Tower 2. We were not disappointed. The room was clean, the beds were comfortable, and the air conditioning worked great. The showers drained a little slow, but I have that happen at most hotels. TV was nice, but we never used it really, it’s Vegas. Cleaning Staff: Our cleaning staff was awesome. Some days we didn’t leave the room until after 1pm, but our room was always cleaned when we returned. At any hotel I like to leave a $5 tip on the nightstand each day before we go out. I leave a note requesting extra towels every day, cups, etc., and this has always gotten my requests filled no problems, the Excalibur was no exception. At the least I figure the tip gives them extra motivation to clean my room regardless of the time I leave. Location: This hotel is in the best location in my opinion. It is a cheap $15 + tip taxi fare from the airport or an easy drive if you rent a car. If you choose other hotels like Bally’s you have to fight the strip traffic, which is horrible at best. It’s a 20-25 min walk from here to the Bellagio which is in the middle of the strip. Families: If you are one of the many people that say hey, I want to take my kid to “Sin City” this info is for you. This hotel has a several things that would appeal to kids, mainly an overpriced arcade, and a statue of Sponge Bob. *Remember this is Vegas, so Sponge Bob is roughly 15ft from a Liquor Bar, 25ft from the Gaming Tables, and depending on the time of day only 40ft from women in very little clothing dancing on a stage. Not to mention if you decided to go for a stroll down the strip the porn pushers will introduce your kid to enough porn to last them until they are in college. They will like the pool though! General: This hotel is a great value, clean, friendly, and has a great vibe. If you want luxury the MGM is across the street and is very nice, but I stayed 4 nights at Excalibur for the price of 1 and a half there. I wanted to spend my money on other things. Remember though, I booked a wide screen room in tower 2, I can’t speak for the cheaper rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value...Great Location”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelerArizona
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Excaliber three times over the past two years. The Excaliber is an older hotel and yes it is in need of updates and repair; but I found the hotel rooms to be clean and the customer service better than some of the other upscale hotels on the strip. You cannot find a better value in a comparably good location in all of Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “my stay was horrible .”
Reviews.Author: pammy769
Reviews.Content: Do not go to this hotel especialy handycapped, one the comfeture was ripped ,the maids do not know what clean is. Then on the day islipped and fell in the going down the step ,I slammed my back hard and it still hurts. There so called lifeguard saw me and didn't even see if I was allright because I'm handycapped and on the nheavy side. I reported to securety and pictures done and they have not caaled or checked on me. So please for your safety don't go here therenot nice here at excaliber. Ill never say here again

Reviews.Title: “Older Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jaac04
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs some updating. The springs in the mattresses poked you when you sat or layed on the bed (My weight 115 lbs). The bedding and carpet is old. Be prepared to walk through cig. smoke while in Vegas. The room and bathroom was nice size.

Reviews.Title: “what a dive!!!”
Reviews.Author: LoraCamarillo_Ca
Reviews.Content: We just got back from las Vegas and were very upset with the Excalibur as a whole! the room was dusty and dirty, we requested extra blankets and called 3 times they never brought the blankets to us after i told them at 10:00pm I NEED THEM NOW they still ignored my request. we called again the second night and had to call 3 times and wait 1.5 hours to get the blankets. there was trash and empty glasses in the hallway dailt, it was just gross! we had small children with us and they had GO GO DANCERS right in the Lobby area! so weird!!!! they have a bar called something like Dicks bar which is so gross! they have people where hats with very inappropreate saying written on the hats, we couldnt walk through the lobby without covering the kids eyes!! it was horrible, i would never recommend this hotel just spend the extra money and stay at a decent, clean hotel with good help!

Reviews.Title: “BELOW AVERAGE”
Reviews.Author: Sasso74
Reviews.Content: for a las vegas hotel it sucked. rooms were below average, fairly old looking. horrible place to gamble - the poker room was electronic. Food was average at best. Nice workout facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Very Tired Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Boeta85
Reviews.Content: After traveling around Canada and the US for 6 months this is unfortunately the worst hotel I've stayed so far. Staying in only 3 - 3.5 star hotels, I've seen a few hotels with very tired rooms, but the Excalibur takes the prize. Toilet was broken and leaking, shower felt like it was stolen from a cheap motel. Bed was short sheeted & I found myself playing housekeeping and remaking the bed at 2am. Location is quite good for most shows, walking distance to MGM/NYNY/Luxor Otherwise you can see why they are dumping the rooms at cheap rates... people clearly aren't staying here like they used to.

Reviews.Title: “A good value”
Reviews.Author: Gnutter
Reviews.Content: Went on a trip with some friends and stayed 4 nights at the Excalibur. We were in the newer section of the hotel and while pleasantly surprised with the room, our view was of the roof. Guess we can't have everything. The hotel is on the corner of the strip and Tropicana, with MGM Grand, New York New York and the apparently soon to be demolished/renovated (?) Tropicana Hotel. The price is the biggest draw as well cheaper gaming tables. My room mate and friends enjoyed the penny and 2-cent slots and made a fun time of the trip, for sure. I did well playing $5 craps and $10 black-jack. The all-day Buffet is not a bad deal, but wish they changed the food from lunch to dinner. Maybe it was just the day we were there, so we got tired of the food and ate somewhere else the other days. (Tried the MGM dinner Buffet. The food was much better, but also pricier.) The comps are generous for the amount of playing I did. Do get yourself a MGM Player's Card which allows you to accummulate points at several properties. We got some pretty good comps for meals (at least one meal each day) as well late check-out. I think I came out a bit ahead at the end of the stay, even counting the $$ saved from the freebie meals. I'm a newbie on the comps thing, so had I known we should have charged all the meals to the room, I might have gotten everything for free. I learned from that! For those of you complaining about pay-to-use internet access in the room. suggest instead that you go to the food court where Krispy Kreme is --- they have free wi-fi there, if you absolutely must check your email, etc. While I was doing just that, there were 3 other people doing the same thing. :) I've recommended the hotel to some friends and they also had a great stay, so I guess it's not really too bad, for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Book a month ahead and you'll get your $$ worth”
Reviews.Author: vegas111
Reviews.Content: I am actually still in the hotel...came here for 9 nights with a friend. We got a free room upgrade, very nice check-in clerk. Rooms are decent size, clean, comfortable. No fridge though, however, there is ice machine on the same floor. Don't watch TV much, so it doesn't matter how many channels it has - one is in Vegas, why watch TV?!! Some noise from the outside traffic etc. but if you turn the fan/AC on, it will drown it out. As far as internet, you don't have to get the $14 hotel thing, turn on your PC and look for wi-fi offers - Travelocity and some others will pop up - slightly cheaper then the hotel. OR, go to McDonalds or krispy Creme downstairs and youo got free internet. Drinks are VERY pricey, $7 for a basic beer, BUT in the downstairs of Tower II, right by the elevators, there is a little store with one fridge that has the same beers for $3.75 ;-) Overall, it is worth the money etc. The pool does close pretty soon - 7PM. Easy access to MGM and New york New York and Luxor. Would stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Still a great bargain! Go see Monte at the Jesters Lounge!”
Reviews.Author: lizziebarf
Reviews.Content: We needed to visit Vegas for a quick, one night stay to see some family friends and booked Excalibur. We paid a few extra dollars for Tower 2 and it was just fine. I think our Wednesday summer night rate was $58. Room was nicely remodeled, but the coffee table obviously wasn't cleaned- cup rings and smears were seen, but the maid knocked and entered right after we checked in at 4:30, so maybe she was coming to clean it... I don' t know because I sent her away. We had a nice dinner with our family friends at Regale...it was fine, like Olive Garden. The best part of any of our visits is to hang with Monte at the Jester's Lounge. He has been there since Excalibur opened, and is always a wonderful host. We always make a point to see him when we go to Vegas, even if we stay somewhere else. Go there and said Liz and Scott from Los Angeles sent ya! Also, check out the Atomic Testing Museum on Flamingo Blvd...worth a trip and sponsored by the Smithsonian.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur - no no no”
Reviews.Author: BrammersLeeds
Reviews.Content: OK, so I'm on business and need a cheap hotel - that's exactly what I got. Having walked around most of the neighbours, it's quite clear this place is in need of some considerable TLC - or preferably TNT ! Room looked tired and very downbeat - nothing vibrant about it at all. Shower was tatty and the furnishing from the 1970s I think. As someone who doesn't smoke, the public areas were very smoky - considerably more so than other ones I went into so I think something needs to be done there. The pool area again was OK, but not a patch on others. Good things - well Dicks bar can be quite entertaining and the house band was very good. Drinks are expensive and menus very limited. The spa was good at at $20 a pop tends to remain quiet which is a plus for me. Overall a dingy place with vgery little appeal compared to its' neighbours the Luxor and Mandalay - but I guess you get what you pay for?

Reviews.Title: “gone down hill”
Reviews.Author: maotto3
Reviews.Content: this used to be my go-to hotel whenever i went to vegas (2-3 times per year) but they're slacking recently. my room was clearly not vacumed before i checked in, nor was it dusted (fairly thick coat of dust on every surface, including nightstand and table). i had to call and ask for washcloths. they also now charge $20 for a mini fridge (im diabetic and need to keep my meds cold) ans $14 for one day of internet access. valet was full the entire time of my stay (saturday-tuesday). the only parking available was far out back past the parking structure. the pool closes at an unreasonable time, 7pm, though they do have a nice 18+ area! the casino is very tight with pay-offs these days. the prices in the cafe's and other eateries have shot up also. seems like they're losing money and trying to make up for it by skimping on services/cleanliness and milking the customers. PS: if you do stay here, don't bother paying extra for the "upgraded tower". all that means is granit counters in the bathrooms (no tub, just shower) and a bigger tv.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: DeeT93
Reviews.Content: The main hotel area is not as luxurious as some of the others, rooms were clean and well serviced, The Spa was nice but expensive. There is a rail link between Mandalay Bay, Luxor, Excalibur to the MGM but absoloutly no signs for this in the Excalibur. We were hounded by what we thought was Hotel staff selling time share with offers of free shows etc. Poker room is all automatic, no dealers which took away from the game, overall we got great value for money but when we go back we will be staying at the MGM, which is more luxurious and very central and close to all amenities

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jenlyn5
Reviews.Content: Good hotel for the price. Rooms were clean and spacious. Pools were very nice. Staff were friendly. Not impressed with the buffet. Unhappy they did not provide free wireless internet. Bathroom not designed well - especially with young children (sinks high, unable to reach toilet paper holder, no shelves in shower to put items). They do have a food court area with a few choices. Game area downstairs, but rides were expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Packed Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beighton14
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in March this year for 7 days with my son and brother. After rejecting the first room given on the ground floor, we were given a room with a safe in it, but had to pay an extra 20 dollars per night, but it was worth it for peace of mind. The excalibur is a very busy and noisy hotel with lots going on. The buffet was good value and the food was edible with plenty of choice. The rooms were spacious and cleaned every day. I would say for a few dollars more you can get a much better room on the strip, however, we were not disappointed with our choice. We used the monorail, but found the convenience of the 'deuce' better value to get around. There is so much to do, the time flies. I am not a gambler, but even I struggled to do everything that I wanted to do in the week I was there. This was my second visit to vegas and I love it. The first time I stayed off strip at the Gold Coast which was fabulous and such good value for money. I am planning to go back again, but will probably stay off strip as it is a bit better value for money and a bit quieter and there are free shuttle buses back and forward to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “A great deal”
Reviews.Author: danielleinqueens
Reviews.Content: I work in a luxury New York hotel and was a bit scared to book this hotel, however our stay was great. We tipped the front desk agent and were upgraded to a Tower II room which was clean, nice, w/ a big plasma tv and a great view of the pool. There isnt a night club here, but you can easily walf to any number of hotels including the MGM or Luxor. The pool area was great and I was happy to have an adult only section.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value, best for families with children.”
Reviews.Author: cppaso
Reviews.Content: I went to Las Vegas July 6-10 to attend a conference at Mandalay Bay. Since I was traveling solo, I decided to save some money on the room and stay at the Excalibur. I was in the remodeled Tower II. The room had ordinary hotel decor with large flat screen TV. The bed was very comfortable and the nonsmoking room was really nonsmoking. Overall, the room was adequate and a good value. The casino had $5 tables and craps, unlike the Luxor and Mandalay Bay. The casino was smoky and needs a facelift (carpet did look clean). I took the free tram or the people mover every day to Mandalay Bay for the conference. I ate in both the cafe at the Excalibur and at the Luxor for breakfast; the Luxor was best. The Luxor also has a good buffet. Overall, the Excalibur was convenient and a good value.

Reviews.Title: “A Resort Fee? You gotta be kinding me!”
Reviews.Author: mulhollandmatt
Reviews.Content: They charged me an extra $5 a night for a "resort fee" saying it is mandatory to offer the services that they do. I thought that was what the price was for. My stay was only $29, so $5 increased the price by about 18%. Also, it is the principle of the thing. Hotel managers listen up. If you are going to charge something automatically to each room, then it is not fair to exclude that charge from the advertised price. I should also mention that there was over a half hour wait to check in, the staff was not friendly, and it was over a city block from my car to the elevator that took me to my floor. The only this place has going for it is location, but there are better hotels nearby.

Reviews.Title: “go elswhwere”
Reviews.Author: im4k9lives
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not one of the better hotels, I would recomend another hotel. It is very loud confusing layout and the underpaid bartenders really are rude in particular Hout at the Lounge near tower II, My boyfriend and I walked away feeling upset . If your spending alot of money to visit Vegas spend it somewhere else. Thank you for reading this review. No matter what hotel you stay at take alot of money for food and water :)

Reviews.Title: “Happy with my first stay”
Reviews.Author: virgonomic
Reviews.Content: I played at the electronic poker tables at Excalibur during my first Vegas trip in December so I decided to stay there this time. I paid $29/night for my room. At check in I slipped a $20 in my ID wallet and asked if they had any complimentary upgrades. She made a call and told me they would upgrade me (to a Widescreen Tower Room). She handed back my ID and the $20 and then asked "oh, is this for me?" I told her it was and thanked her for her help. The room was better than expected. It overlooked the 4 pools and the parking area. I liked the fact that there was an 18-and-over pool and it was not very busy. The queen size bed was VERY comfortable. I had originally booked a king but didn't really care. The widescreen tv was nice and the furniture (dresser, table, 2 plush velvet chairs) was functional. The A/C was loud when I arrived but I turned it to Low and slept well. My only real complaint is the window coverings. There is a blind over the window that leaves gaps along the edges. The curtains are decorative and do not cover the window. I tucked them into the sides of the blind to cover the gap. It still let some light in but didn't wake me up. I just thought it was strange. The hotel was very quiet. The elevators were a little slow. The time share people did not talk to me once. I heard one guy tell another guest that they "have deals for families with children" or something to that effect. They did seem to be approaching families a lot. Overall this was a great stay and I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great of the price”
Reviews.Author: d30f3
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice and both times I paid about $110 night to stay in the Jacuzzi suite. With the upgrade the hotel was very nice. There are much nicer hotels on the strip, but I have found some of the best deals here. I do however recommend to get the upgrade. I have seen the knights show about 3 teams. To be honest it is very historically inaccurate and cheesy. It however is a relatively inexpensive show and it is fairly entertaining. Just don’t go in there with high expectations of seeing anything remotely realistic. The location of the hotel is good, but not great. It is on the strip, but it is a good walk to a love of the more popular locations. With all of this being said it is a good place to go if you are trying to save money. I however would stay away from most of the restruants in the hotel, they do not compare to the other places on the strip. I ate at the buffet once and I would not do it again even when it is free.

Reviews.Title: “Don't fall for the cheap room rates!”
Reviews.Author: jschnatho
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 5 nights at Excalibur with my husband. We knew that it wouldn't be the best hotel on the strip because of the price, but we certainly expected more. The towels were good quality and the view from our room (Tower 2, 23rd Floor) was nice (overlooked New York New York). The hotel is on a helicopter flight path, so helicopters fly by constantly. The pool was nice and not very packed on the days that we went. The location on the strip is great. The widescreen upgraded room that we booked was not very renovated - the fixtures, bathroom, etc. were all very worn. The carpet was awful too. There were crumbs on the floor when we arrived. The shower door came off and fell on me when I showered one morning and after reporting it to several people and getting no response, I figured nobody cared. I just called and spoke to a manager about it again today and all I got was "sorry". Don't look for impressive customer service at this hotel - I don't think they care if I ever come back again, or how many people I tell my story to. There are plenty of better hotels (even on a budget) on the strip! The hotel doesn't have much of a casino and the food choices are not very enticing. The dinner at the Tournament of Kings made me sick, but the show was pretty good (Vegas corny). Valet parking was full every time that we tried to park (at various times throughout our 5 night stay), so we were stuck parking far away in the self park garage/lot. Watch out for the timeshare vultures - they get you as soon as you walk in and every time they see you after that. Some of them were downright unpleasant when I told them that I was not interested in their promotions. The spa left a lot to be desired as well. Okay, it was disgusting. The showers were dirty and littered with used sanitary products. Lots of kids, but still plenty of partying adults. One night we had a lady screaming outside of our door for half an hour or more before security finally showed up. After all this, the hotel didn't even offer to comp one of my cheap room stays, dinners, shows, or anything. Crappy Vegas service! They will promise you comps for visiting their timeshare property all day, but not to make up for a horrible experience that you had to pay for - BEWARE.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: ritraveler68
Reviews.Content: Dingy hotel!! This hotel offers discounts for a reason - they need people. It was dark and dreary. Rooms were dirty, wall paper in room was coming off, carpeting was lifted and the walls are paper thin. Deepest pool is 3 1/2 feet and it closes at 7:00. There is no micro, mini fridge or coffee pot in room. We booked through an agent so we did not do our homework. I recommend you do yours. At the end of the trip I needed to print boarding passes and we were charged $5.00 per pass to be printed. I do ot recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “June 25-July 1st 2009”
Reviews.Author: tkportersat
Reviews.Content: Check in was pretty smooth, small line but went very quick. Our check in clerk would not even entertain the idea of an upgrade, so we didn't press. Maybe it is because I got the room for $29 on the weeknights and $57 on the weekend he didn't feel we deserved it - ha. We were immediately accosted by the annoying Time share folks, after six days of this we got very good at avoiding them. First appearance of the room reminds you of the 70's, quite outdated and even though I requested non-smoking I am not convinced that is what we got but we were not disappointed overall; especially for the price and location. The room started to take on a moldy smell but we were hardly in the room so we didn't let it bother us. I will tell you that you might want to pack earplugs like we did, the air conditioner is VERY loud and you can't control loud people in the hallways. The earplugs were a lifesaver. The casino was fun and I made money there a few times. Cocktail waitresses are hard to flag down but it was like that at most casinos we visited. If you play poker like we do, never had any trouble getting drinks at the poker tables at Monte Carlo, Excalibur, Harrah's, Osheas, Venetian, etc. The Monte Carlo was by far our favorite poker room as the staff is very friendly, service is great and the bathrooms are right there. The pool which I only made it to once is very nice and does have one adult only area, although most of the folks were very newly of age I believe. I am 37 and felt quite old as the twenty somethings challenged each other to handstand competitions.....but the pool area was nice and drinks were reasonably priced. That leads to another topic - children. Why on earth would people think that Vegas is a good family vacation? I am seriously confused by this...most of the kids we saw were running without supervision, crying or yelling. Not to mention dodging drunks, smut cards advertising bill boards, gambling and go go dancers - how about Disneyworld or a cruise instead? Seriously I have children so I get the need to get away, but when I go to Vegas my teens get to hang with Grandma and when we do a family trip it is to the coast or a cruise. As far as food goes we only ate McDonalds, Baja Fresh, Krispy Kreme and Starbucks and all those were fine for a quick grab. Also the Dog and draft at the bar for $2.50 made a great mid-day snack. We ate at the Luxor buffet several times and the one at Monte Carlo and both were very good. All in all we had a wonderful time and the Excalibur was a great place to stay. The price is right and while not fancy it certainly serves it's purpose. I would stay there again. I think next time we might aim for the Monte Carlo just because we spent a lot of time there and it puts us further down the strip. If you have any questions for me, feel free to ask!!

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur great bang for $”
Reviews.Author: Magswpg
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel as kids stay free and 2 water slides at the pool. Booked through Allegiant out of Fargo, was a great deal. When first booked in we were in old tower, room was outdated and did not seem clean. Booked rooms with parents to help with the kids and they were 10 floors away. Went back to front desk as parents room had crickets in it some alive still, room must have just been sprayed. Got switched to the newly renovated tower and a joining room no extra charge, at first they were going to charge, but everyone who was checking in was getting upgraded so just make sure to ask, sometime twice... casino was not the best, food courts, food at the pool was real good and lots for price. Pool was real good for the kids and great break for everyone. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sarah286
Reviews.Content: My friend and i stayed at the Excalibur from the 24th April 2009 for 7 nights, our first night was not a good experience but this was not the hotels fault. We had a 9 hour flight so all we wanted to do on the first night was get some food and a shower then hit our beds, at about midnight we were awoken to lots of screaming and shouting from a group of noisy teenagers we asked nicely for them to keep the noise down only for the volume to increase and then doors began to slam, i am not the most tolerant of people and espically when i am woken up so i then called security and the noise decreased only for it to do up again a hour or so later this went on all night. when i went to the reception the next morning to ask to be moved i was told it would cost me $60 as this would include an upgrade i said i would pay, the receptionist went away then came back and said it would be free of charge as all the noise we had encountered the night before. This was a nice gesture on the hotel's part, the room was lovley and clean and very quiet the maid service was prompt and cannot be faulted. In Vegas you do alot of walking but this suits me as i love to be outside and there is so much to see and do, the food was great and i must say my favourite place to eat was the Harley Davidson cafe. Overall Vegas is a great holiday i loved it and cannot fault any service i recieved there i returned to the uk on Saturday the 2nd May, on Sunday 3rd May i had re booked to return. One thing that made me laugh is there was a homeless man sitting on the path with a sign that said 'Why lie i need beer' i had to give him a few dollers just for the honesty. If you ever have the option to visit Vegas you must go,i would give the hotel 10 out of 10 on everything.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: theresa1970
Reviews.Content: Stayed at tthe excalibur because we had a 2 night room comp in a widescreen room, $25.00 free slot play,2 free spa admissions, 2 free midway games, and $25.00 a day food credit which was not honored because i had a cash deposit and you need a credit card so you can charge it to your room. The check in line was long and she told me I could of went to vip to be checked in which I did not know.i had to wait 20 minutes for her to check about getting my food credit. the supervisor just said oh well her name is denise and she should be fired as she was rude. I hope they don't pay her too much cause she's not worth it. Talking about rude i ordered a coffee and tipped the cw a buck and she ripped it out of my hand. I did not experience any friendy workers!!!!!!!!! the slots were fun finally I was able to play for a little while while as most casinos sucked up the money. The spa was okay enjoyed the steam room. Excalibur my only advice to you is get new friendly workers.

Reviews.Title: “NOT what I expected for only $34!”
Reviews.Author: JudyJackpot
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Excalibur Las Vegas on a recent Wednesday night, hence the cheapo rate. It was for just one night so I didn’t expect much beyond a bed and a hot shower. Imagine my surprise when we opened the door to a mini-suite of sorts complete with hot tub and a million dollar view of the Las Vegas strip from our 24th floor. The coolest part was that the hot tub was tucked inside the turret, so I felt like a queen waving to my subjects from the window. Warning: the window opens to the wide open sky, so do not stay in one of those rooms if you have small children, pets or people with mental issues. That said, all I can say about the rest of the room is “eh.” The furniture dated back to the 1980s complete with faux wood, and the lighting fixtures were probably original to the grand opening of the hotel, about 20 years ago, with the cheesy medieval dungeon look. I was hesitant to sit on the upholstered chairs, but the room overall smelled clean, and the bed was definitely clean and fresh. The bathroom was clean as well, and as good as it gets for the price.
