This idea works at the Hard Rock Hotel, because that's its theme (and the girls were prettier). But with the family-friendly things like the jousting dinner show, the Spongebob 4-D ride, etc., it just needs to be 100% family-friendly. Instead of having go-go dancers, have maidens in flowing dresses. Have knights walking around posing for pictures. Have a huge castle-themed playground for the kids. (That's not a stretch; they have lots of McDonald-type playgrounds at other casinos in town, like the grandparent-friendly Station and Coast casinos.) Heat the pool year-round. The pool has a new water slide, so that's a good start. My daughter picked out this hotel to stay at for her first trip to town, but it quickly became forgotten, replaced by the Stratosphere, Circus Circus and the Golden Nugget. There are enough adult-oriented casinos in town. This one is missing an opportunity. The room was not that great, but the bathroom was nice. FYI- it had a shower instead of a bathtub. The rates are fantastic, and the location is great, but it could be a much better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but certainly not great”
Reviews.Author: Terpr13
Reviews.Content: Pros The were polite The place was clean The Time share presentation thing was absolutely worth the 3 hours of saying no. lol Cons The Evaluators were very confusing and it was easy to accidentally get on to an elevator that didn't go to your floor The maid service speaks and understands ZERO English it seems...this manifested in them throwing away ALL of me and my Wife's marriage documents as well as a few other important documents... Registration Lines were VERY long as most of the service counter spaces were closed The AC was either on and freezing you out or off and hot as hell High Speed internet cost 15.95 per and was still crappy and slow

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, quiet and convenient”
Reviews.Author: frankgarrison
Reviews.Content: Attended DMB shows in Vegas and got a great rate at the Excalibur for a Thurs-Sunday stay. Upgraded to a remodeled room and the room was clean, quiet and comfortable. Room was in Tower II, 12th floor (i think). Staff quite friendly. Pool was clean and well-staffed, though the water was a bit warm for my taste (Vegas was experiencing a heat wave over this time, though). Buffet ($25 all day) was nothing spectacular, but it was cheap and plentiful. Close to NY NY and the MGM Grand, which was important to us. Overall, I'd stay there again at the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: robem76
Reviews.Content: Great location on the strip with easy access to neighbouring hotels. You seem to be able to get a great price deal on this hotel. Would suggest people only get a wide screen tv room. The old rooms are cheaper though dingier and noisier. My parents who were holidaying with us had origianally booked the older rooms though when they saw ours upgraded, as the updated rooms are really quite nice. The casino does seem smokier and louder than others, though cant fault the buffet and other places to get snacky food.

Reviews.Title: “This place was great”
Reviews.Author: gmanRoanoke_Va_
Reviews.Content: I don't know where some of these other folks stayed, but I thought Excalibur was great in every way. Check-in was quick and although we got there at 11 a.m., we were able to get right into our room. Room was plenty big and clean and the beds were comfortable. Air conditioning worked great. Restaurants were a bit pricey, but they all offered specials, which didn't hit the wallet too hard. Buffet was delicious and not that expensive. Also, there are McDonald's, Pizza Hut, Mexican and Chinese fast food outlets that are money savers. Other stores in the hotel were a pricey, though. Pool was great and prices at the pool-side restaurant were reasonable. Casino wasn't as smokey as some reviews say and the dealers were all helpful and entertaining. Not stuck up at all. There could be more $5 tables, though. Overall, we had a great stay. You can't beat this place for under $40 a night. We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, old, tired....Just not a nice place to stay anymore”
Reviews.Author: smcptravels
Reviews.Content: We generally stay at Hilton Properties, but stayed here becuase family function. Room was old, tired, moldy, had holes in the wall, bathroom was old broken and had mildew. Overall, just not a good place to stay. There are better options for the same money. Note: Stayed there when first opened and a few years later, rooms were always small and a little dumpy but not in this bad shape

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest, but relatively inexpensive and grew on us”
Reviews.Author: birkdale
Reviews.Content: The Excalibur is sensational from outside, and a definite attraction on the Strip. Inside, first impressions are not good; everything looks tired and dingy. The casino is smokier than any of the others in Vegas, the clientele seem to be all on stag and hen nights so the volume is right up there. The bedrooms (or ours anyway) continue the dingy theme, but it's all in the decor, and thankfully the room was very clean. All in all I wouldn't stay there again even though I spent very little time in our room or in the Excalibur. Didn't eat there at all. The best breakfast close by is in the House of Blues at the Mandalay Bay, which is just a stroll or a two stop train ride away. The pool is OK but old fashioned and a bit basic.

Reviews.Title: “Same old stay”
Reviews.Author: rijets
Reviews.Content: Went to the Excalibur again just because of the price of the room. The hotel has not changed since the last time I was there in October. This is a no frills hotel, just very basic amenities. Also, a very good price for buffet if you go between 2 and 6 p.m. as it costs only a two for one price.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best place to stay ...but for 40 bucks a night..what do you expect?”
Reviews.Author: dany0802
Reviews.Content: We chose this Hotel because friends were staying at the same place and we thought we would give it a try. Checking in was ok but we checked in at like 11pm so it wasn't busy. The guy at the counter was sorta grouchy. Not one employee went out of their way to make us feel welcome. The casino smelled of terrible cigarette smoke. I know that it's Las Vegas, but the other surrounding casinos were more bearable. Seemed like there wasn't any ventilation in there. The room was just alright. I didn't like the decor...it was definitely from the 70's or something. The bed was uncomfortable and the pillows were way too soft (luckily I always bring my own). The bathroom was clean. I was disappointed to not get a coffee pot. The air conditioner in the room was so loud and it kept blowing the curtains around. Luckily we weren't in the room very much and needless to say we didn't stay at that casino either. We didn't get a chance to use the fitness facilities or the pool, but I hear it was remodeled. And to add to the casino...it's so boring. Not much goes on in that place. It was dead during the week. I've stayed at New York and Venetian and will definitely go back to those ones. After this stay I'm believing the saying that you get what you pay for. So if you are looking for just a cheap place to stay and you dont mind cigarette smell ( I mean terrible) then the rooms at this place were ok. If you want a fun upbeat hotel, then stay at New York..the prices aren't that bad.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: chassyone
Reviews.Content: Beds made me itch! This was a awful hotel. Kids loved the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing horrible. You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: sweetkness
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel becuase it was the cheapest one in the heart of the strip. So going in with that mindset we were really not disappointed. Check-in on Friday was nice and quick, our room was satisfactory (even though it was one of the horrible reviewed tower rooms) with nothing to complain about....comfortable beds, spacious enough bathroom, room was cleaned properly each day, etc. Customer service was average, food choices average, pool below average, casino a little above average if you are looking for value on the strip. Yes, when we go next time we will probably fork out the extra money for a place like Mandalay Bay, but for the cheapest hotel in the heart of the strip, we were completely satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Good.... for the price, Great!”
Reviews.Author: realto1
Reviews.Content: The wait at check-in seemed long, mostly because we were waiting before it opened. After it started, it moved fairly quickly. The room was clean, nothing fancy. I would say better than a Super 8, but less than a Hampton Inn, and bigger. Yes the furniture is a bit worn, the TV was old, but who goes to Vegas to look at furniture and watch TV? The bed was newer and very comfortable. No problem with noise or room service. There is a room safe. For $20 more per night, could get a remoldeled room in Tower II. We decided not, but I would recommend it to those who want to use pool/spa/fitness center often, as you don't have to cross casino floor to get there. Ate at Sherwood Forest cafe, not impressed. The $25 eat all day buffet did not look great either, and with k's of restaurants in Vegas, why would you want to limit yourself? The new Baja Fresh off the Casino floor is very fresh, good, and cheap. Food court is good. The casino is not as fancy as most, but was fine with plenty of penny slots. It has the only video Texas Holdem poker in Vegas- no dealer, but a large table screen with a console for each player. I liked playing it. Two huge shaped pools, and a shallow pool with slide and waterfall, with bar/restaurant, fitness center and spa in same area. Very nice! GF got a massage, 50min/$105., said it was great. I used the spa on last day, extra $5.- cozy, Zen inspired with white and jade tiles, steam room, sauna, hot tub with sitting area, another small siiting area w/ TV. Different scented shower stations. New age music in background- very relaxing! Strip location is great- lower walkway right into Luxor. Another walkway to NYNY, which leads down to MGM Grand and Duece bus stop. Monorail goes from Exc., to Luxor and Mandalay Bay. Next time I would prob. pick another casino just to experience a new one, but would recommend Exc. The price to fly RT from the East Coast + three nights was about the price of three nights at a Super 8 at home- I can't complain!

Reviews.Title: “Spend a little extra and go elsewhere!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lena0106
Reviews.Content: I've been to Vegas 4 times and have stayed at a different hotel each time. By far, the Excaliber was the worst. The only perk of this hotel is the convenience to the "4 corners" of the strip and the accessibility to the other casinos. The are extremely rude, the rooms are dirty and you will not get the room you choose unless it's a stroke of luck. If you are just trying to get to Vegas on a tight budget, then this hotel may be for you. If you can afford an extra $20 a night, stay at the MGM or even at the Tropicana across the street, which is almost the same price as the Excalibur, but with much better customer service and pools. I will be back in August but will be staying at the Flamingo or MGM.

Reviews.Title: “Tolerable but smoky”
Reviews.Author: Americka
Reviews.Content: Was in town for 3-nights and wanted something reasonably price and accessible to town center S of MandalayBay. At arrival all seemed well from the outside but upon our entering Tower 1 we were inundated with SMOKE. The ventilation was horrible, thank goodness the room didn't maintain the same smell. Check-in and check-out wasn't bad. The staff were not overly welcoming but got the job done. We stayed in Tower II supposed recently upgraded, NOT!! The only new thing was the widescreen tv, oh and the toilet, everything else was OLD and worn (carpet, drapes, sheets, & furniture). Disappointed but since it was a short stay and we weren't going to be in the room much, we made due. The offerrings in the casino area weren't impressive although the buffet and Sherwood Forest Cafe were pretty decent for general purpose eating. The pool closed at 6pm (never heard of such a thing) and the security stations at the tower entrances were not manned and anyone could walk-in. There are definitely other reasonably priced hotels on the strip with better amenities and atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur made our first trip to Vegas perfect!”
Reviews.Author: keobeer
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at the Excalibur three months in advance of our trip on a recommendaton from a friend. It was only then that I found out there were no bathtubs and that worried me a bit together with reading some very negative reviews. However, after everything I read...we had a hassle free and friendly early check-in (about 11:00 am) to our booked King Bed no smoking view room. And what a view!!!! I loved the sound of the traffic and the roller coaster screams reminded me of 'Roller Coaster Tycoon'. The room was clean, the shower was big and the bed and pillows were super comfy. We were never interrupted by hallway or other room noises. The sheets and towels changed everyday, and even when the shower drain slowed down one morning we alerted maintenance and it was fixed by the time we returned in the afternoon. The hotel is located at the most perfect spot; we walked in all directions and used the monorail and deuce bus as well. The atmosphere in the casino was really good and I found it the most busiest and liviest of all the hotels we walked through. We really felt like we were in the heart of Las Vegas...everything we ever imagined!

Reviews.Title: “I thought it was awesome”
Reviews.Author: NatChamps2008
Reviews.Content: My room was very nice, bed comfy, big bathroom (relatively) and it was one of the older rooms too. The food was 25 bucks 4 all day buffte and I never left hungry. I ate prime rib and the best Mac and cheese I ever had. Later we went to the Wynn buffet anyway. The location was awesome, very convenient...and did I mention...the place was so cheap! There was no way I could lose for the price I paid. As far as solicitors, Huh? What? I just blew them off...walked right past them...SORRY...not interested. Huge casino, plenty of slots, poker room was electronic, which takes getting used to, later I just went elsewhere. This place makes their big money on slot donkeys...so serious gamblers can get in cheap. Pool and weight room were nice., got 2 free weightroom coupons, after that, 20 bucks. I still haven't found a hotel w free internet and its getting old, about 15 day...thats ridiculous....Other than that it was ALL GOOD. It may be the worst of the MGM hotels, but that's plenty good 4 me!! I was too busy counting all the money I won elsewhere to really complain. The Deuce bus is right outside... This place makes a great "Mother Ship" for gambling trips.

Reviews.Title: “Looks can be deceiving”
Reviews.Author: vboceanboy
Reviews.Content: Ok forgive me but in May when its hot and I mean hot...isn't swimming a great way to cool off? For me it is but here the pool was only open to 6pm. Every hotel that I have ever stayed at has theirs open to atleast nine. Next the room: I booked the room through their own website. Not expedia, not orbitz, but through Excalibur.com. I booked a king non smoking. I go to check in and they wanted to put me in a two doubles. They claimed its only a request. Umm...no where on the site did it say that. Secondly I have worked in hotels as a Night manager and auditor for several different companies and that only applies to reservations made through those travel websites, not you very own. I ended up getting a handicap king room after some arguing with the clerk whom really didn't seem to care. The bed actually wasn't too bed and the pillows were comfy. I didn't like how the grate was falling off the a/c and the bathroom door had black marks all over it. Also I like most people brought my laptop, cell phone, and blutooth headset. So did my friend. There were not enough outlets in the room and the safe could only accommodate one laptop. Decent food court...I loved how they had a Krispy Kreme. Quick access to the MGM so you can ride the monorail. Overall it wasn't a bad hotel but I should have looked into it more.

Reviews.Title: “Totally recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: c-forever
Reviews.Content: I was very skeptical about this hotel after reading the reviews here but since we had booked the hotel 4 months in advance and had already paid the entire 5 nights stay, we had no choice but to go. The rates were exceptionally good...for 5 nights we paid $295 US (we're Cdn). We were upgraded to a renovated room. Location was perfect. Everything is connected and we had no problems walking from one end of the strip to the other. Check in was fast, only a few people ahead of us in the line up, even though we arrived on a Saturday afternoon. They charged us the resort fee of $5 every night. We tried getting out of it but to no avail. I don't know how people have gotten out of them at other hotels. The room was your basic hotel room but very clean. Our room faced the pools. Washroom was large enough for two people to be getting ready at the same time. Shower was HUGE. No bathtub, but we weren't planning on soaking in a tub either. The only issue we had was that our sheets were not changed for the entire 5 nights! Towels were replaced and the room otherwise was tidied up everyday. Our safe also stopped working and all of our passports, cameras and $$ ended up being locked in there right before we needed to go out. We called the hotel desk and were told someone would be up within an hour. Someone was up there within 1/2 hour to fix the problem for us. There is construction noise early, early mornings but you're in Vegas! You don't go there to sleep anyways. It did seem to be the smokiest hotel on the strip though. I noticed other hotel casinos didn't smell as bad as Excalibur did so I don't know how they consider it children friendly. Who would bring their child into a smoke filled atmosphere like that anyways although we did see many children and babies. Very irrresponsible of the pareants IMO. Overall we were very satisfied and happy and would definately stay at Excalibur again.

Reviews.Title: “we were so lucky!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mellyscookies
Reviews.Content: We really were soooo lucky! our standard room was upgraded into a suite!!! we didn't spend any extra charge. and the room was bigger than the place where I live! There was a huge jacuzzi, 2 bathrooms, a living room and a king bed (maybe it was even bigger!). the hotel is very clean and there are all the things that you need for a perfect journey. We stayed just one night and we ate at the italian restaurant (not so good, the pasta was over-cooked, and it was sinking in some water... and I can say that just because I'm Italian!) The hotel has a free parking, just next to the entrance. It's connected with all the other hotels with 2 different metro-rail. the location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “For the last time, I'm not interested in a timeshare!”
Reviews.Author: lowes421
Reviews.Content: The room was dusty and old, but we were not planning on staying in the hotel room for long. Day one we were asked 6 times if we wanted free tickets to a show in exchange for a time share pitch. This happened at Excalibur, New York, and Monte Carlo mostly. I was the worst in the morning and they target couples. Decent pool with newer music. The all-day buffet was a good deal, but the food was bland. The drink servers at both the tables and the slots did not come around often. Expect 1 free drink every hour or two. If buying drinks at the bar expect $5-7 for a beer and $20 for a pitcher. Didn't notice that many kids running around, but overall a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely fine”
Reviews.Author: divera67
Reviews.Content: stayed to attend conference-hotel fine, clean and staff friendly. pool v good. one gripe, with vegas, not hotel- how are you meant to get around? taxis unreliable/impossible once you are off strip. not good in a university town.

Reviews.Title: “Oh dear what a let down”
Reviews.Author: terryulsterman
Reviews.Content: If you fancy staying with the chav's, trailer park fraternity etc then choose this gawd awful place. If not go elsewhere and be thankful. No redeeming features at all.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Madison100
Reviews.Content: We last stayed at the Excalibur for six years ago and found it good value for money so we tried it again this time. No complaints, room clean and very comfortable, staff nice and efficient, good location. Time share were a pain, they collared us offering "comps" first thing and so we did go to their desk. However as soon we realised they were time share we made our exit. They are very pushy but in the end we just smiled and walked past them. One lady actually stood in front of us waving our hands to make us stop - however after a killer glare from me she soon made a hasty exit. Would stay there again. Did have breakfast at Sherwood Cafe and it was warm and greasy, buffet fine but Mandalay Bay was far superior. Did all day at MGM Grand and it was good too.

Reviews.Title: “"Child friendly" - No Way!”
Reviews.Author: Plangy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights with my wife and 2 kids (10 & 7), lured by the cheap(ish) rates and strip location. Also read that it was a good hotel for families with kids. Check-in was quick and easy, staff not particularly friendly. To get to the room we had to go past Dick's Last Resort restaurant and the "Party Pit" both of which were not places that you would wish to expose your kids to. Dick's Last Resort had women wearing paper hats made by the wait staff with pithy sayings such as "My breath smells like his balls" on them, it clearly catered for Bucks/Stag parties, college kids and those there to party. The "Party Pit" was home to a few gaming tables and had a catwalk behind them with chicks in their underwear dancing on it. If I was there on my own I would have had no complaints, with the kids in tow it was a different matter. The casino was smoky and certainly was not a top-end establishment. I went to get coffee early one morning and came across one woman playing the slots in her pyjamas, cig in hand and necking a beer at 7am - class! The rooms were clean and quiet, we had a widescreen room, $16 per day for internet access was a bit steep, so we didn't bother. It was a pleasant room with no real views and a smart bathroom. There is no fridge or coffee making facilities forcing a trip to the (expensive) coffee stands or the food court. Pool area was adequate, cold beer and snacks were easily accesible and biled to the room, free towels on the way in too. You pay a "resort fee" of $19 or so a day, these little charges certainly added up. Plentiful free parking was a useful feature. I would not stay there again. It would be fine for the party crowd. In hindsight the Mirage was good value in a great location and had a degree of finesse, maybe next time?

Reviews.Title: “Great value and a great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Earlybird8
Reviews.Content: Just back from a GREAT stay at the Excalibur! I have to admit, I thought of changing hotels after reading some of the reviews here, but I’m so glad I didn’t. Not only was the price right, so was everything else. We had a newly remodeled widescreen room. It was very clean and had a super comfortable king bed. Linens were very nice, especially the fluffy towels. Spend the extra $10 for a remodeled room – well worth it! Clean is important to me, and there was nothing to complain about. Public areas like hallways, the casino, and especially the room – all sparkling. Check-in took a little longer than I’d like, but nothing unreasonable. I asked for a quiet room and was given an “inside” room on the 26th floor of tower 2. I didn’t know what “inside” meant, but it turned out to be perfect because it faced the other tower and the fun castle-looking parts of the hotel. All this added up to no street noise – a very welcome break from the constant ka-ching that is Vegas! The food court is very handy for a quick meal – who can say no to Krispy Kremes? We didn’t eat at the buffet at Excalibur, so I can’t comment on that. We did have a late-night sandwich at the Sherwood Forrest café, and it was pretty good. We saw “Defending the Caveman.” It’s pretty funny, but the showroom it is in is NOT set up for a show like this - you sit sideways to the stage and crane your neck the whole time. Also, the show is very short. I would not spend the money on this one again. All in all, this was a great location, great room, and great time. I would not hesitate to stay at Excalibur again or recommend to my friends. Don’t take the negative complaints on this site too seriously; if you go somewhere looking to have a bad time, you will. But I found much to be happy about and did not have any of the bad experiences described in some other reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the room interiors”
Reviews.Author: gunchigirl
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and well furnished. The view from the room was great overlooking the swimming pool and the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Good First Time Experience”
Reviews.Author: kbarry02861
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed here March 25th through the 29th. This was our first time in Vegas and chose the Excalibur primarily for the price and location. Unlike previous reviews, we did not see a lot of kids here. Some here and there but not many. Check in was quick. I was a little disappointed that we could only get a smoking room on the first floor, but decided we could see the view as we walked around. Room was basic and clean. No real complaints. This was an updated room but still seemed a little dated. Ate at the Sherwood Forrest Grill and the food and prices were very good. Ate at the Buffet. $25 per person and the buffet was fine. A buffet is a buffet to me. Food was hot and plentiful. Compared to other casinos, this one always seemed busier than others we visited. Good mix of machines and tables. One of the Crap table workers took the time to explain the game to me. Was very helpful. Enjoyed the pool for a few hours each day. Always able to find lounges. Overall a good trip. We would consider going back.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: cdlemons
Reviews.Content: Timeshare salesmen ambush you when you arrive and trick you into thinking their desk is check-in. Then they bug you every time you come or go from your room. Too crowded with rude pushy people. Very stressful. The rooms do not have coffe or fridges and you have to pay 15 dollars for internet access. I would reccomend Hooters over the Excalibur any day! Made me not want to come back to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money!!!”
Reviews.Author: cmm80124
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Excalibur for four nights from April 24 - 28, 2009. We checked in around 12:00 pm, and found the process efficient and the desk clerk friendly. We have stayed at the Excalibur twice previously, and found that both our room and the service we received met our expectations and were consistent with our previous experiences. The Excalibur is a very nice hotel for those travelers who are not interested in spending large sums of money on hotel rooms. The rooms are large, clean, and come with all the basic amenities (toiletries, a hair dryer, ironing board, etc.) but are not fancy or lavish. My main complaint with the Excalibur is the excessive presence of timeshare sellers located throughout the hotel. You are approached every time you enter or leave the tower where your room is located, when you go to the fast food restaurants or buffet on the second level, or when you approach the lobby area. My husband and I just smile and say "No, thanks" as we walk by, as we know they are just doing their job. However, it quickly becomes tiring. Other things to note: The renovated pool area was very nice, and there were adequate lounge chairs considering the occupancy level of the hotel. The poolside restaurant offered very generous portions at very fair prices - my husband got a footlong hotdog for $5. The buffet offers standard fare, and there is a $25 special being offered right now for an all-day pass to the buffet. The Italian restaurant and Steakhouse are also offering prix fixe menus. There is adequate parking in a garage behind the hotel, which is located closest to Tower 2 (the tower by the pool). Tower 1 is located closest to the Strip, if this makes a difference to you. Overall, we had a great time at the Excalibur, and would have no problem recommending it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “nice trip”
Reviews.Author: ferdyk
Reviews.Content: Stay at this hotel for a long weekend, room was kind of dated, Staff was very helpful One bad thing was no in room safe, so i had to take all my cash with me, Still a great price for the room so i would stay again, who sits in the room anyway when your in vegas.

Reviews.Title: “excalibur hotel & Casino”
Reviews.Author: travelhappys
Reviews.Content: This place seemed to be struggling. We spent 4 nights here, had trouble with the plumbing in the toilet, the shower and the sink. The fan sounded like it needed to be shot and put out of its misery. Our first call to housekeeping did not give the expected outcome. We called again when we returned and that 2nd call fixed everything. The place otherwise was comfortable but in need of an update. The Sherwood Cafe for breakfast is a must miss. 1st day I tried the scrambled eggs. Well, when I could only eat a couple of bites I was asked how I enjoyed my breakfast. I was truthful in mentioning that the eggs were terrible. She said next time ask for "country eggs" those were broken on the spot. The ones that I had on my plate were from a carton. The second day I tried the tropical fruit bowl. Half the grapes were rotten! Very unappetizing. I also found that out of all the casino's we visited the excalibur had the most trouble dealing with the smoke from their smoking patrons. We will be giving this one a miss next time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the casino in excalibur”
Reviews.Author: busybee000
Reviews.Content: The Excalibur is definetley worth the money and I had a great time there. I had a great time at the pool going down the slide every chance I got. You don't even have to leave to hotel to get food. They have a food court where you can get food no matter what budget your on. Overall it was great, I would love to go back.Price is good for what you get. pay Little -get Little!!

Reviews.Title: “Great time!!!”
Reviews.Author: snu70
Reviews.Content: This trip to VEGAS was a girls trip and 4 nights only cost us $395 Canadian with taxes ect. There are two towers in this hotel. We stayed in tower 2 and it was fine. The rooms were spacious, flat screen tv, huge bathroom and air conditioning. We had two queen beds in the room. The room was really clean. However, the maids would not take any plates ect from room service..and there was no fridge, u could rent one for $20 per day! We just used our ice buckets to stick some beer in. There was also no bath tub! Our other friend had a room in Tower 1 and it was ugly, old and small.. she demanded to be switched to Tower 2 and they did but wanted to charge her. After she put up a bit of an argument they ended up not charging her. The difference between rooms was incredible! Don't stay in Tower 1...!!! The hotel is ideal for location!!! It is next to the New York New York and there is a walk way to MGM which is across the street. It is also near the luxor and the mirage. And you can walk the strip to Ceasar's (a MUST SEE) as well as all the other Bellagio! The pool was really nice! There were actually 4 big pools! There were some shops in the Casino a couple pubs, buffets, ect.. We went to Dicks and enjoyed some good entertainment! It was pretty pricey for drinks, water or anything actually. But there was a Walgreens not far down the strip where you could stock up on water, advil, mix ect.. and you can fill up a big mug of booze and cruise around cheaper! Overall, we had a great time. It was worth the money and we met lots of fun people!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place dont listen to the negative reviews!”
Reviews.Author: billpickle
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the excalibur from april 19 -23 09. Right from the start it was a great expeience! Was uprgarded for free to tower 2 with a nice view of new york new york and the roller coaster! Everything was clean , needed to call front desk cause the plug in sink was brken, but was fixed within 20min! I wont reccomened the buffet not all that great but that is my only complaint. I would totally stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “We Enjoyed Our Stay A Second Time”
Reviews.Author: MOJO329
Reviews.Content: We are returning guests to Excalibur. We stayed in Tower II Widescreen View non smoking 2 queen bed rooms. We were fully aware when we made our reservation that the hotel charged an additional non refundable $5.00 daily resort fee which included access to the fitness room, free local & 800 phone calls, 2 free drinks per room during stay & 2 free fantasy Faire midway coupons during stay. Our room was clean through out and was made up promptly by the housekeeping staff. The pool area was busy throughout our stay as it was spring break. We appreciated that security routinely patrolled the parking lots of the Excalibur, which eased our minds. The food court was a plus with our family - when one didn't feel like having a sit down meal in one of the restaurants. We also enjoy staying at the Excalibur because of its location and that one can walk to the nearby hotels, attractions and shops located on the strip. However, walking at night can be a bit of a task as crowds can become large due to the present construction on the strip and the dozens of peddlars handing out "girlie" cards to the men walking on the street - it can become rather annoying to the many families that are walking on the strip and being confronted by these people. Another annoyance are the tahitti time share resort personnel that are present within the hotel as they approaching the incoming hotel guests with their offers of free show tickets if one gives of their time to attend their many resort presentations. Should we visit Las Vegas in the future, we will definitely consider returning to the Excalibur.

Reviews.Title: “Don't eat the food!! It will ruin your trip.”
Reviews.Author: JShoey
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights at Excalibur in a Widescreen room. The room was very clean and modern, no complaints at all. On the second night I had dinner at the Round Table buffet. The food looked great from a distance but when close up to it and eating it I would say Mc Donalds would be better. I never ate most of the food on my first and only plate. The desert tasted like it was made a week ago. During our dinner we spotted a cockroach on the wall and informed a waitress who then stomped on it. The next day I had food poisoning. For my last meal in the casino I tried the Camelot Steakhouse which was another bad experience. I ordered the pot pie and after getting half way through it noticed the pastry at the bottom was still doughy and uncooked, and the chicken was an uncooked pink. This was reported to our waiter who removed my meal off the bill and the food wasn't replaced. If you do choose to eat at this casino try the $2.50 dog and draft deal, you wont go wrong. I wouldnt eat anything else there except for Mc Donalds. Overall the casino slots had good payouts and the atmosphere was great but the food was dangerous.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic value for money at the excalibur”
Reviews.Author: lmondeo56
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed at the excalibur from the 6th to 16th april we had a wonderful time, this hotel is in a great spot on strip, we were in tower 2 and the room was spotless, cleaned every day, food was great value from buffet bar, staff were very friendly and helpful, if you are going to visit gran canyon book with sundance they are a class act just a fantastic place to visit las vegas cant wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “Expect Room Only - dont expect anything else”
Reviews.Author: Bignbeefy
Reviews.Content: After waiting 20 minutes to check in, I did expect a bit more than we got. The room was clean though, but no bath - not good when you have an 11 month old with you. Beds were good Queen size and quite comfortable. There was no coffee facilities in the room, and we were warned about the fridge so we dared not open it. We ended up with ice in the sink to keep baby milk cool!!! The TV had very few channels, but we werent really in the room that much to watch much. The rooms were cleaned daily so we had no problems with that. Excalibur is positioned quite nicely with quick walks to New York New York, MGM Grand, Luxor and Mandalay Bay and of course onto the strip itself. It is far from the "seedier" end of the strip, so we all felt quite safe. Parking was also not as difficult as I thought. We got a good deal over the Easter weekend so all in all it wasn't a bad experience, although I did expect a bit more in terms of facilities. $ 3 for filter coffee was a bit much to take though! Also, the 2-for-1 all you can eat buffet during the afternoon is good value. Great selections and you can really load up so you can have light breakfast and dinner. The only downside we had - and this wasnt the hotel's fault - was a massive domestic disturbance in the room next to us at 4.00am whereby all hell broke loose and I had to call hotel security to settle it down. Considering they were all yelling at each other, the sound was actually quite muffled, and our kids did not know it had happened through the night so that was ok. The Excalibur has loads going on, with the Party Pit and Dirty Dicks so its a fun place. I would stay again, but I would probably like to try somewhere different, just for the experience.

Reviews.Title: “This was the best value for money!!”
Reviews.Author: staceyhurt7
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great value for money, I went with a girlfriend, we had a room with 2 queen beds, extremely comfortable. Highly recommended. It is at towards the "end " of the strip, but everything is within walking distance so not a problem at all. Go and see "Thunder from Downunder", we loved it, as a couple of Aussie girls we thought it a great laugh the way the American girls loved our Aussie boys.

Reviews.Title: “ICK!”
Reviews.Author: kahtraveler58
Reviews.Content: We stayed in tower II which I must say was better than tower I. We arrived to find an empty champage bottle outside of our jacuzzi deluxe flat screen tv room, that bottle was still there when we left four days later. No shampoo !? Half of the lights in the room didn' t work, our room had the best view though! T he hotel/casino itself is FILTHY, along with the entertainment and it's VERY loud!! security is a joke. Save your money and go elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible rooms”
Reviews.Author: Englishbulldoglover
Reviews.Content: We first got there and we had to walk all through the casino with our luggage to get to the registration desk. Which was unprofessional to me. Then we get up to the room and it looks and smelt like we were staying at a Super 8 Hotel. An old TV, no power button on the TV, the air conditioner did not work the best. It was hot and uncomfortable in the room. Then our safe was not working so we had to call them and it took them forever to come up and get it to work. We tried to switch to the newer tower, which is tower 2 but they would not accomidate us at all. Then no one even told us about the buffet they have, if we would have known that we would have eaten there our whole trip. It was just a bad experience, even though the price is decent i would for sure pay extra to stay somewhere else, like the MGM, we loved that one when we stayed last year. We will NEVER stay at Excalibar again.

Reviews.Title: “21st Birthday - Nothing special, Nothing terrible either.”
Reviews.Author: adam048777
Reviews.Content: As you go through all of these reviews you are going to see hundreds of cases where people receive bad customer service. I have stayed at the Excalibur multiple times now and have been satisfied with what I pay for. First of all, you need to know what is going on in Vegas during your trip. Huge conventions cause a lot of chaos among customer service counters at many hotels because of the massive amount of group bookings and people wanting the five star treatment anywhere they go. If you at this hotel and are arriving on Thursday-Saturday after 12pm the waits for your room are going to be extensive at every hotel. When you book your room and choose one king or two queens, remember you are booking upon availability. With the economy the way it is, these cheaper hotels are getting more business than the expensive ones. If you are expecting a perfectly cleaned, spotless room at any of the hotels that have been in Vegas for 15+ years you are not going to get them very often. Excalibur has done a bit of remodeling with some WIDESCREEN ROOMS. They are nice and very adequate for anyone going there to have fun and party. They are pretty basic though, you are not going to get your coffee or anything special in the room. THAT IS WHY THEY ARE $40-$80 MIDWEEK AND $80 -$150 WEEKEND. They look a little more classy in the pictures than they actually are. Everything is just a little newer. If you want a decent room for a cheap price this is the way to go. Service at the Excalibur is okay.If you are respectful of the staff they will treat you the same. Housekeeping has always done a decent job of picking up the room while we were away. They will be a lot more thorough if you leave them $5 a day. You will find the occasional hooker/prostitute at the bars if you are staying here with kids. They don't make it very obvious so don't expect to see a girl with her skirt hiked up so you can see half her butt everywhere you go down there. There are a lot of younger couples and college kids that stay at this hotel also because of the cost. Don't expect a quiet nights sleep everynight. You will not get it. The food is at the bottom end of what you kind find on the strip but it is cheap. McDonald's in house very cheap $1 Menu for breakfast/lunch. There are also some other options by the food court. Good food is close thought at Mandalay Bay or MGM. They both are within 15 minutes walking distance. The location is near the South end of the strip. You are only on a street corner between Luxor and NYNY. It is a very long walk to get to the North side near the Wynn and Riviera. The casino is relatively smoky and you definitely can smell it. Don't be surprised when you get there. This casino has been in Vegas since 1990, back then it was primarily a gambling town. It is older and is not going to be remodeled on the casino level anytime soon. People that complain about this casino needing a face lift are right but it's not going to happen so don't complain about when you get back. If you are going to be out and about shopping down the strip. I recommend staying at one of the Harrah's properties: Flamingo, Paris, Bally's or Harrah's. They are all in the same price range with Paris being the most upscale. Gambling at Excalibur has always been lucky for me. The slots have a decent payout percentage and is definitely better than the highscale properties. This casino has paid for itself many times over so they are in the black no matter what. MGM owns and runs so join there Players Club because you can gamble at all of the casinos right around it to earn comps as well. The table games at excalibur range from $5 UPWARD. Beware the farther down the strip you go and the later in the day you play the minimum does go up. Many big casinos range in the $15 - $100 minimum bet limits after 4:00PM. Good luck if you choose Excalibur and it will be adequate if you know what to expect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cclondon_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur for 5 nights in April and had a great time. We chose the hotel due to its location and price, being one of the least expensive venues on the Strip. If you're on a budget, don't waste your money on expensive pretentious hotels when you can save your cash for gambling, shopping and drinking! You can stay here and walk 2 minutes from your room to be in NYNY, Luxor or MGM. Remember; Location, Location, Location! Given that most of your time in Vegas is probably spent in the casino/bars/pool/shops (delete as appropriate), the room was more than adequate; very clean, big comfy bed, double shower and TV. And this was just a standard room! The casino itself was a little smokey as others have mentioned but only noticeable if you spend hours on the tables. The pool was lovely and a bonus to have an adult pool without the screaming kids and with a bit of music playing to create a lively atmosphere. There is a Pleasure Pit in the casino with a some good looking dancers strutting their stuff, although nowhere near the calibre of the PussyCat Doll Lounge at Caesars or the Croupiers at Planet Hollywood! Sorry Girls! Avoid the buffet too. There are far too many other choices nearby to waste time with queues and mediocre food. Plenty of snack options upstairs and also a Krispy Kreme which has free WiFi. There's also a 'Dog and Draft' offer at the bar for a hotdog and small beer for $2.50. Bargain! My advice is stay at Excalibur, chill by the pool all day, take a few steps over to Coyote Ugly (NYNY) and the West Wing Bar at MGM for Happy hour (5-8?) before heading out on the town where the real fun begins. If you're sober enough when you get back then a few hands of BlackJack or a Bud at Dicks is a perfect finish to a Vegas day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for the price!”
Reviews.Author: dawn011
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Excalibur 4/7/09-4/11/09. Loved the location. At first it was a little confusing on how to get down to the strip. But after just about a 1/2 an hour we got our bearings and it was VERY easy to get to NYNY, MGM, and down to the strip. We should have asked someone but had a lot of fun exploring. Finding the tram to get to Luxor and Mandalay Bay was every easy. However we mostly took the moving sidewalks that are all indoors. It is not a bad walk to Planet Hollywood also. We had the standard room.The room was just fine. Very clean! The carpet was ok. We had a smoking room so it had a few very small burns but it was clean. We stayed on the 2nd floor and had a view of the Luxor. It was awesome that the window opened. Only about 3 inches but the weather was cool this time of year and it helped get the smoke out of the room. The beds were very comfortable. We did have a safe in the room. While it is not a 5 star hotel it was WELL worth the price. I did see a few children. However it was not out of control. The casino was great. Lot's of penny slots and penny poker. The craps table's were HOT. We got the all day buffet only once and that was enough. Breakfast was very good but lunch and dinner was well... awful. We ordered room service one eveing and the food was good and the service was fast. The only thing we did not like is that they did not tell us that we had to set it up so we could charge to the room when we checked in, So we had to pay cash for the food. Which was fine but we would have much rather have charged it to the room. The best advice I can give you is DO NOT do one of the timeshare deal's. They offered us a show and $100 in casino credit if we did it. We were told that it would only take 1 1/2 hours... Took 2 1/2 hours the show was worthless (V at planet hollywood)and only gave us $50. What a waste of time.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but you can find better...”
Reviews.Author: joel1316
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur as the room rates seem to be very good and they provided child friendly activities for our young son. We arrived at the Excalibur mid-afternoon and found a long line to check in. It wasn't bad though as they had most of their check in desk open and they were relatively fast in checking everyone in. Our room was in Tower 1 and faced Tower 2, with no real views. It was fine as we didn't spend much time in our room looking out the window. Our room was a bit on the small side and is definately showing some serious wear and tear. The chairs were scratched up and needed some new upholstery. The beds were horrible! You could feel every spring on your back as you rolled around. The pillows weren't any better! Your head just sank through the pillows. You needed at least 2-3 for you to feel them, LOL. We also found that the A/C unit in our room was not working! But instead of the front desk moving us (they said to just wait out the repair - I was too tired to argue), they had maintenance come in and actually replace the huge unit. We couldn't even get comfortable as we had people in and out of our rooms during the repair. After the repair, the area was filthy and I had to get one of the cleaning ladies to come in and vacuum and she wasn't the most friendly person to deal with. I will say though, that the hotel is in an awesome location and was nearby all the attractions that we were interested in seeing. But I probably won't stay at the Excalibur again though. Most people come to Vegas to party and have fun, then you use your room to rest and sleep. But with the bed and pillows like we had, forget it! Pay a few bucks more and either upgrade your room (I assume that more expensive rooms have better beds) or go to another hotel.... Oh... The Excalibur does have a Midway for kids to play games and win prizes. A lot of the video games were in major disrepair though, but the Midway games were fun. Now, would I recommend the Excalibur? I would say no, but it does have its perks and I guess you'd have to weight them out yourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Dismal and depressing”
Reviews.Author: PNWTravelr
Reviews.Content: A small group selected this hotel for our stay while bowling nationals--I assume for its lower price compared to the nicer resorts. I hate casinos. They are noisy and big. This one smelled of smoke (They still allow smoking inside? Join the 21st century, folks!) was dim, and dingy. The room was large enough, but the temperature control fan and the bathroom fan were noisy. (Will wake your room partner if you need to turn on the light in the bathroom during the night!) Small sofa (hideabed?) smelled like pee. No bathtub, shower only. No robes. Only Pepsi products, no Coca Cola. Sheets came untucked easily. Charged extra for Internet, not working the second day...only good thing to say: Elevators were quick.

Reviews.Title: “excalibar”
Reviews.Author: tessworcester
Reviews.Content: bellagio it ain't but great value for money. four of us ages 60-27 free room upgrade casino always packed free drinks buffett good value for money. service good rooms clean and quiet could'nt fault anything

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel let down slightly by poor housekeeping!”
Reviews.Author: philipo49
Reviews.Content: We stopped here for 7 nights from the 1st April 2009 and a had a great time at the hotel. We were given room 26212 (26th floor in Tower 2) and found the room to be excellent with great views from the window (see pics I uploaded). The bathroom was huge (although no bath, only a shower cubicle) and the room was well equiped & in good order. My only criticism of Excalibur is the slightly shabby housekeeping throughout the hotel. We found our room cleaned but the bathroom wasnt wiped down very well each day with soap marks left on the worktops & the soap not changed daily. Also we noticed that room service trolleys were being left out in the hallways outside peoples rooms for hours 7 hours at a time and the elevators were not hoovered very often leaving the carpets covered in bits. One other small thing that may be worth mentioning is the stealth fee of $1 per night for telephone usage, regardless of whether you plan to use the phone or not?! I was a bit annoyed at having to pay this, whats wrong with only charging people for the calls they make?? These are only small criticisms but did stop me from giving the hotel a 5 out of 5 rating. But they would not stop us from staying here again, as the hotel is very nice and great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Now I know...”
Reviews.Author: minervenus
Reviews.Content: I just got back from the Excalibur with the hubby and two kids. Let me sum it up quickly – you get what you pay for. We got the cheapest room we could (it’s what you do when the economy is bad and you would rather spend your money on fun activities for you and the fam), and while the room was clean, the view totally sucked. Be sure and check out the pic of our view (yes that puffy thing is a dead bird which was there when we checked in and there when we left and the other stuff – cigarette butts and prostitute flyers). Enough said as far as the view. On to the rest, even though the check in line was quite long, it moved rather fast for its length. I think we were checked into our room within 20 – 25 minutes. There was no hard sell on an upgrade room, and I was fine with that. We were approached by timeshare people way too often though. Let’s just say I needed both hands to count the number of times I was approached. My youngest, 11, really enjoyed the 4D rides downstairs in the Arcade area. She also enjoyed the games. As a parent, I didn’t really enjoy paying a $1.00 for each game, but hey she needed some fun too. My oldest, 16, didn’t care for the 4D ride; she said it was too childish for her. Still, when we walked across the street to the roller coaster ride at New York New York, she screamed her head off and said it was awesome (missing from the purse - $14.00, a teenager saying something is cool and thanking a parent for something – priceless). As a family, we also took in the free water show at the Bellagio (this I loved). That afternoon, the choreographed water dancing was set to Sir Elton John’s “Your Song”, and it was simply breathtaking. I could have watched it over and over again. And finally, you can’t go to Vegas without gambling. At Excalibur - My husband won at the blackjack tables, and I lost at the slots. He did win enough to cover my losses though so I did bring him back home with me. The part I didn’t like about the Excalibur Casino was the stank attitude of the cocktail hags. They had no personalities and only offered you drinks if you were at a table game (I had to get my husband to get drinks for me most of the time). And even when they brought him drinks, they would stand at his side like they deserved a tip. Well when you have the look and the attitude of an old drunk who hasn’t been able to find a bottle in a week, then you’re certainly not going to get anything from me, and I certainly wasn’t going to let my hubby tip them. In between those sourpusses and the cigarette smoke which was probably even too much for a fireman’s mask, the casino at the Excalibur was too much for me. For the rest of the trip, I happily lost my few bills at friendlier casinos where the cocktail servers actually seemed to like their jobs and where I could freely breathe without carrying my inhaler around. I can’t tell you where to stay on your next trip to Vegas, but I can tell you that the Excalibur is not the place for me. I’m going to try out the Bellagio next time. At least, I can watch the water show over and over again.

Reviews.Title: “not a good place for kids”
Reviews.Author: road trip'n
Reviews.Content: I was not at all impressed with the excalibur hotel and casino. The rooms were very small, although since they have been updated they are much nicer. My main concern was the smoky casino. You have to go through the casino to get anywhere and I could smell the smoke in my hair and clothes for the rest of the day. Also, the ONLY elevator that went to the restaurant level and the arcade was right next to the skanky tabletop dancers. I know this is part of vegas but they were right there and unavoidable. There are so many nicer, newer, better ventilated hotels in Las Vegas, that are not a lot more expensive and more centrally located. I will never stay here again. On the plus side, they did have a nice pool and the dinner show was fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Miss121
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to Vegas with our kids. When I asked where they wanted to stay they said the Excalibur. I figured it was more of a kids hotel so I was fine with it. Before we every got to the hotel I called to find out about Limo service, they gave me the information on Bell Trans. What a wonderful experience, they were at the airport waiting for us, took our luggage and drove us around the strip. All for $50. The driver then took us to Valet and from there the service was fantastic! From the bell hop, taking our baggage, before check in, checking in took 20 minutes, and picking up our rental car at the hotel. We had a room with a view of the pool. Our last day we rented a cabana by the pool, it was great. Nicole our cabana host was wonderful always there for us. This was the best trip I had to Vegas with our kids. My husband and I will be going to Vegas for our 20th anniversary, We will be staying at this hotel again. The value is great.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel and casino.”
Reviews.Author: Conwayluvs2travel
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Excalibur four times now and will continue to stay there in the future. The front desk is always friendly and helpful. Our last two trips we have had newly remodeled rooms in tower 2 that were always clean and comfortable. Even when my husband and I stay at different hotels we always manage to spend the majority of our gambling time in the Excalibur Casino. Parking is always good. I only have one minor complaint and that is everytime we stay there is a dirty drink glass outside our bedroom door, not sure why housekeeping does not pick them up... just a minor complaint.

Reviews.Title: “NOT FAMILY Friendly-avoid time share vultures wanting to give you a gift & show you how to get to your elevator”
Reviews.Author: crazyflamingo
Reviews.Content: Evening hours through night-expect to see 1-2 sexy girls dancing on stage with booty shorts & bikini top (or as my young son calls it thong & bra). Dick's Last Resort was VERY innapropriate for kids since since waiters don't know how to sensor their comedy spiel. The game room was fine. The rooms were fine-but not as big as MGM. I've stayed at MGM & Monte Carlo & this was not nearly as nice. We did pay $40 for a late check out & that was convenient. The time share vultures are almost as annoying as the card snappers on the strip! They pretend to give you directions to the elevator & then ask if you've received your free gift yet. I saw them reprimand a new old man time share seller for approaching someone the wrong way. I felt sorry for him.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the money”
Reviews.Author: witch1
Reviews.Content: We had a updated room in Tower II. It was clean with maid service daily. The front desk was helpful from check-in through check-out. Very helpful with questions and finding our way around Vegas. Very good location. It has it's own mini monorail (free)connecting to the Luxor and Mandalay Bay. It is also across the street from the MGM where you can catch the Monorail ($5 each way) which brings you all the way down the strip. If you don't want to take the Monorail then just wait for the double decker bus($3). The only negative I can comment on is that Excalibur's casino seemed to be smokier than the others. We still did most of our gambling there. Pools are nice, we sat at the adult only one most of the time. Nice and quiet. Caught a show at NewYork NewYork called Zumanity. It is definetly a show that one will not forget. The buffet at Mandalay Bay is to die for. $26 pp with all you can eat Prime Rib and seafood. EXCELLENT!!Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Not the Worst Choice”
Reviews.Author: permanantHoliday
Reviews.Content: Rundown of the stay: Rooms-standard size 2 Q bed was recently refurbished with the exception of the shower. The shower was in dire need of renovation, the grout was very dirty with mold and looked like it suffered too many quick and unskilled tile repair jobs. Beds were comfy, didn't notice too much noise from neighbors. The door kept getting jammed, needed assistance to open several times from the hotel crew and there was no internal security latch. Toiletries were nice, towels clean, a housekeeping crew always seemed to be on our floor and it was easy to receive extras just for the asking by opening the door from the friendly maids. Elevators were fast and wait wasn't very long even during rush hours. I didn't notice if they had room service or not? WiFi was offered at an overpriced premium service. I don't know if the Sbx nearby have their hotspots as they do in standalone shops. Overall Hotel-our first encounter with the front desk was miserable. Very cold and unfriendly and highly unwilling to assist us with when we arrived in the middle of the night with reservations they could not accomodate since they were full. We were turned away to find on our own accord another place to stay. The other hotels in the area were also full but even without having reservations they went the extra mile to be apologetic and in one case, called around to competitors to find a hotel room that was available. We'll remember that hotel brand on our next trip for certain! Arriving by valet we had quick bell service with great personality. Unfortunately we encountered a lost item and when dealing with the hotel staff, again we were met with unacceptable levels of concern. Not only that, when addressing the matter again (merely trying to locate the lost item) we were treated very rudely and accused of lying. It was really a nightmare and I can't imagine if there was even a worse situation how they would have treated their customers. Also beware, valet becomes full very fast at this hotel on the weekends. The navigation around the hotel/casino compared to other resorts of similar size wasn't complicated, they are easily connected with indoor walkways to Luxor and then on to Mandalay Bay, the NYNY and MGM are also very easy to reach by the short outdoor overpass. Parking overall can be a challenge here. The pools were nice, one adult pool (with not the best security to keep the rugrats from wandering in) and three other pools. One pool had waterslides (tame ones) but that was closed likely because it's early pool season in Vegas. The poolside is great for full suncatching since there are no blocking buildings to the area. No problem getting a chair at the adult pool area on the weekend, but again, this is different in high summer. Also know the Excal is a "family friendly" hotel (using the term loosely) so this place attracts lots of kids. Beware of the resort fee they tack on to the nightly rate as well. Dining-decent choices of food including MCD's, Sbx and KK's upstairs in the food court, if you're a fan of raunchy humor, you'll like the Dick's Last Resort bar (although too bad the hotel admin seems to take the rude attitude for real as well). Didn't try the buffet, it runs a really awesome deal right now for $25 it's an all day all U can eat and couponless 2 4 1 deals. The other mid tier hotel eateries have flat rate specials too. Vegas dining is getting pricey so if you're budget minded this seems to be a good spot to keep your stomach and your wallet near. Entertainment-right now Louie Anderson is playing and the classic Tournament of Kings dinner show. The Caveman show and Thunder Down Under strippers are also on rotation in the showrooms. No free shows but I really really REALLY liked the abundance of REAL LIVE MUSIC LOUNGES! They also were featuring beer pong and karaoke on specific nights. Lots of gambling choices, avoid the 5:6 bj. MGM is the parent company and their player's card isn't very generous, but still sign up for one anyways. The Party Pit is Party Pituful, where are the scantily clad dealers to make me not care about losing the high table minimums? They had prancing dancing girls on a catwalk but nothing spectacular for Vegas and the pit area was not the optimal spot, appears squeezed in as a last minute thought as to compete against the PCD pit and comes up very short on the glam party factor. Overall, as a Vegas Veteran in the bullseye of the Vegas marketing demographic, I can't recommend this hotel when I know there are far better choices in this category to choose. Price the following hotels as a comparison: Stratosphere, Hooters, Harrahs to name a few. If you can find Excal for around $45 a night midweek and maybe not too much more on the weekends, see if there is something comparable before booking.

Reviews.Title: “some good, some bad!”
Reviews.Author: HeswallLou's
Reviews.Content: check in was fine, room had no view but was clean. we were booked in for 12 days and we had 5 coat hangers between us which semed mad but when asked for more they arrived pretty quick. our first trip to USA and didnt think to take travel kettle, wish we had as NO facilities in room, so would mean going down to casino level every time we felt like a cup of coffee. £ not doing so well against dollar meant everything seemed very expensive too. thought we might save by having a couple of beers in hotel room so asked about having a fridge. 22 dollars PER NIGHT, didnt bother after all. time share people drive you crazy as you have no choice but to go past them as they seem to be in every entrance in hotel.we probably spent too long in las vegas, i think its more a couple of nights kind of place and we are quite happy to pay for what we get when we know about it but check out just proved to me tthat its all about getting as much out of you as possible and then just trying for a little bit more.when we checked our bill they had put on 2 dollars per night for the use of local calls, when we said we hadnt used the phone they said that didnt matter, they charge everyone 2 dollars per night whether you use it or not! on a lighter note , luois anderson was a nice show and the buffet was qiute good and had a fair variety. excalibur isnt a bad hotel but a lot of little things just let it down.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay! Highly recommend!!”
Reviews.Author: adawson78
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews posted on here, I was a little concerned about our stay, we even considered booking at another hotel. Let me tell you, once we arrived, and got to our room, all of our concerns went out the window. We booked through their website and got the standard room, and when we walked into the room, it was a large room, with a table and chairs and a love seat and coffee table by the window. The bed was one of the most comfortable "hotel" beds we have ever slept in. Our room was cleaned every morning, and the hotel in general had a fun and happy atmosphere. We were there 4 nights and went to different restaurants every night we were there, and do not have any complaints about any of them. We also went to the dinner show at the Excalibur, Tournament of Kings, and it was fabulous. My husband isn't really into shows so i wasn't sure how he would like it, but he actually loved it, and since we have come back, has told everyone we talk to about the show and has told them all he highly recommends the show and the hotel. We will definately be going back to the Excalibur.

Reviews.Title: “Where OH Where are we?”
Reviews.Author: Lobster65
Reviews.Content: Great location right on the strip. Paid extra to have a room with a view. Only $10 per night. Looked straight down the strip over Newyork, Newyork and MGM Grand. What a sight, blew us away. Could not fault the room. Every time we left the room and went down to ground floor we got lost in the gaming room. If I didn't know better I would say it was designed that way so we would spend more money on the slots. LOL Thankyou Excalibur, my wife hasn't looked another slot since.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, Clean, Friendly”
Reviews.Author: saltygem
Reviews.Content: Staff was very nice, stayed in one of the older rooms which from reading about knew not to expect much. It was clean and hey, our purpose was to see all the sights, not hang out in our room. Very pleased with the four pool areas, had one that was adults only that also had a whirlpool/hot tub, really appreciated that. Signed up for a Players Club card, worth the wait in line to get...all in all, okay place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “hotel is a little tired”
Reviews.Author: JPBee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Excalibur during March.....the hotel is looking a little tired now and could do with a bit of a refurb....however we did have a great time and the staff we did encounter we really helpful....We did miss out on the unlimited buffet for $25 which enables you to return as many times as you like throughout the day...however the queues between 2pm and 6pm were huge. There is great access to the mono rail which enables you to exlore the whole of the strip but you need to walk through MGM to get to the station and for us our first attempt did take some navigation!...Great American diner in New York New York just over the bridge.

Reviews.Title: “A disapointment”
Reviews.Author: shutterkat
Reviews.Content: The hotel was part of a package deal. It wasn't expensive so our expectations weren't very high to begin with, but we were still disappointed. We were actually surprised that the Excalibur was still open as when we were in Vegas 3 years ago, we were told that the Excalibur was going to be blown up and rebuilt more efficiently. When we checked in, we were offered a free upgrade because we were staying a week. Nice I thought! Then we saw the room. :O( I wonder what our original room was supposed to be like. The room was quite small. I think our room at Circus Circus 3 years ago was larger. The nicest thing about the room was the 42 inch TV screen...not that we were there to watch TV. I think it got 24 channels, but most of the stations were advertising or junk. Internet was $14.00US per day and there were no hotspots on the hotel. We didn't get the internet. There were five pools there however, only 2 of the smaller pools were open...I guess to save money by paying a smaller number of lifeguards. The pool was only open from 10 AM to 5PM each day which was quite useless as families are usually out exploring and being tourist during those hours. There was constant blaring of loud music around the pools which was annoying to hear in our room when we did happen to be there during those hours. The bed spreads had rips in the stitching. The fan/air conditioning didn't work. The shower needed to be updated as the grout was old and it looked dirty. There were a couple of extra pillows which was nice. There were not enough hangers. I hate walking through a hotel "lobby" and being harrassed by time share hawkers every time we went out or came home as a family. When I went out by myself or hubby went out alone, we were never hassled. The arcade was not very well run. It was supposed to open at 11:00 but both times we visited there the stairs were roped off until at least 11:10. The first time that happened, we just walked past the ropes at 11:10 as there were other people walking around down there. The next time, we took the escalator. The arcade was poorly run. Machines often broke down and we needed help getting our money back. The prizes at the prize booth were disappointing. Much of it is junk. Circus Circus' arcade is MUCH better. There's an arcade at NY NY and it looked better run as well. The Round Table Buffet was pretty good...but after several days, who can handle buffets...LOL. The best deal is the eat all day for $25.00 PP. But...that means you have to be there all day or be willing to go back and forth. We took that deal on a day that we weren't going too far from the hotel. Hubby and daughter went to the buffet just before it closed for dessert and a class of milk before bed too. Also, if you have the eat all day deal, you avoid most of the lineups...which is a bonus!!! We were trying to line up a rental car and the agent needed to get back to us. They had our phone number, room number and hubby's FIRST name but not the last name and the hotel wouldn't put the call through to us. That sucked as it delayed us getting a rental car by a day. We did like the location of the hotel. The strip is HUGE...way longer that you probably would expect. The hotel you can see from your room that is only a couple of blocks away is likely 2-3 km away. So be prepared for lots of walking! BTW...if you want a good deal on a rental car, go to Fletcher-Jones Toyota and talk to Tony. We rented a RAV 4 for $35.00/day. A smaller car was $27 or $28 but they were rented out by the time we were able to get back to the rental agent. Hubby took the bus to get the car. Take your own rental car insurance if you can cuz you'll save a lot of money. The prices for a rental car at all the other agencies were $79 to $120 day as we didn't book before arrived. (We weren't sure which days we'd need the car until we got there). IHOP near the LV Outlet Mall has free Wi-Fi...but make sure your virus protection is up to date as our Virus protection quarantined a virus as soon as we connected. There are not many free WiFi spots around Vegas...at least around the strip. The Airport has free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “If you are staying with kids, give this one a miss”
Reviews.Author: housewife64
Reviews.Content: We stayed with kids in early September 2008 in this supposedly 'child-friendly' hotel. After a hot day out we took the kids to the pool at 6pm for some relaxation before dinner only to be greeted with 'Pool Closed'. At 6pm !!!! Even sunset was not until 7pm!!!! And the temperature was in the 90s. The reason ? "Lack of staff". We didn't see any lack of staff in the casino. The next day half of the pools were closed ("lack of staff" again). There's not a lot of shade, so you wouldn't want to be out there too long. One gets the impression that this hotel does not want to encourage its guests to do anything other than spend time in the casino and is not much interested in anything else. Other reasons not to stay there include having to take kids past scantily clad girls gyrating on tables in order to get to carparks/restaurants and the kids fun area in the basement is pretty tired.

Reviews.Title: “Old, stindy and it smells like Grandma's Room”
Reviews.Author: JX1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Excalibur for 6 days 5 nights and booked this hotel through a US Airways package and I got a great deal. I got the Widescreen Room as they called it since it has a 42” plasma in the room. As far the hotel the Excalibur is a pretty old hotel; almost 20 years old. Check in was ok, I was able to do an early go at my room with no problems. The staff was nice and courteous; no issues there. The room itself was nothing to write about as it is just a bid better than the standard room. My advice to you is not to upgrade if the price is more than $50 bucks. The bathroom was dirty and moldy with handles falling or broken on the shower screen door. The linens were dirty and ripped. I was told by a supervisor that this is an outgoing problem they had. According to her they were aware of the issue and they were working on getting more durable linens in the future. As far as having a HDTV plasma in the room with only 2 HD channels is ridiculous. Again, not worth the price they charge. The Excalibur is old stingy cigarette smelling hotel for families and middle to senior folks. It offers more affordable prices south of the strip. MGM runs this hotel as well as it sister’s hotels (Mandalay & Luxor). Compared to the Mandalay which I have stayed in; the Excalibur is a dump. If money is tight but you also want a little more quality then stay in the middle (Luxor). The buffet here is probably one of the cheapest in the strip since they have a special for $25, were you can eat all day. This is probably more suitable for a family rather than a couple since you would have to make the trip back to the hotel if you want to get your money’s worth. One thing though, the cigarette smell is horrible at their buffet. If you’re ok with that then I guess this is for you then. Overall I would recommend this hotel if you can get a great deal and you don’t want to stay in Circus Circus, the Fitzgerald, Four Queens or Bills.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: antjame
Reviews.Content: (March 22-27th 2009) I stayed here after searching many hotels and reviews.....we booked through Vegas.com as package deal, flight and hotel and free tickets to Ka (which we loved-first time ever seeing anything like that-very entertaining) anyways we paid 840 per couple. The rooms are outdated with ugly orange carpet, drapes and bedding, but who cares you do not go to stay in the room. The room was spacious with 2 queen beds a large bathroom with plenty of counter space a large shower (no tub-but didn't care no time to lounge in tub just a quick nap, shower and out to the strip). This hotel meets the basic needs, a bed, tv, shower ect....if your picky and looking for glam and glitz pay the money to stay else where. If your looking for deal and can make due with basics stay here. Few things about the hotel they will charge you a 5 $ a day resort fee for each day you are there this is an additional charge that is not included in any package or when you book your room. Also they do not have a fridge in the room .....we just put our pop on ice in the sink or the ice bucket. They do have a safe in the rooms or atleast the two we booked had them. Some other hints: atm fees are 4.99 everywhere. .....where comfortable shoes you will be doing alot of walking,.....take a zip up sweater or ect it may seem nice 60 degrees but the wind is something else and the casinos are cooler....take mositurizer your skin/hair will be dry for days once you come back.....drink lots of water to keep from getting dehydrated.......the double decker buses there take for every to pick you up......we got impatient and took taxis which will rip you off....they are the most convienent way to travel but they take you out of your way and cost more than you think so just be prepared to pay......eat at the food courts which every hotel has (pizza hut, mc donalds ect....) it is cheaper than always doing buffets, waitresses were so very slow to get you drinks at every casino....did not expect this because everyone talks about the free drinks....not sure if due to economy they let waitresses go but you will spend more money in a machine trying to wait for a waitress to get a drink than if you just bought the drink out right.....the machines did not pay out very well and we played in almost every one on the strip.....beware of the time share people they are in every casino when you walk in they ask if you are planning to see a show and how long you are staying what you do is say you are leaving that day and they leave you alone.....also watch out for the men/women handing out nude cards of girls you will see them they are on the strip and everyone tries to hand them to you......anyways it is fun and I hope this review helps.....ps the ppols close at 6pm which kinda sucks....but hey you can swim back home.....vegas if for gambling

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur is the BEST”
Reviews.Author: BronsonluvsVEGAS
