Reviews.Content: I went to Vegas for 5 days to get away, booked my hotel online. From the minute I walked in, I was treated with the best service. The Front desk manager, Brad Rodabaugh , I wrote his name down because this guy was a true representative on Las Vegas, Upgraded me to a Strip room with the new big TV's. My stay there was very nice. The Bars, clubs & lounges are very good, the buffet , not that good, but that was the exception. Will stay at the Excalibur again. The Camelot Steakhouse was AWESOME.

Reviews.Title: “Kiddie Kastle”
Reviews.Author: luvmyminninegirl
Reviews.Content: I feel Las Vegas is an adult entertainment venue. That being said --there were children everywhere. This hotel caters to families. There is a playroom downstairs and has gift shops, buffets, and rooms especially for families. I stayed at another hotel on my last trip and did not see children every where I turned. Hotel charges $13.99 per day for internet connection.

Reviews.Title: “The Room Is Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: graciegirlcalifornia
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 28th floor It was so quiet never heard anyone and this was on a Saturday night.The beds were very comfortable and the furniture nice. It had a wide flat sceen TV with a nice roomy shower and bathroom.Check- in line was long but moved quickly. It had no coffee pot or refrigerator. Overall excellent room. The buffett was priced price and the food was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: lookin4lloyd
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the fact that room service charged me $5.00 for an order of hot water even though we ordered $90.00 worth of food and wine. Not tea, not coffee, not hot cocoa -- PLAIN HOT WATER to make formula for our baby. Really??? Is there anything even remotely okay about that?! NO. Then when we called to talk to the hotel manager about the crazy charge, we were given the runaround for at least 10 minutes, AND we were never able to find anyone who "handled" that department. We just got transferred from person to person -- no one could even tell us who the hotel manager was! This was after pushing the button on the phone that said "HOTEL MANAGER." Isn't that what the button is for? To call the hotel manager? Obviously this hotel doesn't really give a crap about you or your family after getting your money! Oh, and if you have kids -- you definitely don't want to stay at a place where you have to walk by "strippers" dancing on a stage EVERYTIME you leave or return to your room! Isn't this the hotel that "caters" to families with children??? If you stay at this hotel after reading my review, you've got to be a moron.

Reviews.Title: “The sheets wern't long enough to fit the bed, but no other complaints.”
Reviews.Author: Blue081
Reviews.Content: Strip view wasn't complete, but good enough. The sheets were not long enough to fit the size of the bed, this didn't change when sheets changed?? Room was good size for a standard. Food at hotel wasn't as good as the others, buffet not great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Price”
Reviews.Author: toddwack_1
Reviews.Content: The location is great and the price is excellent. I paid $270 for 3 weekend nights. I found a coupon code online that saved me about $10/night. Easy access to MGM and NY NY. The casino is definitely not as highend as others - has more of a college feel to it. It was up-beat, with girls dancing in the casino. I received an upgraded room at no charge at checkin. The roomhad some upgrades to it. The TV was nice and so were the granite countertops. The wallpaper was old and the tile. Overall, the room was good. A great hidden gem in the hotel is the Kryspy Kreme doughnut conveyor belt in the 2nd floor food court.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur does the Job !”
Reviews.Author: Pato136
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Vegas as an adult (travelling with my wife) so wanted to be sure that we didn't experience the horrors that others often write about on these pages. Hence my hotel selection was not that easy - my first choice was Bills Gamblin Saloon but it was sold out for the weekend (recession??). I ended up booking the Excalibur for about $98 per night (average price for Fri/Sat night) and got a better deal thru the www.smartervegas.com website than by booking direct with the hotel. Glad to say that everything turned out OK. We got the room we booked and it was in Tower 2 - the recently renovated tower. Rooms were adequate, not great but we were hardly there so it didn't matter if there was no coffee pot, no bath tub or the mirror was too far away from the basin blah blah blah !! Check in was fine - we waited about 5 min. Beware the timeshare sales guys that pick you out as a "newby" literally as you walk in the door and pretend they're helping you to check in. They take you to a small counter where they hand off to someone else who starts the hard sell. We quickly worked out what was going on (after about 5 seconds) and moved on to the real check in counter around to the left. We had breakfast at the Rainforest Cafe in the MGM - just a short walk across the bridge (kids would love it - animals come to life every so often) and spent Saturday in a hire car visiting Hoover Dam and some shopping malls. So we had plenty on and spent little time critiquing the room itself. The drinks voucher gets you very little and is limited to only 1-2 bars but service was good. Did a little gambling - the only negative was that the table service for drinks was way too slow for my liking but i found this at all the casinos, particularly the Mirage. So in general while it is looking a little dated and caters to a more general crowd, it served it's purpose and we went away feeling relieved with our choice. It's a good location on the strip so if you are happy to do lots of walking you won't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Good all rounder”
Reviews.Author: chuckles4
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing to rave about but there is also nothing on the bad side about it. It is central to the strip in Vegas. The rooms are large and contain 2 large double beds. It was clean. The casino was fine, security was good. Coffee perculator was not supplied and it was a good job that we had brought a travel kettle with us for the mornings! Overall it was a comfortable stay but wouldn't stay here for more than 3 nights as I would prefer more home comforts. Considering that it had a full blown lets go for it casino that was very busy downstairs you could not here any noise in the rooms at night.

Reviews.Title: “Not The Best But Not The Worst”
Reviews.Author: TNTraveler68
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel. The first time I had my two children and it was a good choice for them. There were many activities they could enjoy. This trip, it was myself and my 78 year old spunky mother. We rec'd a free room upgrade which was really nice. The room was very clean and the maid service good. Really, we were just in the room long enough to sleep and shower. Although we enjoyed ourselves, I wished we had chosen another hotel because of my mother's age. This hotel is fine for families with kids, the college crowd, and 20 to 30 yr. olds but do not recommend it for mature travelers or seniors. It can get quiet loud and crowded at times! Check in and check out were quick and easy for us. The employees we came in contact with were nice and helpful. We never made it to their buffett due to really long lines most of the time. The Food Court was good though. The casino had many many slot machines to choose from and we had decent luck with them. I loved the addition of lots more penny machines. We enjoyed the casino most in the early morning hours. It was quieter and less crowded. Also, much less smokier in the mornings. Overall, the hotel was clean, the food good , and the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “great for the price”
Reviews.Author: jayson1986
Reviews.Content: stayed 2 nights late check in no problems friendly staff. upgraded room for no charge just asked. Room was big two queens updated granite counter tops in Bathroom flat screen TV but no HD channels. Who watches TV in Las Vegas. Definitely gearing toward adults now GO Go dancers in front of Dicks last resort. Buffet was very good this time ate dinner and Breakfast got the deal for 25.00 for three meals Casino was a bit smokey at times. Sports book is better than average now. Venetian has the best sports book FYI. Overall excellent stay will be back for the great prices Payed 110.00 for Thursday and Friday 55.00 a night including resort fee

Reviews.Title: “Still a decent stay”
Reviews.Author: Travelover101
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur again from Feb 14th to Feb 20th because we enjoyed it on our first trip back in 2007. Still a decent stay, we upgraded to a Widescreen renovated room for US$20 per night extra. Still reccommend getting the upgrade. Asked if there were any comp upgrades when we checked in but due to Valentines Day and something to with Daytona the gentleman behind the desk said they were'nt giving out comps because they were booked out or so busy or soemthing like that. We booked our room through the travel agent, but looking back now I wished we booked online because online prices were A LOT cheaper. Our room this time was in Tower 2 (as it was last time) but not view unfortunately this time. This time our view was of the roof which disappointed me a bit because I was hoping for a nice view of the strip (we could've got one but that was US$30 per night extra as oppossed to the US$20 for the regular upgrade) or of the mountains in the distance that we could look at every morning and night. Bu oh well easy come easy go. Overall a good stay, reccommend to anyone looking for a fairly cheap stay without forking over a fortune for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Money”
Reviews.Author: jmcn80
Reviews.Content: Excalibur is a great hotel to stay on a budget. If you have a big budget and want a 5 star stay somewhere else. But if you're just looking for a place to store your luggage, sleep and shower, you can't hardly beat it. The room was clean, the decor was fitting and price was right. There's a ton of things to do. You can play in the carnival area, gamble, or escape the smoke and eat or shop upstairs. There's a walkway and tram that takes you to the Luxor and Mandalay Bay. It's a bit of a party place and the cheap prices bring in the younger crowd, but we didn't hear much from our room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very Affordable!”
Reviews.Author: doormold
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Excalibur. We booked the hotel due to the ultra cheap deal we found on our Orbitz, averaging just under $35/night. We stayed for three nights, starting on a Saturday. We were a little worried about the young guys partying just across and down the hall from our room, but by the time we returned to the hotel after a late evening of dinner, gambling and roaming around, all was quiet. We stayed in Tower II, in a room with two queen beds. We would have preferred one king bed, but we did not want to pay for an upgrade. The room was a decent size, with a large bathroom and clean shower. The room was also clean, but the beds are very, very firm. Neither my husband nor I had a hard time sleeping, but if you want a soft bed, this is not the hotel for you. The hotel appears to be making a conversion from child friendly to adult playground. We don’t have children, but if we did, we would NOT take them to Las Vegas. Vegas is an adult world! Dick’s Last Resort is a very noisy bar/restaurant geared towards the younger crowd, and it is located not too far from the hotel’s registration desk. Someone else mentioned the go-go dancers just off the lobby and its true…young children should not be exposed to this. We love the Krispy Kreme donut shop located in the hotel; it is a great way to start the day or end a late night…coffee and sugar! We have also dined at the Regale Ristorante; not the world’s greatest Italian food, but certainly affordable and edible. They appear to have closed the Prime Rib House, but it was nice to see the $25 three course meals offered at The Steakhouse at Camelot. If you are like us, where you primarily use the hotel room to sleep and shower, the Excalibur is a fine hotel for the money. Be sure to search for Internet specials and don’t take the upgrades when you check in. Oh yeah, don’t forget about the daily $5.45 “resort fee” that the hotel charges for the convenience of having a phone and access to the Fitness Center/pool. Also, if you need Internet access, there is a separate fee of $14/day.

Reviews.Title: “Please check you bank account!!”
Reviews.Author: jdgCharlotteNc
Reviews.Content: the stay was ok,we were actually were given 3 nights for going to a time share song and dance.the room that we were given was not so nice,so my wife called downstairs to ask for an upgrade.we were taken care of and the new room was fine.upon check out,we paid the daily resort fee of $21.80 in cash.we then went to the airport,flew home,and all was well.the next day i visit the bank to withdraw funds and i am told that the excalibur hotel has a pending charge of $866.93!!!i am at a lost for words so my wife called the hotel to get some answers.after going round and round,playing phone tag with 5 people,i was able to talk to someone who could find the problem.i was told that the hold charge on a room is actually $80.well the desk clerk did something wrong and the deposit that i was charged for the room was $777, plus taxes made the total $866.93.after the error was found the manager told me she was very sorry and this issue would be fixed.2 days later as i write this review,the $866.93 charge is still pending on my account and i can not acces these funds.i just got off of the phone with another manager who did not seem to be too concerned about this situation.i will never stay at the excalibur again and i advise anyone who stays here to be vey careful!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Fun”
Reviews.Author: sonmar
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas to get married at the Graceland Wedding thingy....Elvis and all and and stayed here. The location is excellent as is the Camelot Steak House in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, lots of fun for families”
Reviews.Author: tradeshowtraveler
Reviews.Content: We really liked our stay at Excalibur. No one thing was exceptional, but as a bundle, the place was really fun, relaxed and friendly for our family of five. There was plenty to do for kids, which was really nice, and there were lots of other families there, so we felt really comfortable. The pool scene was fun for families and singles. We all seemed to mingle together in the hot tubs because the main pool was a bit cool for adults. The kids didn't mind the cooler big pool. We didn't like the pool closing at 5 p.m. because it just got warm enough to swim around 3 p.m. The arcade was great with the Spongebob 4D rides, the Tournament of the Kings was really good, the $25 all you can eat all day was excellent, the free drink vouchers and free drinks at tables were also a bonus. Our rooms were average, but hey, we were hardly in them. We paid for a view room the first night so we could get the two for one Tournament of the Kings vouchers. The room had a beautiful view of the NY NY roller coaster and part of the strip, and it had a big screen TV, but there was no cable, so it wasn't really worth it. We downgraded to Tower 1 the following nights, which were next to the bar we liked but far far away from the pool. It was embarrassing walking through the casino in our swimmers, but everyone else was doing it so we didn't care so much.

Reviews.Title: “Good for your wallet, bad for your back”
Reviews.Author: RoadTrip13CA
Reviews.Content: We reserved our room on Excalibur's website and got a great deal. When we checked in, the room was old and dated...but it was cheap, so we didn't worry about it. The bed, however, was like a brick...worst night of sleep in my life. We contemplated changing hotels for the second night of our stay, but found out that the other tower (Tower II) was completed renovated and for $20 more, we could stay there. We agreed, and then wondered why no one offered the upgrade when we checked in. The renovated room in tower 2 looked nicer, but it was the same old bed. If you like an extra-extra-extra firm mattress, this is the place for you. If you want a cushy bed to sink into, this isn't the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!!!!”
Reviews.Author: gordborg
Reviews.Content: This was my 7th trip to vegas , But my first time with a child. We stayed at the Excalibur because we thought it was one of the more kid friendly hotels...i mean it looks like walt disney castle...promoted spongebob has a arcade and midway games sounds good for kids right??...WRONG!...first there are no bathtubs in rooms and no fridges..so if you have small children that dont like showers and need milk your screwed. you can rent a fridge for 20.00 a night!...The staff told me there are very few hotels in vegas with fridges..total lie! ..the rooms had no chain on doors so children could just open the door and walk on out to the hall..we were on a non smoking floor that constantly smelled like weed...security did nothing about it. the midway games and arcade is a joke half the games didnt work or ate the quarters. one day we went to go on the 4d spongebob ride and was told he was to small by 1/2 " my kid cried all the way back to the room...next day new staff said he was fine to go on?? it is also very dirty down there. The front desk told me since mgm grand bought this place they are tring to turn it into a adult playground and will be closing the arcade and midway..they have girls dancing on stage in the casino wearing barely anything...pole dancers too..and when the kids pose with a plastic spongebob character they see all of this!...spend the few extra dollars and stay elsewhere the 11 of us that went down there for NASCAR will never stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Best we've stayed at in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: blondie777
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on Feb 24th and 25th. We should have stayed here during our entire eight days in Vegas. This was the best hotel we have stayed at so far. We got our rooms for only $25 a night. When we arrived they gave us a complimentary upgrade to a wide screen room with two beds. The rooms were clean, the shower was big. The beds are the most comfortable. They had the foam mattresses. We also got a bunch of coupons for free drinks and arcade games. Staff was friendly. Everyone we encountered was very polite. The valet, bellmen, front desk, bartenders. Check in was fairly quick, we had to wait in a line but it kept moving. Check out was a breeze, didn't have to wait at all. The property was clean and had maps/signs everywhere. Location was great, being on the corner of the strip and having close access to the pedestrian walkways and escalators and also being near the interstate was nice. We didn't eat at any restaurants on the property during this visit because we spent most of our time out at the track for the dirt races. The only thing I didn't like was the parking garage being so far away, it's not connected to the property. But we will valet our vehicle next time anyway, so it doesn't really matter. When we go to Vegas again we will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Las Baby!”
Reviews.Author: raajimk
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas! Oh Boy! What a splendid experience! How can someone go to Vegas and not bet their life out! We drove from LA to Las Vegas and the journey was pretty quite with deserts all around and nothing interesting to lay our eyes on than my lil baby cousin who kept up our spirits, making funny sounds :) But all that boredom was long lost the minute we entered Las Vegas! A huge billboard with flashy lights that says 'Welcome to Las Vegas' Nevada, gives you the excitement of your lives. I have toured across many places but nothing excites more than Las Vegas. It was late when we reached Excalibur, then too there were hoards of people waiting for their turns to Valet park. We were all tired and thought of rushing to our beds n drop dead! But the minute we entered the hotel, Oh Laa Laa! We all just kept looking around! There was so much to see and so much to do! It was beautifully decorated, amazingly lit and very well organised as far as attracting the gamblers was concerned! I HATE gambling but this place had something great that I wanted to know everything I should about the games played! Soon as I got my room keys, I just rushed to my room. Got a little fresh and ran down with my sister and my cousin to learn the Game - Poker! I still dont know though how it is played but I thoroughly enjoyed hearing its a Draw, its a Flush.. and what not! Late night I went back to my room and through the windows I could see a brightly lit Strip! New York New York is just across Excalibur and MGM is located diagonally. I felt like on top of the world suddenly. I slept well thinking of all that I am going to do for the next couple of days, still dreaming if I was really at Las Vegas! Excalibur is beautifully located almost at the start of the famous Strip. Early morning I could see the roll-coaster at NYNY zapping up! And could hear the excited people scream! By the morning there are happy people everywhere at Las Vegas! There are some amazing Hotels to visit! We started with roaming at the Strip! Started with parking at Planet Hollywood and having a lavish breakfast there. Then we went to Venetian, The Mirage, Paris, MGM Grand, and I couldnt move wen I saw the Romance at the Bellagio! Amazing fountains that make you feel absolutely ecastic! All these Hotels had themes within! Let me tell you Las Vegas has its own beauty! Its all about Glam, Power, Beauty and Love! Excalibur definately lives up to its meaning! A fort like building, beautiful decors within, and some cool Martinis! And the best of all its Location! Its like the head of the Strip! Las Vegas time! Go Play!

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price”
Reviews.Author: Jewels806
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in September 2008. We got a very good deal on the room, and even after upgrading to the newly renovated rooms at $20 a night, I think we spent less than $250 on the hotel. We thought that was a fair price for what we got. The check in line was long! The girl at the front desk clearly did not like her job but once we got to the desk, check in was quick. You cannot walk through the casino without being harrassed by one of the time share agents. At first we tried to be polite but by the 2nd day you just have to be almost rude and just ignore them! Our room was not bad at all! The bed was comfy and the room was mostly clean. The only thing we noticed were these splatters on the curtain that kind of bleached them. The bathroom was nice as well, the shower wasn't the cleanest I have ever seen but not horrible. The flat screen TV was a nice touch and it was decorated nicely. The lobby and casino have seen better days. Compared to other hotels, this casino is nothing special. We never had a problem getting a drink while sitting at the machines. The moving walkway in the front is nice though after a long day of walking! There is a nice little food court/shop area upstairs that was good for breakfast or a late night snack. There is a Pizza Hut, McDonalds, Quiznos, Starbucks, Krispy Kreme, those sorts of places here. The best part about this hotel is its location. We liked the indoor walkway to the Luxor and the monorail thing to Mandalay Bay. It was also very easy access to NYNY and MGM. For the price, I would stay here again. However, our next visit to Vegas we will probably try somewhere else just to try something different.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: h87
Reviews.Content: Having read some reviews before we set off we were a little bit worried, but any fears soon disappeared once we were there. We had standard rooms, which hadn't been updated, but thet were fine. Good beds, bathroom with everything you need, very clean, and a great view over Luxor! Clean towels every day, staff friendly and helpfull. Plenty of places to grab a bite to eat, McDonalds, Pizza Hut etc are all here, the buffet is well worth the money, $12(I think) for breakfast, all you can eat and they have anything and everything! Excalibur is one of the cheaper hotels on the strip, but if you are looking to get there on a budget or can't quite stretch to the likes of wynn and bellagio, then you cant go wrong with Excalibur

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur - Perfect for the $$!!”
Reviews.Author: jasejase
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights with another couple (adjacent rooms). We had the newly renovated widescreen rooms with two queens. The rooms were clean and newly renovated. The decor was modern, but basic... Housekeeping did a good job, and no issues were noted within the room, besides a battery needed in the AC/Heat controller.. Which was quickly taken care of after a call to the front desk. The location is, as described, towards the end of the strip. Mandalay Bay, and the Luxor are even further down the strip, so this isnt exactly the 'end' of the strip. We thought the location was pretty good. If you were there to explore vegas and take it all in, it was perfect. We spent alot of time at NY NY, and just venturing out. It takes a bit to get the numerous entrances, and exits down, and to navigate your walks with utmost efficiency in between casinos, etc. There seems to be 5 different skywalks, elevated sidewalks, escalators, and walkways to get to each place! One word of advice for any newbie (2 out of 4 of us were new to LV)... Things are MUCH further than they appear. If you can see the building that you are trying to get to ahead - this means NOTHING! It became a bit of a joke towards the end. The Eiffel Tower seemed like it was two blocks away.. . but it was probably a good mile plus from the Excalibur. And the stratosphere... was at least 3 miles out. The sidewalks force you to walk about double the distance sometimes, taking you up and over roads, instead of across sidewalks. I get the reasoning... (keeping traffic moving), but I thought i would mention it, as it added some time onto your walk now and then. (noteable more for reservations, etc). another thing we noticed was, the amount of people. everyone has alluded to the fact that vegas is hurting a bit... We did NOT see that. in the 5 days we were there - the sidewalks were jammed, stores were packed, and restaurants were filled. We needed resrevations for two out of the three 'nicer' restaurants we went to. The eiffel tower restaurant was EXCELLENT. a bit pricey. But the food, and service were superb. The restaurant on the ground floor of the eiffel tower - mon ami mambi (or something like that) was also really good, and a bit cheaper and more casual... but still very nice. we did a TON of walking and i THINK we saw most of the hot button attractions that most first timers would want to see. We walked a TON.. and used cabs, and the Deuce (bus). The deuce was a great value, easy to use, but slow at times - especially during rush hour. Back to the Excalibur... The casino was a bit more dated than others we saw (we must have entered into about 25+ other casinos!!!).. but it was good. It had everything you would need in my opinion, and the cocktail waitresses provided better service than i was anticpiating (except for one miserable one!)... The tables were always busy (a good sign), and the smoke level was average to fair. Being from CT, i would actually rate the air quality level in vegas casinos as being better than Connecticuts own Foxwoods or Mohegan Sun! We went to our Buffet once for dinner. And it was pretty good. no complaints, and there was more than enough food options to suit your needs. We all found something that we liked, and left stuffed... no surprises there! The Tournament of Kings show was also excellent... Dinner was provided (cornish game hens, brocolii, potatoe wedges, apple turnover, sodas)... And it was actually really good! We were surprised. It was definitely worth the price we paid (buy one, get one free). It was a blast. Much like Medieval Times, etc. The girls used the Spa at the Excalibur, and had nothing but great things to say. It was clean , efficient, and relaxing. The amount of shops, restaurants, etc in the Excalibur was also sufficient. It certainly was not an indoor mall - but had a handful of fast food restaurants, gift shops, and coffee shops. We did not eat at the formal restaurants at the Excalibur, so we can't comment on them. The pay bars on the casino floor were a bit pricey, and service was intermittent at best. I used a drink coupon (you get them on checkin), and it seemed to cost me more than if i didnt have them on one occasion... Oh well... Just say no thank you to any one in a suit and a name tag that approaches you... They are timeshare salesmen... Keep walking. Unless you want a timeshare that is. we expereinced this at a few hotels. We walked the pool area in the morning (right when the pool opened). At least one pool was heated, and the water was WARM. Not sure about he water slides, etc. That pool appeared closed. There was a small restaurant/bar at the pool, and the area had tons of private cabanas, with tv's, etc. it was an overcast day, and it was early... so only a handful of people were up there at the time. There was also a mid sized hottub at the pool area. The fitness center and spa were right off the pool area. A quick headsup - they charge you for gym usage here... But you do get a free one day fitness pass at checkin (along with a 20% off coupon for the spa, and two $5 off drink coupons)... not sure how long this coupon promo is on for.. Other points of interest - Stratoshpere - Worth the trip down... observation deck was cool, and so were the rides on the top! we lost our nerve a bit once we stepped out on the observation deck to board the tower ride... but we got it together! it was a good time. NY NY has a rollercoaster as well.. though not quite as intense, it got the job done, and gave our adrenaline levels a bit of a boost! The boys also made it to the Gun Store to fire off some full auto machine guns... We were both novices, and thought it would be fun... It was! it was pricey- but it was a great time! Dont forget to have the cab wait for you (its quick), or take down a cab #... We found oursevles walking back to the hotel... 4 miles. It was a nice easy walk though! Great weather! Cirque Du Soeil Love was EXCELLENT. None of us were huge Beatles fans or anything, but you will know the songs... Beatles or not - it was REALLY impressive. Small theater too... didnt appear to be any 'bad' seats in the house. The athleticism, choreography, and talent of these performers was incredible. I would see it again. There are SO many great places to eat... Each hotel seemed to have about 2 or 3 restaurants that were 'nice' and appeared worth trying. I could spend years in this city just eating at different places. Same goes for Clubs, if thats your thing. Made our way down to Freemont/Downtown area one day. This is 'old vegas' as many already know. It was nice to spend the day down there.. a bit different feel, and a bit more lowkey. Still a fair amount of things to do. Lots of shopping too... a long bus ride though... or at least it seemed like a long bus ride! If you check out Coyote Ugly at NY NY - be sure to get a free coupon from one of the 4 people handing things out in NY NY... its good for either free, or discounted admission.. saved our group $40 or so. (depending on what time you go). we checked it our for 20 min or so... watched them do their thing, and headed out. Its worth the stop... its probably worth staying a bit if you just turned 21! One final parting tip on LV... if you're used to hailing a cab as needed, be advised - its illegal for LV cabs to stop to pick you up. You either have to call a cab for pickup or get one at any hotel cab stop. They can't stop on the street. This is a bit different, as we venture to NYC often. Its apparently for the cab driver, and the passengers safety. We had a great and much better than anticipated time in vegas. It was definitely a better time than i ever thought it would be! The excalibur was a great hotel for the price.. You cannot beat it! I would get the widescreen room, and they were clean, and just 'felt' right. NOTHING fancy.. but definietly did the trick. Its not the nicest place on the strip - but lets you keep some of your $ for the 10,000 other things to do in LV. The location isnt central, but like i said - its still good in our opinion. Close to many things, and you're there to walk around anyways!! Again, the casino isnt new, but it was a casino. The excalibur met our expecations, and we would go back there again if in vegas, and the price continued to be right!

Reviews.Title: “Not exactly”
Reviews.Author: kwa829
Reviews.Content: Nobody will mistake the Excalibur for Bellagio or Wynn, but it does provide an affordable and reasonably decent Las Vegas Strip experience, and is a good base from which to walk up and down the Strip. The hotel is starting to look and feel a bit dated, but the rooms are decent enough - clean, comfortable. Apparently some rooms have been renovated, though I did not have a renovated room. The staff was very helpful in providing me a room in close proximity to the room of the other party with which I was traveling, even after the other party (which arrived before me)asked for a change of room when they were not happy with their initial assigned room due to a brick wall 15 feet out the window. I got a good night's sleep, and the room was reasonably sound-proof so as to block out the noise from drunken revelers stumbling down the hallway in the middle of the night. Compared to the somewhat homogenous clientele of the more upscale properties, Excalibur guests seemed to come in all types: young, old, fat, thin, blue collar, white collar, multiple ethnicities, families, couples, singles, etc. The fitness center was incredible . . . though hard to believe that at in a hotel with over 4,000 rooms, there were only 3 people using the fitness center on a Sunday morning. Small compaints would be as follows: - Limited number of channels on the TV (though casinos want you to be gambling, not watching TV) - Rooms and hallways a little but musty, but not too bad. - Like many casinos, the line for the dinner buffet was ridiculous (over an hour). We passed on it and instead opted for the very pleasant and quiet Sherwood Forest Cafe (adjacent to the casino floor). - And, the breakfast buffet, though extensive, was of marginal quality - With respect to the buffets, be careful if you choose a higher room rate in return for a dining voucher (e.g., I had a choice between an $81 room, or $91 with a $25 food voucher); you may then feel obligated to use the voucher, which may mean a long wait in the buffet line unless you are able to go at a non-peak time.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Beds, Otherwise Okay”
Reviews.Author: iwanderafar
Reviews.Content: I reserved the redone widescreen rooms because they advertised comfy "pillow top" mattresses. Well put a piece of cotton down on a hard floor and you'll feel just how "comfy" those beds were. Apart from the beds the rooms were nice. It's too bad. I paid an average of $68 a night. I think I'd pay a little more and sleep elsewhere. PROS: Room size is nice, there is an easy to adjust thermostat to get heat or cold. The marble counter top in the bathroom is nice and there is plenty of seating, storage, and space to put your luggage. When we called about a light out and the safe not working they came right away and fixed everything. The rooms seem fairly clean. CONS: The bed is too hard and the linens have wrinkles in them that are so hard they'll wound you. There is no place to put your washcloth or scrubby in the bathroom and no place to put the shampoo. The bathroom is a shower only so no place to sit or shave your legs. For some reason they put the sink in about 5 inches from the front, so if you're short (I'm 5'4") you need to lean on the cold marble to wash your face. The widescreen TV is not HDTV, so don't expect too much and there are only about 5 real stations to watch anyway (NBC, CBS, ABC, TBS and CNN). Also, the window shades don't entirely cover the window, so you'll have plenty of daylight in the morning. Excalibur offers a $10 credit on their player's card if you have a card from another casino family. The card they gave me didn't work and then the next card, didn't have the credit on it. You have to stand in line, each time you have a question about their player's card. The tram to Mandalay Bay wasn't working, neither was the people mover to get to NY, NY. If you need a cheap place to stay, don't waste y our money on the upgraded rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice renovated spacious rooms great pool”
Reviews.Author: ekazaka
Reviews.Content: We stayed here only as our sleep over place for our half way driving point from Utah to California. We stayed in Tower II which apparently has the deluxe renovated rooms. We booked room 2 months in advance and checked rate night before we went which was lower. We had them adjust the price. Pros: Our room in Tower II was very spacious with wide screen plasma and 2 sitting areas. There are 3 big Pools, 1 with only 10" for toodlers and 1 with slides for older kids. They have nice cabanas available to rent to get out of sun and watch TV. Several hot tubs. Cons: NO coffee pot in roomplace for . Stategy to get you to buy from startbucks downstairs and walk thru casino to gamble. Only shower stand no tub for kids to bathe in. Located at far end of strip

Reviews.Title: “I would not recommend this hotel to ANYONE!!!”
Reviews.Author: lizkittyliz
Reviews.Content: From the moment I walked into this hotel I was disappointed. There was always a long line for any service, check in, check out, mail etc. My requests from reservations were not met (king bed, non smoking, next to my colleague I was traveling with) so we agreed to take two queens each to have adjacent rooms. I wish I would have taken pictures of the condition of my room to strengthen my review. There was hair all over the bathroom floor and other stains, there is also no tub but a shower stall (with a shower head with so much lime on it that it barely sprays out water.) There was actually blood and other mysterious stains on one of the beds as well as on the sheets of that bed. The other bed had more permanent type stains-like ink so I slept in that one. There are nice flat screen tv's on the wall but no HD tv- but still a nice touch. Every time the maid came into my room something happened. First time a dirty pillowcase was left on my suitcase, the next time a dirty cleaning towel was left on the floor, the third time the radio was left on very loud. I never complained about any of this to the hotel because I did not want the hassle and did not want my room moved. But when I checked out they tried to charge me a room upgrade fee that was $21/night and my colleague who was in the SAME exact room next door to me had no such charge. When I complained they reversed it but it just added to the pain of my experience at this hotel. They also do not have an airport shuttle, you had to pay $6.50 per person to get back to the airport. I advise people to hire a cab, if there is more than one person it will be cheaper and would not have stops at other hotels although "Miss" Diamond Bell made our trip interesting. Everything about this hotel is sub par for Vegas, I would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone, if I had any choice about where I stayed (our boss made the reservation and paid) I would have checked out and gone to another hotel after the first night. I would also not recommend this hotel to people with children. In the "party pit" several nights a week girls dance in bras and very small underwear very provocatively. This area is NOT in a bar, it is in the middle of the casino floor across from the reception area and the Sponge Bob statue meant for the kids to pose with. It was sad to watch very young little girls mimicking the dancers while their parents were in Dick's Last Resort-which actually has great drinks. This place is not worth any "deal" on the room, go elsewhere. I was at a large conference that included this hotel in it and everyone I talked to that stayed here was disappointed and had similar experiences with mystery stains-including one person that had an extensive stain on their curtains!!

Reviews.Title: “Many Great Attributes...”
Reviews.Author: nireo23
Reviews.Content: We visited Excalibur as part of an Orbitz package deal. Having never stayed at this hotel, did nto know what we were getting into. We were pleasantly surprised. Loved the location, the casino, and the great food choices. Could have done without the greeters that try to sway you into visiting a time share. Really think this should not even be allowed. Because we arrived in the morning and had to wait a bit for a room, we were walking to the luggage storage area and they swooped in and offered us "our free gifts"...do not fall for "we have some free gifts for you". Also, would have to say beds were not the best. We upgraded to newley renovated room, thinking it would be updated and modern...not really. TV was, alarm was, other than that not to much. Camelot resteraunt was AWESOME! Spa was AWESOME!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and well located!”
Reviews.Author: JoshuaTreeMusicman
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights during President's weekend - many other places were fully booked, but Excalibur had plenty of rooms. We were booked into Tower II - 22nd floor - facing NY/NY (north). This side of the building is VERY noisy with street traffic and emergency sirens (as well as roller-coaster screams). I have stayed here several times but usually had a room facing the pool (west). If you are used to quiet nights, book a non-north view. Otherwise, I love this place - lots of eateries - friendly staff - easy walking distances to many other casinos - (and great giant pina coladas at Dicks!!!)

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ravyn0324
Reviews.Content: We got to the Excalibur on a Sunday morning and was able to check in early with no problem. They UPGRADED our room from Tower 1 to Tower 2 for no additional fees. We were on the first floor-right off the casino-we thought it would have been cool to have a view from higher up but NYNY was right outside our window and we didn't have to wait for an elevator. We were right by the casino and Dick's Last Resport but never heard any outside noise while in the room. Room was VERY VERY nice and was definatly an UPGRADE from the pictures I saw on here of the older rooms. Very clean and maintained extremely well. We had a smoking room but it did NOT smell like smoke in the LEAST, not to mention spacious!The hotel is in the PERFECT spot, had easy access to NYNY and MGM. I read reviews that it was a long walk to get out of the hotel so I was nervous but it wasn't at all. I don't know where these people were walking from but there was a walkway over the street to get to the other hotels, which was quite easy to get to. You can also walk to Luxor and Mandalay Bay without going outside at all. Something I was pleased with is that every hotel seems to have a " food court" upstairs[ just like in a regular mall] if you don't want to spend money on the buffets or sit down restaurants. I can't say enough about this location and hotel-I would definatly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: danbycan
Reviews.Content: We spent several days at the Excalibur during the month of January and have nothing but good things to say about the hotel and its staff. We stayed in a widescreen room which was large clean and very comfortable. The only problem we had was a blown circuit breaker in the room which was fixed by maintance within 5 minutes. The service we recieved at check in/out, players club,and waitresses was fast and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A great value”
Reviews.Author: kwsheeha1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Excalibur many times. Their recent upgrade of rooms is good. It's a great place to stay for value. There are many good restaurants at a nice price. It's very convenient to the Luxor, NY NY, Mandalay Bay and MGM. It's a relaxing place to stay. I also really enjoy the free live entertainment they have in the evening. Good variety of gaming. I have stayed at the Belagio, Luxor, and downtown hotels. Obviously the Belagio is nicer, but there are no reasonable price places to eat. I do wish the Excalibur had tubs, they only have large showers in the standard rooms. Also, if this is your first time to Vegas you may want a Hotel located in the center of the strip. But if you are looking for a decent and fun place to stay, I recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for Vegas”
Reviews.Author: lgu98141
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 4 day trip to Vegas over the Superbowl weekend and had a very pleasant stay in the Excalibur. I was an avid reader of reviews in the run-up to my trip and I was pleasantly surprised by the Excalibur. I am 28, from the UK, and went with 3 friends to basically gamble and party. I booked via the hotel's website under their best rate guarantee and got an extremely cheap room over a v. bust weekend. TOP TIP use the website smartervegas or smartvegas dot com (can't exactly remember) which gives out the hotel promotion codes which use can then use to reduce the price at EX if you phone them up. We enjoyed our stay as we were upgraded (didn't ask) to a widescreen tower room which was very nice. Too be honest, people of our age range don't stay that long in the hotel room so it did the business as far as we were concerned. As far as location, I think it can't be beat. NY NY is right across the road which has great nightlife and MGM which is always buzzing. I don't think it really matters where you stay but the middle to south strip is the best. Gambling limits are also quite low at the EX and if you can't be bothered waiting for free drinks off the waitresses (which was quite slow), go to the bar and put $10 in the poker machine on the bar and your drinks will be free (much quicker for us anyway). Recommend it for younger people or those just wanting a nice place to crash

Reviews.Title: “Loved it-Choose your room wisely!”
Reviews.Author: 123nps
Reviews.Content: Hello from Vegas Airport (FREE WiFi)- Just wanted to sign on to let everyone know about Excalibur -located on NOw Famous four Corners. First I loved being in Excalibur-VERY SAFE in a secure area. If parking your rental car drive between LUXOR & Excalibur--Park at-near TOWER ONE-Enter in side door- and registration is a five minute walk into the casino on the right.I found checking in a bit confusing even after booking online the HOtel charged an additional $5.45 a day--tax they say? Nevertheless at this point I WOULD Put your foot down and demand a room facing NEW YORK NY-Its closer to parking, the strips view is a bit better (i've heard)and you dont have to worry about the SUN walking you up every morning unless you favor that. One benefit and down fall is that you have a great view of flights taking off day and night-but the sound might keep you up all night if you dont leave the fan on to damper the sound. We stayed on the twenth floor in tower 1 and the walk from car to room is exhausting after a day of walking etc. We were given two FREE drink vouchers and when we order our drinks-one liqour- we got charged an additional 8.00. For that I could have gambled then got a free drink and maybe better winnings. the ROOMS are clean and spacious-family friendly with a nice food court. BUT I SUGGEST FOR BREAKFAST you go DOWNTOWN ON fremont @ the FREMONT PARADISE BREAKFAST BUFFEt FOR $6.79. tHE FOOD IS great FOR A MORNING MEAL-THE STAFF IS GREAT THERE AS WELL. Internet cost $14.99 in your room-NOT FREEWe found gambling was best bizarrely at Paris... we played BIG6 for HOURS-it sorted like Roulette but only $1 minimun. Slots of fun hav Roulette with $0.50 min-cant beat that deal....hope this helps- Staying on the Twenth floor at Excalibur in all was GREAT. When we left we made TWO paper airplanes and watched them glide away---- good luck gaming- hope you do better than we did.-

Reviews.Title: “Just the Basics”
Reviews.Author: lzlin11
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the basic room as part of a Southwest Vacations Package booked with AAA. The hotel is in process of upgrading all rooms but at this time they charge $20-30 per night for the upgraded rooms so we just opted to stay in the basic room. It did the trick and the check-in person was kind enough to give us a high floor with a good view. I am used to Hyatt, Marriott's, Hilton etc.. so I had to really live unlike I normally would while on vacation- No coffee-maker, unflattering decor and 20 inch tube. Needless to say I survived. Excalibur is now on the end of the strip that is not all that happening, except that NYNY is across the street and so is MGM and those seem to be a bit more 'happening'. We walked or took the Double Duece bus to where Paris, Bellagio etc.. is and that is the area I would suggest the next time you stay on the strip if you want to be near the the more high traffic areas(and the Bellagio's water fountain-my favorite).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing deal!!”
Reviews.Author: SuperStarr216
Reviews.Content: I booked at the exalibur 3 weeks ahead of time through their own website and payed 61 bucks a night for fri and sat night. Check in was strictly 3pm but when we arrived an hour early they got us in no problem and gave us a free upgrade to the widescreen room worth 20 extra bucks a night, and we didn't even ask for it! The room was great top floor tower 2, free drink coupons, buy one get one free buffet from 2-6pm as long as you get there before 6 there is no problem with the line. Food was good. Location was excellent, free monorail from exalibur to luxor and mandalay bay. I was more than happy staying here and would do it again!

Reviews.Title: “Room smelled, awful odor”
Reviews.Author: royalpiper
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 2 day stay. Upon entering room 2244 in Tower 2, the strong odor of mildew nearly left me gasping for air. Went straight to desk and requested room change. They did so, but the next room, 2350, was just as bad. Had housekeeping come up to original room to try to deodorize. They sprayed the carpets and draperies with febreze. This helped for a little while, but odor returned later. Won't stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel, Great gambling!!”
Reviews.Author: Theaterbelle
Reviews.Content: I booked this trip as a girls getaway with my two best friends. Let me start by saying I'm usually picky with hotels. Whenever I went to vegas before, with family, I stayed at the Venetian, which is the epitome of luxury. This time around, though, we were looking for something inexpensive and fun. The excalibur definetely did the trick. At checkin, we where upgraded to a room in the new tower, tower 2. The room was nicer than I expected, with brand new beds and pillows (very comfy) and a 42" plasma TV. Everyone was always curteous, and the room was cleaned perfectly every day. I loved the castle theme, and the ambiance. Everyone in this hotel seemed to be around my age (mid 20's), so there where lots of people to meet. But the BEST part of this hotel was the gambling. I lost a lot of money while I was in vegas, gambling at other hotels...and I made all of it back, and then some, on the slots at the excalibur and the NYNY. I love that I got a great room ina fun hotel for $40 a night....and that we had such a blast. The only thing that could be better is the security. There's a security guard at the entrance to the tower elevators, and he's supposed to check our keys....but he never did. So, really, anyone could get up to the rooms....which is a little scary for three girls traveling alone.

Reviews.Title: “A good base to explore the Strip”
Reviews.Author: sprayny
Reviews.Content: Between the wide choice of hotel on the Strip, the Excalibur is probably not the most appealing, but it has some good points: firstly the location. You can walk without exiting the hotel to the Luxor, then to the Mandaly Bay and to the Four Season. On the other side, just crossing the street you are at the New York New York and at the MGM. About 10 minutes walking I was at Bellagio and Paris. With their great hotel rates (35$ on weekdays) the Excalibur sounds actually a good choice, and, at the same time, offering a comfortable stay in a clean and nice room. Ask for tower 2, as there rooms are newly refurbished. I was on a low floor, so no view. Huge flat tv, very nice bathroom, well appointed, with a big shower. So, at the end, stay here if you want a good base to explore the rest of Vegas. If you're looking for a nice hotel where spend all your time, with superior accomodations, fine dining options, appealing casino, then I'll say to choose something else. I slept at the Excalibur, but of all hotels I've been in, the Excalibur itself has been the one where I dind't spend any or a little time walking around, mostly because I've found the decoration and the ambience not very nice. But again, to sleep, was comfortable (and I'm a picky person!).

Reviews.Title: “Charging "Resort Fee" even with package deal”
Reviews.Author: ChangesInLatitudes72
Reviews.Content: We booked through Allegiant airlines as a package deal, where all costs, taxes and fees were itemized and paid in advance. When we got to the hotel and registered they gave us several coupons for a couple drinks/free play/spa discount. They failed to mention that there is a $5 per day charge for those coupons. They said that by signing in at registration I acknowledged that I was OK with paying the extra $5. When I checked out and realized that they were charging me, I asked them to remove the charge, but they wouldn't. I called to talk to a manager later in the day. They said they would call me back, but no one called. I had to call them again and they are going to credit me half of the charges. Not a good way to end our trip. Also, be warned. They have people at every entrance/exit trying to get you to buy show tickets and go see their other resort. They wouldn't leave us alone.

Reviews.Title: “dated room didn't bother us, the bad food did”
Reviews.Author: lainee_7
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I just got home from our week stay at the Excalibur hotel. The room was clean, and roomy. The bathroom, even though it was only a standing shower was good in size as well. The outdated decor and old tv didn't bother us, as we were not in Vegas to sit in the hotel room and watch t.v! I liked that the elevator was fast, we were on our floor in no time. Which is good, because it was like a 10 min walk from the strip to the elevator. The food at the buffet was absolutely disgusting!! I like my food hot, warm even. Not cold. Would not suggest this place to anyone! The timeshare people who harassed us every morning and night of our stay need to buzz off. They were relentless, and annoying!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect if you like ugly decor and bad food”
Reviews.Author: DefiniteOne77
Reviews.Content: Was put up in the Excalibur by my company for 5 nights during a tradeshow. Compared to other hotels on the strip I have stayed at I was disappointed. The room was furnished with shabby old furniture, a classic looking TV, ugly carpet and a nice view of a rooftop. The casino is located right near the very end of the far end of the strip so its quite a long walk/cab/monorail to where the real action is. Not a convenient location at all. The medieval theme is very obnoxious and tacky to say the least and the decor and general ambiance of the place is downright ugly. Found the casino to be mostly full of low budget bus tour patrons scouting for nickle slots. The drinks came slowly at the gaming tables and they didn't allow me to order multiple beverages so I was empty alot of the the time. The food choices are limited to pretty much a cafeteria with pre-made sandwiches and cold hot dogs served on a tray to a greasy Denny's style breakfast place. Don't bother with this place. You can get a much better room in a much nicer hotel on the strip for the same money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Internet Rate”
Reviews.Author: gillianp
Reviews.Content: Driving home to Vancouver Canada from Phoenix we just had to go to Vegas. Of course we were looking for a bargain. The Excalibur had an internet rate on there own site good for seven days a weeks of of $36 per night. We walked up to the counter but could not get that rate. We took the computer up to Krispee Creams free wi fi area on the second floor booked and came back down viola. Decided to do another two days same thing. So yes the internet rate means just that do it before you arrive. Were very leary of such a cheap price but it was great. Tower 2, floor 3, lovely very large fully renovated room. Surprisingly very very tasteful not cheap and cheerful. Vegas is very hard to find free wi fi I guess they don't want you on your computer. Yes time share guys are everywhere but don't bug you. No real cheap food anymore just realistically priced. Was much busier than we had heard. Vegas is much more fun with a car, we still walked from one end to the other walkways across the street make it very easy. more to do every time we go. Do your research read the reviews and have fun

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean and cheerful!”
Reviews.Author: djulster
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd trip to Vegas and I was looking to have a bit of fun and not spend too much on my accommdation so the Excalibur was the right choice! I got a nice clean room on the 11th floor of Tower II overlooking the pool complex which was good. The pool complex is good - they have 4 pools with 1 specifically only for adults which is good if you want to sunbathe and not be plagued by kids jumping in and out of the pool. There is also a decent poolside bar with waitress service. I like the location it is at the south end of the strip but linked to the Luxor, NYNY and MGM Grand by walkways so it handy for alot of amenities. The staff are freindly and good fun and are happy for you to sit at the bar and chill playing video poker while waiting for friends. I wasn't overly impressed with Dick's Last Resort but other than that the food outlets were decent.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience @ Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: SCValleyGirl
Reviews.Content: We booked our room through Travelocity and received an incomparable rate -- made ridiculously lower with a promotional offer by MasterCard. Upon check-in -- we were upgraded to a widescreen room without having to ask for it! The room and carpets were clean, with updated furniture and a renovated bathroom. The vanity had a wide, beautiful granite counter and sink. Our room was located on the second floor in Tower II with a limited view of the Strip. Our room was comfortable and nicely appointed. The staff at the front desk were friendly and helpful. We signed up for the Players card and received comp's before check-out. The only 'con' was the fact there is no in-room coffee. Depending on the time you tried to call room service -- you may have a long wait to order that first cup. However, there are coffee stands located on the first floor for the desperate. I recommend Castle Coffee at the base of Tower II -- the 'supercharged' style coffee will certainly start your day with a blast of much needed caffeine! A great trip. I recommend this hotel for its location on the Strip and the hospitality we received. We'll definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Top 10 Reasons To Stay and Not Stay At Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: GBPackers-Lover
Reviews.Content: Top 10 Reasons to Stay at Excalibur: 10. Casino - Friendly dealers, fun atmosphere, low limits! 9. Location - Between Luxor and NY NY, across from MGM Grand. 8. Fast Elevators - From floor 1 to 25 in less than 10 seconds! 7. Clean Rooms - Stayed 3 separate times, never a dirty room. 6. Food Court - In the hotel: McDonalds, Pizza Hut, Krispy Kreme. 5. Dick's Resort Party Pit - Play blackjack and get loud, real loud. 4. Roundtable Buffet - Big selection, 2 for 1 between 4 and 6 pm. 3. Friendly Staff (outside of the annoying timeshare salesmen) 2. Pool - Waterfalls, slides, four pools to choose from! 1, Price, Price, Price - Do your homework, get the right promo codes, and stay for under $40 per night. Many hotels triple their prices on the weekends, escape the pressures of those overbearing prices beating down on you and pull up a seat in the castle for a few nights. Remember, you don't have to stay at the same hotel your entire stay. Top 10 Reasons Not To Stay At Excalibur: 10. Lame Blackjack Rules - Card shuffling machines, no surrendering allowed, and dealer must hit a soft 17??? 9. Timeshare Salesmen - These guys are ruthless. 8. Children - Parents, a reason we go to Vegas is to get away from loud, smelly children. The casinos don't want your kids in Vegas and neither do we. Trust me, leave little Billy and Sally in Missouri; you'll have more fun and so will we. 7. Timeshare Salesmen - What is unbelievable is the hotel places them right by the elevators that go to the guestrooms. 6. Hotel Setting - It seriously takes like 10 minutes to walk from your room to Las Vegas Blvd. Why can't we place the hotels closer to the street? 5. Timeshare Salesmen - You tell them that you are not interested 4 times, and they still approach you hoping the 5th time will be a charm. 4. Louie Anderson - Seriously??? 3. Timeshare Salesman - They also place them next to the front desk, this way you cannot even check in or out without running into them. 2. Five Dollar Resort Fee Per Night - This fee is basically to use the gym and phone. First, 95% of us are not using the gym on vacation and 2nd, 99% of us have cell phones. 1. Timeshare Salesman - Not only are these guys placed by the guest room elevators. Not only are these guys placed beside the check in, check out line. Also, there are even placed in front of the outside entrance! This way, you get to say no as you walk toward the hotel, no when you come into the hotel, and no when you go to your room. That's all.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't deserve the bad wrap”
Reviews.Author: cymblue
Reviews.Content: I went to Excalibur in May with one friend as a girls' getaway. We had a great time! We had a "widescreen room" in the renovated tower, and it was very nice - a plasma tv, a safe in the room, large bathrooms with granite countertops, and comfy beds. We never had any problem with not having something we needed (towels, shampoo, etc) and the staff at check in and check out was very friendly. I also enjoyed the casino a lot - it is not fancy, but there is a welcoming atmosphere and lower limits, so it was not intimidating to play some table games there. I took the free craps lesson and my friend took the free blackjack lesson - it was nice to have that offered. I did see some timeshare sales people around, but I guess since I was just a single girl none of them bothered me. Overall I would say that Excalibur gets a bad wrap, but it is a great value and the room we had more than met our expectations - I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Trip to Vegas, first time at Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: bride2bCT
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Excalibur on August 30 - September 5 2008. This was our second trip to Vegas, and during our first trip we stayed at the Stratosphere on the very North end of the Strip. This time we decided to stay in the middle of the action, so we booked our stay at the Excalibur for $36/night for a standard non-smoking room with one king sized bed. I read the reviews and the complaints about the shabby rooms, etc., but for the amount of time we actually spend in the hotel room, it didn't influence our decision at all. Check in went very smoothly, and there was no wait at all. The front desk attendant was very friendly, and made small talk as she checked us in. The room itself was large and clean, and the bed comfortable. The bathroom was spotless, which was a big deal for me because a dirty/shabby bathroom is about the only pet peeve I have when staying at a hotel. We didn't have a room with a view facing the Strip but we didn't care, because the point is to be out on the Strip in the middle of it all instead of watching it from your hotel room! The housekeeping staff were very friendly, and we always came back to a freshly made room each afternoon. My fiance and I aren't ones to sit around the pool all day, but we did a walk through just to see what it was like. It was nice! There were cabanas poolside that people could reserve, plenty of chairs deckside, and a lot of room for children and adults alike. This hotel is not a luxury resort, so if you are expecting to be pampered or have a marble toilet I would check elsewhere. If you don't need frills and are just looking for a bargain room in a prime location to come back to at night to recharge for the next day, then this is your place! There were a lot of families with children staying at the Excalibur, mainly because it is one of the more kid-friendly choices on the Strip, if you can call Las Vegas "kid-friendly". They have an arcade, the Tournament of Kings Dinner Show, and the Midway, which has all sorts of little Las Vegas type souveneir shops and fast food options. So if you're looking for a place in Vegas to get away from kids for a while, this probably won't be the best option for you. We did eat at Dick's Last Resort, which is located in the Excalibur. It's a toned down version of the restaurant that is in Boston, but still not for the easily offended. The food was good though, typical pub type stuff. On a side note -this time around in Vegas we did want to see a Cirque du Soleil show, because they do have a number of different shows at a host of hotels on the Strip, and are always a hard ticket to get. Rather than go straight to the hotel box office to purchase the tickets, we decided to go to one of the half-priced ticket offices that are located on the strip. After all, half price beats full price! DON'T FALL FOR IT! What they should advertise is that you MAY get a ticket at half price, but you also may pay more than the actual box office price. Here's how it works: At the actual venue box office there are different ticket price ranges for each level of seat quality (orchestra, 1st mezzanine, 2nd mezzanine, etc). Each level has a price range in which tickets at the box office can be purchased......for example say the box office range for orchestra level tickets was $100-$200. The seats in the front of the orchestra level would be $200, and the seats in the back of the orchestra level would be $100. At the offices where the so-called half-priced tickets are sold , they'll offer all orchestra tickets at $150. You pay the money and they give you a voucher to take to the venue box office to redeem for your ticket to the show. At the box office you find that you're sitting in the back of the orchestra level. You just paid $150 for a $100 ticket at a half-priced ticket office. Not such a deal, is it? Long story short, at the half-priced ticket office my fiance and I ended up paying $80 extra to see Ka at the MGM Grand versus what the face value of the ticket when purchased at the MGM Grand box office. The show was amazing but I was definitely frustrated about getting hosed on the ticket price. Just do yourselves a favor and check the box office prices before going to the half-priced ticket office! You'll also have a say in where you sit if you purchase from the box office - they'll ask how close or far away you would like to be. Hopefully this information will help someone else from making our mistake!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value”
Reviews.Author: DancingRiver
Reviews.Content: Great value, pay the extra $20 or so to stay in the tower where the rooms are refurbished. This is the lively end of the strip. Thanks to a previous writer, don't sign up for an airport van to take you to the hotel, it's only $13 plus tip each way. For 2 people that's cheaper than the van and no wait, just step out and go on both ends. Came here for CES. They apologetically put us on the ground floor room 1227 saying we could get a higher floor later. But after the first day I wouldn't trade if they paid me. Who window-gazes in Vegas? Coming back in late evening, cabbies would drop us off at Tower II door and around the corner and we were home, no elevator to wait for or dozens of doors to walk by. Open our window and there was NewYorkNewYork, staring at the little Empire State building. The room was a smoking room, but thanks to a previous writer I brought odor neutralizer which I sprinkled 2-3 times and then never smelled old smoke again. Walkways or trams to Luxor, Mandalay Bay, MGM Grand and NYNY. Tip: We had tickets to see Penn & Teller at the Rio, with 2 hours to kill we took a walk down the strip to see the Bellagio water show (every 15 minutes). When we made it there, popped across the street to the Paris, and hubby saw the sign for free van to the Rio. Saved ourselves $15 on cab fare. Cab lines can be long. When returning to the airport Sunday morning, other hotels had lines of cabs waiting to be called, but at Excalibur one appeared about every 30 seconds, I think because the drive is so short, cabbies figure why not pick up passengers on the other end of the strip where they can get a $20 or $25 ride. Breakfast buffets are about the same price regardless of the lavishness of the hotel, so may as well use breakfast for entertainment. Wonderful amount of food choices for $12 each at Excalibur, but a bit underflavored for me. Since I have to have my Eggs Benedict when I travel, one day we took the tram to Mandalay Bay for a sit-down (not buffet), which was about the same price and I was just as full. It overlooked a wonderful tropical courtyard. Temps in the 40's but sitting there in the sun looking at that view, could have been Cancun. Another day we took in the buffet at MGM Grand. About $2 more, I liked the blintzes and sausages better. Also had chef-carved meats. If you're into the TV screen-sports betting thing, the viewing seats at the Excalibur are much better than the ones at MGM, Luxor or NYNY, comfy leather ones with cup holders. If you have kids, be at the MGM Grand either 11 am or 4:30 pm on the button to see the lions come in. They rotate lions from a park and when the shift's 2 lions come in they're all curious and exploring. It's neat to have a huge male lion snuffling the glass & putting his paws there while teenage girls squeal and snap cell phone photos from a foot away.

Reviews.Title: “Better than i had expected!”
Reviews.Author: angelbabiie
Reviews.Content: My rating is a 3.1/2 stars. We stayed at the excailbur between 29/12/08 - 01/01/09 (mind u it cost us over $900 AUD for the 3 nights). The hotel/casino is quite interesting from the exterior and alive inside and it wasnt as smokey as some people had described it. We stayed in tower 1 and the room was nice and clean and bigger than expected. I liked the bathroom sinks how it was long so i could put all my stuff on my side and husband on his side!! The only let down for me was no coffee or tea maker available. Excailbur was close to luxor, MGM and mandalay where we hang out a fair bit and when we needed quick snack we went upstairs to their food court. Didnt try the buffet as the 2 for 1 was not available during the new years period. We however had buffet at the luxor for $20 us pp and the food was nice enough then we try the new years eve brunch at MGM for $28 pp and that by far is the worst buffet i ever had! it was over priced and over rated and totally not worth the time. Would stay here again if no where else but next time i'm going to vegas i want to stay at the encore coz that hotel casino is sooo pretty!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Bathroom & Blanket”
Reviews.Author: Renata_Tim
Reviews.Content: The bathroom sink was just nasty. It was completely dirty, I could not believe how the house keeper could miss it. It was not only a little spot, but it was all over the sink. There were some dirty spots on the bathroom floor as well. The blanket in the bedrrom had some dirty spots too. I would never go back to that nasty place.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: lebyvr
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel , nice location for people who want t be in the middle of action , close to luxor and NYNY and MGM grand, casino is always busy and alive. loved the buffet , 2 for one between 4 and 6 pm , room was nice , no fridge or microwave or coffee maker , but u can find coffee downwstairs in the lobby. there is a tram that takes u to mandlay or luxor if u dont wanna walk . quiet a walk to Belagio or Paris .but its fun

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: vYrb
Reviews.Content: I went to Las Vegas with a few of my co-workers for 2nts/3days. The exterior is nice and replicates a castle. That design is continued on the inside. The room I stayed in had 2 queen beds and a Plasma TV. Room was very clean, beds made neatly and bathroom spotless. I like the variety of food choices in the Food Court.

Reviews.Title: “What you need, if you don't want to pay a lot more for what you want”
Reviews.Author: Kennelman_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur from 26-28 Oct 2008, and found it to be just what we needed. We had a tower room - the standard two queen/TV/shower configuration. It was perfect for me and my two kids, and all the fun you could want. There’s a food court (McDonalds, Ice Cream bar, Subs, Quick Wok style Chinese, etc.) for the budget conscious, the buffet for the hungry ones, as well as other restaurants, but the best has to be Dirty Dicks restaurant downstairs near the lobby.. I took my kids there and we loved it. In Vegas, you can get a meal for three (including wine/beer) just about anywhere for $50, but the entertainment value of the people that work at ‘Dicks’ was worth double that. We ate, drank, and tipped well, and I hope it was enough. Everyone gets a hat, and they are legendary! They’re made from a roll of white butchers paper with insults written on them. They look like chef hats at a distance, but when you get closer to the victim, you see the sting. A couple of days before we’d been moving through the casino and passed a girl with something written on hers I had trouble explaining to my kids! They toned down theirs when we were there of course, but I daren’t tell you what they wrote on mine (after the kids had gone to bed) The only downside to Dicks is its vicinity to the pole dancing area which my children found a little oppressive. Not really the sort of thing for a family holiday, but hey, Vegas is Vegas. A word about smoking. The Nevada clean air act, means that you can eat smoke-free anywhere in Vegas, although smoking is allowed in the casinos. Now I hate smoke, but didn’t find any of the casinos oppressive in anyway, and the restaurants are fine for us non-smokers. America seems to be finally losing its love for tobacco, and very few people seemed to be smoking anywhere. I have to say the system there is preferable to the UK where you have to fight to get in through sad little groups of smokers freezing outside bars and restaurants everywhere. My daughter is a Sponge Bob fan, and so we went downstairs to the ride there. It’s actually one of those video screen flight simulator style rides (similar to the Star Wars one at Disney) and the price structure makes it attractive to go for all three rides (Sponge Bob, a Log run and an Earthquake adventure) It was run by two harassed and overworked girls who yelled and waved at a distance while running from room to room. Their problem was some folks had bought one ride and others like us bought two or more, and we were all mixed in together so they were trying to weed out people while feeding in others. Not a satisfactory experience, and I’d advise avoiding it unless you’re a real addict to that sort of thing. The other thing to avoid is the rather tacky ‘play area’ It seems to be designed as somewhere to dump the kids while you hit the tables. I’ve been there and done it as regards gambling so didn’t need to offload my two. The whole thing is a cheap flim flam stall with various machines spitting out yards of tickets that you exchange for goods. Trouble is you need ten thousand of them to get anything worthwhile, and everything my son got broke within minutes. We ate breakfast on the last day at the Buffet. It’s fine and very American, so remember whatever the advertised prices add on sales tax and gratuity and figure on at least $10 each. But of course, for that you eat as much as you want and from a huge range. The down side is you’re milling around with thousands of others all looking for things that no-one can locate as the food is spread over an area the size of a tennis court. Again slightly understaffed. All in all though I thought it was a good hotel. I’ve previously stayed at the Hilton, (most of my LV trips have been conventions) Bally’s, and The Luxor, as well as out of town motels and I cannot fault the Excalibur with respect to any of them. It's a budget hotel and has to be seen in that context, but it exceeded my expectations. If I'm pushed to speak of a gripe it was that they closed the main pool leaving only two smaller ones for everyone. Granted we were at the end of the season, but there were still a lot of people there and the two remaining pools were crowded and to be honest, not what I would call sparkling clean.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur - Loved the Roulette”
Reviews.Author: silvesy
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was good. The room was clean and well presented, I found the service to be friendly (especially when you were betting). The swimming pool area was great as well and well positioned when the sun was setting. Our room looked out onto the Luxor pyramid which was freaky. I felt like I was in Egypt and space at the same time. I loved Las Vegas and this was a great place to start our exploration of an amazing city. The only problem I found was how noisy the Air Conditioning was. I don't know if this is intentional and had trouble sleeping after being awake for 24 hours. Wherever you stay I think it would take a lot for anyone to not enjoy their stay in Las Vegas baby

Reviews.Title: “Don't Go”
Reviews.Author: lynetteabill
Reviews.Content: My daughter really wanted to go to Las Vegas for her 21st birthday. We booked an upgraded room in the tower for about 80.00 a night, which is frankly inexpensive, However there are so many bargains out there right now with better rooms for the same price. Upon check in we were greeted very rudely, not at all welcoming. When we got to our room I saw that the bedspread and linens were freshly stained. On our way out to dinner I stopped at the desk and told them. They looked at me and said what do you want me to do about it?? No apologies. I was amazed . I said move me or change the linens. They changed the linens. There were light bulbs out, the shower door was broken, ect. Probably a fine place for young adults. If you do go:: Skip the ala carte restaurant for breakfast and go to the buffet. It is the same price, in fact cheaper depending on what you order, and there is great variety and it is quicker.
