I stayed at the hotel for five nights since I was working a trade show nearby and never was the light bulb replaced. I finally took a bulb out of a lamp in the bedroom so I could see in the bathroom. Sheets were never corrected....not sure why they would have king beds with not having king sheets!!! There was a glass and a beer bottle in the hallway all week until the day I left the hotel. Hotel is located ok near the south end of the strip but walkable to other hotels along with tram availability. Not sure what they are thinking with the "go go" girls dancing on the gaming tables in the "party pit" but since it is Vegas....guess anything goes. Class is not what I would say applies to Excalibur and obviously neither is service. This place is really just a step above a motel 6 so keep that in mind when booking. If the rate is cheap, then it is probably worth putting up with the other issues.

Reviews.Title: “ok, wouldnt stay again”
Reviews.Author: Homer34s
Reviews.Content: Went for a wedding, it has a good location but not worth it. I would suggest taking your time and looking up a good deal there are lots of them. I tried the new widescreen rooms they are average at best

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: dublingirl23
Reviews.Content: good location on strip, one of my luckiest casinos too. no probs with check in or out, on arrival to room, we had trouble with room safe, within five mins of talking to reception soembody came to fix it, after the engineer left we had a follow up call to ensure we were happy, nice touch. found the restaurants and bars in casino reasonable priced too, pool area looked good but was too hot for me. not sure if i would stay here again as there are so many other interesting hotels to see, at the same time would recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: kgeissler
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 10pm and just wanting to check into our room quickly. We were confronted by a man , who we thought was a hotel employee, but as it turned out, he was just trying to sell us a time share and just wasted our time. When we finally got to the registration desk, we were informed that there would be a $1 surcharge per night to have a telephone in our room, regardless of whether or not you used the phone. The room itself was very bland with not much decoration. One thing we did miss in the room was a coffee machine, I thought these were pretty much standard nowadays. On the plus side, the casino was nice and the buffet at the hotel wasn't to outrageously priced. New York, New York was across the street from the Excalibur and after walking around that hotel it appear much nicer. So if I go back, I will not be staying at the Excalibur, but more than likely, across the street at New York, New York.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, no hassles”
Reviews.Author: Herdcyclone
Reviews.Content: First trip to Vegas, chose this hotel because I liked the thought of the Medieval theme. After reading some reviews here, I had some concerns about how this would go. The concerns never materialized. Checked in on a Thursday night about 8PM. Probably a 3-4 minute wait. I was given a choice of 2 queens or a king room. Asked for a king, they offered to upgrade it to a tower 2 room, though it was a "handicapped" room. No extra charge was asked for. I think the only downside of that is that the bathroom sink area was smaller to accommodate wheelchairs. I have no idea why I was given Tower 2. I got the room in a package with Allegiant Air. I tried to be extra friendly upon check in, but didn't even ask for anything. Also got an ok view. I was on the 7th floor facing NYNY (north). Nice room, could have been a little cleaner, but acceptable. Certainly heard street noise at all hours, but it is Vegas, the 24 hour city, no need to get POed about that. As a newbie, I learned the Tower 1/Tower 2 thing. When looking at pictures, I see 4 "towers". Well Tower 1 is the east and south "towers". It is actually one tower as it is joined in the middle by the elevators, and connecting walkways. Tower 2 is the west and north "towers". I parked in the ramp to the west. It is kinda of a long walk to the front desk to check in, tho despite what some have wrote here, I thought the signage to find the registration was decent. If you park out back, and if you have never been here, I would highly recommend just walking in without your luggage to check in. Scope out the lay of the land so to speak. Overall you will walk further, but it will cutdown on the distance you need to tote your luggage because the distance to the tower elevators will be shorter. Think of check in this way-assuming you park out back. You park in Los Angeles, and Washington DC is where you check in. Your elevator will either be in Chicago (Tower 2) or New Orleans (Tower 1). So in my case, the choice would be to drag luggage from LA to DC and back to Chicago. Or walk from LA to DC, walk back to LA, then get your luggage and bring it to Chicago. I guess that is the call you need to make on your own, depending how bulky/heavy your luggage is. Speaking of elevators, when I first saw them, I thought there would be long lines to use the elevators. I was always able to get on the first car. Another nice thing is they have elevators for floors 2-17, and then for 18 and up. So the people on the higher floors don't need to stop all the way up, nice for them. I was surprised by the pleasantness of the staff at this hotel. I kinda figured I would get the surly/indifferent service worker attitude, but everybody I dealt with was pleasant. As for the time share people, I had no issue whatsoever. I saw a couple of them, and most times never even had contact with them. I think I was asked about shows twice, and I gave a quick no thanks, and that was the end of it. Went to the breakfast buffet twice. Pretty decent place for a buffet. Good selection. Very friendly staff. Went to the Tournament of Kings. I love that stuff, and it didn't disappoint. I thought the food was pretty good for a mass production delivery. The chicken was spiced nicely and was moist. Drink service was great. Couple refills on water and Pepsi, and available servers for alcohol drinks. Went to Sponge Bob 3D. Lotsa fun. Way too short of ride, I was enjoying it too much. This was my first trip to Vegas. If I go back, I would probably stay somewhere else, just to try it out. But would have no concerns about staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Excalibur!”
Reviews.Author: Adriansmum
Reviews.Content: We booked in July for a 3 night stay at the Excalibur Sep 8-10. We were on the 28th floor of tower 2 and were completely satisfied with the room. My husband was approached on the casino floor the first evening by a host and was told he was being comped. For the rest of our stay, my husband, my son and myself ate free in the hotel restaurants. We attended the Tournament of Kings show which my 10 yr old loved! At check-out, we found that we owed nothing, and a credit for my deposit was being applied to my credit card. Nice Surprise. My son then flew back home alone to Vancouver, and my husband and I moved down the strip to the Stratosphere. After an awful check-in process there that resulted in us walking out, we headed straight back to the Excalibur for the next 3 days. We had no reservation, but they quickly found us a room on the ground floor of tower 2. Once again, our play resulted in a free stay at the Castle. I found the customer service and the comp program at the Excalibur made for a great retreat, and we will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Overall, good hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Bobbert63
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Las Vegas. We stayed at the Imperial Palace last time, so this time we thought we would try staying somewhere new. We chose the Excalibur Hotel which is towards the airport side of the strip. Our main reasons for choosing the Excalibur were the price ( typical 3* hotel ), the updated/remodelled rooms and the pool scene. To start with, the hotel itself was quite nice. The casino is a good size and the layout is not like the mazes that most hotels offer. We were put in tower 2, which appears to be the one that is completely renovated so far. We were put in the last room of a long corridor. The walk to our room from the elevator was a pain, but there was no noise down there. In fact, speaking about noise, the room we had was so sound proof, we were both amazed. It was like no one else was staying there. In short, nice room ( if typical except for the plasma t.v.), typical lousy view ( the interior roof tops and so on ). You get a 50/50 chance of having a view. We did not arrive until 11:00pm so i assume we got last choice. We only ate at one of the true restaurants at the Excalibur. It was the Italian restaurant. To be blunt, the food was okay but the service was awful. We waited a while to be served. When our waiter showed up, he took our orders, without any chit chat or smiles, and quickly left. It would have been nice if he stayed long enough to ask for our drinks!!! Unfortunately the food did not make up for the service. Lesson learned. We chose to eat elsewhere the rest of the week. RESTAURANT TIP - Try the Cheesecake Factory at Caeser's Palace. There must be 10 pages of items, including 32 types of cheesecake for dessert. It was one of the best meals we had for under $50 and the food was great and plentiful. The pool area is what we most liked about this hotel. While the main pool was out service, ( low season, so we were told ) the other two pools were packed but there were always lots of chairs. We chose to stay at the adult's only pool all week. They have a good pool drink service, so you never have to get up. We chose to buy our own beer/coolers the night before and brought a cooler bag with us. Does it sound like we are cheap? You save money where you can in Las Vegas so you can see all of the great shows. Only complaint about the pool area, is that it needs to be maintained a little better. Some mornings when we arrived at opening ( 9:00am ), there were some things floating in the pool that should have been cleaned before guests arrived. In general, things to do at this hotel. Do rent a car and travel to the Hoover Dam and the Red Rock Canyon. You can travel to both places and be back in 6 hours. If you have the time, drive up to the Grand Canyon ( full day trip ). Our cost for the rental and gas inclusive was only $70.00. We declined the insurance as we had our own. We were given a P.T. Cruiser as a compact car. At night, check out the lounge at the Excalibur. They have good bands playing every night for free. In closing, we did enjoy our time at the Excalibur. It served it's purpose and was clean. The price was definitely right. Would we stay here again? Probably, but we like to try different hotels. If we were to visit again, we would probably go a little more upscale and stay in the heart of the strip. P.S. BEWARE THE TIMESHARE PEOPLE!!! They appear to be nice, friendly people offering help and guidance. By the end of the week, you want to strangle them. I still do not understand why the hotels give them space inside the casino to abuse their customers.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur at end of strip”
Reviews.Author: haleysgrammy
Reviews.Content: Got great deal through travelzoo.com/worryfreevacations so can't complain too much, for the price! Stayed in Tower 1 Sept 14-18 2008. Very outdated and old rooms. Room was clean.Towels and sheets clean, but old, and worn. If offered, you may want to upgrade to Tower II, as it is closer to pool and walkway to strip and updated. Free tram to Luxor and Mandalay Bay, close walk to MGM and NY/NY on pedestrian walkways. NO COFFEEPOT in room-had to buy at crowded McDonalds or Starbucks for $3-$4 a cup! $8 steak after 11PM at Sherwood Cafe was worth the money. Food court with McDonalds,Quiznos, Cold Stone, upstairs. Can get bus on other side of MGM($5 for 24 hr ticket) if you can't walk far, or want to check out downtown.. Excalibur is at the South end of strip, but if you like to walk, pedestrian walkways make it easy to walk down the strip and see majority of the casinos. 4 pools, only 2 open when we were there. One complaint-entire pool area only open from 9am to 6 pm! I like to read paper and drink coffee at the pool, but cannot enter until 9am, even if not swimming!

Reviews.Title: “loved the castle”
Reviews.Author: preciouspongo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in June. We had a great time, not to mention the view we had. The staff was friendly and our wide screen room was very nice, although we did not spend much time in the room. We did however enjoy the view at night of New York New York and MGM. I was almost magical. I would definately recomend stayin here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Girls Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: goddessgibson
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend from work and I decided (instantly) we deserved a work, husband/boyfriend, kids getaway. We booked here quickly and were off by tuesday to return thursday.... WE LOVED IT. We walked the entires strip and visited all the casinos... bottom line.... we'll go back to the Ex. The staff were nice, the room was clean and comfy. We enjoyed the atmosphere, everything was affordable and best of all.... The thunder From Down Under!! Transportation to and from the airport was great. Taxi to Freemont Street was reasonable. We cant wait for next year! Have fun if your going.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: likecruising
Reviews.Content: Good value, good but not great location. Get the new widescreen view room. House keeping good,.Staff very friendly. Casino just ok, but did not go for the casino. Food was OK, not great, not bad, just OK. Tram to Luxor and bay was very good. New York New York next door gave something different to do when tired of Excalabur. All in all I would recoomed this hotel for someone with either kids or looking for good value.

Reviews.Title: “September Las Vegas getaway at Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: danbot32162
Reviews.Content: Three day free stay in tower 2, 10th floor, room 249. Very nice and clean. No blackout drapery for the window but the pull up shade did its job - my view was facing west away from the sunrise. I'd avoid rooms with a view facing south - you'll get sunlight from dusk to dawn. The window faced the swimming pool area. Later in the day strong winds blow so avoid opening the window. Night view of the West valley, freeway , and distant hotel properties was nice, would be better if the flood lights illuminating the hotel were shut off in the early morning night. Flat screen tv was cool, but only about 15 channels available which includes 3-4 of the hotels promo channels. Climate control was excellent. All floor and table lamps functioned well. Hidden safe was in the drawer chest. Full bathroom amenities. No coffee maker. Handy personal swing arm mirror came in handy. Problems: there is a missing towel bar on the shower door , the sliding closet doors get jammed when open fully (the slides are out of alignment) and the shower drain was very slow at first, almost filling to overflow if I hadn't cut my shower time. Maintenance did fix it after I called. Over all it was a good stay this time. The offer I received included three nights in a room with a widescreen tv, $100 free slot play, and $50 food credit for each day of my stay, but I only received $25 food credit. so I mostly ate out at other casino properties and played there more. All my slot play at this property was a loss, even with the $100 free slot play I got back $8. For this trip most of my lucky winning slot play was at the Orleans ($1800 and $433) and Fitzgeralds ($900) downtown. Follow the locals and the experts, play away from the strip. Happy Gaming !!!

Reviews.Title: “Not next time!!!”
Reviews.Author: Catheart
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Las Vegas September 12, 2008. Booked online, and for the price I guess it was OK. No bathtub which sucked....this is North America not the Carribbean. The buffet at supper was awful, but the buffet at the Luxor was fabulous. The room was very basic, but outdated. Maid service was wonderful as was the service as the reception desk. The sales reps at every hallway for the time shares were a pain in the butt...constantly pestering everyone as they walked by. Rented a car at the hotel, which was very accomodating and helpful. Went on our own to Lake Mead and Hoover Dam. The Sherwood Restaurant food was really good and plentiful. Tram to Mandalay Bay was out of service. Be prepared as there is a ton of walking to see Las Vegas. Make sure you go to Freemont Street, its an experience in itself and worth the trip. We will absolutely go back but stay somewhere more central on the strip. Have to say that the US airports were the best I have ever been in, easy to check in, board and depart.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service and not to friendly”
Reviews.Author: redtboner
Reviews.Content: Dropped off at the rear enterance and had to haul our luggage to the other side of the hotel to check in (no line which was nice). We asked for room next to each other they said we can do that, just a couple of rooms apart. Is 40 rooms a couple? Then we traveled back across the casino to our upgraded widesceen room, i would hate to see the not upgraded room. I sat on the bed and broke my behind, hard as a rock, no tub which sucked. Nothing special at all. We went down and played some blackjack and after 45minute and 3 complantes to the pit boss and we never had a waitress, $100 down and no free drinks. Very smoky and mean dealers, they must not be allowed to smile. Pool area was preety nice but very very dirty. There was all kinds of stuff floating in the pools (beer cans, sticks, paper) and a oily residue on the top of the water. We did enjoy the buckets of beer 4 for $19, and $7 drinks. Little far from everything unless you like the 4 casinos on the corner. The food court was preety nice, but dont go to the buffet or to DICK's, the food is awefull. for the price of the upgraded room we could have stayed somewhere a lot nicer, we did have a great time, 4 couples in 4 different room all with the same reviews. We are going back to vegas next year and are definatly not staying here. I hope this helped you, have fun....Go see KA at MGM it is a must!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel for the price and location!”
Reviews.Author: vegasdiva_8
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Vegas and i was worried about this hotel after reading some of the reviews on here. When we arrived we upgraded to a room in tower 2 for an extra $20 a night i thought this was reasonable as i know they would be a massive improvment. im sure if you got a really friendly reseptionist they may even do it for free. The room was spotlest and modern, two large comfy beds, clean towels every day and bedding if required. Hotel pool was great, plenty of beds free towel and waitress service. Buffet was fine for breakfast plenty of choice but its well worth the extra dollers to eat at the Luxor or Mandalay bay. Location fine...but take comfy shoes as there is plenty of walking done. Vegas is my best holiday ever and I would definetly stay here again...as its one of the cheapest hotels on the strip. in England you'd be lucky to get a grotty travellodge for the same price or more.

Reviews.Title: “good, not great”
Reviews.Author: Perthchik
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, but as far as location goes, it's not fabulous! My partner and I stayed in one of the new rooms, with a big screen tv. The room itself was fabulous, we had a great view looking right out to the New York New York roller coaster. No complaints on the room or the service of the hotel , it really was what we wanted, clan comfy nice and Vegas! The hotel itself, not as great. I know you can smoke on the casino floor in most Vegas, but the Excalibur seems particularly bad. So if you don't like smoking, it's probably not the place for you. I'm not sure if they have poor ventilation, or there were more smokers, but all the other hotels we went through were fine. The location of the Excalibur isn't the best either. It is right on the trip, sure. But right at the END of it! We walked from the Excalibur to the Venetian, through most of the hotels, and it took us a few hours. There is a bus that goes up and down the strip, but it's $5 one way per ride! as is the monorail. So if you want to be in the center for a little more cost, choose maybe the planet Hollywood or treasure island. Though even if your not staying here, I would definitely recommend the dicks last resort for dinner, for some crap service that will have you rolling in laughter!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Loved the Castle!”
Reviews.Author: Spadam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur from August 23rd-26th. Checking in early on a Saturday morning was a bit worrisome, seeing as how Friday nights are very busy in Vegas. We figured we'd be told to come back after check-in time. (We arrived at the hotel at around 11 AM). We had booked a non-upgraded room in Tower 1. To our surprise, not only were rooms available at the early hour, but we got into a nicely updated Tower 2 Widescreen Room on the 17th floor at no extra charge (wait time for check in was less than 10 minutes, too!). We had a great view of the NY NY and MGM hotels. The room definitely should qualify above a 3-star rating. The bathroom was large, and the shower was just fine. The bed was absolutely huge (CA King), and quite comfortable. Being August, the temperature outside was well into the 100's, but the AC worked wonderfully and the temperature in the room was comfortable at all times. I felt very secure in the room, as the door deadbolts by turning the handle upward. The casino was fine, didn't win, but didn't lose much either. The nice thing about the casino is the ease in navigating it. Many casinos in Vegas are huge with little signage, but I found it easy to navigate, and not too smokey. The access to Luxor and NY NY is also very convenient. My girlfriend got a Swedish massage at the spa and loved every minute of it. I will definitely look for good rates at The Excalibur in the future, as the location is prime and the comfort level is supreme.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - kid friendly - great pools”
Reviews.Author: saps0306
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur for 3 nights - Sept. 3 -6, 2008. We go to Vegas all the time, but never with the kids. We had a wedding to attend, and we brought the kids along (ages 5 and 2). We wanted something family-friendly, but nice - so we chose the Excalibur. It fit the bill exactly. We checked in, and we were upgraded to a Widescreen room. The beds were not that comfortable, but the tv and furniture were new. We were on a non-smoking floor, and it didn't smell of smoke or anything. The bathroom only had a shower - no tub. The vanity was large with only 1 sink. It was clean - and housekeeping came everyday w/ no issues. The pools were great! There is a shallow pool for the small kids, and an adult only pool. I saw a few hot tubs, but it was over 100 degrees outside, so we didn't try them out. I think there were 4 pools total - all were clean and refreshing. There were plenty of lounge chairs to go around., but not enough shade. The bar staff at the pool were RUDE! We ended up getting our drinks at the kiosk inside and bringing them out. The midway/arcade was ok. Many games were out of service, but the kids enjoyed the carnival games. We also saw the Tournament of the Kings Dinner show. It was fun for the kids - the food was good as well. We ate at the buffet one morning for breakfast. Lots of selection - price was reasonable. They also had a 24 hour McDonalds which was great for those late night munchie attacks. Casino was fun! I won on the slots the one night we got a babysitter service. Table games were crowded - but it seemed everyone was having a good time. Drink service was slow, though. If we take the kids again - we will stay at the Excalibur. It was fun and not too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: 193cat
Reviews.Content: Excalibur often gets mixed reviews - but we stayed in a Wide Screen Strip View Room which we booked direct with the hotel. Got exactly the room we wanted and it was very freshly decorated, comfortable beds and clean. Great view of the NYNY Rollercoaster from our window! Had a couple of minor problems like not being able to open the safe and the air conditioning not working on the 2nd day. Phoned reception and within 5 minutes on both occassions a maintenance guy came to the door, sorted our problem and they were very friendly and helpful. Once they had left, got a follow up call from reception to ensure we were happy with the service. I was very impressed with Excalibur and would have no hesitation in staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rebs08
Reviews.Content: i booked me, my husband and 3 children ages 12, 10 and 7 yrs we had interconnecting rooms, which were nice and spacious and a rollaway bed, the hotel was enormous, didn't like the food in their restaurant buffet, but there were enough variety options to eat around the hotel! tip the staff and you'll get more soaps, towels, etc! overall we were very happy and would be happy to return to this hotel,a good family hotel! too hot at this time though it got to 42 degree's! the hotel is also in a good location on the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Great fun, Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ctg85
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great value. The room was spotless had a big widscreen tv and ipod docking station. The staff were friendly and the other hotels nearby were excellent, we both liked New york New york!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Michael_Gr
Reviews.Content: We, two adults and a nine years old child, stayed at the Hotel on the 25th of June for one night. There is nothing to complain. We had a Widescreen View Room that was located in the north tower with an excellent view to New York New York and the MGM. The room was clean, spacious (especially the bathroom) and the air condition not too noisy. You hear some noise from the traffic outside on the street but this was in an acceptable scale. Check in and out handled quick. Only the long way from the self parking area to the lobby (you have to go through the casino) and back to the room with the whole luggage was a little bit annoying. We also joined the dinner buffet in the evening and the breakfast buffet in the morning. Both buffets offered tasty foot for a fair rate. Unfortunately we were not able to visit the new remolded pool area. Conclusion: Nice Hotel and a good option to the more high priced hotels at the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Hmm... in between”
Reviews.Author: chriskitten8
Reviews.Content: This hotel was OK. We actually got the updated room- the "Widescreen Tower Room". On their web site they advertise that this room is "remodeled from floor to ceiling", HA! The bathroom sink is nice, and then turn around to the nasty old school shower. I was disappointed. The room was dirty (stains on curtain, wall, comforter), loud people above us, poor customer service... but, the pool was fun, and the casino was awesome. Good restaurants and lots of free entertainment there- bars. I'm torn. I'd stay again, ONLY if I got a cheap room. I didn't love the location either. It's at the very south end of the strip, and a walk to the center is FAR...

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!!!”
Reviews.Author: Merycap
Reviews.Content: A very nice place to stay and amuse in las vegas!! Direcdtly on the strip! not expensive!! comfortable!! big room!! fabulous buffet at 14 $ pax. Contact and book by the direct web site for the better price...even expedia could be good... About 35$ except for the week end...raising at 150 $ ...

Reviews.Title: “the most enjoyable stay in vegas in 8 years!”
Reviews.Author: vegasmvp
Reviews.Content: i stayed monday to thursday 8/25--8/28.... at first i had a problem, if you get there before 11 u cant check in to your room, however the new rooms that are 20 more a day are ready. come on now in a hotel with 5,000 rooms the standards are not ready and on a monday, come on. the lady was cocky because she wants for you to upgrade (she was the only problem i had). its a waste wait an hour go eat breakfast at the monte carlo buffet and come back and get your regular reservation. returning to the hotel at check in the man at the counter was very welcoming, gave me a high room with a strip view no extra charge. i also got alot of free stuff with my reservation . my room were the old ones but clean as can be and comfortable and big. the pool area is so great. 4 pools 3 hot tubs and plenty of space and tons of chairs. pool bar is nice but little high drinks are 10-11 bucks and beers are 6-8. they have bands outside from 4-8 and make it more fun. singer came in the pool and sang and danced withthe swimmers. the casino was great won 141 bucks ona 50 cent machine, and won91 on a penny machine....and won 50 on a nickle machine. there buffett ate twice for lunch is great big selection. its aso in a great spot its close to everything, and has walkways and tram to luxor and mandalay bay. i didnt not want to leave! my friends had to pull me off the lounge chair at the pool (lol). this will be my permanant place to stay in vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for the buck & nice place to come home to!”
Reviews.Author: AtomicQ
Reviews.Content: I've been to Vegas 3 times, but this was the first time I planned the trip myself. I chose the Excalibur because I stayed there when I was 16 with my family. Also, the Excalibur was a very reasonably priced hotel that I knew was decent. We got a renovated room in Tower 2 with a great view of the New York New York. The room was very clean and presented nicely. There was a free safe that you could use. I liked the room very much & I thought it was very nice for the price. The casino itself was OK. I am not a huge fan of old slot machines and there weren't many newer video slots at the casino. The card tables were good and there was actually a 5$ blackjack table which I had a hard time finding anywhere else. I am not a high roller but I wanted to try Blackjack so that was nice. The pool was shallow, 3 feet all around. It was nice looking and the area around the pool was nice, but it wasn't really somewhere I wanted to go swimming often. The water was salty but I believe that is a necessity in Las Vegas. The food was mediocre at best. However, all the food in Las Vegas isn't that great. The best food we had all vacation was from Chain resteraunts we knew about like Cheesecake Factory. Although there is a Japanese restaurant in the MGM Grand next to the Studio Cafe that was amazing. As far as food in the Excalibur goes, The Round Table Buffet was decent, better than the Sherwood Forest Cafe. The French Toast was the best part. This hotel was well connected. You could take an indoor walkway to the Luxor which was nice. You could also take a short bridge walk outside to the Tropicana or the New York New York and then to the MGM Grand. The MGM Grand is the southern most station for the Monorail and it was about a 15 minute walk to the Monorail from the Excalibur. I would recommend that if you want to maximize your budget that you should stay at the Excalibur, it's nice and the service is great. If you have a little more money to spend you might want to check out the MGM Grand.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur was great - met my expectations”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter108
Reviews.Content: This hotel had clean rooms and a great location. There is an internal walkway to the Luxor and a tram to Mandalay Bay which is perfect for the hot days. The service was no better and no worse than the typical Las Vegas hotel. While I was very happy with the hotel and would likely stay there again, I would like to let people know 2 things: a. Hotel staff does not understand the terms of their various promotions. For example, I had a 10 and 15 dollar credit vouchers to the restaurant. The restaurant "Regale" initially told me (before I was seated) that I had to use them on 2 separate occassions... mmm....interesting, there is no mention of that on the terms. Lucily, the waitress allowed me to use them both on the same meal. b. The SPA is advertised as a 13,000 sqft SPA. It probably is, but in the relaxation room which is basically next to the jacuzzi, and near the sauna and steamroom, there are only 2 lounge chairs. It's not a relaxation room, really. The staff were great and the steam room and sauna were great. However, would not recommend spending the 20 bucks admission for it, but it's great when it's comped. Overall, my experience was great! Oh, and check-in was quick! Unless you want to spend time in the room, the widescreen upgraded room is not worth the money and neither is the view. You basically see a view of the Hooters restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “good location, bad service”
Reviews.Author: bossladyTexas
Reviews.Content: Arrived early Sunday 8-24-08 (8:30AM) rooms not ready, no biggy. We checked bags with bellman, started gambling. Had a great first day, all 8 of us were up on gambling. Second day, started gambling again, but could NOT get drink service at tables. Even had pit boss call for waitress, when she FINALLY arrived in the area, the pit boss motioned for her to come our way. She looked at him, then turned and went another direction. I headed to VIP check in to talk wih someone about the poor service (we waited on our table for 45 minutes). After talking with someone, we were given a $50 voucher for the lounge for drinks. $50 for 8 people does not go very far when you are paying full price for the drinks. We got our complimentary drink from the bar, then went to NYNY. Waitresses were there every 15 minutes, EVERY dealer was super friendly. I hate bashing the Excalibur, we've stayed there 2 times a year for the past 3 years. We were given free rooms this trip. We all had upgraded rooms. The bathroom sinks are a little tall for short people (5'2"). The peep-hole in the door is too tall also. The beds are wonderful! The room is very nice and HUGE. The Excalibur has a few really friendly dealers. Make sure you find Karen - you can't miss her - she wears a butterfly in her hair; and pit bosses Jun and Jan are really fun too. Unfortunately, we felt we were not taken care of well enough. Next time, we will probably stay at NYNY.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations - Great Family Stay”
Reviews.Author: SEAsiaTraveler27
Reviews.Content: This seemed the best place on the Strip for those with young children. The hotel is clean, offers great shows for kids (Tournament of Kings, Ronn Lucas - although I think his show has ended), and the pool was a lot of fun. But what I most appreciated, having moved here from the Paris, was that there were no extra costs. We pre-paid online and checked out without paying a single extra dime. And checkout was fast, as you can do it all on the TV and drop the room keycard in a kiosk at each exit. All-in-all, a painless stay and well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur is a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: scorpiosport
Reviews.Content: For anyone feeling uneasy about booking a stay at the Excalibur, this is the review for you. This is a great hotel. It is NOT overrun with kids. I saw more kids at MGM than at the Excalibur. It has an absolutely wonderful pool area. (four different pools!) with a live band every day between 4 pm - 8 pm. A slushy alcoholic drink cost $9 by the pool. Beers were $7 (I believe). Breakfast at the Sherwood Forest Cafe was excellent and my service was NOT unusually slow - as others have mentioned. Late lunch at the buffet was also great. It's not going to win any fancy foodie awards but it is, indeed, good food. There is absolutely no reason, in my opinion, to avoid the buffet. In fact, if we had tried the buffet earlier in our trip, we would have visited the buffet more than just one time. Our room was cleaned very efficiently every day. We had more than enough space for two people. We were in a deluxe tower II room on floor 17 which was especially great because it was just a short walk from our room to the pool. We never had any issues finding two lounge chairs together by the pool and we were never down there early in the morning. The water was wonderfully refreshing. There is a small 4 foot (?) waterfall in one of the pools that had just enough pressure to release the knots in my neck. It was a very nice addition to the pool area. The largest pool has a seat ledge built in that is nice for sitting on while in the water. We spent a lot of our time enjoying this simple feature. We listened to a great band in one of the lounges on our last night there. They were awesome. The place was packed by the time we had to leave. I'm not a big gambler but I was able to enjoy 2 1/2 hours of slot play on just $20 in the Excalibur casino. I was very surprised, but happy, with that. NY NY is just a short walk away. We spent some time at the ESPN Zone. I found the cheapest mixed drinks there. I got a double shot of captain morgan with diet coke for just $8. If anyone has any questions about Excalibur, please do not hesitate to ask me. This is a great hotel. EXCELLENT value. I will be staying here again and have already recommended it to many friends and family members.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location- Uncomfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: KatfromLQ
Reviews.Content: We (husband, two kids aged 11 & 10 and myself ) decided to stay 3 nights on the strip in a family oriented hotel. We normally stay down town at the Golden Nugget and had booked two additional nights there. We chose the Excalibur because according to the their website they have newly remodeled rooms with pillowtop mattresses and plasma TVs. Our room was overlooking the pool in Tower II. Yes, the rooms have been updated- granite counter tops in bathrooms (though shower was not updated) and over a/c unit. The beds DO have a pillowtop mattress but NO box springs. The mattress sits on top of a board. We all woke the first morning with a back ache. After that we made sure we did a lot of walking in the evening so that we would be so worn out we could sleep on the rock hard mattress. The buffet was horrible. Sherwood Cafe was good. Kids had fun at the pools and arcade. There is a free monorail to Luxor and Mandalay Bay. FYI- If you use the valet when checking in , the bellhop who loads your luggage onto the cart and moves it 20 feet to the holding area expects a tip and advised us that they are tipped separately from the bellhop that will eventually bring your luggage to the room. We brought this to the manager's attention when checking out. There is self parking near Tower II and we took care of our own luggage when leaving. Good location- near MGM, NY NY, Monte Carlo. We walked to the Belagio and Paris at night once it cooled down but beware there are a lot of people handing out cards advertising GIRLS. We kept trying to distract our kids so they wouldn't figure out what it was all about. Be prepared to be approached often by timeshare salespersons as that seems to be the standard in most of the hotels. If you don't mind hard beds and want to be on the strip at a reasonable price then this family friendly hotel will work for you. Personally, we couldn't wait to get back to the Golden Nugget.

Reviews.Title: “My 21st bday review”
Reviews.Author: crazylilstormy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for my 21st birthday. I LIVE IN in nevada, in boulder city so I only needed to stay one night. Just so we could be on the strip and not have to drive back to boulder city at night. I love this casino. We had such a fun time, We gambled, and we had food right there at our fingertips. Our room was cozy and had two beds. The view wasnt great but we didnt care because thats not what we were worried about. It did have a safe in the room, just in case. The pool was cool, even though we really didnt swim, we were too busy worrying about wondering around the strip on my birthday and being youngsters lol I would love to go back one day and enjoy everything this place does have to offer though. We did have our age and weight guessed though that was fun. I would recommend everyone staying here, and the price isn't bad either especially for the strip

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur - great trip - far exceeded my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: rockfoxxx
Reviews.Content: Just recently got back from a 7 night stay at Excalibur and had a blast! I (26) went with my boyfriend (32). We have both been to Vegas at least 6 times each and in the past we've stayed together at the Monte Carlo, MGM, Aladdin and the Mirage. From reading reviews on here I wasn't sure what to expect... seems people either think Excalibur is great or should be torn down. But I have to say, in comparison with the other hotels we've stayed at on the Strip, Excalibur was pretty great! Check-in was fairly easy... got a Widescreen room in Tower 2 on the 22nd floor - king bed, non-smoking, just as requested. Tower 2 was a great location because of it's really easy access to the pool... although, Tower 1 wasn't too far away... either way it would have been fine with us. The room was very nice, bed was super comfy, TV was nice and we had a great view. The bathroom was big and had a big shower (no tub). Lots of storage space in the room, hair dryer, iron, ironing board, and there was also an in-room safe which I think only the Widescreen rooms have. The pool area was great! I tend to pick hotels with the pool in mind so I was excited to see Excalibur's new and improved pool area. Four pools (one for adults 18+), 3 large jacuzzis, and lots of room. We never had a problem finding chairs no matter what time of day we hit the pool. Also, another good thing I noticed was there were a lot more shady spots here throughout the day than at some of the pools we've been to before. The pools were very nicely landscaped, drink service was fast and the new Drenched restaurant was really good - got some breakfast by the pool a couple times. Excalibur also has nightly pool parties with a live band from 4pm til 8pm - the pool is open from 9am-8pm daily (at least for the summer). All 4 pools were open every day we were there except for one day when one of the main pools was closed, but the pool area wasn't crowded so it didn't really matter. Food choices at the Excalibur are okay. They have a food court which is nice for a quick, cheap eat. The Sherwood Forest Cafe is open 24 hours and was very good and great for the value. We'd eaten at the buffet there on our last trip and it wasn't that great, so we skipped it this time. We also ate at Dick's Last Resort which was tons of fun... we hung out there at night one of the nights we were there and they had a really fun live band playing. Lots of drinking and dancing and very casual. The Luxor is directly connected with the Luxor, Mandalay Bay, NYNY, and MGM, so you have lots of options should you decide you want to eat elsewhere but don't want to hike down the Strip. A few things slightly annoyed me about the hotel, but in no way sullied our stay there. 1) It stinks that all the theming is being removed from so many hotels because Vegas is trying to be so "hip." We stayed at the Excal. because we love the old school Vegas theming and it seems like it will soon be a thing of the past and everything will look the same. I noticed that Excalibur was trying to get more hip and sexy with the addition of Octane (a bar on the second floor) and a party pit casino section with scantily clad go-go dancers (parents may want to avoid this section). 2) I don't necessarily mind kids in Vegas, they are at every hotel and Excalibur didn't have any more kids then any of the other places we visited or have stayed at, BUT there were a LOT of ignorant parents there. Letting kids run up and down the hotel hallways screaming, kids running around the pools and going into the adults-only section, etc. It actually made me think that if you're bringing a child under the age of ten for more than one night (at any casino) you're making a huge mistake. All-in-all, we had a great time at Excalibur and I would stay here again. We got a great value on the room and airfare through US Airways, and we really enjoyed the casino, the pools, and our room. My only complaint (being a girl) is that there was no full-length mirror in our room - but hey, if that's my only complaint it couldn't have been that bad!

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Here Again!”
Reviews.Author: Where2nexttrip
Reviews.Content: Booked a widescreen tower and was upgraded to a widescreen deluxe (a little larger) just for asking! Since there were three of us we appreciated the extra seating area to spread out. Our luggage was brought up promptly and hotel staff were very nice. Our room was in Tower 2 on the 6th floor overlooking the pool, which I thought may get too loud, but was never a problem since it closed at 8PM. Room was very nicely decorated, beds were comfortable, and we never heard our neighbors on either side. Shower (no tub) was very large but not enough shelving. Deuce bus stops were right next to the hotel - $5 for a 24 hour pass can't be beat, would recommend this over monorail. We didn't notice any more children here than at any other property. We found the casino to be a nice size and had consistent luck on the slots. Check out was a breeze with self-checkout kiosks at the base of the tower. The mandatory $1 charge for local calls is a minor irritation. Service was very slow at Sherwood Cafe though food was served hot and was tasty. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: LuciBrasil
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, as expected, but we can here the people's conversation in the other rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome pool area!”
Reviews.Author: CapeCodChris
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've visited Las Vegas and I was very happy with this hotel. Check in was easy and extremely fast. I asked for a room that was high up with a decent view and although the woman hesitated at first (she wanted me to upgrade to a more expensive room), the clerk right beside her was giving another customer a room with a nice view so it seems she changed her tune a bit and gave in. It ended up being a view of the Luxor and the airport, but the mountain view was beautiful! The room itself was nice and clean. The beds were comfortable although I wish I had asked for extra pillows. The tv had alot of good stations and pay preview. The shower was the only thing I have to complain about. It had no shelf room so I had to put all of my tioletries on the floor of the tub. The hotel itself was excellent! There were lots of restaurants and bars including Dick's Last Resort which was a blast! My friends and I went there 2 out of the 4 nights we stayed in Vegas and it was sooooo much fun! We also saw a show of kings and knights where you sit in a stadium like area and eat pheasant food with no utensils...it was very entertaining. The pool was great as well! That's where we spent alot of our mornings and afternoons drinking buckets of beer served by a waitress while we swam and sunbathed. The atmosphere was fantastic! I would def stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, nice pool, creepy casino”
Reviews.Author: ckoncurat
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 3 nights with my husband and six kids. We were upgraded upon checking in to one of the nicer rooms, but our rooms did not connect. We decided to stick with it because our location was so quiet and near the pool. My kids LOVED the pool, the arcasde and the tournament of kings show (we got half priced tickets across the street) Sherwoood Cafe had decent food and was never crowded, bit it was kind of unsettling to march my kids through the casino to get there. Our room was also really nice and had a great view.

Reviews.Title: “Newly Remodeled??????”
Reviews.Author: galita614
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a long weekend stay at the Excalibur. We reserved one of the "newly remodeled' rooms. Aside from the 42" plasma tv and the granite counter in the bathroom, I don't think you could call anything else about our room "new". Some of the tile on the floor in the bathroom was chipped and cracked, one of the faucet handles was turned backwards, the paint on the door jamb to the bathroom was chipped and the bedspreads were stained and torn. We were told that the beds had a pillow top mattress, but that wasn't true. We did have a 42" plasma tv which was nice, but it wasn't so nice when we couldn't change the channel or even turn it off! We actually ended up having to unplug it from the wall to turn it off one night!! Most of the staff was very pleasant, but don't bother asking one of the maids for extra towels if you see them in the hall. She looked at me like I was crazy for wanting extra towels and said that I needed to call to request them because she didn't have extra ones. The Sherwood Cafe was a great place to eat. We had brunch there one day and there were 17 of us and they did a great job of accomodating all of us.

Reviews.Title: “Great fun”
Reviews.Author: jls141
Reviews.Content: Could not have been happier with my stay at the Excalibur - it was great. It was my first visit to Las Vegas and i wanted to stay in a themed hotel as to me that is what Vegas is about. We arrived slightly earlier than the 3pm check in but where allowed to check in straight away. Our room was on the 16th floor in Tower 1, had two queen sized beds and was very spacious......even with two cases lying on the floor! The hotel is advertised as a family hotel yet you would not have known that as there were not hoards of kids running round screaming! The hotel has a number of pools of differing sizes with one of them having slides for kids. There is also a jacuzzi and an outside spa. Towels are provided by the hotel although be warned the sunbeds do get hot in the sun! I would definitely recommend this hotel to people and would stay there again myself. It is not as ornate as the Bellagio or Wynn but if you want a great hotel for a cheaper price, book this one!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Worth the stay for a good price”
Reviews.Author: TravelMoe
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal for the Excalibur, $41 for a Thursday and $81 for a Friday night. It was definitely worth the price. I was very surprised by how nice the room was decorated. We were on the 4th floor facing a wall but I guess that is where they put the $60/night average guests. Didn't bother me at all. The casino is definitely older than some of the other casinos, and missing the pizazz of Vegas, but if you are looking for $5-$10 tables that can be a good thing! pluses: Room was very clean, nicely decorated, quiet, nice flat screen tv, excellent service, great location. minuses: no coffee maker in room, shower was fine but there were no shelves so my stuff was stored on the floor. (it was shower only, no tub). The scene/casino at the Excalibur isn't high class. I think it is built for families but just take the 2 min walk to New York New York or MGM and you are there. Bottom line, I would stay here again. They usually have the best deals and you are connected to Mandalay Bay, Luxor, MGM & New York New York. The rest of the strip isn't a bad walk.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: CNYC
Reviews.Content: After reading some of these reviews, I was skeptical in regards to booking my stay at the Excalibur Hotel & Casino from July 29-August 2. Reading about dirty rooms, bad window views, and rude service almost made me cancel my reservation. I booked the basic room for about $60 per night. Upon arrival at the hotel, the check-in process took no more than 5 minutes. Although I wasn't given an upgrade to those fancy-schmancy rooms, I was given a 21st floor room in Tower 1. I had to say I was scared to open the door. However, after stepping into the room I found it was clean and very spacious. The decor may not be brilliantly colored but the peach/brown theme suited well for the medieval themed hotel. The view outside my window was beautiful. The room faced the castle and New York-New York Casino. On the first night there were minor mishaps in the bathroom. After calling the housekeeping service, help arrived in no later than 6 minutes. This fact earned my respect because of how quickly they solved our problem in such a large hotel (over 3,000 rooms). My family spent some time at the arcade area downstairs. The arcade games were fun, but we would have played more games if the majority of change machines were not broken. The hotel has a 4-D theatre where you could ride and watch Spongebob, ride an extreme log around the depths of the AMazon river, or escape the claws of a T-rex. 1 movie for $9.95, 2 movies for $10.95, or all 3 for $12.95. The sales representatives didn't prove to be annoyances during our sales. I realized that they seem to target couples or families that have at least a male. Excalibur has a free tram that connects you to its sister hotels, The Mandalay Bay/ THEhotel and Luxor. Within steps away from Excalibur is New York-New York, MGM and the Tropicana hotel. Since the Excalibur is located at the southern tip of the Strip, I recommend taking the Vegas Monorail ride, which takes you anywhere in the Strip for $5 per ride. There are other deals like one day passes or 3 day passes. If you are planning to go to the Grand Canyon (which you should if you have time to spare in Vegas), DO NOT GO TO THE CONCIERGE HERE AT EXCALIBUR! They will offer you the $192+ trips, which are severely overpriced. What I did is I picked up those free magazines that you find at airports or at tourists centers and flipped through the pages. I found a bus tour company that offered tours to the Grand Canyon, complete with a small breakfast and lunch, for only $95. I went with my family and I enjoyed it. We went to the South Rim. My bus driver was funny and very informative. He showed new movies like Transformers, RV, and a few Grand Canyon documentaries that weren't boring. What I didn't like about the Excalibur was it's pool hours. They were unreasonable. For a city that booms at late hours of the night, the pool closes at 7pm. The hotel guide, that you find at your hotel room, does not show pool hours. Due to the heat at Las Vegas (which reached as high at 110 during my stay), many people choose to swim either at the early morning or at night to avoid cancerous UV rays. Here, ithe pool hours are from 9am-7pm. I wished they would have changed it. Other than that, my stay was wonderful. I would most likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Travel Agent Opinion”
Reviews.Author: ToonTownAgent
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Excalibur property from August 2nd - 6th, 2008. As a travel agent I received a good fare on an airline and decided to take a friend with me to Vegas as I send clients all the time but had never been. First of all, we checked in LATE. It was about midnight when we got to the front desk, but the line was short and we talked with a cheerful man who upgraded us to a smoking room in tower 2 ( had booked a smoking strip view room in tower 1 ) which improved my mood considering the airline had already lost one of my bags! So, that was a positive experience with the employee's there. * Note: When the airline found my luggage they sent it to the hotel and the front desk was prompt in sending it up to my room for me. Another positive experience occurred when we were trying to figure out the best way to go outlet shopping - a nice man at the guest information desk was very helpful. The room did not even smell of smoke upon entering ( though it did shortly afterwards as my friend is a regular smoker ) and was spacious and nicely decorated. One of the lamps did not have the lightbulb screwed in completely, however this is an easy fix! One turn and... let there be light. It is a medieval themed hotel so it is a little different in decor but still nice for an inexpensive hotel. Security was usually at their desk at the entrance to the tower, though I noticed that they were there more in the evenings and at night than in the morning. I'm thinking that there's generally less trouble between 9am and noon than at other times though. The food court is very reasonably priced and convenient. The Starbucks came in handy after a few late nights. Speaking of late nights, McDonalds is open there 24 hours, but around midnight when everything else is closed the line up can get a bit long. My one complaint is housekeeping. They were prompt in the mornings, but one day we tried to sleep in and requested a 4pm or later service. They kept coming to the room and calling up to see if they could clean yet, and we kept having to repeat that we wanted it cleaned after 4pm. When they did arrive at 4 and started cleaning they yelled back and forth in Spanish, pointing around our room at our things and our bedding making us feel very uncomfortable. We requested they change all the bedding as it was our fourth day there, and they seemed upset by this. Also, they missed cleaning a cookie chunk which was there upon our arrival to the room. When they missed cleaning it up again, I called down and the girl who answered was very apologetic and offered to get it cleaned right away. I should have said yes! I just told them to get it tomorrow, and so it stayed there until we checked out as they KEPT missing it. It was partially covered by the bedside table, which might explain why. They do clean a lot of rooms in a short time and probably don't look as closely as they should. Did it ruin my stay? No. And it was likely not a regular problem there. But it begs mention anyways. The pool area is fantastic, great for kids with the slides and good for adults with the adult only pool and cabanas for rent. I must also mention that if you have a good sense of humor that isn't easily offended, Dick's Last Resort is a great time. I wouldn't go there if not ready for some friendly sarcasm from the staff though. We also had the "tall drinks" which are 32oz. souvenier cups that they fill with Pina Colada, Margarita, etc frozen drinks for $15. Refills are $9. And you can take them with you out on the strip easily - due to their shape, they don't really spill. The walkways between the MGM grand and New York New York were handy to see more than just our hotel easily. A constant flow of people going back and forth, and some good photo ops on them. A few bums looking for a handout, but they are quiet and unobtrusive. We explored a few hotels and this one was fairly easy to maneuver. Others were crowded or confusing. The Luxor is a maze to get to the rooms, but nice. MGM is huge and the whole thing is a massive maze! Finding the Monorail in there is hard, but worth it to get around the strip. Raoul who works the jello shooter bar Monday evenings there is great. Imperial Palace had neat "Dealertainers" ( celebrity look-alike dealers ) and a Billy Idol impersonator on a table but was extremely crowded, even for Vegas. Planet Hollywood is definately the "Party Place". New York New York was nice, and so was Treasure Island. Out of all of them Excalibur and TI were the easiest to deal with. Check out staff not as friendly as the check in, but not rude either. Please note that on top of the $1/day phone fee for local calls, they will also charge you an additional $1 for each 1 800 call. As two girls, the time share people were almost non exsistant to us. We didn't have any problem avoiding them. Overall, a pretty good experience and I would recommend this hotel to budget travellers looking for an inexpensive, fairly kid-friendly property on the strip. You could, conceivably, get everything you need just inside this resort - but what's the fun in that? Good launching pad to explore Vegas. PS - A recommendation - if you've never seen a Cirque du Soleil show, go see Mystere at Treasure Island in Vegas. It was incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hogweed1959
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 night in July and had no problems. We booked 2 rooms and asked for them to be close to each other. We got adjoining rooms and they were large and comfortable. Dicks bar did what it said on the tin, if easily offended stay away. We found it entertaining. Would recommend it for a good value hotel with a great location on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great !”
Reviews.Author: pokyboule
Reviews.Content: We stayed there fora couple of days and really enjoyed the hotel, the pool, the whole atmosphere andthe breakfast ! We already stayed in this hotel12 years ago and found the same level of service. Great service for a nice price ! (only 60 USD per night) !

Reviews.Title: “If it's your first Vegas visit don't pick this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ribena
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in July 08. Arrived around 3 pm & check-in was quick & easy. Had the renovated room with view of the pool & I15. On a high floor so quite impressive. Not sure if the $20 premium (per night) for the renovation was worth it as didn't see the older rooms. BUT, I have to say the shower was pretty grungy, it seems they didn't replace any of that. Overall the room was average like any regular motel. Beds were very comfy though. Be aware they charge you a daily fee for the phone whether you want it or not (bit of a scam in my opinion). I have stayed at Caesar's & the Mirage on previous trips & had a fantastic experience in both room comfort & casino facilities. The excalibur is lacking in both. This is why I would recommend if you've never been to Vegas before pick a better hotel than Excalibur. If I had stayed here first I might not have been so keen to come back at all. The class of the casino really does factor in. I know people say it's just a place to sleep but having the restaurants, bars, shows, gambling of the Mirage quite literally at your feet makes a huge difference to me. The Excalibur casino is dark & has a peculiar smell (like boiled cabbage!), the decoration is uninspiring (compare the check-in desks of Caesar's), the bars are rubbish & restaurants even worse. It just doesn't have the wow factor you expect of a Vegas hotel. The staff were great, very helpful. Overall this one's crossed off my list of returns.

Reviews.Title: “ok, but expected better poolscene”
Reviews.Author: BergenRoy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days in july, stayed in a newly renovated tower 2 room, felt ok here, clean and ok kept, had a few towards ny ny and mgm. The big minus here was the newly renovated pool. There was not much cleaning going on around here , mostly i was coming there around 18 so i still would have to hours of nice bading, but there was so much old towels and glasses and other stuff floating around many places that i felt a bit dirty. It is ofcourse partly to blame to the people wo are to lazy to take their towels with them when leaving. They had live music too, which is an ok thing, but then they should close down the othere music ont he hotel speakers, i really feeled echoing between this to and one louder then the other. And it was so, all the three times i was there. If the problems by the pool we're over i problaby gave it a 4 rating. Had an ok stay otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: hkygoalie
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms at the Excalibur via the hotel website and got a deal of $41 a night for a standard room. When we arrived there was very littel wait to check in and we were upgraded to the widescreen rooms without asking. The location is great and the free tram from Excalibur to Luxor and Mandalay Bay was great. Casino had a wide variety of slots and table games and it was not too difficult to find a $5 table. We ate at the buffet once for lunch and once for dinner and there was no complaints from any in our party. I highly recommend getting a players card and before checking out go back to the players club desk and ask what comps you can get. I don't feel we gamble very much but I got some awesome comps and will surely stay at the Excalibur when we visit again.

Reviews.Title: “great stay the excalibur”
Reviews.Author: mje3
Reviews.Content: great stay at excalibur. stayed 4 nights in august with my wife and 2 teenage daughters, everybody had a great time . staff was beyond great, they went out of there way to make our stay great. rooms were very nice and we ate all diiferent meals and were pleased . the negative reviews i have seen on this site must be from people that can not be pleased. this is not the belagio but for the money is a great place to stay espeically if you have kids. we got our rooms at super rate thru exc website. would recomend this hotel to any

Reviews.Title: “nice sized room”
Reviews.Author: gothepanthers
Reviews.Content: The room was large, clean and we had good views from our bedroom window. Only problem was every time you walked through the hotel your clothes smelt like cigarettes. The tournament of kings show was great.

Reviews.Title: “totally unpleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: penniless-traveller
Reviews.Content: On a fly-drive holiday, staying at 6 different hotels, this hotel stands out as the only bad one...and it was terrible. We arrived late'ish (around 8) after a long journey from the Grand Canyon, so no valet parking and just a sign that said "no valet parking" - with no indication where else to go (and believe me, if you don't know Vegas, driving around this part of the city trying to find a car park space can more exciting than you are really prepared for). We ended up driving for 15 minutes before parking in the hotel "garage" car park (multi-storey to us Brits) and had to drag 4 heavy suitcases for 20 minutes before we found a door into the hotel, and then another 10 minutes to find the reception area (where we queued for another 15 minutes). Despite booking a no-smoking room (which had been confirmed via the on-line booking), there were no no-smoking rooms available. The receptionist couldn't have cared less. The room was with a "strip view" (yes, I actually paid a premium for this) - the sound proofing from the road was virtually non-existent, a particular delight with the screaming teenagers from the NewYork- NewYork roller-coaster keeping us awake until 3am. The hotel corridors were full of uncollected trays and litter. This was the most expensive hotel of the trip and it was just downright rotten. The good news was that, as we couldn't sleep, we were awake at 5am, which allowed us to get on the road very early and drive off to Death Valley (very apt for how we all felt). It has been stated in various articles that 50% of vistors to Vegas do not gamble, they are there as a stop-off for other activities (driving between Grand Canyon and California, musical shows, etc). We might be a bit pathetic to complain about not being able to sleep in Las Vegas, but for many visitors, the only reason they are in Vegas is to get some sleep while touring. If this is how the Excalibur wishes to treat their customers, they should perhaps be charging no more than $5 a night? A rubbish hotel and I will NEVER go there again (actually, not even for $5 a night)

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: NycNYTraveler
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Las Vegas. We stayed at Excalibur hotel, casino for four nights. Overall, a good experience. Loved the four pools and jacuzzi. The main pool got shade till noon - nice! However... We upgraded to a remodeled room for an additional $20 per night. Although the bathroom was nicely done (no tub), we never used the flat screen TV, the light over the desk didn't work and was in the way. The thermostat was hidden and inaccessible, while one window pane was missing. So the room got hot if the shade was not drawn. Also...FYI... 1. Try not to book a tour with SHOWTIME. The bus never stopped in front of the rotunda of the casino, but on the side. So we missed our paid for, nonrefundable trip to the Grand Canyon. We had to play slot machines the whole day to console ourselves, instead. 2. Dick's Last Resort should be avoided at all costs, as far as I'm concerned. 3. Tournament of the Kings was good entertainment, especially for children, although overpriced. If you are traveling with your family and willing to check out a time share, you could get tickets for almost nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as in 2000”
Reviews.Author: warey55
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Excal with two boys aged 8 and 11 in 2000, had a good time so went back in july 08. Tried to check in at 2.30pm not ready, ok no probs we were early anyway ! We were told we were in tower 2, near the pools, Great. When we returned at 4.30pm we are now in tower 1 which is the other side of the casino from the pools, but we could upgrade for $20 per night to stay in tower 2 which has recently had a refurb.Ok my call, but the ladies attitude was appalling, bordering on rude when we explained our previous conversation at check in. A member of staff at pool area also rude to my wife, maybe a crash course in manners needed in this hotel. Pool area very noisy as they have a live band belting out songs all afternoon. ( maybe I'm getting old ) Room ok quite small but clean, Dont think we will return, had a better room in Tropicana. Good hotel for kids, nice arcade, and good position for a stroll on strip, MGM, Trop, New York, Luxor. Recomend King Arthurs jousting tournament with a chicken dinner, no knives or forks, kids love it.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling staff attitude”
Reviews.Author: TravelmanDubai
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on 17/18 July as part of a three-week tour of the South West USA. I booked the hotel because it seemed to be one of the few that promoted itself as being child friendly and had a central location on the strip. For the money the room was fine but any positives the hotel may have had were ruined by the the attitude of the staff, especially at the pool. There's a poolside bar - don't let your kids get anywhere near it. My four-year ran up to my side while I was trying to order some food; up till then the barman had been doing his best to ignore me (I was the only customer at the bar) but on seeing this he threatened me with "no more service if my kid did this again." No polite request or information that children were not allowed within a specified distance of the bar at the child-friendly pool. Just threats and rudeness. The family we were travelling with got the same treatment from a different barmaid. And yet the whole pool area was awash with empty beer bottles. Needless to stay I told the staff where to stick their food and have written direct to Mrs Renée West, President of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Jerry1031
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights during our wedding trip. Overall a nice stay. I read reviews and got a room in tower two. We had 2 teenagers and the pool is right off the elevators of tower two. Tower 1 was a walk through the casino it looked like? Our room faced east and the morning sun was bright so next time I would get a west facing room in tower two. Older rooms, but clean and housekeeping was fast. Check-in was good and personnel were friendly. The hotel show "tournament of Kings" was great and I would recommend. We liked the location with N.Y.N.Y. MGM and Tropicana right by. We got a couple of 24 hr bus passes for $5 and they were great. Nice buses and all drivers friendly, took a while sometimes, but we were able to get all around on a budget. We took a few taxis and they were ok too, but approx $8-9 to get up the strip. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: AlfredUK
Reviews.Content: I attended with my wife for an 8 night stay, having previously stayed at the Bellagio and MGM Grand i did not know what to expect: i have to say i was pleasantly surprised. Check in was quick and efficient, we stayed in one of the wide screen tower rooms, which was spacious and clean. Yes as soon as we walked to the lifts we were approached by the time share people but i found a quick "no thankyou" and walking straight past them was most effective - however towards the end of our trip i spoke to one of the agents near the upstairs food court and basically they pick you up from the hotel give you a free breakfast or lunch give you a presentation then you get either free or half price tickets for a show - if you are there for a few days 4 hours out of your trip might be worth it, i may certainly consider it next time!!. Inside the hotel there are four swimming pools, they got quite busy but then it was 107 degrees on average outside and we never had a problem finding a sun bed. Inside facilities are good with a food court and shops and plenty of restaurants. I found Dicks quite funny actually although if you don't pre-book there is quite a wait for a table as none of the guests seem to want to leave. Buffett is cheaper than most hotels on the strip, food was average but adequate. From the airport you can either get a shuttle bus or taxi to your hotel, if there are more than two of you get a taxi, it is quicker as there are no multiple drops and the price is about the same. Make sure you get down to Freemont Street at night. If you are using other hotels casinos and your thinking "slots or food" a lot of the hotels are in groups so you can put food and drink at their restaurants on your room at your own hotel in some of them. Overall a pleasant stay i like the way you can review your bill daily and book out of the hotel via the TV in your room and then drop your keys in a slot downstairs makes it a lot quicker and easier.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value-for-money hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Gusboy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have today returned from a week's stay at this hotel (I previously stayed 6-years ago but this was my husband's first time) - the hotel is an excellent 3* (in our opinion we would rate it at least a 4*). We cannot fault the Excalibur, we had a standard room (x2 double beds, en-suite shower, toilet, hand basin), tv, excellent air-con, very spacious, clean and quiet (room 15140). All the staff were polite and friendly. It's a great hotel for singles, couples and families alike and the pool area is reallly nice, clean and modern. We bathed in the `adults-only' pool which was never too busy and had a lovely big jacuzzi and plenty of good music and evening `pool parties'. Hotel facilities are very good and it's an excellent location for exploring the Strip. All in all there really is no place quite like Vegas and if you're looking for a good, reasonably-priced hotel then look no further!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced compared with others in the area”
Reviews.Author: alwaysowen
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 10 day stay at the Excalibur, and as Las Vegas goes its fairly reasonably priced. Ideal for families, although any elderly or diabled visitors may find the locaction a bit far from the centre of town, as the buses turn up when they feel like it and the nearest monorail station is quite a walk away inside the MGM Grand hotel. Although the staff were fairly pleasant, we didnt experience the level of customer service most of us have come to expect when visiting America. The room was very spacious, clean and well kept, houskeeping was very efficient. There is a food court on the first floor, with a Macdonalds (24hr) and other fast food retailers for pizzas, donuts, steak subs, cakes etc, providing a good choice of standard fast food fayre. There are a number of restaraunts within The Excalibur, the Sherwood Forest Cafe we found to be very good (24hrs), good service and great food fairly reasonably priced. As far as drinks go, as the average age of our party was 45 years old, we found it quite strange to be asked for our passports when ordering drinks at a couple of the bars within the hotel, but apparantley this is usual practice, so get reception to photocopy your passports for you, as you wont want to be carrying your originals around with you all the time. Beware of Dicks Bar, we paid £22.00 for four pints of lager!!!!!!!! There is a policy of sarcasm towards the customers, which is supposed to be funny, but to be honest its lost on anyone apart from the Americans, we just found it quite rude! So we gave Dicks a miss after our first and only visit. The other bars are ok, with bands on each night. Its a good idea to shop around for cheaper bars outside the hotels, theres a great mexican resaurant by the M and M shop where we found our lagers for two dollars a pint. There are a couple of shows on within the hotel, the Knights of the Round Table show in the basement theatre was good, particularly for the kids, loads of audience participation, jousting knights, tumblers, jesters, knights on horseback, with a meal thrown in. If you are a first time traveller to Vegas, as we were, you may be unaware of the Tix for Tonite ticket shop located next door to the M and M shop just down the road on the strip, tickets for most of the shows on the strip can be bought here on the day of the performance for big reductions, so dont buy your show tickets direct from the hotels. As far as getting around is concerned, we tried all modes of tranport Vegas had to offer, the buses - dont bother - they turn up when they feel like it and are usually packed to the rafters., the traffic is so bad on the strip that it will take you ages to get anywhere. The monorail, which was reliable and clean but could prove expensive and the stations were quite a walk away. We decided that travelling by taxi was best for us, they are faster as they could use the backroads unlike the buses, and more cost effective, but there were four of us, this may not be the ideal if there is just two of you. Althought we probably would stay at The Excalibur again, a critisism we have is there wasnt a quiet corner to get away from all the noise of the gaming machines, one bar away from all the noise would have been nice.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Hopdevil
Reviews.Content: Stayed 8 nights at Excalibur while attending North American Bridge Championships. I found a deal through the hotel ( via Travelzoo ) and paid $51 for 4 nights, $61, $71, and $111 on weekend. Tower I Quick check-in on a Thursday evening; asked for a view and got one of Las Vegas Blvd. Room was big, clean. Large bathroom and shower stall. Nothing fancy, but fine for someone not spending time in the room. Cable reception and variety of channnels could have been better . I took the monorail every day, a 20 minute walk to the back of MGM Grand. Nice to have to pass through NY NY Casino. If you're a craft beer fan, they have a great beer selection in the Pour24 bar on the mezzanine level, next to Coyote Ugly. One day, I bought a day pass for the bus and went south on the Blvd to the Yard House beer bar ( 160 taps ) and the Factory Outlet Centre. Easy check-out too, late on the night before I left. A fine hotel, well-located, easy walk to the Centre Strip. Don't miss Ellis Island Casino for the $6.99 Steak special, including beer and great steak.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel on Strip”
Reviews.Author: daburck
Reviews.Content: Very nice stay. We were upgraded to a re-modeled tower room . There were many families with children staying here. The 24th floor room was clean and quiet with a large screen plasma TV. Very few choices of TV channels to watch, though! Wireless internet was $13 for a day's use.
