Hotel added $1 to bill for the privilege of making local calls....whether you make one or not! We ate at the buffet for "Linner" and the hotel restaurant for breakfast. Both were a little less than average. Very convenient to walking the strip. Pool area was huge and crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the money”
Reviews.Author: MiMary
Reviews.Content: My family of five stayed at the Excalibur basically because we got a good room rate. Also, the pool areas looked perfect for the kids. We arrived in the late afternoon and found out that the pools close at 5:30. Also, to get to the elevators, the children had to walk past a bar called Dick's where patrons had very obscene "nick names" written on their hats. The room was fine, but must have been very dusty because our allergies all kicked in. And our non-smoking room smelled faintly of smoke. The location of the hotel was good. We walked to M&M world and Game Works. However, I would not recommend this hotel for families with children.

Reviews.Title: “What an experience!”
Reviews.Author: lee05
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur at the end of a 2 week US tour, for 2 nights. Like everyone else, we suffered from continual pestering from touts inside the hotel lobby. In fairness they didn't push themselves when you said no. The room was quite large, clean and with a good view of the strip (From tower 1). No real problems there, but drink making facilities would have helped. The public areas, were in my view, horrible. It was hard to get to the room without passing through the Casino - this had the atmosphere of a sleazy working mens club (UK residents will understand this). There were no quiet areas and the cafes always seemed to be closed (Although the bars were always open). Noise followed you everywhere, as it does elsewhere in Vegas, with no peace even at the pool. Would I recommend it - no. Would I go again? Certainly not. Incidentally, I paid more than many contributors, as part of a UK arranged package. Even on a micro-budget, I'd look elsewhere. Probably in another town.

Reviews.Title: “What's There to Love?”
Reviews.Author: marivi90804
Reviews.Content: NOTHING! We stayed at Excalibur from July 11 to July 13 this year. The only reason we stayed there was because we were celebrating a family member's 21st birthday and the majority of the guests needed bargain rates. After staying at Signature, Mandalay Bay, Mirage, MGM, etc., we will never stay at this hotel again! Checking in was not a problem. The person who registered us was snobby though. He told us we were staying in TOWER TWO with a pool view but several in our party had not upgraded and were staying in TOWER ONE. He actually shuddered and rolled his eyes when he said this! He made us think we were getting this incredible room. WRONG! What a shock! Yes, there was a plasma TV. Yes, it was big. Yes, the room overlooked the pool area as well as a major freeway. Big deal! The room was stark and very uninviting. The headboard was black and leathery. The bedspread was old and had holes in it. The bathroom was ok. Did someone say the counters in the bathroom were granite? Are we sure? The bathroom itself was only functional - sink, toilet, shower stall. We had breakfast at the Sherwood Cafe. That was an experience in itself! We stood in a long line. The hostess came up and asked if anyone would be willing to sit at the counter. We said yes and were given counter seats. Then we waited, waited, and waited. My husband finally tracked down the hostess who got a waitress to take our orders. It was obvious that the waitress was not happy to add us to her tables! We did like the Caribbean Stud table in the casino. The dealers and other players were fun to spend time with. The time share vendors were annoying. They were at every entrance ready to pounce! We were concerned about room safety. Either security wasn't there at the elevators or they were drinking coffee and ignoring those going into the elevators. We stayed up very late one night and the person on duty didn't even ask to see our room key. It's really unfortunate that this hotel is being runned this way. It's in an excellent location across New York, New York, MGM, and Tropicana. The tram runs between the hotel, Luxor and Mandalay Bay. You can also catch the Monorail at the MGM. So, if you want substandard services for cheap prices, this is the hotel for you! My suggestion is save a little bit more money and treat yourself to a nicer hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur was fine...especially for a Vegas trip”
Reviews.Author: spadesqueen74
Reviews.Content: You are never in the room when you go to vegas, so I always try to get something inexpensive but with a good strip location. We have stayed at Ex- two years in a row because of the value and location. Of course the rooms are nothing spectacular like the Bellagio, however, we slept well and felt the rooms were clean and adequate. Never even watched tv, so who cares what they had in there. My only problem with Excalibur is they changed their points system for comps. The first year we were there we got free buffets (at least four). We even rolled over some points which ended up being no good when we returned less than one year later. I was disappointed in that, but really that has nothing to do with the room or the amenities. We swam in the pool and found it very pleasant. I definitely recommend Excalibur if you are not a picky traveler who expects luxury. It will do for three or four nights in vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, even at a bargain price”
Reviews.Author: vcb219
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms for two nights in July (14 &15). About 5 years ago we had stayed in this hotel with our kids, now the kids are teens and we desided to stay at this hotel again. We got a fabulous rate and thought it would be a great bargain. Sadly, we were all disappointed. Check in was easy, but came with a bit of a sales pitch. We had booked view rooms but were offered free upgrades to newly renovated rooms that had one catch: they were smoking rooms. We passed and kept our original rooms. The view of the strip was nice but that was the best part of the rooms. The rooms are really run down. Both TVs in both rooms did not work very well. The furniture was scratched and stained. The carpets were stained and the bedding was old. The mattresses were lumpy and had no support, and the pillows were awful. The bathrooms are roomy but in bad need of a heavy cleaning and repairs. One had a broken toilet seat and cracked counter top. The other bathroom had broken tile on the floor and stains on the counter top. Both bathrooms were not very clean: hair in the shower, mild film on the shower door. Overall they were just bad. We agreed to just get through our two nights and never stay again. We chalked it up to a learning experience. One other change we noticed since our stay years ago is the presence of sales people in the main walkways of the casino/lobby area. They stop anyone that will respond and try to sell them show tickets, vacation deals, etc...It is very tacky. As for the dining options they are average Las Vegas. Just don't try to go to the food court during average meal times. You can't get near a counter to order as they are jammed packed with people. Breakfast time is especially bad. During all times there is a lack of seating and trash all over the place. Overall we will not be staying at this hotel again. Yes it is on the strip, but there are plenty of other options. Until something major happens to gut out and redo this place, just visit it as walk thru, don't stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great cheaper hotel on the strip”
Reviews.Author: edinm
Reviews.Content: We spent a week here and had a great time. The Excalibur is about the best deal you can get on the strip. We paid the extra for an upgraded room it seemed to be worth it. The bedroom was spacious with a huge bed and flatscreen TV, we got a great view of the pools. The room was very clean and comfortable. The bathroom was huge with a giant shower and great toiletries. We heard no noise from the corridor at all. You have to pay extra for wireless access but that seems standard in Vegas. We also noticed that there are a lot less cable channels than in other places in America, again may be standard for Vegas. We ate at a couple of the restaurants, an Italian and Sherwood cafe and both were great. The pools are fantastic, lots of beds, 4 pools to choose from and a couple of slides for the kids. Waitresses come round from the bar regularly. As we were there in April it wasn't as busy as it must be later in the year so I guess sunbed availability may be less then. We didn't gamble but we took a coupld of the free lessons in the casino and they were excellent. Staff were all very helpful and our check-in/check-out experience was quick and easy though it does get very busy on Friday nights. We checked out using their kiosk, very useful. There are lots of lifts and they split the floors between them so you don't have to wait long and no need to spend all day in the lift either. It's located at the end nearest the airport, with MGM, Luxor, New York New York, Tropicana all nearby. Transport in Vegas is pretty good (buses less so) but all the same a hotel nearer the centre of the strip would be more convenient. Overall we had a great stay, no complaints. It'd be great for families, lots of kids games downstairs, family restaurants, good pools and of course the medeival theme. It's Vegas on a budget which was perfect for us, if you are prepared to pay more for more luxury then choose another hotel. It was great, just depends what you want from your vegas experience.

Reviews.Title: “Try somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Froggggie
Reviews.Content: Good location between New York New York and Luxor. Hotel itself in need of updating. Rooms dull and outdated furnishings. Poor overall service. Rude housekeeping staff. Charges $1 per day for use of the phone even if you never make a local call. Not worth the money and suggest you try other hotels on the strip. Stratosphere/MGM or Mirage much better value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: DLL70002
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur for two nights - July 18 and 19, 2008. We rented a car at the airport and had a fairly easy time locating the hotel. However, locating where we were supposed to park to check in (we didn't want to use valet parking), was somewhat confusing. We finally ended up with my husband dropping me and the luggage at the door while he searched for a parking space somewhat nearby. One of the bellman noticed me, and offered to help me inside (it was 109 degrees!!!). He helped me in, and even went out of his way to keep an eye out for my husband. Check in was relatively uneventful and quick. We had booked the room online and had already paid 1/2 of the amount for a deposit. Our room was located on the 16th floor of tower 2. The room was clean. We had one of the rooms with a plasma TV which was nice, but my husband was disappointed in the small number of channels. We had a nice view of the strip, but noticed later on that even though the view was nice, there was the noise of the traffic, too! There were a couple of things I that I would have liked to have seen in the room: A full length mirror would be nice, as well as some sort of shelf in the shower on which to place shampoo, etc. (there is a soap dish). Also, the lighting in the room could be a lot better - it was nearly impossible for me to read my book at bedtime... We attended the Tournament of Kings show and thought that it was really good - considering the difficulty level of performing such a show. The food was surprisingly good, and the service was good, as well. Check out went smoothly for us ... we used the check out kiosk located in the lobby area near the elevators. One thing we noticed about the hotel is that there were a lot of children ! I would recommend it as being "family friendly", but I think that my husband and I will choose a hotel with a more mature crowd next time we are in Las Vegas. All in all, I would say that this is a good, clean, comfortable hotel, with courteous and knowledgeable staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good if on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Cubsfan_1974
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Excalibur hotel for 2 nights in July. The room was of average size. There was nothing fancy about the decor but the room was clean. Our alarm clock wasn't working and when I called to request a new one, we never received it. The bathroom had a large countertop area and was large in general, although there was no bathtub (just a large shower stall). There is no coffeemaker in this room (although I didn't mind, others I was travelling with did). The room key card was fickle and it took several attempts to open the door each day. All that being said, the price is hard to beat for the quality and location of this hotel. The casino has a lot of varied slots but I thought it was a little low on tables. The sports book is big and comfortable enough. There is a small food court with fast-food restaurants and there are four or five more traditional restaurants. The Camelot Steakhouse was excellent. The Roundtable buffet food was of mediocre quality but it's hard to beat the price on the central strip ($16.99 dinner). My travel companions said that the service at the sherwood forest cafe was terrible (but food was good). The excalibur is in a good location across from the Tropicana, NY/NY, and MGM Grand, and next to the Luxor. There is a free tram that runs from the Excalibur to the Luxor and Mandalay Bay. I think this is a prime location for families as I saw a lot of kids in this hotel. Overall, a great value for people travelling on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected for such a BARGAIN price”
Reviews.Author: Mexicantourister
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed with in the excalibur, with wife, 2 year old daughter, sister, father, mother and mother in law and were more than satisfied with our stay. The two things i liked the most were that although I booked the cheapest rooms available, paying only about $40 dlls per night, the accomodations were better than expected, of course you cant expect any luxurys at all, but furniture was OK, room clean, and bathrooms were better than fine. The other thing great about the excalibur, is Location, iths hard to find another casino&hotel right there on the Strip for that price. If want to go as cheap as you can, there is a food court right there in the hotel, and the 24 hour dinner is also reasonable priced, and portions are big, Buffet was OK. There is 1 pool for adults only, and the other 3 are for adults and kids, and were not espectacular but did the job just fine. Being a fist time player in casinos, I found that you could actually win some money (change) in the slot machines, and spend a couple of hours with 1 or 2 dlls (I also stayed at the venetian and you could win at all on those slotmachines, and your dollar would evaporate in just a few minutes). Tournaments of Kings was a lot of fun (Dinner was Huge), and shouldnot be missed. The gaming area (carnival) for kids, was so-so, I guess only really small children (like mine) could find it entertaining ( I did win several plush toys). *Tip. Tournament of Kings is about $60 dlls, but you can go for about 37 dlls if you get up early in the morning and go to the other corner next to the M&Ms store and get the discount tickets.

Reviews.Title: “One night stay”
Reviews.Author: VaRobin88
Reviews.Content: We stayed July 7th. Overall the one night stay was ok. The room had 2 queens and was clean. There was 5 of us so we had 3 kids in one of the queens. Booked through excalibur website for a cost of $67.00. If you have kids "BEWARE" of the cards they handout on the strip. They are thrown all over the sidewalk for anyone to see!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: HotelCritic0917
Reviews.Content: My most recent trip to Las Vegas was meant to be a "low-budget" trip (for as low-budget as Vegas can be). So, my husband and I decided to stay at the Excaliber Hotel. We were in a newly renovated room, which at the time, I believe was about $70/night. The Excaliber is a great little place to stay - it's clean and comfortable and centrally located on the Strip. It is a little crowded, smokey and noisy, but then again, virtually every hotel on the Strip is loud and smokey. The only downside are the "greeters" just inside hotel - these are folks offering you "free show tickets" virtually every time you walk past them. Come on now - I wasn't born yesterday. There's no such thing as a "free show ticket", especially in Las Vegas (not without sitting through a 90-minute demonstration about a time share). These interruptions can be a little annoying at times - but if you tell them you're "leaving today" - they'll leave you alone. Definitely don't overlook the Excaliber, especially if you're trying to save a few bucks to spend on the big expensive shows.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Time at the Excalibur!”
Reviews.Author: portocall
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur for 4 nights July 7-11 and really enjoyed ourselves. We found no line when checking in at 2:00PM. We didn't stay in one of the newly renovated rooms but were pleased with the room we did have as it was cold despite the 100+ temperatures outside and it was clean. I really liked that the McDonald's had the $1 menu so we were able to keep food cost down. We did try the Roundtable Buffet once for dinner and didn't care for it. Everything looked great, the taste however wasn't too great for the price. We didn't visit any of the sit-down formal restaurants because we come from New Orleans and can get that at home for less cost. The pools looked nice, but we decided not to go because there wasn't enough shade. I sunburn easily and didn't want to ruin my trip. I would have enjoyed being able to cool down without the worry of sunburn after 5 minutes. I did enjoy the location on the strip. We were able to get to the other hotels easily and really enjoyed looking around. We aren't big gamblers but had fun giving the casino's our money on the slot machines. Actually, we came back to the room with more money than we left with each night so I can't complain. I didn't enjoy the time share people, my husband and I just split up and we weren't approached, however, we shouldn't have needed to do that. They were everywhere so I can't say that it was only an Excalibur thing. When they did catch us off guard on the strip, I just kept walking without looking back and eventually they would stop yelling and hound the next couple or family they came across. I loved being able to Valet the car and never waited more than 10 minutes to get it back even when they were busy. I did enjoy the theme of the hotel and the staff were mostly friendly and polite and I left satisfied and happy. Overall, a good value and a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “fab time!!!”
Reviews.Author: GreenAngel
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i have just returned from a fantastic weeks holiday in vegas!!!! we had an amazing time and had a very possitive experience at the excalibur. Staff were all very friendly and nothing was any bother to them. We got a free upgrade to one of the better, big tv rooms in tower 2 which was great and we really enjoyed the view that we had. We didn't find the timeshare people any bother at all. The concierge desk was very helpful when we were considering a trip to the Grand Canyon and they sorted a booking for us ( everyone must go!! it was fantastic we went with sundance helicopters and had a fantastic lunch in the canyon it was an epic trip!!!). The Excalibur has everything you would need in a hotel, we didn't eat there all the time but the meals we did have were great. We had breakfast at the sherwood cafe a couple of times which was yummy and the staff were lovely. We really enjoyed the fact that the excalibur is joined to so many other hotels which mean't we didn't have to brave the hot hot summer heat too much (42 degrees!!!). The pool area was great you can have as many towels as you want and the live bands playing by the pool in the afternoons was fun. The pool is rather shallow (3ft deep) so wallowing is more the thing to do than actual swimming. Would definately stay there again if we make it back to Vegas. Overall its a great value, relaxed hotel and you aren't in your room much anyway its Vegas there too many other things to do!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for an awesome price”
Reviews.Author: red12281
Reviews.Content: so before checking in i was concerned about the check in line. i had seen a line that was forever long. but we checked in a little after 4 in the afternoon and there was no line what-so-ever. they saw that we booked our room through there site and they upgraded or room. when walking to the room a timeshare guy came and asked us if we wanted somr free stuff. he told us to get settled in and then come down and see him. i thought that was really nice since i had heard about how pushy they are. we went to our room and it was really nice. after reading the reveiws on here i was a little scared but the room was very clean, we had a huge flat-screen tv and even a little reading nook. we did end up going for a timeshare pitch, it wasnt too bad it did take longer then the guy told us it was going to, but it was well worth it, we got $125 in cash, and we got 2 free tickets to a show. there were a few restraunts to choose from while in the hotel, the sherwood forest cafe had a great $8 steak special, the buffet was decent. there was a lot to choose from but ive had better buffets. it is very close to many other hotels which was very convenient. i had a great time here and i would definatly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: AnnaMarie29
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 6 nights recently with my husband and 2 children aged 6 and 8. My sister was getting married in Bellagio. We had a fab time, room was plenty spacious with large bathroom and 2 queen beds, sofa and table area. overlooking side street but view was not an issue with us. Children enjoyed fantasy fayre although some of the games are dated and not working property. They loved the spongebob squarepants ride but I thought it was a bit expensive for what it was. Pool area kept clean and well maintained but would have liked to see more pools open more often. Buffet was ok but Luxor much better choice. Had good fun in DIcks', my parents walked out as they didn't realise the theme was to be insulted, very very funny at the time. Great selection of food, ate breakfast in Sherwood cafe, excellent. Italian restaurant very intimate for dinner although extremely quiet the night we ate there. Steak house also very good. Foodcourt very handy for bringing food back to the room and had pizza delivered one night with no problem. Service always excellent and quick check out service meant not having to drag bags across the foyer. Because of wedding didn't get a huge chance to use casino this time, stayed there 12 years ago and not a lot has changed. really enjoyed stay for a brilliant price of approx 65 Euro per night.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: mindylewis
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4th of July weekend. Vegas was busy & hot. But the hotel was great.

Reviews.Title: “What a difference 16 months makes! Much better this time around”
Reviews.Author: clint52
Reviews.Content: In the spring of '07, my wife and I stayed here and encountered a few problems(Note: the hotel was good about it and upgraded our room as a result). I wrote a pretty negative review. So when we needed to go to Las Vegas on 7/3, the first night of the big holiday weekend, budget and location were our primary needs so we gave the Excalibur another try. Our experience was very pleasant this time., We paid $71 (total $79 with tax and $1 automatic phone charge) for an upgraded room in Tower II. Upgraded because you now get a flat widescreen tv, though if a lot of channels is important to you, you won't get them, and new marble-like countertops have been placed over what appears to be older furniture. Still, the room was clean and in good working order. We were comfortable EXCEPT for two very minor nitpicky inconveniences: 1) When we first got to the room, our hot water was only lukewarm. However, maintenance came up within 15 minutes of our call and he did agree the water was strange. Basically, he put it off to the fact the hotel was booked and water usage was high. No matter, he said he would look into it and suggested we try again in 30 minutes. We did and things were fine. 2) This room was obviously older as evidenced by the window/wall unit air conditioner, like an older motel would have. It was noisy but did not present a problem with our sleep. We did not eat in any restaurants or use the pool. For those new to Vegas, the location is perfect if you want to access many hotels without getting in your car or walking forever. You can access the MGM, New York, New York, and the Tropicana via a bridge and a tram connects you to the Luxor and Mandalay Bay. As others have mentioned, this hotel does not strive to be anything other than what it was built to be-an economical, no frills place for those on a budget. If that is all you need, I think things will work out for you. Otherwise, the surrounding hotels, namely MGM Grand and Mandalay Bay, may be worth looking into first.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the castle!!!”
Reviews.Author: ajmtx2000
Reviews.Content: I too read all the reviews on here about horror stories at the Excalibur, but it simply was not true when I went. I booked for 3 nights on the excalibur.com website for only $60 dollar a night!! At that rate and after reading some of these reviews I was prepared to have to sleep in the broom closet!!! However, tip number one, check in is at 3pm, we went at 1pm and stayed in line maybe 5 minutes. I highly recommend trying to check in early. Check in is at 3pm, but most rooms are available before then. The gentelmen that checked us in was very accomidating. I asked if we could please have a room in tower 2, but he let me know that the rooms there are the deluxe rooms and that it would be a $20 a night upgrade. Knowing that I didn't really come to Vegas to stay in my hotel room, I asked him if we could atleast have a room on a higher floor. Well not only did he give us a room on the 21st floor in Tower 1 by the way, but he upgraded our room to the jaccuzi room which is all the way in the front of the castle with an amazing view of the strip!!! We were so thrilled!! We loved our jacuzzi, after a long day of walking the strip it was perfect to go relax in our jacuzzi and look out the window to the colorful Vegas Strip. So tip number two, ask if any jacuzzi rooms are available!! The room was clean and just fine. The maid never came and pulled us out of our room at the crack of dawn, we always had fresh towels and a clean room no matter what time we finally woke up and got rolling. The Excalibur also has a very decent buffet on the upper level. We ate there for lunch there for a couple of days. There is a lot to choose from, and it was very fresh. Also for two people only $30 bucks, not bad. The Excalibur also has a great players card. I highly recommend that when you check in go register for the Members Reward card. We used it there, at MGM Grand and by the fourth day that we left we earned enough for a $30 comp at the Sherwood Cafe at the Excalibur. We had a hearty breakfast with that certificate and couldn't have been happier. Here is the ONLY downfall of not only the Excalibur but most all of the Casino's, THE TIMESHARE PEOPLE!!! They are relentless, and won't give up. No matter if your checking in, strolling through or checking out they are still stalking you!! My boyfriend and I made it a game after awhile, on how to "Ditch the timeshare stalkers"!! We would walk behind someone else real close, or make a beeline the opposite direction. But no matter how you cut it they are abnoxious. I don't recommend you taking them up on there offers either. We overheard one poor couple that what was suppose to be an only 3 hour tour was a 6 hour nightmare!! Not worth it. Please don't turn down the Excalibur Hotel. I had a great time there and you will to.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special, even for Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: Anabug
Reviews.Content: Outside was grand and unique, but that's Vegas. No hotel is the same. Inside pretty typical, slots and tables everywhere and you'll get lost trying to find your room. Room basic, housekeeping was at a mininum, bathroom could use a remodel (cracked tile and discolored caulk and trim). Sherwood resturant was NOT worth it and the $8 steak was like shoe leather. Second floor shopping, food court and buffet were good and prices to be expected, but not insane. Would stay there again IF I had no other choice. I like to try new things so I would look into the smaller casinos like O'Sheas, Bills, etc. for next time for something different.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great place!”
Reviews.Author: Bowtell
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel because of its low price and great location. We were not disappointed! Our room had good air-con (a must in that desert heat) and the room was large, airy, quiet, clean and comfortable. Large, clean bathrooms with well working shower (no tub). Lots of parking available as well as a valet service. The Sherwood restaurant was reasonable and tasty. Lots of shops in the complex and good links with the other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very cheap”
Reviews.Author: chelle1986
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in April 2008. Absolutely love it. The rooms very spacious and good bathroom facilities. Right on the strip and very close to the MGM Grand the the New York New York. Casino is very spacious and the 3 pools are very nice with some very nice poolside bar staff. Overall a very enjoyable stay and would stay here again as the price was definatly right.

Reviews.Title: “ok..”
Reviews.Author: ladyann22
Reviews.Content: I like the place but theres really nothing especial...same hotel that you can sleep in and wake up in the morning and plan to go out and not stay in the room..But hey,thats the thing there right? All in all..it s ok.... oh..forgot...like the front

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Great Vlaue”
Reviews.Author: davdell_8
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for one night. We booked the hotel from its website for $51.00/night. Check in was very fast. Upon checking in I asked for a room on a top floor facing the Strip. I was told that I would be given a "complimentary upgrade" to a room that met those requirements (normally there is a $30.00 upgrade fee). I was also given $25.00 in food coupons, $10.00 in match play money and two complimentary spa visits (that valued at $20.00 each). We used all of these so basically the room was free - not bad for someone who doesn't gamble very much. The room was great - clean and comfy. We had two queen size beds with a flat screen tv and a nice size bathroom. We stayed in tower 2 which is very convenient to the parking lot and the pool/spa area. The hotel has 4 decent size pools. 1 is reserved for adults. One of the pools has a slide for children (and there are LOTS of children at this hotel) and a waterfall. All of them were very nice. None were over 3.5 feet deep. The casino is big. Table minimums are $10.00 but do drop to $5.00 on occasion. There is the usual food court/shopping/buffet area on the second floor. We ate at the buffet using the afore mentioned coupons. It was average by Vegas standards. The hotel has an indoor walkway to the Luxor which is next door and a sky tram (monorail) that takes you to the Luxor and Mandaley Bay (which is next door to the Luxor). It also has walkways that cross over the Las Vegas Blvd. and Tropicana Ave. which makes getting to NY NY and the Tropicana very easy. Overall we really liked the hotel and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Room fit for a king!”
Reviews.Author: jenwestUk
Reviews.Content: We were in LV for my sisters wedding in May this year, and had booked Excalibur beforehand and got a very good deal on Expedia. On arrival we were checked in and when we got to our room it was not too nice ... Drab decor and we were just over the air con vents and from past experience knew that this would be noisy. When we went back to complain that we did not like the room, the lady said that check in was not till 3 and that was all she had available. Had we been told that check in was not till 3 we could have waited. She then went on to say that we could pay an extra charge for an upgraded remodelled room. We chose this option and it was well worth it... The room was fresh and smart and we had a great view of the strip. Although we didn't plan on spending much time in our room, it made a great difference to our stay and the Excalibur is still a reasonable option in a great location on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “warning”
Reviews.Author: maggiern99
Reviews.Content: When we checked in we thought we were getting the widescreen spa room, we went on line and book 30 days advance notice. During check in we were told that it is not a guarantee and we got tower 1 spa room it was musty, just a room with a spa tub which made the room really musty when ran a bad expeience. We stayed in many hotel over the last 10 years this was worst that in the worst part of Las vegas. People were rude at the bar and the cafe, it took forever to get our coffee in the cafe and the waiter was rude when asked about the steak special. We spent the rest of the time gambling and eatting at the other casinos on the strip and just staying there since we could not go anywhere else. The pool was only 3 feet all around, the slide closed 2 out of 3 days and the snake shack was closed at 3pm the first day we were there. It was out first time staying there and our last don't stay we should of listen when others told us not to stay. We learned a hard lesson and will not recommend this to our friends and family

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Quark2008
Reviews.Content: I felt that other reviews I read helped me make a good choice with Excalibur - It is not the newest or glitziest hotel on the strip, but it is well-kept-up, the service was good, and the price was right. I stayed in an "older" room to save money, and the bed was not plush, but everything was clean and in good order. (For a little more you can get rooms with new furnishings.) I am pleasantly surprised that such a massive hotel can offer affordable rates and still give good service (though I didn't have a lot of special requests.) Excalibur seems to be well run by people who are still trying to do a good job. Some of my family members stayed at a "Luxury" hotel nearby and then at Excalibur, and actually liked Excalibur better, especially for a family with kids. Overall i found it a positive, upbeat atmosphere, and I would stay here again. Pool area is not as fancy as some on the strip, but is clean and nice - food is available at a reasonable price, and there was live music. Be sure and check out all 4 pools - there is a pool with a waterfall and waterslide that you can't see when you first go out

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at Excalibur, would go back again!”
Reviews.Author: dopey1200
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Excalibur for 5 nights (June 9-13) in the remodeled Widescreen rooms (we booked these rooms, didn’t have to ask for an upgrade). We checked in around 5pm on a Monday, with no wait. The clerk who checked us in was very friendly & got all 3 rooms checked in quickly. These rooms were very nice. Everything was clean, the beds were comfy, & the towels were soft. There was plenty of hot water & pretty decent water pressure in the shower. My mom and dad’s wheelchair accessible room was perfect. The roll-in shower only had a small seat that folded out of the corner, but they called & requested a regular bath seat & it was in their room when we arrived back to the rooms that evening. Contrary to what a lot of people say, the hotel does not smell bad & it is not crawling with kids. Yes, the casino was smoky. Just don’t sit next to a smoker & move if one sits next to you. I can’t stand cigarette smoke but I could last in the casino for 1-2 hours before my eyes really started burning. Yes, there were kids there, but the only part of the hotel were the kids might annoy somebody was in the arcade. Even at the pool, kids were not a problem. Pool – The pool area was very nice. Our only complaint was very little or no shade. We were in the pool at 12:30 on a Thursday & it was not crowded at all. There were four pools & all were open at that time. One pool is for the little ones, it was only 2.5 feet deep. There was a pool for adults only, age 18 & up. Then there were the 2 main pools, which were plenty big & well protected by numerous lifeguards. One of these pools had 2 slides & one of these slides was closed when we were there. There were also 2 big hot tubs, each holds about 20 people. We did not use poolside drink service, so I can’t comment on that. There were plenty of towels available & we were able to find a few lounge chairs. The cabanas looked nice, but we didn’t rent one. Restaurants – We ate the breakfast buffet once ($13) & it was pretty good with a large variety. Staff was very helpful & friendly. We also ate at the food court a few times for breakfast & lunch. Lots of options here: Pizza Hut, Quizno's, Starbuck's McDonald's, Krispy Kreme, Cold Stone Creamery. It was always crowded at the food court, no matter what time of day. Arcade – The arcade was big & had both video games & carnival type games. There were quite a few games that were out of order, but I think there were still plenty of games to play. I thought it was cute that the prizes at the carnival games were all castle/medieval themed. We saw lots of kids and adults walking around wearing Viking hats, etc. Check out – We used the express check out kiosks & they were very easy & convenient to use. Tower II Widescreen rooms – A few more comments about this: If you stay in a Tower II room, look for the parking lot behind Excal that takes you right into Tower II. It took us a few days to realize it was there & you can avoid walking all the way across the casino. If you plan on using the pool, you might want to book a Tower II room. The pool is located right outside Tower II, but people from Tower I had to walk all the way thru the casino to get to the pools. All rooms in Tower II do not have a view of the Strip. Ours had a view of the turrets of the castle. Timeshare Reps - I wasn’t bothered at all by the Timeshare people; in fact it took me 3 days at Excal before I realized that the people in the navy blue suits were Timeshare Reps. Just don’t make eye contact with them. If you do, a simple “no thanks” or “we’re leaving tomorrow” will do the trick. All in all I have no complaints about the Excalibur & wouldn't hestitate to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: RickyC
Reviews.Content: Returned a couple of weeks ago from a 4 night stay at Excalibur. I would have to say that the best I can say about this hotel is that it's "okay." I agree with other members who say that if your stay in Vegas is all about being out and about this hotel is a reasonably-priced place to shower (only shower--no bathtubs) and lay your head. If you're hoping to do any quality gaming or enjoy the flash of upscale hotels you definitely want to skip this place. Positives: pool area renovated in 2007 has a nice atmosphere for all ages. Pool's daily happy hour from 4-8 isn't bad except for the service at Drenched pool bar. Also, the hotel is linked by walkways to New York New York, and Luxor and from these properties you can link over to MGM Grand and Mandalay Bay. Staff seemed very helpful...housekeeper was very pleasant and the lady who checked us inn was really sweet. Dick's Last Resort in the lobby is also fun. I t hought the Buffet was pretty good although others in my party thought it stunk. Negatives: Though the hotel is undergoing some renovation, many of the rooms are well-worn, dreary and in bad need of a makeover. Casino is very dark and also in need of a makeover. Gaming is HORRIBLE--if you want a $5 Blackjack table there is only ONE so you'll have to stand and wait for it for hours. As I said before..service in Drenched pool bar is terrible, mostly because they don't have enough people staffing it.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Nice Rooms but still the Excalibur :)”
Reviews.Author: Shelleeee
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I arrived in Vegas a night early and were unable to check into our hotel early because they were sold out so we found a room at the Excalibur hotel for the evening for only $60. I remember staying here as a child and can't say much has changed since then. Literally, I think the carpet in the casino is still the same. The same cannot be said about the rooms though. When we checked in it was a bit chaotic and one of the front desk agents was a bit rude. She passed us on to another agent right before checking us in because her shift was ending and she wasn't polite about it at all. However this turned out to be a good thing for us. The next gal to check us in was very friendly and found us the best room she had available which was in the newly remodeled tower. Our room had a flat screen TV new beds and linens and overlooked the strip. The rooms are also quite large with tons of counter space in the bathroom. I have to say I was kind of bummed out to be staying at the Excalibur but ended up being very pleased with my accommodations. Unfortunately a downside to this experience did occur. It was the buffet. We made a bad decision to have breakfast there. Whatever you do, do not eat at this buffet it is disgusting and you can pay the same price to eat at a buffet somewhere else on the strip, or you can by a cup of coffee and pastry at Starbucks. There is also a McDonald's at the Excalibur and that would also be a much better option. I wasn't able to find one eatable thing at the buffet aside from the oatmeal. All in all, for $60 it's a great deal if you don't mind kids or taking a quick walk to the MGM for gaming and dining.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location!”
Reviews.Author: CDP2008
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and his 2 sisters stayed at the Excalibur at the end of March. We found a great deal through www.allegiantair.com flying out of Bellingham, WA. Checkin went smoothly, no problems. We were assigned to the old tower, but the room was very big with a large bathroom. Our bed was too soft and sagged in the middle. The room was cleaned properly everyday. There was an issue one day when we heard some people getting into a yelling fight a few rooms down. We were concerned because it was getting louder and louder so we called the hotel security and they came right away and told the people to quiet down or they would be removed from the hotel. We were impressed with their speed and how the handled the situation. The pool area was wonderful!! There were plenty of lounge chairs available and 2 of the 3 pools were operating. The service was a bit slow, it took the waitress about a half an hour to bring us our drink order. Most of the time I got them myself from the bar on the pooldeck. The pools were strangley shallow, I guess for all the kids. We ate at the Excalibur buffet, it was your typical Vegas buffet, some variety but nothing amazing. The Sherwood Forest cafe was alright. If you are easy to please then you won't be dissapointed. Tip: Excalibur is connected to the Luxor, go to the Luxor buffet! It has way more variety and the quality of food is alot better. Also the Pyramid Cafe in the Luxor had great food and huge portions. We ate mostly at the Luxor. The casino was lots of fun. We all won some and of course lost some. One of my sisters in law won $250 on a slot machine. We went to see Carrot Top at the Luxor, it was a great show!! He is hilarious! We also went to see Elton John at Caesars Palace. He was amazing! We ate at Spago's at Ceaesar's Placae and had the most delicous meal. Well worth the extra bucks to try a great upscale restaraunt.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur and Vegas - wonderful”
Reviews.Author: rentawitch
Reviews.Content: Loved the Excalibur. Great price. Looks a bit old in the casino and one of the not updated rooms but service for the rooms and all over the hotel was excellent. All the reception areas were very helpful Breakfast in Sherwood Forest was fab. Try their corned beef hash! The pool was very pleasant and very well supervised. Very centrally located. Ronn Lucas' afternoon show was very clever and very funny. Also.. try Olives Terrace for lunch or dinner with view of fountains. the China Grille at the Mandalay bay - excellent Asia fusion but take a torch to read the menu. Quarks at the Star Trek Exhibition at the Hilton AND Binions steakhouse down at Fremont Street. Superb service, views and sublime food!

Reviews.Title: “Was Not What I EXpected”
Reviews.Author: 40winks
Reviews.Content: The Casino was fine, but so disapointed with the hotel. We will not stay agian.

Reviews.Title: “Ho Hum on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: NYClemur
Reviews.Content: We visit Las Vegas three to four times a year because my family moved there. We won't be staying at the Excalibur again. We paid extra over our package from Jet Blue for a renovated room that smelled like a wet towel had been abandoned and had mildewed somewhere in the room. There is no bathtub in any room, although the shower is in a space intended for a bathtub. You will pay $1.00 a day for local calls, even if you never pick up the phone. The sheets don't reach the foot of the bed. The coffee shop -- Sherwood Forest -- has excruciatingly slow service and higher than average prices for lousy food. You can get a bagel at various locations in the casino, but not only isn't it toasted, it isn't sliced either. An employee of a snack bar tried to short change us. We vastly prefer the Luxor on the strip and the Sun Coast, which is not on the strip, but which has much nicer rooms.

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is, a place to sleep!”
Reviews.Author: tarcs
Reviews.Content: You have to ask yourself, what am I going to Vegas for? If the answer is to walk around and check out all the sights and sounds of the strip then I would say to stay here. If you plan to spend a ton of time in your room and the hotel pool then I would probably not stay here. Our room (strip view) was a room with a bed and a table and a TV and bathroom. After a long day of walking around Vegas it was a place for us to sleep. We saved a ton of money because they give you great deals! The location is excellent, you are in walking distance to New York New York and MGM grand (where the monorail is), also there is a free tram to Luxor and Mandalay Bay so you just cannot beat that! The casino, and places to eat are fine. All in all, I will probably stay here again because it is such a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “June 2008 visit”
Reviews.Author: Smallwood4
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in June 2008 - we were on the 18th floor of Tower II overlooking the new and fabulous pool! My boys loved it but I will admit, after passing thru the casino, we smelled of smoke! Our room was one of the new updated widescreen rooms and the beds were updated but they only updated half of the bath...they put in new marble countertops and a new toliet but left the old tile floor and shower - very disappointing. They should have replaced them as well as they were showing age. I was impressed with the security - each time we had to show our room key before we could enter the elevator lobby area to catch an elevator. Valet was great and so was check-in and pool staff. Overall a nice place but for the price, a better deal can be found!

Reviews.Title: “Good deal in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Goofey74
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Excalibur for 3 nights. Made reservation for a upgraded room. Called in from New York and confirmed my late arrival, and my upgraded room. No problem at check in, got my upgraded room - with strip view. It was actualy towards New York New York, but.... you did see the strip. We did hope for a better view, but oh well. No problems during our stay. Ate at the Sherwood Cafe, and the buffet. It was a line at the Sherwood Cafe, and it took some time... but its like that almost everywhere in LV. Not really many anoying people trying to get you to shows - just now and then, but not bad. Long walks to get to things.... but also... thats Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay with Kids in Vegas!!!”
Reviews.Author: jbhcatfan
Reviews.Content: Our 8 year old loved it. She liked the idea of staying in the castle and they have a great arcade and game room that she spent a lot of time in. Lots of stuff for her to do. We had a widescreen room and it was very clean and comfortable. As far as the casino goes, there were a lot of gaming choices. It was a great choice for a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheHighlanderCymru
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Excalibur, and must say before i got there was a little nervous as some of the reviews had been negative, but based on my experiences they must have sayed at a different hotel! Check in was painless, and although I was prepared to pay to upgrade to one of the newer rooms i was told i was already booked into one. The room was spotless and cleaned in very quick time everyday, had no problem with the cleaning staff even leaving some money (couple of dollars) on the bedside table and all still there each day when i got back, the meals (that i took there) were great, although they could have done with some more staff in the 'snack bar') No problem locking the room The staff were friendly and courteous No Timeshare / Show sales people seen AT ALL (other than at designated stalls)! There was a Happy Hour in the pool nightly until 8pm so not sure why some people had the pools closing at 7pm although must say didn't attend myself. Only got to the pool once but found a lounger right away. All in all a wonderful stay and would return in a heartbeat 10/10

Reviews.Title: “Great Venue”
Reviews.Author: OzGirl_1974
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Excalibur with my husband for 3 nights from 7-10 June 2008. Room was large, lovely bathroom and all hotel amenities were great. We stayed in Tower 2 which is close to the pool, although when checking in you had to wheel your bags right through the middle of the Casino to reach Tower 2. Pool area is fantastic - open until 7pm. We went for a swim one evening at 6.30pm and they had closed all pools except for one, so the one that was open was very busy. Booked on the internet and our stay cost approx $250 for the 3 nights. Great venue, especially when the only time spent in your room is to sleep and shower.

Reviews.Title: “Okay I Guess”
Reviews.Author: abbsey05
Reviews.Content: The Excalibur is okay. I wasnt' overly impressed by it. This is a great hotel if you have kids. The service was okay, when we checked in the person at the desk was a little rude and it seemed like we were a bother. The casino seemed to be smokier than any of the others. If the hotel would just put a little money into updating the hotel it would be a great place. The one plus is that the pool was great.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right for Us!!”
Reviews.Author: Bursibunch
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our very first trip to Vegas. My children screamed from excitement when they first saw the hotel. It remined of something out of Disney. When we walked in, we were simply overwhelmed by the beauty and the Vegas hustle/bustle. It is something I've never experienced before. We loved the children's midway on the lower floor and brought back MANY stuffed animals. We enjoyed the food court and had steak at Sherwood's Cafe. It wasn't the BEST steak I"ve ever had but it was good. Believe it or not, we did't visit the Casino but then again, we weren't there to gamble. Our view from our Tower II room was amazing. Our room was clean and comfortable. We did fall into the timeshare pit. We had no idea what we were getting into. We had planned on taking our son to the Tournament of Kinds for his birthday and they offered us tickets at a much lesser price. We thought "what's a couple of hours" to sit and listen to their presentation. Well, we left the hotel at 12:00 and returned at 4:00!!! I refer to it as Timeshare Hell. Oh well, in the long run, we did get tickets to Tournament of KIngs. Tournament of Kings - the food stunk BUT the show well made up for it! Pools - the pools are beautiful, a bit crowded at times, and less that 4 feet deep. My kids had a ball! I have two children under the age of 12. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling with children!

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the bad reviews!!”
Reviews.Author: collierminx
Reviews.Content: We booked a 10 night stay at the excalibur and after reading some of the reviews, i was a bit dubious. We stayed at the luxor a couple of years ago so we had an idea of what sort of standard to expect. First of all, check-in. We arrived at 4pm and there were no queues at all. The only advice i would give here is: avoid the reps. They are situated at the entrances and will try to sell you shows etc. I think there's some timeshare reps too because they only targeted couples. A polite 'no thanks' will do, but gets a bit tiresome after a couple of days so walk separately when you get near them and they think you're on your own and don't approach you! We booked a standard room (£485 ebookers) but when we got to the room it was quite clear we had been upgraded. As a lot of guests were only there for a few days, we assumed it was because we were staying for longer. Anyway, the room was spot-on, big plasma tv, big, comfy bed and clean. Oh yeah and a big clean bathroom too! The air-con didn't work but within an hour of speaking to reception, an engineer had been and fixed it. There were 4 pools altogether and 3 were open for most of our stay, then all 4 on our last day when it started to get busier. The pools and pool area were very well kept and cleaned every day. No problems getting a sunbed, there were loads! Good bar. We had breakfast at the sherwood forest cafe a couple of times and although the food was very good, the service was really slow (even when it was quiet). There's loads more places to eat in the hotel so you'll never be hungry!! To be fair though, i think as long as you've got a clean room, you'll be happy. I'd DEFINATELY stay at the excalibur again and it's better than a 3star. I can't speak for the standard rooms but if you can get an upgrade, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: S19
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 seperate periods as we went off on a 4day coach trip. The hotel stored our luggage free whilst we were away[did get emailed agreement before hand]. We stayed in Tower 1 for first 5 nights, room fine, furniture bit old but hey you only sleep there. The room overlooked the strip and was not noisey, also the lifts to Tower 1 were more frequent that Tower 2. On our return we got upgraded to Tower 2 same size room etc just newer furniture and widescreen tv. If you get a good price stay in the updated rooms but I wouldn't pay more unless its important for you. One thing check price of rooms just before you go as I think the price had gone down and we might have paid over the odds for our first 5nights but the second 3 nights we paid less as the guy upgraded us and obviously saw the price difference. The food in the Sherwood Cafe is excellent[we didnt bother with buffet as you get plenty anyway and we prefered it cooked fresh] and my husbands a vegetarian and he loved their Walnut Salad. Pools really good only downside is no shade after 11.30am so we used to get out there at 9am and sit in shade till11.30 then have lunch.The airconditioning throughout hotel was on a bit high so it always felt chilly. We thought location fine. We used the Deuce two days whilst there, its $5per person for 24hrs,hop on and off brilliant as its a long walk in the heat. The fountainsat Bellagio worth seeing, also Freemont [downtown] the old part is worth getting bus too.If you get the Deuce from the hotel cross over and walk back towards luxor as the next stop loads of people wait there. You do get fed up with the timeshare people they grab you as soon as you enter hotel with your luggage so be aware of that seems like they are being helpful when in fact they just want you to go to a presentation. Just be firm and then just say whenever they ask Oh we're checking out tomorrow that shuts them up. Also on the strip there are people handing out cards for 'women' again just ignore them and don't let it spoil your holiday. All in all a great place and a great hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value! Hard Beds!”
Reviews.Author: Amber12478
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to try out Excalibur for this trip to Las Vegas. The rep at check in was very nice and made sure the room we were booked in was what we had requested. The room was one of the upgraded ones and the decor was appropriate. The bathroom was nice - though a showerhead that is larger or more adjustable would have been nice. The TV didn't get a lot of channels, and when we decided to stay in one night, the "MENU" button to access Movies instead acted as a "LAST" button - bummer. Complaints about the room include a bed that is SO hard - our backs hurt after sleeping there. In addition, the blinds for the window leave gaps that illumniate the room the entire night. The peep hole is up really high - I, at 5'4" had to stand on my toes to see out of it. One last comment on the room - there is a deadbold on the door - you have to lift the handle. However, for the price we paid, we were very happy with the room. The casino played host to a number of very nice dealers who were playful and professional. I was shocked at the number of fellow gamblers who don't have the decency/know how with regard to tipping the dealers - I understand not tipping if you're not winning, but when you win hundreds or thousands of dollars at the table, at least tip your dealer! The restaurants at Excalibur are adequate. During this trip, we ate at Sherwood Forest four times and the buffet once. SF was great for the price and during one meal we had a waitress, Jennie, who was the best at customer service! The buffet has gone seriously down hill in the past few years. One huge complaint about Excalibur is the fact that they rent out space to so many Grandview timeshare hawks. As though it isn't bad enough that you can't get to the hotel from NYNY or Trop because they're at the entrance, they're also inside the hotel at the entrance and at the top of the ramp to go to Tower II (likely at Tower I as well - we didn't check). I just want to go on vacation and NOT be annoyed by these people! Everytime we returned to our hotel from anywhere we just split up and met back at the elevators because we just didn't want to be bothered! What a hassle! Vegas itself was surprising. We've spent the last few first weeks in June there and were surprised by the number of visitors during this trip. It is plain to see that the economy has taken a few blows when you can walk freely down the Las Vegas strip sidewalk (or watch the traffic actually move) on a Thursday night with plenty of room between. Nice for vacationing, though. Finally, watch for the local phone charge at Excalibur. If I had to do our trip over again, I would have refused it at the start and then went up stairs and removed the stupid phone from the jack and returned it to the front desk. This charge is a scam and although we paid it, Excalibur has lost a future guest because of it.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding and Honeymoon Suite”
Reviews.Author: kspencer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were married in Excalibur's Canterberry Wedding Chapel. The ceremony/vows were absolutely perfect and the chapel is beautiful. In fact, the pictures taken in the chapel are prettier than anyone else's I've seen in a traditional church. It wasn't at all like the stereotypical Vegas wedding. The Chapel took care of all the paperwork for us and were very professional. My only complaint was that we were rushed out of the chapel early (during pictures) because another ceremony was coming in. The hotel itself was ok. I LOVED the large jacuzzi in the honeymoon suite! The furniture and fixtures could be updated, just because it's a "castle" doesn't mean everything has to be so dark. Overall, our experience was acceptable. I would absolutely recommend the Wedding Chapel to anyone, but try to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “I loved the Excalibur!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: nessa1dc
Reviews.Content: Well, I'm back...I have a fantabulous time....I'm seriously depressed now....here's my TR: We had a 7:00am flight out of DCA with a connection in Phoenix. The flight went quite smoothly. We arrived in Las Vegas at about 11:20am. A1 Limosine was waiting by Baggage Claim. There were 9 of us all together. We took the Limo to the Excalibur. They let us out right in front of the entrance closest to the Registration desk. Registration went quite smoothly. Our room was ready, we had a remodeled room in Towere II (with the widescreen TVs)....Tower II is not that close to registration. So we trekked through the casino with our luggage and went up to our room (14254). When we walked in the room it was extremely clean and laid out well. They don't have many TV stations, and the shower doesn't have any space for razors, shaving cream, etc. All they have is a place for a bar of soap. The room and the bathroom were spacious and clean....we were very pleased. We gambled at the Excalibur most of the day...the dealers were nice, the pit bosses nice, but I was a bit upset when I asked for a comp for dinner and the pit boss said I had to go to the card desk. Pit bosses cant give them anymore. We had a small meal at the Sherwood Cafe....I didn't care for it that much. I had the chicken tenders (easy, uh)...not real good, but the steak I had later in the week was delicious. I can't go day by day....to be honest, its all a blur, and I'm not a big drinker, but we went everywhere....so I'll do it this way...and if you have any questions, please feel free to ask me. Hotel - Excalibur The hotel was wonderful....we saw a few children, but nothing out of the ordinary. The time share people were bothersome, but I simply ignored them and kept walkin. Check-in was simple and I used the electronic Check-out by Tower II. I didn't like that they charged a $1 a day for phone usage, and I never picked up the phone. Not many TV stations...but when do you have time to watch TV. Casinos - We went everywhere...(Excalibur, MGM, Bellagio, Flamingo, Imperial Palace, NY/NY, Circuscircus, Rio, Palm, Gold Coast, Riviera, Golden Nugget, Fremont, Binions, Planet Hollywood, Luxor, Ballys and Paris)...I think that's it. The best dealers was by far...Ballys....they are so nice and so inviting. I was losing, but had a ball with the dealers. Excalibur was good too. Best luck was at MGM....I had a nice run at Crazy 4 poker. Riviera was the quietest I had ever seen. I mean they really are going to have to make some changes to bring people in.....it was "going out of business" quiet. That's sad, because I really like the atmosphere at Riviera. Shopping - I didn't do any. Food - I only enjoyed the steak at Sherwood Cafe (Excalibur). The breakfast buffet at the Excalibur was delicious and not too pricey. I also loved the food court at the Excalibur. We also had dinner at Emeril's in MGM...FANTASTIC!!!!. I had the seared sea scallops and they melted in my mouth....its pricey, extremely PRICEY....but well worth it. Well I guess that's about it....I simply loved my vacation. We are going back in January 09. We are going to Hawaii for my job and then will stop back through Vegas for 3 nights....I haven't decided where we'll stay.... The Excalibur was great, I simply loved it and for those heading to this hotel...if your in the remodeled rooms, I think you'll like it too. Any questions? I'd be happy to answer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Surprise”
Reviews.Author: runningonthehub
Reviews.Content: I have been to Las Vegas almost 40 times in the last thirteen years. I have stayed in many hotels. I read alot of reviews about Vegas hotels. One thing that I have learned is "beware of the Vegas snobs". These are the people who go to Vegas and expect to be pampered in luxury and have a negative criticism of everything that does not meet the expectations. Before I booked Excalibur, I had read some negative reviews about the hotel. After I checked in, I walked around and was very pleasantly surprised. True, some of the rooms may need to be updated, but what you have here is a clean, safe, ideally located hotel. If you expect to be pampered in luxury, please go somewhere else, Excalibur is not for you.. I ate at the Round Table buffet and it saitisfied my needs. It is not the most expensive buffet on the strip, but for the price, it is a fair deal. This is not the best hotel on the strip, but it is far from the worst. If you want better, expect to pay much more. For the price, it is a very nice surprise. Don't be fooled by the Vegas snobs.

Reviews.Title: “Cheapo hotel, Travelodge level of accomodation, right on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Redspecial2000
Reviews.Content: What do you want from Las Vegas; a hotel that you can sleep in and then spend all of your money on the tables or vice versa? Well this is definately a hotel for those with one eye on their budget. Since my visit they've worked hard to improve the accomodation standard, and the place was looking a little tired and threadbare in places- I wasnt going to complain at $70 per night though! Decent pool, some snack places inside the hotel (standard Quiznos and a McD), and interconnecting walkways to several hotels nearby. Its in a great location- top end of the Strip and perfectly located for the main Casinos and attractions. Be warned about the overly pushy sales staff for tours and other attractions that congregate outside the hotel- they really do get on your nerves after a while. On the whole I cant complain for the price I paid, but I wouldnt have been happy paying much more.

Reviews.Title: “was not bad at all to tell the truth”
Reviews.Author: Michael2400
Reviews.Content: After reading these reviews for the past 3month i was really worried about my stay at the excalibur, but only 2 things that were bad . ONe the time share people do hit u up a lot but they were not just [----] about it so that was not to bad. But the food puke room service, there round table or w.e, was all the worst food prolly in the world. But that did not stop us from having a good time everything was really neat to see for my 1st time in vegas people were nice and i have to say the overall stay was great .. We stayed upgraded room with view june3-7

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel good price!”
Reviews.Author: ChicEngland
Reviews.Content: My husband and i have just returned from 7 nights stay at the excalibur hotel. This is the 2nd time that we have visited las vegas, our prev hotel was the luxor and we were keen to experience another hotel on the strip. We found it very good value for money and also received a free upgrade to one of the newly rennovated tower II rooms with plasma tv, the room was decorated very well and was clean.. We didn't really eat in the hotel as we were keen to go to all the other hotels on the strip to eat. The new pool and spa area was fantastic, my husband had a back massage during our stay of which he thoroughly enjoyed. Hopefully won't be too long before we visit viva las vegas again...

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: truezeta
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by my stay at the Excalibur. I knew from previous trips to Vegas that the ventilation system in the casino was non-existent so I wasn't expecting much from the ventilation in the rooms. The smoke smell definitely stopped once I arrived in Tower 2. We picked the renovated wide-screen rooms and they were nice. The bathrooms were huge, only a shower, but that's what I take during trips. The beds were OK and the wide-screen TV was nice. Only one incident of someone walking into the room and that was about 30 minutes upon arrival - a housekeeper came into the room to "check" the room. We typically kept the deadbolt on (lift the handle up) and there was no problems. The swimming pool was nice. The water temperature was a little cold which was odd considering the 90 degree temperatures but maybe they keep it that way. There was ample space for everyone, even in the hot-tub. The casino was still smoky but as usual the slots were loose. Dick's Last Resort had great drinks and always carried a festive atmosphere. The connection to the Luxor and Mandalay Bay is always an added bonus. The quick eats available on the second level - Quiznos, Pizza Hut, McDonald's, Krispy Kreme and Starbucks are also a plus. No problems, will definitely go back. I thought the Luxor would be better than the Excalibur, but stayed there last year and I actually will go back to Excalibur before Luxor.

Reviews.Title: “maids are thiefs”
Reviews.Author: sandman2661
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is the Pits. You could give me free rooms for life and I would rather pay than stay at this place again. First off, they put us in a room that looked like it was last cleaned during King Arthurs actual reign as king. Of course, it was kind of hard to see how dirty the room was because the lighting was one step above darkness. The buffet basically consisted of what tasted like re heated Stouffer frozen dinners. The staff was less than courteous and the final nail in the coffin was the FACT that the maids were involved in stealing credit card numbers and the three digit code and either selling them or using them. I know this as fact because it happened to me and the idiot maid actually had the items sent to her house where she was arrested by the Las Vegas police department. When I asked the casino what they would do to help make this right, they said nothing, THEY WOULD DO NOTHING!! I asked for some comp rooms, No, they were not interested. Their employees steal from me, run up over $6000 in charges and they can't comp a room? When this place close, I want to be the guy pushing the detonation button. STAY AWAY STAY AWAY. Pay the extra couple of bucks and stay where they actually treat you as a valued customer. I will never set foot in that dump again and advise you to do so as well.

Reviews.Title: “check in clerk”
Reviews.Author: pittsburghPittsburgh
Reviews.Content: The check in clerk told me there were no upgrades on the internet. So I missed out on the internet upgrades. I felt like I was lied to but maybe the clerk just didn't know about the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Satisfied with Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: LavaRaf
Reviews.Content: I went to Las Vegas for a trade show. The Excalibur is linked by monorail to Mandalay Bay Resort where the show was held that is the reason i had picked this hotel. Once at the hotel ,i liked it right away, it is very big . I stayed in the older tower, not the widescreen rooms in Tower 2 and was satisfied with the room, it was clean and comfortable. As some people have posted , the timeshare people can be annoying but you can avoid them. As for Las Vegas , the city should do something about the hundreds of people lined up on the strip ( I am not exaggerating, it is along the whole strip) offering escort services by passing out cards with nude pictures to everyone,There was even cars with large signs with the same messages. They wear T-shirts that say ( Girls in 20 minutes ) It gets annoying after awhile and lessens the image of the luxurious surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: natanddaz08
Reviews.Content: For our first week in vegas we stayed at the venetian as it was our first wedding anniversary so moving here on our second week we knew we were in for a come down but we had a nice stay. First of all we enter the hotel and set about finding our way to the reception we got there just after 11 so did not think we would be allowed in our room yet so i asked the woman at the bag storage about leaving our bags there she was not at all friendly and told us to go and try to check in we might get our room early she seemed really put out that i had asked her a qeuestion and i thought here we go! Howeve the woman at reception was very nice we managed to get checked in at 11.30 which was great no messing about she gave us a high floor as requested. We stayed in a remodeled rooms it was nice and clean with a huge telly and a free safe we had a good view out to the luxor. The bathrom was nice but when they remodelled them they should have replaced the showever as you can tell these are old it would have been nice to have a bath but no biggie. Bed was huge and comfy but the bottom sheet did not always fit which was very odd. Towels were a bit of pot luck you either got nice think new ones or thin old ones! One thing i will say about these rooms is that considering they have only just been renovated i do not think they are going to wear well the paper in the bathroom was already looking like it was getting damp and we had some furniture with missing handles. The rest of the hotel is okay but a little plainer than i thought it would be considering the exterior and yes the corridors do have a certain dungeon air to them but hey thats in keeping with the theme! We tried the diner buffet at the round table as we had a free 20 dollar food voucher to use and i have to say we enjoyed it! a great selection of salads and main corses but desert was a dissapointment it you dont get a voucher with your room then i would pay the extra couple of bucks and go to moore at luxor next door as ths was amazing (one of our fav's and we tried buffets everywhere including the wynn!) Overall if we had a tight budget wouldnt hesitate to stay again! p.s. time share are EVERYWHERE and are no worse here then any where else including the venetian !

Reviews.Title: “In the spirit of it's Medieval decor...”
Reviews.Author: macjule
Reviews.Content: Spent only one night here, thankfully. In the spirit of the Excalibar's Medieval decor: The room was like a dungeon, dark and confining. Sleeping in a bed here is the equivalent of being "racked." The air conditioner in the room sounded like a jousting contest was being held in the room. The televisions are archaic and the remote was held together with scotch tape. On a positive note, the room was clean... I spend an average of 14 days a month on the road, and I have not experienced a hotel of this quality since I was in college and could afford only the cheapest....

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay at the castle”
Reviews.Author: honey18
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an 11 night stay at Excalibur. We stayed in Tower 1 in an older room, which I was a little worried about having read some reviews, but it was fine. The room was large with two big comfortable queen beds, it was very clean and had a great view out to the Luxor. I like the fact that the in room safe was free of charge, I have stayed in another strip hotel that charged for the safe and when staying for 11 nights this could have ended up expensive! Check in and out was a breeze and as we were two women travelling together we never got bothered by the timeshare people (I did see them bothering lots of couples though and can see how this can be irritating). The hotel has a lovely pool area which is large and has lots of space, we never had any trouble getting a bed and even managed to find some areas with some shade! The casino is large but I did find it a bit smokey. The location of the hotel is good but having previously staying at a hotel with a monorail station, I missed that (tried using the Deuce bus but oh my god it takes forever to get anywhere). The free monorail to the Mandalay Bay is great though. I would stay here again as it is great value for money (we got a brilliant deal) with lots of good amenities.

Reviews.Title: “good stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: klein3
Reviews.Content: this was our first time to vegas and we booked this hotel based on reviews, we upgraded our room to the big tv and newer rooms and had a great room with no problems. the hotel is very basic and was looking a little run down but overall very good value for the price. we walked in all the other hotels and liked what we saw and what they provided, tigerss at mgm, flamingo`s at flamingo and stuff like that and we didn`t have to pay for any of it, one reason our room was probably cheaper then there. over all a very good stay and good location to everything that we were looking for, we would stay there again if we went back

Reviews.Title: “Everything was average”
Reviews.Author: renegadeTM
Reviews.Content: We booked our room online and got a 30 day promotional special that included a $51.00 a night room along with a $25.00 food credit and two spa passes. We had a room in tower 1 which has not been updated recently. We heard that tower 2 has been recently updated with flat screen TV's, but our room had an older TV and furniture. The room was fine for the price. It was clean and the bathroom was nice enough. Nothing fancy, but good enough for the price. We did like the large shower, but there isn't much space for accessories in the shower itself. The sink area is nice and big and plenty of room for toiletries. Maid service was good. We used our food credit at the round table lunch buffet. With our food credit we ended up only having to pay $3.00 for two people to eat. The food is average. Nothing spectacular, but fine for the price. We checked other buffets and they were more expensive. They may have been better, but we were satisfied with the average food. The pool area is very nice. The pool area has just been renovated. There is one pool that seems to be for adults only and it was nice and relaxing and quiet. The other pools, including one that has two waterslides, is more geared towards children and families. Plenty of seats available around pool areas and a nice bar and restaurant conveniently located. Overall a nice pool area with very little shade. One thing to note is that Tower 2 is closer to the pool area. If you stay in Tower 1 you will have to walk through the Casino to get to the pool, but it isn't that bad of a walk. It is pretty much a straight walk right through the Casino. Casino is a nice size and easy to get around. It isn't as large as some of the other newer and fancier hotel casinos, but it is user friendly. We stayed Monday - Friday and there were alot of $5.00 table game limits, which is nice if you don't want to pay higher limits to gamble. We watched the Tournament of Kings show and enjoyed it very much. It is alot different from the other Vegas shows that are offered and not a bad price because it includes a meal. However, the meal must be eaten with your fingers. They do not provide utensils because they are staying with the Medieval theme of the show. We were served Tomato Soup, Cornish Hen, Jo Jo Potatoes, Broccoli, roll and apple dessert. The hen was very good and the soup and apple dessert were tasty, but the potatoes and Broccoli were nothing spectacular. Overall we enjoyed the show very much. Overall we enjoyed our stay at the Excalibur and we would stay there again.
