Reviews.Title: “Good location, looking a bit tired.”
Reviews.Author: Melarnie
Reviews.Content: This hotel was going to be the luxury part of our journey. We wanted somewhere on the main strip and somewhere to feel part of the buzz of Vegas. We did get these two things. It was on the strip, it was buzzing with people and excitement, but somehow failed to tick the wow factor. When we arrived, our room was upgraded which we were thrilled about. However, the room despite being clean looked tired and a bit knocked about. There was a huge jacuzzi bath in the bedroom that looked in need of some new fittings which took the shine off the room a bit. Despite being a city that doesn't sleep, room service most definitely does! We lost track of time and nearly missed last orders at 11! When the food arrived, it was late, not what we ordered, and not great tasting either. A bit of a let down. Also, in the first 5 minutes of arriving we were approached TWICE by hotel staff trying to hawk us show tickets. Its to be expected in Vegas, but it was really slick sales.... one to watch out for for the novice. Overall, ok hotel, good location, but left me wondering what the other hotels were like.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool area”
Reviews.Author: travelerk_8
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 5/13-18 in Tower I. Standard room was average. Furniture could use updating. No tub, coffee pot or refridgerator in room. People trying to push time-shares which is irritating. Watch for hidden charges! We were charged $1.00/day to have a phone in the room (whether you use it or not). Pay attention to what you are signing upon check-in. (I was told I initialed a section agreeing to this charge). I have never paid for having a phone in a room anywhere & travel ofren. What's next, a daily charge to have a shower in the room?!!! Pool area was great. Never a problem getting a seat. Vegas in general is not the place for kids. People on street handing out cards picturing bare-chested women for hire. These cards are all over the ground, on telephone poles, etc. Sex is pushed everywhere for all eyes to see.

Reviews.Title: “Marginal rooms for the price”
Reviews.Author: tuckmics
Reviews.Content: After reading some other reviews here, glad to hear that Tower II has upgraded rooms. Hopefully, Tower I will get the same treatment soon. The rooms are certainly serviceable and clean, but everything is old (I'm sure from the late 80s when the hotel was built). The bedspreads where threadbare and the towels had a strange odor. The room (which was non-smoking) and the hallways all had a stale cigarette odor. If I had paid $100 or less a night, I would probably recommend this property, but at around $150/night, there are other properties with better rooms. Granted, you don't spend a lot of time in your room, but still. The casino was OK, though as with many of the places on the strip, they are huge and it takes hours to walk from one place to another. As others have mentioned, the food was OK but the pool area was very nice...definately the best amenity on the property. If you can get a good rate, it is a reasonable hotel/casino in a pretty good location at the South end of the strip. Close to the Luxor and Mandalay Bay (the former has a nicer casino and the latter has superior food service) which are connected to each other both by interior walkways and a free tram.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: starbelrus
Reviews.Content: I was not looking forward to staying here but it was Memorial Day weekend and this was the only thing that was a reasonable price on the strip. I actually ended up spending a bit more and got into their newly renovated room and still it was cheaper than all the other hotels on the strip. This newly renovated room had a flat screen TV, the most comfortable pillows and bed, and was super clean!!!! It is at the end of the strip so it’s quite and peaceful. We went to the spa and it was okay - not great but okay. The buffet here is awful, so def skip if you can. Check-in was easy. Check-out would have been easy too but they tack on a $1 a day fee for local calls so even if you did not make any calls you still have to pay this! Apparently, when you check in they have you initial something that says they do this but I have never seen that happen anywhere else that I have stayed. We argued with the manager and in the end got that taken off the bill!!! But I was rather annoyed that they sneak that in and most people just pay it! Anyway, I would recommend this place. Def. not as glitzy as some places but a good value overall.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: Kane_richards
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a mate last summer and thoroughly enjoyed my time.We were on the 4th floor so the view outside the window was less than to be desired (it was a wall.... go figure). The room I shared with my mate was large enough for us both to have a double bed each and the whole room was clean. At the time of staying however there seemed to be a degree of work being done to the pool so in order to actually get there we had to walk through a sort of make shift tunnel however I believe that this work was meant to finish not soon after we left Vegas. The hotel itself is vast enough to wander about in at night if you prefer a quieter one than you'd have if you went on the strip and it's also connected to the Luxor so you never really have to go outside into the heat if you don't want to (I'm Scottish, heat and me don't go well). There are a number of shops in the Casino itself if you like that sort of thing as well as places to eat (I do hope that when I go back the 24 hour Krispy Kreme is still there, something we don't get in the UK!) The only issue I can think of with the hotel is it's location as it's pretty much at one end of the strip so if you want to see anything you will have to walk but I suppose if you're goign on Holiday in Vegas you're expecting to do a bit of walking and we never really complained about that. Overall a place I thoroughly enjoyed staying. It gave us everything we expected of a hotel room in Vegas and I would defiantely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very UNSAFE! Poor Service.”
Reviews.Author: daymeeyan
Reviews.Content: I would say I'm in vegas 2-3 times per year either on business or personal. I also write lots of reviews and have to say this is the most harsh review I'll write thus far. I checked in on a Sunday night and was assigned a room in Tower II which is the nicer one as it has been updated more recently. The room itself was nicely done. 42" plasma TV, nice furniture, etc. I just noticed an oily stain on one of the bed spreads. Good thing there were 2 beds and I only needed 1. The first thing I noticed was that there was NO dead bolt on the door and no security latch. Very strange, but I thought I'm in a casino where security has to be top notch. I checked in around 7pm quickly went to eat and then went to bed at 11pm as I was there for a conference and had to be up at 6am. At 1:30am someone barges into my room and completely startles me. Heart racing I end up yelling and the guy just said "sorry" and exits the room. One of the scariest moments of my life. I tried to call the front desk, but it took 20 min of constant ringing before someone even answered the phone. They tried to tell me that they knew about someone coming into my room and it was their fault as they were checking for "unoccupied" rooms and the guy must have went to the wrong room #. CHECKING for EMPTY ROOMS ON a SUNDAY NIGHT 1:30AM?!?!! They just told me to dead bolt the door which I told them was non-existent and he just sounded surprised there's no dead bolt. So all I got was an apology and I couldn't get back to sleep which completely ruins my first day of the conference. Next morning I go down to reception and complain to the person who is wearing the "supervisor" name tag. She just acted all surprised and just apologized. No offer to make things right. I couldn't care if they offered me a free night or free buffet since my company was expensing everything, but they could have at least offered. I did learn that you CAN dead bolt the door. All you have to do is turn the door handle up. I found this out as I was telling a co-worker my story and he told me what to do. He said there's a sticker on the back of his door in the older rooms of Tower I. Definitely no instructions in my room. So that event ruined my week since I just didn't feel safe in this hotel and had no faith in the management as I really think they sent someone to break into my room with full knowledge of what was happening. I can't understand why they would check for empty rooms at 1:30am. I even had the "Privacy Please" sign on the door. On other aspects of the hotel. Internet is wired not wireless and cost is $12.99/24h. Bathroom has a shower only and no tub in case that matters to you. The sink and counter are higher up which is good for taller people, but bad for shorter people. Pool area is very nice with 3 pools. One of those is designated for adults only. Food in this hotel is probably the worst on the strip, just walk across to MGM for better restaurants. The kids area in the basement is a joke. Take your kids to Circus Circus instead.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay for the price.”
Reviews.Author: muzzer_mc
Reviews.Content: My Friend and I stay here for a Week in July 07. Check in was quick and Easy. Can't remmber what Tower the put us in but they asked if we wanted a high room and one closer to the ground, I have a small dislike of lifts so asked for one closer to the ground, which meant we had a view of a brick wall. But the room was Big, Two double beds, Decent size TV, Big Bath room, Clean and smell free. The Casino was good to play in. We Ate a few times in the hotel. Once at the Buffet which was decent but not the best, McDonalds for lunch and the hotels own 'fast food' counter which the hot dog was pretty bad. There are other places to eat there but didn't try them all. The hotel has a link to the Luxor so the hotel feels even bigger than it does. We choose this hotel because it was a good price and more central on the strip than other hotels we looked at.

Reviews.Title: “I won't recommend staying here”
Reviews.Author: PisceanCouple
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel last weekend (May 17th). We originally booked to stay for 2 nights, but we ended up staying only one night after our hotel room was broken into Sunday morning while we were sleeping! My niece's purse and her boyfriend's wallet were taken and the thieves left them on the hallway after taking all the cash and credit cards. We had called security and they were rude. As we told them what happened, they pointed out the items that the thieves could have taken that were not taken. One of the security guys was humming while we were filling out the report. The management called our room later on and mentioned that security reported that there were 6 people stayin in the room when it was only registered for 4. There was actually only one extra person but she only happened to stay there one night. The lady on the phone demanded that the extra person leaves. It was like kicking us while we're down. Therefore, we decided that we no longer felt safe staying in the hotel another night and not particularly in that room. When we checked out, the lady who assisted us was a trainee and needed a supervisor / manager to approve the process. The manager did not even bother to look at us and acknowledge us. Good customer service is acknowledging your customers regardless of their experience with the hotel and hopefully the customers will consider coming back. But after the incident and the attitude we experienced from the workers, I don't think I will ever recommend this hotel to anyone I know. Another thing is that the doors don't have 2nd locks. You'll have to rely on the door shutting by itself and the only way to get in from the outside is through the card key. When we called for police report, the cop who came to assist us was surprised to see that the door didn't have a 2nd lock and she was concerned about that. After coming back to the bay area and sharing my experience. I learned from others that Excalibur is knowng for having "snatch and grab" robberies.. I've heard of specfic stories which actually led people thinking that it could even be an inside job. I'm not too sure about this one, but either way. I will never go back to that hotel nor will I ever recommend it to anyone. They have poor customer service and security.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: thesarah
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Excalibur May 12-16, 2008 and was very happy with my stay. I booked through a discount airline and got a great deal ($300 per person for flight and hotel). I was given a newly remodeled Tower II room for no extra charge without even asking. The rooms have newer furniture, a large flat screen TV and granite countertops. The guest services people were very friendly and always willing to help. The one real negative at Excalibur is that there are no bathtubs. The stand-up shower is quite large but there is really no place to put shampoo, soap, etc. A tub would have been nice after long days walking the strip. There are also no coffee makers but coffee is readily available in the casino. I also ate at the Camelot Steakhouse during my stay. The food was very good but the service was substandard and the prices were really high. Excalibur has a pretty good location on the south end of the strip. There is a walkway to New York, New York; Tropicana and Luxor. There is also a free tram to Mandalay Bay. I would highly recommend Excalibur to anyone going to Vegas. The price is only slightly more than lower end properties such as Circus Circus and Sahara and sometimes even less if you get a deal. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “classless but fun!”
Reviews.Author: BaurFan
Reviews.Content: Booked this direct with hotel in Dec. remember reading someone else's review on another hotel which said, keep checking the rates, if they go down, contact the hotel and see if they will honour this. I did this 3 times with the Excalibur, and each time they reduced the rate (they were very patient!) Well done for this. We booked re-modelled room in tower 2, great views, comfy beds (I like firm beds) and huge bathroom. very clean. Didn't like time-share touts, but like previous customers, learned to ignore them, also didn't like walking through casino whenever we went anywhere, after a time it got on my nerves. altogether, i found it good value for money, i liked the location, I didn't want to stay in the centre of the strip. a word of warning, we enquired the cost of Grand Canyon trips with the concierge, decided it was too expensive and went to one of the booths on the strip. Wish we hadn't, our helicopter and boat trip was cancelled and we are still waiting for a refund, despite sending loads of e-mails to the company and as yet they have not responded. We wish we had booked though the hotel as they refund the same day. The concierge at the hotel is very helpful, as was every member of staff we came across. restaurants and food courts adequate, but nothing to get too excited about, there were VERY long queues when we tried to go to a few of the restaurants and in the end, grabbed a sub at quiznos (very good!) Would I return? probably not, but that is no reflection on the Excalibur, I just was not too keen on Vegas itself.

Reviews.Title: “great stay !”
Reviews.Author: aggie_bella
Reviews.Content: It's was my 3rd time in Las Vegas and this time we chose this hotel because of our son...and tighter budget ;-) The previous hotels were The Venetian, & Monte Carlo so buy now I knew what to expect paying $79 a night. It was money well spent. I think the trick is to be smart about booking your hotel. I signed up for the MGM newsletter and have been receiving a lot of promotions by email. Really worth receiving the 'junk mail' it if you don't wanna overpay later on!! The hotel was clean - we got the renovated room. Fantastic pool!! Very kids friendly hotel but still you wont see the running all over the place. There are 4 different pools - one of the for adults only - so no kids allowed ;-) Saw the 'Tournament of Kings' - again, do your research instead of buying the tickets online or straight from the hotel. Try 'Two for One Show Tickets' on the Strip ( beside the big Coke bottle) and you can get 1/2 priced tickets for a lot of the Vegas shows. over all my stay was very enjoyable and will come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Decent Stay”
Reviews.Author: iupjimbo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Excalibur from Thursday May 15th to Monday the 19th. It is important to note from the outset that there were very large conventions in town that weekend that boosted the nightly rates, especially on Sunday night. The Excalibur was not one of my top picks to say the least, but I booked the room in advance through the hotel website, which gives a fairly good discount if you do so at least 30 days in advance. All of the MGM properties offer this, but it is non-refundable. The rate was $675 total for four nights. A bit rich for my blood, but it was the best deal we could get considering the weekend. We stayed in one of the newly-renovated rooms in Tower II. The room was as I expected based on other reviews. The furnishings were rather new, with a nice TV, safe, and other bells and whistles. The beds were quite firm. Too firm for my tastes, but not terrible. The bathroom was quite nice, although there is no bathtub. I never take baths anyway, especially in a hotel. The shower is quite large. There are indeed timeshare people all over the place downstairs. I'm glad that I was prepared for this, and they are very easy to spot. If you ignore them (I used the pretend-they're-not there method), it's really not a problem. The truth is that we saw these people in several other hotel/casinos, so it is unfair to say that Excalibur is the only place with these people. A local told me that they are desperate to sell these things b/c of the current market, so maybe there is some truth to that. The casino is nothing special, but this is true for most MGM/Mirage properties. The Luxor, Excalibur, and New York New York are all really more of the same. It is nice when in Vegas to stay at a casino that is fun to hang out in. After all, it is like your home-base. The Excalibur isn't particularly fun to hang out in, but it is close to other casinos. You can get to the MGM, NY NY, Luxor, Mandalay Bay, Trop, and Hooters quite easily, the latter of which is a good spot for low-limit gaming. The Casino is very blah. You won't fine a low limit game (less than $10) unless you are there early in the morning. Even then your chances are slim. They have the full assortment of gaming though, and it is not any different then the other strip casinos for the most part. Very little video poker if you are into that. The hotel staff is friendly and efficient. Housecleaning did not come on Saturday. I did tip them the first day ,and they jazzed up the place a bit, which is nice. The elevators are great considering the size of the hotel - very fast and not usually too crowded. For a hotel of over 4000 rooms, this is a big plus. The cab line was never too bad, even on Sunday afternoon. Cabs to the Wynn run about 16 dollars, over 20 to downtown. They have valet parking, but my advise is to use the self-park, as it is very close to the building. I imagine that there is a wait for the valet. The food course is quite convenient - Krispy Cream has decent coffee, along with McDonald's and Starbucks. The buffet is just a little better than a college cafeteria, but it is only about 12 bucks, which can hit the spot at least one morning. I was worried that since this was more of a "family" establishment that there would be kids everywhere. This really wasn't the case. I saw children, but no more than at places like the MGM. Don't bring your kids to Vegas - seriously. The new pool is pretty nice, but there was a heat-wave last weekend and the temp was over 100 most days. This is not pool weather for me, so we skipped that. I checked it out though, and it is better than some other strip pools. Overall, if you are left with few reasonable choices (as we were), consider staying at the Excalibur. Given the choice, however, I would choose the Flamingo for a similar price-range. The location is better, and its an all-around better establishment. The five point scale here is a bit restricting, and on a ten point scale I'd give it a 7. Very suitable by my standards. Again, there are better places to stay, but you should not fear the Excalibur. It is definitely worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay for the price, fairly average.”
Reviews.Author: cuddlyelephant
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in may 2008. You generally get what you pay for and as this is toward the cheaper end of the hotels that are on the strip, i found it to be ok for what we paid. the rooms are clean and adequate but by no means luxury but you dont go to spend all your time in your room so this wasn't a problem. The pool area is nice, although one section of it was closed during our stay which was a little dissapointing but as the pool area is huge, there were still other pools to swim in. We found the staff to be a bit pushy in terms of trying to make you sign up for show tickets/free gifts etc which all come at a price- nothing is free! so beware of this, just be firm and say you are not interested as they keep asking you. The meals were nice- if a little disorganised at the round table buffet- its good value for money for breakfast and dinner, but it was badly orgainised in terms of seating people and general staffing- we went to the MGM Grand hotel for one dinner buffet meal which was much better organised but was more expensive. One thing to be aware of is this hotel is right at one end of thestrip so if you are wanting to visit the other hotels , you need to allow yourself plenty of time to either walk or take the shuttle bus down the strip- its a good few miles from one end to the other and each hotel takes a long time to walk round as they are all huge! but its worth seeing them all. A reasonable stay for the price at the excalibur but if i went to las vegas again, i'd probably splash out a bit more and try one of the more plush hotels further up the stip. Do make sure you catch the free fountain show at the Belaggio, its great!

Reviews.Title: “Really Great Time”
Reviews.Author: jset1
Reviews.Content: We chose The Excalibur due to a great package price from Southwest Air. We arrived on May 13 around 3 pm, there was a short line for check in but plenty of desk staff so it moved quickly. The ladies in front of us were giving the desk clerk a really hard time, apparantly they weren't happy with their rooms. A bit of advice, be nice to the employees, even if you're unhappy it's not their fault personally, and they most likely can help resolve your problem unless you're as rude as these two! Besides, in most cases you're on vacation, leave the stress at home!! When it was our turn we joked with the clerk that we garunteed that she would have a much better experience with us, she laughed and upgraded us to a renovated room for no extra charge (See, it pays to be nice). The room itself was nice it was on the inside of the property so there was not much of a view, but honestly we're there to get out and have fun so we went outisde to see the sights. The bed was comfortable, good firm mattress 4 feather pillows. Bathroom had pleny of space, nice counters and a large shower. I've read a lot of reviews commenting on the medieval decor, and the lower quality of the hotel compared to Belagio or Wynn. My comment to that is.....It's a huge castle, what do you expect the theme to be? Secondly, as I said in the begining the price was great, if you want luxory and can afford a more expensive place then stay there! We had a wonderful experience, I would definately stay there again. We only ate in the casino once for breakfast, food was ok. Plenty of slots and tables with lower limits are available. And they Players Club card works at all MGM/Mirage properties, you can also charge items to your room directly from those properties.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I Ever Stayed At”
Reviews.Author: WayTooMuchtravel
Reviews.Content: Booked a room over the phone for a conference, when I arrived I was given a ground floor room, and even though I request a non-smoking room they put me in a smoking room, and when I requested another room they told me they were sold out on non smoking rooms for a week and it was only a request, not a confirmation. The staff was rude and did not seem to have any interest in providing customer service. The room itself is very old and shabby (perhaps their new rennovated rooms are better), no desk, no mini bar, old and rusty shower and sink, loud air conditioning unit. I've stayed at some motel 6 properties that were better than this dump. Stay away, I know I will.

Reviews.Title: “It's a Huge Lego Castle!”
Reviews.Author: DaveM_Sunderland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights as part of 3 week tour of California with 2 teenage kids. Our main reason being to visit Grand Canyon. If you're going to Vegas however, you've got to stay on the strip! This hotel was great value for location. The design of the hotel now looks quite comical next to the chic design of the Luxor and New York and New York nearby, its days are probably numbered. Room was very comfortable and surprisingly peaceful. Thanks v much to trip advisor for the warning about the timeshare sales people in the lobby, they jumped on us the minute we arrived - hot and tired after a drive through the dessert from LA - we were nearly caught out but I remembered the tip just in time! Just keep on walking despite promises of vouchers etc.

Reviews.Title: “bad bed”
Reviews.Author: MarylandSheri
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 24th floor with a strip view. I would not pay extra for the view room again, cannot see much anyway. The bed was awful. I could feel every spring in the mattress. Drainage in the shower and toilet was slow. Had to shower standing n a puddle of shower water every day.

Reviews.Title: “Alright Place to Stay on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: Melaina_in_Calgary
Reviews.Content: My sister & I stayed at the Excalibur from May 9th and left May 13th. Overall it was alright. We stayed in Tower 1, room 13129 which is the side that has not been renovated. The view from our room was nice - we could see the Luxor and Mandalay Bay. The room was decent, clean but nothing showy or spectular. I was a bit diaspointed to find out that there was no bathtub (would've been nice for foot soak after long days of walking all over the place) although the stand-up shower was very spacious but as others have commented there's only a small shelf for the soap, so you have to put the rest of your stuff on the shower floor. This would've been all and well except for the fact that our shower did not drain properly which resulted in the shampoo/conditioner and razors floating around the bottom of the shower. There was an in room safe which we could use for free but no coffee maker. This was a major pain (being a coffee addict!) because I would have to go down to the main floor and buy a coffee from the little coffee shop outside the entrance to the elevators - not so bad except the coffee was medicor and extremely expensive (over $3 US for a large). "Dick's Last Resort" was a total hoot. The staff are hilarious (although may come off as rude - you need to appreciate their sense of humour). The band was fabulous and most nights there was a good crowd there. If you like fast food the food court on the second floor has a 24 hour McDonald's, Quizno's, Pizza Hut, Krispy Kreme donughts, and a couple of other places. I did not find any of the employees that worked at these places to be overly friendly AT ALL. Anytime we went there to eat they acted as though our presence and our order were a MAJOR inconvenience! The Excalibur is fairly close to New York, New York, MGM Grand, the Luxor, and Mandaly Bay but keep in mind EVERYTHING on the strip looks closer than it actually is! There is a train that goes between the Excalibur, the Luxor, and Manadaly Bay and it's free. "The Deuce" bus is a good alternative if you do not want to walk the entire strip. We bought a 24 hour pass but the night we rode there was a 25 minute delay (it's allegedly supposed to come every 10 minutes or so) which resulted in an EXTREMELY crowded bus and very angry people who could not get on because the bus was full. We rode for 3 stops and then got off because it was getting just a little bit too claustrophobic for my liking. We gave our pass to a couple that was staying at the hotel. There is also a train you can take but it travels on the other side of the strip and you miss out on the sights. The pool area was alright - I liked that there was an area for adults only (18+). On that note, I found there to be A LOT of young children at this hotel - from newborns to young kids. Even thought there were signs everywhere stating that it was against Nevada law for children to be on the casino floor they were EVERYWHERE. I don't think Vegas is really kid friendly town so I was shocked to see as many children as I did. Overall - our stay was good, ordering room service was good (except for the night that we ordered a well done cheeseburger and it arrived medium well but they were quick and friendly in rectifying the situation). I had to call guest services for a local number because we didn't have a phone book in our room, within 5 minutes there was a knock at our door and an employee handed over a phone book for us, we got a call about 10 minutes later to make sure that we received our phone book. And off topic from the hotel stay - if you're going to Vegas you HAVE TO HAVE TO HAVE TO go a Cirque Du Soliel show. We saw the show "KA" which played at the MGM and it was incredible. Words cannot even begin to describe how awesome and amazing this show is!! So in closing I would say that the Excalibur is a 'get what you pay for' kind of place. If you're looking for a hotel on the strip that isn't overly expensive than this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Treatment at Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: Guinness5
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Excalibur May 5 through 9, 2008 with a girlfriend. Our stay for the most part was nothing but wonderful. We chose to get a remodeled room in Tower 2 and it was well worth it. Everything in the room was new. I liked having the walk-in shower with the sliding glass doors, granite countertop and flat panel TV. There were 2 things that were not right when we entered our room. The first was the greasy forehead marks covering the window making it difficult to appreciate the view of New York New York. The second was the toilet seat that was so loose I was afraid of what might happen. Our call to maintenance was promptly answered. Within 5 minutes someone was in our room with a bucket of soapy water and a squeegee cleaning the window inside and outside. Before he left another person came to tighten the toilet seat. Five minutes after they both left we received a phone call wanting to know if everything was taken care of. I've never had such great service for issues like that. Walking around the hotel we noticed security, maintenence and remodelling people all around. All were courteous and alert. We spent a fair amount of time at the pool. There were 4 pools. One was not in use (although full of water). Another was 18 and over only. All the pools were too shallow for our liking and only one was long enough to do something resembling a lap in. Plenty of lounge chairs and life guards. One pool had slides going into it but these were never working during our stay. They told us they were only available for weekends. Why? There was food available at a small restaurant and bar with outdoor and indoor seating near the pool. There was also a waitress taking drink orders around the pool but this service was VERY slow. I never felt as if this area was truly up and running. The Spa is very nice. It is split by gender. The women's area has scented showers (green tea, mango, lavender, citrus, dewberry), a steamroom, a sauna, a whirlpool, locker room, make up room and lounge area.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: ellehinck
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur for one night in May 2008. We booked it because it was one of the cheapest rooms we could find on the strip--about $60 for a Sunday night. To be honest, my expectations were not that high, but I was pleasantly surprised. My husband and I both thought the bed was extremely comfortable--it had a great pillow top mattress. We didn't want to get up in the morning! The room was clean, and the bathroom was large. Both check in and check out were fast and easy. I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort at a reasonable price!”
Reviews.Author: Audi4d
Reviews.Content: Excalibur always comes first in mind when my friend and I thinks of a place to stay in LV. Its Stay & Play package is a great come on! We enjoyed use of spa and the receptionist (forgot her name) at women spa section was very accommodating and made us feel like VIPs... Love the pool area! Ambiance is very relaxing. Planning to visit LV next month and hoping to stay at Excalibur again!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, but not much more”
Reviews.Author: SCTraveler69
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, the bed was fine, and it was spacioius. No coffee maker, which I haven't experienced in a hotel or motel since I can remember. No refrigerator. No wireless. Wired ethernet was available at the highest rate I have ever seen in a hotel: $12.99 per day. And there was not really a desk for you to set up your computer - there was a table there, which I used. Outrageously long wait one morning, early before the rush time, to get a table for breakfast, and then to get waited on. I'd pick another hotel in Vegas the next time I return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Woodythebeagle
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Vegas after staying at the Excalibur for three nights over the weekend. I was hesitant at first as it is quite a bit cheaper that other casino hotels and does initially seem dated when driving up but in the end I was really impressed overall. Check-in was a breeze. We called ahead early before we arrived to make sure we got connecting rooms (which ending up being really convenient.) They actually said the room was already ready when we called ~10am Friday. So we checked right in with no wait well before the actual check-in time of 3pm. This was well received after a long long night time drive. We stayed in Tower II which has a really convenient entrance right next to entrance from the parking lot and drop off area and next to the pool entrance. The timeshare people were in the area whenever we walked from the casino to our room but didn;t really bother us too much. The remodeled widescreen room with two queen beds was very comfortable, with everything feeling new and modern. The bathroom was large with nice counters and a very big shower but no tub. They typically gave three towels each day and the basic soap / shampoo / lotion. The widescreen TV was nice and big but not many actual channels (maybe ten?) besides hotel / vegas info type ones and none of them were in HD. I would've liked at least one channel like disney for the kids but oh well, we are in Vegas. The food at the breakfast buffet was very good, but the dinner buffet was a disappointment. I suggest going elsewhere for a lunch / dinner buffet like the Rio. Other than the channel selection and food, i can;t really complain too much especially for the price compared to other casinos. A strong "bang for your buck" value recommendation for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely Priced Hotel on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Jeep_M5
Reviews.Content: The family and I stayed at the Excalibur on our recent trip to Las Vegas. The hotel was what we expected after booking it on the hotel website. Check-in was quick and easy, as was the express checkout at the end of our stay. We ate several times at the buffet and found the food to be of good quality for a reason price. A must for anyone staying at the excalibur is to attend the tornament of Kings. You will get a discount in the ticket price if you attend the "time share" presentation, but be warned that this presentation took 4 hours even though it was stated to be between 3 - 4 hours. The only issue with is hotel is that the time share staff try a persuade you each time you walk through the casino. Criss Angel fans can use the connection to the Luxor to visit his shop, were my son spent about an hour or so.

Reviews.Title: “Fair at best”
Reviews.Author: cajundego
Reviews.Content: The only reason I stayed one night at Excalibur was I needed a play to lay my head because the MGM was booked & I got to Vegas early. I booked thru a vegas website & they put me at a different hotel. I do have to admit the registration staff was great in helping me sort things out. They said that those website get Tower I. UGH! Should have went with Tower II which I understand is newer. Tower I reminded me of an old Knights Inn (what I imagine it to be like). The rooms were old & very worn. I doubt I would ever stay here again - at least in Tower I. It was definately a place that should be < $50.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: palto
Reviews.Content: i stayed at excalibur for nascar weekend and was worried before i got there after reading bad reports about the hotel. i have to say i loved the hotel and rooms were excellent. the only thing is timeshare people everywhere,but they seem to be in most hotels.i stayed at nyny across the road in 2006 and would recomend either of these hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Ok if on a budget”
Reviews.Author: kimtinsy
Reviews.Content: Booked thru hotel's website and prepaid 2 months in advance, after checking out 1 day before arrival, the price quoted had dropped $35 for the duration of our stay. We couldn't get a refund or comps for the difference. The hotel is huge and you had to walk thru the casino floor each and everytime you wanted to get anywhere. The hotel food is terrible, we ate lunch at the Roundtable Buffet and it was one of the worst you can waste your money on. The room was adequate in size as is the bathroom. The beds were old and worn and you felt and heard each and every spring in the mattress when you laid down on it. The a/c was nice and strong and we had to turn it off coz it was still chilly outside. The location of the hotel is ok, just beside Luxor and across from Tropicana, New York New York and MGM Grand. Mandalay Bay is also nearby. I suggest you use the "Deuce" when you try to get around the Strip. $2 one way, $5 all day. Also, just use this hotel to get around to the other hotels or attractions, Mandalay Bay's Bayside Buffet (lunch) was excellent as is Bellagio's The Buffet although quite unreasonable that kids (even below 9) are made to pay full adult's price. Tip: Vegas isn't a place for kids, not anymore. If you don't plan to gamble (like me) or isn't after the view from the hotel room, why not stay in some of the inns and motels around the big hotels, there're lots of them. just choose those located in the south end of the Strip, near the airport. remember, the "Deuce" is the key. $2 one way, $5 all day.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur Hotel Review”
Reviews.Author: BuyYourTicketsHere
Reviews.Content: Checking in the hotel was fast maybe 5-10 miniutes between checking in and the lines. They had alot of staff on to handle the flow of people. I did go to other hotels touring and not as fast as check in the hotels. You could see the impatient travelers waiting in lines. Hotel price was aprox $707 for the week with $1.00 per day added on phone fee, I found I made alot of calls in the area and was glad for the standard fee. Location Tower 1 20th Floor Non Smoking The hotel was room was 2 queen beds with an " outside view " Our view was of the Luxor Pyramid and at night it was very nice to see the lighted beam in the sky and lights on the pyramid. They do have a inside view in Tower 1 but, it is of the castle roof and the castle inside peeks lit up. It does look nice but not as nice as outside view. Shower was very large you could fit 2 plus people in it. 1 sinks, large mirror in bathroom and plenty of counter space. Nice thick white towels. Hair Dryer, Bar soap, Shampoo, Conditioner Ironing board, Iron TV has a vegas history channel on it. As soon as you turn on the tv and go to next channel you'll get the histiry channel. I found it interesting to listen to when slowly awaking at night. Bed were ok as far as comfort there is no place like home as far as sleeping. The have a restaurant that has buffettz for breakfast, lunch and dinner. $11.99 for breakfast plus tax. Large selction and food was good. Also they have a McDonalds, Starbucks, an Ice Cream place and more for eating. A bar called Dick's for those with a sense of humor and a place for laugh's inside the hotel. Gambling All Night Long! This is truely the city that never sleeps. Lori Gaudette BuyYourTicketsHere

Reviews.Title: “Great place...we enjoyed it!”
Reviews.Author: bomberchick
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur for our honeymoon. It was the first trip to Vegas for both of us, and we really didn't know what to expect. The hotel was great...yeah it's older than some on the Strip, but our room was clean, the bed comfortable, and the bathroom was huge!! The hotel staff that we did deal with were very friendly and helpful. If we had any complaints, it would have to be the timeshare people....they are relentless!! Stay away from them...don't make eye contact if you can help it. The food court was handy, and we did eat at the buffet a few times and enjoyed the food. All in all, we enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel, but for Vegas no uniquness at all”
Reviews.Author: jenniyoder
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Excalibur, as my cousin got married there and there was a large group, so everyone stayed on the same floor there. I usually stay next door at the Luxor and wish that I had. The Excalibur is clean and does offer a great location for the south side of the strip, but there's no frills. Nothing great, the room could be any Holiday Inn anywhere, the pool is not spectacular and the casino is average (didn't have good luck gambling there). For the same price as this hotel, I could have stayed next door at the Luxor, which is definitely not an ordinary or mundane experience.

Reviews.Title: “WOW - excalibur gets even better”
Reviews.Author: GB11
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at the Excalibur and it gets even better. The rooms are undergoing a refurbishment and if you choose one of them you will get large LCD TV, remodelled bathroom and furnishings. I am disabled and require an accessible room and it was fantastic! Remote blinds and lights, excellent bathroom with grab handles and roll-in shower. Check in staff were spot on again and did everything to help. The casino is good and offers all the gambling options, entertainment caters for all and the dining is spot in, especially the buffet. I also like the location of the hotel as you can get to the Luxor and Mandalay Bay via monorail, the interstate is adjacent and you can be in/out of Vegas easily. All in all this hotel is perfect for the average traveller to LV – if you want extreme luxury you may have to look at the higher end of the price bracket but for £36 per night (what I paid via website) then you cant go wrong. PS I was upgraded to the refurbished room free – it’s an extra £10 per night at present for the LCD TV etc – but well worth it! Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like a regular Motel!”
Reviews.Author: CleanAir8
Reviews.Content: Just coming into to town wanted to try something new with fun. Was traveling with friends so decieded to try excalibur. The physical appearance of The Place is wonderful if you travel with family, but the service was okay! not the best compared to other places Should have thought twice about coming here but the casino was nice and the buffet was resonable but the quality of the rooms were just average nothing to wow me with. Next time im going to vegas im going to try The palms hotel which is the new hot spot in vegas. Especially hearing good things about the palms!!

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur Hotel-middle of the road experience”
Reviews.Author: pebbles75
Reviews.Content: Excalibur is a good hotel if you want a fairly cheap room on the strip in a big hotel. We managed to stay in one of the newly remodeled rooms, which is good, since I heard an employee mention the un-remodeled rooms look worse than a motel 6 room. Apprarently the pool was newly renovated, however, it lacked any appeal, and some of the pool guests were less desirable, discussing their many "triumphs" in the middle of the afternoon. The cabanas are also very blah, nothing appealing, and they are quite small The buffet was really good, alot of different foods and reasonably priced. Every other restaurant we wanted to go into at the hotel were always full, even on a tuesday evening...make reservations Our room was quickly cleaned in the mornings, and most of the staff were courteous. The location of the hotel is towards the south end of the strip, making it a bit of a pain to go anywhere up the strip all in all, the hotel is middle of the road, if you want a fancy vegas vacation, stay somewhere else (like the bellagio, GREAT hotel!). Excalibur had people of all ages, so if you want diversity, Excalibur is it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place with a few drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: charliesgoneaway
Reviews.Content: We booked a package tour that included four nights at Excalibur.The package included a standard room but at check in I was offered an upgrade to remodeled room with a 42 inch tv and a safe for $20 a night more on a non smoking room.The room was clean and the beds were comfortable .The maid cleaned and swept the room every day.The bathroom was large and kept well stocked with clean towels and soap. We ate at the Sherwood Forest cafe twice,They have a steak dinner special every night after 7pm for $7 and it was great. The banana splits are huge.The only complaints that I have are the timeshare people that wont leave you alone.The other is while Nevada law prohibits smoking in restaraunts,shops and shows it dosent include casinos. the casinos at Excalibur are smoke filled to the point that just walking through them burns your eyes .Other than that it wasnt bad.

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded rooms are just ok”
Reviews.Author: Twink-Twink
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Excalibur April 24-26, 2008 in one of the upgraded widescreen view rooms (22nd floor, room 25). The upgraded rooms are just okay. If you choose an upgrated room, expect a half-way decent hotel room, basically. Don't expect anything fancy. Basically, they're a just a step (or maybe a half-step) above a Holiday Inn. The room looked like it had been renovated, but done very cheaply. It also looked like the bathroom was only partially renovated - the shower and bathroom flooring looked old and didn't match the style of the rest of the room. Not a big deal. It was annoying that the shower didn't have any shelves, so we had to put our shampoo, etc. on the shower floor. Probably the most annoying thing was the fact that the the television reception went in and out (not that I spent my time in Vegas watching tv, but I did try to do that a little just to relax after a long day of sightseeing, etc.). The person I was staying with commented that her back hurt after sleeping on her bed, but my back was fine. There were a few other minor things that weren't that nice - like that each bed only had 2 pillows, our nightstand was missing its drawer pull and there was no hotel information book in the room, such as you usually have in hotel rooms. None of this really bothered me, but just made me feel that I wasn't staying in the lap of luxury. Some of my travel companions stayed in the non-upgraded rooms and they had some problems. I didn't visit their room, but heard that it was very old and not very nice. Also, apparently there was some kind of leak in their bathroom upon check-in and water was all over the floor. So, I would not stay in a non-upgraded room unless all you want/expect is a place to crash. I've seen several reviews mentioning timeshare people. This concerned me a lot. I pretty much had to stay at this hotel because this was where my companions were staying, and I was concerned about being constantly bothered by these people. I was never approached by timeshare people, and I never even noticed any. I am thinking that the timeshare people must approach families (I was traveling with a group of women). I did not use the spa, but after visiting the spa lobby, I would avoid it. I went down to inquire about getting pedicure. There were 5 girls behind the desk, only two of whom were working (and I think that one of them was a new girl being trained). Right when I walked in, one of the girls (Leah) was on the phone and was apparently frustrated by something and was cursing (the "F" word). I thought this was extremely unprofessional, and took away from any relaxing setting that you would want at a spa. Pedicures aren't offered at the spa - those are at the salon elsewhere in the hotel. The pedicure cost $55. I made an appointment and arrived on time, and was told to sit and wait. I waited for 10 minutes when the nail tech realized that I was there. Apparently, no one told her that I was there. This wouldn't have been a big deal, but I was in a bit of a hurry, and it was just not very professional. The pedicure was just average, and not worth $55 -- though another woman at the salon commented that it was one of the best that she'd ever had. I'm not sure why she thought it was so great. In any event, I've heard that the spa at Mandalay is really good and you don't need to be a guest there to use it (it might cost you a few extra dollars though). Some random suggestions about Vegas after this, my first trip there -- --Do not go to Fremont Street unless you want to dance in the street and listen to live music (by cover bands), or if you have some kind of historical interest in seeing the old casinos. It is an hour bus ride to get there and there is nothing to see there. The Fremont Street Experience is simply a large videoscreen that shows videos of dancing (clothed) girls, like you might see in an MTV music video. There are also some lovely video screens advertising strip clubs that show women taking their tops off (with a censor bar covering them). I was told that there were shops there -- these are simply souvenier shops that are everywhere in Vegas. The casinos are VERY smokey there also. There are many other, better things to do in Vegas. --Wear your most comfortable shoes, as you'll do LOTS of walking. Things are much further away than they appear. --Take a cab back to the airport. You can reserve a spot on a shuttle for $6/person, but they come extremely early (they were going to send my shuttle at 4 a.m. and my flight was at 6:50 a.m.). Instead, I split a cab with someone (I paid $7) and left later.

Reviews.Title: “You Will Enjoy Your Stay Here, Best Value, Good Location, Clean Room”
Reviews.Author: richie_real
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on April 22nd for 3 nights with my Wife for our 3 year anniversary and had a pleasant experience. Great Check- In staff, attentive and friendly. I requested specifics for my room, such as non adjoining, and king bed and was granted it. We stayed in Tower 1 which was perfectly fine, simple, clean, spacious and as a plus we had a great view of the Luxor. The bed was soft and the Housecleaning staff was great. The casino was ok with attentive waitresses that brought drinks promptly, just order your next drink as you receive your first one. This hotel is linked to the Luxor and Mandalay Bay and is extremely accessible to and from New York New York, MGM Grand and Tropicana. We have no complaints. We had a comfortable stay. We would stay here again. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep here go to Mandalay Bay Hotel to eat.”
Reviews.Author: kamiogi
Reviews.Content: We arrived at about 1 PM, even though the check-in time is shown as 3 PM, the registration desk was very courteous and very fast, we were in our room within minutes. Time to relax a bit and hit the strip. The hotel is comfortable without any special feature. A plain clean room tower 1- 16th floor. As far as the food is concerned do not bother, the food court is junk food and the buffer is so-so. Get on the free tram head to the Mandalay Bay hotel. Buffet is fabulous in a very nice setting. The buffet staff at the Mandalay Bay is probably the most professional one in Vegas. I go to Vegas every year. You do not like Buffet, just fine ,the Mandalay Bay has a good selection of good restaurants, a bit pricey but worth it. Check-out was as good as the check-in. Two days later got an email from the Excalibur hotel thanking me for my stay and an invitation to return at a discounted price.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price :)”
Reviews.Author: kaultra
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Vegas. Went with another friend to attend a wedding and picked this hotel because other wedding guests were also staying here as the price was not too expensive. I found a great price through US Airways Vacations with my flight and hotel together. I arrived late (11pm) and it was really awesome to fly into vegas at night so you could see the strip and all the bright lights! At check-in there was NO line at this time of night and I figured there were no good rooms left because it was so late. I booked the lowest category room possible. I asked if there were any rooms left with any kind of view of the strip and she said no but we upgraded you to a room in tower 2 for no extra charge! I knew that would be a new plasma TV room so I was pleased. My room was great, floor 21 and I had a nice view between the towers over to the Luxor which looks neat at night. Big enough bathroom with a big shower, no tub, large granite countertop. Big TV but honestly i never even turned it on! This room was perfect for good sleeping, absolutely no noise at night, it was probably one of the quietest rooms I've ever had! The bed was really hard so I called housekeeping and requested a mattress topper(egg crate type of cushion). They promptly put one on both beds the next day and it made for much better comfort! The room was sufficiently cleaned each day. I really liked the selection fast-food type of restuarant stuff on the second floor, starbucks, quiznos, mcdonalds, crispy cream---YUM. I did eat at the Sherwood forest cafe and enjoyed it greatly. As a single person I skipped the long line and they were happy to seat just me right away! I even played blackjack for the first time ever! what fun, very good service with the free drinks too. As single girls we were NEVER approached by the timeshare people. PLUS, i tried to never make eye contact with them either, if you just don't look at them and ignore them as you walk by it shouldn't be a problem. I do think they prey on married couples and families. I never had a chance to check out the pools. As single girls we also LOVED Dick's Last Resort for our nightly entertainment! That place is a hoot! We met some really fun people and had a blast. The band played perfect music for dancing, beware of the employee near the bathroom area! This hotel is located at the end of the strip but it is attached to NY NY, Luxor, Tropicana, Mandalay Bay and MGM... Tons of stuff to do, there is even a bus stop right out front. The bus is cheap, $5.00 for a 24 hour pass but it will drive you crazy it's so slow! but, if you are not in a hurry no big deal! I did find the woman at the concierge desk to be slightly rude, she wasn't even very busy! Check-out, again, no line, no unexpected charges. I had checked my luggage in with the bell-desk in the morning as I had a very late flight that day and had no problems with retrieving it. Took a great tour to hoover dam and the grand canyon west rim on the day i left. Highly recommended if you have an extra day! Overall the complaints you will hear in this section, if you ask me, are from those who simply expect more than what this hotel has to offer. Do your research and you'll know this is not a 5 star hotel or casino. You will find rude people all over Las Vegas. Bed bugs, lost luggage, bad food, problems with the front desk, long lines at check-in if you arrive at a popular time, you will occasional find these problems at EVERY hotel, even the nice ones. This place for me was well worth the price and I would definately recommend it. Would I stay here again, probably not since it was my first trip to vegas and I like trying new places. I would however return to Dicks! lol.... What fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for the Monay”
Reviews.Author: GoBoSox07
Reviews.Content: Usually we stay at the Imperial Palace for a budget property that meets our needs in a great location, but we ventured to the Excalibur this time because the price was just about the same. We got a remodeled flat screen TV room and were very happy with it. It was clean, comfortable, and the bathroom was wonderful. Shower only, but very roomy and good water pressure. The worst part about the Exaclibur is the overly pushy and agressive time share reps. They don't seem to leave anyone alone, and their positioning right by the main entryways and walkways could not be more inconvenient. We learned that if you tell them you are a local they leave you alone immediately, so that was our secret for the weekend! I've been going to Vegas regularly for about 10 years now, and these reps seem to be getting more and more agressive everywhere, so in all fairness, this is not just a problem with the Excalibur. Pool area seemed nice but there were a few closed. Even though, there was plenty of chairs and open, uncrowded pools to be used. We booked on thier website and got two free steak dinners in Sherwood Forest cafe which was a nice break from the climbing cost of Vegas food. All in all, this was a nice stay and we would return. PROS: Clean, modern rooms, many dining options, easy to enter and exit from the strip, easy to get a seat on the Deuce strip bus from this far at the end of the strip CONS: Time share reps, high priced wireless internet, flat screen tv was large, but not HD?? No shelves in the shower to put toiletries (seemed unsanitary to have everything on the floor).

Reviews.Title: “Rip Off”
Reviews.Author: ladub1
Reviews.Content: Do Not buy tickets for their show from the Hotel, It's a complete RIP OFF . The tournament of Kings is a good show but I paid full price $58 for 7 guests while the guy beside paid $34 at a half price ticket outlet. The hotel would do nothing for me, no refund or discount to my room. I got a blank stare from the guy I bought the tickets from earlier in the day and a complete brush off from the hotel supervisor at the front desk the next day. The whole thing was very frustrating. If you like to gamble they do not rate you if you only play $5 they only rate you if you play $10 so games like Let It Ride can be $30 hands in order to get rated comped etc. They have lots of people that look like Hotel employees trying to "giveaway" free tickets but they are just trying to sell TIME SHARES so BEWARE. They are close to the entrance and close to the room elevators. I get comped at a few hotels in Vegas my guests were from England and wanted to stay here but I will never go back . THANKS but No Thanks. I stayed at the hotel for 4 days 3 nights with 7 people and 3 rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur Weekend April 10-13, 2008”
Reviews.Author: seadootraveler
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Las Vegas for a weekend with another couple- and we had all been to Vegas previously but had never stayed at Excalibur. We booked our vacation with Allegiant Air for a GREAT price, so we were willing to make a few exceptions in the accomodations. Overall- the trip was fun and the Excalibur was average. I might stay there again, but I definetely prefer to stay somewhere located more central on the Strip. When we booked the vacation, we requested non-smoking king rooms. I also called to confirm this request. We checked in around 3:00 p.m. on a Thursday and there were no king beds available- so we had two queens. We checked in at a later time from our friends, so we did not want to upgrade to the newer tower as our room was to be across from theirs. We were offered to move to king bed rooms the next day, but we didn't feel like repacking/moving. The older rooms are just that- old. They were okay- and once you realize that you are just there to crash and shower- they are fine. They were clean, fairly roomy for two adults, and have nice big bathroom counters, and a big shower. It was a bit underwhelming, but fine overall for just sleeping. Other than that, check-in/out went smooth. The casino is fine- I would have preferred some newer slot machines that are offered at newer casinos- but still fun and has decent drink service. The timeshare reps are very bothersome. You can not walk anywhere without being offered a "free show/dinner/etc." It is okay if you just ignore them, but it gets old fast! The same can be said about the stripper cards being passed out on the strip! If you had children there, that would be a definite problem for me! The pool seemed nice, but we decided not to use it. We were in the other tower and it seemed like too much effort to get ready, then parade through the casino to the other tower to get to "relax." We checked it out and two of the pools were closed and it was very busy- no available chairs to be seen. But it seemed like a fun pool atmosphere. As for the restaurants, we ate at the buffet which was pretty good. We also ate the $7.99 steak special at the Sherwood Cafe which was pretty decent for a $7 steak dinner. My hubby had a hamburger and fries which were great. The food court has alot of choices for quick, fast food as well. We did enjoy some Coldstone Creamery one afternoon- yum! They also have decent shops and a walkway to the Luxor and tram to the Mandalay Bay which is nice. Overall, the Excalibur could use some updates for sure, but it is a fun area of the Strip and was a good deal for the cheap pricetag. It is a good choice for those traveling with kids or people that want a reasonable hotel room on the Strip. If you don't go into it thinking that it is comparable to the Wynn, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: roxa12
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival to the hotel we were pestered by timeshare people offering to give us free dinner and tickets who followed us all the way to the check in line where we then had to wait over an hour to be checked in. Our room was said to be newly remodeled yet we had to be switched over to a different room after finding bed bugs on our beds that bit my daughter. It took over two hours to get another room. We went down to the pool and about half the pools were closed; when asked why a lifeguard simply told us they were too understaffed to open any more pools! My husband paid to use the work out facility, which has a daily charge, only to be denied the right to shower after he was finished working out because they would be closing in 10 minutes and was told by the rude attendant they would have security called for those not out of the spa! When asked to speak to a manager the attendant simply told him he would have to go back at 6am the next morning or go to the front desk. We ended up spending most of our time in other hotels and never will be back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Stole my Bag”
Reviews.Author: BirdmanWA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here thinking the kids might enjoy it. When we checked in we used the valet and the bell cap. The bell cap wrote down how many bags we gave him. When the bags were delivered there was 1 missing. Even though there own system proved there was a bag missing, I became suspect #1 as far as the hotel was concerned. They treated me like I was trying to defraud them and didn't do anything to lessen the impact of the lost bag on my stay. They didn't even offer to give me toiletries so we could brush our teeth! Later the surveillance footage shown that the bag was stolen off the cart while in the possession of the hotel. We suspect a member of the hotel staff stole the bag but the hotel will not let me see the report made by hotel security and they don't want to talk about it. They misled me into believing I could make a police report over the phone when I got home, but in fact the police will only investigate crimes reported in person. The hotel has not compensated me for the bag.

Reviews.Title: “A great option with kids”
Reviews.Author: Gquad
Reviews.Content: I had been watching prices for weeks, and this was the bargain of the strip when traveling with kids. The internet booking offered great Sun-Thurs rates, with a $20 upgrade option to a fully renovated, quiet room with a granite bathroom, new furniture and bedding, thick towels and very comfortable beds. There was an in-room safe, but no fridge or mini bar. My daughter loved the iHome clock radio, and my son loved the 42' plasma TV. There were 4 swimming pools, but the pool with the waterfall and the slides were only open on the weekend. The arcade was a bit tired, but they loved the virtual rides. The only dining that we did at Excalibur was the “Tournament of Kings” Medieval dinner jousting show. The dinner was a plain roasted chicken & tomato soup (there was no tomato soup in medieval times- Columbus hadn’t discovered America yet...) But the show had a lot of action and every seat was a good view. The hotel has a tram to the Luxor Hotel & Mandalay Bay Hotel, and a walkway to NY NY & MGM. So we had access to hundreds of restaurants, bars and activities without ever touching the street. If you want an excellent burger, be sure to go to Burger Bar at Mandalay Bay. Wolfgang Puck’s Trattoria Del Lupo was a disappointment-great service but way overpriced for what was offered. For the same price, Mesa Grill (Ceasar’s) was a far better meal, or have an amazing meal at Daniel Boulud Brasserie (Wynn) or Aureole (Mandalay Bay). The buffet at the Rio Hotel was far better than the buffet at Treasure Island. You can get 2 for 1 tickets to the NY NY roller coaster if you visit the Adventuredome at Circus Circus at the end of the strip. The MGM lions were fun, we enjoyed the Shark Reef at Mandalay Bay. Beautiful flower show at Bellagio, but high winds canceled the Bellagio Fountains & The Sirens show outside of Treasure Island. The Penn & Teller show (Rio) was a riot, and they meet the fans after the show. But from Vegas, you can now get a quick trip to the Hoover Dam & Grand Canyon. You can pay $150-250 pp for a bus or flight trip, or rent a car for $30-$50 and take an easy drive to Hoover Dam, and continue another 1h 30min to the West Rim of the Grand Canyon for $60pp. Start out at 8am to be at Hoover Dam when it opens at 9AM. You can look around or take the tour, but don’t spend too much time. Continue another 1hr 30 min to Grand Canyon West . $20 to park, and continuous busses take you to spots around the reservation. ***Watch out for AZ speed traps outside the reservation; they look for out of state plates and give you a ticket for 5 miles over the speed limit- those vultures even followed us for 20 minutes on our way home, but we knew better. AZ cars whizzed passed us, but they nabbed every CA & NV plate*** The Glass Bridge/Skywalk was incredible. You look through the glass floor to a mile down. And there was a spot that jets into the canyon, where you could climb and be in the "center" of this incredible cravat. There were no long lines or big crowds like the South Rim, and it was beautiful weather compared to the North Rim. The kids just loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Time”
Reviews.Author: elaine20
Reviews.Content: Quick decision holiday, Dublin, Ireland, At the chance of a quick getaway, we decided to book Excalibur. We arrived early evening to be greeted by what we believed to be a hotel employee directing us to registration, only to be in firing line of a very insistant time share person. On telling him that we were tired and not interested he produced 2 pictures of his children and pleaded that they were the reason for him to be there. Not a good start. After eventually getting away from him. we found Registration and were in our room in about 5 minutes, very good counter staff. Room very clean and bathroom excellent considering no bathtub , but excellent and huge shower. hotel itself very nice and in perfect place to explore the strip. Good points; great location, lovely pool area, pity only 1 pool open the 2 days we got to relax as small pool got very crowded. Restraunts; Sherwood forest cafe great value and fabulous food but problem when your in a queue to get in and you can see there are tables free inside and set for diners. Buffet; not impressed with this and only tried it twice,not happy with way it is set up. Food court; brilliant, every taste catered for, Cold Stone ice cream the best ever. Bad Points.Every time you move about the hotel you are approached by those horrible time share people, it got so bad i wanted to get a tee shirt with writing on it, NO TIME SHARE APPROACH PLEASE, Overall a great time at the Excaliber and would return.

Reviews.Title: “check in awful”
Reviews.Author: Carlie25
Reviews.Content: This is the second time of staying here and we only stayed because the mandalay bay was booked for the time we wanted. we got to the hotel at 3.30pm and queued for about 15-20minutes to check in. We booked the room and paid the amount for the three nights in full at the time of booking. We finally got to the desk to be told that there were no clean rooms that we had booked and we could change rooms at no extra cost!! we booked and paid for a newly remodelled widescreen view room, they were offering us a normal tower room for the same price, no widescreen tv not remodelled and no view, i said def not. then they said they would discount 10 dollars per night!!! i had already paid nearly 200 dollars extra and they were going to down grade us and still charge us more then 170 dollars more then anyone else!!! i asked when the room would be ready, my reply was, i dont know come back in a couple of hours. we had just flown ten hours and wanted a shower, i was not impressed at all. i said i paid in advance and expected the room to be ready for us. she said very rudely, we have taken the payment its quite easy for us to reverse it and you stay somewhere else. i said i wasnt queueing again on the offchance the room would be ready, so she said go to the vip check in. i would never stay at this hotel again. the room was ok nothing special. beware of the shower floor, very slippery, my boyfriend slipped over in the shower as there is no protection. not a happy customer. moved to the mgm grand after a couple of days and could not fault the staff. i suppose you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “About what I expected... except for the hard beds”
Reviews.Author: FrequentBizTraveler
Reviews.Content: I paid $20 extra per night for the upgraded rooms and it was fine except for a really hard bed. The decor itself in the upgraded tower is new, clean and nice. Room service (breakfast) was very spotty: 20 minutes one day, over an hour the next. Bathroom toiletries are cheap and not replenished during the stay. As with most Vegas hotels, there is no coffee maker in the room and few channels on the TV as they don't want you to spend time in your toom. In-room internet ($12.99/day) was very fast. Check-in was fast and they allowed me to check in before noon. Staff were all friendly. Hotel is directly connected via skybridges to Luxor and Mandalay Bay. Overall: what I'd expect from a large Vegas hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a sticky mess!”
Reviews.Author: cchristys
Reviews.Content: We stayed a total of four nights at the hotel. The first night was excellent since I immediately won enough money to pay for all four nights of the hotel plus some shows, etc. This was brilliant. However, if only I had a crystal ball, I probably would have stayed somewhere else. That night, we ate at the Sherwood Cafe and it was the worst food ever. It was not fresh and the pancakes were hard as rocks. We each got a hot chocolate that wasn't even stirred. We ended up not eating it and refused to pay. We were shocked that they got security over when we told them that the food was horrible and that we would not be eating it. Now, I could see them refusing to take it off the bill if we ate it but, we were very dissapointed in it. And, I assure you that money wasn't an issue since I had just won a jackpot. Even security was a little miffed that they got them over there. They ended up comping us. That was nice since we didn't even eat the crap. The upgraded rooms were at best mediocre and I'm not sure if $20 more a night is worth it. However, I would have hated to have seen the older rooms. Our view was of the towers and luxor; however, in order to have a view, we had to rig the blinds everyday because they did not work. We basically had to tie them up as high as we could. When you looked out the window, you could tell that others did the same thing. For upgraded rooms this was horrible. Maid service was not the best. The rooms were not dusted and the beds were made horribly. On the last day, I noticed some sticky scum on the blanket which really grossed me out that I had been sleeping under them. On my last night there, we decided to go off the strip for breakfast. When the valet drove up my Lexus, it was covered with tree sap, twigs and bird droppings. I asked if it was parked under a tree and the valet said that it was. So much for valeting your car....I could have parked it under a tree myself if that's what I wanted. I was livid and asked to speak with management. Management agreed that they had a problem with the sap and would take care of this before I woke up in the morning. Around 10:00am, I got a call from the Valet stating that I would have to go get the car washed myself and that they would reimburse me. Well, since it was almost check out time, they said that they would give us a 3pm check out time. So, off to the car wash. I had it detailed hours before I arrived in Vegas and they told me that it would have to be waxed again to get the sap off. So, I paid for the minimum to get it off. Two hours later, they were finished and we drove back to the Exacalibur. So much for two hours being wasted but, I was happy the SAP was off my car. So, the staff took care of it as planned and reimbursed me $35.00. Before we left to get the car wash, I was told that I had enough points on my card to get 2 free buffets. I asked the Manager, who reimbursed me for the car wash, how I get the buffets. She told me to charge it to my room and when I came down to check out, it would be taken care of. Well, we went and had our buffets and came down to check out. Well, at check out, they tried charging me for the buffets. Again, I was very upset since I had wasted my morning getting the car washed and now they were saying that I owed over $30 for the buffet. I asked for the Manager and she said, "Well, we paid for your car wash and we gave you a late check out." (wasn't this nice of her to do this for us especially since neither were our fault.) I said, "You know, I was told that the buffet would be taken care of too...what about my time." Thirty minutes later, after I started getting a little pissy with them, they finally comped our buffet. My Mother was pretty upset with the whole ordeal since she had planned on being home before we had even gotten to leave. If it had not been for my win the first night, this stay would have sucked.

Reviews.Title: “Widescreen room - just because I asked.”
Reviews.Author: snowwhite
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights with our two children aged 8 and 12. When we arrived at around 7pm I asked at check in if we could have a room in Tower 2, the young lady looked at the computer screen and said that would be fine; she didn't ask for any further money so we were very pleased about this. Our room was on the 10th floor and had a view of the towers - it was just like the many pictures on the website, I particularly liked the amount of counter space in the bathroom and the hair dryer was quite powerful for a hotel one. It was good to have a safe and there was plenty of storage. Our a/c stopped working one evening and I rang down, 20 minutes later 2 maintenance men came up and sorted it out for us. The hotel is family friendly - as advertised - which is what we wanted. I didn't think it was particularly smokey. The Sherwood Forest Cafe was good and we ate there one night as they were serving steak specials for $7.99 - which were very good, they also had a good kids menu. We also ate at the buffet, which was cheap and cheerful with friendly chefs on the cavery station. The salad counter was good and well stocked but for a little extra we much preferred the Luxor buffet - which has a better range of food and is higher quality, it also has a dessert station to die for! We went to The Tournament of Kings Show one evening and were seated in the Spanish section with a very loud school/collage? party, so we got fully involved in all the cheering and booing and had a great time. The food is also good and plentiful considering it is mass produced. We spent a few hours in the swimming pool and had a fun time playing monsters and princesses with our kids. One pool was closed which we were initiallly disappointed by, but once we started playing we still had a great time. I don't know what they put in the pool but it ruined my and my husbands swimwear - it sort of ate away at the elastic in them - luckily we didn't notice until we were back in the room and I don't really care now if anyone else did! We were constantly hassled by timeshare staff but just said no thanks / not interested etc and that was that! No problem really. One evening was quite funny - I had taken the kids up at about 10pm using my husbands room key as I'd not taken my bag with me. He stayed downstairs to play BlackJack. When he tried to return he was not allowed by security as he didn't have a room key. They asked him the room number but he said 10214 instead of 10240 and when they rang up (luckily) noone was there. He asked someone to come up so I could verify who he was but they refused. In the end, after a lot of questions and answers at check in they issued a new key. So I will say that security is very good at the hotel!! Location is good and I don't know what all the fuss about walking the strip is about. Ok it was late March and we couldn't have coped in the summer heat but one day we walked across to the MGM and then all the way to the Venetian, we got a taxi to the Stratosphere to go up the tower and do the rides then walked back to Circus Circus then got a taxi back. Taxis are cheap. Las Vegas is great fun, the kids loved it (That will pick up some bad comments for me!) and we will go back and would stay at the Excalibur again.
