Try to get out of Vegas - The Valley of Fire is amazing! Please feel free to ask any questions!!

Reviews.Title: “Travel Agent warns do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: lapCanada
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on my 30th birthday. I received bed bugs from the room. I received my money back for the stay but spent my 30th birthday with bug bites. I am a travel agent and I would highly recommend to travellers and to travel agents booking else where.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Stay!”
Reviews.Author: AH2301
Reviews.Content: We had read mixed reviews about this hotel but were pleasantly suprised. We had booked our stay through Allegiant Air and had paid in advance. When we arrived, which was pretty late in the evening (around 10pm) the type of room we had booked was no longer available (double queen beds). So we were upgraded to a room in the newly remodeled portion of the hotel. The room was really nice and our room was cleaned thoroughly every day. We ate at the Sherwood Forest Cafe at the Excalibur and the food was pretty average, but the portions were big for the price. Service at the restaurant was so-so. The staff at the front desk was friendly and helpful... check-in and check-out went very smoothly. The casino here is a lot of fun and one of our favorites on the strip... drink service is really fast! We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal For The Money”
Reviews.Author: compujohn1
Reviews.Content: I normally stay at The Orleans for the great rooms and price, but with the traffic congestion getting worse than ever I decided to stay on the strip. and skip renting a car this trip. I considered the Imperial Palace but decided on something a little more modern. We got a "Widescreen" room on the seventh floor. Room was very clean, a little small but not that bad. Housekeeping was good except for one day. I normally like rooms up high but it was certainly nice to not have to wait for the elevator ! I found the staff alright. Not great but not bad at all. Check in was very smooth and girl at the desk was helpful. Now, let's comment on other people's complaints: I've noticed a few people complain about the poor channel selection and all I can say is sure, but why on earth are you sitting in a room watching TV ? I also noticed a few complaints about the "dark" decor. Uh - medieval theme, right ? I liked it. A nice change to the other overly bright hotels. As for the constant barrage of sales people trying to push "free" vouchers, shows, timeshares, whatever. YES, I agree completely. This is rubbish and totally unwanted. As soon as I walked in I got caught off guard and one of them actually got me over to the desk before I realized what was going on. I hate being rude to people, but the best way I dealt with them was to completely ignore them and keep walking. Or if you want to have a little fun, some of them will walk up to you with their hand out and say "Hi, how are you doing today ?" I found a great answer was to shake that hand and say "Well, I had some really bad diarrhea earlier but I'm doing alright now !" But back to the issue, let's face it - just about everywhere you go on the strip you will run into these people and a lot of them are extremely nasty. It's part of the Vegas experience. As for the complaints about too many children in the hotel - I noticed quite a few children in all the hotels. Probably the most I've seen in 12 years I've been going to Vegas. Now for my one and only complaint about the Excalibur: If you get a room next to the elevator and are a light sleeper, go back and ask for another room. The A/C drowned out most of the noise but you can hear the machinery running all night. It wasn't terrible (or I would have asked for another room) but I can see it being bad for some people. So all in all, not a bad deal for the money. I was on a tight budget and if I go again on a budget I would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated rooms, out-dated casino/main lobby”
Reviews.Author: mcmug2002
Reviews.Content: We were originally booked into the Monte Carlo (paid $90 a night on priceline) but because of the fire that happened the week before we arrive, they have to move us to their sister property. Stayed there for 2 nights. Based on the price we paid in Monte Carlo -> they determine that we're in the "Exclalibur" grade. Knowing it was an older establishment, I objected to their arragement but the Monte Carlo/MGM booking staff would not do anything. They assured me that we'll be booked into one of the "newly renovated rooms" in tower 2. We arrived a 8:30pm on a Sunday...check in lines was long and took us about 20mins. The casino is going thru re-carpeting, etc as well so we'd to go in big circles to walk from one end to the other. Rooms are renovated with LCD TV and nice bed. However, only the sink/vanity in the bathroom was upgraded and the old/original shower remained. Decor in the lobby/Casino is very outdated. Outdoor pool was closed. Internet costs $13 a day. Front desk explained to us that $1/day would be charged automatically to the room to cover local calls. However, we used the express check out service and was charged $50 on credit card. We only used internet for one day and the rest of the charges were the 1-800 calls made. Apparently they charge $1.00 per 1-800 call. Did not dine on-site as none of their establishment was too exciting. This is my 2nd trip to Vegas and if I'd a choice, would definitely not pay $90 for an Exclalibur room.

Reviews.Title: “good accept for the last day?”
Reviews.Author: jil204
Reviews.Content: it was very nice but the last day i woke up to someone banging on my door and the room was flooded. Apparently someone flushed a towel down the toilet above us.I know it wasnt the hotels fault but they should be more then willing to compensate you for this. I did get two nights free but it wasnt easy, in my opinion the hotel should suggest compensating you, they made like it was no big deal. My clothes and my suitcase were soaked it was a real mess.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the price”
Reviews.Author: NativeOR
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went with friends to Vegas for a week in February. We chose Excalibur because it was the cheapest but still half way decent reviews. We learned from last time that we aren't in the room much anyway. Still, we don't plan on going back there. The hotel was decent, but there was construction constantly as they ripped up sections of floor. Every time we came back to the room or got up in the morning a new section was blocked and a new detour had to be taken. A minor inconvenience by itself considering, but combined with the tight machines, poor air circulation (VERY smokey), and it being at the far end of the strip, it would be worth it to pay more for a nicer place. The worst was the time share people. They were down right rude - mocking, yelling, pushy. Most places you can say no or ignore them, but not these ones. Still, if you are on a budget, it's one of the better budget hotels. Recommend highly Dick's Last Resort and the Tournament of Kings.

Reviews.Title: “A Few Knights in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Rollywheels
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week - to make sure that we had enough time in Vegas (but it's never enough time!). The hotel was a bit old, but comfortable. They were putting in new carpeting while we were there, but the renovations were not an imposition at all. The rates were really good, and in fact a big reason why we chose to stay here. The hotel is not as fabulous as some of the newer, fancy hotels (Palazzo, Wynn, etc.), but it is fun and friendly. The dinner show (Tournament of Knights) was awesome, and the cast truly got the crowd going. The food was very good as well. It was definitely worth the ticket price. Dick's Last Resort was a hoot!! We laughed the entire time we were there! The waiters constantly kept us entertained, and were fun to be around. We even started laughing and joking with surrounding tables, it seemed like the whole place was one big party! Note though, that the place is a bit crass - which is why we loved it!! However, we were surprised to see people there with younger kids - definitely not appropriate. The midway was fun, and the other stores and restaurants were convenient and well priced. Although the Excalibur seems to cater to families through theme and having a midway, Vegas is definitely still an adult playground. We weren't sure why people would bring kids to Vegas anyway. This is a really good value hotel, if you are a looking for a place to sleep with decent food.

Reviews.Title: “sorry, but not a good review”
Reviews.Author: rckl0382
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in properties before that have had some negative TripAdvisor reviews,and have had no issues during our stay. Not the case this time... As I have stated in my other reviews, we are raising a 9 year old grandson. He wanted to see Las Vegas. My husband and I have been there several times and we knew that there were lots of things for him to enjoy (Hoover Dam, the Fremont laser show, the top of the Stratosphere, the Eiffel Tower, M &M World, the Bellagio fountains, the Habitat at the Flamingo, etc..). We also assumed that the Excalibur is family friendly. After all, there is the Fantasy Faire game room, the dinner show where you eat with your hands, the 4 pools, the whole castle themed thing... So we booked 2 rooms last December (3 months ago) for his March spring break. We reserved-and paid a deposit for-2 non smoking rooms with a wide screen TV and a view of the strip. We wanted non smoking as my sister and my grandson both have some problems when exposed to a large amount of smoke. Our flight did not arrive until 10 pm. When we checked in, we were told that all the non smoking rooms were gone. I said that I reserved these rooms 3 months prior. His reply was, "it does not matter how far out you booked your rooms. It is first come-first served." He told us that if we stopped back at the desk after 12 noon the next day, we could get our requested rooms. He also said that the hotel staff would help us move our belongings to our new rooms. It was really late by that time, and we felt as though we had no other option. We got to our 2 smoking rooms on the smoking floor. Not all of the key cards worked, so we had to make another trip downstairs to get new key cards. The view from both rooms was the roof of the casino below. All we could see was the red and blue turret towers. No view of the strip at all. We waited till noon the next day and asked to be moved to the rooms that I had requested months ago. We were told that they had 2 non smoking rooms ready and I asked if they both had views of the strip. I was told "yes". We were told that we had just enough time to go back to our current rooms and get our suitcases out of the rooms as our key cards would momentarily be deactivated to our 2 current rooms. There was no mention of assistance from the hotel staff to help move us. We hurried as quickly as humanly possible to our current rooms. Guess what, folks? The key cards to the rooms that our belongings were in had already been deactivated! We were furious! We were on our way back downstairs to talk to-who -knows- who in order to get into our rooms so we could get our things out. We spotted a hotel staff member on our floor. We explained our situation and pleaded with him/her to let us into our rooms. This person kept telling us to go back downstairs and talk to supervision until he/she saw the desperation in our faces. We were let in only if we promised not to tell as he/she was afraid of being fired! Fired? This is the only person since our arrival that was willing to go above and beyond and they were afraid of getting fired? How sad...We offered him/her some cash for saving us, but it was refused. What an awesome employee to help us out even when it meant their job was on the line.... We finally get in to our non smoking rooms only to discover that only one of the rooms had a strip view. The other still had a view of the casino roof and the red and blue turret towers. Only now with this view you could also see old hotel room furniture stored in an area on the roof and also a "punching bag" that had been hung-for staff use, I guess...Yeah, nice view. Shame on the staff member that just plain lied when stating that both non smoking rooms had views of the strip. We were so tired of taking that long walk back in order to get what we asked for that we just gave up and took the rooms. But wait, it gets even better..We spent some time at the pool and wanted drinks from the bar. The line at the bar kept getting longer and longer. The bartender was refusing to wait on anyone. Instead, he was gathering up bottles and wiping down the bar area for closing time. It was still a good while before the bar was to close for the evening. The line kept increasing and he just kept ignoring the customers. Finally another customer became very upset and told the bartender that his job was to wait on customers as long as there was one in front of him. I could not agree more. The gathering of beer bottles, mixers, and liquors can wait until the customers have all been taken care of or until after the bar closes-not before. Finally another bartender came out, but he was not much more motivated than the other one. We actually heard one of the bartenders say, "There are ticked off people here today. But I really and truly do not care." Yep, that was obvious,buddy. I am a former night club owner and I would have fired any bartender that had that attitude. And as for the bar/restaurant inside known as "Dick's Last Resort"-that place needs to be moved away from the path that leads to the rooms. As we walked by the place with our grandson (and there were a large number of other children on spring break walking by there as well) there was a young inebriated man and woman in the midst of an obscene and truly embarrassing act. I realize that it was also spring break for college students as well, but for Pete's sake, clean it up, Excalibur!! If you really see nothing wrong with what was happening in there, then please put up a wall so the rest of don't have to watch what bordered on "porn!" Family friendly hotel? I think not...... After our initial experience, we felt that we could just not spend our hard-earned money in the Excalibur restaurants, gift shops casino, etc.. So we spent it elsewhere on the strip. We felt as though "we really mattered" to the staff everywhere we went except the Excalibur. Customer service is what it is all about and my personal opinion is that this hotel just doesn't understand that. Even our 9 year old grandson picked up on the fact that the service was not all that it should be. I know that this "vent" won't make a difference to the hotel management, but I want the TripAdvisor readers to know about our experience. Will we visit Vegas again? Yes, indeed! Will we stay at Excalibur again? No way!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: JennyBGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Excalibur Hotel for 4 nights on a room only basis with a group of family members. Las Vegas is a completely different holiday to anything you will ever experience and the most you really need is a room to sleep in and get showered and changed. The Excalibur is not the most plush out of all the hotels however, it is clean and tidy and the rooms are extremely big. The towels and sheets are changed regularly and it provides a quiet place to get your head down. The only gripe I had was with the hotel staff on arrival. We had requested a non smoking room and on arrival they stated they only had smoking rooms left. In order to get a non smoking room we had to pay to upgrade to a room with a view of the strip which was only about £10 per night, but not the point. Agreed to do it eventually after a row with the manager however we were so tired we couldnt be bothered with it. The pool area has no brolleys or shade so is not suitable for young children, I think this is to encourage people to stay inside and gamble. The breakfast is fantastic and after paying a standard amount you can eat what you want, which is basically what happens at all hotel restaurants breakfast, lunch or dinner. It is at one end of the strip and is fine if you are happy to walk, which to be honest is the whole idea of vegas as you will walk for miles both inside and out of hotels regardless of where you stay on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel even with the kids”
Reviews.Author: mariamac
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice. We traveled with our two younger children but saw many families at Excalibur. We upgraded our room for $20 a night and we were glad we did. We were told the remodeled rooms had queen beds instead of full size, a safe, and flat screen tv. The beds were very comfortable and I like using a safe while I am out of the room. No free internet acess, however. Overall, a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great time with the Family”
Reviews.Author: DuBBy111
Reviews.Content: The Excalibur was great. We decided to take our two children 5 & 7 and stay at the Excalibur for 4 days. When we checked in at the front desk they where very kind to us and we recieved a delux room in tower 1. The room was very clean and the beds where very comfortable. I really liked this room for the kids because it is a little larger and has a table and couch. We never spent alot of time in the room because of the great location that we where at and the kids loved the gaming area. You can walk everyplace on the strip from this location with kids and enjoy yourself. The food at the buffet was good but with kids that don't eat alot its not worth the kids price. My kids ate better at McDonalds. We had a babysitter everynight so the wife and I could go and gamble. We had alot of fun and the waitresses brought us drinks quickly. We never won alot but never really gambled very hard to try to when big. As for the time share people. They only bothered us the first two days. After that they never said anything anymore because it was the same people. This is a great hotel for a family on a budget. They have a magic show next door at the Tropicana that is good for a family and good price. We loved our stay Excalibur and will go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Super Prince”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler1492
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 3 days is Vegas, and stayed at the Excalibur Hotel & Casino. The hotel was very nice, the room large (and quiet) and the view ok. I didn’t spend anytime at the pool, but did take a quick look. According to the hotel website, they have just finished a remodel of the pool. The pool was open, but two of the three pools were closed, including the one with two water slides, during my stay. However, it looked like it has the potential to be fun during the hot summer months. There is also free tram service between the Excalibur and Mandalay Bay (with a stop at the Luxor) it was easy making a 730pm showing of Mama Mia! The price was the best part, $51 a night, booked online with 30 days advance booking and a $10 discount per night! This offer is valid through the end of the year! One can't beat $51 a night in Vegas. I spend little time in my room; therefore, don't mind staying at a low-end property. However, this property didn't seem low end at all! I would consider staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “first time visiting vegas”
Reviews.Author: anaerosmithchick
Reviews.Content: This was my first time visiting vegas and I didn't know what to expect. I was offered the $20 upgrade at checkin so I took advanatage of it, and I did and loved my view, I was on the 21st floor. It can be confusing when you are first there trying to figure out where to go, but the people were very helpful. I stayed in tower 2 and I noticed that on one side they were checking for room keys but not always on my side. the room was nice and clean, a bathtub would have been nice though after walking around all day and night. My only real complaint was in the spa, the guy who did my massage talked pretty much throughout the massage and was telling me rather personal things and asked me some things that I did not feel comfterable answering. Not very professional and my tip reflected my unhappyness with it. For the price it was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Pay the extra 20 dollars for the upgraded rooms”
Reviews.Author: Melissa Masino
Reviews.Content: The new upgraded rooms are really nice and worth paying the extra 20 bucks a night. Even though we weren't in our room very much, it was still worthwhile. The bed isn't as comfortable as one you would have at a more expensive hotel, but it was decent. There is no bathtub. Only a standing shower. The bathroom and room itself though are very clean. I would stay here again if I knew I wasn't going to be in my room very much.

Reviews.Title: “Renaissance Fair gone wild!”
Reviews.Author: vrjenia
Reviews.Content: We decided to extend our stay in Vegas by a night and booked a room at the Excalibur at the last minute, mainly due to the cheap price. We paid $55 and received a $25 dining credit. The mix of clientelle at the Excalibur is reflective of the price... as one of the most affordable options on the Strip is attracts a lot of college students... and well, uh, others that would appreciate a $50 hotel room. I feel bad for the families that ended up here on package tours with their young children (it must have been really weird for them to have their 10 year olds hanging out at the pool while 22 year olds got drunk a couple feet away). I have nothing against college students, but at 30, I'd rather not be in the middle of their spring break. The theme is the most played out theme on the Strip. Maybe they could update it, kinda like Treasure Island did by updating their theme from kid friendly pirates to sexy partygirl pirates... they could go for a sexy princess theme... or maybe they should just implode the place... or change the sign to Motel 6. The room was, in a word, gross. And in two words: gross and weird. The medieval stuff looks like it is from a flea market. Honestly, the only people I can manage this place appealling to are renaissance fair dorks or college kids that are just looking for a crash pad on the strip. The bed was noticeably sunken, I was scared to walk barefooted on the carpet (though I did see one 20 year old drunk guy walking barefoot through the casino), and I wished I would have had shower shoes for the bathroom. I was there in mid-March on a 75 degree day that followed a string of 60 degree days, so the pool was packed. I noticed they did not check our room keys when we entered the pool area. The mix of people at the pool was interesting: a lot of college spring breakers (they seemed to be enjoying the hotel, I noticed the bartender at the pool did not check IDs), the previously mentioned families on package tours, and what were either really tan college students with really nice bodies or local strippers... that could be a plus for some I suppose. To sum it up, if you are 19 to 24 looking for a cheap place to party with your friends, this is a good option. For anyone else, I'd recommend elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Room!!!”
Reviews.Author: Briman111
Reviews.Content: I read that the hotel had updated many rooms and offered a strip view for an extra $10/night. I thought I would give it a shot for a Friday and Saturday night at $121 each night!! Great price for a new room with strip view, in my opinion. Check in went very quickly at about 9:00 PM on Friday night. We were in Tower 2, which has the better strip view and is very close to the pool area. Tower 1 requires you to walk through the casino to get to the pool. Speaking of the pool, the new area is now open and is VERY nice!! Some of the pools themselves were not open, but the whole surrounding area was available for sitting. No real restrictions on alcohol, either. We just bought some beers from the store upstairs and brought them down there. There is also a bar, but I didn't check any prices to compare. The room was nice. Two queens, flat screen TV, nice bathroom, good view. We were only on the 12th floor, and the view was nice (see photos). I do like the location of Excalibur, connected to Luxor and just an overpass away from NYNY (The Bar at Times Square is the BEST place to hang with the dueling pianos), Tropicana, and MGM. Parking was very easy and access is easy right off Tropicana. The casino was typical. Limits weren't crazy high like a Bellagio or Wynn level casino. We ate at the buffet for breakfast. The food was great, but the setup is kind of weird. You wait in line after paying, and the lines moves right to the start of the buffet. After you get your food, you then get escorted to your seat. I don't know how it works of you want a second plate. (We were set with one). We also ate at Dick's Last Resort, which is quite an experience. Again, the food was great but the atmosphere was odd. Like they say in the advertisements, you need to go there to understand what it is all about. I don't think I would go back, though. We enjoyed the pool area, new room, and location. All in all, a real good experience. I would probably stay there again, but only in the new rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: annmarieUk
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed at the Excalibur for ten nights last summer and we absolutely loved it. The check in was simple and when we reached our room on the 26th floor we decided we wanted to upgrade to a strip view room. We ventured back down to the check-in and the staff were more than able to accomodate our request and automatically upgraded our room for an extra $10 a night. The new room had a fantastic strip view, plasma tv, nice, clean, large bathroom, a safety deposit box and two queen beds. The room was clean, spacious and modern (enough). The towels and beds were changed everyday, the room was tidied and the beds made. The staff were friendly and the hotel was clean and secure. It wasn't too far away from the rest of the strip, however it appeared a long walk in the heat, we stopped several times for water or to pop into another hotel to cool down. Overall I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel and would definately recommend a visit to Las Vegas. It has so far been our best holiday and we are already planning our return.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, fun place, nice pool!”
Reviews.Author: Becky15349
Reviews.Content: My 5 friends and I stayed at Excalibur this past weekend for my bachelorette party, from 3/6/08 - 3/10/08 and had an awesome time. We stayed in rooms 22158 and 22160, which were ajoining rooms. Granted, the rooms weren't modern at all, but they were spacious, clean, and had large bathrooms with large counters that were good for 6 girls needing to get ready to go to the clubs each night!! The hotel staff was nice, and we also rented a fridge in one of the rooms for the 4 nights we were there, and the fridge worked well and was brought to the room quickly after I called for it. The pool at the excalibur is really nice too - they just finished remodeling it and are almost nearly completed. I think the only thing that was left to do was balance the water chemicals in the larger front pool, because it wasn't open. The back pool is really nice, large and has lots of palm trees and cute guys and girls, with really pretty waterfalls!! I was totally blown away, because I hadn't expected this at all!! We paid around $700 for 2 rooms for 4 nights, which is an average of $88/night...and it was the best deal ever!!! I think that the food court at Excalibur is good too - they have a little bit of everything. Go to the Sherwood Forest cafe and get the $7.00 steak special! Its really good - order it medium. Also YOU MUST GO TO DICK'S LAST RESORT - it is such a blast. We had so much fun there on friday night that we went again on Saturday night! Order a small 190 Octane (a yummy frozen Fat Tuesday beverage) and have a good time!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay At Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: ibefit
Reviews.Content: Although this was not my first stay in Vegas but the first time at the Excalibur, I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. From the bellmen to housekeeping, everyone was very accomodating and timely. Upon arrival (a Sunday) there was a little bit of a line at the Registration Desk but in no time we were on our way to the room on the 25th floor of the old tower. The "view" room was very clean, beds were comfortable as were the pillows. We stayed in the older tower but it was very nice and clean. The room design is of course themed according to the Excalibur which gives a dated appearance but I felt that went right along with the theme of the hotel. Housekeeping was very timely when calling for extra towels, etc. Our room did not have a refrigerator so we ordered one which was immediately brought to the room. The service was very good. The view room faced the other towers and revealed a partial view of the strip but this was not important for me as I didn't spend much time in the room anyway. I also, despite some reviews of the food, went to the buffet at this hotel as well and found the food and service to be very good as well. I had lots of seafood but the buffet offered quite a variety of food. I found the buffet staff to be very accomodating and friendly as well. Of course I had forgotten about the tour traps at these hotels and was approached to take a "tour" in exchange for free or reduced price show tickets, cruises, etc. on several occasions but that was no bother. After they saw me several times they stopped asking and a polite no thanks moved them on to the next tourist. The casino was busy but not extremely so. I like slots and found them to be fun and quite a variety (especially when you're winning!). I did see the Tournament of Kings show which was great. The showmanship was excellent. The food had a very good taste but caused me a little bit of stomach problem. No eating utensels required as the meal consisted of Cornish hen, broccoli, oven roasted potatoes, bread and unlimited soda/pop. There was a cookie type desert (I really don't know what it was) but it was not very tasty at all. At the end of the show we got to meet some of the actors and they posed for pictures with us. Overall, our stay was enjoyable, would stay again and recommend it to my friends as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel & Great Price”
Reviews.Author: eMm-LeE-07
Reviews.Content: So we went to vegas for my fiance 21st b-day, and I decided to pick the excalibur. The hotel staff was great he gave us an upgrade to the new room, which is well worth it. One thing that bothered me though was the people trying to sell the tickets by where you enter the tower are annoying and very rude if you are under 25! anyway we didnt eat at the hotel were mcdonalds freaks. It was very nice there I really enjoyed it. The casino is a little older then the others which was a negative but since he was the only one of age we didnt spend much time there. If you are willing to pay a couple more dollars for a higher class hotel then i would recommend the luxor. It was beautiful and I had friends stay there and said it was great. I liked the walkway we had to luxor because we did see the fantasy show that was there and it does get chilli at night so we just went through the walkway which was wonderful. by the way the show is great also well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “just alright”
Reviews.Author: jabryant22
Reviews.Content: The whole hotel is just very bland. The rooms are ok, the food was ok, the pool was ok. Everything overall was just very average. The one good thing was the tram that goes from excalibur to the luxor and mandalay bay. Next time I will spend the extra $20 or $30 a night and stay at the luxor or mandalay bay , they are much nicer. Check out the toby keith bar and grill at the harrahs its lots of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Budget Travellers”
Reviews.Author: barons29
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay in Vegas and my first time at Excalibur. I have to say that it was better than I had expected. Paying $61 a night for that location I had set myself up to expect the worst but I was very surprised once I arrived. Within 10 minutes from arrival at the front door I was checked in and in my room. I was given one of the newly renoed rooms which are spacious and very clean. The hotel itself is really nice. The only downside to Excalibur is the casino and the buffet. It is an older casino so it isn't as glamourous as some of the other places nearby and the dealers aren't the most welcoming people out there. As for the buffet you get what you pay for. The buffet is realitively cheap but the food is average at best. This hotel is perfect if you are just looking for a cheap place to rest your head that is central to everything on the strip. If you are looking to stay around the hotel more during your stay (pool, entertainment, etc) and still keep the cost low, I would suggest paying a little extra for a hotel like Treasure Island or the Mirage ($100 a night during low times).

Reviews.Title: “Out of this world!!”
Reviews.Author: stacei81
Reviews.Content: What can i say an amazing hotel! Went with my Mum main purpose of visit to see Celine Dion didnt want nothing to fancy this hotel is great, good location with bridges linking you to New York New York, Luxor Mgm and Mandalay Bay. 24HR bar and casino this truly is the city that never sleeps! Happy hour every night and some fab resturants or u can grap a mcdonalds or pizza hut. Theres some shops as well. Even though i didnt go and see them they had shows every night too. recommend going to the titanic expo in the Tropicana across the road and visit O'Sheas bar on the strip for kareoke every tuesday Has to be the best place in the world and u couldnt ask more from a hotel clean friendly staff rooms were ok cleaned everyday not 1 complaint def going back

Reviews.Title: “A Guest Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Klockars
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Excalibur. The special we booked was for a two-bed room in the older Tower One that has a great view of the strip and the airplanes landing at McCarran airport. This was a real treat with always something interesting going on. The room was nicely renovated and clean but the beds were very hard. I called the desk and asked whether we could have a mattress topper to make them softer, and I was told that they would send two up immediately, and was there anything else they could do for me? When the mattress toppers came, a maid came with them to remake our beds. This made the beds very comfortable. We found the strip and the airport were noisy at night, but this goes with the spectacular view. We turned the fan on and this made a "white" noise that covered the disturbance. We ate at the buffet and although it had good prime rib, it was not the most interesting overall. There were other good food choices like the $7 steak special in the Sherwood Forest Cafe, and a food court that has McDonalds, Pizza Express, Chinese food and more. We especially liked the Prime Rib and Peppercorns sandwich at Quiznos.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Hotel & Excellent Room”
Reviews.Author: ozcookie1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was much easier to find than we expected as were driving in from LA and this was the first thing we saw at the end of the strip. Visually the turrents are very appealing from the outside. Check-in was easy but I was surprised at how close reception was to the bar and gaming areas. We must have been lucky as were upgraded to one of the refurbished rooms with one of the largest TVs I have ever seen. We had a fantastic view and the room despite not being overly large had a great feel and was excellent value for money. Only downside was the lack of tea/coffee making facilities in the room. Call me a cynic but it might have something to do with the 'Starbucks' located 20 metres from the lifts to the hotel towers. Alas we arrived very late and left early so didn't get a chance to use the pool or the restaurants but there appeared to be plenty of options. Overall-we really enjoyed our short stay and would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great for New Years”
Reviews.Author: Mega_Man_KC
Reviews.Content: The staff were excellent over New Years in 2007-2008. The check in lines were unbelievable, but they had their act together and it only took about 10 minutes in a long line to get our room. Also, on check out, we left a day early, and they gave us a refund instead of charging us for the whole night! Awesome! It's got a good location, but getting across the street in either direction can be a pain. The room only had a shower, no bath, but the view was fantastico! It wasn't particularly spacious, but it was very clean, as was the restroom. The management is no nonsense and they will respond to your needs, which is hard to do in a busy town like Vegas, especially on New Years. I've stayed here twice and it really is the best deal on the strip. Much better than its sister hotel CIrcus Circus and only marginally worse than Luxor (Mandalay is much nicer). We ate at the buffet, which was only okay. Sherwood Forest restaurant was better and so much food for the money! They usually have a couple decent bands playing downstairs so go see them, they're free. The spa is great also, although you will have to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good place to say with kids”
Reviews.Author: taekwondo-family
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival, we noticed that the Casino was not well ventiliated, The cigarette smoke was overwhelming. Check-in staff was very helpful Our reservation had been mixed up and we were booked in 3 hotel rooms. Our check-in lady was very patient as she waited for the "hotel reservation" staff to correct our problem. The hotel needs to allow the check-in staff to fix such mishaps themselves. This would have made checking in less time consuming for us. The room in Tower 2 was quite clean with a large bathroom and shower. Beds were comfortable and clean. The air conditioner was very loud when it came on, causing some loss of sleep. Our first 2 nights went smoothly and the halls were quiet. The last night of our stay was a different story. There was a loud party down the hall from us with pleny of bad language and behavior. Our daughter became aftraid and we called hotel security at around 12:50 a.m. The noise seemed to die down until 3:00 a.m. when partiers from the room threatened to urinate on our door. We called security again. The partiers ran up and down the hall, kicking doors, swearing, yelling that they were in control, etc. At around 4:00 a.m. we decided that we should leave the hotel early, hoping to get some sleep at the airport. Upon checking out, we requested that our money be refunded for the last night of our stay. The hotel refused our request, but said they would check the hall and door for urine, and check the partiers room for damage. We will never stay in this hotel again. We were there for the American Taekwondo Association Spring National Championships.

Reviews.Title: “Honest Opinion about the Excalibur Hotel & Casino”
Reviews.Author: Baglady001
Reviews.Content: I am actually at the hotel as I write this review. I am in Vegas on business and attending a show at the Sands Expo center. It was a last minute booking so I had to take what I could get. I was disapointed that some of the hotels I have stayed at in the past where booked but that was my own fault. I booked the Excalibur and then decided to read the reviews. I will admit that some made this place sound like the worst hotel out there. I am in one the old rooms and while they look a bit drabby they seem to be very clean. They do have only a shower but I happen to think it's better than taking a shower in a bath tub but thats my opinion. The best thing I could say about this hotel is that it's clean but badly in need of a facelift. The saying "You get what you pay for" really applies here. I am not normally the type of person to judge people but I just can't help myself. The Las Vegas NASCAR race was yesterday and I can't even begin to tell you what some of the people here are like. There are drunks all over the place and they are loud and annoying. I have seen a couple of small fights for stupid reasons, I have seen a semi naked drunk woman getting ice in her panties and bra, I have seen more people without teeth than I have seen in a lifetime, and the rude comments to other women and cocktail waitresses was very uncalled for. To be honest there are so many rednecks here I was looking for Jeff Foxworthy. Ok, another problem many others wrote and I have to agree is the time share people. You can't walk in and out of this hotel without someone running over to you asking if you want free tickets to a show. I am smart enough to know that nothing is free and I usually smile and say no thank you however a couple where downright rude. I had a guy this afternoon actually say to me "Well, then have a lousy day" when I walked by him and said no thank you. I guess he was offended that I didn't give him some of my time. You know the hotels are making money off these deals but you wonder if they really realize that they are doing more harm than good annoying their guests. I spoke with many guests and all where just as angry. I didn't find the food bad as others suggested in fact I thought it was pretty good and the prices where decent. Someone wrote that it had a McDonalds like that was a bad thing but when your running out in the morning their breakfast is fast, cheap and not all that bad. Overall this hotel is very average and attracts below average guests because it's cheap. Expect a louder crowd and not the friendliest of people. I personally would not stay here again but I didn't want to this time either. I will say that in a pinch if I had to stay here again I wouldn't think it was the end of the world. The other hotels on the strip are just way better but they cost more as well.

Reviews.Title: “Really Good for what you Pay =)”
Reviews.Author: lucky1bunny
Reviews.Content: Loved this Hotel ! Right on the strip close to all the major hotel attractions by foot! Also, what was great was that there was a McDonald's, Subways, Krispy Kreme, & more inside this hotel. We did not have the new contemporary room, but it was just as good. It was super clean & comfortable. I recommend this hotel in Vegas as it is very convient in location 'on the strip' & close to the highway. If I go back to Vegas - I will definitely stay here again !! At $70.00 a night - it is worth it !

Reviews.Title: “looove las vegas”
Reviews.Author: saz038
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying I dont know where all the negative feedback for this hotel comes from. We stayed at the Excalibur in mid Feburary and found it fantastic and one of the best hotels we stayed in on our holiday - much, much better than best westerns or comfort inns that some people like to compare this hotel to. My children were completely overwhelmed at the magnitude of the place. Granted, we were in the recently refurbished tower 2, but we could not fault anything about this hotel from the time we entered to to the time we left. The reception staff were friendly and helpful and our room was clean and large enough to accommodate the 4 of us comfortably for 3 nights. I especially liked the huge bathroom. The sherwood forest cafe serve a lovely breakfast, better than the all you can eat buffet. the food court was also very convenient. I also loved the shops within the hotel. the kids used the pool that was open and it was large and clean with a lifeguard on duty. It would be great to go back when all the pools were open. Las vegas itself was fantastic, especially at night when the strip really comes alive. You don't have to spend lots of money whilst there either. As we were travelling with children in tow, the casinos were out of the question. We took in Circ de Soliel's Mystere one night and the other nights we walked the strip; taking in the fountains at the Bellagio, watching the pirates outside of Treasure Island and having a gondala ride at the Venetian, as well as shopping, shopping and more shopping. We also did a tour of the Grand Canyon by car. However as first time travellers to the GC I would not recommend this mode of travel. Although more expensive, a bus tour or aerial tour would be money better spent. The guy we toured with in his mini van gave no commentry on anything on the way (hoover dam, route 66 etc..) and when we got to the southern rim of the GC all we did was walk around a path for about a mile, caught a shuttle back and drove back to Las Vegas - all up an 8 hour trip. All in all i would definately recommend the Excalibur to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place for the Money”
Reviews.Author: OntarioCanuck
Reviews.Content: Excalibur is a relativey inexpensive hotel on the strip with easy access to Luxor and MBay. If you want a room to sleep in that is not fancy but decent (ie like a Holiday Inn/BWestern) then this is a good choice. I am disturbed by people who try to compare it to more upscale and much more expensive hotels on the strip! You get what you pay for and as far as value this hotel is fine for a stay on the strip. If luxury is desired than MBay is a great property, but for Excalibur fits the bill because i am never in my room, more cash to spend doing other things in vegas. I have stayed there several times, it is about the same (I did not stya in an upscaled room) as it was 2 yhears ago. So enjoy if your standards are basic but want a clean comfortable room.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good vacation”
Reviews.Author: mds85
Reviews.Content: Went to Excalibur for a long weekend, 4 days/3 nights with my girlfriend, and had a very nice time. The hotel is not nearly as bad as many of the reviews make it out to be. The check-in staff was nice and friendly, and the room we booked was available for us. We did upgrade our room to a newly renovated one, and it was very nice, spacious, and clean. We ate at the food court and Sherwood Forest Cafe. The food court was fast, convenient, and relatively cheap by Vegas standards. We found Sherwood Forest to be slow, but the food was good, diner style food. The service at both could have been better. Sherwood Forest was really slow even though it wasn't really crowded when we were there, and the girl at Pizza Hut Express was just unpleasant. Also, the timeshare people that everyone seems to complain about are annoying, I can certainly agree with that. But they seem to be everywhere on the Strip, certainly at all the MGM casinos (which are about half of them on the Strip). Pretty much every time you go by them, they will approach you, but it's easy to shrug them off once you pass them a few times, especially if you're under 25, not married, don't have credit cards, etc. It's the same as passing the Grand Canyon tour solicitors, or the people passing out the porn cards. You're just ignore them and keep walking... Overall, Excalibur proved to be a nice hotel for the value. It has its upsides, and downsides as do all hotels. If you're looking for a luxury hotel, you probably want to avoid the place, but if you want a good value, with the feel of Vegas and is right on the strip, it's a good choice...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: PriceySheffield
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Excalibur from 14th-21st February this year and were slightly worried after reading some of the reviews on here. We need not have worried. We arrived at Check-in and asked to upgrade our room to one of the newly remodelled ones, for $20 a night this is worth it for the safe alone! Our room was fantastic, very spacious, light colours and nicely decorated. Bathroom had a huge walk-in shower and lots of shower gels, shampoos and other smellies. The hotel itself I thought was great, some nice lounge bars and Dick's was ok to have a beer. Our room was cleaned daily and fresh towels, soap and smellies left everyday. I found all staff that we encountered to be very friendly and helpful and couldn't fault anyone. We didn't eat in the Excalibur so can't comment on that, but I have to disagree with other reviews who said the hotel looks tired, each to their own I suppose! The only slight gripe we had was the pool was shut, but, hey, you don't go to Vegas to lounge round the pool all day!! I would certainly reccommend the Excalibur as a great base and would certainly visit again. Go on give it a try!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Room with a few caveats”
Reviews.Author: e0steven
Reviews.Content: Check in was quick and efficient, however we were told that the room we had booked far in advance was not available. Luckily we were offered an 'upgraded' room that was part of their recent renovations. The downside was that we no longer had a view, except for a concrete wall, and some of the finishing touches were a bit unfinished. We noticed that the bathroom door wasn't hung correctly and had to be pushed hard to shut, also there was some residual paint streaks on the handles. The large flat-panel TV was a very nice addition, though if I were going again the lack of free WiFi or free internet might be a deal breaker. Overall a good mid-range choice that puts you on the strip, just beware their booking strategies.

Reviews.Title: “Ok For The Money”
Reviews.Author: alligatorNH
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the excalibur in sept 06 and decided to return in 2008. They have done some remodeling. Do not bother paying extra for the flat screen TV. The reception was terrible and you only get 10 channels anyways. They over charged us for our room and it was not resolved until 2 weeks later because the manager who said she would fix our rate never did and she wasn't working the day we checked out. The manager who was on duty refused to adjust the rate to what it should have been before we checked out. We thought this was a poor business practice. I do not recommend the food at either the buffet or the bar and grill Dick's. I have had better food at military chow halls. The room was clean and bed was comfortable. It is OK for the money but I may or may not stay again based on this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Vegas Hotel but location a little off”
Reviews.Author: Flake25
Reviews.Content: Went with a few friends to Veags and this was pretty much the cheapest one on the strip. Typical Vegas hotel. Room were OK but nothing great. Wish they had a decent buffet like the Rio or Ceasers but wasn't expecting too much from this place. Only issue was the location and getting from one side to the other. Hotel is next to NY NY and Trop, but to get there you need to cross over bridges and I guess being it was like 100 degrees out just seemeed like a pain to exit out of the hotel, unlike others on the strip where you leave the hotel and you are right there on the strip. Hope the little info I provided help.

Reviews.Title: “was surprised how nice the room was.”
Reviews.Author: arkachic
Reviews.Content: my finance and I booked the Excalibur for a friday night over president's day weekend. We were arriving that night and essentially just needed a "place to crash" that night as we were seeing the Beatles Love show at the Mirage and were leaving for Sedona the next morning. The hotel: the hotel is located on the southern end of the strip next to the Luxor and not far from New York New york. I cant give you loads of info on the hotel itself since we didnt stay long, but we did see a few restaurants open for all meals as well as a spa, pool, and of course a gigantic casino with a "knightly kindgom" kind of feel. There was a small coffee shop right near the tower 2 elevators and a starbucks not far away in the hotel. Check in was easy. Check out was easier at a self serve booth. We got a room in Tower II on the 24th floor for about $115 dollars. The Room had 1 king bed and was pretty large, though our view was of the pool that was closed for the winter. There was a gigantic flat screen TV on the wall and all of the finishes seemed almost new. The bathroom was large and had granite countertops and nice soaps and stuff. My only complaint would be that tthere was no tub. They had wifi in the hotel that you could purchase for 5 dollars an hour. all in all it was a great buy for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Lived like kings at Excalibur!”
Reviews.Author: dybbiedoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Excalibur from Feb 13-Feb 17, 2008. This being our first trip to Las Vegas, I wasn’t too sure what to expect. We were pleasantly surprised with the Excalibur. We booked into one of the newly renovated rooms which are LOVELY and are excellent value for money (we paid about $100 per night plus taxes) considering the location (South Strip). The casino is lots of fun with slots and tables. While we didn’t use the pool there are three lovely looking ones and apparently a new one under construction. If you have the time you really must do the ‘Tournament of Kings’ show. Buy your tickets at one of the half price ticket booths on the strip or at the Fashion Show mall. The show was typical Vegas, lots of theatrics, smoke and lights but was so much fun. The meal was medieval style and was yummy and pretty healthy (Cornish game hen, potato wedges, broccoli, roll, soup and desert). The show is great and is very interactive with the audience. We were seated in the “Ireland’ section and even got a photo with King Patrick when it was all over. We didn’t try any of the restaurant safe for Krispy Kreme and McDonalds for quick bites. I’ve heard mixed reviews about the Round Table Buffet, we hit up the buffet at Treasure Island and it was just divine. The Excalibur is great, treat yourself and book a renovated room and have tons of fun. I cant wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Dissappointed in Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: montanatex
Reviews.Content: The Excalibur is somewhat dated, although the renovated rooms have nice finishes. The widescreen television was nice, but we had a broken window shade and trying to get any response was like pulling teeth. Finally after 2 days they moved us when we pitched a fit. Restaurant choices are somewhat limited, we found ourselves going to MGM or New York New York to eat most of the time. I would not recommend this hotel, as the service was poor.

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay”
Reviews.Author: bct1133
Reviews.Content: The hotel its self is nice, at the time of my stay they were replacing the carpet on the main floor, the only real problem I had with my stay was one the bed. I felt like I was sleeping on springs that would dig into me and my room did not have a bathtub. Other than that it ws great.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: yarsor
Reviews.Content: Stayed here this past weekend and really enjoyed it. We were upgraded to one of the refurnished rooms, which is nothing special but very clean. It is a pretty good hotel for the right price. The casino is not as nice as the others, but you could have drinks and play at a resonable price. The buffet is not good try the one next door at the Luxor.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget choice”
Reviews.Author: chrisi2007
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Excalibur twice, once in 2001 and more recently for the 3 nights of our honeymoon that we spent in Vegas in 2007. We stayed in a room that has not yet been refurbished and yes it was quite dated. On a positive side everything was working and clean however on the negative the bed linen was old and worn and wallpaper was peeling from some of the walls and the airconditioing unit was VERY noisy!! For the cheap price then this hotel is fine, thats all we wanted, we were saving the big bucks for our hotels in Hawaii!! SO I would say for a cheap deal then excalibur is great, the location is brilliant right at the end of the strip where everything is happening..However if you are looking for luxury then try another hotel. I beleive the refurbished rooms are nice tho.

Reviews.Title: “the place to go”
Reviews.Author: nounouAntony
Reviews.Content: we visited Las Vegas in august 2007 for the first time and we just loved it. We stayed at the Excalibur hotel on the strip a comfortable room in the tower beside the pool area practical to go there otherwise you have a long walk from your room ,our room looked onto New York New York on the 11th floor best to be up high for the view. The pool was lovely plenty of sun beds with towels and you can buy lovely ice cold drinks and get a snack at lunchtime, hotdogs ,hamburgers not too expensive and good moneywise. The buffet breakfasts delicious with a large choice of food good value pricewise and keeps you going for the day.The hotel is at the end of the south strip need to take transport as quite a walk in the heat to the middle of the strip where there are lots of animation in the hotels situated there. Pity there is no fridge in the room but plenty of ice in the machines in the corridor. Have a meal in the fun restaurant Dirty Dicks a good souvenir and something different! We don't gamble but loved Vegas for the hotels, lights, night life just too much to do and see and not enough time so we must go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “A good strip hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paul H
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a week in Las Vegas, absolutely love the place. We stayed at the Excalibur hotel on the strip, a typical Las Vegas hotel, huge room with views of the airport, the Luxor and Mandalay Bay hotels, cheap and brilliant buffet meals and lots to look at. Probably as a result of the eating culture in the States a high proportion of women and many men look as if they have to be winched through their bedroom window by the Fire Brigade each morning. A trend that is crossing the pond is the need to ride around in an electric buggy because the rider is far to fat to walk under their own steam! All of the hotels are about the same really with a foyer/casino bigger than a football pitch and in the city nothing closes so a game of roulette at 4am with a cocktail waitress providing the drinks is a cure for jet lag! This will be our sixth visit and apart from more building, not much has changed, walking down the strip one has to run the gauntlet of dwarf Hispanics flicking cards on their hands before shoving them at you. The cards advertise strip clubs and prostitutes; I don’t know why the authorities allow them. That’s about it though; the city is safe with little in the way of trouble it costs a lot to stay there but only through the enjoyment of a flutter in the casino. Last Tuesday we went horse riding in the Red Rock canyon, re-living the days of the cowboys on a 2 hour ride up the hills, no nice soft grass to ride on, all rough ground and climbing. Then it is back for a walk down the strip. Next door is New York New York with a scary roller coaster on the roof, opposite the MGM Grand well known for its concerts and main attractions. The expensive Bellagio with its massive water feature, over the road Paris with a near life size Eiffel tower and then The Venetian canals meandering through the hotel with gondolas and singing gondoliers. The Planet Hollywood hotel, originally the Aladdin, we stayed there twice soon after it opened, further down is another hotel that we stayed at, The Imperial Palace one of our favourites, a favourite because it houses probably the biggest classic car museum around and with a difference as almost all of the cars are unique – and for sale. Each hotel has a unique feature and as the strip gives way to more free land before the next hotel, one day this will all be hotels and casinos but now after passing a new shopping mall there is a gap before Circus Circus, one of the cheaper hotels. More shopping centres and the big Stratosphere towers above the ground with roller coaster and other rides on the top. Then we are ‘Downtown’ and for those planning a romantic Las Vegas wedding it’s fair to point out that the chapels in the main are situated in this area with the strip joints, porn shops and rampant tackiness! Chapels with names like ‘Th wee Kirk o’er the heather,’ ‘Drive thro marriages’ and ‘The little white chapel’ stand alongside cheap motels, porn book shops and clubs. The whole area is seedy. Not that being married by an overweight crooning Elvis Presley isn’t anyway! Pass through this area on one of the regular and reasonably priced double decker buses called ‘The Deuce’ and you reach Fremont with its enclosed area containing casinos with names like The Golden Nugget.’ Above is a huge curved ceiling that at night provides a light show with booming music, another place well worth a visit. As for the Excalibur, no problems at all, an excellent hotel. It was our 6th time in Las Vegas and we would stay at that hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Old”
Reviews.Author: ntxo
Reviews.Content: Is one of the oldest hotels in Las Vegas but even with that it has enough for a holidays in Las Vegas. If you are looking for an excelent or luxury hotel choose another one. It depends on your pocket.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: angel09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur as part of our honeymoon and found everything to be great. We had a spacious room in Tower 2 which was newly refurbished. It was a good location at the top end of the strip with everything you need located in the hotel for breakfast, lunch, dinner and snacks. We found some of the staff extremely annoying as they constantly harrassed us as we walked past to go visit some timeshare. If you have time it might be worth doing as they give away about $125 worth of dining and gambling vouchers.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: MissOrgana
Reviews.Content: I got married in Vegas in November and had my reception in the Excalibur. A group of family & friends also travelled with us. Firstly I would just like to say that the banqueting staff especially the coordinator Ann Young, were absolutely exceptional. However . . . the staff at the reception (check in) were some of the rudest people I've ever met. About half of our party had problems when they checked in regarding price etc. I stayed in a plasma room, which I would recommend. They were refurbished last year and are very well done. Very clean, bright and airy compared to the older rooms. I also left my mobile phone behind me in the room. I rang the lost property in Excalibur the day I checked out and then again the next day, but they never returned my call, nor did they reply to the email I sent them when I returned home. At the end of the day you get what you pay for. Its cheap and would be fine for a quick stay. And if your planning to get married in the chapel in the Excalibur - Dont!! Its right next to the food court (Mc Donalds, Pizza Hut etc.). I would have died if I'd booked it!

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay”
Reviews.Author: LindyJules
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at the Excalibur. We were a little annoyed because we had made arrangements for adjoining rooms with some friends, but that got all screwed up. Somehow, one of the couples got a free upgrade, while we were in the old tower. The other couple opted to pay for the upgrade. The new rooms were very nice, but the older ones were just fine for sleeping and showering, which is all we did there. Rooms were clean and comfortable. We were also supposed to have a king sized bed, but ended up with 2 queens. Oh well, we weren't looking for luxury. I was a bit disappointed that the casino seemed to be removing a lot of the themed decor. I guess that's what a lot of the nicer casino/ hotels are doing. At any rate, we loved the convenience of being on the strip. The restaurants and bars were nice and, except for the little errors at check-in, the service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded room was great!”
Reviews.Author: eap-cruiser
Reviews.Content: On our 5th trip to Vegas in the last 6 years, we decided to go w/the cheaper hotel (more $$ for playing). We did up grade to the newly redone rooms (called plasma tv rooms) and upgrade to a veiw. those upgrades cost $30 per night. they were well worth it. The room was very nice, great bed, 42" plasma on the wall. Had an Ipod dock on the alarm clock, make up mirror, large shower and all of it shinny and new. We originally upgraded because the old rooms don't have in room safes, the new ones do. We arrived at the hotel at 9:00 a.m. and were given a room right then! that is a real bonus! We felt these rooms were better then our rooms in previous years at the Luxor, New York New York and the Monte Carlo. We recomend it!

Reviews.Title: “OK but not great”
Reviews.Author: tkd1615
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Excalibur was a pretty good experience, but I'm not sure we would stay there again if we ever returned to Las Vegas. We paid the extre for the remodelled room and it was comfortable and well equipped. The view was terrific, although the screaming from the rollercoaster over the road was slightly off putting in the middle of the night! The check in was a very slow process and not overly friendly which was a disappointing start. The room was a long way from checkin and carrying suitcases to the room was not an easy task, especially as you had to walk through the casino. The range of restaurants and shops was excellent-the only down side was Dick's Last Resort-obviously people enjoyed eating there, but the noise and mess that came from it had to be seen to be believed. Most staff of restaurants and shops we encountered were reasonably helpful-it was very busy. The location is very good, but we would try somewhere else next time. Las Vegas itself was an interesting place to visit, however I agree with a previous post that it is not very family frienly. My 13 and 17 year old sons were CONSTANTLY handed porn cards along the street at all times of day and night. A bit of a culture shock and not necessary for the kids to deal with. They gradually got used to it and ignored them, but it's a shame it's allowed to go on. We found most other people we encountered to be very friendly and helpful-Denny's Restaurant particularly!

Reviews.Title: “Unethical practices”
Reviews.Author: Lege
Reviews.Content: While the hotel rooms have improved since my last stay, I unfortunately had a bad experience and felt I need to caution others. I booked a spa room for my wife's birthday directly from the company's website and had a printed confirmation specifying that I had prepaid for the spa room. When I arrived at 3:00, the lady at the front desk, "Kelly," stated that there were no rooms available until 6:00 and she can't check me in. I showed her my printed confirmation with a check-in time of 3:00, and she immediately changed her story, stating that she could put me into a "renovated standard" room right away. I said, "No thanks, we'll wait until the spa room is ready." Kelly replied that there were no spa rooms available that night. I reiterated that I had already paid for a spa room for that night. Then she informed me that I had been essentially downgraded and that the hotel was oversold for the night. Kelly also stated that the Excalibur website specifically mentions that your room type is not guaranteed. When I returned home, I walked through the reservation process on the Excalibur website and found no wording to that effect. Although, I was charged a lower rate ($161 for a regular room instead of $208 for the spa room, which meant they had to credit me because I had already pre-paid the $208), I really felt cheated by the experience. If I wanted just a regular room, I could have stayed downtown for half the price, but I wanted the spa room for my wife's birthday. I called the manager on duty who said the "best he could do" was to allow a late check-out which he claimed to be a $40 value. Two hours later, a recorded broadcast message on the voicemail to all guests offered a late check-out the next day for $25. Yet again, the employees are contradicting themselves and changing their story. Sadly, the ethical behavior of the Excalibur employees was downright shameful. I wrote to the President of the hotel 7 weeks ago explaining my experience and have yet to hear a reply. If she happens to reply with an apology and a hint of integrity, I will gladly post a follow-up stating that my faith is restored. While I hope my experience is a rarity, I wanted to caution others.

Reviews.Title: “Choose Tower II---NOT Tower I”
Reviews.Author: tpeterman
Reviews.Content: This hotel is older but inexpensive compared to others on the strip. The rooms in Tower II are great since they have been remodeled. However, the rooms in Tower I are old and dirty. We had to move twice before they moved us to the remodeled tower. No one told us that we had a choice, so request Tower II. As far as children, they are everywhere in Las Vegas!!! We dodged strollers all week long. I don't know what makes parents think that this is a family vacation spot. Sexual imagery is EVERYWHERE and solicitors for prostitutes are every five feet on the strip handing out calling cards for hookers. Leave the kids at home and have a good adult time.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value on the Strip!”
Reviews.Author: Andischatz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Excalibur for 5 nights in January 2008, because I was in Las Vegas for a trade fair. As hotels can get expensive very quickly when there's a trade fair on in Las Vegas (sometimes the price difference between a "slow" date and a popular one can be up to 1000%, so if you're flexible, plan your stay wisely!), I opted for the Excalibur as it offered reasonable value for money. After reading the reviews on this site and generally browsing the internet, I booked a "Widescreen Room", which means it's one of the recently renovated rooms at the Hotel. My room was number 25202, which means it was in Tower II, 25th floor, at the far end of the corridor, with no view of the Strip (I saw parts of the Luxor and Mandalay Bay buildings instead). The location was ok, although I must say that due to the room being situated at the far end of the corridor, it was always quite a long walk from the elevators and ice machine, which I therefore only bothered to use once (the ice machine, not the elevators). The room was immaculately clean (big plus!) and furnished with a very comfortable king size bed (two nightstands), a comfy armchair and a big dresser. There was also a small table with a 3 or 4 chairs in a little alcove (which was, alas, windowless). And yes, there was an enormous widescreen TV on the wall above the dresser. The bathroom was spacious and modern and also very clean. A small closet for clothes was built into one wall and that contained an ironing board and - for some reasons - two irons. Not that I'm complaining, but why two irons? Do people in Vegas go in for competitive or synchronous ironing on a regular basis? My first impression of the room was excellent and I did enjoy my stay. Still, here are a few things I noticed that could be improved: - High-speed internet access is offered for ca. $12 per 24 hours. The cable for this is extendable to around 2ft and is located on top of the dresser. If you want to use this, you cannot place your laptop anywhere else but on top of the dresser. The chairs in the room, however, are too low to make sitting at the high dresser comfortable. Also, you'll have to spread your legs wide because otherwise they have nowhere to go. Suggestion: Make the cable long enough (or provide an extra outlet) to reach the room's table, where people who need to work can actually sit comfortably. - There were a few freely accessible electrical outlets in the room, none close enough to the dresser to work with a laptop situated there. I had to use the one behind the dresser to plug my laptop in, which was a bit awkward and uncomfortable. - The lights in the room (one on each bedstand, one floor lamp, one hanging above the table in the alcove, one on the ceiling near the door) all had to be operated separately by a switch located on the lamp itself (except the one by the door). This means when you had them on and wanted to leave the room (or go to sleep) you always needed to walk to every single lamp to switch them off awkwardly with a flimsy little switch. Suggestion: wire them up to switches next to the bed and a central one near the door. - I had requested a non-smoking room, but I could faintly (but clearly) smell stale smoke in there and there was an ashtray in one of the drawers. The window could only be opened about 2 inches, no doubt for safety reasons. - The hotel provides shampoo, lotion, shower gel and soap in the bathroom. Whenever I opened the bar of soap to wash my hands and left it next to the sink, it was taken away by the maid and replaced with a new, wrapped one the next day. Seems like an awful waste. Only once did the maid leave the used bar AND put a new one there, which I would have preferred every day. - The humungous TV is nice, but was only capable of showing poor analogue-quality free network TV stations (around 8 or 10 of them), with seemingly nothing but news, teleshopping and commercials on all the time. All that with the strangely distorted picture you get when watching 4:3 content on a 16:9 screen. The only alternative is the hotel's pay-tv option, but who wants to pay almost the price of a cinema ticket to view an in-room movie? Suggestion: Get cable. ;-) Even though this is quite an extensive list, I must say that I did enjoy my stay and would probably stay at the Excalibur again, maybe trying to get a room with something that could be used as a desk (or bring an ethernet extension cord) next time. The atmosphere in the hotel is nice and relaxed and the guests are relatively "normal" people. I spent some time in more expensive hotels there and I wouldn't have wanted to swap the crowd with e.g. the Venetian clientele who were a lot more pretentious. Also, on the casino floor the table minimums were affordable ($5 for most games) and the dealers friendly (with a few grumpy exceptions). Peggy for example was a lovely lady who had no problem explaining some rules to a novice like me and was always friendly and accessible during the game. Check in and -out were swift and efficient, as was the Valet service in front of the main entrance. I didn't try any of the restaurants on the property (except for a sandwich in the food court) or any of the Hotel's attractions, so I cannot comment on them. Overall, I paid an average of around $150 per night and got what I paid for. If you're looking for decent value and a good Strip location, the Excalibur is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good second stay.”
Reviews.Author: zngcat369
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to Excalibur, as I also stayed here in Feb 2007, and it was another good experience. As before, we were given an unrenovated room in Tower 1. Despite the older furnishings, the room was clean and there was nothing to complain about. No refrigerator in the room, and the bathroom has a shower only (no tub), but all else was fine. The housekeeping staff we encountered were friendly and a special request was handled perfectly. I kept an eye out for kids on this visit after reading some of the other reviews, and I really didn't see any more (or worse behaved) kids than you would see anywhere else. Perhaps this was due to the mid-week stay. Check-in and check-out were very smooth, with only small lines at check-in. We did most of our dining next door at New York, New York and Luxor, but if you're on a budget Excalibur does have a food court with a McDonalds (complete with a $1 menu) and Pizza Hut. This isn't a luxury hotel, but it accomplishes what it sets out to do, which is provide a clean room at a good price. I would have no problem staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Yet another great strip hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chilly25
Reviews.Content: I watched the Excalibur being built in 1991 and was excited to be staying in it over new year 2005/6. This was my first trip to Vegas as an adult and really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The rooms were very comfortable and clean. Compared to other hotels on the strip this is in my opinion somewhere I would stay with children. There is a good dinner show 'Tornament of Kings' which would be great for a family.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the budget”
Reviews.Author: christiepooh
Reviews.Content: Lots of families around the casino so if you don't like kids, be warned. Lots of young people too. The rooms are clean and comfy. Great for sleeping between one wild Vegas day to the next. Great location for airport and access to the rest of the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur Hotel and Casino Brings Magic to Life”
Reviews.Author: let-it-go2008
Reviews.Content: If you are harboring thoughts of bringing the family for a Las Vegas vacation, then perhaps you should seriously consider a stay at Excalibur Hotel and Casino. This hotel will have you feeling as though you've stepped into the fairy tales of your childhood. From the moment you cross the threshold from the outside world to the charmed existence of life in the hotel you will find that you have truly been charmed and are leading a somewhat enchanted existence. Not only is there the magnificent casino to enjoy, there is also the wonderful pool, links golf, the castle walk for your shopping pleasure, and the midway where you can play all kinds of fun and exciting arcade and carnival games. Perhaps one of the most memorable and impressive of offerings is the Tournament of Kings dinner show. This show is offered nightly at 6:00 and 8:30 and you will eat in the manner of those in medieval times, without utensils while watching the evil wizard Mordred as he invades the evening festivities. This show is quite enjoyable and relies heavily upon audience participation. Dining in the hotel and casino can be quite the adventure without the assistance of horses and actors as there are several dining options including the Roundtable Buffet, The Steakhouse at Camelot, Regale Italian Eatery, Sherwood Forest Café, and how could we forget Sir Galahad's Pub and Prime Rib House? If you're looking for the fairytale wedding of your dreams, then Excalibur has the package for you. You can even elect to rent medieval costumes in which to get married. There are many different packages available to fit various budgets and wedding needs. Wedding packages vary in price from around $400 plus $55 for the cost of the minister to around $1575 plus the cost of the minister. These are all rather basic packages and do not include extras such as costume rentals, extra poses for the wedding photos, or video and candle services. Before your big day make sure you make liberal use of the spa services available at Excalibur Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas. Of course this is a great idea even if you are just hoping to relax while on vacation. You remember relaxation right? That is what you did on occasion before you had children. You should definitely get the royal treatment that is available through the spa and enjoy every minute of your visit. Some of the spa services offered at Excalibur include: facials, wraps, Aveda facials, and various massages. There are add on services that can be purchased and packages available. This is a great way to spend an hour or three before your big day or any day. Once you've finished getting pampered at the spa, step on over to Kristina's Salon and get primped. You can enjoy everything from manicures to full service hair styling services. Whether you are preparing for your big day and saying "I do!" or simply for a romantic evening on the strip this is a great place to begin.
