Excalibur also offers full service catering and convention services. Whether you are hosting a wedding reception or a company convention we have the facilities as well as the expertise to keep everything operating seamlessly behind the scenes so that all eyes will be on the things that are important. Projections and profits for the corporate conventions and the bride and groom for wedding receptions. Excalibur Hotel Casino can meet almost any lodging and accommodation needs for those staying and playing in Las Vegas, more than that we can provide a great 'fairy tale' atmosphere for your family vacation or just your big trip in general. If you haven't given proper consideration to the idea of staying here during your visit, I highly encourage that you do-especially if you have a little princess in your party that you are trying to impress.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK”
Reviews.Author: Kashay
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Excalibur for one night, and I must say I wasn't sad to leave. I must've been in the older tower because the rooms were dark and in serious need of a remodel. It wasnt all bad though, I did get what I requested, 2 double beds. However it smelled as if it was a smoking room, which I did not request. The casino and restaurants were good. It has a connecting bridge straight into the Luxor should you need to go there. I was with 2 of my female friends, so it was a girls trip. Bathroom and sheets were clean. They sucessfully covered your basic needs. Check in and check out was very smooth. It was a busy weekend, so the rates may have been jacked up for that weekend, however, I dont think it was worth the money. I will try my best not to return.

Reviews.Title: “i'll be back”
Reviews.Author: puppyWollongong
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the excalibur last november for 4 nights and could not complain about anything.sure there are better hotels but more expensive as after all how much time do you really spend in the room.the location was good as last year i stayed at the circus circus and even though the hotel room was very large and clean i found the hotel too far away.if you are looking for a clean standard hotel for a good price then this hotel is the one . pam wollongong australia

Reviews.Title: “Sooo unsanitary and disgusting!!!”
Reviews.Author: bobbysworld143
Reviews.Content: I actually expected the place to be old and run down, but I was a little surprised that the room wasn't too bad. In need of a remodel and a little dirty, but okay. That was until we were getting ready to check out. I have two children so I always check to make sure they haven't left anything. I looked under the blankets of my bed and found the most disgustingly HUGE BUG ever!! I was shocked! Me and my 1 month old baby had been sleeping in that bed all night. So I check the bed that my 9 year old had slept in and guess what..2 more bugs and some blood on the sheets. I had never seen anything so repulsive, I just wanted to get out of there, and fast! Then I realized that I should have complained, taken pictures or something but I was in such a hurry to get out I forgot. So then I called and let them know about the "bed-bugs" and they told me that I would have to file a report with security in case anybody needed "medical care". Of course security was unavailable and would have to call me back to take this report..which of course they never did. I should have followed up, but I had a new baby and too much time passed. But all I know is I will NEVER stay there again or recommened them to anyone! Pay the extra money and stay somewhere, ANYWHERE else, please!!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good stay”
Reviews.Author: starbright31
Reviews.Content: There are lots of better hotels there in Vegas where you can get five star accommodations, dining, entertainment and etc, but if you're looking for an inexpensive place to stay in Vegas that's still on the Strip, on the south end, then Excalibur's a fine choice for you. I stayed in one of the newly renovated rooms in Tower II, but not facing the side of the strip. The room was a lot nicer than I expected and it looked modern instead of that outdated "medieval" look that the rooms have had for ages. The bathroom was especially nice and pristine. They give you a big widescreen plasma TV in the room too. The internet service feels outdated there, and it didn't work the first time I plugged my laptop into the cord, but their maintenance staff were very quick to get to my room and fix the connection. I'm not much of a gambler so I can't say anything about the casino experience there. For the food, I went to the snack shop that's near Tower II and you can get a decent sandwich there for about $7. You're better off taking the express tram to Mandalay Bay if you want better food. I'd stay there again if I can get a good deal, but only in the renovated rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: OhioRon
Reviews.Content: When we checked in, we were told that we would be "upgraded" to a more spacious and recently remodeled room in Tower II. The room was quite nice and spacious. The shower and bath facilities were modern and attractive. There is lots of free parking in the surrounding lot and in the parking structure. The location is good because there is a sky walk to New York, New Yord and, indirectly, to MGM Grand. There is also a light rail to Luxor and to Mandalay Bay. The exterior of the hotel resembles a castle and is quite attractive, especially at night. One thing I didn't like is the mandatory $1 per day charge for local phone calls. Since we use cell phones, we have no use for that. The woman at check-in said they would remove the charge, but that didn't happen. There is a shopping area with a food court that includes McDonald's, Krispy Kreme, Pizza Hut Express, China Wok, and Starbucks. There are many full-service restaurants, but we didn't try those. There is an arcade in the basement that has the kind of carnival games that you see at county fairs. We had a good time at Excalubur and would gladly stay here again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Dick's Last Resort Dinner was Terrible”
Reviews.Author: TenaciousBri
Reviews.Content: went to the Dick's at Ex Caliber Las Vegas. They definetly lived up to their namesake. They were rude and obnoxious. The DJ microphone was too loud. The jokes were bad. The waiter was lame. Unfortunualtely the food was all over cooked too. My Salmon was dry. The Big A$$ Burgers were very dry. $11 for a Miller Lite is way too much. I tried to tolerate this lame place but shoud have just left. This was the poorest dining experience I have ever had. The Casino itself is a bit tired but a good place to go if you have kids

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jozza67
Reviews.Content: I read all the review before l booked. was a little nervous when we arrived but once l steeped in side, the best 4 days we could have imagined begun. l booked the upgraded room, we got a king size bed and a view to die for overlooking the snow capped mountains and the new swimming pool. the room couldnt be faulted, was serviced promply everyday, not that we were there much ,it is vegas. the smoke in the casino was my worry but for me it wasnt a problem l am an ex smoker and can not stand smoke the only time it botherd me was if someone on a machine next to us lite up a smoke, then we would just move. we loved the arcade and the shops, easy acess to every thing, the duce bus became our second home with a stop right out side the casino and only $5 for 24 hrs and take you all along the strip from end to end. we ate at sherwood forest food was good, there was always a cue but it went through fast. excalibur was a great place to be based priced was very cheep and everything you want is right near by were saving now forour next visit and this is where we will stay again deffinetly.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, shame about the TV”
Reviews.Author: Adder_65
Reviews.Content: I accept that the Excalibur, like Circus Circus, offers cheaper accomodation on the strip, but Excalibur is in need of a refurbishment. The rooms were OK, but the carpets and furnishings are looking a little tired. The TV was not only missing its remote control but the on/off button as well, a pen poked through the hole served as the on/off switch, they only had the basic channels. No in-room coffee or in-room safe. I had to pay $1 per day for unlimited free local calls whether I wanted it or not. Only had a shower, but the bath towels were thick and soft. The pool area was OK but nothing special and not used much. Good location and a good value breakfast buffet. Limited non-valet parking close to the hotel, but plenty in a multi-storey round the back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: Durple
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur for 2 nights. When we checked in, the phone in the room did not work. There was no water flowing in the sink faucet and a couple of lights did not work. I complained to the front desk, they said they would take care of it and they did in the next few hours. However, when I got back to the room late at night and switched on the TV, the TV did not work either. I mentioned this to the front desk again and asked if I could be upgraded in light of all the problems. They said yes and put me in a room marginally larger than my previous one a pretty useless upgrade if you ask me. Rooms were clean, the location is good but not the best on the strip. The mattress was cheap and uncomfortable. I do not expect to get more than a couple of hours of sleep when I am in Vegas but I expect it to be a comfortable couple of hours. Excalibur did not make the cut.

Reviews.Title: “almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: agiesbrecht
Reviews.Content: Price was great, Staff was excellent and very helpful when giving directions or suggestions. We had one of the renovated rooms with a plasma tv and granite counter tops, it was very nice Although we didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel. The location was good, its at the south end of the strip, and we found it easy to walk to nearby hotels, and the Tram was a great help. The self park was right outside the rear entrance, never had to park too far away. Will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: dkpm4
Reviews.Content: My husband, two children (aged 8 & 4) and I stayed 5 nights recently (10th Dec - 15th Dec) and found this hotel to be clean and very comfortable. We upgraded our room to a view of the strip for an extra $10 per night. We were in Tower 1 on the 27th floor. I'm not sure if this was a recently renovated room or not. It looked nice to me. The room was clean and the beds were soft. The bathroom was huge and the water temperature in the shower was perfect. The location was good, right next door to Luxor, New York New York and MGM. The buffet was good, they didn't charge us for our 4 year old. There is a variety of fast food and coffee shops like McDonalds, Pizza Hut, Starbucks and Krispy Kreme. Check in was quick and we had no problems, check out was even quicker because we used one of the self check out machines near the entrance of Tower 1. The only negative point about the hotel is the time share people everywhere but I noticed they were in every hotel we went to. We got caught by them when we first arrived because the guy was standing near the check in counter and we thought he was an employee of the hotel. He offered us discount coupons for the kids but we soon found out it was for the time share thing. We politely said no and left. After that when they tried to offer us free things for the kids we just said no and kept walking. Just keep walking, do not stop for them! Overall we had a very pleasant stay and would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Always good to me”
Reviews.Author: Ksigns
Reviews.Content: This was my third time staying at this hotel (in the past two years). This is an excellent chice if you want a good location, clean room and helpful staff at a great price. I have never stayed here and payed over $100. I've stayed mid-week and weekend. This time I stayed with my family- husband and two small children- we stayed only one night to attend my sister's wedding. The only complaint I have this time around is the Timeshare people. I've stayed here before and I had never noticed these people. I'm assuming this is something new, maybe it's because they saw a family and not singles- not sure, but we were stopped (or they tried to stop us) every time they would see us walking to the elevator or to the valet. "Are you from California?" "How often do you visit Las Veags per year?" This was very annoying. Other than that, it was as good as always.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD room, GREAT location and GREAT price but nothing fancy”
Reviews.Author: milk41358
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip through Southwest Vacations and Las Vegas.com, and I have to say that all went very well. Our room at Excalibur was the "standard" room, not the refurbished one, which would have cost a lot more. We did however pay extra for a front room with a view. Our traveling companions stayed across the hall (no view of the strip), but they were happy with their room also. Our rooms were clean and comfortable. We didn't spend much time in our rooms. I mean, you don't go to Las Vegas to hang out in your room all day. I have only two minor complaints. 1. There was no tub. 2. The maids knock, unlock the door, and say "housekeeping" and walk in simultaneously. I got angry at the lady who nearly walked in me while I was getting dressed. She walked in on our friends across the hall too. To keep these people out keep the "Do not disturb" sign on the door at all times or lock the secondary lock on the door. Otherwise, the room and service from the HOTEL were great. We were even able to check in early at no extra cost. But, down in the casino and all the other casinos, there are these really obnoxious and pushy people who stand at the entrances and harass you in an attempt to get you to visit a time share place down the road. These hucksters are everywhere and you can't avoid them. You can, however, have fun with them. Since they don't know how to back off then you say "no thanks," I tried other devices. One thing that's fun is to accuse them of hitting on you, then while they are trying to figure out what to say next, walk around them. My favorite line was "Dude, I'm not interested, and can't you see that I am with my WIFE? Geez, go flirt with someone else." My other was "Ma'am, I am happily married so you can take that nonsense somewhere else." Many said, "Hey buddy, I can save you money on Vegas shows." To that, I responded, "Sorry, I insist on paying full price for everything." But, there were times when I just got too tired to rebuff them politely, and I had to just yell "GO AWAY!" FOOD: The buffet at the Excalibur is really good. They have everything, but to save money, eat a late big breakfast because breakfast buffet is cheaper and then get dinner at the Sherwood Cafe. Between 7 p.m. and 7 a.m., Sherwood Cafe serve a pretty good $7 steak. Just get the steak because a soda costs at least $2. Every casino has some special dish at a certain time of the day. You can save money by getting only the special and ordering water to drink. Most places have a cheap steak they sell. And, ask the locals where they eat. Locals usually suggest off-the-strip casino restaurants. BOOZE: If you're gambling, drinks are free, but tip your waitress a dollar. Otherwise, drinks are expensive if you're not gambling. To save money, get a bottle of liquor and some soda from the big store down the street and mix your own drinks in your room. Don't buy a bottle of liquor at the small hotel stores. It's mucho expensive. PARKING One more suggestion about Las Vegas -- put your car in Valet Parking whenever possible. All the good parking at the older casinos has been replaced with Valet Parking and all the free parking is way in the back. The parking at the newer casinos is even farther away. You most likely will have a few extra dollars on you when you visit the city so budget in $30 for tips for the valets. IT'S WORTH IT. I tipped according to how far they take the car and how far away the free parking is. At Circus Circus, valet parking is right out front so I tipped $2. At Caesar's Palace, I tipped $5. The next time we go, we will probably get some day passes for the tram. EXCALIBUR ENTERTAINMENT: We went to the Tournament of Kings Dinner Show in the basement. Our friends wanted to see it so they went on a time share tour. More on the tour later on. The show was really cheesy, but children would love it. It was very family friendly, but probably not appropriate for children under age 7 because of the simulated killing. But, even after each knight is "killed," he jumps right back up ready to fight some more. FOOD AT THE SHOW: Dinner was tomato soup, game hen with french fries and broccoli served with a soda. Desert was apple turnovers. If you ask they will bring you silverware. Otherwise, you're supposed to eat with your hands. We opted for the silverware. BOOZE WITH MEAL: You can get beer or mixed drinks also, but anything other than the included sodas are really expensive. I think my martini was $9.50. NOTE ABOUT TIME SHARE TOUR: Our friends hated it, and they felt threatened by the people who were pressuring them the buy. But, if you're interested, our friends held out so long that the price dropped from around $40,000 with a $200 maintenance fee down to $6000 with a $48 maintenance fee. Think about it, if they are asking for $40,000 for a week, they are in essence trying to sell a condo for $2 million, and you're probably not going to ever get a $2 million room.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur is OK”
Reviews.Author: GypsySueDenver
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a package we got through Southwest Airlines. The hotel wasn't that bad. There aren't a lot of amenities and the rooms aren't fancy, but they were clean. I would recommend NOT getting a room next to the elevators as there was equipment noise that was very loud. Other than not, no big noise issue. The only issue I had with this hotel is that at three different places along the way to get to your room you are bombarded by employees trying to sell you a time share. If it weren't for that, it would be a good experience (for a cheap casino on the strip). We only ate at one place here and that was the cafe--can't remember the name. The food was decent and the portions huge, but I thought it was overpriced--but not compared to the rest of Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: happytravels35
Reviews.Content: We went to vegas for a long weekend i was kinda having sencond thoughts about the hotel after reading some of the reviews but thet are all wrong.The room was great very clean and the beds vere very soft.The buffet was great also.I would tell anybody to stay here they will be happy too.Over all we had a GREAT time!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay at the Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: txmimi
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Excalibur before and the rooms were clean and we were very comfortable but we weren't as happy this time. The upgraded rooms are nice enough and comfortable but the bathroom was nasty, someone else's hair in the sink, shower and floor, was so gross. The maid didn't actually "clean" until the day before we left. The carpet was wet next to the bed in our friend's room. They are doing construction on the pools and we were awakened every morning by the noise around 6:00 a.m. which wasn't a big deal, just a little annoying. Also, the elevators are slower than Christmas. Average wait, 5 - 7 minutes. We did enjoy the casino but I probably won't stay there again unless we get some good offers. I will visit there and play in the casino but I think we will probably go back to Planet Hollywood to stay. We only spent a few hours a day in our room so we still had a good trip but were a little disappointed this time with the Excalibur. Oh, and dont eat at the buffet, not good!!!

Reviews.Title: “So-So Stay”
Reviews.Author: lowoncaffeine
Reviews.Content: There are some great aspects of the Excalibur: it's at the top of the strip, with easy access to the Mandalay Bay, Luxor, Tropicana, New York-New York, and MGM Grand. The non-smoking rooms are clean and even the 'non-view' rooms have a great view of the Nevada/Arizona mountains. The worst aspects? They don't keep your reservation, and their customer service. We had booked a fairly cheap package over the phone with Expedia and requested a non-smoking room (one of us have bad allergies). When we checked in, we were told that all of the non-smoking rooms were filled and we would have to sleep in a smoking room and transfer to a non-smoking room the next day. To try and sweeten it up, they upgraded us to a Deluxe Room for the night (the difference between the Standard and the Deluxe? A two person couch). Once we entered the room, it was clear that we could not stay there. In the half-hour it took for us to be transferred to another (smoking) room, the toilet had ran an average of fifteen times. The second room was worse, with a heavy hang of freshener in the air and a view of a wall (our previous view was of a spotlight). The front-desk for the hotel was very short with us, and not at all accommodating. Unlike other (fairly affordable) hotels where I've been in where they freak out if you don't have enough towels, the Front Desk took on the attitude of 'Well, there's nothing you can do about it so deal with it.' instead of 'How can we make it better?' and told us to come back to them after 12pm the next day. After calling Expedia to try and rectify the mistake, they tried to pin it on us saying we made no specification on whether or not we wanted a smoking or non-smoking room -- except our e-mailed itinerary said specifically 'Non-Smoking.' We were only in Vegas for two full days, and having to come back from breakfast to pack up and change rooms was very inconvenient on our time to sightsee. However, the second room had a great view of the Nevada mountains, was VERY clean and nice. The lady who helped us change rooms was apologetic and accommodating, even putting us on the 24th floor (we requested a room above the 5th floor for security concerns -- someone in the casino was screaming at our door since our room was in Tower 1 and the first room off the Casino floor). In short, we would probably stay at the Excalibur again. It's a no-frills type of hotel, where you stay if you know you're not going to be spending a lot of time in the room. The rooms are plain, the entertainment is fairly comical, but they do offer free lessons in the casino. The location is great and accessible, and the MORNING front-desk service and check-out have great people. Just don't bother with the night person's.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: ascentia
Reviews.Content: Not a good experience for my first time in Vegas. Fire alarm was pulled in the middle of the night, people were sleeping drunk in the halls and we had a domestic dispute in the room next door and heard everything in the middle of the night. Won't stay again and we don't recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: luvs2run27
Reviews.Content: I was very nervous after reading the reviews so we upgraded to the "newly renovated" rooms for $20 extra (check right before you go--way cheaper). The upgrade was worth it. These rooms were average so I can only imagine what the original rooms looked like. The beds were comfortable though and the room was clean. The service was fine both at the desk and housekeeping, etc. The hotel is centrally located to some other popular properties so that worked out great. Also, the rooms were amazingly quiet. I hardly heard a neighbor or someone in the hall. Impressive for a city that never sleeps. Overall, I'd pick somewhere else to stay, but for a cheaper hotel, it's a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Baby!”
Reviews.Author: TamraK
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas is definetly somewhere everyone has to visit at least once in their life. It was amazing! The Excalibur is an excellent hotel to stay at. The pool was sooo nice and the drinks at the pool were even better. We didnt spend too much time in the hotel. Definetly visit Fremont Ave. That was my favorite. Also If you want to have an amazing dinner and not worried about dishing out some dough, have dinner at the Eiffel Tower. It was delicious. ANd you get a front row view of the water show at the Bellagio! I cant wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur: Good for the money, but beware...”
Reviews.Author: Hokiegirl10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at Excalibur while we were in Las Vegas for a wedding. After reading several posts, I was somewhat cautious about staying at this hotel. KIDS ARE NOT A PROBLEM HERE! I had read that in many other posts, but when I was in Vegas, of course school was in, kids were not a problem. The major problem were all of the property pushers that will not leave you alone! I was stopped and/or bothered 5 times before I could even get to the elevator to my room! I did the upgrade to the new rooms with the plasma TV and was pleasantly surprised by how comfy and nice they are for the price. My first morning at this hotel; however, changed my mind rather quickly. After a long day of traveling, I looked forward to sleeping in a bit. Yeah, right. At 7:00am we were awakened by drilling, hammering and sawing. When we called down to complain, we were told that the construction was taking place on the 14 floor. It sounded like it was all around us! After a bit of complaining, we were given another room on the 22nd floor. Not that big of a deal, but moving was rather a pain. No offer of an upgrade or anything for our trouble. Overall I was happy with staying at this hotel, but be ready for some minor conflicts. If I go back to Vegas, I will probably stay here again as I like the location and the room was a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better......”
Reviews.Author: canukhead
Reviews.Content: The best way to start this is to say "Beware". Beware of the timeshare carnies that rope you in fresh off the plane with your suitcase in hand. " Oh, are you checking in? Right this way".... Yah, right. Head straight to the "Registration Desk" and don't be lead anywhere else! We had a room booked for months thru airmiles and the day before we left I "upgraded" to a new room with a KIng bed with a view of the strip. "Confirmed" is what I was told. We check in and were told that room was NOT available as they are first come first serve. What? Maybe they should look up the defination of reservation in the dictionary. We were offered a 2 queen room with a view...... We wanted a King but figured we weren't getting anything else. We get to the room, I go to look at the "view" and the blind is broken. No one on staff was available to fix it...hmmmmmm. We change to a King room with no view.... guess what the blind is wrecked in that one as well... On the plus side, the rooms were very clean. You do get what you pay for I guess. Hotel staff were not overly friendly, the most helpful staff were the security folks. My first trip to Vegas, and it all just didn't live up to the hype.....

Reviews.Title: “Save Me!! Nor more Timeshare Pitches!!”
Reviews.Author: myshnook
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay in Vegas at the Excalibur because I got an email offering me a cheap package. It was cheap--just a little over$200 including taxes for 4 nights, and I got a buy one get one for the Tournament of Kings show. I got a room on the 26th floor with a great view of the strip. The room itself was very very tired with broken handles on the dressers, beds with thin mattresses that were not very comfortable, and small, thin pillows. I paid so little that I shouldn't complain. On the plus side, everything was very clean. The thing that bothered me the most were the constant timeshare pitchmen on the walkways. Anytime I tried to get anywhere, I was bombarded by people saying, "do you have your free show tickets", or "let me tell you how to get a free return trip". One or two times, I could take, but it was ALL of the time. At one time, a man yelled out, "Hey, is your husband with you?" What an idiot. Point out to the crowd that I am by myself. By the third day, I had grown to hate moving from one place to another, having to run the gauntlet of timesharers. I tried my best to dodge them, but there always seemed to be one in my path. I thought I was on vacation. I was there at a slow time, so maybe they were more obnoxious because there were less people. The check in and out was easy. The Tournament of Kings was a great show, and relatively cheap by Vegas standards. I would actually stay there again if I didn't have to be barraged by the pitchmen and women.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur, Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: ken_ll
Reviews.Content: It was a toss up between the Excalibur and the Luxor. Not having been in Vegas before, we went for the value of the Excalibur and found it more than met expectations. We booked the lowest priced rooms $81 for the Sat. and $51 for the Sunday - Tuesday nights and paying for 2 of the 3 nights. For $183 + tax +$1/night for phone, we had a good deal. Check-in at about 5 p,m, was quick and efficient, no line up. We sought out the opportunity for an upgrade at check-in and were assigned a high floor, no view tower room in a N/S King. A tip works well in addition to being friendly. Great room at end of hall, renovated, pillow top mattress, plasma TV, clean room/bathroom, this more than met expectations. It would be nice to have a coffee maker & fridge in room. There were no odours in room and it was spotless. The air conditioner has 2 speeds, low and high, even at low it can be loud and operates on a thermostat. Hair dryer, iron/ironing board and safe in room. The power from the wall circuit to the TV went out once late at night, went to bed, power on next morning. The room was quiet with the exception of the yahoos coming and going at all hours of the morning across from us on the last night. Carpeting near and in the elevators as well as the elevators are tired and could updating. With the casino on the first floor, it was full of smoke. They need to have a flow of air similar to the Manderly Bay to clear the air. Your favorite timeshare representatives are a nuiance, you learn to ignore without speaking. They're like parasites at all entrances. We ate at the Roundtable Buffet, prime rib and turkey each night with osdles of other hot dishes, plus salad items, drinks and dessert included in the price - $15.99. Staff was friendly, from check-in, to security, to Duane at check-out. He was efficient, you are on your way within 20 seconds. The elevator areas would qualify in the 1*-2* range while our room I feel would qualify as a 3.5*-4*. Overall, the hotel exceeded our expectations and its' proximity on the strip is good. We would have no hesitation in staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price I paid”
Reviews.Author: carohp
Reviews.Content: Overall, we had a good experience. We stayed on Wednesday 11/21 in Tower 1. Check-in was very smooth; there was hardly any wait at all. The room was clean, but dark, with dark colored carpet and furniture. The bathroom was ok; I'm fine with the tub-size shower; there was little dirty caulking at the bottom like other reviewers said, but it did not bother me. The beds were actually double beds instead of queen beds as advertised. The mattress and pillow were comfortably soft. The only complaint I had was that the pool was cold, even though it's advertised that it's heated. We ate dinner at Sherwood Forest Cafe. The $5 meals (choice of NY strip, cheeseburger or breakfast items) were filling (although they were not available on Thanksgiving morning); you also get potatoes (mashed, baked or fries) and steamed vegetables. My sons ordered other dishes and they were plenty; they couldn't finish them. I have teenagers and a 10-year-old with me, and they absolutely loved the arcade. There were some easy-to-win games that were good for the kids' self-confidence. They said that the arcade was their favorite experience of the Vegas trip. Gambling was ok; I lost some on the slots machines. I didn't go to other casinos, so no comparison can be made.

Reviews.Title: “Basic and looking very tired”
Reviews.Author: JumboMcNutt
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a non renovated room (and there are still many of these). View of the strip was OK, but given the angle of the hotel and it being near the bottom of the strip the view is really only that of the MGM, Tropicana and McCarren airport. Room had no safe, and although we booked a triple for 3 lads on a stag do we had to request a 3rd bed, which they claimed was $20 per night - although they never charged us. TV was old and only had 8 channels to choose from, which given that some times you just want to chill out was not great. I would recommend paying a little bit more if you can and stay at Luxor, NYNY or monte carlo. Apart from the room the casino is also old and looks a bit tacky. The excalibur theme doesn't quite work - in fact even back in the 90's when I first visited it looked tacky. Dick's bar recently opened is a bit full on and with it serving food to a whacky theme you get a lot of kids but it tries to be more raunchy with past patrons bras hanging from the bar - so you just leave the place confused as to whether it is trying to be a party bar for 20-30 year olds or a TGI Friday - avoid!. There is a lounge bar that when compared to things like Heart bar at planet hollywood or in fact any of the strip casino's bars is awful. Staff friendliness is mixed ranging from pleasent down to rude. All in all if you get a good deal that saves you £100's go for it if the only other hotels in your range are the even worse Circus Circus or the poor location of the Stratosphere. Otherwise save a bit more and go for another. Can't comment on the pool as it was November and thus it was closed, but the good news is that they are giving it a makeover at the moment.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: DoggiesFan
Reviews.Content: We Stayed at Excalibur for 5 nights in adjoining rooms. We had two children who loved the medieval theme, especially the tournament of the kings show & Fantasy Faire. They also enjoyed the pool area. The rooms were comfortable and large enough for a family. The bathroom size was also a pleasant surprise. We liked the Roundtable Buffet which had a good variety at a reasonable price and the location on the south end of the strip suited us well.

Reviews.Title: “Good, cheap time”
Reviews.Author: armgiem
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur Hotel the weekend before Thanksgiving. The room was not that modern but was very clean. The bathroom was much larger than usual budget hotels and had a real shower with a shower door. We stayed in tower 1 which had a great view of the strip but we could hear traffic noise at night. I can't recall ever hearing traffic noise in our room at any other strip hotel. We ate the $5 dinner special at the Sherwood Forest Cafe and it was great! The new Sports Book is as good as any on the strip. I would pass on the buffet as it was average at best. You can walk or take the free monorail to the Luxor next door for a really, really good buffet for just a dollar or two more at most meals. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable beds and great value”
Reviews.Author: tracy7314
Reviews.Content: The Excalibur is a great place to stay while in Vegas. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The showers have good water pressure. For the price, you can't beat staying there. It is connected to Luxor and Mandalay Bay, so you don't even have to step outside to get over to the other places, but be prepared for a walk. The pool is nice, not luxurious, but that's ok with me. The restaurants aren't so great, but with the money you save on lodging you can go have some excellent meals elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Laura74
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for the Nov 16th weekend. Very convenient as we flew from Mexico only to attend the Billy Joel concert at the MGM Garden Arena, and it is just across the street. Booked one of those renovated rooms and ended up exceeding our expectations. We have been MonteCarlo fans for the last 6 years but Excalibur was really fun. Drinks available all the time and average restaurants. Good choice for price.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, fun gaming”
Reviews.Author: redwing634
Reviews.Content: Our last stay in Vegas was at the MGM Grand so the bed at Excalibur was a little bit of a let down (the beds at MGM grand are amazing), but then again the cost of Excalibur is about half of MGM Grand. It's an amazing value. The restaurants are quite good; we ate at sherwood cafe, and the Steakhouse there. Food was great at both ESPECIALLY at the steak house. If you like somewhat finer dining, it's a great place to check out. When it comes to gaming, we're a "craps" couple, and Excalibur is pretty much the only place we win. The dealers/boxmen are all very friendly and helpful. We tried a few other places including Venetian, etc and always ended up back at Excalibur. It's true that you end up having to walk through pretty much the whole casino with your suitcase to get to the check in, but that didnt bother us much at all; allowed us to take it all in. And if you have kids they of course have the arcade to keep them busy. Only negative I have is the pool was a little lacking compared to most vegas hotels; its just one 3-4 foot deep pool, with no hot tub (unless you go to the spa and pay the spa entrance fee). Good if youre a kid I guess but otherwise not impressive. Overall a great stay and an amazing value

Reviews.Title: “Good Times”
Reviews.Author: robertandshanni
Reviews.Content: After reading many a bad review on this site, I was very surprised to find that the Excalibur was a great place to stay. We went the week of Thanksgiving and my boyfriend and I had an upgraded room on the 24th floor with a great view The room was very nicely done and I loved the bathroom. There was no bathtub, but who cares. I don't go to Vegas to take a bath, I go to gamble which is what we did a lot of. At then end of our trip I had enough comps to get half of my upgrade charges taken off the bill. I would stay here again in the future!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Shaz-shazza
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the excalibur from the 17th September - 2nd October 07, there was 7 of us in total & we all had a superb time. The hotel is close to all ammenities & all the sites there was to see. Outside the back of the hotel you can get the trolley bus that runs the whole length of the strip - fantastic value for money although at busy times it can take just over an hour to get from one end of the strip to the other. The best time at the casino was at 6 in the morning, where there was no old people to run you over in the motorised scooters. The restaurants are ok but you are better heading out to one of the other hotels unless you are a fast food junkie!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value,better than expected”
Reviews.Author: stellaWidnes
Reviews.Content: stayed 7-14th november booked this hotel for price first, location second view room ( old style) not available so was upgraded ? tower room -no view - well very limited - rooms only have showers and after a long day walking a bath tub would have been lovely ! Clean rooms but maid service slow, we couldn,t time when our room would be cleaned they seem to work all day Pool area dissapointing , re-model under way but slowly it seems...the pick a lounger carefully or you will be in the shade most of the day. Time share sales people are posted at every door, they don't pester if you say no,but do seem at first glance to be hotel staff. WALK PAST !! First stay here but have stayed in other Vegas hotels I prefer, next time we will go off strip again as it is more relaxing with easier access to nice pool without going through the casino every time...feels less like hard work Hotel definately clean - the carpets were washed on our floor at least three times that week .

Reviews.Title: “Not to bad.”
Reviews.Author: pete707
Reviews.Content: I stayed in The Excalibur in October for 7 nights and it really wasn't to bad,Our room was on the second floor so we had a pretty poor view but then again i wasn't in Vegas to look out of my hotel room. Check in was quick and easy but they do charge you $1 a day for telephone calls which is abit of a rip off if you ask me,especially when i had no intention to use it. The Roundhouse buffet was average and very empty when i went in there but there is plenty of other options around if you are hungry,make sure you go into Dick's last resort though, me and my friend spent some good times in there. The only disappointment was the swimming pool complex,it was under construction so a couple of the pools were shut and there was no hot tub/jacuzzi but these things happen i suppose,it was still nice there with lots of sun loungers available. Overall it was a great stay there and i can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best you can get”
Reviews.Author: patrick_nancy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel in Oct 1994 and returning this year was like turning back into time. It all looks like 10 years agoo, very old fashioned in 2007. The room was OK, but shopping area was not worth visiting. It is not the place the find a souvenir to take home. Breakfast food was OK, but we had to pay 14 USD for 2 beers, this is even more than in the Bellagio. Price/Quality was less than we had on the rest of our trip in the West. This hotel list is no longer on our 'to-go' list

Reviews.Title: “Memories of My College Dorm Room”
Reviews.Author: travelduck111
Reviews.Content: Hello everyone, I stayed at the Excalibur the last two nights and bring you this Travel Duck review. After finding a $138 round trip fare on Delta from Atlanta (not a typo), I arrived at 9:30 a.m. on Saturday. Below is a list of positive and negative aspects of the hotel for your reading pleasure. I will start with the negatives: 1. The front desk staff, while not rude, are certainly not pleasant. These folks really need some customer service training. It seems like they just know that their hotel is inferior and act the part. The manager Harley was nice though when I called to his attention the unacceptable rooms (see below). 2. Rooms are completely shabby and border on unacceptable. For instance, rock hard beds where the spring of the mattress is placed ever so nicely on your back. Also, the mold around the shower is just gross. It really reminds me of my college dorm room except there was no wierdo roommate at the Excalibur. I wonder what happened to him? 3. The hotel wants to charge you an additional $20/night to upgrade to a "renovated" room with a pillow top mattress and flat screen t.v. How about you just upgrade the guest for free if the room is available? The guest will be happy, gamble in your casino, and probably lose the $40 within about ten seconds at the blackjack table. 4. I was trying to take a brief nap after a game of poker and I was awoken by people swearing at each other outside my room. I opened the door and it was several housekeepers. I guess I would be mad too if I had to try to clean those rooms. 5. Annoying timeshare sales people hassle you as soon as you enter and leave the casino. If you have been to Vegas before you know what I mean. I suggest telling them you are late for your flight home. If that does not work, start following them around and asking them a bunch of questions about their personal life. Now for some positives: 1. Closest hotel on the strip to In and Out Burger. You must go - you must. 2. Very reasonably priced for a hotel on the strip with a good location - I paid $106 for a Saturday night and $46 for a Sunday night. For those prices, I really cannot complain too much. 3. Manager was nice and addressed my concerns about the room - put me in a somewhat nicer room which was closer to Holiday Inn quality than a Motel 6. 4. Krispy Kreme donuts and Starbucks on site. It is actually the cheapest cup of Starbucks coffee in Vegas hotels which I found -$2.60 a cup ($3.20 at Planet Hollywood). 5. Easy tram ride to Mandalay Bay. Go to Mix Bar at The Hotel at Mandalay Bay for the best view of Vegas 61 stories high. Get there before 10:00 p.m. and avoid paying at $30 cover. All in all, if you just want a place to sleep for a few hours and are not looking to impress anyone, this may be the hotel for you. If you want a better place to stay for a bit more money, I would suggest Paris, Luxor or Mirage. If you want further Vegas tips, please send me a message! TD

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: tripvisor1234
Reviews.Content: Just returned. Stayed in tower II on the 26th floor. Room was nice, clean, bathroom large, This room faced the New York New York and the view was awesome. The casino itself was average, nothing fancy as compared to the Bellagio or Caesars Palace. The Excalibur is located on one of the best corners (NY NY, MGM, Tropicana, and Excalibur) second only to where Bellagio and Caesars Palace is. Bellagio's fountain show is a must see at night. It runs every 15 min. Only complaint is smoke but it's bad everywhere except the restaurants. Seems like everyone in the country who smokes is there.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: CanadaFlygirl
Reviews.Content: Travelled with a friend Nov 13-16/07 for three days of casinos, shows and shopping and was a little hesitant about the Excalibur after reading negative reviews; however, was pleasantly surprised for the most part! Previous complaints were regarding the unrenovated rooms in Tower 1 -- not a problem. The rooms are average; beds were reasonably comfy, pillows were soft, sheets clean and refreshed daily if desired. The bathroom was clean and bright and the shower was powerful enough (no tub for foot soaking after a long day of walking) and the carpet was reasonably clean. The hair blower was weak and the whole system fell right off the wall. We deliberately chose a low floor so we could have the option of taking the stairs if the elevators were extra busy but there was never a need to use the stairs. Security at the elevators was hit and miss; sometimes you needed to show your key, and other times not. The view from our room was definitely lacking but we were prepared for that by choosing a low floor. As others have mentioned, the buffet on the second floor was unappealing. Everything looked nicely presented but it all was very bland. For $12, you can likely have a better lunch/brunch elsewhere. Some reviewers talked about children all over the place. There is a children's arcade in the lower level of the hotel where I imagine you would find lots of children. I saw only a handful of children in the casino! Timeshare staff was another thing I did not look forward to but they seemed to be invisible. Perhaps because we were two women, we were ignored -- worked for me! Smoke in the casino is an issue for lots of people. I am a reformed smoker and did not find it overly offensive. The Hard Rock Casino had a worse problem than the Excalibur for smoke, I found. It goes without saying that you’re gonna smell smoky anywhere in Vegas! Finding your way around the hotel is a bit of a problem but signs are plentiful and the internet kiosk at the concierge desk allows you to view a hotel map free of charge. (That kiosk is a poor excuse for internet access and charges an initial rate of $5 which allows 20 minutes of internet surfing. Each printed page uses $1 worth of your time. In other words, printing your boarding pass(es) costs $5.) Getting out and about and finding your way across the street is also little confusing and my feet suffered. But getting out and walking the strip is the best way to view Vegas! Take comfy shoes. The bus system on the strip is good -- $2 a ride or $5 for unlimited 24 hours use. The bus is, however, very slow negotiating the traffic on the strip. Of course, taxis are everywhere. A trip to the Premium Outlet Mall north of the strip was a $17 taxi fare from the hotel. The airport was about the same. The shuttle bus from the airport was $6 per person. We spent our last day in Vegas at the spa and pool area. It was unseasonably hot for mid-November and we soaked up the sun before returning to a Canada winter. I looked for a review mentioning the spa before leaving home but I could not find one. It was okay but not luxurious and prices were nearly comparable to home for all the services such as massages, wraps, facials, etc. The pool area was cement and unremarkable but new construction hints at a more contemporary area. Construction noise was minimal. I was told, however, that a room in Tower 2 overlooking the new pool area starts hearing construction noise at 5:30 AM! In summary, the hotel is definitely not as luxurious as many of the others but neither does it cost as much. As the old saying goes….. you get what you pay for. You decide what’s important to you.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: PAULEL
Reviews.Content: A great hotel. If you are considering staying at the hotel I would highly recommend it. Please do not be put off by other reviews here as I feel that some people may be expecting something like the 5 star Bellagio or are just too picky. This is a 3 star property and the experience I received cannot be faulted. The location, the room and service was all top notch, certainly as the majority of the trip is spent in Las Vegas and not in the room. Fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Not pleased overall”
Reviews.Author: WordofmouthToronto
Reviews.Content: The room environment was in dire condition. The worst was the bathroom. In addition, the TV was broken. This was in tower one. I asked to be relocated to another room in Tower 2. The agent at the registration desk wanted $20 additional dollar per room and this after I explained that the room was below stndards! Talk about being totally disconnected with the customer and the lack of experience they were provided. I managed to convince the agent not to charge me the extra $20 per night but only when I threaten to change the hotel entirely. The Tower two was an improvement as a room except for the bathroom again where the shower area was lacking caulking around the edges and of course the edges were completely dark with mildew. Quite disgusting. Also the light was not working as the fuse breaker had tripped. Lastly and this is the worst, for some reasons while sleeping (around 5:30 AM) you could hear a worker putting up drywall! That day I did not need a wake-up call, as the dry walling noise took care of that. Overall quite a nasty customer experience. The outside is appealing but that is it. I have communicated this to anyone who asks me about my hotel room; that it was a dive in great need of renovation. I will never return to this hotel… shocking and definitively bringing down the reputation of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: fk1701
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay in the Excalibur. We love it. Great location on the strip, brilliant casino and plenty to do in the hotel. The rooms are spacious and staff are very helpful (we travelled twice with a small child!) On the downside, the medieval dinner show, wasn't worth the expense - only lasted an hour and the food wasn't great - fun, while it lasted though - think cut price Medieval Times! Overall, really nice hotel - would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price for Great Location”
Reviews.Author: paym01
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Friday night and Saturday night. The hotel room was old, but clean. We had two rooms next to each other with connecting door which was cool. The main pool and the water slides were closed for construction. The smaller and shallower pool was open. The hotel is located across the street from MGM, Luxor, and New York New York, so great central location on the strip. Pros: Location and the price Cons: Old rooms (two star quality) Tip: If you have more than two people in your party better take a cab to and from the Airport rather than spend $11 per person for the round trip shuttle. It's cheaper and more convenient.

Reviews.Title: “You're Better Off at a Best Western”
Reviews.Author: FWJgirl
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews here and since so many people were saying that the Excalibur was a good, inexpensive place to stay I gave it a shot. Never again. It wasn't *terrible* but it wasn't great either. It was a step below a Best Western because at least the Best Western has in room coffee and a Continental Breakfast downstairs. I upgraded to a widescreen room and if that was an upgrade, I shudder to think of what a normal room is like. In the week I was visiting I had to call a few times to see if they offered maid service since they never showed up. I just loved seeing all the room service trays n the hall way all the time. It's really nice to see other peoples half eaten food gathering flies in the hallway. Oh yeah and there was the drunk half naked girl sleeping in the hall. She was fun to explain to the kids. Let's see...oh and Widescreen? What good is a widescreen television when you only get a few channels? Most of them about the Excalibur or Vegas? Plus the Internet connection for $12.00 a day worked only sometimes and they charged me $1 a day for unlimited local calls - when I didn't pick up the phone once. I used my cell phone. Add to that all the ticket hawkers and time share salespeople literally harrassing you every time you stepped on or off the elevator and I'd think it's safe to say I'll never step foot near the Excalibur again. Oh and I forgot all the cigarette smoke. Don't go there if that sort of thing bother you. And Dick's? Go for the atmosphere because the food is a step above fast food.

Reviews.Title: “Hated It.”
Reviews.Author: kilborn7
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed in a hotel that did not have a coffee maker in the room or where you pay for a telephone you never picked up.The room was small,no view no bathtub,not very clean.The hallways are dark and smell bad.Staff leaves a lot to be desired.The food was ok but pricey.I will not be going back.The casino is small and full of little kids and the machines don't pay out very well.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: LovesVegas7
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Vegas (so sad). Have stayed at Excalibur twice before, the first being about 15 years ago. It was a low budget place then but acceptable. Last time we stayed, about 4 years ago, we decided we wouldn't go back. After receiving a good offer in the mail for the renovated, strip view room we decided to try again, we only sleep in the room anyway. Big disappointment ! When we first walked into the room, it looked quite nice. But, then when looking around, we could see that the renovation was done on a tight budget, looked and felt cheap. The rest of the property is in bad shape - torn carpet, scary elevators, just plain dirty. Drink service is not as good as other places that I've stayed and played. Check in staff (lobby) was very nice, check out staff (VIP Services) was ok. We did get late check out at no charge, and one of the Casino Host's was nice enough to print the boarding passes for our return flight home. I have to say that Excalibur was probably the worst hotel / casino that I've stayed in over the last 19 years of visiting Vegas on average two times a year.

Reviews.Title: “Not too impressed with an upgraded room”
Reviews.Author: Welovevegas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur from Nov 4 - 7. Our room was 23270. We asked for an upgrade and paid the $20 per night. I was pretty excited to stay in a upgrade because I had read good things about the rooms. I will say that it was not the worse room I have ever stayed in but I was not impressed. The room was clean, no doubt about that and that makes up for alot of other problems. First of all, my understanding was that the upgraded rooms had safes built in now. Ours did not. My understanding was that the beds were pillowtop beds and comfortable. Ours did not have that. The carpet in a brand new remodeled room had been cut away from the wall so far that it was jagged and you could see the concrete floor below. This was not that big of a deal but I hoped that they did not pay the carpet man for that kind of job. The floor to the shower was very slippery and I almost killed myself getting into the shower. Probably should do something about that before it is too late. I was also disappointed that they doors did not have any extra security latches. Normally you will have a dead bolt or a bar running across the top of the door for extra security. I did not feel very safe and I do hope that they change this as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great WOW”
Reviews.Author: teenba
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel 2 hours before check in thinking we would have to wait, but no our rooms were ready Hotel was great all staff were friendy and helpful. Easy reach of the strip and all the other hotels. 3 great eating place and a very entertaining pub All in all we had a great stay

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: muc_ramhar
Reviews.Content: We (1 couple, 2 single women, all late 20s/early 30s) spent 8 nights in the Excalibur at the end of October. Our first impression was that it was very impressive from the outside – it was fun to stay at such a themed place. We were offered assistance with our bags when we got there but as we all had roller suitcases, we declined. On arrival at the hotel we did notice that the casino smelled a little bit strange – kind of musty overlaid with carpet freshener, but it was by no means awful and we got used to it quickly. We arrived at about 3pm on a Thursday afternoon and there was no queue for check-in. Throughout our stay, I never noticed any large queues, even though there were several conventions that week. We got our requested rooms (smoking) in a very short time. They put us on the same floor, just a few doors apart, which was great for us. We were happy with our standard rooms. The queen sized beds were definitely large enough for two people to share and the rooms themselves were bigger than we expected. The bathrooms were big too, with a lot of counter space for toiletries and a large mirror. They were well lit and very clean. The shower cubicle was huge, at least twice the size of a normal one. No baths, which wasn’t a problem for us. There was no ledge in the shower for shampoo etc. which was a bit awkward but again not a major problem. All in all, we were very happy with our accommodation. The only gambling we did in the Excalibur was on the penny slots, but these seemed “loose” enough and we all made small wins throughout our stay. The exception was on the last night when one of our party won $160 on a five dollar roulette table, so that was a good finish. Cocktail service was okay – not great but not awful either. We ate twice at the Sherwood Forest café, once for lunch and once a very early breakfast (4.30am). The five dollar specials are good – I would recommend the breakfast. Getting seated was a bit slow, especially as the restaurant wasn’t full, but service was efficient once we ordered. We ate at the buffet twice also, both times for breakfast. Food was good and worth the $11.99. There was a good variety and everything we got was hot and fresh. We also ate in the Italian restaurant in the hotel which was fine too. Nothing spectacular (wine list was quite bad) but not expensive and it was fine for our purposes. All in all it was a very enjoyable stay. This hotel has got some bad reviews but we found it to be clean and serviceable. I would definitely stay there again at the current prices. The location is pretty good too with easy access to NYNY, MGM Grand, Tropicana, Luxor and Mandalay Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Cue trumpets: Here Ye, Exaclibur was better than expected ....”
Reviews.Author: CanadianGrrl
Reviews.Content: This is a better than average place to stay that is not as sketchy as some of the old school cheapos with similar locations. Arrived in Vegas for the first time with low expectations. This was, after all, one of the cheapest hotels on the strip, popular with families/kids, and because it was Halloween weekend, we seem to have paid more than the room was worth, based on negative reviews. The Excaliber exceeded our expectations and we had a good time there for the reasons others have listed above: great location to walk to many attractions, decent food, fast valet, quick and easy to visit Luxor and Mandalay Bay on the free tram. We booked a Deluxe Room for more space but to be on the same floor as our friend who had upgraded we too ended up in the new rooms high up on Tower 2. Wish they had bathtubs but otherwise found it pleasantly modern, clean and spacious. Wish also that the pool was more than 3 feet deep but I suppose that's what you get for picking a kid-friendly place... The internet in our room did not work with our laptop (suspect the cable was broken). They offered to "send a technician" but rather than wait we used the kiosks downstairs. Walked through many other casinos/hotels that would be more our style if budget allowed. (The shows and restos/clubs at this place are pretty lame/tame.) But if I was going on the cheap, I'd consider booking at the Excalibur again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected....”
Reviews.Author: roadtripmama
Reviews.Content: Was expecting the worst based on these reviews, and regretted winning this on hotwire ($50/N)...however....everything was just fine! Speedy valet, good location, great widescreen room (paid $15 extra for refurbished interconnecting rooms on a high floor with view of strip, as requested). Beds were comfy, room clean...no bath but shower worked just fine (no temperature swings), and all in all we were very pleasantly surprised. You wont get luxury and frankly for the price you pay you shouldnt expect it either, but its a far cry from dreary and faded.....at least in the refurbed rooms!! Great Value!!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: LCarpenter
Reviews.Content: We have stayed now at 8 differant hotels/casinos in Las Vegas. We were travelling with some family members that were on a budget so we decided to pick the Excalibur because of the price. I was worried because of the reviews but it ended up being a good choice. Check in was speedy. We got the remodeled Widescreen room and it was very clean and spacious. We ordered a mini fridge brought to our room ($20 a day) and they delivered it within 20 minutes. Room service was a nightmare. We ordered just coffee one morning and it took an hour and a half for them to bring it. The woman who brought the coffee said that they had a bunch of layoffs so they were extremely understaffed. Next two days we just went down the elevator and there was a coffee shop right there. The food at Sherwood Forest was very good. They always seem to have a line but it moves very fast. The Camelot Steak House was just okay. Extremely overpriced for the quality of food. Our bill was $150 for two people. The Roundtable Buffet was horrible. Do not eat there. The casino itself was very crowded compared to other casinos in the area ... even on Sunday night it was packed and you could barely find a slot machine to get on. But the location is great and the access to Luxor, Mandalay Bay, New York New York and MGM is very easy. So if you are on a budget this is a great place to stay and really not as bad as other reviews have made it out to be.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for, overall not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: magical127
Reviews.Content: 6 words: You Get What You Pay For. This place looks amazing on the outside but don't let that fool you- it is the equivalent of a run-of-the-mill Holiday Inn as far as the rooms go. Outside of that, don't expect a lot and you won't be disappointed. If you pay more than maybe $125 a night during peak travel times/days, you're paying too much. If a no-frills hotel sends shivers down your spine, spend the extra bucks and stay elsewhere (MGM, or Bellagio if you can swing it). There is no bathtub, which was unexpected and annoying. They only had a smoking room available when we checked in (Priceline doesn't let you choose smoking vs. non-smoking rooms, so we didn't specify when we booked)- not an issue since we were both smokers, but we would have been very upset if we didn't smoke. We had an AWESOME view out of our window (note: heavy sarcasm- check pics). The hallways take forever to get down, but all major hotels in Vegas are like that. It was clean, housekeeping did an adequate job, etc. Check-in and check-out were simple (we checked out at a kiosk). The staff who checked us in were slow but very friendly, so you couldn't really get mad. It's in a perfect location on the strip. You're within very easy trekking distance to Luxor, Mandalay Bay, MGM Grand and NYNY. A farther (but not totally winding) walk will get you to Monte Carlo, Bellagio, Paris, Caesars, Planet Hollywood. I'd stay there again if we were on a really strict budget, but if I could afford it, I'd probably try a new hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unmipressive”
Reviews.Author: duranimal70
Reviews.Content: I stayed here mostly to be close to a concert I was attending at Mandalay Bay, which is connected to Excalibur by tram (Mandalay Bay was upwards of $400 a night, Excalibur was $164). First, I expect smoking in Vegas but they really need to upgrade their air filtration system. I felt like I needed to wash the smoke smell out of my hair simply after walking through the casino to check in. Room was average and unimpressive with a pool view, and unfortunately I was by the elevator which was very noisy all night. I also missed not having a tub (Excalibur has showers only) as I like to soak after a long day sightseeing. I didn't request the upgraded room with a flat-screen, and the older model TV kept turning off by itself at random when I would change the channel. Maintenance was very nice and tried to fix it, but it still kept doing it. Next time I would probably stay at Luxor, the rooms are nicer and the Tower rooms have tubs.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it...with the upgrade!”
Reviews.Author: Seebradgo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in August. We have stayed all up and down the strip including a stay at The Stardust (tear. I miss it). I have to say, after reading all of the negative reviews, that our stay was quite the opposite. Upon the advice of some of the other reviewers we upgraded our room to one of the newly remodeled rooms. I simply asked for this at the time of check-in and the front desk easily accommodated us without any issue. As for check-in everything went very smooth. We arrived in Vegas at just after 12:00pm. By the time we made it to the hotel (took a shuttle from the airport) it was about 1:00pm. Even though official check-in isn't until 3:00pm they had no problem allowing us into the room early without charging us for an early check-in. And, again, the upgrade for an extra $20 per night was easily done…and worth it! The room itself was very nice. Brand new bed that was very comfortable to sleep in. The furniture in the room was brand new and the 42" plasma hanging on the wall was very nice...not that we did much television watching. The bathroom was completely new. Marble countertops with a full sized shower (not a bathtub/shower combo). The room smelled brand new like we were the first to stay in it. The casino itself is still very dated. Not near as modern as the others, but it is still very family oriented. We didn't do much gambling here so I can't comment on how the drink service was. The few times we sat at the slots we were always asked if we wanted drinks so I guess I can't complain. The location is great. This is probably the most redeeming quality of the Excalibur. Nearly every major casino/hotel is within walking distance. I can't say enough about the location. Saved us a ton of money on cab fare this year. The food is on par with what you might expect from a buffet. We ate the at the buffet twice. Once for breakfast and one for a late dinner. Both times we were satisfied with what we got. If your concerned with getting a good buffet I would suggest taking the free tram over to The Luxor. We did this once and were very impressed with it. You will pay quite a bit more, but the food was worth it. My only major hang up with this hotel is all of the timeshare people. I’m sure the Excalibur has some type of deal with the timeshare companies to allow them in the hotel, but I felt as if I was running a gauntlet every time we went to the hotel room. Once you say “No” they quickly back off without being pushy. That’s not the problem. The problem is having to say “No” six or seven times a day. It got very tiresome very quickly. Saying “No” to timeshare reps just became apart of our daily routine, unfortunately. Overall, we would recommend this hotel to our friends who are on a budget. I consider it a good value for what you pay for. It won't blow you away like some of the newer casinos...but you won't be paying an arm and a leg to stay there either.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful View and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: I_Love_the_Sea
Reviews.Content: It's easy to get the room you want if you know how to do it. I've read complaints about people getting queen beds instead of king, smoking rooms instead of non-smoking and other problems. I didn't want to be another one to complain. Here's how I got what I wanted: I booked my room through "last minute getaways" on the AAA site. With their booking system it's impossible to specify your room selection so I went to the Excalibur website. There's an online Kings Express check-in there. A week before the vacation, I picked a non-smoking room with a king-size bed and a view of the strip. I also emailed stating my requests. Around noon on the day of the flight to Las Vegas, I called the King's Express helpline: 1(800)753-9773. The rep was very polite and helpful. I told her that I was concerned about getting the requested room because my boyfriend and I weren't arriving until after 9pm. She said, "No problem, just make sure to give us a call if there's a delay." She also assured me that it was a really nice room on the 22nd floor. As Murphy's Law would have it, the out-going flight was delayed. I called the phone number I mentioned above and the rep said Excalibur would hold my room until 3am. I certainly hoped I wouldn't get it that late. I finally got on the plane, but after an hour of taxiing around the airport it returned to the gate because of mechanical problems (The airline was Ted by United and I'm not going to fly them again until they get the kinks worked out, it's a much longer story than I describe here and more happened on the return flight too). Eventually the whole flight got canceled, but I was able to get the another flight out. My boyfriend and I arrived at Excalibur well after midnight. The express check-in kiosks were down (which they seemed to be for the entire trip whenever we walked by reception). The line moved quickly to deal with the clerk though. The clerk was efficient (but I wouldn't call her overly friendly or rude). We went up to our room and walked out the elevator. The entire floor was designated non-smoking. Our room had absolutely no smoke smell. I opened the drapes and was met by a stunning view of the Luxor (I added a photo, trust me, it was huge and much more impressive in person). We stayed in Tower 1. It seems that the rooms with odd numbers from around 22105-22119 would probably have the same spectacular view. I could also open the window a little bit to get fresh air. It was very quiet and a haven after being on the busy strip. The carpet was clean (not sticky or dirty at all). My boyfriend and I were starving so we ate at the Sherwood Forest Cafe. There's a $5 special from 5pm-5am, but you have to eat in the cafe which can be a pain because the waiters are slow. Some are a bit surly and obviously don't enjoy their job, but others are very nice. For $5 you can get a great cheeseburger, a steak or a huge breakfast. Even take-out is slow in this place. Allow yourself extra time if you eat here. Everything else at Excalibur was fast and efficient except the cafe. As for the room, the king-size bed was comfortable and this wasn't one of the remodeled rooms. All the lights worked. The phone didn't so I let the front desk know the next day and it was replaced within an hour. They also waived the $1 a day phone fee. The TV worked fine and there's an express check-out service that you can do from the TV. There's some art with a medieval flavor like a knight giving a lady flowers. The only thing missing was a bathtub. I really needs a place to soak after walking around Vegas, but the shower was huge. Housekeeping was very friendly, but a bit questionable. The first day, everything was replaced and clean (there's a card in the bathroom that says to put dirty towels on the floor and to place the card on your pillow if you want new linens). The second time we had housekeeping, the shower mat disappeared and we found an empty pillow case on the chair. If you sleep in, prepare yourself to get a call from housekeeping. They'll call in the afternoon to ask if you need the them. They don't call early though. We got a call around 3 pm and at noon. Make sure to get a room on the upper floors. The lower floors have a monorail that goes past them. Also, you may have a view of a concrete wall. The first floor was missing a drink, vending machine and the machine on the second floor didn't work either. The vending machine drinks were less expensive than the same drinks sold at the stores on the ground level, so we frequented them. The casino was extremely smoky; just walking through there my clothes would reek. The only time it wasn't too smoky was at 2am on a Monday. Hint: If you need fresh air and you're on the strip, be sure to visit the animal habitat at The Flamingo. It's huge, free and very relaxing. The wild birds are beautiful and plentiful too. One of the best things about Excalibur is its location. There's a small, shopping area above the casino that has a Starbuck's, Krispy Kreme and a couple other chains. There's a walkway to the Luxor which also connects to Mandalay Bay. On the other side of Excalibur you can walk a bridge to NYNY or the MGM Grand. I visited the game arcade at both Excalibur and Luxor. The one at Excalibur is definitely aimed at little kids under 10. If you're feeling nostalgic, The Luxor had better games (there's a Simpson's Pinball Game and an F-Zero console). I really enjoyed my stay at Excalibur. It can be a great experience, but you have to make sure to ask for what you want.

Reviews.Title: “Expected More!!!”
Reviews.Author: Washy10
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay here as my daughter 4years old wanted to stay in a castle, the staff were very friendly and helpful and check in and out very easy, the only real complaint was house keeping we decided to upgrade our room for an extra $20.00 a night to have a room with the same views only 2 floors higher and a flat screen TV had had bad reception, the room was dirty stuff left all over the floor from the previous guests, dirty cups left in the draws that hadn't been checked, we asked for extra pillows and towels the first night we arrived and it took 3 DAYS to get them, with that all said they did not charge us for the room upgrade which was nice and on about day 4 they cleaned the room properly. The casino was not that smokey to my surprise i thought it would be terrible and have smoke clouds everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at the Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: tjruk04
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur from the 3rd October to the 17th October. We had one of the newly renovated rooms with a strip view. The room number was 17205 which was at the end of the corridor. The room was much better than the un-renovated rooms which we had previously stayed in. We heard no noise whilst we were in the room and had a wonderful view of the strip. The only downside was the timeshare people that pounced on you every time we walked by.

Reviews.Title: “Viva las Vegas!!!”
Reviews.Author: MarRio
Reviews.Content: it was an awesome experience!!! Everyone oughta visit Las Vegas at least once!!! Excalibur was a really good place to stay at...looking forward to visiting again. Really happy!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap........and it shows”
Reviews.Author: BirdieEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: The first room we were allocated was on the third floor of Tower 1, the view from the window was of a white brick wall....... Im perhaps a bit of a hotel snob but even so, I dont plan to travel 3000 miles to look out onto a brick wall. This might be fine for all day sleepers!!! The second room we were allocated (after being told by a stroppy assistant that they would have to charge us to change our room that had a view of a brick wall) still had dirty towels lying on the floor, popcorn ground into the carpets which quite obviously hadnt been cleaned and a used coffee cup on the bed. I figured things werent going to get much better but the view of the luxor from our window was great. Another annoyance is that everytime you walk towards or away from your hotel bedroom in Tower 1 you are harrassed by people trying to offer you a 'free show' which translated into, spend a day of your vacation with us and we will offer you discounts off the shows. The pool area was under construction/refurbishment while we were there and so the main pool was closed. The smaller pool was open but the noise of drilling wasnt so relaxing and we gave up after about 20 minutes. Ive stayed at the Bellagio and the Venetian before and this is a very cheap alternative......although you can get some great deals at both these hotels if you search hard enough.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at the Excalibur.”
Reviews.Author: HEVER
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and my parents stayed at the Excalibur for 14 nights and had a great time there. On arrival, check in was quick and not much of a queue (which is great after an 11 hour flight). My husband and I decided to pay an extra $30 a night for an upgrade to a remodelled room which we thought was well worth the extra money. We had an in room safety deposit box (which we much prefer rather than having to go down to reception all the time) and we had a lovely view of the NYNY and MGM hotels.The room was clean and towels were changed everyday and toiletries were replaced when needed.There was no bath but that didn't bother us as we prefer a shower anyway and it was a good powerful shower. My parents stayed in one of the older rooms and,to be honest,they were perfectly happy in there.They had a good view of the Tropicana and the airport (my dad loved sitting at the window watching the planes). We ate most mornings in the snack bar (Little John's i think) which was fine.A bowl of cereal and some toast was just enough to set us up for the day. We also ate at Robin Hood a few times but we felt that it wasn't as nice there as when we've been on other visits. It was convenient if you don't want to go too far for food but we think the Pyramid Cafe in the Luxor is much nicer (huge portions there). Sometimes we just had a snack from the food court which is very convenient.
