I had a small sub from Quizno's one day and it was gorgeous.We didn't bother with Dick's Last Resort as it's not really our kind of place but it always seemed to be busy (we weren't impressed when we saw a couple trying to get in there with a baby that only looked a few weeks old). I enjoyed playing the slot machines (only the 2cent ones) and there were always cocktail waitresses around so we didn't have any problems getting a drink. A lot of people say that the hotel is full of kids,it's old, dated etc well we didn't see any more children there than at any other hotel in Vegas and yes it is an older property but it's only somewhere to sleep so for us it was perfect (including the location).We will definitely stay there next time we go back to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel and recommend if on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Natz76
Reviews.Content: We had stayed for two nights at the luxurious Mandalay Bay (see other review) but as we were in Vegas for 5 nights, wanted to make sure we did as much as possible so moved hotels for the other 3 nights. We chose the Excalibur for price and location and it was excellent. The decor was dated and needs an overhaul but who cares? The Camelot theme was great, families especially would appreciate. We stayed in Tower 2 which is very convenient for the pool area. The rooms were a decent size and very clean, we had a double bed which was comfy. The bathrooms were basic, no bath but large shower and very clean. The pool area was nice, lots of sun loungers available but the music they play is very loud so try and position yourself on the left side of the pool where there's a temp fence as they're building another pool area next door. There's no speakers on the temp fence so you can listen to your ipod in peace! The hotel is massive and we made use of the free monorail to Mandalay bay and Luxor. Food - we only ate at the buffet restaurant, can highly recommend the lunch/dinner buffets there with a full range of salads, roast dinners, pasta & Italian, Mexican and Chinese food. Lots of puddings too and of course unlimited drinks (as everywhere in Vegas). We had breakfast at the Robin Hood cafe which was excellent, there's a bit of a queue but if you are a small party and ask to sit at the counter rather than wait for a table you bounce the queue!. Hotel is in a great location with a walk way to New York New York (a fantastic hotel - check out the Big Apple bar and the excellent Chinese restaurant there). Would recommend Excalibur for the price. Only downside was the annoying timeshare sellers who accost you as soon as you walk in the door. However, when they ask if you are married and you say "no" they immediately leave you alone (top tip!!). They also leave you alone if you say you're not over 21. The key is not to stop but just keep walking past you - difficult because they are friendly but just remember you're wasting valuable holiday time!!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK.”
Reviews.Author: wildshy
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 rooms at the Excalibur along with 4 plane tickets using VEGAS.com. My husband and I got a room with 2 queen beds(not very romantic) and my brother-in-law and his girlfriend got a King size bed. The air conditioner in both rooms kept going on and off very loudly and did not seem to cool the room. We ordered room service the first night because it was our first time there and we did not want to get lost in the dark. 2 hours later the food arrived with a "sorry, we are running late tonight" and "the maid will remove it in the morning so just leave it in the room please" by then we were too tired to eat. The next day we left the room at 10:30am and returned around 10:00pm to find the room service cart was still in the room and had begun to stink. I wheeled it into the hallway and thats where it stayed until the 2 days later when we checked out. The location was good and the bus stop was close by. The buffet was really bad. You get your food and then you get in line to get seated while the food gets cold and then you still have to get your own drinks. I HIGHLY RECOMMENED THE BUFFET AT THE BELLAGIO AND PARIS, PARIS. I will not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “West Coast Tour 2007”
Reviews.Author: Shrimper72
Reviews.Content: This was the second hotel we used in Vegas, returning after going to Page. Location is good with New York New York, MGM, Luxor etc all very close. The Excalibur's rooms were good, quite big and comfortable, the hotel itself is large has a large choice of places to eat, lots of tables and a nice looking pool area thou I didn't use it so am unable to comment on how good it is. Would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Value was excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: chris306
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here from Oct. 3 thru the 7th. Booked directly on their website. I honestly was concerned with some of the things I had read from others, but had to try for ourselves, we were not disappointed. Got one of the refurbed widescreen tower rooms, from what I had seen on the this website of traveler pix, we made the right choice to go for the widescreen room. The room was very clean throughout our entire stay, maid service was excellent. The beds are SO comfortable, if only the towels in the bathroom were just a bit bigger! Very clean!! The pool is still undergoing renovations, but it looks promising (peeked thru the fence). The entire staff is very friendly and accomodating. Even if we had the do not disturb sign on our room, they passed by it and came to clean after we had left, not like others said that they ignored the sign. The casino is big, and there are signs that direct you to which tower you go to, a bit confusing at first, but once you get it, it's all ok. We ate at Dick's Last Resort, we have one of these here in Boston, so we kind of knew what to expect as far as the waitstaff. It was a fun place, go there to just hang out and have some good pub-food. Overall, we would stay here again, they are making some positive changes to this place, and it is worth checking out. Grat deals on their website. Don't let others scare you away with the negatives, this place really is pretty cool.

Reviews.Title: “Value for the Dollar”
Reviews.Author: tiredmom2
Reviews.Content: We visit Vegas every year and have stayed at the Excalibur for the past 4 years. We usually use the promotions sent to us and found this is an inexpensive way to stay in Vegas. We found the rooms to be average and on the faded side. Nothing fancy but then we use the room for sleeping only. Each visit has found at least one lightbulb out in the room and it is usually on my side of the bed. This year we upgraded and got the jacuzzi suite - the extra cost to upgrade definitely wasn't worth it. Enjoying the jacuzzi at the end of a day is great but for what the cost of the upgrade was we could have just gone to the spa instead and saved a ton of money. This room is the same as any other room with a view in the decor dept. - just had a jacuzzi in the corner and you're not able to see out anywhere except into your room due to the location - we were hoping that at least we could look over the strip while enjoying the tub but a peak at the turret was the best we could do. Next time I'll just take a regular room and save money. We rented a car which is the only way to get around and enjoy the sites and other hotels. The valet service at the Excalibur is excellent - so friendly and quick. We experienced valets at a couple of the other hotels that we visited and the Excalibur definitely had the best valets. We played the tables and slots but found only a couple of dealers that we really liked - we had a hard time understanding most of them and they weren't the friendliest of people-standoffish. But we really did enjoy the couple of dealers that were so friendly and helpful. Wish they were all like that. Overall, if you're looking for a value priced hotel the Excalibur is good for this. Prices are reasonable, and generally service most times is good. There's always things at hotels which can irritate but overall it was a good time and we are coming back (but with no upgrades!).

Reviews.Title: “loved the excalibur”
Reviews.Author: carolshanks
Reviews.Content: i booked a surprise 60th birthday holiday for my husband and i in september originally to stay at the gold coast. a couple of months before the holiday i was informed by the travel agents we had been upgraded to the excalibur,having read some of the revues earlier on this hotel i was a bit concerned about it. However the only downside to it i found was the stale smell of cigars which seemed to permiate the room. the room was clean albeit a bit dark ,staff friendly and the hotel overall was lovely and nicely situated on the strip. i would definately recommend this hotel and will certainly be going back again. vegas has certainly hooked us, use the monorail and buses to get about it works out cheaper than taxis and keep saying no thankyou to ticket touts cos they are everywhere viva las vegas carol

Reviews.Title: “Not a fan”
Reviews.Author: shrek61
Reviews.Content: I needed a place near family at the Luxor for one night and $49 couldn't be beat. This hotel is need of an overhaul. the room was far too dark and dreary, toilet ran on. I did not like having to trapse all the way to the center of the casino area to check in. I knew what to expect so for the price I got just what I expected.

Reviews.Title: “I thought it was Fine”
Reviews.Author: charlotteguy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights and thought the hotel was great. While it is not the Bellaigo you certainly do not pay Bellaigo prices. I had a room in the "upgraded" tower. It was fine. TV--This is a flat screen tv but the picture was kinda grainey. Shower--Decent water pressure. Very spacious bathroom. Beds--Very comfortable. Check-In--Went very easy for me. The only bad thing was the breakfast buffet....it was horrible. Go eat somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: aon2020
Reviews.Content: Overall a really good value place to stay. Spacious room and bathroom. Buffet in the hotel has a really good selection and in Vegas you definetly get what you pay for - i.e. if you pay £3.50 for food you will not get great stuff! Can also recommend the buffet at the Mirage (excellent choice!). Yes the casino does smell a bit strange but most of them do and you kind of get used to it! It's not the most luxurious of the hotels but we loved the look of it and the price! It is a bit of a walk down to the main part of the strip and so if I was going back I would probably book somewhere more central. However, the buses stop right outside (but be warned they are jam packed and take forever to get up and down the strip - standing room only many a time). Check in and out was really quick, we got a no-smoking room no probs. You do get charged a dollar a day for local calls whether you make any or not - dont like that kind of thing. Didnt use the pool or spa - the pool didnt seem to have any shade so I couldnt have stood the heat! Try one of the margaritas in the souvenir excalibur goblets - pricey but yum and potent! Dont bother getting the airport bus to the hotel as it goes all round the houses and we were second to last stop- in the sweltering heat this was torture. If you are not bothered about frills and just want to get out and enjoy vegas then i would thoroughly recommend the Exclaibur.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur was great!”
Reviews.Author: thersa7
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Excalibur from Sept 18 thru Sept 22.I have stayed at the Excalibur three times and have never had a problem. It is at the end of the strip however I know my way around and its easy to go from end to the other without a problem.I certainly will stay there again. The buffet rest. has changed owners and the service is not as good as it once was but the food was fine, just service was slow. Checkout is so so easy, just drop your keys in the box and you are on your way. Check in usually is busy but goes faster than you would expect.Rooms were clean and bathroom too. Not fancy but fine for my friend and I. Again I would stay there.. We felt safe too. Teresa in Tennessee

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joshua_MX
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review almost 2 years from when I last stayed at the hotel, wonder why? because this is the first time that I use TripAdvisor and find it as a great help for everyone trying to decide where to put his money. It is amazing how different people think about this hotel, is even funny to read they were expecting Venetian kind of rooms for $40 bucks! This is a great hotel for both family and lovers getaways; I have stayed here for the last 5 or 6 times visiting Vegas and all I can say is; friendly staff, ultra-fast self check in, good size casino, clean rooms and great prices; can't think of anything else you might need... Next month (Nov 07) my wife and I are going to break tradition by staying at the Luxor for a change, hope the bad reviews of it are as wrong as the ones for Excalibur, I'll keep you posted.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, convenient, inexpensive, and perfect for one night”
Reviews.Author: Traye
Reviews.Content: I read bad reviews of the Excalibur and was hesitant to book a room. I probably would have been on the safe side and booked a room at Bally's if we'd been staying for a weekend or more. Since we were only staying one night and just needed a bed and place to shower/get ready/keep our clothes, the Excalibur was cheaper than Bally's or the Imperial Palace, but a step up from the Sahara/Stratosphere/Circus Circus (which were way cheap but also had horrible reviews and were too far down the strip). I wasn't disappointed in anything about Excalibur, in fact I was pleasantly surprised at how easy it was to stay there. It ended up being a great choice. We did call-ahead check in and our keys were waiting in a self-check in kiosk to the side of the line to check in with the staff (which wasn’t horribly long, btw, at 3:00 on a Friday). We got a room in Tower 1 (though we hadn't requested a tower room), and it was non-smoking with 2 queen beds just as we had requested when my friend booked the room on the hotel's website. We called the hotel before we booked to compare rates and ensure that we didn't have to do anything special to get the 2 beds, and that's when they told us about the check in over the phone and gave us a number to call. When we called to check in, they just asked about what time we'd be arriving (we called at noon, said we would arrive about 2:30), and how many beds we wanted. Checking out was just as simple, all we did was drop our keys in a box not far from elevator to the tower. Everyone should do this, it's a breeze! The only interaction we had with the reservations staff was over the phone, and it was always professional. I don't know if our room had been renovated or not, though it was nothing fancy, it was nice enough and clean, with plenty of space, enough for two couples. The hotel itself is a little generic but the rooms didn't seem run-down, nothing was worn out. I read complaints that the bathroom was small, but I didn't think so. The stand-up shower could have fit two people, and the sink/counter had enough room for all of us to set our stuff out. Free TV channels, an iron and ironing board, small table, good lighting in the bathroom and a second mirror above the dresser. The bed was comfortable, but I did bring my own pillows. I suppose the a/c unit might be considered loud by some people. I’m one of those who absolutely can’t sleep in dead silence and always has to have a fan, so I was extremely relieved and happy that I could set it to “fan only” for noise. No coffee maker in the room would be the only thing lacking, I guess. But there are two Starbucks in the casino, and a McDonald's, or you might be able to get coffee from a cocktail waitress, if you're on that tight of a budget! The purpose of the visit wasn't to hang out in the room, of course, the couple we were with didn't even end up sleeping. The Excalibur was perfect because it's convenient to most places, so each person could go back to the room when they were ready. Excalibur is connected to the Luxor and Mandalay Bay, and there is a bridge to New York New York, where they have several food places. It’s at the very south end of the Strip, but we still walked and gambled at the Casino Royale, Harrah's, and the Flamingo. We passed by the Imperial Palace and just looking at the entrance to the parking garage, I was glad we didn't stay there. It faces the strip and people trying to pull in had to wait for an endless stream of pedestrians on the sidewalk, it looked very risky. Valet at the Excalibur was simple as could be, they were very nice as well. When we realized we forgot our cel phone in the car about 20 minutes after arriving, they asked what it looked like, where it was in the car, asked me to point out my keys, and went and got the phone for us, in less than five minutes. Same ease with check out, too. We wanted to stay for a bit after check out to watch football and gamble some more. They pulled the car up so we could put our bags in (I didn't trust the bag storage, no particular reason, I'm just a cautious person with my things), and re-parked the car. All it takes is a few dollars for tips. We stayed on a Friday and checked out on a Saturday. The casino seemed a little busier as we were leaving, but I think if you do the self-check in/out thing, you'll be fine. Don't be afraid of the bad reviews, there was absolutely nothing wrong with the Excalibur if all you want is a simple room at a decent price. Save money by staying here, and you still have easy access to everywhere else to dine, dance, gamble, or hang out.

Reviews.Title: “Felt Safe”
Reviews.Author: BrendaLondon7
Reviews.Content: I,ve been to Las Vegas three times before, in the summer. My job only allowed me to visit in the first three months of 2007. Las Vegas is nice in the Summer. Cheaper in the Winter. I wanted to stay at the Imperial Palace, where I had stayed before (I want a hotel on the Strip, where the action is, which doesn't cost a lot), but couldn't get it. Instead, I stayed at the Excalibur. It's south of the main action, but you can walk or take the bus. In Las Vegas, there are a lot of beggers, as opposed to New York. Should have some lose bills on hand. These people have a hard life. The Excalibur rooms are quite nice, and one feature above the Imperial Palace is that they check who you are before you go up the elevators. Makes you feel safe. They don't do that at the Imperial. When I visit Las Vegas again, it's a toss-up between Excalibur or Imperial. I'd rather spend my money on shows than just a place to sleep. I think the Buffet at Excalibur is better than Imperial, but I last visited the Imperial in 2004. For taste, the best buffet is at Paris. Costs more, but worth it. Best location is at Imperial, but it's not a far walk from the Excalibur. The view of the Strip anywhere is what makes Vegas Vegas. Avoid walking between Wynn and the Stratopshere, especailly at night. You will not feel safe. A bus ticket doesn't cost a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Not very nice”
Reviews.Author: Wynda
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel at least three times, not because it's great but because they have the Midway which is fun for kids and we always travel with our son. The rooms are not as nicely decorated or as large as you would expect. The bathrooms are small and not very nice. Room service is usually fast and the food is good. The tv's do not have connections for video games. You do not get what you pay for at this hotel. The only really good thing about this hotel is that they have the Tournament of Kings show which we really enjoy, but you don't have to stay at the hotel to see it. We have decided that we will no longer stay at this hotel even though it does have the Midway.

Reviews.Title: “what a dump !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CanadaK123
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Sept. for 3 nights $ 99 per night mid week. Booked a King size bed and was told at check in there were none available. This seems to be an ongoing problem at this hotel. The hotels advertising motto is "you rule" Wrong ! The staff do ! They are all very rude. From check in to check out and everyone in between. Not only were they rude to me I also saw them being rude to other guests. A note on check in. There are very long line ups to check in. A bit like checking in at lax. The same for check out. I am a very easy going person with a good sense of humour and not hard to please. I have been all over the world 2 x over. and have never seen anything like this . So do yourself a favor and dont make the mistake we did . Go stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CamaroChickCanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at this hotel. Room was ok - nothing special. Bed was very comfortable. Liked the walk in shower. Air conditioner was so noisy that we turned if off while we were in the room but left it running while we were out to cool down the room. Hotel staff very friendly especially the security on the way to the elevator. Not impressed with the people selling time shares at every entrance to the hotel. They swarmed you every time you walked by. We ate breakfast at the Sherwood Cafe but found it to be every expensive - usually around $25 for 2 people for nothing special. We found the dinner buffet to be excellent and well worth the price. Enjoyed the Tournament of Kings dinner theatre. Besides the noisy air conditioner, the toilet in the next room was extremely noisy. Check in was good and since we had to check out at 11 a.m. but our flight didn't leave until 6 p.m. we were glad of the area where we could leave our luggage. We would consider staying at this hotel again if we ever returned to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK.."”
Reviews.Author: masubi55
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the castle and the room we got had no view at all..it was our 10 year anniversary. We booked it knowing it was standard room and low cost. I spoke to the front desk and they gave the "oh well..and will cost you extra expression" But I must say the House Keeping and Security staff was very friendly and professional. If you guys stay in the CAStle please double check everything from views to a food reviews in the hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, smoky Family accommodation with some problems.”
Reviews.Author: incongru
Reviews.Content: Sorry to disagree with the Jammy Dodger but we must have been there at much the same time and my experiences were somewhat different. This is a family-type hotel, slightly run down and DEFINITELY aimed at people who are willing to accept second best. You know it, the minute you walk in the front door. It does offer good value for money ( for a hotel on the strip) but I would recommend spending a few more dollars and booking into a better hotel. However if you are young, or travelling with young children, (and you believe that the dangers of passive smoking are greatly exaggerated ) then this just might be the ideal hotel for you. Because from the minute you check in, you are breathing other people's cigarette smoke. Apparently it is legal ( almost obligatory) to smoke cigarettes in casinos, and the whole of the ground floor is, of course, one big casino. The very walls seem to be ingrained with 20 years worth of cigarette smoke. I was surprised to see people with children- even babies- walking through this at all hours. One of the dubious attractions of this casino ( through which you must pass every day) is, apparently , a noisy bar called "Dick's last resort" where people are encouraged to whoop, holler and ( for reasons unclear) wear paper hats . This is a very noisy bar and the floor is covered with torn up paper. I never did find out why. This bar was full of people who in the UK we would describe as "chavs", -and fair play to them. But the American version is much noisier . Okay, here's what happened. 24 hours before we left the UK I phoned the hotel and confirmed the booking- a double widescreen non smoking room in tower 2. We arrived at 11 pm to be told by a very flustered clerk - whose english wasn't too good- that allegedly our room was NOT available and we would have to go into an unrefurbished "smoking" room for 2 nights. Personally, I think he was trying to extort cash ( a bung?) from us. But after travelling for 24 hours I couldn't be bothered with his nonsense so we stayed in an unrefurbished room for the first 2 nights of start of the holiday. The toilet was flushing continually and we phoned for the repair man. He stopped it but it started again the next time we used it. That night the toilet overflowed and the sewage ran out into the room, soaking the carpet. It turned out it was the toilet NEXT DOOR which was blocked. Also the next day, I heard a gurgling noise from the bathroom sink and I discovered the sink had ysteriously filled itself with delightful brown, cigarette- scented water. Also from next door, allegedly. The toilet extract didn't work and - most worrying of all- the window could be slid FULLY OPEN which isn't so clever when you are on the 14th floor. Admittedly the refurbished rooms are much better. They are of an acceptable standard. And if you enjoy waking to the sound of ambulances and grey haired old men on harley davidsons, remember to choose a room at the FRONT of the hotel. I would highly recommend that you ONLY stay in the refurbished rooms, even if it means paying a bribe for the priviledge. The Excalibur is an innovative hotelier. They allow new guests to check into rooms which are still uncleaned and with unmade beds from the previous occupants. I saw on three separate occasions , people at the reception complaining about this. There are quite a few different places where you can eat in this hotel. The most popular is a buffet where you can eat "as much as you want" but there are also some nice restaurants with friendly staff. In fact the staff are, in general, very pleasant to deal with. I have read suggestions on here that the negative reviews are being posted by rival hotels. I am a real person from the UK and if you want to know any more about the excalibur, feel free to email me. I'l be happy to answer any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Bummer”
Reviews.Author: Aimster77
Reviews.Content: The air conditioner was LOUD and must have froze up because by the third day it didn't blow cold. We tried to rent a movie but the sound didn't synch up with the movie. We called down to the front desk on the prehistoric phone (took 20 rings). Apparently this happens all the time because we were instructed to turn off the tv for a minute and restart it. The room was really dark. It was clean but lacked any style. The beds were terrible. The restaurant choices are a bummer. On the upside, the rates are really resonable (for Vegas).

Reviews.Title: “far exceeded expectations ...”
Reviews.Author: thejammydodger
Reviews.Content: We werent going to have a holiday this year due to recently buying a house, but come May, the call of vegas was too much and we booked ten nights at the excalibur ... choosing this hotel primarily because of the price and because we hadnt stayed there before. As most people have said, the many negative reviews of the hotel on this site had us a little worried, but we neednt have been .. the hotel was great. We booked a 'widescreen' room ... and it was very nice, definately worth the extra $20/night. The casino is showing its age in places but is not as rough as some people have said. We only ate in the Sherwood cafe for breakfast but this was fine. The pool was still under construction which was a bit dissapointing, but the old pool was still open and we never had a problem getting a spot. All of the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. I suppose it depends on what youre expecting as to what experiance you have here ... weve stopped at some of the more upmarket hotels and The Excalibur has nothing on them .. but you dont pay $350 a night to stay at the Ex either ... All in all, definately very good value for money ...

Reviews.Title: “Needs A Complete Overhaul”
Reviews.Author: Pippy8
Reviews.Content: We had to be in Las Vegas during the first 2 weeks of March (don't go in March) on short notice and the Excalibur was the only hotel that could give us 6 days consecutively. We were warned it was cheap and not to stay there but we thought the proximity to the airport would cancel any hotel negativity. Not so! We also didn't realize that it was Spring Break and March Madness Time! Checkin was lengthly due to only 1 desk person on duty. First impressions....cheezy theme,dirty, digustingly smokey everywhere. Put in a redone (?), non smoking room only to find that where the table "wasn't", there now hung a "new" lamp (face height) with a mirror on the wall behind it. Good Luck getting any use out of that mirror! Marble bathroom counter tops of no great looks. There was a flat screen TV but nothing special otherwise. New carpeting doesn't a new facility make!! Everytime housekeeping made the beds they left the bolster pillows on the floors. We really wanted to use those pillows! The security guards present by the 1st floor elevators were extremely pleasant and made us feel quite safe inspite of the huge influx of college students on break. The kid friendly amusement area in the basement level is patheically old and dirty. So dirty it's scarey. With so many college aged (mostly drunk) kids present, the casino catered to them no end. Bleachers were set up so they could watch and wager on the NCAA basketball games and when they chose to take chairs away from slot machines in the casino no one stopped them. They were scarey. The facility itself is outdated and dirty inspite of continual cleaning, smokey and generally not worth 1 penny of what we spent there. In the past we have stayed at hotel/casinos near midstrip and been much,much happier in every way eventhough spending more $$$-$$$$. We would never recommend Excalibur to anyone we know and hope that soon the facility will be razed and redone in a more modern theme with everything new. Back to midstrip for us!

Reviews.Title: “great value on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: shadylady26
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and would stay there again. Clean updated rooms with plasmas and pretty good service. Ask for a room with a strip view otherwise they will give you the back, which is still ok looking down at the pool. Close to ny ny and luxor. we got an awesome deal on vegas.com instead of going with all the other sites. only thing i didn't like was the shower only had a place for bar soap so you have to set all your shower items on floor. Very nice place to stay--we were hardly in our rooms though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Good location, shame about all the kids”
Reviews.Author: bandit26
Reviews.Content: First time in Vegas with my wife and some friends. We stayed up on the 24th floor overlooking the strip in the new renovated rooms in Tower two. Worth the upgrade. Unit was really nice and clean. Had to call housekeeping for extra towels and maintenance to fix the front of the A/C unit, within 10 minutes all was done. Great service.. Checking in was a pain in the butt, they don't explain the parking and the route to the reservations desk. If you are not careful you end up walking throught the whole casino with your baggage. Make sure you get the accurate directions before you unload your vehicle. Other than that, the casino was busy lot's going on, friendly, unfortunately there were kids around, which to me spoilt the atmosphere of the casino. The restaurants are very expensive approximately $28.00 to $42.00 for a steak. We tried the buffett at the EX $15.99 on the first night yuk!! But then we did found the buffett at the MGM Grand $19.99, well worth the extra few dollars, they had Prime Rib, Clam Chowder, which is a must and the rest of the food was great. Enjoy G

Reviews.Title: “Not what it used to be”
Reviews.Author: neba1110
Reviews.Content: As much as it makes me sad to write a negative review on TripAdvisor, I feel that I have to get this all down and try to steer people away from the money grubbing that's going on at this hotel. Some background: my husband and I came to Las Vegas for the wedding of my brother and to renew our vows at the Canterbury Wedding chapel which is inside the hotel itself. The chapel should be excluded from most of the negative parts of this review, as they treated us very well, and both my brother's wedding and our ceremony were very nice. We received the chapel rate for our stay (Saturday-Tuesday) because of the ceremonies. When we arrived on Saturday and got the keys to our first room we went upstairs only to find the beds were unmade, there were wet towels on the floor in the bathroom and the TV was on. I hope that whoever was actually in that room wasn't planning on coming back, as their keys would no longer work. I went back to the front desk and got keys to the second room. This one had a charming view of a brick wall and a porta-potty, a hole in the alcove wall and the carpet was ripped in several places. ANOTHER trip down to the front desk was required. It should be noted that we paid extra for a view of the strip, which is an upgrade. When I went to the desk the third time I was told that I would have to pay for a view (even though I had). I explained that the rate we paid was for a view room, and finally got keys to a suitable room on the 23rd floor of Tower 1. We didn't get the single king we wanted though. We enjoyed our time in the hotel, and purchased some souveniers from some of the vendors. Our ceremony was beautiful and we had dinner afterwards in the Camelot steakhouse which was excellent!!! We didn't enjoy eating at the buffet for Monday morning breakfast. It was expensive ($11/person), crowded, badly set up and noisy. We used the salon for some of the women in the wedding party and it, too, is incredibly overpriced. $55 for a wash and blow dry that looked pretty average. Again, my brother's wedding was very nice at the chapel, and the dinner at Ragale was to DIE FOR!! Excellent food in every way for all the guests. After dinner, my husband and I decided that we wanted to stay in town for another day to be with my family. I called the front desk to find out what the stay-over rate would be and was put on hold for 5 full minutes before a snippy front desk clerk told me that it would be $136 and that the chapel rate would no longer apply. Keep in mind that our ceremony was $395, my brother's was $650, the check in the salon was $400, our dinner after our ceremony was $100, the check at Regale was $1700, and all told our party probably lost about $1000 gambling in the Excalibur casino. I was asking to stay over on a Tuesday night in late September and was asking for a rate that was only $50 less. I called and spoke to a manager who told the the best they could do was $101. Needless to say, we're not staying over. My family was one of the first to stay at the Excalibur when it was built in 1991. Back then, the staff was friendly, the attractions fun, the accomdations comfortable, and the amenities reasonably priced. Now, there's surly front desk people, rock hard beds, doors that don't stay shut without the deadbolt, overpriced services and no effort on ANYONE's part to make a stay pleasant. I'm certain that it's possible to enjoy one's stay at Excaliber, but if people do, it's in spite of the hotel rather than because of it. I can't in good conscious recommend staying here, and would instead point people to the Luxor or MGM Grand which are near neighbors.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Pass Up Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: oldweasel
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Excalibur on a Saturday night around 9:30 and only had a five minute waite to check in. The desk staff was very nice and helpful. We were put in tower 2 on the 3rd floor. The room was nice. The only quipe we had was that there were no handrails in the shower stall. Dinning was most enjoyable, since we used our comps. to eat on (get your Player's Club card and use it). Watch out for the "leeches" that attack you whenever you enter the hotel/casino. If you want to see a free show, then let them take you to the resort for a 2-3 hour timeshare tour.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel but a great time!”
Reviews.Author: KimmyCustard
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Excalibur for a week from 7th September. We booked Vegas in April, then decided to get married whilst there! We stayed in Tower 1 at the Excalibur, I have read reviews that say Tower 2 is better and newer. Our room was very clean and basic, there was wall paper peeling off the wall, the fan in the bathroom didnt work and the bathtowels were too small but for sleeping and showering, it was fine. We didnt aim to spend alot of time sitting the hotel room, had it been a beach holiday then I would have addressed the issues. The buffet breakfast was great, loads of choice and the hot stuff was hot, however the dinner buffet is not the same! The hot stuff was lukewarm and not very appetising to look at which put you off choosing alot. However, for the price, you got what you paid for. Half the swimming pool was closed whilst we were there which was a shame, including the water slide. The other pool got quite crowded because of this but again, we were not there to lay around the pool for the week. I would recommend this as a basic hotel at a good price and the location is very good, right opposite MGM Grand and The Tropicana and transport up the Strip is right outside. Vegas was great and I am envious of anyone going!!

Reviews.Title: “superb value for the money”
Reviews.Author: paul24
Reviews.Content: I have been lucky enough to stay at most of the major casinos along the strip. This time i was on a budget and opted to stay at excalibur. I was almost put of by some of the reviews on this website but was well happy with my stay. It was for four nights in one of the new widescreen rooms. Really clean and roomey. Had a great view of the strip. Casino was good, had a great time in the dicks bar, (real good laugh!!) Nice big pool. Suberb Value and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Much nicer than expected”
Reviews.Author: horhay123
Reviews.Content: I had heard that this hotel was just "ok." But I think this is one of nicest hotels I have stayed at on the strip (for under 150/night). Pay for the "widescreen" upgrade, its 20 bucks a night above the normal rate, and well worth it. There is a 37 inch flatscreen tv, and the decorating is very nice. Very large also. An extra 10 gets a nice view of the strip looking at NYNY. There is nothing too fancy about the hotel, but its very friendly, inviting and the location is great. The "four corners" area is probably my favorite (NYNY, Tropicana, MGM, Excalibur). Once you get bored at one casino, its a quick walk across a bridge to another casino. For the 3 star class of hotels on the strip, this one is great. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: matt_williams386
Reviews.Content: Reading some of the other reviews on this website my wife and I were feeling fairly apprehensive about out stay, having stayed at the Luxor the year before the bar had been set fairly high. We were extremely impressed by the hotel, we are not under any illusions regarding the hotel, we knew from last year that it needed modernising and was one of the cheapest options on the main strip. We upgraded to one of the larger rooms facing New York, the room was huge and made the stay more comfortable($10) a bargain. The room was nice, not plush but reasonable, everything was clean and working, perhaps in need of decorating. Food, there is a huge choice, the breakfast it nice and reasonable, there are a large amount of well priced restaraunts in casino, although i recommend trying Mandalay Bays breakfast buffet, which is excellent for 2 extra dollars. The casino is fun and friendly as well as the bars, easy to find your way around with lots of different bars. Show wise we tried the tournament of the kings, not too bad, wont win any EMI's thought, more for the children. The new pool wasn't finished but the old one is nice and was sufficent for us, tends to get busy though. I'd recommend getting your water and other stuff from the smaller shops opposite The Monte Carlo, as the mark, up is 300%. Over all we would go back but would like to try the more up market options on the strip, would recommend though we had a brilliant time.

Reviews.Title: “So-So experience at the Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: sliaros
Reviews.Content: This was my husband's and my first trip to Vegas and also part of a delayed honeymoon. Upon arriving to the check in desk, I asked to be placed in tower 2, since I had read on Tripadvisor, that these rooms had been remodeled. The check in person said we'd have to give up the king sized bed we had booked and go with 2 queens in order to do that. We agreed, thinking that the benefits of the upgrade would be worth it. My husband even tipped the guy. When we got to our room, it didn't appear to be upgraded at all and the view was of an air conditioning unit on the roof. Hearing the staff talking to another family getting moved out of their room a few days later, the upgraded rooms and better views seem limited to floors 18 and above. Oh well, live and learn. The room itself was basic, but clean, and seemed to meet our needs. We didn't plan to spend much time in it anyway. Unfortunately, that wasn't true for the entire stay. We were at the Ex from Tuesday to Saturday. Wednesday, the housekeeping service showed and replentished the towels and made the bed. Thursday, they did as well and we left a generous tip. Apparently, that was the problem, as by Friday, nobody came to check on the room and even after a phone call to get more towels and being promised they would be delivered, nobody ever showed again. The rest of the hotel was pretty decent. There is a stong family presence there and I was shocked at the number of kids, but apparently that is a plus for the Excalibur., if you want to travel to Vegas with children. One wierd thing was that the elevators (all of them) automatically stopped at the 8th floor and most of the time nobody was there. As for other aspects, my husband and I both enjoyed the casino and the staff there. We also ate at the Sherwood Cafe and their food was better than anything else we had during our stay. We had planned on including some nice restaurants during our visit, but never quite made it, but the cafe at the Ex was pretty good in comparison to major chains with which we are all accustomed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Much Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: knig
Reviews.Content: I would like to start off by saying how much I wasn't expecting to like this hotel but I did! We stayed in Tower 2 and upgraded to a strip view room this was a little expensive at over $30 per night but after reading the reviews I would not risk ending up in Tower 1. Rooms and public areas were clean and tidy..yes it did smell of smoke in the casino but you would expect it too because people are smoking! Room Service were quick helpful and efficient. Housekeeping were discreet and also efficient when we arrived our window was filthy we could not see our strip view but after a small tip and a note the next day it sparkled. We ate in the buffet this was good (please note the only breakfast buffet we went to) plenty of choice fresh food etc. Sherwood Forest cafe was better unless you want to stuff yourself with mexican and chinese food at 8am. We travelled with our 4 year old my advice is to take a pushchair we didn't and missed out on a lot of early evening activities the heat coupled with the distances makes for sleepy children. We got married during our stay at The Little Chapel of Flowers which was excellent we didn't feel like we were on a conveyor belt and our minister Jerry was great. I booked the Glam Squad to do my hair and make up (recommended by another trip advisor member thanks) and James was great on time (almost) and did a great job - please note airbrush option is a bit of a rip off. Excalibur pool area still undergoing refurbishment but this was not a problem didn't experience any noise but get there early as only shade is before 11am. We flew with Virgin from Gatwick they were great on the way out and crap on the way back. All in all fantastic time we will go back and would not hesitate to stay here again although I think next time we would try somewhere new further down the stip closer to the Mirage and TI. Maybe next time Bally's? I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel as a good budget option and great for families. PS Dont hesitate to take children to LV my son enjoyed everything about it.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur is Average”
Reviews.Author: Pokalong
Reviews.Content: The Excalibur is at a good location, easy to get from/to the airport and highways and other casinos. It has all the types of gambling you want. The facilities are average. We upgraded to a strip view room with a flat screen TV because of I review I read previously. The room was nicely decorated and clean and had all the ammenities of a regular hotel room. There was the normal noise from people walking and talking in the hallway late at night. It just wasn't anything special. Other than fast food, the dining choices in the hotel are limited but there are other restaurants in the hotels close by that give you variety. The pool remodeling hadn't been complete despite info that it was slated to be completed in Summer of 2007. The Spa facilities are very nice. If you are looking for the quality of the Bellagio or Mandolay Bay, this isn't it. But if you are looking for a convenient, value priced hotel with basic accommodations, it might work for you. This is a good example of "you get what you pay for."

Reviews.Title: “Too many good deals on the strip to waste your money here.”
Reviews.Author: SugarBB
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the positives... Playing at least $10 at the bar in video poker keeps you with as many drinks as often as you want. And the bartenders are very nice, and great to chat with. And then there is everything else. Booked an upgraded king sized room and ended up with 2 queens. Okay, fine. I suppose it's "busy" on a Sunday night... But the room was not only unclean (shower not clean, tables sticky, etc), but there was VOMIT all over the room. On doors, ceilings (yes, it was on the ceiling), walls, stained on bedspreads... everywhere. Yet when we called to ask for a change-- They didn't seem too thrilled to send us to a clean room. When we finally got to another room, we noticed our "nonsmoking" room reeked of cigarettes, had a broken lamp, was steaming hot, and no soap (we never got soap in our room the entire stay. Thank goodness we brought our own products). But since we were tired, aggrivated, and unwilling to move again we opened the window for some "fresh" air and tried to air it out. Thank goodness for the Downey Wrinkle release spray and some scented candles... it's the only thing that made the room stink bearable. And then there was the AC-- It never kept a constant temprature. Just on freezing cold and full blast directed towards the bed (brrrr) or off and hot as... But wait, there's more! I dared to walk around the room without socks! And as a reward I got punctured with what I thought might be broken glass. But no... it was only somebody else's nail clippings. Gross, huh? From check-in to check-out, I was astounded by the lack of compassion and customer service skills demonstrated by everybody from the bell staff (who never once showed up to help with baggage) to maids, to security, to cocktail waitresses, on up to the supervisor I spoke to (had to wait an extra 20 minutes while checking out to speak to her). You know, when I mentioned the fingernail clippings, she said that it happened all the time and then chastized me when I told her I cleaned up the mess instead of leaving it there for them to "document." For my trouble they offered to comp me breakfast (this was after I mentioned I was on my way to the airport). Wow, thanks. I would have preferred that things be clean and I be treated with respect. I guess what bothered me the most was that I actually stayed here a month ago (during the weekend when the hotel appeared to be twice as busy) and my experience during that time was completely different. In fact, when they heard I was going to be back a couple weeks later, they told me that they would make sure my next stay would be great and they would give me upgrades and food comps, and to just remind them and my next check-in. Of course, that never happend (during my check in this time the guy asked me three times if I had stayed there before, and then told me that I would have to pay for the upgrades that I had been promised for free before). I have the feeling that I lucked out the first time and that makes me sad, because I wanted to give the place a chance. Like I said in the title-- There are so many hotels and hotel rooms in Las Vegas, that it would be a waste to spend your money here. Why reward them with your business and hard-earned money for doing a crappy job?

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, awesome, awesome!”
Reviews.Author: gtbek
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Excalibur hotel with my best friend for 5 nights and I have nothing bad to say about the hotel at all! I honestly think you could just stay in the hotel for a week and never get bored! Of course, there is nothing like this hotel in Australia (the look of it, the theme, decor... everything!) so we were totally blown away from the start. I will try and keep an order to the info I review the hotel on. Ok, check-in. Check in was fast and easy and we only needed to give them a $5 deposit for the phone. The lady who checked us in was really nice and also gave us a map of the hotel. Finding our way to our room was interesting (the place was huge!) even with a map, but staff were helpful and pointed us in the right direction. When we reached the room we were very pleased with the size of it. We had 2 Double beds, a very big bathroom, table with 2 chairs and plenty of room for our stuff. The room has a great theme, people say it's outdated, but I loved it... I thought it added to the theme of the hotel. We also were lucky enough to have a view of the NY NY rollercoaster across the road. The room had air-conditioning, pay TV and a nice assortment of toiletries provided. There is obviously, heaps of gaming machines although we didn't really play in the casino. If you go downstairs you will find "Fantasy Fare" where there is lots of kids skill games etc and also the Tournament of Knights dinner show. Up a level from the casino is the food court where they have Pizza Hut, McDonalds, Krispy Kreme donuts (OH MY GOD!!! SO GOOD!) Starbucks, Cold Stone Ice-Creamery and more. There is also the Excalibur buffet (very reasonably priced!) The Thunder From Downunder showroom, Octane bar and a moving walkway to the Luxor hotel. The buffet we had at Excalibur was really good, heaps of selection and reasonably priced. We also saw the Thunder From Down Under show which was hilarious to say the least. On the casino level there is a place called "Dick's Last Resort" which is a great place to eat/drink. They have HUGE $14 drinks here in a souvenir cup (see my photos) and yummy food as well. There is also a snack bar called "Little Johns'" for if you get the munchies. As I mentioned before, there is a moving walkway to the Luxor hotel, so it is easy to explore this hotel too. There is also a walkway to the NY NY hotel and from there, another walkway to MGM Grand. From MGM Grand you can get the Deuce bus ($5 for a day pass) which stops at all of the hotels on the strip as well as downtown. On the food court level there are lots of shops, Excalibur themed souvenirs, LV stuff and a $10 boutique with lots of handbags and jewellery. I was very impressed with the service of Lost & Found at the Excalibur too. When I arrived into San Francisco airport I realised I had left my digital camera in the room at Excalibur. I called the hotel and they located the camera. As I didn't have credit card details available I had to call Excalibur when I got back to Australia. The lady then took my credit card details and the camera arrived at my house in Brisbane one week later, very securely packed and protected. I loved this hotel and would definately consider staying there again if I get to head back to Vegas one day. I would definately reccomend it to anyone heading to Vegas for a short or long stay. Great hotel, great food options, lots of stuff to do all close by and fantastic staff in all of the shops, bars and general security etc. Thankyou Excalibur for making my trip to Vegas perfect!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice update”
Reviews.Author: MickeyInGlenwood
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in the new remodeled rooms at Excalibur. They were great. Much nicer than the old rooms. Our stay was also very nice. They let us check in at 9am on a Saturday, not like other hotels on the strip who barely let you into your room by 4pm. The little updates here and there through the hotel are noticeable and appreciated and as I understand will continue for some time. The whole property is getting a facelift. Our stay was pleasant, the staff was courteous especially Soy who checked us out, and we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location, helpful personnel, good deal”
Reviews.Author: chicca62
Reviews.Content: If you need a rather cheap hotel in a good position on the Strip with nice and helpful personnel and a pretty good restaurant, this is the hotel to choose. Rooms are a little bit run down, and I would not recommend it to honeymooners or for a romantic gateway, but if you travel with children, or you are not looking for something exclusive, it is a very good deal. When we entered our non smoking room, we noticed there was a strong smell of cigarette. We called the guest assistance and were immediately assisted and a new room was assigned to us in a minute. Courteous and prompt customer service is always a big plus. If you want to taste one of the best steaks I have ever had, try the Steakhouse Camelot: it is a very good restaurant with excellent food and service. Also the Round table buffet is not bad at all.

Reviews.Title: “Widescreen Rooms not that big of a deal”
Reviews.Author: 123letsgosomwhere
Reviews.Content: We only stayed at the Excalibur because we were attending a wedding and wanted to stay with the other people. We booked there only because we saw the "new" Widescreen Rooms. In general the Excalibur Hotel and Casino is really worn and looking shabby. These remodeled rooms aren't that great and only partially redone. The old furniture is stil there, with the addition of a couple new lamps. The beds are not comfortable at all. The air conditioner is still the noisey kind although kept the room cool. The blanket, was a thin piece of material and no extra expense was spent on the bedding or the comforter. If you are taking kids and have any hope of entertaining them by watching TV. forget it. The tv channels are the basic local channels and hotel adertisement channels, so what is the use of even having a large TV! The bathrooms have been partially redone, by putting new sinks and granite. But the shower is still the same. The window coverings are cheap, I don't even know why they bothered. The only perk is the elevators to the tower where the widescreen rooms are is less busy than the other side. If you are going to stay at Excalibur I would say spend the extra to get these rooms, because I can only imagine what the original rooms are like. But if you are looking for a little nicer experence, stay somewhere else because this remodel falls short of what one should expect in Las Vegas. They should be charging $79 ! Happy Trip

Reviews.Title: “close to the action”
Reviews.Author: suzytee
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the excalibur from August 15th to 20th. The room was an adjoining one ( we had asked for )as my son and his wife and baby were holidaying with us ,So they were accomodated next to us . The air con was faulty in our room and It was no trouble at all to move us all to another two adjoining rooms , that same evening . The rooms were value for money , comfy beds , clean sheets , there were some noisy neighbours in the rooms opposite however , shouting on and off at 2/3 am on more than two nights .. So I would ask and try to ensure there are not too many young singles near to your room as vegas is a 24hr city and people play day and night . Location was good as we could get the monorail to other hotels nearby , which saved our energy, as the 41" heat sapped your strength quickly . ! Hotel casino not too big , the boys (12 and 10) were able to find their way round it fairly easily. We would stay there again .

Reviews.Title: “pay extra for a "widescreen room"”
Reviews.Author: rrdub
Reviews.Content: Stayed here and had been warned so I payed about $20 extra per night to upgrade to a "widescreen" room.... I was really glad as I saw a friends regular room and the improvement was worth way more than $20. Room was nice, new , clean and comfortable, and about the only complaint I had was that there was no bathtub, just a shower. Older rooms were pretty shabby compared to this.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy beds”
Reviews.Author: sandii54
Reviews.Content: The new renovated rooms have very comfy beds. Casino extemely crowded. Slots were hit and miss. Dick's Last resort is a fun place to go if you have a good sense of humor. Food was okay

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: smullins
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the Excalibur on Saturday (3 days ago) morning, we were automatically annoyed. We had stayed there 3 years ago and had a wonderful experience. It was a great value for a clean room on the strip. However, this time went wrong from Day 1. We had booked a "Stay and Play" promotion, which we had counted on to have passes to the spa, money for Excalibur restaurants, and some coupons for doubling bets. The check-in clerk told us we were not signed up. We still can't figure out what happened. All we know is that the front staff was NOT helpful. They shut us down rudely and did not even try to make ammends or help us figure it out. Then we got to our room. Not at all as we had remembered. They still have those nasty bedspreads that don't look like they've been washed since the last time we were there. They had little black hairs all over the bed, which only continued into the bathroom. Ugh. I couldn't take my shoes off, even in the shower. The casino staff was hit or miss. A few folks were awesome, like Neil in the Poker Room. Others were a miss. Like the blackjack dealer who made you feel like you were in some sort of funeral home rather than a casino having a blast. These dealers can really make or break your experience. Unfortunately, many of the Excalibur dealers break it. I'm so disappointed with this experience. We've raved about the value of Excalibur for the last three years. This time, they ruined our trip. We would not recommend it and would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Eh, not too great”
Reviews.Author: kadensmommy51902
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur under suggestion from a travel agent. We had stayed at Circus Circus earlier in the year and wanted something closer to the center of the action. We have two kids (5,1). We booked adjoining rooms because we had 4 adults. When we arrived at 4, 1 room wasn't ready, which was annoying after a long drive from Oregon. However, we did get keys to the other room and went up. The room stank. It smelled like musty cleaning supplies. HEADACHE! The room was old fashioned, in dyre need of an update, however after paying out the nose, I didn't feel the need to upgrade at an additional price. When the other room was finally ready, which we had to go downstairs to find out, it too stank, and it had two queen beds even though we had reserved, and reiterated that we wanted a king size. Other than that, the hotel isn't really kid friendly, and I understand that this is Vegas, however, there was a lot of drunks, smokers, even at noon! We had to rush through the casino to get to our room. The food choices were small, and don't believe that their located in a renaissance style mall, they are really down stairs in a barely decorated hall. McDonalds, Quiznos, Krispy Kreme plus the usual buffett and some pricier places. It was a long walk to the front door, too, and then another long walk to outside, albiet there is a moving walkway for people coming into the hotel, I guess they don't want to help you leave! On the plus side, it was a good location for other must see for kids, such as Luxor, Mandalay Bay shark reef, NYNY and the lions at MGM, nice tram to Mandalay and Luxor, elevated sidewalk to NYNY and MGM. Next time we'll pick something else, would suggest Circus Circus above this hotel anytime, although it's quite far from the center of the strip. Also crummy shopping, not good souveniers, over priced and cheap quality mostly.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: an725
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our first trip to Vegas from a Wednesday through Saturday. It is very cheap to stay here which we liked. The rooms are definitely older and outdated but we didn't really mind as we were basically only in our room to sleep. We thought the location was pretty good as you could walk to NY NY (which we loved), MGM, the Luxor, and Mandalay Bay. We walked down the strip to the other hotels as well and would take the tram for $5 back to MGM. The pools were alright, they were really crowded but I'd expect that in 105 degree weather! Being from Boston we are very familiar with Dick's Last Resort which is located in the hotel so we ate there a few times. The meals are reasonably priced and they were always giving out tickets for buy one draft get one free! In Vegas, that comes in handy! The breakfast buffet was really good too, but other than that we ate at other places. If you are looking for a cheap place to stay, I wouldn't rule it out, just don't expect much. We were so busy trying to fit everything in that we didn't really mind that it was outdated. If you are looking for a resort that has nicer ammenities then you should probably look somewhere else, but if you just want a place to sleep then it's not so bad!

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel in exellent location”
Reviews.Author: cliveDerbyEngland
Reviews.Content: i have recentley been on a 16 night trip to navada and california.my first stay was the excalibur for 3 nights.my 15 year old daughter and myself was doing the holiday.because of this i wanted a family type hotel.i had read in reviews that the excalibur was family friendly.i had read mixed reviews on trip advisor about this hotel so i was a bit apprehensive.i need not have been.i found the hotel absolutley fine.the room was clean and ok.the hotel was big like most in vegas but it had a nice feel to it. the location was excellent .on my last night of the holiday when we got back to vegas we stopped in the new york new york.this hotel was fine but given the choice because of my daughter i would choose the excalibur over the new york new york.

Reviews.Title: “There are better”
Reviews.Author: gs07jas
Reviews.Content: OK hotel for the price...But there are better. The hotel had a great location...next to the New York New York and the MGM Grand. Rooms are very old...dated and need a remodeling. Old: bed sheets, carpet, wall paper, furniture, etc. Lot's of things to do with your family and kids. Has an arcade in the premises.

Reviews.Title: “Nice on a budget”
Reviews.Author: StageKing
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Excalibur for 4 days during the week in late March of this year. Room was located on the 28th floor but waits for the elevators were minimal, as one bank does the first 15 floors and the other does the rest. Casino was large and open, and no more difficult to navigate then any other large casino. Drink service was usually rather fast with decent potency for mixed drinks. Service was decent, nothing spectacular but efficient in most cases. Timeshare morons low key compared to some other properties (Luxor for example), but perhaps I just looked to poor to buy one. Nice view up the strip from the room (which we didn't pay for) and it was clean and orderly. Lack of a safe was a small issue to me but nothing was swiped. Overall good value, decent location and casino, but go elsewhere for dining.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy, but reasonable”
Reviews.Author: wouldbeworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: Room and bathroom were good size and clean. As far as decor, it's nothing special and perhaps bordering on a little outdated so this is probably not the room for you if you're looking for the most modern look. However, it was reasonably comfortable. I actually did a walk-in, should have booked online. I would have saved a few dollars if I had. Front Desk staff was reasonably friendly. In any case, the price was pretty reasonable to be on the Strip. Would I stay again? Other than I would like to try other hotels just for the sake of checking them out, I would have no reason to not stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excalisucks”
Reviews.Author: Vegastrip_7
Reviews.Content: We (family of 4) stayed there for two nights. The room is worse than motel 6. Our bathroom sink was clogging, it took us two hours and several calls before we were able to change rooms. The staff was rude and gave run around for any complains. It is rundown, and crowded hotel. A.C. in our room was noisy and did not work properly. There are 6 Internet computers in the hotel only one worked. We will not stay with them again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: Aquilla
Reviews.Content: I spent a fabulous 6 nights at the Excalibur Hotel and Casino in April 2007. The service was fantastic and I could not find a fault with anything. The room was clean and cosy with a stunning view of the strip. Besides some traffic noise it was surprisingly quiet. I ate daily at the many resturants on the second floor and was always happy with my meals and service. It has an awesome location and was close to many attractions, transportation was easily accessable. The Tournament of Kings is a must see experience. I could not have asked for a better base to explore Las Vegas and would most certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't ugrade- it isn't worth it”
Reviews.Author: kelibundi
Reviews.Content: If you happen to get a good deal at the Excalibur, do not take the upgrade they offer you at check-in. The only upgrade difference I noticed was a new tv and marble counter tops in the bath room.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay @ the Castle”
Reviews.Author: TxNurse
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay @ Excalibur in 2 months. I picked it again this time for the great package price and its central location. We rented a car this time and it is very easy to get in and out, unlike some of the land locked hotels in the middle of the strip. We arrived early, 7am and went to Hoover Dam. Got to the hotel around 1 and was able to check in early. We waited in line around 20 min. Requested Tower II and got a room without problems. Again, these are the standard hotel rooms, nice enough for as long as you are in them. Big roomy shower, no tub. Very cold a/c.....loved that!!!!! As many have said, make sure you sign up for the players club. We got a couple of meals and room charges comp'd for our play. Plus the cards are good at several casinos, so if you play at different one's you only have to have one card. There is construction going on around the pool area. If you want shade be there before 10am when the sun makes it over Tower II. The pools are shallow, about 3.5 ft deep. It does have a water slide and a nice water fountain. Wait staff present to bring you drinks at your chair. Overall, we had a great stay and would stay here again. Staff was friendly, food decent, and a great location with easy access by foot or tram to many casinos. The Thunder from Down Under show was also great entertainment for the girls!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lobopuss
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are both seniors and have travelled all over the world and we had a great stay at the Excalber Hotel. We came in around 11:30 am and our room was ready for us. It was in Tower 2 on the 27th floor. I had read alot of bad reviews so we did upgrade to the newly fublished rooms. The upgrade was only 20$ which I had thought was an extra twenty a day but was only twenty for the whole 5 nights. We had a lovely view of the swimming pools ( Which by the way was not under constuction). It was very quiet and not one wrong thing to say about it. The maid sevice was excellent and our sheets changed every day and loads of towels.Even the toilet paper was replaced every day with a fresh roll and an extra one. All the staff could not have been better. I certainly will recommend this hotel to all our friends and would return to it again. Fort Erie Ontario

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel shame about the pool area...”
Reviews.Author: Holidaypurplegirl
Reviews.Content: There are some worrying reviews about this hotel, so I hope I can set some things straight. The hotel is very clean and check in and out was swift. We had a tower 2 room, which had 2 queen beds, TV with basic US channels, a small dining table and 2 chairs. The bathroom had a twin shower with single basin and a noisy extractor fan (which can be separately turned off). Ice and cold drinks are on every floor located to the other side of the elevators. Despite being on floor 12 the lifts were incredibly swift. We ate in the Camelot Steakhouse, it was very nice but over priced in my mind. We had the breakfast buffet, which was good value for money. There was also a wide range of other outlets (McD, Quizinos, Krispy Kreme) but make sure you pay a trip to Cold Stone Icre Creams - boy amazing. Now to the downsides about Excalibur. The pool extension is not yet complete and is not only an eyesore but very noisy and a dusty. Pool drinks are overpriced and the sun loungers are packed in closer than sardines. Other things to do - well Lake Mead Cruise and Hoover Dam tour is amazing for $75 though despite what the tour company tells you is a 8.30 til 5pm day tour. We also flew to Grand Canyon South - which was awesome. We loved New York New York - especially the Guiness in Nine Fine Irish Men and the Daily meal specials in America (Salad, rib eye stea, potato and veg $15) - well worth it. We also went the the Factory Outlet South - $15 in a taxi and we bought Nike trainers for $19, Timberland shoes for $38 etc amazing savings. Though watch excess luggage on the way home they charge $16 per kilo and are ruthless. The monorail at MGM Grand is cheap at $9 for a 24hr pass and saves walking. If you are flying via Airtours dont bank on eating plenty - take some snacks as the meals are terrible (1 meal and 1 snack outbound). Timeshare touts are in the hotel - as the hotel is marketing its own property. We were got on our arrival by the staff starting a converation about where we were from and offering us a gift. Go if you wish, but be prepared for very hard sell. Also barter with the staff when they offer you things as you can up them from their standard offer. We went - beware we were there 4 hours!! We were away for a week and only got to see 1/3 of this amazing city - going back again though would like to go more mid strip.

Reviews.Title: “No tea or coffee in room”
Reviews.Author: dwanhalla
Reviews.Content: Clean & tidy. Check-in easy and quick. Would have loved a coffee after a long flight from New Zealand but had to go downstairs and look for one. Buffet was good especially breakfast. We would have liked to have something in the room to tell us more about the hotel and where things (food etc) were located. Good handy location. Would look for somewhere with a cuppa supplied if I went back.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur - Same old same old”
Reviews.Author: tmarcone
Reviews.Content: This was my 10th or so stay at the Excalibur. It may be me but I am tired of this old barn. Price wise it is the best value on the strip. Comfortable, "cozy" rooms and low limit casino tables are a plus. But the place is getting old. They are refurbing some rooms but the casino, elevators, employees.....it is all old and dreary. There are so many newer, brighter, friendlier resorts on the strip to choose from. If you are on a tight budget - this is the place for you. But if you are a first timer coming to Vegas drop an extra $50 a night and upgrade to a nicer joint.

Reviews.Title: “You're better off elswere.....”
Reviews.Author: JohnNJ78
Reviews.Content: OK, so it's a cheap place to stay, but, you do get what you pay for. If you want a pool thats under construction for the entire summer ( something that was planned to be finished for this summer), TVs that don't work, drains that back up and AC that's broke, this is the place for you. It's crowded and the elevators didn't work all the time witch made for looooonnnnggggg waits to get up or downstairs. Staff was friendly, but not helpfull. Hallways and elevators were dirty, and always had empty beer bottles and glasses laying around...sometimes for days. I spent a week here, and although it didn't ruin my trip, I will never stay here again. Spend a few more dollers and stay at the Luxor or Ballys, both MUCH nicer than Excalibur.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: DMH1416
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. Check in was quick and efficient. Rates were wonderful. The pool was fun for the kids. Lots of food choices, but they need a more mid-scale eating establishment. They had really pricey and then McDonalds... I would stay here again though if I went back.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience overall”
Reviews.Author: I<3Disneyland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I choose the Canterbury Wedding Chapel to get married in so we naturally decided to stay at the Excalibur. They were very accommodating to my party. They called a week before our check in date (Aug 3-5) to see who was in our party and to put us all on the same floor. Since we were using their wedding chapel, we were allowed to check in the VIP area. It wasn't necessary though, family in line at regular check in were done when I was. Which was good since we were all checking in about an hour early. 5 minutes tops. My father had knee surgery and needed a room closer to the elevator, they happily obliged and even upgraded him for free to a view of New York, New York and it's roller coaster. Rooms were clean and as described only two complaints. 1) My room door stuck a lot. It was the hardest door to open, I had to put my weight against the door every time I opened it and 2) their is a ceiling lamp above the table and chairs that is WAY too low. EVERYONE that sat in the chair under the lamp, hit their head when they were getting up (it was like this in all the new rooms). There was supposed to be security in front of the elevators to the rooms but a majority of the time, no one was there. When someone was there, they didn't check keys. Not a big problem to me because I had family and friends staying somewhere else that were often coming to our rooms. There were two pools, one had a slide. Personally, I find the "open" policy of drinking and smoking in the pool disgusting. The pool was packed with people lining the sides of it doing such activities, which resulted in their trash floating around the pool. The pool hours were 8 AM - 8PM, Vegas is hot 24 hours during the summer. It's not even dark when they closed the pool, most hotels I've stayed at stay open until 10 or 11 PM. The buffet was bland and a waste of money. The food court had a lot of options (McDonalds, Quizno's, Krispy Kreme, Cold Stones, etc) and that was great for a quick food break. Didn't try any of the other restaurants. The chapel was gorgeous and performed a wonderful ceremony. I would recommend it to anyone that wants a real ceremony on a budget in Vegas not a cheesy one. Overall, it was a great stay and would stay there again if we weren't interested in trying out other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: Heather875
Reviews.Content: This was actually my second stay at the Excalibur. The reasons I chose it again were for the same reasons I stayed there the first time. It is cheap and is right on the strip next to the hotels I would really rather stay at! Our room was your basic room, 2 queen beds. It was clean and we had no problems with it. I went with my husband and another couple. I feel like Excalibur is really geared more towards children, as they have a great play area in the "dungeon" with all kinds of carnival like games, arcade, and even a 3-d theatre type thrill ride that is pretty fun. My daughter would have a blast here. The casino is your basic casino, you have seen one, you pretty much have seen them all, but then again I am not much of a gambler. We loved the monorail over to the Luxor and Mandalay Bay. Overall, if you are looking for somewhere that is right on the strip and within walking distance to other great hotels, this is a great place for you! If you are looking for top of the line, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Staff is not friendly”
Reviews.Author: DebbieCincinnaitOhio
Reviews.Content: The rooms were cheap which was a plus. However, I called to add a night and the woman was just plain rude. I requested connecting rooms months in advance and within this HUGE hotel was told they could be next door but not connecting!! That was disappointing. I've been to several hotels in Vegas and will not go back to this one. If I'm on vacation, then people better be nice!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and fun gaming”
Reviews.Author: MTCSS
Reviews.Content: This was a short notice trip to Vegas for work. I checked online and booked a room for 3 nights at $59 a night. I’ve never stayed here before and thought this would be a good time to try. Check in and check out was a breeze. The room was on the 16th floor and it looked as if the whole floor and rooms have been refurbished. The room was clean and bed very comfortable. I liked the walk in shower (no tub) and best of all was a 52” plasma TV on the wall. I spent some time playing BJ and all the dealers were very friendly. The biggest complaint I have is the $1 surcharge for the “convenience” of having a telephone in the room. Another way to nickel and dime the customer. Still, not a bad 3 days in Vegas. I would not mind coming back to Excalibur.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and good location”
Reviews.Author: axcooper
Reviews.Content: This is definitely the worst hotel we've stayed in on the strip but it was also by far the cheapest. When we checked in we were given a room with a dismal view but Reception quite happily swapped it for a higher floor and looking down the strip. By European standards the rooms were adequate size but by American standards they are small. They are decorated in dark dowdy colours but are clean and comfortable. The Excalibur has lots of kids running round so we didn't even venture round the pool. We only use the hotel for sleeping and spend the whole day and evening somewhere else so it was fine. If you want cheap but clean and comfortable accommodation at the safe end of the strip then it's okay but I wouldn't choose to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, nothing great”
Reviews.Author: DukeFan91
