Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from the Excalibur. We were there for three nights. It was a decent hotel, but only because we upgraded to a new "Widescreen Room" for $20. Good points include nice room, nice pool, affordable, and decent location (on the south end of the strip, but still on the strip). Bad points include staff is not the best (check in girl was very confusing and put us in a smoking, old room instead of a non-smoking, new room as I had asked - by the way, the old rooms are very dark and dingy - must upgrade to be in a nice room), Time share people are EVERYWHERE in this casino (we must have said not interested to 50 people over 3 days in the hotel alone), spa is not unisex so if you are looking to sit in the jacuzzi with your husband/wife look elsewhere, exercise facilities were decent - elipticals were old and hard to use (there is a 20 dollar fee to use the spa/workout center), food at buffet is borderline horrible, check in line was okay when we got to the hotel at 8pm, however the next day around 1pm, the check in line was 30 people deep and moving terribly slowly from what I saw, and the casino is as smoky as many others, however the Luxor and Mandalay Bay's casinos seem almost non-smoking...go there if you don't like the smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Sarahbearah28
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stopped over for two nights in Las Vegas on a road trip to California and wanted a place that was cheap but not disgusting. The Excalibur was in the lower price range but had better reviews than The Sahara (and was in a much better location) so we gave 'er a shot... It was a GREAT place to stay! It was quite clean (minus a suspicious hair found in the shower) and had lots of space. The location can't be beat - right at the busy end of the Strip, across from MGM Grand and beside the Luxor and NY, NY. Didn't have any problems with noisy neighbours or safety issues at all. Skip the Sherwood Forest Cafe - overpriced, undercooked, blech - and watch out for the timeshare guys (although they're everywhere). Other than that, it is an ideal place for those who want to spend their Vegas budget having fun but be right where the action is!!

Reviews.Title: “No, No, No! Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: Katymoo
Reviews.Content: We waited in line for 40 minutes at check in, were "greeted" by misreable staff, hassled by floor staff several times a day wanting us to book shows with them. On entry to the hotel we noticed a musty smell, this smell was right through the hotel to our room!! Tower 1, OMG!! Dirty, smelly, decor from at least 15 years ago and an air conditioning unit that sounded like we had a train going through our room! The furniture was all chipped and broken, we didn't even unpack! Don't expect to get any sleep at this hotel, between the air conditioning and the constant shouting and banging of doors at all hours of the night! Decent enough location but that's about it!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: DallasKJG
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Excalibur for five nights, and it was a very nice visit. The staff were all very accommodating, and any problems (for example, we had a loose toilet seat) were fixed promptly. We were on an American Airlines package, and we upgraded to one of the new rooms with the 42" TV for an additional $20 per night. My wife actually upgraded over the phone before we left. The check-in line was long, but moved quickly, and they had our upgrade set when we checked in. The room was very nice - my only complaint was that there is no coffee in the room! (My wife reminded me I have complained about this at every hotel I've visited in Vegas - I'm usually there for meetings.) There was a coffee stand at the bottom of the elevators, so it was available but it was not cheap. There was also a $$tarbucks and a Krispy-Kreme in the hotel for other coffee options. I had to double up on pillows because they were very soft. That solved the problem, so I never bothered to call and see if firmer pillows were available. The food court has a McDonalds which seems to be the only place in Vegas that does not gouge tourists - the prices seemed about the same as a "real" McDonalds. Skip the buffet - it was not very good. It actually met my expectations which were very low. My wife was not impressed. There are better ways to spend your food money. Room service is outrageous, but it is 24/7. When a grilled cheese sandwich with fries is over $10, you're in a danger zone. We had a grilled cheese, nachos, an apple cobbler with ice cream and two ice teas and it was a $42 bill. It was two in the morning, so that's almost (but still not) forgivable. I would consider it highway robbery, but the Strip is not a highway. The prime rib in Sir Galahad's Pub was very tasty and the wait staff there was very good, as well. We ended up in the Pub because the main restaurant was closed the evening we went. There are a lot of families (including people pushing strollers around) there, although that probably has more to do with the rates than the castle theme. I do not understand why anyone would think bringing children to Vegas makes any sense at all, but that is more a general issue than a problem with the hotel. There are children out and about, but for the most part, they are under control. They're not supposed to be in the casino (I think) but you will see them, so if you're really allergic to kids, you probably want to go somewhere else, although, again, it's a city issue (from an old marketing campaign), not a hotel issue. I do think you will go broke with your children unless you just eat in the food court all the time, which is where you see a lot of families. Some of the patrons do look like they're using gambling as an investment program, so if you want to hob-knob with the upper crust, this is not the place. I'm not sure there really is such a place in Vegas anymore. The hotel is a bit smoky (probably not too much more than other casinos) - I didn't notice it as much while walking around, but I did notice it in my clothes when I was changing at night. My wife is a reformed smoker and she complained about it in a couple of areas - especially the Sports Book and Keno area. I would stay here again. The package rates were good, the room was more than acceptable, and I liked the casino. My wife said she would go somewhere else, but it's more because she simply wants to stay in a different place (we visited ten casinos for meals or shows during our stay, so we saw a lot of variety) than because of problems with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel in a great location on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: krystennicole
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Excalibur for a girls only weekend. 4 Friends shared a room at the New York New York but I wanted my own room close to the New York New York but that was cheaper. Excalibur was perfect because its just a short walk across the bridge to meet my friends. When I got to the hotel the lines were kind of long for check in so I used their handy check-in kiosk. Worked out great and I don't understand why no one else was using it because I got a room right away. Room was on the 3rd level in Tower II. Room was very clean. I did not get a very good view but I did not mind since sometimes strip views can be very noisy. I wasn't planning to spend much time in my room anyways. One great thing about Tower II is that you are close to their inexpensive food area. So right after I got to my room, I ran down and ordered a sandwich and brought it to my room to eat. Otherwise Excalibur is a large hotel to walk through-so its nice having something handy close by. Room decor was outdated but I didn't mind. It was very clean and the carpet was very clean which is shocking to find in cheaper hotels. Beds were comfortable and they provided extra pillows. Room is quite large and had a table and two chairs to eat at. Chairs were in need of replacement though. Ordered room service once and the food was very good and friendly bell guy. A little pricy but to be expected in Vegas. Ate a meal at the 24/7 Sherwood Forest Cafe and had good food and service. Which is a surprise because it was 3 a.m. It's so hard to find good prices on the strip so I'm glad Excalibur is still an option. Paid $130/night compared to my friends next door at New York New York who paid over twice that amount and had to have 4 girls in one room! They could have stayed at the Excalibur for the same amount but gotten two rooms so they wouldn't of had to share beds and one bathroom. My only complaint is that sometimes loud drunk people shout in the hallways while you are trying to sleep and you can hear them. And the dealer at the table was a rude lady. But overall, I had a great time at Excalibur!! I recommend it to anyone who just wants a cheaper room on the strip that is clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at the Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: mom23rats
Reviews.Content: Don't recommend this hotel!!! Check in took over 1 hr. Then they gave us an occupied room...lucky for the other people we are honest. They gave us an "upgraded room". TV didn't work properly. Couldn't rent a movie for kids. Internet didn't work and it was never fixed over the 4 days we were there. If you like bug bites, this is the place for you. Valet parking was full a couple of times and it took a long to get vehicle when we could valet. Cocktail waitresses were few and I couldn't even "buy" a drink at the bar since the bartender never helped me. The staff was overwhelmed for the amount of people staying there and it didn't matter if your needs were being met or not. Not very clean. Hallway to room stayed dirty the whole time. DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: clarey_fairy1001
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last May for 4 days, the hotel room was amazing and the amenities were very good for the money that we paid - about £20-25 for a 4* hotel! The main downfall was that food was so expensive but then we were in las vegas.. the hotel was nearer to the end of the strip, but it was in a really good location still - right opposite new york, new york and not far from the other main ones - about 5min walk, definately at the better end of the stip - stay away from the stratosphere, sahara, circus - they look horrible!! ours was clean, friendly, nice pool, health spa, the restaurants/bars werent as good as new york new york but that was only opposite so we went there a few times. Also good tourist offices nearby. The bus from the airport dropped us off right at the hotel and also so did the trip to the grand canyon. All round good hotel - with a massive casino too!! but perhaps not the best out of the bunch. If I went back I would stay again but would like to try some of the others too - its a safe bet.

Reviews.Title: “Great room terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: trav4victoria
Reviews.Content: We had 3 nights at this hotel. Check in staff was rude and although we had paid for a view room and requested tower 2, he said there was nothing available. Our view was of the airport!!! I rang reception and asked if there was anyway of upgrading to tower 2 with a view. We paid extra and were able to move. (This should have been offered when we first checked in) This was the best thing we could have done. Room was much nicer and had been refurbished. We had a great view of the strip. Hotel itself is extremely noisy and full of people out for a good drunk time. Pool is still under construction but was adequate for swimming. Food court was okay. I would not stay here again. It is worth paying extra and staying elsewhere. If you must stay here, then insist on a room in tower 2. It is closer to the pool (if you are in tower 1, you have to walk through the casino to get to the pool which isnt a good look!)

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience, Cheap/Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: persiadors
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice for the price. The rooms were clean and beds were comfortable. We stayed in tower I. Bathroom was large and updated. Our air conditioner broke down the 1st night. We called at 6am. the next morning. The hotel sent someone righy away (within 10 minutes) and the problem was resolved. Dicks resturant in the hotel was great..we had a blast. The bar upstairs Octane was not too impressive. 1st night great music, expensive alcohol. It had the worst margarita that I had the entire vacation and the most expensive. Drinks came very slow.. 2nd night had a singer..not so good. Pool was 3ft. Not so fun, but lots of room and fit the purpose of cooling off.

Reviews.Title: “The right end of the strip”
Reviews.Author: Ma77hew
Reviews.Content: This was the second trip to Las Vegas. Our first trip was to the Saraha which was a fantastic stay. Last time we went to Vegas we found ourselves travelling up the top end of the strip so it made sense to at Excalibur as the price was fantastic. The breakfasts were great, and very big for an English appetite! All the staff in the hotel and casino were very friendly and the room was a good size and very clean. If you're doing Vegas on a budget and need a place to stay Excalibur is perfect. Highly recommended. And if you want to see all the sights Vegas has to offer, take 6 months off work....it takes that long!

Reviews.Title: “IExcalibur rules”
Reviews.Author: thepengy
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights 29th June – 5th July. Arrived at 3.00pm through check in within 5-10 minutes, there are lots of self check in stations, but no one was using them. Reception staff were fine. Paid extra $20 to upgrade to Tower 2. Rooms were fantastic, I can’t see how people complain about rooms in Tower 2, they are all new, you even get that new carpet smell when you step out of the elevator. The hotel is a bit smoky, but so are a lot of places, until the 21 century catches up with Vegas and they ban smoking in casinos, it’s a fact you will encounter smoky places. Timeshare is not an issue, just shake your head or say no and they leave you alone, if you travel in Asia the timeshare people follow you down the road and grab your arm! Again this is not the only place that has timeshare people. New pool is a long way from being finished, but the other pools are open the one at the back attracts most of the kids, easy to get a sun lounger up to about 10.30, after that not impossible but a bit of juggling would be required. Didn’t eat at any of the restaurants, however they were packed, so I can’t see there being too much wrong with them. Went down to the Food Court for Starbucks and Krispy Kreeme (can’t get them at home) most days, you need to be there by 8.30 or the queues are very long. Dicks Last Resort had recently opened in the hotel, this was a great place to eat and drink, very convenient to have one on the way out or in the hotel, and the Frozen Margaritas were good to take back to the room while you got changed. As stated in may other reviews the location is perfect, if you want to stay local you have Luxor, Mandalay Bay, NYNY and MGM all a few minutes walk (or tram). This was my 3rd trip to Vegas and 3rd different hotel, if I am lucky enough to get back again, it will be the Excalibur for me, I think it’s a great balance between cost and services with all the advantages of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the Price!”
Reviews.Author: MrHendu
Reviews.Content: We (2 couples) booked our trip through Alaska Air Vacations. While we were a little worried by the reviews posted, we were pleasantly surprised by what we found. We arrived on a Tuesday at about 1:00 pm. We walked by the timeshare people, right up to the check-in counter and were checked in within minutes. We took the upgrade for the remodeled rooms that overlooked the pool area. The rooms were nice and we enjoyed the pool for a couple hours each day of our stay. The pool area was about halfway through a remodel but two large pools were open and distractions from the work were mininmal. We played blackjack, craps and slots and found the service to be comparable to other casinos. The only minor hiccup was one night our room key was not working and the front desk was not very helpful at the time. We kept one of our two rooms for late check out on friday so we could enjoy the pool one last time. 3:30 pm Checkout was a breeze and they kindly stored our luggage until our late night flight home. Overall we had a great time and would stay at the Excalibur again.

Reviews.Title: “Magical”
Reviews.Author: IrelandCailin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last year with 2 of my friends. Firstly can I say that I am Irish and it was my first time in America so everything excited me. I had already been to New York and San Fran but Vegas was number one... Absolutely loved it. From getting off the plane to getting back on it again I had the best time of my life. The Excalibur was perfect for me and my friends cause it was so so reasonable and we didn't have loads of money to splash around but I must say it was excellent. On the first day we visited the Spa which was beautiful and you felt more like you were in some far off exotic island rather that right in the middle of the hussle and bustle of Las Vegas. That showed me you really could have any kind of holiday you wanted here. Our room was large and clean. Nothing spectacular but you just have to look out the window and you get all that. I loved the poker in our hotel. At first I was nervous thinking at would be really serious but it wasn't. Well I'm sure you could find a serious game but not if you weren't up for it. The free drink was great,.....I know your thinking how irish am I.... but it was nice to be waited on while you sat around playing cards... Also the choice of food was great, anything you want basically at any time... Loved that! I can't even begin to explain it all but i'm trying to. What I really loved about our hotel is that it was right next to New York New York which is such a cool place with the best Pub i'v ever been to " The Times Square Bar " Best live music you could imagine. I'll sum up really with this, No one can tell you about how amazing Las Vegas is, you have to go there and see it all for your self. Otherwise your missing out big Time. Booking to go back next March for Paddys Day. Simply Can't wait........ Vegas BABY!!!

Reviews.Title: “go anywhere but here!!!”
Reviews.Author: kseskie
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay thru the hotel itself. Yes, the price was "cheaper" than some hotels but as they say, you get what you pay for!. Our room didnt look like the floors had been vacuumed, and the "view" was primarily the airport unless I leaned against wall to see up strip. When I pay extra for a "view room" I expect to see the strip as advertised. We were never once asked how our stay was. We ordered room service twice as our feet were dead from the walking. Food was great, service was great...delivery was slow. Dont expect to see your food for at least an hour after ordering. our first room service cart sat outside room for 16 hrs before being picked up. The second time it sat in the hall for 36 hours and I feel the only reason it was picked up was we complained to security that it was crazy and a health hazard that there were six food carts in the hall that had been there for almost 36 hours. Dont know if staff was afraid of the 13th floor or what...and yes they have a floor #13. Also would not recommend gambling there as the children underfoot are ridiculous. Also seems the staff is either rude or doesnt speak english well. If you are wanting your "free" drinks while gambling play the tables as the cocktail people will fly past the slots. Would recommend the Tournament of Kings it was about the only good thing there. I dont know what Royalty they are talking about when they say you will get treated royally. If any royalty got treated like us they wouldve thrown the whole lot in the dungeons and forgot about them. Our "king size" bed was closer to a queen and practically sat on the floor. The mattress was so bad we had springs in our back the whole time. And as for the players club, dont bother unless you have a "real credit card", Since we used our Visa "debit" we were on cash only basis and the players club didnt get us comps. Also TV was fuzzy, and the high speed internet they advertise costs 10.99 a day and doesnt even work half the time and no refunds on if it doesnt work. Oh yeah, our bathroom sink didnt drain and light bulbs were burned out on table lamps. Took two calls and 16 hours to get those fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Decent night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: Tripletmom96
Reviews.Content: We paid $66 for our one night stay at this hotel. For that price, we weren't expecting much. We flew into Vegas for a family vacation in southern Utah/northern Arizona and were just trying to get a decent night's sleep before heading out of Vegas. The beds at this hotel were exceptionally comfortable, the rooms seemed clean enough, although our midnight arrival didn't allow for a very thorough inspection! We left at 9:00am and felt like we got a good night's sleep. We had chosen the Excalibur because it was listed in Frommer's as one of the kid-friendly hotels (in a city that is absolutely NOT for children in any way, shape, or form). Other than a few posters advertising the male revue show "Thunder from Down Under" which were pretty innocuous, there was nothing that would be inappropriate for children. For the money, it was not a bad place to rest up for our vacation elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Had a really good time at the Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: MerryEngland
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed for five nights at the Excalibur in May 2007, The rooms were clean and we had very good maid service every day. The in room safe facility was very useful. We stayed in Tower 2 on the 17th Floor with excellent view of the Strip and mountains. We had a slight hiccup with the air condo and the toilet in the bathroom immediately we arrived but following a phone call to housekeeping this was resolved within half an hour of our arrival in the room. The rates were very reasonable and we found the hotel facilities very good. The Sherwood Forest Cafe served 24 hour food and we ate breakfast there most mornings and could not fault the food or service. We ate there very late one evening and that was also excellent. The only restaurant that we did not enjoy was the Sir Galahad, the food was very good but the service was a little too overpowering we did not need four servers for four people. We used the Casino quite a lot and did reasonably well with our gambling. The overall experience was first class.

Reviews.Title: “Great Wedding Chapel.... so so hotel”
Reviews.Author: RobertsMom
Reviews.Content: We were married at the chapel in the hotel and that was a wonderful experience. The chapel was lovely and the wedding service was better than we expected. There was nothing "Las Vegas like" about the chapel. The hotel on the other hand left a lot to be desired. Whenever we ask staff members any questions, we would time and again get incorrect information. They just seemed uncaring or overwhelmed by the crowds. The rooms were digny looking - very dark furnishings. Seemed dated and not in a good way. Highlights. The YARD LONG margaritas - for obvious reasons I can't remember if we had them in this hotel or next door at the Luxor. I do remember they were very good and very very big. Their steak restaurant was very nice, as was the food-court area. Loved the Krispy Kreme donuts - it was fun watching them go thru the sugar "waterfall". Overall - we won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Better places on the strip”
Reviews.Author: fink369
Reviews.Content: Our group arrived at about 2pm which was early for check-in however we had contacted the hotel ahead of time and had been told that our rooms would be ready by 11am. Well two of the rooms were ready...mine wasn't. I had reserved a Upgraded King room with a view. I was told that I could take a queen room instead but I stuck with my King room. They told me to come back in about an hour to an hour and a half. I didn't have a big problem waiting since we had the other two rooms, we just put our luggage in one of the rooms and began enjoying ourselves. At about 4pm I went back to registration and was told that the maid was still in the room. When I told the person at the front desk what I had previously been quoted he shrugged his shoulders and said he didn't know why anyone quoted a time as they had until 5pm to have the rooms ready (normal check-in time is 3pm). So we went back to one of the rooms that we did have that adjoined the room that I would be checking into. At no time during that hour did we ever see housekeeping anywhere in the vicinity. At 5pm I returned to registration and was finally allowed to check-in. Upon opening the door to the room I found out why they wouldn't let me check in. The room, which was supposed to be non-smoking, smelled of cigarette smoke. We opened the window as far as we could and opened the doors but even by the following day it still smelled horribly. I should have complained but I simply bought a bottle of Febreeze which took care of the smell (although it required several applications). The upgrades were a definite improvement over the old rooms. Even the hallways on the upgraded floors were given a facelift. All and all though we weren't in the rooms much anyway. For food and fun check out Dick's Last Resort. It just opened and is a fun experience. You won't be disapointed. Also the Spongebob 4-D ride was pretty cool too.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Las Vegas!!!”
Reviews.Author: patvikuk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in July. Loved it!! We upgraded to tower two with a strip view. And what a view!! Room was modern and stylish and big for us brits not used to big rooms! We read some bad reviews before we left and were quite worried. No need as the staff very helpful and courteous. The air con stopped working and rang reception and was fixed within half an hour! We came here to get married and my wedding gown and my daughters bridesmaids dress needed pressing. Took them to the bell service and we had them back in perfect condition within hours. Fanatastic!! Tried the buffet and it was ok, so went and tried MGM and the Luxor and they were awful. I would recommend the Sherwood Forest cafe here for breakfast as the service and food was exceptional. Got to go to "dicks last resort" here as it was so much fun and the food lovely but be prepared to spend a bit extra on the alcoholic drinks. But well worth it. Heard bad things about the timeshare people, but they do not hassle you as they do in Europe where they chase you down the street!! Just say no thanks and they leave you alone. Even though there is renovation at the pool we did not find it a problem and there are so many lifeguards we didnt worry about the our kids in the pool when we were relaxing. Dont forget to check out the "Cheesecake Factory" in Ceasers Palace. Excellent food and reasonably priced. A must is Mystere, Cirque De Soleil at TI, what a great show! If you have a chance go and take a helicopter flight over the Grand Canyon, it was amazing. We went with Maverick Tours and we could not fault them!! Amazing!! The heat is unreal at this time of year, however you do get used to it. We cant wait to go again and would definately stay at the Excalibur!! Rated as a three star but compared to european hotels this would be a four star through our own experiences. Overall a FAB holiday, wedding and honeymoon all rolled into one!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay here again!!!”
Reviews.Author: blueyedtraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for one night after a long 2 week road trip. We had booked a king nonsmoking with fridge in Tower 2. After a hot walk from the parking lot (lots of construction) to the front desk it was another long dark hike thru the maze of the casino to our room. No one at the desk asked if we needed assist with our bags. When we got to our room was a 2 queen room on the far end of the 26th floor. We had no fridge, no blow dryer (empty metal bracket on bathroom wall). Attempted to call front desk and got into a long phone queque listening to recordings about how to book a reservation. Tried to call bell hop again got same message. Finally hung up. Also, they require that you pay $1 a day for local phone service. Who uses hotel phones anymore with cell phones. Ate in the buffet twice nothing special. (Had meal credits as part of our package). We were constantly harrassed by high pressure sales to go to the hotel's timeshare presentation at every entrance. We stayed at the Tropicana just the previous week(same location on the strip) would probably stay there again. The hotel has seen better days but the level of customer service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Old and runned down”
Reviews.Author: abbagirl123
Reviews.Content: The room was depressing, old and dirty. I got a deal on the website, and I guess I got what I paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the money”
Reviews.Author: blondechick
Reviews.Content: We visit Vegas about 2 x a year and usually stay at Luxor. But this time we got really good deals from our Player Club Card to stay at Excalibur, plus we went with another couple. We tried to use the Kiosk check in, but it was only showing smoking rooms. I went to the front desk and asked for a non-smoking room. I know the casino themselves smell like smoke, but I do not want to sleep with that. The front desk upgraded our room for free to one of the remodel rooms in Tower 2. The room was decent and fit our needs. The other couple we went with decided to try out their smoking room in Tower 1. They were disgusted with their room - I was told it smelled like beer, urine and smoke. They called front desk asking for a non-smoking room that did smell like beer and urine. They were given a hard time at first, but then they were given an upgraded room in Tower 2 too. Make sure you get a room in Tower 2. These rooms are much nicer and do not smell. The casino itself is not bad... this is where you can play BJ for $ 5 a hand. Most of the time we stay at Luxor and play at Excalibur.

Reviews.Title: “Great buy for the money”
Reviews.Author: Bob2222
Reviews.Content: The Excalibur Hotel was part of an Expedia.com booking package -- I stayed there 3 nights. Having read other reviews in advance of my stay, I was prepared to pay up to $20 per day for a renovated room. To my surprise, the desk clerk gave me a free upgrade. So just ask for a renovated room in Tower 2. I had a view of the freeway and pool (pretty small from the 24th floor). The entire floor was non-smoking, so no evidence of tobacco was found in the hallways or the room. The carpets and furnishings actually LOOKED new. The room itself had 4 lamps plus an overhead light in the hall. The flat screen TV was fine (no High Definition, though) and I never used the wired Internet access ($11.95 /night). The room was spacious with two well-padded chairs, a table and a long narrow dresser desktop under the TV. The individual digital temperature and fan-controlled air conditioning unit will fill any specific requirements. The bathroom had plenty of extra towels, shower stall only (but quite large) and was well lit with included hair dryer, magnifying mirror and the three shampoo/conditioner/lotion liquids (small containers). Note that there is a 'mandatory' one dollar phone charge per day for local calls, even if you never make any. I mean, whom do you know in Vegas anyway? The charge doesn't even include '411' directory assistance calls. Why can't they just add it to the room rate? Such are the vagarities of Vegas. Excalibur has games and souvenirs for kids, and there were lots of them (kids and souvenirs). The place is big enough, however, that their presence was only felt while I was navigating around the casino floor. As mentioned by other reviewers, the timeshare salespeople were hovering around the front and side entrances but it's easy to ignore them or go in the back entrance. If someone says to you "Would you like a free show ticket?", run away very quickly. Security was non-existent in our wing for all 4 days. Across from our entrance, the other side was manned constantly. I have no idea what the reason was -- a manpower shortage? There was a definite tobacco smell in the casino and the entire first floor, since smoking is allowed in the casino. The table minimums are lower than most of the strip hotels ($10 vs. $15 for BJ and Craps). The Video Poker was a poor 7-5, but most of the strip had this; I saw no better payoffs in the 4 casinos I visited. I never ate there, but in addition to the ubiquitous buffet, there were lots of fast food restaurants as well as upscale ones. In general, I feel that this hotel, though dated, is a great buy for the money, especially if you can grab a renovated room. It's location on the Strip, anchoring one side of the NYNY, Tropicana and MGM intersection, plus trams to Luxor and Mandalay Bay make its location ideal for checking out the upper Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay there again”
Reviews.Author: diorCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Was not expecting a four star hotel stay- understand that this is a family/kid friendly less expensive hotel. But the staff was terrible; not friendly, not helpful with anything ( including problem with our room), actually rude at times. After driving for several hours to get to Vegas in time for a surprise party we checked into our room and the shower had no hot water. The maintenance guy that came to fix it broke the shower faucet, so he said we would have to get another room. The front desk did finally get us another room, but she was not helpful, did not apologize for the inconvenience, did not send up the new room key, and the maintenance guy and a security guy both left!! We were late for the dinner we went there for, most of our family had eaten by then. The hotel operater was rude, hung up on us when we called to get info on the salon. The maid ran over a relatives cell phone cord with the vacuum, they were supposed to send another cord up to the room- never did. When we went down at the end of the day to find out where to get one we were given the run around , a security guy was rude and irate to us (like it was our fault), and we finally had had enough and called a manager. She was actually very nice and apologetic, but could not compensate us anything on the room because we booked on vegas.com and not directly with the hotel !(something to keep in mind for future reference). Oh, and to top it off we were charged $5.00 ( $1.00 ea for 5 calls) for calls within the hotel!!! Bottom line- the rooms were what we expected but the staff was horrible.If you are on a budget look for a hotel with comparable rates.

Reviews.Title: “1st time Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: MsShell
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur (on the strip)- exceptional value for the money. Hotel interior, well, very medieval as the name implies. However, the rooms were great, simple elegant modern interior - nicely done, very clean and well attended, extremely comforable beds, wanted to take the mattress home! Hotel front desk needs some serious re-training - many seem to hate dealing with the public, particularly early am check-in clerks -of whom one was especially most unfriendly and unwelcoming , just what you'd want to deal with at 2am). If you keep your inter-action with them to a minimum, you will enjoy yourself. Great views of the Strip, could see Bellagio water show , MGM Grand, NY NY roller coaster from my window - it was terrific!

Reviews.Title: “What happens in Vegas Stays in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: celina12
Reviews.Content: how true is that saying! I surprised my husband with a trip to Vegas for his birthday, neither one of us had been there and we were pretty excited. The hotel itself wasn't great - it's old and smelly. We were constantly harrassed by hotel staff trying to get us to go visit their new hotel (can you say timeshare!). That was nothing - the icing on the cake was when my husband and I were returning to our room, to find a hotel staff person in our room alone with the door closed. We surprised him, the door was not propped open, there was no cleaning cart in front of our room - there was absolutely no reason for the guy to be in our room. After we made some calls the hotel sent up the housekeeping supervisor, we explained what happened and she agreed that there was no reason for him to be in our room. She agreed that the housekeeping manifest had been updated identifing that we were going to be checking out late. They sent a security guard up to take our statement as well as this man's statement. They were going to start an investigation. The guard told us that it was not right that this man was in our room and told us that we could get a copy or our statement at the security desk later that afternoon. Before checking out we stopped at the securiyt desk to pick up the report, well low and behond, there was not report. No one knew about it nor could they find our statement anywhere. We proceed to check out where we requested that the $25.00 late check out fee be waived as we spent a few hours tied up with this whole mess. The front desk manager was called and she now informs us that this man was a "house man" meaning we think - the person who goes and checks the room before the housekeeping staff go in a clean (funny because he was cleaning rooms when we left! - house man and housekeeper - who knows). She continues to tells us that he had every right to be in our room, that he had propped open the door but it had accidently closed behind him, leaving him in our room with the door locked behind him. There should never be anyone in your room with the door closed - not for any reason. I can't imagine what this guy was doing in our room and what might have happened had we not returned when we did. Anyway she agreed to waive $12.00 of the fee (big deal). We still never got a copy of the report. The whole thing got swept under the carpet - makes you wonder what else this hotel get away with. Pretty scary - We will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ugly room”
Reviews.Author: iamalexis
Reviews.Content: Spirit Air canceled our flight so they put us up at this hotel for the night. It was OK. The rooms are very ugly and dated. The shower preassure was great though. Would not stay there again because there are so many better choices.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: bounty19
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Excalibur from Apr 29-May 4 and didn't have any major complaints about it. I was slightly hesistant to book after reading some of the reviews but decided to judge it for myself. We upgraded to a newly remodeled room for $15/night extra and it was worth it. We got a room on the 18th floor of Tower 2 and there is not one negative thing I can say about the room. Everything was clean and comfortable. Now yes, the casino at the Excalibur was smoke heavy but alot of casinos in Vegas are that way. Plus when you go to Vegas you never stay in one casino anyway. I definitely would recommend this hotel for the price as long as you get a updated room.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: soccermom201111
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent a week at the Excalibur and will never stay there again. We paid $10 extra per room to get a view of the strip and all we could see was the airport. When we finally got to our rooms, they smelled very musty and there was hair in the shower (no bathtubs) and we also found hair in both of the beds. We called housekeeping and the supervisor came into the room and said that the sheets sometimes have hair stuck to them. I asked her if she would sleep in beds with someone elses hair in them. They moved us to a new set of rooms (we had 2 for our family) and there was also hair in those beds. My daughter called our travel agent back in Texas to see if we could be moved to another hotel but it would have cost us each approximately $400 per family to move and that was not feasible. We then demanded to talk to someone higher up and got the Assistant Manager of the hotel. Everything was going smoothly until she told me that she was afraid to put us in another room because we would probably find something wrong with that room too, she would just rather try and fix the problem. After all was said and done, we were moved to the "newly remodeled" rooms that faced the pool area. There was still some hair in the bathroom but by that time (we had been going through this for about 3 1/2 hours) I just got a washrag and washed the hair down the sink. I will never stay at the Excalibur again and that is what I told the Assistant Manager even after she moved us to the new room. I would rather pay a few extra dollars and sleep with only my hair in my bed.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here Your Stuff Will Be Stolen By The Maid!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sa3704va
Reviews.Content: It does not matter that you put the do not disturb sign on your door, the maid just barges in like she owns the place. When you leave your room and make sure the door is locked with the "do not disturb" placard haning on the outside door, the maid will enter and clean your room out including your personal possessions. What does the the Excaliber Staff do about it? NOTHING!!!!! You are just S.O.L. They do not care that your stuff is gone and your vacation ruined, just so long as you pay your bill, oh yes you are fully charged for suppling the made her new wardrobe!!!!! BY the way we did report the theft to the motel staff and they took a report and did say sorry. That is hard to chew on. S. Vaughn and D. Ball of Washington State (we stayed in room12204)

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaLaura
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms,nice staff. An enjoyable stay. Convient to all the in places to see.

Reviews.Title: “Watch the time share reps”
Reviews.Author: PARS1
Reviews.Content: spent 10 days at Excalibar as part of Airtours package from Manchester Good enough hotel very central, Sherwood Cafe is good value and a pleasant eatery .Biggest hassle were timeshare reps accosting you as soon as you checked in offering all sorts of freebies After an 11 hour flight and still with suitcases approaches were not welcome Throughout the holiday they accosted you every time you moved throughout the public hotel areas They were acting for a part of MGM/MIRAGE group who own the Excalibar By the way we had booked the Gold Coast hotel and found out of change at LV airport to later find out from fellow travellers that they had been told when phoning Airtours of the change to Excalibar 4 weeks earlier If you are booked to vegas with this company --worth checking for hotel changes to avoid a shock at airport on arrival

Reviews.Title: “Okay choice when you take the kids”
Reviews.Author: bunkylunk
Reviews.Content: Stayed in what was termed a "Recently Renovated" Tower Room. The renovation didn't amount to much beyond a new TV, furniture, carpet and lighting. The A/C unit is still the original thru wall type not usually seen in high-rise properties (thermostat sis not work well) and the bath was antiquated (I think they simply replaced the countertop). TV didn't work when we turned it on, maintenance arrived within thirty minutes and rewired it at the wall. Pool is still under construction as was the new Dick's restaurant just off the casino. Check-in was quick and efficient, maid service was okay and amenities such as Starbucks, a convenience store and arcade for the kids were handy. All in all, an okay choice if you are going to Vegas with the kids in tow and don't want to break the bank. Definitely spring for the renovated room as I would hate to see one that is still originally furnished!

Reviews.Title: “A very good deal”
Reviews.Author: skywards747
Reviews.Content: I was going to Las Vegas for a night on 14th June with my wife and son. I did lot of research to find a good deal on a hotel on the south strip. The best I could find was Excalibur's weekday rate of $71 with a $25 food credit and $30 casino credit. I booked room through the hotel web site on the morning of our arrival. Check in process was fast except for getting intercepted by the time share sellers between the entry door and the reception. I know those people have a job to do but it really is a nuisance. The lady who handled our checkin was very friendly and managed get us exactly what we wanted, a room with two queen beds on a higher floor with a (south) view. You need to pay more for north view rooms which have been upgraded. Since we checked in around 4 pm , the room was ready and it was big. While the room, corridors etc showed the signs of the hotel being bult in 1990, it wasn't too bad. The Amenities were better than adequate. We tried the round table buffet for dinner. It was average, have had better and have had worse in Vegas buffets. But since we used the food credit, it was pretty cheap for us. In summary, we enjoyed the stay without any major complaints and it was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Had A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Cubbie52
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Excalibur from June 11-15 with three other couples and nobody had any complaints. We stayed in Tower 2 and the rooms were nice and clean. Ate one night at Sir Galahad's and had a great prime rib (ask for Archie). Alot of complaints I noticed on trip advisor were regarding smoke and time share people, and we weren't bothered by either - but in fairness, we did not use the main entrance very often and you could see them around. We enjoyed the location as we could walk to the other casinos we wanted to see. Also enjoyed the pool area, but if I do have a complaint, it is that the deepest part of the pool is 3 1/2 feet, and they close it at 8:00 - but it still felt great getting into after a hot day of walking. All in all, I don't feel you can beat it for the price, and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay at the Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: tmteague
Reviews.Content: Do Not Stay at the Excalibur I have been to Vegas about 20 times and stayed at many different hotels. My stay at the Excalibur has been by far the worst. When first entering the Casino you are accosted by third party vendors to talk to them about a "free gift." This of course is your typical Vegas "free offer" you don't need to spend you time with, and one would expect to find in Vegas. However I would not expect a casino to allow this to take place inside their hotel, it's more annoying than a telemarketer, especially when you' have your hands full with bags trying to make it to your room. This however is minor but reflects the managements focus on customer service. When we arrived in the room I went to use the bathroom only to find first the shower door hanging off by a broken hinge and most disturbingly that the previous guests had clogged up the toilet with foulness which I will not begin to describe here. Of course this meant that housekeeping either did not clean the toilet, did not call to have it fixed, or had created the "mess" themselves. Suffice to say I felt inclined to use the casino bathrooms after the one in our room was not fixed three hours and two calls after arriving at the hotel. I finally made a third call three hours after the first then went out for the evening in the hopes that when I returned it would be fixed. When I arrived back exhausted 8 hours later at 5 in the morning I found the bathroom in the same condition I left it. Pissed off but to exhausted to do anything about it at that hour I went to sleep. When I woke up a couple hours later I called again. After waiting a little while and having a need for the bathroom I decided that since I had to go downstairs to use one anyway I might as well have a discussion with management. On my way out “engineering” finally showed up, said it would take a while to fix, and that it was on record that I had called. My discussion with the assistant manager consisted of her telling me that they only had a record of one call, and that they had gone to the wrong room, 5221 instead of 15221. She seemed to blame me for not staying in my room until they got there and fixed the problem even after three calls. Here was the end result after talking to the assistant manager and calling the manager with no response. 1. Paying about $80 dollars for the first night (1/2 off, who cares) for a room without a functioning bathroom. 2. Having to pack all our stuff up move to another room, without the view I had specifically paid extra for and paying full price for the second night. This was their solution. Do not stay at the Excalibur… ever. P.S. Because I received half off the first night this created an issue with the bill so instead of expedited check out using the simple in room or self serve kiosks I was forced to wait in lines during Sunday checkout times.

Reviews.Title: “some good, some bad”
Reviews.Author: ludicrous_speed
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur on June 16th 2007 and we were for the most part happy. The location is great and the room was nice. We were in one of the refurbished tower rooms. The nice decor, nice bed, 42" TV and modern bathroom were impressive. The two things I was not very impressed with was the $20 charge for a crib and the swarm of timeshare representitives in the entrys to the elevators to the rooms. I was surprised with the extra charge for the crib because they seem to market themselves to families. The timeshare people are a little annoying but you can live with it if you don't mind ignoring them.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location/Good Price”
Reviews.Author: chicken3
Reviews.Content: Quite an old hotel on the strip but you can't get a better location. Rooms are quiet spacious although decor needs a revamp. Excellent facilities within the hotel and staff are generally friendly. If booking online, watch out for hidden costs (they charged an extra $20 per night which we were not aware of). Also be cautious of the offer of a free show and cash for dinner or gambling in the lobby, you will be stuck for hours with pushy sales staff at a time share accommodation. If you decide to take up the offer grab casino dollars, convert them to chips and just cash in the chips the next day. This will give you money to spend elsewhere. Also take your own car if you have one or be prepared to take a cab home as they will try and keep you at the esablishment for over 3 hours.

Reviews.Title: “No Compaliants”
Reviews.Author: Ohmaid54
Reviews.Content: No problems, good honest accomodation, great value, say no more ! Just don't give the time share (Free Shows etc) dudes the time of day.

Reviews.Title: “Remodeled Rooms in Tower II”
Reviews.Author: ksreviewer
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Tower II on the 18th Floor overlooking the pool. The remodeled rooms are definitely nicer than the old rooms in Tower I. The pool area is open while they are working on the new pool area which is supposed to be open this summer. If heavy equipment noise bothers you, then you probably shouldn't pick this hotel as they start work very early in the morning. We didn't really mind the noise as it isn't any different from any other construction. The room was very clean and decorated nicely. New York New York, MGM, Luxor, Mandalay Bay and Monte Carlo are all within easy walking distance. If renting a car, I would definitely recommend the valet parking rather than walking to your car as the close parking spots are always taken and it is quite a jaunt to the parking garage behind the hotel. This hotel had the best price for a hotel located on the strip and for the quality of room we had.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: PGBakes
Reviews.Content: First thing to say is that this hotel has a great location on the strip, with easy access to the majority of other hotels. Be careful when booking a stay in Vegas as this is not the case for all hotels / casinos. Upon arrival avoid the offers of free gifts, tickets to shows etc unless you actually are interested in spending half a day viewing a timeshare property to get $50 dollars off of something you may or may not want. (they'll keep asking throughout your holiday which is a little annoying) Check in was pretty straightforward, though our booking for a view room couldn't be met as they were all taken. Strangely we were then immediately offered an upgrade to a view room. Hmmm - as we got charged the original amount in the end it didn't matter too much but felt like a bit of a scam at the time. Room was lovely, with spacious and comfortable bed, excellent bathroom, good facilities, 32" widescreen tv, safe (no charge) and view of south end of the strip. Room serviced daily to a very high standard with anything you'd touched being replaced. Hotels amenities were good with restaurants, shops, coffee bars. Casino itself was massive and open 24 hours. Security to the accomodation blocks, though this never meant you were delayed. Dedicated lifts to the higher floors were a plus. Overall, whilst if we returned to Vegas we'd probably stay elsewhere simply to experience something different, we would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur's bad rap...”
Reviews.Author: T-dott
Reviews.Content: Stayed from the 17th-21st of May If you have read the previous reviews by people who are nitpicking all the negative aspects of this hotel please read on. It is smokey (this is a casino), a little outdated (this is a castle) and doesn’t carry the same ambience as Mandalay Bay or the Venetian (rooms are not $1100 per night). This being said, for people who are trying spend their money elsewhere other than on their room (which we spent time in to shower, sleep for a few, dress, drink and get out) this place will accommodate you to the fullest. We stayed in Tower II section of the hotel, and from what I was told, they were superior to that of the first tower. Our rooms were clean, staff was courteous and accommodating and the flat screen TV was great watching the NBA playoffs. After reading the reviews on trip advisor we were initially weary and went in expecting the worse. When I opened the door to the room, I was pleasantly surprised. I can say that there was a sigh of relief because I am used to staying in rated hotels whenever I travel on business or with my girl, and the Tower II rooms did not fail me. My party members were all in their mid to late 20’s, so we spent all day walking the strip, talking to people and checking other hotels and casinos. It’s situated in a great spot and the 5* hotels and restaurants are a hop, skip and a jump away. If for whatever reason you have a problem walking due to illness, age, weight or just plain laziness, there are cabs everywhere and they are ready to take you to your destination. Negative Points: -People bring their kids (what kind of gambling degenerate brings their kids to a smokey, gambling drug infested orgy?) Vegas strip is for grown folks only! (For now) -Mostly fatty fast food in the hotel. The Italian restaurant wasn’t bad. (Never really ate at the Excalibur during my stay) -Apples and Bananas are $2 each…EACH! Couldn’t find fresh fruit anywhere… -The check in line is a good 20min+ wait almost at all times. Not cool after flying for four hours on no sleep. -Watch the doormen. They get kickbacks on referring you to clubs and most tourists are not in the know. They will send you somewhere “hot” because they are being paid to do so. Talk to people; on the blocks and in the bars to find out what’s hot for nightlife. Positive: -$$$ -Location and its proximity to other hotels -Clean spacious room & washrooms -Staff is friendly -Timeshare people don’t bother you unless you are over 40 -Show ticket sellers don’t bother you unless you’re with your spouse or significant other -$$$, again! My friends and I ended up spending $$$$$$ on this short trip. We ended up spending 80% of our time on the go, in the club and hugging the blocks.

Reviews.Title: “IMPLODE.....”
Reviews.Author: maltipoo
Reviews.Content: I had to stay there through a work related event.....The place is an absolute dump, trash overflowing, cigarette butts on the floor, never saw any one in the hotel ever cleaning or picking up messes. The glass doors to the entrance were filthy, the pool is nasty. They should consider imploding the place and starting anew. Moved to the Mandalay (heaven) of course you can't even put the two hotels in the same paragraph, it wouldn't be fair to the Mandalay. No matter how inexpensive the rooms may be or at a great rate it certainly isn't worth it at any expense.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: ElleBee77
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from our first trip to America which included Las Vegas. We stayed at the Excaliber Hotel and had a really nice standard room. The food in the restaurants was really good, but there is a food court where you can buy the usual take a way food. We caught the local bus easily as we were at the top of the strip, some people who tried to get on further up found the bus was full by then. The trip to the free Freemont Experience was quite long, over an hour, and I would recommend a taxi for this journey. We took a trip to the Grand Canyon whilst we were there, and that was well worth it. We booked before hand but you can arrange these trips while you are there. Every where they are trying to sell you half price shows. My husband did manage to get out of them in the end, that the condition of one of these concessions is that you take two hours out of your day to go into the desert to view a time share, so be aware. We didn't use the pool at the Excaliber, which is under construction, as it was really hot while we were there and there didn't appear to be anywhere under shade to sit. I would recommend this hotel to any of my friends or family, but there weren't many children there at this time.

Reviews.Title: “What a deal!”
Reviews.Author: Shortypots
Reviews.Content: Well, we stayed at the Excalibur on Memorial Day weekend this year, and I have to say I was pleasantly surprised. In Dec 05 we stayed at the NY NY hotel, and determined that the rooms were pretty small unless you got one of the corner rooms, or player rooms which we eventually got upgraded to. Considering we only paid a little additional for the View of the Strip rooms (without the 42" plasma screens) I thought the room at the Excalibur was nice. Considering how little time you really spend in the room, I thought this room was reasonably priced. The theming is pretty good too, they really keep with the Medieval theme. The Sherwood Forest Cafe is their 24 hr cafe and it had the best Baked Potato soup I think I have ever had. Food was good, but the service was horrible. Prices weren't that bad either considering you were in Vegas. We ate their twice. We also tried Regale's italian eatery and were pleasantly surprised there too. We tried their family meal deal which is $19.95 pp and includes Fried Mozzerella for an app, a salad, the entree was a combo of manicotti, chicken parmesan, and sausage, then dessert was tiramisu. Food was really good and Adam, our server, was a hoot! Would definitely eat there again. All in all, I thought the location, being close to the MGM and the monorail, made it very easy to get around Vegas in general, and the value of the size of room to what you pay is pretty good. I would definitely stay there again. Thought the casino could use a little work, but it appeared they used a lot of space for the Carnival type atmosphere that was downstairs, I guess either way you are spending money! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: iluvdisney
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Vegas on Sunday May 27 and we were there celebrating our 1 year wedding anniversary. We choose the Excalibur because of the value and location on the strip. This was my first trip to Vegas but my husband had been before and had actually stayed at the Excalibur before. He had told me the rooms were dark and kind of like a comfort inn but we figured we would rather spend less on a room and more money for gambling. With that said on with the review...... We arrived at the hotel around 2pm and the checkin line was pretty long but it moved rather quickly. I had booked a view room through their website. When we got up to the counter my husband told the girl it was our anniversary and asked if we could be upgraded to one of the new widescreen rooms. She said she was able to do that but didnt have one with a strip view. We said we would take it anyway. She gave us our keys and we were on our way. Went up to the room which was in tower 2 and was pleasantly suprised at how nice it looked. My husband couldnt believe it was the same hotel. Our view looked down into the pool which was nice and we had a nice view of the mountains. The bed was firm, but comfy. The pillows were very "mushy" and we needed to call housekeeping for extras. The a/c worked very well keeping the room nice and cool. The bathroom was nice and roomy and had a shower but no tub. The flat screen tv was nice but it didnt have too many channels to choose from. We didnt have any problems with any outside noise. We ate at the food court the first day, my husband had Pizza Hut and I had Quiznos. We also had Coldstone Ice Cream one night for dessert. Everything was good with those, a little expensive but hey your in Vegas right!!! We also ate at Sherwood Forest Cafe one night when it was really late. They are open 24 hours which was very convienent. The food was good, not great but ediable. I had a reuben and husband had a Philly Cheesesteak. The slots werent very loose here so I didnt have too much luck with those. My husband played poker one of the days and he did ok. He said he liked the poker better at the Luxor. We checked out on Friday using the inroom checkout. Checkout is usually at 11am but we called down and they let us checkout at noon. The taxi line out front was long at times but moved quickly both times we needed one. Also there is a tram that connects to the Luxor which is the next casino over and also Mandalay Bay which helps with some of the walking. We used it several times and found it very convienent. All in all I would stay at the Excalibur again. I would like to try some of the other hotels just to see what they were like but for the value Excalibur worked great for us.

Reviews.Title: “2 hotels in 1”
Reviews.Author: wlarryw
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at Excalibur and ended up staying for a few days in both their Tower 1 and Tower 2. Comparing the 2 rooms/towers, it was basically staying at 2 separate properties. Saying that they need to get Tower 1 refurbished is a huge understatement. My Tower 2 room was nice, but not 5 star. It was well renovated with new furnishings including: carpets, marble/granite bathroom counter, curtains, wall decor, bedspread, pillows, lighting, widescreen TV, furniture. It looked and felt new, and clean, and that was pleasing. The look is 'similar' to the 'modern' look of, for example, THE Hotel at Mandalay. It's definitely not that level, but it is going that direction if that is the look they're trying for. I got improved sundries in the Tower 2 room versus basic small bars of soap in the Tower 1 room. The Tower 2 decor was a clear move away from the 'Medieval' theme that is prevalent in Tower 1. I think if Tower 1 was not so dilapidated, and the Medieval theme a bit more tasteful than schlocky, the Medieval theme would have been fun. There was always security checking for room keys from anyone entering Tower 2. On many occasions, no security was present checking for room keys at the entrance to Tower 1. Read into that what you want. The Excalibur is located on a great corner on the Strip, close (realistic walking distance) to other major Vegas resorts like the MGM Grand, NY-NY, Luxor, etc. Just because you can see something on the horizon, doesn't mean you should claim it's within walking distance. There was a convention or 2 in town that week, and it's unbelievable what rates were being charged for the Tower 1 room (almost $300). At that price the Tower 1 room is a very bad value. Given my unscientific experience of other Vegas rooms on the Strip over the last 2 years, I wouldn't pay more than $50/night (weekday rate) for a Tower 1 room. The Tower 2 rooms were more of course, but were no bargain either during this period. I would stay again at Excalibur if I could get the refurbished room for a good price. Bottom line, great location on the Strip, but stay in Tower 2 only.

Reviews.Title: “Daughter's Wedding”
Reviews.Author: haleysnana328
Reviews.Content: Our Daughter was married May 24th in the Canterberry Chapel inside the Excalibur. The chapel was pretty, the wedding went well but even though we upgraded the most expensive package the kids were given one of the old spa rooms. It was dark, very dirty and out dated. All the lamps needed new light blubs. We finally got them moved to one of the new widescreen rooms but it surely wasn't worth over $100.00 a night. The staff was rude and few could speak English. We will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty weak, given the price”
Reviews.Author: Runner0382
Reviews.Content: We just stayed two nights in an upgraded room ($20 gets you an almost complete redecoration, plus a plasma tv, and a nice bathroom) over the holiday weekend. Compared to its competition in Vegas (read: not 4stars), Excalibur is only okay. My problems: 1) Nice refurb but the A/C is extremely loud - no matter how nice the room is, it doesn't matter when you're waking up everytime the [----] A/C turns on. 2) Noise - noise from the pool comes right up Tower II (newly upgraded) as long as the facility is open. Come to find out, the quality of music at the pool was pretty bad - how about more speakers and less volume, guys. We were on the TOP FLOOR. 3) Plasma TV with FEW channels, POOR reception, and slow channel-changing times. 4) NO COFFEE? You have to be kidding me. Super 8 gives you coffee. Oh, that's right. 2 Starbucks and a bunch of coffee kiosks line the casino. Nickle and diming customers is NOT my idea of good service. We won't be staying here again. For the price, you can do better. Use Priceline or Hotwire. Positives: 1) McDonald's open late? 2) $5 BJ tables 3) Linkage to Mandalay Bay and Luxor 4) You get to stay in a castle. The above negatives were dealbreakers for us. Less granite in the bathroom and paying more attention to detail (the A/C issue, for example, or the uselessness of putting in massive TVs that don't even function well) would significantly improve the new tower. The Luxor's new refurb is heads and shoulders above Excalibur's. Stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Underdog_TN
Reviews.Content: Room was o.k., but the bed looked like the maid was in a hurry and didn't quite finish making it up. Sheets seemed clean, however, but were not tucked in properly. Huge wide-screen tv, large bathroom with a shower. Internet is $11 a day and they tack on a $1/ day phone charge even if you don't want to use their phone. They have a food court with a McDonald's and a Krispy Kreme among others. Not the Venetian, but not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!!”
Reviews.Author: Apollocanada
Reviews.Content: Had read lots of reviews on the Excalibur and had reservations about staying here,but it came with our package that included Anaheim and Princess cruise lines. We were pleasantly surprised,room was older but clean and had a fun king Arthur type theme. Housekeeping did a great job with our room! Lost a fair bit in the casino slots here,but thats not reflective on the polite staff.and decent food in the restaurants.Sadly,we were hounded throughout our tenure in Vegas by the Timeshare lizards that appeared on every block ,and in what seemed like every hotel lobby. They are WAY too aggresive,in fact beyond annoying. Food was great,so was the Neil Diamond impersonator we saw at the Riviera.Its a shame Vegas allows these high pressure timeshare pichmen that come across as aggresive overbearing panhandlers to annoy their tourists relentlessly.

Reviews.Title: “Short on style but affordable”
Reviews.Author: Satine
Reviews.Content: Excalibur, for the most part, is the perfect hotel if you plan on spending most of your vacation outside of the room. The first thing I noticed when I walked into the casino was the smoke. Being from New Jersey, where smoking is banned practically everywhere, this was an unpleasant surprise. (The reason I bring this up is that the newer hotels must have better ventilation systems because the smoke is not as prominent.) The second thing I noticed was the dated decor. If that's something that you think is very important, you'd be better off at Paris or Bellagio. Fortunately the smell did not permeate my non-smoking floor and I wasn't upset with the '70s vibe. I stayed in a no-frills room with a shower stall in Tower 1. I did have a nice view of Luxor's pyramid and Mandalay Bay. My friends were in Tower 2 and their room was refurbished with a flat-screen HD TV, granite countertop, new bed/linen and a crisper, more updated look. My understanding was the updated room cost $20 extra per night. Since I stayed 5 nights and wasn't in my room all that much, I stuck with the cheaper accommodations. Excalibur is definitely cheaper than many of the other hotels on the strip. However, its location isn't ideal. It's at the beginning of the strip, and most of the action is more in the middle - closer to Paris, Bellagio, Venetian, Mirage, etc. The hotels are next to one another, but it's a very, very long walk, especially if you poke around inside each hotel, too. Vegas does have a tram service that runs between certain hotels, but I never saw many people using it. Taxi drivers, on the other hand, make out like bandits. The average cost for a one-way ride from Excalibur to Paris, etc., was $6-$8. A trip out to the Hilton, where the Star Trek Experience is located, cost us about $13. My advice? Bring plenty of $$$ for taxis because you're going to need it!

Reviews.Title: “speedy service (Ellie K.)”
Reviews.Author: adventurous4ever
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week (May 13 to May 19) The room was clean and we also had a very nice view of the stripe. They offer a very friendly and speedy service both the housekeeping and the check out staff. It is also ideal to stay at this hotel if you are travelling with kids since it has an arcade room with plenty of activities for the little ones.

Reviews.Title: “This Place Was Great, And The Staff Was Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: cancun2005wv
Reviews.Content: I checked in April 30th, and check out on May 5th, the day of the big boxing match... I must say, I LOVED THE EXCALIBUR!!! I booked our package from an airline company for air/hotel both... Wonderful time in Vegas. The hotel was great in all aspects. I believe I had the most wonderful bed you could have inside a hotel.. Other than my own bed, this was the most comfortable bed I have yet to sleep on in my life.. The buffet was great, along with the staff. I did find it VERY HARD to hit on the machines though.. Didn't win a cent... I wasn't expecting to become a big winner though.. We saw Some Thunder From Down Under while at out hotel too, and it was amazing.. Loved it, and would recommed it along with this hotel for anyone.. Well, I wouldn't recommend the men to go watch the show lol... I only went in a few of the hotels, but took pictures of many of them... I went inside of The Luxor, The Mandalay Bay, New York, New York, MGM Grand, & The Tropicana.. MGM was an experience, but I loved The Mandalay Bay, and Ny, Ny.... I hope i've been of some help by posting this trip report. Please don't pay attention to these bad reviews.. They must have just lost really, really bad.. I did the same, but I still enjoyed my Vegas Experience.. This was my first, but not my last trip to Las Vegas... The Duece Buses are the Best.. They are big double decker buses, and you'll see bus stops around the hotels.. Only $5 bucks for a 24 hour pass.. The Excalibur is the bus on the South Side of the stip, along with all hotels on that same side.. The other side is the North Strip Bus, and they also have a Fremont St. Bus too... Well worth the money.. You go to the bus stop, and pay when you board the bus... I didn't get to see the Fountains or Volcoano do to VERY HIGH WINDS.. We were in Tower 1 on the 13th floor with a view of MGM Grand & Tropicana Hotels... When you go to the elevators to Tower 1, the elevators on the left go up to the 18th floor, and the elevators on the right go from 18th floor and up.. I figured i'd post this, cause I took the wrong elevator lol.. Free drinks in the Casino... If you plan on tipping, which I usually do, I wouldn't recommend tipping for a soda.. They are all ice with very little pop.. Water comes in small bottles, beer in regular bottles, and mixed drink in small glasses.. All of those are worth tipping, but not the soda in a glass... Inside the hotel, up on second level is the buffet place, thunder down under, several food chain resturants including mcdonalds, shops, etc.. Also, on this level, they have a walkway with rolling sidewalks to The Luxor... From this hotel, they also have a FREE TRAM SERVICE.. You can take this to The Luxor & Mandalay Bay.. Over across the streee at MGM Grand, you can purchase monrail passes, but I find the bus much better, and much cheaper!!! Enjoy The Excalibur, because I sure did... We booked the Grand Canyon tour, and it was awesome.. A must do for anyone... It is called The Grand Canyon South Rim Tour.. It only cost us $72 bucks each.. All in all, I LOVED VEGAS & THE EXCALIBUR, AND I WILL BE BACK!!! P.S. Construction is going on at the pool area. No biggie.. The pool was open, and felt great...

Reviews.Title: “Better then I expected”
Reviews.Author: mymisfit
Reviews.Content: Stayed from May 8th - 11th 2007. Was there for work, my plane came in at 8:00a.m., no way the room would be ready that early, but checked any way. They told me they could not check me in just yet, but to check back at 11:oo a.m. Went back at 11 and my room was ready. The staff was very nice, and all seemed to be smiling and having a good day. I had an upgraded room in tower two, we were on the 22nd. floor. The room was all new. It had new carpet, new queen size beds, new flat screen t.v., new dresser, new everything. We had a view of the strip (nyny and mgm) We even had a safe in the room. This room was well worth the small amount it cost to upgrade. Never wanted to stay in this hotel before, just didn't like the looks of it. But boy was I wrong. It really turned out to be a great place to stay. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: wsjester
Reviews.Content: I was working on the military base just a few miles from Las Vegas and needed a hotel. Neither my wife or I had seen Las Vegas so we decided we wanted to stay at a hotel downtown. I chose this hotel because it is located right on the strip and seemed to get decent reviews. Also important, in a week when lodging prices were very high it was a reasonable price ($100 avg over 5 nights). I am told their are two towers one just renovated which is very nice. I stayed in one of the older rooms and there was nothing spectacular about it at all. It contained old, towels, bed, and furniture. It was clean but dark and dingy (really adding to the whole castle feel!). The pool looked like it was under construction, but it was small and nothing worth writing home about. I am told the gym facilities are very expensive something like $50-$60 a day. On the positive side, I had no trouble checking in and the service was good. It is a prime location, right in between the NY NY, MGM Grand and Luxor. If you want a cheap room right on the strip this is the place for you. Save money sleeping here and then eat and play elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: gill501
Reviews.Content: Booked through our local travel agent with Airtours we got an excellent price on our 10 night stay and the flight from UK. After staying at the Luxor last year and reading some negative reviews on here I was a bit dubious about our stay here but we coulndn't pass up such a good offer. Before we arrived in Vegas I actually emailed Excal and enquired about an upgrade to our room, the lady who emailed me and corresponded with me was most helpful and courteous. We upgraded to a Widescreen View room for an extra $35 per night. Arrived by taxi to Excal on April 25th around 3pm, we didn't bother checking our luggage with the bellboys as we only had 1 case each and I knew it would take a while for us to receive it in the room. The check in line was short and moved fast. The woman who checked us in was quiet but polite and confirmed with us that we had requested an upgraded room (good start). we were allocated Tower 2 22nd floor, room 31. Made our way through the casino to the lifts, getting accosted by timeshare touts on the way! (We had experienced them in 2006 so we knew to wave them off immediately) This was to be the first of many attempts of these people to try and get us "free show tickets". Three or four times a day we would have to pass them by to get to our room and they were a bit of a pain! Room was lovely, glad we upgraded. View of NY NY, side on to MGM and some of the strip. Huge shower in bathroom and nice large marble dresser area around the sink. Hairdryer was ok, not great (allow extra time girls for drying your hair!) Iron and ironing board and fair size wardrobe. Loads of drawer space and safe in cupboard. 40" Philips lcd television mounted on wall. Huge kingsize bed (I say huge because in the UK a kingsize bed is nowhere close to this big!) Very comfortable mattress and pillows, we slept like logs the whole stay. Air conditioning was good, bit noisy but we didn't use it during the night as it was cooler weather during our stay. Maid kept the room very clean the whole time with fresh towels and bedding every day. We never saw any problems with room service trolleys being left in the hallways, although there were sometimes dirty glasses left in the lifts all day. The only trouble we encountered was in the early hours of Saturday morning after the Mayweather fight about 5am screaming shouting and arguing in the hallway, knocking on our door, girls crying... this went on for about 30 mins, quite annoying but this could happen in any hotel I guess. We played a bit in Excal, just on slots though so not sure what dealers are like, all looked friendly enough and there was always lots of tables having fun at all times of the day, especially at craps. We won a $500 about 1 hour after arriving here on VP so were happy with that. We did not get a chance to try out the pool, I hear that the original pool is open while they renovate a new pool are close by so there could be some noise/construction. We tried the breakfast buffet 3 times, it is ok, we found it hard to find much that we liked. In the UK it's not normal to eat chinese sweet and sour chicken for breakfast! Or fried chicken and country gravy! (Still not sure what that it!) I like to eat Eggs Benedict when I am in USA but at the buffet it was always cold, not nice. Champagne brunch on Sunday was nice, there is a huge range of salad stuff as well as breakfast items and a carvery table.
