We ate also at Sir Galahad pub one evening, I ordered a salad to start which was lovely but huge and I could not finish, my boyfriend had prawn cocktail.. now this looked lovely but the sauce was very spicy, he thought it would be thousand island like we use in UK but it wasn't and he thought the prawns would be like king prawns but they were more like langoustines, pretty big and chewy. Main course I had salmon, was very nice, boyfriend had roast beef which was 3 huge fairly thick slices with yorkshire pudding etc, he could not finish it all, said the meat was delicious though. We saw 2 guys at the table nest to us getting served the prime rib or sirloins... they were massive, about 3 inches thick and about 5 inches long, glad we didn't order that, we would have had no chance!! Bartenders were friendly and always asked us if we wanted another when we were playing VP at the bar, of course we always tipped too. I like the Excal because of the short walk through to the Luxor and Mandalay and it's good transport links. Bus stop for Deuce across the road and Monorail just 15 mins away at MGM. As for the kids things... yes there was a few kids there, never had a problem with them though, I suppose it depends what time of year you go. I would definately reccommend this hotel to anyone of any age.

Reviews.Title: “Had a good stay”
Reviews.Author: MikeCPA
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Excalibur for 2 nights April 30th and May 1st. I have stayed at the Excalibur several times over the past ten years and the last stay was just as good as the previous stays. No, it's not the Bellagio or Caesars Palace, but in my opinion a great value for the price. I booked the room via their website. They offer specials a lot of times and that's what I did. I paid $61 per night which was for a strip view room. The offer also included $25 in dining credits and $25 in casino match play. I used all which made my stay an exceptional value. I got 2 free buffets which were quite adequate. The rooms are clean, comfortable, quiet and comparable to like a Holiday Inn. The property staff were all friendly and helpful. No complaints. The only bad thing was that the pool was closed for major renovations, so if you need a pool, call ahead to see if they are done yet. It looked like it might be awhile. This I think was about my tenth stay at the Excalibur. I like the property and the location. It's not luxury Las Vegas, if you're looking for that, you're going to have to pay more. For value, you can't beat the Excalibur.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: tonyej
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here 4 times before but not since 2004 and having read some reviews on here was wondering what it would be like now but have to say we had a great time here.Stayed in Tower 2,room was clean and tidy as normal,room service was quick and good,pool was good even though they are expanding,great new sports book and bar.Seems to be they are doing the whole place up.

Reviews.Title: “Plesently surprised”
Reviews.Author: peegee1
Reviews.Content: After some of the reveiws on this site I was a little worried about our stay (30th April - 3rd May) with my 2 Adult Daughter's. Got an online promo offer $71.00 per night stayed on 24th Floor tower 2 with a strip veiw. Room must have been recently renovated as we found it very clean, tidy and not dark and dingy as I had read in other posts. Very good size and Comfortable Beds, good size Bathroom with shower (VG preasure). Check in was fast and painless. Played Slots and Black Jack in Casino with good drink service etc. Tried the Buffett for Breakfast (Comped) but would not eat there again even if comped worst meal of my 3 week trip by far. Other than that a very enjoyable stay and would recommend this place, will be returning next year and unless I find a better promo offer will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best but it worked.”
Reviews.Author: SillyBlondeGirl
Reviews.Content: We didn't care for this Hotel as much as others we have stayed in. The first night the beds were terrible, you could feel the springs as you lay, so we got another room and the beds were pillow-top and much better. The pool was only 3 ft deep and Ice cold. Overall it was not the best but it worked once we got the 2nd room it was much better, I don't think we will go back to this one, I did hear that tower 2 had newer rooms though. The price was good and the location was great for us.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: inastance
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here one night, a Thursday, for $52, because the weekend rate was closer to $500 (Kentucky Derby, Motocross, and De La Hoya/Mayweather). Our good experience may have been due to the room upgrade we were given upon check-in. Didn't ask for it, but for some reason (probably because my girlfriend is ridiculously hot) we got a king bed with in-room jacuzzi. When I say in-room, I mean in the bedroom. The check-in line was long, and the check-out line was longer, but we just checked out in the room and dropped our keys, so we didn't have to deal with it. It seemed like a typical mid-range Vegas strip hotel to me. Somewhere between Bally's and Sahara I guess. I'm sure this place is hit-and-miss with the rooms. We were very happy with our stay though.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good First Experience”
Reviews.Author: Caress8989
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Las Vegas with 2 friends. We only stayed there for the weekend so we didn't have a lot of time to experience everything Vegas has to offer. One of my friends was playing tour guide since she had been there many times before. First of all the whole Las Vegas strip is amazing. Looking at pictures does not do it justice. The outside of the Excalibur Hotel was absolutely amazing, especially at night. When we walked in, or should I say rolled in, the scenery was beautiful. The casino was the first thing I noticed. There were quite a lot of people there at the time, so I bumped in to so many people. But being from New York, I was used to it. We checked in and went up to our room which was pretty standard. Nothing to write home about. There were 2 double beds of course since there were 3 of us. Now me being in Vegas for the first time, the first thing I checked out was the air conditioner. I was not pleased. It was not working and it had to be fixed. It kept shutting off in the middle of the night. The bathroom was good. No problems and it had plenty of space which I liked. There was lots of room to put our clothes away in the dressers. The beds were comfy and the view was great. I did not get to go into the pool or the spa. I loved the casino. The buffet was really good. I love food and for me, it was fantastic. The 24 hour restaurant was pretty good as well. I recommend both. There are also fast food places as well if you're in the mood for those. And they had a Cold Stone Creamery which I was soooooo excited about. If you haven't had it yet, I highly recommedn you go there. Lots of different places to take pictures to take home. All in all it was perfect for just a weekend. If we were staying In Las Vegas longer, I would have liked to stay in either a nicer room or a nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This place sucks!!!”
Reviews.Author: BodieCa
Reviews.Content: Me and a friend stayed at the Excalibur, they put us on the first floor,the hallway smelled like sewer, one of the walls had water damage, there was no coffee maker,we asked for another room, and was told there wasn't any available. And no one ever took away any of the room service carts in the hall for the 3 days we were there. The last day we were there we woke up to water dripping in the bathroom, it was a serious leak on the ceiling right above the shower and the carpet by the beds was soaked. We called maintenence, no one ever came. Told the front desk at check out and they acted like they could care less. We will never go back there. Oh yeah, and the buffet was terrible!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur Hotel & Casino”
Reviews.Author: LotsOPlaces
Reviews.Content: I just got back from staying four nights at Excalibur. I've been to Las Vegas a dozen times, but this was the first time I've stayed at Excalibur. I've always thought the Stratosphere was the best value on the strip, but the location of Excalibur is definitely better than Stratosphere. I booked my room through Southwest Vacations and the room rate averaged out to be around $127/night. This was for a Thursday, Friday, Saturday, and Sunday. I was very happy to find a decent place for that price. Check-in went smoothly. I arrived around 2pm and didn't have to wait in line at all. The desk agent, Soy, was very helpful in finding me a outer-facing room. The only one available was on the second floor. The view turned out to be not bad. My room faced the Luxor pyramid, but bright up-lighting outside kind of ruined the view at night. Oh well. My room was in tower 1, which is not the remodelled tower. But my room was spacious and very clean. The bed was comfortable and pillows were great. The only complaint about the room was that the air conditioner was VERY loud. And there was a lot of mechanical noise in general, but probably because I was on the second floor. The hallways always had some trash on the carpet, but no bad smells or anything too gross. The casino was actually pretty nice. If you haven't been to Excalibur in a while, it has gotten a lot better. There's still the castle theme everywhere, but they have made an effort to make it a little more classy. The casino was quite crowded over the weekend. Drink service was very good. Table limits start at $5/min. Plenty of slot choices. I did see a lot of people with kids, but mostly just passing through. I didn't eat at the Excalibur, but I did like that there were several Starbucks conveniently located around the place. There are coffee stands at the bottoms of the tower elevators, but if you don't want to wait 10-15 minutes just go up to the food court on the second floor and there's never any line at the Starbucks or Krispy Kreme. Staying at Excalibur will also save you a lot of taxi fare. You can easily walk to MGM Grand, Tropicana, Luxor, Mandalay Bay, New York New York, and I even walked to Bellagio, Caesars Palace, and Mirage one night. The Excalibur is not the best choice for a romantic getaway, but if you're going to Las Vegas for a few nights of fun then it's a great place to stay on the strip for cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: cmcatch22
Reviews.Content: I won a free trip to Las Vegas through a radio station but was only given a few options on where to stay. After reading through reviews for all of my options, I settled on the Excalibur. It didn't sound great but appeared to be the best option. I was a bit worried after reading some of the reviews but as I said, it appeared to be the best option. Fortunately, it turns out I had little to worry about. The lady at the check-in desk was quite nice and helpful. We stayed on the 23rd floor in Tower 1. The room was nice; plenty of room, comfortable beds, etc. The bathroom was very spacious however it is also the subject of my one complaint. The bathroom had an odor to it. It wasn't strong and it wasn't awful, just a strange smell. Also the towels smelled like smoke. Other than that the room was fine. No problems with the maid service. We didn't have any problems with noise from the hallways like some previous reviewers stated. The casino was a little smokey, but it's a casino. What do you expect? Also the time share folks weren't bad. After we told the first guy we weren't interested, they left us alone for the rest of the trip. We ate once at the Sherwood Cafe. It's similar to an IHOP or Waffle House. The food wasn't bad and the prices were reasonable. While there we saw a manager bending over backwards trying to satisfy a woman who it appeared just like to hear herself complain. He really seemed to go above and beyond what should've been necessary and never once got the slightest bit upset with this crazy woman. All in all it was a good experience and we'd definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Ordinary”
Reviews.Author: picoll
Reviews.Content: The hotel check in line was slow and crammed stunk of smoke from the nearby machines, carpark was confusing and a long distance from the check in then to rooms. The room had a good bed, Very ordinary bathroom noisy airconditioner and very aged and dated feel. I expected much better and was very dissapointed. The pool was at the other tower so you had to walk throught the gaming floor to get there which put you off going at all. Check in staff were really good. It is in a good location on the strip handy to everything. Would choose another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: iluvpugs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur from April 14-21 and had no complaints . Room was on a non smoking floor as requested and we overlooked the strip. Housekeeping does an excellent job. Staff were all extremely courteous and helpful with any questions we had. The only complaints I have - the casino is really smoky on the weekends, but if I chose to go there it's my fault...and I couldn't find a good cup of coffee anywhere except at IHOP!! (I don't like Starbucks). I will be back in October!!

Reviews.Title: “Not that great but not horrible”
Reviews.Author: drichey418
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on Trip Advisor, I was a unsure if I had made a mistake in booking my room at Excalibur; it was and wasn't a mistake for the following: The rooms in Tower 2 have been remodeled and are very clean and nice. I stayed in a non-smoking room on the 27th floor with a view of NYNY and MGM and part of the strip and the room itself didn't smell like smoke, but the rest of the hallway did (complete non-smoking floor). Otherwise is was a great room. The valet service was the WORST I have ever seen. Instead of the valet's TAKING cars out to park them and bringing up new cars, the valet's would go 2-3 to a car and then maybe see one come back with a car. Every valet in Vegas (and I've used NYNY, Paris, TI, Mirage, Cesaers, Tropicana and Stardust) run to get cars, not just stroll to the parking lot. This to me is a very bad point for the hotel. And finally, the casino itself is very smokey like everyone has said in their reviews. That's the only thing you DO smell walking through the place. I was sitting next to Starbucks and the Race Book area and couldn't smell the coffee at all. I know Excalibur is an older hotel, but so is Tropicana across the street and THAT hotel didn't smell like Excalibur.

Reviews.Title: “Ok visit to Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: buggins7
Reviews.Content: Room was usual US style with two large queen beds with plenty of space for our family of four. All clean and tidy as was all areas we visited in the property. Excalibur is certainly well located with a short ride to the airport and to visit the other strip hotels. Pricing was reasonable, buffet and restaurant (Sherwood Forest) were OK but certainly not spectacular. Watch out for the rip off addition of $1 for local calls added per day to your room bill with no apparant way to avoid it. If it's a standing cost it should be quoted up front ! We didn't play in the casino so no idea what this was like. The pool was supposedly open whilst we were there, although you'd only use it if you liked being surrounded by a building site. I'd check to see if this work has been finished before you go if that's what you're after. Overall, we would go back to this hotel as a reasonably balanced proposition.

Reviews.Title: “loved the excalibur”
Reviews.Author: jaimia
Reviews.Content: i only stayed for 3 nights,unfortunately, i wish it could have been longer, i stayed on the 24th floor,tower 2 overlooking the swimming pools, the view was fantastic, the room was spotless, staff very helpful, the buffet excellent, no waiting, the casino was clean, not full of smoke as i have previously seen mentioned,in fact, being a non smoker i was was amaized at the clean air conditioning, i will be back next year for longer, and i will be asking for the same floor and room, ...............bridget from worcestershire

Reviews.Title: “As Always, a Good Value on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: iagainsti
Reviews.Content: I fondly recall my first ever trip to Vegas when I was 20 (OK so I had a fake ID). We stayed at the Excalibur, which was, at the time, the newest thing in Vegas. I still remember eating at what was then called "Lance-a-lotta-pasta" on the second floor. (it's now called Regale) Of course, over the years, many newer and nicer places have come along and pushed the Excal down into the "solid middle of the road" category. Still, though, it's probably one of the best values on the strip. You can get a room during the week for 60-70 bucks. And that puts you right on the strip, within walking distance of NYNY, MGM, Luxor, Mandalay, etc. I just got back from a 3 night stay and see that in Tower II where I was staying there has been a complete facelinft. New carpet, paint, bathroom fixtures, even a widescreen plasma TV. If you want the best there's nothing wrong with splurging and going to the Venetian (I went there last year to see Phantom and it was awesome). But if you want a good value, the Excal can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for budget travel w/ good location”
Reviews.Author: woodside*girl
Reviews.Content: I just want to start by telling everyone that I was very skeptical about staying at this hotel for this vacation. What I saw on the internet was not impressive at all. Well the hotel is not overly impressive but very adequate and clean, the casino is very dated/worn and I thought extremely 'smokie' and we are non-smokers. But, once we had been there for a day or so things really worked out, the location is great and it is easy to access the monorail at MGM or go to Mand. Bay/Luxor area by monorail. We did a get a newly renovated room which was nice, new carpet, bedding, 42" plasma TV on the wall, furniture & nice granite in the large bathroom, it does only have a shower no tub. Perfect for us. The pool is open for use but is under construction. We did get to sit out a few days we were there. The new pool chairs are very uncomfortable to lay on, very hard!! The pool towels are shower towels but you can take 2 per person and that is enough to cover the chairs. It will be really nice once it is finished but was at least usable and the temperature was not bad in the water. The pool staff could work a little harder at keeping the pool cleaned out from the construction stuff, was really in need of good vacuum job, but that is a management issue. The moving walk-way was working during our stay, which was nice. If you get a chance do go down the strip to some of the newer hotels, they are extremely nice!! I thought the Wynn was beautiful with the multiple waterfalls. Hope this helps those of you that may be questioning your staying there. Feel free to contact me thru this site if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: SuitcasesRus
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Vegas and I found the Excalibur offered the best value located on the strip. We stayed for 5 nights and the room was clean and comfortable. For someone not spending much time in the hotel room, it does not matter how modern the furniture is, contrary to some who have commented on the dated decor. I don't think of a castle as being contemporary anyway, and I liked the mideival shaped mirror, chairs and wall hangings in the room because it related to the theme of the hotel. Everything in the room looked nice, the furnishings did not look worn, and everything worked fine. If you want something contemporary, look into a newer (and pricier) hotel. My only complaint is the time share people that try to snare you for their sales speil with the promise of free show or dinner tickets. They are in most of the other hotels as well. Keep Walking!!! You will do a lot of walking in Vegas and it is a good walk from the Excalibur over to the MGM to catch the Monorail by the time you get there and go through the entire MGM hotel to get to the station. Take your most comfortable walking shoes. I only tried the Breakfast Buffet at the Excalibur and it was good. because of the variety of choices. I had two meals in Sherwood's Cafe, and did not find the food there quite as good. The food court is another option if you do not want to spend a lot of time or money. Take a sweater to the restaurants, especially if you are dressed in summer attire, because they are very cold. I would stay in the Excalibur again and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay again!”
Reviews.Author: mjv111
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at the Excalibur. Once again, the hotel offers one of the best locations on the strip for the price. My son and I stayed four days in February. The room was clean. The check in and check out was speedy. I checked in online the day before and then used the kiosk to get my keys. Check out was on the TV and then I recieved my receipt in the mail. My only complaint was that parking was a little far based on the fact that we were lugging around equipment. When we return to Las Vegas we will be staying at the Excalibur again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: jimmyg21
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Excalibur on April 4th and 5th with 3 friends. We upgraded to the rooms in Tower 2 which were just remodeled for $20 per night per room. Worth the extra money since the rooms were very clean with all new furniture, bedding and flat screen TV's. I was somewhat concerned before I arrived because some of the reviews I read indicated that some rooms in the Excalibur are showing their age but the rooms in Tower 2 are in great shape. Didn't try any extra services like room service. We were all very happy with the accommodations. Enjoyed a nice dinner at Regale with great service. Food court was fine for a quick meal. Great casino with $5 limits on the Craps table most of the time. The dealers were friendlier than most of the other casinos that we played at. We all had a great time at the Excalibur! Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Reidy77
Reviews.Content: The Excalibur must be the best value hotel on the strip! Have stayed here twice, previously stayed at Ballys and Luxor but when you consider that Excalibur is on average at least $30 cheaper per night than other hotels in area and all you really do is sleep in your room, it's an easy choice to make! Superb location, large clean pool, good restaurants, not the best casino on the strip but you can use all other casinos anyway so thats not really an issue, rooms are clean and spacious if maybe in need of modernising!

Reviews.Title: “ugg......”
Reviews.Author: timeytell
Reviews.Content: From the outside its a pretty colored castle. Great for kids we assumed. We know that Las Vegas is trying to avoid "children" at all cost, but kids usually come with parents or visa versa. We used this as stop over to Hoover Dam and the Grand Canyon. Our toliet overflowed in a matter of minutes in our room. Though the staff was great about fixing the problem, and the front desk gave us a new room, the view was of the tram exit. Hundreds of people looking into our room every five minutes. We felt we should put on our own show and charge a fee. Well we could live with brown and dingy and casino noise. After all we were in Las Vegas. However a case of food poisining from the hotel buffet was the last straw. The front desk had us fill out a security report, and told us we would "hear from someone" in 5-7 days! Ok so we didn't want a 10 discount back to the buffet, but a little compensation would have been nice. The pool was closed, so we had to make the 10 minute trek to the Luxor pool, which was small and boring. Not a great visit, were done with las vegas and will mark it off our "been there, done that list", however if you want to go, put the excalbur on the "only if the motel 6 is booked" list.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Brilliant!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TonyWilliamsBelfast
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Las Vegas for the second time on the 25th of March this year and stayed for 7 nights. There were 4 of us sharing a quad room and upon check in we upgraded to a deluxe room for only $70 and this was well worth it. We found the rooms spacious and the shower room was a great size and enough space for 2 in the cubicle! The extra sitting area was a great bargain for only $70 and we had a nice view of the Tropicana and MGM and the monorail from our 6th floor room. It's location is superb, and although the pool was closed, I was reluctant to use the Luxors pool and so I went across the road to the adult pool at the Tropicana (with excalibur bathroom towels in tow) I stayed at the Trop last summer and really liked the pool( and you just walk into the pool with noone checking room keys! ) AVOID the Luxor pool at all costs - it's over crowded and it looks like a car park with sea of sun loungers.....chance your arm at the Tropicana. I will be returning to theExcalibur and all those negative comments on here about the Excalibur have no justification! Enjoy Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: limabean76
Reviews.Content: We didn't plan on making a family trip to Vegas. We were driving through and found out my in-laws were in town and decided to spend a day with them before we moved to Hawaii. I made the reservation on the phone from the middle of the desert in Utah, so needless to say I did not visit their website to research the property. Big Mistake. When I asked a friend to recommend a hotel our family with 2 younger children would enjoy she mentioned this one so I looked up the number and called. I was trying to ask the person on the reservation line about the room and facilities, but she was just interested in getting my credit card number. After we met with my in-laws we went downstairs to the arcade with the kids. Almost none of the games that needed a staff member were open. The games cost a fortune and did got give tickets to redeem for prizes. I asked an employee where the pool was and he told me which direction to go in. Along the way I asked another employee just to double check, she too pointed which way to go. It wasn't until I arrived at an empty concrete hole that I found out the pool was not in service. Needless to say the kids were not happy after the lack-luster trip to the arcade, a trip to the pool was just what they were waiting for. The next morning I expressed my unhappines with a staff member at the front desk. She pretty much told me I was lying about not being informed that the pool was being serviced. She went on and on about every member of the staff being aware of the situation. I was expecting some sort of appolgy or offer of a service, which never happend. She assured me she would speak to the person that made our reservation...but she didn't bother to ask my name or room number so I have a feeling that didn't happen. I asked for the service manager's name and number and called him. I explained the situation and he agreed to give me half off the first night stay. I was slightly satisfied. Our next problem occured at 3am. The fire alarm was blaring. So at 3am we dragged our 6 and 11 year old children out of bed and walked down 12 flights of stairs. As soon as we reached the bottom we were told, false alarm, go back to your rooms. I had never been happier the next morning to check out of a hotel. When I went to check out, what a surprise, the manager that I spoke with made no notation on our account about the half price for the first night. So we had to go through the whole process of getting someone to fix it. Never EVER go there if you can avoid it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, no problems”
Reviews.Author: Lori Jeannine
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews before our trip, I was worried. We had a nice time and did not experience any problems. Check in was fast and easy. (We arrived on a Thursday around 4:30) Clerk was friendly. We rented a car and used Valet the entire time. It's FREE, just tip whatever. The Valet guys were always nice and we never had to wait more than about 5 minutes to get our car. There were a few times the signs said "FULL" but being that we were STAYING at the Excalibur and not just using their FREE Valet so we could walk up and down the strip, I pulled up there anyway. We never had a problem with this. One thing I dislike very much is hidden charges. They are upfront with the fact that they charge $1 per day for local calls. (even if you don't use the phone) I asked for a View Room, we were put in Tower 1 and had a view of the MGM and partial of NY NY. The room was nice and clean. We used the Breakfast Buffet twice and it was good. Lots to choose from; eggs, bacon, biscuits and gravy, potatoes, pancakes and syrup, Mexican Buffet with tortillas, fajita meat, etc. They also have donuts, but we didn't see these until we were on our way out, as they are off in the corner. Drinks are plentiful. King Arthur's Tournament was ok. (we were on the front row) Food was bland and server was late on any Pepsi refills. the only thing I thought was really tasty was the pastry. Margarita was ok and I opted for the souvenir mug. We live about an hour from Dallas and have been to Medieval Times several times and it is MUCH better. Food, Service and Show. We were vacationing with our two boys ages 11 and 7 and they had fun. The game room was fun for them. (Dad took them while I went to play slots) I saw them on the way back and called them over to say hi, Within SECONDS, casino staff were there about to tell me they needed to leave, so they are very strict about no kids in the casino area. There are alot of kids, but mostly, they are just walking through. We were there for the Monster Truck Finals at Sam Boyd and had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Out of the cheapest hotels this is the one to stay at!”
Reviews.Author: MrsHReading
Reviews.Content: I was so worried about staying at Excalibur, it was our first time to Vegas and USA, complete with husband,kids aged 5 and 8 and my mum I really didnt know what to expect after reading some reveiws. However our stay was great. Check-in was fine, as requested we got two non-smoking rooms next to each other, the staff were great, the room was clean and shower was big enough for us all to fit in! The view was of a brick wall, but all we did was sleep and shower in room, as soon as you step out of hotel the view and location is perfect. It is at the end of the strip next to Mandalay Bay, Luxor, MGM and New York. The other end of strip is tatty, and thank god I didnt book Circus Circus as we first intended. Very shabby, dirty and clearly needs total revamp! We got around in Taxis and Monorail. To walk to mid strip (Bellagio ect) it takes around 20mins, which is fine as you can pop in to M & Ms world and take great pictures of the hotels as you walk past. Go to Paris for breakfast, it is the best, get there for 10am and you can also see the lunch, the food was absolutly amazing, if you go there first, all the other buffets will not seem as good! You do need to queue for the buffets but it is worth it, you will not need to eat anything else!! Also Bellagio for lunch buffet, again superb choice and quality. The kids loved, The Mirage dolphin and tiger sanctuary. We went to the Fab Four Beatles show at Aladdin..excellent!!! For shopping go to Premium Outlet, (Stratopshere end), the shoe shops are so cheap. It is worth the queue to Stratosphere tower, amazing views..scary rides on top! Go to top of Eiffel Tower at Paris at night to watch Bellagio fountains, beautiful! We went via Papillon to the Canyon, brilliant, excelllent staff, breath taking trip! We will be booking to go to Vegas next year, it was awesome!!!! We all walked miles, but the kids loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Showing its age but decent value”
Reviews.Author: billhelm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur in January 2007. This was our 6th trip to Las Vegas and our first stay at Excalibur. We generally stay at lower rent places on the strip. Our room was on the second floor of the south tower. It was clean when we first arrived and stayed clean throughout. The bathrooms are adequate, with a nice walk-in shower. The rooms are pretty basic if not a bit on the small side. We were not in our rooms much and did not really partake in any extra services while in the hotel. We did not play in the casino much, but it took our money when we did. Overall, the Excalibur provides good value and is in a great location on the strip. The property is showing its age and the rooms could use a general sprucing up - the decor is quite dark and themed in the same way as the property.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service leaves something to be desired....”
Reviews.Author: gmboilers1
Reviews.Content: If you want a quick summary, here it is.... We paid for an upgraded view and received a decent room with a great view, however, we had a small problem with the room that took over half our trip to get resolved, and the Excalibur staff were, overall, not pleasant to work with. The room was nice, not outstanding, the casino was pretty easy to navigate with a decent selection of games (missing some of our favorite), and the restaurants were average to slightly above average. Not our best, not our worst Las Vegas experience. If you want a little more details, here you go... We received an email offer from Excalibur that coincided with our annual trip to Las Vegas (I travel with a group from 4-12 people each year to a trade show, and I decide where we stay). Most in our group had not stayed at the Exclaibur, so I decided to stay there. I had an option to "upgrade" my view, so I did at a little more expense. We checked in without problem into Tower II, on a high floor. Our room was newly renovated, so everything was new. We had a nice sized flat-screen TV, the bathroom was decent, however it does not have a bathtub, only a shower. The bed was actually quite nice. However, our small window had a shade that was broken, making it impossible to look out the window. We immediately notified housekeeping and maintenance, receiving assurance that the problem would be quickly remedied. This turned out to be a much bigger problem than it should have been. It wasn't until the 3rd day (of our 4 night stay), that they finally fixed the problem. During that time, we made around 8 calls, and several trips to the front desk. With a few exceptions, we were treated as a nuisance, not a valued guest. Our only offer was to be moved to a (much) inferior room with no compensation. One desk person even claimed that we did not deserve a room with a view, despite the fact that I had paid more to be upgraded to a "view" room. We are not usually complainers, and will tolerate most things, but not being able to see the view in a room with a view bothered us. If you are a "I'm only sleeping in the room, who cares about the view" person, this won't make any sense to you, however, we really enjoy the view of Vegas and the surrounding hills, so it mattered to us. Being treated like pests was not something we were used to, and has left a bad taste in our mouth for the Excalibur. If you are still considering the Excalibur, we can give you this further information. -The buffet is a reasonable value. It is one of the lower price (not cheap) buffets, and gives decent value for the money, but it is not a "special" Las Vegas buffet. -The Italian restaurant in the hotel offered a very good meal, with disinterested service, the price was reasonable, the atmosphere was subdued and realxing. -The spa was in a renovation area, and was absolutely disappointing. However, the massage therapist was competent, and after the renovation, things may be quite a bit nicer. -The renovated rooms were nice. The rooms in Tower I (that we saw) were a little run-down, but not bad. Be aware, if you get a room without a view, it is really a bad view, like a concrete wall or other rooms. Conversely, some of the views (like ours of New York-New York, the strip and Red Rock Canyon off in the distance, compare favorably to some of the better views anywhere (we've seen) on the strip. -The casino is not the confusing mess that some of them are. The dealers at most tables were more friendly than many, particularly after we stayed at the tables for quite a while. Some even greeted us when we passed them the next day(s), which is nice. Of course, some of our group played all through the night, which probably helped. I personally like playing multi-hand video poker, and the Excalibur had the worst selection of these games of any casino have ever been in, I had to walk over to the Luxor to find a better selection. -Following up the last point, Excalibur is very convenient to Luxor (indoor walkways) and NY-NY (outdoor walkway over the street), plus MGM and Tropicana across the street. Therer is a shuttle (somewhere) to Mandalay Bay as well, although we never used it. we were pleased with the overall location of the hotel on the strip. -We had a room safe, our companions didn't, so check with the hotel if that is important to you. -Although we did not see the "Tournament of Kings" show this time, we have seen it on two previous trips. If you have seen "Cable Guy", then you know what to expect. We enjoyed ourselves both times (once with kids, once with another 2 couples), but the food is not really that good, and don't go thirsty because both times the server was gone for long periods of time, and they have a schedule to move you on out (I wanted another beer!). There are better shows, but this one is certainly different than the others. Overall, for the price we paid, Exclaibur was an excellent value. If their people were better at customer service, we would have rated it higher. I am in the customer service business, which means I not only know how customers should be treated, I also know how much I hate the "whiners" and people out to score "freebies" for every little problem. So we try extremely hard not to whine, and to treat everyone like friends. However, the Excalibur staff, for the most part, made us feel bad for bringing up our problems, and did almost nothing to make us feel better during the process. We were given the classic "run around", and they did everything they could to make us lose our cool (which we didn't). The cost to them is a dissatisfied guest who is not afraid to let others know how we feel. Final recommendation, there are better casinos and better hotels. After the way we were treated, I cannot recommend Excalibur, unless you are getting a great deal, or are being comped. I can't imagine taking my group back here with all of the other choices available.

Reviews.Title: “Right on the strip, but don't expect the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: Carline
Reviews.Content: The adage 'you get what you pay for here' applies here. But you do get a large room, you're right on the strip and the shower is great. And as you're in Vega you'll be out and about, so you don't really need much more. Avoid the buffet, its only good value if you have a huge appetite. The worst part to the hotel is the tacky gambling area. If you're looking for a stylish hotel then stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Same level as a Best Western”
Reviews.Author: danikarp
Reviews.Content: I was excited about the low rate I got for the hotel, but was not too happy when I arrived. I told the front desk it was my honeymoon, and she made no comment. The next question she asked was if I'd be needing two twin beds or one king. I guess she wasn't paying attention to my original statement. The room was equivelent of a Best Western. It looked decent from the outside, but inside, it was pretty ugly and was in need of a rennovation. I was offered a rennovated room, but they were going to charge me an extra $20 per night, so I declined. I asked the concierge to book me a specific restaurant, and she said, "There's a pay phone over there." Um, what? The service was terrible. Excalibur's casino was smoky and bleak. The only good thing about the hotel was it's location - right on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Excal is okay, you get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Nug
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Excalibur with some family, it's as good a place as any if travelling with children in Vegas. This town is not family friendly but then they don't really claim to be either. We had a good time at the hotel, the front desk staff was efficient. Our only one problem was a gross one, however, apparently whoever had our room before us had vomited in the sink and it had not been properly cleaned up. We didn't notice it on arrival but the next morning, we awoke to find someone elses days old vomit had backed up in our sink and in my sister's room next door. Needless to say it was disgusting. At least the hotel was speedy in rectifying the problem. If it had not been for this, this hotel would have been an exceptional value at $60 bucks a night.

Reviews.Title: “basic but great as a place to lay your weary head”
Reviews.Author: pinkypunkyprincess
Reviews.Content: i don't understand people complaining so much about this place. you get what you pay for. yes, its cheap and cheerful - just like the prices! my partner and i stayed here for a week last September and enjoyed it just fine, although i must admit that we didn't eat there (apart from getting coffee and donuts!) so i can't rate the restaurants. we just wanted a cheap place to stay, on the strip, and we got all we could ask for. the room was clean, the bed comfy, the bathroom well stocked and thoroughly cleaned every day by our friendly maids. if you're going to be out and about, eating and drinking at other places each night etc, then this place is just fine!!!

Reviews.Title: “not luxurious, but affordable, nice and fun”
Reviews.Author: gginny
Reviews.Content: The exterior of Excalibur is great. It is fun unique and great for taking pictures. The inside is not at all as impressive as the outside. The decor consists of just cheesy swords, sheilds, and dragons placed here and there. I wasn't that impressed. The hotel rooms are ok. Nothing special. They are pretty clean, a little dark. More lighting would be good. The bathrooms are a good size and clean. The casino is ok. NY NY and MGM casinos near by are better. The casino workers are friendly and helpful. The drink service is good. The service over all was very good. Stay away from the dessert/coffee stand it is expensive and not good. If you want to save money for breakfast and lunch. I recomend just going to the food court that is just a little bit down the strip from the hotel. It is located next to the M&M store.There are a good amont of resturaunts and shops in the hotel. Check in and check out was a breeze and the staff was very nice. If you are bringing kids on your trip I would say this would probably be a good hotel for them. Its disney like castle theme is fun and it seems to be the most child friendly of all the hotels we went in. If you can get a good deal, this hotel can be a great choice. It's far from luxerious, but it offers just about everything you need and the service makes up for a lot of the under par accomadations. I probably will go back sometime to this hotel.. but next time I am staying at another one

Reviews.Title: “The Medieval Dump”
Reviews.Author: TravelCuties
Reviews.Content: You'll live like a king, but in medieval times when they didn't bathe regularly and ate with their hands. This hotel made me feel absolutely filthy, but it has low limit table games (although not as low as downtown), a great location, and cheap room rates. If you're coming to Vegas to gamble and cruise the strip, stay here and save your money. You can take a walkway directlly to New York, New York and there is a tram to the Luxor (also a walkway) and Mandalay Bay. Do not waste your time on room service or the restaurants. There is a food court with McDonald's and some other shops that will save you money on a quick bite. Insist on a high floor - nothing below Floor 26 if you can swing it. Ask for a room facing the strip or the mountains - there are some fantastic views. If they try to put you on the first floor, the dungeon if you will, demand to move or you'll be subjected to security pages and all around noisiness. Enjoy and best of luck. Come on 22!

Reviews.Title: “Dark, Dingy, Dirty Dungeon - But it's Cheap!”
Reviews.Author: Royzee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights at a Conference. The Good points: $60 per night (w/o tax); Right on the Strip Smaller, easier to get around ( than MGM, or Caesar's)Casino Good Hot Water pressure in the Shower Great on-site service for business dinners/events The Bad points: Rooms are spartan and dingy. 2 of 6 lights in my room & alarm clock didn't work Dirt & dust on furniture, light fixtures, air conditoning/heat vents Poor quality toiletries Beds not even Red Roof Inn Quality Food at Buffets is not good Pool under repair You won't impress anyone by staying here; and you will spend some time in the room. Pay $40/night more ( that's about 1/2 hour of gambling) and stay someplace decent.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased with my stay”
Reviews.Author: PATerry-7
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Excalibur from 2-25 to 3-1-07. I can not understand how this hotel is often ripped in reviews. I will not claim all is perfect at this hotel but during my stay I found my room to be clean, security was not a concern and any staff I had contact with to be helpful. Yes, the hotel could use some updating,and like most casinos it is smokey and the time share salespersons can be bothersome. I selected this hotel due to room rates being much more reasonable than most other lodging and I was pleased for what I paid. I can afford to book other higher rated hotels and pay 2 to 3 times the room rates I paid here, but I choose to spend my money on entertainment not a room I spend little time in. If you are looking for luxury do not stay here. If you are looking for a secure place to sleep at reasonable rates in Vegas this should wok for you.

Reviews.Title: “The Very Greedy Castle”
Reviews.Author: LM50
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Excalibur for three days-not by choice. I was with a group of people who got this deal through AAA - although I wouldn't call it a deal. This was my first stay in this Las Vegas hotel and I will not be going back. Everything about this place screams of greed. The coffee shop charges outrageous prices for their breakfast items(I pity people who come here with children), the slots are way too tight and to add insult to injury, they tack on a $1.00 a day local phone call surcharge to your bill each day you stay there. Most people have cell phones - I think this is the ultimate rip off. We were in Tower I-the window in our room looked out at a wall - there are no hand rails in the shower stalls -guess they forgot about those when they decided not to put in bathtubs. Looks like an accident waiting to happen - wonder how many people have slipped and had nothing to hold on to. There was a bathroom rug in front of the shower and no tub mat to place over it. It was obvious that the rug was used over and over-not sanitary at all. At check-in I asked if there were any rooms available that had been remodeled and I was told that they would be an additional $25 a night. What a joke. A couple that was traveling with us (but stayed in Tower II )had to call security three times because the couple in the room next to them were fighting and bouncing off the walls and screaming at each other. The corporate honcho's that run these casino's better wise up. You can only take advantage of people who don't know any better and there are plenty of people who frequent Vegas more than once in their lifetime and they will soon get sick of your crap and your bottom line will show it. Word to the wise-if you have lots of money to blow and don't care about being ripped off, this is the place for you-

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as expected”
Reviews.Author: joepyeweed
Reviews.Content: I must say, from what I was hearing, I expected a lot worse. The room was clean, the staff friendly. The pool was under renovation so we got to use the Luxor's next door and never had any problems. Overall all I would say this hotel is fine, not great, just fine. However, the casino is a maze and it lacks the visual appeal or interest that the other hotels in Vegas have. I stayed here during the NBA All Star weekend...that's a whole other story.

Reviews.Title: “It's got one benefit”
Reviews.Author: blogginovertheworld
Reviews.Content: If you're going to Vegas, you spend very little time in your hotel. Other than crashing out for a few hours, it's pretty rare you'd stay for hours on end in your room. If you're going on a romantic getaway, or even if you're going with your partner, then you should probably pick another hotel. This place is a bit of a tip. It's dirty and messy, and the casino is sub par. From the outside, it looks cool, there's no doubt, I can see the appeal, but on the inside its a step down on the strip. The hallways were cluttered with old food carts that seemed to sit there for days, we had to switch rooms a couple of times due to faulty doors, and non working amenities. However, if you're going to go down with a group that's more concerned with just partying then the Excalibur is fine, it's dingy, dark, unimpressive and allows you to get out of your hotel quicker and into Vegas, 'cos trust me, the Excalibur ain't it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BordaInc
Reviews.Content: The Excaliber is a fantastic value hotel. Hands down the best in Vegas. Why you may ask? Well here are the advatages and disadvatages: Advantages: - I paid $68 for my room. I received comps as follows: $25 food comp, 2 spa passes (value $20x2) and $30 table comps. I also received lots of coupons upon check in. Therfore my room was basiclly free. (Book hotel on their website) The room was decent and clean. Shower was nice and clean. Spa was extremely nice with great workout machines and free weights. Great location Great for kids Best Value hotel in Vegas (actually anywhere) Entertaiment Disadvantages: Some may not like the atmosphere (I did not mind it) It is a "value" hotel with no bells and whistles (other than spa) No dance club

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: cateyes_1313
Reviews.Content: This stay was a special event "First Time to Vegas, 50th Birthday party". However, I was NOT notified of any renovation to the building UNTIL I arrived. I was assured that I would not be disturbed, however, I could switch rooms. At SIX AM the next morning, I learned that the renovation was directly above us. My guest and I played "NAME THAT POWER TOOL" until nine in the morning. I called to switch rooms for the next evening as there was no way we could sleep through this racket again. I was told there were no rooms available! After requesting a manager I was eventually moved fifth floor, same tower. No comps were offered nor apologies rendered for this inconvenience, I demanded a discount (hardly worth the headache) off the first night in the room. I had a delivery ordered to the room. It did not shown up as requested upon our arrival (confirmed by staff). I made the trip downstairs to investigate. I spotted the gift, a $100 custom cookie basket, cookiesbydesign. com, behind the desk FULLY IN TACT. I spoke to the person at the desk and said I would like to receive it myself in person as they did not deliver upstairs as promised. She refused & rudely said, "We can't just give stuff out you know!” I requested the delivery brought up. The cookie basket arrived upstairs promptly with two of the items broken in half! I was horrified! This was supposed to be a present, now broken in shambles due to careless staff! Again, my complaint was brushed off by a manager on staff explaining to me that "There was NO WAY to KNOW whether or not this package was in this state upon delivery." *SHOCK* I had just been closer then five feet to the item five minutes earlier! On a final note, room service trays were left in the halls for two days with leftover meat on the trays beginning to ROT on MULTIPLE FLOORS!!! This is unsanitary and outrageous! AVOID! Most smoky/dirty casino in VEGAS!

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur a pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: markd530
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I ended up at the Excailbur because our original hotel the MGM overbooked us and sent us there. With little recourse we regretfully checked into the Excalibur. We were given a nice room with king size bed in a recently remodeled part of the hotel. My wife became ill soon after arriving and the hotel staff was excellent in providing us information and directions for her to get proper attention. Even though it was not our first choice to stay in,I would readily recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay there. Hotel staff gets a high rating and hotel atmosphere and cleanliness are top notch as I saw it. Location to other hotels and attractions was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Play here, but dont stay here !!”
Reviews.Author: Prashanth C
Reviews.Content: I thought I'll give my girlfriend a surprise vacation to vegas and booked this hotel as part of it, and it turned out to be the worst part. The rooms look like any Motell 6 rooms, there's NO grandeur at all, and I was wondering why I should pay $175 a night for this. Terrible terrible place. Took the sheen out of our whole trip, because the moment we stepped into the room, we were downcast, The food in the restaurants is bad, the ambience terrible, and it looks like this casino belongs in mississippi and not vegas. HIGHLY AVOIDABLE.

Reviews.Title: “Trailer Park of the strip”
Reviews.Author: pigle36278
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just returned from a trip in Vegas. We stayed a week, and expected to stay in the Hotel all week. We left after one night. This place was a joke. This is the hotel version of trailer park living. Within 30 seconds of entering the building we knew something was wrong; Very wrong. The lobby smelled STRONGLY of Cigarette smoke, and the decor was all cigarette-smoke stained. It was almost as if the place was coated in a light brown film..Vile, truly vile. The rooms were all dark, dingy, and had the same filmy coating that we noticed in the lobby. There is no tub, and the bathroom had a faint smell of flatulance that persisted throughout our short stay The food was at best average, and although it was not expensive..why pay ANYTHING for food you don't like. Finally, and by far the most offensive thing was the other "guests"..this seems to be THE place to go for the lower income, obese, loud Midwesterners. From Grandpa at the crap table that pulled out his teeth while at the table to the thousands of children dressed in dirty clothes running around EVERYWHERE..be prepared to "Low Brow" America up close and in your face Yes, the place is cheap. But VALUE has more to do with JUST cost. I always thought if you had to travel "on the cheap"(at least at the level of this hotel) Why bother going?

Reviews.Title: “pretty dodgy”
Reviews.Author: aussiechick06
Reviews.Content: We stayed in budget hotels throughout vegas and this was pretty much hostel rather than hotel quality as far as rooms go. We were expecting it as we got a great deal off their website that included food and gambling vouchers so in reality our stay proberly cost us next to nothing but Only do it if you really can't afford anything else! Manpower australia wandering the foyer of an afternoon made it bearable though!

Reviews.Title: “Excal Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: HappyGoLucky101
Reviews.Content: What can I say. Its the excalibur, the rooms are not luxury, at least not in my opinion, but I love staying there none the less. It is very central on the strip and an awesome place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Slyph
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a week and have no complaints at all. Rooms were spacious with large comfortable beds. Most importantly the room itself and bathroom were clean and tidy. Only fault was that there is no tea/coffee making facilities in the room and no bath in the bathroom. I guess this is because they want you to spend as little time in your room as possible and as much time in their casino! ;) Nevertheless there are many places to grab drinks and snacks, together with a few nice restaurants. We did have an encounter with an extremely sarcastic and annoying waiter in the Italian restaurant however I wouldnt let that put you off as the food was very good. The Excalibur is a great place from which to explore the strip, being right next door to the Luxor, New York, New York and MGM Grand and I would definitely recommend it to anyone not wanting to break the bank in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “My First Trip to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Birdy2323
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel if you just need a place to sleep, not luxury. Cleanliness was so-so. There was no tub though, so plan on only a shower. I felt safe here, security is very good at each tower. The customer service was good at Registration, and Bell service. The location is good if you want to start at one end of the strip, and work your way down.

Reviews.Title: “Can't complain!!”
Reviews.Author: averagejane
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur from February 9th through the 12th and had a great time! It wasn't our first time and definitely wont be our last... For the budget minded who dont want to sacrifice comfort or a "resort" feel - this is the perfect place, not to mention a great place for bringing the whole family. Lots of restaurants, lots of shops, you cant go hungry or get bored at this place. The lounge at nice was great, good live music and surprisingly, it wasnt that smoky! Nevada now only allows smoking in the Casino area, no lobby smoking, etc. and that helps those who dont like to smell the smoke. Check in was a breeze- we got in late, but our room preference was exactly what we asked for and ready. No lines and the lady at the desk was very pleasant. The room was clean, but the towels were a bit worn and the toilets run a bit slow. Also, like other guests have stated, the water pressure is a hit or miss sometimes, but that only happened the first day. The Ex now has upgraded rooms- flat screen tvs, new decor, etc. We hope to check those rooms out the next time we stay. I would definitely recommend the Excalibur to anyone. Its not as ritzy as the Paris or Ceasars, but its definitely a cut above the Riveria or the Imperial Palace and will give you all you need for a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: TravelinTeacher-7
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel to stay at especially if you don't want to drop a lot of money on a hotel. Rates were low during the week but more than twice as high on weekends. Overall, The Excalibur is reasonably priced and is conveniently located on The Las Vegas Strip, within walking distance of all of the other "swankier" hotels. To put it bluntly, The Excalibur does not have the same "status" as let's say The Bellagio, Caesars Palace, or The Venetian, but I did not find this problematic, in that you can still frequent hotels, regardless of whether or not you are staying there. In addition, I have no complaints about the rooms at The Excalibur, as the beds were large, comfortable, clean, etc...Bottom Line: If you are pretentious and want to brag about the posh hotel you are staying at, The Excalibur might not be the best choice. However, if you just want a decent place to stay without having to refinance your house, you should look into The Excalibur!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time, nice location, great people.”
Reviews.Author: World29
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 5 day, 4 night stay at the Excalibur and had a great time. Don't know why there are such negative reviews on this hotel?? We arrived at 3pm on Thursday and check in was quick and painless. Got the room we requested and the lady who checked us in was polite and quite nice. The room itself was very clean. I do have to agree on the reviews that the rooms are a little outdated but nothing too major. If they got rid of the pictures on the wall, the room would be fine. The casino itself is fun and very easy to navigate around in. It is a little smokey but that is not the hotels fault, its the people who smoke. And smoke filled casinos is everywhere in Vegas even in Bellagio. So if you don't smoke get ready to be a little smoked out!! Overall it was a fun trip and the Excalibur did not disappoint. The location is great, people are nice and the hotel just has a fun atmosphere. Next time we come to Vegas we will stay at the Excalibur again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheesiest Hotel on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: trfr75
Reviews.Content: We just got back. Every single person we dealt with from the front desk, bell desk, dealers, cashiers (except one waitress in the cafe) was a complete jerk. Rude, rude rude. Nobody smiles and they all act like you are putting them out by being there. You can't walk through the hotel without being approached CONSTANTLY by the sales people. To the point that you really just want to hit them. No means no. The rooms are ok for the price. I took a very cold shower. Thought it was a fluke but when I talked to my brother who stayed in a different room, he complained of the same thing, although my husband said the showers at the spa were hot. I would not stay there again. I was there very little but the lack of customer service was just absolutely terrible. If they had better service and a friendlier staff, I would have no complaints. Other than the salespeople. Lose them.

Reviews.Title: “Wheres the Magic?”
Reviews.Author: GARY71
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to visiting Las Vegas and to stay at the Magical Castle hotel of "The Excalibur". The photos I had seen prior to the trip looked exciting and promising. When I enter hotel rooms for the first time I am either excited or disappointed - unfortunately the second was to be the case. Although the room (and bathroom) were large the decor in the bedroom was dark and dated and colourless (colorless for American readers). My first thought was - oh the maid hasn't finished making the beds as there was no cover on them and the white sheets weren't exactly flat (they looked like they havent been ironed), I then found out that this was the case, there are NO covers for the beds which to me made the room look unfinished! Another thing I wasn't happy about was the fact that there was no room safe!! - surely nowadays this should be as standard, especially in a location where people probably take more money (and valuables) than anywhere else, or is this a ploy to make you spend it all a lot faster in the hotel casino! The bathroom also looked a little dated and (excuse the pun - British people will understand this bit) Bog standard! The funniest thing I found was when one of the security guards who sits near the lifts for the towers was fast asleep!!! not very good for security there! I didnt know whether to wake him to show my card or just go, so I just went! The casino area itself was nice, the eateries there were expensive (I guess that would be the case anyway). I think that the wizzards need to wave their wand to bring some magic back to the hotel (especially the rooms).

Reviews.Title: “Good price for the location”
Reviews.Author: RoxyGrl756
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur May 2006 and had an okay experience. I chose the Excalibur for its location and price. The Excalibur is located towards the end of the newer and nicer part of Las Vegas, which I liked because the opposite end or older part of Vegas looks seedy and shady. Considering its location, the Excalibur’s price was pretty good compared to other hotels on the strip. Our room was quiet (besides the sirens coming from the strip at night), it was clean, and both the room and bathroom were spacious. We didn’t have any problems with the timeshare people because we said not interested and kept walking. I liked the security at the elevators and the wide variety of restaurants. The pool looked nice but during the two days we were in Vegas it was too cold to go in (even with it being the end of May). I had never been to Las Vegas before but I think it is absolutely not a family place. If you like partying, gambling, drinking, and smoking then it’s the perfect place for you. If you don’t like those things, because I don’t, then expect not to have the greatest time. Traffic going up and down the strip is terrible no matter what time it is, so I recommend taking some form of public transportation. The shows in Vegas were pretty cool and every restaurant I ate at was great. If you are going to go anywhere (show or restaurant) I would suggest you call first, you evidently need a reservation everywhere. We made the mistake of going all the way down to the Stratosphere to have a late lunch/early dinner just to be told that we needed a reservation to eat there. Overall I found that Vegas was not the place for me, but I was happy as I was going to get with my stay at the Excalibur. I would definitely first research everything again and then decide where to stay if and when I ever come back to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Discount Motel”
Reviews.Author: lauraleigh9mm
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 1 night at the Excalibur. I had been there previously about 15 years ago when it was fairly new. I was in tower 2 on the 8th floor in a room facing the roof of the inner courtyard. Now I booked this through the hotel directly with a special for $43 with tax. This also included $20 in gaming coupons and $20 in restaurant credit. For these reasons only I would ever stay there again. The room was clean, but OLD and the bed was terrible. The TV choices were worse. The were several employees laying about in the hallway near my room (I have no idea why). I got room service breakfast which was fine and not too pricey. When I checked in it was a VERY far walk to my room which was difficult with two heavy bags. This place is very ghetto, if you can get a screaming deal, take it. If you can get a good deal somewhere else, do it.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Awaygrrl
Reviews.Content: We thought we got a great deal until we realized that we only got what we paid for. The rooms are outdated and shabby. This is the poor little brother of the hotals in the area. Nice location. Desk staff was accommodating. Fitness room use cost $20 extra. Food was mediorcre. Not really a deal after all.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: Bgiannam
Reviews.Content: Needless to say after reading dozens of reviews on here, I was hesitate to say the least checking in to the Excalibur. I was literally holding my breath when we turned the door handle, not knowing what to expect. We stayed in Tower 1 on the 19th floor. Room 19163 to be exact. It was VERY clean. Nothing was broken, or not able to be used. Yes, the decor is outdated, but HELLO people..it's SUPPOSED to remind you of being in a castle...you know...heavy tapestries, the dark colors etc. We had no problems at all. We used the automated check in kiosk, which you can sign up to use online. No waiting in lines, it was a breeze. Yes, the timeshare people are annoying, but all you have to do is smile and say no thanks, they leave you alone. The location is great, moving walkways or the FREE monrail to the Luxor and Mandalay Bay hotels and walkways to New York New York and MGM. Just a sidenote, you HAVE to check out The Bar at Times Square,at New York New York with the dualing pianos! It was great fun!! It is an easy walk to the midstrip from the Excalibur, but it is hike to the North Strip, but we found parking for the attractions we wanted to see in that area. We had a fantastic time. Perhaps we got lucky with our room, but again, we had no problems and it was clean and convienient! I want to go back again!

Reviews.Title: “No problems!”
Reviews.Author: leannenufc
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Excalibur for five nights in January and we really enjoyed our time there. We checked in at about midday on a Wednesday; there was no queue and we were up in our room within about ten minutes. The woman who checked us in was absolutely lovely-I imagined that with it being such a large hotel, the staff wouldn't be too interested in all of their guests, but it really did seem like they were making an effort to be friendly whenever we went to the front desk or safety deposit office. As for the room-we were on the 16th floor of Tower One, and were really pleased with it. True, it wasn't the most modern of rooms, but we found absolutely nothing to complain about. Both the main room and bathroom were a good size, it was very clean (with very prompt maid service every day), and very comfortable. We stayed in six hotels throughout our holiday, and this was definately our favourite room. We also had a fantastic view of the Tropicana and MGM Grand, which we were very happy with. We did have the occasional problem with noise: one night we were woken up by a couple arguing outside our door, which was a little annoying, but I don't really expect such a large hotel to stay serenely quiet all the time, so wasn't hugely bothered by it. The hotel/casino is in a good location on the Strip, with Mandalay Bay and Luxor linked by a Monorail and moving walkways, and casinos like NY-NY and MGM Grand just a two minute walk away. The casino itself is not one of the most modern or nicest on the Strip but this doesn't really matter, because there are so many other options around to spend your time. We ate at the Roundtable Buffet once; we knew it wasn't supposed to be brilliant, but we were rather tired on our first day and it was more out of convenience than anything else. We actually didn't find it to be too bad-it had enough to fill us up and wasn't too expensive. We also ate at the Sherwood Forest Cafe for breakfast, and thought it was fine-good service, and decent food. The food court was also really handy. Excalibur may not have the fanciest restaurants on the Strip, but it certainly has enough decent places to stop you from going hungry. We booked a helicoper flight to the Grand Canyon with the tour desk, and everything was handled quickly and easily, with really friendly service-again, no complaints at all. On first arriving, we were immediately hunted down by the timeshare people, who proceeded to take up about fifteen minutes talking to us; our immediate thoughts was that they would drive us crazy during our stay! However, we escaped that time, and were never caught out again. From then on, we either walked quickly past with a 'sorry', or simply told them it was our last day in Vegas. They are a bit of a pain, and we did find ourselves bothered by them more in this hotel than when visiting others, but as long as you don't let yourself be caught out, they aren't a major problem. Considering the price we paid was so much cheaper than the majority of other Strip hotels, we were over the moon with our experience at the Excalibur. If we were to return to Vegas on a bigger budget, we would most likely choose a different hotel simply to widen our experience a bit. However, we would have no problems with returning to the Excalibur, and absolutely recommend it to anyone looking for a friendly, cheap, comfortable and clean Strip hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very realistic: Smelly and grotty like the Medieval times”
Reviews.Author: pungpui
Reviews.Content: This 4000+ room hotel and casino was finished in 1990 and especially in comparison to the never ending development of new casino’s in Vegas, it is certainly showing signs of offering less superior accommodations and facilities to its younger brothers. Part of the massive MGM Mirage group in Vegas, I believe this has to be the worst property of the lot. The pictures show a colourful castle-themed resort where I expected much more theme than actually offered. There is simply no distinction between hotel and casino in this place. All entries into the building lead straight into the casino, with the registration area on one side. To access either of the 2 towers of rooms, they are located at opposite ends of the casino, so it wasn’t uncommon to see people with children walking through the casino area with heavy baggage! What on earth is that about? There is absolutely no personality with the hotel staff at all. With 4000 rooms to check in a day, check-in staff are like passport control people at the airport: looks like they permanently lost control of their face muscles and is locked in ‘boredom’ position. The only staff who actually do talk to you are those annoying show ticket salesmen who literally drag you off what your are doing and try to get you to attend a seminar. You MUST be careful in Vegas about this, especially at any MGM Mirage casino. It looks like they are offering a concierge style service, but all they want you to do is attend a seminar by offering cheap show tickets afterwards. Even on the strip, there are stalls saying ‘Las Vegas Information’, but they are really just the same time-share salesmen trying to get you to invest. Common first questions to draw you in are ‘Where are you from?’, or they try and shake your hand. Just keep walking, it’s awful. Just as annoying as those people who flick hooker cards at you while walking on the strip. The entire hotel, from head to toe is done in a medieval castle-style theme, and that is the same as the rooms offered. There are 2 types of general rooms offered: normal and deluxe. The only different is deluxe has a little more floor space for a couch, but is limited to the 1st 7 floors (so any hopes of a good view of the strip are gone). We opted for the more expensive deluxe, and found it to be a little too realistically medieval! Room felt too dark, the design of the bed spreads and curtains was just yuck to a stage where you don’t really want to lie on the bed, and the furniture is very minimal. The 2 chairs and table look like they are going to collapse, and there is no central air-conditioning. Each room has its own unit which is attached under the window, so if it’s on, it blows the curtains upwards. It’s also incredibly noisy and distracting when sleeptime. The bathroom is huge, however, but completely lacks in colour. There is only one massive shower (no tub), and there is a small fan which looks like it had cheaply been added after the room was completed – the power was too low and it was completely useless as the mirrors fogged up during showers anyway. Towels smelt old and felt thin (ie used for a long time). The hallway is similarly medieval: dark and smells damp. I did, however, like the fact that entry into the hotel tower required you to show your room card to the guard outside the lifts, so we felt a little more secure. Location is very good for south of the strip, with very frequent monorail/trams to Mandalay Bay and Luxor, and foot bridges to New York New York and Tropicana, themselves foot-bridge linked to MGM Grand. However most of the newer, more exciting casino’s are emerging at the northern end of the strip such as Caesar’s, Wynn, Venetian, the new Trump hotel being built, Bellagio. These are quite a walking distance away. Also note that any tours booked or airport transfers will have pick up and drop off at the back of the hotel (the Rotunda), complete opposite side to the main taxi, hotel check-in area. Why this occurs is beyond me, makes transferring hectic, especially if you’ve just arrived and don’t know where you’re going. Overall, I don’t think I would recommend this casino to anyone at all. I did read in a newsletter that 1000 of the 4000 rooms are being renovated at the moment, as is the pool area, but that still wouldn’t change the old feel and incredibly poor layout of the casino and registration areas downstairs. Spend a little more money and stay in much better, newer places.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice place!”
Reviews.Author: DRUtah
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time. One of the first thing we noticed was how eassy it is to travel from the airport to Excalibur. We took one of those cheap buses from the airport and in less than 10 minutes we were at the hotel. The room (Spa suite) was very clean (smoke free) and had a good view. All the linen was very clean and the bed was in very good shape. They have a nice kids area in the basement with great games, we liked that (even though our children weren't with us this time). The hotel is connected with Luxor and Mandalay Bay Resort, so we didn't go outside at all. The second floor, were the shops are, is smoke free... we liked that because we don't smoke. The shows are very good and the Spa offer great service. This was our third time in Vegas and we had a great time in our hotel... the times before were not as great. I strongly recomend Excalibur for any couple or whole family, you will have a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: erizzo1213
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a wonderful location. Right inbetween MGM, Ny NY, Luxor, Mandalay Bay and the Trop. The rooms are out dated but your in Las Vegas baby. Casino Table games started at 5 bucks. Can't beat that.

Reviews.Title: “Desperate for Renovation”
Reviews.Author: mrdigby
Reviews.Content: The Excalibur is in desperate need of some serious room renovating. I know some of the rooms have been upgraded, but they would want to be. I stayed in an interconnecting room on the 5th floor of Tower 2. The tapware is old and leaked, towel rail was broken, carpet thread bare, aircondition not working properly and noisy, power points broken and overall room appearance very old. Word of warning: don't go looking for a relaxing bath- no baths here. TV old and broken buttons. Limited channels and expensive pay to view movies. It was also noisy. I could hear someone thumping up the fire stairs at 5 in the morning and the disgruntled gambler slamming their door shut at 3am down the hallway. I quite liked the location on the south end of the strip easy to get around. And there is nothing wrong with the Casino area and Buffet was outstanding. If you don't plan to sleep or bath during your trip to Vegas well the Excalibur is fine, otherwise you better look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: WittyL8dy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Excalibur for 4 nights while attending a conference in town. My husband's employer booked the travel, so we didn't have a choice on our hotel. Good: Location is great. You are close to some nice properties such as NY, NY, MGM, Luxor, and you've got a free tram that takes you to Mandalay Bay. Rooms are well sized, plenty of room to unpack and relax. Security at each elevator checks your room key before letting you upstairs, so you have a mild sense of security. Maintenance and housekeeping staff were friendly and attentive to our needs. Coldstone Creamery and Krispy Kreme Donuts are inside the building, which is a nice bonus for those with a serious sweet tooth. You can get decent rates at this location, which is not always the case at other strip properties. Not so good: Property is due for some remodeling and updating. Decor is tired, our bed was soft and bouncy (definitely NOT a "do not disturb" mattress...I felt my husband's every move all night), water pressure in the shower was consistently weak, and we waited in line over a half hour to check in.
