Timeshare vultures are everywhere, as others have noted. If you're on a budget and need to be "on the strip" this is a decent option. Just don't expect the Vegas luxury you would find at most other strip locations. NOTE: Pool is currently undergoing renovations. Obviously this wasn't a concern for us in January, but if you're staying later in the spring or early summer you might want to make sure the pool will be open during your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: dnvrjeep
Reviews.Content: A great value. check in was a little slow, but sped up a lot once they opened up more self service kiosks, which we ended up using. It was very easy to navigate. We found our room to be very clean and mfFortable. maid service and cocktail service in the casino were both good. Bed was comfortable, and the pool was clean. We found it to be a good value and re-booked it for a trip this March. Buffet was not good, but we went at an off hour and ate elsewhere afterwards

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: murderbomb7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business for 2 days. It was okay. I mean, it needs an upgrade compared to other newer hotels. But it was good. Service was great. Room was great, and it was just a regular room. I think it looks like it's great for kids from the outside, but I just didn't see anything that was geared for the kids. Really. Good room service and food. I drove a Bobtail truck there from California, and was nervous about parking it there because we had a lot of product in the back, but the parking lot is well guarded. The minute we found a parking spot, and jumped out of our truck, a guard truck pulled up beside us. They didn't say anything to us, but I was happy in knowing that I could sleep great that night without having to worry about our truck being broken into. It was good. Very level time from the time we got there, to the time we left.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and a nice experience....”
Reviews.Author: ju123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur for 3 nights, Sunday - Wednesday and managed to get a good rate of $100 for the Sunday and $70 for the other 2 nights. We thought this was exceptional value especially as some of the other slightly more upmarket hotels wanted $200+ per night. Check in was smooth and very pleasant. We were slightly annoyed that once we checked in we were immediately jumped on by the timeshare people, trying to book us on a trip to view the latest wonder of the world accomodation in exchange for show tickets. We declined the offer, but this happened on a few occasions during the 3 night stay, in the end we just told them we'd already turned down the offer previously. Lifts to our block were very easy to find, unlike some other properties on the strip (hello NYNY) and after a lenghty walk down the corridor we came to our room. The room was marvellous. Very very big, much bigger than the standard rooms in both the Luxor and the NYNY and obviously with a medieval theme. Plenty of space for bags etc, a great chest of drawers/televison cabinet and table and chairs in the corner. There was also a nice relaxing soft chair in the room as well. Bathroom wasn't quite up to the standard of the rest of the room, it was still large but had been slightly neglected. It wasn't dirty by any means, but there were a few tiles cracked etc, nothing major to worry about, and exactly how long do you spend in the bathroom in Vegas? Having explored the Excalibur on previous visits to Vegas we knew all about the casino, shops and restaurants etc. We were very impressed with the 24hr Sherwood Forest Cafe, where we ate on a couple of occasions and was never overly busy. Food was exceptional for the price. The casino itself is nice, better than the NYNY in layout but I still prefer the Luxor. However the slots were quite loose, we managed to come away $600 up playing the 25c machines, and in fact the guy sitting next to us racked up a huge win during one of the evenings. The waitress service was spot on also, I think we somehow managed to drink about 10 bottles of beer one night for a $1 tip each. Obviously they want to keep you there, but when you are winning and also getting a beer for a $1 tip there is nothing better!!!! Location is pretty obvious, southern end of the strip between NYNY and Luxor. We like this area and have now stayed in the 3 hotels in a row, perhaps we will try mid strip next time but for overall value and fun, the Excalibur is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur is clean and a good bargain”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaDebbie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Excalibur. I read many reviews after booking our stay there and became a little nervous. Short and to the point- if you've booked a room you will probably be happy with it. The room was neat, clean and clutter free. Excalibur is not as fancy as some of the hotels but we enjoyed our stay there. We had the Sunday brunch buffet and the price was reasonable and the food good. There is also a food court that provides meals at a reasonable rate. The service was good. There were time share employees lurking about but if you ignore them they leave you alone. We would use this hotel again-it met our needs at a great price. A tip-use the bus to get around and save your feet. A bus pass is good for 24 hours, unlimited for $5.

Reviews.Title: “Low price = Low lifes”
Reviews.Author: GrnZoom
Reviews.Content: We went to L.V. for my birthday. Met our son, dau. & hub. there. We all stayed at the Excalibur Jan. 12 to 14th. Arrived about 1:00pm, check in was fast and our rooms were ready. Off to a good start. Our room was fine, the bed was soft. Our daughter said their bed was lumpy and you could feel the springs. Jeff, our son said his was broken. All the rooms were clean, but dated decor. We all stayed on the 26th floor- non smoking- but in the hall there were ash trays .... ?? We ate at cafe, had soup and salads, They were what you would expect. Nothing special. The first night Friday, was fine. Sat. night was a different story. Outside our daughter's room, a male and female was fighting, yelling, cussing etc..etc. They called security because of the noise and sounded like the situation might turn violent. In the room next to ours there was a loud party going on. Lots of noise and mexican music. Yelling and whistling up and down the hall. Not good...We all agreed when you stay in a cheap place, the low lifes are there. Next time we will spend a little extra and stay in a place that caters to a better class of people. Also... we ate at the buffet. We do not recommend it. Bottom line.. if you want a low price, you might be staying next to low lifes.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good place”
Reviews.Author: matthwh610
Reviews.Content: Good place overall. The castle theme was really interesting. Many restaurants in the hotel - anything from a fast food place to a nice Italian restaurant. The casino itself was average overall.

Reviews.Title: “met our expectations”
Reviews.Author: isema
Reviews.Content: First, thank you all for your inputs although this hotel doesn't get plenty of encouraging reviews. We enjoyed our stay from 26-30 December at this place. Booked through their web site with promotions( you pay $20 extra but receive 45 in coupons plus spa admission-didn't have time for it) and got 27th floor. Interior was basically designed accordingly so disregard comments about old carpets etc-the hotel is supposed to take you 400 years back(EXCALIBUR!!!). It was clean throughout and rooms were acceptable(spacious and comfy). Location, location!!! YOu can't go wrong with excalibur. We tried food at Regale two times and it was OK(affordable and decent service). We simply couldn't go to the buffet for three days because it was so busy and long lineups( not only there-at Rio, we had waited over an hour for a seafood buffet just to get in a line up and we gave up). I had good luck on blackjack downstairs although the casino is just average in comparison with some high class hotels. Advantage: you are connected with Luxor and Madandalay Bay accros the street NYNY or MGM or Tropicana. My advice: don't get stuck gambling all day long, there are so many things to see. Valley of Fire-breathtaking and a must-see. Get away for a morning. It is handy to have a vehicle if you can be responsible and dedicated.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant for those of us on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: KatyBen
Reviews.Content: We booked at the Excalibur from 27th December for New years. As the flights cost so much it was either this or Circus Circus. For the price and in general it was a really good hotel. When we arrived there was no queue to book in and we were dealt with really quickly. We were put into a no smoking room but were moved in about two minutes when we brought this up. I really liked the security to get up to the rooms. Having watched too many CSI's I was grateful! The hotel was always busy especially over the New Years weekend. The tables were cheap and the waitresses were always there with the drinks. The poker room was also very nice. Yes there are time share people who bugged us but these people are in every hotel! If you are rude and ignore them completely they get the message. As with all casinos there is a mammouth walk to the rooms. The King size bed was very comfy and the room and bathroom were always clean. I would stay here again and again. The money you save on the room you can spend on gambling.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Pam&Terry
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Vegas in 3months.... We previously stayed at this hotel for 3 nights.... Second part of the stay was at the Bellagoi (25th Wedding Annversary trip)... We decidesd to spend New Year in Vega who wouldnt, all the hotels charged a lot to stay over that period, but we had no issues staying here again. We felt that althought the lobby staff/check in ladies were at times a little offish, everone else was freindly and polite. The room was cleaned daily and spacious. Try to upgarde to a New York/strip facing Jacuzzi room if poss, its worth it............... Must do things to do are The Grand Canyon.......... The under looked Jubille show at Ballys....... The White Tigers at Miriga........... And the fountains at Bellagio, day and night................ oh and take in as many lounge show they are free and great......Dont book for New Year at Vegas if you are expecting over the top fireworks, you could be disappointed but its a great place to be. On the whole if you are on a budget this is a great place to saty.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and a good bargain”
Reviews.Author: coolcaesar
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Excalibur over a weekend in December 2006. I don't know what all those other TripAdvisor users are complaining about. I got a clean, pleasant, comfortable, affordable and quiet non-smoking room, just as I wanted. I didn't see any cracks or marks in the walls, or old furniture or any other obvious signs of aging (as people have often complained about older hotels like the Tropicana). The Excalibur itself doesn't have any incredibly spectacular attractions (except that Tournament thing for little kids that still get a thrill out of watching equestrians play knight) but it's very convenient to all the major resorts which do have good attractions. The free tram to Mandalay Bay and Luxor is fast and smooth and very convenient. The Excalibur's self check-in machine is a little slow and confusing but it did give me my keycard eventually (and it was still faster than waiting in line for a live person). One thing I really liked is that the Excalibur has a tiny convenience store by the elevator lobby for each tower, as well as a larger convenience store in the second floor mall. The only bad thing I can possibly think of is that my room was a low-floor room that didn't have a view. But that's all right since I was in Vegas to visit the casinos and the Strip, not stay in the room all day!

Reviews.Title: “Never again--needs imploding-fas!”
Reviews.Author: cynlouhoo
Reviews.Content: Since we decided basically last minute to travel to Las Vegas for New Years, we had limited choices for hotels that were available AND relatively "cheap" in comparison to other strip hotels for the 31st. Unfortunately, the Excalibur was the only property left taking Dec 31st check ins for just one night stay (we had a room booked the next two nights at NYNY). The room at Excalibur was dated, the bed LOW to the ground, and we could feel the springs....and, to top it off, we had a view of a BRICK WALL!!! No kidding! I would have been glad to see another hotel rather than a wall.....it was depressing! But, being it was New Years, we didnt hang around long!! The other annoying thing was that the hotel didn't plan how its guests were going to get to the strip after the overpasses were closed for the New Years party. Guests had to climb through flower beds and dangerously clamour over fencing just to join the action on the strip....if there was an easier way, it wasn't pointed out by anyone. It may have been a kind gesture to have an employee show us a safer way! The absolute worst part of this story is that we spent OVER $300 for ONE NIGHT in this lousy hotel.....I wouldn't even pay $50 to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Substandard hotel”
Reviews.Author: jasoncalg
Reviews.Content: We planned a holiday over the Christmas break and since we had stayed at the Excalibur hotel once before a few years ago thought we would try it again. Our experience started off with walking into our room and finding that our toilet had been used and not flushed, either from the previous guest or the housekeeping staff, we didn't really care which. This of course brings up the question of the room being cleaned as a check out room or as a stay over room. Finding a dirty toilet questions the cleanliness of the entire room. We called down immediately and after having to explain that 'no it is not ok to just flush it and use it' we were moved to another room. The room we were moved into was the same size etc and though the furniture was pretty beaten up (and this was an upgraded room that I paid extra for) we were ok. Then one evening the bathroom light went out. We called to housekeeping who contacted engineering who sent someone up. He started to tear everything apart saying that it wasn't just the bulb but that the whole thing needed replacing and he would need parts. We said that was fine as we were going out and that we needed to use the bath room to freshen up before we went. The maintenance man said he would go and get the parts and come back and fix it. When we arrived back in our hotel room at 1 AM we walked in to find that nothing had been touched and pieces of the light fixture was all over the counter and floor, just as he left it. We called down to find out what had happened and why our light was still not working. They once again sent up a maintenance man, a different one of course because the other was now off shift. He walked into the room and started out by asking 'who took the light apart?', I am guessing he assumed we knew who they have on staff since he didn't. After telling him that we hadn't done it he then said "well the Front Desk shouldn't have checked you into this room'. After telling him that we had already been in the room for 4 days by this point, the game of 20 questions finally ended. He went down to the maintenance area to get parts and when he came back explained that on the work order it stated that we 'threw' the other guy out and that is why he never came back. Saying that we needed to use the washroom while he was getting parts to fix it is apparently 'throwing' him out of the room. Finally after maintenance man number 2 going downstairs two more times to get the correct parts our light was finally fixed at roughly 2:45AM. During this time I went to the Front Desk to complain and the front desk supervisor said that she wouldn't charge us for the upgrade, a whole $10.00 a night. I am in the hotel industry and I tend to be more understanding because I know that sometimes things happen, this however went beyond just bad service. So between our room adventures, the restaurant being highly over priced for the quality you get, watching people sitting at slot machines with their children sitting beside them (in strollers as well) which is against the law in Nevada, and people taking photographs in the gaming area (which is also against the law apparently) we will never recommend this hotel to anyone. For the price there are certainly other options....use them!

Reviews.Title: “Won't go back”
Reviews.Author: cgillus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur Dec. 24 - 28. I had requested a non-smoking room with double beds. I am well aware of the policy that when you check in, you may not get exactly what you requested , but I did expect some kind of concession (upgrade for one night, discount, etc) on their behalf if what I booked wasn't available. I was wrong. Upon arrival around 6:30 pm, we were told that there were no non-smoking rooms available, only smoking rooms with king beds. Even if we had gone ahead and took a smoking room (which I had no interest in doing), we still needed 2 beds, because our 2 children were with us. The staff made no attempt to accommodate us. I guess she thought we could all squeeze into one bed. She only repeated that there was nothing available. Finally, after about 20 minutes of us just standing there, she finally decided to talk to a manager. After 5 minutes, she came back and said that she and the manager had "found" a nonsmoking room with double beds. I had paid extra for a strip view, but my view was of the Tropicana hotel, entirely, nothing else. The beds were pretty uncomfortable and the shower had quite a bit of mildew. The temperature dipped into the 30s at night, and the first night we discovered the heating unit was not working, so they ended up replacing the entire unit. I also didn't care for the buffet setup, having to fix your plate before you find a seat. We stayed at the Excalibur with our children about 3 years ago. We didn't complain then because we paid a very cheap price and for the money, we could live with it. However, this time, the price was not much lower than some of the other hotels on the strip, so I expected better. Hearing about the renovations was the only reason we chose this hotel again, but I was told once we got there that they were not letting anyone stay in the renovated rooms just yet. We are frequent travelers, especially to Las Vegas, and we're pretty easygoing when we experience problems, but it wouldn't have bothered us so much if the staff would have at least acted like they were interested in helping us resolve our situation. They didn't seem to appreciate our business at all. So, I will not stay at the Excalibur again, even after renovations are complete. I will stay elsewhere from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest”
Reviews.Author: Mick_Jenny
Reviews.Content: Poor experience. Started bad booking in when 2 of our credit cards were rejected. Again 2 were rejected at their restaurant. After days of phone calls internationally was their system sending wrong information. No interest from their staff to assist. On the last day the hot water failed and no-one got a warm shower, from listening to others at checkout we weren't the only ones.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Cheap”
Reviews.Author: azmrse
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth time at Excalibur. It is a favorite of ours for the atmosphere that so many others complain about. Tacky is how some describe it. I think it is neat. I love the theme hotels in Vegas. It has gotten a little older and dirtier since my first visit. I did even find a bug on the 21st floor bathroom. Still I like the decor and it has a great view of my favorite part of the strip. The prices also make it a bargain. We got great rates of $41 a night and then got an email from the hotel offering one night free so we called and got the second night free. We stayed two nights here for $62 and got $25 in food coupons for breakfast. Final cost less than $40 for two nights. It is close to NY, Luxor and Mandalay Bay. We did spend one night on town at Fremont Street and Casino Royale for dinner. I will always love the Excalibur for the castle motif and prices. Rooms are basic and clean. I go for the views and walking around the strip. Life is too short to gripe about thin walls, construction noise and kids running around.

Reviews.Title: “TREATED LIKE PEASANTS AT EXCALIBUR”
Reviews.Author: konarm
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Excalibur one night with my wife on Dec 19th after severe weather cancelled my flight home. They gave us a standard room that had NO bathtub. Only a shower. Not a big deal for me but a huge issue for my wife. They would not UPGRADE ??? us to a room with a tub unless we agreed to pay an additional $30 for the night. We were already in a foul mood due to our flight cancellation and we no longer had any luggage. I explained to them the situation and also the fact that it was my birthday but they were completely unsympathetic. No customer service here. Entirely rude staff. The heater in the room they gave us was broken. The temperature that night was 30 degrees. They sent maintainance and after three trips to the room they replaced the entire unit rather than to move us. Totally unacceptable. We will never stay here again. There are other nicer hotels in this price range on the strip that value their customers. This will cost Excalibur in the future because I frequent Vegas about 8 times a year with an average of 10 grand a visit. I will be sticking with classy hotels like Mandalay Bay, Bellagio,Ceasers,Paris,Venetian and Wynn.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but bad service”
Reviews.Author: man_from_Brum
Reviews.Content: We booked into the Excalibur Hotel & Casino in Las vegas for two nights in december 2006 using the hotels promotional food and gambling package .we arrived in early hours of the morning to find there was no hot water in the hotel(gas main had gone down on the strip). it was off for a full day so had a cold shower before hunting down warm food elsewere (there was no cooked food in the hotel) we contacted the front desk a number of times but they was not intrested in the problem and would not refund the extras we had not used (food and spa vouchers). the room was standard for the price, i would have gave the hotel 3 stars but for the poor comunication in the hotel and a unfriendly welcome i gave it one star. there are better hotels on the strip for the price so in future i would stay elsewere

Reviews.Title: “great time at the Excablur”
Reviews.Author: billellen
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Excabilur Dec 6th thru the 9th, nice place, rooms very clean, the 14th floor was very quiet with a nice view of the southern strip, slept well in the queen beds, plenty of towels, only problem we had was no hot water one evening, no falt of the hotel,with all the contruction going on one of the companys hit a gas line an put alot of the hotels in the area without gas for awhile, food was good in the resturants though we didnt try the buff; all in all we had a nice time, staff was very friendly, security was very watchful at all the entrance to the towers, only hotels guests were aloud to enter the elevator entrances. slots are tight so we played the 2 cent draw poker machines, traffic is (really) bad between noon an 2 in the morning on the strip, the tram an the double decker (duce) bus is the way to get to where you want to go, the cabs know how to get around all the construction an the traffic so dont get upset if the take you down some side streets to get to where your going, went to IP to see the legends show an it was great, will come back again. Mr an Mrs Woods

Reviews.Title: “very friendly place”
Reviews.Author: hulkstillrules
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at Excalibur for a weekend and it was pretty cool. The gambling tables were mostly $5 tables and most of the staff that we came in contact with were very friendly. We basically stayed there because of the location and the fact that we had never stayed there before. We gambled a lot, but didn't lose of butts because the minimums were low enough. We ate at Sir Galahad's Buffet which I just learned is the largest Buffet in Vegas. They had very good food and a lot of it. It was worth the price. Anyway, I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone who is on a budget and I assume that is 90% of the people. The only thing I wouldn't recommend is the Rum Jungle night club. Wwaaaaaaaaay to loud in that place. It is so loud that the staff was wearing earplugs. The music was good, but when we left, our ears were ringing for days.

Reviews.Title: “Did noy enjoy the stay at Excalibur - very outdated”
Reviews.Author: Bunni29
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our 5 night stay at Excalibur. To say the least I guess you get what you pay for. We changed rooms 3 times..........so I did get to see 3 different rooms..........all were so outdated and felt very dirty to me..... First Room: Woke up to the Fire Alarm 7:00am in the morning and major smoke. I could hardly breathe and was choking so bad..... Yikes......I thought there was super fire.........it was our heater to our room overheated and smoke was coming out and set off our alarm. I called the front desk........they did send someone up right away......and the guy said that their heaters had not been turned on for a while so they probably built up some dust and it was burning off........ok.........Well Excalibur let me just say this..........You probably need to update your AC/Heating system........it was straight from the early 1970's......... I called again the front desk and had them change my room and upgrade me asap for my inconvience........so they did....... Went to the 2nd Room: 2nd room was a Jacuzzi Room.........Upgrade according to them: Ok all you folks out there that want a Romantic Jacuzzi Room please please do not pay for this room..........it was so yucky....... again it was old furniture, dark, gloomy and so old and dirty looking - very outdated - peeling wallpaper, bathroom was so old looking and dirty.... I would Never have gotten into that jacuzzi it was so yucky....the jacuzzi had this rug cover and it was all fraying ...it was so scary... The problem with the 2nd room was that it had a super strong chemical smell.....and I mean strong.........there was no way I was staying in this room................I called the front desk and they moved us again.............they said they just deep cleaned some of the rooms.............. Our 3rd room: A jacuzzi king room again. The smell was much better but again a very old dirty looking room.......very outdated and dark The hotel lobby is ok....I think it's the nicest part of the hotel. - Check in was fast I did call in an hour before I arrived for the Express check in. - Room Was so so oudated! I felt like I walked into a 1960-1980 old hotel room. It has this weird old looking dark orange color...looked dirty to me. The furniture - YIKES....can they please update their furniture.......it was so Old looking..........I think they can afford to get some new furniture!!! The TV: was pretty small and all the stations has static - not one clear station hmmmmmmmmm??? strange. The Bathroom: Dirty - old and yucky............ It was so very outdated..........the tile was dirty The shower -(no tub) had this scary sliding door which was old and dirty looking The bathroom was just yucky in all 3 rooms I was in. The light in the room was so very dark! So ladies if you want to see what you look like ...it's very dark in the rooms........bad bad light and no mirror that was fullsize that you can see what you look like......... The Buffet at Excalibur: No good at all..........the food was really bad and tasted yucky The food was absolutely awful We had it once for breakfast and once for lunch..........totally bad..... Please go to a nicer hotel to eat their buffet............. Mandalay Bay had a good buffet.......so did Bellagio Shows: Saw "O" at the Bellegio Was good.........liked Mystere better..........had a lot more acrobats and more visual things going on Lance Burton: the Magician: Was awesome.!!!! Legends in Concert at Imperial Palace: had pretty good impersonators and singers were using their own voices.......was good............The Imperial Palace theater is so old though....all good seats though. Comedy Stop at the Tropicana was funny! Restaurants we dined at: The Eiffel Tower Restaurant at the Paris hotel........ Was wonderful!!! Had the Ribeye Ask for a window table as it overlooks the Bellogio fountains Micahel Mina: at the Bellagio Four star restaurant they say Was a nice place - but for $70++ a plate..........they literally gave me 3 (yes I said 3) tiny pieces of pasta.........and my rack of lamb was so small I got about 4 bites out of it.............I left there mighty hungry.......... China Town off the strip: Great Chinese food.......Yummy Casino at Excalibur: A bit smokey compared to the nicer hotels.......I think the nicer hotels have a better ventilation system........ But, the casino actually was not that bad looking at the Excalibur was ok Timeshare People: Please do not fall for them They are all over the place they are dressed in black suits and they look like they work at the Excalibur but they do not............they Ask "Hi how long are you staying here" do you want some free show tickets...........Then they give you their talk and then they want you to spend 3 hours at their timeshare place......NO thank you!!!! All in all had a nice time but would not stay at the Excalibur....... just too outdated and dark, and peeling wall paper is not my thing...............just felt dirty........... I could have gotten the Monte Carlo for the same price and it is much much nicer........ So if you want a nicer room please look elsewhere........... thank you and have fun!

Reviews.Title: “great but you get nothing for your money”
Reviews.Author: diannepoxon
Reviews.Content: our stay here was nice, our room was nice, and there where plenty of towels, but thats it, not even a coffee maker in the room, you can use any of the other hotels for food and gambling, any body can use the monerail, if you want to use the gym it 20dollards a day, so I really dont know what we paid for, we could of had the same or better from a motel. I didnt think we got value for money, and to be honest I think it would be better of f staying of f the strip, you need to get away from all the traffic, people, slot machine and noise for a while. On the whole this hotel is nice, no problems, but its only a room, nothing else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: nicmo9702
Reviews.Content: Our room was so-so with just a normal room, althought the deluxe room was better and much larger. The bathroom was large enough and very nice so that more than made up for the heavily themed darkness. The Arcade was very crowded and reminded me of what is at the outdoor carnivals. But it wasn't bad, just not my first choice. The pool was nice and large. Our favorite thing was the location and the ease of coming and going so we have stayed here two different times for that reason alone. Pizza Hut, McDonalds and Quizno's is upstairs as well as Krispy Creme. We also enjoyed the moving monorails from Excalibur to Luxor and Mandalay Bay. One weekend it rained the entire time so this came in very handy. We were able to visit other hotels without leaving the building (so to speak) The Tournament of the Kings was a great dinner show and perfect for families with or without children.

Reviews.Title: “Never again -- showing its age.”
Reviews.Author: session
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Vegas in about 7 years, and the first trip ever for my wife. We discovered a fantastic room rate online for Excalibur and decided to spend Thanksgiving week there. Previously I stayed at the Flamingo, but I was not yet 21 so my experience is limited. However, I don't remember the Flamingo being quite as bad as the Excalibur. For starters, as you walk through the doors you are instantly knocked back with a backdraft of old carpet and cigarette smoke. The tar and smokey haze literally permeated the entire complex. I realize that there are a lot of smokers in Vegas, but it seems like the Excalibur has never even installed a proper ventilation system, let alone maintained one. We confirmed this by walking through most of the other casinos -- we didn't have a single problem with cigarettes elsewhere. As for the hotel itself, it reminded me of any Best Western in the middle of nowhere: nothing to write home about. The lighting was poor, the carpets looked 16 years old, the bathroom fixtures were dated and leaky, and the bed was stiff. The air conditioning unit was so loud that we just turned it off and opened the window; too bad they only let you open the window about 2 inches. We reserved a king bed 2 months in advance, but when we arrived they told us all they had were two queens. Luckily we were able to trade to a king room the next night. One comes to Vegas to do three things: eat, gamble, and see shows. Let's just say I didn't look forward to any of those things in Excalibur. The restaurants feel straight out of a suburban strip mall: uninspired and overpriced. The buffet felt like a cow stable and the food was awful. The 24-hour cafe, Sherwood Cafe, wasn't bad but $10 for a croissant and fruit? Are you joking? As for the casino, the aformentioned cigarette smoke was too much to bear. Also, the Excalibur staff were quite aggressive in pushing their timesharing scams and pounced on us nearly every time we walked from our room to the casino floor. One plus was that the cocktail waitresses were very attentive and friendly. The shows? Unless you like watching a Medieval Times ripoff or a male stripper show, you won't like the Excalibur. They apparently booked the washed up Louie Anderson but he was gone when we arrived; there are much better comedians in Vegas anyway. All in all, I felt bad for my wife. I'd built up Vegas to be a wonderful place, which it still is, but the Excalibur was a let down. Next time we'll be staying elsewhere, likely at the MGM Grand across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay Without Breaking the Bank”
Reviews.Author: WpgBanker
Reviews.Content: This hotel/casino is not the most glamorous property on the strip and it doesn't pretend to be. It is clean and relatively well looked after. The staff was prompt and eager to assist. I am disabled and the hotel had made arrangements for a scooter and that was ready for me when I arrived. Check-in was a breeze – even though I was checking in well before normal check-in time. Check out was also easy as I did it the night before. I called down in the morning when I was ready to leave and a bellman was sent up promptly and I was able to get assistance to the shuttle to the airport. The rooms are basic – has a shower but no tub. There is no coffee making facilities in the room. Room cleaning seems to happen in the late afternoon - I would have preferred it earlier in the day but on the one occasion I happened to have returned to the room and the maid came to clean the room, she offered to come back later. Supplies for the most part were replenished daily. Security is stationed at the base of each elevator section and you have to show a room key to gain access to the elevators. I was given a $20 dining credit good for the higher end restaurants in the hotel. Used mine in Regale and the food was pretty good. The buffet was so-so, it was convenient and cheaper than most and it showed. I used some of the food court places on the second floor and the prices were reasonable. Although it is located on the south end of the strip I found it was close to most of the places I wanted to visit – MGM, NYNY, Luxor, Mandalay Bay (and the Tropicana (although I never visited this one)). Although a number of people have complained about children I didn’t find them too much of a problem. I am not sure why anyone would want to bring children to Vegas and it must be difficult to keep them entertained when so much of Vegas is geared towards adults, but for the most part kids were evident but well behaved and no worse than any other holiday destination.

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: MikeTA
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Excalibur once before, a couple years ago. This time around, not much had changed. The line at registration was short, I walked in on a Wednesday afternoon and had a room within moments. The elevators are fast, the hallways are clean, and the rooms are clean too. The room truly felt non-smoking, and the carpet and sheets didn't look old or worn at all. Excalibur is one of the few casinos on the strip I've found easy to navigate as well - probably because the floor is just a large square with entrances at two corners and elevators at the other two. It's location on the strip is pretty good - it is towards one end, so plan on a solid 20 minute walk to Bellagio's fountains, for example. The second floor of the hotel has a variety of quick and easy dining options, including a Quizno's sub shop, a fast food joint (McDonalds, I think), and Krispy Kreme donuts and Coldstone Ice Cream for treats. In short, it's quite underpriced relative to the hotels around it, and nice enough that you'll likely have no complaints with the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “No Thanks”
Reviews.Author: cinncitraveler
Reviews.Content: Would not stay here again. The place is worn-out; dirty, noisy, seedy crowd in the casino. The room was dirty - air vents that had not been cleaned in years (decades?) and towels that were small and worn. Did not try any of the restaurants, so no comments there. I did like the free tram to Luxor and Mandalay, just wish I had stayed there instead.

Reviews.Title: “Stay elsewhere on the Strip if you can afford it”
Reviews.Author: young4life
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay on the Excalibur website. Drove from SD, parking car was easy, lots of bays midweek in the afternoon. Before you have even checked in annoyingly chirpy staff try to talk you into show tickets or to go on a 3hr tour at Excaluibur's new timeshare apartments somwehere nearby (apparently they drive you there the presentation/tour is for 3 hrs and you cannot leave until it is over), they tried to lure us with dinner vouchers and Mirage aquarium tickets. So if any staff approach you randomly in reception area or when you walk out of tower lifts, politely decline and keep walking. Our room was in Tower 1, 20th floor, rooms are basic and service is even more basic. There is no room-safe, no guest information booklet regarding amenities/services, no tea/coffee making facility, no fridge which i believe are some basic hotel requirements. I called houskeeping to request a kettle to boil water for my infant son and was told bluntly to call room service, sat on the phone for 45 mins waiting for room service to pick up before i hung up. I really think there is no room-service for those on 20th floor,as there was no menu in room and never did i hear a trolley go past or a tray left in the halls. The pool was closed indefnetely, only found this out by chance when we decided we would go for a swim. The decor is dated (very true to the medieval theme i guess),dark and depressing. The gaming room shares the same decor as the rooms, boring and dark, after walking through other hotels on the Strip i would stay elsewhere next time. Yes this hotel is on the Strip but right on the end, it does get tiring walking up and down tje Strip during the day and night so I would probably look at staying somewhere more central on the strip such as Bellagio, Alladdin, Venetian, Ceasars etc. Ps. do not go to the outlet mall not far from the Strip as it is a waste of time.

Reviews.Title: “Great for family travelling with kids”
Reviews.Author: Lilyjm
Reviews.Content: Excalibur Hotel and Casino is in a great location on the Las Vegas strip. Kids enjoy it because of the Midway Fantasy Faire where they can play games. The hallways are a bit dark but that's because of the theme. Rooms are a bit small but they are clean. Beds are comfy. It's alright for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Sir Galahads Restaurant - No Go”
Reviews.Author: lafinboy
Reviews.Content: This is my third trip to Las Vegas and have previously stayed at Circus Circus. This time due to traffic we thought we would stay nearer the action for a more enjoyable experience, this did not proove to be the case. The rooms and corridors were dark and dingy, after a couple of days the unit to control the temperature of the shower just fell off the wall, the toliet was constantly trying to refill.....refreshing noise in the middle of the night. There was no safe in the room, had to make use of a safety deposit box, to keep valuables and cash in, which beacme a pain visiting safety deposit on a daily basis to get to your cash Sir Galahads Restaurant - Booked as a special treat as we had just had our wedding vows renewed, can honestly say that the food was the worst ever experienced at approx $40 - $50 per main meal. The salad turned up with hair in it, I plumped for the dish of the day filet mignon which was stone cold, when I complained, the waitress offered to put the steak in the microwave for me.....now that is class. No wonder the lighting was very gloomy I was playing Texas Holem at the tables and was told that this was a new game for the dealers...this was quite evident as I found myself teaching them the rules, and often the dealer tried to take my money when they had not actually won....good job someone knew what they were doing! The air con played havoc on me, ending up with a chest infection, many other gamblers were complaining, it was as if the air con units had been scented with something quite peculiar..... Machines the tightest I have ever seen, I did not see one person win anything over £200 in a week's stay The swimming pool was out of action being re-furbished which we were not informed of. On the whole not the experience I was looking for,,,,,,,I think I will stick to what I know in the future!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay!”
Reviews.Author: dc23
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed in the hotel for 3 days and paid $69 per night for a deluxe room. The only reason why i reserved a deluxe room ($10 more) was because we wanted a king sized bed. However, we were told room not available when we checked in. The hotel is in a good location, compared to the same pricing hotels like Sahara. However, the hotel is pretty worn down. Disliked the bathroom a lot, the shower head was worse than the one in my own house. Also towels were old & looked kind of yellowish. I would recommend this hotel if you would like to find a place relatively closer to the strip with a lower price. You get what you pay!

Reviews.Title: “Big and tacky”
Reviews.Author: Gottalock
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a long week in Vegas with 2 friends. We booked the first 2 days at the Excalibur through there official webpage due it looked like a cool place to stay. Well we landed into the airport and cabbed over which wasn't far at all. We paid about $15 bucks with tip which is the same as a shuttle and quicker. We made our way into the lobby after turning down a gentleman at the door offering us to take our bags to our room. We turned him down due to we have never been to Vegas and didn't want to get robbed and we didn't have a room yet. Its very true about the huge line for check in which looked like a hour long wait guranteed but we headed over to the auto check in and using the credit card that was used to book the room we pulled up our reservation and had 3 keys printed off. Took a couple of minutes and we headed to our room. The hotal has 2 towers at each end and different set of elavators to get to said rooms based on the room numbers. So be sure to read your instructions so you don't take the wrong elvator just to come back down and wait again. The hotel is so huge and the elavators were slow so being only on the thrid floor we just took the stairs to save time. Room and bathroom was pretty clean and roomy because we were 3 guys and we had an air mattress. We had 2 double beds and the air mattress I brought so we can share the beds evenly. Works out well and can save you a bundle on room rates. The view from the room sucked as we looked right at a wall due to being so low to the ground on the thrid floor. Heard alot about the timeshare reps but you learn were they set up shop and they target couples so don't hold hands or be arm and arm if you go with a boyfriend/girlfriend/husband/wife and just keep walking by them if you don't want to be bothered. The food was very good after eating at the Round Table buffet twice. We had breakfast and dinner in the 2 days we stayed. Prices were decent for a buffet and it did offer something for everyone. Chinese to Mexican and even quality deserts with unlimited drink such as milk, juice, soda etc. Ate once at the Sherwood cafe(24hrs) and it was tasty for about $10 bucks to eat. Food court is nice with Mcdonalds, Quiznos, Krispy Kreme(24hrs) etc which is good if your looking for some fatty goodness. Luxor which is conected through the moving walkway has a food court as well for other good fast food. Overall a good hotal with plenty to see and do. I would have given this place a 5 but they did have some problems. Arcade in the basement is big and nice but most of the games are broken. Head to the Luxor for better arcade which can be accessed through a moving walkway near the food court area. All of the hotel smelled of cigarette smoke but thats Vegas for you. The guy who took my bag to load the cab after we were leaving damaged it jamming it into the car and I didn't notice till after we left and to late to process a complaint. I would stay again if I was in Vegas again. I also stayed at the Hooters hotal for the end of the trip so look out for that review.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: PB69
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel to stay at. Before you go to all the fancy hotels like the Bellagio, Luxor, etc., go to the Excalibur first and check-in. This hotel does not have the super fancy "blinged" out lobby like all the others do, so don't be disappointed, but it has no bearing on the hotel itself. There are self-serve check-in computers that work great, takes no time at all and avoids you having to wait in line. I booked online at the hotel website and got a decent deal. It was over Columbus Day long weekend (Thanksgiving here in Canada), so Sunday was a bit more expensive (120 USD) and the two other days were 81 USD, so not bad overall. In addition, there was a promotion that gave us $10 off the buffet, 2 match plays, and an entry to the spa (we didn't use it). The hotel is older than the surrounding ones so it shows a bit of wear, but not really too bad. It's also medieval themed, so if you wonder why the hotel is darker and why the rooms are darker, that's why. It seems a bit smokier smelling than the other hotels, again, it's older and likely has set in over the years. The room we had was non-smoking and had two queen beds. Large room, clean, smelled smoke-free, bathroom very clean with shower only (who bathes in hotels anyways? Yuck.) Beds could be a bit more desired though. GREAT location for the price. Tram connects to the Luxor and Mandalay Bay. You can take the trolley to the Las Vegas Outlet Mall for $2 a person. The buffet is one of the better ones around and not that expensive ($14.50 for dinner). The Luxor's buffet is $20 and has nicer ambience, a little bit better food, but each has its plus and minuses. Regardless, food was very good. There's security at each tower entrance and you have to show your room key (nice bonus), and there's also time-share people coming right at you all the time. No different than a lot of other hotels and along the strip. Just ignore them and you'll be fine. Overall I would stay here again. Previous reviews have metnioned poor service and unfriendly staff. Never ran into any of that, most were more than willing to help. To get to the hotel you can take a shuttle from the airport that'll cost you about $10 return. Easy and great way to get there and back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Tired Hotel”
Reviews.Author: teamla
Reviews.Content: We were a group of six and booked our stay at Excalibur via Expedia because of its location and price. We got basically what we wanted for beds, but were asked about smoking/non-smoking when we arrived, so I think that was still up for grabs. Overall, the hotel is older and the theme looks tired and somewhat shabby. Our room had the basic amenities (shower only though, no bathtub). The bed was hard, but passable. We had some valuables, so we left the Do Not Disturb sign up over the 3 days we were there, and we were left alone. The casino is definitely the most smokey of any we visited, so we only really slept at the hotel. We much preferred Luxor and New York New York on either side of Excalibur and spent our time and money there and exploring the other hotels. We never ate at the hotel, but other people in our group tried the snackbar off the casino floor and didn't recommend it. The coffee booth by the entrance to Tower 2 looked good, but we didn't try it. The Starbucks off the casino floor, where we grabbed coffee one morning, might be the slowest in the world. Note: There is a coupon for a free donut in the booklet you get at check-in, which you can redeem at the 24-hour Krispy Kreme in the passageway to the Luxor, if you are desperate for a snack on the way back to your room at 4:00am... If we go back, we'd probably spend more for a slightly nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: acaj
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a great stay at the Excalibur in beautiful Las Vegas. We had a wonderful time. We chose this hotel for two reasons, location on the strip (right across from MGM and New York New York) and price. There is sooooo much to do and see in Vegas we decided to spend less on the room and more on the adventure. The hotel is clean, offers full amenities, rooms are average but nice, express check-in and out is fantastic (no lines), locations is perfect. Although at the south end of the strip we found it was close enough to some of the more fun hotels. Basically in Vegas you walk and walk and walk. No matter where you are on the strip there is always a hotel you want to visit that is further away. The Excalibur provided us with exactly what we needed, a comfortable bed to sleep in and a clean room. We spent most of our time out and about, experiencing Vegas. I would definetly stay at the Excalibur again. Sure the hotel is not as luxurious as the newer ones but we got to visit them anyway. They are open to all. The Excalibur was a great deal for us and we were very satisfied with it all. For those who complained that the casino was smokey (news flash they all are). People smoke everywhere. Even in the lobby of the Bellagio. All in all a great place to stay. Great value, great price.

Reviews.Title: “Not As Bad As Expected”
Reviews.Author: Ginger44
Reviews.Content: Having booked our week at the Excalibur a year in advance, I got to read alot of comments about the hotel. About 50% of them rubbished the place while the other 50% gave it a fair rating. We never expected the hotel to be as glamorous as the Bellagio or the Wynn but it certainly was not as dirty or depressing as some reviewers claimed. We found the staff to be friendly, the breakfasts were great and there were enough slots to keep us gambling there. We had previously stayed at the Stratosphere and I would say both hotels rate their 3 stars. For those on a budget the Excalibur is a grand place to stay and I would have no problem going back there sometime.

Reviews.Title: “Really not too bad and a good location to boot...”
Reviews.Author: Rilaw
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just stayed at the Excalibur (Oct. 14-18) for a little getaway from reality. I have visited LV numerous times, but this was our first stay at the Excalibur. So anyway, here is review from a “normal” person, which should help other “normal” people when deciding whether or not to make this a location to stay in. The Excalibur is a very large hotel/casino. It is quite clean, has been kept up well over the years. Check in and out was quick, with no issues. There are two nice pools (One was closed during our stay) with an outside food and beverage area (The food was below standard, but the drinks were very good). The décor of the Excalibur could definitely use some help, but as I said, it was kept up well. On the second floor there is a food court area with a McDonalds, sandwich/pizza shop, etc. (The line is very long in the am at Mc’ds). Security is posted at all entrances to the hotel tower elevators, and your room key must be shown to the guard to proceed. The Spa area seemed very nice and professional (We did not use the spa, but did wander through), and the gym/workout area was actually large and well equipped. The hallways to the rooms were dimly lit, and the décor was dated. The rooms were of a good size, very clean, and fine for staying in if your not going to be in them for anything but sleeping (This was all we needed it for, so it was ok), but had to be the oldest looking hotel room I have ever stayed in. The room looked like we had just stepped back in time to 1982 (I was surprised there was no shag carpet). The bed was not the best, but not the worst. We actually walked into the room and noticed no comforter on the bed. I made a call, and was informed that they were “going through a remodel” and the new comforters were not in yet, but “we triple sheeted the bed for you”, ok, that was a first. We did not eat at the restaurants or buffet because of the other reviews (The buffets at MGM, Rio, and the Luxor were very good). Here is one piece of advice for anyone who does not want to fall into the time-share scams: AVOID THE PAIN IN THE BUTT PEOPLE IN THE BLUE SUITS AT VARIOUS BOOTHS THROUGHOUT THE EXCALIBUR!!!!! These people are hardcore pains, they bother you every time you walk by them; “Newlyweds?, Where are you from?, Want free show tickets?, etc., etc…. We were ready to kill them by the last day.. So, all in all, if you’re looking for a clean, decent place to stay, with a good location on the strip I recommend Excalibur. We stayed here because it was reviewed ok, and it was one of the cheaper choices in the package we purchased (It was the best choice of the locations offered in the package, at a value price). I have stayed at Ballys, Paris, and TI in LV before, and would definitely stay at all of them again, but would not return to the Excalibur unless there was a really good deal. Hope this helps, good luck....

Reviews.Title: “Great location pool not great”
Reviews.Author: glamourpuss1000
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights, it was cheap, clean, comfortable, and the location is excellent, we ate at the Luxor and the MGM, it doesn't matter where your room is as everything is close together. We paid an extra $10 for a view of the strip which was worth the money as the room didn't cost very much. The hotel has 2 pools but they are 3 feet deep throughout and we found it very difficult to swim in them. Likewise the slides are for children. Otherwise I would recommend it as a budget option for anyone who wants to stay on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “it's still OK”
Reviews.Author: billybclubbin
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here once before & it's still OK for the price. Great location & low enough table limits for black jack. Booked on the Excalibur website & requested non smoking King room. Checked in & received Smoking w/ 2 Queens.

Reviews.Title: “A kooky place”
Reviews.Author: Aldis
Reviews.Content: How can you label a hotel as being child friendly when you have to troll through the business end of the casino with your togs to get to the swimming pool? There are no changing rooms at the pool, just toilets. The swimming pools open at 10am and close around 7pm, just when the weather is getting pleasant for a swim. There was no soap or shampoo provided in the room for us, and it took a couple of trips for housekeeping to get them delivered. No free internet was provided, and both pay terminals were down the evening I needed to use them. Our room cost us USD$257 on a Thursday night, and it was really ordinary. We had a view out over a faux Disney castle scene. The air conditioning was so noisy that it woke me with a start every time the thermostat switched on. Every time we went anywhere in the hotel we were badgered by sales people on commission trying to get us to attend a timeshare sales seminar. At every other hotel we stayed at in the USA we were always made to feel like welcomed guests. Here we felt like a nuisance at the front desk. All in all an expensive mistake staying here.

Reviews.Title: “EH, so so”
Reviews.Author: bickey11
Reviews.Content: We chose the Excalibur because of the price and location. This was my second trip to Vegas and we'd stayed at the Luxor previously and loved it. We figured for a little less money we could be a little further from the end of the Strip and stay in a decent place. The first room they gave us had a view of a brick wall, so we asked for another room, the 2nd room had a better view, but the beds did not have comforters, apparently they were remodeling the rooms and didn't have any. Odd that the next day we saw them delivering comforters to the room next door. The rooms were ugly as heck and did not have a tub only a large shower. I was fighting a cold and could have used a nice hot bath. They were fairly clean, but VERY unimpressive considering the locale and price of this hotel. They did not offer the opportunity to upgrade although I'd heard they had plenty of rooms available. At the Luxor they upgraded us to a Suite for free w/out even asking. Here I asked and they said NO. Oddly the tables in the casino were beat up and old. It may be an odd thing to complain about, but it was junky. The people were friendly and I highly recommend the Champagne Brunch Buffett. It was excellent. Overall it wasn't bad, but I just expected a little more glitz for the being on the Strip. Probably will pay more to stay at a nicer establishment next time. Pool was very unimpressive, no music, water slides and falls did not work. We went to the Luxor pool every day instead.

Reviews.Title: “Griswolds go to Vegas!!”
Reviews.Author: Rdrkplaza
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the excalibur 7 nights during April school vacation with teenage boys they loved it ! We were scared about staying here with the reviews, those people that write bad reviews about the excalibur need to get a life!! We had a room on 27th floor overlooking the strip What A View at night with all the lights. Room was clean, comfortable,and quiet to sleep what more can you ask for ? Location is great for kids who like arcades you have your chioce of excalibur's midway , Luxor's arcade is right next door , Gamework's is across the street . The boy's loved the Tournment of Kings dinner show . Hotel staff was friendly and helpful . Slot machines were a little stingy but still had a great time gambling. Food wasn't too high priced and actually was pretty good for buffet food. We had a great time at the Excalibur we already booked our next trip Griswolds Go to VEGAS July 2007 for 8 nights. See you in July !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in Vegas !!”
Reviews.Author: shutl4unme
Reviews.Content: Why not stay on the strip when the price is as low or lower than off strip hotels?! Best days are during the week. You can still see all the shows and save $$ too. Don't miss the Tournament of Kings dinner show at Excalibur. It's awesome !! The guys aren't hard on eyes either. They also have Thunder Down Under. Aussies that DEFINATELY work out at the gym !!!! The entire staff is very helpful and rooms are clean and spaceous.

Reviews.Title: “Sub par for Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: avalonsidh
Reviews.Content: Excalibur is a cheap place to stay for the most part. Don't expect special treatment. I've stayed in cheaper that were better. Try the Las Vegas Hilton. It was much better. I went in summer and there were kids everywhere. So if you have kids, it's probably a good value for you. But singles and couples w/o kids will not have a good time. No nightlife to speak of and very few bars, all open to the casino floor. No lounges to just chill out in. The buffet was the worst I've ever had in my many trips to Las Vegas. But it was inexpensive compared to most. I stayed because I was with a friend that suggested it since she had a players club card and we did get the 1st night free due to her points. So it's hard to say no to a free night. But I won't stay there again. The pool was sub par. No umbrellas or shade if you wanted it. And it was teeming with kids. Drinks at the pool were expensive except for the bucket of beer. If you don't drink beer, watch your wallet! Staff was generally friendly. We did have some problems with check in. They didn't want to give us the free night. And then they called the next day and said my friend's credit card was declined and we needed to make other arrangements to pay for the second night. My friend called her credit card company and they said there was no problem with the card. She tried to pay again and yet again the card was declined. We went to the ATM and pulled out cash off the credit card. There didn't seem to be a problem at all. And I have to say the staff member helping us was not nice and seemed to think we were deadbeats, and treated us as such. The 24 hr coffee shop restaurant was great. The wait staff was wonderful, especially the late shift. We had one waiter in particular we loved. He treated us great! Food was pretty good for the value. I prefer coffee shop restaurants to the buffets because the food is usually better and I can't eat my money's worth at the all you can eat places. The room was so so. The whole place needs some updating. And the non smoking floor stunk of smoke, including our room. Maids were friendly and room was clean except for the shower/tub. I found a hair. And you know what kind I'm talking about! It was on the wall of the shower. YUCK!!!!!!! One other small thing, the elevators were sweltering. Everyone complained about them. A suggestion would be to add some a/c. Didn't try the more expensive restaurants, so can't give an opinion. The hotel/casino layout was bizarre. Check in is miles away from the two hotel towers and you can easily get lost. All in all just a slightly below average place. Try it if you're on a budget with kids. Everyone else, pick another place. I'm coming back to Las Vegas in Oct/Nov and will be staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than I expected!”
Reviews.Author: JorgeZD
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Excalibur recently and I have to say that I was very surprised by the service I received there. The staff made the experience of staying there just perfect--from the moment we arrived to the time we checked out. The rooms were of good size (make sure you request Tower II for great views of the strip). I would stay at the Excalibur again and would recommend the hotel to anyone who wants to stay on the strip and pay reasonable price for top noch service.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Excalibur in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: 26scream
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Las Vegas. Fourth trip to vegas so decided to stay at 3 different hotels. Stayed at the Flamingo - wasn't too bad - rates were reasonable. Only stayed there 2 nights, because they claimed to be full on the 3rd night. Then we went and stayed at the Stratosphere for the next 4 nights, .because we checked on the internet for their rates before we left home. They were quoting rates like $63.00 a night. On the net it looked like one of the cheapest places to stay. Not so. We paid $98.99 a night and $198.00 on the weekend for a very small room and the window didn't open. Pool was nice though. Then we stayed 6 nights at the Excalibur at the other end of the strip. We paid $54.90 a night and $126.90 on the weekend. What a bargain! It was the nicest and biggest rooms we had and you could even open the window a couple of inches. We were impressed with the security by the elevators before you could go up to your room, and also the little coffee bar so you didn't have to wait in a lineup at Starbucks if you didn't want to.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: frommidwest
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Tower 2 on the fourth floor. We asked for a non-smoking room and that is what we received. The room was very spacious. The bathroom was very clean with a decent sized shower not a tub/shower. The king sized bed was very comfortable. We found that the room was very adequate for the little time that you would be there. The casino unfortunately was very smoky. You smelled the cigarette smoke from the minute you walk in the door until you get onto the elevator. We found that some of the other casino's were not as bad. I would not recommend the casino if you are very sensitive to cigarette smoke. We were very frustrated by the timeshare people as well. They would attack you no matter what hotel/casino you were in, not just the Excalibur. They are even out on the street. They would not only ask you how long you were staying, but some would ask if you wanted free tickets. They are dressed in suits and look like the hotel staff. Some are very aggressive and will get in your face. You almost have to get rude to them. The Sherwood Forest Cafe was very good. The Roundtable Buffet was great for breakfast. There are lots of choices! There are many buffets that are approx. 50-75 feet long. Plus there are different buffets for Chinese, Mexican, and desserts. The breakfast buffet during the week is only $10.99 and if you leave hungry, if is your own fault. There are plenty of taxi's available from the Excalibur. The taxi from the airport to the Excalibur was around $16.00 not including tip. The taxi' drivers were very nice and helpful even though there may have been a slight language barrier. We were able to catch the shuttle to the airport after our stay was over. The shuttle was $5.50 per person. You may store your luggage at the bell hop area if you have arrived before check in or need to check out long before your flight out. This was free. I would suggest tipping though. We did not know we were supposed to and we had gotten quite the look from the bell hop. I would recommend the Excalibur. It is next to New York New York and is towards one end of the strip. We would definately stay there again if we ever go back to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Oscar_De_La_Hoya
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I had stayed at the Excalibur, and I thoroughly enjoyed it once again! The Hotel and Casino is cleaned to a very high standard, the rooms are spacious, beds are the most comfortable I have slept in, bathroom is clean with a big shower cubicle and the staff are very friendly. With regards to another reviewer who mentioned the price of food, I can highly recommednt the 'Sherwood Forrest' restaurant on the Casino level. The food is delicious and reasonabley priced. The Hotel is conveniently situated at the 'top end' of the strip, with easy acces to the Luxor, Mandalay Bay, New York New York and the MGM Grand. The swimming pools, although not that deep are very clean and tidy, with poolside snacks and drinks available. I will have no hesitation in staying here again the next time I find myself in Vegas!! STAY NOWHERE ELSE!!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: unclebud_93463
Reviews.Content: Excalibur was a surprisingly good value in my opinion, for the hotel portion. Everything else, including all of Las Vegas is a different story. The food and beverage now in Vegas everywhere are more expensive than any place I have been, of course it used to be the opposite and that was part of what made Vegas fun. Now you will get hammered on the bar/restaurant tab and the gambling (if you lose). On this last trip, I have as much bankroll for food and beverage as I did for gaming. Back to the hotel itself. The room was great, nice bathroom with marble and a steamer in the shower and plenty of room. The beds were super comfortable. The room felt clean and smelled good. I agree with what other reviewers have said about the timeshare hawks. It is really inappropriate and uncomfortable. Although I was not approached because I was with my friends and not my wife, I did see them confronting most of the couples and baby boomer generation folks that walked by them. Your best bet is to put a mean look on your face like you just lost a bunch of money and look straight ahead as you walk past them. You will know it's them because they all say the same thing "how long are you staying here?" I think it is too bad that Excalibur allows this garbage, they must think their guests are primarily idiots who will actually buy timeshares (as that is a qualifier for purchasing). In either case, I still recommend Excalibur for its great location, nice rooms, and the pool area was nice too. Good Luck.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Mrs.Bart
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Sept 15 -18 and have stayed here previously. I don't think I'll stay here again. The staff is lovely, but the rooms just aren't that comfortable. I had booked a 'deluxe' room and ended up with a 'view' room. The view was great, but I really wanted a good bed. The room, 26141, could definitely use a couple new mattresses. I could feel springs. There was no comforter on the bed, only a linen wrapped blanket. We had to request extra blankets and pillows, which were oddly lumpy. Be prepared to be harrassed by time share sales people. I was shocked at how well they could ignore 2/3s of the people, but harrass me at every stop. I wish they could convert the walkway between check-in and out to the rooms to a non-smoking corrider as well. When I ran down for my morning cup of tea at Starbucks around 6 AM each morning, I was pleasantly surprised by how un-smoky the casino was. There smoke blowers do work. They just can't handle the volume.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a Few Day Stay”
Reviews.Author: BarrieLew
Reviews.Content: My company booked travel and hotel accomodations after our office won a contest. We stayed on various floors and in both towers of the Excalibur and we all enjoyed our stay. The hotel staff were all professional and very appreciative of even the most thrifty of tips and everyone seemed to be very knowledgeable about how to get everywhere. The beds were comfortable, the rooms were clean and the restaurants (we sampled them all) were superb!...that buffet on the 2nd floor cannot be beat! The drinks were strong and the plates were hardy. We walked and rode Vegas. The cabs are your best bet...fast and inexpensive! If you have time to waste, take the trolley, but don't waste your $6 for a day pass...it will take you all day to go one way to the Premier Outlet Stores. The shows are NY quality, but you don't really have to dress up. Just make sure you wear a good shoe, avoid flip flops! You need a good walking shoe. Remember plenty of water because the atmosphere will suck the living juices from your skin. Your face and lips and skin will literally crack without adequate hydration....so remember the lotions, creams and sunscreen too. We couldn't believe what the heat did to our lovely pedicures either. Oh, don't carry a shoulder bag! Invest in one of those fanny packs because your shoulders will tire from the weight of your purse. Take advantage of the massage stops...your shoulders and back will need it. Leave your kids at home if you are squeamish about nudity, drunkeness, vulgarity or ignorance because (like everywhere in the world) Vegas attracts a certain element that even some adults may find distasteful (to the 4th power) and the freaks do come out at night! Otherwise, limit your stay to 3 days or so and you'll have a really good time...it gets old fast. Not as fast as NYC, not as diverse as MIAMI, not as boring as LA, not as jazzy as CHICAGO, and not as big as RHODE ISLAND..........but fun anyhow.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: ian1784
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and i stayed here for only 3 1/2 nights and it was no where near enough. The food in the cafe on the gaming floor was great, as was the service. The only negatives that i can come up with is that check in was a bit slow (we got there just as check in opened), our toilet overflowed, which was fixed very promptly by housekeeping, no in-room fridge, so the drinks that i had i couldn't keep cold unless i used an ice bucket. The gaming i found to be some of the best out of the casinos i visited and the drinks sevice was well above expectations. They even gave us a courtesy call the day before we left and asked if we would like a late check out or an extra night, for less than what i booked it for. The bed was Huge as well as the shower. All the staff were very helpful and earned their tips. All in all i give this hotel a 10 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Johnboy63
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel a year before we went because of friends recomendation and the cost. Before travelling we read some of the coments here and were worried we had done the wrong thing! When we arrived there was no queue at check-in (Sunday afternoon) and we were allocated a room in Tower 1, 27 floor with views overlooking the Luxor. The room was large and clean and suited our needs, the beds were comfortable. Not been a lover of buffets we ate at the Sherwood Forest Cafe a few times, the service was good, the food was excellent1, with a varied menu and the prices were good!(Why pay $35 at Wynns when you can eat for less than $10?) The pool area was clean and we always managed to find loungers, no matter what time of day we decided to visit. The only downside was the timeshare salesmen who hassled you at every opportunity (but this is the same in lots of hotels on the strip) just tell them you won't be in town the next day - they soon leave you alone! The hotel could do with a lick of paint and new carpets, but it is clean and that's the main thing. Overall we had a great time, the hotel's in a great location and has everything you need.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: missrocky
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas many, many, many times and have learned that there's no reason to book an expensive hotel room when you're only going to be showering, MAYBE sleeping and hopefully ...well, you know. If you want to impress your friends by staying in a $399 a night hotel, so be it- you'll have $300 less to gamble. ANYWAY- I got my room for $79 a night and it was worth EVERY PENNY!. We did self check in and got a great room with no view by the elevator. Perfect for me but if you've never been to Vegas, get a view room. At night, the Strip is amazing! Our room was clean and the bed was SO comfortable that I actually took the sheet off just to see what kind it was so I can BUY one! The pillows were great too. I went to the SPA- one day for treatments and another for steaming and jacuzzing...it was great and reasonably priced. I got a facial/ wrap/massage package for $140. any other Spa on the strip charges at least $300 for these services. The casino is loud- just the way it should be! All the updated slots and table games you could ever need! The buffet is gross but we received coupons when we checked in and ended up paying $5 for the 2 of us to eat...only paying $5 made it taste a lot better. This is a good hotel for kids- but I really don't recommend bringing kids to Vegas...it's an adult amusement park- but if you have to bring them, this is a good place to stay. The pool is not as large as it seemed in the pictures and the deepest it goes is 3 1/2 feet. If you're tall, you're gonna hate it. I had a margarita breakfast by the pool which consisted of a strawberry marg. in a plastic, clear football for $13. It was worth every penny! As a matter of fact, I wish I had one now. THIS IS NOT A 5 STAR HOTEL- but trust me, you can make it into a 5 star vacation if you stay here and spend what you've saved on the room around VEGAS.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!”
Reviews.Author: leturtle
Reviews.Content: We just returned from staying 6 nights at this hotel, and thought everything about it was wonderful! The staff couldn't have been nicer. They were able to answer any questions we had - right away! The room was clean and comfortable. I would stay there again in a heartbeat! Thanks Excalibur staff!

Reviews.Title: “Better Places to Spend Your Money!”
Reviews.Author: Gauggel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur from Sept 10 to 14th. We came to Vegas for my brother's wedding, which took place at the Excalibur Chapel. First off, I hadn't been to Vegas since 1996 and boy has it changed and I think for the worst. This is indeed an American Cesspool as one reviewer stated. Vegas is not only filthy dirty with beer bottles and topless photos of women everywhere, but is extremely expensive. No longer are the days of $5.00 buffets or a buck a beer (or free beer for that matter). I wasn't impressed with any of the sights there, it's over extravegant, and excessive to the extreme. As for the hotel, I stayed there in 1996 and it was okay then, now it's run down and in dire need of a reno. Our room was clean and quiet, but the pool area was dirty as well as the casino and restaurants. I actually saw a cockroach at the McDonald's (2nd floor) on the wall....Yikes! Another reason the stay wasn't all that pleasant was the constant bombardment by salesman for some stupid timeshare / casino deal. Everytime you came in or out of the casino, they jumped all over you. We found out that every hotel on the strip has this new deal now. It's a real pain. Another thing about the Excalibur is the constant humming of helicopters that fly between New York New York and Excalibur. It starts at 8:30 am sharp to 2:00 am. If you're outside, it's horrible. All in all, it was neat to see the changes made in the last 10 years, but we don't think we would come to Vegas again anytime soon. For the amount of money we spent, I would rather be on the beach in Mexico. Good Luck!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christine166
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights and found the Excalibur to be a very good hotel. We stayed in tower 2 and our room was very spacious and very comfortable. The hotel itself is very busy and has a lot of amenities. The buffet breakfast was great, we did not try lunch or dinner. The coffee bar at the entrance to tower 2 was fantastic and is open 24 hours. The Excalibur is located quite far down the south of the strip, it is very close to New York New York, Luxor, MGM and the Mandelay Bay. There is a tram or a moving walkway from the Excalibur that will take you to the luxor and the Mandelay Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: RBG81601
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights at the end of June. No line at check in and I was literally only at the counter for two minutes. Room is big, quiet, bathroom is really big and clean, beds were comfortable. What more do you need out of a place you spend the most time in with your eyes closed.
