Used the pool which was great, lots of chairs and the water was just right. Casino is big and layed out well. There is a Starbucks and Pizza Hut on the level above the casino. Avoid the buffet, it was not good. Did the self checkout which took under a minute. The location is great - there is an escalator and monorail connecting the hotel to Luxor and Mandalay Bay, and the pedestrian overpasses connect the hotel to New York New York, MGM Grand and Tropicana. I will totally stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: WDH-NY
Reviews.Content: First, a disclaimer, I really think Las Vegas is a horrible city. I went to Las Vegas for a family occaison and found it to be everything that I expected it to be. It realy is the cesspool of American culture. The first few nights I was traveling alone and stayed at the Westgate Flamingo Bay resort which was extremely nice for the price. Then I met up with family and stayed for the remainder of the trip at the Excalibur. This hotel is really not worth the price at all. It is run down and the staff is not personable at all. The service was inline with McDonalds, there seemed to be a lack of attention and interest in what these people were doing. Having come from a hotel that cost less and was a much nicer I really felt that I was being ripped off, but I guess that is the nature of Las Vegas. If you must stay on the strip I'm sure there are nicer hotels in the same price range. I understand that they try to market this place as a family hotel but it's really not, it's Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Castle!”
Reviews.Author: tombradygirl
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I had a 3 day romantic getaway and the Excalibur was awesome!!! We love it there!!! We like this one best. The staff is very friendly and the whole environment is out of this world!!! I highly recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur should be renamed Excrapur”
Reviews.Author: Trvln-T
Reviews.Content: Describtion for the Excalibur... Our room was dingy and dirty, we found huge hairballs on the carpet, gum on the nightstand, the trash hadn't been removed from the previous guest, our view was of a concrete wall, walking to the bathroom turned our feet black, it seems to be lounder than all of the other casinos we visited, the buffet was very over priced and really bad, the pool is so packed with unattended kids there was no way to find room to use it. The elevators were not working or partly working. The cable TV was equal to using rabbit ears antennas. If you do stay at the Excalibur make sure you put the Do Not Disturb sign up, b/c every morning at 8 the cleaning staff comes around to bang on your door. The hotel overall was just filthy, grimy and you felt unclean. I haven't stayed in a hotel this dirty since I stayed in a youth hostel in Europe - and at least that had charm.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was great!!”
Reviews.Author: SwtCanuck
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur August 21-25,2006 and it was fantastic. The front desk was quick and efficient. We were in our room 10 minutes later. The room rates we got on-line were great!! The room is larger than most. I liked the shower only, it was quite big (if you know what I mean ;-) !!) The house cleaning did a fabulous job every day. We did tip them everyday and they left us a couple of extra towels which was appreciated. The hotel was easy to navigate and was close to alot of the things we wanted to see and do. There was ample (and safe) parking out back. The pool is saltwater and it reminded my husband of home. It was busy but we were able to find 1chair to store our belongings on. We ate at the Sherwood forest cafe for breakfast and it was delicious. Check out was great. I like to go up to the counter and deal with real people and we were through in less than 5 minutes!! My husband and I like to try new casinos every time we go but we highly recomend the Excalibur and would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Balance - Great For Families”
Reviews.Author: MAddBarker
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur from Aug 3 - 12. Our mid-afternoon check-in was a breeze - there was no line at the desk. While not the most luxurious accomodations we have had, the room was adequate and comfortable. We were on the 19th floor and had a view of the airport, Luxor, and Mandalay Bay. While it had no tub, the bathroom was large as was the shower. The beds were comfortable -- the only issue we had with the room was that there was no truly "comfortable" chair to sit in. We liked the fact that we had to show our room key every time we approached the elevators - great security. Regarding the elevators, the middle elevator (upper floors) in Tower 1 performed inconsistently. Several times it would not leave the main level, and the doors would open, close, open, etc. We patronlzed the food court a few times, as well as the Regale Italian restaurant (excellent) and the buffet and Sherwood Forest(good). Other dining options were conveniently located at New York New York and MGM Grand. The Timeshare Hawks were always lurking when we entered the hotel. A good strategy for avoiding them is to give the appearance of not being a family or couple, whom they seem to only approach. However a "no thanks" and wave of the hand works equally well. Our son liked the Midway Arcade - it was the best one of all of the hotels we visited. The casino was large, but not overwhelmingly so. Although immense in size, it is relatively easy to find your way around the property. This is evidenced by the fact that my directionally-challenged wife quickly learned how to get around in the hotel. The pool area was fine - we only visited it once, on a Friday afternoon, and had no problem finding a group of 3 empty chairs. We used the valet parking service almost every time. Once we returned to the hotel in the evening and were greeted with a "valet full" sign. It took us a while to find a parking place, and then it was somewhat of a walk to the building. The next night we were greeted with the same sign, but we were accomodated anyway. In all, the valet service was efficient and the attendants were courteous. Our reservations were made initially through the hotel's website. However I received a promotional email from the property a week before our arrival which quoted lower rates. I phoned the reservation desk and was quickly accomodated with the lower rates. Are there more economical properties in Las Vegas? Probably. Are there more luxiourious ones? Definitely. But, if you are looking for a good balance between the two extremes, the Excalibur is a great fit.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: CruisingandDriving
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel about 15 times over the years. We just returned from our latest trip and will never stay there again. First, the check-in was so messed up. We did express check-in over the phone and were told the room was ready. When we swiped our card at the self-service terminal it said the room was not ready and to check back. We stood in line for about 20 minutes to be told that was a mistake and the room was ready. The room had a nice view but there was not a drop of soap, shampoo or conditioner in the room. Nothing. That's a first for me. As my daughter was getting settled in, she saw something under the bed and pulled it out. You guessed it...an unopened (thank god!) condom. Lovely. Later that night we smelled a terrible smell. I went into the bathroom and the sink had obviously bubbled up with sewage of some sort. It was so disgusting. But we were all ready for bed and weren't in the mood to move everything. But right then and there we decided we were checking out the next day (one day earlier than planned) and never coming back. The other new thing they're doing is a timeshare hard-sell, mugging kind of thing as you walk through the casino. One time we were asked, "where do you live?" Like it's any of their business. The other time as I was walking alone with my two kids I was asked "are you single?" Are you kidding me? I pay for this? The answer is never again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for kids !”
Reviews.Author: Peter&Juli
Reviews.Content: My wife and i have been to Vegas on numerous occasions but this was our first trip with our two youngest children (7 & 14). whilst we have stayed at the top end hotels we wanted a hotel that would be kid friendly and to be honest we made a good choice. the rooms are more than adequate and the facilities good. the kids enjoyed the pool and there were pleanty of other children around for them to play with. for the money this is a good choice as a base to explore Las Vegas. we would definately recommend it for families.

Reviews.Title: “Most uncomfortable bed on the strip”
Reviews.Author: melsriver
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Excalibur for two nights this past weekend. We got a great deal on the price, however I don't think you could pay me to return to this hotel. The pillows on the bed are one lump of foam, the beds all slope in the middle, and are soooo uncomfortable! Almost slept on the floor the second night, thought it would be better than the bed. As for the service, all I can say is wow there are some miserable people that work there! We ate at the Sherwood Forest Cafe and drank at several of the bars in the casiono. We got sandwiches at the cafe and it took two hours. At the bar I asked for a beer three times and each time the bartender would nod and walk away and never returned with a beer. Finally my husband pulled out some cash went to another bartender to order. Our friends were staying at the Aladdin and that was a great hotel. Excalibur just isn't worth the hassle! On a positive note if you are in vegas and want to see a show, we went to see Zumanity at New York, New York, it was fantastic! Definitely worth it! Also ate at N9ne Steakhouse at the Palms and that was phenomenal!! The food and service were outstanding! The manager of the restaurant even walked us over to the ghostbar afterwards and got half of us in for free. Definitely worth the price for the food and service we received there. If we were to return to Vegas we most definitely would not stay at the Excalibur again.

Reviews.Title: “Hey the room was $48 bucks a night....”
Reviews.Author: Jaineen
Reviews.Content: And for 48 bucks a night it was perfect! I do not recommend the buffet at all. Everything tasted as though you had to "just add water". YUCK

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: haley01
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at Excalibur for one night, Aug 24. We got the room for about $60 for a Thursday night. We had been at the Grand Canyon that morning, so we were pretty tired when we got to the hotel. We checked in (they have self check-in, but it wasn't working) and went up to the room around 4 pm. The AC wasn't on, and it was about 110 degrees outside, so the room was pretty hot. We showered and went out again around 5:30, and when we got back after midnight, it still wasn't very cool in the room. It was finally cool when we woke up in the morning. The hotel is big. We didn't use the pool or eat at any of the restaurants, so I can't give any opinions on those. However, l will say that the rooms are pretty tired. It was OK for us this time since we were only there for one night, but I would have been disappointed if I had booked 3 or 4 nights there. I would compare it to an older Best Western. The furniture and decor in the rooms were quite outdated. The bed was comfortable enough--pretty standard. I'd probably stay at Bally's or Flamingo over Excalibur if I were looking for a hotel in this price range on the strip. But if you have kids with you, there were a lot of them at Excalibur and this is probably a good place.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: JulieMCCoy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Excalibur August 18 and 19 with my husband and 2 teenagers. The room was large and clean (we paid $10 extra to get a bigger room) but the hotel is worn out. I am not very picky but i would not stay here again. The hotel was littered with straws and cups by the elevators and in the hallway to our room. There was a day bed up against the wall for most of a day making it look like a Motel 6. The hotel has everything you need for a comfortable and fun stay but it needs upgraded due to the wear and tear. You get what you pay for here. If you are like us - site seeing all day and night - then you are not in the hotel much making this hotel o.k.You most likely can get bargains at other hotels as well that would feel more like a nice Vegas hotel on the Strip. The pool is nice but it is difficult to find lounge chairs. The best pool on the Strip is at the Flamingo! The beds were fine but the pillows have seen better days. There are no bath tubs - just a square shower stall with basic amenities. You get plastic cups and plastic ice bucket. No frills what so ever.

Reviews.Title: “A Princesses Fairy Tale Visiti with a Happy Ending”
Reviews.Author: AliCatAngel
Reviews.Content: We got married at Little Chapel of the Flowers two weeks ago (fantastic see whole review under that heading for Little Chapel of the Flowers if interested) - and we stayed at Excalibur - it looks like a giant castle, which is wonderful if you have children and want something extremely reasonable and on the strip. The rooms were large and clean. My daughters didn't like their mattresses, but mine was new and great. The staff seems very accommodating. Anyway who can complain with the deal we got??? We got two adjoining rooms for under $100 a night together! (Again you must search for a discount this good - I found this discount thru Travelzoo and it included two visits the spa - which is a four to five star spa, with ultra clean facilities, steam room, jacuzzi, fitness center, sauna, even iced eyeclothes are included, and the discount included two buffet dinners, which were better than Mandalay Bays) Avoid the Italian restaurant in Excalibur, not a good value and food is iffy with small portions. This is a three to four star hotel. The pool is large, clean and has waterfalls and a slide. This was our second visit, the kids loved it and Vegas when they were eight and again at thirteen. Also it is nice being on the closer end of the strip to the airport. (Value tip - don't take the bus to get here and back - it is the same cost to take a cab if there are at least two of you - the bus costs $5.50 pp and the cab is ten dollars - Wish I had done this the first time, it cost me double on the bus plus took us over an hour and half to get to our hotel vs. the cab that takes 15 minutes).For the value and location you just can't beat this hotel! I would stay here again and again. Maybe one day I can even get to go to that male review show "The Thunder from Down Under" ( the only non child oriented thing in the hotel besides the casinos) - if my husband will let me........... lol!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: wenellie
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for four nights with a friend. We made the mistake of forgetting to request for a room with a view.. so the room we stayed in, which was on the 2nd floor of Tower 2, featured a wonderful view of a wall! The room had a rather strange stench to it, which seemed pretty unbearable at first. But I guess that all didn't really matter because we were hardly in our room. It met our basic needs for a place to sleep in and a place to keep our belongings while we were out. Check-in and check-out was very quick. But keep in mind, we checked in just before midnight and we took advantage of the late check out option (additional $25+tax). The housekeeping staff seemed very friendly. The bell boys/door men were friendly as well. Other than that, we didn't really have any encounters with any of the other staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the money. I'm glad we choose this place.”
Reviews.Author: skyhead
Reviews.Content: Stayed Aug 15 - 19th After reading to other reviews I was a little worried about staying here. I travel a lot for work and usually stay at Hilton Suites or Doubletree suites. While this hotel is nowhere near a hilton level is was better than I expected. The rooms were large and clean. The casino was clean. it was a little busyier than I perferred but I was always able to find a table or slot machine.The buffett was just OK, it was cheap and the food was edible. The hotel also has fast food places so you can always eat there too. We Really had a good time at this hotel and will stay here the next time we want to save money. Also check in and check out was FAST.

Reviews.Title: “Underated”
Reviews.Author: knighttravel
Reviews.Content: Excalibur is not a 5 star on the level of MGM, Bellagio, Wynn, Mandalay Bay, Venetian, etc. however it is an extremely good value for the money. Check in was quick, room service was great, the buffet was excellent, the room was neat and clean. What more do you want? I stayed at Luxor last year which is next door to Excalibur and I walked through Excalibur a lot last year and decided to actually stay there this year instead of Luxor. Nothing against Luxor but I figured if Excalibur offers the same service as Luxor and is cheaper, why not stay at Excalibur. Will gladly go back to Excalibur again. One sad note; took a tour to Hoover Dam and the tour guide was telling us that the future plans of Las Vegas are to tear down hotels like Stardust(which will happen this year) and others in a few years like Sahara, Alladin, Flamingo, Imperial Palace, Excalibur to name most if not all and to build brand new mega casinos like Wynn, Venetian, Bellagio, etc. That is sad; then you won't be able to find the $40-$80 a night rooms and will have to spend $150 on up.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every dime!!”
Reviews.Author: daviesfamilytour
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our two children aged 16 &11 for two nights last week, during a longer stay in Vegas. We booked online a few months ago, requesting a room with view. This is what we got. A view overlooking the New York New York (including the roller coaster). We cannot fault the hotel at all. Check in was easy and quick. The room excellent, especially the bathroom with exceptionally large shower cubicle. Took our lap top and connected to the internet for $10.99 a day, excellent to keep in touch with friends and family. As we overlooked the roller coaster, we had to do it. Well worth the few minutes of sheer terror!! Reccomend the buffet and krispi kreme donuts!! The pool area was simple not over fussy with waterfalls etc. Towels provided. All in all well worth the money, and not overly priced. Will go again. Alan Tracy George & Tomos. Oxford England

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel, fun casino, good food and happy times!”
Reviews.Author: ponycar1
Reviews.Content: At check-in, we were upgraded free to a queen suite with views of Tropicana, MGM, the airport, and Las Vegas Blvd--quite a view! The room was sparking clean; bathroom was huge; mattresses were firm & did NOT sag. Easy parking when using valet--why make work for yourself? Others wrote there is no coffee pot in room--their website confirms--check it before you make reservations! Delicious coffee is available in hotel at Starbucks, Pizza Hut, Krispy Kreme, & in-house restaurants. The Sunday buffet is FABULOUS--includes champagne, prime rib, huge chilled shrimp, & anything you can think of for about $15--don't miss it!! Weekday buffets are about $12--and are OK. The castle theme throughout hotel. Only 10 minutes to airport--they provide shuttle service. Walkway to NY/NY, MGM, Luxor, and Mandalay Bay. The lowest temp all last week was 101, so be sure to drink lots of water. We bought ours at Walgreen's by the case, to save a few dollars. Casino provided free drinks while gambling--even the fancy whipped cream ones. Great trip here!

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: captspock16
Reviews.Content: Excalbur is our Favorite hotel let me tell you why we stayed for 3 days last week we decided to get a spa room for 1 nite the only problem was we filled the spa got in it and the jets didnt work called mantience they came up and fixed it here why I like this Hotel got my room booked thru the one club told what happended they gave me a choice 1 free nite on my next vist or they would take half off the room I opted for my free nite when I return in Jan they have a great pool and lots of chairs went in the afternoon great snack bar fun dealers and a great poker room and our favorite place to eat was sherwood forest cafe ate there 4 times we will be back in Jan thank you Excalbur

Reviews.Title: “Not so great...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The casino was nice, but the rooms were not too great. Very basic - no coffee maker, etc. The beds were sagging in the middle with wear and were noisy. Would not reccomend with children.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for children”
Reviews.Author: C8
Reviews.Content: JUNE 26, 2006 vacation with grandchildren (ages 3 and 9) for 3 nights. Room was in Tower 1 on 23rd floor with view of MGM. The hotel was great for children. I would suggest saying in Tower 1 because it is very quiet. Tower 11 is where the pool location and it seem to be very crowded with traffic. The room was adequate with twin beds and the bathroom was large with shower only (problem for the little one) but she managed. Room service and housekeeping was great; no problems at all. The children loved the pool because it is only 3 feet and very large with a water slide which they loved. We went to the pool around 3 when it was cooler. They supplied pool towels. Great location where you can take off to MGM, New York, New York due to the walkway. Took to double decker bus which was fun also to Circus Circus. Saw the Lion at MGM and the sharks at Mana Bay (little pricey..but enjoyable). The roundtable buffet is not great, but only eat there twice for the children's breakfast and dinner. Eat at the food courts. The activities for the children is great especially the Knights dinner. The food was very good and you are served an entire Cornish Hen. If you have a small child (1,2, 3,4) and they can sit in your lap, do not purchase a ticket. The show was great and I highly recommend. Our stay was good at the hotel and this is my 2nd trip, the first with kids. Good for Kids.

Reviews.Title: “OK, not great”
Reviews.Author: mkerbsbald
Reviews.Content: We stopped at the Excalibur for one night on our way home, on June 27, 2006. Our room was clean and spacious, but the hallway on our floor smelled like a dirty diaper. We ate at the buffet, and it was ok, but not great for the price. French toast was hard as concrete. There are signs all over the casino saying "no one under 21 allowed in the gaming area", but when I asked security how we could get to the food area without taking our small children through the casino, I was told that we would have to take them through the casino to get to the elevators/escalators. That makes a lot of sense! We didn't use the 2 pools, but they appeared clean and spacious. All in all, our stay was just ok, and I would probably not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Family Deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Excalibur from June 23, 2006 to June 26, 2006. It was a good deal. I took my sister 57 years old and a 21, 18 and 15 year old. All enjoyed the Hotel. It was clean and the staff was nice. I had read many weeks of the previous reviews and was prepared for some things that might otherwise have upset me. I stayed on the 18th floor of tower 1. The view was very nice, especially at night. The bar soap was very small but I was prepared and had brought bar soap from home. The teenagers ate at the fast food places in the hotel (their choice) my sister and I ate at the buffet. I enjoyed the buffet. I have been to many buffets in Vegas and it was good choices for the money. I was also not as crowded as the other buffets I had attended on previous stays in Las Vegas. I bought the power pass which was a good deal. We did everything we wanted to from the power pass in one day. I purchased it at the stratophere on the second floor. The power pass can be purchased for 1 day up to 5 days. It has many attractions that are included for the price of $62.00 per person. My sister is a Trekkie so she was very happy with the Star Trek Experience. The Teens enjoyed it all. They were especially happy with Madame Tussades. I was surprised the family was not more impressed with the forum shops in Caesars but they thought it just so/so. I was just blown away the first time I saw it. I had took them there to experience a 4D ride that used to be there but apparently "The Race to Save Atlantis" has been discontinued. I was not happy with the transportation. We used the trolley, It is $2.00 or $5.00 for a whole day pass. But it stops at every hotel. The last time I was in Vegas about 6 years ago it was free. The seats are uncomfortable. We also bought daily passes for the duece bus. It is supposed to run every 7 minutes. But actually waited about 40 minutes to go back to the hotel on one ocassion. The bus is also very crowded. (I personally liked the old bus system better). I also noted that there would be 2 buses coming at the same time. Several time when we were pressed for time I would just get a cab. But continuously hopping in cabs is expensive. I also wanted to mention that the new "Sirens of Ti" outdoor show is just silly. The old pirate show was much better. I didn't bring little children but I don't think it was appropriate for them. (They were many,many children in the audience though.

Reviews.Title: “No problems with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dublin123Dublin
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel we stayed in on our road trip through South West USA, and I had absolutely no problems with it. We got bullied into some timeshare thing as soon as we walked in the door, but when we went to cancel and get our deposits back we had no hassle. My husband's bag didn't make it off the flight, but they rang as soon as it arrived as they promised they would. The room was on the 5th floor of Tower II and it was clean and quiet. It wasn't as glamourous as some of the other casinos, but for the price you pay it was fine, and the location is great, right next to New York New York and MGM Grand so to tell the truth we didn't spend much time in the hotel's casino as the others were nicer. There was plenty of room in the pool area during the day, although the kids would drive you mad. All in all, I wouldn't have a problem staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great value!”
Reviews.Author: carinah
Reviews.Content: I almost cancelled my reservations at this hotel based off of some of the reviews on this site. I am so glad I did not. Not only did we get a great rate, but after noticing the rates had been lowered I called and asked for the new rate, which was applied to my room. I stayed three nights at the Excalibur and could not have been happier with our stay. I traveled with family members and we requested and received adjoining rooms. The rooms were very clean and the beds were very comfortable. The shower was the biggest one I have ever seen and the water pressure was awesome. I couldn't find a single thing wrong with our room. The reviews on this site lead you to believe you will find a run down hotel. I did not feel this was the case at all. It is themed like a castle and that is exactly what it looks like. I spent time gambling in the casino and did find it to be smoky in places, but no more than any other hotel we walked through. I wish something would be done about this issue overall. I don't feel I should have to breathe second hand smoke and it should be banned in all public places including casinos. We enjoyed the fast food restaurant choices on the second level of the hotel (especially Krispy Kremes). The prices in Las Vegas are high and so it was a nice change to be able to find a cheap meal. We also spent a great deal of time in the arcade/carnival portion of the hotel for children. We had three children with us and they enjoyed the time spent. My only complaint of this hotel is here. Many of the machines were either broken down or ate our money. The children still had fun here. Once again smoking was allowed even on this level and they even provided ashtrays on this level, yuck! The early registration was great and the walkways to Luxor and Mandalay Bay were great. We were able to cross the street to get onto the Deuce Bus and used that the entire time we were there to travel up and down the strip. It is a convient walk to the New York from the bridge at the Excalibur. If you want a great value don't hesitate to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay At The Excalibur!!!”
Reviews.Author: NtrDm2004
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June 2006 for our honeymoon and it was absolutely awful! We stayed in a jacuzzi suite and the first room we were in, the jacuzzi was broken so maintenance had to come up the first night and fix it. Then we came home one night to the smell of raw sewage in our room. We were moved to another room where the jacuzzi didn't hold water, the sink in the bathroom dripped and there was no water pressure. It was an awful experience. When we complained about it, the hotel staff was less than accomodating! I would absolutely without a doubt stay away from this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it -- there's better places to stay for the $”
Reviews.Author: Sail525
Reviews.Content: Spent almost 2 weeks at this hotel (attending course held at this location), and it was one of the worst I've stayed at for customer service. I requested a quiet room (light sleeper), and was given a room with a broken AC, and traffic noise that was ridiculously loud. I went back to the front desk and asked for a different room. The first person I spoke to seemed supremely annoyed at my request. At least the person she handed me over to was a bit more pleasant, and I was given a quieter room, with a working AC. There are practically no amenities in the room (e.g. coffee maker, fridge). The ice bucket was flimsy plastic, so the milk on put on ice to have with my cereal in the morning was sitting in a bucket of water. I did find out from a fellow student that you can rent a fridge for an additional $20 per night. As I was taking a redeye, I called the front desk on my last day and requested a late checkout. The person told me that would be fine, and it would $25. When I looked at my bill, they had charged me $40. They refused to credit me the $15 difference, saying the person I spoke to had written in her notes that she quoted me $40. What, I just made up the $25 from thin air? I didn't appreciate essentially being called a liar. This is the first time I've written a review, and the reason I'm doing it is I was extremely disappointed in just about everything about this hotel. I've probably visited Las Vegas at least a dozen times, and never encountered such poor customer service, and a place with so few amenities. I could go on and on about the negatives, but bottom line, stay elsewhere -- you'll be better off.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs Up!!”
Reviews.Author: kty26
Reviews.Content: Me and my Boyfriend stayed at the Excalibur for 10days (20th June 2006 - 30th June 2006). we found the hotel to very nice, it was our third time to Vegas and we had stayed in higher class hotels but we found Excalibur to be just as nice. The Room: the room (room: 24103) was very nice we had a brilliant view of the Luxor and the bed was very comfy, the room was clean and comtable, the bathroom was large and had a shower, a bath would have been nice though. The Hotel: There are many places to eat within the hotel, we tried the Round table buffet for breakfast which had great choice of foods and was very nice, we also tried Sherwoods cafe which again was nice to eat at, we also went to the Ragele restraunt wich was a good itialian and proved popular as it was busy every nite. Although the Hotel offers a good variety of diffrent places to eat going out of the hotel to eat was sometimes cheaper. The pool was very nice, there were 2 pools available and one had 2 slides wich was great for kids. we prefered the other pool with no slides as it was quieter and more relaxing. Shows etc: We went to the tournament of the kings show but found it be not as good as expected as it was more for young children, but you get food in with the show which was a plus. we also visited the Grand Canyon with the Pink Jeep Tours, the tour was very good and intresting and i would recomend this tour if you are scared of helicopters.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur - A nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We waited a bit late to find reservations in Las Vegas but were pleasantly surprised to find reasonable rates at the Excalibur. The location was excellent; we had tickets to see David Copperfield on June 20th, and we could use the convenient walkways to get there. The hotel itself was not hard to find, though we were slightly unsure where to park at first with all the different directions we were given. When we went to check in, we were told we would have to take all of our luggage through the casinos to our room. However, we then found out that we were in Tower II, so this was not the case. On the first night or so, someone in my group detected a smell. We tried to brush it off, but eventually everyone could smell this. We stopped by the front desk on our second day early one morning, and they told us that they would look into it. We told them that we would be out most of the day, so they would have adequate time. Returning sometime that evening, the scent was overpowering as soon as we opened the door. We made a call to the front desk, explaining the situation. They agreed to send someone up. In about 15-20 minutes, a man came up to our room with a spray to get rid of smoke smell. As soon as he came in, he realized that this odor was simply not smoke! He left to find someone else. We got a call, and they offered to move us to another room that evening. We did and had no trouble with the new room. Staff told us that the other room would undergo a complete inspection, and that something might have died in there. Overall, the location was excellent. The room was nice, though we could have done with a bath in addition to the shower. The food court was convenient, and we had a really great stay!

Reviews.Title: “A Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: AJK31
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Excalibur June 23rd to the 25th. I had read the poor reviews prior to my stay so wasn't sure what to expect. When I walked in the hotel I wasn't sure where to go but signs were placed all over to direct traffic so I easily found the check-in. The check-in line appeared long but it was Friday and the line moved very quickly. I was greeted at check-in and requested a deluxe, non-smoking room which I received without any problems. From there I was directed to Tower 2 and followed the signs to the elevators. My key was checked by security which I liked. I found my room very clean and spacious. The room was also very quiet. I was happy with it and would stay at the hotel again. There is a food court on level two and a monorail that takes you to the Luxor and Mandalay Bay. The pool is in Tower 2. I found the Excalibur casino to be less smoke filled than some of the others.

Reviews.Title: “Watch Out for the Hired Help”
Reviews.Author: bengw
Reviews.Content: The hotel is showing its ware. The furniture is chipped and scratched. The elevators and doors are missing parts and are dirty. They add a $1 a day charge for local phone calls even if you do not use the phone; they also charge a $1 every time you call an 800 number. The final insult; I had a digital camera stolen right out of the room.

Reviews.Title: “A fine place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults and 2 children aged 9 and 12) stayed for 3 nights recently as part ot a larger trip around the US. This hotel is at the lower end of the price scale (assuming you avoid weekends) for a place on the strip, and for the money it is just fine. The rooms are spacious and well maintained, we are not into gambling, just sightseeing, so couldn't care about its facilities or merit as a casino. The children enjoyed it, with a reasonable sized arcade but from this aspect alone (ie childrens entertainment) Circus Circus would be a better choice. Other reviewers comment on what is a reasonable time to stay in Vegas, with a family a couple of days is more than enough. The more desirable family attractions, like rides etc, can cost you a small fortune and you soon get tired of paying out. (eg Roller coaster at NY, NY almost US$13 per person per ride.....not good family value) In summary if you are looking for somewhere that will reliably provide a good value room for a family then this will certainly do the job with no worries.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful of the elevators”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Excalibur in late June, 2006 for one week. I did not play any games here, as I prefer TI or Mirage, however I will say tha tthe lasagna at Regale is equal to the best I have had. One major drawback to my stay: the elevator I was in got stuck. I read that someone else had been stuck in one of these elevators as well. After noticing that the elevator I was stuck in was still powered off and doors propped open on the eight floor two days after the incident occurred, I really began to wonder abou the safety of the elevators in general. I also noticed that one of the lighted buttons on the "down" button did not light, and that in one elevator cab, the "Door Closed" button had been replaced with a bolt and washer... substandard maintenance? You be your own judge, but having worked in the elvator business before, I am unsure why anything but a proper repair would be made to something as critical as an elevator, and the owners of this hotel ought to check this out. Overall I would recommend the Excalibur to anyone who has kids, as the kids were plentiful at the pool, midway, etc. It is also not a bad location to stay if you intend to plat at any of the adjacent casinos (Luxor, Mandalay Bay, NY NY, MGM). It's also located fairly close to a CVS pharmacy and some discount tourist stores.

Reviews.Title: “not too happy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Excalibur from 6/11 through 6/16. We had a pacage deal through the Airline. After dragging out luggage all the way across the casino to find the check in desk we were given a room on the 2nd floor. I thought if we couldnt have a high room, one near the ground floor would be great. I was wrong. The room was as far from the elivator as it could get. The view from the room was a block wall 10 feet away. If you opened the window and looked straight up you could see the sky.The telivision only had 12 stations.There was a service elevator right next to our room and they started banging around between 5 and 6 every morning. Very annoying. I wanted to ask for a different room but my girlfriend wouldnt let me. Almost didnt want to go to the room at night. We stayed at the Riviera last year and I think we'll go there next time.

Reviews.Title: “very good until the last day”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur for 4 days in june. The hotel is not glamorous at all but our room was clean and the staff and other guest were very friendly. For the first few days i didn't understand why people were writing such bad reviews on the hotel until the last day i went to withdraw money from my bank account only to find that i had an overdraft on my account from the hotel for a purchase that i did not make.I called my bank and they called the front desk only to be told that they did not know what the charge was from.so the bank credited the money back to my account and i called my family at home just to let them know i arrived safe and sound. for a fifteen minute call i was charged SIXTY DOLLARS. if it had not been for those charges i would have been really pleased. The hotel staff is friendly and the hotel is clean if you want glamour go to the more exspensive hotels but for a family or a good deal come here. Just pay attention to all charges and check debit and credit cards if you use one.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Family Stay at Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: happytravelgrl
Reviews.Content: We had a decent stay at the Excalibur, no problems or major issues. One of the best pluses was the housekeeping staff, they did an excellent job during our stay, our standard double queen room was kept very clean and tidy. This hotel is on the low end when compared to the newer upscale casinos on the south Strip, but it is probably the most family-friendly affordable property in Las Vegas. The rooms are newer and much nicer than Circus Circus, you may regret falling prey to their cheap specials. There is a small midway with carnival games on the lower level of Excalibur, along with a 2-screen ridefilm theater. Bring a small electric travel cooler if staying with children, it is an additional $20 a day to rent a refrigerator for the standard and deluxe rooms. Only hotel guests have access to the pool area, which reduces the crowds that you find at some of the other casino pools on the Strip that are used as crosswalks much of the time. We were staying with our 7 month-old infant, and the pool was a good feature of the hotel, although they really need some shaded structures - there are no patio coverings or large shade trees around the pool whatsoever, only bright desert sun. There is a large 3 ft. pool area hidden behind the bar and snack stand, I would have missed it if I did not go looking for it, it has no signage to direct you, but it is a nice large area to find. The tropical slide was closed for long-term repair while we were there. Being a family friendly hotel, in addition to their usual signature upscale restaurants they offer a food court with Quiznos, Krispy Kreme, Pizza Hut Express, and of course McDonalds where a Sausage & Egg McMuffin is only $1. We chose to have our breakfasts in the Sherwood Forest Cafe restaurant, very fresh and lots of variety, breakfast was around $8-$11 a person. Skip the "new" Round Table Buffet - it was dried-out and generic, not fresh and over-priced poor quality despite being the cheapest on the Strip, you get what you pay for. For a few dollars more I would treat the family to the buffets at either Rio (the largest), Treasure Island or Mirage for an excelent family friendly Las Vegas buffet experience for the prices you are going to spend anyway ($20-$25 per adult is an average buffet in Las Vegas). The buffet at Rio was very family friendly and worth the wait in line. They have something for everyone and also many items you do not expect, very fresh and great variety. The staff are very organized and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “You'll be happy if you don't expect too much.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It is exactly like the other posts. The hotel is a bargin, most amenties are cheap, but the room was clean (except the mysterious smell eminating from the bathroom). We ate at the Sherwood Forest Cafe once and decided to eat the rest of the trip in other hotels. The time share people were nuts but we found alternate ways to avoid them. The pool was the real disappointment. The pool was pretty nasty. It was very salty, very shallow, and very boring. I almost cried when I say the wave pool and the moving river at the Mandalay Bay Hotel, but then I didn't have to pay for it. The Torn. of Kings show was OK. The food wasn't that good, the preformance was substandard for Las Vegas but overall it wasn't to bad. Kids will love it. Overall: You get what you pay for, however, the hotel is in a great location, and had clean rooms. We joke about it for three days, but it defintity did not ruin my trip!

Reviews.Title: “I can't complain”
Reviews.Author: flamingomom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur June 11 through 15. We had a clean, comfortable room at a great price. We stayed on the eighth floor of tower 2. Our room looked a little worn, i.e. scuffed up furniture, wall paper seams showing, but all in all our stay was nice. I would stay there again. The only real negative I could find was having just a shower and not a tub. We did not see a lot of children. We didn't hear anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Price”
Reviews.Author: traveler8427
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel is pretty good, especially considering how cheap it is. Yes, it is smokey but so are all the casinos, it's frickin Vegas. The rooms are decent size and if your looking for an above average room for cheap this is it. If you want luxury go to the Bellagio. The biggest complaint with this hotel is the pool. It's over by tower 2 and is a whopping 3 feet deep. It has no diving boards or anything really for adults, just one lame slide. I'd suggest trying to get in to one of the other casino's pool's. I would recommend this hotel particularly for budget travlers, young adults and probably even small families. Please note though if you're going to be in Vegas- only make it a 2 day or 3 day trip max. You can do everything in Vegas over a weekend and if you stay longer you'll get bored- there's only soo much you can gamble. And to be honest, other then gamble, unless you're a club hopper or have a particular show you want to see there is not much to do in Vegas. Also I'd recommend the Luxor, if you could afford the extra bucks, they also have a pretty good lounge act you can catch late at night for free. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “OK Stay For Price and Location - Constantly Harrassed by TimeShare”
Reviews.Author: ddani73
Reviews.Content: Excaliber is in a great location, however it is a little out-dated. We got what we paid for! When we first checked into the hotel, the Valet Staff were very nice and friendly! We checked in ok, I asked for a low level floor and was put on the 25th!! not too happy about that! As we were walking to our room we were swamped with staff from the timeshare asking if we want to see a show for free. We had all our luggage and were trying to find our i.d, they were relentless in asking for more i.d as we were from Canada and I have a postal box address, so after about 15 minutes, we were given the speil, yadda yadda yadda, do you want to see a free show, do you earn this much money, you have to go and sit at a presentation for about 2.5 hours to get all this free stuff, so we said no. After that we had to spend the rest of the time walking through the hotel avoiding these timeshare booths - which were all over the casino~! you couldn't go anywere without being harrassed! We would never stay at this hotel again after this stay! Last time we were in Vegas, we stayed at the Stratosphere and never experienced any of this harrassment and enjoyed our stay! The food was very greasy - we ate at the Sherwood Forest Cafe, and I could probably bottle the oil that came out of my hashbrowns~! The rooms were clean but were a little old, and the corridors were very dark and had no cameras so it didn't feel very safe. The security looked asleep half the time down at the elevators and we only showed our room key once or twice.

Reviews.Title: “Went back for our Annual stay at The Castle”
Reviews.Author: agj25us
Reviews.Content: For many years now we have spent our Annual Las Vegas Vacation at "The Excalibur". I have "defended" it over the years and will continue doing so until I find a reason not to. I don't expect anything overly special, I expect a clean stay, a good time, reasonably priced food, rooms, a good atmosphere and entertainment. For me, I have always found this at Excalibur. IF you want Gourmet or Top Notch Food, or fancy accomodations go somewhere else, because I really hate to see you complain when you don't get that at the Excalibur. I guess it is the way I treat the staff at Excalibur - but I have always had a great time with them, from Check-in to eating to Casino playing, etc. I can find faults if I look at any place in Vegas - like hanging "tacky" plastic flower shaped balls that are supposed to be "decor" in an expensive Hotel, or waiting in line for over an hour to pay $45.00 a person for a supposed "Gourmet" buffet. I can go on about all the negative comments I read in Trip Advisor about the Excalibur - but I am glad to see that there are others though who enjoy it as well as we do. I'll be back again next year Excalibur!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the excalibur”
Reviews.Author: tylee63
Reviews.Content: Well I have been on this site for a while now and had my reservations about staying at this hotel after reading some of the reviews. But after staying there for seven nights, It was great , everything about this hotel was up to standard. the food the staff, the rooms where all great, I would recomend this hotel to any one. and for the people that said the shower clogs up with water , I think you where just in there way too long :) Cant wait to go back ,

Reviews.Title: “Dump, Da Dump, Dump....”
Reviews.Author: qbill
Reviews.Content: Oh, and what a dump it was! Hotel was one of the worst I've ever stayed in. Halls were dark, dank, and downright scary. Room was depressing and out-dated. Check-in clerk looked like she was just released from prison and had an attitude to match. Casino was filthy...trash and dirty glasses all over the place. Supposed to stay there three days but had to chek out sooner...couldn't take it anymore. No problem cheking out early, though...they must be used to people doing this. Stay anywhere else but here. I'd rather eat broken glass than return to this slum.

Reviews.Title: “Great room at great price...”
Reviews.Author: CentILMatt
Reviews.Content: No complaints whatsoever about our 2 night stay here in May 2006. Room was very accomodating and nicely decorated in "medieval" theme. Hallways were a little dark. We were on the 19th floor...never had to wait more than 3 minutes for the elevator to show up. Location was great, if you want to be on the south end of the strip. MGM Grand, NYNY and LUXOR are right next door. Everything we experienced at Excalibur would be considered "family friendly"; there was plenty of security, plus there's a great carnival midway downstairs with all sorts of games for kids of all ages. We ate breakfast at the Round Table Buffet. Overall, the food was terrific. Excellent choices and variety. Got this room for $50/night, which is cheap compared to some other pricing I was seeing on the strip. I feel very satisfied that I got great value for my $$ and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Won't go back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I went to San Diego(from Colorado) and decided to leave early to come to Vegas and spend our last night of vacation there. We were going to stay at Circus Circus but decided the Excalibur would be better. When we got there and checked in is when we had our first bad experience. The receptionist commented what you don't have reservations? Even though we passed 10 signs that said, "No Armor, No Reservations, No Problem" that's why we decided to stay there. But I let it go because I was so excited to do the Tournament of Kings Dinner Show. When we got in line and waited our turn, the guy said, "tonight is a black out night". There is no show on Tuesday nights but no advertisement for that. So at this point I was truly beginning to feel we should have gone to Circus Circus. I made mention they should advertise Tuesday is a black out night and the lady behind the counter said,"Well the horses need a day off too you know" very snotty. As well I agree the animals need a break there was no need for the remark. Plus at all other big animal shows(Seaworld for example) they have two sets of animals and trainers/actors because who in their right mind would make them do two dinner shows a night six days in a row. Animal Cruelity? you decide. Anyway, we had a room on the first floor in tower2, it was ok nothing spectacular. I did like the security guards out front checking for room keys.......but then at 1 in the morning they called us looking for someone else. Of course that woke the kids up. Then at 2 we get another phone call looking for the same guy again, so I told the security guy that please stop calling here, that person wasn't in this room. Then at 3 we get another phone call...this time I'm pissed and the security guard was like I'm sorry this lady is looking for this guy. When we checked out and I told the management they just acted like so what, who cares..."drunks do that", she said. No sorry or nothing.The buffet was very high priced and not so tasty. Food was rubbery and cold and the selection was little compared to most buffets in Vegas. The pool was just as nasty as could be...tasted like pure salt water and gagged you immediately. It made me miss chlorine. The gambling wasn't so hot either, not that I'm a big winner but usually I win enough to keep me playing, but both my husband and I had the worst experience of gambling ever. Not to mention we never saw a big winner, usually you see someone yelling or shouting having the time of their life, but not this time...and I frequent Vegas. So no I would not recommed this hotel and I won't be going back to it any time soon.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Keeling
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived back from Las Vegas having stayed at the Excalibur. The room was reasonably sized and clean. We had problems with the toilet in that it kept filling up but hubby sorted it out and it was o.k. after that. We were on the third floor in Tower II and we had quite a lot of noise at night when people were coming back to their rooms. One morning at 4.00 a.m. we had an American girl screaming and crying on the corridor saying she was not going to University and she wanted to go home and this was certainly not the only night we had a problem with noise!!! I do not know why Americans have to be so loud and noisy when they are returning to their rooms - I think they think that if they are up in the early hours of the morning then everybody else is but when you are getting up at 5.30 a.m. to go on a trip it is certainly no joke!!!!! We were not too hassled by the timeshare people we just told them sternly, no we were not interested and they left us alone. Everybody was helpful and pleasant at the hotel and after reading other reviews was pleasantly surprised that we did not have a long wait to either book in or book out - only waited about 5 minutes both times. We never really ate at the hotel - we had breakfast at Caesars Palace at the Stage Deli, New York when we were not on trips and ate at different hotels for dinner. We went downtown on the Deuce bus which only cost $2 each way for each person but be prepared for it to take about 1 hour to get there and about 45 minutes to get back because of traffic. If you get chance go and see Mama Mia at the Mandalay Bay and Celine Dion at Caesars Palace. They are both brilliant shows and well worth the money. We also went on trips to Lake Mead, Hoover Dam, Bryce Canyon and Zion National Park, Grand Canyon West Rim and Death Valley. All very good and enjoyed each one especially the Bryce Canyon trip. There is also a trip with My Travel to Laughlin which costed $2.50 per person. You get a free buffet dinner which tasted very nice and we went up the Colorodo River on a boat trip and went to an outlet shopping centre which was quite nice. It was nice to get out of Las Vegas to a much quieter place for the day. Also would recommend the free shuttle bus to the Rio from Harrahs. The carnival floats in the Masquerade Village were very good. They come out all lit up and there is music and dancers and the floats go across the ceiling - we enjoyed our evening there. All in all we enjoyed our stay at the Excalibur. It was handy for all what is going on on the Strip and would stay there again if I thought the corridors would be quiet at night!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaGirlOC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while in Vegas to see Madonna at the MGM Grand as it was $200 cheaper than MGM! Pretty standard of the Vegas hotels - big clean rooms, lots of dining options, good casino. Long lines at check in but the self service kiosks make a big difference if you have a straight forward reservation. Good location across from MGM and beside NY NY. All round good value for money and I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Walberto
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this hotel. The first thing was the price. We paid around £250 for a 4 night stay and for the location alone, that's excellent. The taxi ride to the hotel cost us $15. Upon arrival there was no check in queue (that was at about midday) The hotel only had double queen standard rooms available. For an extra $10 per night we upgraded to a deluxe room with a king bed. The tower 2 room was extremely large and seemed relatively new. We overlooked the pool but a tree obstructed the view, not that i was bothered. The room was clean and nicely furnished so i was happy. Walking around the hotel we found it to be nice and clean. All the staff we came across were very helpful and polite. The only place we tried eating in the hotel was the Sherwood cafe. We had breakfast (the eggs benedict was nice) and 2 midnight snacks (Well 12 oz steaks!). The food was good and extremely well priced. Check out was less than a 5 minute wait however there was a 15 minute wait for taxi. That was around 11am. All in all this hotel is superb for the price. Excellent location, fascinating decor and a clean up to date room.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and a good time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Excalibur from May 16th to 20th. Before visiting, I read the reviews on this site for several months and became very aprehensive after reading some of the negative comments. I thought about cancelling my reservation, but instead opted for a room upgrade to a King Spa suite. A couple of days before my trip, I saw that the internet rates had dropped to lower than my reservation rate. I called and asked if I could get the lower rate for the night that had not sold out yet. The serviceperson said yes on that, but turned down my request for lowering the other nights, because they were sold out and "out of the system" I was fine with that. She then put me on hold and came back and said her supervisor agreed to lower the rate on my entire stay. How's that for service??? Express check in was easy at the kiosk. The room was as pleasantly clean and the bedspread an linens seemed clean and fresh. The towels were not real thick, though. My hamburger and fries and my wife's meatball sub at the Sherwood Forest cafe was tasty and served fast and friendly. Our one dinner at the Roundtable Buffet was OK for a buffet. Try the prime rib if you go. In the food court, Quizno's, Manchu Wok, Krispy Kreme and McDonald's all offered good food for a nice price. We spent alot of time at the casino...the dealers were nice and the atmosphere was fun. I compared it to alot of other casinos on the strip it was quite adequate and a nice atmosphere in comparison. Get the "one club" card and show it so you can get comps. We are not high rollers and just a few hours a day on the tables earned us a $100 comp. A lot of big spenders never bothered to use a card. Yes, the casino was smoky, but we loved the non-smoking table areas. Many of you may like that as well. The pool area was fun (HOT) and packed each day by 10:30 am, so get there earlier for a chair. Overall, the experience I had was enjoyable. The staff were mostly helpful and friendly and seemed happy we were there. As you read these reviews, just remember that most people who write reviews have had the negative experiences and those who had good or great ones don't usually write. Alot of people there seemed to have a great vacation, including us. I hope you do too.

Reviews.Title: “A Daisy Between Two Roses !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel (Daisy) Right Between Two Roses (New York-New York & Lexus). Very Clean,Spaceous,Very Affordable & Right Near Everything You Need. The Pool Beats New Yorks Hands Down.You Must See (The Tournement Of Kings Show) To Round Out The Whole Mid Evil Experence. I Would Highly Reccomend The EXCALIBUR To Anyone. Why Test The Rest When You Can Stay At The Best!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good price, good location”
Reviews.Author: holrk
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at this hotel, and again, and very satisfied with our stay. Check-in was fast and friendly with no problems. Our room was a decent size and clean, what more can you ask for? I was a little surprised to see that they no longer use bedspreads - instead - they use a blanket put in between 2 sheets. That's fine with me since hotel bedspreads kind of freak me out anyway. There was an extra blanket and pillows in the room, so we were fine. Housekeeping did a great job of keeping the room tidy. If you are looking for a no-frills, affordable, clean place to lay your head and take a shower, then this is the place for you. If you are looking for above-average accommodations and service, then go to the more expensive hotels. I will gladly book Excalibur for my next trip out to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Good price for what you get”
Reviews.Author: smsteffy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is OK, nothing compared to the luxuary palaces next door but the price is very good for what you get. You're on the strip, walking distance from everything, the rooms are old and fairly dark but clean and quiet. Do not expect extra features like coffe maker and fridge but again, the price... If you have kids, they'll probably love the disney castle style.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel if you aren't looking for fancy”
Reviews.Author: Beaverton Duck
Reviews.Content: My wife, seven-year old daughter, and I stayed at the Excalibur for four nights last weekend. This hotel is a nice place to stay in Las Vegas if you are looking for a clean room at a great location. We were on the 18th floor in tower one and it was great because there is an express elevator that goes straight to the 18th floor and above. If you want a non-smoking room, request the 18th floor. The room was clean, although the sheets had a small tear on one bed, and I found a hair or two on the floor in the bathroom when we arrived. The shower was fine, although one of the mornings, the water was warm at best even though I had it turned to the hottest setting possible. The other three mornings, we had plenty of hot water. The room was surprisingly quiet. We left the fan on high while we slept and heard very little hall noise. The pool area was fairly crowded, but our daughter really enjoyed the shallow pool and rafts you can rent. She also enjoyed playing the midway games downstairs. I agree with many other reviews that the timeshare people are very annoying. They hang out by the entrance and both towers and are quite aggressive. Unfortunately, many other hotels have the same problems. They were even worse when we stayed at the Flamingo, and on this trip, we were also bothered a few times at the Forum Shops at Caesar's. We tried the express check-in and the machine worked, but the key cards it gave us did not work very well. The next day we had to go to the front desk and get new keys, but they were very friendly and gave us some discount coupons for the midway downstairs. We ate two meals in the hotel. The buffet was nothing special and fairly expensive. On the other hand, we had dinner at the Camelot Room Steak House. While it was expensive (dinners $25.00-$40.00), both the food and the service were exceptional. I recommend the Excalibur for families and budget travelers. If you are looking for something more romantic or fancy, we have stayed at Paris Las Vegas and it was definitely a step up. We also walked around Mandalay Bay and it looked fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Luvvaca
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent and took a large group there for my sister's wedding. The place was horrible and the management were completely useless. 1 room had a problem with the toilet and sink backing up - we asked for a different room - they sent someone up an hour later to do plumbing. The plumber mentioned that the fumes weren't safe and to wait in a room from someone else in the group. A couple of hours later, management finds another room for them - but weren't nice about it. 1 room had a used condom on the water sprinkler. We called the management. They actually acussed us of putting it there to get the room comped. Over an hour later, they finally sent someone up to take it - the person did not speak English. Management did not even apologize. Nothing but trying to accuse the guests of the room of trying to get it for free. When I stepped in and explained that I was the agent and we were with a large group and didn't "plant" the condom, they had nothing to say. Place is old and dirty - would never go back there and would not recommend anyone stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Eh, OK I rekon...for Vegas”
Reviews.Author: pwn_man
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for two nights on the end of our Utah National Parks trip because we used LAS airport. Excalibur was the cheapest we could find for those two days (apparently the big fight was scheduled for the next night so everything was booked solid) Anyway 129 for Thur and 179 for Fri. Room was average clean. Shower worked good. OK so room 2025 is in Tower 1 on the 20th floor. The lower elevators stop on the 18th floor. Our room was right beside the elevator motors for those three elevators. Boy, elevator motors are really loud! This room is great for the hearing impaired; otherwise stay away from this room or similar rooms in the other towers. This hotel seemed much more smokier than many others we visitied. I doubt there were any more or less smokers, we just figured their air handling system is not up to par. Some of the newer hotels had hardly any smoke smell in the casinos at all. Vegas is definitly not the town for non-smokers. Oh yea, they have a bunch of self check-in terminals with no line! Guess why no line there? They do not work. I tried and everyone else that tried couldn't make it work. Others in line that are frequent visitors said they have never seen them work, so don't lose a good place in the other line wasting time trying to get that to work. OK, so our 4 cents worth (2 cents each <G>)

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: greenturtle2
Reviews.Content: The Excalibur is a good choice for a decent-priced hotel on the strip. The rooms are comfortable; soft beds, big bathroom. Also, the location of the hotel is good, close to Luxor, NYNY, MGM Grand, Mandalay Bay, etc. Great choice for this end of the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: carolpowell321
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 3 nights as part of a 15 day visit to America to celebrate our 25th Wedding Anniversary. We had a free upgrade to a Junior Suit which was well decorated, big and had a very comforable king size bed. you don't get tea & coffe in your room but we expected this, not the done thing generally in America, which we also found at the other hotels we stayed in. We had a great view of the strip and the double galazing kept noise to a minimum. Lack of a bath was a suprise but otherwise no complaints. They did add a dollar a day to our bill for unlimited local phone calls, you had no option but to pay this, seems a rip off to me unless you want to make local phone calls. In keeping with the other Vegas hotels on the strip it's not obvious where you first register and where the rooms are, you have to walk through all the casino with your bags, felt really strange. We did get hassle from Time share reps but we resisted the goodies they offered, from experience the 2-3 hour pitch they promise you usually turns into a 5 hour ordeal. I didn't go to Vegas to spend hours under pressure. Food was ok and you have many options within the Hotel and outside. The casino is on a par with the other hotels, it's just amazing to see people playing the machines at 0700, we like a small gamble but it seems like people are addicted to it. You have top go and see the other hotels, many do outdoor shows like Treasure Island who have pirate battles two or 3 times a night. The Stratospher has rides at the top of a hugh tower. The best thing we did was a Grand Canyon trip. Can't say i would go back to Vegas though it was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Excalibur looks cool from the outside but it really is not that fabulous on the inside. You get what you pay for on the strip with this hotel. A place to sleep, that is it! I found no entertainment in the hotel at all. The casino was average to the others on the strip and short distance to some fabulous ones. The rooms were clean and I had a great view of the Luxor. So that is a positive! Another positive is that you can take indoor moving sidewalks to two mega casino hotels. This was a convienince well worth the cost of our stay. We could stay in air conditioning and visit three casinos! The hotel and casino are outdated and not even well themed. The staff were forgetable which not positive or negative. It simply means that nothing was done to provide superior service or to offend us. I would not go to the buffet ever again, the food tasted like it was made from powder. The meatballs dissolved in my mouth and made me nauseated for half a day. I very likely will not stay there again. I will pay for more glitz and glamour.

Reviews.Title: “Legas - Love it or Leave it?!?”
Reviews.Author: es1gt
Reviews.Content: The Hotel I just returned from a 4 day trip to "The Strip" and I have got to say Vegas is either a love it or leave it city. We stayed at the Excalibur and had no problems checking in. We arrived on a Wednesday afternoon and there was maybe a three minute wait to check in. I can't say it would be that quick the closer it got to the weekend. Come earlier in the week if you are going to visit. The room was your typical hotel room...nothing special but hey you are not going to Vegas to stay inside your room all day. We had the "Deluxe" room with a King size bed. There is plenty of room in this size, don't know about the other sizes. This hotel is one of the older "mega" hotels on the strip and the amenities show it. I personally did not like the casino. It was very smoky and the service to get a drink while gambling is nearly impossible to get. We ate at the Sherwood cafe the first night and the food was pretty good and did have reasonably priced food. The slot machines at this casino are not the best for paying out either. Compared to the pricing (room/food/drinks) of the rest of the mega hotels this doesn't rate too badly. As for the air quality and amenities, this hotel ranks on the bottom for me. Other Hotels / The Strip The casino's that I liked the best were Monte Carlo, Mandalay Bay and New York New York. They are much newer, their drink service while gambling is very good and you can actually breathe inside the casinos! One thing I noticed about Vegas and the Strip is that all hotels are geared to keep the guests in the casino and not in the restaurants or rooms. We tried many restaurants at many hotels and none of them place a bathroom inside the restaurant. They force you to go out into the casino to use one....convinently located next to slot machines. I can say that pretty much every bathroom I entered was clean....a surprise with the amount of people going through them. Bring your pocket book if you are going to eat / drink / sleep on the strip. Nothing on the Strip is cheap! Old Vegas The last night (saturday) we went to the old Vegas (Freemont St). Now this is what Las Vegas is supposed to be like! Eat / drink / and gamble like they want you there. Drinks were very cheap, the service was right there when you needed something and the casinos seem to pay out more often than the Strip. The covered street is also cool to see. Shows start at 8PM and run until 11PM on the hour....and are free. Everyone we were with had a blast that night.....can't say that about other nights on The Strip. Overall I would leave it. I wanted to see Vegas and the mega hotels and now that is a place a can check off the list. Seeing the mega hotels is worth it and there are plenty of things to see that cost next to nothing and/or are free. I am not one that likes to be in smoky areas and a majority of the places on The Strip are very smoky. As a non-smoker, I feel like I am going through nicotine withdrawals today. If you are going to see a show, eat or go out to the clubs.....bring a lot of money, it is not cheap on The Strip! I've spent a lot less money on vacations elsewhere in the states and outside of the states and had a lot more fun. Oh yeah, one last thing....as you are on vacation spend the money like you are on vacation. We rented a Porsche from Dream Car Rentals and drove out to the Hoover Dam on the back roads. It costed a lot to rent but it was worth it for me. My wife and I spent a lot to see a show and for her it was worth it. So go to Vegas, vacation, bring your pocket book, and have fun....life is too short otherwise!

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed Thursday-Sunday. First thing on arrival we were bothered by the folks trying to sell us timeshares. Theses people are everywhere. The rooms are very basic. No frills is right and a horrible bed. My huband and I felt we would be better off on the floor. We could feel the springs. Don't ever stay in room 1137 it is on the first floor across from the Ice Machine and next to the elevators. You will get no sleep. I didn't like the fact that they did not have tubs in the bathrooms, they only had stand in showers. Which after a long day of walking you really don' t want to stand anymore. The casino was average as well. A lot of the tables weren't open and the lowest amount you could bet was $10. We did like the fact you can take a free monorail to the Luxor and Madalay Bay. The other monorail cost $5.00 per person per ride. But you can buy a double ride for $9 if there is 2 of you and save a buck by using the same ticket. If you really are looking for the Las Vegas experiece and don't want to pay a lot. The Excalibur is it, but don't exspect any special treatment or comfort. Next time I will pay the extra just to have a nicer time

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, Cheerful and a Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: swannee15
Reviews.Content: The Excalibur is a great place to stay. For anyone on a budget, look no further than this Hotel. Everything about it is cheap, cheerful and great value for money. The rooms are enourmous (especially with just a King bed in) and everything you want is there. The room was meticulously cleaned everyday and the toiletries restocked when needed. The bathroom was bigger than the "double" room, we stayed in, in New York the previous week, which shows the size of this place. Access to the two towers is from the casino, so you are not having to walk huge distances to your accomodation. If you are lucky enough to get into Tower 2, there is even an all night coffee bar right next to it (gets a bit busy in the morning). The food is also great. We usually plumped for the Buffet breakfast for 11 dollars each. After "pigging" out, we didnt need anything else until evening, really great value for money. The other buffets (lunch and dinner) are just as good with a fantastic selection. We had dinner in "The Steakhouse at Camelot" for our Wedding Anniversary. Whilst a lot more expensive, the food was cooked perfectly and again excellent value for money. Excaliburs location is superb, being central to 7 other casinos (dont bother with Hooters, a big disappointment). The new Duece bus, literally stops outside, so is great to getting to any part of the strip or downtown and for $5 for 24 hours, hop on/off is excellent value for money. Unfortunately, the Vegas curse has struck the Excalibur. Whilst it is the the busiest, livelest and most fun place to be of the three group hotels in that area (Luxor and Mandalay Bay been the others, which quite frankly were dead most nights), the money men have decided, that "cheap, cheerful and fun" is not for them and are closing it at the end of the year and tearing it down. The downside (as mentioned in another review) is that Vegas has become the Timeshare capital of the world. EVERY Hotel/Casino is offering lucrative goodies of free shows, holidays etc to get you to go to the timeshare presentations. What they dont tell you when you get snarred, is that it is Timeshare. You only find this out when you get the free, complimentry bus. BE WARNED, the 2 to 3 hour, no obligation, presentation, turns into a 4 to 5 hour interegation and extreme pressure to sign. Although at the end of it all, we did get the promised goodies, even though we didnt sign. If you have to go to one show in Vegas, go to Mama Mia, its brilliant. If you want a great time in Vegas at a nice, cheap but clean and very comfortable hotel, stay here, Its Great

Reviews.Title: “Great price for the location.......”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on the Excalibur, some were good and some were not so good but I took a chance and booked a room for spring break with my son/daughter, let me just say, it's a great price for a single parent, the location was perfect for the kids (NY/NY, MGM,Gameworks). Excalibur may not be as glamorous as some of the other bigger hotels on the strip but I must say we were not dissapointed. Room and Restroom/Shower were very clean and a good size. The pool was great. Check in was efficient and valet/staff were very helpful. It was an enjoyable stay. We will come back again to the Excalibur.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Fancy”
Reviews.Author: elkayandboro
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur from 4/12/06 thru 4/15/06. I arranged the trip thru Southwest Airlines Vacations, so the room was basically free. Even so, we were pleased with our stay. Our room was a basic hotel room with a good king-size bed, and a nice sized bathroom. No frills, but no complaints. The service from the hotel staff was very good, especially the baggage handlers. They were cheerful, and efficient. Tipping before they move the bags may have something to do with that. We checked in at noon, but we only had a few rooms to choose from. If a view from your room is important, don't bother trying to check in early. We ate at 4 different buffets. I'm known for eating anything and usually don't complain. My impressions are as follows: Roundtable Buffet for dinner (Excalibur) - terrible; you pile food on a plate before you're seated. How stupid is that? Limited choices and very mediocre food. Carnival World Buffet (Rio) - great; get a Total Rewards card first and get 2 $5 off coupons. We got there at 10:30, paid the breakfast rate and ate brunch. That way you can have bacon, sausage AND prime rib! We ate here twice for breakfast. Village Seafood Buffet (Rio) - hated it; it's like calling the hogs to eat.
