If you don't eat 25 little crawfish-sized lobster tails, it's a waste of money. To eat the lobster, you've got to stand in lines waiting for a fresh pan full. If there's more than 5 people ahead of you, you get the dregs, and it ain't pretty. Other than the lobster, this buffet is mediocre. In my opinion, it's the biggest tourist trap in Vegas. That's saying something. The Buffet (Bellagio) - Great: again, got there at 10:30 and chose from breakfast and lunch buffets. The food and ambience doesn't match the rest of this resort/casino. The only reason I rated it great is because I had 3 Filet Mignon and Havarti on crusty sourdough sandwiches. My favorite meat, favorite cheese and favorite bread in one place. Other than that, it was good, but not great. It's much more ethnic than the other buffets. I'm a meat and potato kind of guy, so it didn't impress me as much as some people. Tip for limited mobility travelers to Vegas. I rented a motorized wheelchair for my father-in-law from Mesa Medical in Las Vegas. It cost $110 for 4 days, and was a Godsend. They will deliver to your hotel and have it there before you arive.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Neelie65
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Vegas. We went with a group of people from our area. Wasn't sure what to expect. My first impression was OK. After we did the strip a couple of times, we came to appreciate the Excalibur. Although, not very fancy, our rooms were very clean. It was a bit dark, but I guess that goes with the motif. You were always able to get on a $5.00 table........we were happy about that!! Pool area was fine. Was disappointed they charges $15.00 to use the gym. We opted to walk/run the srtip instead. Food was ok but you must try the STEAK HOUSE at the Luxor.....OUTSTANDING!! Overall it was a fine place to lay your head........if your looking for a bit more luxury, you'll have to look elsewhere. Kid friendly. Most annoying was the people trying to sell you a time share. If you stay here. stay in Tower II. It seems to be nearer to all. We had a room in Tower I and the view stunk.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur Hotel gets thumbs up review”
Reviews.Author: discman455
Reviews.Content: Excalibur may not be as glamorous as some of the other bigger hotels on the strip but I must say we were not dissapointed..Heard lots of issues with the food but we ate at the sherwood forest cafe a few times and found the food and service to be top notch.. People, if you have food allergies the staff in the restaurant were very accomodating and made sure they got the orders right so there were no problems. The food portions were awesome and the prices were very resonable. As for the rooms,Yes they are not the fanciest but we always found them clean and well taken care of..Also spent a couple of afternoons by the pool which was a nice treat. lot of chairs and staff available to take care of your needs. One thing if any I would love to recommend is that they limit the some of the areas to designated smoking as it became irritating if your following or standing in an area where some of the people are smoking cigars and cigarettes. Also Room service should come by more often and pick up there used dishes as we noticed some sitting out in the hallways and not picked up in the four days we were there.. Other than that very enjoyable stay...This was our second stay at the Exaclibur and we will come back..

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but needs cleaning”
Reviews.Author: DBR10
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Excalibur whilst attending a conference at Green Valley Ranch. Plus points - Great location at the end of the strip, good parking and easy to get onto I15. Great gym / spa but $15 per day. Cheap accomodation. Bad points - generally dirty and grim. I got bitten all over by bed bugs. Dirty pool area. A shame as the location is great but the hotel is low rent and in need of serious cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: choosychops
Reviews.Content: Was last in Vegas 12 years ago and remember the Excalibur as being a bit tatty. No more. They have really refurbished it and made it shiny and new. Good location and connections to Luxor,Mandalay Bay, New York New York and MGM Grand. Rooms were very clean and a good size.Check in was efficient and staff very helpful. Definitely recommend The Tournament of Kings, which is held in a full size arena under the hotel. Can definitely recommend the buffet breakfast at the MGM Grand - it has to be seen to be believed.

Reviews.Title: “IT WAS SNOWING”
Reviews.Author: madvon
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to Excalibur (first was 2004) I was very dissappointed this time. The hotel was dark and dingy, rooms smelt funny and you are constantly pestered with TIME SHARE reps. Yes it did snow while we were there in fact the whole two weeks was bad weather. I think Vegas has lost its magic. We did use the new monorail system which is time consuming. It is situated at the rear of each hotel, so you have to walk through the whole hotel to get to it and again when you get off to get back on to the strip. It is quicker to walk the strip or get the deuce bus which is better value, the monorail is alot more expensive. Alot of the hotels are being demolished or refurbished so alot of construction going on while we were there. Vegas is a good place to visit for a few days 2 weeks was too long. Got BORED!

Reviews.Title: “On the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After spending a week on the " creaking old lady"(see Queen Mary reveiw) what could the Excalibur offer? We arrived to a very large queue at check in which to my surprise moved quite briskly.when our turn came to check in the man on the desk was funny, informative and took an interest in where we came from and nothing seemed too much trouble he cheered me up no end after a 4 hour drive.The room was very clean with plenty of garment space, the only minor moan was that there was no bath just a walk in shower.Even though we were on the 27th floor the elevators were fast and frequent.The all u can eat resteraunt was exellent as my partner will testify. The food tasted as good as it looked and the staff were friendly and helpful without hovering over you waiting for your empty plate.The hotel is ideally situated exit I15 right and right. Even my girlfriend could find it and she did! Compared to other more pricey hotels on the strip (ive stayed at a few) it holds up very well.The only major gripe I have are with the people who accost you inside the hotel trying to give you free tickets to shows if you agree to take a tour of the new hotel properties. my vacation time is precious and I really dont want to walk round a construction site or whatever it is they are trying to sell.Avoid them if you can but its kinda hard as they stand at the entrance to the elevator foyer.

Reviews.Title: “feel like a king”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: what a great place to stay. stayed for 5 nights and saw many shows and went home with more cash then we started out with. great dollar slots.nice view of the strip and could see the roller coaster at new york. the staff was very friendly. only catch was at check in I paid 2 months in advance for a non smoking room and when we showed up they didnt have one. I asked for the manager and was givin a non smoking room with a view for the same cost as a regular room. we will go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Best price on the strip and not too shabby...”
Reviews.Author: jswan7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur on March 18 and 19. It was the best price I could find for almost any hotel on the strip. The location was pretty good, but not as central as I would like. The casino was clean and we enjoyed gambling there as there was always a $5 minimum table. The room was clean, but had an odd odor to it. The bed was average on the comfort scale. The bathroom was large and the housekeeping was on top of things. The last time we stayed in Vegas we were at the Paris which definitely has nicer rooms, but costs twice that of Excalibur, so you do get what you pay for. I was a little disappointed that we could not check in to our room more than a couple of hours early and we had to check back a couple of times to see if they were allowing early check-in. When we stayed at the Paris, they let us check in when we arrived at 8am and that was nice after the overnight flight. Overall, Excalibur is a good deal for the price and we were satisfied with our experience.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant experience for 59 dollars”
Reviews.Author: Toronto217
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Excalibur for one night for 59 dollars. Sunday March 19th. We originally booked at 89 dollars. When we pointed out that the price for the room had gone down, the front desk people immediately credited us with the difference, no problem. The bell staff were very helpful with our bags, they handled our luggage with care. They were efficient and polite. The person who worked at the taxi line was also polite and friendly. There was really only one bad thing about our stay: the room had not been properly prepared for our stay. When we first got to our room, there were deflated "Happy Anniversary" balloons from the previous guest. They also left behind a few chocolate covered strawberries on a plate. Also, the room service cart was still in the room, along with their room keys.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur March 20th - 24th, and I was very happy with the outcome of the stay. Located across the street form MGM Grand and New York New York, and located next door to The Luxor. A monorail runs from the Excalibur to The Luxor which is very conveient. After requesting more towels for our room we received them within 10 to 15 minutes of asking. We ate at the buffet bar on our last day, I beleive it is called "The Roundtable". I would not recommend this buffet it is a waste of money and we were all very disappointed. The food was dried out and the display signs were not changed out from breakfast and you had no idea what you were eating. If you are looking for a buffet you need to try "The Carnival of Buffets" in the RIO. It runs about $16.00 per person for lunch and it is worth it! The Excalibur has a game room for the kids and the games range from .25 cents to $1.00 and prizes are very easy to win as they are nice plush animals. The hotel also has a shopping mall inside that includes; Kripsy Kreme, Pizza Hut, Quizno's, The Roundtable, an Italian Rest, adn various shops. Overall we were very happy with our room and the beds were comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the excalibur Mar 21-Mar 24. He was there for a convention at Mandalay Bay. Upon arriving, my husband checked in and was told that there were no non-smoking rooms available until tomorrow (maybe). I am 4 months pregnant so needless to say we were not happy. However, we decided to tough it out. When we got to the room, I couldn't stand it so I called down to the front desk and explained my situation. They were extremely friendly and were able to accomodate our request and even upgraded our room for no extra change. We moved to Tower 2 which was so much better. We had a wonderful view of NYNY and the room was better. We ordered room service which only took 45 minutes. The woman who delivered was very nice. The room itself is not state of the art but we were not paying for it so I couldn't complain. We ate at the Steakhouse and the Sherwood Cafe and had good experiences at both. The location of the hotel was nice too especially for my husband who had to travel over to Mandalay Bay. Even though, I don't like smoking. I dealt with the casino's that is what Vegas is about. Overall, this hotel was average and you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than anticapted”
Reviews.Author: JasonMia
Reviews.Content: Some friends and I recently stayed at the Excalibur (Mar 22-25). to be honest I was not expecting much at all..just a decently priced room to sleep off the infamous Vegas hangovers. However I was very imporessed. Rooms and bathrooms were big and clean (note bathrooms only have showers no tubs), staff very friendly and accomdating (extra towels brought up within minutes of requesting), and great location on the strip. Also check in/out kisoks were great as you did not have to wait in any lines at all. Only gripe was lobby and casino area looked a little dated. All in great place at a good price to stay in Vegas..(you will save your money on the room and spend on shows, restaurants, shopping casinos etc)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Kingdom!”
Reviews.Author: energizer138
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at the NYNY while we are in Vegas and have always loved it. I decided on this trip to try to save some money on our hotel as we where there for Nascar weekend and all of the casino's had there room rates jacked up. So I couldn't believe that this hotel was half the price of the others! So we decided to book at the Excalibur and I'm glad that we did. The room was excellent. I've stayed at numerous hotels in Vegas, and this was as good as any of them. While we were there we decided to do the Tournament of Kings dinner show, and it was excellent. Next time that we're in Vegas I will definately book at the Excalibur again! And with the money that we save, we'll take in a couple of extra shows(including Tournament of Kings)!

Reviews.Title: “Not a place for kids as advertised”
Reviews.Author: ur1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during March 2006. We thought it would be a good place to stay with our three children but we were very disappointed. The rooms were dark and drabby. The arcade was terrible. Most of the games did not work (they just took our money) and the workers were rude and lazy. The buffets were over priced.

Reviews.Title: “Our Worst Hotel Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We travel a fair bit so we went with an open mind about the hotel but from the moment we checked in, we were disappointed. They refused to honor the spa passes that were supposed to come with our trip. Then, we were sent off to our room with a "go that way" and a vague wave of the hand. Our room was terrible. Beware if they put you in an ajoining one. The adjoining rooms have a very thin door, with a flimsy lock. I opened mine to see what was behind it only to see right into the bed in the next room - with someone in it!!! The next day the shower broke off in my hand due to corrosion. We had to fight to be moved to another room. We were moved to one across from the housekeeping closet where the maids hung out screaming and laughing starting at about 7:30 in the mornings which always woke us up. Our second room had red ants in the bathroom. As we were only there a couple of days, we decided to stick it out in that room. When we checked out, they at first refused to send a bellman to help with our luggage, because they said he didn't have time to sit around while we checked out. My husband had to rationalize with them a bit. There is supposed to be security, but they don't always check everyone (I watched). We were never able to successully order room service as every time we called we were told there was an hour and a half wait. The spa facility is not very good. The products in the shower room and vanity area are drugstore brands although it touts its to use Aveda. They don't offer the amenities of most spas I have been to, and the facilities were not all working the day I went. The sauna was not working, and a guest let them know but they never had anyone look at it in the time I was there. There was also a lot of scum in the jacuzzi. If you have other hotel options please consider those. Las Vegas is awesome and you shouldn't spend your time dealing with poor service, and substandard accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad, but would want to stay at other hotels in the future.”
Reviews.Author: LoneRock
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Excalibur Hotel from March 10-12 and March 15-17 2006. The staff was very nice and the Sherwood Forest Cafe was very good; however, when my family had returned on March 15th after spending time in Arizona and Utah we came back to two hotel rooms that had just been shampooed and the bathroom floor was just mopped. After being on the road, lugging our suitcases through the casino to tower II, then to smell carpet shampoo and almost fall on the bathroom floor, we had to move to tower 1 and go through the whole nine yards again. Overall i had nothing against the hotel, but would only stay there again if every hotel in the city was completely full or very expensive because this was a peak week. If one wants to stay in the hotel in the future, it is good for family's or the younger crowd, but i do want to say upfront that there weren't coffee makers in the rooms, so bring one with you if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading some other reviews from the Excalibur, I was a little uneasy about staying there. I was very pleasantly surprised! Check in was really quick (even at 2 in the afternoon) and if the line is long, you can do your own self check-in at the computer. Our room was huge with a king size bed. It was neat, tidy and clean. The bathroom was huge as well. It wasn't overly furnished but had the basics. It was more than I had expected! You have to show your room key when going up to your room, which I thought was a great security feature. They don't let anyone up without a key. The elevators are divided up into 2 different sides...one side for higher floors, one side for lower floors. Not that confusing! This way the elevators are never crowded! The casino is a little darker than others but it is in keeping with their theme. As for the smokiness of it, it's Vegas, every casino is smokey! The only thing I thought this hotel was lacking in was normal restaurants. There of course was buffet(never tried it), a food court, and pricier restaurants. It would be nice to have something in between. We ate at the ESPN Zone (New York New York) a couple of times and House of Blues (Mandalay Bay) since they were in the area. The location of this place was great! On one side it is attached to New Yorks (outside) and the other side is attached to the Luxor and Mandalay Bay (inside moving sidewalks) This was our second time to Vegas. The first time we stayed at the Monte Carlo. We enjoyed the convenience of the Excalibur and would recommend it to anyone who wants a great, quiet place to sleep and doesn't want to spend a lot of money. We didn't think it was in a lower class of hotels. If you are expecting the Bellagio, stay at the Bellagio. If you want great value on the strip, stay here! We had no real complaints and enjoyed our holiday!

Reviews.Title: “wouldnt come back here”
Reviews.Author: lar63
Reviews.Content: i didnt like anything here. all the food was greasy. my kids werent allowed in the hot tub, they r 10&7. the wall paper in my nonsmoking, but smelled like smoke room was peeling, and my carpet and bathroom were dirty. the casino was terrible. it had low ceilings and old games. it looked like a basement. the bar selection was very limited. this is supposed to be a family casino resort and not even my kids who like anyplace we stay were impressed. there are literally dozens of resorts in vegas that give you a better value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you can look past the cheesie-ness this is a great value! The room was clean, but old and dingy. The view of the strip was GREAT!! Loved the location because you can experience the Luxor/Mandalay Bay and NY NY without paying the extra cash. Housekeeping did a great job keeping our room clean and beds made. There is a snack bar called Little John's on the casino floor- avoid it and go upstairs to the food court (Mc Donalds/ Quiznos/ Krispie Kremes / Chinese) where there is cheaper food and faster service. Coffee bar was nice in the morning - lots of sweet rolls to choose from and great tasting coffee. Tried the buffet, definately would not eat there again. All in all an enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but not Great. It just average.”
Reviews.Author: Queenfish11116666
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Hotel from March 8-10, It was three nights. The rooms in this hotel weren't dirty, but not very clean either.The room seem old so there was a sence that it wasn't clean, but it was fine. The beds weren't to comfortable. We had a room at the top of tower 1. THe Pool and the spa are in Tower 2. So we had to walk through the middle of the Casino to go there. It felt a bit odd. The Elevetors in the hotel where confusing. We saw many people get on the wrong elevators. The elevators were divid in to floors. THe upper floors had their own set of elevators and the lower part had their set. The floor numbers were hard to see too. When you walk into a tower you had to show secrity your room card. To get anywhere in this hotel you had to walk through the casio which was annoying when you have teenager and kids, because there are people smoking and gambleing. When ever you went downstairs you had to walk through second hand smoke. It was gross.There was also a sign saying no one under 21 is allowed in casino area on the wall when clearly the hotel is breaking the law because where ever you went you had to walk through the casino with children to get anywhere. I also found that you had to wait in a long line to get a taxi and annoying. What I liked was that this hotel was connected to other hotels so you didn't have to go out side to enter a another hotel like the luxor. That was nice. I had an average trip here. It wasn't too exciting.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary at the Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Excalibur March 6th thru the 9th--had a wonderful time. Got married there in March of 2000.. Have been back 4 out of the 5 times in the last 6 years. The only problem is with the show tour people are bothersome. Check-in/out kiosk is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: TNTravelChick
Reviews.Content: I gave the Excalibur a 4 because of the price for what you get. It is often one of the better priced hotels and it has a prime location so I figured there must be something wrong with it. I had a wonderful time. The rooms were clean and had some little extra theme touches to it. I did have a toliet problem at one time but they took care of it for me quickly. I ate at a couple of the restaurants and enjoyed them very much. The check in/out could not be easier! I liked that I could walk over to the Luxor & Mandalay Bay without ever stepping foot outside. If it is cold or rainy you still have options! I would stay there again for the price, location and great experience I had.

Reviews.Title: “Economical, Clean & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Anyone considering a stay at Excalibur can rest assure their trip will not be ruined because of poor accomodations etc., regardless of what you may have read from other postings. Stayed at Excalibur for the first time. (3-days) No major compliants, Check-in - easy, room hostess was nice as can be, room was very clean. Requests for in-room food service and towels were fulled quickly. Bartenders service was weak! (no shortage of bars in Vegas) The best $50 I ever spend on a hotel in LAS VEGAS!!! Convenient locale to MGM, Tropicana, Luxor, NY,NY. - 10-15 MIN walk to Ceasars Palace, Paris, Harrahs etc. Bellagio or Wynn it is not; but if economy and a decent room is all you're in need of, have no fear, Excalibur is here. Last time in Vegas, I stayed at the south end - Stratosphere. Was much happier on the North End.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: ALASKA
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay and found the Excalibur to be a very good value for the money. Booked through lasvegas for a discounted rate. Large hotel and casino with its own unique theme, like everything else on the Strip, but not on the same grand scale as some of the newer properties. Rooms were not luxurious but were clean and functional. I have never been to a city where less time was spent in the room anyway! Hotel is connected via walkway to New York, New York, and also has easy access to the Tropicana, which in turn is connected via another walkway to the MGM Grand, which houses the Monorail station which gets you everywhere. Excalibur also had good dining options, buffet was outstanding, 14.99 for dinner and the food very high quality.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of smell”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Excalibur has failed to invest in any sort of air filtration system that keeps the casino and towers smelling fresh and/or normal. Other casinos and hotels on the strip do not have this problem. Other casinos and hotels even seem to pipe in air freshners and keep the air circulating on a continuous basis. One walk in the casino leaves your hair reeking of stale smoke. The rooms all smell very stale and just unpleasent after a long day of exploring Vegas. It really just grossed me out. The housekeeping service was decent and my room/bathroom were always clean, but that is really the only two things that keep me from rating this hotel even lower. If you don't want to smell like an ashtray everytime you leave your place, then don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “What a difference a diamond can make”
Reviews.Author: Belasaria
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference being held at the Mandalay, but due to $$ restrictions, was forced to stay elsewhere. The Excalibur offered the best rates for one closest to the Mandalay. the PLUS -- the hotels are connected via tram. the MINUS -- good luck finding the tram Parking is a major pain. The signage is confusing, especially valet (which I had initially tried to use, but it was full). When I finally "check in parking", it was a 10 minute walk to the counter. Unlike other hotels I have stayed at, I had to prompt the desk clerk on where to park my car and how to get where. Even more frustrating was that I had to drag my luggage through the whole casino area because the 'free' parking is on the other side of where my room was. Quite a haul. "Dear Check-In Staff: Please write the COMPLETE room number on the check in card". The woman behind the counter told me I was on the 25th floor and wrote "37". When I exited the elevator, I was looking for room 37, not 24137. This is an older hotel and unfortunately, not aging gracefully. The rooms are lackluster and the beds simply OK. I was given a double instead of a king, which had a walk in shower, not a tub. The food is too expensive for the rating of the hotel and the service is abysmal. I had to send back a BLT because the toast was burnt and the kitchen apparently thought they could hide the scorched bread by having it on the inside. Disappointing all around, but if I were on a tighter budget and my focus was on gambling, this may be an OK hotel. Personally? I'll find a better place to stay next time.

Reviews.Title: “buffet is great”
Reviews.Author: brettnyc
Reviews.Content: stayed for 5 nights..rates were great..cant beat location..by the crossways,monorails,,//.get the room with a view for the extra 10 bucks,rooms are standard but comfortable and clean.staff very helpful with everything//checkin easy and checkout even easier//they need more winning ticket money exchangers...had couple but broke....would definately stay again//

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here anytime.”
Reviews.Author: cancungirly
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here many times and will again. Just can't beat it for the price. Everytime we have been the rooms are always clean with plenty of linens and good check in. Yes it is older but everything to us was in good order for the number of people who come in and out all the time. Don't like their buffet much so we walk to luxor and eat theirs which is really good. Do like their slot machines always have a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Dingy rooms and VERY poor service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Vegas from the UK. We arrived around 7:30 PM after 15 hours travel and ordered room service. After 1 hour and no show from room service I phoned again to be told that our sandwiches were on their way to the room. 20 minutes later they had still not arrived and so I cancelled. It was obvious that the staff concerned couldn't have cared less. This typified our experiences at the hotel over the next few days with the majority of the hotel management and staff, who appeared to have bad attitude problems. Obviously all Excalibur staff training takes place at the local branch of the Basil Fawlty school of Customer Service and Charm. As other reviewers have commented the decor, fittings and general cleanliness of the place are all poor also. I've stayed in many hotels large and small across the USA (many charging far less than this hotel) but thought this place really was the pits. I did try complaining while I was there but it was clear that nobody cared. Badly in need of new management. AVOID!!!

Reviews.Title: “More than adequate”
Reviews.Author: kg38
Reviews.Content: Was a bit skeptical after reading some bad reviews but found the excaliber more than adequate. Stayed there 4 nights in mid January. The rooms were quite large and clean. The hotel is aging a bit but it seemed clean and the service was good. I found the express check-in and out to be a very good feature. Got my keys when I arrived in 5 minutes and avoided the long lines to check-in. Great location on the strip. Would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “A great time had at the Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from 23-25 January and had a pleasant stay at this hotel. The hotel is in a great location - right on the key intersection on the Strip - corner of Las Vegas Blvd & Tropicana Ave. The rooms are well furnished, although the carpet was a horrible colour. The room I had was a good size. On the down side, this property is designed around the casino. Finding the registration/check-in desk is a challenge. The rooms are in two towers so you have to make sure you at the right tower. The restaurants at this hotel are a little pricey compared to what you can get elsewhere on the Strip. I would stay at this hotel again, but did not think it was amazing - it was fine, but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a great weekend in Las vegas, my wife a I decided to take a trip to Las Vegas with our two children. We decided to stay at the Excalibur for the first time, their buffets had great food they were very freindly at a fair price. We decided to go to the dinner show with the nights and horses, it was very entertaining and the childeren loveds it. The room was very clean and checking in and out was very fast. I will deffinatly stay at the excalibur again.

Reviews.Title: “We like the Ex”
Reviews.Author: mommaneedsatrip
Reviews.Content: I just returned from the Excalibur a few days ago. This was my second stay there in the last year. Our first trip out we asked for any available upgrades (of course hoping for a freebie). They said they could upgrade us from a standard to a deluxe for an additional $10/night. We agreed, thinking that we were really going to be getting a better room. We were disappointed. We had a room on the 3rd floor, tower 2. Our view out the window was of a BIG TREE. And there was a sign hanging on the window, "please do not open the windows, due to moths flying in". But, we weren't staying at Ex. for the view or any "luxurious" features of the hotel. The deluxe room is slightly larger, with a small sofa in it. Our second trip out there we decided to save our extra $10/night and get the standard (and the standard room was comped for all 3 nights of this trip!!). The room is exactly like the deluxe, just a few feet shorter without a sofa. On this trip we had tower 1, 12th floor, room 34 (pretty close to elevator - Less walking! Yay!) Both trips we were very happy with the cleanliness of the hotel rooms. There is no bath tub at this hotel, but the shower water pressure is WONDERFUL. And we really appreciated the big vanity in the bathroom this last trip (2 women with lots of makeup/hair stuff). If you want something beyond "basic" this may not be your place to stay. We never spend much time in the room besides sleeping and getting ready to leave, so it was perfect for us. I have a pillow-top mattress at home, so I was concerned about how I'd sleep there. But I've always slept hard here. And we've played at the casino and are usually very generously comped (and we're by no means high or even medium rollers). And we've received plenty of free room offers in the mail. I would recommend this hotel to people who want to save some money on accomodations on the strip, however shop around first and if a better deal comes up on a better hotel - take it. We're returning in February, we have 2 nights comped at Ex and the other nights were supposed to be casino rate. However, we got rates at MGM (through my players card) for the last 3 nights that are a little less than Ex., so we'll take our 2 free nights at Ex and then move on to MGM because its little cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal, great location”
Reviews.Author: vancouver-jim
Reviews.Content: Over the past ten years we have stayed at the Excalibur several times. It isn't as nice as the Monte Carlo or Treasure Island but it has a much better location, convenient to the Luxor, Tropicana, and Mandalay Bay to the south, and to the New York, New York, the MGM, the Aladdin, and the Monte Carlo to the north - all within a ten minute walk. We had a room (21605) on the 16th floor of Tower 2 - the fire engines' ladders only reach to the 7th floor. The room was relatively large compared to the newer hotels. No mini-bar, no microwave, a large shower instead of a bathtub. Only one bedtable between the beds. A round table with two chairs. A six foot wide, six drawer dresser plus a hall closet. We stayed from Dec. 27/05 until Jan. 3/06. The beds' sheets and bedspreads were changed after the third day - the rooms were kept clean but definitely don't look new. Service was good. The casino's slots (penny slots) were much looser than on our previous stays here; if you want a drink more frequently than every ten minutes while you are playing on a slot machine, you will be disappointed. The hotel has a nice spa: a well equipped common exercise room plus separate Spa sections for men and women. Each Spa has a large whirlpool with powerful jets, a hot, hot steam room, and a large sauna. Frequently there are complimentary passes; the normal cost is $15/day for hotel guests. For some unknown reason, my wife wanted to experience New Year's Eve in Las Vegas - she thought there must be a good reason for the rooms to cost $330/night besides it being on a weekend. It turned out that Las Vegas Boulevard was shoulder to shoulder persons, no room to move, many drunk - all waiting for something to happen to entertain them while they were waiting for the 8 minutes of fireworks, they were disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as I thought..”
Reviews.Author: icem2829
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel was average at best, It was certainly better then I expected after reading the reviews on here. The rooms were large and clean, but very boring, and I think that is a big complaint of many people on here. The furniture is outdated and somewhat dusty looking. However my room was very clean with plenty of space. Room service was fast and not as pricey as other resorts. For me the casino was great because I spend most of my time in the sportsbook and the excalibur has one of the best on the strip. The rest of casino however seems dirtier and much less classy then other hotels. The big selling point of the excalibur for was the price. 88.00 for one night, and 44 for the next. For that price there is NOTHING to complain about here. Sure, if you want to indulge yourself or impress someone stay as The Bellagio or the Venetian. If you want a decent hotel at a very cheap price for a few nights stay at the Excalibur and visit the Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Excalibur is definetley a hotel where you have to like children to stay, it's very family oriented and lots of children running around. Our group was made up of young parents, aunts and uncles so we were all used to the commotion but for older or singles I don't think this is the hotel they would want to be in. Travelling as often as we do, we found this hotel to be very nice, the rooms were clean and well prepared each day, the staff was friendly, the pool is great a little chilly in the morning, but nice once the sun hits it for a few hours, the hot tub was large and clean, the work out centre had great equipment and the spa offered wonderful services. The only down fall of the hotel room was the bathrooms, they only have showers, no tubs...not a big deal, but it was very hard to wash your feet in the sink after a long day of walking. The staff we found very accomodating, we arrived on an earlier flight then the rest of our party, when we arrived at the hotel our room was not ready because we we're early, the check in staff was very accomodating and checked our luggage to be sent up when the room was available, and sent us to the restaurant complimentary.When we checked out our flight was later, and our luggage was securily held until we could pick it up later that night. Both on arrival and departure the bell hop service was great, I don't think either of us touched our luggage to transport it at all. It would be nice however, if the hotel had an Excalibur to Airport shuttle. The whole reason we were in Vegas was for a wedding, so as most of our party was at the Excalibur, the wedding party was at the Flamingo where the wedding was taking place. Getting to and from these hotels was not hard, the bus stop was right out front of the Excalibur and the tram was across the way at the MGM, yes we are little off the strip, but you don't really notice it and some of the higher class hotels like Mandalay Bay are just as far off as you. One last note, this hotel isn't huge, but you can get lost all the halls look the same! The security to get to the hotel rooms was great, we were asked regularly to show our hotel guest ID before we could enter the tower. The food is excellent and a good variety between the buffet restaurant and the food court.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible - Dingy, Dirty, Dusty and Bugs”
Reviews.Author: tikkipembo
Reviews.Content: If I could give this hotel zero stars I would. This place was horrible. I stayed at the hotel this past week for the CES show. Unfortunately, I didn't decide to attend until the last minute so I was stuck at this hotel. PROS: Exterior - When the cab pulled up to the hotel, the exterior shape of the castle was pretty cool. I think kids would like this. Cheap - It's gosh darn cheap. If you are looking for a cheap place with cheap rooms and relatively cheap food - this is your place Casino - Small and not too crazy. There are some casinos in Vegas which are huge, this wasn't. One major flaw - not much free drinks is given away like other casinos. Location - South Strip can be a bit of a pain but it has a tram to Mandela Bay and easy access to New York and a relatively short distance to MGM (where the metrorail is located). CONS: Hotel room: Dirty, Dingy, Dusty and Bugs as well as Horrible Customer Service I entered the hotel room and while the space was rather large, it was barely furnished. The decor was old and I don't believe it has ever been renovated. The amount of dust and dinginess actually aggravated my allergies. My first morning, there was no water pressure in my shower (I stayed in Tower 2 - 15th floor). The front desk moved me to another room (Tower 1 - 4th floor). The second night, I flipped open the covers of the bed and to find a live roach scurrying around - Disgusting. I called the front desk immediately and they were pretty unconcerned and blase about it. The manager informed me that they run into these issues - ants, water bugs and roaches during the winter b/c it's cold outside and warm inside. It was the most pathetic answer I could have ever heard. I told him how appalled I was and asked what he was going to do... all he offered me was another room and either a free breakfast or a late check out. The next day (it was already 4 am on day 2 so I was stuck), I immediately checked out and moved over to MGM's West Wing - which was sooo much better. All I ask for in a hotel is cleanliness and good customer service. Neither were provided. *hint - if you do stay and want to contact the front desk or anything, dial the operator to connect you. If you call the front desk (for example) "directly", you will have to listen to 3 minutes of pre-recording before you are actually connected. Of.. and for location - Tower 1 is closer than Tower 2 to the front desk and casino. As for other comments regarding parking theft - it's true. While I did not park at the hotel, when I checked out - 2 police officers were taking a report by a hotel guest for that particular reason.

Reviews.Title: “Could do worse or better”
Reviews.Author: SSThunder
Reviews.Content: The saying goes, "you get what you pay for". And that is where the Excalibur excels. Forget viewing this as some luxury piece of vegas hotel, and forget thinking that this is a castle. On both counts it isn't. I was lead to belive that the hotel opened in the early 90's, but to be honest, it felt more like a medieviled them hotel opned in the 70's that wasn't sure what it was going to be. The rooms are large, but are spookily devoid of muchfurniture, as per the bathroom. In typical Vegas style, no standard fridge, and not much in the way of views either - we could see the pool and the large expanse of carpark. There were drink and ice machine's on each floor,and it was very dark looking! But considering the price, (we paid abour $60US) on expedia, it was reasonable value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Ants!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TNCG
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in November lasts year, the hotel was fine apart from the lack of basics and of course the little reddish ants I found crawling all over my towel as I stepped from the shower! I rang the front desk to complain the was transferred about a million times before they agreed to move us! We were moved next door to a room with a bathroom directly beside the one with the ants, and of course this room had ants too! We were finally tranferred to a completly different floor with lovely views of the strip instead of other hotel rooms!Sorry was said but not much beyond that,lets just say I wasn't best pleased and shall never be staying their again. On the plus side the buffet was good!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: clkVa
Reviews.Content: My husband has always wanted to stay here, so we stayed one night for our anniversary. The cheapest we could get the room was for $200. The staff was courteous, however there was a roach in our room, the AC was outdated, no in room coffee pot, blow drier was broken... when we reported this they said, oh, thanks for letting us know... I am SO glad we only stayed 1 night. The dinner show was fun, and we got a buy one get one free ticket when we checked in. One weird thing, there are birds in the rafters of the dinner show.

Reviews.Title: “Hated it!!!”
Reviews.Author: RLWalling
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Excalibur Dec. 4th thru 7th. You get what you paid for!!!! First we upgraded our rooms when we got there. When we got to our rooms, they looked like a Motel 6, and that may be insulting the Motel 6 chain. I would have hated to see our rooms if we hadn't upgraded. The furniture in the rooms were cheap and it looked it. We ate at the Blackforest Cafe one night. I have had better food at a ballgame. It was terrible and overpriced. The next morning we ate at the Roundtable buffet. Once again the food was terrible and overpriced. Those were the only 2 times we ate there. For our other meals, we went to different casinos. The only 2 good things about the Excalibur was the casino and the Fantasy Faire for the kids. I liked the casino because it was small and you didn't have to walk a long way to get to everything. The kids loved the Fantasy Faire area, but half of the games were out of order or they took your money without allowing you to play. I will never stay there agina unless they comp me free rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Found the Excalibur cheap if you book it direct on the web. The place is clean, bright and cheerful. Great drinks service at the tables. Only downside is that they advertise too much in the way of food, everywhere you turn there is pictures of food (that looks nothing like the picture, tastes poor too)

Reviews.Title: “No problems, had a good time!”
Reviews.Author: wblosangeles
Reviews.Content: Stayed there this last weekend, Dec 2 through 5, the hotel, along with Luxor and Mandalay, were sold out due to a prize fight, the marathon, and the rodeo. Got in around 5:00 pm on Friday, checked in via the kiosk at the counter area. Never seen this before, but it was very fast. You swipe your credit card to locate the reservation and follow the prompts. Got checked in, with keys issued from the computer, in about three minutes! One warning: I might not do this again, for one reason. The computer issues you a room, and you have no input. I got a good room facing the strip, however if you don't, you are overlooking a dreary courtyard, as the hotel towers are arranged in a square, and the inner rooms have no view at all. Not even of the mountains, since the towers are the same height. You would see the other towers! The rooms were okay, not five-star, but clean. Furniture wasn't "worned out," and I found the room more than "barable," despite what the previous poster from Los Angeles said. Room was minimal, served its purpose, housekeeping came every day, etc. Personnel were friendly, had good luck on slots! I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “They Lost My Luggage”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice enough, with clean enough rooms. All in all I would have said the stay was plesant until the point where they lost my luggage. I left my bag with the baggage check are at the service station of the Excalibur Hotel at 11:15AM in the morning and when I returned that evening at 9:15PM, the bags of my two traveling companions were retruned and mine was not. Since then I have spoken with several people regarding the bag and what type of compensation they will offer. The baggage claim ticket states that they hotel will be liable for lost items at 250.00 per item not to exceed 750.00 per guest. The hotel is claiming that one bag of luggage is considered one item and is only willing to offer me 250.00 total for my lost bag. Anyone who travels would probably agree with me that 750.00 is not adquate coverage and 250.00 certainly will not cover it. Amongst items lost with my luggage are also my keys to my home and my car. How can 250.00 compensate for the locks I need to change plus my personal items? Furthermore they state they have reviewed all of their security cameras and still can not find what happened to the bag. How a bag can escape a casino's worth of security cameras is beyond me. I would recommend two things, one, always get traveler's insurance, even if you are taking a bag on carry on and two, do not stay at the Excalibur Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What Do You Want”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the excalibur 17th-24th Nov 05" Room was good size beds were comfy & bathroom large & clean, housekeeping were excellent. Casino was smokey but always buzzing so non-smokers you have been warned. Negative reviews of this hotel were unfounded for me you get what you pay for & if you want luxury stay at the Wynn & pay the price. On the downside the slots seem to have been tightened everywhere & 1cent machines allowing 200 lines $2 dollars a press you might get more value playing the tables. Brits be aware of the 30% tax on wins over $1200 on some slots get a tax number or be charged $375 tax which you can get back, all hotels will give you advice on this, so be lucky, enjoy & stick to your budget. Check out the "V" at the aladdin awesome juggler. Don"t let some reviews put you off some people want 5 star for 1 star prices, you can always change hotel if not happy. Although I will not be stopping in the Excalibur again as I never visit the same hotel twice I don"t have any negative comments on this hotel so pay your money & take your chance. "VIVA LAS VEGAS"

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel, budget rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night and we were glad we stayed only one night, because the rooms were NOT comfortable. The rooms are outdated, the ac unit is weak and the bed/ furniture were worned out. The bathrooms looks barable, I wouldn't say the rooms were clean exactly. The only great thing about this hotel offered free parking and is located off the strip. This is probably one of the cheapest hotel on the strip, so it is convenient, but the rooms look more motel-like. For the price you are paying, it is ok. If you want to stay in a nice hotel for the same price off the strip, try Holiday Inn Express.

Reviews.Title: “A bit dated but comfy”
Reviews.Author: ouisel05
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at Excalibur on our honeymoon 13 years ago and I don't think the place has been refurbished since! Despite this though it was clean and comfortable (even with our two children in tow). It is conveniently located and the food was great. The buffet breakfast was good and we all enjoyed the Tournament of the Kings show. The gaming floor was not as smokey as some other casinos which was a nice change and the staff were friendly. I would stay there again but would most likely try another hotel first, just for a change because there are so many in Vegas! As it was winter, the pool closed early (5pm I think, from memory) and my kids weren't too happy about that. I think it would have been too cold after dark anyway to swim but it was heated so who knows?!?! We had two queen sized beds in the room which was ample for our family. One criticism is that there were no in-room safes which would have been handy for our passports etc. We had a great stay and I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at Excalibur!”
Reviews.Author: kandpsmom
Reviews.Content: I was in Las Vegas this past weekend for a work related conference. I had reservations at the Riviera and ended staying at Excalibur. I am not sure if it was simply because of the bad experience I had at the Riviera but I really felt like the Excalibur was worth every penny. The front desk staff was friendly and tried to be as accomodating as possible. The rooms were comfortable and quiet. The food court had many choices including my personal favorite "Cold Stone". I think overall it was a great experience and would recommend it for those looking for a nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel Good Rate”
Reviews.Author: bowdenj
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel one night 11/10/05. Rate around $60.00 for two double beds. Las Vegas seemed really dead that week so no crowds, quick checkin, quick checkout, etc. Ate two meals at Sherwood Forest - decent Denny's type meals with matching prices. Security checked to make sure everyone had room key to get to elevators. LONG walk from parking lot to hotel room (through casino). HUGE bathroom (no tub).

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur...bad beds, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Excalibur Hotel/Casino, and I must admit you get what you pay for. My boyfriend and I went there for our 3 year anniversary. It was his first time there and I have been there many of times and have stayed in hotels like Treasure Island and The Hard Rock. Both are awesome hotels but can be a little pricy. Knowing that it was his first time I knew that we were NOT going to be in our room for more then just a quick sleep and a shower. So we did not want to spend a lot of money on the hotel room. We wanted to spend more time on things like a spa day (Spa Mandalay, at Mandalay bay AMAZING!) and a show (Rita Rudner, HILARIOUS!). So back to the review of the room. The hotel has had a recent "make over" and still has a mideval theme and is not anywhere close to luxurious!! Our room was on the 18 floor with a strip view, and the bathroom was clean and recently remodeled, the beds are rock hard so unless you pass out drunk from the yard long margaritas :) you will NOT have the best night sleep. That is the only real thing I had a problem with the hotel, was the beds. Check in was fast and friendly, The pool is HUGE with a water slide. OH, do not, REPEAT DO NOT eat at the buffet at the excalibur, NASTY...NASTY!! If you have seen Vegas Vacation... You will have an mental idea what it is like. (The Luxor has a decent buffet) All in all if it is your first time in Las Vegas and you have a little more to spend on a room... SPEND IT!! it will be worth it. You do get what you pay for. Enjoy your vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Spend your money Elsewere”
Reviews.Author: Illy1108
Reviews.Content: Booked our trip almost a year in advance, yet a late check in had us end up in a a dreary double room. Not very conducive to celebrating a wedding anniversary. Apparently, even though we booked and paid in advance for a king deluxe room, they stand by a first come, first serve policy. After checking in at 2am, we were too exhausted to argue and slept in a cramped, past it's prime full sized bed. After calling the front desk the next morning for a new room, we were shuffled around to 5, count em, 5 rooms before we threw a fit and the manager set us up in a suite. The suite was amazing, two rooms, a jacuzzi, 1 1/2 bathrooms, very very nice. It made up for losing an entire day of our vacation to changing rooms. Almost. After seeing so many different rooms, I can tell you that the regular rooms at Excalibur are dreary, out dated, and not the cleanest I have seen. The amenities such as soap and shampoo are cheap in the regular rooms (not so in the suite). Rooms of this calibar can be had for much less at different hotels on and off the strip. I have seen deals on Hotwire and Expedia for the newer hotels (Venetian, Bellagio, MGM, etc.) for just a little more per nite than we paid. The buffet was HORRIBLE; overpriced, dried out, bland and cheap food. The cafe was decent, reasonably (not great) priced. Room service was AWFUL; cold, expensive, incomplete, and served by a rude waiter. Order a pizza instead. The food court was ok, I especially enjoyed the Krispy Kreme factory, the one saving grace of a dismally over rated, over priced hotel. The nicest thing about this hotel is the castle facade, which was unique and eye catching on a strip with unbelievable over the top hotels. All in all my opinion of this hotel was relatively low and I will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “So-so”
Reviews.Author: Yaeneth
Reviews.Content: The check-in time was a little long. The room was standard. The food was okay. Too many children running around and the hotel is very hard to navigate.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: caitni2000
Reviews.Content: If this is your first time in Vegas, spoil yourself and go to a fancy casino. Excalibur is cheap, basic and fits in with the strip and has many good experiences. The buffet is horrible and they shows aren't worth it, but if all you need is a place to lay your head its good enough.

Reviews.Title: “OK not so great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed on 10th floor, tower 2, last week - room was dreary maybe they want to look rustic like the medieval times - whatever - thought the room was overpriced paid 119 the first night 109 the second night - however, you get 2-for-1 tickets to the Tournament of Kings show, so it evened out in the end for us traveling with a 7 year old - all in all, liked staying at Circus Circus better - room was nicer, no musty smell going down the corridors - beds were firmer at Circus Circus (sister property to Excalibur) - would NOT stay at Excalibur again -

Reviews.Title: “Cheap rooms, but you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: wr70beh
Reviews.Content: THe room was cheap (49 bucks for a Wednesday night and 99 bucks for a Thursday night), but the room had problems. First off, the view was of a brick wall (I know not all rooms have that view but ours did), and the toilet was broken. It kept running and running. Service is almost non-existant. The check in lines are insanely long (do yourself a favor and check in using the self-check in kiosk). The casino is full of people but they had the cheapest gaming (next to the Tropicana) on the south end of the Strip. Someone mentioned the timeshare sharks and they aren't lying. They are about the same annoyance as those guys who stand out on the strip and hand out those escort service flyers. Just ignore them and they won't bother you.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, affordable casino in a great location”
Reviews.Author: zandychicago_IL
Reviews.Content: there was nothing special about the Excalibur, but we knew that going in -- we booked the weekend here because it was affordable and we didn't want to spend a lot of $ on a hotel room because we were planned on gambling. We stayed at the Tropicana a few years ago and felt that it was a little outdated, so we decided to give excalibur a try. The room was large, as was the bathroom. Both were clean. We opted for Tower I because it's a shorter walk to the strip. The view was disappointing -- roof of the casino and the landscape to the west. We wanted to stay at NYNY, but for $100 cheaper a night we stayed at the excalibur and spent the extra cash we saved at the casinos. I would reccommend Excalibur for ppl that want an affordable, clean room on the strip across the street from MGM and NYNY. BTW, the checkin lines WERE long, and I don't understand why it takes so long to get a couple keys for a hotel room! :)

Reviews.Title: “Very Long Check in Lines”
Reviews.Author: Valleybrookln
Reviews.Content: The Excalibur Hotel was OK. The Rooms have not been updated since the Hotel was Built. Nice Roomy Bathrooms. Good Service from the hotel staff. The check in line was very long & slow moving.Took over 0ne hour to check in to The Hotel room. Not much fun waiting in line after traveling all day!!! On a scale from 1-10 overall I would give it a 6.The rooms are over priced as well as the Buffet. Nice chapel for a wedding. Good Location on the strip. Hotel Stay 10/14/05-10/17/05

Reviews.Title: “Good Family Atmosphere -- Room Was Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: AlbinoShaq
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur Oct. 17 and 18, when the GM convention was in town, so we payed double the normal discount price - $100.00 per night. After being told there were no king-size beds available, we were upgraded to a room with a view of the New York New York and the MGM Grand Hotels with 2 queen beds ...great view...the room was a little rough: No lounge chair, the desk chairs were uncomfortable, no bathtub, and the bed springs were shot. In contrast, we did love the casino itself, since we were there with our 15-month-old baby...the employees were super nice to our baby, the buffet was awesome, and baby loved the game room. Although the employees were nice and the casino celebrated our baby, we would probably stay somewhere else because of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: susie6505
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Excalibur from Oct 16 to the 19th and was very pleased. The staff was very friendly. We had booked our hotel through Funjet since we already had our airline tickets. Since we booked through Funjet, we were able to use the express check-in window, which was great because there was a long line. We requested a corner room, but did not have a smoking one available, but took the one next to it. We did not eat in the hotel, but did go upstairs to get a cup of coffee and Kripsy Kreme donut, yum! The Sherwood (sp) Forest cafe was always packed, so I think that was a good sign. What is nice about the Excalibur is the location. It is a big hotel but easy to get around unlike MGM. MGM was terrible to get around in and we got lost 3 times trying to get to the monorail (which I highly recommend). We did not get to use the pool because of weather, but look nice. For location and transportation, definitely stay here! Really enjoyed it and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I have stayed at the Excalibur on many occasions. If you join their "One CluB" rewards program (free) you accumulate points and comp dollars. Both points and comps are based on your level of play. It didn't take long for us to have several hundred comp dollars and several thousand points. Now when we go to Las Vegas, we are treated like VIPs..We contact VIP services, our Hotel rooms are free (we use comp dollars) and all our food is free thanks to our comp earnings. We are even picked up at the Airport by a Limo and returned to the airport via Limo. I cannot say enough good things about the Excalibur Hotel. The staff at the VIP center as well as all the staff we have come in contact with are wonderful. We really feel we are welcomed when we make contact for reservations and upon arrival. We have also stayed at many other Hotels over the years, but have found that the Excalibur is the best.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you paid for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First of all, I'd like to thank everyone who wrote a review of this hotel. This is a great resource for first-timers like me in a strange city (and Vegas is one of the strangest!). My wife used to manage hotels and I used to work in hotels, so I feel confident in this opinion: the Excalibur Hotel and Casino is to the Las Vegas Strip what any economy hotel is to the average city. You get everything you need (hair dryers in the rooms - irons too!), but not a whole lot else. First off, the good points. the Excalibur has excellent access to the south end of the strip: bridges to the New York, New York and MGM Grand; Trams to the Luxor and Mandalay Bay; easy walking distance to the Monte Carlo. I never saw less than six taxis lined up outside the hotel, so access to any casino or hotspot is no problem. The view I had from the 16th floor of tower 2 was outstanding - I was eye level with the roller coaster next door! Once I got past security to my tower (never was a problem), I rarely met anyone in the hallways. Things were very quiet in the hotel - even though I was told the hotel itself was over 90% capacity on the saturday night I stayed there. The "Tournament Of Kings" show was worth the admission. I sat next to a 4 year old boy who lived and died with every joust and fight. His reactions will be one of the highlights of my trip. He got into the show, and his excitement was contagious. Secondly, I take exception to a few other reviews on this board. I did not find the casino filled with any more smoke than any other casino I was in. I agree the hallways were darker than average hotels, but not so dark that I felt uncomfortable in them. I noticed the hallways in the Luxor were darker. I also agree that the hotel could use some refinishing, but overall the facility is in good shape. Finally, there's always some things that need improvement. The dinner buffet at the Excalibur was passable, but I felt it wasn't worth the price I paid for it. The lunch buffet at the Luxor had the same problem. The overall flow of the casino needs improvement. I always found the Excalibur casino to be the most congested, most crowded and loudest casino on the strip. In their defense, the Freemont Street casinos were louder and more crowded. In fact, after the first day of our trip, we never gambled in the casino, but walked through it to other casinos. Overall, if you want to be pampered and treated to every amenity while in Vegas, this is not your hotel. I'm sure other hotels will offer more of what you want, but you will need to pay more for it. If you want a clean, comfortable place to stay with amazing access to the strip - this is your hotel. The next time we're in Vegas, we'll definately consider staying at the Excalibur.

Reviews.Title: “Magic and funny !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A good place for the family. We stayed 2 nights : we payed 33 dollars per person and day (it was not the week end). The room was clean. Restaurants and access to Internet were a little expensive. Only one real problem : too cold inside because of the air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights from the 24th september. We payed $99 for the Saturday night and $59 for the other nights. We booked it early on the hotel website. This is a great Family hotel.The room was very large and clean. Being on the south end of the strip it is nicer than the north end were Circus Circus is located.We went and had a look at Circus Circus and it was a mad house with kids running every where. The Excalibur had a great swimming pool area which was not crowded.It had alot of eating options within the hotel. It was easy to catch the Cat (bus) up and down the strip from the stop in front of the hotel.The freemont st light show was well worth seeing we had a great buffet at the Golden Nugget We went to the Tournament of the kings, It was not average, My 9 year old Daughter enjoyed it, We also went and saw the show V which was great for kids and adults.We got tickets at one of the cheap ticket outlets and saved about 35% on normal rates. We flew out to the Grand Canyon south rim which is a must, to see its real beauty you have to see it from lookouts like angel lodge. We did Scenic airlines South rim air/ground tour. We also went to hoover dam which was great and did a night helicopter flight which was amazing.($50) Overall the Excalibur was a great place to stay we would definetly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great low limit poker room”
Reviews.Author: Thornaldo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Excalibur for the first time in almost 10 years, and I must say I was very satisfied. OK, there are finer hotels in Vegas, but in its price range the Excalibur must be one of the best. Far better, and just a little bit mor expensive, than San Remo (soon to be Hooters hotel & casino). I spent one week in Las Vegas, most of my awake time in poker rooms. The Excalibur has a really nice one, with friendly dealers and a funny mix of players. It must be one of the best places to play low limit poker in Las Vegas. I was travelling alone, and got a small, but nice enough room at the 24. floor with a limited view of the strip and a great view of the airport (if you like planes, that is). It was clean enough and the room service was effective. There is no in-room bar. Some complain about to many kids at Excalibur. I didn't see that many, and the fact that this is a familiy hotel really shouldn't put anyone off. My previous hotel experience in Las Vegas includes Alladin, MGM Grand, Luxor and the previous mentioned San Remo Hotel. I rate the Alladin as the best one I've stayed at so far, but for this trip I didn't think it was worth the extra money. For a low budget trip to Las Vegas, the Excalibur is my choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: MichaelC1968
Reviews.Content: The Excalibur is great value for the price. If you want a themed hotel but are on a budget, Excalibur is ideal. Close to several of the biggest hotels (Luxor, MGM, NY NY & Mandalay Bay) it is a good location for seeing this end of the Strip. The rooms are perfectly adequate (if a little dated) and all the staff I came accross were helpful & friendly. I've stayed at both Luxor and NY NY and rate both higher - but you pay more. Given that few people spend much time in their rooms whilst in Vegas the quality of room furnishings should not matter too much. Don't come here expecting Bellagio quality at this price. If you want to spend just a little more I would highly recommend Luxor (opt for a pyramid room) but you can't beat Excalibur for value on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping is TERRIBLE!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from September 15 thru September 18. We got married in Vegas and wanted a decent place to stay. The food was awesome, expecially Sir Gallahads, buffet was good, Sunday brunch was awesome! Housekeeping was TERRIBLE! Our room was clean the first day, the rest of the 3 night stay, our room NEVER got cleaned! Had to call for towels to get us by.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent the week of Sep. 11 at the Excalibur and could not have had a better experiance. The hotel was great and every member of the staff that we met were wonderful. The location could not be better and I thought the rooms were nice. The casino also payed very well. For those who write a bad review on this hotel/casino, all I can say is "get a life". This is a great place to stay, and I will definently be back.

Reviews.Title: “best choice for bargin/budget traveler”
Reviews.Author: davidphd
Reviews.Content: good stip location across from mgm, ny,ny, tropicana, and luxor! best buffet value on strip! small average rooms, two nice pools with water slide for kids, air conditioner was a little noisy and no in-room-safe. for $45/night i got a room plus 2 for 1 buffet, spa, and show tix! while the rooms are not as nice as mgm and other properties, they are clean and perfect for anyone seeking a bargin on the strip! overall service was good, check in/out was quick and easy, room service arrived with coffee in the morning in about 4 minutes!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Mikesbabygirl
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Excalibur Hotel. One of the main reasons we stayed there was the price. I wanted to stay on the strip and still not pay too much. The room was clean but very dark and so-so. We were disappointed that there was no refrigerator in the room. We had requested a strip view room but when we opened the window all I saw was a big wall. I have to say the Customer Service was excellent though. After my boyfriend called and explained that this was our first trip to Vegas and we really wanted a view they moved us right away. We ended up facing the New York New York hotel with a spectacular view. I could hear the screaming riders on the Manhattan Express from my room. As I said before you get what you pay for. I don't think I would stay here again for the simple fact it was too gloomy for me. But I would recommend for others who want to be on the strip for a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “No problems!!!”
Reviews.Author: AshleyD1226
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Excalibur Sept. 1-6, 2005 (Labor Day Weekend). We arrived at the hotel at 8:30 am and was checked in immediately!! We asked for a room close to the elevator. We were given a room in tower 2, our room # was 4239. We had a pool view!! Tip--if you plan to use the pool ask for a room in tower 2. Our room was the first room off the elevator. We had read many horriable reviews about this hotel and was a little scared to stay. We did not have any problems. Would stay here again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Kids? Not in adult areas.”
Reviews.Author: Aquasolaris
Reviews.Content: Basic hotel/motel style rooms, but if you can find a rate including food and other comps it kan be a really good deal. Sign up for their email list and get other specials than promoted on their website. Asked for a high floor with a view, first time 26th view of the Luxor and Mandalay Bay and Airport, second time 28th (highest) with a side view of the strip. Ask for a room in tower 1 high floor, rooms between nr 14 and 28 and you'll have a stripview without having to pay more! View of Paris, Aladdin and NYNY. Some things you need to know: Kids are on the hotel grounds, but mostly in areas where they are aloud. On the casino floor you won't see them, and isn't that where you want to be? The rooms are very basic, bed and big bathroom with a shower (Why so much space for just a shower, vanity and toilet?). Beds are rather hard, but you're not sleeping on the floor, want better beds, pay more! Seemed clean enough and if you want a bed to sleep in, this will do enough for you. Don't expect any more than this and you will have a good time, don't pay more than 50 bucks (sun-thu) including comps and you'll be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: Rugen
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a stay in the Excalibur. The rates were cheap, and I got a clean, quiet room with no problems. There are certainly better hotels on the strip, but not at the prices that I paid at Excalibur.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, inexpensive room rates but other hotels are so much nicer.”
Reviews.Author: FunToReview1
Reviews.Content: First of all, let me say that we did not experience any of the problems that plagued previous reviewers. The Excalibur is a perfectly fine place to stay and it would be considered great if it was your only choice. The fact is, we walked through many of the other hotels and they all were just so much nicer than the Excalibur, especially the Luxor and Mandalay Bay. That being said, the best things about Excalibur are the low room rates and its great location. You can easily walk to Luxor, MB, NYNY, MGM, Showcase Mall, and we even hoofed it up Las Vegas Blvd all the way to Caesar's, passing Alladin, Paris and Bellagio on the way. (Had to take a taxi back!) Expect to do a lot of walking so wear comfy shoes. We arrived in LV the day after Labor Day. There were almost no kids except our own 10 year old. There was no line at the check-in counter! We got a great room ($69.95) on the 26th floor of Tower 2 with a great view of NYNY and its roller coaster (barely heard it). Tower 2 is your best bet especially if you want to use the pools a lot. You simply take the elevator down, cross the hall, go down a corridor and out to the pool. No hike in your bathing suit through the casino! There is also a convenience store and coffee shop just steps from the elevator. The room was clean. The bathroom too. It was however stark. Just the basics and no extras except for some mini toiletries, an ice bucket w/plastic cups, and iron/board and hairdryer. No fridge, no morning paper, no coffee pot. Towels are thin but plentiful. Pillows are small and spongy. We left $10.00 and a note for the maid to bring us 2 more pillows and an extra blanket. We met her after coming back from breakfast and she cheerfully provided both. She even left us extra towels. Nothing in the room was broken or smelled funny. Nothing leaked, squeaked or rattled. The a/c was a little loud when it kicked on but that was it. The halls were chilly but clean and dimly lit, yes, but that's part of the medieval theme. No trays were seen left out and elevators were speedy. Tip: Soda machine near elevator has bottled water a whole dollar cheaper than shops downstairs. The casino itself is huge. The ceiling is low and it feels very confusing . Signs are around to help you find your way through the maze. The arcade is downstairs. It seemed kind of dingy and it smelled musty from the fountain. Our child loved it anyway but claimed that NYNY had the best arcade. There are lots of places to eat in the hotel, but beware, everything costs almost double what you'd expect to pay at home. We had dinner at the Regale which had great Italian food. We saw free entertainment at the Court Jester's stage which our child enjoyed. We saw the Tournament of Kings Show. Having read reviews of this, we already knew about the food and that you don't get silverware. Well, I can tell you, the food is horrible and the show isn't much better. We were incredibly disappointed. Not only that but we had front row seats and one of the kings rode around the arena with such force that his horse kicked up dirt onto the table and three people got it in their food, their drinks and in their laps! They demanded their money back but they didn't get it. About 15 minutes later, the waiter showed up with spaghetti and meatballs! So if you must go to this show, don't sit in the front row. Overall we had a great time in Las Vegas. Our main objective was just to see the city. We had never been there and it was our anniversary so we wanted to go somewhere special. Although we brought our 10 year old who found it all so very exciting, I will say that Las Vegas (and the Excalibur in particular) may appear to have child oriented things (magicians, roller coasters, arcades, lion habitats, shark tanks, etc) it is not a good place to bring kids. It's a playground for adults. Go alone. Leave the kids at home and take them to Orlando instead. Highlights: Must see Luxor, MB pool, eat at the Rainforest Cafe in MGM, stroll through the Forum shops at Caesar's and see the fountain statues come to life.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience!!”
Reviews.Author: all8
Reviews.Content: This place is a dump! We come to Vegas twice a year, and stay at either the Las Vegas Hilton or MGM. Well, we planned to stay an extra day last April, so we checked out of the Hilton and went to Excalibur for a change of pace. Big mistake!! I know the Hilton isn`t exactly the newest hotel in Vegas, but the place is head and shoulders above the Excalibur, it`s much classier. Where do I start...first off we were on the very bottom floor....so low we were BELOW ground, and the front desk said we would have to pay extra to move! Plus the room stunk like cigarette smoke (non smoking room) One wall had a nasty, huge brown stain, and there must have been 20 people in the room next to us partying all night. Hey, I like to have a good time in Sin City just like the next guy, but this was nonstop noise all through the night. We heard security finally tell them to put a halt to the goings on at about 4am...gee, thanks! Oh yeah, there was a sewer problem in the tower we fortunately weren`t in, but I heard plenty of [--] guests complaining about it at the front desk when we checked in (which by the way took over an hour on a Sunday night). The valet took 45 minutes to retrieve our rental car Monday morning because the attendent misplaced the keys. To top it all off we didn`t win a dime gambling there. All this in ONE night!! I`m never setting foot in this place again. Nasty, nasty hotel, and too many unsupervised kids running around. We`ll only stay at the LV Hilton or MGM from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a Low/Mid-Budget Strip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VegasDude66
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Excalibur on at least 4 occasions this year on my near-weekly trips to Las Vegas on business.
