The hotel seems to cater to large groups and is very popular with families. It offers a wide range of quality restaurants and a food court for those wanting something quick on the go. The casino is huge but navigatible...there is a "Fantasy Faire" for the younger ones downstairs which offers a multitude of carnival-type games for the kids and a couple of magic motion rides. There is a poker room with low limits as well as every table game and slot you can imagine. A monorail runs between Luxor, Mandalay Bay and Excalibur for those wanting to venture down the road a bit...the New York, New York Hotel, MGM Grand, Monte Carlo, and Tropicana are all within a quick walk. The hotel and casino are huge...so take note of your room tower...it's easy to get lost/turned-around and I've been in the place at least 20 times over the last couple of years. There is a large pool area (full of kids!) and a spa located near the rear entrance. Overall, a pretty good value for a Strip property. Rooms are clean, spacious and with the basic ammenities (iron and board are a must for me!).

Reviews.Title: “sixteen years and still coming back!”
Reviews.Author: ChefLin
Reviews.Content: We started coming here sixteen yeas ago when our children were small. They loved the castle theme, etc. Loved the arcade and the breakfast buffet - perfect for picky eaters. Now that they are adults, they still choose to come along with us. My husband and I stay there primarilly for the offers they give us. Out of five nights I rarely pay for more than two. The comps are the best on the strip. They give cash back, free items, free buffets and best of all they are extremely generous with the room comps. I tour around during the day and play a little here and there, but when I want to win some money and accumulate comp points, I play at the Excalibur. They make it worthwhile for me to travel from Connecticut a couple times a year. Also, if you want to get away from the kiddie castle theme, give yourself a treat and head for the spa. Prices are reasonable - it's new, beautifully decorated and they treat you very nicely and you get a great massage for an extremely reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing - to say the least....”
Reviews.Author: Beachlove
Reviews.Content: You only get what you pay for..... I should have known. Too many undisciplined noisy kids. Rooms are rundown. The place is tired. We paid extra for an upgrade - which wasn't an upgrade, afterall!

Reviews.Title: “Outside Better than the Inside”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the exterior, the castle is absolutely beautiful, and their midevil music is very tasteful. On the inside, the halls were dark and dismal, and smelled musty. Was that part of their midevil castle image? I don't think so. Guests ordering dinner to their rooms were making it hard on the rest of us. The leftover food stayed in the hallways on a cart, all night, and until the cleaning staff started their work. It was pretty disgusting. We didn't win any money there, but we didn't win anywhere else either. Their Tournament of Kings Dinner Theatre was absolutely spectacular and was definitely the highlight of our trip. All and all, a good Casino/Hotel smack dab in the middle of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the price range - great location”
Reviews.Author: travelbugger
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a couple nights at the end of August. As it was mid-week we were able to get a great rate ($50/night) which definitely made it the best choice in the price range (compared to similar rates we found at Circus Circus, Sahara, and the Riveria, which all seemed a little dumpy when we walked around them during our stay). Much better location too - south strip is much more convenient to everything. Rooms were plenty large and clean - not overly luxurious but certainly nice enough. Would recommend if you can get a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur: Aware of water shortage”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Las Vegas for my 30th birthday. It was the first time for both of us and we were ready for a good time. We stayed at the Excalibur, which was fine for what we were there for, holding our luggage. I'm a clean freak usually, but this time I overlooked the same ripped sheet for three days, the bathroom rug not matching anything or being washed. I simply used a towel to step onto when coming out of the shower in place of the rug and I decided the hotel was conserving water by not changing our linens. After all, it was JUST us that had slept on those sheets, right? Otherwise the staff had been friendly and helpfull with questons & directions. There is a tram that takes you to the Luxor and the Mandalay to save you from the heat. A bridge walkway takes you to New York, New York where you can walk a short distance to the Monte Carlo and catch a tram to the Bellagio or walk across the street to the MGM. You just have to know which hotels have the tram. The Excalibur is at the cleaner end of the strip in our opinion. I was glad we stayed that direction. It is busy towards the middle of the strip and then it becomes a bit dirty and dungy looking towards the end. If you do decide to walk the entire strip, which we did once, I recommend very comfortable shoes! Flip flops and sandles will give you blisters of some kind. We had a great time and will be back to Vegas! I also recommend seeing the Blue Man Group, so worth the $$.

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: g230
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Excalibur from 31st July for 5 nights. Got a good deal on their own web site. I booked 2 rooms and wanted them together. I was told I had to ring on the day of check in and they may be able to arrange. This was difficult I we were flying in from UK – I rang them from New York airport while waiting for the second flight. They were able to provide rooms next to each other with adjoining door. When we eventually arrive later that evening I was surprised at how large and clean our rooms were as I had only booked the very basic standard room. One room had very large king size bed the other 2 queen beds. The bathrooms were again large and very smart -with no mold ! We did not have much of a view but that did not bother us . The swimming pools and sun loungers kept out teenage kids entertained during the day but unfortunately there was not much for them to do in the evening, as you have to be 21 to drink or gamble. My daughter spend some time in Medway which was in the basement of the hotel – it was full of games and funfair side shows, rather than win prizes she received tickets which at the end of our stay she converted into prizes. The hotel is marketed as good for families but I don’t think I would bring my kids back to Vegas Plenty of choice in the large food court. The round table buffet was exceptional value for money. The only down side of the hotel is that it felt so large and impersonal - but most of the strip hotel would be like that ……

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly, But Too Big”
Reviews.Author: lethal77
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at Excalibur for a few nights after leaving the Boardwalk Hotel A++++. The rooms are great here and nice and big and clean. The staff were freindly, pretty big queue to check in and out, but it's a busy time of year. Can not complain about the staff, but I will say the way to get to the pool is crazy, we had to walk right through the casino from our tower to the oppisite side of the hotel then down a corridor just to have a swim. It was hard work just to get in the pool. Maybe another way that you don't have to pass people dripping wet????? Some of the security staff that check your rooms keys on entry could do with an attitude re-alinement? Some of these people were rather grumpy insisting on seeing every persons key, but I guess it meant out room was safe. Overall a good location, very cheap rates, close to everything, very clean rooms and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Room - Nice Stay - No Problems”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Excalibur for one night (August 18). Check-in was quick - most likely because it was 10pm on a Thursday night. Had a room on the 28th floor with a great view. I had read other reviews about the condition of the furniture in some of the rooms. The furniture in my room was fine - except for an annoying radio alarm clock that kept turning on. No complaints about the bathroom - it was clean and the shower was big. I was worried about the huge checkout line the next morning - but there were plenty of people manning the hotel desk and it went fairly quickly. For the money (a little over a $100) I'd definitely stay there again. Check there rates though - as with the other hotels in Las Vegas, they jump up dramatically for the weekend dates!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap in all ways”
Reviews.Author: alray
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because we thought the kids would like it. Although the room was very large (the only plus), it was also very dirty. And, even though, we were on a non-smoking floor, there were people out in the hallways smoking. Yet, service was quick when we needed more towels. The downsides: Dirty, restaurants expensive for TERRIBLE food, pool area filtty (sticky cement from drinks and food -- yuk!!), very far from everything else on the strip. It is worn out and needs a total face lift. If you are looking for a hotel to stay with kids pick another one.

Reviews.Title: “The economy isn't worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Diandra
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a four day stay in Las Vegas. Because the hotel we always stay in was sold out sunday/monday (Aug 14/15), my husband and I decided to try Excalibur ...it was cheap but it's a big hotel so we though it was ok. We have stayed in chain motels before (in Vegas) and generally they are fair. As soon as we entered the room, though, we regreted so much the saved $$. Although all the furniture is extremely worn out, the main problem was the non-hygienic conditions of the place. I could give some many examples but I think one will suffice: the bathroom rug doesn't match the cotton towels (as in any cheap motel) and therefore it isn't fresh-washed. It's made of nylon and they must change once every 6 months only - because it was full of body hair from previous guests. So ...you can have the picture. It was really depressing and I never imagined such a thing in a thematic hotel on the Strip. And believe me...the saved extra dollars aren't worth when after a full day of Strip-walking, you go back to your room and feel unconfortable to take a shower and sleep. After two days we left and went back to our favorite. I was relieved.

Reviews.Title: “Kids will love it; parents...well...”
Reviews.Author: KJKKJS
Reviews.Content: We visited the Excalibur about a month ago, during Vegas' record breaking heatwave. Stayed at the Excalibur for the 2nd time in 3 years. Family of 5, with kids 13, 10 and 6. The hotel is very kid-friendly. Our kids (and the aprx 5000 other kids that were there the week we visited!) loved the pool, the arcade, and all the medieval themed decorations (lots of good photo-ops). Also, the food court was a huge hit; all the big-chain favorites: McDonalds, Subway, Pizza Hut, Krispie Kream, etc. Despite the legendary rumours of cheap Vegas foods, there were no deals at the Food Court. Expect to pay about 25% over what you'd pay "back home". Besides the food-court, there are several sit-down restaurants in the hotel. We ate at a steak-house (Camelot), and I was shocked at how good the experience was...service was attentive, food was perfectly prepared, and the atmosphere was fairly peaceful, given the craziness of the mass humanity just outside the doors. I was also a bit shocked at the bill; about $150 for dinner for two, with a few drinks. Safety and security seemed adequate. Given the size of the hotel (5000 rooms), and the sprawling lay-out of the casino, it's a bit easy to get disoriented, but it never feels over-whelming. Just pause, take a deep breath, look around, and you'll eventually find where you're going. The casino offers all the usual games, and does have some very low limits, on a few of the tables. Of course, as the crowd grows (say, 10 or so at night), the minimums start rising. Still, a pretty good place, if you're a low-roller, like us. Staff was generally friendly and helpful, although we did encounter a few dealers who looked like they would rather be anywhere else, than dealing us cards. Even as they were sucking away our money hand-after-hand, some of them couldn't crack a smile. On the other hand, there were many who were very engaging (as they sucked up our money). Check-in was uneventful, but we arrived very late (1:00 a.m.). Given the time, they were unable to accommodate our request for connecting non-smoking rooms. For the 1st night, we had smoking rooms, then switched to non-smoking, with a fabulous view, up on the 17th floor. On other days, it looked like you needed to be Job, in order to check-in without having a melt-down. Check-out via the kiosk was very easy. Rooms were adequate. Nothing fancy (not even a tub, if you consider that a frill; just shower stalls), but for the time we spent there, perfectly adequate. There is an element of you get what you pay for... Vegas itself seems to be undergoing a transformation. After many years of hard work to promote itself as more "family friendly", I think the accountants have taken over the casinos...elaborate, free family shows, with expensive props don't generate revenue; gamblers generate money. Compared with our visit 3 years ago, it seemed every casino had scaled-back the free productions. There is still a lot to see in Vegas on the cheap, but it's noticeably down-sized in scope and scale, compared to a few years ago. Still, just walking up and down the strip is a lot of fun. Watch-out for those summertime temperatures, however...we saw highs of almost 120F, with night time lows of about 98F(!). One night, we were walking around at 10:00 at night, and it was 108F! Well, at least it's a dry heat... The pools were a great relief from the heat, and all the kids really seemed to enjoy the slides. Note that, although adults are certainly ALLOWED in the pool, there were just as certainly not many of them actually IN the pool. All in all, I can heartily recommend the Excalibur for families, or for those who are economizing on their accommodation costs in Vegas. This is not the right hotel for everyone (please stay away if the sight of swarms of children having fun makes you ill, or if your primary purpose in Vegas is to gamble in a high stakes environment), but for what it is, it is fine. Please note that although on the strip, the Excalibur is almost at one end. It's a fair hike to middle strip, and to walk to the other end (Stratosphere) would be out of the question for some families. Cabs, Monorails and buses are all readily available. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel-Wow!”
Reviews.Author: Seymo
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two week holiday at the Excalibur hotel Las Vegas. After reading previous reviews, I was a little concerned. However, the Excalibur exceeded my expectations. The location is perfect, walkways to the Luxor, Mandalay Bay, Tropicana, New York New York and onto MGM Grand. The hotel also looks pretty amazing from the outside, especially at night. The interior is also decorated to a castle theme, it is over the top but after all it is Vegas. The room we had was very spacious for the four of us. Two large comfortable beds, two chairs, table, large television and plenty of storage, again all done in a tasteful castle theme. The bathroom was large with huge walk in shower cubicle. The room was immaculate on arrival and kept that way by the daily maid service. Towels were changed daily, as were sheets if required. The air conditioning was good, a little noisy but most are.The only real problem we had,was that our keycard failed to work a few times in the first few days. However, it was sorted promptly. Security was very good, keys were checked before access to the lifts to the rooms. The corridors were clean and again lighting was in the castle theme, but unlike previous reviews suggested, it was not too dark. We were in Tower two, fourth floor, the view was not great but we did not pay for a room with a view. It did have it's advantages, however, to a room on a higher floor. It was much quicker in the lifts not having to stop at lots of floors. Tower two is also in my opinion the better tower as access to the pool is easy. The other Tower means a trek across the casino floor when in need of a cooling off. The pools were brilliant, one has two slides for the children and two waterfalls, the other is larger but less fun. There were always plenty of lifeguards on duty. My favourite part of the pool complex was the hot tub jacuzzi. Seating about 30, it was like sitting in a hot bath with powerful bubble jets at back and leg level. What a great way to ease those aching muscles after walking the strip. Not to be missed! There were plenty of food choices in the Excalibur. The buffet for breakfast and dinner was good, although, you can eat too much. The food court was excellent for the children and adults, with McDonald's, Quizno's, Pizza Hut, cold stone ice-cream, Krispy Kremes and Manchu Wok. Service, food and cleanliness were all excellent. We did not have chance to try all the fine restaurants but they looked excellent. The shops were good offering a large selection of reasonably priced gifts. Entertainment was fantastic for the children with performances by various artistes of a high standard. The midway level for the children was also good fun. My husband visited the spa facilities and found them to be of a very high standard. He enjoyed it so much he wouldn't stop talking about it. He felt pampered like royalty, very befitting to the castle theme. After two weeks in Vegas and visits to many other hotels, we decided that the Excalibur had indeed been a good choice. Excellent accomodation choice which I would recommend to anyone with children young or old. My two were 16 and 11. If we return to Vegas we would not stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “OK For What It Is!”
Reviews.Author: Bttrfie
Reviews.Content: We were offered a timeshare deal, so we got to stay for free. Thay had given us three hotels to choose from and considering the Excalibeu was the only hotel/casino on the list we choose to stay there. It was my third time in Vegas and my husbands second, however, this was our first time together. The rooms are alright, nothing special. They were reasonably clean and spacious. The bathrooms were decent but there was absolutly no shower pressure. The room decor was pretty horrible, but that's really a personal preference. Other than those minor details the room was pretty ok. As far as the casino goes, I've seen better. THe only thing I suggest anyone NOT doing is eating at their restaurants. We experienced their buffet and it was just horrible. One evening after returning from a late show, we had stopped in to their dinner and it was just as horrible. Overall I'd say this Hotel was not for us. I don't think we will be staying there ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, Big Rooms, Clean, Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: hypnoticrichard
Reviews.Content: I was impressed. Dated rooms (brown 80's thing) but well kept. Great steakhouse, fantastic location in the heart of the action (near NYNY, MGM and Mandalay Bay, and Luxor). Got a great deal and would without a doubt stay here again. Huge rooms, and hi speed wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price but...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in March for our first trip to Vegas. My first impression was good, as check-in was easy and I was excited about the trip. The room was in shabby shape, with absolutely no view. I tried out one of the pools, but soon realized I was the only adult in it! Being in the city for a few hours, I realized I wish I would've booked a hotel more center of the strip, as it's a LONG WAY to some of the more glamourous sights. All in all, I would come to Excalibur again if I was bringing our daughter with us, as it's fitted more to families.

Reviews.Title: “Should've spent the extra dough on the room!”
Reviews.Author: tma031979
Reviews.Content: Excalibur had a great location and was close to where my sister was staying, so we stayed. Besides, rates were pretty reasonable, and there was transportation to the places we needed to go right outside our door. Arriving late is NOT recommended. We were not offered bell service, our room was not what we'd wanted, apparently they'd already closed the day (We got there at 1am), and Valet parking was full. Throughout our stay the front desk was never helpful, and we heard "that's not my department" more than one time. The shower in our room was slippery, and thankfully I wasn't seriously injured when I fell. I don't think anyone had stayed in the room for awhile, and had the clerk told me that at checkin, I would have happily taken the smoking room we'd been assigned to. The drawer on our dresser was broken too, and Room service took 45 minutes the one time we ordered it. I should have spent the money for a more updated room and better service. Now we know! For families not looking for luxury, go for it, but for couples or people in the industry, I definately wouldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: LouMG
Reviews.Content: Just a quickie as others have already gone into greater detail; As on road trip with girl friend we decided we wanted somewhere on the strip yet not too fancy price wise as just two girls wanting to see what Vegas all about, (not worried about romance and jacuzzis in our room). Excaliber great hotel for doing this- value for money, central and large, clean room with enough space for big table on which to practise card playing before hitting the tables. We had great fun in Vegas and felt we had great value for money at this hotel. However if I were to return with partner for more "romantic" time I'd probably book myself into one of the four star hotels as the Excaliber rather over run by families and not have those little extras that make for a really special night away with a partner. Enjoy! Viva Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Very Decent Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent six days at the Excalibur and were not disappointed with the room, the security, the staff, and especially the price. We registered early only to be told our room wasn't ready. An hour later, the room still was not ready, but they gave us an upgrade for the same price in Tower II. Like in many other reviews, we found the guards at the tower entrances to be a nice, comforting touch, the hallways in the towers were a little dark, parking was a stretch, and the air conditioner made its presence known when it came on. The staff was super friendly and courteous, especially housekeeping. I am usually bothered by smoke, but I wasn't bothered my entire stay there, even when I did some lurking in the casino. The Food Court had a variety of places to eat, with McDonald's being the cheapest. The Buffet was decent, and the price of the Buffet was quite a bit cheaper than some others in nearby hotels. My wife found that the pool was not really deep enough for swimming, but it attracted a lot of kids which would have made swimming difficult even if it were deeper. Tip: best price is to go to the official Excalibur website and reserve your room online. I looked at the other sites and they were all higher. Your credit card will be charged for the first day as a deposit, however. Also, the Pyramid Cafe in the Luxor next door is a very reasonably priced place to eat if you want a change of pace.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews of this hotel I wasn't impressed - it put me off before I had even got there and we were staying for two weeks, but upon arriving the staff were friendly enough and the room was clean and tidy the maid came everyday - clean towels, sheets that kind of thing, all in all I thought the hotel was good value for what we paid and would go back again. Enjoyed our stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Great family trip”
Reviews.Author: WeddingLady
Reviews.Content: I travel to Vegas at least once a year and this year was the first time I went with my two sons to meet my sister and her 3 kids. All 5 kids range in between 5-10 years of age. We chose Excalibur since my mom and sister had stayed there before with the kids last year and they really enjoyed it. I thought it would easier to post a highs and lows review. Highs: The pool is awesome. Plenty of lifeguards and the two slides were huge hits with the kids. The snack bar was very convenient with great items, like a wonderful Fruit plate with grapes, melons and kiwi. My boys loved the chili cheese fries. We rented a float while there and that added to the fun. The hours are 8am-8pm, which was very convenient. We went to the pool 4 out of our 6 days there and never had trouble finding at least 3 chairs together. There is also quite a bit of shade on the slide side. We never played on what we called the "adult" side, since the slides were so fun. The arcade was great fun and the kids won so many stuffed animals, including a huge pony. After some touring around town, we found the Excalibur's arcade prices better at $1 a game vs. NY NY and we won more easily at Excalibur. Great photo opportunities throughout the hotel for the kids with knights and dragons. This was very exciting to them. Location of the hotel was the best for sightseeing. We were able to tour NY NY, MGM with the M&M factory nearby, the Tropicana's Titanic tour and then back to the Excalibur all by taking the walkways above the strip. Much safer feeling overall. We loved the easy walkway to the Luxor also. What a great hotel. My oldest son, especially loved the pyramid and all the Egyptian touches. The food court was very convenient and had a good selection with McDonald's, Pizza Hut, a coffee cafe, cold stone ice-cream and the best, still hot Crispy Creme donuts. Connecting rooms and tower II location to the pool. We were on the 4th floor with a great view of the NY NY rollercoaster, too bad the kids were too small to ride it. Plus, $12.50 a person is a bit ridiculous. The guards were very diligent about being sure no one got on the elevators without showing a key. We loved having connecting rooms for the kids to enjoy each other more and have the convenience of one adult babysitting while the others went downstairs for gambling. Lows: Checking in was very stressful due to the hotel having a different rate than what I was quoted. I had booked all three rooms so I had all the confirmations and rates written out. They were charging us about $75 more per room for the week, but after about 30 minutes of going back and forth with the manager, it was resolved. I just thought it was a waste of energy and a bad start to visit. The buffet was absolutely terrible for lunch. A complete waste of money. Comments: I have stayed at many hotels in Vegas, including my favorite the Venetian and all of them are smoky. Just a fact, folks. Excalibur was not any smokier than any others. My clothes and hair always smell like smoke in Vegas, it's not the hotel's problem. We apparently had record breaking temperatures on Tues. 7/19, but it didn't bother any of us. We were in the pool from 10am-4pm, then napped and headed out for dinner. It's the desert, make the most of it. By the way, not one of us had any sunburn since we used 35 plus and reapplied every hour and half or so. The babysitting center at Kid's Tyme at the Orleans was great. The kids loved it. The three adults ate at the Steakhouse, which was fantastic. I would recommend this to anyone. Nice casino to gamble in too. Enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the excalibur for 6 days, it is an average hotel but for the price it´s OK if you can get a good deal. The rooms are fine with the only exception of the old air conditions. This was a real bother, it made a lot of noise and didn´t let us sleep, we had to be calling everyday to have it fix but they never really got it complete fixed. If you like to gamble, the machines don´t pay. If you are traveling with kids it is a great hotel to stay in. The buffets are really good and also has a nice food court. I really like how the hotel looks from the outside. Don´t know if I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Its not great”
Reviews.Author: lynnoo7
Reviews.Content: The carpet is old. Rooms feels like 1970s decoration and it smells ancient. You can smell cigarette smoke from the casino. Its natural for people to smoke at a casino, but this is going over board. My clothes smell like cigarette smoke. The price is cheap, but I wouldnt want to stay at Excalibur if I planned this trip ahead of time and saved some money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, Definitely Would Return”
Reviews.Author: travelqueen4
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Excalibur was great. From the moment we stepped out of the car we were treated super. They took good care of our car (we used valet) and baggage. At check in we were taken care of courteously & promptly after what I thought would be a forever line but it wasn't. Our bags were brought up promptly after calling for baggage delivery. We had a nice inner room with great cold a/c, clean all the way around, everything in it's place. It was well maintained the whole time by housekeeping too. The room was updated and had new carpets, etc. but it did need a new bed (I must say I think that was our only complaint). There are great shops, super places to eat & a great buffet, things to keep kids busy if you have kids with you (we didn't) and lots more. When I go back to Vegas this is the place I would stay. We had fun at the casino's slot machines too, they have plenty of them ! So relax, enjoy and stay with Excalibur. I'd do it again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed out stay at the Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: bowhunterups
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the excalibur. Taking a family of 5 on an extended vacation is quite expensive so we loved the $49 and $59 rate we paid. Don't be fooled by the cheap price it is very nice. The Hotel itself is very clean and family Freindly. They had good security to help not only protect our kids but to keep the working ladies, if you know what I mean, out. The self serve check-in Kioske are a plus and easy to work. You do need to call in after 9 AM the day of check-in to ask that you be put in tower 2 which has the best access to the pool. They have 2 pools that are very large, and clean. They had 8 lifeguards on duty so we felt our kids were safe. I understand they have a wonderful spa but we didn't use it. The Hotel has an incredible buffet and we received a 2 for 1 lunch buffet coupon with every nights stay. There are several fine dining restaurants and several fast food restaurants. They have different free shows going on all during the day and they have some excellent shops. There is an arcade for smaller kids and a vitual type ride that we were given a free ticket for. The hotel grounds are well maintained and they have plenty of parking. I had know problem parking near our entrance myself although I believe they have valet parking also. The rooms themselves are very clean and spacious. The bathroom is large and has a big nice walk in shower with glass doors. The beds are very comfortable, not like most hotel beds. House keeping was very prompt when we called for extra towels. The only little thing I had a slight problem with was when I needed my boarding passes printed out for our flight home they charged me $10 but I guess for $49 a night they just can't provide everything. Our plan was to leave Las Vegas and travel to California for a week and then return to Vegas for 1 day to catch our flight home. We enjoyed the excalibur so much that we returned to Vegas a day and a half early so that we could spend more time there. The Excalibur is an extremely nice ,family freindly hotel at a cheap price and I'd recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Budget, Not Quality--not my style”
Reviews.Author: elkejames
Reviews.Content: Where to begin........how about parking? Valet parking took almost 45 minutes from when we first arrived at the hotel. The hotel check-in line resembled an airport line.....it made the post office lines seem like nothing! Unfortunately, Excalibur reward club members were not given a priority line and had to stand in the cattle line. Luckily I spotted self-service check-in machines, where I was able to collect my keys and coupons with little effort and only a 20 min. wait (I did have to go back to the lobby to obtain an additional key though). I stayed in Tower 1 on the 17th floor. Quite a trek from the lobby, dodging slot machines and smoking gamblers. Apparently Excalibur keeps their rates down by skimping on the air in the elevators (there is none), making it a long trip up to the 17th floor. The trip back down from the 17th floor to the casino resulted in no less than 6 stops down in a hot, crowded space, picking up people from lower floors. Our room was a about as far away from the pool as you could get...so we opted not to use it. Cruising through the casino bikini-clad did not appeal to me. Our room was low budget. The thread barren sheets and towels were stained, the pillows flat as pancakes. The bathroom rug was just plain sad. The bathroom was large but lacked a tub. No coffee machine, frig, or safe. There was a large spider web hanging from the ceiling onto the lamp above the table. The maid walked in on my son the first day because there was not a privacy sign (I left a note for one and more towels....each day I had to ask for more towels). I got up early to avoid the line at the breakfast buffet...however, even arriving 20 min. before they opened did not help (there were about 20 people ahead of me). One phrase for the $9.99 breakfast buffet....."Save your money!"...that is unless you like powdered eggs and very poor quality food. For $2 more, you can eat at the Rio and have a totally awesome quality breakfast! Warning: do not leave any belongings behind. An hour after checking out and on the freeway, we called the hotel regarding $60 worth of memory cards left in the bedside drawer. Several days later, we called the hotel again and they were never found. The hotel did not find our loss important enough to send someone up to the room immediately. The best thing about the place was the casino. The slots were great as well as the tables. The dinner show with horses and sword fighting was really awesome. I would go back to the casino and the show...my 13 year old son loved it! The food at the show was mediocre. I paid aprox. $110 for one night and $65 for my other two nights. I did not get my money's worth. I do not believe I will ever stay at this hotel again. If you are like classy places, I would not stay at the Excalibur.

Reviews.Title: “Must take advantage of spa”
Reviews.Author: euromonica
Reviews.Content: For the rate you can not beat the excalibur. I highly recommend staying in the higher floor rooms. We were first given a room with a non-secure window and someone could easily walk on the top of a ledge to your window. We asked to be moved and immediately were taken care of in a professional manner. I loved the spa and fitness facility and you feel like a queen when you are there. The pool is not as great as the mandalay bay, but the security at the elevators is always manned by security and the hotel actually has security boxes for free for guests. IT's hard to beat the price so I recommend it and would return. ALthough I would not do the supper buffet again. Not the best food in vegas. If your looking for moderate and affordable lodging this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Castle with a Strip View”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Excalibur for $34.95 each night for four nights. Tower One, 27th floor, 2 Queens, Non Smoking, View of New York New York. Rooms cleanliness to my satisfaction. We did not want our room to be touched, so we exchanged our towels out for new ones when needed. Maids nice & courteous. Brought our own bedding for home comfort. This made the week more comfortable for us knowing that our blanket, pillows & sheets were clean. Plus we brought our cooler to store water & drinks. The rooms Renaissance decor wasn't over done. The bathroom had oversized showers with sliding doors. Which was very nice in my opinion. Not one to like shower curtains sticking to me when showering. Sinks were wide, and lots of space to sit things. The only thing bad about our room, was the air conditioner was so noisey it would wake the dead. You have no choice but to run it, with the heat at 104-112 degrees outside in July. I really like the castle theme of the casino, but the smoke was to much for me. But then again the New Wynn hotel/casino was smokey too, and was just opened this last April. I think all the casinos need better filtering systems, well excpet the Bellagio. I never get sick there. I just can't afford to stay there. Won $235 on crap tables, $25 on $1 slots, $5 on Keno. Our trip to Las Vegas was pretty muched paid with our winnings. Really enjoyed my stay in Vegas. Got some great deals, Drank some Frozen Margarita's, ate some good food. Places ate at ( Excalibur Buffet - good/ Dishes Treasure Island - good/ Sherwood Cafe Excalibur - good/ StarDust Steak & Lobster, good, but steak too hard to chew/ McDonalds Excalibur - $1 Sausage McMuffin made breakfast cheap) Next time around eating at the Wynn buffet. Madam Tousads Wax Museum was well worth seeing. We checked out the New Pro Bass Shop, and Hoover Dam. Check the Pro Bass Shop out for the aquariums, and waterfalls even if your not a sportsman. The week was all good, and planning another trip soon. Check out my photos of my trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Can't get enough of it”
Reviews.Author: scarlett_reinhardt
Reviews.Content: I loved that hotel!!! We got a really cheap price and had a nice view od the New York New York roller coaster which was great. The minute I stepped into this place, I couldn't stop laughing. They totally got that tackie medieval thing that is just ridiculous but o-so-fun. I couldn't get enough of the advertisment for the "Thunder from Down Under" show displayed on the hotel's TV chain, of the medieval sunday brunch where you can get "champagne" out of a presurised can, of the medieval decoration of the rooms.... I mean you cannot be bored here. This is a nice place to stay if you want to get a nicely priced themed hotel. Way cheaper than other Strip's hotel, it has a nice location, a food sourt, awesome design, two pools... For 69$ a day for three adults, it was a real steal and lots of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: CasseyCollie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur for 10 nights between 16th-26th June 2005. We stayed in a Deluxe room in Tower 2. The room was adequate for what we needed, it was large and tidy, aswell as the bathroom. We are late risers so hung the Do not disturb sign on our door each morning until we went out and we were left alone. My only complaint about the room was that it was only on the 3rd floor, so we didn't get much of a view (we were facing NYNY) I would have thought the Deluxe rooms would have been on higher floors with decent views, but it wasn't a problem, as we only slept there! During our stay we ate at breakfast at the Sherwood Forest cafe, the food and service here was good, obviously not award winning, but it doesn't claim to be. We had an evening meal at the Steakhouse at Camelot and Sir Galahads Prime Rob, both of which were lovely meals with exceptional service. We also ate at the Regale Italian restaurant, the food here was lovely, but I don't know if we went on a bad night, as the service wasn't up to much. The food court comes in handy for the odd snack when you're peckish, there are a number of places here from McDonalds to Manchu Wok. The location of the Excalibur is fantastic with walkways to the Luxor and NYNY. And the monorail stops at the MGM, across the road. We found the monorail the best way to get around. We used the number 301 bus a couple of times, but this is a LONG journey, it stops at pratically every hotel along the strip and every man and his dog gets on at each stop. Whilst here we watched the Tournament of Kings show, I thought it was a good show and the food was ok for the money, and good for a laugh, my boyfriend wasn't as keen though. Some of the reviews have complained about the number of children in this hotel, being a family hotel. But I can't say that I noticed too many kids about the place, other than in the pool. It didn't seem to be a problem, we were all kids at one time!!! All in all, we enjoyed our stay at the Excalibur Hotel & Casino, we will defnitely stay here again, and more than happy to recommend this place to friends, family and anyone else visiting Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: lfresa
Reviews.Content: Just go back from the Excalibur with my husband and two boys ages 10 and 13. Could not be more pleased. Pool was clean and staff friendly. Loved the over sized shower. I saw complaints regarding no tub, who uses a tub on vacation anyway. Room and bathroom was spotless. Across the street from the monorail at MGM. Nice location, sure staying down the strip is closer to more casino's but it takes 2 hours to drive the stip. Your better off taking the monorail or walking. Would stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “great big castle(loved by all)”
Reviews.Author: brightis
Reviews.Content: June 26 -June 29 We stayed at the excalibur for three nights. This hotel/casino is great for families and anyone else who is on a budget. Rooms were not expensive. Hotel was very clean and rates very high on customer service. The pool area is very nice also. There are two pools, one has a slide and the other a little waterfall. The pool area also has a food/drink bar. Our two kids (2 and 6) just loved the medeival theme and had a great time in the arcade. Overall we were very impressed with the excalibur, it exceeded our expectations. Don't expect anything fancy as far as rooms are concerned. There are no tubs only walk-in showers. Which didn't bother us. Otherwise, great stay would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “If you got kids, Excalibur is the place to be!”
Reviews.Author: Takami826
Reviews.Content: The amount of kids in Excalibur is insane. There were truly LESS children at the All Star Hotel we stayed at in Disney World a couple years ago. We chose excalibur being fans of medieval decor, etc and it wasn't until a day or two before we departed that we learned this hotel is a child haven. It was all we could do to run in and out to New York New York just to get away. I thought there were laws about children being on the casino floor, but apparently not. There was no enjoying the casino in this hotel, not even Keno, because it felt like a day care with kids running around and babies parked nearby at Keno while parents played games etc. One even changed her baby right there in the Keno area! Disgusting! The room was pleasant, it didn't smell moldy or musty, but the water pressure in our room was abysmal. The shower felt like a tinkle, it took forever to rinse out my hair and the toilet; well let's just say that when it takes literally 5 flushes to take care of #1, we ended up trekking down to the casino floor restrooms because none of us wanted to have issues. It was quite an inconvenience! 2 pillows for 2 double beds and 4 people was also rough. Having to use the comforter as a pillow was a trial, but at least the A/C worked, although we would have preferred that the maid not shut it OFF every time she came to take care of the room! We kicked it down a bit the next day, came back and the room was stifling again, so instead of relaxing in our room, we had to crank the A/C and trek down to the casino floor to let the room cool off. We didn't even attempt the pool or hot tub, the amount of kids there made it not even worth the effort; I can't see how it would have been relaxing at all. All night long we had to listen to kids playing WWF in the room(s) above us and thundering up and down the halls at all hours. The bars were kind of shady, too. When you first come into Excalibur there is a bar that sells souvenier blended drinks. The sign said $14.95. We decided not to go there because there was no place to sit and we went into the Jester bar and decided, well, let's treat ourselves and get the drinks here where we can sit and relax. He said the drinks would be $10.95 each. ????????? a $4.95 difference from the front entrance drink station to the bar inside the hotel??? That's shady. We drank elsewhere the duration of our trip. First time to Vega$, I loved it, but I will never EVER stay at Excalibur again. I went on vacation to get away from unruly loud screaming children only to have to endure their chaos on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur is great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got in from Vegas last night and stayed at the Excalibur for 7 days. We were there for our vow renewal with about 15 other people. The rooms were clean with large bathrooms and great views. People keep saying the hallways are dark but it goes with the medieval theme!!!! Make sense??? The hotel puts you close to all the action. We were with a fun group that made our way up and down the strip several times getting in at night around 3:00 or 4:00 am and then up for breakfast around 8:00am and back out again. The hotel was great and served all our needs. Plenty of clean towels, free drinks at the slots - what else do you want for $44.95 wknts? I guess if I were some lonely person staying there I would think it was awful too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, it is located in the heart of Las Vegas, for the price and location you can’t beat it. It is close to the Luxor, New York New York and the Mandela Bay. When we arrived there was a long line at check-in, but it moved very quickly and the staff was friendly and accommodating. The room was very clean and spacious; the only thing I missed was no coffee first thing in the morning. We ate at the buffet a couple of times and the food was very good, they had a lot of food choices. We also went to the Tournament of Kings dinner show, the food was good and the show was even better. I would definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “A great time in a great Resort”
Reviews.Author: BGIexpert
Reviews.Content: I just got back from 4 days at the Excalibur, I was really worried aobut going there from reading some reviews, there was 8 of us that went and I usually stay in 4.5 * places when I travel. It was perfect, I like the darkness of the place, although its not too dark...sure who cares!! I certainly didnt go to Vegas to be in my room all the time...guess what I spent a couple of hours a night in there sleeping, so anyone in my opinion who complains about the rooms here, needs to get out more and enjoy themselves!! we were 8 girls in 2 rooms, the rooms were big and the bathroom was huge too which is great for 4 girls trying to get ready each night. I would totally recommend this place for anyone going to vegas to have a good time, is'nt that everyone??

Reviews.Title: “loved excalibur”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved staying at this hotel. I loved the pool and everything else about this hotel. The food was terrific. I also really liked the security by the elevators. I would def. stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “"BIG disappointment"”
Reviews.Author: TravelCass
Reviews.Content: I wanted to write and warn people about the Excalibur. I stayed there for a solo trip to Vegas (or, rather, I had booked a room there). Within 10 min. of being in my room, I was on the phone to Treasure Island to book that 4-star gem for the next three nights. I suppose if you have kids or aren't really into the quality of a room the Excalibur would be fine. However, the carpet was suspicious, the hallways are dim and dingy, the bathroom was nasty, the furniture was old and dingy . . . Need I say more? Yes, the Excalibur has nice places to eat and a cool casino, not to mention a decent medieval village, but the rooms are like 1 or 2 star in my opinion. I moved to Treasure Island and was thanking my lucky stars that I did that. TI's rooms are as nice as the rooms in the Plaza in NYC - I kid you not. Gorgeous! Marble bathrooms, five gold-framed paintings, etc... Loved it and TI overall is smaller and gorgeous. The Mirage is also very, very nice. Excalibur just wasn't for me and I wanted to warn people. Cassy, Cumming, GA

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: FreezinginSD
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Las Vegas from June 13-16 for our honeymoon and stayed at the Excalibur. We had reserved a standard room through a travel agent, but on arrival, asked about upgrades and ended up in a 2-room Jacuzzi suite on the 28th floor (the very top!) with a view of the strip. We have stayed at other hotels before, the Luxor and Paris, but this was by far our favorite. The staff were very friendy and made sure we had a cocktail at all times while we were gambling. We went and played at other hotels and the service was not near as good. I didn't think the hotel was confusing to navigate around at all. There are signs everywhere that point you in the right direction so we never had a problem finding anything. And what can you expect with such a huge hotel? It was also very nice to be so close to all the other great hotels like NY NY and MGM since it was so hot outside (102). We barely had to be outside! If you go with the right attitude to have fun and relax, you will definitely enjoy your stay at the Excalibur! We will be staying there again on our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: u9537503
Reviews.Content: We spent two weeks in Las Vegas and this was the hotel we spent most of our time in, mainly because we got a really good deal on the room cost. The positioning of the hotel on the strip is very good, being on a major intersection between Luxor, New York New York and MGM Grand you can pretty weel get anywhere you like quickly and easily. Check in was very quick and effiecient and our requests were easily dealt with. The room we had was nice and large, and well kept. Comparing the cost to something in the UK you would never get a room the same size or quality for the same amount. There are one or two things that drops the Excalibur, one is it can seem pretty dark, especially in the corridors around the rooms. The other problem we had was a room service trolley did not get removed from outside of our room for a day and a half. All in all I would recommend the Excalibur as a good cheap place to spend some time in. You are not really visiting Las Vegas to stay in a hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel - Great time!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Excalibur during my first trip to Vegas and had an excellent time. The staff were friendly and helpful - especially some of the bar staff (George was great!) & the hotel was comfortable and clean. Our room had a bit of an odd smell - but that was my only complaint. One more little issue- I would have liked it if the hot tub was not open to kids - it was packed full of little ones trying to swim around when I just wanted to relax. We ate at the food court a few times and the buffet a few times. The buffet was okay- nothing special but greasy enough to cure a hangover! The location was great too! It was so close to everything we wanted to see. I would definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Still a nice place for the money”
Reviews.Author: coastermeister
Reviews.Content: My family of 3 was here for 3 nights the last week of May '05 and had a great time. We were last here in '97 and thought the place was nice then and it didn't disappoint us this time. While the "Ex" may not be quite as swank as a few of the other properties on the strip it also doesn't have the swank price to go along with that. We had a room with 2 doubles and a very nice view. The room was nicely furnished and sized a little bigger than your average hotel room. The rooms we have had in our 3 stays have all had only showers but they were nice large showers. The hotel, casino, shops and restaurants were all very nice, clean and well maintained. The buffet seems to have improved somewhat since '97 with better food and a larger selection. We all enjoyed it and for about $10 it was money well spent. The strip location of the Ex is excellent and very convenient to the airport and other strip attractions. We would definately stay here a 4th time when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Location's on the Strip!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Excalibur for six nights. I must admit I was a little skeptical as some of the reviews posted weren't all that good. We were pleasantly surprised and had a wonderful, fun stay! The staff was great! We had a room on the 27th floor which overlooked the strip. The room was very clean and bed quite comfortable and although we have stayed at fancier hotels on the strip (The Venetian, Flamingo and MGM - company paid trips), we found the room at Excalibur spacious and more than adequate for the price. The hotel is in a nice location, easy access to Luxor, Mandalay Bay, New York, New York, MGM and Tropicana. It is also easy to go over to MGM and get on the Monorail for a trip down the strip if you are not up for walking. The bathroom is large and although there wasn't a tub (just a shower) it didn't matter as we prefer showers when on the road. Sherwood Forest Cafe had the hugest Cobb Salads and best I have had anywhere. The casino was great also. We would definitely stay there again. Not so hard on the budget! Oh, I love the shops there too!

Reviews.Title: “Great for a Family”
Reviews.Author: radoki
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at the Excalibur in July 2004 for a few day and had a great time! I have two boys 7 and 10 and they, as well as us parents, had a blast! The room was great! Very clean and comfortable. We had a tremendous view of the strip! Dining was awesome! Each of us found plenty of food at the buffet. With young ones, it was great to have a McDonalds in the casino for those quick bites to eat. The arcade kept the boys busy! Staff was wonderful! For a family this is quite the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the $$”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not as bad as some people state. Lots of kids there, a kid friendly hotel. Not the Bellagio but hey, it's not supposed to be! It's decent if you're not into a fancy hotel, just a nice place to rest your head. Buffet is great too!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Great”
Reviews.Author: jalu
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week here as part of a three week US tour (Los Angeles, San Fran, Vegas) while my parents stayed at the Luxor (much more expensive) and I can honestly say I preferred the Excalibur. The building itself is very stylish, especially at night - who doesn't love a storybook castle (complete with Merlin)? Location is good, with a monorail running between Excal-Luxor-Mandalay Bay with one running from the MGM Grand down to the other end of the strip within walking distance (although you may struggle during the heat of the midday sun). Check in was godawful - huge queues and only around five people serving; although there were auto-checkin machines, they only seemed to work for around two or three people. When I arrived (Memorial Day) housekeeping were behind and the mess the previous tenant left was not cleared away till 9pm, not ideal when you first check in and want to get settled. Room was nice - bigger than a Luxor tower room with an opening window, should you wish to use it (although I arrived in moth season, so I stuck to the a/c) and a roomy bathroom. Hotel was, as Vegas hotels tend to be, a bit confusing and you can tend to get lost in the casino if you're not prepared - here's a tip: head towards the registration desks as the entrance is right next to it (Vegas hotels never advertise this, seemingly). All in all pretty good - when you make your reservation try to find out if you can use self checkin as this will save you an awful lot of time when you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: ht137
Reviews.Content: excalibur is a good value for the price. definitely not up to par with the Las Vegas megaresorts, but not what you're paying for those resorts either. rooms are a bit dated and could use some renovation. the spa passes were put to good use... excellent facilities and helpful staff. 24hr. cafe had reasonably priced food and good service. casino was fairly sized and paid out decently. Only complaint would be parking is rather annoying to find if you don't use the valet. Other than that, it is usually a good value, but seems to have been priced up a bit more than before. So I'd say $100 night on a weekend is a good deal and worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Hated this hotel”
Reviews.Author: tollfree1800
Reviews.Content: If you want to enjoy yourself while in Las Vegas, do NOT stay at this hotel! A group of 11 of us booked this hotel, and prior to arriving had sent the hotel an email requesting rooms together in the pool tower. While when we arrived we were placed in the other tower making us have to walk through the casino to get to the pool, not exactly what we had asked for! As far as the rooms go they need to be renovated badly! The beds were old and when two people slept in one bed you rolled to the middle because there is no support left in the mattress. Then there are NO ROOM SAFES! Pardon me but this is Las Vegas, people bring money to gamble with and don't want to carry it all around all the time! Never mind your passport and other identification! We ate at the buffet in the hotel one night. The food was awful, never mind that there was no selection. Basically I hated this hotel. I have stayed at the Mirage, Treasure Island and the new Alladin before, and I would recommend any of these hotels. Unfortunately because of a convention in town the Excalibur was the only place with enough rooms for the 11 of us. But trust me I will never even set foot in the hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur buffet was excellent, hotel okay”
Reviews.Author: Bris98
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Excalibur on May 14. It was fully booked because of a major fight in town. The checkin was a breeze at about 4pm. They had a line manager moving the line and it was easy. The staff were very friendly. It was irritating to go to the pool through the casino but my kids loved the pool. The buffet was great. The selection was enormous and the quality was great. We also ate at three other buffets during the week including Luxor, Mirage and Circus Circus (don't bother) and returned to the Excalibur later in the week because we liked it best. The room was spacious and the lighting was dim, but hey, it is supposed to be medieval. This is not a five star hotel, but it is okay. I don't know what all the complaints are about. If you expect the Bellagio at Excalibur prices it isn't going to happen. We enjoyed our stay, the staff were friendly and it was not the nightmare I had expected from reading the reviews before we went.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: eyedoc424
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a two night stay at the Excalibur, Las Vegas, May 20-22. We had a room with a strip view, one king bed. The room was very clean, carpet was brand new, bed comfortable. We had lunch at the Roundtable Buffet, which was excellent. The pool was nice, not overly crowded. Went to the spa for massage/facial... great service! Overall, I think the Excalibur is a great value for the money. It is in a great location, with a tram to the Luxor and Mandalay Bay and you can easily walk to NY/NY, MGM, and Tropicana. My only complaint was that we were in Tower 1 and it was quite a long walk to get to the pool. I would definitely stay at the Excalibur again!

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT, I repeat NOT pick up the phone!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was mortified to learn that the price of 3 one minute phone calls home (to California, 400 miles away) cost more than our room! When we checked out our room charge was $64.95, phone $74.15! Super rip-off-so don't forget your cell phones! Too many kids, too. What are people thinking bringing babies and small children to Vegas? It's not for kids with all the smoking and drinking and "adult" images. Leave 'em home!

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur is the Best Las Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VegasLover25
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Las Vegas and I stayed in Las Vegas. I had the best time I thought I would never have. The hotel and was really cheap but excellent service and cleaniness in each room. Hey, the rooms werent the best as other 5 star hotels but for what you pay to stay there they are great! I loved being able to walk to the other great hotels right from Excalibur. They were so close. I had a great view of both the pools. I went in the pool and waterslide and they were great. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone espically family types. The theme was awesome and the arcade was really fun. The buffets and resturants had the greatest food and prices out of the other hotels I went to. I loved staying in Excailbur I had no problems with the staff and not alot with the rooms. Anyone traveling to Las Vegas should stay in Excalibur. I will never forget how wonderful it was.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay great price!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to Vegas to get married April 10 to the 15th. We reserved our room online through excalibur online for $89 a night for a room with a view of the strip. We got a $10 per night discount for booking online. We arrived at Excalibur on time and we check in fairly easily. We had a room in tower 2. Tower 2 is all the way across the casino and kind of hard to get to. But it was across from the pool. We left our DO NOT DISTURB sign on our door all weeek and we were left alone all week. Our big complaint was that the Roundtable buffet was not worth the ridiculous amount of money you pay for the food. The line is too long and the quality of thier food was poor. The front desk was very helpful when I had my wedding dress pressed by an outside company. They had it sent out for me and called me when it came back on my cell phone. Thier poker room is of sufficient size and their dealers were very nice. If your thinking of booking a room at Excalibur we suggest you do!!! It is really worth it if you get a great deal or not.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: SunBunnie
Reviews.Content: Well this was my first trip to Vegas and I went with my friends who are 25 and 33 (I am 21.) We got the hotel at a great price and the midevil theme seemed cool. The hotel itself does need a bit of renovations. The room size was great but it also needed to be renovated. We had a horrible view! When we looked out the window, about 5 feet away there was a huge wall. (We were on the first floor.) And every time we went ot the casino we got lost because of the way it was all over the place. The food at the buffet wasn't that great. We did eat at the Steakhouse though and although it was a bit pricey (which most food in Vegas is nowadays) it was worth it. Also the tram to Mandalay Bay and Luxor was like an added bonus. The hotel is located in a great location. I had also heard there were alot of kids there, and for Vegas, yeah there were a bit much but it wasn't swimming with kids. I probably woudn't stay there again because I am a travel agent and I've been able to experience better but I would totally recommend it for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: ballhatguy
Reviews.Content: Well, I stayed at the Excaliber because of the lower cost compared to other Strip hotels and the location was good for access to Mandalay Bay (a tram is provided to Luxor and Mandalay Bar) and all the south Strip. It was a pretty good location and a good value but I will include a few additional comments: - Easy check in and out. Not sure if was the time of day but I had no problems. - Fairly clean room. Again, I had no problems upon check in or through out my stay. - Did not eat at the buffet but did at the 24 hr. cafe. Food was decent and what I would expect for a very reasonable price. - Lots of families and kids. Probably too much for me but with it being reasonably priced and the whole castle/medieval theme I see how it would attract families. - Casino was very smokey. It honestly hurt my contacts at times. - Dated interiors. As an older hotel on the strip I think it is starting to show its age and is a little shabbier than the newer hotels. But you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Excaliber was the best!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed staying at the EXCALIBER! We have recommended staying there to many of our family members and friends...our room was clean, the personnel courteous in every way, and we enjoyed a beautiful view from our room as well. Our mini-vacation to Las Vegas was made even more enjoyable by our stay at the EXCALIBER and we only wish we could frequent there even more!!! Our grand-daughter just loved it too!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: WaterdogILM
Reviews.Content: Seven friends and I stayed at the Excalibur for three nights in early April for my bachelor party. This casino is a great value for people looking for a place to stay that is not too pricey, yet still gives you a taste of the Las Vegas strip in all its glory. It's location at the center of the north end of the strip provides a good homebase for journeys out to MGM, New York New York, Mandalay and others. The rooms were clean and service was above average. Since we were partying pretty hard for my bachelor party, we worried that security might be a problem. But we were pretty much left alone to have a good time. We were concerned originally that this would be a "kiddie hotel" with all of the medieval kitsch, but found that it provided a good balance for both kids and adults. The pool was large and the water slides were great. The biggest problem is that the casino is smokey. The buffet was average, contrary to the awful reviews I had previously read online. Stay at the Excalibur if you are looking for a decent strip hotel at an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: edgar90
Reviews.Content: This is one place I will never stay at again. When I got to the Hotel at about 12:30 A.M., the front desk said that they did not have a non-smoking room available. They then asked me if i would take a smoking room. After saying yes, suddenly a non-smoking room that was just cleaned popped up. After saying I would take this room. I went up to it. To start with, a towel was hanging over the shower curtain rod, the trash had not been emptied, soap was still in the soap dish (used), and the bed had a corner turned as if someone was getting ready to go to bed. When I woke up the next morning, I found a bug crawling away with what looked like blood in it. I killed this bug then tore the bed apart and found another and killed that one also. I called the front desk and asked for another room. They provided one with out the bedbugs, and said they would call Ecolab. (Pest Control). They did not offer any compensation of any type or even an apology.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: njjenn27
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed at the excalibur in feb 2005, we loved it easy check in no lines, room was average compared to others i have seen on the strip but who really stays in their room, however it was a pretty big room, we ordered room service one night a little on the expensive side but food was great and the portions were pretty big. room was clean. we got late check-out at 6:00 pm for an extra $40 was worth it seeing our flight left at 9:30 pm. check out was easy nolines there either and they had kiosk check in/out if you preferred. Overall a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: Steve147
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights at the Excalibur, this was my second trip to Vegas (stayed at the MGM last time). The room was a decent size, with everything you could reasonably want in it. The staff were always good-humoured and helpful, and the whole place had a bit of character about it which helped set us at ease. Good location - very close to NYNY, MGM, Monte Carlo, Luxor and Mandalay Bay, and from these you can take the monorail or trams down to the other end of the strip. Though even Treasure Island and Wynn (right down the far end) are reasonably within walking distance anyhow. The hotel felt more family-friendly than some hotels on the strip, though don't think that means it's swarming with kids running round your ankles - it isn't. The only thing that stops it getting five stars was that the room we were given on arrival hadn't been properly cleaned, but one call down to the front desk saw us moved to another room right away.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and facilities!”
Reviews.Author: popstar
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Excalibur for 4 nights and had a fabulous time! I was in Vegas with my sister and we shared a room. We both have high standards when it comes to cleanliness and we thought our room at the Excalibur was fantastic. The bathroom was incredibly clean, and the whole room felt fresh. I have seen some reviews where people say their room was damp or musty, but ours was perfect. The housekeeping staff were very pleasant as well. When we were there one of the 2 pools was closed for cleaning, so the pool area did feel a little crowded. It was difficult to get a lounge chair by the pool if you arrived later than 10:30 or 11am. But we had a great time sitting by the pool, even though there were kids it wasn't too noisy or anything. The only thing that I did not like about the Excailbur is we had to walk through the casino floor to get to the pool. One of the towers is right at the pool so there is no problem, but the other tower (where we stayed) is across the casino so it is not really good if you are shy and end up in that tower. But we just put our swimsuits on under our shorts and tank tops and it was fine! I am going back to Vegas for my 4th time this July and probably will stay at the Excalibur again. The location is excellent and the price is reasonable. Please feel free to e-mail if you have any questions cjkbarker@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time on our first visit to Sin City at the Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our 20th anniversary by taking a visit to Vegas. We had a wonderful time. We are not big gamblers so the little that we lost at the slots did not dampen our spirits. We stayed at the Excalibur from April 30-May5. The hotel was clean, everyone was friendly and the medieval theme was fun but a little gaudy. The pool area was nice and clean and the spa passes that we got when we checked in let us experience how the rich and famous live. We saw the show "Splash" and took the Hoover Dam tour. The guide on that tour was very informative and knowledgeable about Las Vegas. We checked out all the major hotels on the strip and the Wynn was the most impressive. The Venicetian was beautiful and the fountain show at the Bellagio was worth the wait. Coyote Ugly was fun but the drinks were a bit steep. The only thing I would change about the whole trip would be to outlaw the smut handlers and time share hawkers. They drove me crazy!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this turkey”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiance' and I stayed at this hotel last year and thought it was the worst of the hotels on the strip. Our mattress was saggy, we had a terrible view from our room. The carpet was worn and the furnishings were horrendous. The pool was always crowded and there seemed to be plenty of families with children. Some of the employees were totally rude jerks. We overheard an employee in one of stores mocking someone with an accent who called to her co-workers. This was after hanging up on the person. Although the casino staff was much more pleasant, the casino was by far the smokiest on the strip. And for some reason, it seemed as if more people were crammed into a space in the casino. I would definitely avoid this turkey and stay @ the Luxor next door which is only a few bucks more, but a better upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: KathyCollins1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in March with my husband a two kids. The room was very clean are comfortable. The theme was consistent throughput the whole hotel, which was good fun. The Roundtable buffet was a great place to eat, reasonable prices and lots of choice. We would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Excalibur was great. It is up the good end of the strip and in walking distance to all the other good casino's. The rooms were big and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Best price for the location”
Reviews.Author: C5254
Reviews.Content: I rated the Excalibur above average because of the price per night. I found a $49 per night rate on the Excalibur web site. This was my first trip to Las Vegas and I was impressed by the fairy tale castle look of the outside of the hotel. The room was good sized although nothing special and somewhat dated. The bathroom only has a large shower, no tub. The beds were hard and not too comfortable but if you don't spend much time in your room, it is not that important. I actually had a nice view from my room window. It is kind of a long walk to the elevators and rooms in the towers, but the room itself was very quiet. I did not hear any hallway or outside activity when I was in the room. The Casino was huge, lively and fun, although it reeked of smoke. We received a coupon at checkin for a two for one buffet dinner and found that to be a good value. There were a lot of activities going on, too many to fit everything in. I liked the location of the hotel, between the Luxor and New York New York.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Excalibur for 3 nights....have visited vegas on trips, only staying 1 night previously in Circus,Circus! After mulling over reviews, prices, location on strip etc, I plumped for the Excalibur, 3*, top of the strip & affordable! On arrival was quickly checked in but a little disappointed with the room as the view was the roof of the casino & the back of the turrets! So went for lovely lunch in their buffet, cheap & plentiful & clean, as was the rest of the hotel/casino,then went to "BEG" for another room with a better view, we did get moved immediately to a partial view of the strip...MGM,NY NY, & the airport...which was brilliant, cost an extra $10 per night, but well worth it. The rooms were lovely & clean, bed comfy, shower good, housekeeping efficient, security good, the pool...although a long walk thru the casino as it was in tower 2...we were in tower 1, was lovely, clean, spacious, snack bar sufficient & not overpriced! (Rooms just starting to look a little bit worn around the edges, but hey, they see some people!) Shops were nice, casino good, felt at home, no winnings tho!! Staff all pleasant! Didn't have time to do the "Tournament of Kings" a jousting dinner evening, but thought at $57 a bit overpriced! Oh, the hotel has a lovely spa centre to which we received a free visit to use the spa, sauna, steam room, showers & a room with all the "stuff" us girlies need to pamper ourselves, lotions & potions & it was lovely! Only one BIG problem....Didn't want to come home!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fine for Vegas”
Reviews.Author: vickam
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Excalibur for 4 nights and found it to be fine. I was a bit sceptical after reading some reviews but the hotel was quiet and convenient. I was a little dissappointed as we had booked a "view room" and the view was not great (overlooked airport) The location was convenient and the room amenities were fine. Nothing spectacular but clean, comfortable and adequate. Cleanliness in corridors was not always up to scratch, but no problems with room. I would use this hotel again and the price was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price....Great Location”
Reviews.Author: stoner299
Reviews.Content: There isn't anything spectacular about the Excalibur Hotel and Casino. They did have one of the better Poker Room Deals in Vegas 1-3 Holdem...no structure just a 3.00 max bet anytime. That was fun and it wasn't overcrowded like some of the others I saw. Being right there by New York and MGM you were right in the middle of a very large entertainment as well as shopping block so for the money(about 100 bucks less a night than the ones around us that weekend...big fight in town) it was well worth it. I'd definitely stay again b/c of the value and the poker room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent if luxury and pool ambience are non-issues”
Reviews.Author: DavidHanna
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Excalibur for four nights over the period from 11 April-15 April, and, as other reviewers have commented, I found the hotel to be an excellent value for the money. I booked the room on Excalibur's website and paid around $45 per night with some freebies thrown into the deal. I found the hotel to be nicely decorated, although it is a basic, standard room. I was pleasantly surprised that even at that low rate I had a nice view of the pool from my room on the 11th floor of Tower 2. The maid service was thorough and efficient and the room was always kept very clean. I didn't go to Las Vegas to spend my days in my hotel room, and, therefore, Excalibur was fine for my needs. It's a budget-to-moderate hotel, basic and standard, no frills. I didn't care for the pool scene at all. Crowded, noisy, not at all relaxing. If you are looking for a good value and plan on spending the bulk of your time and money on entertainment, gambling, various restaurants, and sites in and around Las Vegas, you might give Excalibur a try. Its low rates will give you the extra money to do just that. However, if you are looking for a hotel room that is luxurious, I doubt that Excalibur will fit the bill for you. I wouldn't recommend it at all for those who are eager to experience a pleasant pool scene either. Be honest and realistic about what you want out of a hotel room. If you want real luxury, try Bellagio, Venetian, or the new Wynn. If luxury isn't first and foremost, think about Excalibur. As long as you are realistic about your objectives, you probably won't be disappointed or have serious complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Trip report for mostly Excalibur Hotel..”
Reviews.Author: deemaxx
