Reviews.Content: Trip report to Las Vegas - I tried to make this as detailed as possible. Just hope it is not too long or too boring. Tuesday April 5th Early morning flight "way too early!" Had to leave home at 4:15 am. We arrived in Vegas at 8:33 am from Texas, bought a round trip Bell Trans shuttle ticket. We will never do that again. See why later in this report. Went to the Excalibur, where they could not have been nicer. We had VIP registration, so the process took all of 5 minutes. However, because we arrived at such an early hour our room was not ready. They told us to come back in a few hours. We put our luggage on hold until a room was ready. we went to the Luxor for breakfast. They have a scrumptious breakfast. As far as I am concerned, the Luxor has the best breakfast on the strip. Came back at 10:30 and our luggage had been brought to our room. The room faced the Luxor, so we had a pleasant view of the pyramid and sphinx. We played the slots, roamed around the south end of the strip. Then decided to go to the Rivera to see Splash, which was quite entertaining. Especially if you like dancing to the 80's music. The ice skaters were incredible. We made the unfortunate choice of having dinner at the Rivera buffet. The cold food was hot; the hot food was cold, and none of the main dishes very appetizing. The prime rib was dry and tasteless, the salad wilted, and sweets have seen better days and were stale. We ate dinner at 6:30 pm, therefore, I expected the food to be fresh. After Splash, we gambled at the Rivera and I actually won $35.00. We joined their slot club, they give you $10.00 free & you can use any slot machine at the Rivera, not just special slots that you never win on. In fact, this is how I won my $35.00. Then we went to slots are fun. I won another $15.00 nothing big but at least not a loss. Husband lost money. Went over to Circus Circus, just to see what was going on. Took the metro bus back to the Excalibur. I love riding the bus; you meet such nice people from all over the world. Gambled a little more, I came out $23 ahead for night. Husband lost... A little about the Excalibur. The staff was terrific. Everyone was extremely helpful and cordial. As I said, our room faced the Luxor. There was a strange phenomenon occurring, it was "moth" season. There were notes on the windows to keep them closed. Well, if anyone has seen the pyramid, you know there is a big spotlight on the top. There were millions of moths caught up in the light. It was so out of the ordinary that the local TV news broadcasted the occurrence. I took pictures, but all you can see is a huge white line going into the sky. Our room was exceptionally clean, no dust, bed was comfy, and bathroom immaculate. No bathtubs, but I take a shower anyway. It is true that the hallways are dark, but that is all tied into the medieval theme. The one thing I do appreciate is that there is a guard at each of the room entrances. You must show your room card to get in. I was easy to remember, because I had my arm in a cast, but the guards verified my card every time I went up to the room. Wednesday April 6th - After breakfast at the Luxor, we decided to rent a car and drive out to the Valley of Fire. The Valley of Fire State Park is located in the Mojave Desert approximately 50 miles from LV. The park has amazing rock formations that are 150 million years old. The red rock and sand are beautiful. You follow the 15-mile sightseeing trail. There is a $6.00 park entrance fee. Take your camera; some of the Valley is breathtaking. We took the long way back approximately 75 miles riding along Lake Mead, although you couldn't see the lake most of the time, but the desert was beautiful. The desert flowers were all in bloom. I have photos if anyone is interested. We went to Hoover Dam, which is the largest reservoir in the U.S. The dam was not open; I did not find it very picturesque. Went back to the strip for dinner at the Excalibur. We enjoyed this dinner, the prime rib was perfect, shrimp pealed and ice cold, and ribs were tender. The buffet had many choices. Lots of veggies for salad, Mexican and Asian food also. The desserts were wonderful. I particularly enjoyed the carrot cake and custard filled pastries. We went to see the Freemont Street Experience downtown. It was o.k. Lots of noise and big crowds. We played the slots at Binions, which is small, dreary and dark, and at the Golden Nugget, which is huge and beautiful. Hint, if you drive to downtown, park in Golden Nugget's garage. Get your ticket validated, by the cashier cage and the first 3 hours of parking is free. We both lost on the slots downtown. Went back to the Excalibur. I won $20, husband lost again. We called it a night. Thursday- April 7th Ate breakfast at the Excalibur. I would not recommend having breakfast there. Eggs & waffles were cold. They did not have a buffet with many choices. We are not accustomed to paying $10.00 each, [although it was comped.] for cereal, coffee and fruit. Oh, and the morning coffee was dreadful, very weak. The dinner coffee was strong, I guess they wanted to keep everyone wide eyed and bushy tailed for gambling through he night. I learned how to play craps. There is an 11:00 am class everyday. Confusing but fun. I took a walk to Tickets 2night. The strip was very crowded Unfortunately, they did not have any shows available that we wanted to see. Therefore, I walked down to the Harley store, where there is another Tickets 4tonight. They had some different shows, but I did not buy any tickets. I think I was too tired from our excursion the day before. The weather was perfect. 68 at night to mid 70's during the day. Walked over to the Bellagio, roamed around the shops, although I did not buy anything. My husband has a hard time walking long distances, so he did not walk the strip with me. When I got back to the Excalibur, we strolled over to N.Y, N.Y. Husband finally won. He bought some shirts at the Harley shop, with the money he won. I bought a shirt at the NY experience shop. That shop has cute stuff, reasonably priced. Every time we go to Vegas I buy something there. Friday April 8th - last day. Had breakfast at the Luxor, Yum! I played the penny slots at Luxor & won $20.00 several times, playing 10 rows at a time. A 10 cent machine. I did not play the picture games; I played the bars and 7's. Husband really had horrible luck this trip. He lost again. At noon, I called Bell Trans, on my cell phone, to make our reservations for 5:00 pm to the airport. They had me on hold 32 minutes. When I mentioned it to the dispatcher, she was rude. We checked out and put our luggage on hold, played the slots. I actually came out $57.00 ahead. Husband lost his ----. Overall, we had a good time. Our room and all meals within the Mandalay group were comped. The drinks at all the hotels have improved, they now serve frozen drinks, Pina Colladas, Margarita's etc. but the wait time for drinks has not improved Unless you are playing a table games. Waited for Bell Trans from 4:15 - 5:00. No transportation. Gray Line came by several times. Called Bell Trans and was put on hold again for 22 minutes this time. When dispatcher finally took the call, she was nasty. Told me I must have missed the bus! Then said I'll send another but "you better be out there this time!" I will never take Bell Trans again! When the shuttle bus came, I mentioned this to the driver; he said he was never called to pick us up. And right then and there reported the dispatcher to his supervisor for rudeness. At the airport, I was thoroughly checked because of the cast on my arm, which I did not mind because it is a safety issue. We took America West, which had a stop in Phoenix. The first plane was small and uncomfortable, only 4 seats across. The second roomy. However, when we landed we found out that they lost my husbands luggage, but knew where it was. They were supposed to deliver the luggage on Saturday morning. If you want to know the ordeal of getting his luggage, e-mail me deemaxx95@yahoo.com You won’t believe what happened. I have 3 typed pages of mishaps. His luggage was finally delivered at 11:47 pm on Saturday.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent time at excalibur”
Reviews.Author: jemma024
Reviews.Content: Me and My husband stayed at excalibur for 6 nights we were both a bit worried as we had both seen a few bad reviews. We had the best time the room was nothing fancy but was fresh clean and large. the staff were very friendley and we spent a lot of the time in the casino having a ball. check in/out was quick and easy. value for money was good No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at Excalibur for 4 nights - check in line was pretty long when we got there, but they were very busy, so acceptable. Stayed in Tower 2, which didn't have much of a view, but didn't go to Vegas to spend time in a hotel room anyway. King size bed was comfortable and room was quiet even when maids were making up rooms around us. Casino is pretty good, with plenty of free drinks and friendly staff. Also found the food choices in the hotel excellent for any time of day or night. Location was also great, as internal walkway to the Luxor and only a quick walk across road to New York New York, so plenty of options if you get sick of the same casino. Would stay here again if the price was good - we paid apx $120/night and didn't spend much time in room, so was good value for us.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 2564 for 3 nights. 2564 means Tower #2, 5th floor, room 64( tower 2 elevators are back by the pool, tower 1 elevators are in the front of the building). This was a standard queen room with no view (we had a block wall outside our window - a view will cost you $10 more per night) and the room is the same as shown on Excalibur's web site. Booked the room on Excalibur's website for $45 per night(great price for this location on the strip). The room was clean. The carpet was in good condition and not stained at all(I do not like dingy looking carpet). Bathroom is large and was clean(no mildew or hair was found). The matress was good. Pillows were small but we asked for extras and they were brought up to us. Bottom sheet on bed is not fitted so it wants to come loose when you pull back the covers. The room has an iron and board and a blow dryer in the bath. Some people have complained about the darkness of the halls and about room service trays left in the halls. The halls are a little dark but this is because of the mid-evil theme of the hotel. The halls have good carpet and are in good shape but the hotel uses darker colors(look at the rooms on their website and you will see what I mean). Room service trays were in the hall in the morning but were gone when we came back to the room later in the day. Excalibur is gettig old and is not on the same level as the newer resorts but it is clean and the room rate should be much less than the newer resorts. We did not eat in any of the resturants at the hotel so I can not comment on them.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: yo2u
Reviews.Content: My family and I just recently stayed at this hotel (March 29th - April 1st). We had a nice time. The hotel is really decent. We stayed in Tower 1 which is not near the parking lot and faces the top of Luxor. We purposely chose to stay at that end to avoid the noise of the strip and pool. That worked out. It was very quiet and nice. If I had any complaint at all, it would be the bugs outside surrounnding the door as you walk in the Excalibur. You kind of had to fight in the air because they were swarming. I really believe the beds of flowers outside by the door attracts them. The customer service was excellent. As for the rooms, they are average, but if you want to be in a decent, convenient location, and not spend a whole, whole lot of money then this is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We learned to ask more questions about room location. We faced the wall of another part of the bldg. And the beds were in horrible shape - mattresses all saggy. you didnt have to sleep in the bed you could "see" it was in bad shape. Our stay was four days -We were so disappointed we didnt spend any time in Excalibur for anything - found Mandalay Bay and Luxor both very pleasant for food and service. may try there next time!

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but won't stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur from March 24-27, 2005. The express check in machine is wonderful, but we had to walk a long distance through the casino to Tower 2 elevators with our luggage. The room was okay-nothing fancy. The bed was not comfortable at all. The hotel was crowded with kids. We booked the Excalibur because the rates were good through their website but we will stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “A great family vacation”
Reviews.Author: buffalogirl
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Las Vegas from Buffalo on 3/26 and stayed until 3/29-we booked 2 connecting rooms at the Excalibur through Fun Jet vacations. After reading some of the reviews I was nervous, but we didn't experience any of the difficulties that others seemed to have had. I did the online checkin that the hotel offered a couple of days before we arrived. There was a little glitch because of how FunJet books the room but I emailed excalibur and then emailed me back the next day. Our rooms were in tower 2 20th floor-that gives you the best access to the pool. The rooms are clean and functional. This is not a luxery resort, but the kid's didn't care.The bathrooms were clean not fancy-but functional. We ordered a room service Pizza, it came prompt and hot with a flourish, it was also a pretty good deal-under $20.00. It did sit outside our room overnight-and someone did help themselves to the last piece before it was picked up, but it was gone in the early afternoon. Our rooms were serviced early, in fact the maid walked into the kids room at 8:00 a.m, they forgot to bolt the door. The pool was clean and cold, the kids were thrilled. The buffet was good-lots of different selections, better than the Luxor buffet. The hotel is inexpensive and kid oriented-however, I think I would have got a better price booking alone, without FunJet-I would check both ways before going through them again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I will never return to excalibur again. We had a coupon for one of the games, and we handed them to the cashier and he threw scissors at us telling us we needed to cut out the coupon ourselves. That was actually the only thing he said to us the whole time, we asked a question and he wouldn't answer us..it was just a really weird experience. I have never been treated so rudely. A couple heard my friend and I talking about how rude he was to us and they said the same thing happend to them so we decided to tell the manager. the manager treated us just as rudely as the cashier saying that he didn't understand what the problem was and that we shouldn't complain. Never will I go there again

Reviews.Title: “Pros & Cons”
Reviews.Author: BigBabyBlues
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 3-night stay with 5 adults at the Excaliber during probably one of the most packed weekends of the year (some concrete convention there with 130,000 people alone, plus March Madness). This was part of an airline/hotel package. Room was decent and big enough to fit an extra rollaway in addition to the 2 queen beds. Knew we weren't going to spend that much time there, so didn't need anything too luxurious. But, we couldn't check in before our friends arrived because all names weren't on the registration. However, they did give us an undesignated room key so we could at least use the pool area while we waited for our friends. Our issues were 1) that you have to walk through the casino to get to the pool/spa/workout area if you're in the opposite tower of rooms - no shortcuts. Felt a little uncomfortable in beach attire, but probably no one was paying attention anyway. 2) When we got to our room, two lightbulbs were out and the phone didn't work. Lucky we found someone from housekeeping in the hall to call about the lightbulbs! But, they came right away to fix things. 3) The air conditioner rattled so loudly during the night that it kept us awake. Turns out the coils were iced over and had to be defrosted. Again, they fixed it right away. 4) Restaurant staff in no hurry (including the fast food area on the 2nd floor). [But, the main bar (Jester's Lounge) staff was outstanding! Fast, friendly, funny!] Bottom line was that there were problems, but were fixed pretty quickly. Most staff courteous, accommodating and great to deal with, except restaurants. Knowing this was an older hotel and part of a package deal, it was about what I expected. We had a few favorites at the bar - Manny & John - plus Fred in the casino at the big wheel (singing). There are so many places to stay that I'd probably stay somewhere else next time, but would probably have to stop in to visit our favorite people there.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur Hotel Las Vegas: Clean and affordable”
Reviews.Author: donjefffab
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Las Vegas for a three day trip in February and stayed at the Excalibur. We are comparing it to the Aladdin where we stayed last February 2004. Aladdin was very pricy and the room was beautiful but we were never in the room. We got a great deal on a room through the Excalibur website and so I was worried, but the rooms were VERY clean, nothing fancy, just a hotel room. But how much time do you spend in your room in Vegas anyway. We were very satisfied. We had a lot of fun in their casino, especially with the Black Jack dealers. Very friendly atmosphere! Very friendly people.

Reviews.Title: “The excalibar is as old as a dragon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights and the room is dark and dreary! Three or more times we had to call for housekeeping to come up and clean our bathroom. Three days at 3 p.m. we waited for our room. I had to go use the casino's bathroom. I'm not sure why it took them an hour to clean our room. The view outside my room was the back of the castle. Who wants to look at the back of a castle? There were broken window castings and the cover to the heater contols was broken off. And the toilet would not stop running.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: During march madness, stayed here. This hotel clientele is very young -- and the gambling is so-so. Lots of low limit BJ tables -- packed full of people who don't know how to play BJ. Express checkin was great, elevators fast, clean, good service. We had great rate (around 107.00 per night, or so) but long walk from most of strip. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Vegas Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: walt14
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had our honeymoon at the excalibur and it was a disaster, we got a horible room with a terrible view of the pool and trash cans, we asked for a room with aview of the strip months in advanced and they said nothing about an extra charge for that!!!! The lady at the front desk was rude... The buffet was aweful, it was not fit for prison inmates!!!!! We are going down again this August and we are staying at Treasure Island... SPEND THE EXTRA 20 BUCKS AND STAY AT LUXOR!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Super stay at Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: tpcruise
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Excalibur in September 2004 for 7 nights. We didn't have a view of strip. The room was excellent, and clean and we got an excellent internet deal through their site. We heard lots of negatives about the hotel, but we didn't find a single fault with it. The food at Sherwood Forest Cafe was great for the most part. We had Spagetti with Meat Balls and Jambalaya. Portions are huge and prices are pretty good. Another nite I had Fish and Chips - they were nothing spectacular. We ate breakfast in the food court upstairs. Slots - broke even. Played quarters and won, and then lost at nickels. Tournament of Kings was ok - dinner good, show so-so, but I wouldn't spend the money to go twice. The dinner Buffet was excellent! We are going back again in April 2005. We will be staying at Stardust for 4 nights and Excalibur for 3 nights. It pays to check the hotels websites every few days. They post good deals on and off.

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the same class as probably a Motel 6. The room decor is old, and the air conditioner is the kind that has to keep running unless you get up to turn it off. One of the drapes had what looked like a blood a stain on it. The shower door leaked water all over the bathroom floor. And sewage backed up in the sink and stunk up the whole bathroom on all three days that we were there! It can be a decent value, and it is conveniently connected to Mandalay Bay and The Luxor, but the rooms aren't so hot. The casino has lower limit tables than some of the nicer ones, and they have a self check-in system that really saves a lot of time, but I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Stay”
Reviews.Author: jonstanford
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Excalibur for 5 nights at end of January, 2005. Very pleased with the hotel. Rates paid via their website were fair. Good service at check-in. Room was clean, spacious and comfortable, didn't have the strip view but had view of the "castle" which was great at night. Food outlets were good, everthing seemed well organised and clean. Good location for exploring the strip, can take monorail to Luxor and Mandalay Bay. Also has elevated walkway to New York, New York and MGM Grand. Overall, very pleasant stay, would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We liked Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Excalibur 12/26/04 for 3 nights. We liked it. The decor was fun, a little campy, but fun. The hotel was clean and the employees were friendly. We arrived early (several hours before check-in). The staff stored our baggage for us until we could check into our room. A couple things to mention- Location was GREAT...very close to NY,NY, the LUXOR and MGM. Lighting in hotel room was pretty dim (which could bother some people) and our room smelled slightly musty or damp one day (we had the jacuzzi room...that might have had something to do with it) The smell was gone the following day, so it wasn't a big deal for us. In general I liked the hotel and would recommend it to others. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “For the Money and on the Strip, good choice!!!”
Reviews.Author: fauberte
Reviews.Content: I went to Vegas from March 3rd-March7th 2005. I've stayed at the Excalibur Hotel for money reason. I've booked on their website and the rate was 15$ cheaper than any website for this hotel. The location is great and on the strip, close to all the mammoth hotels. Excalibur is showing his ages regarding the quality of the room and furniture. Nothing fancy there. Front Desk people were a bit on the rude side and aren't close to perfection regarding greeting you with a smile. Bartenders deserve a good note regarding the services and always said a huge thank you whenever you left tips for drink. The buffet is quality regarding the price. Again, nothing fancy but good. They only critic I have is they have the same stuff, day in, day you, at the same spot, everyday, either for breakfast or dinner. The great thing about the buffet is you don't wait. The place is huge with thousand of tables and you never wait and it's very clean, everywhere inside the hotel. Would I go back there? Yes, but for money reason only as I don't think Excalibur deserve to charge more than 100$ a night for being an average hotel. MGM, New York/New York are way much nicer hotel but you will never get the rate you get at Excalibur. Also, remember, the place is pack with kids during the day....Enjoy your stay and be ready to get a cold shoulder at checkin!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't get what we expected”
Reviews.Author: nickaroni97
Reviews.Content: We took our kids on our trip, so we decided to stay at the Excalibur because of the dragon, water slides and kid-friendly entertainment. No one told us that the dragon isn't there, the mote was drained and the pool for the waterslides was empty and being jackhammered up. Needless to say, instant disappointment for the kids. We even called and asked about this stuff and no one told us that they weren't available. If we had known, we would have stayed somewhere else. As far as the rooms go, they are pretty run down looking. Tiles are falling off the inside of the shower and there were some mildew issues. The sheets had tears in the sides and the entire room had a musty smell to it. I don't think we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “execellent hotel and casino”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we have been going to las vegas for eighteen years and the past ten years we have stayed only at the excalibur.the main reason is because it is centered on the strip to go to all the cool places.we love the buffet and all the help are wonderful to you.always ready to help in anyway they can to make your trip perfect. thank you excalibur, keep up the good work. sincerely GG

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: JamLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: I took this trip on Mar 1st - Mar 4th What a poor excuse for a "strip" hotel. I traveled with the entire family and reserved two rooms. I called for "express" check in so we could get to our rooms quickly after a long drive from Los Angeles. When we arrived we were greeted by a very friendly valet and bell hop. As I entered the hotel and went to the self check in kiosk , i thought something was wrong as i swiped my credit card and only one room reservation came up. The people in express check in stated both rooms would be available for express. This was not the case. The attendant for express check in was very nice and did not have me stand in the long lines at the check in counter. She allow me to go to VIP check in WOW. Ok it was down hill from there. The walk to the rooms is too long. The rooms were not ready at 3 pm. There were still towels on the floor and the beds had not been made. I call and the rude operator on the phone stated check in was at 2 pm , so i asked why the rooms had not been cleaned but given to me. She stated the rooms were checked as being clean (WHAT). I went back down and got two more rooms, same problem. If check in is at 2 why were the rooms not clean? On the second night I had the privacy sign up but housekeeping came in anyway. The person did not speak any ENGLISH. I called and asked for the room to be clean when we left at 12 noon, we returned at 6 pm and the room was still dirty! I then got calls to get the late check out special, however they do not tell you , you can not express check out in your room after using this special that I paid 25 dollars for. You have to go and stand in line to check out. . ... Too many problems, but the place is kid friendly ! Spend less , get less

Reviews.Title: “I made the wrong choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i will never stay in this hotel ever in my life until they protect people from being verbally abused by their own staff

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for the Money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For this money, there is no better hotel on The Strip. Good rooms (ask for a Strip View), nice swimming Pool and good service. Hotel in the Same Price Class are Circus Circus, Stratosphere & Stardust.. but this hotel is on the better side of the Strip. So if you don't want to pay too much but still want a hotel on the Strip, choose this one..

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location.”
Reviews.Author: Montrealcopper
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Excalibur from Feb 6-10, 2005. We got a super package deal out of Toronto, Canada. The hotel was rated 3.5 stars by our agent and that's exactly what we found it to be. Our room was clean and quite large. The bathroom was very clean but nothing fancy. The only problem we had was the noise from the strip. We were on the 18th floor of tower 1 which is facing Las Vegas Boul and the airport. I wore earplugs to sleep. The sound of sirens was very loud, probably due to the echo from the Tropicana across the street. We ate the buffet breakfast 1 day ($9.99) and found it to be excellent value. We would definetly stay at this hotel again, but we would ask for a room facing away from the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Perhaps we Brits are easier to please!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: drippub
Reviews.Content: 23rd. Feb. 2005. My wife and I have just got out of our car after driving home from London Airport and the end of a wonderful week in The Excalibur in Las Vegas and The Beverley Garland Holiday Inn, Los Angeles. This was our first trip to Vegas, come to that our first trip to the USA. Perhaps the American public see Las Vegas as solely a gambling resort, if this is the case what a waste. Las Vegas is Brash, Noisy,Glitzy and Very very over the top, it performs as if it were tha biggest,brashest,loudest live show on Earth and it does the job perfectly. If you have never been to the USA; Las Vegas is a great place to start and The Excalibur Casino Hotel will not dissappoint you. I have no doubt that there are bigger and newer five star resort hotels up and down the strip but this place provides great value for money. And most importantly you will find it hard to get better treatment or a more friendly welcome anywhere in the world. I now believe I can see the meaning of the phrase; "Viva Las Vegas". Oh! by the way my wife and I are not what you might call in the first flush of youth, in fact we went the the USA to celebrate my sixtieth birthday.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Mother
Reviews.Content: First time in Las Vegas, went with my daughter for her 21st, 30th Jan 05 to 4th Feb 05, was concerned after reading some of the reviews- but we had a great time, the hotel is meant to look old, its part of the theme - the people that we dealt with were great, the drinks were coming round much more often than in any of the other Casino's we visited.The Buffet was top notch - it had ever thing you could wish for and was by far one of the best value one's around. Well worth seeing the show's. I thought it wa in a great location as you could walk along to the Treasure Island and back. you can also get the bus from just outside it's $2 per stop or $5 for a 24 hour pass and you can get on and off as often as you please in that 24 hours. A MUST Celine Dion, I got tickets at $175 each but they start from $85 and there is not a bad seat so get these tickets it has to be the best proformance I have or will ever see in my life, it will make you cry it was out of this world, even my 21 year old daughter shead tears. I would be happy to return to this hotel anytime and would recommend it. We had a ball!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THIS PLACE!”
Reviews.Author: Fragglered06
Reviews.Content: We visited the Excalibur Christmas 2003 for our Honeymoon and fell in love with Vegas and this hotel. We arrived at 4pm and checked in straight away - no waiting! The room was big with a view of the strip which looked amazing at night. The bathroom and beds etc were all really clean and the room service was great - lots to chose from and quick service. All the staff were really friendly and there were no problems checking out as we just used the express check out option and popped our room keys in the box at reception on the way out! The security was great - only registered guests could get in the lifts that lead to the bedrooms. The location is fab and if you want to get to the other end of the strip, you just cross the road outside and hop on a bus which will take you all the way down and further on to Freemont Street if you wish. Fantastic value for money and a really fun place!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there a couple months ago. We had an extra day in Vegas so we just booked a $49.99 weeknight there. Checkin was very rough. Probably almost an hour. Location was great. Close to NY NY and Tropicana. The room was a good size, but smelled kind of musty/smoky. Buffet wasn't worth the money, but the other restaurants were good. We didn't do the tournament of kings as I heard it was lame (we're mid 20's). Might be good for kids. Slots were kind to us. Overall, if you are looking for a cheap hotel in great location or are taking kids, this is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “non smoking rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jjaso
Reviews.Content: Don't stay in this hotel if you have any respiratory problems. The non-smoking rooms we booked reeked of cigarette smoke and aggravated my asthma. The only thing that made the room bearable was the fact that the window opened for outside air. The usual forced walk through the casino also aggravated the asthma. Would never stay at this hotel again for the above reasons. The room was clean and the bathroom was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Why pay more!?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Vegas (got back on Jan 31) and I was a little nervous about this hotel after reading some reviews, but it turned out to be awesome!! Rooms were very clean. Showers had good water pressure. Came to Vegas to gamble and found the dealers in Excalibur to be very friendy overall. Free drinks were prompt, and dollar drinks were served at the bar if you played the arcade slots located there. The hotel comped dinners for myself and my friend because we spent so much time in the casino. The food at buffet was just as good as the much hyped Luxor buffet. I would definately recommend this hotel and plan on returning myself very soon!!

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: MrJackson
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 4 days at the Excalibur. It was our first trip to Vegas and for themost part we were impressed. The rooms were spacious and clean, the bathroom was also quite large, and the elevators were quick. I've readothers complain about the buffet, we thought it was quite decent although for just a couple of bucks more we felt the MGM Grand had a better spread. Not much of a gambler, just a little blackjack so I can't offer much advice in that area, but the dealers were friendly. Only complaint was the smoke, but that's a Vegas thing, all the casinos are smoky. Overall we felt the Excalibur was good value in a good location on the south end of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: SkyTravel
Reviews.Content: I have read a lot of criticism of this place because of it's theme, because of being "family friendly" (a polite way of saying overrun with kids), etc. But I disagree. I think it's nice to have a family oriented place in case you do bring kids there - I don't have any but didn't notice that many running around. I enjoyed the medieval theme. The room was nice, nothing spectacular but very clean and no problems were had. The price is reasonable for being right in the middle of the best section of the Strip. The buffet was good and well priced. Pool is nice. The thing about Vegas is you don't have to hang around your hotel, you want to be located close to an busy area so you can see it all, and this hotel is perfect for it! So no, it's not a super classy luxury hotel, but for people who can't afford Belagio, this is a great choice! I'd stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “excalibur is top notch”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i had family in town and we gambled at several of the strip casinos, but nowhere was there better service to be found then at the excalibur. we played at the machines and the floorpersonnel was very courteous, polite, and prompt. a family member won a jackpot and we did not have to wait more than five minutes. when you are in las vegas, make sure you stop in at the excalibur and you are sure to have one of the best visits at any casino.

Reviews.Title: “Knew what to expect.....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Excalibur Hotel from January 10th - 15th.... I was there for a Convention so really wasn't concerned with staying at a luxury hotel and the Excalibur is not. However, having done research ahead of time, I knew to expect a clean hotel in a convenient location (with frequent shuttle to Mandalay Bay Convention Center) which it was. The rate was very affordable. Food: The buffet was NOT GOOD!!! I do not recommend that at all..... After the buffet, I really didn't have an interest in trying any of the other restaurants there so, I don't have anything to share on them. Service: Check-in/out was simple (I had read multiple complaints about the time that it took) and quick. Room was clean and turned every day (while I was out). Casino: Kind of an older crowd - walk over to NY NY for a younger environment (if that's what you are looking for) I walked away ahead $$ ahead and my husband somewhere around the same $$ figure so.... how could I complain? Overall, I was satisfied. Just don't go expecting luxury and ambiance.... if that is what you want, you can certainly pay for it elsewhere and there are plenty of options for you. I would stay at the Excalibur again....

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay just wish they had bathtubs”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We got there really early as in 10am and they booked us in right away no waiting a very wonderful surprise. Great place to stay really wonderful experence except they had no bathtubs thats the only reason the last time we were there we stayed at the Hilton because it has bathtubs. Kings of the Round Table was just unbelieve not only did you get a wonderful dinner and coke dessert that were hot and very tasteful but a amazing show it's unbelievable the show alone was more than worth the cost of $50. But you got dinner as well.... We can't say enough good things about this show and the hotal. If our next visit isn't during really hot weather (due to no bathtubs) we would stay there. We may not of slept there but we did spend alot of time there.

Reviews.Title: “More than worth the (little) money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Package deal with Southwest airlines made this hotel very reasonably priced, allowing splurges on other LV enjoyments. Check in line was non existant due to SW Vacation deal, check out just as easy. Room was clean and location of the Excalibur on the Strip is much better than other similarly priced 'budget' hotels. And how much time does one spend in the room for LV, for a few hours shut eye, it was worth the bargain.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Average hotel clean and central to everything stayed from Dec 30th till Jan 6th.The slots are very tight but blackjack was fun and the dealers were great...There was a $400.00 difference between calling the hotel and booking online it seems you get the better deal these days by calling them directly. A great website to checkout if your planning a trip to Vegas is cheapovegas

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur, great for adults and children alike!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Laying on the bed is like sinking into a cloud, it is so wonderful, for the first time in years my back didn't hurt when I woke up. Excpetionally quiet, didn't hear a sound, even woke up late. Though the parking can be hairy, the price and incredible service make up for it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and in row of great themed casinos that connect”
Reviews.Author: jetski1200r
Reviews.Content: I thought the room was good, very large with your 2 queen beds tv, air-con, large bathroom we had shower only but i dont use baths when i go away.. The room was tidy and themed to the medival and i found the rooms fine, besided all i go there for is to sleep, which is not often in vegas, as vegas never sleeps. we found the casino great with a huge range of pokies and free training in most of your games. the other great thing is up the elevator is places like mcdonalds, restaurants, heaps of cheap takeaways, and acess to ajoining casino luxor where we enjoyed there great smorgas board better and also acess from luxor to mandlyon bay and mono rail. we stayed there in the end of october and left on 30th october 2004 but we really put out as we were never warned about the hour turn back of the time, out clocks in our rooms were not changed for us or a note to advise us of this and being from Australia we had no idea, so we checked out and still not knowing waiting for our booked picked shuttle bus and wondering why it was not there and still no wiser we got a different one and got to the airport and sat there like fools still not knowing and wondering why our plane wasnt there??? later realised, but think it was something small that they should of done but my only complaint was close to great places like the MGM, coca cola world, M&M's world, wid coyotee bar, new york new york.... so much and at nite we walked the strip and seen so much but never did walk to the end of the strip but i found it easy to walk and explore and im am not fit and seen so much all on foot... Oh and if your are going to buy beer or grog to take back to your room , dont buy it in the hotel walk down the road a bit to where the quike marts are or what ever you call them and get 6 pack of coronas for $7 and 6 packs of jim beam for $8 cheap Cheap.. so much to do and see and i thought this was a great place to stay and get around with easy access to everything and affordable themed accomadtion would stay there again but next time i well proably stay at the other end for a new experience as this was our first time in vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Best low stakes poker room on strip, great deal”
Reviews.Author: getwhatpaidfor
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in Mid October 2004. It was my second trip to Vegas and I had read reviews about kids running around all over etc. I was pleasantly surprised. There were few kids and although it isnt a lavish hotel like some of the others, it was clean and seemed to be central to everything. The best part for me was the poker room. I wasnt looking for big stakes, I just wanted to play some cards and not lose big and this was ideal for that. They had 1 dollar blind Holdem with 3 dollar max bet. We were able to walk to many of the other casinos and buffets so overall, for what you pay for this hotel, its well worth it. The pool wasnt all that great but that may be because it was very cool compared to the last time I went. If your looking for a reasonably priced hotel where you arent going to spend alot of time in your room, this is a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best on the strip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We chose the Excalibur for a stay December 25-28. We did not have any problems at check-in but arrived early (11:30 a.m.). As we entered the hotel area we noticed a distinct odor. The odor continued throughout the hotel elevator, halls and room. The room was sparsely furnished and many of the furnishings were very worn. The light in our room appeared to have liquid stains from a leak. The blankets on the bed had holes in them. The bathroom still had hair from previous occupants. Throughout the stay though, the smell bothered us the worst. The casino was average however, there were no free drinks, playing or not. This makes the value not so good if you have to pay $6 per drink. We also ate at the Prime Rib Restaurant (Galahad's) the food was tasty with very large portions but not the best we'd ever had. The cafe there was good for small meals. We would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and basic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Excalibur in July 2004. We found the room to be clean but pretty basic. Needless to say, I would not recommend stay at this hotel if you can find a comparable price for one of the nicer hotels on the strip. However, with that being said, the hotel is not one of the nicer strip hotels but is not a bad choice if you want a clean, basic hotel with basic ammenities. We prefer a strip hotel with a casino so this fit the bill and came as part of a free promotional trip. If you visit this hotel, and are fond of the slots, make sure to look for the small bank of about six $100.00 or nothing $1.00 slot machines. I'm not much of a gambler, but both my boyfriend and I won on these machines - my boyfriend actually won a few times in a short period.

Reviews.Title: “Pefect Location at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: R1
Reviews.Content: Possibly not the best on the strip, but if you want a central location in a themed hotel at an affordable price, this is definately the one and the rooms are of a very high standard. Would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Clean; and Great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Basic accomadations; comfortable and very clean. Best thing about this hotel is the location..Right across from NY NY and close to MGM Grand..We asked for a strip view which can be done for $10 more, About $65 total inc taxes..GREAT Deal!!! The only thing I could complain about is how long it took to check-in (about 20 min) we arrived at 12 midnight and there was a line..but the desk agents were very slow. Second, it was pretty cold outside and the room was cold when we got there..we put the heater on and in about 30 min got some warmth..!! Yeah..And third shower was not as hot as I like the water to be. Other than that I would stay here again..I would not pay more than $100 bucks though..Hope you n-joy your trip to LV>>>>>Party!!!!

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Compared to some of the other hotels on the strip, not quite as nice, although loved the location and the buffet breakfasts were like nothing I have ever seen! Bit disappointed as had requested a non smoking room and when arrived was told no non smoking rooms and it would be $10 per room per night to chance to an upgraded non smoking room. Being a canny scot, decided aginst this, and the room did smell of cigarettes. Couldn't open the window as was on ground floor. However, one of the biggest hotel rooms I have ever stayed in. Overall, hotel OK, not the best but certainly not the worst. Not as clean as a lot of the other strip hotels, but sheets etc appeared ok. Basically rooms just needed redecoration and freshening up!

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal!”
Reviews.Author: ScottyDoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur Hotel in June of 2002. This medieval themed hotel is in a good location and is not as expensive as some of the fancier and newer hotels. The rooms are relatively basic, nicely furnished and clean, although when you're in Las Vegas, you don't spend a whole lot of time in the room. We were very impressed with the security at this hotel. Only registered guests are allowed in the corridors leading to the guest rooms and the pool. The only complaint that I had was that the public areas were very smoky and gave me a bad headache. If you are going to Las Vegas and don't want to spend a fortune, I would highly recommend staying at the Excalibur. My family really enjoyed this unique hotel, and we will definitely stay here again next time!

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel - you'll not be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ReedyBarnsley
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a 3 centre break down the westcoast 12th to 16th Nov 2004 and was not sure what to expect as I had read a couple of bad reviews on this site. Anyway the check in was quick the rooms spacious - clean and well presented, the location we found to be A1, 2 minutes to Luxor - MGM - Mandalay Bay and New York New York. Anyway unless your landed gentry or J Lo I think you will find this more than fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: awakeone
Reviews.Content: I was traveling to Vegas for a wedding and the bride had secured a block of rooms for the party. I had only been to Vegas twice before and had stayed at very nice hotels (MGM & Luxor) so when I saw the price of the rooms on the internet and the price available for the block of rooms I was thinking that this hotel wouldnt be all that great, but it was for a wedding and in Vegas so I didnt give it another thought. When I arrived I was very surprised at how nice it is and how large the casino floor is. Out of all the rooms in the party I did not hear one hotel-related complaint for the entire stay. Plus, its location cant be beat on the strip for the price you pay. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “loved the castle!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: just got back from a 4 night stay at the excalibur and we had a great time! this was our 2nd time to vegas and our first time at the excalibur. the first time we stayed at new york new york. we enjoyed both places very much. you really can't go wrong with any of the newer places on the strip. they all have their on theme and their pluses and minuses. i would recommend the excalibur, they have a huge casino some good restaurants and good shows!! the rooms were not as nice as at new york new york, but it is newer. all in all we had a great time and look forward to going back to vegas again in the future

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: cjennt
Reviews.Content: Sorry folks, but I have to be the dissenter here. I was not impressed with Excalibur though it has long been recognized as a venerable LV establishment. The place was overrun by noisy and not terribly well behaved crowds in the downstairs casino. You have the impression of hordes of people coming and going constantly, not that that is any big surprise being in Las Vegas. However, I was not crazy about the room, rather smallish, just average ho-hum decor that has definitely seen better days and tacky furnishings. The carpets were low quality, worn and the dated wallpaper was peeling and yellow in the bathroom. Granted, there are some terrible places out there and I wouldn't quite put this in the terrible category, but it just didn't grab me. The bathroom was plain and needed some renovation, the tiles were dirty in the grouting and awful wallpaper that needs changing, sometime soon? The place does look cool lit up at night, but that is the most I can say to recommend this place. Not awful, for the price, but not great either! There ARE much better places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Love It!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Excalibur hotel is a great place to stay, I have stayed there more than twenty times and I wouldn't keep going there if i didn't like it. The food court on the second level is a great place to grab a bite, having a McDonalds, Pizza Hut, Crispy Cream, and a few other places to grab some food. Thunder from Down Under is also on the second story and is made more for the girls. They have a great selection of shops for everyone's shopping needs. The hotel has walkways to the Luxor, Tropicana, and New York New York, and even a sort of tram that takes you to the Mandalay Bay. The staff is very friendly and the rooms are very nice. Check-in can be along time, so if you wanna get into your room without a line, I suggest calling in in advance, Express Check-in. The casino level has alot of different gambling selections and even had a part of Fear Factor taped there. The lower level below the casino holds the carnival area and The Tournament of Kings Dinner show. The hotel is made more for kids of younger ages, but the kids never get in the way. Even adults can go out to the carnival or the dinner show and have a great time. The Tournament of Kings Dinner show is held two times nightly, 6:30 and 8:00. In the arena below the casino there is jousting and dinner nightly. The show is really great and I highly recommend that when you are in Las Vegas, that you don't miss this show. The kings will come out after the show for pictures and are very friendly, so be sure to bring your camera.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, but hey - the rates are excellent!”
Reviews.Author: darrylpmatthews
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Excalibur in the past, and have to say that I was not 100% happy. I chose to say again as I got a fantastic rate on a jacuzzi suite. I used the electronic check-in machines which were great, all checked-in within 10 mins, beating the queues. The room was great, able to "bubble" in the jacuzzi whilst looking out onto the strip. Room service was excellent. Ordered at 2am, delivered within 20 mins, HUGE portions and well priced. A very pleasant surprise - thoroughly enjoyed my stay (November 5th).

Reviews.Title: “"my kids loved it and so did the parents"”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i just want to say if you have kids it is a nice hotel to stay in the little arcade room on the bottom floor is nice for the kids it is very kid friendly and even if you dont pop a balloon with a dart they still give something for trying plus they have a mcdonalds in the casino the only thing is that the breafast end at 10:30 but anyway in the food court they have a puppet entertainment show witch is great for kids my kids loved it its o every have hour plus they have a krispy cremes and they show you step by step how they make a donut the maid service is great i asked for extra pillow and they came within 10 minutes asked for a bell boy and they came within 10 -15 minutes the snack bar is open all night the strip is not that far checking out is a breeze i would love to come back with my kids i had a good time and thats that i went with my 3 kids

Reviews.Title: “Great for the money”
Reviews.Author: HemiTom
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 5 day stay at the Excaliber. We paid the extra $10.00 for a strip view room. What a view from the 22nd floor! We used the kisok check-in with no waiting and the key drop check out. No problems. The room was clean and comfortable. We we there for the SEMA convention (over 100,000 people) and it really didn't seem that crowded. Plenty of room to move around and/or gamble and get drinks. If you were doing slots and needed a drink, it was a good idea to be in a busy area to get good service. And of course you won't get much service if you don't tip a dollar! How do you think they make their money? A dollar tip for a free drink is fair. We ate breakfast buffets at both Excaliber and Luxor. Luxor was a little better since they had a cook-to-order station. We also ate supper at the Luxor buffet. Just huge and great food! On a side note we went and saw Celine Dion. Just a fantasic show if you are a fan of hers. We had seats in the 5th row but there are no bad seats in the whole place. Overall it was a great week and we will go back again. If you have any questions, feel free to e mail me.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: AmandaSouthampton
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from a big trip to California.We stayed 2 nights in the Excalibur.It was fantastic! Just driving up we were really impressed.they have valet parking,just as easy to park yourself and its free! Lovely big rooms,comfortable beds.Worth the extra $10 for a view of the strip!We stayed in alot of hotels in California and the was one of the best and very affordable.Easily accessible to the Luxor and Manderlay Bay.We are going back[when I have stayed enough!] without the kids though.We will stay at the Excalibur! You will not be sorry! Whats there to complain about?

Reviews.Title: “What's the problem?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Why are people rubbishing this hotel? We have just got back and this was our third time to Vegas (previously in Riviera and Sahara). The reception was quick and very friendly, staff are overall good although cocktail waitresses can be a bit short if they don't get a tip. The waitresses are not very visible either so I suggest you bet where there are a few other people around. They won't look after a single person on one machine, when they can walk around a few people getting their tips! Yes corridors are dark, Doh! it's meant to be a castle after all. Rooms are fine and ours was clean and well appointed. We had breakfasts in the Sherwood Forest cafe and they were good but not cheap if you want a large meal. Casino here is as good as any other and the main advantage is the location on the strip being near loads of the other big casinos. If you want to go downtown then think about a limo. There was 6 of us and it cost 39 dollars and cheaper than a taxi. We liked it here and would go back, email if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Hey, this place is OK.”
Reviews.Author: mikey7909
Reviews.Content: Originally booked in at circus-circus we tranferred to the Excalibur after reading reports on the forum. No queue to speak of at reception and a well placed $20 bill secured a 2 queens room overlooking NY-NY and an excellent view of the strip. The housekeeping lady was superb, friendly and nothing too much trouble. The corridors are 'atmospheric' and in keeping with the theme of the place. I would not have been surprised to have seen the flickering candle type bulbs. Security was good with no access to elevators without being checked up. The pool was 3' deep but then even in the sea you only swim in the top 2' - 3' anyway!! You never spend all your holiday in one place and here you are next to the excellent facilities of the Luxor, MGM, NY-NY etc. which you can use without paying their room rate. Ate at the buffet (excellent) and rate it above the Pharo's feast, spice Market etc. Do not bother with the cheap steak and eggs at the San Remo, not worth the walk. To be different try the trail ride at Red Rock Canyon..super morning out and remember to wear a large hat and sleeves unless you are ok with sun-lotion. It is hot and bright and great!! This trip was a 'one-off' for us and we were not disappointed by the Excalibur..oh yes, don't forget to get down to the LV outlet mall a mile or two down past the airport Enjoy M+C

Reviews.Title: “Not very impressed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We moved to this hotel from a couple of nights at the MGM as had unexpectedly had to stay an extra night in Vegas and didn't want to pay the weekend prices of the MGM. You get what you pay for though. We found the room very basic and drab. The corriders are very dimly lit and dark and there is a stale smell about the place. We spent some time by the pool which was ok but the chicken salad I got from the pool snack bar was awful. To end on a good note, the casino itself is good and we enjoyed the food at the breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews before going to Las Vegas. We went for the Jimmy Buffett concert and wanted a location close to the MGM but not at the MGM prices. I chose the Excalibur for the theme. I was not disappointed at all. It was clean. The theme followed through out the hotel and the staff was very friendly and helpful. One thing people need to keep in mind is that cigarette smoking is the state passtime. People do it everywhere. In the elevators, in the cars in the casino, etc... Knowing that before we went made it easier. You can't escape it no matter where you go in Las Vegas. The food was super. We ate at the Stakehouse at Camelot. It was romantic, excellent food and the wait staff was charming. Of course my husband was charming as well :0) The slots were fun. I played $200 for several hours. Not really interested in table games. Security was nice to have. This is a great venue for children. Security is at the elevators and only persons with room keys are allowed up the elevators. All in all a great expierence. I would definately book here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a stinky dump”
Reviews.Author: marcnshirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur Hotel after deciding to extend our stay in Las Vegas....we chose it on its proximity to the Luxor, right next door where we had already been for 4 nights (which was great by the way), but was booked out for the weekend. So off we go next door...oh boy, what a difference. Now i am a smoker, and at the Luxor we had a suite, smoking, but it was fresh as a daisy, as my husband doesnt smoke this is important. The room we were given at the excalibur was just aweful. It stank, so much so i felt sick. The bed covers stank...so must not get changed for new guests. We arrived to an unmade room, fortunately housekeeping were on their way down the hall and my husband called her to attend to our room asap. Well she did come, and did a quick whip around, asking us if we would need it vacumed?*%£^$.....oh my goodness...i was so disgusted i said for her not to concern herself with it. Now my husband and i are not complainers. So we just headed off for the day shopping, in the hope that upon our return things might pick up. Not suprisingly, they didnt. We went to the Italian restaurant there...AVOID it at all costs..it was watery, salad was limp and warm. Prawns were not fresh. We paid got up and left. The casino was a stinky dump. No coctail waitresses around, full ashtrays, rude attendants and cage staff. I could go on and on, and you may ask why we didnt complain, well i'll just answer, because we are not like that...we just wont return, and will do everything in my power to discourage anyone i know from staying there. any questions you have, you may email me at lilly2kool@hotmail.com i would be glad to suggest where to go and eat, gamble or sleep. Just do not spend a penny of your money at this dump!

Reviews.Title: “No problems with the Excalibur...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked the Excalibur through their website. A week before our trip, the price went down about $70 per night. I called the toll-free #, and they were very gracious and quick about giving me the lower price. When we checked in at 1 pm, there was a HUGE line, so we tried the self check-in kiosk. It worked without a hitch, spits out your keys, receipt and everything. (Although the man in front of me at the kiosk did not get his keys as the room was not ready. He had to come back...poor man). Saved us a LOT of time in line, I would definitely recommend that way to check in! The room was average, but how much time do you spend there anyway? I will bring my own (brighter) light bulbs next time, though... room seemed very dark. I liked not having to go too far for a variety of restaurants & shops. Buffet was OK, but I don't like the seating arrangement: you have to get your food first, then they seat you...my food got cold. Price was good for the buffet. Vegas is fun, a little "out there" at times, but we expected that. We'll be back to the Excalibur, excellent room for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Excalibur!”
Reviews.Author: kalishea
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Excalibur yesterday. We stayed two nights. The reason we choose Excalibur was the location and price. We needed to be close to MGM for a concert, but could not afford MGM prices. We checked in at 3:00- no line, fast check-in! Our room was in great, no complaints at all. We requested that we have two rooms together and they met that request perfectly! We never heard the housekeeping, although when we stepped out for breakfast, they promtly made up our room. The casino was typical, the restrooms were clean. We ate at Sheirwood Forest Cafe (I think that was the name) twice for breakfast and it was good. The Excalibur was in a central location, within walking distance of everything we wanted to see. Check out was a breeze by using the drop box for the keys. They had nice under cover parking with security. There is also a security guard in front of the elevators, so no one without a key is allowed up to the rooms. That was a nice sense of security. No complaints and we willl definatly be back to the Excalibur!

Reviews.Title: “over-priced”
Reviews.Author: faithv
Reviews.Content: Booked reservations on line, last minute deal. Arrived in Vegas on Wednesday and booked room until Sunday. Great rate on Wed & Thur, only $69. Then came Fri & Sat. OUCH!! $219 and $269!! I was fine with that, the rates averaged itself out for the 4 days. Well after seeing our room, which I requested a king bed, and we get 2 queen beds, There was no way I was paying over $69 bucks for this room. Just by looking at the beds you could see their slope, the room was not anything that you would ever give compliments to. I called around to other hotels and we changed to the Paris for the same price, and our room was amazing. 20 million times better! I do not recommend this hotel at all, especially if you are paying more than $69 buckeroos!

Reviews.Title: “good experience at the Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a medical conference in Las Vegas and stayed at the Excalibur in early Oct. for four days. We had a great experience. The housekeepers were always on time in the mornings, and most helpful. We utilized the express kiosks for check in at the recommendation of one of the trip advisors. Need to call the hotel the morning of arrival, and they will give instructions on express kiosk check in. Very effecient. We found the staff to be helpful and available. We would definitely stay at the Excalibur again--good value.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur is okay”
Reviews.Author: cchancesare
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a one week trip - Las vegas and Utah. Stayed at Bally's in Vegas the first 4 nights great hotel - after returning from Utah stayed one night at Excalibur before returning home. We were running late returning from Utah so called the hotel to advise we were on our way and would be there by 6:30 p.m. Person I spoke to was a bit rude. On checking in (before 6:30 p.m.) the person at the check in counter was also quite curt. We were given a room on the 5th floor - next to the elevator. Needless to say we could hear the elevator all night. The best thing about Excalibur is Matt one of the bus boys at the Italian resturant. Matt is a real gem. The food there however leaves a lot to be desired. I do not recommend dining at this restaurant. Excalibur is almost to the end of the Strip - not a bad location - but will need to walk a fair bit to get up to the other side of the strip. Overall the hotel is okay. Just watch out for rude staff.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: faith179
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Vegas, and after reading the reviews on here for months before we left, I was a little nervous. But I got there and was totally surpirsed. There is NOTHING wrong with Excalibur. It was great. Yes the halls are dim, but its designed that way. Check in was great, used on of the computer self check ins, it was a pc of cake, went right to our rooms, we were on the 11th floor looking out across at Tropicana and MGM Grand. Only downside was for whatever reason, there were lots of sirens , ambulances etc, and you could hear them very well. If you were on the non view side it probably would be so loud. But that is not the hotels fault. The room was spacious, enough that my husband , myself and our two kids were quite comfy. Even with the kids stuff strewn about. We ate at the Regal Italian and it was great. Kids eat free from 5 to 7 with an adult meal. So basically we just paid for ourselfs and it was very good and very nice. We also did the buffet for breakfast a couple times and dinner once. Lots of choices, it was good for buffet food. All the staff we encountered were quite polite. The kids loved the hotel. the games and arcade was great for them. Some on here have complained about the walk to the elevator or to the casino floor, etc. Yes, sometimes you have to walk but quite honestly, where do you NOT have to walk in Vegas? Its just part of it. I would totally recommend staying here, its great if you bring kids. Its a well rounded Casino, has a little bit for everybody. I liked it better than NY NY , where we stayed on a prior trip.

Reviews.Title: “It's been nice and friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have been staying at the Excalibur for about 5 years and have had not one problem. The staff is always nice and the times we took our kids they went out of their way to be nice to them too! I don't understand why people complain about there being no tubs, who would want to take a bath in a hotel anyway, and the reason there is no fridge or coffee makers is the hotels WANT you to go the the restraunts so that you will also gamble on your way down there. If you don't spend all your time in the hotel room this is the place for you, if you want super fancy and like hanging out in your room (you might as well stay home). The idea of going to Vegas is going out, eating lots, visiting other casinos, and GAMBLING, not hanging out in your room. Also, don't go in the summer when theres a bunch of kids, go in October, Nov. Dec. Jan. Feb.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again”
Reviews.Author: mhstar75
Reviews.Content: It's not the Belagio but it's a good hotel at a reasonable price. The rooms are cool, in King Arthur motif, our room was clean and quiet, everything worked. The staff was helpful, good security too. Breakfast buffet was great, lunch buffet wasn't though. Also, the two pools are only 3 feet deep. Not strip-central, but close to the MGM, Tropicana, Mandalay Bay, Monte Carlo, Luxor and New York, New York. The exterior at night is awesome. I plan to come to Vegas often and would definitely stay at the Excalibur again.

Reviews.Title: “Very average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kam-Haider
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Vegas for 3 nights. Took advantage of the early phone in check in service, was on hold on the telephone for around 6-7 minutes before a person answered the phone. Room was on the 19th floor, at least 100 yards from the nearest elevator. Room itself was OK, nice shower room facilities, room spacious, no fridge or safe which was a big no no. Room clean. Breakfast was at the roundtable buffet, very good selection, staff at the roundtable were rude and unhelpful when we were trying to find a place to eat. Location is good, on the main strip near Luxor and New York New York. Didn't have time to watch any of the shows as we spend a day in the Grand Canyon, this is a must for anyone travelling to Vegas although it knocks out a whole day if you travel by bus. I liked the Express Check Out option on the TV in the hotel room, most convenient. Porter service was a disgrace. I rang down for a porter to collect our luggage to take to the exit area, they were late coming, and when I didn't give a tip the porter was extremely abusive. Very poor staff. There are better hotels to choose from on the Strip and I wouldn't come here again

Reviews.Title: “Not For Everyone”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Its not for everyone. If your the single guy/group of 'the boys'..then this is a cheap place to drink, gamble and lodge. If your with your 'other' go to the Luxor or the like. Its nicer and less kids. Who brings kids to a gambling resort with adult shows? Other than that the rooms were ok. I had the jacuzzi. The room was nice. Strip view. However it was ruff around the edges. Chipped paint on the roof/walls. Rusty shower heads. The TVs had no remotes and had few channels to choose from (and no microwave...but thats ok. Elevatores didnt work (but now fixed im sure). Kids running around. 'Wenches' didnt look at all apealing to the average 'guy' on vacation....but then I guess that is a wench? Wenches slow to offer drinks (even after a hour on the same slot...eHem). Not a lot of comps if you gamble at the bars. Luxor comped like no tommorow (given you spend the dollars). Room service was a lil slow but very great. Halls were full of used towers and dishes making the appearence very 'ghetto'. The pool was so very long but dont why do they have lifeguards? If your 3 feet or less you may need it...so dont expect to get any swimming in. Go to another hotel. Eating? Well the buffets where good, again to many kids. They had the basic food places. And the upscale spots were average and in no way 'impressive'. Again go to another hotel. And if your asking me..waht about such and such...my answer is go to another hotel. Oh and go to another hotel. Now again if you want to stay cheap, bring all your 14 offsprings and eat whatever, then dont go to another hotel. Stay here. Or if you just want a cheap room to drink & gamble...stay here. Or if you want a cheap room and dont really plan on staying in it because you want to go spend all your time at a better hotel gambling and drinking then stay here. I am staying at the Luxor next time I go.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was GREAT!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Piggybanke
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Excalibur from Sept 23-27th. We were supposed to leave Vegas on the 26th but due to Hurricane Jeanne in Florida, our flight was canceled. When I went to the front desk to ask what they can do for me if I stayed the extra night, the best rate they gave me was $139. The young helpful lady behind the desk (her name was Biya), told me to wait and went over the head of the person quoting the rate and got us an $89 rate. Due to Biya's efforts and constant speaking to those who could help, finally secured a $49 rate and comped buffet. All of their staff were friendly but she was great. The Roundtable buffet which was a zero the last time I was there, is up to much higher standards at this time. Both breakfast and dinner were above average. The only reason they did not get a five was that the room was average and there is not enough room to walk through the ailses of the casinos without bumping into someone.

Reviews.Title: “Medieval fun at the Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Excalibur is situated down one end of the strip next to the Luxor and Mandalay casinos for which there's a connecting monorail. Our large room was clean with some medieval style furniture and a king sized bed. There was internet access from the room for US$6 for 2 hours. The check in wasn't good. The queues was very long and the self check in didn't work. Finding our way to the check in, then to our room was also very difficult as we lugged two large suitcases through hundreds of slot machines. The Excalibur is not new and has a permanent stench of cigarette and is air conditioned to a very low temperature. Don't get the room service for breakfast, it was so expensive! Go next door to the drug store/supermarket and buy something for breakfast the night before. All in all, we enjoyed the Excalibur and were very comfortable there. We especially enjoyed the new spa area.

Reviews.Title: “OK place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Lynn60
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur for 3 nights just after Labor Day. The rooms were average but very clean and comfortable. The first night we ate at the Round Table buffet, which was good as far as buffets go. You won't go away hungry. The second night we went to the "Tournment of Kings.'' It was very entertaining and the food was pretty good. The third night we ate at the Sherwood Cafe. The food was very good and lots of it for the money. We had no problems during our stay. The check-in kiosks are very convenient and it didn't look like too many people were taking advantage of them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went to Las Vegas this past August. It was hot. . . if possible go at a different time. I stayed at the Excalibur. The room rate was $49.00 per night!!!! The location is wonderful. It is on the new part of the strip. It is connected to the Luxor, which is connected to Mandalay Bay. From the Excalibur you can use the walkovers to go to New York, New York & MGM. From MGM, you can take the tram to the center of the trip. The rooms at Excalibur were very nice, but nothing fancy. The pool area was also a treat. The hallways seemed a little dark. . . but I guess that is to be expected with a castle theme. I would definately stay there again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, affordable & has a poker room (Texas Hold'em)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Excalibur several times. Easy check-in/check-out policies. Check for TV specials for $55.00/night. Nice rooms. I loved the Poker Room (Texas Hold'em). BJ tables okay but not the best. Too many new rules. Overall - Absolutely wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, but not worth it”
Reviews.Author: VegasVampire
Reviews.Content: Although I had read some bad reviews here, I had gotten an extremely good rate for what was a rather expensive weekend in Vegas. There was a de la Hoya fight in town so the hotels had increased their rates. I had read enough good reviews to make me assume that the people giving poor reviews were just spoiled by nicer hotels. I was wrong. If you have any extra money at all, go somewhere else. Bad service, unpleasant and uninterested employees, UGLY rooms, depressing hallways and the casino was unpleasant. The sliding shower door came off its track and fell on top of me. The maid dropped and broke a piece of my friend's glass jewelry that was left in the bathroom and didn't even bothering to clean up the broken pieces of glass on the floor. The only positive note was that we called ahead and used the express self check-in kiosk. We also used it to check out. This was great because the lines at the regular counter were unbelievably long. I had previously stayed at the Stratosphere and although that hotel is not a 5-star resort and its way too far north, it was a great deal. The prices were low and the staff and environment were excellent at the Strat. This trip we spent most of our time at NYNY across the street just to get away from Excalibur.

Reviews.Title: “Regular at the Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Excalibur for the last ten years. The service has always been excellent. I am a member of the One Club and have always been treated as a special guest. Would not think of staying anywhere else. As an added bonus, have been lucky on the slots.

Reviews.Title: “Traveling with 2 Little Guys!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We did it! We went to Vegas with 2 little boys, ages 2 and 5! I have been to Vegas but not with kids. It was great. We chose the Excalibur because of the theme. Our boys love swords, knights and dragons. I have never seen so many strollers, it was great. The pool was fun, only 3 ft deep and the waterslide was a blast for our 5 year old (and us). We went to the Tournaments of Kings, a must see!! Fantasy Faire was fun. At the food court they had Mc Donalds! Happy meals for only $2.29. Krispy Kremes, Quizno's, Pizza Hut, etc. They put on free shows daily every 1/2 hour, very impressive for kids. Plus, they pick children out of the audience to participate. The rooms were nice, get a view of the strip. No bathtub, but large showers. I would stay there again with children! They have removed the 51' dragon!
