Things to see with kids: Tournament of King's Rick Thomas at the Tropicana was terrific!! Take tram from Excalibur to MandalayBay. MGM Lion Habitat, RainForest Cafe M&M World Ceasar's Forum Shops, aquarium was great and watch the statues come to life! CircusCircus was fun for my 5 year old, only 7/8 rides he could go on, a little out of the way. This is "THE HOTEL" for families. When visiting other casinos, they didn't seem to have as many kids...

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying in Las Vegas. We had a great time and we thought everything at the hotel was great. All the personnel we encountered were very friendly. Our room was very nice and clean and we had a great view of the strip. We ate several times at the buffet and the food was good. The only downfall was that the slots were tight! We would definatly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good for families”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Excalibur is a pretty decent hotel - many of the earlier reviews don't do it justice at all... Long-ish queues for checkin were a bit surprising, but it was all pretty efficient and fast-moving. The receptionist gave us plenty of information and was very welcoming. Rooms are fine - clean and spacious. The casinos are great fun and nicer than those in other establishments (eg the casino in New York New York is a bit run-down). As a group of single women, the bar/nightlife scene is pretty non-existent at the Excalibur, so we ended up spending nights out in other places. The buffet was great - decor of the dining room is not the most exciting in the world... All in all, I'd go back to the Excalibur if I had a young family in tow. For next time though, I think I may try something a little bit more exciting....

Reviews.Title: “Best value on the strip”
Reviews.Author: pstar_ken
Reviews.Content: Stayed end of Aug 2004 for 5 nights at an awesome midweek rate of $46/ngt off the internet (included 2 free spa coupons, 2 free magic motion rides, 2for1 buffet etc). When we used the washroom for the first time, it was plugged. We called housekeeping and expected it to take a while, but by the time we were ready to leave the room (within 5 mins) the guy was already at the door to fix the toilet! The room at Excalibur was spacious and clean (the only bad thing was it didnt have a tub) - for the same price as a hotel such as Imperial Palace (dirty and slow elevators), I'd much rather stay at Excalibur!

Reviews.Title: “very O.K!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the hotel was just OK... no complaints, pool OK, check in was fast with use of the kisok( 3 minutes) the plane landed at 10:30 am and i was in the room by 12 noon... 4 nights saturday - tuesday(total $225.00) and since i had a 11:00 pm flight i took advantage of the 6:00pm check out for an extra $25.00...this gives you an extra day while not having to hurry out of the hotel....i'm single and there were just way too many kids running ...while there i explored other mega-resorts and while i would love to stay at Mandalay , Luxor, Paris, Monte Carlo....the price just wasn't right... would i stay there again?? yes, but i'll look around and i'll probably try new york new york because i found myself there more than any other location...(9 fine irishmen, coyote ugly) just too fun... also use the monorail for zipping to the other end of the strip...$3.00 a trip or 10 trips for $20.00...this came in really handy.... as for the excalibur...i'll X it off my list and leave it for folks with familys

Reviews.Title: “Really Enjoyed The Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Las Vegas a week ago, and we stayed at the Excalibur for 2 nights. I'm not sure why this hotel received such poor ratings. If you want a nice clean room, Excalibur is well worth your money. Yes, the Excalibur doesn't compare with the Bellagio or Venetian, but either does the price. For $45.00 a night, you won't find a better room at your local Holiday Inn or Super 8. Heck, you probably can't even find a similar room for under $60.00 at a Holiday Inn! Anyway, the room was very clean and so was the hotel. You simply cannot beat the location on the strip. The casino was fun, and I won a lot more there than I did at any of the higher priced places just down the street! The single deck blackjack at the Excalibur was great! I would highly recommend it if you want to win once in awhile.... If you want to stay at a fun place with a great location, it doesn't get any better than the Excalibur. Don't listen to all the negative reviews listed on this site. I've stayed at quite a few places in Vegas, and the Excalibur was fine. Not amazing like Mandalay Bay or Bellagio, but it was very nice. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Hawwwribbbbbbbbbbbble!”
Reviews.Author: goyagirll
Reviews.Content: Holy Moly! I was always under the impression that the Excalibur would be a decent hotel. However, all of that changed my mind. I checked in at the hotel and I saw the check in line wrapping around 4 times. I stood on the line until i noticed that the hotel also has a quick check in automated machine where you swipe your credit card. That process was quick until my hotel cards could not be coded correctly. As a result, I had to go to their front desk to get a new set of cards. My gawd, the front desk service was soo dam slow. I finally got my new key cards and was set to go. I was a bit surprised when I saw a security guard checking all Excalibur key cards. I never saw an actual security guard at any hotels that I've stayed in. I guess it tells you something about their past. When i entered my floor, the halls were pretty clean. I entered my room and immediately smelled an musky odor. The room was actually clean however, you can tell that the hotel is pretty old and have never been renovated. There was no bath tub and they have a sign stating that the Excalibur is into conservation of the towels so that they will only replace any towels that were found on the floor. So in the future, if you need to get a new towel set, throw them on the floor after your shower. I would recommend the hotel if anybody is low on cash and will not spend any time at the hotel. Otherwise, you can find the same price at a better hotel such as ballys and tropicana.

Reviews.Title: “Big Let Down”
Reviews.Author: BusyBie
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Exalibur with our children once or twice each year since 1994. Our most recent visit August 12th was very disappointing. Very young drunken clientelle, dirty floors in restaurants. miserable staff apart from in the Jesters Bar. Food left out on the corridor floors for 24 hours before collection. The whole place is sad and run down and in need of a complete make over, facelift, or implosion. We checked out and spent 4 great nights at the Monte Carlo, part of the same chain, but so much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Not Very Good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to L.V. We booked 3 days at the Excalibur because, of a good deal we got with our Costco card. For starters, check in was a very drawn out process. The hallways and elevators are extremely hot and stuffy and the hallways are full of dirty dishes and linen. I noticed the same dishes and linens days in a row. Upon entering my room I saw out of date furniture and noticed a musty smell. The bathroom was large but had only a shower, I was not impressed. We attempted to watch an in room movie and to use the internet, however, these options did not work on any of the three days we were there. We managed to visit the Roundtable buffet which was pretty good. The price definitley did not match the quality. I wont be staying here again and would suggest you check around for a better value before settling here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice accomodation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Before visiting Excalibur I read a few reviews and was quite concerned about this hotel - no need really. Check in was fast and simple - staff were really nice and recommended self check in - even hovered over our shoulders to ensure we had no probs. The room was great. Good size, lovely bathroom, great size walk in shower and all very clean. The hotel itself has a lively, fun atmosphere. The castle theme is carried on effectively throughout the hotel. We would definitely stay there again. There were only 2 negative points which I will elaborate on for the sake of future visitors. Firstly, we got a fabulous deal through Expedia - amazingly cheap for a 4 star, however, when we decided we would like to stay an extra night we were informed we would get a 'special, preferenece rate'. As it turned out, it was quite a bit more expensive than we'd originally paid. Suffice to say we didn't bother. FIRST ADVICE - Book all the nights you need before you go. Secondly, we decided not to eat in the buffet as we wanted table service, so we decided to eat in Sir Gallahads. The restaurant is nicely done out and the service is good. I was, however, very disappointed with the food. The price was above average and what I recieved was a very rubbery piece of chicken with what I SWEAR was SMASH (instant mashed potatoes). I was rather gob smacked at the cheekiness at such a price. SECOND ADVICE - Choose where you eat carefully, not Sir Gallahads.

Reviews.Title: “Fun!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in the Excalibur a few years ago and had a wonderful time. The buffet was delicious and the theme is great! If you are a Monty Python And The Holy Grail fan you will love this hotel! The rooms were spacious but the bathroom was a little dirty. We had to call room service to come clean it and they were there within five minutes. If you have small children they have an arcade in the basement almost the size of the whole hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur, fun for all”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just spent 4 days at the Excalibur. The rooms are ok, nothing flashy, but the lack the one thing a person walking the strip needs, they don't have bath tubs. It's all showers. I had hoped the pool would be open late, but it closes at 8pm, kind of early for the Vegas crowd. I tried buffets at Harras and the Excalibur. Harras was awesome, all kinds of hot and cold food. The food at the Excalibur was at best barely warm. You can get warmer food with more flavor at Krispy Kreme across the hall. I spent my time in the kids arcade, at least there you have a chance at winning something, if its only a stuffed bear or flower. If your in the mood for a show, I suggest Mystere at TI, I've seen it twice and loved it more each time. Lance Burton at Monte Carlo is ok, but not $77 worth. One last note, the tram is cool, but the casinos make you walk all the way through to get to them. Keep the 3 bucks and walk, its quicker

Reviews.Title: “Yuck!”
Reviews.Author: Keg_Spice
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur May 9-14. The experience was terrible right from the beginning. We got there early and asked when the earliest was we would be able to check in. They told us to come back at noon. When we arrived back at 2pm they were surly and rude. They gave us our room key and we went up to dop off our bags. When we got there we thought there must have been a mistake, as the room was still filthy from the people who had checked out before us, including their room service dishes. We called down and they told us that it was no mistake and they had just said we could drop off our bags, they never said the room would be clean! Why not just tell us the room wouldn't be ready intil later? The girl at the front had also told us we had a room with a view of the strip. We had a view of the other tower. When we questioned them, they told us we would have to pay extra for a view of the strip. Why did their staff decide to lie to us to begin with? The room (once cleaned) was decent for what you pay, but we continued to have problems with the staff. Jay Leno was in town when we were there and was sold out. We decided to enlist the help of our concierge to track down tickets. When we called down to the front we were rudely informed that there was no concierge. In a city with the biggest hotels in the world? I've been to small town hotels with concierge desks! I return to Vegas yearly, but I will NEVER return to the Excalibur.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur is fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Excalibur from July 22nd thru July 26th for a sorority convention. From the moment you enter the hotel, you feel as if you are a part of King Aurthur's court. We were abel to do a early check-in at the hotel. The room had a cute theme as well and was large enough to accomodate four fabulous women in "Sin City." The Casino is cool. Defintely take part in the free Blackjack lessons. The Sherwood Cafe has the best pancakes for the early birds. If you wanted a cheaper meal, head upstairs to hit Pizza Hut, McDonald's, Kripsy Creme or Cold Stone Creamery. For my first time in LV, I am so glad I chose to stay at the Excalibur. Check-in and Express check out was smooth and quick. For the price and quailty you receive, I enjoyed my visit. I loved my stay at the Excalibur and would tell my own mother to go stay there. So, you know it must be a great place for momma to stay at. Bump the haters and chose to stay at the Excalibur.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: franklin411
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Excalibur from 7/30-8/1. Too bad I didn't see the self-check in kiosks, b/c we could have saved the wait in line. Nobody was using them, so maybe they need to advertise this better. The room was nice and clean. They even gave us extra keys for free. It's not as much fun as staying at the Luxor or other "adult" themed casinos. There's really not too much at the Excalibur for those seeking "adult" fun, but if you're just looking for a cheap, clean, decent room to sleep in or for family entertainment, the Excalibur is a good choice. Avoid the buffet, except for the lunch buffet. It's not that great, and you have to wait in longer than average lines. Also, you have to serve your own beverages and theres less quantity and quality than other buffets. Eat here only if you're getting the lunch buffet w/ the 2 for 1 coupon you get as a hotel guest.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO STAY! GREAT LOCATION! GREAT STAFF!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We checked in on July 18 th, and had a non-smoking room. They gave me the key, and told me that it wasn't ready yet, but I could check the room out. I was so glad that I got to do that. The room smelled so bad of smoke that I coudn't stand it. I called the front desk, and they told me to come right down, and they would change it. I had the nicest rep named Phylibu who went out of her way to make it right. She said, that she was so sorry that our first room was bad. I told her that it isn't the hotels fault that they get a guest who is not suppose to smoke in a non-smoking room. She said, I bet you will like this room, and she said, if you don't please come back. She was so pleasant and had the nicest smile. I went up to my room. and loved it. We were on the 17th floor overlooking NY NY and the MGM. The best view in town, and our room was clean. My husband and daughter coudn't believe the difference. Also, the beds were comfy, and the carpet was clean. Test had white socks on, and they were pretty white. We booked on Excalibur website that is the only way to go. We got the room for 49., and than got another e mail saying I could have the room for 45 dollars a night plus it came with alot of freebies. Got 20.00 dollars off the Kings Tournament show and Dinner. Everyone loved it, and the food and frozen drink was really good. We were in the Dragon Section, alot of action another words we were the bad guys. It was so much better than others have seen in the past. Our tickets were only 43 dollars; because we had the coupon for booking it up on line. Also, the pools were fun for the kids with the slides. The only complaint I had was the pool closed at 8PM, and that is way to early. Was told that is their later summer hours. I don' understand that! Got 2 free coupons for the spa, and I enjoyed that. It just opened in March very nice. The Fantasy Faire found it very hard to win prizes, and not to good. The bellman was very nice we had Charles. That is the way to go. Tip them good. It took forever to get a elevator. The security was the best that I have seen in Vegas. My husband and I were very impressed with all the nice security guards. My husband did the best gambling at the Excalibur, and had the most fun. You wonder why it is so crowded that is why. The John snack bar was the worst food. They would do better if they put something else there. Yes, I agree with some people it could be a little updated, but for the price, location and staff who could ask for more. We had another reservation to stay with our friends at the Luxor, and cancel because our beds were nice, air great, securtity the best, staff great, and they had the best water pressure, no baths but great big showers. We had the room with the view, that we all enjoyed for no extra cost. Thanks again for making our stay at Excalibur a good one! We will be back! Ron, Andrea & Cassondra

Reviews.Title: “Had great time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Vegas and even though you could tell the Excalibur was a little old, it was still good. Room was clean and comfortable. The only thing was the elevators seemed a little slow. Pool was very nice, but crowded. Didn't really like the spa, definately crowded. Nice outside bar by the pool. All in all, we had a great time, would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL TIME”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the excalibur from 7-19-04 to 7-23-04 and we had a wonderful time. We went into alot of other hotels while we were there and found we enjoyed Excalibur best. The room was great, the employees were always pleasant, lots of different eating choices (we loved the Sherwood Cafe), and the location can't be beat. I was worried after reading some of the reviews, but I did not see any of the problems that I had read about. My husband is a clean freak and he had no problem with the room.

Reviews.Title: “Book at website...EZ check in”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Used the self check in...took 3 minutes to check in, skipped the long line. I wish it were that easy at every hotel I have stayed in. Book at the excalibur website....the rates were better than any other travel site we checked. Hotel and casino were nice.... not the nicest on the strip, but nowhere near the worst. Games for the kids, buffet was good, tournament of kings was pretty good... a tad pricey. EZ access to MGM, NYNY, Luxor and Mandalay Bay. Worth the price you pay for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur - Alright”
Reviews.Author: Chenry
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur from 7/11/04 through 716/04. I will say that based on some of the reviews, this hotel was a little better than expected. They do, however, need new mattresses. The room was OK. The staff was friendly and helpful. The pool was alright. They actually have 2 different pools. The deepest part is only 3.5 ft. which was a little disappointing for our 11 year old, but he made do. It is a very nice setting with several waterfalls. We had no problem getting chairs regardless of what time we went. The arcade was one of the better ones we visited. They had plenty of different kinds of games and most of them worked. We visited the Roundtable Buffet for breakfast and it was great, we were actually there right around 11:00 AM and they changed over to lunch and there were no problems with your being able to get whichever you wanted. I highly recommend the Tournament of Kings, we had front row seats in the center and the food was good. I mean as good as chicken, broccoli and steak fries can be. The show is interactive in the sense that they bring the crowd into the story, it really was fun. As to the overall value of the Excalibur, the price was right, however, the hotel is beginning to be a little run down. Considering how much time you actually spend in your room it still was probably a better value than some. When we return to Vegas, we will probably stay some where else, just because. On a side note, we took a ride out to Sam's Town and enjoyed it very much, may consider staying there next time.

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Excalibur 3 TIMES THIS YEAR 2004 and we love it. The staff are always very friendly and very helpful. They got me and my party in our rooms way before check-in time, gave rooms w/ strip view just for the asking, help us arrange for limo rides, renting scooters.ect..... The rooms are very nice & clean with lots of clean fresh towels airconditioner worked great, beds were clean & comfortable, housekeeping staff were always on the ball cleaning the room every day or at least they asked we wanted them too( some days we didn't need anything.) The casino is laid out nice, easy to find your way around. Lots of good slot's to play. And the fact that Exclaibur is located in the heart of all my favorite casinos, and is a much better value than any of the rest is a BIG plus for them. I don't know of any other strip hotel where you can stay and be in the heart of it all, for rates as low as 29.95 a night. In fact WE LOVE IT SO MUCH we are going back in DEC 2004 :o) A.W.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: DaytripperChicago
Reviews.Content: This place was terrible. We rented two rooms for our family vacation. From check-in on it was a nightmare. Rude staff all the way, the rooms were very low standard and dirty. In one of the bathrooms sewage kept bubbling up and filling the shower floor and the smell was horrible. We called front desk to see if we could change rooms, but were told they were full and we couldn't. They sent maintenance to "fix" the problem. Well, the problem kept happening. We were then told they were having problems all over in the hotel. The maid threw my daughter's contacts and case out. We had to fill out a report, which they said they would look into. As of last year, we still haven't heard anything from them. Never once did they offer any type of compensation and when we asked for it, they said they couldn't do a thing. This was our first visit to Las Vegas and may well be our last. I'm soured on Vegas all together after staying at this pit. When ever anyone mentions they are going to Vegas I always tell them stay away from Excalibur. It's not family friendly, it's not even people friendly. It's a dump and the staff suck.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a great stay. We weren't sure what to expect after reading some of the reviews so we were pleasantly surprised. We got a great rate and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “You almost get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ok, it was cheap....... That's the good news. I checked out early and went to the Monte Carlo - thank god. Here's how it happened. One hour plus to check in, didnt have the room we paid for (a premium for a view). Once we got into our room with a view (of the tropicana across the strip and little else), things went down hill. Dirty, nasty, rude -- what can i say.....

Reviews.Title: “People come on....... Excalibur is fine.”
Reviews.Author: JillA
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a weeks vacation June 19 through the 26th in Las Vegas where we stayed at the Excalibur. We got exactly what we expected a hotel in a great location at a fraction of the cost of other hotels. Our room was clean and decent size. The shower was huge and clean. Room service was great always bringing us extra towels when we needed them. I have read many reviews complaining that there was no bathtub- there isn't (and who takes a bath at a hotel anyways)? The casino was great and after trying out a few others we prefered to play there. We had no issues at the pool. People complained about a lack of towels and chairs. We never ran into this. Again if you go to a pool mid day when it is 100 degrees out expect it to be packed. Why anyone would bring kids to Vegas is beyond me and there are plenty of them. They never bother us once at the Excalibur. If you want to stay away from kids stay out of the arcade where they are the majority of the time. The buffet is average and you can find much better on the strip. But the Sherwood Cafe is great for breakfast, there is a food court for your quick lunch and the restaurants in Excalibur where very good. Excalibur is a decent hotel, at a great price in a FANTASTIC location. If this is what you want stay here. If not stop complaining and go spend hundreds of dollars a night to sleep somewhere else. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “What a pain!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Terrible once we walked into the door. Long line for people that booked online, seemed very disorganized. Supposed to be 'kid friendly', didn't seem to be. Security told me I could be fined for having my child in the casino. But it was the only way to get to restaurants, arcades, and to the outside. Security disciplined her because she stopped and adjusted her shoes!! She cried after that whenever I wanted to leave the room. Complained, didn't do any good. Would not stay there again even if the room was free.

Reviews.Title: “Family Had A Good Time!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and my two teenagers (17 & 14) stayed at the Excalibur for two days. I was a little nervous because of some of the reviews. However, for the price of the hotel per night, it was very acceptable to us. If you are traveling with kids this is a very good place to stay. They loved the arcade! They did better in the arcade than we did in the casino! They came home with all sorts of prizes! They definitely entertain the kids! We did not have reservations, it took about 20 minutes to check in -- and about 5 minutes to check out. No problems. Yes, the rooms are not fancy at all. There are no tubs, just showers, but they are spacious. The only thing that shocked us was that we always heard that the food was inexpensive. We were surprised! Our dinner meal cost more than our room did!

Reviews.Title: “Family had fun!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family of five (boys 7, 8 and 11) stayed at the Excalibur the last week of June. I too was nervous when I read other reviews. Don't worry. We rented 2 rooms and both were wonderful. The pool was good for the young ones. The Tournament of Kings was alot of fun and the food was pretty good. I will stay there again. One word of advice, check in using the internet BEFORE you arrive. When I got there, the check in line looked to be about a half an hour long. I checked in two days earlier on the internet so when I got there I went to a different window and was checked in in less than five minutes. No wait. If you are able to select a tower, try tower two. The parking is closer and the pool is below tower two.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur is great value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Excalibur for 4 days in May 2004. Booked room over Internet at a great rate of $49 per night plus taxes. The room i got was large with 2 King beds but on the 2nd floor, so no views but otherwise very good. Clean, tidy and everything worked OK. My friend had a room on 18th floor and it was good also. Same price as mine. Hotel is a little old and very busy but not really a problem. Staff were courteous and friendly. Security for guest only access to rooms, very good. Check-in was quick. Check out is great. Just put your door pass into the slot at the counter or at various places in the Hotel and GO. Buffet breakfast was good value and excellent food variety. Would stay there again. Glenn

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Vegas 2 days ago. I read some negative reviews on the hotel after I booked the Excalibur. But while staying there, I realized that these people are all expecting a 5 star hotel for a 3 star price. True, Excalibur is not the same hotel as the Bellagio or Venetian, but it is also not charging $400 a night. People got to be real here. Also stay somewhere else if you're not traveling with kids. There are plenty of kids in this hotel. The good part of the hotel is its location, food court, arcade, decent pool (MGM is better), free shows throughout the day, clean room. The bad part is lack of quality restaurants (but there are plenty of good places to eat in the surrounding casinos), buffet is below average, low budget shows throughout the day, average size room, no tub (shower only). Overall, not a bad hotel for those with kids and with low budget. But for slightly more, I recommend the MGM or T.I.

Reviews.Title: “I Don't Think the Real Medieval Times Was This Bad!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place needs a major overhauling if it wants to compete with the other hotels on the strip. I found the hotel to be dirty and out of date (excluding the fact that the hotel is medieval theme). The rooms were VERY average for a Las Vegas strip hotel. I felt like I was sleeping at a motel as opposed to a Las Vegas hotel. The buffet was disgusting and the casino was awful. The only way I would stay here again would be if some MAJOR renovations took place. At it's pace now, I expect the Excalibur will be gone withing 10 years.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base, good value but busy”
Reviews.Author: RKD419
Reviews.Content: The Excalibur was a good deal booked through Octopus. The room was very clean, themed but looking a bit tired. The casino was as all the others - a casino. There was no fridge or coffee maker in the room - I'm sure to try and lull you into spending money in the place. The swimming pool was really busy with loads of families. The gym and spa in the hotel were really nice for $15 it was a quiet oasis away from the Las Vegas hustle and bustle. All food in the hotel was pretty pricey. We were offered a third night (we only had two booked) for only $40 - worth remembering. Value for money - especially if you don't intend spending much time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: At first I was impressed by this hotel. Great location and clean rooms. On the other hand, the staff could have been much more friendlier. They seemed as though they hated their jobs and were rude, at times. Also, they had the nerve to charge me long distance charges for making toll free 1-800 calls with my calling card and when I made collect calls. I will NEVER stay at this hotel ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with kids!”
Reviews.Author: kbohms
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay at the Excalibur with our two children ages 3 and 8. We had a wonderful time. The room was nice, nothing fancy, but very nice. For 50.00 a night you cannot get a better deal. The Kings buffet was by far one of the worst buffets we have ever eaten at. The Regale Italian restaurant was awesome, our server made us feel like royalty. McDonalds and Krispy Kreme made the kids happy. We took the kids to the arcade and had a ton of fun, the coupon book we got at check in made the arcade easy on our pockets. The pool is great for kids with two water slides, we spent an entire day just hanging out. If you are travelling to Vegas with your kids, this is a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Great rates for a great Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If there are any negative reviews about the Excalibur, please do not listen. My family and I stayed at the Excalibur and we had the best time. When we first went to our room it had a little order but it only took one phone call down to housekeeping and less than a hour our room smelled brand new. Some other reviews complained about the smoke in the casino...you can visit all the top notch casinos, for example the Bellagio and there was a lot of smoke in that hotel casino too. The front desk clerk was very nice and professional. She also worked out a cheaper rate for our room. If your looking for somewhere nice to stay and at a reasonable price, the Excalibur is your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur; Get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from a 4 nite stay at the excalibur hotel. Before we arrived in vegas, I had read some poor reviews but ended up booking and staying here anyways. My mistake. Upon arriving at the hotel we waited in line for approx. 30 minutes to check in, I did notice the Kings Window(express check in) moved quick, but couldn't figure out how to prearrange that. I called the Hotel and waited on hold for 20 minutes without ever speaking to a real operator. The girl at the desk was nice and we declined a room with a view, didn't pay the extra 10 bucks. Our room was in tower 2 on the 22 floor and looked directly at tower 1(poor view) although we could see abit of the Luxor and Mandalay Bay. The room itself was terrible. I am not usually one to complain, however, Upon entering the room we were shocked at how musky and old it smelled, hard to explain, but it reeked of dog and old carpet smell. the bathroom was large, but just had a shower. the Air Conditioning unit was the biggest problem. It worked fine other than the fact it was extremely loud, couldn't fall asleep while it was running, and it didnt have climate control. By the end of the 2nd day morning my nose started to bleed because it was so dry and the air was in dire need of moisture/humidity. The cleaning ladies did a decent job, i feel sorry for them that they have to work in those wretched smelly rooms all their lives. 2 of the mornings we woke up and left our room to find beer bottles in the hallways and elevators. The staff did seem friendly and they did have a security check in at the bottom of each tower and only allowed hotel guests up the elevators. We ate at a few a places in the hotel over the 4 days; Sherwood Forrest cafe was decently priced and offered large portions 24/7, the buffet wasn't exactly the greatest for 18 dollars a plate. The McDonalds/Pizza Hut/Quizinos etc on the 2nd floor was overpriced but quick service. Too many kids in the hotel(yes it is a family hotel, but in my opinion Vegas is not for kids). Not much to do/see in the excalibur itself other than the castle games floor(for kids). Sports book at the Excalibur was brutal, they didn't offer prop bets like the other REAL Sports Book casinos, and the odds were never as good as NYNY or MGM, i compared these closely. Slots were pretty tight for us, never played the tables, didn' like the general atmosphere because of all the small children and to get anywhere in the casino you have to go directly through all the tables and slots. Pool was nice and fitness center/spa was great! Brand new and clean, lots of new equipment. Tram to Luxor and Mandalay bay was nice however those hotels didnt have much to offer either. The Excalibur is a good place to stay if you like looking at children hanging around smokey casinos until the wee hours of the morning. It is too far south on the strip and is a good 45 to 1 hour walk or 12 dollar cab ride to Strip central. If you want to cheap out in vegas stay at the Flamingo, Ballys or Imperial palace. In my opinion spend the money it will be well worth it at cesears, venetian or bellagio. Excalibur needs major work to bring it up to standards with the rest of the strip hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good clean hotel, bit of a problem checking in at the King's window, you can also email them as well as phone 2 hours before. Apart from that hotel was a lot better than expected, would book again.

Reviews.Title: “Get place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It was great, mean most of the time i was drunk and having a great time. It's connected to Luxor and Mandalay Bay. Easy acceess to the strip and a walk away from EVERYTHING! I mean if you live in a hotel it's not a great place, but if you live for gambling, drinking, and having a great time, it's awsome. Why pay over $300 for a room that your not going to be in, right? So i rather save my money, and use it to gamble.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've been to Vegas twice and both times I stayed here. Sure, it's not the most glamorous hotel but it's on the strip and is a good place to get some sleep. There are some good and cheap restaurants here and overall, it is good value for the money I paid.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. I was there last week and it was ok. For a little price, we had a large room with a large bathroom. The rooms that are on the side of the Strip may be noisy - the airport is very close. Would recommend it. But would not recommend to go to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, and a great deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Las Vegas in May 2004 and had chosen the Excalibur as it was in the middle of things on The Strip. It is close to all the other main hotels and the buzz of activity around it was high. You can pay a lot more to stay in Las Vegas and certainly the top hotels that we visited looked great and had high levels of finishes and amenities. What prompted us to write this review was that, if you search a little harder, you too can stay at this class of hotel for £85 for two nights. This was about half the price of the normal hotel websites, check it out on ---------------------------

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Excalibur on May 24-26th. I highly suggest pre-registering online or by telephone so as to avoid the long lines. The rooms were clean, comfortable and cheap. The hotel's location is ideal. Overall, a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel - we had so much fun!!”
Reviews.Author: Angel05
Reviews.Content: Excailbur Hotel and Casino is a FANTASTIC place to stay! There is so much to do, and the atmosphere is great. It is always packed with people looking for a great time, and there are so many other activities you don't even need to gamble! The rooms are lovely and comfortable, the staff are friendly - there are heaps of shops, and the fantasy faire arcade is lots of fun (and has great prizes)! I would definitly stay in this hotel again - its proximity to most casinos is very good, and the value for money is superb. It is not 5 star, but if you are like me and want to spend most of your money on shopping and fun, [not on a room you are barely in], then this is the place to be!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value For the Money”
Reviews.Author: momtravelswith3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur from May 16-20, 2004. We chose the hotel based on price and location. We were not dissapointed. This hotel is rated as a 3.5 Star, if you are looking for a 5 star hotel do not stay here. There are many beautiful 5 star hotels on the strip but obviously they cost more than the Excalibur. There was a line at check-in, we waited about 20minutes or so, not a big deal to me. We received a standard room with 2 queen beds. The rooms are simple but very clean, the bathrooms are good sized with a very large shower (no tubs). We ate at the buffet 2 times for breakfast, $8.99 includes choice of many beverages, the food was great buffet quality food. We attended the Tournament of Kings Dinner Theater, it was a fantastic show, very well choreographed and the food was pretty good. The food court is great for quick food on the go, they have Pizza Hut, Quiznos, Krispy Cremes and an ice-cream place. We walked around to many hotels and casinos on the strip and felt the casino at the Excalibur was about the busiest on any given night. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. The hotel is connected via tram to the Luxor and Mandalay Bay, there is a pedestrian walkway to New York, New York and from there over to MGM as well as Tropicana. I like the idea of paying for the lower priced hotel but having access within 5 minutes to 5 hotels. We used the pool once, there are plenty of loungers but the water is very cold even on a hot day. The security checks at the main room entrances are great, they will not let you past witout showing a room key. We were very happy with our stay at the Excalibur and would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lost my family for 40 minutes at this horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Exalibur from March 9 to 16th. On the last day, I asked my wife and three children to wait at the foot of the escalator while I went to cash in my players points. When I came back they were gone. I looked all over and had them paged numerous times. Before I found them it was the scariest 40 minutes of my life. What had happened was a security guard had told them they were not allowed to stand around in the casino. Despite the fact that they were at the foot of the escalator and not in the casino and said they were only waiting for me, they were told they would have to wait somewhere else. What made the whole experience really bad and convinced me that I would never stay at this hotel again was the attitude of the front desk staff. When I complained on checking out, first they said that this was a security department issue not a front desk issue and when I asked to speak to a manager, was told by the front desk manager that she did not have the authority to do anything. It was this complete lack of interest in guest satisfaction that convinced me never to stay at here again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: BarbinMadison
Reviews.Content: Had to admit I was worried with what I read about some of the reviews, but there was nothing to worry about. The check in line was long but went fast, the staff was friendly and helpful, the room was clean and the decor was very nice with the theme of the hotel. It was handy to get from casino to casino with the tram to Mandalay Bay and the Luxor. It was very close to New York, New York and across the street from the MGM and Tropicana. We ate breakfast in the restaurant and supper one night in the buffet and both we excellent and well kept. We also rented a car and the valet service was fast and friendly too. The check out was easy with thier express check out service too. The only advice I would give is to call ahead if you can and request express check in and things will go even faster for you. We would stay there again if the occasion arises.

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel, more than comfortable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews of this hotel, I felt I had to stick up for the Excalibur! OK, so it isn't exactly the most plush hotel on the LV strip, and the Casino had a slightly seedy feel to it, but my partner and I were both really impressed with our room - much, much better than we thought it would be. And we are quite a fussy couple! It was spacious, spotlessly clean, had a huge bed and the bathroom looked recently decorated, with no sign of mould or stains anywhere. The decor in the room was in keeping with the medieval theme and everything within it seemed very well maintained. One of t I can't comment on the restaurants though as we didn't eat at the Excalibur (apart from during the "Tournament of Kings" which was a great laugh). Generally excellent value for money - I would definitely stay here again, but would only recommend it to those of you who have a strong sense of fun and who enjoy (for example) places such as Disneyworld.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as they say, good deal!”
Reviews.Author: raveman2001
Reviews.Content: I read the negative reviews so I did express check in by calling from the airport, that problem was solved, the check in lines did look huge. The rooms weren't the greatest but its a themed hotel! Yes, there are kids and it is a bit cheesy but its supposed to be a castle what do you expect? Overall it was fine, and cost $100 less than any other hotel in vegas on a Saturday night. The Italian restaurant is very good. If you need to save a few bucks its great, if you have more money go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Jemimagold
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because of a conference I was attending at The Excalibur. It was awful. To name a few problems..... looooooong check-in lines, looooooooong check-out lines, teens sitting on the floor around reception with pillows they've brought from home - I guess waiting on Mom to get the fam checked in, dirty musty rooms with nasty brown shag carpeting that has likely been there since 1970, fake wood furniture, overall cheesy decor, and disgusting food at the buffet. I did one night here and immediately moved the next day to the Tropicana which was $20 more a night but a huge improvement in terms of service and quality. I will never return - gives me the shivers just thinking about it.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay at the Excalibur again.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Excalibur 5 nights in April. Would stay there again. Clean sheets, huge bathroom with huge shower. Great location. Great view! I would reccomend it to anyone. The 2nd level has everything from fast food to fine dining. No problems encountered at all. Room service had a little to be desired but the service was above average.

Reviews.Title: “good value and location”
Reviews.Author: travelcj
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Excalibur Hotel at least 10 times, and have always been satisfied with the staff, service, and room. A few times I have had to wait in a long line for check in (normal in Las Vegas), but a few years ago discovered the "Kings Window", an express check in. It is best when making your reservation to mention this, you will avoid a long wait in line. I last stayed May 2-7 2004, and for $55 / night, I cannot think of a better value and place to stay. In addition, its location is ideal, just walking distance from NYNY, MGM, Tropicana, Luxor, & Mandalay Bay. Looking forward to another stay in December!

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur was no great shakes”
Reviews.Author: dwheatl
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Excalibur, and it was not so special. we chose it because it was "family-oriented" and we had to bring our kids because we came to Vegas for a family celebration (otherwise, I would never take kids to Las Vegas). The pool has very short hours, (from 11:00 to 7), the service in the coffee shop was terribly slow, and you have to walk through the sleazy, smoky casino to get into or out of your room. In fact, I heard someone asking a security guard to help them find their car that they had parked by the door that said "Casino Entrance". the guard laughed and said every door was the "casino entrance."I know most casino hotels do the same thing, so I would recommend that if you HAVE to take your kids to Vegas (I don't recommend it; my husband caught a pervert photographing my daughter's rear end and a pair of drunks chased me and my 2 children from N.Y. N. Y. to Excalibur) stay in one of the non-casino motels off the Strip, and really watch everyone who comes near your family.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: HolidayqueenEssex
Reviews.Content: 11 of us went to Vegas for New Year, 10 of us stayed in the Excalibur and my brother stayed in New York, New York. Our rooms were ok, it was my second time in Vegas so I knew what to expect, you certainly get what you pay for, and Excalibur was one of the cheaper hotels, so what can you expect, staff were pleasant, food was good, rooms were clean, what else can you ask for. If you go over New Year don't expect too much, there were fireworks along the strip, but nothing else happening, I thought there would be alot more going on along the strip, but was disappointed. Would definitely go back though, a fun place to be.

Reviews.Title: “There are better hotels than this one!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When you enter the hotel be prepared to get into a long line for registering. The room was dirty and old! There was no tub and no phones in the bathroom. On top of that you have to pay $1 a a day for the phone services even if you do not use it. The room does not have a safe and no fridge. The air-conditioning is also very loud. For the price of this hotel you can stay in another with better rooms. I give hotel a 2 star not 3.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel yet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at found it to be the most entertaining hotel on the strip. The Juost Dinner was incredable, Intertaining and very good food. The shops were different and fun. You will not be disapointed if you choose this hotel. Jim

Reviews.Title: “Better than my expectations”
Reviews.Author: labgalbuffalo
Reviews.Content: I was really nervous about going to stay at The Excalibur last week (April 15-17), after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor before I left. I thought I was going to catch a disease, have to feel my way around the hallway, and dust off my plate at the buffet. Come on people! The place was great for a moderately priced hotel (We spent $69 on Thursday and $129 on Friday, on a very busy, sold out weekend in Vegas). The hallways are lit with lanterns to give you the feel of midevil times. The Buffet was wonderful; breakfast was better than dinner, but too bad they didn't have an omlete making station (but prime rib, yum!). The food court was convenient. The walkway to Luxor was time saving. Our room, tower 1, had a beautiful view down to the Eiffel Tower of Paris; and we didn't even ask for a view. They had a great variety of games in the casino, and their players club had some good comps. The pool area was beautiful, but I agree with the reviews about the lounge chairs. They need to buy about 100 more chairs. It is murder trying to find somewhere to sit. You have to walk all around the pool and stake people out that look like they are leaving. When they know the hotel is at capacity, they should definately increase staff and things like pool chairs. The pool is outside of tower 2, so I wished we were there instead of tower 1, because it was a hike. The spa was perfect, with state of the art exercise equipment, and a great hot tub and steam room.

Reviews.Title: “It keeps getting better.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas was fanastic, Excaliber hotel was fine and the food delicious. Viewing of other hotels was spectactular, i.e. Venetian (the ceiling, gondolas), New York New York, Paris, Ceascers (the sky, the talking statutes) Luxor etc. Day tour to the West Rim of the Grand Cayman (Grand Canyon Tours) was awesome. Five night shows provided entertainment and the lights of the "City that never sleeps was entertaining.We, my sister, her husband and I enjoyed each moment of our visit of 6 1/2 days. Could have stayed longer.Having completed my fifth trip I look forward to my annual visit in 2005.

Reviews.Title: “adequate hotel/fair price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read many tripadvisor reviews of Exclibur prior to my trip to Vegas. Many were critical. They referred to Excalibur as the "Motel 6" of the strip and argued that the rooms were small and sub-par. I found the rooms to be fine. Generally I found the facility to be clean, reasonably priced, and aesthetically appealing. My only real complaint was that lines for food, check-in, etc. were LONG!!! But that's probably par for the course at a mega-complex such as this.

Reviews.Title: “needs upgrading but good location”
Reviews.Author: Cecili
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights (4-11 to 4-14-04) of an 8 night stay. The other 5 nights were booked at a different hotel. It was spring break and knowing this we were already aware of the crowds. Have stayed at Excalibur at least 4 or 5 times over the last 10 years and this year is the last year we will be staying. We chose this as we had older kids with us and like the location. ( We were there as spectators for a motocross event at the Speedway) The hotel is in great need of a renovating! The rooms were worn and did not seem real clean. However, the rollaway bed was much nicer than expected. Better than Circus Circus's rollaway which we had later in the trip. There was an odor in the hotel and even in the rooms, when the room was non-smoking. We now know what previous reviews stated about the noises in the plumbing and we are not talking about your typical shower running or toilet flushing. There was actually sounds that the pipes made. Looks like the pipes are in need of servicing. FYI, there is only a shower no tub, but the shower is big. The security guards at each entrance to the elevators, to go to the rooms, was made you feel secure. The buffet looked good, but was bland. We chose other restaurants in the vicinity to sit down as we did not like the buffet. We did like the food court as it gave us an option for a quick bite to eat. We did not attend the Tournament of Kings as we had done that before, but if you attend I am sure you will like it. However, don't expect a lavish dinner. All in all, we think that the Excalibur was much nicer in the early years, 1990-1998. For the price we will be choosing another hotel on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “don,t stay here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the excalibur in feb. it was the worst trip ever. 1.there was a roach in the food at the buffet and gnats. 2. there was a used condom in the shower. 3. the air didn,t work in the room 4. the bed was hard as a rock I mean come on we go to vegas twice a year and this is by far the worst of them all. this was the first trip to vegas for our kids so we thought that excalibur was appropriate don,t do it NewYork will be our future spot from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband & I arrived at Excalibur about 11.00am on a saturday, March 20th, 2004. Thinking our room would not be ready I asked my husband to go check our luggage into holding area, while I organized initial checkin. The Line was not to bad waited about 20minutes and to my surprise there was a room available to go straight in. I had requested a strip view room and we were given very spacious room and had a view over to the New York New York and MGM. I notice in other reviews some are saying there is no bath, we had a bath with a shower in was all very clean and tiled very nice. Once bed time came never heard any noice from highway or downstairs so maybe it depends what floor you are on we were on the 13th floor, bad number i know. It was great having the food area on second floor very handy for late night snacks and coffee, even McDonalds. Pool area was crowded but seems like every hotel is that way, vegas is a busy place. There was good security so no one could just go up to room areas you were checked everytime from the guard. I found hotel clean, no rubbish laying around in lifts or on the floors great atmosphere hotel and it was spring break so there were many people there. Only thing i would say was when your ordered a drink from waitress it usually took her sometime to return when you are playin on machines or tables. For what we payed at $59.00us a night I know I would never get something like Excalbur in Australia and we would definetly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Way Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: You can never get a floor or connecting rooms even when you book 8 months ahead. Had small children and needed connecting rooms and could not get them. You can get anything on the strip for what they charge . This is not even a 1st class hotel. Beds are terrible, staff unfriendly. Have stayed their several times but no more. Booked 5 rooms and asked for rooms on same floor at least in same tower and no one was even close to being together.

Reviews.Title: “Bad with the Good (though more of the former)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have a generally positive outlook and typically refrain from negative reviews but this stay (4/8-4/11) had too many detracting issues that other potential travelers should be aware of. GOOD: *for us location was great *Deluxe room was sparse but large which gave us space to spread out *casino was nice, though tough to get seats for table card games *sports book was great, seats always available, marquee games on the multiple big screens, continuous drink service *spa was clean, and complete with adequate exercise equipment and plentiful amenities in the locker room BAD: *electronic key cards initially did not work *problems with checking in and activating a credit card for room expenses *no offer for bellhop to take luggage to room *filthy entrances (finger/hand prints covering every door) *lack of lounge chairs by pool, many had to spread towels on the walkways for a place to lay down *though the breakfast buffet was cheap in price, it was due to its lackluster options *blackjack dealers were less than friendly/cordial (two exceptions) *long wait for bellhop when checking out *beds/pillows were not comfortable *air conditioning unit would not operate properly *constant running toilet Overall, even though the casino is nice and the pool is too, if you only could get a seat, the cheap price for the hotel is indicative of the less than ideal stay the Excalibur offers.

Reviews.Title: “Yuk!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a spring break trip to Vegas and Excalibur. I'll never stay there again! This is about our 8th time to Vegas and this is the worst hotel we've seen. The check-in line was miles long and SLOW! Our "non-smoking room" smelt like a bar and gave my kids headaches sleeping in it. The place needs renovated badly. It took an hour for the bell hops to bring us our bags. The whole place is old and dirty. Everytime we got in the elevators hey were full of trash. And the beds are the worst we've slept in. We had pains in our necks the whole time. Please take our advice and spend just a little more, go to MGM, go to Ceasars, go to Ballys, and get a nice, clean, and comfortable room. This place stinks!!

Reviews.Title: “Wow, hotel was fab!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Excalibur for three nights and it was WOW! The hotel was fab. Clean rooms, excellent staff. The shower cubicle could 've fitted my whole family in! I wouldn't say our view was the best (tower 2, around the back) but we were hardly there so it didn't matter. For the money paid I would recommend it to anyone, especially as there was someone to check you had a door key, before letting you into the lifts. I wish we'd had more time!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vegas Experience!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Excalibur is a great place to stay for a first trip to Vegas (especially on a modest budget). The staff is so fun, especially the casino hosts and dealers. Although the "after hours" choices for food aren't "perfect" (you can always grab something though), the Round Table Buffet is awesome! Excalibur is at a great location on the Strip. You are across the street from Luxor, MGM, NY NY, Tropicana, to name a few. There is always some sort of shuttle, cheap bus, etc., from the hotels to get to whichever place you're looking for. Not to mention, the walk from one end of the strip to the other is not bad at all. We stayed at the Excalibur during the week in which we were married, and it made the experience so much better! We have elected to go back for our one year anniversary, and we are staying in the same place! The Excalibur is a blast. If you want something with better room service, stay at the Bellagio (and pay a LOT more for your room!) :) Contact me with any questions... Enjoy Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Off with their heads!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked a last minute mini vacation through America West and didn't have much choice when it came to hotels. We ended up at The Excalibur. Although we were told it was a hotel it felt more like a youth hostel in a 3rd world country. Lines everywhere. No room service (had to wait an hour on the phone because there was only one operator - and this is one of the largest hotels on the planet, mind you). Hotel cleaning staff sitting in gangs in the VERY DARK hallways. Drinks and bandaids left in the elevators. Bell service is a joke. Astronauts eat better food. The whole place is as dark as a dungeon. But the worst thing? Once you're outside, there's no way to tell how to get out of there on foot. The signage is non existent and the architectural clues are misleading. Just stand at the valet station and watch as family after family tries to get to the walkway...Hilarious! The Excalibur is by far the cheapest, ugliest architectural embarrassment in this city of architectural missteps. Could be easily forgiven if the service was there. It wasn't and we got the distinct impression that Excalibur doesn't care --the crowds will always come. There's no accounting for taste. Yuck. Next time it's Mandalay Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well, having previously stayed in Luxor, the best hotel I have ever stayed, I decided to stay in Excalibur for 27-30 march. I was lucky with checking in since there were only 3 persons in front of me. Taking a look later on it looked like you had to wait about 30 minutes to get checked in. I stayed in 27th floor with a view of the strip, very nice! The rooms were huge, very tidy and had excellent bathroom. Only problem was some very loud banging noise in middle of one night, that really scared me when I was fast a sleep and believe me, I don't wake up so easily! It lasted for about 5 minutes and never was a problem after that, I suspect it was some problem with the ventalation or maybe someone was having good times upstairs... My verdict: I rate this as a poor mans option of Luxor , but if you are looking for a good value hotel in LV pick this! It is the best value in Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “deeply disappointed”
Reviews.Author: jamiejh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned yesterday from our trip to Las Vegas (3/26-3/29). And I must say we were deeply disappointed with this hotel and casino. We had reserved a deluxe view room and we ended up in a room on the 2nd floor and our great view was of the parking lot, wow. When we called the front desk to tell them we weren't happy with the room they basically gave us the run around. But besides our sucky "view" room, the rooms are way too dark and the halls are even darker. Very poor lighting everywhere. I feel that the money we paid for this hotel wasn't worth it. I would take your money spend a few dollars more and go to 'Ny Ny hotel', 'Paris hotel', 'The Palms' or 'Aladinn'. Just stay away from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Excalibur on March 23-27, 2004. I found the hotel to be extremely nice. The room and bathroom were LARGE and clean. As most people have noted there was no tub, but I'm not one for bathing anyway; I prefer to take showers. How many people actually take baths in a hotel anyway!? The hotel is a themed hotel-MEDIEVAL-and as such it is dark, come on people there were no florescent lights back then! I enjoyed the food court and I did have the roundtable buffet for lunch the last day of my stay and what I tried, I really liked it. The buffet was HUGH and had a plethora of food to choose from. After reading some of the reviews here I would have been scared to stay there! I guess maybe some of these people are accustomed to staying at such places as the Bellagio or the Venetian. I'll admit that Excalibur doesn't compare to those places, but for the price you pay you get a **** good deal! I would stay, and do plan on staying there again. Also, and perhaps most importantly, people be warned, stay away from the time share people they are horrible. The tour was about 3 hours long (they said it would be 2 hours) and they offered a great interest rate of 17.9%(they must think we are idiots!!!!) Once we told them we were not interested in purchasing they became extremely rude with us. During my stay that was the only bad experience I had, and it had nothing to do with the Excalibur or Excalibur staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Excalibur for 2 nights. It was our first visit to Las vegas and would use the Excalibur again. My husband and I found the staff courteous and friendly and the room spacious, clean and tidy. The food was excellent especially the breakfast buffet and it was situated ideally at the south end of the strip by the New York, New york, MGM and The Luxor. Was very good value for money. Will rebook again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We came in on sunday morning. The stay was great. People were very nice,rooms were very clean and plenty of gambling. We got checked in very quick because we booked with funjet. I did feel sorry for the others. Line was long so if your planning on staying call ahead with express check in. Last thing PEOPLE KEEP YOUR KIDS AT HOME. Couldn't fathom pushing a stroller and holding on to a three year old at 1:00 am and expect to have a ggod time.

Reviews.Title: “I had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got home yesterday and I wanted to write this while it was still fresh in my mind. I know I read these reviews before I left so I had no surprises when I got there. This was my first trip out to LV and I thought that Excalibur was a great hotel! Check-in was easy! But then again, I got in at 11 pm on a Wednesday. The room was clean and comfortable. Nothing too fancy...but comfortable. No, there were no kids running around like tazmania devils and the staff people were nice as long as you were nice to them. The only problem we had was with the late check out...they charge for that and they change the price of the charge when they feel like it. The food court was helpful for the late night munchies and the Steakhouse is AWESOME! Great service there also. STAY AWAY FROM THE BUFFET. ICK! To sum it up...no the Excalibur is not on "MANDALAY BAY LEVEL"...but it is nice enough for the price. My only other words of wisdom....STAY AWAY FROM THE TIME SHARE PEOPLE. NIGHTMARE!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week in Vegas and stayed at the Excalibur. It was a great week and I really liked the hotel. OK, it's not in the same class as Caesars Palace and some of the others but for the money it was great. Really loved the building and found most of the staff helpful and polite (with the exception of 1 table dealer). The rooms were quite spacious and clean though the first room we went to was not made up but were moved immediately to another room. I wasn't a big fan of the swimming pool area - the pool was too shallow and there weren't always enough sunbeds. A new spa has just opened up and looked great. Ate a couple of times at the Roundtable buffet which was more than adequate for the price. Went to the Tournament of Kings show which was OK but not a big fan of the food there (especially if you're a vegetarian)! Overall had a great time and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with the Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with the Excalibur Hotel. We were in the registrationline for 30 minutes before we were sent to a room that was not ready. housekeeping had just started cleaning the room from the previous guest. I called the front desk and was told that I could wait until housekeeping was finished with the room. I told them I would not wait and I wanted a room that was ready. They said they would send a bell person up with a key which took about 20 minutes. All employees were rude the rest of our stay. the drinks at all the Excalibur bars were weak and not good at all. I will never stay at the Excalibur again.

Reviews.Title: “They only care about your $$ or rather their $$”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3/3/04 to 3/6/04. Was acceptable as far as hotel accommodations go, ok rooms nice bathrooms (big shower, but no bath). Stayed at a Super 8 because we got back home too late (would have gotten home, after 2 hour drive home, at 2:30 am due to delays) and their room was comparable (except bathroom) for 1/2 to 1/3 the price. What really got me was the service, unless they worked for tips they treated you as if you were a nuisance. Was next to impossible to have any problems with staff addressed, managers didn't seem to care, just waited for you to leave for home so life would go back to normal for them. Try to raise the issue with 'Guest Relations' department, good luck, they seem even less interested than management. My wife worked 7 years as a manager for a local Indian Casino around our area and she said people would have been fired at her former employer for this type of behavior, but seems to be the norm here. Only worth the stay here if you booked on the cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Lower your standards”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 days @ the end of January, sub-par rooms. Heater stopped working twice, but was repaired quickly. My room had a tub with shower, and was reasonably clean. The 1st room I was given wasn't too good. My casino host was great-Yvonne Godert. Most of the staff and dealers were real nice. The food @ the hotel was ok for breakfast, but Great for dinner (Camelots, I think). I had a great trip in Vegas, but I guess I expected a liitle more from a "strip hotel" I probably wouldn't stay there again unless it was real cheap or I try a jacuzzi suite. I've stayed @ Luxor tower-very nice, and mgm grand-pretty good, but this was quite a few steps down.

Reviews.Title: “loved the EXCALIBUR”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had a BLAST!!!! Clean rooms, friendly staff, pleasant bell-hops and cocktail waitresses. Will definately be staying at the EXCALIBUR again...can't wait...but enjoyed the Sherwood Forest Cafe more then the Buffet...all in all a great experience...WAY TO GO EXCALIBUR!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience for the Money!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Travel Channel had a great deal with the Excalibur. We've been to Las Vegas many times and stayed at various hotels. Excalibur hospitality of the dealers was great. We truly felt like we were at home and since the casino is smaller, we were not constantly trying to find our way. We ate at the buffet which was also wonderful. Although the rooms are not up to modern standard of the other hotels we have stayed in, the rooms were extremely clean and functional. Security is posted at the entry of the elevators which ensures that you have authorization to go onto the floors, thereby, elevating our comfort level. We fell in love with two of the dealers named Donna and Janice and I felt like I wanted to give them some type of little gift when we left but was not sure if we could do that. We definitely would go back to the Excalibur!

Reviews.Title: “Great place especially for kids!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Excalibur on more than one occasion with our 4 children. We always need to get 2 adjoining rooms to accomodate our family. Most of the staff is friendly and helpful...we have encountered a couple of somewhat rude employees. The rooms are not real fancy, but they are spacious enough for our large family and are clean. The kids really enjoy the fantasy faire arcade and the free theatre shows on the food level (right across from the roundtable buffet). The food at the buffet is good and Regale is pretty good too. There is a McDonalds and Krispy Creme and a couple other fast food restaurants as well. The pool has a small water slide that the kids love anytime of year (our last stay was in February). It does lack a hot tub but they are supposedly building one to open spring 2004. Excalibur is a short walk to MGM, NY, NY, Luxor, Tropicana, Mandalay Bay, Gameworks, the Coke Bottle, M&M store, and other attractions. Overall the Excalibur is a great hotel especially if you have kids. And if you stay definitely check out the Tournament of Kings...the food is good and the show is interactive, fun, and exciting. We really like Excalibur and would not hesitate to stay there again, and again and again!!!

Reviews.Title: “We had a BLAST!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This time we took our kids with us. Ages 16,15,14,and 12. All girls. We had such a great time and the hotel was just beautiful. The two older girls we let go on their own and they were fine. The security at the hotel and on the strip was great. Even at night the girls felt very safe. The rooms were beautiful, and clean. We asked the girls if they would want to come back and they all said yes. The only thing they didn't like was all the walking we did. Other than that, they loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: comfortsales
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from Vegas early this morning, we stayed at the Excalibur to see Elton John at Caesar's Palace. I was reading the reviews below, and don't agree with most of them. The Excalibur is totally fine. I mean, it isn't one of the newer hotels, but it IS a theme hotel, for cryin' out loud! The hallways are dark, yes, but it's supposed to be! It was very adequate for the money. Some things I remember that I did like........The Roundtable Buffet is wonderful, the Quiznos, mmmm...the Krispy Kreme...watching the donuts get their wonderful glaze bath....mmmmm...see the pattern here??? The Check-in was ok......make sure you can figure how to go express.......we went to the America West window...very courteous and fast. The room was fine, I mean, what's a room in Vegas for besides to shower and sleep? The rooms were fine. Kids area downstairs is VERY fun, even for us adults....try the game where you win the sharks by knocking the monster's teeth out....secret...throw the sandbags REALLY hard! All in all, didn't have much of a problem with the Excalibur.......I would recommend it to anyone! But, if you must know....here are some things I didn't prefer.........The check-OUT guy was a little rude and curt....the casino was a little to "carnival-ly" for me, and I didn't like the idea of having to lug your bags through the crowded casino. Other than that......stay there!!! It is well worth it! Chris Lebanon, New Hampshire

Reviews.Title: “Not my first choice”
Reviews.Author: Hottotrot
Reviews.Content: I went here because of a wedding, otherwise, I would not have stayed here. Unless you are bringing kids, try a different hotel on the strip. This hotel is very kid friendly, and as an adult with no kids, I did not enjoy this hotel. This was my third visit to Vegas, and the worst. The buffet in this hotel is horrible. The food all tastes the same, yuck. My favorite thing about this hotel is that it has Krispy Kreme and Cold Stone Creamery.

Reviews.Title: “Safe and Fun”
Reviews.Author: tabd3m
Reviews.Content: Latest trips, 3/03, 8/03, 10/03. Have been staying here for at least 10 years, have been comming to LV for 17 (since my first trip on my 30th birthday). Would not stay anywhere else. I come at least twice a year, usually alone. Being female I want to stay where I know I will be safe. The security is exceptional. Also Fun? Oh yes, both of the house shows are excellent and yes I go to each, every trip. Pool is nice and the shops and food are great too! If you would rather spend your money in the casino's or on tours sightseeing (dam is awesome) this is the place to stay. I have never had a bad stay or trouble with the employees...kids? Never had a problem there either. Some of the reviews you read, I really wonder about the people writing them. Excalibur - see you in April 2004... Would recommend A+++++

Reviews.Title: “I Don't!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not only did I stay at the Excalibur, but I was foolish enough to get married there! Searching for a place in Vegas to wed, wanting inexspensive and not too tacky, we choose this hotel based on chapel pictures. No one said I would be married by Merlin or that my bouquet would contain nine half dead roses. This place may cheap to stay, but unless an embarressing cememony is what you desire, do not pledge the rest of your life to someone at this tack fest!

Reviews.Title: “Go See Fred at The Wheel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Excalibur is a great place to stay if you want to have fun. The best part about the place is the casino action because of the wide array of games. Make sure to go stop by the wheel near the stairs and ask for a guy named Fred with the thick, dark glasses. He will make sure you have a good time! If he is not there you can also ask for a guy named J-Boogs, he will either be at the wheel or dealing blackjack or war. These guys are classic characters who keep the mood enjoyable. The rest of the place is alright too and the location is right on the strip, a good value for your money!

Reviews.Title: “home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stay here at least twice a year. Sometime the rooms are not as soundproof as we would like. Actually it gets quiate noisy at times. We love the service, the wonderful casino and the great staff. This is truly the bargin of the stip. If you like excitement stay here.

Reviews.Title: “We were very pleased”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Excalibur during the National Finals Rodeo and had a blast. The rooms could have been a bit "fancier" but good grief, you aren't in Vegas to hang out in the room! The food was fine, we had a ball in the Casino. We plan to stay there for the 2004 Finals too.

Reviews.Title: “Hated the Excalibur.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur for 3 days.I hated the rooms.They were full of mold and/or mildew.The air conditioning unit looked like it was about to fall off the wall.I would never recommend it to anyone,and I will never stay there again,even if the trip was free..

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in 2002. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Check in was a breeze. Very crowded.
