Quite a few families with children running around, certainly not the hotel's fault. Probably because the rates were very reasonable and the kids love the theme of the hotel. The smoke really was thick and bothered both my husband and daughter. The rooms were okay but the smell of smoke was every where. We will not stay there again mostly because of the smoke issue. But if you are looking for good rates, it works.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excalibur for the CES convention (January 2004). Although the hotel shuttle service to and from the convention was horrible, the hotel itself was great. The room was above average, and there was a good choice for dining. The tram between the Excalibur, Mandalay Bay, and Luxor was convenient. I would definitely stay here again, but perhaps with a room not overlooking the busy Strip--it was a nice view, but noisy.

Reviews.Title: “The castle is great”
Reviews.Author: Longears63
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Excalibur quite a few times over the past few years. We have always found the staff to be courteous. Excalibur has something for everyone. In summer, the pool is fabulous. With the water slides and waterfall it is enjoyable and saves you the admission price to Wet and Wild. The food court is convenient and very popular. of course if you are looking for fine white linen and other high end amenities you are not going to find it. But, the rooms are spacious, always very clean, and the location of Excalibur is right near NYNY, MGM Grand and of course Luxor and Mandalay Bay. Contrary to other postings, it's not swarming with kids. Yes, families stay here and if you go down to the gameroom you will fins a lot of kids, but if you are playing in the casino you naturally will not see a lot of children. Another very nice touch is the security posted at the entrance to the room elevators. They check thoroughly for room keys. It provides a feeling of safety. If you are looking for a fun place, with lots to do, and a great value, Excalibur is it. For $49 a night midweek in the summer, you can't beat it!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just a note about our recent four-day stay at the Excalibur. As noted by many others, there were many families with an almost endless stream of young children (why would anyone bring a child to Las Vegas is beyond me). However, the room was quiet, clean and comfortable. The staff were polite and responsive. No major complaints. Will go again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to The Excalibur. Dec. 23-27, 2003. The hotel staff is magnificent. They are incredibly friendly and extremely helpful. We had a VIP check in which was trouble-free. We had a strip view room, facing NY, NY and the MGM Grand Lion. I wish we had snow it would have been perfect. But we had slush and rain. December is not the time for Vegas. Cold and rainy. This is our third stay at the Excalibur and I will stay there again and again. The Champagne brunch for Christmas was terrific. I have seen where people complain about kids at the Excalibur. Well let me tell you, there are Kids all up and down the strip. I love kids, but I do not feel that Vegas is the proper place for children, especially at Christmas. However, the children also have their own arcade at the Excalibur away from the casino. They are well taken care of at the arcade. The little shops at the Excalibur are unique, and I always find something that I just have to buy. I like the location, it is on the South end of the strip, and not congested. All the popular hotels are in the vicinity if you choose to explore. The rooms are large and clean. There is a guard by all the tower entrances, to make sure that only guests are entering. And believe me they check EVERYONE. This makes me feel very safe staying there, and roaming around by myself, when I get tired of gambling. This is the first time we lost money. The slots were TIGHT, everyone was complaining. But as we ventured into other hotels, that complaint was heard loud and clear. Maybe it was because Christmas is a slow time for Vegas. I was disappointed with one thing. Las Vegas was not decorated for the holidays, the Excalibur was, and that made me happy. I think this hotel is a great place to stay and look forward to staying many more times.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Casino and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews, I was worried about my stay here. However, it wasn't that bad. I asked ahead of time for a non-smoking, "quiet" room. Quiet meaning away from the strip. The quiet part they got right. Every night, had good sleep. Non-smoking they sort of got right. It's suppose to be a non-smoking floor (signs everywhere). However, our room had an ashtray, our blankets smelled like smoke, and there was a communal ashtray in the hallway with seats. A couple of the lamps in the room did not work. And yes, there are long waiting times for the elevators......simply volume of people.....nothing to do with the elevators themselves. The good points: the stores and restaurants (McDonald's, Pizza Hut, Quizno's, Krispy Kreme) on-site are very convenient. One last thing. On the morning we checked out, something really gross happend. I was in the washroom checking if I left anything and I heard someone flush a toilet. At the same time, some sewage came up through the sink drain. It reeked. I left a note for the housekeeper. We were wondering why it reeked always in the washroom throughout our stay. We thought it was us. But it might have been because of the pipes.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is about average”
Reviews.Author: callt
Reviews.Content: This hotel was better than I thought it would be. The good points: It's a 5 minute walk to New York, New York which is my favorite hotel to gamble. There is a 24 hour Krispy Kreme donuts on site. You can't beat being able to walk out of your room and grab a fresh, hot donut anytime day or night. A lot of cheap, fast food places to eat at at this hotel if you're on a budget. Good location if you don't mind walking just a little. The room was pretty big as was the bathroom.The bad points: It's definitely not the most up to date, fashionable place to stay. The air conditioning in my room worked only intermittently (thank god it was the middle of December so it didn't matter.) Yes, if you look really closely in your room you can see all the grime that is never completely wiped away by the hotel cleaning staff. Walls are pretty thin. If you're a light sleeper you should definitely sleep with the air or heat on as it blocks out a lot of the outside noise.All in all I liked the hotel. I would definitely stay again because I like the location and the cheap food. If you're looking for a place to stay on the strip that won't break your budget, has a good location and feels fairly safe because of all the families, this is a good bet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Dec 20-22 weekend stay at Excalibur. This is our second time staying here and we were even more pleased this time. Check in was quick and painless. Non-Strip view room was very clean and kept that way every day. While the decor is geared around their cheesy theme, the place is well kept and not run down. Not many kids this time of year. Great late night crowd, waitresses were always making rounds including the nickel & penny slots areas; very friendly dealers and bartenders. Great south-strip location with easy access to Luxor, NYNY, Mandalay Bay, and MGM. Be sure to get on their e-mail listing for specials. They offered us Sat-Sun for $45-49. Then they sent another e-mail dropping prices to $ 35 per night. For that price you usually read horror stories. Not here.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: Travelguru4u
Reviews.Content: The room was alright-simple. The decor was CHEESE! The pool area was nice. However, TOO many families/kids.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money”
Reviews.Author: ajox
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the end of September, 2003. Smallish room, but a great price. The deal we had included coupons for certain things around the hotel, but because of limitations, we couldn't use them all. We saw the Tournament of Kings, a good show. Hotel was crowded at check-in and it took 30-45 minutes to get to the desk. Room was clean and neat. Lot's of kids. Overall a good experience and I'd go back, but I'd check others first.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: elvislover
Reviews.Content: Just returned today from a week at the Excalibur. Had concerns before leaving after reading some of the reviews on this site. All in all, Excalibur was excellent from check in right through check out except for the roundtable buffet. Prices are good but food is not good. If you want an excellent buffet for $20 a piece at dinner, go to the Aladdin. Best bang for your buck on the strip. I would recommend anybody to the Excalibur. Was not crawling with kids, real mixed crowd. Staff was more than accomodating and friendly. Would definitely go back. For $49 a night, it was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in October, 2003. Overall, I would recommend excalibur to everyone who wants a clean, decent room, good parking, and a great rate. We were able to park in the outdoor parking lot just outside the back. One problem was the long walk to get to the towers. Long check-in lines. The lady at the check-in was wonderful. We had weird arrangements and she patiently did a perfect job getting us checked in. She had short red hair with a new england accent.(in case she reads this). The rooms were clean, but it was weird not having fitted sheets. The casino was good. Pretty big. I did pretty well on the slots, but I'm sure I just had a lucky night. One of my friends liked the poker room. Nice, laid back atmosphere. The game room downstairs wasn't very good. The tournament of kings was great, but the food wasn't very good. The buffet was okay, but could have been a lot better. Overall, this place is well worth the money and I would go back without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Excalibur - King's Treatment”
Reviews.Author: therogersfamily44
Reviews.Content: We flew into Los Angeles and drove up to Las Vegas for a 5 night Stay at the Excalibur.We telephoned prior to our arrival (we called at 9:00 a.m. and arrived at about 11:30 a.m.) and we "pre-registered" (we had a previous reservation set up, we only had to phone on the day of arrival and get the reservation set up with a credit card and our keys are ready for pick-up when we arrive at the King's Window). This was on the advise of one of the other reviewers on this site and let me tell you it is the BEST thing we ever did!! The line at this King's Window was very short (5 min), compared to the 200 people waiting in the regular registration line.Also, since we had called early and pre-registered, it was noted that they had overbooked the Jacuzzi Suites we had reserved and we were upgraded to a full King Suite (at no extra charge). It was WONDERFUL!! 2 rooms - a bedroom and a living room, each with a TV and Stereo system, a giant jacuzzi tub, King Bed, 2 Bathrooms and a Bar in the giant living room area. We had a spectacular view from the top floor.We have stayed at the Excalibur on 3 other occasions and we have always enjoyed our accommodations.We have always found the staff to be very accommodating and pleasant. We will definitely be staying here in the future!Rhonda & Lance, Calgary

Reviews.Title: “A suprisingly nice stay at the Excalibur”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here this past weekend. Very apprehensive because of all the negative reviews. Was at the Luxor last time and signed up for a One Club Card. Called in for reservations and got a $284 convention Sat. rate for $99 with the One Card, other nights were discounted also. Only had 100 points on the card. Found the hotel check in to be quick, although we did arrived at 11:30pm. Had a room in Tower II that to our surpise also overlooked the strip (Go One Club!). The room was clean, and the bathroom very large with a tile shower. Perhaps this is a newer tower. The decor is a little garish with tapestries and drab wall paper, but I guess that goes along with hotel theme. Just not as elegant as some other hotels. The buffet was mediocre, recommend the breakfast buffet over lunch or dinner. No luck on slots for us, but friends had good payouts. The staff was friendly and dealers very helpful at the tables. They are the ones that made it an above average stay. $10 minimum table bet to get credit on One Card though. The lounge band was okay, but got a little old after four nights. Overall, we had a good experience at Excalibur. Thought it was a good value for what we paid over a weekend stay.

HotelInfo.Name: Excalibur Hotel & Casino
HotelInfo.Address: 3850 Las Vegas Blvd S, Las Vegas, NV 89109-4300
